Headlines: TikTok considers London and other locations for headquarters
Description: TikTok has been in discussions with the UK government over the past few months to locate its headquarters in London, a source familiar with the matter said, as part of a strategy to distance itself from its Chinese ownership.

Headlines: Disney cuts ad spending on Facebook amid growing boycott: WSJ
Description: Walt Disney  has become the latest company to slash its advertising spending on Facebook Inc  as the social media giant faces an ad boycott over its handling of hate speech and controversial content, the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday, citing people familiar with the situation.

Headlines: Trail of missing Wirecard executive leads to Belarus, Der Spiegel reports
Description: Former Wirecard  chief operating officer Jan Marsalek travelled to Minsk soon after he was suspended and may still be in Belarus or Russia, a German magazine reported on Saturday.

Headlines: Twitter says attackers downloaded data from up to eight non-verified accounts
Description: Twitter Inc said on Saturday that hackers were able to download account information for up to eight accounts involved in the hack of its systems this week, but said none of them were verified accounts.

Headlines: U.S. Republicans seek liability protections as coronavirus aid battle looms
Description: A battle in the U.S. Congress over a new coronavirus-aid bill began on Friday as Republicans were putting the finishing touches on provisions granting liability protections for a wide range of entities resuming operations amid the pandemic.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Fund managers navigate 'Night of the Living Dead' in small caps
Description: Investors are searching for bargains in the world of U.S. small-caps, as the beaten-down asset class prepares for what may be the worst earnings season in its history amid a resurgent coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Take Five: Hoping for that V-shape in earnings
Description: We knew Q2 earnings would be dire but the hope was a) they might turn out to be better than feared and b) companies could offer guidance on the outlook. So while expectations are for European Q2 earnings to slump 50%-plus, there's margin for error.

Headlines: Evictions nearly back to pre-pandemic levels in some U.S. areas: Cleveland Fed study
Description: Landlords in some areas of the United States are filing to evict rent-delinquent tenants at roughly the same rate they were before the coronavirus pandemic as eviction bans across the country begin to expire, research from the Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland showed on Friday.

Headlines: Google bans ads on coronavirus conspiracy theory content
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Friday it would prohibit websites and apps that use its advertising technology from running ads on "dangerous content" that goes against scientific consensus during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Flight to suburbs boosts U.S. homebuilding, but COVID-19 surge erodes consumer sentiment
Description: U.S. homebuilding increased in June by the most in nearly four years amid reports of rising demand for housing in suburbs and rural areas as companies allow employees to work from home during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Delta will avoid pilot furloughs if they agree to reduced minimum pay: memo
Description: Delta Air Lines told pilots on Friday it would avoid furloughs if they agreed to reduced guaranteed minimum pay, according to a memo seen by Reuters.

Headlines: S&P 500 ends higher as traders weigh stimulus and virus worries
Description: The S&P 500 ended higher on Friday as investors weighed the prospect of more fiscal stimulus against fears of further business disruptions due to a record rise in COVID-19 cases.

Headlines: FTC considering deposing top Facebook executives in antitrust probe: WSJ
Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is considering taking sworn testimony from Facebook Inc's  top executives Mark Zuckerberg and Sheryl Sandberg as a part of its probe into whether the company has engaged in unlawful monopolistic practices, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.

Headlines: Where did all the bulls go? Rallies stall as EU summit begins
Description: Global equity benchmarks treaded water on Friday and government bond yields edged lower as investors waited on the European Union to iron out details of an expected 750 billion-euro recovery fund that could provide another round of stimulus as the world economy reels from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: BlackRock profit beats Street estimates as markets rebound
Description: BlackRock Inc's  results topped Wall Street estimates on Friday, helped by investors flocking to the world's largest asset manager's bond funds in the second quarter as global financial markets rebounded strongly from a COVID-sparked brutal selloff in March.

Headlines: Dollar falls, euro hovers at four-month high as EU negotiates rescue fund
Description: The dollar was broadly lower on Friday as the euro rose to just under a four-month high, with negotiations underway between European Union leaders on a recovery fund that could lift the bloc out of the current recession.

Headlines: Boohoo tells UK Home Secretary it is probing charges of malpractice in supply chain
Description: Fashion retailer Boohoo Group Plc  wrote a letter to UK Home Secretary Priti Patel, saying that the company is taking action to probe allegations of malpractice in its supply chain and that it asks for the government to take action as well.

Headlines: Exclusive: EU in talks with Moderna, BioNtech, CureVac to secure possible COVID vaccines
Description: The European Union is negotiating advance purchase deals of potential COVID-19 vaccines with drugmakers Moderna , Sanofi  and Johnson & Johnson  as well as biotech firms BioNtech  and CureVac, two EU sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Former Pemex boss arrives back in Mexico for graft trial, enters hospital
Description: A former boss of Mexico's state oil company Petroleos Mexicanos facing corruption charges that could envelop leaders of the last government was taken to a hospital early on Friday shortly after his overnight extradition to Mexico from Spain.

Headlines: Twitter says about 130 accounts were targeted in cyber attack this week
Description: Twitter Inc disclosed late on Thursday that hackers targeted about 130 accounts during the cyber attack this week, an incident in which profiles of many prominent personalities and organizations were compromised.

Headlines: Senator asks Twitter about claim worker was paid to help with hack
Description: Senator Josh Hawley, a Republican who closely follows tech issues, pressed Twitter Chief Executive Jack Dorsey on Friday on whether a company employee had been paid to assist with a hack of high-profile accounts this week aimed at scamming readers.

Headlines: Treasury's Mnuchin open to blanket forgiveness for smaller business relief loans
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said Friday policymakers should consider blanket forgiveness for all smaller businesses that received "Paycheck Protection Program" loans.

Headlines: On eve of bankruptcy, U.S. firms shower execs with bonuses
Description: Nearly a third of more than 40 large companies seeking U.S. bankruptcy protection during the coronavirus pandemic awarded bonuses to executives within a month of filing their cases, according to a Reuters analysis of securities filings and court records.

Headlines: Rival parties take aim at Germany's Scholz over Wirecard scandal
Description: Germany's Social Democrat Finance Minister Olaf Scholz is facing calls from rival parties to account for the regulatory failures that led to the collapse of Wirecard after it emerged he knew of concerns about the company 18 months ago.

Headlines: U.S. economy faces significant risks, long road to recovery: IMF staff
Description: The U.S. economy is forecast to shrink by 6.6% in 2020 due to the shock of the coronavirus pandemic, but a resurgence in coronavirus infections and a systemic increase in poverty could worsen that outlook, the staff of the International Monetary Fund warned on Friday.

Headlines: Euro zone shares flat as EU recovery plan awaited; Ericsson soars
Description: Euro zone shares were little changed on Friday as investors awaited the outcome of an European Union summit where leaders are expected to hammer out details of a 750-billion-euro ($858 billion) recovery fund.

Headlines: Cohen's Point72 to open Warsaw office for some back office teams
Description: Billionaire investor Steven A. Cohen's Point72 Asset Management is opening the $16.2 billion firm's latest satellite location in Warsaw and moving some back office operations to lower-cost Poland.

Headlines: In Utah, a debate stirs over Estonian radioactive waste
Description: (This July 16 story has been refiled to fix spelling of 'whether' in paragraph 2)

Headlines: End of the jumbo: British Airways retires 747 early due to coronavirus crisis
Description: British Airways, the world's largest operator of Boeing 747s, will retire its entire jumbo jet fleet with immediate effect after the COVID-19 pandemic sent air travel into freefall.

Headlines: Fed opens 'Main Street' loan program to nonprofits, eases terms
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Friday opened its "Main Street" loan program to nonprofits, allowing education, health, social service and other groups with as few as 10 employees to tap central bank funding.

Headlines: As big U.S. banks let customers delay payments, loan losses remain unclear
Description: Major U.S. bank executives this week said they extended forbearance programs to millions of credit card, auto loan and mortgage customers who were financially hard hit by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: UBS, Morgan Stanley expected to lead Vodafone Tower IPO: sources
Description: UBS  and Morgan Stanley  are expected to organise the lucrative listing of Vodafone's European towers unit - a deal that could value the entire business at up to 16 billion euros ($18 billion), sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Thyssenkrupp to explore further options for boosting finances - memo
Description: Thyssenkrupp  is seeking new ways to strengthen its balance sheet, including through state aid programmes, after its finances took a hit during the coronavirus crisis, according to a company memo seen by Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Icelandair to sack cabin crew but keep flying after failed talks
Description: Icelandair  will sack its cabin crew and put pilots in charge of onboard safety after negotiations on a collective-bargaining agreement failed between the airline and the cabin crew labour association, the company said on Friday.

Headlines: Economic recovery further away than markets think: BlackRock CEO Fink
Description: The U.S. economy is going to take longer to recover from the hit from the coronavirus pandemic than the market expects, and more stimulus is critical, BlackRock Inc  Chief Executive Larry Fink said on Wednesday.

Headlines: EasyJet pilots say they have no confidence in COO in union vote
Description: Over 2,000 easyJet  pilots voted to say they had no confidence in the airline's chief operating officer Peter Bellew, illustrating the strain on labour relations as the company tries to cut jobs.

Headlines: Exclusive: HSBC sheds top talent as global equities boss leaves - sources
Description: HSBC's  global equities chief Hossein Zaimi is leaving the bank, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter said on Friday, in the latest revamp of the lender's troubled investment banking operations.

Headlines: Lloyds Bank sets target to increase number of senior Black staff
Description: Britain's biggest domestic bank Lloyds  has set a target to increase the number of Black staff in senior roles to at least 3% by 2025 from just 0.6% now.

Headlines: Wall Street analysts look past Netflix's weak subscriber forecast
Description: Wall Street analysts shrugged off Netflix Inc's  weak third-quarter subscriber forecast, as it racked up a record number of users in the first half of the year, allaying worries about competition from new players such as Disney+ and HBO MAX.

Headlines: Exclusive: Pact to aid poor cocoa farmers in peril as COVID-19 hits demand
Description: The steepest dive in cocoa demand in a decade has thrown into jeopardy a plan by top producers Ivory Coast and Ghana to guarantee some two million farmers a living wage, sources within the countries' regulators said.

Headlines: Italy plans listing for Autostrade by early 2021: sources
Description: The Italian government plans to list Autostrade per l'Italia by early next year after forcing through an agreement with the Benetton family to take Atlantia's  motorway business under state control, sources close to the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: German abattoir scandal puts cooling systems under COVID spotlight
Description: A COVID-19 outbreak in Germany is forcing meatpacking plants to review infection risks posed by their cooling systems, placing the industry at the sharp end of growing global concerns over airborne transmission of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Former Pemex boss Lozoya taken to hospital after arrival in Mexico
Description: Emilio Lozoya, a former boss of Mexican state oil company Pemex who faces corruption charges, was taken to hospital early on Friday due to the delicate state of his health after his extradition to Mexico, the attorney general's office said.

Headlines: Bored bank customers flock to day-trading platforms during pandemic
Description: Retail investing is having a moment. Major U.S. brokerages that reported quarterly results this week cheered the self-directed day trading happening on their platforms as individuals with a bit of extra money and time on their hands during the coronavirus pandemic have been engaging more in markets.

Headlines: Stripe wins business following Wirecard's collapse
Description: The U.S. payments company Stripe is picking up some former Wirecard  customers, an executive told Reuters.

Headlines: Indonesian tycoon Salim wins close shareholder vote on controversial $3 billion deal
Description: Indonesian tycoon Anthoni Salim narrowly won shareholder backing on Friday for a $3 billion takeover transaction between companies he controls, overcoming criticism about the deal's valuation and questions about corporate governance.

Headlines: EU regulators halt LSE, Refinitiv probe, await data
Description: EU antitrust regulators have temporarily suspended their investigation into the London Stock Exchange's  $27 billion bid for data and analytics company Refinitiv while waiting for the companies to provide requested data.

Headlines: Lyft to provide drivers with partition shields as coronavirus protection
Description: Lyft Inc  said on Friday it would distribute some 60,000 vehicle partition shields to its most-active drivers as a protection against the coronavirus and begin selling the custom-made protective barriers to other drivers later this summer.

Headlines: Deutsche Boerse proposes new rules for quick DAX expulsion in wake of Wirecard
Description: In the wake of the Wirecard  accounting scandal, exchange operator Deutsche Boerse  said on Friday it was proposing rules to enable it to quickly expel companies from the leading DAX index when those firms file for insolvency.

Headlines: Daimler to stop building sedans in the U.S. after second-quarter loss
Description: Daimler  will stop building Mercedes-Benz sedans in the United States and Mexico as it seeks deeper cuts after posting a smaller-than-expected quarterly loss.

Headlines: Volkswagen expects single-digit sales decline in China this year
Description: Volkswagen AG  said on Friday it expects its China sales to fall a single-digit percent this year as new sport-utility vehicles and premium models help it recover from a sales slide in the world's biggest auto market.

Headlines: Coronavirus surge, renewed lockdowns fan fresh worries about global fuel demand
Description: Surges in coronavirus infections are slowing a recovery in fuel use from the doldrums of lockdowns in the United States and other countries, raising concern it could be years before consumption rebounds from the impact of the pandemic.

Headlines: United Airlines, pilots union reach creative deal to limit furloughs
Description: United Airlines  and its pilots' union said on Thursday they had reached an agreement on two different packages aimed at reducing involuntary furloughs in the fall and keeping pilots at the ready once coronavirus-hit demand starts to pick up.

Headlines: Netflix names content chief Ted Sarandos co-CEO, forecasts weaker growth
Description: Netflix Inc  on Thursday elevated its content chief Ted Sarandos to co-CEO, making the 20-year veteran of the pioneering streaming video service a clear successor to co-founder Reed Hastings.

Headlines: Westpac says regulator-ordered report finds governance 'immature and reactive'
Description: Westpac Banking Corp  said on Friday a regulator-ordered report found the lender had not made enough improvements to its risk management and culture even after it was sued for allegedly enabling payments between known child exploiters.

Headlines: Twitter stepped up search to fill top security job ahead of hack
Description: Twitter Inc  had stepped up its search for a chief information security officer in recent weeks, two people familiar with the effort told Reuters, before the breach of high-profile accounts on Wednesday raised alarms about the platform's security.

Headlines: Before hack tore through Twitter, online forum offered accounts for sale
Description: Before a hacking campaign tore through Twitter and compromised some of its most high-profile users, an ad went up on a gray market site that facilitates the trade of user accounts for many popular websites including Twitter.

Headlines: Microsoft trims jobs as it enters new fiscal year
Description: Microsoft Corp said on Thursday it had trimmed its workforce across geographies and teams as it entered a new fiscal year from July 1.

Headlines: New York to invest $750 million to expand electric-vehicle infrastructure
Description: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo on Thursday announced an investment program that would allocate $750 million to build charging stations and other electric-vehicle infrastructure as part of the state's long-term goal to reduce emissions.

Headlines: California blames PG&E for Kincade wildfire in wine country
Description: The Kincade wildfire in California's wine country last October that forced some 2,000 people to flee homes was caused by PG&E Corp's electrical transmission lines, the state's Department of Forestry and Fire Protection (Cal Fire) said on Thursday.

Headlines: Jailed executive in Wirecard scandal offers confession, lawyer says
Description: The former head of a key subsidiary of Wirecard, who was arrested earlier this month, has admitted wrongdoing to prosecutors for his role in a multi-billion-euros fraud, his lawyer said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. judge approves transfer of jailed former VW executive to Germany
Description: A U.S. judge in Detroit on Thursday approved the transfer to Germany of a former Volkswagen AG  executive imprisoned in the automaker's diesel emissions scandal.

Headlines: Wall Street ends lower on COVID-19 worries, tech weighs
Description: The S&P 500 dropped on Thursday, pulled lower by Microsoft Corp  and Apple Inc , as elevated levels of unemployment claims heightened concerns about the economic toll from rising coronavirus cases.

Headlines: TUI to offer free coronavirus insurance to lure travellers: report
Description: Travel company TUI   will offer travellers free coronavirus insurance starting this weekend, a German media group reported on Friday.

Headlines: With shift toward merit-based pay, Japan's Hitachi to drop old ways
Description: Hitachi Ltd  is moving to scrap a remnant of one of Japan Inc's most famous practices: seniority-based pay.

Headlines: Key U.S. lawmakers back unions' call for new airline bailout
Description: Key U.S. House Democrats are backing a push by airline unions for a new round of government bailouts to keep workers employed in the face of tens of thousands of possible layoffs this fall, according to a letter encouraging other colleagues to sign on.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. FBI is leading an inquiry into the Twitter hack, sources say
Description: The U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation is leading a federal inquiry into the Twitter hacking, two sources familiar with the situation said, after hackers seized control of accounts belonging to Joe Biden, Kim Kardashian and others in what appeared to be a bitcoin scam.

Headlines: Twitter delays launch of new API software following hack
Description: Twitter Inc  said on Thursday it is delaying the launch of its new Application Programming Interface (API) following the recent hack of several high-profile accounts.

Headlines: Focus falls on bitcoin trail in race to identify Twitter hackers
Description: Hackers who targeted some of Twitter's top users to reap bitcoin worth $120,000 have likely left digital footprints that could offer clues for law enforcement agencies investigating the attack, three blockchain analysis companies told Reuters.

Headlines: Senate Republican asks Twitter for urgent briefing on hacking incident
Description: The chairman of the Senate Commerce Committee asked Twitter Inc  to brief committee staff by next week on the hacking of high-profile accounts on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump will remain on Twitter, his account secure: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will not stop using Twitter and his account was secure during a hack of the social media platform, a White House spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headlines: FBI says it is investigating hack of high-profile Twitter accounts
Description: The FBI's San Francisco office said on Thursday it has launched an investigation after hackers accessed Twitter's  internal systems to hijack accounts for high-profile people such as U.S. presidential candidate Joe Biden, reality TV star Kim Kardashian, former U.S. President Barack Obama and billionaire Elon Musk and used them to solicit digital currency.

Headlines: Rising U.S. coronavirus cases slam stocks, push debt yields lower
Description: Government debt yields and global equity markets fell on Thursday as a growing number of U.S. coronavirus cases weighed on risk sentiment, which was also hurt by deteriorating U.S.-China relations and discouraging Chinese data.

Headlines: Virus surges. Work hours plateau. U.S. may be flattening the wrong curve
Description: The U.S. economic recovery showed signs of plateauing last week as the country battled rising coronavirus case counts and an increasingly fractured government response, according to data from a broad set of industry and government sources.

Headlines: Rise in COVID-19 cases spurs risk-off move, dollar lifted
Description: The safe-haven U.S. dollar rose modestly on Thursday afternoon as worries about rising numbers of coronavirus infections spurred a broader risk-off move, pushing U.S. equities lower.

Headlines: Negative U.S. rate bets persist, but seen unlikely to happen
Description: Negative U.S. interest rates could be the norm next year and all through to 2023 if fed funds futures are any indication. Or it could just be traders hedging their bets.

Headlines: Fed's Evans signals little reason to raise rates for years
Description: There's little reason for the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates until inflation rises above the Fed's 2% target, Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Charles Evans said on Thursday, noting that he expects low inflation to be a problem for the next few years.

Headlines: TikTok expected to operate as a U.S. company, White House adviser says
Description: A top White House adviser said on Thursday that he expects TikTok to separate from its Chinese owner and operate as an American company amid growing U.S. concerns about the security of the data handled by the short video app.

Headlines: Oil falls as OPEC+ plans to raise output while virus cases increase
Description: Oil prices fell 1% on Thursday after OPEC+ agreed to ease record supply curbs and as new infections of the novel coronavirus continue to surge in the United States.

Headlines: Target, CVS, Walgreens to require customers wear masks at U.S. stores
Description: Target Corp, CVS Health Corp and Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc  said on Thursday they would require customers wear face coverings while shopping at their U.S. stores, adopting a widely accepted way to curb the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. Senator Warner asks for probe of hacks, better monitoring of high-risk accounts
Description: U.S. Senator Mark Warner called on Thursday for Twitter Inc to investigate how hackers gained access to the social media company's internal systems to hijack accounts of several politicians, billionaires, celebrities and companies, and to put more resources into protecting high-profile feeds.

Headlines: Rejected Bridgewater trade secrets claim started as a guess: ruling
Description: A senior Bridgewater Associates LP executive was only making a guess that former employees used trade secrets to compete against the world's largest hedge fund firm, according to an arbitration ruling made public on Thursday that rejected the firm's claim.

Headlines: Attorney General Barr accuses Hollywood, Big Tech of collaborating with China
Description: U.S. Attorney General William Barr took aim at Hollywood companies, including Walt Disney Co  on Thursday as well as large technology firms like Apple, Alphabet's Google and Microsoft Corp over company actions with China.

Headlines: Top EU court ditches transatlantic data transfer deal
Description: Europe's highest court ruled on Thursday that a transatlantic data transfer deal is invalid because of concerns about U.S. surveillance in a decision that could disrupt thousands of companies that rely on the agreement.

Headlines: Explainer: U.S. Congress readies $740 billion defense bill covering far more than bullets
Description: The National Defense Authorization Act, which sets policy for the U.S. Defense Department, is one of the only major bills to reliably pass Congress and be signed into law every year.

Headlines: Investors sue Deutsche Bank and its CEO in wake of Epstein fine
Description: Investors are suing Deutsche Bank and its CEO Christian Sewing, alleging the bank made false and misleading statements before it agreed to pay a $150 million fine for compliance failures linked to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley posts record profit on trading boom
Description: Morgan Stanley posted a record quarterly profit on Thursday that blew past analysts' expectations as another of Wall Street's big investment banks gained from huge swings in financial markets due to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Twitter silences some top accounts after internal systems hacked
Description: Twitter  said hackers accessed its internal systems to hijack some of the platform's top voices including U.S. presidential candidate Joe Biden, reality TV star Kim Kardashian, former U.S. President Barack Obama and billionaire Elon Musk and used them to solicit digital currency.

Headlines: Privacy activist Schrems welcomes EU court decision on Facebook
Description: Austrian privacy activist Max Schrems on Thursday welcomed a decision by the European Union's top court in his case against Facebook, saying the legal basis for more then 5,000 U.S. companies that use an EU tool to transfer Europeans' personal data to the United States for commercial use has been annulled.

Headlines: Malaysian court grants temporary freeze on $340 million 1MDB money in UK
Description: A Malaysian court on Thursday granted an interim order to stop Saudi energy firm PetroSaudi International (PSI) from using more than $340 million in funds in Britain, which Malaysian prosecutors believe was siphoned from state fund 1MDB.

Headlines: U.S. retail sales snap back; high unemployment, rising COVID-19 loom over recovery
Description: U.S. retail sales rose more than expected in June as consumers bought big-ticket items like motor vehicles and dined out, but a resurgence in new COVID-19 cases is chipping at the budding recovery, keeping 32 million Americans on unemployment benefits.

Headlines: American, JetBlue team up to boost New York flying and drive recovery
Description: American Airlines  and JetBlue Airways  said on Thursday they were forming a strategic partnership to boost flying options in New York and Boston and create what executives called a "growth engine" to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: UK ban on Huawei opens door for competitors, although consumer may pick up tab
Description: Britain's decision to ban China's Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL] from next-generation 5G telecom networks is the latest blow to the global leader in telecom equipment and could help lay the groundwork for broader changes in the industry.

Headlines: Oil giants including Exxon set first joint carbon target
Description: A group of the world's top oil companies, including Saudi Aramco, China's CNPC and Exxon Mobil, have for the first time set goals to cut their greenhouse gas emissions as a proportion of output, as pressure on the sector's climate stance grows.

Headlines: Twitter shares stumble after high-profile, unprecedented hack
Description: Shares of Twitter Inc dropped more than 4% in pre-market trading on Thursday, a day after hackers gained access to the social media company's internal systems to hijack accounts of several politicians, billionaires, celebrities and companies.

Headlines: Exclusive: J&J in talks with Japan, Gates Foundation to lock in deals on COVID-19 vaccine
Description: Johnson & Johnson  is in talks with the government of Japan and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation about locking up allocations of its potential COVID-19 vaccine as it prepares to kick off human trials, the company's Chief Financial Officer Joseph Wolk told Reuters in an interview.

Headlines: European stocks end off session lows ahead of EU summit
Description: European shares ended off session lows on Thursday ahead of a keenly awaited meeting to organise a European recovery fund, after weak earnings and a growing number of COVID-19 cases had earlier pushed stocks down from one-month highs.

Headlines: Exclusive: Natixis plans shake-up to focus on greener lending
Description: French bank Natixis  will merge its commodities and infrastructure operations to focus on clean energy in a restructuring sources said was accelerated by a series of loss-making loans to oil traders.

Headlines: NY Fed's Williams says low take-up of emergency lending facilities a sign of success
Description: The emergency lending facilities set up by the Federal Reserve helped to ease credit markets after they were disrupted by the pandemic, and relatively low usage of the programs is a sign that markets are functioning well, New York Fed president John Williams said Thursday.

Headlines: Amid virus crisis, U.S. bars imports of Malaysia's Top Glove over labour issues
Description: U.S. Customs placed a detention order on imports of products made by subsidiaries of the world's largest medical glove maker, Malaysia's Top Glove Corp Bhd , an action taken against firms suspected of using forced labour.

Headlines: Apple expands coding education programs to more historically Black schools
Description: Apple Inc said on Thursday it was working with 10 additional historically Black universities and colleges to become "hubs" that will teach computer programming and app design skills in their regions.

Headlines: EU regulators to probe Alexa, Siri and other voice assistants
Description: EU competition regulators are seeking information from 400 companies to establish if there are problems in the market for voice assistants such as Alexa and Siri and other internet-connected devices that could lead to antitrust cases.

Headlines: Irish regulator sees U.S. data transfers decided on 'case by case' basis
Description: Ireland's Data Protection Commissioner, the lead data regulator for Facebook in the European Union, on Thursday "strongly welcomed" a ruling by Europe's highest court that a transatlantic data transfer deal was invalid.

Headlines: Ebay nears $10 billion sale of classified ads unit: sources
Description: Ebay  has called a board meeting on Friday to select a buyer for its classified ads business in a deal potentially worth up to $10 billion, sources close to the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Twitter hacking spree alarms experts concerned about the platform's security
Description: The extraordinary hacking spree that hit Twitter on Wednesday, leading it to briefly muzzle some of its most widely followed accounts, is drawing questions about the platform's security and resilience in the run-up to the U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: U.S. business inventories post record drop in May
Description: U.S. business inventories fell by the most on record in May amid the COVID-19 crisis, supporting expectations for the sharpest drop in gross domestic product in the second quarter since the Great Depression.

Headlines: ECB to go all the way on stimulus even as economy recovers, Lagarde says
Description: The European Central Bank will use its stimulus firepower fully even as the euro zone economy shows some signs of rebounding from its pandemic-induced recession, ECB President Christine Lagarde said on Thursday.

Headlines: Lagarde says ECB expects more grants than loans in EU recovery fund
Description: The European Central Bank expects a pending European Union stimulus scheme to favour grants over loans in the funding mechanism it uses to help kick-start the bloc's economies, bank president Christine Lagarde said on Thursday.

Headlines: Insurers favor warehouse investments over offices as pandemic hastens real estate shifts
Description: Global insurers want to increase investments in commercial warehouses as their stakes in office space become riskier because of employees working remotely during the novel coronavirus pandemic, Goldman Sachs Asset Management (GSAM) executives said.

Headlines: J&J says large study of coronavirus vaccine could begin in September
Description: Johnson & Johnson  said on Thursday it is aiming to begin  in September a late-stage study of its experimental vaccine for the novel coronavirus, as researchers work at break-neck speed to develop a shot to combat the fast-spreading pathogen.

Headlines: Americans on COVID-19 jobless benefits spent more than when working, study shows
Description: Americans who received enhanced unemployment benefits due to the coronavirus pandemic spent more than when they were working, a study released on Thursday said, adding to concerns about a steep fall in spending when the emergency benefits expire.

Headlines: Instagram rolls out shopping feature in U.S.
Description: Instagram said on Thursday it was launching a new feature that will allow users to browse and buy products from brands and creators without leaving the app.

Headlines: State-run Air India working to contain costs
Description: State-run airline Air India Ltd said on Thursday it was working to contain costs by reducing debt, aircraft lease rentals, as well as staffing and operating expenses.

Headlines: Bank of America profit slumps as heavy loan losses loom
Description: Bank of America Corp  saw its profit more than halve in the second quarter as it set aside $5 billion to cover potential loan losses, while warning that it would struggle as long as interest rates stayed low.

Headlines: Lagarde comments at ECB press conference
Description: The European Central Bank left policy unchanged on Thursday, as expected, scrutinising instead the effectiveness and any unwanted side-effects of its crisis-fighting measures.

Headlines: U.S. passive stock funds back in demand as investors seek steadier returns
Description: U.S. passive equity funds have started to witness inflows after a two-month hiatus as investors flock to rising equity markets, but prefer shadowing indexes to picking stocks.

Headlines: Japanese robot to clock in at a convenience store in test of retail automation
Description: In August, a robot vaguely resembling a kangaroo will begin stacking sandwiches, drinks and ready meals on shelves at a Japanese convenience store in a test its maker, Telexistence, hopes will help trigger a wave of retail automation.

Headlines: YouTube not liable for user copyright breaches, EU court adviser says
Description: Google's YouTube and other online platforms are not liable when users illegally upload copyrighted works onto their platforms, but rightholders can ask for injunctions against the companies, a European Union Court of Justice adviser said on Thursday.

Headlines: Uber acquires public transportation software company in latest transit expansion
Description: Uber Technologies Inc on Thursday announced the acquisition of transit software provider Routematch, marking the ride-hailing company's latest move toward expanding its business with public transportation agencies.

Headlines: Facebook studying EU court ruling on data transfer
Description: Facebook said on Thursday it was looking at the implications of a European court ruling that deemed a transatlantic data transfer deal invalid because of concerns about U.S. surveillance.

Headlines: Domino's U.S. same-store sales rise 16% on pizza demand during pandemic
Description: Domino's Pizza Inc  on Thursday beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly same-restaurant sales and profit, as diners ordered in more pies since dine-in options were limited due to lockdowns triggered by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nissan plans 30% cut in car output through December as virus hits demand
Description: Nissan Motor Co  is planning a 30% year-on-year cut in global vehicle production through December as falling demand due to the COVID-19 pandemic complicates its turnaround efforts, two sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Amazon India demands product listings have country of origin by August 10
Description: Amazon.com Inc's India unit has told sellers they must provide country of origin information on product listings by August 10, according to an email sent by the e-commerce giant to sellers, against a backdrop of brewing anti-China sentiment.

Headlines: EU justice chief says will boost data transfers tool after court setback
Description: The European Commission will closely study a top EU court ruling striking down an EU-U.S. data transfer pact and consider how to boost such transfers with its U.S. counterpart, EU Justice Chief Didier Reynders said on Thursday.

Headlines: Factbox: Reaction after EU court strikes down transatlantic data transfer deal
Description: Europe's top court on Thursday quashed a transatlantic data transfer deal for the second time because of U.S. surveillance concerns in a ruling that could disrupt thousands of companies that rely on the pact.

Headlines: EU's Vestager says court rulings on Apple taxes, EU data transfer tool are a 'loss'
Description: The European Union's antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager said on Thursday that EU court rulings this week, which saw courts reject a key EU tool used to transfer Europeans' personal data across the Atlantic and reject an EU order for Apple to pay 13 billion euros in Irish back taxes, were a "loss".

Headlines: China's economy rebounds after steep slump, weak demand, U.S. tensions raise risks
Description: China's economy returned to growth in the second quarter after a deep slump at the start of the year, but unexpected weakness in domestic consumption underscored the need for more policy support to bolster the recovery after the shock of the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Communication collapse: Inside Facebook's tussle with Brazil's central bank
Description: Allowing millions of Brazilian users of Facebook's  WhatsApp to send money as easily as texts seemed a golden opportunity for the world's largest social media company.

Headlines: BOJ looks to big data for clues on pandemic-driven economic changes
Description: The coronavirus pandemic may have caused structural changes in Japan's economy and the way it affects inflation, requiring the Bank of Japan to tap more deeply into big data in making policy decisions, the central bank's top economist said on Thursday.

Headlines: Amid national debate on race, Fed's Bostic sees central bank role on inequality
Description: A rising stock market alongside 11% unemployment has put the U.S. Federal Reserve in a quandary amid the national debate over racial and economic fairness: Is it helping fix the problems its top officials agree need fixing, or deepening divides between Black and white, and rich and poor?

Headlines: Germany’s long, lonely campaign: Battling Wirecard’s short sellers
Description: German authorities pressed on for four years investigating investors who bet against Wirecard AG's shares, even after a UK regulator concluded that their evidence against the short sellers was "not sufficient," according to documents and people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: India's Reliance seen emerging as bigger threat for U.S. firms like Amazon, Walmart
Description: A $20 billion fund raising spree may take India's Reliance closer to its dream of becoming a digital giant, further threatening the ambitious plans U.S. companies like Amazon, Walmart and Zoom have for India.

Headlines: Siemens to let staff spend less time in the office permanently
Description: Germany's Siemens  has decided to let its employees work from wherever they want for two or three days a week, in the latest example of how the coronavirus is making major companies re-think how and where their staff work.

Headlines: Ladbrokes owner GVC's long-time CEO Alexander quits
Description: Ladbrokes owner GVC  announced on Thursday the departure of Chief Executive Officer Kenny Alexander, who transformed the company into one of the world's biggest gambling businesses during 13 years at the helm.

Headlines: Danone beefs up Specialized Nutrition business in China
Description: French food group Danone said on Thursday it would spend 100 million euros ($114.08 million) to strengthen its Specialized Nutrition business in China, as it bets on the Chinese market as a source of growth.

Headlines: China vows 'necessary' measures in response to UK's Huawei ban
Description: China will take necessary measures in response to Britain's "discriminatory" ban on Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL], which has severely damaged China's investment confidence in the country, China's Commerce Ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: China says UK has lost independence on Huawei issue
Description: China said on Thursday that Britain has lost its independence on the matter of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd after London decided to ban all Huawei equipment from its 5G networks by the end of 2027.

Headlines: Many verified Twitter accounts able to post again after hacking
Description: Twitter  users with verified accounts started to be able to send tweets again at around 8:30 pm EDT, after the company had silenced some of its highest-profile users in response to an hours-long security incident.

Headlines: American Airlines sending 25,000 furlough notices as U.S. demand sags
Description: American Airlines  said on Wednesday it is sending 25,000 notices of potential furloughs to frontline workers and warned that demand for air travel is slowing again as COVID-19 cases increase and states re-establish quarantine restrictions.

Headlines: Royal Bank of Scotland bids farewell to tainted name on July 22
Description: Royal Bank of Scotland  will formally change its name to NatWest Group on July 22, in a move aimed at distancing the state-backed lender from its government bailout during the 2008/9 financial crisis.

Headlines: With inflation in India ticking higher it may be time for RBI to pause
Description: With India's economic growth sputtering, the Reserve Bank of India was expected to maintain a rate-cutting cycle, but an uptick in near-term inflation could give the central bank's Monetary Policy Committee reason to pause for now.

Headlines: IMF chief warns global economy 'not out of the woods,' dangers lurk
Description: Global economic activity is picking up after an unprecedented decline this year due to the coronavirus pandemic, but a second major wave of infections could trigger more disruptions, the International Monetary Fund's top official said.

Headlines: Trumps tweet support for Goya Foods amid boycott campaign
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and his daughter and adviser Ivanka Trump are rallying support for Goya Foods on Twitter, as social media pressure continues for boycotting the largest Hispanic-owned U.S. food company over its CEO's effusive praise for Trump.

Headlines: Delayed tax day to bring revenue lift to cash-strapped U.S. states
Description: A downward spiral in revenue in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak will pause this month for most U.S. states as Wednesday's income tax filing deadline generates billions of dollars in payments that would have been due in April.

Headlines: Tesla registrations in California nearly halve in second quarter: data
Description: Tesla Inc's  vehicle registrations nearly halved in the U.S. state of California during the second quarter, according to data from Cross-Sell, a marketing research firm that collates title and registration data.

Headlines: China's economy will continue recovery in second half: stats bureau
Description: China's economy will continue its recovery in the second half of the year, although the impact from the coronavirus pandemic on the world economy would create some challenges for its growth, the statistics bureau said on Thursday.

Headlines: New York Times to move part of Hong Kong office to Seoul in wake of security law
Description: The New York Times  will shift part of its Hong Kong office to Seoul, the latest sign of the chill spreading in the global financial centre just two weeks after Beijing imposed a new national security law.

Headlines: China's second-quarter GDP grows 3.2% year-on-year, beats expectations
Description: China's economy grew 3.2% in the second-quarter from a year earlier, data showed on Thursday, recovering from a record contraction as lockdown measures ended and policymakers stepped up stimulus to combat the shock from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: China industrial output rises 4.8% year-on-year in June; retail sales, investment fall
Description: China's industrial output rose 4.8% in June from a year earlier, data showed Thursday, expanding for the third straight month and offering some relief to an economy trying to regain its footing from the shock of the coronavirus outbreak earlier in the year.

Headlines: Google ties more work tools into Gmail, aiming to get ahead of Microsoft
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google said on Wednesday its corporate Gmail customers would now be able to edit documents and other files without leaving the email service, as it aims to lure clients from rivals by making its tools more integrated.

Headlines: Dell considering spinning off VMware stake, shares surge
Description: Dell Technologies Inc  is considering spinning off its 81% stake in cloud computing software maker VMware , the PC maker said on Wednesday, adding that such a move would not occur before September 2021.

Headlines: U.S. judge confirms Berkshire Hathaway unit's 643 million euro award against German pipemaker
Description: A U.S. judge on Wednesday confirmed a 643 million euro ($734 million) arbitration award favoring a unit of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  that claimed it was fraudulently induced to buy an ailing German pipemaker that inflated sales to look profitable.

Headlines: Neiman Marcus must justify executive bonuses: U.S. Justice Department lawyer
Description: Top executives of Neiman Marcus, which filed for bankruptcy in May, do not deserve bonuses of up to $10 million unless they can show they boosted the luxury department store chain's earnings, a U.S. Department of Justice lawyer said.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies on vaccine bets, Goldman results
Description: U.S. stocks ended sharply higher on Wednesday, with the S&P 500 at its highest since early June, following promising early data for a potential COVID-19 vaccine and a strong quarterly report from Goldman Sachs.

Headlines: Japan firms see no immediate fix for virus pain, some eye better productivity: Reuters poll
Description: Nearly half of Japan's companies have no immediate plans in place to help counter the impact of the coronavirus pandemic, although a third of those surveyed in a Reuters poll indicated they were looking to improve productivity to cushion the blow.

Headlines: Major U.S. retailers Walmart, Kroger will require customers to wear masks
Description: Walmart Inc, Kroger Co and Kohls Corp will require shoppers to wear face coverings starting next week, the retailers said on Wednesday, imposing a widely-accepted protective measure as coronavirus cases jump across the United States.

Headlines: Boeing to support NASA with ISS operations through 2024
Description: Boeing Co  said on Wednesday it would support International Space Station (ISS) operations through September 2024 as part of a $916 million contract extension with NASA.

Headlines: Global stocks rally on vaccine hopes, crude oil gains
Description: World shares strode to four-month highs on Wednesday as hopes for a coronavirus vaccine offset rising U.S.-China tensions and also helped lift the euro and oil prices on improved sentiment.

Headlines: Britain publishes plans to keep internal trade flowing after Brexit
Description: Britain publishes plans on Thursday to keep trade flowing freely between its constituent nations when regulatory powers are reclaimed from the European Union at the end of the year and redistributed to devolved governments in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

Headlines: Pompeo says U.S. to impose visa curbs on Huawei over rights
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo took fresh aim at China on Wednesday, saying the United States would impose visa restrictions on Chinese firms like Huawei Technologies Co Ltd that he accused of facilitating human-rights violations.

Headlines: Virgin Galactic ropes in Disney veteran as CEO
Description: Billionaire Richard Branson's Virgin Galactic Holdings Inc  on Wednesday named Walt Disney Co  executive Michael Colglazier as its new chief executive officer, sending its shares up 4.3% in extended trade.

Headlines: Apple expands news offerings with audio, local newspaper stories
Description: Apple Inc  on Wednesday expanded its news offerings with audio versions of stories narrated by voice actors for subscribers, a morning newscast hosted by two journalists and more access to local newspaper stories.

Headlines: U.S. rare earths miner MP Materials to go public in $1.47 billion deal
Description: U.S. rare earths miner MP Materials will go public in a $1.47 billion deal by merging with a private-equity backed blank-check company, underscoring Wall Street's rising interest in efforts to boost production of the strategic minerals.

Headlines: Safe-haven dollar hits one-month low on vaccine hopes
Description: Risk sentiment revived in currency markets on Wednesday as progress toward a COVID-19 vaccine helped equities rebound and commodity currencies strengthen, pushing the dollar to a one-month low.

Headlines: UBS will no longer be able to contest client data sent to France tax authorities: Swiss court
Description: UBS  will no longer be informed or be able to contest customer data the Swiss tax authorities hand over to counterparties in France investigating alleged tax avoidance, a Swiss court said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Oil climbs 2% on U.S. stock draw but gains capped as OPEC+ set to ease cuts
Description: Oil prices rose 2% on Wednesday, supported by a sharp drop in U.S. crude inventories, but further gains were limited as OPEC and its allies are set to ease supply curbs from August as the global economy gradually recovers from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: OPEC+ eases record oil cuts as economy recovers from pandemic
Description: OPEC and allies such as Russia agreed on Wednesday to ease record oil supply curbs from August as the global economy slowly recovers from the coronavirus pandemic but said a second wave of the virus could complicate rebalancing in the market.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing snaps back; new COVID-19 cases threaten recovery
Description: U.S. factory output rose by the most in more than 74 years in June as motor vehicle production accelerated amid the reopening of businesses, but the nascent economic recovery was overshadowed by surging new COVID-19 infections.

Headlines: Amazon extends work from home policy, still restricting travel
Description: Amazon.com Inc  has extended a work-from-home policy until Jan. 8 and is continuing to ask employees to defer all non-essential travel, a spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: No coronavirus risk to Tesla's Elon Musk after meeting with Oklahoma governor: spokesman
Description: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk and other Tesla employees are not at risk of having contracted the novel coronavirus after a July 3 meeting with Oklahoma's governor, who said on Wednesday he had tested positive for the virus, a spokesman for the governor said.

Headlines: Beyond Meat to sell plant-based patties Brazil, world's No. 3 beef consumer
Description: Beyond Meat Inc  said on Wednesday it will sell plant-based burgers and sausages at a Brazilian high-end supermarket chain, entering the country about two weeks after launching in mainland China's retail market through Alibaba Group's  Freshippo markets.

Headlines: Blow for EU as Apple wins fight against $15 billion tax order
Description: Apple scored a major win on Wednesday as Europe's second-highest court rejected an EU order for the iPhone maker to pay 13 billion euros ($15 billion) in Irish back taxes, dealing a blow to the bloc's attempts to crack down on sweetheart tax deals.

Headlines: S&P 500 beating Nasdaq for fourth day as investors shift focus
Description: The S&P 500 index on Wednesday was on track to beat the technology-heavy Nasdaq Composite for a fourth straight session, a feat scored only twice since Wall Street launched its massive recovery last March.

Headlines: Google backs Reliance's Jio Platforms with $4.5 billion India investment
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google will invest $4.5 billion in Reliance Industries' digital unit, the Indian group said on Wednesday as it laid out an ambitious roadmap for its businesses ranging from entertainment to retail.

Headlines: VW centralises group software development at Audi
Description: Volkswagen  on Wednesday said it was replacing software chief Christian Senger and moving the centre of its group-wide software development from its Wolfsburg headquarters to Ingolstadt, where premium brand Audi is based.

Headlines: J.C. Penney to cut 1,000 jobs, close 152 stores
Description: J.C. Penney Co Inc said on Wednesday it would cut about 1,000 jobs and shutter 152 stores as the U.S. department store chain looks to emerge from Chapter 11 protection and the COVID-19 crisis.

Headlines: Travel stocks soar as encouraging vaccine study lifts Europe
Description: European stocks closed at over a five-week high on Wednesday, with travel stocks surfing a wave of optimism following reports of progress in developing a COVID-19 vaccine.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs leans on trading profits to boost capital, legal reserves
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc's  outsized reliance on trading and investment banking became a big advantage in the second quarter, driving up revenue while avoiding losses due to the coronavirus, but the pop may prove to be fleeting.

Headlines: Pompeo says U.S. to have decisions soon on Chinese technology firms, apps
Description: The United States hopes to have a set of decisions shortly on Chinese telecoms companies that will reflect Washington's central understanding that the information of U.S. citizens should be protected from Beijing authorities, U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing output surges in June, but production still below pre-pandemic level
Description: U.S. factory output increased for a second straight month in June as motor vehicle production accelerated amid the reopening of businesses, but the nascent improvement in manufacturing activity was overshadowed by surging new COVID-19 infections.

Headlines: As virus-wary shoppers opt for online purchases, retailers pay the price
Description: Online sales may be a saving grace for pandemic-battered retailers with fewer shoppers in their stores. But many retailers, from department store chain Macy's Inc to essential retailer Target Corp, are grappling with higher expenses related to e-commerce.

Headlines: Moderna shares jump on data from early coronavirus vaccine trial
Description: Moderna Inc's  shares rose around 11% on Wednesday after a small-scale study showed its experimental COVID-19 vaccine produced high levels of virus-killing antibodies, bolstering hopes the shot could prove effective in later stages of testing.

Headlines: German watchdog under EU scrutiny as it widens Wirecard investigation
Description: The European Union's markets watchdog said on Wednesday that it was reviewing Germany's financial reporting set-up in the wake of Wirecard's  collapse as Germany widened its own investigation into the failed company.

Headlines: Swatch Group free to supply watch movements, says Swiss watchdog
Description: Swatch Group  will be free to supply mechanical watch movements wherever it wants, but won't be allowed to abuse its dominant market position by undercutting rivals' prices, Swiss competition watchdog WEKO said on Wednesday.

Headlines: German's watchdog widens probe of possible Wirecard insider trading
Description: Germany's financial watchdog is widening its examination into possible insider trading of Wirecard shares to include any individuals who have sat on the company's management and supervisory boards in 2020, a BaFin spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Policymakers will tread carefully on tax reform after Apple ruling, says Ireland's Donohoe
Description: Policymakers will pay greater care to the legal foundations of corporate tax reforms after an EU order for Apple to pay 13 billion euros ($14.9 billion) in Irish back taxes was rejected in court, Ireland's finance minister said on Wednesday.

Headlines: EU regulators seek feedback on Google's Fitbit data pledge
Description: EU antitrust enforcers are asking interested parties whether Google's pledge not to use fitness tracker maker Fitbit's  health data for its advertising, and to separate the dataset from its own, might ease concerns over their tie up.

Headlines: Britain's BBC announces further 70 job cuts in news
Description: British broadcaster BBC said on Wednesday it would cut 520 jobs in its news operation, 70 more than the number of layoffs announced in January which were put on hold due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: China warns UK: 'Dumping' Huawei will cost you
Description: China warned British Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Wednesday that his decision to ban Huawei from the 5G network would cost Britain dearly in investment, casting the move as the result of politicised pressure from U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Navistar to develop self-driving trucks with TuSimple
Description: Truck maker Navistar International Corp  has bought a minority stake in TuSimple and aims to co-develop self-driving trucks by 2024 with the technology company as it rolls out a national U.S. autonomous freight network, the two companies said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Back-to-school sales to hit $102 billion as laptop buys surge: NRF
Description: U.S. households are likely to spend a record $102 billion in back-to-school shopping next month, with laptop sales set to boom as parents anticipate the COVID-19 pandemic will keep at least some classes online, a U.S. trade group said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Arm raises prices on chip technology for some customers, sources say
Description: SoftBank Group Corp-owned  semiconductor technology supplier Arm Ltd has moved to raise licensing fees for some customers in recent negotiations, four people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Chipotle plans on hiring 10,000 workers to support drive-thru expansion
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc  said on Wednesday it plans to hire as many as 10,000 employees over the next few months to help support the expansion of drive-thru lanes at its restaurants.

Headlines: Singapore Airlines flags slow recovery in 2021, sees operating first quarter loss
Description: Singapore Airlines Ltd  on Wednesday flagged a hit to its revenue making ability in full-year 2021 on seeing a slower than expected recovery as the ongoing coronavirus crisis saps demand for air travel.

Headlines: Delta takes $3 billion charge on buyouts, American Airlines workers brace for furlough warnings
Description: Delta Air Lines  said on Wednesday it would record charges of up to $3 billion in the current quarter for buyout packages aimed at reducing costs while avoiding involuntary furloughs in the fall.

Headlines: No time frame for any possible Apple appeal, EU Commission says
Description: The European Commission could not say on Wednesday how long it might take to decide whether or not to appeal an earlier court tax ruling on iPhone maker Apple, a spokeswoman for the EU executive told reporters.

Headlines: Special Report: Drug cartel ‘narco-antennas’ make life dangerous for Mexico’s cell tower repairmen
Description: The young technician shut off the electricity at a cellular tower in rural Mexico to begin some routine maintenance.

Headlines: Nissan bets on new Ariya electric SUV to symbolize its revamp, but sales plans modest
Description: Nissan Motor Co  on Wednesday unveiled the Ariya - an electric SUV and its first all-new global model in five years - hoping it will symbolize its road to recovery after more than a year of scandal and a precipitous decline into earnings losses.

Headlines: Brazil's Embraer says Helvetic to convert orders to bigger aircraft: filing
Description: Brazilian planemaker Embraer SA  said Helvetic Airways has reached an agreement to convert four firm orders to the larger aircraft E195-E2 from the original E190-E2s.

Headlines: Handelsbanken, SEB top forecasts as Nordic banks weather pandemic
Description: Quarterly profits at Handelsbanken  and SEB  fell less than expected as the Swedish banks coped with the economic hit from the COVID-19 pandemic, although SEB saw a spike in provisions for bad loans.

Headlines: 'Hands free': Automakers race to next level of not quite self-driving cars
Description: Autopilot, ProPilot, CoPilot: Automakers have many names for new systems that allow for hands-free driving, but no safety or performance standards to follow as they roll out the most significant changes to vehicle technology in a generation.

Headlines: Factbox: Semi-automated driving systems: Not all are 'hands free'
Description: At least five automakers offer some form of semi-automated driving system in the United States — but not all are truly "hands free" because they require the driver to keep his or her hands on the wheel.

Headlines: VW brand freezes new hiring until end 2020
Description: Volkswagen  has stopped hiring new staff at its core brand until year end, VW's brand's chief said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ireland welcomes annulling of EU Apple tax order
Description: Ireland welcomed the judgment by Europe's second-top court on Wednesday to reject a European Union order that iPhone maker Apple pay 13 billion euros ($14.78 billion) in Irish back taxes.

Headlines: Apple welcomes court ruling against EU tax order
Description: Apple said on Wednesday that it was pleased that Europe's second-top court had rejected an EU order to the iPhone maker to pay 13 billion euros ($14.78 billion) in Irish back taxes.

Headlines: EU's Vestager vows to continue tax fight after Apple setback
Description: EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager vowed on Wednesday to continue her fight against tax measures used by multinationals despite a setback dealt by Europe's second-top court, which earlier scrapped her 13 billion euro tax order to Apple.

Headlines: U.S. Paycheck Protection hit some of its mark, but missed the most vulnerable
Description: The Paycheck Protection Program appears to have thrown a critical safety net under U.S. middle and upper-middle-wage jobs, but it faltered when it comes to lower-paying positions and the industries hit hardest by the coronavirus pandemic, according to a Reuters analysis of loan details.

Headlines: UK minister on Trump's Huawei remark: 'We all know Trump don't we'
Description: A senior British minister on Wednesday denied that U.S. President Donald Trump was responsible for Britain's 5G ban on Huawei, saying the decision was a considered one despite attempts by some individuals to claim credit.

Headlines: China says UK's 'dumping' of Huawei will hit investment
Description: China said on Wednesday that Prime Minister Boris Johnson's 5G ban on Huawei was disheartening and that other Chinese businesses had followed how the telecoms giant was "dumped" so investment would be hurt.

Headlines: Airbnb says one million nights booked in one day
Description: (This July 14 story, corrects headline, first paragraph to say guests booked 1 million nights)

Headlines: Singapore's Resorts World, a major employer, axes jobs as virus batters tourism
Description: Resorts World Sentosa, one of Singapore's biggest private sector employers, said on Wednesday it was laying off staff to cut costs as the coronavirus pandemic batters the city-state's tourism industry.

Headlines: Tele2 says Huawei remains a 'viable vendor'
Description: Swedish telecom operator Tele2 sees China's Huawei as a "viable vendor", although that could change in the future, its top chief said on Wednesday.

Headlines: ASOS to reject UK govt bonus for bringing back furloughed staff
Description: British online fashion retailer ASOS  on Wednesday joined peers Primark  and John Lewis in saying it would not take advantage of a British government scheme to pay employers for bringing back staff from furlough.

Headlines: Amid Hong Kong convulsion, Taiwan pitches investors its democracy
Description: Amid political turmoil in financial hub Hong Kong, Taiwan is pitching investors its democracy, rule of law and high quality of life as the island aims to draw more foreign money and talent, Taiwan's top financial regulator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wanted: signs of V-shaped recovery in earnings reports
Description: (This July 14 story corrects currency conversion, paragraph 7.)

Headlines: Coronavirus cost jobs at a third of small firms open in May: global Facebook survey
Description: One small firm in three around the world was obliged to cut jobs to stay open through the coronavirus pandemic in May, a survey showed on Wednesday, underlining how hard the outbreak has slammed the world economy.

Headlines: Chinese mutual fund industry sees jump in new funds and inflows
Description: China's mutual fund industry saw another massive jump in new products and subscriptions in June, suggesting the swift rally in mainland stocks has room to run further.

Headlines: China says it will act to protect its interests after UK Huawei ban
Description: China said on Wednesday it will take all necessary measures to safeguard its interests following Britain's decision to purge all Huawei Technologies Co Ltd equipment from its 5G network by the end of 2027.

Headlines: SMIC's Shanghai listing tests if money alone can bring chip dominance to China
Description: China's biggest chipmaker SMIC is set to follow its staggering $6.6 billion share sale with its Shanghai market debut on Thursday, just as Sino-U.S. tension widens the chasm it wants to cross to reach global leader TSMC, industry insiders said.

Headlines: Asian shares gain in cautious mood as U.S.-China tensions rise
Description: Asian shares rose on Wednesday led by coronavirus vaccine hopes though sentiment was cautious after Beijing vowed retaliatory sanctions against the United States, while the euro rose to a four-month high ahead of a crucial EU summit.

Headlines: Over 2,500 games removed from Apple's China App Store after loophole shuts: data firm
Description: More than 2,500 mobile games were removed from Apple's China app store in the first week of July, four times as many in the same period in June, after Apple closed a loophole to comply with Chinese licence requirements, data from SensorTower showed.

Headlines: UK to purge Huawei from 5G by end of 2027, siding with Trump over China
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson ordered Huawei equipment to be purged completely from Britain's 5G network by the end of 2027, risking the ire of China by signalling that the world's biggest telecoms equipment maker is not welcome in the West.

Headlines: UK's Huawei decision disappointing and wrong: China's ambassador
Description: China's ambassador to Britain said the decision to strip Huawei equipment out of the country's 5G network was disappointing and wrong and called into question Britain's openness to foreign investors.

Headlines: Shares of Hyundai Motor jump nearly 8% on Seoul's 'green new deal'
Description: Shares of Hyundai Motor  jumped nearly 8% on Wednesday, a day after South Korea announced a "green new deal" to spur use of environmentally friendly vehicles.

Headlines: Internal U.S. small business watchdog launches inquiry into duplicate pandemic loans
Description: The U.S. Small Business Administration's internal watchdog has launched an inquiry into a technical glitch that led many small businesses to receive duplicate loans through a high-profile federal coronavirus aid program.

Headlines: China to sanction Lockheed Martin over Taiwan arms sale
Description: China will sanction Lockheed Martin for involvement in the latest U.S. arms sale to Chinese-claimed Taiwan, Beijing said on Tuesday, adding tension to its troubled relationship with the United States.

Headlines: Tesla secures tax breaks for cybertruck factory in Texas
Description: A central Texas county that includes Austin on Tuesday approved a plan to provide millions in tax subsidies to Tesla Inc  if it builds a $1.1 billion vehicle factory in the area.

Headlines: Dakota Access pipeline can keep running amid legal fight: U.S. court
Description: The Dakota Access oil pipeline can continue to operate amid an ongoing court battle, a U.S. Appeals Court said on Tuesday, setting aside for now a lower court's order earlier this month to shut and empty the line.

Headlines: Crunch time for Apple in fight against $15 billion EU tax order
Description: Apple's clash with EU competition regulators comes to a head on Wednesday as Europe's second-highest court rules on whether it has to pay 13 billion euros ($15 billion) in Irish back taxes, a key part of the EU's crackdown against sweetheart tax deals.

Headlines: Calvin Klein owner PVH to cut 450 jobs in North America, shut 162 outlets
Description: PVH Corp  said on Tuesday it would cut 450 jobs in North America and shutter 162 retail stores of its business that houses brands such as Van Heusen and IZOD, as the coronavirus crisis wreaks havoc on the apparel industry.

Headlines: Wall Street surges, led by energy and materials
Description: Wall Street surged on Tuesday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average ending more than 2% higher as investors bought energy and materials stocks and looked beyond a recent rise in coronavirus cases.

Headlines: Fed officials warn on 'thick fog' ahead for U.S. economy as recovery concerns deepen
Description: The U.S. economy will recover more slowly than expected amid a surge in novel coronavirus cases across the country, and a broad second wave of the disease could cause economic pain to deepen again, Federal Reserve officials warned on Tuesday.

Headlines: Oil rises slightly as OPEC+ complies with production cuts
Description: Oil prices rose slightly on Tuesday as OPEC and its allies cut production by more than agreed to in June, although demand concerns lingered due to increased cases of COVID-19 in the United States. Brent crude  futures settled up 18 cents at $42.90 a barrel, after moving lower earlier in the session. U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude  futures rose 19 cents to $40.29 a barrel.

Headlines: Fed's Harker says increase in coronavirus cases has direct economic impact
Description: The increase in coronavirus cases across the U.S. can stall the economy and make consumers cautious, Philadelphia Federal Reserve Bank President Patrick Harker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan says there is 'lots of overcapacity' in U.S. economy: CNBC
Description: Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Robert Kaplan said on Tuesday there is "lots of overcapacity in the economy," which he described as "disinflationary."

Headlines: Fed's Brainard: Forward guidance and yield curve control 'very complementary' tools
Description: It may become relevant for the U.S. Federal Reserve to consider using yield curve control in the future alongside the use of forward guidance to help speed the U.S. economic recovery from the coronavirus pandemic, Fed Governor Lael Brainard said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed's Harker says U.S. economic downturn is painful and 'stubbornly long-lasting'
Description: Months after the coronavirus arrived in the United States, the economy remains "mired" in crisis and policymakers need to create solutions that offer better support to struggling small businesses, Philadelphia Federal Reserve Bank President Patrick Harker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Massachusetts sues Uber, Lyft over driver status as contractors
Description: Massachusetts on Tuesday followed California in suing Uber Technologies Inc and Lyft Inc over allegedly misclassifying their drivers as independent contractors instead of employees entitled to extensive benefits.

Headlines: Iowa farm billionaire's companies receive U.S. pandemic aid
Description: Iowa-based seed companies owned or partially owned by billionaire Harry Stine won approval for at least six loans - totaling $2.55 million to $6.35 million - in the first round of the federal government's pandemic aid program for small businesses, an analysis of government data showed.

Headlines: Dollar falls on rising inflation expectations, higher euro
Description: The dollar fell in North American trade on Tuesday as expectations for inflation picked up slightly and the euro rose on optimism about the possibility of a European Union stimulus package.

Headlines: Virus worries and FOMO drive options bets on surging tech giants
Description: Options investors are ramping up bets on some of this year's  biggest winners, including Amazon.com Inc , Netflix Inc  and Tesla Inc , even as they turn cautious on the wider market amid a resurgent U.S. coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Elanco to divest brands, forgo Canadian rights for Bayer's unit deal
Description: Elanco Animal Health Inc  has decided against acquiring Bayer AG's Canadian distribution rights to several poultry insecticides, Canada's Competition Bureau said on Tuesday, as it looks to complete a $7.6-billion deal.

Headlines: Google faces lawsuit over tracking in apps even when users opted out
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google records what people are doing on hundreds of thousands of mobile apps even when they follow the company's recommended settings for stopping such monitoring, a lawsuit seeking class action status alleged on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wells Fargo will cut costs further after first loss since 2008
Description: Wells Fargo & Co will launch a broad cost-cutting initiative this year, executives said on Tuesday, as the bank braces for massive loan losses caused by the coronavirus pandemic and continues to work through expensive regulatory and operational problems tied to a long-running sales scandal.

Headlines: Free pizza and a 75-foot statue of Musk: the battle for the next Tesla plant
Description: Tulsa, Oklahoma, is an oil-industry town with a 75-foot (23 m) statue called "The Golden Driller."

Headlines: Delta CEO says demand 'at a stall,' 2019 business travel may never return
Description: Delta Air Lines  expects its third-quarter revenue and flight capacity to be around 20% to 25% of last summer, with demand stalling amid a surge in COVID-19 cases and a sustainable industry recovery more than two years away.

Headlines: BT says Huawei ban can be absorbed in 500 million pounds already earmarked
Description: BT , Britain's biggest mobile and broadband company, said it estimated that a ban on Huawei's equipment in its 5G networks would cost it no more than the 500 million pounds ($630 million)it had earmarked to comply with a cap imposed earlier this year.

Headlines: "Thick fog" over U.S. economy and Fed will need to provide sustained accommodation: Brainard
Description: There is a great deal of uncertainty about the path ahead for the U.S. economy and the Federal Reserve should use forward guidance and large-scale asset purchases for a "sustained" period in order to help the recovery, Fed Governor Lael Brainard said on Tuesday, as she offered a downbeat assessment of the risks ahead.

Headlines: Google hit with 600,000 euro Belgian privacy fine
Description: Google has received a record fine from Belgium's data protection authority (APD) of 600,000 euros for not complying with European rules on a person's "right to be forgotten" online.

Headlines: German watchdog files new Wirecard insider trading complaint
Description: The German financial watchdog BaFin said on Tuesday that it had filed a complaint with Munich prosecutors over a further episode of alleged insider trading in Wirecard.

Headlines: Can Netflix stay one of Wall Street's favorite pandemic stocks? Results due Thursday
Description: Netflix Inc will tell investors on Thursday how home-bound audiences and a lack of live sports have boosted its membership rolls even as streaming competition rises to unprecedented levels.

Headlines: Thailand's AIS says Huawei among bidders to build 5G core networks
Description: Thailand's largest mobile operator Advanced Info Service Pcl  said on Tuesday Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL] was among five companies bidding to build its 5G core networks as it ramped up investments this year.

Headlines: Gasoline boosts U.S. inflation; escalating COVID-19 cases seen suppressing demand
Description: U.S. consumer prices rebounded by the most in nearly eight years in June, but a resurgence in new COVID-19 cases after the reopening of businesses suggests a moderation in demand that could keep inflation muted and allow the Federal Reserve to keep injecting money into the ailing economy.

Headlines: Wall Street banks see trading-revenue renaissance ending soon
Description: Big swings in stock and bond markets since March have helped big Wall Street banks weather the coronavirus downturn better than they otherwise might have, but their trading-revenue gains are unlikely to last.

Headlines: Boeing 737 MAX cancellations top 350 planes in first half of 2020
