Description: Boeing Co customers canceled orders for 355 of its 737 MAX jets in the first half of 2020, the U.S. planemaker said on Tuesday, as the damage done by the jet's grounding and the coronavirus crisis to the airline industry continued to mount.

Headlines: Spotify expands to Russia and 12 other countries
Description: Spotify Technology SA  on Tuesday launched its music streaming service in Russia, the fastest growing international market for music, and 12 other regions as part of its expansion strategy after breaking into India last year.

Headlines: BlackRock cast tougher climate votes, environmentalists want more
Description: BlackRock Inc  released figures showing it took a tougher stance on climate matters in the springtime proxy season, though it drew criticism from environmentalists claiming the top asset manager failed to back up its recent emphasis on the area.

Headlines: JPMorgan braces for loan losses as trading props up profit
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co beat Wall Street profit estimates in the second quarter due to a surge in trading revenue while setting aside a record $10.5 billion to cover future defaults, as the bank predicts the United States faces a tougher path to economic recovery.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump administration to soon end audit deal underpinning Chinese listings in U.S. - official
Description: The Trump administration plans to soon scrap a 2013 agreement between U.S. and Chinese auditing authorities, a senior State Department official said, a move that could foreshadow a broader crackdown on U.S.-listed Chinese firms under fire for sidestepping American disclosure rules.

Headlines: Virgin Atlantic agrees $1.5 billion rescue deal
Description: Virgin Atlantic has agreed a rescue deal with shareholders and creditors worth 1.2 billion pounds ($1.5 billion) to secure its future beyond the coronavirus crisis, the British airline said on Tuesday.

Headlines: India quizzing owners of banned Chinese apps over content and practices
Description: Chinese companies such as TikTok-owner ByteDance have been asked by India to answer 77 questions about their apps that have been banned by New Delhi, including whether they censored content, worked on behalf of foreign governments or lobbied influencers.

Headlines: Tech sell-off weighs on Europe as virus fears mount; FTSE 100 outperforms
Description: European stocks were hit by a selloff in technology shares on Tuesday, as U.S. peers slumped on fears of new coronavirus restrictions, while London blue-chips outperformed on a boost for the telecoms and energy sectors.

Headlines: VW to shift centre of software development to Audi
Description: Volkswagen  will shift leadership for software development to the company's premium Audi division in Ingolstadt, Bavaria, Herbert Diess, chief executive of the multi-brand group said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Crowded trade, high valuations: why investors worry about tech stocks
Description: Some investors are getting increasingly worried about the outlook for technology and big growth stocks after a massive rally which has pushed the Nasdaq Composite index to record highs despite the coronavirus-inflicted economic damage.

Headlines: UK's Huawei block protects its security, trade and rights-U.S. envoy
Description: Britain's decision to ban China's Huawei from its 5G mobile networks was welcomed by the U.S  ambassador to the country, Woody Johnson, who said it was a win for fair trade and human rights.

Headlines: In New York's Harlem, small businesses reel from coronavirus toll on Black communities
Description: Sylvia's, a soul food restaurant on Malcolm X Boulevard in Harlem, New York, saw a welcome bump in donations and revenue from new customers in early June following calls to "buy Black" after the death of George Floyd.

Headlines: U.S. air passengers fell 89% in May amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: U.S. airlines carried 89% fewer passengers in May compared with last year, a massive decline that is still better than a historic low in April amid the coronavirus pandemic, the U.S. Transportation Department said Tuesday.

Headlines: Comcast bets on ads with launch of Peacock streaming service
Description: Comcast-owned NBCUniversal will enter a crowded streaming market on Wednesday when it launches its Peacock streaming service nationally, offering 20,000 hours of content, including NBC shows such as "30 Rock," "Cheers" and "Saturday Night Live."

Headlines: UK bans Huawei from its 5G network: reaction
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson has ordered Huawei equipment to be purged completely from Britain's 5G network by 2027, risking the ire of China by signalling that the world's biggest telecoms equipment maker is no longer welcome in the West.

Headlines: German court bans Tesla ad statements related to autonomous driving
Description: Germany has banned Tesla from repeating what a court says are misleading advertising statements relating to the capabilities of the firm's driver assistance systems and to autonomous driving, a Munich judge ruled on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trading gains shield Citi as bad loan provisions surge
Description: Citigroup Inc on Tuesday posted a 73% plunge in quarterly profit, as the bank set aside nearly $8 billion to brace itself for a potential surge in loan defaults stemming from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Big U.S. banks predict more economic pain from coronavirus
Description: Three of the largest U.S. banks said on Tuesday they had set aside a whopping $28 billion for loan losses, in a stark reminder that much of the economic pain from the coronavirus pandemic is still to come.

Headlines: As Britain bans Huawei, U.S. pressure mounts on Europe to follow suit
Description: Britain's decision to ban China's Huawei from its 5G network increases further pressure on EU countries to impose stricter limits on the world's largest telecoms equipment maker just as the company expands its footprint across Europe.

Headlines: India's Flipkart to raise $1.2 billion in Walmart-led funding
Description: Flipkart will raise $1.2 billion in funding led by majority owner Walmart Inc , the Indian e-commerce firm said on Tuesday, as it looks to compete better with Amazon.com Inc  in a coronavirus-hit market.

Headlines: Exclusive: Huawei hid business operation in Iran after Reuters reported links to CFO
Description: China's Huawei Technologies acted to cover up its relationship with a firm that had tried to sell prohibited U.S. computer gear to Iran, after Reuters in 2013 reported deep links between the firm and the telecom-equipment giant's chief financial officer, newly obtained internal Huawei documents show.

Headlines: Amazon tests primary healthcare program for employees
Description: Amazon.com Inc  said on Tuesday it launched a pilot healthcare program for its employees and their families to provide primary services such as vaccination and physical therapy.

Headlines: 15 U.S. states to jointly work to advance electric heavy-duty trucks
Description: A group of 15 U.S. states and the District of Columbia on Tuesday unveiled a joint memorandum of understanding aimed at boosting the market for electric medium- and heavy-duty vehicles and phasing out diesel-powered trucks by 2050.

Headlines: UK economy limps out of COVID-19 slump as dire 2020 unfolds
Description: Britain's economy stumbled out of its coronavirus-induced slump in May, dashing hopes of a swift rebound as government budget forecasters said it was on course for its worst year since pre-industrial times.

Headlines: Ryanair to cut back Irish schedule over 'defective' quarantine
Description: Ryanair  on Tuesday announced it was cutting 1,000 flights serving its home Irish market in August and September, citing a 14-day quarantine it said was doing "unrecoverable damage" to the country's tourist industry.

Headlines: Huawei says 'disappointing' ban will put UK in the digital slow lane
Description: Huawei said Britain's "disappointing" decision to ban the use of its equipment in its 5G networks was "bad news for anyone in the UK with a mobile phone" and threatened to put the country into the digital slow lane.

Headlines: UK says Canada has a similar Huawei analysis to UK
Description: Britain's digital minister said that Canada had a similar type of analysis to that done by the United Kingdom which on Tuesday said it would ban Huawei equipment from the 5G network by 2027.

Headlines: UK's BT says it will analyse cost and impact of Huawei ban
Description: BT , Britain's biggest mobile and fixed-line operator, said it would analyse the details of the ban on its supplier Huawei in terms of the costs and impact on its business.

Headlines: UK firms rethink FX hedging as coronavirus and Brexit fog outlook
Description: Coronavirus and the end-2020 Brexit deadline have left UK firms facing historic uncertainties, prompting many to find more flexible ways to protect their foreign exchange exposure -- even if these come at a higher initial cost.

Headlines: India's tech hub, other towns back in lockdown amid COVID-19 surge
Description: India's high-tech hub of Bengaluru will go back into a coronavirus lockdown for a week on Tuesday after a surge of infections, threatening to derail government efforts to revive a stuttering economy.

Headlines: How to read U.S. economic data, without the spin
Description: As the United States gears up for presidential, congressional and local elections in November, the country's economy is also on a rollercoaster ride.

Headlines: Bill Gross predicts value outperforms growth, based on rates correlation
Description: Billionaire investor Bill Gross is predicting that value stocks like IBM  and Altria Group  are likely to fare better than growth stocks like Apple  or Amazon.com  in the near term, due to a correlation with real interest rates.

Headlines: India's Bharti Airtel, Verizon tie up on video-conferencing tool
Description: Bharti Airtel Ltd  is partnering with Verizon Communications Inc's  BlueJeans to launch a business-focused video conferencing tool, the Indian wireless carrier said on Tuesday.

Headlines: UK to ban Huawei from 5G network
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson's government will ban Huawei from Britain's 5G network by ordering telecoms companies to remove its equipment by 2027, Media Secretary Oliver Dowden said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Google offers data pledge in bid to win EU okay for Fitbit buy
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google has offered not to use health data of fitness tracker company Fitbit to help it target ads in an attempt to address EU antitrust concerns about its proposed $2.1 billion acquisition, the U.S. tech company said late on Monday.

Headlines: TikTok's U.S. users prepare for life without the video app
Description: Ty Gibson, 20, of Greensboro, North Carolina, brushed off speculation last week on TikTok that his favorite video sharing platform was going to be banned.

Headlines: Investors seek more euro exposure, expect a choppy summer: BofA
Description: Global fund managers said the euro was cheap and they were seeking more exposure to it and European equities on the back of a massive fiscal stimulus plan, a Bank of America survey showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Virgin Atlantic to clinch $1.5 billion rescue deal: Sky News
Description: British airline Virgin Atlantic is close to securing a 1.2 billion pound ($1.5 billion) rescue deal, Sky News reported on Tuesday, removing the medium-term chance of administration as a result of the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Prominent Democrats press Fed, Treasury to aid states, citing racial inequality
Description: With the Republican-controlled U.S. Congress far from agreement on how or even whether to give more aid to states and cities reeling from revenue losses during the coronavirus crisis, three U.S. Senate Democrats are appealing to the U.S. Treasury and the Federal Reserve to do more to help.

Headlines: Niche U.S. finance firms grease global trade of masks, gloves
Description: From specialty finance firms to boutique investment banks, a disparate mix of small financiers is bankrolling a U.S. gold rush for masks, gloves and other supplies in the wake of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Factbox: Huawei's involvement in telecoms networks around the world
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson is set to ban Huawei Technologies Co from Britain's 5G network on Tuesday, angering China but delighting U.S. President Donald Trump by signalling that the world's biggest telecoms equipment maker is no longer welcome in the West.

Headlines: UK economy could shrink 14% this year, budget forecasters say
Description: Britain's economy could shrink by more than 14% this year if there is lasting damage from the coronavirus, a scenario that would push government borrowing to nearly half a trillion dollars, budget forecasters said on Tuesday.

Headlines: John Browne steps down as Huawei UK chairman ahead of government ban
Description: Former BP chief John Browne is stepping down as chairman of Huawei's UK operation ahead of the British government banning the Chinese company from the country's 5G networks later on Tuesday.

Headlines: Google in talks to invest $4 billion in Reliance's digital arm, Bloomberg reports
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google is in advanced talks to invest $4 billion for a stake in the digital arm of Indian conglomerate Reliance Industries Ltd, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Thailand gears up for motor show as pandemic restrictions ease
Description: Thailand's capital on Tuesday prepared to host its twice-postponed annual auto show, with organizers saying it would showcase the country's success in containing the coronavirus.

Headlines: Demand for UK COVID loans and jobs plan flattens out: Treasury data
Description: Demand for emergency coronavirus loans backed by the British government and for its huge job retention programme has further flattened out, finance ministry figures showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Euro zone industry output recovers less than expected
Description: Euro zone industrial production rose in May, official estimates showed on Tuesday, but the recovery from lockdown-induced record declines March and April was lower than expected and far from offsetting past drops.

Headlines: Faced with COVID-19, highest number of Australians tap retirement funds since April
Description: Australians asked to pull out more than A$5 billion ($3.5 billion) from their pension funds in the first week of July, the highest since the government granted early access to retirement savings to support a coronavirus-hit economy.

Headlines: China posts first import growth since pandemic, exports also up
Description: China's imports in June rose for the first time since the coronavirus crisis paralysed the economy, as government stimulus stoked demand for commodities, while exports, fuelled by medical goods, also rose in a sign the recovery is gaining traction.

Headlines: Chongqing city district says it discussed projects with Tesla
Description: U.S. automaker Tesla Inc  has met with officials from a district in the city of Chongqing in southwestern China to discuss "accelerating projects", the Liangjiang New Area said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Euro zone banks expect to tighten access to credit in third quarter, ECB says
Description: Euro zone banks maintained relatively easy access to credit for firms in the second quarter with the backing of government guarantees, but they will likely tighten credit standards in the following three months, the European Central Bank said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Nokia rolls out software upgrade to 5G
Description: Finnish telecoms equipment maker Nokia launched software on Tuesday that enables mobile operators to upgrade their 4G radio stations to new 5G technology without a site visit or replacing equipment.

Headlines: A third of British company audits failed quality test, watchdog says
Description: A third of company audits by Britain's leading accounting firms failed a quality test, the country's accounting watchdog said on Tuesday, piling further pressure on a sector already being questioned over its competence.

Headlines: Volkswagen-SAIC JV to revamp Shanghai plants to make Audi sedans: government document
Description: Volkswagen AG  and its Chinese joint venture partner SAIC Motor  plan to invest 4.13 billion yuan ($590 million) to revamp their car plants in Shanghai to make new Audi sedans, according to a government document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: China's economy seen growing 2.5% in second quarter as lockdowns end, stimulus kicks in: Reuters poll
Description: China's economy likely returned to modest growth in the second quarter after a record contraction, as lockdown measures ended and policymakers announced more stimulus to combat the shock from the coronavirus crisis, according to a Reuters poll.

Headlines: Hedge fund manager Singh calls Trump's handling of coronavirus 'an incredible gift'
Description: President Donald Trump's handling of the coronavirus outbreak early this year was "an incredible gift" for investors because it kept markets stable long enough for some to protect their portfolios, Axon Capital co-founder Dinakar Singh told investors this month.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor Group head says Hyundai, Kia to sell one million EVs in 2025
Description: Hyundai Motor Group leader Euisun Chung said on Tuesday flagship Hyundai Motor  and sister company Kia Motors  aim to sell 1 million electric vehicles (EVs) in 2025, together targeting over 10% of global market share of EVs.

Headlines: Garuda Indonesia talking to Airbus to delay 2020 deliveries
Description: Flag carrier Garuda Indonesia  is in talks with Airbus  to delay deliveries of four aircraft this year, its chief executive said on Tuesday, as the coronavirus outbreak restricts travel and dampens demand.

Headlines: Delta may avoid furloughs after demand for buyouts, other U.S. airlines sound alarm
Description: Delta Air Lines may be able to avoid involuntary furloughs in the fall after receiving interest from more than 15,000 employees for early buyout packages, one person with knowledge of the matter said, even as other U.S. airlines are sounding the alarm on jobs.

Headlines: Singapore and Malaysia to reopen business travel next month
Description: Singapore and Malaysia are to resume essential business and official travel between their countries, they said on Tuesday, letting people cross their border for the first time since most movements were suspended because of the coronavirus in March.

Headlines: China eases Macau border restrictions, shares in casino operators jump
Description: China has loosened coronavirus-related border restrictions between Macau and the neighbouring coastal province of Guangdong, sending shares of Macau casino operators surging on hopes of a quick pickup in demand.

Headlines: First companies obtain regulatory approval for IPOs under new ChiNext system
Description: Three Chinese companies have become the first to obtain regulatory approval to publicly list on Shenzhen's start-up board ChiNext, after a recent reform aimed at fast-tracking initial public offerings (IPOs).

Headlines: China June exports unexpectedly rise 0.5% year-on-year, imports up 2.7%
Description: China's exports in June unexpectedly rose 0.5% from a year earlier, and imports increased 2.7%, customs data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: China's first-half exports to U.S. down 8.1% year-on-year, imports fall 1.5%
Description: China's exports to the United States fell by 8.1% in the first half from the same period a year earlier while imports from the U.S. declined 1.5%, customs spokesman Li Kuiwen told reporters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Bridgewater Associates found to have 'manufactured' false evidence against ex-employees
Description: Hedge fund Bridgewater Associates was found by a panel of arbitrators to have "manufactured false evidence" in a case in which the company attempted to prove that its former employees had stolen trade secrets.

Headlines: Delta may avoid furloughs thanks to demand for early exit deal
Description: Delta Air Lines  may be able to avoid involuntary furloughs in the fall after receiving interest from more than 15,000 employees for early exit deals, one person with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: U.S. Senate to begin debate on new coronavirus bill next week: McConnell
Description: The U.S. Senate will begin debate next week on a fifth coronavirus-response bill, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said on Monday, as he forecast tough negotiations with Democrats who are seeking broader aid than Republicans.

Headlines: Yum's KFC closes dining rooms at company-owned restaurants in Florida
Description: The fried chicken chain KFC has closed dining rooms in corporate-owned stores in Florida because of the escalation in coronavirus cases in the state, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: California's new lockdown dims outlook for U.S. growth in pandemic
Description: California Governor Gavin Newsom's decision Monday to reimpose restrictions on bars, restaurants, gyms and even ordinary office work to tamp down a surge of coronavirus infections is dimming economic growth prospects for the nation as a whole.

Headlines: Chipmaker Analog Devices to buy rival Maxim for about $21 billion
Description: Semiconductor maker Analog Devices Inc  said on Monday it would buy rival Maxim Integrated Products Inc  for about $21 billion in the largest U.S. deal this year, aimed at boosting its market share in automotive and 5G chipmaking.

Headlines: Australia's scandal-hit Westpac names KPMG partner as CFO
Description: Westpac Banking Corp  on Tuesday named KPMG partner Michael Rowland as its chief financial officer, filing the last of its top three positions with permanent appointees more than six months after facing a major money-laundering scandal.

Headlines: American Airlines emphasizes mask rules after photo of Texas senator emerges
Description: American Airlines  said on Monday it had reached out to U.S. Senator Ted Cruz after a photo of the Texas Republican without a mask aboard an airplane was posted on a social media site.

Headlines: S&P 500 and Nasdaq end lower after sharp drop in tech titans
Description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq ended lower on Monday, pulled down by Amazon, Microsoft and other recent big-name leaders of Wall Street's recent rally.

Headlines: Equities reverse after hitting five-month peak, bonds edge higher
Description: World equity benchmarks reversed course after hitting a five-month peak on Monday while safe-haven U.S. government bonds and gold gained, as optimism about a global economic recovery was overtaken by renewed fears amid record numbers of new coronavirus cases in the U.S.

Headlines: Oil slips on surge in COVID-19 infections, U.S.-China tension
Description: Oil prices slipped about 1% on Monday after global coronavirus cases rose by a record daily amount, fanning fears of renewed government lockdowns, and on growing U.S. and European tension with China.

Headlines: Tesla taps brake on massive stock rally
Description: Shares of Tesla ended down 3.1% on Monday, tapping the brakes on a rally that has boosted the electric car maker's stock by over 40% in two weeks.

Headlines: SoftBank Group explores options for chip designer Arm Holdings: WSJ
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  is exploring options including a full or partial sale or public offering of British chip designer Arm Holdings, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.

Headlines: Amid pandemic, wealthy U.S. families approved for government loans
Description: Private investment firms that manage the fortunes of wealthy individuals and their kin were approved for millions of dollars in taxpayer-funded relief loans designed to help small businesses weather the coronavirus lockdown, according to a review of recently released government data.

Headlines: Luckin Coffee ousts chairman Lu, names Guo as CEO
Description: Luckin Coffee Inc  has ousted co-founder and chairman Charles Zhengyao Lu and replaced him with Jinyi Guo, who will also be the chief executive officer, the embattled coffee chain disclosed on Monday.

Headlines: Electric car maker Fisker to go public through SPAC deal at $2.9 billion valuation
Description: Electric car maker Fisker will go public through a merger with a blank-check company backed by alternative investment manager Apollo Global Management Inc at a valuation of $2.9 billion, the companies said on Monday.

Headlines: Dollar stabilizes ahead of earnings, U.S. consumer data
Description: The dollar edged lower on Monday as investors looked to U.S. corporate earnings and upcoming retail data to gauge whether guarded optimism on the economic outlook was justified.

Headlines: British pilot union to hold confidence vote in easyJet COO
Description: EasyJet's  new chief operating officer, Peter Bellew, will face a vote of confidence from pilots this week, the British Airline Pilots Association (BALPA) said on Monday.

Headlines: American Airlines preparing to send furlough warnings this week
Description: American Airlines  is preparing to send notices of potential furloughs, as well as early retirement packages to encourage voluntary departures, to its workers later this week, two people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Apple says full return to offices not until the end of the year: Bloomberg News
Description: Apple Inc  has told its staff that a full return to U.S. offices will not occur before the end of the year, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing an internal video message.

Headlines: Tesla slashes Model Y SUV price as pandemic weighs on auto sector
Description: Tesla Inc  cut the price of its sport utility vehicle Model Y by $3,000, just four months after its launch, as the U.S. electric carmaker seeks to maintain sales momentum in the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. June deficit surges to $864 billion
Description: The U.S. federal budget deficit in June surged to $864 billion from single digits a year earlier amid continued strong spending on coronavirus relief programs and a drop in individual and corporate tax receipts, the Treasury Department said on Monday.

Headlines: EU top court to rule in landmark Facebook, Schrems privacy case
Description: Europe's top court will on Thursday rule on the legality of tools companies use to transfer Europeans' data around the world, in the latest clash between Facebook and Austrian privacy activist Max Schrems.

Headlines: U.S. consumers more secure about jobs but earnings expectations drop: New York Fed survey
Description: U.S. consumers are more optimistic that the worst of the economic crisis sparked by the coronavirus pandemic is behind them, but are still concerned about their earnings and their ability to find new jobs if they become unemployed, according to a survey released on Monday by the New York Federal Reserve.

Headlines: European stocks gain on vaccine, stimulus hopes; earnings eyed
Description: European shares rose on Monday as progress on a possible COVID-19 vaccine, some upbeat earnings reports and stimulus talks fed into hopes of an economic recovery from the coronavirus-induced downturn.

Headlines: Disney to shut Hong Kong Disneyland again as coronavirus cases rise
Description: Walt Disney Co  is temporarily closing its Hong Kong Disneyland theme park from July 15 amid rising coronavirus cases in the Chinese-ruled city, the company said Monday.

Headlines: Alphabet's Google commits $10 billion to accelerate digitization in India
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Monday said it would spend around $10 billion in India over the next five to seven years through equity investments and tie-ups, marking its biggest commitment to a key growth market.

Headlines: Britain set to ban Huawei from 5G, though timescale unclear
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson is set to ban Huawei from Britain's 5G network in a landmark decision that will anger Beijing but win plaudits from President Donald Trump as the United States grapples with China's rising economic and technological clout.

Headlines: Ackman's blank check company raises IPO target to $4 billion
Description: Pershing Square Tontine Holdings Ltd, the blank check company backed by billionaire investor Bill Ackman, has increased the size of its initial public offering by $1 billion to $4 billion, the largest ever IPO by a special purpose acquisition company.

Headlines: NY Fed's Williams says timeline for ending Libor is unchanged by pandemic
Description: The global pandemic that roiled markets in the spring and disrupted daily life across the world is not delaying financial regulators' plans to ditch Libor, an interest rate benchmark that was tainted with scandal after banks rigged it for years, New York Federal Reserve Bank President John Williams said on Monday.

Headlines: Accused Ghosn escape plotters too much flight risk for bail: U.S. judge
Description: (This June 7 story, refiles to correct date in final paragraph to July 28)

Headlines: Brazil's offshore oil workers chilled by coronavirus outbreaks
Description: On Friday, May 1, two workers on the PXA-1 offshore platform  owned by Brazil's state-run oil company Petrobras checked into the facility's infirmary complaining of headaches and fever-like symptoms.

Headlines: C$ rallies along with stocks; BoC decision due Wednesday
Description: The Canadian dollar strengthened against its U.S. counterpart on Monday as stock markets globally climbed and ahead of an interest rate decision this week from the Bank of Canada, with the loonie recovering from a 10-day low on Friday.

Headlines: Alibaba's Jack Ma sells $8.2 billion worth shares, stake dips to 4.8%: filing
Description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd co-founder Jack Ma has cut his stake in the company over the past year to 4.8% from 6.2%, cashing out around $8.2 billion at its current share price, the firm's annual filing released on Friday showed.

Headlines: AMC reaches agreement with bondholders to reduce debt by up to $630 million
Description: AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc said on Monday it had reached an agreement with bondholders to reduce its debt by up to $630 million, as the theater industry suffers from the impact of COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Ubisoft shares sink after misconduct review
Description: Ubisoft  shares dropped 9% on Monday after the French video games group said over the weekend that three senior managers were leaving the company following a review into allegations of inappropriate behaviour.

Headlines: UK government to make Huawei statement on Tuesday
Description: British minister Oliver Dowden will make a statement to parliament on Huawei some time after 1130 GMT on Tuesday, the opposition Labour Party said on Twitter.

Headlines: Diageo to launch Johnnie Walker whisky in paper bottles in 2021
Description: Johnnie Walker scotch whisky will be available in plastic-free bottles from early 2021, Diageo Plc said on Monday, as the world's biggest spirits maker ramps up efforts to tackle plastic waste.

Headlines: Google supports OECD engagement on digital taxes, CEO Pichai says
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google supports a multilateral solution for taxing digital services that is under discussion by the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD), its chief executive Sundar Pichai told Reuters in an interview.

Headlines: Did Uncle Sam's virus aid help your credit score? Don't count on a loan
Description: Rachel Levine, a New York-based office furniture saleswoman, lost her job in late March without any notice or severance pay when the coronavirus outbreak shut down most of the city. The married, 44-year-old mom is still out of work, unsure when or whether she will return to her previous job.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. turns screws on maritime industry to cut off Venezuela's oil
Description: Several companies that certify vessels are seaworthy and ship insurers have withdrawn services to tankers involved in the Venezuelan oil trade as the United States targets the maritime industry to tighten sanctions on the Latin American country.

Headlines: Russia keeps U.S. fuel oil exports high as Washington seeks to replace Venezuelan barrels
Description: Russia kept fuel oil exports to the United States close to its record-highs in the first six months of this year, as Washington looks to replace the heavy Venezuelan barrels it stopped buying a year ago, traders said and data showed.

Headlines: Apple to spend more than $400 million of $2.5 billion California housing fund this year
Description: Apple Inc on Monday said it has allocated more than $400 million of $2.5 billion it pledged last year to stem California's housing crisis.

Headlines: From planes to PPE: Abu Dhabi aerospace emblem Strata chases new markets
Description: Aerospace supplier Strata Manufacturing, a key player in efforts by oil producer Abu Dhabi to diversify into high-tech manufacturing, is chasing new income at a time of uncertainty about demand for plane parts.

Headlines: UK trade fair industry warns 30,000 jobs at risk as events yet to resume
Description: Around 30,000 jobs in Britain's events industry are at risk due to increased uncertainty about when trade fairs and exhibitions could resume in the UK, an industry body representing event organisers, venues and suppliers warned on Monday.

Headlines: Barclays gets capital boost ahead of potential coronavirus loan losses
Description: Barclays  told investors on Monday that recent regulatory changes had boosted its core capital, giving the British bank a bigger buffer to absorb any further loan losses during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Daimler talks with workers heat up, with 15,000 jobs at risk
Description: Labour representatives at German carmaker Daimler  said on Monday that discussions with management over cost cuts had become "rougher", after a board member said over the weekend that more than 15,000 jobs were at risk.

Headlines: UK will place priority on national security in Huawei decision, minister says
Description: Britain will place a "huge priority" on national security when considering Chinese telecoms firm Huawei's role in the country's 5G network, justice minister Robert Buckland said on Monday.

Headlines: PepsiCo's results beat as lockdowns boost snack sales
Description: PepsiCo Inc  beat analysts' estimates for quarterly revenue and profit on Monday, as people stocked up on its snacks including Tostitos, Cheetos and Doritos before hunkering down in their homes due to coronavirus-related restrictions.

Headlines: Ex-Nissan boss Ghosn says helping everyone who stood by him
Description: Former Nissan Motor chairman Carlos Ghosn is helping everyone who stood by him, he said in an interview broadcast on Saturday, though he declined to comment on cases of people accused of helping him flee to Lebanon from Japan.

Headlines: Federal Reserve's $3 trillion virus rescue inflates market bubbles
Description: The Federal Reserve's $3 trillion bid to stave off an economic crisis in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak is fuelling excesses across U.S. capital markets.

Headlines: EU should draw up list of medicines to be produced in Europe, says German health minister
Description: The European Union should draw up a list of active substances used in medicines whose production should be brought back to Europe to reduce dependency on China, German Health Minister Jens Spahn said on Monday.

Headlines: NIBC agrees to Blackstone's reduced takeover offer
Description: NIBC  has agreed to a proposed takeover by Blackstone , the Dutch bank said on Monday, despite the U.S. private equity firm lowering its bid in light of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Life after Zoom: corporate travel agents plot safe return to business trips
Description: Corporate travel agents are using the coronavirus-induced lull in bookings to work with companies on how to get their staff out of Zoom videoconferences and safely back in the air.

Headlines: Pause, reflect: Five questions for the ECB
Description: For the first time in months, the European Central Bank has reason to break from crisis-fighting mode -- economic activity is picking up after the COVID-19 hit, markets are stable and agreement on an European recovery fund appears close.

Headlines: Macau junket Suncity gives rare details VIP finances in rebuttal of online criticism
Description: Macau's biggest junket operator Suncity, which operates VIP gambling rooms across Asia, has given rare insight into its balance sheet during a rebuttal of online criticism, saying it is financially robust and not the target of law enforcement.

Headlines: China's export slump to ease in June as economies reopen, imports fall less: Reuters poll
Description: The slump in China's exports likely eased in June as some countries reopened their economies, while imports contracted less sharply on higher crude oil and commodities purchases, a Reuters poll showed on Monday.

Headlines: 'Let's get going': UK tells businesses to prepare for Brexit crunch
Description: Britain is urging businesses and individuals to prepare for the Dec. 31 end of the Brexit transition period with an information campaign titled: "The UK's new start: let's get going."

Headlines: Oil slips as traders eye supply cut easing at OPEC meeting
Description: Oil slipped in early Asian trade on Monday as traders eyed an OPEC technical meeting this week which is expected to recommend an easing in supply cuts that have been propping up crude prices.

Headlines: Coronavirus bringing record $1 trillion of new global corporate debt in 2020: report
Description: Companies around the world will take on as much as $1 trillion of new debt in 2020, as they try to shore up their finances against the coronavirus, a new study of 900 top firms has estimated.

Headlines: Hedge fund Chatham's bid wins auction for Miami Herald publisher McClatchy
Description: Hedge fund Chatham Asset Management's bid succeeded in a court-supervised auction for bankrupt news publisher McClatchy Co , the news company said on Sunday.

Headlines: U.S. Congress needs compromise to extend COVID-19 unemployment payments, Pelosi says
Description: Democratic House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Sunday she believes U.S. lawmakers can find a compromise on extending jobless benefits and unemployment insurance for Americans struggling amid coronavirus pandemic shutdowns.

Headlines: Volkswagen to replace head of software division: Handelsblatt
Description: Volkswagen  is replacing its head of software development, newspaper Handelsblatt reported on Sunday, as the German carmaker wrestles with the transition to electric vehicles.

Headlines: WeWork expects to have positive cash flow in 2021, Financial Times reports
Description: WeWork Executive Chairman Marcelo Claure said the office-sharing company was on course to have positive cash flow in 2021, a year earlier than a target the company set in February, the Financial Times reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Touchless: How the world's busiest airport envisions post-COVID travel
Description: With COVID-19 ravaging the aviation industry, airlines and airports worldwide are reining in costs and halting new spending, except in one area: reassuring pandemic-wary passengers about travel.

Headlines: France's Engie to designate new CEO in September: newspaper
Description: Engie  will designate a new chief executive officer in September as the former French gas monopoly pushes ahead with a transformation towards renewable energies and client solutions, executives told Le Journal du Dimanche newspaper.

Headlines: Mandatory masks, Mickey at a distance as Walt Disney World reopens
Description: Mickey waved from a distance and visitors wore colorful face masks with mouse ears on Saturday as Florida's Walt Disney World opened to the public for the first time in four months amid a surge of coronavirus cases in the state.

Headlines: Ubisoft announces staff departures after misconduct allegations
Description: French video games group Ubisoft announced several staff departures on Saturday after conducting a review in response to allegations of misconduct at the company, which earlier reports said centered around sexual misconduct charges.

Headlines: U.S. sets record for new COVID cases third day in a row at over 69,000
Description: New cases of COVID-19 rose by over 69,000 across the United States on Friday, according to a Reuters tally, setting a record for the third consecutive day as Walt Disney Co stuck to its plans to reopen its flagship theme park in hard-hit Florida.

Headlines: UK plans to create 'freeports,' cut taxes: Sunday Telegraph
Description: British finance minister Rishi Sunak is preparing to introduce sweeping tax cuts and an overhaul of planning laws in up to 10 new “freeports” within a year of the UK's becoming fully independent from the European Union in December, the Sunday Telegraph said.

Headlines: Elon Musk's net worth zooms past Warren Buffett's, Bloomberg reports
Description: Elon Musk's net worth soared past Warren Buffett on Friday as the chief executive officer of Tesla Inc  became the seventh richest person in the world, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

Headlines: Exclusive: India asks court to stymie potential challenge to Chinese app ban
Description: India's government has petitioned a state court to stop any of the Chinese companies whose 59 apps it recently banned from obtaining an injunction to block the order, according to two sources and the legal filing.

Headlines: Chinese electric vehicle maker Li Auto files for U.S. listing
Description: Chinese electric vehicle (EV) maker Li Auto Inc, backed by food delivery giant Meituan Dianping , has filed for a U.S. initial public offering.

Headlines: Goya chief executive sparks backlash over praise for Trump
Description: Goya Foods Inc, the largest Hispanic-owned U.S. food company and a popular brand among Latino Americans, became the target of a boycott campaign on social media on Friday sparked by its CEO effusively praising President Donald Trump at the White House.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Investors await BlackRock earnings after blistering second quarter market rally
Description: Investors will watch next week's earnings from BlackRock , the world's largest asset manager, for a snapshot of how the industry performed during the second quarter's dramatic rebound in global financial markets.

Headlines: Amazon.com bans, then un-bans TikTok app from employee mobile devices
Description: In the span of a few hours on Friday, Amazon.com Inc banned and then unbanned the TikTok video sharing app from employee mobile devices, calling the move a mistake.

Headlines: U.S. insurers eye Legionnaires' disease safeguards as buildings re-open from pandemic shutdowns
Description: (This story removes reference to "cooling tower of the hotel's air-conditioning system" in eighth paragraph)

Headlines: U.S. slaps French goods with 25% duties in digital tax row, but delays effective date
Description: The Trump administration on Friday announced additional duties of 25% on French cosmetics, handbags and other imports valued at $1.3 billion in response to France's digital services tax, but would hold off on implementing the move for up to 180 days.

Headlines: LinkedIn sued over allegation it secretly reads Apple users' clipboard content
Description: Microsoft Corp's  LinkedIn was sued by a New York-based iPhone user on Friday for allegedly reading and diverting users' sensitive content from Apple Inc's  Universal Clipboard application.

Headlines: UK expected to order removal of Huawei 5G equipment by 2025: Telegraph
Description: The British government is expected to set a deadline of 2025 for removing equipment made by China's Huawei from the country's 5G telecoms networks, the Telegraph newspaper said on Friday.

Headlines: Tesla to hold annual shareholder meet and 'Battery Day' on Sept. 22
Description: Tesla Inc will hold its annual shareholder meeting in person on Sept. 22 at its Fremont factory in California, the electric carmaker said on Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street jumps with financials; Gilead data offsets virus fears
Description: U.S. stocks rose on Friday as a positive analysis on Gilead Sciences Inc's antiviral drug to treat COVID-19 helped to soothe investor worries over a record rise in coronavirus cases in the United States, and as financial shares surged.

Headlines: RBC commits C$150 million to diversity push, aims for more minority executives
Description: (This July 6 story corrects to say Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce has one black board director instead of "none of the top six banks had either a Black CEO or a board member")

Headlines: Credit Suisse settles U.S. shareholder lawsuit over debt writedowns, disclosures
Description: Credit Suisse Group AG  agreed to pay $15.5 million to settle a lawsuit accusing it of defrauding shareholders about its risk appetite and management before taking $1 billion of writedowns on souring debt, court filings on Friday show.

Headlines: Amazon.com says it sent the TikTok ban email to employees in error
Description: Amazon.com Inc said it sent an email earlier on Friday that requested employees remove the TikTok app from mobile devices that also had access to company emails in error.

Headlines: Cash-strapped New Jersey to borrow up to $9.9 billion under deal
Description: New Jersey, one of the states hardest hit by the coronavirus outbreak, would borrow up to $9.9 billion from sources that could include the U.S. Federal Reserve to deal with massive revenue losses from the economic shutdown, under an agreement announced on Friday between the governor and legislative leaders.

Headlines: Global stocks jittery as record U.S. virus count weighs on risk appetite
Description: Global equity benchmarks edged higher after struggling for direction for most of the day and bond yields flat-lined on Friday as investors weighed a record number of new coronavirus cases in the United States against improving economic data in Europe and signs that Gilead Sciences Inc's remdesivir drug helped reduce the risk of death in severely-ill COVID-19 patients.

Headlines: Amazon begins rolling out bigger UPS and FedEx-style delivery trucks
Description: Amazon.com  is launching a new fleet of bigger, boxier trucks like those favored by rival package carriers United Parcel Service Inc  and FedEx Corp , as it fights to fix widespread pandemic-fueled delivery delays that sent customers into the arms of competitors like Walmart Inc .

Headlines: Trump adviser says next coronavirus relief bill to be more focused
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Friday a further round of economic impact payments to Americans should focus on those who no longer have a job to return to, saying the next coronavirus relief bill should be "tighter" than previous efforts.

Headlines: U.S. dollar slides as vaccine news offsets surge in virus cases
Description: The dollar slipped on Friday, as its safe-haven allure diminished, on hopes of a potential vaccine for the novel coronavirus that outweighed concerns about the surge in infections in the United States and around the world.

Headlines: Exclusive: TIM excludes Huawei from 5G core equipment tender
Description: Telecom Italia (TIM)  excluded China's Huawei Technologies from a tender it launched this month for 5G equipment for the core network it is preparing to build in Italy and Brazil, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Oil rises as International Energy Agency boosts demand forecast
Description: Oil prices climbed more than 2% on Friday after the International Energy Agency (IEA) bumped up its 2020 demand forecast but record-breaking new coronavirus cases in the United States tempered expectations for a fast recovery in fuel consumption.

Headlines: Fed adds Apple, Anheuser-Busch, Expedia to its bond holdings
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve added $1.33 billion in bonds of individual companies from June 22 to June 30, including iPhone maker Apple Inc, beer-producer Anheuser-Busch and travel booker Expedia Group.

Headlines: ‘The Ultimate Hold’: Why Disney has investors stuck in place
Description: Walt Disney Co is planning to reopen its Orlando-based Walt Disney World theme park on July 11, ending the longest shutdown of the company's highly profitable U.S. theme park division in its history.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler recalls more than 900,000 U.S. vehicles due to faulty air bag covers
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV  said on Friday it would recall about 925,239 of its older model vehicles in the United States to replace air bag covers on their steering wheels after 14 potentially related injuries.

Headlines: Boeing in scramble to shore up 737 MAX financing
Description: Boeing is scrambling to shore up financing for the 737 MAX as it awaits regulatory approval for design changes after the plane was grounded following two fatal crashes, industry sources said.

Headlines: UK economy to slump over 10%, debts to surge: Moody's
Description: Britain will suffer the sharpest peak-to-trough economic slump of any major economy this year, rating agency Moody's warned on Friday, and the coronavirus crisis will push up national debt as a share of GDP by nearly a quarter.

Headlines: Skin whitening creams remain online despite mercury findings
Description: Skin-whitening creams identified as containing potentially dangerous levels of mercury continue to be sold online more than seven months after a watchdog group raised the alarm, including on platforms run by eBay, Amazon.com and Alibaba, a Reuters review of the sites shows.

Headlines: Tesla appears poised to electrify S&P 500
Description: (This story refiles to include full name of S&P Dow Jones Indices in paragraphs 5, 6 and 8)

Headlines: Fed policymakers worry growth plateauing, pledge more support
Description: (This July 7 story, corrects first name of Atlanta Federal Reserve Bank president to Raphael from Ralph in paragraph 5; the mistake also occurred in an earlier version of the story)

Headlines: Exclusive: Apple supplier Foxconn to invest $1 billion in India, sources say
Description: Foxconn  plans to invest up to $1 billion to expand a factory in southern India where the Taiwanese contract manufacturer assembles Apple  iPhones, two sources said.

Headlines: U.S. companies seeking capital during pandemic test bank market's new normal
Description: NEW YORK (LPC) - Bank lenders for high-quality US companies are taking different refinancing avenues as they seek to extend maturities on billions of US dollars in loans at a time when the Covid-19 pandemic has made liquidity a top priority.

Headlines: Google to restrict advertising of unauthorized tracking technology
Description: Google said it would change its policies in August to restrict advertising for spyware and malware that can be used to track a user's texts, phone calls, or browsing history.

Headlines: Upbeat economic data helps European shares snap three-day losing run
Description: European shares rose on Friday after upbeat industrial output data from Italy and France raised hopes of an economic recovery, even as a spike in coronavirus cases around the world kept gains in check.

Headlines: Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway reduces share count, suggesting possible buybacks
Description: Berkshire Hathaway Inc has reduced its share count by 1.2% since April 23, a regulatory filing shows, suggesting that Chairman Warren Buffett might have become more aggressive in repurchasing its significantly underperforming stock.

Headlines: Exclusive: Lonza expects EPA approval 'very soon' to make COVID-killing claims for surface disinfectants
Description: Lonza Group AG is in the “last step” of discussions with U.S. regulators for approval to claim that its formulation is effective in killing the novel Coronavirus on surfaces, an executive at the pharmaceutical and chemical giant told Reuters.

Headlines: Muji's U.S. business seeks bankruptcy protection over coronavirus
Description: Minimalist lifestyle brand Muji's U.S. subsidiary has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, its Japanese owner Ryohin Keikaku Co said on Friday, joining the list of casualties from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Standard Life Aberdeen sells Boohoo shares, citing 'inadequate' response to allegations
Description: Investor Standard Life Aberdeen  said on Friday it had sold its shares in fashion retailer Boohoo , describing the company's response to allegations of worker abuse at supplier factories as "inadequate".

Headlines: U.S. producer prices unexpectedly fall; underlying inflation stabilizing
Description: U.S. producer prices unexpectedly fell in June as rising costs for energy goods were offset by weakness in services, pointing to subdued inflation that should allow the Federal Reserve to keep pumping money into the economy to arrest a downward spiral.

Headlines: Take Five: A bull with underlying health conditions
Description: Southern European bonds and the euro have rallied hard in the two months since France and Germany mooted a 750 billion-euro  ($848 billion) post-COVID-19 recovery fund. On July 17-18, European leaders meet to hammer out details. But differences remain on whether the fund should be based on loans or grants; if the proposal stumbles, markets will take it badly.

Headlines: Tesla rival Rivian adds $2.5 billion investment led by T. Rowe Price
Description: Electric vehicle startup Rivian, which is backed by Amazon  and Ford Motor  and aims to put an electric pickup and SUV in production in 2021, boosted its war chest further with a $2.5-billion investment round led by T. Rowe Price , Rivian said Friday.

Headlines: AliExpress Russia eyes $10 billion turnover by 2022-2023, up an estimated 66%
Description: AliExpress Russia, an e-commerce venture between Chinese online shopping giant Alibaba and Russian partners, said it was aiming for annual turnover of $10 billion by 2022-2023, up from what analysts estimate is about $6 billion now.

Headlines: IEA raises 2020 oil demand forecast but warns COVID-19 clouds outlook
Description: The International Energy Agency (IEA) bumped up its 2020 oil demand forecast on Friday but warned that the spread of COVID-19 posed a risk to the outlook.

Headlines: EU assessing supervisors' responsibilities over Wirecard scandal: Dombrovskis
Description: The European Commission has asked the bloc's market regulator to assess the responsibilities of financial supervisors in the scandal that led to the collapse of German fintech firm Wirecard, the EU executive's vice-president said on Friday.

Headlines: Germany will have to change oversight laws after Wirecard case: Scholz
Description: The Wirecard case will result in changes to laws on financial oversight, Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Friday, as German prosecutors probe alleged fraud, balance falsification and market manipulation at the collapsed firm.

Headlines: China floods blamed for fresh African swine fever outbreaks
Description: Outbreaks of deadly African swine fever are surging in some parts of southern China following heavy rains, analysts and industry sources said, in what could be a big setback for Beijing's goal of replenishing pork supplies.

Headlines: UK cyber security centre continuing work on Huawei, says PM's spokesman
Description: Britain's National Cyber Security Centre is continuing its work looking into Huawei, a spokesman for Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Friday, responding to reports that culture minister Oliver Dowden would make a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Google can ward off EU antitrust probe into Fitbit deal with data pledge
Description: Google may be able to stave off a full-scale EU antitrust investigation into its planned $2.1 billion bid for Fitbit  by pledging not to use Fitbit's health data to help it target ads, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Pandemic-proofing: Insurance may never be the same again
Description: Insurers are creating products for a world where virus outbreaks could become the new normal after many businesses were left out in the cold during the COVID-19 crisis.

Headlines: Uber agrees to pay $3.8 million Denmark fine over taxi law: police
Description: Uber has agreed to pay a 25 million Danish crowns ($3.8 million) fine in Denmark, settling claims of breaching local taxi law out of court, Danish police said on Friday.

Headlines: Italy's Armani returned to sales growth in 2019
Description: Sales at Italian fashion group Giorgio Armani returned to growth in 2019, a year in advance of its target, after a three-year planned fall from streamlining its distribution and brand portfolio under just three labels.

Headlines: Exclusive: Japan may still build Aegis Ashore despite reports of cancellation, source says
Description: Japan may still build Aegis Ashore missile defense systems to defend against attacks by North Korea and other regional rivals, including China, a source told Reuters just weeks after reports that the proposal had been killed.

Headlines: Tech giant Tencent makes peace with China's 'old godmother'
Description: Chinese tech giant Tencent said it has made peace with the country's best-known chilli oil maker Lao Gan Ma, after an advertising scam that bewildered many and generated a public relations nightmare.

Headlines: Honda invests in China's CATL to jointly develop EV batteries
Description: Japan's Honda Motor Co Ltd  will buy a 1% stake in Chinese electric vehicle (EV) battery maker Contemporary Amperex Technology (CATL)  and the two will jointly develop EV batteries, the companies said on Friday.

Headlines: EU regulators to decide by July 31 on Alstom, Bombardier deal
Description: European Union antitrust regulators have set a new deadline of July 31 to rule on Alstom's  bid for Bombardier Inc's  transport business after the French TGV high-speed train maker offered to sell assets to address competition concerns.

Headlines: Death of Macau's casino king comes as gambling hub faces new era
Description: Hong Kong's highest-profile officials and business people paid their respects on Friday to Macau's gambling king, Stanley Ho, who built a business empire from scratch in the former Portuguese colony and became one of Asia's richest men.

Headlines: Exclusive: India panel proposes new regulator for non-personal data: draft report
Description: India should set up a data regulator and require companies to disclose how they collect and store data devoid of personal details or which has been anonymised, a panel tasked to draw up such regulations has said in a draft report seen by Reuters.

Headlines: ING accelerates Dutch branch closures as customers go digital
Description: Dutch bank ING  will close a quarter of its bank branches in the Netherlands as the COVID-19 pandemic has accelerated the switch to digital banking, it said on Friday.

Headlines: Japan Display aims to bring some panel production back from China after coronavirus
Description: Japan Display Inc  aims to bring some automotive panel production back to Japan after the novel coronavirus outbreak disrupted its supply chain in China, a company executive said on Friday.

Headlines: What's in a name? Banks count cost of loans in NMC collapse
Description: As the crisis engulfing his business empire deepened, Bavaguthu Raghuram Shetty met with Bank of Baroda officials in mid-March to discuss the $250 million he and his firms owed.

Headlines: Blackouts darken misery of Lebanon's economic collapse
Description: Samira Hanna spends a lot of time in the dark. Her old Beirut apartment gets less than two hours of electricity a day, and with Lebanon's economy in ruins, the grandmother can barely afford candles, let alone a private generator.

Headlines: BOJ offers virtual tour as headquarters off limits amid pandemic
Description: Forced to cancel a popular on-site tour due to the coronavirus pandemic, the Bank of Japan created a virtual one that takes viewers through the brick corridors, dome-roofed rooms and even an underground vault of its century-old headquarters online.

Headlines: Russia's Nornickel fights cover-up accusations over Arctic oil spill
Description: Pressure is mounting on Russian mining company Norilsk Nickel over an Arctic oil spill that has wiped about 17% off its share price, left it with a hefty compensation bill and exposed it to accusations of covering up the full extent of the damage.

Headlines: Explainer: Dollar peg is critical to Hong Kong amid U.S. threats, China worries
Description: China's national security law for Hong Kong and moves by the United States to begin withdrawing privileges enjoyed by the city under U.S. law have unsettled investors.

Headlines: Fast Retailing cuts outlook on pandemic woes despite Uniqlo June rebound
Description: (This July 9 story corrects paragraph 5 figure to trillion from billion.)

Headlines: Japan's economy to shrink at fastest pace in decades this fiscal year due to pandemic: Reuters poll
Description: Japan's economy will shrink at the fastest pace in decades in the year through March 2021, forcing the government to compile another stimulus package to cushion the blow from the coronavirus pandemic, a Reuters poll showed on Friday.

Headlines: IMF urges 'equity-like' government support for virus-hit firms
Description: International Monetary Fund Chief Economist Gita Gopinath urged governments to shift to "equity-like" support from one focused on loans as the coronavirus pandemic inflicts prolonged damage on companies.

Headlines: China's aviation industry suffers $4.9 billion loss in second quarter on coronavirus jolt
Description: China's aviation industry sank further into the red, losing  34.25 billion yuan ($4.89 billion) in the second quarter, only slightly narrower than in the first quarter, underlining the colossal financial impact from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: A space odyssey: Britain rockets into unknown with OneWeb
Description: Britain is betting that satellite operator OneWeb will help it boldly go into a post-Brexit era. But it faces formidable challenges to complete a working constellation and rebuild a collapsed venture that has proved a money pit for investors.

Headlines: Pharmacy executives tied to deadly U.S. meningitis outbreak lose appeals
Description: A federal appeals court on Thursday cleared the way for prosecutors to seek longer prison sentences for a founder and supervisory pharmacist of a Massachusetts compounding pharmacy whose tainted drugs sparked a deadly fungal meningitis outbreak in 2012.

Headlines: Ford says restrictions at Mexico plants 'not sustainable'
Description: Ford Motor Co on Thursday said new staffing restrictions imposed on plants producing car parts in the Mexican state of Chihuahua were "not sustainable," the latest sign U.S. automakers are still reeling from coronavirus lockdowns in Mexico.

Headlines: Dow, S&P 500 fall on fears over virus resurgence but Nasdaq ends at record high
Description: The S&P 500 and Dow dropped on Thursday as investors worried about another round of business shutdowns to contain a surge in coronavirus cases and began to shift their focus to earnings, while the Nasdaq hit another record closing high.

Headlines: Ford says restrictions at Mexico plants producing auto parts "not sustainable"
Description: Ford Motor Co  on Thursday said restrictions imposed by Mexico's Chihuahua state on staffing at factories producing vital car parts was "not sustainable", but that it would not impact production next week in Ford's U.S. plants.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon plans at least $100 million to keep Zoox talent after $1.3 billion deal
Description: Amazon.com Inc  plans to create at least $100 million in stock awards to retain the 900-plus employees of Zoox, the self-driving car startup it offered to buy last month, and can walk away from the deal if large numbers of them turn down job offers from the technology giant.

Headlines: Wells Fargo names new head of mortgage
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  said on Thursday it has hired Flagstar Bank's Kristy Fercho to run its mortgage division following the retirement of 23-year veteran Michael DeVito from the company.

Headlines: Global stocks succumb to shutdown fears but China charges on
Description: Equity markets slid on Thursday after U.S. data raised worries about the economy's recovery and doused enthusiasm that drove a Chinese stock rally for an eighth straight day, while the dollar rebounded as new coronavirus cases hit another record.

Headlines: Dollar rises from four-week low as U.S. stocks end mixed
Description: The dollar climbed from a four-week low on Thursday, as a decline in U.S. stocks enhanced the currency's safe-haven appeal for investors following a surge in new coronavirus cases and a U.S. Supreme Court ruling on President Donald Trump's financial records.

Headlines: U.S. judge rejects immediate bail for accused Carlos Ghosn smugglers
Description: A U.S. judge on Thursday refused to grant immediate bail to a Massachusetts father and son who are trying to avoid extradition to Japan, after being accused of helping smuggle former Nissan Motor Co chairman Carlos Ghosn out of that country.

Headlines: UK watchdog seeks record fine for Deloitte audit of Autonomy
Description: Deloitte should be fined a record 15 million pounds ($19 million) for "serious and serial failings" in its audit of technology company Autonomy, a lawyer for Britain's accounting watchdog told an independent tribunal on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. finalizing federal contract ban for companies that use Huawei, others
Description: The Trump administration plans to finalize regulations this week that will bar the U.S. government from buying goods or services from any company that uses products from five Chinese companies including Huawei, Hikvision and Dahua, a U.S. official said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Electric car maker Fisker eyes deal to go public
Description: Electric vehicle maker Fisker Inc is in talks to go public through a sale to a so-called blank-check acquisition company, modeled after a successful deal earlier this year by peer Nikola Corp , people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil falls $1/bbl as resurgent pandemic prompts worries about U.S. demand
Description: Oil prices fell about $1 a barrel on Thursday as investors worried that renewed lockdowns to contain the spread of coronavirus in the United States would again sink fuel consumption.

Headlines: U.S. recovery in limbo as retail traffic falls in virus hot spots
Description: U.S. states that have driven a record surge in coronavirus cases may now be slipping backward https://graphics.reuters.com/USA-ECONOMY/REOPEN/yxmpjlxewpr in their economic recovery, as cellphone data shows retail visits in a clutch of high case-growth locations falling below the rest of the country.

Headlines: 'Disaster' U.S. earnings loom, but investors try and look beyond
Description: U.S. companies are preparing to open their books on a quarter that is set to show the biggest earnings fall since the financial crisis, leaving investors looking for light at the end of the tunnel.

Headlines: Starbucks makes face masks mandatory at all company-owned U.S. outlets
Description: Starbucks Corp  said on Thursday customers would have to wear face coverings at all company-owned U.S. stores, starting July 15, to contain the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Harley-Davidson to cut hundreds of jobs as part of turnaround strategy
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc  on Thursday said it will lay off 500 employees this year as part of new Chief Executive Jochen Zeitz's efforts to revive the struggling motorcycle maker.

Headlines: LATAM Airlines adds $1.3 billion to bankruptcy financing proposal, Brazil unit seeks protection
Description: LATAM Airlines, the largest airline group in Latin America, said Thursday it had secured an additional $1.3 billion for its financing proposal before a New York bankruptcy court, while adding its unit in Brazil to the debt restructuring process.

Headlines: European stocks slide as Wall Street hit by virus surge
Description: European stocks closed sharply lower on Thursday as Wall Street tumbled after another record surge in U.S. coronavirus cases that raised fears of fresh lockdowns.

Headlines: Weekly jobless claims near four-month low; millions drawing unemployment benefits
Description: The number of Americans filing for jobless benefits dropped to a near four-month low last week, but a record 32.9 million people were collecting unemployment checks in the third week of June, supporting expectations the labor market would take years to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: VW's labour chief sees no need for more cost cuts
Description: Volkswagen's  labour chief Bernd Osterloh has been on a roadshow to tell analysts and investors the carmaker has no need for deeper cost cuts in Germany.

Headlines: Nokia launches data centre networking tools, developed with Apple
Description: Finland's Nokia launched a set of tools on Thursday for data centre networking, developed in cooperation with Apple Inc, to help companies to manage the growth in traffic as 5G and machine learning technologies roll out.

Headlines: German prosecutors open Wirecard money laundering probe
Description: German state prosecutors are investigating individuals at Wirecard  for suspected money laundering, they said on Thursday, adding to probes into alleged fraud, balance falsification and market manipulation at the collapsed firm.

Headlines: Rolls-Royce burns through 3 billion pounds, expects more cash outflows
Description: Aerospace engineer Rolls-Royce  burned through 3 billion pounds ($3.8 billion) in the first half as the hours flown by its engines halved due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and said it expected a further 1 billion pound outflow in the second half.

Headlines: Delta CEO cautious over adding new flights amid U.S. COVID-19 spikes
Description: Delta Air Lines  is cautious about adding more flights to its schedule due to spikes in coronavirus cases through the southeast and southwest of the United States, Chief Executive Ed Bastian said in an employee memo on Thursday.

Headlines: New $1 billion fund aims to steer antibiotic companies in tough market
Description: Several large drugmakers including Merck & Co Inc  and Pfizer Inc  on Thursday unveiled a $1 billion fund to bolster struggling antibiotic companies and sustain a pipeline for new treatments.

Headlines: ByteDance evaluates changes to corporate structure of TikTok
Description: ByteDance is looking to make changes to the corporate structure of its short video app TikTok, a company spokesperson said on Thursday.

Headlines: Wells Fargo preparing to cut thousands of jobs: Bloomberg Law
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  is preparing to cut thousands of jobs starting later this year, Bloomberg Law reported https://news.bloomberglaw.com/banking-law/wells-fargo-is-readying-thousands-of-job-cuts-to-start-this-year on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Exclusive: Crypto exchange Coinbase readies landmark stock market listing, sources say
Description: Coinbase Inc has started plans for a stock market listing that could come as early as this year, making it the first major U.S. cryptocurrency exchange to go public, according to three people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: British retail to lose further 5,000 jobs in blow to economy
Description: Britain's high street faces more than 5,000 job cuts after two of its biggest names said that customers were unlikely to return to their old shopping habits after the coronavirus crisis, in the latest blow to the country's ailing economy.

Headlines: American Airlines delays HK flights over new COVID-19 testing rules
Description: American Airlines Group Inc said on Thursday it delayed flights to Hong Kong, a day after the city introduced mandatory virus tests for all arriving crew members.

Headlines: VW's Skoda boss Maier to step down at end of July
Description: Bernhard Maier, chairman of Czech carmaker Skoda Auto, part of the Volkswagen Group , will leave his post at the end of July after nearly five years, the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: France urges no sackings at Airbus as workers march over jobs
Description: The French government backed union calls to avoid compulsory job cuts at Airbus on Thursday as several hundred workers marched from the company's headquarters to Toulouse-Blagnac airport.

Headlines: TikTok says removed over 49 million videos in second half of 2019
Description: Social media app TikTok said on Thursday it removed more than 49 million videos from its platform in the second half of last year for violating its guidelines.

Headlines: Speedy removal of Huawei would cost UK, operators: Vodafone and BT
Description: Britain's rebound from COVID-19 could be harmed if the government demands a speedy removal of telecoms equipment made by China's Huawei from mobile networks, Vodafone and BT warned on Thursday.

Headlines: Brazilian airline Gol says expects to lose 3.20 reais per share in the second quarter
Description: Brazil's Gol Linhas Aereas Inteligentes  said on Thursday it expects to lose 3.20 reais per share in the second quarter, and that it could reduce its fleet by 30 more aircraft in 2021-2.

Headlines: Wells Fargo pledges $400 million in support of small business after PPP payout
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  will donate over $400 million toward helping small businesses recover from the coronavirus pandemic, giving away all proceeds from its participation in the Payroll Protection Program.

Headlines: Mexico's Aeromexico sees passenger traffic drop 86.1% in June
Description: Mexican carrier Aeromexico said on Thursday that passenger traffic dropped 86.1% in June when compared to the same month the previous year after the coronavirus pandemic eroded demand for air travel.

Headlines: The man who led Wirecard into insolvency
Description: On the night of June 18, Wirecard AG’s new compliance chief stayed up late at his office in the company’s low-rise headquarters in the Munich suburb of Aschheim to pore over the payment firm’s books.

Headlines: Alstom offers French factory sale to clinch Bombardier deal
Description: France's TGV high-speed train maker Alstom  on Thursday offered to sell a French rail factory and make other concessions to win European Commission approval for its planned purchase of Bombardier Inc's  transportation business.

Headlines: Malaysia's AirAsia seeks nearly $500 million in funding: report
Description: Malaysia's AirAsia Group Bhd is looking to raise 2 billion ringgit ($469 million), its CEO was quoted as saying by the Nikkei Asian Review on Thursday, a day after its auditor cast doubt on the airline's ability to continue as a going concern.

Headlines: British retailer Boots to cut 4,000 jobs
Description: Health and beauty retailer Boots, one of the best-known names on Britain's shopping streets, plans to cut 4,000 jobs and close 48 optician stores, in the latest major blow to the country's retail sector from the COVID-19 crisis.

Headlines: Trading, underwriting soften profit plunge for some U.S. banks
Description: Trading and underwriting revenue could provide some comfort for big Wall Street banks that begin reporting results next week, although second-quarter profits likely plunged because of the coronavirus pandemic's impact on lending.

Headlines: Another 1,300 jobs at risk in UK retail sector as John Lewis shuts eight stores
Description: British department store chain John Lewis said on Thursday it would close eight stores, putting around 1,300 jobs at risk in another blow to the UK retail sector after the coronavirus pandemic accelerated a shift to online shopping.

Headlines: Airbus first-half deliveries hit 16-year low despite June bounce
Description: Airbus  deliveries rose 50% in June compared with May and reached their highest level since the coronavirus crisis spread to Europe in March, but the accelerating recovery failed to prevent first-half deliveries from sliding to a 16-year low.

Headlines: Tesla 'very close' to level 5 autonomous driving technology, Musk says
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc  is "very close" to achieving level 5 autonomous driving technology, Chief Executive Elon Musk said on Thursday, referring to the capability to navigate roads without any driver input.

Headlines: YouTube not obliged to inform on film pirates, Europe's top court says
Description: Google's YouTube is not required to hand over the email or IP address of users who upload films illegally to its video platform, Europe's top court ruled on Thursday, saying there must be a balance between protecting personal data and copyright.

Headlines: Aston Martin's first SUV rolls off production line
Description: Aston Martin's  first sport utility vehicle rolled off the production line on Thursday, key to hopes of a turnaround at the luxury carmaker which has seen changes in management and ownership over the last few months amid a torrid performance.

Headlines: Samsung 'definitely can' supply a 5G network to UK, executive says
Description: Samsung executive vice president Woojune Kim said the company was in active commercial discussions with European operators to supply network equipment, and was investing its resources in 4G, 5G and 6G rather than legacy technology.

Headlines: Rooftop revolution: Coronavirus chill upends solar power industry
Description: The booming rooftop solar panel industry nosedived overnight when the coronavirus forced homeowners to rein in spending and keep their distance from would-be installers.

Headlines: Gilead to deliver more remdesivir to Europe from autumn: WiWo
Description: Gilead Sciences Inc  plans to make more of its drug remdesivir available for Germany and Europe from autumn and will decide how much each country gets based on the rate of infection, the drugmaker's Germany boss told a German magazine.

Headlines: Bond investors wait for more headlines on EU recovery fund
Description: Euro zone bond yields held their ground on Thursday with investors' main focus expected to be any new developments on the European Union's recovery fund, which aims to help the region's economy recover from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: UK's Sunak: too early to predict shape of recovery from recession
Description: Britain is facing a significant recession but it is too early to tell how quickly the economy will be able to recover, British finance minister Rishi Sunak said on Thursday.

Headlines: UK's Sunak: we must watch interest rates and debt costs
Description: British finance minister Rishi Sunak said on Thursday it was important to be alert to possible changes in interest rates, adding it was likely the cost of servicing debt would be included in the government's future budget rules.

Headlines: UK's Sunak says will start to fix budget deficit once outlook clearer
Description: British finance minister Rishi Sunak on Thursday said he would act to put public finances back on a sustainable footing in the medium term, when he has a clearer view of the economic recovery from the COVID-19 crisis.

Headlines: Ant Group listing would be fillip for Hong Kong's flagging IPO market
Description: An initial public offering from Alibaba's  Ant Group by year-end would give equity capital markets in Hong Kong a timely boost after a new security law cast in doubt the city's future as a global financial centre, analysts said on Thursday.

Headlines: China's market euphoria trumps political risk in Hong Kong
