Description: French unions and regional leaders urged Airbus  on Thursday to step back from a Big Bang restructuring as workers across Europe waited for a factory-by-factory breakdown of 15,000 job cuts brought about by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Germany can prevent job losses by supporting Airbus: CEO to Spiegel
Description: Airbus could save 2,000 of the 5,100 jobs it is due to cut in Germany if the government helps it by extending a short-time work programme and supporting its research into hydrogen-fueled propulsion, its boss told Spiegel magazine.

Headlines: Boeing to pull the plug on its 747 jumbo jet: Bloomberg News
Description: Boeing Co  is pulling the plug on its 747 jumbo jet, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Who's to blame for Wirecard? Germany passes the buck
Description: Germany's accountancy watchdog has denied blame for failing to spot problems at collapsed payments firm Wirecard, the latest in a string of agencies to shirk responsibility following the country's biggest accounting scandal.

Headlines: German watchdog chief calls Wirecard scandal a 'massive criminal act'
Description: The head of Germany's financial watchdog on Thursday called the accounting scandal at Wirecard "a massive criminal act", while Deutsche Bank said it was considering support for the collapsed payments company's banking unit.

Headlines: Amid strong June job growth, signs U.S. recovery may be stumbling
Description: The U.S. economic recovery, after two months of faster-than-expected job gains, may be stumbling as a surge of new coronavirus infections prompts states to delay and in some cases reverse plans to let stores reopen and activities resume.

Headlines: EU regulators checking if Fitbit deal will boost Google's clout
Description: EU regulators are checking whether Google's purchase of Fitbit might allow it to drive rival makers of wearable devices, app developers and other online service providers out of the market, and boost its dominance in online advertising and search.

Headlines: Cyclical rally, U.S. jobs data drive European stocks to one-week high
Description: European shares closed at a one-week high on Thursday as hopes of a COVID-19 vaccine and a better-than-expected rebound in U.S. hiring overshadowed concerns about surging coronavirus infections.

Headlines: BofA's U.S. staff to start returning to offices after labor day: Bloomberg News
Description: Bank of America Corp  will start bringing back its employees to offices in phases after Labor Day, Sept. 7, Bloomberg News reported https://bloom.bg/3dU8liD on Thursday, citing a memo from the bank.

Headlines: Tesla to make molecule printers for German COVID-19 vaccine developer CureVac
Description: Tesla Inc is building mobile molecule printers to help make the potential COVID-19 vaccine being developed by CureVac in Germany, the electric-car maker's Chief Executive Officer, Elon Musk, tweeted on Wednesday.

Headlines: EU court rules against BlackRock tax break claim
Description: BlackRock is not exempt from paying value added tax (VAT) on part of a service from an outside supplier to help manage its funds, a European Union court ruled on Thursday, dashing the fund sector's hopes for cost savings.

Headlines: June U.S. payrolls rise sets record amid virus reopenings
Description: The U.S. economy created jobs at a record clip in June as more restaurants and bars resumed operations, further evidence that the COVID-19 recession was probably over, though a surge in cases of the coronavirus threatens the fledgling recovery.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit widens as exports fall to lowest level since 2009
Description: The U.S. trade deficit widened in May as the COVID-19 pandemic pushed exports to their lowest level since 2009, strengthening expectations the economy will contract in the second quarter at its steepest pace since the Great Depression.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Clouds may be parting for dividend investors
Description: U.S. companies are cutting their dividends less than investors anticipated, providing a potential boost to a stock market rally that has clashed with concerns over a recent surge in coronavirus infections.

Headlines: EU banks to take on Visa, Mastercard with new payments system
Description: Sixteen banks from Germany, France and three other euro zone countries on Thursday said a "truly European" payments system was expected to be up and running in 2022 to fully digitalise a region where half of all retail payments are still in cash.

Headlines: U.S. seeks Warhol, Monet paintings linked to 1MDB scandal
Description: The U.S. Department of Justice on Wednesday said it was looking to recover another $96 million in assets in real estate and artwork allegedly linked to the 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) international money-laundering conspiracy.

Headlines: Top-performing U.S. equity funds this year are betting on a transformed world
Description: U.S. equity funds that were able to best weather the global economic upheaval from the coronavirus pandemic this year are turning to healthcare, e-commerce and electric vehicle stocks as they look ahead to 2021.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court takes up Nestle, Cargill appeals over human rights claims
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court will decide whether American corporations can be sued for alleged human rights abuses occurring abroad under a 1789 law, agreeing on Thursday to hear appeals by two companies - Cargill Inc and a Nestle SA  subsidiary - accused of knowingly helping perpetuate slavery at Ivory Coast cocoa farms.

Headlines: Coty changes CEO again, hires former L'Oreal executive to revive sales
Description: Coty Inc  on Thursday named former L'Oreal executive Sue Nabi as chief executive officer, the cosmetics maker's fifth since its multi-billon dollar deal with Procter & Gamble nearly five years ago.

Headlines: Tesla's 'jaw-dropping' second-quarter deliveries send shares surging
Description: Tesla Inc  outpaced analyst estimates for second-quarter vehicle deliveries on Thursday, defying a trend of plummeting sales in the wider auto industry as coronavirus-linked lockdown orders kept shoppers at home, and sending its shares up 8%.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury agrees on loan terms with American, four other airlines
Description: The U.S. Treasury said on Thursday it has agreed on terms for government loans with five U.S. carriers, including American Airlines Group Inc .

Headlines: Deutsche Bank weighs support for Wirecard's bank
Description: Deutsche Bank said on Thursday that it was considering providing "financial support" to the banking unit of Germany's Wirecard.

Headlines: Unilever's India unit to rebrand 'Fair & Lovely' cream to 'Glow & Lovely'
Description: The Indian arm of global consumer giant Unilever  said on Thursday it would rebrand its skin-lightening cream 'Fair & Lovely' to 'Glow & Lovely,' after facing backlash that the name promoted negative stereotypes towards darker skin tones.

Headlines: U.S. farmers scramble for help as COVID-19 scuttles immigrant workforce
Description: The novel coronavirus delayed the arrival of seasonal immigrants who normally help harvest U.S. wheat, leaving farmers to depend on high school students, school bus drivers, laid-off oilfield workers and others to run machines that bring in the crop.

Headlines: Ryanair resumes flights from Greece after four-month grounding
Description: Low cost carrier Ryanair  resumed flights from Athens after a near four-month grounding due to COVID-19 travel restrictions, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Novartis pays $729 million to settle U.S. kickback charges
Description: Novartis AG agreed to pay more than $729 million to settle U.S. government charges it paid illegal kickbacks to doctors and patients to boost drug sales, the U.S. Department of Justice said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Italy's Prada sales in Asia up double-digit, trend will continue: CEO
Description: Sales at Italy's Prada  are growing at double-digit rates in Asia while any forecast for the American market is hard to make due to the health emergency, the Chief Executive of the luxury group Patrizio Bertelli said on Thursday.

Headlines: Explainer: How U.S. airlines are trying to stop COVID-19 on flights
Description: As some Americans prepare to travel for the July 4 holiday weekend, and airlines slowly ramp up service, the U.S. government has not changed rules for air travel during the pandemic, leaving airlines to implement their own measures.

Headlines: Turkish central bank saw slight rise in year-end inflation expectations
Description: Inflation expectations for the year-end increased slightly last month, while those for the next 12 months declined, the Turkish central bank said on Thursday in minutes of last week's monetary policy committee meeting.

Headlines: Delta's global growth drive stalled by Latin American bankruptcies
Description: Delta Air Lines had a strategy for years: expand worldwide by buying stakes in airlines and partner with them while avoiding the cost and red tape of full acquisitions.

Headlines: The heat's on Corporate America to reveal racial diversity data
Description: American companies are coming under increasing pressure from investors to publicly disclose information about diversity among employees in the wake of nationwide protests against racial discrimination.

Headlines: American Airlines warns of 25% drop in international capacity in 2021 summer
Description: American Airlines  on Thursday forecast a 25% drop in its long-haul international summer capacity in 2021 over 2019, as the carrier curtails operations to cope with a slump in travel demand because of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Eyes in the sky: Investors reach for new tools to gauge climate change risk
Description: In the twilight years of past civilisations, astrologers would scour the heavens for signs of impending calamity. In an era where climate change is eroding age-old certainties, a new cast of characters is searching for answers in the sky.

Headlines: Airbus hints at compromise as governments fret over job cuts
Description: Europe's Airbus  left the door open on Wednesday to scaling back its planned 15,000 job cuts in exchange for government-funded labour schemes and research, as its coronavirus restructuring stoked political and union alarm.

Headlines: Traders thought Apple had 'the holy grail' of oil data, but the quest continues
Description: Every day, energy merchants collect and scrutinize whatever information they can find on fuel demand to get a trading edge: from satellite data tracking oil tankers worldwide to thermal images from cameras on pipelines and storage tanks.

Headlines: Apple supplier Foxconn, others hit as India holds up imports from China: sources
Description: India's additional scrutiny of imports from China has disrupted operations at plants owned by Apple supplier Foxconn   in southern India, three sources told Reuters, and other foreign firms are also facing delays as tensions between the two countries build.

Headlines: Indian police allege fraud by GVK chairman, others at Mumbai airport
Description: India's federal police have filed a criminal complaint against the chairman of conglomerate GVK Group and others for alleged fraud in the development of Mumbai's international airport that resulted in the government losing more than $92 million.

Headlines: McDonald's to pause U.S. reopening of dine-in services by 21 days
Description: McDonald's Corp  plans to pause the reopening of its dine-in service in the United States by 21 days as the number of coronavirus cases rise in the country, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: China hopes India corrects actions against Chinese firms immediately
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Thursday that it hopes India would correct its discriminatory actions against Chinese companies immediately, after India banned Chinese mobile apps amid a border crisis between the two countries.

Headlines: Check in but never leave: Taiwan offers fake flights for travel-starved tourists
Description: Starved of the travel experience during the coronavirus lockdown? One Taiwanese airport has the solution - a fake itinerary where you check in, go through passport control and security and even board the aircraft. You just never leave.

Headlines: Investors are waking up to a possible Biden victory in U.S. presidential election
Description: Investors are increasingly preparing for market volatility ahead of the U.S. presidential election, with some shifting stock positions and selling the dollar, as Democratic contender Joe Biden maintains a lead against President Donald Trump in opinion polls.

Headlines: Fed's Bullard warns of financial crisis risks as virus cases spike: FT
Description: St. Louis Federal Reserve Bank president James Bullard has warned that a growing number of bankruptcies due to the coronavirus outbreak could lead to a financial crisis, the Financial Times reported.

Headlines: Energy Transfer digs in on North Dakota pipeline expansion despite oil slump, sources say
Description: U.S. pipeline company Energy Transfer  has taken the rare step of invoking force majeure - normally used in times of war or natural disaster - to prevent oil firms from walking away from a proposed expansion of the controversial Dakota Access pipeline, according to two sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. regulator, Boeing complete 737 MAX certification test flights
Description: The Federal Aviation Administration and Boeing Co  have completed certification test flights on the 737 MAX, a key milestone toward the plane's return to service, the U.S. regulator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: American Airlines warns it's overstaffed by about 8,000 flight attendants
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  warns it is overstaffed by about 8,000 flight attendants and might reduce its workforce through early retirements and voluntary leaves as the carrier looks to weather a hit to business from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: U.S., EU advocacy groups warn against Google's purchase of Fitbit
Description: Twenty advocacy groups from the United States, Europe, Latin America and elsewhere signed a statement Wednesday urging regulators to be wary of Google's $2.1 billion bid for fitness tracker company Fitbit Inc  because of privacy and competition concerns.

Headlines: PG&E emerges from Chapter 11 bankruptcy
Description: Utility PG&E Corp  said on Wednesday it had emerged from bankruptcy, marking an end to a long-drawn restructuring process which began after its equipment sparked some of the deadliest wildfires in California.

Headlines: Trump backs work incentives as part of next stimulus bill
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he supports another coronavirus stimulus bill but wants it to include incentives for Americans to go back to work, setting up a clash with Democrats in Congress over jobless benefits.

Headlines: S&P, Nasdaq close higher on vaccine hopes, improving data
Description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq indexes closed higher on Wednesday to kick off the third quarter as increasing optimism for a safe and effective COVID-19 vaccine eased concerns that another round of business lockdowns was likely.

Headlines: Fed revisits idea of pledging to keep interest rates low
Description: Federal Reserve policymakers are looking at reviving a Great Recession-era promise to keep interest rates low until certain conditions are met, in a bid to deliver a more rapid recovery from the recession triggered by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Fed deluged by letters from needy over U.S. loan program
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Wednesday released thousands of letters and emails from individuals, businesses and nonprofit groups this spring urging wider access to its Main Street Lending Program for Americans slammed financially during the pandemic.

Headlines: In Brazil, delivery drivers for Uber, Rappi and others protest amid pandemic
Description: More than a thousand food delivery drivers on motorcycles gathered in São Paulo on Wednesday to protest their work conditions, set by Uber Technologies Inc  and makers of other apps, as their services remain in high demand due to coronavirus lockdowns.

Headlines: Mercedes Benz to resume second shift in Brazilian factory as sales slowly recover
Description: The Brazilian unit of Mercedes Benz  said on Wednesday it has resumed a second shift in its factory located in Sao Bernardo do Campo, an industrial suburb of Sao Paulo, to increase social distancing among employees as sales begin to rise.

Headlines: Facebook frustrates advertisers as boycott over hate speech kicks off
Description: Advertisements for more than 400 brands including Coca-Cola and Starbucks vanished from Facebook on Wednesday, after the failure of last-ditch talks to stop a boycott over hate speech on the site.

Headlines: Factbox: More companies join Facebook ad boycott bandwagon
Description: A long list of companies have pulled advertising from Facebook Inc in support of a campaign that called out the social media giant for not doing enough to stop hate speech on its platforms.

Headlines: New North American trade deal launches under cloud of disputes, coronavirus
Description: A modernized U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade pact took effect on Wednesday, ensuring continuity for manufacturers and agriculture, but the threat of disputes is exposing cracks in what was meant to be a stronger North American fortress of competitiveness.

Headlines: U.S. House approves extension of small business loan program
Description: The U.S. House of Representatives on Wednesday approved an extension of a $660 billion lending program in an effort to help small businesses hit hard by the coronavirus pandemic, renewing a lifeline that had just expired.

Headlines: Apple to re-close more stores in seven U.S. states, bringing total to 77
Description: Apple Inc  said it would re-close more than two dozen stores in seven states starting Thursday, including its home state of California, bringing total closures to 77 as coronavirus cases continue to rise.

Headlines: Tesla becomes most valuable automaker in latest stock rally
Description: Tesla Inc on Wednesday became the highest-valued automaker as its shares surged to record highs and the electric carmaker's market capitalization overtook that of former front runner Toyota Motors Corp.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sears exploring sale of home improvement business
Description: Sears is exploring a sale of its home improvement business following interest from potential suitors such as private equity firms, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. companies not rushing to rehire workers; rising COVID-19 cases threaten recovery
Description: U.S. private payrolls increased less than expected in June as reopening businesses showed little urgency to rehire workers and employers announced more than 170,000 layoffs, bolstering views the recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic would be a long slog.

Headlines: Mexico exporters urge government to respect foreign investors under new trade deal
Description: A top Mexican exporters' group on Wednesday urged the government not to spook foreign investors after a number of disputes erupted over major projects in the run-up to the start of a new North American trade deal.

Headlines: P&G says will not disclose advertising decisions as Facebook ad boycott grows
Description: Procter & Gamble said on Wednesday it will not make any announcements about its activities on advertising platforms, in response to a question about whether it will join the growing ad boycott against Facebook.

Headlines: Manufacturing, vaccine data power stocks higher; U.S. dollar dips
Description: Stocks across the globe rose on Wednesday following data pointing to a recovery in manufacturing and on bets for a COVID-19 vaccine, while the risk-on mood pushed the U.S. dollar lower.

Headlines: Fed mulls promises for the future, appears to discount yield curve control
Description: The Federal Reserve edged towards a longer-range plan for monetary policy at its meeting last month, raising serious questions about a strategy known as yield curve control that is untested in the United States, and signaling it may rely on explicit promises about its inflation or employment goals to steer public expectations.

Headlines: Citigroup taps RBC banker to co-run software investment banking group
Description: Citigroup Inc  said on Wednesday it hired Niall Cannon to co-run its global software practice within its investment bank.

Headlines: Dollar wobbles as decent U.S. data tempers safe-haven demand
Description: The dollar retreated on Wednesday in choppy trading, as generally solid U.S. economic data and improving European numbers diminished its appeal as a safe haven, though the currency's outlook remained upbeat given renewed risks posed by the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Trump: Getting 'more and more happy' with Fed Chair Powell during pandemic
Description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday indicated he was warming to Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell, whom he has harshly criticized for not cutting lending rates below zero, telling Fox Business Network he appreciated the central bank putting liquidity into the economy during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Trump says he will have a statement on the minimum wage in the next two weeks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he will have a statement on the minimum wage in the next two weeks, adding that his view on the issue is different than some fellow Republicans.

Headlines: Police raid Wirecard HQ as administrator kicks off asset sales
Description: Police and public prosecutors raided Wirecard's headquarters in Munich and four properties in German and Austria on Wednesday as they widened their investigation into the financial payments company that collapsed last week.

Headlines: Oil rises over 1% on U.S. crude stockpile draw, manufacturing activity
Description: Oil prices rose more than 1% on Wednesday following a drawdown in U.S. crude inventories from record highs and a string of positive manufacturing data, but a surge in coronavirus cases tempered gains.

Headlines: Uber extends mask requirement for drivers, riders, launches new campaign
Description: Uber Technologies Inc  on Wednesday extended indefinitely a requirement for drivers and riders on its platform to wear a face covering or mask and launched a new campaign video to educate users about the policy.

Headlines: Macy's posts nearly $4 billion in losses, doesn't expect another shutdown
Description: Macy's Inc reported a staggering $3.58 billion quarterly loss on Wednesday as coronavirus-related store shutdowns resulted in a $3 billion impairment charge.

Headlines: U.S. lawmaker seeks to ban Chinese firms from U.S. capital markets
Description: A top senator is preparing a bill to ban Chinese companies from U.S. capital markets if they engage in spying, human rights abuse or support China's military, threatening a financial blow as tensions mount over COVID-19 and Beijing's crackdown on Hong Kong.

Headlines: Alitalia resumes international flights from Milan, Linate to open on July 13
Description: Alitalia [CAITLA.UL] on Wednesday resumed international flights from Milan as Italy gradually reopens its airports to foreign travellers and scraps restrictions imposed to contain the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Fed's Daly sees four to five year recovery in best-case scenario
Description: San Francisco Federal Reserve Bank President Mary Daly on Wednesday painted a grim picture of the U.S. economic outlook, saying that even under her best-case scenario unemployment will still top 10% at year's end and won't return to pre-crisis levels for four or five years.

Headlines: Hugo Boss poaches another Tommy Hilfiger executive
Description: German fashion house Hugo Boss  has appointed Oliver Timm as its chief sales officer with effect from Jan. 1, 2021, just weeks after it hired former Tommy Hilfiger boss Daniel Grieder as its next chief executive.

Headlines: Automakers laud U.S. consumer 'resilience' despite COVID-19 hit to sales
Description: Major automakers posted lower U.S. monthly or quarterly new vehicle sales on Wednesday due in large part to weak fleet orders, but said consumer demand remained robust despite the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: European stocks end choppy session higher on vaccine hopes
Description: Hopes of a COVID-19 vaccine pulled European stocks from losses earlier on Wednesday, after fears of a no-deal Brexit and anxieties relating to the European Union's recovery fund had weighed on sentiment.

Headlines: United Airlines to triple flights in August, but watching COVID-19 spikes
Description: United Airlines  is adding nearly 25,000 domestic and international flights in August, tripling the number it flew in June, while standing ready to shift plans if recent spikes in COVID-19 cases hurt demand, executives said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Manufacturing slump eases as world emerges from pandemic
Description: A slump in global manufacturing showed signs of easing in June as a rebound in Chinese and U.S. activity offered some hope the  world's two largest economies may have passed the worst of the devastation caused by the novel coronavirus pandemic, while the collapse in European factory activity abated.

Headlines: India's TikTok stars feel pained by government app ban
Description: Geetha Sridhar never used to enter her kitchen in Mumbai without her smartphone. The 54-year-old homemaker used to post dozens of short videos daily on the Chinese video app TikTok, mostly of herself cooking traditional recipes.

Headlines: Citigroup pulls back on office return plans
Description: Citigroup Inc  said on Wednesday it was delaying plans for  U.S. employees returning to offices as COVID-19 cases rise in several states.

Headlines: Lloyd's calls for state-backed 'Black Swan' reinsurance
Description: "Black Swan" reinsurance schemes backed by governments could help businesses get insurance pay-outs after huge shocks such as the coronavirus pandemic, Lloyd's of London [SOLYD.UL] said.

Headlines: Munich prosecutors search Wirecard HQ, as probe widens
Description: Munich prosecutors and police searched Wirecard's headquarters and four further properties as part of a fraud probe following the arrest of the payments firm's former chief executive, Markus Braun, prosecutors said on Wednesday.

Headlines: German watchdog defends Wirecard oversight before lawmakers
Description: The head of Germany's financial market regulator BaFin, which is under intense scrutiny for its oversight of collapsed Wirecard , defended its record on Wednesday, saying it wasn't alone in deciding how to categorise the payments provider.

Headlines: Capri estimates 70% plunge in first-quarter revenue, plans Michael Kors store closures
Description: Michael Kors owner Capri Holdings Ltd  on Wednesday estimated a stunning 70% drop in first-quarter revenue as the COVID-19 pandemic hammered demand for its luxury handbags and dresses.

Headlines: Airbus HR chief says job cut target could be reduced
Description: Airbus'  job cut target could be reduced depending on part-time working agreements or government research funding, the European planemaker's human resources officer said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Turkish competition board launches probe into Audi, Porsche, VW, Mercedes-Benz and BMW
Description: The Turkish Competition Board said on Wednesday that it launched an investigation into German carmakers Audi, Porsche, Volkswagen, Mercedes-Benz and BMW to determine whether they violated competition law.

Headlines: Luckin Coffee winds up internal probe ahead of vote on chairman removal
Description: Luckin Coffee Inc  said on Wednesday it was winding up an internal probe on fake annual sales of about $300 million as it prepares to vote on a proposal to remove Founder-Chairman Charles Zhengyao Lu on July 2.

Headlines: Business groups say flexibility needed to implement new North American trade deal
Description: U.S., Mexican and Canadian business groups applauded a new North American trade deal's entry into force on Wednesday, but said more work and flexibility was needed to overcome challenges including implementation of new labor and automotive rules.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing activity hits 14-month high
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity rebounded in June, hitting its highest level in more than a year as the broader economy reopened, but rising COVID-19 infections threaten the recovery.

Headlines: Luxury British department store Harrods to cut nearly 700 jobs
Description: Luxury British department store Harrods said on Wednesday it plans to cut up to 672 jobs because of the coronavirus crisis, which kept its flagship branch in central London closed for nearly three months.

Headlines: ViacomCBS taps Amazon executive to replace CFO Spade
Description: ViacomCBS Inc  said on Wednesday Amazon finance executive Naveen Chopra would replace Christina Spade as its chief financial officer, effective Aug. 10.

Headlines: Boeing 737 MAX report may boost effort to reform U.S. airplane certification
Description: A new report into the Federal Aviation Administration's decision to certify the Boeing 737 MAX may help proponents seeking reforms to the long-standing practice of delegating some aircraft certification tasks to manufacturers.

Headlines: IKEA agrees to buy Paris site as part of inner-city push
Description: IKEA store operator Ingka Group has agreed to buy a commercial property on Paris' Rue de Rivoli and is looking for more such acquisitions in other large European cities, the head of its investment arm said.

Headlines: EU throws new rule book at Google, tech giants in competition search
Description: Exasperated by its failure to loosen Google's market grip, despite more than $8 billion in fines, the European Union is lining up new rules to level the playing field for rivals.

Headlines: Zoom says added over 100 features as part of 90-day security plan
Description: Zoom Video Communications Inc said on Wednesday it has added over 100 features to its video conferencing as part of its 90-day plan to address security and privacy concerns.

Headlines: Top U.S. business executives urge Congress to pass bipartisan policing reform
Description: Top business executives in the United States are calling on the U.S. Congress to pass bipartisan policing reform before its August recess, in the wake of protests against police brutality and racial bias in the criminal justice system.

Headlines: Drop in June airline bookings give reason for caution: IATA
Description: A dip in airline bookings in the second half of June give grounds for caution about the prospects for the industry in the coming months as COVID-19 cases start to spike again in certain countries, the chief economist of airline body IATA said.

Headlines: Spain working with Airbus to keep jobs in wake of restructuring
Description: Spain is working with Airbus  to find ways for the airplane maker to keep jobs in the country, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Wednesday, a day after it announced many layoffs as part of a global restructuring.

Headlines: German authorities search Continental, VW as part of diesel probe
Description: German prosecutors have extended their diesel emissions probe to include auto supplier Continental  for its role in supplying engine components, searching the company's offices and those of automaker Volkswagen, the companies said on Wednesday.

Headlines: EasyJet to cut jobs in Berlin, scrap German domestic flights
Description: British low cost carrier easyJet  plans to cut jobs and the number of aircraft it has in Berlin and is proposing scrapping domestic German flights as part of its retrenchment over COVID-19, a German union and source familiar with the plan said.

Headlines: India asks telcos, internet firms to block banned Chinese apps, ByteDance to hold talks
Description: India has ordered telecom companies and other internet providers to stop access to 59 banned Chinese-origin apps, according to notices seen by Reuters, intensifying efforts to crack down on such businesses following a border clash between the nations.

Headlines: Potential Ryanair job cuts remain at 3,000: spokeswoman
Description: Ryanair  is still planning around 3,000 additional job losses if it cannot agree pay cuts with pilots and cabin crew, a spokeswoman for the airline said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Strong bookings boost Ryanair's hopes of return to normal
Description: Ryanair reported "very strong" bookings from holidaymakers as it relaunched its network with 1,000 flights on Wednesday, the start of a summer that Group Chief Executive Michael O'Leary hopes will restore Europe's confidence in air travel.

Headlines: U.S. employers announced more job cuts in June: report
Description: U.S. employers announced an additional 170,219 job cuts in June as the recession caused by the COVID-19 depresses demand and pushes companies into bankruptcy, a report showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: Allianz to end Wirecard cooperation amid accounting scandal
Description: Allianz  said on Wednesday that it was ending its relationship with Wirecard Bank  and removing from the market a mobile payment app that the two companies had developed.

Headlines: New York City comptroller tells companies 'to walk the walk' on racial equality
Description: Companies voicing support for racial equality should back up their talk by releasing their workforce diversity data, New York City Comptroller Scott Stringer says in letters being sent to 67 companies in the S&P 100 on Wednesday.

Headlines: OECD says U.S. still committed to global digital tax talks
Description: The United States remains committed to global talks on the taxation of big digital companies despite its call for a pause, the head of the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Senior UK lawmaker says: West should not do business with Huawei
Description: The chairman of the British parliament's foreign affairs committee said on Wednesday that the West should not be doing business with China's Huawei.

Headlines: Toymaker Lego joins ad boycott campaign
Description: Toymaker Lego said on Wednesday it would pause social media advertising for at least a month, joining a long list of companies that say Facebook is not doing enough to stop hate speech on its platforms.

Headlines: Virgin Money restarts job cuts and branch closures after coronavirus pause
Description: British lender Virgin Money will restart a redundancy and branch closure programme that was paused due to the coronavirus crisis, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ryanair hopes to land first Boeing 737 MAX jet by November
Description: Ryanair, one of the largest customers for Boeing's troubled 737 MAX, hopes to take its first delivery in November after the jet's first test flight appeared to go well, Group Chief Executive Michael O'Leary said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Central Europe's factory decline eases in June
Description: The downturn in central European manufacturing eased markedly in June as economies reopened after the coronavirus lockdown, surveys showed on Wednesday, but the sector was still some way from returning to growth.

Headlines: Ryanair sees 'very strong' July bookings but ticket prices lower than ever
Description: Ryanair has seen "very strong" bookings for the first two weeks of July across its network, which it largely reopened on Wednesday, but expects ticket prices to be lower than ever for 12 months, Group Chief Executive Michael O'Leary said.

Headlines: Geely's Volvo announces its biggest ever recall over seat belt cable
Description: Volvo Cars said on Wednesday it was recalling nearly 2.2 million cars built between 2006 and 2019 to address a potential issue with cables attached to their front seat belts in the automaker's biggest ever recall.

Headlines: Renault sees June recovery in French car sales stretching into third quarter
Description: Renault  expects a pick-up in the French car market in June, after the country's coronavirus lockdown was lifted, to carry on into the third quarter, the brand's sales chief for France Ivan Segal said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. property reinsurance rates rise up to 30% at July renewals: Willis
Description: Property reinsurance rates in the United States rose as high as 30% during renewals in June and July, following years of heavy natural catastrophe losses, data from broker Willis showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: Chinese police say Tencent likely swindled by chilli sauce impostors
Description: Chinese police on Wednesday said Tencent appears to have been duped by a group of people masquerading as representatives of China's best-known chilli oil maker, Lao Gan Ma, after the internet giant accused the latter of breaching a contract.

Headlines: Watchdog puts British banks on notice but no overdraft inquiry
Description: Britain's financial watchdog will not open a formal inquiry into how banks charge for overdrafts, but put them on notice on Wednesday of a full evaluation of their pricing next year.

Headlines: The long bumpy road from NAFTA to USMCA
Description: After an long, arduous road the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade agreement (USMCA) took effect on Wednesday, replacing its predecessor, the quarter-century-old North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA).

Headlines: Exclusive: Boeing kept FAA in the dark on key 737 MAX design changes - U.S. IG report
Description: Boeing Co  failed to submit certification documents to the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) detailing changes to a key flight control system faulted in two fatal crashes, a long-awaited government report seen by Reuters has found.

Headlines: Google postpones U.S. office reopening to September as virus cases spike
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google said late on Tuesday it was delaying the reopening of its U.S. offices by around two months because of a surge in the number of coronavirus cases in some  states.

Headlines: Carlyle to buy 25% of Bharti Airtel's data center arm for $235 million
Description: Carlyle will buy a 25% stake in Indian telecom firm Bharti Airtel Ltd's data center arm for $235 million, the U.S. private equity group said on Wednesday, as it taps into the rapid growth of digital services in India.

Headlines: SocGen's Australian securities arm pleads guilty to client money offences
Description: Australia's corporate regulator on Wednesday said the Australian securities unit of France's Societe Generale SA (SocGen)  has pleaded guilty to charges of breaching client money provisions.

Headlines: China's factory activity expands, but job losses quicken amid weak exports: Caixin PMI
Description: China's factory activity grew at a faster clip in June after the government lifted coronavirus lockdown measures and ramped up support steps, but the health crisis continues to pressure exports and jobs, a private business survey showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: California accuses Cisco of job discrimination based on Indian employee's caste
Description: California regulators sued Cisco Systems Inc  on Tuesday, accusing it of discriminating against an Indian-American employee and allowing him to be harassed by two managers because he was from a lower Indian caste than them.

Headlines: U.S. Senate votes to extend small-business aid program through August
Description: The U.S. Senate unanimously voted on Tuesday to extend a $660 billion lending program in an effort to help small businesses that have been hit hard by the coronavirus, extending a lifeline just as it was due to expire.

Headlines: Pandemic sinks Japan business mood to lowest since 2009 crisis
Description: Japanese manufacturers' confidence sank in the second quarter to levels not seen since the 2009 global financial crisis, underscoring the damage the coronavirus pandemic inflicted on the export-reliant economy.

Headlines: Goldman's investment bank to increase Black staff hiring, recruitment
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc's investment bank formed a new group to increase its recruitment and hiring of Black employees and improve career development and retention among existing Black employees, according to a memo sent on Tuesday that was seen by Reuters.

Headlines: UAW leader, U.S. prosecutor discuss independent oversight for union
Description: The United Auto Workers' president met on Tuesday with the U.S. prosecutor heading a federal investigation into corruption at the union, and the two said they discussed reforms including possible independent oversight of future labor agreements.

Headlines: Mnuchin sees support for crisis loans to hotels, restaurants
Description: Up to $140 billion in loans for small business could be refocused to support restaurants, hotels and other industries hit hardest by the coronavirus pandemic, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Tuesday.

Headlines: GM must repay $60 million in state tax credits, Ohio AG says
Description: Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost said Tuesday that General Motors Co should repay $60 million in state tax credits after it closed its Lordstown Assembly plant in March 2019.

Headlines: Beyond Meat to sell patties in mainland China through Freshippo stores
Description: Beyond Meat Inc  said on Tuesday that it will launch retail sales of its plant-based burger patties in mainland China through Alibaba Group Holding Ltd's  Freshippo markets.

Headlines: Aeromexico becomes latest LatAm airline to file for bankruptcy
Description: Mexican airline Aeromexico said on Tuesday it had begun restructuring under Chapter 11 proceedings, the latest Latin American airline to run into serious trouble as the coronavirus pandemic wreaks havoc on tourism and business travel.

Headlines: FedEx shares jump over 9% as quarterly results top expectations
Description: Shares of FedEx Corp  jumped 9.4% in extended trading on Tuesday after a surge in pandemic-fueled home deliveries helped the U.S. package carrier post better-than-expected quarterly profit and revenue.

Headlines: Ryanair expects to fly 4.5 million passengers in July
Description: Ryanair  expects to fly more than 4.5 million passengers in July as it returns to a more regular schedule with 40% of its usual capacity for the peak summer month, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Airbus to cut 15,000 jobs to survive coronavirus crisis
Description: Airbus is cutting 15,000 jobs within a year, including 900 already earmarked in Germany, saying its future is at stake after the coronavirus outbreak paralysed air travel.

Headlines: Airbus CEO warns staff against national rivalries amid job cuts
Description: The head of planemaker Airbus  warned staff against reverting to national or regional agendas that plagued the Franco-German-led firm in the past as workers battle for jobs.

Headlines: World shares end stellar quarter but still down in 2020
Description: A global stocks index rose on Tuesday and marked its largest quarterly gain since 2009 as investors continued to look for signs of an economic recovery while shrugging off data showing a rising number of COVID-19 cases.

Headlines: S&P 500 ends best quarter since 1998 on a high note
Description: The S&P 500 rallied on Tuesday to finish higher and secure its biggest quarterly percentage gain in more than two decades as improving economic data bolstered investor beliefs that a stimulus-backed rebound for the U.S. economy was on the horizon.

Headlines: Bid for Cirque du Soleil dismissed as 'pure fiction' by lenders
Description: A stalking horse bid for Cirque du Soleil Entertainment Group was dismissed as inadequate by lenders during a Quebec court hearing into the company's restructuring on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wanted for graft, ex-Pemex boss to be extradited to Mexico from Spain
Description: The former chief executive of Mexican state oil company Petroleos Mexicanos, Emilio Lozoya, has agreed to be extradited from Spain to Mexico to stand trial on corruption charges, Mexican Attorney General Alejandro Gertz said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wall Street faces danger signs after best quarter since '98
Description: A stock rebound marked by Wall Street's strongest quarter in more than two decades has slowed in recent weeks, as a resurgence in coronavirus cases threatens to derail the economy's recovery from a deep downturn.

Headlines: Oil slips slightly on rising coronavirus cases, returning Libyan supplies
Description: Oil prices slipped on Tuesday as investors worried that rising COVID-19 cases would hurt demand while supply could rise with a potential resurgence of Libyan oil production, which has slowed to a trickle since the start of the year.    The more-active September contract for Brent  settled down 58 cents at $41.27 a barrel. The August contract , which expires on Tuesday, fell 56 cents, or 1.2%, to $41.15. The contract has gained 16.5% this month so fa

Headlines: Adidas human resources head steps down after race row
Description: The head of human resources at Adidas  has stepped down after a group of employees called for an investigation over her handling of racism at the company, which she had described last year as "noise" only discussed in America.

Headlines: Fed officials stress need to factor in structural inequities when evaluating economy
Description: Policymakers need to keep diversity and structural racial inequalities in mind when analyzing the labor market and other measures of the economy, two Federal Reserve officials said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Italy bank showdown looms in test for European consolidation
Description: As many bankers fled Italy's financial capital for second homes in the mountains or lakes at the start of a coronavirus lockdown in March, Victor Massiah rushed instead to rent a house within walking distance of UBI Banca's Milan offices.

Headlines: Dollar edges lower amid uncertain U.S. outlook
Description: The dollar slipped on Tuesday, alternating between gains and losses, as markets digested less bearish comments from U.S. monetary officials along with a more dire prognosis from the country's top medical expert on the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Airbus plans to cut jobs right across its UK operation: union
Description: Plans by Airbus to cut 1,700 UK jobs will affect its operations across Britain including its two biggest factories, the Unite union said on Tuesday, as it re-iterated a call for government support for the sector.

Headlines: Airbus needs to revise "excessive" job cuts plan: French finance ministry
Description: European planemaker Airbus' plans to shed 15,000 jobs are "excessive" and need to be revised, a French Finance Ministry source said on Tuesday after the announced cuts.

Headlines: Mexico loses 12 million jobs, workers in informal sector grow
Description: Twelve million Mexicans have lost their jobs since March as part of the economic fallout from the coronavirus, and the number of people working in the informal sector shot up significantly, official data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Google stymies media companies from chipping away at its data dominance
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google upended plans by European media companies to block it from harvesting data about their readers and slash some of its dominance in online advertising, seven people involved in the talks said this month.

Headlines: Top U.S. House Republican resists extending coronavirus unemployment benefits
Description: The top Republican in the U.S. House of Representatives said on Tuesday it would not be productive to extend extra unemployment benefits that were included in coronavirus relief legislation earlier this year but that expire on July 31.

Headlines: Airbus says to shed 15,000 jobs
Description: Airbus on Tuesday unveiled plans to shed around 15,000 jobs including 900 already earmarked in Germany, saying its future was at stake after the coronavirus pandemic rocked the air travel industry.

Headlines: GM should repay $60 million in state tax credits: Ohio AG
Description: Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost said Tuesday that General Motors Co should repay $60 million in state tax credits after it closed its Lordstown Assembly plant in March 2019.

Headlines: U.S. FCC issues final orders declaring Huawei, ZTE national security threats
Description: The Federal Communications Commission on Tuesday formally designated Chinese's Huawei Technologies Co and ZTE Corp  as posing threats to U.S. national security, a declaration that bars U.S. firms from tapping an $8.3 billion government fund to purchase equipment from the companies.

Headlines: Air Canada to suspend flights on 30 domestic routes due to pandemic hit
Description: Air Canada said on Tuesday it would suspend flights on 30 domestic routes hit by persistent weak travel demand due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. top medical experts rebuke American Airlines for filling planes
Description: Top U.S. health experts on Tuesday criticized American Airlines  and other carriers for filling planes to capacity, saying it sends the wrong message as the country grapples with a rise in coronavirus outbreaks.

Headlines: BOC Aviation cancels 30 Boeing 737 MAX but backs grounded jet
Description: Aircraft leasing company BOC Aviation  said on Tuesday it had cancelled an order for 30 Boeing  737 MAX planes although its chief executive remained confident in the jet which has been grounded for more than a year.

Headlines: European shares edge lower at the end of strong quarter
Description: European stocks slipped on Tuesday, with banks and energy firms leading the losses at the end of a strong quarter, while UK markets took a hit from a worse-than-expected GDP reading.

Headlines: LVMH expects pandemic to dampen sales for some time yet
Description: The fallout from the coronavirus crisis will weigh on LVMH's  earnings for some time yet, though there were some signs of recovery this month, executives at the world's biggest luxury goods group said on Tuesday.

Headlines: NY Fed's Williams says full recovery will likely take years
Description: The U.S. economy is showing signs of a turnaround as businesses reopen, but the pace of the recovery is being slowed by large-scale virus outbreaks in some states and it could be years before the economy is back at full strength, New York Federal Reserve Bank President John Williams said on Tuesday.

Headlines: NY Fed's Williams says no decisions being made on yield curve control
Description: Federal Reserve officials are still analyzing the potential costs and benefits of "yield curve control," a strategy that involves targeting interest rates for certain maturities, New York Federal Reserve Bank President John Williams said Tuesday.

Headlines: Uber bus just around the corner on post-pandemic public transit map
Description: Urban transportation's transformation has shifted up a gear as the coronavirus crisis turns travel habits on their head, with Uber making allies of public transit systems by now offering to sell them its software expertise.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence perks up; rising COVID-19 cases cast shadow over recovery
Description: U.S. consumer confidence rebounded in June as businesses reopened, strengthening views that the economic downturn was likely over, though rising COVID-19 infections threaten to derail the budding recovery.

Headlines: Facebook agrees to audit its hate speech controls
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Monday it would submit itself to an audit of how it controls hate speech in a bid to appease a growing advertising boycott of the platform, as it prepared to address a group of advertisers on Tuesday.

Headlines: India's Chinese app ban seen jolting ByteDance's India plans, angers some TikTok users
Description: An Indian ban on dozens of Chinese apps following a border clash between the two nations has possibly derailed a $1 billion India expansion plan of China's ByteDance, while also sparking an uproar from users of its popular TikTok video app.

Headlines: Citroen to start selling latest C4 model in fourth quarter
Description: Citroen's latest C4 model will go on sale in the fourth quarter of this year, with the French carmaker aiming to expand in the compact car market, the head of PSA-owned  Citroen told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: L'Oreal to nominate CEO successor, drawn internally, by autumn
Description: L'Oreal 's Chairman and Chief Executive Jean-Paul Agon said on Tuesday he expected the cosmetic group's nominations committee to propose a candidate to succeed him by the autumn as his mandate expires.

Headlines: 'Revolting' - French workers at Nokia-owned plant protest layoffs
Description: Several hundred workers at French firm Alcatel-Lucent International on Tuesday protested against plans by parent company Nokia Oyj  to cut 1,233 jobs.

Headlines: Nasdaq's $1.2 trillion biotech index draws Europe's COVID drug hunters
Description: Spain's Pharma Mar  is looking at listing on New York's Nasdaq market, joining a flurry of biotech companies aiming to tap investors' voracious appetite for the sector as it tests one of its therapies to treat COVID-19.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence rebounds in June, but rising COVID-19 infections a worry
Description: U.S. consumer confidence grew more than expected in June, strengthening views that the economic downturn was likely over, though rising COVID-19 infections threatened to derail the budding recovery.

Headlines: Los Angeles delays movie theater reopenings after rise in coronavirus cases
Description: Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti on Monday announced he was taking a "hard pause" on when movie theaters in the city can reopen, citing an increase in coronavirus cases.

Headlines: India's Chinese app ban seen jolting $1 billion expansion of ByteDance
Description: An Indian ban on dozens of Chinese apps following a border clash between the two nations has possibly derailed a $1 billion India expansion plan of China's ByteDance, while also sparking an uproar from users of its popular TikTok video app.

Headlines: China says India's ban on Chinese apps may violate WTO rules
Description: China said on Tuesday that India's move to ban 59 Chinese-origin mobile apps could be a breach of World Trade Organisation (WTO) rules, and urged New Delhi to create an open and fair business environment.

Headlines: Shell to cut asset values by up to $22 billion after coronavirus hit
Description: Royal Dutch Shell  plans to slash the value of its oil and gas assets by up to $22 billion after the coronavirus crisis hit demand for fuel and weakened the outlook for energy prices, the Anglo-Dutch energy company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Hedge funds were right to short-sell Wirecard, says industry body
Description: Hedge funds were right to target Wirecard after "forensic analysis" showed there was something amiss since 2014 at the now collapsed German payments company, industry body AIMA said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Air France plans to cut 6,500 jobs by 2022: sources
Description: Air France  aims to present a plan to trade unions to cut just over 6,500 jobs over the next two years, three sources familiar with the matter said on Tuesday, as the airline grapples with the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: EasyJet looking to cut over 700 pilot jobs: union
Description: British low cost airline easyJet  has said that 727 of its UK-based pilots are at risk of redundancy, equivalent to about one-third of its pilots in the country, union BALPA said in a statement.

Headlines: How coronavirus became a market inferno and what was done to douse it
Description: From a January lockdown in a Chinese province to 10 million infections worldwide, the coronavirus' march across the globe has buffeted markets at every step these past six months, roiling the very plumbing of the global financial system.

Headlines: 'Glow' to replace 'whitening' in some L'Oreal skin products
Description: L'Oreal will gradually replace "white" or "fair" with "glow" or "even" for some products designed to help even out skin tones, the cosmetic group's chief executive said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Apple not dominant in any market, plenty of rivals, senior executive says
Description: IPhone maker Apple, the target of EU antitrust investigations into key segments of its business, on Tuesday rejected accusations of market dominance, saying it competes with Google, Samsung and other rivals.

Headlines: Wirecard's former boss faces criminal complaint in Austria
Description: An Austrian lawyer has filed a criminal complaint against Wirecard's  former Chief Executive Markus Braun and Chief Operating Officer Jan Marsalek at a court in Vienna, accusing them of market manipulation and serious fraud.

Headlines: Fed's offered flood of credit so far just a trickle in practice
Description: The Federal Reserve's promise in the early days of the coronavirus pandemic to flood the U.S. economy with trillions of dollars seemed like the proverbial central bank bazooka.

Headlines: EasyJet says Haji-Ioannou family holding drops below 30%
Description: British low-cost airline easyJet  said in a regulatory filing on Tuesday that the Haji-Ioannou family now hold under 30% of the company.

Headlines: Air France aims to cut more than 7,500 jobs between now and 2022: BFM TV/AFP
Description: Air France  wants to cut more than 7,500 job positions between now and 2022, reported BFM TV and Agence France Presse on Wednesday, citing trade union sources.

Headlines: Google removes ads served to users seeking voting info for 'misrepresentation'
Description: Google  said on Monday it had removed ads for companies that charge people large fees to register to vote or harvest their data, which appeared when users searched for voter information.

Headlines: New rules may be needed for payments in wake of Wirecard, BIS boss says
Description: More joined up rules may be needed across the payments sector after the collapse of Germany's Wirecard AG, Bank for International Settlements president Augustin Carstens said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Germany missed chances to put Wirecard on watchlist, source says
Description: German regulators twice looked into tightening the supervision of collapsed payments firm Wirecard and discussed it with the German and European central banks but no action was taken, a person with direct knowledge of the talks told Reuters.

Headlines: Slumping fleet sales weigh on U.S. auto market
Description: Collapsing demand from rental car companies, corporations and government agencies has sapped U.S. auto sales during the coronavirus pandemic and a recovery will likely be slow, threatening auto workers whose jobs depend on fleet sales.

Headlines: Temasek looks to inject up to $100 million in India's Zomato: Economic Times
Description: Singapore's state investor, Temasek, is looking to invest up to $100 million in Indian food delivery firm Zomato, Economic Times reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Puma pauses ads on Facebook and Instagram in July
Description: German sportswear brand Puma said on Tuesday it will pause all paid advertising globally on Facebook and Instagram throughout July to persuade the social media company to remove hostile and harmful conversation on its sites.

Headlines: Standard Life Aberdeen picks ex-Citi executive as CEO
Description: Standard Life Aberdeen (SLA)  Chief Executive Keith Skeoch will step down after five years at the helm and former Citi executive Stephen Bird will replace him, the British asset manager said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Will office buildings ever be the same? Empire State offers clues
Description: The Empire State Building has been a symbol of America's economic might for almost 90 years. Of late, it's also become a symbol of its struggle with the coronavirus.

Headlines: Airbus slows services push amid coronavirus crisis
Description: Airbus has postponed its target of building a $10 billion services business amid the coronavirus crisis, but is sticking with a strategy of supporting airline operations, a senior executive said as the company heads for a broader shake-up.

Headlines: Coronavirus strikes down global M&A as companies keep their distance
Description: Global M&A activity tumbled to its lowest level in more than a decade in the second quarter, according to data provider Refinitiv, as companies gave up on expansion plans to focus on protecting their balance sheets and employees in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Cineworld delays U.S., UK cinema reopenings to end of July
Description: Cineworld  on Tuesday delayed the reopening of its cinemas in the United States and Britain until the end of July, citing changes to the release schedules for some of the big summer movies.

Headlines: Federated Hermes questions HSBC's stance on Hong Kong law
Description: HSBC  investor Federated Hermes said it has questions about the bank's support for China's new security law for Hong Kong, the second investor in Europe's biggest bank in recent weeks to voice concerns about the lender's stance.

Headlines: Cerberus wants well over 7,000 Commerzbank job cuts: source
Description: Cerberus wants Commerzbank  to cut far more than a reported 7,000 jobs as part of plans by Germany's second biggest bank to reduce costs, a person familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: BMW to source battery cells produced using renewable energy
Description: German carmaker BMW  on Tuesday said its electric cars will use battery cells produced using renewable energy, a step which will compel the biggest suppliers to source more non-coal generated electricity.

Headlines: Cerberus wants well more than 7,000 job cuts at Commerzbank - source
Description: Cerberus wants Commerzbank  to cut far more than 7,000 jobs as part of the bank's efforts to trim costs, a person familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Boeing begins crucial certification test flights for grounded 737 MAX
Description: Boeing Co began a series of long-delayed flight tests of its redesigned 737 MAX with regulators at the controls on Monday, hoping to win approval and rebuild its reputation after fatal crashes that toppled its leaders and grounded the jet worldwide.

Headlines: UK economy shows biggest drop in 40 years in early 2020
Description: Britain's economy shrank by the most since 1979 in early 2020 as households slashed their spending, according to official data that included the first few days of the coronavirus lockdown.

Headlines: Japan to delay 'womenomics' target for female leaders by up to a decade: media
Description: Japan will delay by up to a decade its target to raise the percentage of women in leadership posts to 30% - part of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's campaign to empower women - after failing to hit the deadline this year, domestic media have reported.

Headlines: China's factory activity quickens, but pandemic drags on exporters and recovery
Description: China's factory activity expanded at a stronger pace in June after the government lifted lockdowns and stepped up investment, but persistent weakness in export orders suggests the coronavirus crisis will remain a drag on the economy for some time.

Headlines: Wirecard North America seeks buyer, distances itself from German company
Description: Wirecard North America Inc, a unit of German payments company Wirecard AG, on Monday said it has put itself up for sale, days after the troubled parent firm filed for insolvency.     The U.S.-based unit, which was bought by Wirecard in 2016, said an investment bank is coordinating the sale process. The unit was formerly known as Citi Prepaid Card Services.

Headlines: Environmental groups propose tailings dam safety standards
Description: Mining companies should be required to buy private insurance for tailings dams and their board of directors should be held legally responsible for any disasters, a coalition of 140 environmental groups said in a report published on Tuesday.

Headlines: Tim Tam maker Arnott's loses 50 jobs in first cuts since KKR buyout
Description: Arnott's, maker of Tim Tam biscuits and other snacks, is shedding about 50 staff, a representative told Reuters, the first such cuts since U.S. private equity firm KKR & Co Inc  bought one of Australia's best-known brands last year.

Headlines: Wall Street ends higher on Boeing bump, stimulus eyed
Description: Wall Street stocks closed higher on Monday and the S&P 500 was poised to clinch its biggest quarterly percentage gain since 1998 as investors hoped for a stimulus-backed economic rebound, while a surge in Boeing shares helped boost the blue-chip Dow.

Headlines: China service sector grows at fastest pace in seven months in June: official PMI
Description: Activity in China's services sector expanded at its fastest pace in 7 months in June, official data showed on Tuesday, suggesting consumer confidence is rapidly recovering even as Beijing ramps up coronavirus curbs after a resurgence in infections in the capital.

Headlines: Reddit bans 'The_Donald' forum amid broad social media crackdown
Description: Social media site Reddit on Monday shut down r/The_Donald, a forum which long served as a popular online home base for fans of President Donald Trump, saying it violated the site's hate speech rules.

Headlines: Cirque du Soleil files for bankruptcy protection as COVID-19 cancels shows
Description: Canada's Cirque du Soleil Entertainment Group filed for bankruptcy protection on Monday as the COVID-19 pandemic forced the famed circus operator to cancel shows and lay off its artistes.

Headlines: Unions sue three Nevada casino properties, claiming dangerous working conditions
Description: Unions representing 60,000 hospitality workers in Las Vegas and Reno, Nevada, are suing three casino properties over allegations of dangerous working conditions.

Headlines: Norwegian Air cancels 97 Boeing MAX and Dreamliners, claims compensation
Description: Norwegian Air  has cancelled orders for 97 Boeing  aircraft and will claim compensation from the U.S. plane maker for the grounding of the 737 MAX and for 787 engine troubles that hit its bottom line, the Oslo-based carrier said on Monday.

Headlines: Coronavirus rekindles global trade disputes
Description: At the start of the year, U.S.-China tensions were easing after their Phase I trade deal, while Washington, Brussels and Tokyo agreed on new global trading rules to curb subsidies. A relative calm had set in.

Headlines: Canada federal court dismisses drugmakers' plea challenging drug price rules
Description: The federal court of Canada on Monday dismissed a plea by drugmakers challenging the Canadian government's new regulations aimed at lowering prices of patented drugs that could potentially lead them to lose billions over a decade.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs says it's climbing toward Fed's capital demands
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  has already boosted capital measures and is working to meet the Federal Reserve's benchmark for October, the Wall Street bank said in a statement on Monday.

Headlines: Automakers rev up discounts to beat coronavirus sales blues
Description: In the midst of a raging pandemic, Belal Bilto, 26, a sales executive and a Manhattan resident bought a midsize pickup Jeep Gladiator this month for just over $48,000, lured by a discount of about $5,000 on the list price and a seven-year, no-interest loan.

Headlines: Credit Suisse taps Santangelo as global co-head of healthcare
Description: Credit Suisse Group AG  has named Rob Santangelo as a global co-head of its healthcare investment banking group, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Tesla's Musk calls on workers to help company break even in second quarter
Description: Tesla Inc  chief Elon Musk in an internal email called on employees to work hard to allow the electric car maker to break even in the second quarter despite the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. still poised for 'V-shaped recovery' despite reopening setbacks: Trump adviser
Description: The U.S. economy still appears headed for a "V-shaped recovery" despite some setbacks in efforts to reopen state economies that had been shuttered for the coronavirus, a top White House adviser said on Monday.

Headlines: Wall Street leads stocks' rebound, sterling dips
Description: A gauge of stocks across the world rose on Monday, led by a rebound on Wall Street, even as rising COVID-19 cases threaten to stall the recovery of the world's largest economy.

Headlines: Fed's Powell stresses uncertainty, challenges facing U.S. economy
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Monday said the outlook for the world's biggest economy is "extraordinarily uncertain" and will depend both on containing the coronavirus and on government efforts to support the recovery.

Headlines: Chesapeake asks to cancel pipeline contracts, sets drilling cuts
Description: Chesapeake Energy Corp  on Monday sought bankruptcy court approval to cancel $311 million in pipeline contracts, setting up a battle with U.S. regulators and operators including Energy Transfer LP, according to court filings.

Headlines: Fed opens primary market corporate bond facility
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Monday kicked off a long-awaited program to buy newly minted corporate bonds directly from companies, launching the last of the several programs created to stabilize financial markets rocked by the coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook ad boycott campaign to go global, organizers say
Description: Organizers of a Facebook Inc  advertising boycott campaign that has drawn support from a rapidly expanding list of major companies are now preparing to take the battle global to increase pressure on the social media company to remove hate speech.

Headlines: Factbox: More companies join Facebook ad boycott bandwagon
Description: A long list of companies have pulled advertising from Facebook Inc  in support of a campaign that called out the social media giant for not doing enough to stop hate speech on its platforms.

Headlines: New York Times ends partnership with Apple News
Description: The New York Times Co said on Monday it will end its partnership with Apple News, effective June 29, at a time when the publisher is shifting focus to a digital subscription-based model.

Headlines: Dollar edges higher before quarter-end
Description: The greenback edged higher on Monday as investors positioned for quarter-end and weighed an increase in coronavirus cases in some U.S. states against improving economic data.

Headlines: Pandemic leads to six months of global market mayhem
Description: Probably the best thing to say about world financial markets so far this year is simply that it has been quite a ride.

Headlines: Oil rises on improving economic data but new coronavirus cases loom
Description: Oil prices rose about $1 a barrel on Monday, after bullish data from Asia and Europe, but investors are wary about sharp spikes in new coronavirus infections around the world.

Headlines: Ford pauses U.S. social media advertising, calls for hate speech to be 'eradicated' from content
Description: Ford Motor Co  said on Monday it would pause advertising on all social media platforms in the United States for the next 30 days, joining a growing list of companies that have stopped spending on Facebook Inc  in support of a campaign that called out the company for not doing enough to stop hate speech on its platform.

Headlines: Geneva motor show postponed until 2022: organizers
Description: The organizers of the Geneva International Motor Show said on Monday that they would not organize the event in 2021.

Headlines: Gilead prices COVID-19 drug remdesivir at $2,340 per patient in developed nations
Description: Gilead Sciences Inc on Monday priced its COVID-19 antiviral remdesivir at $2,340 per patient for wealthier nations and agreed to send nearly all of its supply of the drug to the United States over the next three months.

Headlines: Italy picks former Poste Italiane CEO to head re-nationalised Alitalia
Description: The Italian government has picked former Poste Italiane  CEO Francesco Caio as Chairman of Alitalia, Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, as the carrier prepares to return under state control after 11 years of private management.

Headlines: Germany's Henkel joins Facebook advertising boycott
Description: German consumer goods group Henkel  will join a boycott of advertising on Facebook , a spokesman said on Monday.

Headlines: Ryanair UK pilots to decide by Wednesday on plan to limit job losses
Description: Ryanair's British pilot union is to announce on Wednesday whether its members have backed an agreement brokered with management to mitigate the loss of 334 pilot jobs by agreeing to series of measures including a 20% pay cut, the union said.

Headlines: Fed's Daly says 'far too early' to judge U.S. recovery
Description: It is "far too early" to judge the strength of the recovery in the world's largest economy as it reopens after extended coronavirus shutdowns, San Francisco Federal Reserve President Mary Daly told reporters on a conference call on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. appeals court stays order requiring GM, FCA meet to resolve GM lawsuit
Description: A U.S. appeals court on Monday stayed a lower court's order requiring officials from General Motors Co  and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles  to resolve GM's racketeering lawsuit.

Headlines: From New York to Houston, flood risk for real estate hubs ramps up
Description: The number of properties in the United States in danger of flooding this year is 70% higher than government data estimates, research released on Monday shows, with at-risk hot spots in Houston, New York, Los Angeles and Chicago.

Headlines: Airbus close to slashing jobs as CEO confirms 40% output drop
Description: Airbus  was finalising an imminent restructuring plan involving thousands of job cuts on Monday as its chief executive confirmed plans to hold output down by 40% for two years.

Headlines: Mike Ashley's Frasers Group takes Hugo Boss stake over 10%
Description: Mike Ashley's Frasers Group, formerly Sports Direct, said on Monday it has raised its stake in German fashion house Hugo Boss  to 10.1% through stocks and derivatives, part of his drive to take the British sportswear retailer upmarket.

Headlines: Coty to buy 20% stake in Kim Kardashian West's $1 billion beauty line
Description: Coty Inc said on Monday it would buy a 20% stake in reality TV star Kim Kardashian West's makeup brand KKW, as the cosmetics maker looks to cash in on the demand for celebrity-owned products.

Headlines: U.S. home contracts post record jump, factory activity improves in Texas
Description: Contracts to buy U.S. previously owned homes rebounded by the most on record in May, suggesting the housing market was starting to turn around after being hammered by the COVID-19 pandemic along with the rest of the economy.

Headlines: Wirecard collapse leads to call for German parliamentary inquiry
Description: Germany's opposition called on Monday for a parliamentary inquiry into the collapse of payments firm Wirecard after a global fraud that left a gaping hole in its books went undiscovered by auditors and regulators for years.

Headlines: A cash cliff spells trouble for U.S. unemployed, and everyone else
Description: Judith Ramirez is bracing for July. That's when the hotel housekeeper and her electrician husband - who have both been out of work for three months -  expect their combined unemployment benefits to drop by more than half, and their deferred $1,500 monthly mortgage payment on their Honolulu home to come due.

Headlines: H&M's online second-hand shop Sellpy launches in Germany
Description: Swedish online second-hand shop Sellpy, which is majority-owned by fashion giant H&M, has launched in Germany in a first step outside its home market as it bets on shoppers trending towards more sustainable consumption.

Headlines: BlackRock sees big risk of U.S. easing pandemic support too soon
Description: There is a significant risk that the policy response to the coronavirus crisis in the United States could be scaled back too soon, BlackRock Investment Institute's global chief investment strategist Mike Pyle said on Monday.

Headlines: Amazon to pay $500 million in one-time bonuses to front-line workers
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Monday it would spend $500 million on one-time bonuses to its front-line employees and partners working through the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: U.S. pending home sales jump a record 44.3% in May
Description: Contracts to buy U.S. previously owned homes rebounded by the most on record in May, suggesting the housing market was starting to turn around after being hammered by the COVID-19 pandemic along with the rest of the economy.

Headlines: Nissan to launch 7 models in Africa to pursue growth
Description: Nissan Motor Co  aims to launch seven new models in Africa over the next two years, company executives said on Monday, as the Japanese automaker seeks to focus on high-growth markets to try to weather the impact of the COVID-19 crisis.

Headlines: Exclusive: India plans incentives for auto companies to boost exports - sources
Description: India is drawing up an incentive scheme for the autos sector aimed at doubling exports of vehicles and components in the next five years, four sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Germany agrees to terminate contract with accounting watchdog
Description: Germany will cancel its contract with the country's accounting watchdog FREP, a justice ministry spokesman said on Monday, after payments company Wirecard filed for insolvency last week in one of Germany's biggest fraud scandal.

Headlines: Latin America's airline apocalypse signals a future with weak competition
Description: Bankrupt LATAM Airlines  and Avianca Holdings   are dramatically retrenching their once grand ambitions amid the COVID-19 pandemic, reducing competition in Latin America as they mull once-unthinkable cooperation with rivals.

Headlines: LVMH-backed Australian swimsuit brand in administration due to virus
Description: Seafolly Pty Ltd, an Australian swimsuit maker part-owned by French fashion giant LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE , appointed administrators on Monday citing a sales downturn from the coronavirus, the latest casualty of the health crisis in the country's retail sector.

Headlines: KKR, Apollo among suitors for National Australia Bank's wealth unit: sources
Description: KKR & Co Inc  and Apollo Global Management Inc  are among potential buyers which have conducted due diligence on National Australia Bank's  wealth management unit, three sources familiar with matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Credit Suisse appoints new CEO for business in Israel
Description: Credit Suisse  on Monday appointed Hila Goldenberg as chief executive officer of its business in Israel.

Headlines: Nissan denies corporate conspiracy to oust ex-chairman Ghosn
Description: Nissan Motor Co Ltd  on Monday blasted suggestions in media reports of a conspiracy within the company to oust former chairman Carlos Ghosn.

Headlines: Philippines promises 'thorough' probe of Wirecard, looking at three local payment firms
Description: The Philippines' anti-money laundering agency on Monday said it would conduct a "swift and thorough" investigation into scandal-hit German payments firm Wirecard AG and that it has drawn up an initial list of people and entities of interest.

Headlines: Japan automakers' May global sales drop 38% as lockdowns weigh
