Description: Japanese automakers' global sales declined 38% in May, in the third straight month of big falls as most automotive factories and dealerships remained closed due to coronavirus lockdowns.

Headlines: China's factory activity likely slowed in June on subdued global demand, Reuters poll shows
Description: China's factory activity likely grew for the fourth month June but the pace may be waning, as global demand stayed subdued while a fresh coronavirus outbreak in the Chinese capital and rising worldwide cases threaten to undermine a gradual domestic recovery.

Headlines: Yield curve control a double-edged sword for BOJ as low rates strain banks
Description: The Bank of Japan's push to keep borrowing costs low to cushion the economic blow from the coronavirus is coming at the expense of the country's lenders, which are already buckling under the strain of decades of ultra-low interest rates.

Headlines: Exclusive: Boeing 737 MAX certification flight tests to begin on Monday - sources
Description: Pilots and test crew members from the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration and Boeing Co  are slated to begin a three-day certification test campaign for the 737 MAX on Monday, people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Sony sees software subscription as future for data-analyzing image sensors
Description: Sony Corp's image sensor business aims to replicate PlayStation's success to address its reliance on a handful of manufacturers in the fickle smartphone market: It plans to sell software by subscription for data-analyzing sensors in situ.

Headlines: Japan's Takeda expects $200 million operating loss related to Novartis' Xiidra withdrawal
Description: Takeda Pharmaceutical Co Ltd  said on Monday it anticipates an operating loss of about $200 million related to Novartis AG's decision to withdraw a marketing application for the dry-eye drug Xiidra.

Headlines: Japanese bank predicts years of gloom for tourist hub Osaka
Description: Tetsuya Kan, head of a major regional bank in Osaka, said it will take two more years for the western Japan prefecture to recover from the damage caused by COVID-19, which has crushed the city's once thriving tourism and retail sectors.

Headlines: Shale pioneer Chesapeake Energy files for bankruptcy
Description: Chesapeake Energy Corp  filed for Chapter 11 on Sunday, becoming the largest U.S. oil and gas producer to seek bankruptcy protection in recent years as it bowed to heavy debts and the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on energy markets.

Headlines: Chesapeake Energy's bankruptcy delivers hit to reeling pipeline, service firms
Description: Chesapeake Energy Corp's bankruptcy will pile more pain onto leading energy service and pipeline companies whose revenues were already being slammed during the latest collapse in oil prices, according to energy analysts and corporate filings.

Headlines: SoftBank to repurchase $1.9 billion of corporate bonds
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp  said on Monday it will repurchase up to 200 billion yen ($1.9 billion) of its domestic unsecured corporate bonds from June 30 to July 17, part of its plan to pay down debt.

Headlines: Pepsi joining Facebook ad boycott, FOX Business Network reports
Description: PepsiCo Inc  will stop advertising on Facebook Inc , FOX Business Network reported https://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/pepsi-facebook-ad-boycott on Sunday, citing sources.

Headlines: Mexico's Interjet to gradually reopen more routes from July
Description: Mexico's Interjet airline will begin restarting national and international routes in July, the company said on Sunday, as airlines across the world pin their hopes on recovering demand as some coronavirus pandemic restrictions on travel ease.

Headlines: Amazon workers in Germany to go on strike over coronavirus infections
Description: Workers at six Amazon sites in Germany will go on strike on Monday in protest over safety after some staff at logistics centres tested positive for coronavirus, labour union Verdi said.

Headlines: U.S. confirms Boeing 737 MAX certification flights could start Monday
Description: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) confirmed Sunday it had approved key certification test flights for the grounded Boeing  737 MAX that could begin as soon Monday.

Headlines: Big tobacco, big oil and Buffett join Fed's portfolio
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve bought $428 million in bonds of individual companies through mid-June, making investments in household names like Walmart and AT&T as well as in major oil firms, tobacco giant Philip Morris International Inc, and a utility subsidiary of billionaire Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway holding company.

Headlines: Starbucks to pause paid advertising across social media to help stop hate speech
Description: Starbucks Corp  will pause advertising on all social media platforms as it explores the best ways to help stop the spread of hate speech, the company said in a statement on Sunday.

Headlines: Germany to sever ties with accounting watchdog after Wirecard scandal
Description: The German government plans to terminate its contract with the country's accounting watchdog after payments company Wirecard filed for insolvency last week in one of Germany's biggest fraud scandals, a government official said on Sunday.

Headlines: Ryanair bypasses union, threatens base closures in Irish pilot talks
Description: Ryanair  has threatened to close two regional bases and axe up to 120 pilot jobs unless pilots in its home Irish market bypass their union and directly accept a pay cut, a memo seen by Reuters said.

Headlines: Spanish airline Iberia will downsize due to coronavirus: CEO
Description: Spanish airline Iberia will reduce the size of its fleet, the number of destinations it flies to and how frequently as the coronavirus pandemic continues to drag on demand, its chief executive officer said in a newspaper interview.

Headlines: China's big three airlines take delivery of domestically made ARJ21 aircraft
Description: China's three biggest state-owned airlines on Sunday took delivery of their first ARJ21 aircraft, a short haul 90-seater aircraft made by state-run Commercial Aircraft Corporation of China (COMAC).

Headlines: Under Armour to discontinue record apparel partnership with UCLA
Description: Athletic apparel maker Under Armour  said on Saturday it will discontinue its partnership with UCLA - a 15-year, $280 million accord announced in 2016 that was billed as the largest apparel deal in the history of American collegiate sports.

Headlines: Some Disneyland workers protest reopening plans amid pandemic
Description: Workers at California's Disneyland Resort protested from their cars on Saturday, arguing that the Walt Disney Co  has not agreed to adequate protections for employees when the destination reopens to the public amid a pandemic.

Headlines: American Airlines CEO sees 10%-20% extra staff in July 2021, 'hard' to avoid furloughs
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  expects to have between 10% and 20% more workers than needed in July 2021, Chief Executive Doug Parker told employees at a town hall this week, and said that avoiding furloughs will be difficult.

Headlines: Germany's beleaguered Wirecard to proceed with business after insolvency
Description: Wirecard, the German scandal-hit payments company,  said on Saturday it would proceed with business activities after filing for insolvency and expects a provisional administrator to be appointed by judicial authorities shortly.

Headlines: Delta to warn pilots about possible furloughs, offers early retirement
Description: Delta Air Lines  said late on Friday it will soon send warning notices to about 2,500 pilots regarding possible furloughs at the airline, as the industry takes a huge blow after the coronavirus pandemic slashed air travel demand.

Headlines: Grounded jets sit out coronavirus pandemic in Pyrenees
Description: At the airport of Tarbes in France, row upon row of empty jets in liveries from Asia to Africa sit nose to tail on the tarmac, waiting out the coronavirus crisis in the foothills of the Pyrenees.

Headlines: German development bank could lose 100 million euros from Wirecard insolvency
Description: Germany's state development bank KfW could lose 100 million euros ($112.17 million) after payments company Wirecard filed for insolvency, a spokesman said on Saturday.

Headlines: Amazon, SoftBank held talks over Russian online retailer Ozon, shareholder says
Description: Global retail giant Amazon  and Japanese SoftBank  have made approaches to Russian conglomerate Sistema  about a possible acquisition of its online retailer Ozon, Sistema's majority owner Vladimir Evtushenkov said on Saturday.

Headlines: New York court subpoenas Etihad, Fitch in $1.2 billion debt battle
Description: A New York court has sent subpoenas to Etihad and ratings agency Fitch this week seeking a document at the centre of a battle over $1.2 billion in debt issued by the Abu Dhabi carrier and airlines it partly owned, according to legal documents reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Carlyle buys 20% stake in Piramal Pharma businesses
Description: U.S.-based Carlyle Group Inc has agreed to buy a 20% stake in the pharmaceutical unit of Indian conglomerate Piramal Enterprises Ltd for about $490 million, the companies said in a statement on Saturday.

Headlines: Facebook will label newsworthy posts that break rules as ad boycott widens
Description: Facebook Inc said on Friday it will start labeling newsworthy content that violates the social media company's policies, and label all posts and ads about voting with links to authoritative information, including those from politicians.

Headlines: GM seeks U.S. appeals court ruling to continue legal fight with Fiat Chrysler
Description: General Motors Co on Friday asked a U.S. appeals court to allow it to continue pursuing its civil racketeering suit against rival Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV, rejecting a lower court judge's belittling of the complaint.

Headlines: Investors eye economic data, stimulus measures as stocks rally stalls
Description: Upcoming U.S. economic data and deadlines for renewing some fiscal stimulus measures in July could prove key tests for an equities rebound that has wavered in recent weeks.

Headlines: Wells Fargo continues work from home policy to September: Bloomberg News
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  employees will be working from home till at least Sept. 7 due to the coronavirus pandemic, Bloomberg reported on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. fireworks purveyor sees 'perfect storm' of forces behind explosive demand
Description: The piercing boom of illegal fireworks in New York is music to the ears of Joe VanOudenhove, who runs a legal fireworks business in Pennsylvania.

Headlines: Wall Street ends lower as coronavirus surge prompts renewed restrictions
Description: Wall Street's major indexes tumbled more than 2% on Friday as several U.S. states imposed business restrictions in response to a surge in coronavirus cases.

Headlines: Exclusive: Obscure Indian cyber firm spied on politicians, investors worldwide
Description: (This June 9 story corrects to remove reference to speaking with Gupta at his office)

Headlines: New pandemic clampdowns in Texas, Florida rattle business owners
Description: Bar and restaurant owners in Texas and Florida were fuming on Friday after state officials abruptly slapped new restrictions on their businesses due to a spike in new COVID-19 cases.

Headlines: Luckin Coffee board moves to oust chairman
Description: Luckin Coffee Inc  said on Friday its board had proposed to remove its chairman, Charles Zhengyao Lu, following an internal probe into the fabrication of the embattled coffee chain's annual sales numbers.

Headlines: EU investigating German watchdog over Wirecard collapse
Description: The European Union is investigating Germany's financial regulator over the collapse of payments company Wirecard in a rare move that heaps embarrassment on Berlin days before it is due to take over the EU's rotating presidency.

Headlines: Filipino lawyer says he's been framed over Wirecard's missing billions
Description: A Filipino lawyer embroiled in a multi-billion dollar fraud at Wirecard, Mark Tolentino, told Reuters that he was surprised to be linked to the German payments firm and that he was the "victim of a frame-up".

Headlines: Ford, VW will stay neutral on challenges to Trump vehicle emissions rule: document
Description: Four major automakers will not take a position on legal challenges to the Trump administration's decision to dramatically weaken Obama-era fuel economy standards but want to weigh in on any court fix, according to a document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Global stock markets sink as U.S. virus concerns offset Europe rebound hopes
Description: Global equities sank and perceived safe-haven assets like U.S. Treasuries and gold gained on Friday as investors weighed hopes that Europe will continue to rebound from the coronavirus pandemic's economic damage against concerns over a record surge in new COVID-19 infections in the United States.

Headlines: Albertsons shares fall on NYSE debut after lackluster IPO
Description: Albertsons Cos Inc  saw its shares fall in its New York Stock Exchange debut on Friday, a day after the U.S. supermarket operator downsized its initial public offering to $800 million.

Headlines: U.S. dollar inches up, with spotlight on surge in coronavirus cases
Description: The safe-haven dollar edged higher in choppy trading on Friday, moving within narrow ranges, as investors grew cautious about a resurgence in U.S. coronavirus cases that has fueled doubts on expectations of a V-shaped recovery for the world's largest economy.

Headlines: Oil dips on rise in U.S. coronavirus cases, set for weekly fall
Description: Oil prices settled lower on Friday as new coronavirus cases spiked in the United States and China, and on growing concerns about rising U.S. output ticking up while crude stockpiles sat at record highs.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending rebounds; falling income, surging COVID-19 cases loom
Description: U.S. consumer spending rebounded by the most on record in May, but the gains are not likely to be sustainable, with income dropping and expected to decline further as millions lose their unemployment checks starting next month.

Headlines: Consumer sentiment tepid in U.S. South as COVID-19 cases spike
Description: Consumers in southern U.S. states where COVID-19 infections spiked to record levels after authorities rushed to reopen businesses were less optimistic about economic conditions in June than residents in areas that proceeded more cautiously and followed the advice of health experts.

Headlines: Exclusive: Italy's Generali in bid to acquire U.S. asset manager Brightsphere - sources
Description: Assicurazioni Generali SpA  has approached Brightsphere Investment Group Inc  about a possible acquisition of the U.S. asset management firm, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Canada's top court rules in favor of Uber driver in gig economy case
Description: Canada's Supreme Court on Friday ruled in favor of a driver in a gig economy case that paves the way for a class action suit calling for Uber Technologies Inc to recognize drivers in Canada as company employees.

Headlines: Novartis faces key meeting in U.S. bribery scandal after settling corruption case
Description: Swiss drugmaker Novartis, fresh from settling U.S. charges over alleged kickbacks to doctors, is preparing for a key meeting next week with U.S. prosecutors that could lead to the resolution of a decade-old bribery scandal.

Headlines: Gap and Kanye West sign 10-year deal to create line of Yeezy apparel; shares soar
Description: Gap Inc  has entered into a 10-year deal with rapper and fashion designer Kanye West to create a Yeezy line of clothing, both parties said on Friday, sending shares of the apparel retailer soaring 42%.

Headlines: Boeing 737 MAX certification flight test expected soon
Description: A key step in the return to service of the grounded Boeing 737 MAX could take place as soon as early next week, two people briefed on the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Factbox: More U.S. companies join Facebook ad boycott bandwagon
Description: A handful of U.S. companies have pulled advertising from Facebook Inc in support of a campaign that called out the social media giant for not doing enough to stop hate speech on its platforms.

Headlines: U.S. bank shares drop as Fed sets limits following stress tests
Description: Shares of U.S. banks dropped on Friday, with Wells Fargo's  stock falling more than 6% and Goldman Sachs Group Inc  down 7%, after the Federal Reserve capped dividend payments and barred share buybacks until at least the fourth quarter after its annual stress test.

Headlines: Exclusive: AMS to get EU green light for 4.6 billion euro Osram bid - sources
Description: Austrian sensor producer AMS   is poised to get the go-ahead from the European Union for its acquisition of German lighting group Osram , three people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: French drugmaker Sanofi to cut up to 1,680 jobs in Europe
Description: French drugmaker Sanofi , which employs more than 100,000 people worldwide, confirmed on Friday it will axe up to 1,680 jobs in Europe to cut costs and lift profits.

Headlines: Carmakers slip further from compliance with upcoming EU CO2 goals
Description: Carbon dioxide emissions from new cars in Europe rose for a third year running in 2019, provisional data from the European Union's environment agency (EEA) showed on Friday, with carmakers further lagging the bloc's upcoming climate goals.

Headlines: Spirit AeroSystems extends Boeing 737 furloughs through August 14
Description: Spirit AeroSystems Holdings Inc , a major jet parts maker struggling in the face of the ongoing Boeing Co  737 MAX grounding and COVID-19 pandemic, is extending furloughs for hundreds of 737 workers through August 14, the company said on Friday.

Headlines: UK fintech firms forced to suspend services after Wirecard collapse
Description: Customers of several British digital finance companies were unable to make payments or access their money on Friday after the collapse of German payments firm Wirecard caused disruption across borders.

Headlines: Microsoft to close physical stores, take $450 million hit
Description: Microsoft Corp  said on Friday it would close its retail stores and take a related pretax asset impairment charge of $450 million in the current quarter.

Headlines: Investors warm to Europe as Biden lead, virus fears rattle Wall Street
Description: European stocks look poised to make up ground on Wall Street in the second half of 2020 as Joe Biden consolidates his lead over Donald Trump ahead of the November U.S. presidential election and a surge of new COVID-19 cases threatens the U.S. economic recovery.

Headlines: L'Oreal to drop words such as 'whitening' from skin products
Description: L'Oreal , the world's biggest cosmetics company, will remove words referencing "white", "fair" and "light" from its skin-evening products, a spokeswoman said on Friday, a day after Unilever  made a similar announcement in the face of  growing social media criticism.

Headlines: Nike plans to cut jobs in digital push
Description: Nike Inc  on Friday warned of job cuts as the world's largest footwear maker ramps up efforts to sell directly to customers through its online and retail channels.

Headlines: United Airlines to resume China flights in July
Description: United Airlines said on Friday it would resume service to China, with two flights a week between San Francisco and Shanghai beginning July 8.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler chairman echoes PSA support for merger of the carmakers
Description: A merger between Fiat Chrysler  and Peugeot maker PSA  to create the world's fourth largest carmaker is the best way for the two companies to weather the coronavirus crisis, the Italian-American group's chairman said on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: PKN set to win EU antitrust approval for Lotos deal - sources
Description: Poland's biggest refiner PKN Orlen  is set to gain EU antitrust approval for its takeover of smaller rival Lotos  after sweetening concessions aimed at allaying competition concerns, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: French government expects no forced lay-offs in Sanofi job-cut plan: source
Description: The French government will ensure that there are no sites closed and no forced lay-offs in drugmaker Sanofi's  job-cutting plan, a Finance Ministry source told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: American Airlines warns flights may be more crowded in July
Description: American Airlines  said on Friday that it will no longer restrict the number of seats sold on flights beginning July 1, in an effort to come back from the impact of the coronavirus.

Headlines: SoftBank plans to sue EY over Wirecard scandal - Der Spiegel
Description: SoftBank is planning to sue accounting firm EY over its role in the scandal involving German payments company Wirecard, news magazine Der Spiegel reported on Friday, citing sources close to the Japanese company.

Headlines: U.S. on track for economic rebound despite virus 'interruptions', Commerce secretary says
Description: The U.S. economy is still on track for a strong rebound in the second half of the year, despite Texas' decision to scale back  its reopening as cases of the novel coronavirus spike, U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Friday.

Headlines: Amazon agrees to buy self-driving technology startup Zoox
Description: Amazon.com Inc has agreed to buy California-based self-driving startup Zoox Inc in a deal reported to be worth more than $1 billion that gives it options to use autonomous technology in either ride-hailing or its delivery network.

Headlines: Exclusive: Malaysian energy giant's board at odds with PM over payment to Sarawak state
Description: The board and management of Malaysian national energy giant Petronas have urged the prime minister to drop a planned tax settlement with a state run by his political allies, three sources close to the company said.

Headlines: Take Five: World stocks' 2020 rollercoaster ride rumbles on
Description: World stocks have been on a rollercoaster ride in the first half of 2020. Having slumped 35% from Feb. 20 to March 23, they are now within 10% of February's record highs thanks to lashings of fiscal stimulus, interest rates slashed to 0% or below in most major economies, and massive amounts of QE. Borrowing costs for high-grade U.S. companies have in fact fallen below January levels.

Headlines: Tesco rebuked as shareholders vote down directors' pay report
Description: Shareholders decisively voted down Tesco's remuneration report on Friday, as Britain's largest retailer joined a growing list of big companies to be rebuked over executive pay.

Headlines: U.S. auto sales expected to continue their recovery in June: J.D. Power, LMC Automotive
Description: U.S. auto sales are expected to continue their recovery in June following a collapse in April, as coronavirus-led lockdown restrictions ease and buyers slowly return to the market, industry consultants J.D. Power and LMC Automotive said.

Headlines: Former Wirecard COO Marsalek left Philippines this week, bound for China: minister
Description: A former board member of collapsed German payments company Wirecard was briefly in the Philippines this week but left the country on Wednesday headed for China, Manila's justice minister said on Friday.

Headlines: Accounting firms must help in Wirecard case - Germany
Description: Auditors must help with clearing up the case of Wirecard, the payments firm which disclosed a hole in its books that accountants EY said was the result of a sophisticated global fraud, the German economy ministry said on Friday

Headlines: Samsung group heir should not be indicted, South Korea panel recommends
Description: An external review panel in South Korea recommended that prosecutors should not indict Samsung Group heir Jay Y. Lee over a 2015 merger and alleged accounting fraud, the Supreme Prosecutors' Office said on Friday.

Headlines: Navistar names Persio Lisboa as CEO
Description: Navistar International Corp  named insider Persio Lisboa as its chief executive officer, effective July 1, the U.S. truck maker said on Friday.

Headlines: Aston Martin turns to stock offering to bolster capital
Description: Aston Martin  said on Friday it would issue new shares worth up to 20% of its existing equity capital for proceeds of 152 million pounds ($188.37 million) as the luxury carmaker seeks additional funds to ride out the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Hapag-Lloyd to halt waste shipments to China
Description: German container shipping line Hapag-Lloyd  said it had notified customers it will stop accepting cargoes of solid waste, including scrap metal, bound for China that arrive from Sept. 1 onwards to comply with new legislation.

Headlines: Germany opens part of bailout fund to Lufthansa now - Der Spiegel
Description: The German government is making part of its 9 billion euro  ($10.10 billion) bailout fund available to Lufthansa immediately after shareholders backed the rescue plan on Thursday, Der Spiegel magazine reported on Friday.

Headlines: BMW works council backs electric-only platform-report
Description: BMW  should shift course and establish a technology platform just for electric cars, moving away from developing cars that can be fitted with either electric or combustion engines, the head of the influential works council said.

Headlines: U.S. lenders, businesses brace for disclosure on small business pandemic aid
Description: Americans will soon get a first full look at which businesses received $515 billion of taxpayer funds when the government, after initial resistance by President Donald Trump's administration, releases borrower data for one of its highest- profile pandemic aid efforts.

Headlines: In battle against British Airways, trade union goes to investors
Description: The trade union battling British Airways (BA) has met investors in its parent company IAG , seeking to ramp up pressure on the airline over plans to cut staff, pay and conditions.

Headlines: Nike posts surprise loss as COVID-19 hits wholesale business
Description: Nike Inc  on Thursday reported an unexpected quarterly loss - its first in more than two years - hurt by closures of department and retail stores due to lockdowns spurred by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. and states' Google antitrust probe nears finish line
Description: The U.S. Justice Department is seeking the final documents to complete an antitrust investigation of Alphabet Inc's Google , said three sources familiar with the probe, which is expected to end with a lawsuit this summer.

Headlines: Lazada, Alibaba's Southeast Asian arm, appoints its third CEO in three years
Description: Southeast Asian e-commerce firm Lazada, a unit of Alibaba Group Holding Ltd , on Friday named its third chief executive in three years - a move that comes after it lost ground last year to rival Shopee.

Headlines: PG&E raises $5.5 billion as it eyes exit from bankruptcy next week
Description: PG&E Corp  has raised about $5.5 billion from a share offering and sale of equity units as the biggest U.S. power provider by customers looks to emerge from Chapter 11 bankruptcy next week.

Headlines: 'The money's gone': Wirecard collapses owing $4 billion
Description: Wirecard collapsed on Thursday owing creditors almost $4 billion after disclosing a gaping hole in its books that its auditor EY said was the result of a sophisticated global fraud.

Headlines: German oversight of Wirecard to be examined by EU watchdog
Description: The European Commission will ask its markets watchdog to investigate whether German financial regulator BaFin failed in its supervision of payments company Wirecard.

Headlines: Moody's outlook revision reignites SoftBank spat
Description: Credit-rating firm Moody's Investors Service on Friday revised its outlook for SoftBank Group Corp to "negative" from "ratings under review", three months after making a two-notch downgrade that caused a public spat with the tech conglomerate.

Headlines: Verizon suspends advertising on Facebook, joins growing boycott
Description: Verizon Communications Inc said on Thursday it was pausing advertising on Facebook Inc in July, in support of a campaign that called out the social media giant for not doing enough to stop hate speech on its platforms.

Headlines: Major U.S. airline CEOs to hold White House meeting Friday
Description: The CEOs of major U.S. airlines are set to hold a meeting Friday to discuss several coronavirus-related travel issues, including a push to convince the federal government to mandate temperature checks for passengers, three people briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: Novartis, former unit to pay $346 million to resolve U.S. bribery charges
Description: Novartis AG and a former eye-care unit will pay more than $346 million to resolve U.S. criminal and civil charges that they bribed doctors, hospitals and clinics in Greece and Vietnam to prescribe their drugs and use their surgical products.

Headlines: No breakthrough yet from plodding global recovery outlook: Reuters poll
Description: The outlook for a global economic recovery over the past month has worsened or at best stayed about the same, according to a firm majority of economists in Reuters polls, with the ongoing recession expected to be deeper than predicted only last month.

Headlines: Netherlands agrees to contribute 3.4 billion euros to Air France-KLM bailout
Description: The Dutch government has reached a deal with France to contribute 3.4 billion euros ($3.8 billion) to an Air France-KLM  bailout that had strained relations between the airline group's state shareholders, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Albertsons pulls off downsized IPO after years of trying
Description: U.S. supermarket operator Albertsons Companies Inc  decided to go ahead with a downsized $800 million initial public offering (IPO) on Thursday, the culmination of multiple attempts by its private equity owner Cerberus Capital Management LP to cash out.

Headlines: Wall Street ends choppy session higher as strength in banks offsets virus woes
Description: Wall Street's main indexes closed higher in choppy trading on Thursday, with bank stocks soaring ahead of annual stress test results and helping to offset investor jitters over alarming increases in new coronavirus cases.

Headlines: Harley-Davidson to cut about 140 jobs in United States
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc  said on Thursday it will cut about 140 jobs in the United States following the motorcycle maker's decision to adjust production volumes.

Headlines: Uber pares back digital wallet ambitions, head of unit quits: Bloomberg News
Description: Uber Technologies Inc's financial services head Peter Hazlehurst is stepping down as the company focuses on rides and food delivery, and ices plans to become a financial services company, Bloomberg News reported, citing an email to staff.

Headlines: Equities gain, safe havens rise in choppy trading as virus cases surge
Description: Global equity benchmarks moved higher in choppy trading on Thursday as investors gauged the potential economic impact of a surge in U.S. coronavirus cases and loosening restrictions on the U.S. banking sector, while perceived safe-haven assets, including U.S. Treasuries and the dollar, edged higher.

Headlines: Disney to revamp Splash Mountain to feature company's first Black princess
Description: Walt Disney Co  said on Thursday it will renovate its Splash Mountain theme park ride to feature Tiana, the entertainment company's first Black princess and the star of 2009 animated film "The Princess and the Frog."

Headlines: District of Columbia sues four oil majors for misleading consumers on climate change
Description: The attorney general for the District of Columbia on Thursday filed a lawsuit against Exxon Mobil Corp , BP Plc, Chevron Corp, and Royal Dutch Shell Plc for "systematically and intentionally misleading" consumers about the role their products play in causing climate change, the latest action by a U.S. attorney general against the oil and gas industry.

Headlines: Dollar strengthens as virus fears dent risk appetite
Description: The U.S. dollar gained on Thursday due to safety buying as fears grew over a rapid rise in coronavirus infections in some U.S. states, and as trade tensions worsened between the United States and the European Union.

Headlines: Amazon secures naming rights to new Seattle stadium
Description: Amazon.com Inc  has secured the naming rights to the new home stadium for the National Hockey League's Seattle franchise and pledged to make it the first ever net-zero carbon certified arena, the online retailer said on Thursday.

Headlines: IMF warns markets at risk of correction after run-up
Description: Markets for stocks and other risky assets could suffer a second swoon if the coronavirus spreads more widely, lockdowns are reimposed or trade tensions surge again, the International Monetary Fund warned on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil prices climb as U.S. economic data lends support
Description: Oil prices rose about 2% in a volatile session on Thursday, buoyed by signs of a marginal improvement in the U.S. economy and a tepid rise in fuel demand, but price gains were limited by rising cases of COVID-19 in some U.S. states.

Headlines: Emirates will have to review strategy after coronavirus pandemic: COO
Description: Gulf airline Emirates needs to redefine its strategy after the coronavirus pandemic brought global aviation to a near halt, its chief operating officer said on Thursday, flagging an increased focus on bringing more visitors to Dubai.

Headlines: Occidental signals writedown of up to $9 billion on bleak oil price outlook
Description: Occidental Petroleum Corp  will write down the value of its oil and gas properties by up to $9 billion this quarter and restructure some debts to avoid a possible default, the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: German minister demands regulatory rethink after Wirecard collapse
Description: German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz described as a scandal the collapse of Wirecard after the payments company disclosed a hole in its books that left it owing creditors almost $4 billion, adding it was a wake-up call for supervision.

Headlines: Apple to close 14 stores in Florida as virus cases rise, total re-closures reaches 32
Description: Apple Inc  said on Thursday that it would close 14 stores in Florida starting Friday due to a rise in COVID-19 cases, bringing its total re-closures to 32 stores in the United States.

Headlines: Bayer bets on science in bid to prevent future Roundup lawsuits: legal experts
Description: Seeking to forestall further claims, Bayer AG is taking a risky bet that an independent scientific review will ultimately show that its widely used weed killer Roundup does not cause cancer, legal experts said.

Headlines: Philly refiner nears final deal with developer, amends price again
Description: A deal to sell the Philadelphia Energy Solutions (PES) oil refinery to a Chicago-based real estate developer is expected to close on Friday for $26.5 million less than originally agreed to, lawyers for the bankrupt refiner said in court on Thursday.

Headlines: Chuck E. Cheese parent files for bankruptcy as COVID-19 deals fresh blow
Description: The parent company of Chuck E. Cheese, the once popular children-themed restaurant chain, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy on Thursday, saddled by a huge pile of debt and dismal sales because of lockdowns across the country.

Headlines: Lufthansa soars after top shareholder backs bailout
Description: Lufthansa  shares jumped as much as 20% on Thursday after its top shareholder dropped his objections to a 9 billion euro ($10 billion) government bailout for the German airline brought to the brink of collapse by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Lufthansa investors back $10 bln German government rescue
Description: Lufthansa  shareholders on Thursday backed a 9 billion euro ($10 billion) government bailout, securing the future of Germany's flagship airline after it was brought to the brink of collapse by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Volvo Cars, Waymo partner to build self-driving vehicles
Description: Waymo and the Volvo Cars Group have agreed to develop a self-driving electric vehicle designed for ride hailing use, as part of a new global partnership, the companies said on Thursday.

Headlines: We won't meddle in Lufthansa operating business, says German minister
Description: German Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Thursday the government would not get involved in the operating business of airline Lufthansa  after shareholders approved a 9 billion euro ($10 billion) government bailout.

Headlines: British Airways makes proposal to cabin crew on pay cuts
Description: British Airways, owned by IAG , has made a proposal to its cabin crew that would mean those taking on a corresponding role under its restructuring proposals would be paid at least 80% of their current basic rate, an internal letter said.

Headlines: Disney shares drop as company delays reopening of California Disneyland
Description: Shares of Walt Disney Co  dropped 1.8% on Thursday after the media company delayed the reopening of theme parks and resort hotels in California, following a surge in COVID-19 cases in the state.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuela's PDVSA weighs plan to pay for refinery work with fuel, byproducts - sources
Description: Officials from Venezuelan state oil company Petroleos de Venezuela [PDVSA.UL] have spoken with private contractors about paying for work fixing the country's refineries with fuel and byproducts, a half dozen people familiar with the talks said.

Headlines: U.S. labor market, economy struggle despite reopening of businesses
Description: The number of Americans filing claims for unemployment benefits fell moderately last week as a second wave of layoffs partially offset hiring by businesses reopening, suggesting the labor market could take years to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Spain, Ireland, Luxembourg vie for Eurogroup leadership
Description: Finance ministers of Spain, Ireland and Luxembourg are in the running to chair meetings of the powerful Eurogroup of euro zone finance ministers, with euro zone officials saying it is likely to be a close race between the Spanish and Irish contenders.

Headlines: Weak demand prompts Macy's to cut 3,900 jobs in push to save cash
Description: Macy's Inc  said on Thursday it would lay off about 3,900 employees in corporate and management positions as U.S. businesses try to save cash in the face of dwindling demand caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Fuel demand accelerates but new virus wave may slam on the brakes
Description: Fuel demand is gradually recovering as coronavirus lockdown measures ease around the globe but a second wave of infections could swiftly undermine the trend, industry data showed.

Headlines: U.S. imposes sanctions on companies operating in Iran's metals sector
Description: The United States on Thursday blacklisted four companies in Iran's metals sector, as well as one German and three Emirati subsidiaries of Iran's largest steelmaker that Washington said generate millions of dollars for Tehran's metals industry.

Headlines: Google to pay some publishers for content; others dubious
Description: Alphabet's Google on Thursday took a step towards resolving its spat with publishers, saying it would pay some media groups in Australia, Brazil and Germany for high-quality content and expects to do more deals, but others were sceptical.

Headlines: Canada's Trudeau rejects call to swap Huawei executive for detainees in China
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Thursday rejected a call to swap an imprisoned Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] executive for two citizens held by Beijing, saying such a move would set a bad precedent and harm Canada.

Headlines: Munich court seeks assessment of Wirecard from insolvency expert Jaffe
Description: A Munich court on Thursday commissioned an urgent assessment about Wirecard from insolvency law expert Michael Jaffe, putting him in the frame to be appointed administrator of the collapsed German payments company.

Headlines: Vaccine makers face biggest medical manufacturing challenge in history
Description: Developing a COVID-19 vaccine in record time will be tough. Producing enough to end the pandemic will be the biggest medical manufacturing feat in history.

Headlines: Central banks have thrown many tools at coronavirus. What do they have left?
Description: To kick-start a world economy devastated by coronavirus, central banks have delved deep into their toolboxes and unleashed trillions of dollars in stimulus. So what instruments do they have left, should they need to do more?

Headlines: Moderna eyes third quarter for first doses of potential COVID-19 vaccine with Catalent deal
Description: Moderna Inc  said on Thursday it was partnering with contract drugmaker Catalent Inc  to prepare an initial 100 million doses of its coronavirus vaccine for the United States, starting in the third quarter of this year.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sanofi considers job cuts as CEO seeks to reduce costs - sources
Description: Sanofi  is considering cutting hundreds of jobs and will discuss potential steps with staff representatives over the coming days, five sources said on Thursday, the latest move by the French drugmaker's chief executive Paul Hudson to cut costs.

Headlines: India's auto and pharma sectors not ready to wean off China
Description: Days after a border clash with China this month in which 20 Indian soldiers were killed, New Delhi told firms to find ways to cut imports from China. But two big industries, automobiles and pharmaceuticals, say this is easier said than done.

Headlines: U.S. new-car sales in June seen down as much as 30%: research firms
Description: While U.S. new-vehicle sales in June are expected to decline as much as 30%, research firms on Thursday maintained that retail demand has held up relatively well during the coronavirus outbreak and the question now is whether the industry can rebuild inventories fast enough as demand rebounds.

Headlines: Coronavirus resurgence looms over Wall Street rally
Description: The resilience of a months-long rebound in U.S. stocks is being put to the test as a long-feared resurgence in coronavirus infections weighs on hopes of a sharp economic recovery in the United States.

Headlines: April shutdown to June flowering? Rise in U.S. foot traffic competes with virus upswing
Description: If April was the month Americans hunkered down at home to fight the coronavirus pandemic, June may prove the month they officially lost patience, venturing back to restaurants, beauty salons and other socially dense activities that hinted at an economic rebound but may also be contributing to a new viral surge.

Headlines: Nissan to lay off 200 Mexico workers amid global auto slowdown
Description: Japanese automaker Nissan  will lay off about 200 workers at a plant in Mexico amid local and global challenges facing the automotive industry, the carmaker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Ryanair complains to EU antitrust watchdog about alleged Lufthansa price-fixing
Description: Ryanair  has filed a complaint to EU antitrust regulators about alleged talks between Lufthansa's  Italian unit Air Dolomiti and three Italian airlines to fix prices, the chief legal officer of Europe's biggest budget airline said on Thursday.

Headlines: Delta says unlikely to add 'many more' flights for rest of 2020
Description: Delta Air Lines  expects to add about 1,000 flights in August but not many more for the remainder of the year, Chief Executive Ed Bastian said in an internal memo on Thursday that mentioned a resurgence of COVID-19 in parts of the country.

Headlines: Unilever's 'Fair & Lovely' to get makeover after backlash
Description: Unilever  will drop the word "fair" from its "Fair & Lovely" skin lightening products, it said on Thursday, in the latest makeover of a brand in response to a global backlash against racial prejudice.

Headlines: Exclusive: Airbus executive says jetmaker reaches new production 'sweet spot'
Description: Airbus has reached a crucial jetliner production target and smoothed recent industrial problems as it embarks on a new phase in its response to the coronavirus crisis, the planemaker's chief operating officer said.

Headlines: Auditor EY says clear indications of fraud at Wirecard
Description: There are clear indications Wirecard was involved in a fraud with multiple parties around the world in different institutions, the company's auditor, EY, said on Thursday.

Headlines: Hitting back at German court challenge, ECB defends bond buys
Description: European Central Bank policymakers, fending off a German court challenge to their money-printing scheme, insist that bond buys help prop up the economy and their benefits outweigh the side effects, minutes of their June 4 meeting showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Euro zone data confirm tepid recovery, ECB's Knot says
Description: A string of positive economic indicators in the euro zone confirm that a recovery is on its way but the bloc may still need years to reach pre-crisis levels of activity, European Central Bank policymaker Klaas Knot said on Thursday.

Headlines: Accenture beats revenue estimates on digital push, shares rise
Description: IT consulting firm Accenture Plc  beat analysts' estimates for third-quarter revenue and profit on Thursday and forecast strong bookings for the current quarter, sending its shares up about 8%.

Headlines: L'Oreal's beauty-conscious customers return post-lockdown
Description: Purchases of cosmetics are picking up - especially in China - as countries exit coronavirus shutdowns that forced forced hair salons and retailers to close, L'Oreal  Chief Executive Jean-Paul Agon said.

Headlines: Hedge funds pocket $1.7 billion as Wirecard goes bust
Description: Coatue Management and nine other hedge funds likely earned more than 1.5 billion euros ($1.7 billion) this week on bets against Wirecard after the German payments firm collapsed on Thursday.

Headlines: ECB can hold back on bond buys if markets calm, Mersch says
Description: The European Central Bank doesn't need to use the whole 1.35 trillion euros ($1.51 trillion) it has earmarked for its pandemic-fighting bond purchases if financial markets calm down, ECB board member Yves Mersch said on Thursday.

Headlines: Blackstone adds Alphabet CFO Ruth Porat to its board
Description: Blackstone Group Inc  said on Thursday Alphabet Inc's  finance chief, Ruth Porat, will join the private equity firm's board of directors.

Headlines: Pret A Manger to not make June quarter rent in full as virus crisis drags on
Description: Sandwich and coffee shop chain Pret A Manger said on Thursday it would not make its June quarter rent in full as it continued to lose tens of millions of pounds each month because of the coronavirus crisis, confirming a report by the Financial Times.

Headlines: 'Embarrassing' potential ouster from MSCI index could bruise Turkish markets
Description: Turkey's potential ejection from MSCI's widely followed emerging markets index could suck almost a billion dollars out of its stock markets, dealing another blow to the country, whose position is already waning on global markets.

Headlines: Wirecard says continuing as going concern not assured
Description: German payments firm Wirecard, which filed for insolvency on Thursday, said the company's ability to continue as a going concern was not assured.

Headlines: Peugeot CEO confident Fiat Chrysler merger is on track
Description: PSA Chief Executive Carlos Tavares is confident a $50 billion merger of the maker of Peugeot vehicles with Fiat Chrysler (FCA) will proceed as planned and deliver synergies of at least 3.7 billion euros ($4.2 billion).

Headlines: Americans split along party lines over green stimulus: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Description: Americans are split along party lines over whether federal stimulus programs to boost the U.S. economy during the COVID-19 pandemic should prioritize clean energy businesses, according to a survey published by Reuters/Ipsos on Thursday.

Headlines: Factbox: German payments firm Wirecard goes from boom to bust
Description: Wirecard said on Thursday it was filing for insolvency after disclosing a $2.1 billion hole in its accounts only a week ago, capping a swift demise for a company that expanded rapidly over two decades to become a member of Germany's blue-chip share index.

Headlines: Germany welcomes EU green light for Lufthansa bailout
Description: Germany's economy and finance ministers on Thursday welcomed the approval by the European Union for a government bailout package for Lufthansa  and urged shareholders to approve the deal at a meeting later in the day.

Headlines: Lufthansa CEO suggests all staff work less instead of job cuts
Description: Lufthansa  Chief Executive Carsten Spohr said on Thursday he wants to avoid job losses at the German airline by persuading unions to agree to cutting working time and salaries for all employees.

Headlines: Wirecard shares drop 79.68% after co files for insolvency
Description: Shares in Wirecard dropped by 79.68% on Thursday as they re-opened after being suspended because the payments company filed for insolvency.

Headlines: Carnival seeks first leveraged loan to shore up liquidity
Description: LONDON (LPC) - US cruise line operator Carnival is looking to raise its first leveraged loan as it seeks alternative forms of liquidity to shore up its business, which has been sunk by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Skin cream 'Fair & Lovely' to lose 'Fair' from name, says Unilever's Indian unit
Description: The Indian arm of global consumer giant Unilever  said on Thursday it would rebrand its skin-lightening cream 'Fair and Lovely', which has been criticized for promoting negative stereotypes related to darker skin tones.

Headlines: Orange's banking unit may replace partnership with Wirecard in August: executive
Description: Orange's banking division may replace its partnership with stricken German payments company Wirecard in August, a senior executive at the French telecoms group said on Thursday.

Headlines: EU regulators okay with conditions Lufthansa's 6 billion euro recapitalisation
Description: EU state aid regulators approved on Thursday German carrier Lufthansa's  6-billion-euro ($6.74 billion) recapitalisation subject to a ban on dividends, share buybacks and some acquisitions until the state support is paid back.

Headlines: Ryanair senior executive says carrier to challenge Lufthansa's bailout
Description: Europe's biggest budget airline Ryanair  will challenge the European Commission's approval of German rival Lufthansa's  bailout, a senior Ryanair executive said on Thursday.

Headlines: Bayer to pay up to $10.9 billion to settle bulk of Roundup weedkiller cancer lawsuits
Description: Bayer AG, after more than a year of talks, agreed to pay as much as $10.9 billion to settle close to 100,000 U.S. lawsuits claiming that its widely-used weedkiller Roundup caused cancer, resolving litigation that has pummeled the company's share price.

Headlines: California Disneyland delays reopening as virus cases surge
Description: Walt Disney Co  said the reopening of theme parks and resort hotels in California will be delayed until Disneyland receives approval from state officials, as the state is hit by a huge spike in new coronavirus cases.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump administration says Huawei, Hikvision backed by Chinese military
Description: The Trump administration has determined that top Chinese firms, including telecoms equipment giant Huawei Technologies and video surveillance company Hikvision , are owned or controlled by the Chinese military, laying the groundwork for new U.S. financial sanctions.

Headlines: SoftBank is not 'SoftPunku' says CEO in defence of strategy
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  Chief Executive Masayoshi Son mounted a defence of his investing decisions on Thursday, saying the value of the Japanese conglomerate's holdings has recovered to pre-coronavirus outbreak levels.

Headlines: Exclusive: Legal tussles snarl millions in oil from Hin Leong deals
Description: Millions of dollars of oil stored in tanks and ships in Asia and Europe has become caught in a web of lawsuits related to trade and financing deals by Singapore's Hin Leong Trading (Pte) Ltd, according to court documents and shipping data.

Headlines: Amazon to build new facilities in Australia as online demand surges: AFR
Description: Retail giant Amazon Inc  is expanding its Australian operations with plans to build a warehouse in Sydney and is also scouting locations for a giant facility in Melbourne, the Australian Financial Review reported on Thursday.

Headlines: China taps World Bank official for U.S.-facing finance post: sources
Description: China is adding a new face to its trade negotiation team by appointing its chief representative at the World Bank to head the Finance Ministry's international cooperation department, three people with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Tesla plans battery manufacturing facility under project 'Roadrunner': document
Description: Tesla Inc plans to build a battery research and manufacturing facility in Fremont, California, to be operated around the clock, under a project dubbed Roadrunner, documents from the city government showed.

Headlines: U.S. pilots union asks government to subsidize empty seats on planes
Description: A major U.S. pilots union said on Wednesday it has begun discussing with key lawmakers a plan for the government to purchase seats on each flight to prevent passengers from having to sit next to strangers.

Headlines: U.S. to review tariffs on EU goods in aircraft subsidy dispute
Description: The United States moved to maintain pressure on the European Union in a 16-year dispute over aircraft subsidies by flagging possible changes in tariffs on EU goods, as the date for a decision on reciprocal EU duties slipped to the autumn.

Headlines: California wants judge to classify Uber, Lyft drivers as employees
Description: California plans to ask a state court judge to force Uber Technologies Inc and Lyft Inc to classify their ride-hail drivers as employees rather than contractors, ratcheting up the tension over a new gig worker law.

Headlines: Wall Street finishes lower on rising virus cases, weak economic view
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes on Wednesday suffered their biggest daily percentage drop in almost two weeks as a surge in U.S. coronavirus cases intensified fears of another round of government lockdowns and worsening economic damage.

Headlines: No mask, no gambling at Caesars casinos
Description: Caesars Entertainment Corp said on Wednesday it would require all guests at its casinos and other properties across the United States to wear face masks to help counter the spread of the new coronavirus.

Headlines: Lufthansa says it strikes deal with cabin crew unions
Description: German airline group Lufthansa  on Thursday said it had struck a cost saving deal with unions representing German cabin crew that would reap more than 500 million euros in savings.

Headlines: New York City retailers welcome back shoppers but challenges loom
Description: Upscale retailers including Nordstrom Inc , privately owned Saks Fifth Avenue and jeweler Tiffany & Co   reopened their large New York City flagship locations on Wednesday with reassuring signage and sanitizer stands to calm shoppers worried about the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Equities sink, bonds edge higher on fears of pandemic wave
Description: Rising concerns about a surge in coronavirus infections sent global equities and oil prices lower on Wednesday and pushed investors into perceived safe havens such U.S. Treasuries and gold, which hovered near its highest level in eight years.

Headlines: Italy approves guarantees for $7.1 billion loan to Fiat Chrysler
Description: Italy has approved a decree offering state guarantees for a 6.3-billion euro ($7.1 billion) loan to Fiat Chrysler's (FCA)  Italian unit, the Treasury said on Wednesday, paving the way for the largest crisis loan to a European carmaker.

Headlines: Oil dives over 5% as U.S. crude stocks hit record, COVID cases mount
Description: Oil prices tumbled over 5%, or more than $2 a barrel on Wednesday, after U.S. crude storage hit another record and coronavirus cases rebounded in countries like Germany and surged in heavily populated areas of the United States.

Headlines: Dollar gains as coronavirus fears return to fore
Description: The dollar strengthened on Wednesday as a rise in coronavirus cases in the United States reduced confidence in a quick economic recovery, and as the U.S. weighed tariffs on European products.

Headlines: Exclusive: Lufthansa draws up 'Plan B' to avoid insolvency - source
Description: Lufthansa  has drawn up a plan to avoid insolvency should a shareholder vote on Thursday fail to approve a $10 billion government bailout, a company source told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Lufthansa shareholder Thiele to endorse bailout: FAZ
Description: Lufthansa's  chances of winning approval for a 9 billion euros government bailout improved on Wednesday after billionaire Heinz Hermann Thiele, who owns a 15.5% stake, told Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung he would endorse the rescue.

Headlines: Apple to shut seven retail stores in Houston again as COVID-19 cases jump
Description: Apple Inc  is set to shut seven of its retail locations in Houston, Texas again due to an increase in the number of novel coronavirus cases in the United States, the company said Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. FAA finalizes Boeing 737 MAX inspection directive
Description: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) on Wednesday finalized a directive requiring airlines to complete inspections of a key component of Boeing 737 MAX airplanes that, if faulty, could  result in a loss of power to the engines.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler's Dodge, Kia Motors top J.D. Power quality study
Description: Fiat Chrysler's  Dodge and Kia Motors  topped an initial quality study of new vehicles sold in the United States based on owner responses, industry consultant J.D. Power said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs CEO says economic recovery will be rapid at first then challenged
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc's  Chief Executive David Solomon said on Wednesday that he expects the U.S. economic recovery to look V-shaped at first, but for that rapid growth to flatten out and become more challenged in the next 6 to 12 months.

Headlines: U.S. claims Regeneron paid kickbacks via charity to boost expensive drug
Description: The U.S. Justice Department on Wednesday sued Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc, accusing it of using a charity that helps cover Medicare patients' drug costs as a means to pay kickbacks for using its expensive macular degeneration drug Eylea.

Headlines: With no tourists to watch migration, Kenyan operator's planes are grounded
Description: For Kenyan-based safari operator Safarilink, June is the busiest time of year, as the company's small planes ferry tourists to national parks in Kenya and Tanzania to witness the majestic annual migration of 2 million animals.

Headlines: New Google default wipes users' location, web history after 18 months
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Wednesday it will automatically delete some location history after 18 months for new users and make it easier for everyone to access its search, Maps and YouTube apps without being tracked.

Headlines: Law firm Weitz & Luxenberg says has reached Glyphosate settlement with Bayer
Description: Weitz & Luxenberg said on Wednesday it and other law firms reached a settlement with Bayer on behalf of almost one hundred thousand Americans who had been diagnosed with cancer after exposure to Monsanto's Roundup weedkiller.

Headlines: Daimler and Nvidia team up to close tech gap to Tesla
Description: Having pulled ahead in the race to develop a software-based vehicle operating system, U.S. electric car pioneer Tesla faces a new challenge from an alliance of German luxury carmaker Daimler and U.S. computer graphics specialist Nvidia.

Headlines: WTO delays decision on EU counter-tariffs in aircraft dispute: sources
Description: The World Trade Organization has delayed a decision on whether the European Union can impose tariffs against the United States over subsidies for Boeing , due to the impact that recent lockdowns are having on its work, three people familiar with the case said.

Headlines: Disney faces pushback on Walt Disney World reopening
Description: Petitioners are pressing Disney to delay the July 11 reopening of its Orlando, Florida-based Walt Disney World, citing recent spikes in COVID-19 cases in the state.

Headlines: U.S. probes Kia headlight failures, GM steering issues
Description: The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Wednesday it has opened two investigations into reports of headlight failures in 392,000 Kia  Sorento sport utility vehicles and steering issues in 781,000 General Motors  vehicles.

Headlines: IMF predicts deeper global recession due to coronavirus pandemic
Description: The coronavirus pandemic has caused wider and deeper damage to economic activity than first thought, the International Monetary Fund said on Wednesday, prompting the institution to slash its 2020 global output forecasts further.

Headlines: Instant View: Wall Street backpedals amid new virus fears, quarantines
Description: Wall Street's main indexes tumbled on Wednesday, accelerating pullbacks a day after the Nasdaq notched a record high, after New York, New Jersey and Connecticut announced that visitors from states with high coronavirus infection rates must self quarantine.

Headlines: Factbox: More U.S. companies join Facebook ad boycott bandwagon
Description: A handful of U.S. companies have pulled advertising from Facebook Inc in support of a campaign that called out the social media giant for not doing enough to stop hate speech on its platforms.

Headlines: Council's £1 billion property bet shaken by WeWork rent waiver request
Description: LONDON (IFR) - WeWork has asked to skip millions of pounds of rent payments owed to Spelthorne Borough Council, creating a major headache for the tiny local authority that has borrowed more than £1bn to bet on commercial property.

Headlines: Philippines to investigate Wirecard's phantom billions
Description: Wirecard's missing $2.1 billion is being investigated by the Philippines, which said that the German payments firm's former chief operating officer Jan Marsalek may be in the country.

Headlines: Wirecard says former CEO cut stake to 4.94% from 8.04%
Description: Wirecard's  former chief executive, Markus Braun, cut his stake in the company to 4.94% from 8.04% on June 18, the company said in a regulatory filing on Wednesday.

Headlines: Walmart to stop Mississippi flag display; reviews third party sales on Canada website
Description: Walmart  said it will not display in its stores the flag of the U.S. state of Mississippi, which includes a Confederate flag emblem, and is separately reviewing if items sold on its website in Canada breached its terms after online outrage over "All Lives Matter" products on the site.

Headlines: Factbox: Competing claims for oil cargoes linked to Hin Leong
Description: Over $200 million of oil stored mainly on ships in Singapore and Europe and a terminal in Singapore is caught up in lawsuits related to trade and financing deals by Singapore's Hin Leong Trading (Pte) Ltd, court documents show.

Headlines: CVS to offer companies COVID-19 testing program as U.S. cases rise
Description: As U.S. employers grapple with trying to keep workers healthy and on the job amid fresh spikes in COVID-19 cases, CVS Health Corp  has begun selling companies a diagnostic testing program.

Headlines: Vitamin chain GNC files for bankruptcy, may close 1,200 stores and sell itself
Description: GNC Holdings Inc , the vitamin and herbal supplement retailer, has filed for bankruptcy, with plans to close at least 800 to 1,200 locations and possibly sell itself.

Headlines: U.S. probes touchscreen failures in Tesla Model S cars
Description: The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said Tuesday it had opened an investigation into 63,000 Tesla Model S cars after reports of media-control unit failures that led to the loss of the use of touchscreens.

Headlines: New York regulator proposes easing cryptocurrency rules
Description: New York's financial regulator on Wednesday proposed new licensing rules that would make it easier for companies to engage in cryptocurrency business in the state.

Headlines: AstraZeneca taps Scottish firm for 10th COVID-19 vaccine supply deal
Description: AstraZeneca  has signed its tenth supply-and-manufacturing deal for its experimental COVID-19 vaccine with a Scotland-backed firm as the British drugmaker ramps up efforts for wider trials of the potential treatment.

Headlines: BP's stranded Canadian, Angolan assets expose wider industry risks
Description: When BP  slashed its long-term oil price outlook last week, prospects in Canada and Angola were rendered worthless, company sources and analysts said, exposing broader risks the industry faces as the world pivots to low-carbon energy.

Headlines: IMF forecasts deeper recession for sub-Saharan Africa
Description: Sub-Saharan Africa's gross domestic product is expected to shrink by 3.2% this year due to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, the International Monetary Fund said on Wednesday, more than a previous estimated contraction of 1.6%.

Headlines: New-look U.S. bank 'stress tests' may leave analysts guessing
Description: U.S. bank analysts have cleared their diaries on Thursday ahead of a long evening poring over results of the Federal Reserve's bank health checks, which have been upended this year by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: UK airports warn 20,000 jobs at risk as travel slump continues
Description: Up to 20,000 jobs could go at Britain's airports, an industry group warned, calling on the government to do more to help an aviation industry that was shut down by the COVID pandemic and is now struggling to restart due to quarantine rules.

Headlines: Lead gets lifeline as essential industries energise battery demand
Description: (This June 23 has been corrected to remove reference to Ecobat, paragraph 4)

Headlines: Swissport to cut up to 4,556 jobs in UK and Ireland: internal letter
Description: Aviation services company Swissport said it could cut up to 4,556 jobs, or up to 53% of its workforce in the UK and Ireland, as it forecasts regional revenues will be cut by half as a result of the travel slump caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: German authorities seek arrest of second Wirecard executive: Handelsblatt
Description: German prosecutors will seek the arrest of Jan Marsalek, former chief operating officer of Wirecard , the payments company engulfed in a $2.1 billion accounting scandal, business daily Handelsblatt reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Philippines probing people linked to Wirecard saga, ex-board member 'may still be here'
Description: The Philippines is investigating individuals linked to an accounting saga at German payment firm Wirecard, its justice minister said on Wednesday, including a former board member who visited the country in March and "may still be here".

Headlines: Singapore's Grab puts partnership with troubled Wirecard on hold
Description: Southeast Asian ride-hailing and payments company Grab said it had put a partnership with scandal-hit Wirecard  on hold, days after the German payments firm disclosed a $2.1 billion financial hole that threatens its future.

Headlines: Volkswagen explores acquisition of car rental group Europcar: sources
Description: Volkswagen AG  is in talks to acquire French car rental firm Europcar Mobility Group SA , in a deal that would allow the German car maker to better capitalize on its fleet, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: T-Mobile shares priced at $103 each in SoftBank sale
Description: U.S. wireless carrier T-Mobile US Inc  said it has priced a sale of its shares at $103 each in a deal that will see SoftBank Group  divest a portion of its stake - a major step in the Japanese conglomerate's plan to sell assets.

Headlines: Trump administration sees no loophole in new Huawei curb
Description: The U.S. government sees no loopholes in a new rule aimed at crimping global chip sales to China's Huawei and will "aggressively" crack down on any bid to disobey the intent of the curb, Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wall Street ends higher on recovery hopes, Nasdaq hits another record
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes closed higher on Tuesday as improving economic data and the prospect of more stimulus bolstered hopes of a swift recovery, while a jump in technology shares powered the Nasdaq to another record high.

Headlines: U.S. judge orders heads of GM, FCA to try to resolve GM racketeering lawsuit
Description: A federal judge in Detroit on Tuesday ordered the chief executives of automakers General Motors Co  and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV (FCA)   to meet by July 1 to try to resolve GM's racketeering lawsuit.

Headlines: Spirit AeroSystems shares fall, company holds talks with Boeing on 737 MAX
Description: Shares in Spirit AeroSystems Holdings Inc  tumbled 13% on Tuesday after the key Boeing Co  supplier warned it was seeking relief from its lenders due to Boeing's move to reduce parts shipments substantially this year.

Headlines: Unions see jobs threat as Airbus scraps bid to build engine parts
Description: French unions and a regional body slammed a decision by Airbus  to cancel plans to bring some engine work in-house on Tuesday, saying it would cost 350 French jobs.

Headlines: Trump threat to 'decouple' U.S. and China hits trade, investment reality
Description: Conflicting talk from Trump administration officials about "decoupling" the U.S. economy from China is running into a challenging reality: Chinese imports of U.S. goods are rising, investment by American companies into China continues, and markets are wary of separating the world's biggest economies.

Headlines: Dell considering spinning off VMware stake: WSJ
Description: Dell Technologies Inc  is considering spinning off its roughly $50 billion stake in cloud computing software maker VMware Inc , the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Stocks rally on upbeat data, trade reassurances; dollar weakens
Description: The dollar eased and global equity markets surged on Tuesday after reassurances on the U.S.-Sino trade deal and upbeat economic data from the United States and Europe brightened the prospect of a swift economic recovery.

Headlines: Justice Dept, state AGs to meet Friday on Google antitrust probe: source
Description: U.S. Justice Department officials and some state attorneys general are set to meet on Friday to discuss ongoing antitrust probes into Alphabet Inc's Google unit, a person briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: J&J loses bid to overturn baby powder verdict, but damages cut to $2.12 billion
Description: A Missouri appeals court on Tuesday rejected Johnson & Johnson's bid to throw out a jury verdict in favor of women who blamed their ovarian cancer on its baby powder and other talc products, but reduced damages by more than half, to $2.12 billion.

Headlines: Mnuchin says U.S.-China decoupling will occur if firms cannot compete fairly
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Tuesday that a decoupling of the U.S. and Chinese economies will result if U.S. companies are not allowed to compete on a fair and level basis in China's economy.

Headlines: Microsoft adds to diversity investment, aims to increase number of Black employees
Description: Microsoft Corp  on Tuesday set a five-year diversity goal to address racial inequality at its offices, following protests over police brutality against African Americans in the United States.

Headlines: Explainer: Who is affected by Trump’s suspension of foreign work visas?
Description: President Donald Trump temporarily suspended the entry into the United States of certain foreign workers on Monday despite strong opposition from business groups, including major tech companies.

Headlines: Euro rises on upbeat data, Trump says China trade deal still intact
Description: The euro jumped to one-week highs following positive economic data on Tuesday, while the Australian dollar and other higher-risk currencies strengthened after U.S. officials confirmed that the U.S.-China trade deal remained intact.

Headlines: Mercedes-Benz, Nvidia deepen autonomous driving alliance
Description: Semiconductor maker Nvidia Corp  has struck a deal with Germany's Daimler  to develop and equip Mercedes-Benz cars with a next generation chip and software platform that could eventually be used for autonomous driving functions.

Headlines: Top German court reimposes data curbs on Facebook
Description: Facebook  must comply with an order by Germany's antitrust watchdog to curb data collection from users, a top German court ruled on Tuesday, in a setback for the U.S. social network company that could set a wider precedent.

Headlines: Top German court reimposes data curbs on Facebook
Description: Facebook  must comply with an order by Germany's antitrust watchdog to curb data collection from users, a top German court ruled on Tuesday, in a setback for the U.S. social network company that could set a wider precedent.

Headlines: Bayer close to glyphosate settlement worth $8-10 billion: Handelsblatt
Description: Bayer AG is close to agreeing a settlement worth $8-10 billion over claims its glyphosate-based Roundup weedkiller causes cancer, German business daily Handelsblatt reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Aurora Cannabis plans more layoffs, facility closures amid industry turmoil
Description: Aurora Cannabis   on Tuesday announced a new round of staff reductions and plans to shut five facilities over the next two quarters, as the COVID-19 pandemic pummels the cash-crunched cannabis industry.

Headlines: Amazon pledges $2 billion venture capital fund to invest in clean energy
Description: Amazon.com Inc  said on Tuesday it will launch a $2 billion venture capital fund that will focus on technology investments to reduce the impact of climate change and support sustainable development.

Headlines: U.S. economy improving; rising COVID-19 cases a threat
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes increased more than expected in May and business activity contracted moderately this month, suggesting the economy was on the cusp of recovering from the recession caused by the COVID-19 crisis.

Headlines: Wirecard ex-boss Braun arrested as creditors hunt lost billions
Description: Wirecard's  former boss has been arrested on suspicion of falsifying its accounts, after the German payments firm disclosed a $2.1 billion financial hole and questioned whether trustees had actually held money on its behalf.

Headlines: China has picked up its 'game' on trade with U.S., Trump adviser says
Description: The U.S. trade deal with China is not only fully intact, but Beijing has actually stepped forward in a number of areas in a constructive way, a top White House adviser said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Gilead to buy 49.9% stake in cancer drug developer for $275 million
Description: Gilead Sciences Inc said on Tuesday it would buy a 49.9% stake in privately held Pionyr Immunotherapeutics Inc for $275 million, strengthening its cancer portfolio by securing access to two promising drugs.

Headlines: Exclusive: Shell plans major restructuring around climate drive, CEO tells employees
Description: Royal Dutch Shell  will announce a major restructuring by the end of the year as the energy company prepares to accelerate its shift towards low-carbon, CEO Ben van Beurden told employees, a company source said.

Headlines: Sanofi clinches $2 billion vaccines deal with Translate Bio
Description: French drugmaker Sanofi  has agreed a potential $2 billion vaccines deal with Translate Bio , expanding their collaboration in development of an inoculation against COVID-19 and sending the U.S. biotech company's shares soaring.

Headlines: Italy arrests Siemens, Alstom executives over Milan subway deals
Description: Italian tax police arrested 13 people, including executives of the Italian units of Germany's Siemens  and France's Alstom , in an investigation into alleged bribery relating to Milan subway contracts, prosecutors said on Tuesday.

Headlines: French restaurant settles with Axa in tussle over lockdown losses
Description: A French restaurant owner who won a court battle with Axa over lockdown-linked losses said on Tuesday he had reached a further settlement with the insurer, potentially setting the tone for payouts to other businesses facing similar insurance problems.

Headlines: Bayer nears glyphosate settlement after lengthy talks: sources
Description: Germany's Bayer  is set to reach a settlement this week with U.S. plaintiffs that claim its glyphosate-based weedkillers cause cancer, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Disney+ to debut in eight more countries in Europe
Description: Walt Disney Co said on Tuesday it would launch Disney+ in eight more countries in Europe, as millions of people stuck at home due to coronavirus-induced restrictions turn to streaming services for entertainment.

Headlines: Fed isn't fueling U.S. inequality, Daly says
Description: San Francisco Federal Reserve President Mary Daly on Tuesday defended the U.S. central bank from criticism that its easy monetary policy and emergency lending programs are doing more to help the rich than the poor.

Headlines: Wirecard lenders mandate FTI Consulting as financial adviser in talks with company: sources
Description: Wirecard's  lenders have mandated FTI Consulting as financial adviser in talks with company, people close to the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Trump suspends entry of certain foreign workers despite business opposition
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump suspended the entry into the United States of certain foreign workers on Monday, a move the White House said would help the coronavirus-battered economy, but which business groups strongly oppose.

Headlines: Factbox: Apple, Google, Amazon take aim at Trump visa ban
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has suspended the entry of some foreign workers in a bid to boost domestic hiring, sparking opposition from corporate America and tech sector executives including Google's Sundar Pichai and Tesla's Elon Musk.

Headlines: United Airlines expects to raise $3 billion in debt offering
Description: United Airlines  said on Tuesday it plans to raise $3 billion in debt by issuing senior notes, as U.S. airlines beef up liquidity in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. business sector contraction eases in June
Description: U.S. business activity contracted for a fifth straight month in June, but the pace of decline eased, supporting views that the recession caused by the COVID-19 crisis was drawing to an end.
