Headlines: American Airlines expects to raise about $2 billion in upsized stock, notes offering
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  said on Tuesday it expects to raise about $2 billion through a stock-and-notes offering in an effort to bolster its balance sheet to better deal with a slowdown in travel due to the COVID-19 crisis.

Headlines: Wirecard 'disaster' piles on pressure for corporate reform in Germany
Description: Wirecard's  fall from grace prompted calls for an overhaul of Germany's system of corporate oversight on Tuesday, as the fraud scandal threatened to further undermine the country's once-prized reputation for integrity.

Headlines: Explainer: Why COVID-19 can run rife in meatpacking plants
Description: Meat-processing plants around the world are proving coronavirus infection hotspots, with an outbreak at a factory in Germany leading to Guetersloh becoming on Tuesday the first area in the country to be ordered back into lockdown.

Headlines: Central banks hint at pandemic stimulus exit. Markets aren't buying it
Description: As strict coronavirus lockdowns end, some central bankers have started hinting at another kind of exit -- from emergency stimulus they launched just three months ago. Markets so far appear to be calling their bluff.

Headlines: Luckin gets another de-listing notice from Nasdaq, shares slump 18%
Description: Luckin Coffee Inc  disclosed on Tuesday that it received a de-listing notice from the Nasdaq Inc  last week after it failed to file its annual report, sending the shares of the  Chinese coffee chain down about 18%.

Headlines: Prosecutors in Munich say former Wirecard CEO to be released on bail
Description: Prosecutors in Munich said on Tuesday that former Wirecard  CEO Markus Braun would be released as soon as he has posted 5 million euros ($5.66 million) in bail.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler close to green light for $7.1 billion state-backed loan, bank executive says
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA)  is very close to obtaining the necessary authorisations to receive a 6.3 billion euros ($7.1 billion) state-backed loan from Intesa Sanpaolo , an executive at the bank said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: German finance minister points to regulatory failures in Wirecard scandal
Description: German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said lawmakers need to quickly determine how to tighten regulation in the wake of an accounting scandal at payments company Wirecard that has tarnished the reputation of Germany's financial watchdog.

Headlines: SoftBank kicks off $21 billion sale of T-Mobile shares
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  unveiled a series of transactions on Monday to divest more than $21 billion worth of stock in U.S. wireless carrier T-Mobile US Inc , as it seeks funding for a $41 billion share buyback and debt reduction plan.

Headlines: Lufthansa says it has not yet reached agreement with unions on crisis package
Description: Lufthansa  has not yet reached an agreement with unions on a package to cut staff costs, it said on Tuesday, adding to the pressure on the German airline before a crunch shareholder vote on a 9 billion euro bailout plan to be held on Thursday.

Headlines: EU countries, lawmakers agree deal on class action lawsuits
Description: European Union countries and lawmakers struck a deal late on Monday to pave the way for Europeans to team up and sue companies for defective products but with built-in safeguards to guard against the excesses of U.S. class action lawsuits.

Headlines: Siemens, Salesforce aim to sell products for COVID-19 back-to-work plans
Description: Siemens  and U.S. software developer Salesforce  will work together on products to help companies' employees get back to work while following rules to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus, the firms said on Tuesday.

Headlines: ADNOC inks $10 billion deal, keeps tight control of costs amid market downturn
Description: Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC) said on Tuesday it had signed a $10 billion gas infrastructure deal with a consortium of investors, while its chief executive told Reuters the company would keep a tight lid on costs amid low oil prices.

Headlines: Luckin Coffee picks Houlihan Lokey for financial, strategic advice: sources
Description: Luckin Coffee  has picked investment bank Houlihan Lokey  as an adviser, according to sources close to the matter, following an accounting scandal that has seen the Chinese coffee chain's shares plummet and creditors pursue assets held by the firm's family.

Headlines: White House adviser Navarro walks back on comments China trade deal 'over'
Description: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro on Monday walked back on his earlier remarks that the U.S.-China trade pact was "over", stoking volatility in markets already frazzled by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. home sales hit nine-and-a-half-year low; price growth cools
Description: U.S. home sales dropped to their lowest level in more than 9-1/2 years in May, strengthening expectations for a sharp contraction in housing market activity in the second quarter following disruptions caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Volkswagen sees V-shaped recovery lasting into 2022
Description: Volkswagen expects a V-shaped recovery lasting into 2022, its sales chief said on Tuesday, as businesses try to work out how quickly they will rebound from the coronavirus pandemic which shut large parts of the economy around the world for months.

Headlines: Singapore's central bank says received licence application from Wirecard
Description: The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) has received a license application from scandal-hit electronics payments firm Wirecard  under the country's new Payments Services Act, the central bank said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed's gloomy economic outlook 'about right,' say economists: Reuters poll
Description: The Federal Reserve struck the right tone in its first pandemic-era economic outlook, suggesting years of extraordinary policy support for an economy facing a slow and long slog back, according to a majority of economists in a Reuters poll.

Headlines: U.S. fights bail bid by men accused of helping former Nissan boss escape
Description: A U.S. prosecutor on Monday urged a judge to keep a former Green Beret and his son locked up as Japan prepares to formally seek their extradition on charges that they helped former Nissan Motor Co boss Carlos Ghosn flee the East Asian country.

Headlines: Analysts' View: Take Navarro's China trade deal is 'over' comments with a pinch of salt
Description: U.S. stock futures fell and the dollar rose after White House  adviser Peter Navarro said that the trade deal with China is "over". But President Donald Trump later tweeted that the deal "is fully intact" and said he hoped Beijing would continue to live up to terms of the agreement.

Headlines: Virgin Galactic, NASA to develop program for private missions to space station
Description: Billionaire Richard Branson's Virgin Galactic Holdings Inc  said on Monday it has signed up with NASA to develop a program to promote private missions to the International Space Station (ISS), sending the shares of the company up about 16%.

Headlines: Google faces employee petition to end tech sales to police
Description: More than 1,600 workers at Alphabet Inc are petitioning its Google unit to stop selling email and other services to police departments, a source familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Environmental shareholder activism comes to Japan as Mizuho faces climate resolution
Description: More investors are publicly backing a resolution to curb coal project lending that shareholders of Mizuho Financial Group are expected to consider this week, the first time such a step is to figure at the annual meeting of a Japanese listed company.

Headlines: Scores of Volkswagen's Mexico staff test positive for coronavirus
Description: Volkswagen AG's  Mexican unit on Monday said about 2% of its workers tested for coronavirus had contracted the disease at some point, underlining the challenge faced by automakers in reopening factories before the pandemic has peaked in Mexico.

Headlines: Factbox: Who is affected by Trump's new rules on work visas?
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump suspended the entry of certain foreign workers on Monday until the end of the year, a move the White House said would help the coronavirus-battered economy, but which business groups strongly oppose.

Headlines: Apple switches to its own chips for Mac computers as it adds features, privacy controls
Description: Apple Inc  on Monday said it will switch to its own chips for its Mac computers, saying the first machines will ship this year and ending a nearly 15-year reliance on Intel Corp to supply processors for its flagship laptops and desktop.

Headlines: Wall Street ends higher with boost from technology stocks
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes closed higher on Monday with the biggest gains in technology stocks as investors focused on the potential for more government stimulus measures even as they worried about an increase in coronavirus cases in the United States and other countries.

Headlines: Spirit AeroSystems asks lenders for relief after deeper Boeing 737 production cut
Description: Spirit AeroSystems Holdings , Boeing Co's  largest supplier, said on Monday it was seeking relief from its lenders as its finances are stretched by the COVID-19 pandemic and a 737 MAX production halt after deadly crashes.    Shares in Wichita-based Spirit, which builds the fuselage, thrust reversers, engine pylons and wing components for the 737 MAX, fell about 4% in after-hours trading.

Headlines: Oil, stocks gain, but rising infection rates spark concerns
Description: Crude oil prices and a gauge of global equity markets edged higher on Monday as lockdowns eased, with the Nasdaq setting a record closing high, but sentiment remained tenuous as coronavirus infections continued to rise.

Headlines: Bayer wins court ruling restricting California's Roundup warning: Bloomberg News
Description: Bayer AG won a court ruling blocking California from requiring the German-based company to tell consumers that a chemical in its Roundup herbicide is known to cause cancer, Bloomberg News reported on Monday.

Headlines: Gilead targets remdesivir supply for two million COVID-19 patients by year-end
Description: Gilead Sciences Inc  said on Monday it expects to be able to supply enough of its antiviral drug remdesivir by year end to treat more than 2 million COVID-19 patients, more than double its previous target of 1 million.

Headlines: Oil up above 2% on tighter supplies, eased lockdowns
Description: Oil was up 2% on Monday on tighter crude supplies from major producers and as coronavirus lockdowns kept easing despite a record rise in cases globally.

Headlines: Dollar dips, Aussie gains as traders bet on pandemic recovery
Description: The U.S. dollar weakened and higher-risk currencies including the Australian dollar jumped on Monday as investors focused on the prospect for an eventual economic recovery from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: NYSE makes new push with the SEC for IPO alternative
Description: The New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) submitted an amended rule change with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on Monday in a bid to enable companies that debut on the stock market through a direct listing to raise capital.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court rejects challenge to Trump's steel tariffs
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday turned away a challenge to President Donald Trump's tariffs on imported steel brought by an industry group that had argued that a key part of the law under which he imposed the duties violates the U.S. Constitution.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court sets limits on SEC's power to recover ill-gotten gains
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday placed limits on the Securities and Exchange Commission's practice of forcing defendants to surrender profits obtained through fraud as part of its enforcement of investor-protection laws in federal courts.

Headlines: U.S. Disneyland workers say proposed July reopening may be too early
Description: Unions representing 17,000 workers at Walt Disney Co's Disneyland Resort in California have told the state's governor they are not convinced the theme park will be safe enough to reopen by the company's July target date.

Headlines: PG&E says bankruptcy court approves its Chapter 11 reorganization plan
Description: PG&E Corp said its Chapter 11 reorganization plan has been confirmed by the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Northern District of California, bringing the power provider one step closer to emerging from bankruptcy and participate in a state-backed wildfire fund.

Headlines: Exclusive: EU in advanced talks with Johnson & Johnson on COVID-19 vaccine deal - sources
Description: The European Commission is in advanced talks with pharmaceuticals giant Johnson & Johnson to reserve or make an up-front purchase of its COVID-19 vaccine under development, two officials familiar with the talks told Reuters.

Headlines: Patagonia joins The North Face in Facebook ad boycott
Description: Outdoor apparel brand Patagonia Inc will pause its ads on Facebook Inc  and Facebook's photo-sharing app, Instagram, making it the latest company to join a boycott campaign organized by U.S. civil rights groups.

Headlines: Dior revives fashion shows - but with no front row
Description: French luxury label Christian Dior said on Monday it would press ahead with a calendar of fashion shows for this year starting in July with an Italian catwalk display - but without the celebrated front-row audience of A-listers.

Headlines: Germany in Lufthansa bailout talks with key shareholder
Description: The German government held talks with Lufthansa's  biggest shareholder on Monday to persuade him to accept the terms of a 9 billion euro ($10 billion) coronavirus bailout that it has offered the airline group.

Headlines: Carnival extends operations pause as cruise industry troubles persist
Description: Carnival Cruise Line said on Monday it has extended its pause in operations for North American voyages until Sept. 30, as it determines how to safely resume service amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: 'Total disaster': Phantom billions plunge Wirecard into chaos
Description: Wirecard said on Monday that 1.9 billion euros ($2.1 billion) it had booked in its accounts likely never existed, a black hole that threatens to engulf the payments company and tarnish the reputation of Germany's financial watchdog.

Headlines: EU warns of competition concerns over LSE's $27 billion bid for Refinitiv
Description: European Union antitrust regulators on Monday warned about the possible anti-competitive effects of the London Stock Exchange's $27 billion bid for data and analytics company Refinitiv as they launched a four-month investigation into the deal.

Headlines: Google's U.S. ad revenue to take a hit due to pandemic: report
Description: Google Inc's U.S. advertising revenue will drop 5.3% as brands pare spending during the coronavirus pandemic, according to an eMarketer report on Monday, the first decline since 2008 when the research firm began estimating the Alphabet Inc  unit's ad revenues.

Headlines: South Africa to oppose Airlink's bid to halt SAA creditors meeting
Description: South Africa plans to oppose an application by regional airline Airlink to put South African Airways (SAA) into provisional liquidation and prevent a meeting of SAA's creditors to discuss a restructuring plan, the government said on Monday.

Headlines: Nigeria's WTO candidate gets regional backing: document
Description: The West African regional bloc ECOWAS is backing Nigeria's candidate to head the World Trade Organization (WTO) and calls on other African countries to follow, a document showed on Monday, in a possible step towards uniting Africa behind her.

Headlines: Who's bidding to be next World Trade Organization chief?
Description: The World Trade Organization (WTO) began the process this month of selecting a new director-general to replace Brazil's Roberto Azevedo, who is stepping down a year early at the end of August.

Headlines: German prosecutors may seek arrest of former Wirecard executives, say sources
Description: German prosecutors may issue arrest warrants against former Wirecard bosses Markus Braun and Jan Marsalek as they investigate how $2.1 billion went missing from the electronic payments company, two sources said on Monday.

Headlines: Credit Suisse says it will delist volatility ETN
Description: Credit Suisse Group AG  said on Monday that it will delist several exchange-traded notes, including one linked to Wall Street's "fear gauge" that soared during the peak of the sell-off in U.S. stocks.

Headlines: Germany's Scholz says Lufthansa talks were good
Description: The German government on Monday held last-ditch talks about a 9 billion euros Lufthansa  bailout on Monday, Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said, as Berlin politicians seek to resolve a standoff with a key shareholder in the airline.

Headlines: Live jewellery auctions resuming but online sales 'here to stay': Sotheby's
Description: Rare coloured diamonds and historic gems will be seeking new owners at Sotheby's semi-annual sale in Geneva this week, as  live auctions resume after a suspension due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Nokia to cut a third of jobs at French arm Alcatel-Lucent
Description: Finnish telecoms equipment maker Nokia Oyj  plans to cut 1,233 jobs at its French subsidiary Alcatel-Lucent International, equivalent to a third of the unit's workforce, the group said on Monday, confirming an earlier Reuters report.

Headlines: Unilever to invest 1 billion euros in climate change fund over 10 years
Description: (This June 14 story corrects to remove reference to 2039 in second bullet, paragraph 7)

Headlines: Musk says Tesla 'Battery Day', shareholder meet likely on Sept. 15
Description: Tesla Inc  Chief Executive Elon Musk has said Sept.15 is the tentative date for the company's shareholder meeting as well as "Battery Day", at which the electric-car maker is expected to reveal significant advances in battery technology.

Headlines: UBS may increase home working after coronavirus
Description: A significant proportion of UBS's  staff could continue to work from home even after the coronavirus crisis has ended, the bank's Chief Operating Officer Sabine Keller-Busse said on Monday.

Headlines: Delta to resume flights between U.S. and China
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc  said on Monday it would resume flights between Seattle and Shanghai on June 25, making it the first U.S. airline to restart operations between the United States and China after flights were suspended in February due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Index reshuffle to give healthcare stocks a bigger profile
Description: The U.S. healthcare sector looks set for a bulked up profile in growth indexes when FTSE Russell reconstitutes its stock indexes late next Friday, an annual event that historically creates one of the biggest trading volume days of the year.

Headlines: Nokia must 'really significantly' reduce job cuts in France, finance ministry official says
Description: Finnish telecoms equipment maker Nokia  must "really significantly" reduce its announced job cuts in France, an official at the French finance ministry said on Monday.

Headlines: No clear path to salvation seen for stricken Wirecard
Description: Wirecard's confirmation that $2.1 billion it had booked in its accounts likely never existed raises questions over whether the company is able to survive as a going concern or can be broken up and sold.

Headlines: Pandemic propels old-school bond traders towards an electronic future
Description: The mammoth bond market has long been the old-school bastion of the financial world, but the COVID-19 pandemic has cast a light on its future - and it looks electronic. Well, mainly.

Headlines: Small, medium businesses feel brunt of lockdown pain: survey
Description: Small and mid-sized businesses around the world are being hit hardest by the impact of COVID-19 lockdowns and about a fifth say they risk shutting down permanently within three months, a survey by the International Trade Centre (ITC) showed on Monday.

Headlines: German minister: It's our duty to help Lufthansa, think we can reach consensus
Description: German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Monday he thought consensus could be achieved on Lufthansa  as a showdown between its biggest shareholder and the German government looms over the terms of a 9 billion euro ($10.09 billion) bailout.

Headlines: Changing of guard at top German court signals de-escalation for ECB
Description: Changes to the composition of Germany's top court are likely to make it less confrontational towards the European Central Bank following a ruling about bond purchases that sent shockwaves around Europe, according to two sources close to the court.

Headlines: Toyota sees July vehicle output down 10% on initial plan
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  said on Monday it would make 10% fewer vehicles next month than originally planned, as it gradually resumes output following factory closures earlier this year due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Very clear Wirecard deposit certificate was 'spurious', BPI CEO says
Description: Bank of the Philippine Islands Chief Executive Cezar Consing said it was clear that a certificate purporting to be for a Wirecard deposit was "spurious" and reiterated that no cash from the German payments firm had entered the bank.

Headlines: Taiwan minister says TSMC has offset lost Huawei orders
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC)  has made up its order book with other customers now that it has lost China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL], which is subject to U.S. sales restrictions, a government minister said on Monday.

Headlines: German finance minister says supervision institutions did their job on Wirecard
Description: Regulators worked hard and did their job in the case of payments firm Wirecard, which on Monday said that 1.9 billion euros ($2.13 billion) missing from its accounts was likely never there, Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Monday.

Headlines: German prosecutors probe all possible crimes in connection with Wirecard
Description: German public prosecutors said on Monday that they were probing all possible criminal offences in connection with payments firm Wirecard after the company discovered a 1.9 billion euro ($2.13 billion) hole in its accounts.

Headlines: German watchdog says Wirecard case is 'total disaster'
Description: German financial watchdog Bafin on Monday said that developments at payment group Wirecard were a "total disaster".

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S., Brazil protest Thailand's pesticide ban over impact on wheat, soy exports - documents
Description: The United States and Brazil lodged separate protests with Thailand over its ban on two farm chemicals earlier this month, documents reviewed by Reuters show, saying the "restrictive" and "serious" move could hurt key agricultural exports.

Headlines: Inflation dog may finally bark, investors bet
Description: Gold, forests, property stocks, inflation-linked bonds - these are just some of the assets investors are pouring money into on the view that the recent explosion of government spending and central bank stimulus may finally rouse inflation from its decade-long slumber.

Headlines: Exclusive: After BP takes a hit, investors widen climate change campaign
Description: Investors managing £1.8 trillion ($2.2 trillion) in assets are widening a campaign pressing oil majors to better reflect climate risks in their accounting, and will soon target other businesses with heavy fossil fuel exposure, the group said on Monday.

Headlines: Global dollar crunch appears over as central banks rely less on Fed backstop
Description: A global crunch for U.S. dollars that was a hallmark of the early moments of the coronavirus crisis appears to have passed,  the latest milestone in a remarkable turnaround in financial conditions engineered by the Federal Reserve and other top central banks.

Headlines: American Airlines seeks $3.5 billion in new financing
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  said on Sunday it plans to secure $3.5 billion in new financing, to improve the airline's liquidity as it grapples with travel restrictions caused by the coronavirus.

Headlines: China eases green rules for petrol-electric hybrids, giving makers space to manoeuvre
Description: China re-classified petrol-electric hybrid vehicles on Monday so they get more favourable treatment than all-petrol or diesel counterparts under new clean car rules, making it easier for automakers to meet environment quotas and offer more choice.

Headlines: Time is money: the armchair traders of lockdown
Description: At 7am on Friday morning, Dean d'Arco, 31, a phone shop manager from Belfast, Northern Ireland, logged on for his last day as a round-the-clock armchair stock market trader.

Headlines: Brands tout Black heritage as some shoppers question authenticity
Description: L'Oreal SA, Unilever and other multinationals that acquired personal-care brands founded by Black people are moving to reassure their core customers, some of whom have pledged in the wake of racial-justice protests to direct their spending toward only Black-owned companies.

Headlines: Lufthansa gears up for bailout showdown with investor
Description: Lufthansa  will seek to avoid a grounding and insolvency, Chief Executive Carsten Spohr said on Sunday, before a showdown between the airline's biggest shareholder and the German government over the terms of a 9-billion-euro bailout.

Headlines: Wirecard CEO exits as search for missing billions hits dead end in Asia
Description: Wirecard's chief executive quit on Friday as the German payments firm's search for $2.1 billion of missing cash hit a dead end in the Philippines and it scrambled to secure a financial lifeline from its banks.

Headlines: Wirecard's missing money didn't enter Philippine financial system, central bank says
Description: None of the $2.1 billion missing from scandal-hit German payments firm Wirecard AG  appears to have entered the Philippine financial system, the central bank said on Sunday.

Headlines: Huawei to receive planning permission to build 400-million-pound facility in UK: The Times
Description: Chinese telecoms equipment maker Huawei Technologies Co Ltd is expected to receive planning permission this week to build a 400-million-pound ($494.24-million) research and development centre in Britain's Sawston village, the Sunday Times newspaper reported.

Headlines: Wirecard seeks new financing strategy after Moody's junk downgrade
Description: German payments firm Wirecard  said it had hired U.S. investment bank Houlihan Lokey  to devise a new financing strategy after Moody's slashed the company's rating to junk over the disappearance of 1.9 billion euros.

Headlines: Elon Musk tweets Tesla postpones annual shareholder meeting
Description: Elon Musk tweeted https://bit.ly/2AVPdDo late on Friday that Tesla Inc will have to postpone its annual shareholder meeting as no large gatherings are allowed by July 7.

Headlines: S&P 500 closes lower as COVID-19 resurgence casts a shadow on sentiment
Description: The S&P 500 ended lower on Friday after an up-and-down session as investors weighed spiking cases of COVID-19 and Apple Inc's announcement of fresh store closures against anticipated stimulus and continued economic recovery.

Headlines: FedEx to record about $370 million in charges in fourth quarter
Description: U.S. package delivery company FedEx Corp  said https://www.sec.gov/ix?doc=/Archives/edgar/data/1048911/000119312520174218/d949507d8k.htm on Friday it would record non-cash asset impairment charges of about $370 million in the fourth quarter, primarily related to its retail chain that provides printing, packing and shipping services.

Headlines: Airbus extends furloughs in UK, Spain in latest effort to tackle COVID-19 fallout
Description: European planemaker Airbus SE  said on Friday it is extending furlough programs for 5,300 of its employees in Spain and the United Kingdom in its latest effort to cope with the impact of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Canada's Cineplex adopts poison pill
Description: Cineplex Inc  said on Friday it adopted a shareholder rights plan, popularly known as a "poison pill", nearly a week after Britain's Cineworld Group Plc  abandoned its $1.65 billion deal to buy the Canadian theater chain.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon signals entry into alcohol delivery in India with nod in key state - document
Description: Amazon.com Inc  has secured clearance to deliver alcohol in India's eastern state of West Bengal, according to a document seen by Reuters, signalling the U.S. e-commerce giant's first foray into the country's multi-billion-dollar sector.

Headlines: Boeing names new Space Station chief in latest change affecting program
Description: Boeing Co's  International Space Station program manager Mark Mulqueen will leave the company next month and be replaced by the senior official overseeing Boeing's Starliner astronaut capsule, a spokesman said on Friday.

Headlines: Fed officials signal rising caution on U.S. economic recovery amid virus spread
Description: Two U.S. Federal Reserve officials sounded increasing pessimism on Friday on the swiftness of any economic recovery from the novel coronavirus epidemic and warned the unemployment rate could rise again if the disease is not brought under control.

Headlines: U.S. shares retreat on renewed pandemic fears, safe-havens rise
Description: Demand for safe havens rose and global equity markets turned south on Friday after Apple Inc said it would temporarily shut 11 U.S. stores as coronavirus cases continue to rise, rekindling fears of a deadly second wave of the pandemic.

Headlines: UK tells telcos to stockpile Huawei gear in face of U.S. sanctions: letter
Description: British security officials have told UK telecom operators to ensure they have adequate stockpiles of Huawei equipment due to fears that new U.S. sanctions will disrupt the Chinese firm's ability to maintain critical supplies, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Dollar records small weekly gain on safe-haven demand
Description: Fears of a second wave of coronavirus infections have increased demand for safe-haven assets, driving the U.S. dollar on Friday to its best weekly gain in a month.

Headlines: Acknowledging derogatory term, Eskimo Pie owner says to change ice cream's name
Description: The U.S. owner of Eskimo Pie ice cream will change the product's brand name and marketing, it told Reuters on Friday, becoming the latest company to rethink racially charged brand imagery amid a broad debate on racial injustice.

Headlines: Running on 'hopium': Explaining the market rally in Wall Street's terms
Description: Risk assets such as stocks and high-yield corporate bonds have climbed over the past two-and-a-half months despite a dire global economic outlook in the wake of the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Volkswagen seeks open-source approach to refine car operating system
Description: Volkswagen  wants to use an open-source approach to refine elements of a software-based car operating system being developed by the carmaker, Christian Senger, its board member responsible for digital services and software, said.

Headlines: Oil boosted by OPEC+ cuts even as virus weighs on market
Description: Oil prices rose on Friday but pulled back sharply from early highs on concerns that continued spread of the novel coronavirus could stall the United States' economic rebound.

Headlines: U.S. current account deficit edges down; COVID-19 curbs trade
Description: The U.S. current account deficit dipped to a near two-year low in the first quarter as the COVID-19 pandemic restricted the flow of goods and services, while companies continued to repatriate profits back home.

Headlines: Take Five: Reshuffle the decks
Description: After one of the most severe equity market selloffs in decades comes the June 26 "Russell Recon", the once-a-year re-jig of FTSE Russells's U.S. index range, tracked by over $9 trillion in assets.

Headlines: Apple to shut some U.S. stores again due to rising COVID-19 cases
Description: Apple Inc said on Friday it is temporarily shutting  some stores again in Florida, Arizona, South Carolina, and North Carolina in the United States, as novel coronavirus cases continue to rise in the country.

Headlines: Gucci hikes handbag prices to curb coronavirus hit, says analyst
Description: Gucci has raised the price of handbags by up to 9%, joining rivals Louis Vuitton and Chanel in a bet their brands will still lure the wealthy, a Jefferies report said on Friday, as top luxury brands try to shake off the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Incoming Renault CEO says he's ready for turnaround challenge
Description: Renault's  incoming Chief Executive Luca de Meo said on Friday he was confident the ailing French carmaker, which has just launched major cost cuts, could deliver a positive surprise for investors after a period of faltering sales and margins.

Headlines: U.S. economy will likely need more support, Fed's Rosengren says
Description: The continued spread of the novel coronavirus could hamper the U.S. economic rebound from the pandemic, and more fiscal and monetary support will likely be needed, Boston Federal Reserve President Eric Rosengren said on Friday.

Headlines: Discount grocers look to jump on home delivery bandwagon
Description: Discount supermarket chains Aldi and Lidl look poised to accelerate their push into home delivery to satisfy burgeoning demand for online grocery shopping in a shift expected to endure beyond the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Trump renews threat to cut ties with Beijing, a day after high-level U.S.-China talks
Description: President Donald Trump on Thursday renewed his threat to cut ties with China, a day after his top diplomats held talks with Beijing and his trade representative said he did not consider decoupling the U.S. and Chinese economies a viable option.

Headlines: Top French court upholds $56 million Google privacy breach fine
Description: France's top administrative court upheld a 50 million-euro fine ($56 million) imposed last year on Alphabet's Google for breaching European Union online privacy rules, it said on Friday.

Headlines: Philly refinery sale expected to close next week for $27.5 million less
Description: A sale of the Philadelphia Energy Solutions oil refinery site to real estate developer Hilco is expected to close next week for $27.5 million less than planned, the bankrupt refiner said in a court filing.

Headlines: Deutsche Telekom to keep grip on T-Mobile in chase for U.S. top spot
Description: Deutsche Telekom  will retain control of T-Mobile  should Japan's Softbank  liquidate its stake, CEO Tim Hoettges said on Friday as he vowed to claim top spot in the U.S. market.

Headlines: Piraeus Bank hires advisers to auction off $7.8 billion of bad loans: sources
Description: Piraeus Bank  has hired JPMorgan and UBS to sell two portfolios of soured loans worth about 7 billion euros as it scrambles to clean up its balance sheet and tackle a new debt crisis triggered by the novel coronavirus, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Renault has not asked EU's carbon reduction goals to be pushed back: Chairman
Description: French carmaker Renault  has not asked for European Union's stringent carbon emission reduction goals to be pushed back in spite of the coronavirus crisis, Chairman Jean-Dominique Senard said on Friday.

Headlines: KKR buys vacation parks firm Roompot in $1.1 billion deal
Description: (This June 18 story corrects to say in para 5 that PAI Partners bought Roompot for 503 million euros (not 600 million euros) in 2016)

Headlines: BMW, Mercedes put automated driving alliance on hold
Description: Daimler  on Friday said it had put on hold a development alliance in the area of automated driving between its luxury brand and rival German luxury carmaker BMW .

Headlines: Unilever Brazil laundry franchise deal may presage new business push
Description: Unilever Plc  said on Friday it is buying a chain of laundromats in Brazil to be renamed Omo, after the world's No. 2 laundry detergent, in what the consumer goods giant said could be a precursor to other similar deals elsewhere.

Headlines: D.Telekom: we will keep control of T-Mobile if Softbank sells shares
Description: Deutsche Telekom  is in talks to buy out shares in its U.S. unit T-Mobile  from Japan's Softbank , CEO Tim Hoettges said on Friday, noting that under a shareholder agreement it has the right of first refusal.

Headlines: CEO of Germany's Wirecard resigns
Description: Wirecard's chief executive, Markus Braun, has resigned, the German technology firm said on Friday, adding that James Freis had been appointed as interim CEO.

Headlines: BMW to lay off 10,000 contract workers: source
Description: BMW  will not extend the contracts of 10,000 contract workers, a company source told Reuters on Friday, as the German luxury carmaker seeks to reduce its capacity due to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: German government declines to comment on Wirecard
Description: The German government on Friday declined to comment on payments company Wirecard, which is scrambling to find $2.1 billion missing from its accounts.

Headlines: Japan shoppers queue, crash website for Uniqlo's washable masks
Description: Japanese shoppers queued at Uniqlo stores and crashed its website on Friday as the clothing chain began selling face masks with breathable fabric used in the brand's popular underwear, preparing for the coronavirus outbreak lasting through summer.

Headlines: Exclusive: Chief of Malaysia's Petronas quit over payment to state, sources say
Description: The chief of Malaysian energy giant Petronas quit this month after disagreement with the prime minister over giving more oil money to one of the country's states run by a government ally, sources close to the government and the company said.

Headlines: South Korea's wealthy, passed over by pandemic pain, splurge on Porsches and BMWs
Description: Hwang Min-yong, a 37-year-old South Korean businessman, recently received his black Porsche Cayenne coupe with red leather seats after a seven-month wait and took it out for a spin on a scenic road overlooking a river near Seoul.

Headlines: Colgate reviewing Chinese toothpaste brand Darlie amid debate on racial inequality
Description: Colgate-Palmolive  on Thursday said it was working to review and evolve its Chinese toothpaste brand, Darlie, the latest in a string of brand reassessments amid a U.S. debate on racial inequality.

Headlines: Nissan cuts more shifts at Japan car plants due to low demand
Description: Nissan Motor Co  on Friday said it will cut more shifts at its three assembly plants in Japan due to falling demand, as the automaker struggles to recover from a drop in sales triggered by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Blackstone, Taisho Pharma among final bidders for Takeda's Japan OTC unit - sources
Description: Blackstone, Bain Capital and Taisho Pharmaceutical are among the final bidders for Takeda Pharmaceutical's  consumer drug business in Japan, a deal that could be worth up to 400 billion yen ($3.7 billion), three people familiar with the deal said.

Headlines: Main Street investors bank profits on rally that Wall Street doubted
Description: Main Street investors who have reaped windfall gains from the steepest stock market rebound on record now seem to be making for safety, brokers say, just as Wall Street experts are advising clients to dip their toes into riskier assets again.

Headlines: Wirecard says it cannot rule out 'fraud of considerable proportions'
Description: German payments company Wirecard AG  said on Friday it may be the victim of "fraud of considerable proportions", after its auditor refused to sign off its 2019 accounts over a missing $2.1 billion.

Headlines: Air freight rates head back to earth as virus-driven boom cools
Description: An air cargo boom driven by demand for protective gear against the coronavirus has peaked and rates, while still 50% above normal levels, are falling in a worrying trend for airlines relying on freight revenue in the absence of passengers.

Headlines: McDonald's accused of firing worker who sued over COVID-19 claims: Bloomberg
Description: McDonald's Corp  has been accused of firing a worker from its Chicago restaurant for suing the fast-food chain over claims that it failed to protect employees during the coronavirus outbreak, Bloomberg reported https://bloom.bg/310cTBh on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump to nominate lawyer Crenshaw to fill SEC Democratic commissioner slot
Description: The White House announced on Thursday that President Donald Trump intends to nominate Caroline Crenshaw to fill a Democratic vacancy at the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).

Headlines: S&P 500 closes nominally higher amid COVID-19 spikes, muted data
Description: The S&P 500 closed nominally higher on Thursday as investors weighed a resurgence in coronavirus infections and the possibility of a new round of shutdowns as well as data that suggested the U.S. economy might not bounce back with quick, V-shaped recovery.

Headlines: Japanese insurer Sompo investing $500 million in data analytics firm Palantir
Description: Palantir Technologies Inc on Thursday said that Japanese insurance holding company Sompo Holdings Inc   is investing $500 million in the Silicon Valley data analytics company, whose clients range from global banks to the U.S. government and the Central Intelligence Agency.

Headlines: SoftBank set to invest in more than a dozen U.S. minority-led startups
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  will invest $2 million or more in 14 U.S. startups led by black founders and other underrepresented groups, the company said on Thursday, as part of its effort to fund more a more diverse array of entrepreneurs.

Headlines: U.S. grocer Albertsons expects IPO to raise up to $1.3 billion
Description: U.S. grocery retailer Albertsons Cos Inc said on Thursday its initial public offering would target to raise up to $1.32 billion.

Headlines: Facebook acquires crowdsourced mapping company Mapillary
Description: Facebook Inc on Thursday acquired Swedish mapping technology company Mapillary, which collects images from tens of thousands of contributors to build immersive and up-to-date maps, the companies said.

Headlines: World stock markets slip on second wave virus fears, safe-havens rise
Description: Global stock markets meandered on Thursday as a continued rise in coronavirus cases dashed hopes of a swift recovery from the pandemic-induced economic slump and drove demand for safe-haven currencies such as the dollar and Japanese yen.

Headlines: U.S. House Democrats unveil $1.5 trillion infrastructure plan
Description: U.S. House of Representatives Democrats on Thursday unveiled a $1.5 trillion infrastructure bill that they will seek to pass in coming weeks, arguing it has been made more urgent by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Dollar up on fears of new pandemic wave, unemployment claims
Description: The U.S. dollar strengthened on Thursday as concerns about a rise in new coronavirus cases globally and higher-than-expected U.S. unemployment claims drove demand for the safe-haven currency.

Headlines: Tesla wants to start building a new U.S. vehicle plant this summer
Description: Electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc  wants to start building a large vehicle assembly plant in the southwestern United States as early as the third quarter of this year, the company told Texas officials in documents made public this week.

Headlines: Oil edges up on OPEC output cut compliance; pandemic still weighs
Description: Oil prices rose slightly on Thursday as a panel of OPEC and its allies met to review record oil supply cuts, even as the market remained concerned about additional coronavirus cases reported in parts of the United States and China.

Headlines: Unemployment payments backlog draws hundreds to Kentucky's capital
Description: Hundreds of people who lost jobs during the coronavirus crisis but have been unable to get their unemployment insurance checks converged at the Kentucky Capitol in Frankfort early Wednesday to seek in-person help.

Headlines: Lufthansa investor Thiele seeks talks with German government: Handelsblatt
Description: Lufthansa's  biggest shareholder, German billionaire Heinz Hermann Thiele, has reached out to Berlin politicians for talks, Handelsblatt said, the latest step in a standoff over the airline's 9 billion euro ($10.1 billion) bailout.

Headlines: Exclusive: Massive spying on users of Google's Chrome shows new security weakness
Description: A newly discovered spyware effort attacked users through 32 million downloads of extensions to Google's market-leading Chrome web browser, researchers at Awake Security told Reuters, highlighting the tech industry's failure to protect browsers as they are used more for email, payroll and other sensitive functions.

Headlines: U.S. labor market improvement stalling; second wave of layoffs seen
Description: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits fell last week, but the pace of decline has stalled amid a second wave of layoffs as companies battle weak demand and fractured supply chains, supporting views that the economy faces a long and difficult recovery from the COVID-19 recession.

Headlines: LATAM Airlines says operations to plunge 50% by year's end
Description: LATAM Airlines Chief Executive Roberto Alvo said on Thursday he expects the region´s largest carrier to be operating at half of pre-pandemic levels by the end of 2020, and that a full recovery was unlikely for at least 3-4 years.

Headlines: Ford's redesigned F-150 pickup will offer greater connectivity, sleeper seat
Description: Ford Motor Co  next week will show the next generation of its brawny F-150 pickup truck that offers a new sleeper-seat feature and over-the-air software updates in a machine Ford is counting on to help pay off coronavirus-related debts.

Headlines: Chanel warns virus impact will linger on luxury sector
Description: The luxury industry will feel the fallout from the coronavirus crisis for the next two years if not longer, Chanel's chief financial officer said on Thursday, warning the French fashion label's 2020 revenues and profit would be significantly hit.

Headlines: Wirecard scrambles to find missing $2.1 billion as loan crunch looms
Description: Wirecard's auditor has refused to sign off its 2019 accounts over a missing $2.1 billion, sending its shares down more than 60% as the German payments firm said the delay could cause billions in loans to be called in as soon as Friday.

Headlines: Kroger says demand easing after coronavirus stockpiling
Description: U.S. supermarket chain Kroger Co  stopped short of raising its annual forecasts on Thursday, saying a coronavirus-driven surge in demand for essential goods was fading as American households reconsider what they have on their shelves.

Headlines: Coronavirus raises stakes as auto unions ready for a fight
Description: The coronavirus crisis has forced carmakers to speed up layoffs that must be matched with hefty payouts and deft negotiation to retain the support of powerful trade unions vital if Europe's auto industry is to manage a shift to low-emission vehicles.

Headlines: Wirecard investor DWS says has sold down position, considering legal action
Description: Asset manager DWS, the fund management arm of Deutsche Bank, said it has further sold down its position in embattled German technology company Wirecard and was considering legal action.

Headlines: U.S. gasoline demand recovery falters as refiners ramp up output
Description: A recovery in demand for gasoline in the United States, the world's largest market for the motor fuel, hit a plateau last week as coronavirus cases surged in some states, undercutting refiners' efforts to ramp up low fuel production.

Headlines: IMF says deeper-than-expected contraction in U.S. economy likely in second quarter
Description: A defacto lockdown in the United States has lasted longer than expected despite a rollback in some restrictions on mobility, pointing to a deeper-than-expected contraction in gross domestic product in the second quarter, the IMF said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. retail foot traffic rebounds, more staff at work, as lockdowns ease
Description: Retail foot traffic recovered to approach pre-lockdown levels last week and businesses appeared to bring more employees back to the job, according to data from firms that collect cellphone location information and manage employee time for companies.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco cuts hundreds of jobs amid oil market downturn, sources say
Description: State oil giant Saudi Aramco  started laying off hundreds of employees this month, two sources familiar with the matter said, as global energy companies reduce their workforces in response to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Audi boss to head carmaker's R+D division: sources
Description: Markus Duesmann, the head of Audi , will also head the research and development division at German carmaker Volkswagen's  premium brand, two sources told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Prudential sells Jackson equity stake to Apollo-backed Athene for $500 million
Description: Prudential  sold a minority stake in its U.S. business, Jackson, to Apollo Global-backed Athene Holding  for $500 million, the insurer said on Thursday, in the first phase of its plan to create an independent U.S. business.

Headlines: Vans, not glamorous, but key as EU weighs autos mega-merger
Description: Their silhouettes don't stir dreams of adventure like a sports car or trendy SUV, but vans are a rare source of profit for European carmakers, which is why EU regulators are focused on them as they decide whether to back an industry mega-merger.

Headlines: Factbox: German payments firm Wirecard and its missing billions
Description: Billions of euros of loans to Wirecard  could be called in as early as Friday after the German payments company said its auditor had refused to sign off on its 2019 accounts, knocking more than half the value off its shares on Thursday.

Headlines: Cash flows into U.S. growth funds surge, value funds see outflows
Description: U.S. investors have ramped up investments in growth funds over the past few months on expectations of higher returns and safety, while they dumped value funds despite cheaper prices after this year's pandemic-linked selloff.

Headlines: U.S. Chamber urges China to accelerate purchases of U.S. goods
Description: The U.S. Chamber of Commerce on Thursday underscored the importance of functional U.S.-China ties and urged Beijing to step up its purchases of U.S. goods and services as agreed under a Phase 1 trade deal despite delays caused by the coronavirus.

Headlines: Wells Fargo investment adviser to sell feeder fund platform to iCapital
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  said on Thursday its investment adviser Wells Fargo Investment Institute will sell its feeder fund platform to fintech firm iCapital Network for an undisclosed amount.

Headlines: Mother's Day sales uptick doesn't cover coronavirus downturn, Washington D.C. florist says
Description: Mother's Day during the coronavirus pandemic meant an uptick in sales for Lee's Flower and Card Shop in Washington, D.C.

Headlines: Exclusive: Who's in charge at Nissan? COO's allies push to give him shared CEO role – sources
Description: Nissan's chief operating officer Ashwani Gupta helped engineer the troubled automaker's latest turnaround plan. Now his allies are pressing the board to promote him to co-CEO to drive the new strategy, said four people with direct knowledge.

Headlines: Amazon to hire 3,000 people in South Africa for customer service roles
Description: Amazon.com Inc  is hiring 3,000 people in South Africa this year to provide support to customers in North America and Europe, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Ford to offer hands-free driving in 2021 - six years after Tesla
Description: Ford Motor Co  said on Thursday that it will offer hands-free driving on its new Mustang Mach-E in fall 2021, six years after Tesla Inc  and four years after General Motors Co  introduced similar systems.

Headlines: Automakers rev up U.S. assembly lines, wary of outside risks to workers
Description: Automakers are speeding up U.S. assembly lines to meet recovering demand, increasingly confident coronavirus safety protocols are working to prevent outbreaks in their plants but wary of the challenges workers face outside.

Headlines: JPMorgan gets China's nod for first fully foreign-owned futures business
Description: China on Thursday approved JPMorgan's  application to  operate the first fully foreign-owned futures business, as the world's second-largest economy pushes ahead with opening its multi-trillion-dollar financial market.

Headlines: Sharp learning curve for bosses as WFH goes global
Description: Two weeks into the coronavirus lockdown and Sergei Holmeckis, a boss at Deutsche Telekom's Czech operations in the city of Brno, was frustrated with staff video calls. His team didn't like turning on their cameras and the discussion was stilted.

Headlines: PepsiCo drops Aunt Jemima branding; Uncle Ben's, others under review
Description: PepsiCo Inc  said on Wednesday it will change the name and brand image of its Aunt Jemima pancake mix and syrup which have been criticized as racist amid a national debate over racial inequality in the United States.

Headlines: Glass Lewis joins ISS in opposing Tesla chairwoman's re-election to board
Description: Glass Lewis said on Thursday that it urged Tesla Inc  investors to vote against re-electing Chairwoman Robyn Denholm to the company's board, making it the second proxy advisory firm to oppose her appointment.

Headlines: Australian regulator says Google's $2.1 billion Fitbit deal could harm competition
Description: Australia's antitrust regulator warned Google's planned $2.1 billion acquisition of fitness tracker maker Fitbit  may give it too much of people's data, potentially hurting competition in health and online advertising markets.

Headlines: Air maintenance firms, manufacturers plan for $60 billion in lost sales
Description: Maintenance firms and spare parts producers who keep airplanes running are bracing for a decline of up to 75% in sales this year - and more pain to follow - as airlines park or retire thousands of aircraft due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Trump administration proposes rolling back protections for big tech
Description: The U.S. Justice Department proposed on Wednesday that Congress take up legislation to curb protections big tech platforms like Alphabet's Google and Facebook have had for decades, a senior official said, following through on President Donald Trump's bid to crack down on tech giants.

Headlines: U.S. trade chief vows to push for 'broad reset' at WTO
Description: The Trump administration will push for a broad reset of "outdated tariff determinations" at the World Trade Organization to fix what it sees as years of unfair treatment of the United States, a top trade official told U.S. lawmakers on Wednesday.

Headlines: FAA chief acknowledges agency, Boeing made mistakes on 737 MAX
Description: The head of the Federal Aviation Administration, Steve Dickson, acknowledged on Wednesday that Boeing Co and the U.S. air safety agency both made mistakes on the 737 MAX jet, but rejected senators' accusations the FAA was "stonewalling" probes after two fatal crashes.

Headlines: Amazon launches Saudi Arabia shopping site despite CEO's dispute with kingdom
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Wednesday launched a website for shoppers in Saudi Arabia, showing its continued business interests there despite a public dispute between Riyadh and the company's chief executive, Jeff Bezos.

Headlines: S&P closes lower as new COVID-19 cases surge
Description: The S&P 500 closed lower on Wednesday as news of spiking pandemic data and the prospect of a new round of economic lockdowns dampened investor optimism over signs of economic recovery.

Headlines: Ex-Morgan Stanley diversity officer says bank slashed her budget by 71%
Description: A lawyer representing a former Morgan Stanley  diversity officer who is suing the bank over racial discrimination said on Wednesday the bank cut her client's budget for promoting diversity and financial education by 71% from the time she started in wealth management to 2019.

Headlines: U.S. fines Copa Airlines $450K for transporting passengers between U.S., Venezuela
Description: The U.S. Transportation Department said on Wednesday it fined Panama's Copa Airlines $450,000 for unlawfully transporting passengers between the United States and Venezuela via a stopover point, and ordered the airline to avoid future similar violations.

Headlines: Americans face new coronavirus challenge: a shortage of coins
Description: Banks across the United States are facing a shortage of coins during coronavirus crisis, prompting the U.S. Federal Reserve to ration distribution and work with the U.S. Mint to boost supply.

Headlines: Google sets 2025 leadership diversity goal, ends 'tailgater' ID checks
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Wednesday announced a new hiring goal and security policy to address racial issues at its offices, as protests over police brutality against African Americans have carried into discussions about corporate culture.

Headlines: Stocks waver on rising COVID cases, dollar in safety bidding
Description: Global equity markets closed little changed on Wednesday as a rally on economic and vaccine hopes faded, while fresh coronavirus outbreaks and rising geopolitical tensions in Asia boosted demand for the dollar and safe-haven debt.

Headlines: Safe-haven dollar lifted by rise in coronavirus cases
Description: The U.S. dollar was slightly higher on Wednesday afternoon as evidence of a surge in coronavirus cases in some U.S. states and in Beijing sent investors into safe-haven assets.

Headlines: Fed's Powell beats drum for more government aid to bolster economy
Description: The U.S. economy is beginning to recover from the worst of the coronavirus crisis, but with some 25 million Americans displaced from work and the pandemic ongoing, it will need more help, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell told lawmakers on Wednesday.

Headlines: Hertz suspends share sale after U.S. SEC raises objections
Description: Bankrupt Hertz Global Holdings Inc  on Wednesday suspended its plan to sell up to $500 million in new shares after the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) raised objections to the sale, the car rental firm said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Oil slides on fresh COVID-19 outbreaks, bump in crude stocks
Description: Oil prices settled lower on Wednesday on fuel demand worries due to an uptick in coronavirus cases, with emerging hotspots in China and the United States, and as U.S. crude stocks grew again, taking commercial inventories to another all-time high.

Headlines: House panel debating $494 billion infrastructure measure
Description: A U.S. House of Representatives panel is debating on Wednesday a Democratic plan to boost infrastructure spending that aims to fix crumbling roads and highways and reduce carbon pollution.

Headlines: Lyft promises switch to 100% electric vehicles by 2030
Description: Ride-hailing company Lyft Inc  on Wednesday said every vehicle on its ride-hailing and rental car platform will be electric by 2030, but it would not provide direct financial support to drivers for switching from gas-powered cars.

Headlines: Main Street's boldest take on Wall Street in bankruptcy stock frenzy
Description: When Bryan Quevedo received his U.S. government stimulus check last month, he invested $1,000 in the stock of bankrupt car rental company Hertz Global Holdings Inc.

Headlines: Lufthansa warns of threat to its $10 billion bailout deal
Description: German airline Lufthansa , responding to investor criticism of a state-backed rescue deal, warned it might need to apply for protection from creditors if the bailout plan failed to win shareholder approval.

Headlines: Adidas rejects investigating HR chief in race row
Description: Adidas  rejected on Wednesday a call by employees to investigate the German sportswear brand's human resources chief over her handling of racism at the company after she described it last year as "noise" only discussed in America.

Headlines: Several U.S. banks to close branches, offices early for Juneteenth
Description: Several U.S. banks are closing branches and offices early on Friday to observe the Juneteenth holiday, which commemorates the day in 1865 when the last group of enslaved African Americans learned slavery was abolished.

Headlines: LATAM Airlines suspends Argentina operations, blaming COVID-19 and government
Description: LATAM Airlines Group  said on Wednesday its Argentine subsidiary will cease operations indefinitely, canceling all domestic flights, its first major cutback since filing for bankruptcy protection.

Headlines: U.S. lawmaker says seeking bipartisan legislation on airline mask rules
Description: A U.S. senator said on Wednesday he was hoping for bipartisan support in Congress for mandatory rules on masks for air travel after the head of the Federal Aviation Administration again resisted calls for a mandate.

Headlines: U.S. homebuilding rises moderately; jump in permits hints at green shoots
Description: U.S. homebuilding increased less than expected in May, but a strong rebound in permits for future home construction suggested the housing market was starting to emerge from the COVID-19 crisis along with the broader economy.

Headlines: Insider-trading investigation against U.S. senator dismissed
Description: The U.S. Senate Ethics Committee has cleared Senator Kelly Loeffler of wrongdoing in connection with stock trades, her office said on Wednesday, after the wealthy Republican - who is in a tough election race - was criticized over share sales during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. shale companies to boost oil output by 500,000 bpd by month-end
Description: U.S. shale producers are expected to restore roughly half a million barrels per day (bpd) of crude output by the end of June, according to crude buyers and analysts, amounting to a quarter of what they shut since the coronavirus pandemic cut fuel demand and hammered oil prices.

Headlines: United Airlines sweetens exit deal for flight attendants, others
Description: United Airlines  sweetened on Tuesday a voluntary exit package for frontline employees like flight attendants and gate agents, saying it needed "a lot more people to sign up" to avoid involuntary layoffs in October, according to a staff email seen by Reuters.

Headlines: EU worried Fiat-PSA deal may hit competition in vans
Description: Fiat Chrysler  and Peugeot maker PSA's  proposed merger may harm competition in small vans in 14 EU countries and Britain, EU antitrust regulators said on Wednesday  as they opened a four-month investigation into the deal.

Headlines: Southwest Airlines says has enough cash for two years as demand improves
Description: Southwest Airlines  said on Wednesday it has enough cash to carry on business for the next two years, up from its prior forecast of 20 months, as travel demand gradually picks up.

Headlines: FCA moves closer to state guarantee for $7.1 billion loan: source
Description: Italy's Treasury has taken a further step towards approving a state guarantee for a 6.3 billion euro ($7.1 billion) loan for Fiat Chrysler's  Italian unit, a government source told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Qualcomm aims to woo robotics developers with new chips, tools
Description: Building robots and drones is messy: Developers must pull together sensors to be the eyes and ears, chips for the brains and motors to make the device move, tying them all together with several kinds of software.

Headlines: Mars Inc says evaluating changing Uncle Ben's brand image
Description: Mars Inc is "evaluating all possibilities" regarding changes to its Uncle Ben's rice brand image, the food company told Reuters on Wednesday, following news that PepsiCo Inc  was dropping its Aunt Jemima brand.

Headlines: Google releases new ad features to help small businesses
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google on Wednesday introduced new advertising features intended to help local businesses get more customers and recover from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: UK's Supreme Court rules against Mastercard, Visa in retailers' fees battle
Description: Britain's highest court on Wednesday upheld an earlier Court of Appeal ruling that credit card companies Visa  and Mastercard  restricted competition in the way they set fees for retailers, opening the way for them to seek compensation.

Headlines: Trade war? U.S. battle over kitchen cabinets really a domestic dispute
Description: The anti-China trade mood has reached U.S. kitchens, where a battle is being waged over competing visions of where and how cabinets should be made.

Headlines: Wall Street rally wins more fans as economy hints at recovery
Description: Record upside surprises in U.S. economic data are bolstering the case for a “V” shaped recovery from the COVID-19 recession and boosting investor confidence in a stock rally that has already delivered hefty gains in recent months.

Headlines: Special delivery: activists urge France to rein in Amazon
Description: Environmental campaigners delivered a 12-foot (3.6-metre) tall mock-up of an Amazon parcel to the French finance ministry on Wednesday to demand that the government rein in the e-commerce giant's expansion in France.

Headlines: New U.S. Huawei rule targets standards, security concerns remain: Ross
Description: A new U.S. rule regarding China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd is a needed "clarification" to help develop standards, U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Wednesday, adding that security concerns remain over the telecoms equipment maker.

Headlines: German Fin Min Scholz sees no danger of Lufthansa rescue deal collapse
Description: German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Wednesday a bailout deal for airline Lufthansa  was a good, balanced solution which he hoped shareholders would approve, adding he did not think the agreement was in danger of collapse.

Headlines: Coronavirus turmoil fuels the rise of AI-powered companies
Description: For the past seven years, a Munich-based firm called riskmethods has tried to interest companies in buying software that allows them to track all their suppliers in a way that minimizes risks in operating globally spread supply chains.

Headlines: May flowers: Where the U.S. retail blooms are and are not
Description: No denying May's $73 billion rebound in U.S. retail sales was an eye-popper and is the latest fodder to fuel the red-hot "V" vs "U" debate about what kind of recovery to expect from the COVID-19 recession.

Headlines: HSBC revives 35,000 job cut plan after pandemic pause
Description: HSBC is resuming plans to cut around 35,000 jobs which it put on ice after the coronavirus outbreak, as Europe's biggest bank grapples with the impact on its already falling profits.

Headlines: Employee union Unite says to oppose compulsory job losses at HSBC
Description: Employee union Unite said it will oppose any compulsory job losses within HSBC  and "work vigorously to ensure staff are heard and their jobs protected", after the bank dusted off plans to axe as many as 35,000 roles worldwide.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco completes $69 billion SABIC stake deal, extends schedule
Description: Saudi Aramco  has completed its purchase of a 70% stake in petrochemicals company Saudi Basic Industries  for $69.1 billion and extended the payment period by three years to 2028, providing a cushion against weak oil prices.

Headlines: Asian business sentiment plunges to record low on virus effect: Thomson Reuters/INSEAD survey
Description: Business sentiment of Asian companies sank to an 11-year low in the second quarter, a Thomson Reuters/INSEAD survey found, with some two-thirds of the firms polled flagging a worsening COVID-19 pandemic as the biggest risk over the next six months.

Headlines: Senate bill aims to improve aircraft certification after 737 MAX crashes
Description: U.S. senators introduced legislation on Tuesday that would strengthen FAA oversight of aircraft certification following fatal Boeing Co 737 MAX crashes, though a victim's father said the bill, while a positive step, "still lacks teeth."

Headlines: Dollar firm after retail sales jump fans recovery hopes
Description: The dollar held firm against many of its rivals on Wednesday after U.S. retail sales jumped far more than expected in May, while risk-sensitive currencies were hobbled by concerns about the coronavirus and diplomatic tensions in Asia.

Headlines: U.S. posts rule allowing U.S. companies to work with Huawei on 5G and other standards
Description: The U.S. Department of Commerce on Tuesday posted a new rule that allows U.S. companies to work with China's Huawei to develop standards for 5G and other cutting-edge technologies, despite restrictions on doing business with the telecommunications equipment maker.

Headlines: Bayer scraps U.S. plans to produce crop chemical blocked by court
Description: Bayer AG said on Tuesday it will scrap a nearly $1 billion project to produce the chemical dicamba in the United States, but said the move is unrelated to a federal court decision that blocked sales of weed killers based on the product.

Headlines: U.S. calls bid by men to avoid extradition over ex-Nissan boss Ghosn's escape 'flawed'
Description: U.S. prosecutors on Tuesday said a former Green Beret and his son, wanted by Japan for helping former Nissan Motor Co boss Carlos Ghosn flee the country, were advancing a "flawed" interpretation of Japanese law to fight their extradition.

Headlines: Amazon to use AI tech in its warehouses to enforce social distancing
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Tuesday launched an artificial intelligence-based tracking system to enforce social distancing at its offices and warehouses to help reduce any risk of contracting the new coronavirus among its workers.

Headlines: Trump team prepares $1 trillion infrastructure plan to spur economy
Description: The Trump administration is preparing an up to $1 trillion infrastructure package focused on transportation projects as part of its push to spur the world's largest economy back to life, a source familiar with the situation said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. bank profits plunge 70% on coronavirus loss provisioning
Description: U.S. bank profits fell by 69.6% to $18.5 billion in the first quarter of 2020 from the year prior as banks felt the economic impact of the novel coronavirus pandemic, according to data from a banking regulator.

Headlines: Asian stocks set to rise as drug trials, data push Wall Street higher
Description: Asian stocks were set to climb on Wednesday after another late Wall Street surge in response to upbeat trial results for a COVID-19 treatment and data showing U.S. consumers spent big in May.

Headlines: Transparency needed to restore trust after 737 MAX crashes: FAA chief
Description: U.S. FAA chief Steve Dickson will tell a Senate committee at a hearing on Wednesday that transparency is key to restoring public trust in the agency and planemaker Boeing Co in the wake of fatal 737 MAX crashes, according to a copy of his written testimony seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Wall Street closes higher on signs of economic recovery
Description: Wall Street advanced on Tuesday as the prospect of additional stimulus and a record jump in retail sales suggested the U.S. economy could bounce back sooner than expected, five months into its pandemic-inflicted recession.

Headlines: Tesla signs three-year pricing deal with battery cell maker Panasonic
Description: Tesla Inc  has signed a three-year pricing deal with Japan's Panasonic Corp  relating to the manufacture and supply of lithium-ion battery cells at the Gigafactory in Nevada, the electric carmaker disclosed in a filing on Tuesday.

Headlines: Southwest extends limited seating on flights through September
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  said on Tuesday it will continue to limit bookings on its flights until at least September to maintain space between passengers.

Headlines: Why some black-owned U.S. businesses are hardest hit by coronavirus shutdowns
Description: After 15 years working as a hair stylist in other people's salons, Gary Connell opened his "Healthy Hair" studio in Montgomery County, Maryland in early March, sinking his savings into a two-chair shop in a busy mall.

Headlines: Green shoots welcome but recovery still a long road, Fed's Powell says
Description: A full U.S. economic recovery will not occur until the American people are sure that the novel coronavirus epidemic has been brought under control, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday, as he began the first of two days of hearings before U.S. lawmakers.

Headlines: Oil prices rise 3% on signs of U.S. economic recovery
Description: Oil prices rose 3% in volatile trade on Tuesday as Wall Street surged and the International Energy Agency (IEA) increased its oil demand forecast for 2020, but gains were capped by worries about a second wave of coronavirus cases.

Headlines: Stocks and dollar gain on U.S. retail sales, drug trial
Description: Risk appetite found new life on Tuesday on a record rebound in U.S. retail sales, fresh support from the Federal Reserve and Bank of Japan, and upbeat trial results for a COVID-19 treatment, driving global equity markets higher and boosting the dollar.

Headlines: U.S. says former eBay workers sent live roaches, bloody pig mask to intimidate critics
Description: Six former eBay Inc employees have been criminally charged with mounting a cyberstalking campaign against a Massachusetts couple whose online newsletter they viewed as critical of the e-commerce company, U.S. prosecutors announced on Monday.

Headlines: Lufthansa shareholder Thiele raps bailout deal, raises stake
Description: German investor Heinz Hermann Thiele sharply criticised a 9-billion-euro ($10.14 billion) bailout deal for carrier Lufthansa , saying he had raised his stake in the group to more than 15% and hoped alternative options could be explored.

Headlines: Ex-Tommy Hilfiger boss Grieder to become new Hugo Boss CEO
Description: German fashion house Hugo Boss  has appointed former Tommy Hilfiger boss Daniel Grieder as its next chief executive, it said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Did elite David Boies law firm get a pandemic bailout? It's a secret
Description: When the U.S. government announced a multibillion-dollar bailout of struggling small businesses amid the coronavirus pandemic, one of the top U.S. law firms sensed an opportunity.

Headlines: Appeals court sides with exchanges in U.S. SEC fee row
Description: A U.S. appeals court ruled on Tuesday that the Securities and Exchange Commission cannot force stock exchanges to conduct a costly experiment to see how the fees they charge and the incentives they offer affect brokers' trading habits.

Headlines: Hilton to cut 2,100 corporate jobs globally
Description: Hotel chain Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc  said on Tuesday it would cut about 22% of its corporate workforce, or 2,100 jobs, following the coronavirus outbreak that has ravaged the global travel industry.

Headlines: China keen to seek benefits from pandemic, distressed U.S. assets: report
Description: U.S. lawmakers and policymakers should be wary of China's moves to target vulnerable U.S. assets and expand its market share in the wake of the global economic crisis triggered by the novel coronavirus, according to a study prepared for a U.S. trade group and released on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Chesapeake Energy to file for bankruptcy as soon as this week - sources
Description: Chesapeake Energy Corp  is preparing to file for bankruptcy as soon as this week, said three people familiar with the matter, becoming the largest oil and gas producer to unravel after an energy market rout caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Fed corporate bond move relieves potential stigma for companies, say investors
Description: The New York Federal Reserve's planned launch on Tuesday of a bond-buying facility could help ease the potential stigma for companies of asking for help and create an important framework for what the central bank steps in to purchase, analysts and investors said.

Headlines: U.S. economy starts long recovery as retail sales post record jump
Description: U.S. retail sales increased by the most on record in May after two straight months of sharp declines as businesses reopened, offering more evidence that the recession triggered by the COVID-19 pandemic was over or drawing to an end.

Headlines: Apple's App Store, Apple Pay targeted by EU antitrust regulators
Description: Apple  is being investigated by EU antitrust regulators over its App Store and mobile payment system Apple Pay as the bloc turns up the heat on gatekeepers of online platforms on which thousands of companies depend for business.

Headlines: Factbox: What changes are companies making in response to George Floyd protests?
Description: The corporate response to a wave of protests over the treatment of African-Americans has included pledges to increase diversity, donations to civil rights groups and, in some cases, changes in policies or practices long sought by critics. Here is a sampling:

Headlines: Fed Chair Powell says strong job market can reduce U.S. racial inequality
Description: The best way the Federal Reserve can help reduce racial inequality is to return the U.S. labor market to its pre-coronavirus strength, U.S. Fed Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday, as he sidestepped questions over whether the Fed itself contributes to the problem.

Headlines: Instant View: Powell: No U.S. growth recovery until epidemic controlled
Description: A full U.S. economic recovery will not occur until the American people are sure that the novel coronavirus epidemic has been brought under control, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday as he began the first of two days of hearings before U.S. lawmakers.

Headlines: Volkswagen to pay $267 million for Audi buyout
Description: Volkswagen  will pay a 48% premium to buy out the minority shareholders of premium division Audi , Audi said on Tuesday.

Headlines: European airlines face longer haul to recovery
Description: A patchwork of national restrictions and a reluctance among travellers to cross borders mean European airlines face a bumpier return to the skies from coronavirus lockdowns than U.S. and Asian rivals.

Headlines: U.S. business inventories drop more than expected
Description: U.S. business inventories fell more than expected in April as the COVID-19 crisis depressed imports, suggesting inventory investment could again be a drag on economic output in the second quarter.

Headlines: New York area business activity shows signs of improvement in June
