Description: Business conditions in the New York region began to show signs of improvement in June, and companies have started bringing their staff back to work and feel slightly more optimistic about the near-term future, according to a report released Tuesday by the New York Federal Reserve.

Headlines: AB Volvo to cut white-collar workforce by 4,100 jobs as pandemic weighs
Description: Truck- and construction equipment maker AB Volvo  plans to cut its white-collar workforce by around 4,100 positions during the second half of 2020, it said in a statement on Tuesday, citing the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: More senior executives leave Embraer as dust settles over failed Boeing deal
Description: Four senior executives are leaving Embraer SA , in addition to its commercial aviation chief, in the wake of a failed deal with Boeing Co  and as a new chief executive reassess the jet maker's path forward, three sources said.

Headlines: Main IKEA retailer starts returning government aid received to cover wages
Description: Ingka Group, the owner of most IKEA stores, said on Tuesday it had repaid aid received from the Serbian government to cover wages for furloughed staff during lockdown, and was about to do the same in Romania.

Headlines: Airlines urge regulators to extend airport slots waiver
Description: Airlines are urging aviation regulators to extend a waiver on airport slot rules as they struggle to overcome the coronavirus crisis, their main international body said on Tuesday.

Headlines: EU executive to partly shield WTO candidate Hogan from public view
Description: EU trade chief Phil Hogan will limit public appearances after he put himself forward as a possible candidate to become the next head of the World Trade Organization, the European Commission said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Renault to cut 1,500 engineering jobs in France: union source
Description: French carmaker Renault  plans to cut 1,500 engineering jobs in France, a trade union source told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. health insurers may balk at paying for coronavirus antibody testing
Description: U.S. health insurers may balk at covering tests that look for coronavirus antibodies in some cases, arguing that employers or the government should foot a bill expected to run into billions of dollars.

Headlines: Apple says disappointed with EU antitrust investigations
Description: Apple  on Tuesday accused a few companies of filing groundless complaints and criticised EU antitrust regulators for listening to them and opening two investigations into its Apple Pay and App Store.

Headlines: Volkswagen invests extra $200 million in U.S. battery company QuantumScape
Description: Volkswagen is increasing its stake in U.S. company QuantumScape by up to $200 million to boost the development of solid-state battery technology that aims to increase the ranges of electric cars and shorten charging times, the German carmaker said https://bit.ly/2BcvqPY on Tuesday.

Headlines: Cerberus vows no let up in push for change at Commerzbank
Description: Cerberus will use "alternative paths" to force leadership change at Commerzbank  if it continues to resist calls to reform, the activist investor said in a letter to Germany's second-biggest bank seen by Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Huawei CFO raises new argument to fight U.S. extradition in Canada court
Description: Huawei Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou is raising a new argument in a Canadian court in a bid to fight extradition to the United States on bank fraud charges, court documents released on Monday showed.

Headlines: SoftBank-backed ride-hailing firm Grab cuts staff to cope with virus impact
Description: Southeast Asian ride-hailing and payments firm Grab said on Tuesday it would lay off more than 300 employees due to the impact of novel coronavirus, in the latest setback to major backer SoftBank Group Corp .

Headlines: Exclusive: Tencent aims to become biggest shareholder of video streaming rival iQIYI - sources
Description: Tencent Holdings Ltd  aims to become the biggest shareholder in video streaming rival iQIYI Inc , said two people familiar with the matter, to lower costs and counter competition in a sector boosted by stay-at-home virus policies.

Headlines: U.S. companies can work with Huawei on 5G, other standards: Commerce Department
Description: The United States on Monday confirmed a Reuters report that it will amend its prohibitions on U.S. companies doing business with China's Huawei to allow them to work together on setting standards for next-generation 5G networks.

Headlines: FCC chair calls T-Mobile U.S. network outage 'unacceptable', vows probe
Description: The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) will probe an extensive T-Mobile network outage that impacted customers across the United States, the head of the U.S. telecommunications regulatory agency said on Monday.

Headlines: Two former Pinterest policy employees say they faced racism at work
Description: Two former Pinterest employees who left the image-sharing company in late May publicly alleged in tweets on Monday that they had experienced racial discrimination in the workplace.

Headlines: Amazon says CEO Bezos willing to testify before U.S. Congress
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Monday its founder and Chief Executive Jeff Bezos was willing to testify to a congressional panel investigating potential violations of U.S. antitrust law by big technology companies.

Headlines: U.S., China to each allow four weekly flights for airlines; Delta to fly next week
Description: The United States and China will each allow four weekly flights between the two countries, the U.S. Transportation Department said on Monday, easing a standoff on travel restrictions in the midst of the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: The future of media: more digital and more economic pain, Reuters Institute says
Description: The coronavirus outbreak has prompted a significant increase in news consumption but the economic turmoil is forcing news businesses to accelerate their move to digital, The Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism said.

Headlines: Fed launches long-awaited Main Street lending program, seeks to reach nonprofits
Description: The Federal Reserve on Monday launched its Main Street Lending Program, the most complex program undertaken yet by the U.S. central bank to help keep the backbone of the economy from buckling under the strains of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Embraer secures $600 mln loan as commercial aviation chief departs
Description: Embraer SA  said on Monday it had secured a $600 million loan, partly backed by Brazil's government, at the same time as a key executive departed the planemaker weeks after a potentially transformational deal with Boeing Co  fell apart.

Headlines: Wall Street closes higher as Fed soothes recovery worries
Description: Wall Street closed higher on Monday following an announcement by the U.S. Federal Reserve regarding its corporate bond purchasing program that boosted investor confidence, which had been wavering amid a spike in new COVID-19 cases.

Headlines: GM CEO optimistic on U.S. demand, China, EV profitability
Description: General Motors Co's  top executive struck an optimistic note on Monday about U.S. new vehicle demand despite the coronavirus pandemic, and the ability to sell electric vehicles at a profit, especially in China.

Headlines: Proxy adviser ISS opposes re-election of Tesla chairwoman
Description: Proxy adviser Institutional Shareholder Services Inc (ISS) on Monday urged Tesla Inc  shareholders to vote against the re-election of chairwoman Robyn Denholm at the electric carmaker's annual meeting next month.

Headlines: NYSE to reopen trading floor to some market makers on Wednesday
Description: The New York Stock Exchange will allow a limited number of market makers to return to its trading floor on Wednesday, nearly three months after closing it due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Apple-backed study sheds light on physical sales through App Store
Description: Apple Inc on Monday released the results of a study that found its App Store spurred $458 billion in sales last year from categories such as retail of physical goods, ride-hailing and advertising from which the iPhone maker takes no commission.

Headlines: Embraer to receive $600 million loan, partly backed by government, due to coronavirus
Description: Planemaker Embraer said on Monday it will receive a $600 million loan, financed partly by Brazil's government, to help the company weather the coronavirus crisis that has ravaged the air travel industry.

Headlines: JPMorgan to bring back more traders to office next week: source
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  plans to start returning more traders and sales staff to its Manhattan headquarters starting next week with volunteers, a source familiar with the matter said on Monday.Roughly 20% of the bank's sales and trading staff have worked at its New York office throughout the coronavirus pandemic. Starting on June 22, the bank will gradually increase its in-office staff to as much as 50% by mid-July, the source said.

Headlines: Stocks rebound on Fed debt program, oil recovers
Description: A gauge of global equities rebounded on Monday after the Federal Reserve widened its program of buying corporate debt, while crude oil rose on signs fuel demand is recovering and as investors grapple with how to assess the economic reopening.

Headlines: Oil prices rise 2% on optimism around OPEC+ output pact
Description: Oil prices rose more than 2% on Monday as signs that fuel demand was recovering, while OPEC+ members were complying with a production cut deal, outweighed fears that new coronavirus infections could further slow the global economy.

Headlines: Tesla negotiating incentives for possible Texas vehicle assembly plant, report says
Description: Electric carmaker Tesla Inc  is negotiating possible incentives with a Texas county that could bring a new auto assembly plant to the area near Austin, the state capital, the Austin American-Statesman reported on Monday.

Headlines: IAG's Walsh rejects lawmakers' criticism over British Airways plan
Description: British Airways is fighting for its survival and has acted lawfully, Willie Walsh, the chief executive of the airline's owner IAG  said on Monday, in a terse response to lawmakers who heavily criticised its treatment of employees.

Headlines: United Airlines pledges loyalty program for $5 billion loan
Description: United Airlines  said on Monday it is pledging its MileagePlus frequent flyer program for a new $5 billion loan aimed at further buffering its liquidity, even as its cash burn rate slows thanks to a steady improvement in demand.

Headlines: UAW president, U.S. prosecutor to meet for union reform talks on June 30
Description: United Auto Workers (UAW) President Rory Gamble will meet Matthew Schneider, the U.S. attorney for the Eastern District of Michigan, at the end of the month in Detroit to begin negotiations for reforming the union, UAW said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court clears way for pipeline to cross Appalachian Trail
Description: Ruling against environmentalists, the U.S. Supreme Court on Monday decided that the federal government has the authority to allow a proposed $7.5 billion natural gas pipeline to cross under the popular Appalachian Trail in rural Virginia.

Headlines: Amazon's business practices examined by two U.S. states
Description: State investigators in both California and Washington are examining Amazon's business practices, two newspapers reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Lufthansa seeking cuts equivalent to 22,000 positions
Description: Lufthansa  said on Monday it was seeking to strike agreements with worker representatives by June 22 on how to make cuts equivalent to 22,000 full-time positions.

Headlines: BP wipes up to $17.5 billion from assets with bleaker oil outlook
Description: BP  will write off up to $17.5 billion from the value of its assets after cutting its long-term oil and gas price forecasts, betting the COVID-19 crisis will cast a lasting chill on energy demand and accelerate a shift away from fossil fuels.

Headlines: LSE offers no concessions to avert deeper EU probe of Refinitiv deal: sources
Description: The London Stock Exchange  will not offer concessions to EU antitrust regulators reviewing its $27 billion bid for data and analytics company Refinitiv, two people familiar with the matter said, a move which will likely trigger a four-month probe.

Headlines: Italy says closely watching LSE/Refinitiv deal due to implications for Milan bourse
Description: Italian Economy Minister Roberto Gualtieri said on Monday the government is closely watching the merger between the London Stock Exchange (LSE) and Refinitiv, and its implications for the Italian bourse owned by LSE.

Headlines: HSBC gets veiled rebuke from UK government over Hong Kong
Description: Britain's Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab voiced a thinly veiled criticism of HSBC  on Monday after the bank backed China's national security law for Hong Kong, contradicting the British government's opposition to it.

Headlines: U.S. economy will start to rebound in second half of 2020, Fed's Kaplan says
Description: The U.S. economy will experience a "significant, historic" contraction in the second quarter before it starts to rebound, and unemployment will remain elevated at the end of 2020, Dallas Federal Reserve President Robert Kaplan said on Monday.

Headlines: Explainer: How Fed's Main Street program compares to other small business pandemic aid
Description: The Federal Reserve on Monday launched its latest life raft for U.S. businesses hurt by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. Federal Reserve resumes normal bank exams
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve announced Monday it was resuming its normal bank examination activities, after easing back at the outset of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Mnuchin will discuss PPP oversight with Congress after criticism
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Monday he would talk to Congress about proper oversight of $660 billion in small business economic relief, after previously resisting calls to reveal who received the funds.

Headlines: Exclusive: BlackRock injects $18 billion into European firms during pandemic - source
Description: The world's biggest asset manager BlackRock  has pumped about 16 billion euros ($18 billion) into 810 European companies since the end of January, more than half of them in distress due to the coronavirus pandemic, a source with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Meatpacking workers often absent after Trump order to reopen
Description: Smithfield Foods Inc [SFII.UL] is missing about a third of its employees at a South Dakota pork plant because they are quarantined or afraid to return to work after a severe coronavirus outbreak, according to the workers' union.

Headlines: EasyJet resumes flying with COVID-19 measures in place
Description: EasyJet  aircraft took to the skies for the first time since March 30 on Monday, as the British carrier resumed a small number of mainly domestic flights after weeks of lockdown.

Headlines: GE picks Embraer planemaking chief to run aviation unit
Description: General Electric Co  on Monday tapped the planemaking head of Brazil's Embraer  to run its key aircraft engines division on Monday, as the global aviation industry grapples with disruption caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Amazon says CEO Bezos willing to testify before Congress: NYT
Description: Amazon.com Inc Chief Executive Officer Jeff Bezos is willing to testify before a House antitrust investigation into the market power of major tech companies, the New York Times reported https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/15/technology/amazon-jeff-bezos-congress.html on Monday, citing a lawyer for Amazon who wrote to lawmakers.

Headlines: France's Givenchy names Matthew Williams as new designer
Description: French couture house Givenchy, owned by luxury goods giant LVMH  and known for once dressing Hollywood stars such as Audrey Hepburn, said on Monday it had named Matthew Williams as its new creative director.

Headlines: New York manufacturing activity unexpectedly stabilizes in June
Description: Manufacturing activity in New York State stabilized unexpectedly in June after three months of broad weakness brought on by coronavirus-related business shutdowns, and companies' six-month outlook shot to a decade high, the New York Federal Reserve said on Monday.

Headlines: Factbox: What changes are companies making in response to George Floyd protests?
Description: The corporate response to a wave of protests over the treatment of African Americans has included pledges to increase diversity, donations to civil rights groups and, in some cases, changes in policies or practices long sought by critics. Here is a sampling:

Headlines: For shrinking stock markets, corona crisis looks like a turning point
Description: The coronavirus crisis is likely to reverse a decade-long trend of shrinking equity supply that helped to power the longest bull market in history as cash-strapped companies are forced to raise equity instead of buying back their shares.

Headlines: Hungary ready to help Audi run local plant at full capacity: Orban
Description: Hungary is ready to give financial support to Audi  to help its manufacturing plant in the country run at full operating capacity, Prime Minister Viktor Orban was reported as saying on Monday as he visited the site.

Headlines: U.S. mattress business springs back from pandemic shutdown
Description: The U.S. mattress business has bounced back after months of shutdowns from the coronavirus pandemic kept customers away.

Headlines: Walmart partners with Shopify to expand online marketplace business
Description: Walmart Inc  has partnered with Canadian e-commerce firm Shopify Inc  , as the world's biggest brick-and-mortar retailer ramps up its efforts to capture a bigger slice of the coronavirus-driven surge in online shopping.

Headlines: Carmaker PSA cuts back on transfer of Polish workers to French plant
Description: France's PSA , the maker of Peugeot cars, on Monday said it would only transfer a small group of Polish workers to help out in a French plant where production is being increased, following a backlash over the knock-on effect for local jobs.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs increases COVID-19 federal aid commitment by $250 million
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  on Monday pledged an additional $250 million to fund the federal aid program to help businesses hurt by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Honeywell launches new business unit to capture drone market
Description: Honeywell International Inc, a major supplier of aerospace products, said Monday it launched an unmanned aerial systems business to bet on the autonomous aviation space – drones, air taxis, and unmanned cargo delivery vehicles.

Headlines: Delta has received approval from Shanghai government to resume flights
Description: Delta Air Lines  has received approval from the Shanghai government to resume flights from June 18, a company spokeswoman said on Monday, paving the way for the carrier to resume services to China after months of suspension due to COVID-19.

Headlines: Revenue at airline Avianca falls 51% through early June on coronavirus
Description: Passenger revenue at Latin America's No. 2 airline, Avianca Holdings , has fallen 51% for the year as of early June compared with a year ago, the carrier said, in a look into the dire financial toll that the coronavirus has taken on the company.

Headlines: Intesa, BPER revise terms to try to clear antitrust hurdles to UBI deal
Description: Italy's Intesa Sanpaolo  has agreed to sell more branches and assets to rival BPER  to try to overcome antitrust objections to its proposed takeover of UBI Banca .

Headlines: Volkswagen expects very bad second-quarter, positive 2020 adjusted operating profit
Description: Volkswagen  expects a very bad second quarter, but also sees a positive adjusted operating profit before special items for 2020, Chief Financial Officer Frank Witter said in an internal newsletter.

Headlines: Charging points surge ahead of electric car boom
Description: The number of publicly accessible charging points for electric vehicles (EV) jumped 60% in 2019, the biggest increase in three years and outpacing sales of battery-powered cars, according to the International Energy Agency (IEA).

Headlines: Exclusive: Mexico's oil hedge to be pricier, but government likely doing it anyway
Description: Mexico will have to pay more for less coverage under its giant oil revenue insurance policy for 2021, but will likely go ahead anyway to avoid further damaging its financial standing with international investors, sources said.

Headlines: Volkswagen in Mexico will begin sending workers back to plant on Tuesday
Description: Volkswagen AG's  Mexican unit will begin sending workers back to its plant in the central state of Puebla on Tuesday for "preparation and training eyeing a gradual start further ahead," the company said in a statement on Sunday.

Headlines: SoftBank buybacks pick up in June; $4.7 billion spent in total
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  share buybacks accelerated in June, with a total of 499.9 billion yen ($4.66 billion) spent on buying back 107.7 million of its shares since March, a company filing showed on Monday.

Headlines: BPER sees cash call of 600-700 million euro to fund new Intesa deal: sources
Description: Italy's BPER Banca  estimates it will need to raise 600-700 million euros in a new share issue to fund a revised deal to buy branches and assets from Intesa Sanpaolo , two sources with knowledge of the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Commerzbank preparing to make more job cuts: board member
Description: Commerzbank  will announce "considerably" more branch closures and job cuts when it lays out its strategy review in August, a member of the bank's supervisory board said on Monday.

Headlines: H&M says recovery uneven after March-May sales tumble 50%
Description: H&M , the world's second-biggest fashion retailer, on Monday reported a sharp but slightly smaller than expected drop in second-quarter sales as measures to slow the COVID-19 pandemic slammed the sector.

Headlines: Analysts' view: Market jitters over second COVID-19 wave are an overdue pullback
Description: A second straight day of record new coronavirus cases in Beijing and a spike in infections across a swathe of the United States has dented investor sentiment and sent stocks sharply lower on Monday.

Headlines: China's factory output perks up but consumers stay cautious
Description: China's factories stepped up production for a second straight month in May, as the country shook off the economic torpor of the coronavirus, although the weaker-than-expected gain suggested the recovery remained fragile.

Headlines: Dutch Tata Steel employees hold further strike actions
Description: Dutch Tata Steel  employees held further strike  actions on Monday to protest against job cuts planned as part of a broader restructuring, the FNV union said.

Headlines: Recovery rally has further to run, so buy stocks: Morgan Stanley
Description: Stock market gains have further to run and investors are still under-pricing the scale of the world's coronavirus recovery, investment bank Morgan Stanley  said in an outlook note.

Headlines: Crunch time for China's robot startups as pandemic brings pain and opportunities
Description: With glowing blue eyes and trusting feline features, a new robot cat by Chinese startup Elephant Robotics seems happily oblivious to the worries of CEO Joey Song as he shows it off at the company's lab in Shenzhen.

Headlines: Systemic racism slows economic growth: Dallas Fed chief Kaplan
Description: Systemic racism and high unemployment levels among black and Hispanic Americans create a drag on the U.S. economy, Dallas Federal Reserve President Robert Kaplan said on Sunday.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Investors bet bounce in value stocks will stick
Description: As the U.S. economy begins to emerge from the sharp slowdown during the coronavirus pandemic, some fund managers have been drawn to value stocks, a sector that underperformed during the recent rally.

Headlines: CVS joins Walmart in keeping multicultural beauty products out of locked cabinets
Description: Drugstore chain CVS Health Corp joined Walmart Inc in announcing it will stop keeping beauty and personal care products designed for people of color in locked display cases, after the practice drew criticism online.

Headlines: American Express JV gets final approval to launch operations in China
Description: China's central bank has given the final nod to a network clearing license for an American Express  joint venture, allowing it to be the first foreign credit card company to launch onshore operations in China.

Headlines: U.S. eases criminal record provision in coronavirus business loan program
Description: Federal authorities administering business payroll loans as part of U.S. coronavirus relief efforts on Friday eased rules prohibiting lending to business owners with criminal records, allowing some with no convictions in the past year to access funds.

Headlines: U.S. regulator sides with FCA in Jeep trade case against Mahindra
Description: A U.S. regulator ruled that India's Mahindra and Mahindra Ltd infringed upon the intellectual property rights of Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV's (FCA) Jeep brand, barring the sale of the vehicles in question.

Headlines: Bankrupt Hertz to seize on speculation frenzy with $1 billion stock sale
Description: Hertz Global Holdings Inc said it won bankruptcy court approval on Friday to sell up to $1 billion in stock, capitalizing on a remarkable rally in its shares driven by speculators defying conventional market wisdom.

Headlines: Canada spy agency warned of 'shock waves' from arrest of Huawei founder's daughter
Description: Canada's intelligence agency warned that arresting the daughter of billionaire Huawei founder Ren Zheng would set off global "shock waves" and seriously affect ties with China, just before her detention in Vancouver on a U.S. extradition request, new court documents show.

Headlines: Lawmakers label British Airways 'national disgrace' over jobs
Description: British Airways was labelled a "national disgrace" by lawmakers for its treatment of employees on Saturday, adding to pressure on the airline as it juggles job cuts and new quarantine rules.

Headlines: Airbnb partners with Brazil virus hotspot Sao Paulo on post-pandemic tourism
Description: Home rental firm Airbnb struck a partnership with Brazil's Sao Paulo state to encourage tourism once the novel coronavirus crisis has passed, a company executive said on Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street ends higher but indexes mark worst week since March selloff
Description: U.S. stocks ended higher on Friday as bargain hunters stepped back into the market following sharp losses a day earlier, but all three major indexes suffered their biggest weekly percentage declines since March.

Headlines: Zoom hits political turbulence in Washington, Beijing; lobbyists ready
Description: Zoom Video Communications, whose remote meeting app made the obscure California company a hub for global communications during the coronavirus pandemic, now finds itself fighting political battles in Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: World shares modestly higher as investors mull coronavirus, recovery outlook
Description: Global equity markets rose in choppy trading on Friday as concerns triggered by the U.S. Federal Reserve's less-than-optimistic outlook for an economic recovery and a jump in U.S. coronavirus cases gave investors pause.

Headlines: U.S. insurers use lofty estimates to beat back coronavirus claims
Description: U.S. property and casualty insurers have cast the coronavirus pandemic as an unprecedented event whose massive cost to small businesses they are neither able nor required to cover.

Headlines: After jolt, investors still see stocks as long-term bet
Description: An interruption to a searing rally gave a jolt to equity investors who had been getting used to weeks of steadily rising U.S. stocks.

Headlines: Oil prices see weekly loss on virus resurgence fears
Description: Oil was little changed on Friday and logged a first weekly decline since April as new U.S. coronavirus cases spiked, stoking fears of a second wave of the virus hitting fuel demand.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. senators draft plan to reform new plane design approvals after 737 MAX crashes
Description: Two key U.S. senators are circulating a bipartisan draft bill that would reform how the Federal Aviation Administration  certifies new aircraft in the wake of two fatal Boeing 737 MAX crashes that killed 346 people.

Headlines: Volkswagen, Audi on hold as Mexico's Puebla state not ready to reopen
Description: Mexico's Puebla state, where German automaker Volkswagen  and its luxury brand unit Audi  have major plants, said it is not ready to reopen its automotive sector due to ongoing concerns about the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Coronavirus threatens Chicago's last remaining trading pits
Description: Chicago brokers and traders worry the novel coronavirus will kill more of the city's once famous shout-and-gesture trading pits.

Headlines: China's Tencent Music reports passive stake in Warner Music
Description: China's Tencent Music Entertainment Group on Friday reported a 5.2% passive stake in Class A shares of Warner Music Group Corp, about a week after the world's third-largest recording label's debut on the Nasdaq.

Headlines: 'Persistent fragilities' ahead for households and businesses -Fed report
Description: The Federal Reserve expects household finances and business balance sheets to suffer "persistent fragilities" as a result of the shock to economic activity arising from the coronavirus pandemic, the central bank said in a report to Congress on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence rises; COVID-19, unemployment shadow lingers
Description: U.S. consumer sentiment perked up in early June as households cheered the reopening of businesses and a surprise rebound in hiring, though they did not expect a significant improvement in the economy amid fears of a resurgence in COVID-19 infections.

Headlines: American Airlines expects to halt cash burn by year-end, shares jump
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  said on Friday it expects to halt its daily cash burn by the end of 2020 thanks to cost-cutting measures and an improvement in travel demand, easing concerns about its short-term liquidity.

Headlines: Fed frets about small business failures amid 'alarming' data
Description: A large number of small U.S. businesses could fail during the coronavirus recession, the Federal Reserve said on Friday, slowing recovery and creating lasting damage to the world's largest economy.

Headlines: Robinhood users' favorite stocks roar back after selloff
Description: Shares of airlines, cruise lines and other companies that have been popular with investors on the Robinhood trading app shot higher on Friday, a day after stocks suffered their worst one-day market rout in about three months.

Headlines: White House sees red state/blue state divide in post-coronavirus economic recovery
Description: A top White House economic adviser on Friday predicted an "increasing divergence" between states controlled by Republican governors and those led by Democrats, saying Republican "red" states opening up faster will see a stronger economic recovery.

Headlines: U.S. consumer sentiment rises in early June
Description: U.S. consumer sentiment perked up in early June as households responded to the reopening of businesses, which had been shuttered to slow the spread of COVID-19, and a rebound in hiring.

Headlines: Fed's Barkin says some jobs lost during crisis will not come back
Description: Richmond Federal Reserve Bank President Tom Barkin he fears the coronavirus pandemic could have effects that last beyond the next couple of months and that some of the jobs lost during the downturn may not come back.

Headlines: Anti-China group urges Trump administration to block Chinese companies from U.S. markets: document
Description: An anti-China advocacy group that includes former White House adviser Steve Bannon is calling on the Trump administration to exclude Chinese companies from U.S. financial markets, as the White House studies new ways to crack down on China.

Headlines: Luxury food industry turns sour amid global coronavirus lockdowns
Description: Global demand for premium foods like wagyu beef, bluefin tuna and caviar has plunged with thousands of restaurants shuttered and many economies sliding into recession amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: BA, easyJet and Ryanair fight British quarantine with legal action
Description: British Airways, easyJet  and Ryanair  said on Friday they have begun legal action against the British government's quarantine policy in a bid to overturn what they see as overly strict rules.

Headlines: New U.S. stock exchange MEMX adds Citigroup as investor
Description: The Members Exchange (MEMX), a new U.S. stock exchange backed by some of Wall Street's biggest firms that is preparing for a Sept. 4 launch, said it received financial backing from Citigroup Inc .

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuelan shipping magnate faces U.S. sanctions probe - officials
Description: The United States is investigating a Venezuelan shipping magnate for possibly violating U.S. sanctions by bringing fuel to  gasoline-short Venezuela, according to two senior Trump administration officials.

Headlines: Dick's Sporting Goods resumes paying dividend as stores reopen
Description: Dick's Sporting Goods Inc  said on Friday it would resume paying shareholders a quarterly dividend, citing strong early sales at its stores that have reopened amid easing coronavirus-driven restrictions.

Headlines: What rebound? North Dakota in economic crunch as virus batters oil, agriculture
Description: When the novel coronavirus first appeared in the United States, North Dakota was in the envious position of having more money in its state coffers than it had budgeted.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturers struggle to keep workers in face of weak demand
Description: Cheryl Wellman was able to bring back most of her furloughed workers last month with the help of a special government loan.

Headlines: Tesla at $1,000: too much too soon for some analysts
Description: Top Wall Street brokerages Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley downgraded their ratings on Tesla Inc  saying the electric carmaker's shares were overpriced, two days after the high-flying stock crossed $1,000 per share.

Headlines: Take Five: Pump it up
Description: "Rise and rise again until lambs become lions," runs an oft-quoted line from the 2010 film 'Robin Hood'. The motto is being taken seriously by all those merry men and maidens chasing  shares in little-known or even bankrupt firms, using a mobile trading app called Robinhood.

Headlines: Honda resumes production at plants hit by suspected cyber attack
Description: Japan's Honda Motor Co  has resumed production at automobile and motorcycle plants in the United States and other countries after they were hit by a suspected cyber attack this week, a spokesman said on Friday.

Headlines: Lufthansa to offer coronavirus testing at German airports
Description: German airline group Lufthansa  plans to offer coronavirus tests at airports in Frankfurt and Munich, a spokesman said on Friday.

Headlines: Special Report: How China got shipments of Venezuelan oil despite U.S. sanctions
Description: Last year, China replaced the United States as the No. 1 importer of oil from Venezuela, yet another front in the heated rivalry between Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: EU regulators to decide on Alstom, Bombardier deal by July 16
Description: EU antitrust regulators have set a July 16 deadline for a decision on whether to clear French TGV high-speed train maker Alstom's  bid for Bombardier Inc's  rail division, according to a filing on the European Commission website.

Headlines: Exclusive: Netflix in talks to source Indian content from Reliance affiliate Viacom18 - sources
Description: U.S. video streaming company Netflix is in talks with Viacom18, part of the Indian conglomerate Reliance Industries' media unit Network18, about a multi-year partnership to source content, three sources told Reuters, in a move that would expand a relationship between the two sides.

Headlines: SoftBank share buybacks near $3 billion despite May slowdown
Description: SoftBank's  share buybacks slowed in May, a company filing showed on Friday, although total purchases to support its share price since March reached 312 billion yen ($2.9 billion).

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers ask Zoom to clarify China ties after it suspends accounts
Description: Three U.S. lawmakers asked Zoom Video Communications Inc  to clarify its data-collection practices and relationship with the Chinese government after the firm said it had suspended user accounts to meet demands from Beijing.

Headlines: Scrub that: Pandemic forces ship owners to shelve anti-pollution gear
Description: Ship owners are postponing or cancelling the installation of "scrubbers" that extract harmful sulphur emissions from their vessels as the coronavirus pandemic tightens finances.

Headlines: Pandemic heightens chance Japan slides back into deflation: Reuters poll
Description: The coronavirus pandemic has raised the chance Japan's economy will slip back into deflation as social curbs to halt the spread of the disease hits businesses and consumers, a majority of analysts polled by Reuters said.

Headlines: Google's new rules clamp down on discriminatory housing, job ads
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google said on Thursday it was tackling unlawful discrimination by barring housing, employment and credit ads from being targeted to its users based on their postal code, gender, age, parental status or marital status.

Headlines: Japan's Fujifilm to spend $928 million to double capacity of Danish drug facility
Description: (This June 10 story corrects second paragraph to say facility makes antibody drugs, not viral vaccines)

Headlines: Taco Bell parent Yum sues Grubhub for alleged violation of delivery deal
Description: Taco Bell parent Yum Brands Inc sued Grubhub Inc on Thursday for allegedly violating a delivery contract, a day after Europe's Just Eat Takeaway.com agreed to buy the U.S. food delivery company for $7.3 billion.

Headlines: Palantir close to registering for stock market debut: sources
Description: Data mining firm Palantir Technologies Inc is aiming to file confidentially with U.S. regulators to go public in the coming weeks, emboldened by the strong performance of other initial public offerings (IPOs), people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: A month into reopening, no clear turn for U.S. economy or pandemic
Description: A month into efforts to broadly reopen the U.S. economy there is  little clarity either on the pace and durability of the recovery, or on the ability to convincingly suppress the virus that has killed more than 112,000 Americans.

Headlines: Asian stocks set to fall sharply as Wall Street tumbles
Description: Asian equities are set to fall sharply on Friday after Wall Street stocks and oil tumbled over growing concerns that a resurgence of coronavirus infections could stunt the pace of reopening economies.

Headlines: Factbox: What changes are companies making in response to George Floyd protests?
Description: The corporate response to a wave of protests over the treatment of African Americans has included pledges to increase diversity, donations to civil rights groups and, in some cases, changes in policies or practices long sought by critics. Here is a sampling:

Headlines: Apple, YouTube unveil $100 million funds to support black causes amid U.S. protests
Description: Apple Inc  said on Thursday it will increase spending with black-owned suppliers as part of a $100 million racial equity and justice initiative, while Google-owned  YouTube said it will spend $100 million to fund black artists.

Headlines: Stock tumble gives brutal reminder of pandemic fear
Description: A stock market that shook off the coronavirus pandemic, economic devastation and sky-high equity valuations was reminded of all three on Thursday, as Wall Street took its biggest dive in three months.

Headlines: Wall Street's 'fear gauge' jumps on fears of coronavirus resurgence
Description: The Cboe Volatility Index, known as Wall Street's "fear gauge," jumped to its highest level in more than a month on Thursday as concerns over a resurgence of the novel coronavirus pandemic felled U.S. stocks.

Headlines: LATAM Airlines bondholders in talks to supply up to $1.5 billion loan, sources say
Description: A group of bondholders of LATAM Airlines Group SA  is in talks to supply up to $1.5 billion in a debtor-in-possession loan within the Chapter 11 proceeding in the United States, two people with knowledge of the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Google sues Sonos, escalating wireless speaker battle amid trade panel probe
Description: Google filed a lawsuit accusing home speaker maker Sonos Inc  of infringing five of its patents, escalating tensions between the partners that have already led to a U.S. International Trade Commission probe.

Headlines: Microsoft bans face-recognition sales to police as Big Tech reacts to protests
Description: Microsoft Corp  said on Thursday it would await federal regulation before selling facial recognition technology to police, making it the latest big firm to back away from the business following protests against law enforcement brutality and bias.

Headlines: Latin America must restart air travel by July to avoid bankruptcies: trade group
Description: Latin American countries should quicken steps for airlines to renew domestic flights no later than July before more companies are forced to declare bankruptcy or close, a high-ranking official of the International Air Transport Association (IATA) said on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall Street plunges to close with biggest one-day loss since March 16
Description: Wall Street plummeted on Thursday as investors reacted to renewed fears of a pandemic resurgence and digested dour economic forecasts from the U.S. Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Air Canada CEO urges Trudeau's government to relax travel curbs: Bloomberg News
Description: Air Canada Chief Executive Officer Calin Rovinescu on Thursday urged the Canadian government to relax travel restrictions as they have been hurting the company's sales, Bloomberg News reported.

Headlines: Global stocks tumble, safe-haven assets rally on downbeat Fed outlook
Description: Global equity markets fell sharply on Thursday in their worst sell-off since markets crashed in mid-March, while safe-haven assets rose after the Federal Reserve's sobering outlook cast doubt on hopes for a V-shaped recovery from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. states accuse 26 drugmakers of generic drug price fixing in sweeping lawsuit
Description: Twenty-six drug manufacturers were sued on Wednesday by the attorneys general of most U.S. states and several territories, which accused them of conspiring to reduce competition and drive up generic drug prices.

Headlines: Zuckerberg's former aide Chris Cox returns to Facebook as product head
Description: Facebook Inc's  former chief product officer, Chris Cox, is returning to his role, according to his post https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10105509261342903&set=a.692319249513&type=3&theater on the social media platform.

Headlines: Oil prices slump 8% as virus-related demand concerns resurface
Description: Oil prices tumbled about 8% a barrel on Thursday, fuelled by renewed concerns about demand destruction as new cases of coronavirus tick up globally, while crude inventories hit a record in the United States.

Headlines: British Airways turns to Damien Hirst in its hour of need
Description: British Airways will sell at least 10 works of art that normally hang in its executive lounges, a source said, turning to pieces by famous artists like Damien Hirst to raise millions of pounds to help it through the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Nestle explores sale of Pure Life in overhaul of water business
Description: Nestle  is exploring a potential sale of part of its North American water business, including the Pure Life brand, it said on Thursday, as the food giant shifts focus to better performing brands.

Headlines: How Uber hailed a deal with Grubhub only to let it slip
Description: Uber Technologies Inc CEO Dara Khosrowshahi has spent much of his career deftly negotiating acquisitions. Yet his $6.5 billion all-stock bid for Grubhub Inc ended with the food delivery company being acquired by European rival Just Eat Takeway.com NV.

Headlines: Instant View: Wall Street backslides on economic gloom, uptick in virus cases
Description: Wall Street indexes nosedived on Thursday, on track for their worst days since early in the coronavirus pandemic as investors reassessed a stocks resurgence after the Fed issued a gloomy growth forecast and infections showed signs of upswing.

Headlines: Lloyds Bank fined $81 million for overcharging mortgage customers
Description: Britain's biggest domestic bank Lloyds has been fined 64 million pounds ($81.2 million) by the Financial Conduct Authority for mistreating hundreds of thousands of mortgage customers in financial difficulties.

Headlines: Uber, Lyft drivers are employees, says California regulator
Description: Drivers working for ride-hailing services such as Uber Technologies Inc and Lyft Inc will be considered employees under California's new gig worker law, the state's leading industry regulator said on Thursday.

Headlines: Comcast, media mogul Byron Allen reach carriage deal
Description: Comcast Corp said on Thursday it reached a content carriage deal with comedian-turned media mogul Byron Allen, who withdrew a lawsuit about racial bias against channels owned by African Americans.

Headlines: Stock market rally of hope pauses as virus worries mount
Description: The reality that the coronavirus crisis is far from over is threatening a blistering equity market rally that had taken some world indexes to fresh highs.

Headlines: Amazon may face EU antitrust charges over merchant data in coming weeks: source
Description: Amazon may face EU antitrust charges in the coming weeks over its use of data from merchants with whom it competes on its platform, a person familiar with the matter said on Thursday, putting it at risk of a hefty fine.

Headlines: Factbox: What changes are companies making in response to George Floyd protests?
Description: The corporate response to a wave of protests over the treatment of African Americans has included pledges to increase diversity, donations to civil rights groups and, in some cases, changes in policies or practices long sought by critics. Here is a sampling:

Headlines: Unilever picks Britain as best option as it ends Anglo-Dutch era
Description: Unilever proposed on Thursday to ditch its dual Anglo-Dutch legal structure and create a single company in Britain to give it more flexibility for mergers and acquisitions as the coronavirus pandemic overwhelms businesses worldwide.

Headlines: U.S. auto suppliers cheer as carmakers relaunch, but long-term worries remain
Description: Auto parts suppliers across North America said they are  encouraged as major automakers accelerate production after coronavirus pandemic shutdowns, but are holding back on hiring and investment because of longer-term uncertainty.

Headlines: U.S. layoffs easing, labor market distress persists
Description: The number of Americans seeking jobless benefits fell last week, but millions laid off because of COVID-19 continue to receive unemployment checks, suggesting the labor market could take years to heal from the pandemic even as hiring resumes.

Headlines: Volkswagen blames cultural insensitivity for ad criticised as racist
Description: Volkswagen  on Thursday apologised for posting on its Instagram page last month an advert widely criticised as racist, and said it was published because of a lack of cultural sensitivity.

Headlines: 'Sold!' Auctioneers race to unload oil equipment as U.S. drilling dries up
Description: Fast-talking auctioneer Greg Highsmith sung out dozens of prices - "seventy-five-hundred now, $10,000 now, be able to get 15,000?" - before a North Dakotan buyer paid $27,500 for a used Caterpillar oil swabbing rig on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Exxon set to revive North Sea sale after months of delays - sources
Description: Exxon Mobil  is preparing to restart the sale of its British North Sea assets after weaker oil prices and the coronavirus outbreak led to months of delay, industry and banking sources said.

Headlines: Ryanair rejects new UK guidance for passengers to check in all luggage
Description: Ryanair  rejected new British government guidance for passengers to check in all luggage including hand bags, saying on Thursday it would instead recommend that passengers minimise checked-in luggage.

Headlines: Ryanair rejects UK guidance for passengers to check in all luggage
Description: Ryanair  on Thursday rejected new British government guidance for passengers to check in all luggage including hand bags, saying it would instead recommend that passengers minimise checked-in luggage.

Headlines: U.S. EPA orders Amazon, Ebay to remove unsafe products that cash in on pandemic fears
Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) said on Thursday that it ordered Amazon.com Inc and eBay Inc to stop selling a wide range of pesticide products on their platforms, including those that are falsely marketed as being effective against the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Zoom suspends U.S.-based activists' account after Tiananmen event
Description: Zoom Video Communications temporarily shut the account belonging to a group of U.S.-based Chinese activists after they held an event to commemorate the 31st anniversary of China's Tiananmen Square crackdown, the activists said on Thursday.

Headlines: Just Eat Takeaway's $6 billion Grubhub grab tests growth limits
Description: Just Eat Takeaway said on Thursday its proposed $6 billion takeover of Grubhub to create a trans-Atlantic giant would give it the upper hand in the online food delivery market, where competitors are scrambling for share.

Headlines: Europe's Just Eat Takeaway to buy Grubhub for $7.3 billion
Description: European food-ordering firm Just Eat Takeaway.com NV said on Wednesday it had agreed to buy U.S. peer Grubhub Inc in an all-stock deal that, if completed, would create the world's largest food delivery company outside China.

Headlines: Moderna to start final testing stage of coronavirus vaccine in July
Description: Moderna Inc  on Thursday confirmed it plans to start a trial of 30,000 volunteers of its much-anticipated coronavirus vaccine in July as the company enters the final stage of testing.

Headlines: U.S. cannot shut down economy again, Treasury's Mnuchin says
Description: The United States cannot let the coronavirus shut down its economy again, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday, adding that more than $1 trillion in rescue funds will flow into the economy over the next month.

Headlines: Delta rolling out COVID-19 testing for all employees
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc next week is launching a program to test employees for active COVID-19 and antibodies under a partnership with the Mayo Clinic and Quest Diagnostics Inc, Chief Executive Ed Bastian said in an employee memo on Thursday.

Headlines: PayPal pledges over $500 million to support minority-owned U.S. businesses
Description: PayPal Holdings Inc  said on Thursday it was pledging $530 million to support black and minority-owned businesses in the United States and foster diversity, amid worldwide protests over racial injustice.

Headlines: Japan's Takeda to sell some Asia-focused drugs to Celltrion for $278 million
Description: Takeda Pharmaceutical Co Ltd  has agreed to sell a portfolio of over-the-counter and prescription drugs marketed in the Asia Pacific region to South Korea's Celltrion Inc  for $278 million, it said on Thursday

Headlines: Exclusive: Pershing Square's Ackman eyes $1 billion-plus 'blank-check' company - sources
Description: Billionaire investor William Ackman's hedge fund Pershing Square Capital Management has filed confidentially with U.S. regulators for an initial public offering (IPO) of a blank-check investment vehicle that could raise more than $1 billion and be the biggest of its kind, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Factbox: Unilever's bid to end Anglo-Dutch dual-headed structure
Description: Anglo-Dutch Unilever   plans to become a single holding company based in Britain, unwinding a dual-headed structure which has been in place for 90 years.

Headlines: Bombardier to cut up to 600 jobs in Northern Ireland
Description: Planemaker Bombardier Inc  is to cut up to 600 jobs in its Northern Ireland operations, it said on Thursday, as part of plans announced last week to cut 2,500 jobs or about 11% of the workforce in its global aviation unit.

Headlines: JPMorgan's Wikmark takes new role as co-head of Nordics banking: memo
Description: JPMorgan  has promoted Jonas Wikmark as co-head of Nordics banking to drive growth in one of its major European markets, according to a memo seen by Reuters.

Headlines: China, U.S. should resume timely communication on trade: China adviser
Description: China and the United States should resume timely communication on trade and other issues, an adviser to the Chinese cabinet said on Thursday, stressing that the world's two biggest economies are too intertwined to be decoupled.

Headlines: Fiat, PSA face EU antitrust probe over $50 billion merger: sources
Description: Fiat Chrysler  and Peugeot maker PSA  face a lengthy EU antitrust investigation after declining to offer concessions to allay EU antitrust concerns about their planned $50 billion merger, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: EU to file antitrust complaint against Amazon over treatment of third party sellers: WSJ
Description: The European Union is planning on filing formal antitrust charges against Amazon.com Inc  over its treatment of third-party sellers, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Outside panel to review Samsung heir Lee's case: Seoul prosecutors
Description: An outside panel will weigh the validity of an investigation into Samsung Group heir Jay Y. Lee over a 2015 merger and alleged accounting fraud, the Seoul Central District Prosecutors' Office said on Thursday.

Headlines: Walmart to stop keeping 'multicultural' beauty products in locked display cases
Description: Walmart Inc  will stop keeping personal care products designed for people of color in locked display cases, the retailer said, after the practice drew flak online with many saying it suggested customers for these products cannot be trusted.

Headlines: Renault nationalisation, state cash injection not on the table: chairman
Description: A further investment by the French government in Renault's  capital would not be the most pertinent or useful use of state resources, the carmaker's chairman said on Thursday, adding that nationalisation of the firm was not being contemplated.

Headlines: Biting passenger delays flight? No compensation needed, says EU court
Description: Airlines don't need to compensate passengers if a flight is delayed by one person biting another as it is an "extraordinary circumstance", the EU's top court ruled on Thursday after a customer sued Portuguese airline TAP over such an incident.

Headlines: 'Fifty drivers fight for one order': Southeast Asia gig economy slammed by virus
Description: Indonesian motorcycle taxi driver Aji chain-smokes and checks his smartphone constantly while waiting for orders by the roadside in downtown Jakarta on a hot June morning, but is staring at the prospect of another fruitless day.

Headlines: SoftBank buyback puts financial rigour in question, says S&P
Description: Credit-rating firm S&P Global Ratings on Thursday questioned SoftBank Group Corp's financial discipline as the tech conglomerate pursues a massive 2.5 trillion yen ($24 billion) share buyback program in volatile markets.

Headlines: Renault's Senard says relations with Nissan much improved
Description: Renault 's partnership with Japan's Nissan  has entered an "incredibly positive" phase after episodes of strained relations in recent years, the French carmaker's chairman Jean-Dominique Senard said on Thursday.

Headlines: Unilever's UK move is vote of confidence: British minister
Description: Unilever's decision to base the company solely in Britain and not in the Netherlands represented a vote of confidence in the country, said British business minister Alok Sharma.

Headlines: Dutch government regrets Unilever's British HQ decision
Description: The Dutch government on Thursday said it regretted Unilever's  choice to base the company solely in Britain and not in the Netherlands.

Headlines: Nokia names new finance chief in management revamp
Description: Finnish telecoms equipment maker Nokia  named a new finance chief on Thursday, completing an overhaul of its top executive team as it battles rivals Ericsson  and Huawei [HWT.UL] for work on lucrative 5G networks.

Headlines: China auto sales up for second straight month after almost two-year slump
Description: China's auto sales in May rose 14.5% from the same month a year earlier, industry data showed on Thursday, the second consecutive month of increase as the world's biggest vehicle market recovers from lows hit during coronavirus lockdowns.

Headlines: Tesla wins China approval to build Model 3 vehicles with LFP batteries: ministry
Description: Tesla Inc  has received government approval to build Model 3 vehicles in China equipped with lithium iron phosphate (LFP) batteries, a document on Ministry of Industry and Information Technology website showed.

Headlines: Heathrow starts voluntary redundancy scheme, can't rule out more job losses
Description: Britain's Heathrow Airport, which before the coronavirus pandemic was the busiest in Europe, said it had started a voluntary redundancy scheme after passenger numbers fell to an all-time low and it could not rule out further job losses.

Headlines: Europe sets sights on dud antibody tests amid COVID-19 free-for-all
Description: The market for COVID-19 antibody tests is red-hot. It has ballooned in a matter of months as hundreds of products flood the world for people who want to find out whether they've already had the virus.

Headlines: Despite pandemic, new U.S. solar capacity will grow 33% in 2020
Description: New U.S. solar installations will increase by a third this year, a report published on Thursday showed, as soaring demand by utilities for carbon-free power more than outweighs a dramatic decline in rooftop system orders for homes and businesses due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Factbox: How ride-hailers around the world are coping with the virus pummeling
Description: Battered by lockdowns and movement restrictions in the coronavirus pandemic, ride-hailers around the world are cutting jobs and pay, and slashing other costs. In Southeast Asia, the pandemic has raised doubts whether the ride-hailing firms can maintain their promise of improving the lives of millions of poor.

Headlines: Amazon pauses police use of its facial recognition tech for a year
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Wednesday said it was implementing a one-year moratorium on police use of its facial recognition software, halting a business it long defended as many protested law enforcement brutality against people of color.

Headlines: Tyson Foods says cooperating with DoJ in chicken price-fixing probe
Description: Tyson Foods Inc said on Wednesday it was cooperating with the U.S. Department of Justice on a price-fixing investigation in the poultry industry, under a program that could protect the meat processor from criminal prosecution.

Headlines: Ford recalls 2.15 million U.S. vehicles for potentially faulty door latches
Description: Ford Motor Co said on Wednesday it will recall 2.15 million U.S. vehicles with potentially faulty door latches.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs employees to start returning to U.S. offices from June 22
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  said on Wednesday it plans to start the return of an initial group of its employees to its offices in New York, Jersey City, Dallas and Salt Lake City from June 22.

Headlines: U.S. companies vow to fight racism but face critics on diversity
Description: In the past, U.S. corporations have largely remained silent as protests erupted over killings of African-Americans by police officers. That changed with the May 25 death of George Floyd in Minneapolis, which has set off a flurry of corporate statements of solidarity with the black community – along with pledges of more than $1.7 billion to advance racial justice and equity.

Headlines: Lufthansa says up to 26,000 employees at risk of losing jobs
Description: Lufthansa  admitted on Wednesday that the positions of up to 26,000 employees are surplus to requirements, suggesting many more jobs will be cut at the German carrier than a figure of more than 10,000 flagged a few weeks ago.

Headlines: Boeing aims for key 737 MAX certification flight in late June: sources
Description: Boeing Co  is aiming to conduct a key certification test flight on its grounded 737 MAX jet in late June, two people briefed on the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fed vows to support U.S. economy's 'long road' to recovery after dire 2020
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Wednesday signaled it plans years of extraordinary support for an economy facing a torturous slog back from the coronavirus pandemic, with policymakers projecting the economy to shrink 6.5% in 2020 and the unemployment rate to be 9.3% at year's end.

Headlines: Asia stocks set to fall on Fed's dour outlook
Description: Asian stocks were set to fall on Thursday after gloomy economic projections from the U.S. Federal Reserve sent the greenback and most Wall Street shares lower.

Headlines: American Airlines CEO says burning less cash but demand outlook still uncertain
Description: American Airlines Chief Executive Doug Parker said on Wednesday that he expects a daily cash burn of about $40 million in June, down from a previous forecast of $50 million per day, thanks to cost-savings measures to address the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: White House works to move stalled airline contact tracing plan: sources
Description: The White House wants a plan in place by Sept. 1 for airlines to collect contact tracing information from U.S.-bound international passengers, but will not immediately implement a Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) proposal, three people briefed on the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Tailored Brands may seek Chapter 11 protection if COVID effect continues
Description: Men's Wearhouse owner Tailored Brands Inc  said on Wednesday it may have to seek bankruptcy protection or discontinue operations, if the COVID-19 crisis continues to pummel sales.

Headlines: S&P 500, Dow finish lower in volatile trade on dour Fed forecasts
Description: The Dow and S&P 500 ended a choppy session lower on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve reassured investors of its support for the economy but projected a 6.5% decline in gross domestic product this year.

Headlines: Starbucks forecasts over $2 billion drop in quarterly income as COVID-19 hits
Description: Starbucks Corp  said on Wednesday it expects current-quarter operating income to plunge by up to $2.2 billion, and sales to decline for the rest of the year even as nearly all its cafes have reopened following easing of coronavirus lockdowns.

Headlines: Fed shifts tone from repeated lockdown fears to jobs focus
Description: At Fed Chair Jerome Powell's policy meeting press conference six weeks ago he talked repeatedly about the possibility of second and third waves of the novel coronavirus in the months ahead and the havoc that could wreak on the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Europe's Just Eat Takeaway to buy U.S. delivery firm Grubhub for $7.3 billion
Description: European food ordering firm Just Eat Takeaway.com NV  on Wednesday announced a $7.3 billion deal to buy U.S. food delivery firm Grubhub Inc  and create the world's biggest food delivery company outside of China.

Headlines: Boeing supplier Spirit announces layoffs due to virus, 737 MAX impacts
Description: Aircraft parts maker Spirit AeroSystems Holdings Inc  announced on Wednesday a 21-day layoff for staff doing production and support work for Boeing Co's  737 program.

Headlines: Better three months late than never for Fed 'Main Street' loans, Powell says
Description: It is not too late for small and medium-sized U.S. businesses to benefit from the Federal Reserve's "Main Street" lending program, Chair Jerome Powell said on Wednesday, even though its launch in the coming days will be nearly three months after the central bank announced the nearly $600 billion program.

Headlines: Possible Fed move to cap yield rise could further weaken U.S. dollar
Description: The U.S. dollar would probably come under further pressure if the Federal Reserve adopts targets for U.S. Treasury yields that would limit their rise and ensure that interest rates remain near zero for some time.

Headlines: Tesla shares surge past $1,000 as Musk revs up the Semi
Description: Tesla Inc's  stock jumped above $1,000 a share on Wednesday after Chief Executive Elon Musk told his staff it was time to bring the Tesla Semi commercial truck to "volume production."

Headlines: Dollar, stocks slip as Fed signals slow growth
Description: The dollar slid to a three-month low and a gauge of global stocks fell on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve projected a more sluggish recovery than the market expected, but the Nasdaq hit a fresh high on expectations of low interest rates past 2022.

Headlines: ConocoPhillips CEO says surprised by swift recovery in oil prices
Description: ConocoPhillips  Chief Executive Officer Ryan Lance on Wednesday expressed surprise at the quick rebound in U.S. oil prices that slipped into the negative territory in April and said he expects prices to remain volatile in the near term.

Headlines: Nikola in talks with automakers for Badger pickup truck production: founder
Description: Nikola Corp , a maker of hydrogen-fueled vehicles, is in the process of picking a partner to produce its Badger pickup truck, while also aiming to start deliveries of its electric commercial big rigs next year, founder Trevor Milton said on Wednesday.

Headlines: American, Delta say demand uptick helping cash burn; United requiring health checklists
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  and Delta Air Lines Inc  said on Wednesday that a modest recovery in demand was helping to slow daily cash burn rates in June after the U.S. government reported record low passenger numbers in April amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Instant View: Fed sees GDP falling 6.5% in 2020, keeps rates at zero
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Wednesday signaled years of extraordinary support for an economy facing a torturous slog back from the coronavirus pandemic, with policymakers projecting a 6.5% decline in gross domestic product this year and a 9.3% unemployment rate at year's end.

Headlines: Oil edges higher, even as U.S. inventory rise revives glut worries
Description: Oil rebounded from earlier losses on Wednesday, even as U.S. data showed crude inventories rose to a record high, reviving worries of a persistent glut due to weak demand.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury chief says considering more direct payments in next coronavirus aid bill
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Wednesday he would seriously consider more direct payments to individuals in the next phase of coronavirus rescue legislation, adding that funds should also be targeted to help sectors struggling to reopen, including hospitality and tourism.

Headlines: Dollar sinks to three-month lows as Fed keeps easing policy
Description: The dollar extended losses, dropping to a fresh three-month low against a basket of major currencies on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve made no policy changes, as expected, and pledged to continue its asset purchases aimed at stabilizing a U.S. economy that has been ravaged by the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. inflation subdued with economy in recession
Description: U.S. consumer prices fell for a third straight month in May and underlying inflation was weak as demand for goods and services remained subdued amid a recession caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Mall operator Simon Property abandons $3.6 billion acquisition of Taubman
Description: Simon Property Group Inc , the biggest U.S. mall operator, said on Wednesday it was ending its $3.6-billion deal to buy Taubman Centers Inc , citing the beating the retail sector has taken during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Congress seeks answers on Juniper Networks breach amid encryption fight
Description: A group of U.S. lawmakers preparing to fight a legislative attack on encrypted communications is trying to establish what happened when encryption was subverted at a Silicon Valley maker of networking gear.

Headlines: U.S. May deficit nearly doubles to $399 billion
Description: The U.S. federal budget deficit in May nearly doubled to $399 billion from a year earlier amid continued strong spending on coronavirus relief programs and a 25% drop in receipts, the Treasury Department said on Wednesday.

Headlines: J&J moves up start of coronavirus vaccine human trials to July
Description: Johnson & Johnson moved up the start of human clinical trials for its experimental vaccine against the highly contagious coronavirus by two months to the second half of July, as the drugmaker rushes to develop a prevention for COVID-19, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: OECD sees deepest peace-time slump in a century
Description: The global economy will suffer the biggest peace-time downturn in a century before it emerges next year from a coronavirus-inflicted recession, the OECD said on Wednesday.

Headlines: A casino or stock market? Retail buying frenzy goes wild
Description: A raft of small cap stocks has soared by hundreds of millions of dollars in value in recent weeks as frenzied retail traders piled in to a blistering stocks rally.

Headlines: Delta expects second-quarter revenue to slump, looks to amend debt deals
Description: U.S. carrier Delta Air Lines  on Wednesday forecast a 90% plunge in second-quarter revenue and warned it would need to renegotiate its debt agreements to avoid a default next year.

Headlines: Global risk rally has a powerful ally: the weaker dollar
Description: Investors are betting a weaker U.S. dollar will further boost a rally that has seen stocks, emerging market currencies and other risky assets soar in recent weeks.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs forms fund to address racial injustice
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  said on Wednesday it had launched a $10 million fund to support the work of organizations addressing racial injustice, structural inequity and economic disparity.

Headlines: UK watchdog extends deadline for final ruling on Amazon's Deliveroo deal
Description: Britain's competition regulator has given itself two more months to make a final ruling on Amazon's  purchase of a minority stake in online delivery group Deliveroo so it can take full account of representations from all interested parties.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico business set to absorb two internal units
Description: The Mexican unit of U.S. retailer Walmart said on Wednesday a shareholder meeting would discuss the absorption of two internal units, Holding de Restaurantes y Servicios and Tiendas Wal-Mart.

Headlines: Emirates airline redundancies continue for second day, sources say
Description: Emirates laid off more pilots and cabin crew on Wednesday in a second day of redundancies at one of the world's biggest long-haul airlines, three company sources said.

Headlines: Ford, Volkswagen target 8 million vehicles in van alliance
Description: Ford Motor Co  and Volkswagen AG  said on Wednesday they would make up to 8 million units of medium pickup trucks and commercial vans over the lifecycle of the vehicles as part of an alliance announced last year.

Headlines: Goldman traders gain $1 billion in commodities revenue after oil slump
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  commodities unit generated more than $1 billion in revenue this year through May as traders positioned their bets for the collapse in oil prices, a source familiar with the group's finances said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Twitter, Square to make June 19 a holiday to support racial diversity
Description: Jack Dorsey, the chief executive of Square Inc and Twitter Inc, said June 19, popularly known as 'Juneteenth', would be a permanent company-wide holiday in the United States to show support for racial diversity.

Headlines: Ford to return to pre-COVID production rates in U.S. plants by early July, COO says
Description: Ford Motor Co  expects to have its U.S. vehicle assembly plants return by early July to building at the rates they did before the coronavirus pandemic shut down the U.S. auto industry for two months, a top executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Airlines heading for $84 billion loss this year: IATA
Description: (This June 9 story corrects to show combined 2020-2021 loss forecast about $100 billion, paragraph 5)

Headlines: Cerberus demands changes at 'disastrous' Commerzbank
Description: U.S. activist investor Cerberus is calling on Commerzbank  to appoint two of its nominees to the supervisory board, cut costs and adopt a new strategy, as it battles to make a success of a big bet on German banks.

Headlines: Exclusive: ECB prepares 'bad bank' plan for wave of coronavirus toxic debt
Description: European Central Bank officials are drawing up a scheme to cope with potentially hundreds of billions of euros of unpaid loans in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler plans to resume Panda production on June 16: union
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA)  plans to resume production of its Panda small car at its plant in Pomigliano, near Naples in southern Italy, on June 16, a union representative said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Reddit names Michael Seibel to board after Ohanian's call for black candidate
Description: Social network company Reddit on Wednesday named venture capital investor Michael Seibel to its board, days after co-founder and former director Alexis Ohanian resigned and called for the company to replace him with a black candidate.

Headlines: Exclusive: RWE, Thyssenkrupp plan hydrogen production venture
Description: Germany's RWE plans to produce hydrogen from renewable energy to supply steelmaker Thyssenkrupp, the two companies told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. banks prepare branches for gradual post-coronavirus re-opening
Description: U.S. banks have been stocking up on masks and other supplies and setting up acrylic barriers to prevent spreading the novel coronavirus as they ready their branches for the country's gradual reopening, executives and suppliers told Reuters.

Headlines: Adidas pledges to hire more black and Latino staff
Description: German sportswear brand Adidas  has pledged to invest $20 million in the black community in the United States and make sure that at least 30% of all new U.S. jobs are filled with black and Latino people at its Adidas and Reebok brands.

Headlines: Carmakers must overhaul production plans to hit climate goals: report
Description: The world's 14 biggest carmakers are on course to miss globally agreed climate targets, a leading sustainable finance think tank said on Wednesday, urging investors to do more to pressure boards to change their production plans.

Headlines: NATO chief says on Huawei: UK review of 5G security is important
Description: The head of the NATO military alliance said on Wednesday that the West could not ignore the rise of China and so it was important that Britain had a review of the role of Huawei in its 5G network to ensure its security.

Headlines: Bank of England ready to replenish its COVID-19 warchest
Description: The Bank of England looks set to give itself at least another 100 billion pounds ($127 billion) in bond-buying firepower next week to try to stop the coronavirus crisis from inflicting further damage on Britain's economy.

Headlines: Finnair seeks 500 million euros from shareholders to cope with crisis
Description: Finnair  launched a share sale on Wednesday to raise 500 million euros ($568 million) from its existing investors, almost as much as its current market value as it seeks to strengthen its finances to cope with the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Explainer: How will Britain pay for coronavirus borrowing?
Description: British government borrowing is soaring to levels not seen since World War Two, something Prime Minister Boris Johnson and his finance minister Rishi Sunak will try to fix once the worst of the coronavirus crisis has passed.

Headlines: Germany should make provisions to ensure banks have sufficient capital: OECD
Description: Germany should make provisions to ensure banks have sufficient capital in case of a wave of bankruptcies in Europe's largest economy caused by the coronavirus crisis, a senior OECD economist said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Pompeo chides HSBC for 'corporate kowtow' to Beijing
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Tuesday chided British bank HSBC  for backing moves by China to end Hong Kong's autonomy, saying such "corporate kowtows" got little in return from Beijing.

Headlines: Credit Suisse CEO sees business 'going in right direction'
Description: Business conditions are improving after a tough start to the year, Credit Suisse  Chief Executive Thomas Gottstein said in a presentation released on Wednesday.

Headlines: Julius Baer faces investigation over ties to Argentine client: Neue Zuercher Zeitung
Description: Swiss private bank Julius Baer  faces investigation by watchdog FINMA over whether it followed correct procedures against money laundering in its ties with a former Argentine client, the Neue Zuercher Zeitung newspaper said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Cathay Pacific plans to repay Hong Kong government over three to five years
Description: Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd  said it expects to repay the Hong Kong government for HK$19.5 billion ($2.52 billion) of preference shares over a three to five year period.

Headlines: Cathay Pacific shares hit three-and-half-month high after rescue package, outlook uncertain
Description: Shares of Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd  surged as much as 18.7% on Wednesday, reaching their highest level since Feb. 24, after the carrier announced a HK$39 billion ($5 billion) recapitalisation plan led by the Hong Kong government.

Headlines: Chinese companies put U.S. listing plans on ice as tensions mount
