Description: Chinese companies are putting off plans for U.S. listings as tensions between the world's top two economies rise, lawyers, bankers, accountants and regulators involved in what has been a major capital-raising route told Reuters.

Headlines: China factory gate deflation deepens on global demand slump
Description: China's producer prices fell by the sharpest rate in more than four years, underscoring pressure on the manufacturing sector as the COVID-19 pandemic reduces trade flows and global demand.

Headlines: Oil drops after U.S. inventory build renews oversupply concerns
Description: Oil prices fell on Wednesday as an industry report showed a rise in crude and fuel inventories in the United States, renewing concerns about oversupply and slumping fuel demand in the world's largest crude consumer.

Headlines: DoubleLine's Gundlach bearish on U.S. dollar, says stocks 'lofty'
Description: The U.S. dollar is unlikely to make significant moves higher in the near term because of the ballooning budget deficit, Jeffrey Gundlach, the billionaire chief executive of DoubleLine Capital, said on a webcast presentation on Tuesday.

Headlines: Investors brace for market swings as Trump slips in election polls
Description: The U.S. presidential election is re-emerging as a potential risk to markets after a shift in polls that has seen President Donald Trump lose ground to Democrat Joe Biden.

Headlines: FCC awarding up to $16 billion to address U.S. areas lacking broadband service
Description: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission voted on Tuesday to adopt auction procedures to provide up to $16 billion to areas that lack broadband service, including nearly 6 million

Headlines: S&P 500, Dow ease as focus shifts to Fed; tech pushes Nasdaq to closing record
Description: The S&P 500 and Dow fell on Tuesday, pausing after recent strong gains as focus shifted to the Federal Reserve, while the Nasdaq ended at an all-time high for a second straight day after briefly rising above the 10,000 mark for the first time.

Headlines: Stocks trend lower as investors step back, safe-havens rally
Description: A recent run of optimism in markets hit the brakes on Tuesday as investors mostly pulled back from stocks, though the Nasdaq extended its record run to a new high, while the safe-haven yen, Swiss franc and gold rallied.

Headlines: Thousands of Vodafone UK customers face call connection problems
Description: Thousands of British customers of Vodafone Group Plc , the world's second-biggest mobile operator, faced call connection problems on Tuesday evening, although they were resolved within an hour.

Headlines: Oil rises as production curbs offset renewed demand fear
Description: Oil prices rose on Tuesday, as optimism about recent commitments from major oil producers to curb production offset concerns that a resurgence in coronavirus cases could hurt fuel demand.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley's Gorman says worst behind, sees smaller reserve build in second quarter
Description: Morgan Stanley  Chief Executive Officer James Gorman said on Tuesday the bank expects to set aside a smaller amount of money for potential loan losses in the current quarter, compared with the first quarter.

Headlines: What to look for in the Fed's U.S. economic outlook
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve policymakers on Wednesday will publish their first economic projections since the coronavirus pandemic set off a recession in February, estimates expected to signal a collapse in output this year and near-zero interest rates for the next few years.

Headlines: FCC proposes record $225 million fine for massive robocall campaign
Description: The Federal Communications Commission on Tuesday voted unanimously to propose a record-setting $225 million fine against Texas-based health insurance telemarketers for allegedly making approximately 1 billion illegal robocalls.

Headlines: Exclusive: Chanel, Revlon, L'Oreal pivoting away from talc in some products
Description: Chanel, Revlon and L'Oreal, three of the biggest brands in cosmetics, are quietly moving away from using talc in some products as U.S. cancer lawsuits and consumer concerns mount.

Headlines: Macy's says return to normal business at least a year away
Description: Macy's Inc  warned on Tuesday its business was not likely to return to normal until late next year, even as it saw better-than-expected sales from stores reopening after COVID-19 lockdowns were lifted across the United States.

Headlines: Boeing jet deliveries sink to just four in May
Description: Boeing Co  deliveries slowed even further in May from April as the coronavirus pandemic's crushing impact on airlines added to a year of crisis following the grounding of its 737 MAX planes, company data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. layoffs ease in April; hiring slumps to record low
Description: Layoffs in the United States fell in April, but remained the second highest on record, while hiring hit an all-time low, suggesting the labor market could take years to recover from the COVID-19 crisis despite a surprise rebound in employment in May.

Headlines: Volkswagen CEO apologises after row with supervisory board
Description: Volkswagen  CEO Herbert Diess has apologised to the carmaker's supervisory board after accusing some of its members of leaking confidential information to the press.

Headlines: Corning wins U.S. funding to boost vial output for COVID-19 vaccines
Description: Glass maker Corning Inc  said on Tuesday it would receive $204 million from the U.S. government to boost the manufacturing capacity of its vials that will be used to store coronavirus vaccines and treatments.

Headlines: Barclays labels Staveley lawsuit 'distorted and exaggerated'
Description: Barclays  has dismissed as "distorted and exaggerated" legal arguments by financier Amanda Staveley, who is claiming up to 1.5 billion pounds in damages for alleged deceit over a financial crisis-era fundraising in a high-profile London trial.

Headlines: Exclusive: Savings surge forces Goldman to shut Marcus to new UK clients
Description: Goldman Sachs  is closing its easy access savings business to new customers in Britain from Wednesday after deposits surged near to regulatory limits during the coronavirus lockdown.

Headlines: Tiffany amends debt pacts for financial leeway amid pandemic, slump in sales
Description: U.S. luxury jeweler Tiffany & Co , which is being bought by France's LVMH for $16 billion, said on Tuesday it had amended some of its debt agreements to gain more financial leeway amid the coronavirus pandemic after its quarterly sales sank 44%.

Headlines: EU weighs single bid for WTO job; trade chief Hogan confirms interest
Description: European Trade Commissioner Phil Hogan confirmed on Tuesday that he was considering a bid to become the next director-general of the World Trade Organization, as EU governments debated whether to unify around a single European candidate.

Headlines: Vitol veteran Taylor, who transformed oil trade, dies aged 64
Description: Ian Taylor, who built Vitol into the world's biggest oil trader, has died from pneumonia at the age of 64, the company said on Tuesday, after surviving bouts of cancer and a stroke last year.

Headlines: Factbox: Why Tiffany's debt obligations matter for its sale to LVMH
Description: U.S. jewelry chain Tiffany & Co  said on Tuesday that it amended some of the terms of its debt to give it financial breathing space, as it seeks to ensure that its $16.2 billion sale to French luxury goods giant LVMH is completed.

Headlines: U.S. economy entered recession in February, business cycle arbiter says
Description: (This June 8 story corrects GDP decline in paragraph 6 to 5.0% from 4.8%)

Headlines: Singapore's migrant workers fear financial ruin after virus ordeal
Description: As Sharif Uddin contemplates leaving the cramped Singapore dormitory where he has spent weeks under coronavirus quarantine, fears about his future creep in.

Headlines: S&P cuts Japan's debt outlook as spending surges during pandemic
Description: S&P Global Ratings on Tuesday lowered its outlook on Japan's sovereign debt rating to stable from positive, citing increased uncertainty over the country's fiscal health as it boosts spending to overcome the effects of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: HSBC cuts year-end 10-year UK gilt yield forecast to 0%
Description: HSBC  said on Tuesday that it had lowered its year-end forecast on 10-year British government bond yields to 0%, given a small probability of negative interest rates and a sense that rates will stay low for a long period.

Headlines: Volkswagen replaces Herbert Diess as CEO of the VW brand
Description: Volkswagen  replaced Herbert Diess as chief executive of the VW brand on Monday and installed chief operating officer Ralf Brandstaetter to lead cost cutting efforts at the company's largest plants in Germany.

Headlines: Hong Kong spearheads $5 billion Cathay Pacific rescue package
Description: Hong Kong will lead a $5 billion rescue of Cathay Pacific Airways , which like other airlines has been hit by a global travel slump triggered by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Prepping portfolios for next market storm? Not just gold and govvies
Description: G7 government bonds? Check. Gold? Check. But that may not be enough as the coronavirus crisis accelerates a hunt for a wider pool of assets to better balance investment portfolios during stressful times.

Headlines: Household spending plunge pulls down euro zone GDP in first quarter
Description: A plunge in household spending and investment pulled down euro zone gross domestic product in the first quarter as the COVID-19 pandemic struck, but the fall was slightly smaller than first estimated, the European Union's statistics office said.

Headlines: U.S. failed to properly oversee Chinese telecom carriers: Senate panel
Description: A U.S. Senate report released Tuesday says the U.S. government failed to properly oversee Chinese-owned telecommunications companies for nearly two decades.

Headlines: Japanese traders gird for Fed to anchor yields, clip dollar's wings
Description: Japanese investors have clipped the wings of a resurgent U.S. dollar as they position for the likelihood that the U.S. Federal Reserve will take steps to flatten the Treasury yield curve.

Headlines: Exclusive: Banks to Berlin - Loosen coronavirus cash rules for firms
Description: Germany's bank lobby is set to urge the government to drop some of the conditions attached to a trillion euro rescue scheme, arguing that companies are so reluctant to take the help that it threatens any recovery from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Hong Kong government says does not intend to hold Cathay Pacific stake long-term
Description: Hong Kong's government does not intend to hold a stake in Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd  long term after leading a rescue package to help it through the coronavirus pandemic, Finance Secretary Paul Chan said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Hong Kong government to lead $5 billion rescue package for Cathay Pacific
Description: Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd  announced on Tuesday a recapitalisation plan worth HK$39 billion ($5.03 billion) led by the Hong Kong government to help it weather the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: No ware to sell: Beijing's street vendors back on the run
Description: Clad in black, Beijing's city inspectors descended on street vendors this week and ordered them to clear out, just days after the Chinese premier had sparked a rush to set up curbside stalls by praising them as a creator of jobs in the coronavirus-hit economy.

Headlines: TSMC says could fill order gap if unable to sell chips to Huawei
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd (TSMC)  could quickly fill any order gap should U.S. restrictions against Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] prevent sales to the Chinese firm, the company's chairman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Once bitten, not shy: Investors again seek margin loans as stocks rally
Description: Global banks are seeing renewed appetite from wealth management clients to borrow money to buy stocks as markets rebound, bankers said, which comes just months after the strategy burned some investors.

Headlines: South Korean court denies arrest warrant request for Samsung heir
Description: A South Korean court on Tuesday denied an arrest warrant request for Samsung Group heir Jay Y. Lee after prosecutors accused him of accounting fraud and stock manipulation.

Headlines: TSMC says still in talks about subsidies for new U.S. plant
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd (TSMC)  is still in talks with the U.S. government about subsidies for its new plant in Arizona, chairman Mark Liu said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Chinese telecom firms urge FCC not to revoke ability to operate in U.S.
Description: The U.S. units of China Telecom Corp’s  and China Unicom  urged the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) not to revoke the company's nearly two-decade old authorization to provide international telecommunications services to and from the United States.

Headlines: Australia shakes up foreign investment laws for national security
Description: Australia announced the biggest shakeup of its foreign investment laws in almost half a century on Friday, including giving the government the power to force the sale of a business if it creates a national security risk.

Headlines: Factbox: Deals that may be affected by Australia's foreign M&A crackdown
Description: (This June 5 story corrects paragraph 6 to show stake in common facilities being sold)

Headlines: IBM exits facial recognition business, calls for police reform
Description: International Business Machines Corp  disclosed Monday it will no longer offer facial recognition or analysis software in a letter to Congress calling for new efforts to pursue justice and racial equity, new Chief Executive Officer Arvind Krishna said.

Headlines: Men accused of helping ex-Nissan boss flee Japan challenge U.S. extradition case
Description: Lawyers for the former Green Beret and son wanted by Japan for helping former Nissan Motor Co boss Carlos Ghosn flee the country on Monday argued U.S. authorities wrongly arrested them for aiding a crime that they say does not exist in Japan: bail jumping.

Headlines: China's troubled Baoshang rescue exposes fault lines in bank reform drive
Description: In May 2019, China's central bank announced a shock takeover of a lender, its first such move in 20 years, citing "serious credit risks". Creditors in small Baoshang Bank were to take a hit, assets would be sold and an example set for governance.

Headlines: Nasdaq ends at record, confirms bull market on economic recovery hopes
Description: The Nasdaq posted a record closing high on Monday, becoming the first of the major indexes to confirm a new bull market, while the S&P 500 ended in positive territory for the year as expectations for a swift recovery from a coronavirus-driven downturn increased.

Headlines: Macy's raises $4.5 billion to shore up funds as stores reopen, shares surge
Description: Macy's Inc  said on Monday it raised a total of $4.5 billion, including $3.15 billion in new borrowings against its real estate assets, as the department store chain tries to navigate through the fallout from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: GE reopens parts of prior debt offerings to raise $3 billion
Description: General Electric Co  said on Monday it reopened portions of its prior debt offerings for $3 billion in total proceeds to boost its cash reserves amid the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Stocks rally on quick economic revival hopes, oil slides
Description: Global equity markets surged on Monday, with the Nasdaq hitting a record high on hopes of a quick recovery from the coronavirus slump, while oil slid after Saudi Arabia said new output cuts by producer nations would not include extra cuts by three Gulf countries.

Headlines: Nasdaq hits record high as U.S. recession becomes official
Description: On the same day that the Nasdaq marked a new bull market, the U.S. economy was officially declared to be in a recession. The two milestones on Monday illustrate how an 11-week surge in stocks has occurred despite widespread economic devastation fueled by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: JetBlue to fly about 50% of July schedule, more in August: CNBC interview
Description: JetBlue Airways Corp  expects to fly about half of its original schedule in July, up from about 25% to 30% in June, and a bit more in August as leisure demand begins to recover, Chief Executive Robin Hayes told CNBC in an interview on Monday.

Headlines: PG&E plans $5.75 billion equity raise to fund bankruptcy exit
Description: California-based power provider PG&E Corp said on Monday it plans to raise $5.75 billion from public offerings as it tries to emerge from Chapter 11 bankruptcy by the end of this month.

Headlines: Ryanair's O'Leary says UK quarantine will be quashed or dropped
Description: Ryanair boss Michael O'Leary said he believed Britain's coronavirus quarantine will be struck down by the courts or dropped within weeks as some of Europe's biggest airlines prepare to file a legal challenge by the end of Tuesday.

Headlines: Nestle confirms sale of Buitoni brand's North American business
Description: Nestle SA  is selling the North American business of its Buitoni pasta brand to private-equity firm Brynwood Partners, the Swiss food group said on Monday.

Headlines: Dunkin' franchisees to hire up to 25,000 workers as U.S. states reopen
Description: Dunkin', a unit of Dunkin' Brands Group Inc , said on Monday its franchisees are seeking to hire up to 25,000 workers as it prepares for higher demand, with U.S. states reopening after months-long lockdowns to contain the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Nasdaq sets new record, close to confirming bull market in place
Description: The Nasdaq Composite Index  rose to a new high on Monday, and looks on track to confirm that it was the first of Wall Street's main indexes to enter a bull market two and a half months ago, after Wall Street's nosedive on worries about the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: Volkswagen supervisory board to discuss VW brand leadership - sources
Description: Volkswagen  Chief Executive Herbert Diess may lose responsibility for managing the company's core VW brand at an extraordinary supervisory board meeting due to be held on Monday, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: VW says Stefan Sommer, board member for procurement to leave
Description: Volkswagen  said Stefan Sommer, group board member for procurement and components, will leave the company on June 30, 2020 as part of a broader management reshuffle.

Headlines: Lufthansa's Austrian arm gets 450 million euro government bailout
Description: Austria is granting Lufthansa's Austrian Airlines unit a 450 million euro ($508 million) bailout that will protect Vienna as a transit hub and safeguard "the bulk" of the flag carrier's 7,000 jobs, the government said on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Fiat, PSA merger hits EU roadblock, may need concessions - sources
Description: Fiat Chrysler's  planned $50 billion merger with Peugeot maker PSA  has hit a bump after EU regulators voiced concerns about the companies' market share in small vans, indicating concessions may be required, sources said.

Headlines: AstraZeneca, Gilead merger doubted by Wall Street analysts
Description: A merger between AstraZeneca  and Gilead Sciences Inc  is unlikely due to significant political hurdles, Wall Street analysts said on Monday after a Bloomberg report that the British drugmaker last month had contacted its U.S. rival about a deal.

Headlines: U.S. consumers grew slightly more optimistic about jobs and earnings in May
Description: U.S. consumers felt slightly more optimistic about their finances and job security in May as businesses began to reopen and rehire workers following the easing of coronavirus-related restrictions, according to a survey released on Monday by the New York Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Elanco wins conditional EU antitrust okay for $7.6 billion Bayer deal
Description: Elanco Animal Health  secured EU antitrust clearance on Monday to buy Bayer's  veterinary drugs unit after pledging to sell some products to address competition concerns about the $7.6 billion deal.

Headlines: Factbox: Who's bidding to be next World Trade Organization chief?
Description: The World Trade Organization (WTO) began the process on Monday of selecting a new director-general to replace Brazil's Roberto Azevedo, who is stepping down a year early at the end of August.

Headlines: British financier Staveley's $2 billion Barclays lawsuit hits High Court
Description: British buinesswoman Amanda Staveley's private equity firm told London's High Court on Monday it had received a "substantially worse" deal than Qatar when its syndicate invested billions of pounds in Barclays  during the financial crisis in 2008.

Headlines: Exclusive: Oil major BP to cut 15% of workforce
Description: BP will cut about 15% of its workforce in response to the coronavirus crisis and as part of Chief Executive Bernard Looney's plan to shift the oil and gas major to renewable energy, it said on Monday.

Headlines: Austria's Kurz to hold news conference on Austrian Airlines at 1500 GMT
Description: Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz, Vice Chancellor Werner Kogler and Finance Minister Gernot Bluemel will hold a news conference on Lufthansa unit Austrian Airlines at 5 p.m. (1500 GMT), the government said in a statement on Monday.

Headlines: Ryanair boss sees UK quarantine dropped or quashed by end-June
Description: Ryanair  believes Britain's courts will either strike down a 14-day quarantine for international travellers this week or the government will drop the measure before the end of June, boss Michael O'Leary told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: EU antitrust regulators reinforce case against Teva pay-for-delay deals
Description: EU antitrust enforcers, boosted by recent court victories, on Monday reinforced their case against Israeli drugmaker Teva over its deal with rival Cephalon to delay selling a generic version of its sleep disorder drug modafinil.

Headlines: Samsung leader appears in court, waits to hear if he'll be jailed again
Description: Samsung Group's leader, Jay Y. Lee, appeared before a South Korean court on Monday, awaiting a ruling on whether new allegations including accounting fraud and stock manipulation will send him back to jail after more than two years of freedom.

Headlines: Japan braces for worst postwar economic slump, pandemic tests policy response
Description: Japan's economy braced for its worst postwar slump even as first-quarter GDP contracted less than initially thought, as the coronavirus crisis slams the brakes on global growth and raises pressure on Tokyo to cushion the blow to business and consumers.

Headlines: EasyJet CEO says legal case against UK quarantine is strong
Description: Britain's quarantine plan was rushed into existence, is out of proportion and should be challenged in the courts, according to the head of easyJet which has joined rivals in threatening legal proceedings.

Headlines: U.S. Fed's Main Street lending facility likely to start with a whimper
Description: The Federal Reserve's most ambitious and complicated crisis relief program is set to launch in coming days but it is far from certain that the small and mid-sized businesses the $600 billion "Main Street Lending Facility" is meant to help will come clamoring for loans.

Headlines: Fed says beating pandemic is key, but how will it know things are better?
Description: With a full three months of responding to a global pandemic under their belt, U.S. Federal Reserve officials have united around one point: lasting progress on the economic front will be dictated by success in containing the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley flags risk oil price rally will lead to a fall
Description: Oil prices have quickly climbed to levels that raise the risk of price falls as demand is fragile, Morgan Stanley said on Monday, as benchmark crude hit its highest in three months.

Headlines: UK luxury brand Mulberry to cut 25% of workforce
Description: British luxury brand Mulberry  said on Monday it plans to cut 25% of its global workforce of about 1,500, seeking to reduce its cost base after demand was hit by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Scarred and scared: post-Covid consumers not their old selves
Description: Michael Clark of Amy's Housewares has one big fear as its London stores prepare to reopen on June 15 along with other retailers around Britain: "Customers not spending, having no trust in the economy."

Headlines: Tesla China sold 11,095 Model 3 vehicles in May, triple April's volume: CPCA
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc sold 11,095 Shanghai-made Model 3 vehicles in China in May, more than triple the volume seen in April, according to the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA).

Headlines: Galeries Lafayette's Champs Elysees store struggles as group faces $1 billion hit: CEO
Description: Galeries Lafayette's [GALP.UL] new outlet on the Champs Elysees is struggling because people are staying away from the famous Paris boulevard due to COVID-19, according to its CEO, who said the crisis would hit the group to the tune of 1 billion euros.

Headlines: Thai Airways rehabilitation may take up to seven years, legal advisor says
Description: The rehabilitation of flag carrier Thai Airways International Pcl  may take up to seven years, the airline's legal advisor said on Monday.

Headlines: HK residents rush for offshore bank accounts on China law worries: sources
Description: Banks including HSBC, Standard Chartered and Citigroup have seen a spike in enquiries from Hong Kong residents about opening offshore accounts amid concerns stemming from China's decision to impose a national security law on the city, five people said.

Headlines: Hong Kong activist investor David Webb to step back for health reasons
Description: Hong Kong activist investor David Webb has said he will step back from posting his widely read critiques of companies and the city's government after being diagnosed with prostate cancer.

Headlines: Jobs come first in South Korea's ambitious 'Green New Deal' climate plan
Description: The first stages of a South Korean government “Green New Deal” aiming to retool one of the world’s most fossil fuel-reliant economies is focused instead on protecting jobs as the country seeks to stimulate a virus-ravaged economy, activists say.

Headlines: Possibly millions of jobs could be lost if planes stay grounded, Heathrow boss says
Description: Hundreds of thousands of jobs, if not millions, could be lost in Britain if aviation is not able to resume quickly, the chief executive of London's Heathrow Airport said on Monday.

Headlines: Emerging market corporate credit quality down but not out
Description: The coronavirus pandemic has had a devastating impact on companies around the world, but in poorer emerging economies where balance sheets and credit ratings were already weak, the damage is looking particularly widespread.

Headlines: EasyJet directors Gurassa and Martin to step down from board this year
Description: Two non-executive directors of EasyJet  are to step down  from the board later this year in line with corporate governance best practice, having each served for nine years, the British airline said on Monday.

Headlines: Risk-taking billionaires offer rich reward for Credit Suisse
Description: Credit Suisse  is banking on risk-taking billionaires to drive revenue growth at its wealth management division.

Headlines: Coronavirus widens the cracks in Egypt's cement industry
Description: The coronavirus is putting Egypt's private cement industry under even more pressure.

Headlines: Gulf mall operators rein in expansion as retailers reel from COVID-19
Description: Mall operators in the Gulf region are delaying new mega-projects as the coronavirus pandemic and low oil prices upend a retail industry built around huge centres catering to tourists and wealthy locals.

Headlines: Europe's Detroit? Pandemic bursts Toulouse aerospace bubble
Description: Barely three months ago, Serge Dumas had one problem: how to keep up with record demand for the metal fasteners and bolts his small aerospace supply firm manufactures just north of Toulouse.

Headlines: Japan's service sector sentiment rises 7.6 points in May
Description: Japan's service sector sentiment index rose in May, a Cabinet Office survey showed on Monday, although the coronavirus pandemic continues to weigh on firms' business confidence.

Headlines: Japan's economy minister warns against deepening negative rates
Description: Japan should focus on back-stopping struggling businesses rather than trying to spark overall demand in fighting the coronavirus pandemic, its economy minister said, suggesting the central bank should avoid pushing interest rates deeper into negative territory.

Headlines: Instant View: Japan's economy braced for worst postwar slump despite capex gains in first-quarter GDP
Description: Japan's economy shrank less than initially estimated in the first quarter, revised data showed on Monday, but the broad impact from the coronavirus crisis is still expected to send the country deeper into recession.

Headlines: Mexico to propose NAFTA renegotiator to lead WTO: sources
Description: Mexico is set to propose senior trade official Jesus Seade, who helped rework the North American Free Trade Agreement, as a candidate to be the next director-general of the World Trade Organization (WTO), sources said on Sunday.

Headlines: Singapore Airlines secures $1 billion additional credit after rights issue
Description: Singapore Airlines Ltd  said on Monday that it had secured about $1 billion in credit facilities, in addition to the S$8.8 billion ($6.32 billion) it recently raised from a rights issue, to help it weather the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Samsung heir appears in court for arrest warrant hearing
Description: Samsung Group heir Jay Y. Lee appeared in court on Monday for a hearing to determine whether he should be jailed over allegations of accounting fraud, in his latest brush with the law at South Korea's top conglomerate.

Headlines: AstraZeneca contacted Gilead over potential megamerger: Bloomberg News
Description: Britain's AstraZeneca  has approached U.S. rival Gilead Sciences  about a possible merger to form one the world's largest drug companies, Bloomberg News reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Lufthansa CEO promises Germans a 'homecoming guarantee'
Description: Lufthansa will bring home any Germans it flies abroad on vacation, Chief Executive Carsten Spohr said in a newspaper interview, seeking to assuage holidaymakers' concerns that new coronavirus outbreaks could leave them stranded.

Headlines: BA, Ryanair, easyJet protest over 'wholly unjustified' UK quarantine plan
Description: Three airlines have written to the British government in protest at its "wholly unjustified and disproportionate" quarantine rules for most international arrivals from Monday, a copy of the letter seen by Reuters showed.

Headlines: Emirates, Etihad extend temporary salary cuts to September
Description: Gulf carriers Emirates and Etihad Airways are extending the period of reduced pay for their staff until September as they try to preserve cash during the global coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Rosneft says no change to dividend policy despite lower state stake
Description: Russia's largest oil producer Rosneft  said on Sunday it planned to maintain a dividend policy of paying out half of its net profit despite the state lowering its stake in the company to below 50%.

Headlines: Exclusive: Malaysia - Even $3 billion not enough to settle 1MDB case with Goldman
Description: Malaysia's new government would not be willing to accept even compensation of $3 billion from Goldman Sachs in a settlement over the 1MDB scandal, the finance minister told Reuters, ruling out a figure that is far higher than the bank offered last year.

Headlines: HSBC warns it could face reprisals in China if UK bans Huawei equipment: Telegraph
Description: HSBC Holdings Plc  Chairman Mark Tucker has warned Britain against a ban on networking equipment made by Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, claiming the bank could face reprisals in China, the Telegraph reported on Saturday.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg promises a review of content policies after backlash
Description: Facebook  CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Friday said he would consider changes to the policy that led the company to leave up controversial posts by President Donald Trump during recent demonstrations protesting the death of an unarmed black man while in police custody, a partial concession to critics.

Headlines: 'Am I going to get shot?' kids ask, as brands try to explain racism and violence to children
Description: For 8 minutes and 46 seconds - the time it took George Floyd, an unarmed black man, to die at the hands of Minneapolis police - cable TV kids channel Nickelodeon's screen went black on Tuesday to sounds of inhaling and exhaling, as white text flashed "I can't breathe."

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Bond investors look for Fed to justify steepening yield curve
Description: Expectations that the global economy has dodged the worst-case coronavirus pandemic scenarios have led to a dramatic sell-off in U.S. government bonds from their record highs, pushing the yield curve to its steepest level since March.

Headlines: Volkswagen considering more cost cuts to cope with downturn
Description: Volkswagen <VOWG_p.DE > is considering more cost cuts to help cope with the economic impact of the coronavirus pandemic, a spokesman for the German automaker said on Saturday.

Headlines: OPEC and allies to agree one-month extension to output cuts
Description: OPEC and its allies led by Russia are "most likely" to agree on a one-month extension to an oil production cuts deal on Saturday, an OPEC delegate said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Buyout firm Sycamore Partners in talks to buy J.C. Penney - sources
Description: Private equity firm Sycamore Partners is in preliminary talks to acquire J.C. Penney Co Inc  out of bankruptcy should the U.S. department store chain's negotiations with its creditors fail, three people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Explainer: May's jobs report stunner: real deal or head fake?
Description: The U.S. economy unexpectedly added jobs in May, surprising economists and analysts who had forecast millions more losing their livelihoods, and raising hopes of a faster economic recovery than expected.

Headlines: Tech drives Nasdaq to all-time high as signs of recovery emerge from coronavirus pandemic
Description: The heavyweight technology and growth stocks that drove Wall Street higher in recent years are again fueling a surge that has taken the Nasdaq from a brutal selloff to an intraday record high in just 11 weeks, as investors look beyond the economic upheaval caused by the coronavirus.

Headlines: Trump administration orders Marriott to cease Cuba hotel business
Description: The Trump administration has ordered Marriott International to wind down hotel operations in Communist-run Cuba, a company spokeswoman told Reuters, extinguishing what had been a symbol of the U.S.-Cuban detente.

Headlines: U.S. will allow Chinese passenger carriers two flights per week
Description: The United States will permit Chinese passenger air carriers to operate two flights per week after Beijing said it would ease coronavirus-related restrictions to allow in more foreign carriers, the U.S. Transportation Department said on Friday.

Headlines: Bonds falter as blazing stock rally lures investors
Description: Improving U.S. economic data is pushing investors out of U.S. government bonds at the fastest pace in months, the latest sign that risk appetite is returning to broader markets.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. weighs blacklisting dozens more oil tankers over Venezuela - officials
Description: The United States is considering imposing sanctions on dozens of additional foreign oil tankers for trading with Venezuela, U.S. officials told Reuters on Friday, the latest effort to sever what Washington sees as a lifeline for President Nicolas Maduro.

Headlines: Reddit co-founder Ohanian resigns from board, wants a black candidate to take over
Description: Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian on Friday resigned from the social network firm's board and sought to be replaced by a black candidate.

Headlines: PG&E Corp preparing $11 billion debt financing: investor
Description: California utility PG&E Corp  is preparing an $11 billion debt-financing package as it prepares to exit from its bankruptcy, an investor involved with the company's funding plan said on Friday, sending its shares up more than 12%.

Headlines: Trump touts job gains as 'greatest comeback in American history'
Description: President Donald Trump on Friday celebrated a stunning U.S. employment report that showed more than 2.5 million jobs were added last month during the thick of the coronavirus pandemic, and predicted the battered economy will recover all of its lost jobs by next year.

Headlines: Surprise U.S. unemployment rate drop leaves out blacks, Asians
Description: The U.S. unemployment rate dropped unexpectedly in May, but not all workers benefited equally as joblessness among African Americans and Asians rose, signaling some minorities face a longer recovery as the economy slowly rebounds from the coronavirus shutdowns.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies to end higher on surprise U.S. jobs report
Description: Wall Street surged on Friday after a strikingly upbeat May jobs report unexpectedly provided the clearest evidence yet that the U.S. economy is headed for a quicker-than-anticipated recovery.

Headlines: Equities surge, bonds tumble on surprise U.S. jobs gains
Description: An unexpected jump in U.S. employment sent world equities and oil surging on hopes that the global economy has started to recover from the coronavirus pandemic, pulling investors out of perceived safe havens like government bonds and gold.

Headlines: Trump opens Atlantic sanctuary to commercial fishing
Description: President Donald Trump announced on Friday he will open up a 5,000 square mile conservation area in the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of New England to commercial fishing.

Headlines: U.S. labor market unexpectedly improves; recovery years away
Description: The U.S. economy unexpectedly added jobs in May after suffering record losses in the prior month, offering the clearest signal yet that the downturn triggered by the COVID-19 pandemic was probably over, though the road to recovery could be long.

Headlines: Trump threatens EU, China with tariffs; names Navarro 'lobster king'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday threatened to impose tariffs on European Union cars if the bloc does not drop its tariff on American lobsters, naming White House trade adviser Peter Navarro the "lobster king" in charge of talks.

Headlines: Miguel McKelvey, co-founder of WeWork with Adam Neumann, to leave company
Description: WeWork's Miguel McKelvey, who co-founded the troubled office-sharing start-up with Adam Neumann, will leave the company at the end of June.

Headlines: Canada posts surprise jobs gain in May and June could be even better
Description: Canada unexpectedly added almost 290,000 jobs in May as some provinces loosened COVID-19 restrictions on businesses, data showed on Friday, and there could be an even bigger improvement in June.

Headlines: Oil climbs 5% on U.S. jobless drop, OPEC+ meeting hopes
Description: Oil prices rose on Friday after an unexpected fall in the May U.S. jobless rate and OPEC's decision to bring forward to Saturday discussions on whether to extend record production cuts.

Headlines: Facebook to apply state media labels on Russian, Chinese outlets
Description: Facebook Inc  will start labeling Russian, Chinese and other state-controlled media organizations, and later this summer will block any ads from such outlets that target U.S. users, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Donald Trump says Warren Buffett makes a mistake selling airline stocks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said Warren Buffett, often regarded as the world's greatest investor, made a mistake by recently exiting a multi-billion dollar investment in the airline industry.

Headlines: Row over undelivered jets as Airbus threatens to sue airlines
Description: A stand-off over undelivered passenger jets is intensifying after Airbus  signalled it would sue airlines refusing  to honour contracts in the face of the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Reliance says Silver Lake, co-investors to invest extra $601 million in digital unit
Description: India's Reliance Industries  late on Friday said U.S. private equity fund Silver Lake and its co-investors will invest an additional 45.46 billion rupees ($601.40 million) in the company's digital unit Jio Platforms.

Headlines: Virtual certainty? Bankers ask if success of remote roadshows will last
Description: Who needs expensive lunches at glitzy hotels and fancy restaurants to court investors for bond deals or the sale of new shares on the stock exchange?

Headlines: LVMH refrains from renegotiating Tiffany deal, sources say
Description: French luxury goods giant  is not asking to renegotiate its $16.2-billion acquisition of U.S. jewelry chain Tiffany & Co  after deliberating whether to do so, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: United Airlines closing three of four international bases for flight crew
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  is closing three out of four international bases for flight attendants, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters, saying it is not able to sustain the bases in the current environment.

Headlines: German prosecutors probe Wirecard management board
Description: Munich prosecutors on Friday said they had searched Wirecard's  headquarters and opened proceedings against the payment company's entire management board as part of a market manipulation probe initiated by Germany's financial regulator BaFin.

Headlines: Nasdaq hits record high as U.S. economy shows signs of rebound
Description: The Nasdaq Composite  on Friday became the first of the three major U.S. stock indexes to bounce back to a record high, recovering from a stunning coronavirus-led slump on growing hopes of a swift economic rebound.

Headlines: Airbus jetliner deliveries recover some ground in May
Description: Airbus  deliveries partially recovered ground in May compared with the previous month, but remained well below normal levels after falling dramatically due to the coronavirus crisis, company data showed on Friday.

Headlines: Chevron oil cargo tangled in U.S. sanctions on Venezuela
Description: A Chevron Corp  crude oil cargo has become embroiled in U.S. sanctions on shipping companies for violating restrictions on doing business with Venezuela, the company confirmed on Friday.

Headlines: UBS and Bank of America units clear ECB stress test
Description: An asset quality review and a stress test on subsidiaries of UBS  and Bank of America  revealed no capital shortfall, the European Central Bank said on Friday, clearing a hurdle for the banks to relocate activities to Europe from Britain.

Headlines: Ford re-evaluates office space in coronavirus world
Description: Ford Motor Co  is re-evaluating how much office space it needs for white-collar workers as restrictions put in place during the coronavirus pandemic are eased and employees return to workplaces.

Headlines: Ocean shipping shrinks as pandemic pummels retailers
Description: The $1 trillion container shipping industry is in a slowdown. Literally.

Headlines: Brazil, Mexico currencies both rebound but real has more legs than peso
Description: The Brazilian real and Mexican peso have both rebounded strongly in recent weeks, but their rallies are starting to diverge with the peso running out of steam and the real gaining momentum.

Headlines: Cafe Rouge, Bella Italia could see nearly a third of outlets closed: sources
Description: Britain's high-street restaurant chains Bella Italia, Cafe Rouge and Las Iguanas could see around 30% of their outlets cut, two sources told Reuters, as their owner pushes ahead with talks to sell the businesses stricken by the COVID-19 crisis.

Headlines: Factbox: Struggling restaurant chains risk disappearing from Britain's high street
Description: Faced with a partial reopening of their branches from July, many high street restaurant businesses in Britain risk disappearing from the high street or at least changing hands, as private equity owners decide whether to raise billions of dollars to snap up what they see as bargains.

Headlines: Volkswagen resumes deliveries of its Golf 8 after software glitch
Description: Volkswagen  on Friday said it had resumed deliveries of its newest Golf model after voluntarily halting sales in mid-May.

Headlines: Trump says he views U.S.-China trade deal differently amid coronavirus
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he views the Phase 1 trade deal inked between the United States and China differently in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Volkswagen board to review internal probe into racist car ad
Description: Volkswagen  has completed an internal report into  how it came to publish a racist advert, the German carmaker said on Friday, adding that its findings will be released once its management board has reviewed the matter.

Headlines: Surprise May U.S. payrolls rise fans hopes for economic recovery
Description: The U.S. unemployment rate unexpectedly fell in May and layoffs abated, the Labor Department said on Friday in a report that showed the latest signs the economic downturn caused by the COVID-19 pandemic was bottoming.

Headlines: Pence says jobs report indicative of U.S. economy beginning to recover
Description: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence said the jobs report released on Friday was a sign the U.S. economy was beginning to recover from the deep hit caused by the novel coronavirus outbreak, but said President Donald Trump is still in favor of a payroll tax cut.

Headlines: BA owner considers legal challenge to UK quarantine as relations fray
Description: The owner of British Airways is considering a legal challenge to Britain's quarantine plan, as relations between airlines and the government are frayed by steps to curb the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Barclays poaches Citigroup's Chawla in latest insurance investment banker move
Description: Gautam Chawla is joining Barclays  from Citigroup Inc , a statement from the British lender said on Friday, continuing the recent spate of job changes among senior financiers covering the insurance industry.

Headlines: WeWork Global to invest $100 million in India business
Description: WeWork will invest $100 million in its Indian business as the office-sharing startup looks to ride out the coronavirus crisis, which has kept people indoors and away from offices.

Headlines: Bombardier to cut 2,500 aviation jobs as pandemic dents travel demand
Description: Canadian plane and train maker Bombardier Inc  said on Friday it would cut 2,500 jobs, or about 11% of the workforce at its aviation unit, as the coronavirus pandemic's crushing impact on the air industry adds to its long list of problems.

Headlines: Canada adds net 289,600 jobs in May
Description: Canada added a net 289,600 jobs in May, with most of the employment gains coming in full time, Statistics Canada said on Friday. The rebound in May hiring comes after Canada lost a record-breaking 2 million jobs in April.

Headlines: Suntory CEO says 20% of restaurants may fail as coronavirus slams Japan's dining scene
Description: Takeshi Niinami, the head of Japanese drinks and food group Suntory Holdings and a government adviser, predicted on Friday that more than 20% of bars and restaurants could fail due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: BBC appoints insider as new boss to negotiate future finance model
Description: The BBC appointed an insider as its new director general on Friday, tasked with securing the future direction and financing of the publicly-funded British broadcaster in the wake of government scepticism of the current model.

Headlines: Exclusive: Unfazed by pandemic, Bank of Japan to keep economic recovery view - sources
Description: The Bank of Japan is likely to maintain this month its projection that the economy will gradually recover from the damage wrought by the coronavirus pandemic in the latter half of this year, sources said.

Headlines: Take Five: Bulls charge past hurdles
Description: Have HSBC and Standard Chartered "chosen profits over human rights" in backing China's national security law for Hong Kong, as some suggest? Or does it reflect the tightrope businesses must navigate between Hong Kong's protesters and Beijing?

Headlines: British luxury carmaker Bentley to cut quarter of workforce
Description: British luxury carmaker Bentley Motors said on Friday it plans to shed up to 1,000 jobs, nearly a quarter of its workforce, adding to the gloom in the sector hit hard by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Bargain-conscious Americans lift used-car sales in the coronavirus economy
Description: At the height of the coronavirus pandemic in mid-April, used-car dealer Alex Tovstanovsky had vehicles jammed six rows deep on his lot in the western Chicago suburb of Naperville.

Headlines: Volkswagen AG expands executive committee of supervisory board
Description: German car maker Volkswagen AG  said on Friday that it had added two members to the executive committee of its supervisory board.

Headlines: Tesla's Elon Musk calls for breakup of Amazon in tweet
Description: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk on Thursday called for Amazon.com Inc to be broken up, after an author complained on social media about being unable to self-publish a book via the world's largest online retailer.

Headlines: Global airlines add flights; U.S. carriers target the great outdoors
Description: Airlines from America to Australia are ramping up flights in June and July, boosting hopes for a pickup in tourist traffic even as bigger-spending business and global travel remains sluggish during the ongoing pandemic.

Headlines: Allianz in talks for China insurance asset management licence
Description: Allianz  is in talks with Chinese regulators for a licence as the German insurer looks to eventually offer broad asset management services in the world's second-largest economy.

Headlines: Bank of America sees 10% further upside for European equities by third-quarter
Description: European stocks are likely to rise another 10% by the end of September as the re-opening of economies after virus lockdowns is likely to lead to a significant pick-up in business activity, Bank of America analysts said on Friday.

Headlines: Pompeo calls Nasdaq's strict rules a model to guard against fraudulent Chinese companies
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Thursday warned American investors against fraudulent accounting practices at China-based companies and said the Nasdaq's recent decision to tighten listing rules for such players should be "a model" for all other exchanges around the world.

Headlines: China says forcing Chinese firms off U.S. exchanges will harm U.S.
Description: China said on Friday that forcing Chinese firms to retreat from U.S. stock exchanges would severely harm U.S. interests.

Headlines: Japan's first-quarter GDP decline likely smaller than initial estimates on firmer capex: Reuters poll
Description: Japan's first quarter economic contraction was likely smaller than initially estimated, a Reuters poll showed, thanks to stronger business spending although the country is still expected to slide deeper into recession this year.

Headlines: GM Cruise tries to poach Zoox engineers as company for sale
Description: Self-driving technology company Cruise, a unit of General Motors Co’s , is trying to poach engineers from struggling rival Zoox Inc, according to an email sent to Zoox engineers by the founder of Cruise this week.

Headlines: Expecting a spike in bitcoin? Investors say it may take time
Description: Investors expecting a sudden surge in bitcoin's price, after it underwent a technical adjustment three weeks ago that reduced the rate at which new coins are generated, may have to wait a few months, or perhaps a few years.

Headlines: As coronavirus sinks global demand, China’s exporters go online to tap domestic market
Description: At this time of the year, Deng Jinling would normally be welcoming foreign buyers to her vacuum flask showroom or cramming her goods into containers to be shipped to customers in the United States.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs executive's email making plea for racial equality goes viral at firm
Description: An email by a Goldman Sachs Group Inc  employee about his experiences of racial injustice and criticizing managers at the Wall Street bank for not supporting junior bankers from diverse backgrounds went viral at the firm this week.

Headlines: 'How it's going ...' Goldman executive's email on racial inequality in America
Description: Frederick Baba, a managing director at Goldman Sachs who is black, sent the following email to colleagues at the bank on June 2:

Headlines: U.S. banks attract bargain hunters though hurdles to growth remain
Description: Investors eyeing a turnaround in the U.S. economy are piling into U.S. bank stocks even as some caution that positive stress test results and an abatement of loan losses will be needed to sustain a rally in the battered sector.

Headlines: Explainer: No one really knows how many Americans need unemployment benefits
Description: Another 1.9 million people filed for unemployment benefits for the first time last week, according to data released by the Labor Department on Thursday, marking 11 straight weeks in which millions of Americans have filed claims for jobless benefits.

Headlines: KKR, Ampersand Capital in joint bid for Oxford Immunotec: sources
Description: A consortium of private equity firms KKR & Co Inc  and Ampersand Capital Partners has approached Oxford Immunotec Global Plc , a medical diagnostics company that develops tests to identify tuberculosis, with a $400 million acquisition offer, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Bernard Madoff fails to win compassionate release from prison
Description: A federal judge on Thursday rejected Bernard Madoff's request to be released early from prison because he was dying of kidney failure, saying the swindler has never fully accepted responsibility for his massive, decades-long Ponzi scheme.

Headlines: Broadcom's revenue forecast disappoints on possible Apple iPhone delay
Description: Broadcom Inc  on Thursday forecast current-quarter revenue with a midpoint slightly below analysts' estimates, in part caused by a delay at a "large North American mobile phone" customer that analysts believe is Apple Inc .

Headlines: Trump gives U.S. agencies power to fast-track big infrastructure projects
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday signed an executive order that gives federal agencies emergency powers to fast-track major energy and other infrastructure projects by overriding environmental permitting requirements.

Headlines: U.S. court blocks sales of Bayer weed killer in United States
Description: A U.S. appeals court has blocked Bayer AG from selling an agricultural weed killer in the United States, the latest setback for a business already fighting an expensive legal battle over another product.

Headlines: Uber Eats features black-owned restaurants on U.S., Canadian delivery platform
Description: Uber Technologies Inc on Thursday launched a feature on its food delivery app Uber Eats that lets customers in the United States and Canada order from restaurants owned by black people and pay no delivery fees for those orders through 2020.

Headlines: Gap records nearly $1 billion in losses on coronavirus-led store closures
Description: Gap Inc  on Thursday reported a quarterly loss of nearly $1 billion as the apparel retailer was forced to close its stores due to the coronavirus outbreak, sending its shares down about 8% after market hours.

Headlines: Slack revenue growth fails to impress, shares tank
Description: Slack Technologies Inc  on Thursday posted slowing quarterly sales growth, disappointing investors who had expected a surge in demand for its workplace messaging app as companies rapidly adopt remote working tools and technology.

Headlines: S&P 500 closes down, snapping four-day rally
Description: The S&P 500 lost ground on Thursday as investors took profits in advance of Friday's jobs report, ending a four-day rally driven by rising economic sentiment.

Headlines: U.S. jobless claims dip below 2 million, road to recovery rocky
Description: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits dropped below 2 million last week for the first time since mid-March, but remains astonishingly high as companies adjust to an environment that has been significantly changed by COVID-19.

Headlines: American Airlines soars 41% as plan to add July flights sparks relief rally
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  shares jumped more than 40% on Thursday after announcing a big boost to U.S. flights next month following dramatic cuts caused by the coronavirus pandemic, as well as some leadership changes to cut costs.

Headlines: U.S. to revise Chinese passenger airline ban after Beijing move
Description: The U.S. Transportation Department plans to issue a revised order in the coming days that is likely to allow some Chinese passenger airline flights to continue, government and airline officials said.

Headlines: ECB sends euro higher, stocks pause after week-long rally
Description: The euro jumped to a 12-week high against the dollar on Thursday after another shot of European Central Bank stimulus to help economies slammed by the coronavirus pandemic, but world equity markets pulled in the reins after a strong seven-day run.

Headlines: American Airlines announces 14 officer departures, memos show
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  told employees on Thursday  that 14 officers will be as leaving the company as part of leadership changes in which another five officer positions will not be filled, according to memos seen by Reuters.

Headlines: British Airways boss says burning through cash, urges unions to engage
Description: The boss of British Airways said its parent company IAG  was burning through 178 million pounds ($223 million) a week and could not guarantee its survival, prompting him to urge unions to engage over 12,000 job cuts.

Headlines: U.S. senators move to tighten sanctions on delayed Russia-to-Germany gas pipeline
Description: U.S. senators announced a bill on Thursday expanding sanctions on Russia's Nord Stream 2 natural gas pipeline and targeting the project Washington says will boost Moscow's economic and political influence in Germany and other European countries.

Headlines: Oil prices steady as market awaits clarity on OPEC+ output cuts
Description: Oil prices were little changed in choppy trade on Thursday as investors awaited a decision from top crude producers on whether to extend record output cuts.

Headlines: 'Stay at home stock' Slack Technologies dips ahead of report
Description: Shares of Slack Technologies  dipped 3% on Thursday ahead of the workplace communication platform's quarterly report, pausing a three-month rally fueled by millions of people working from home due to the coronavirus.

Headlines: Shell plastics plant Trump touted faces oversupply risks: energy institute report
Description: A massive Pennsylvania plastics project that President Donald Trump touted during a visit last year faces risks of oversupply and a low price outlook for the materials, a report by an institute that examines energy issues said on Thursday.

Headlines: Volkswagen resumes deliveries of Golf 8 after software fix
Description: Volkswagen  is resuming deliveries of its Golf 8 model after fixing a software glitch, a spokesman said on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Bond investors look for Fed to justify steepening yield curve
Description: Expectations that the global economy has dodged the worst-case scenarios for the coronavirus pandemic have led to a dramatic selloff in U.S. government bonds from their record highs, pushing the yield curve to its steepest level since March.

Headlines: Germany rebuffs gasoline auto lobby with radical electric plan
Description: Germany has become the second major European economy to use a multi-billion-euro recovery plan to spur clean driving, with incentives for electric cars that should boost Volkswagen  and Tesla , while polluting SUVs face higher taxes.

Headlines: America's billionaire wealth jumps by over half a trillion during COVID-19 pandemic: report
Description: The combined wealth of America's billionaires, including Amazon.com Inc  founder Jeff Bezos and Facebook Inc  CEO Mark Zuckerberg, jumped over 19% or by half a trillion since the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States, according to a report published by the Institute for Policy Studies (IPS).

Headlines: Fiat-Chrysler's state-backed loan crucial for Italy's economy-Intesa CEO says
Description: A 6.3 billion euro ($7 billion) state-backed loan for Fiat Chrysler (FCA) , financed by Intesa Sanpaolo , is crucial in terms of safeguarding Italy's economy, the head of the country's biggest retail bank said.

Headlines: FCA to face checks, sanctions on state-backed loan
Description: Fiat Chrysler  will file regular reports on its use of a multi-billion euro state-backed loan which Italy is set to approve soon and will face sanctions if it does not respect commitments attached to the package, the economy minister said.

Headlines: ECB gives another shot of stimulus as economy reels
Description: The European Central Bank approved a bigger-than-expected expansion of its stimulus package on Thursday to prop up an economy plunged by the coronavirus pandemic into its worst recession since World War Two.

Headlines: Statement from the ECB following policy meeting
Description: Following is the statement from the European Central Bank following its policy meeting.

Headlines: ECB expands pandemic support to over $1.5 trillion
Description: The European Central Bank beefed up its bond-buying programme on Thursday in its latest effort to support a euro zone economy pummelled by more than two months of shutdowns due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: ECB sees big 2020 recession, partial rebound next year
Description: The European Central Bank expects the euro zone to suffer a deep recession this year, with losses only partly made up in 2021 as pandemic-related restrictions weigh on output for an extended period.

Headlines: Lagarde comments at ECB press conference
Description: The European Central Bank beefed up its bond-buying programme on Thursday in its latest effort to support a euro zone economy pummelled by more than two months of shutdowns to cope with the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: ECB policymakers debated 500-750 billion euros package before compromise, sources say
Description: European Central Bank policymakers debated expanding their pandemic-fighting programme by between 500 billion euros ($566 billion) and 750 billion euros on Thursday before settling for a compromise figure, three sources told Reuters.

Headlines: LVMH propels Arnault scion to head up Tag Heuer watches
Description: LVMH  said on Thursday Frederic Arnault, one of the younger sons of the luxury goods group's billionaire boss, would take over running watch brand Tag Heuer, joining his siblings in taking on bigger roles within the conglomerate.

Headlines: Germany will require all petrol stations to provide electric car charging
Description: Germany said it will oblige all petrol stations to offer electric car charging to help remove refuelling concerns and boost consumer demand for the vehicles as part of its 130 billion euro ($146 billion) economic recovery plan.

Headlines: Tech stocks have been a winning bet, but investors worry it will fade
Description: A bet on tech companies has been a solid one in the aftermath of the coronavirus-induced market crash, but some investors are questioning whether those stocks can maintain their momentum if jobs do not recover soon.

Headlines: EBay raises forecasts on online boom, shares hit record high
Description: EBay Inc  raised its current-quarter revenue and profit forecasts on Thursday, as people stuck at home due to the COVID-19 pandemic ordered more through its online platform, sending its shares to a record high.

Headlines: For U.S. economy, the bottom may be here, but the rebound is slow so far
Description: The U.S. economy may have hit its low point in the coronavirus crash but the rebound so far remains tepid, according to both broad indexes of activity and higher frequency counts of cellphone data and employee time information.

Headlines: American Airlines seeing slow but steady rise in domestic demand
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  said on Thursday it was seeing a slow but steady rise in domestic demand, as coronavirus-led lockdowns start to ease.

Headlines: HKEX says many U.S.-listed Chinese firms plan Hong Kong listings
Description: Many U.S.-listed Chinese firms will likely list on the Hong Kong exchange this year, in part because of U.S. political pressure following China's new national security legislation on Hong Kong, the head of the exchange said on Thursday.

Headlines: Bank of America to pay $7.23 million for mutual fund overcharges: FINRA
Description: Bank of America Corp  agreed to pay $7.23 million in restitution and interest to settle a U.S. regulator's accusations that it overcharged customers on mutual funds.

Headlines: U.S. Labor secretary: Jobless rate can dip below 10% by year's end
Description: The U.S. unemployment rate, which economists expect hit 19.8% in May, should be able to drop below 10% by the end of 2020 now that workers side-lined by coronavirus-related shutdowns are returning to work, U.S. Labor Secretary Eugene Scalia said on Thursday.

Headlines: HSBC, StanChart criticised for backing Hong Kong security law
Description: Senior British and U.S. politicians criticised HSBC  and Standard Chartered  on Thursday after the banks backed China's national security law for Hong Kong, in conflict with the British government's opposition to the proposed legislation.

Headlines: Exclusive: GM plans electric van for business users in bid to pre-empt Tesla
Description: General Motors Co is developing an electric van aimed at business users, joining a growing list of carmakers planning EVs for the same segment which includes customers such as Amazon.com Inc and United Parcel Service Inc, five people familiar with the plans told Reuters.

Headlines: Citigroup forms new strategic advisory group to merge insights, data
Description: Citigroup Inc  said on Thursday it is forming a new strategic advisory group within its investment bank.

Headlines: Virgin Atlantic says to restart some flights on July 20
Description: Virgin Atlantic said on Thursday it would restart some flights that have been grounded by the COVID-19 pandemic on July 20 and aimed to restore further services in August.

Headlines: Factbox: German stimulus to drive forward green vehicles
Description: Germany's coronavirus recovery stimulus package contains measures to boost low emission cars and electric vehicle charging infrastructure.

Headlines: China eases flight curbs after United States targets its carriers
Description: China will ease coronavirus restrictions to allow more foreign carriers to fly to the mainland, shortly after Washington vowed to bar Chinese airlines from flying to the United States due to Beijing's curbs on U.S. airlines.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon in talks to buy $2 billion stake in Indian telco Bharti Airtel - sources
Description: Amazon.com  is in early-stage talks to buy a stake worth at least $2 billion in Indian mobile operator Bharti Airtel , three people with knowledge of the discussions told Reuters, in a move that could turbocharge India's digital economy.

Headlines: Germany finally splurges, but not without fresh criticism
Description: Under pressure from its European peers for years to spend more, Germany has finally served up a bumper stimulus package financed with new debt, but Berlin's rediscovered love to splurge is causing fresh unease among its neighbours.

Headlines: Tata Steel workers at Dutch plant vote to strike
Description: Employees at Tata Steel's  Dutch plant in IJmuiden on Thursday voted to go on strike over planned job cuts and the plant's further integration with Tata's British operations, labour union FNV said.

Headlines: U.S. airlines gain final approval to drop services to 75 domestic airports
Description: Fifteen U.S. airlines were granted final government approval on Wednesday to temporarily halt service to 75 domestic airports as travel demand has been crushed due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: South Korea seeks arrest of Samsung heir Lee in succession probe
Description: South Korean prosecutors have requested an arrest warrant for Samsung Group heir Jay Y. Lee, they said on Thursday, in the investigation of a 2015 merger and alleged accounting fraud in a suspected bid to aid his succession plans.

Headlines: LVMH has explored coronavirus impact on Tiffany deal terms
Description: LVMH 's board met this week to discuss the fallout from the coronavirus crisis on its $16.2 billion purchase of U.S. jeweller Tiffany , the luxury goods group said on Thursday, opening the door to a possible attempt to review the deal terms.

Headlines: GM to work closely with CATL in its China EV push: executive
Description: General Motors  will "work very closely" with Chinese electric vehicle battery maker Contemporary Amperex Technology Ltd (CATL)  as it ramps up electric production in the world's biggest auto market, a senior executive said.

Headlines: South Korean court to review prosecution's arrest warrant request for Samsung heir
Description: A South Korean court said on Thursday it will review the prosecution's request for an arrest warrant for Samsung Electronics  vice chairman Jay Y. Lee.

Headlines: Citi defies coronavirus with Western European corporate lending push
Description: Citigroup  is looking to ramp up its commercial banking operations across Europe, Middle East and Africa, plugging gaps left by rivals facing fallout from a coronavirus-induced recession.

Headlines: Red tape thwarts South Africa's green energy potential
Description: JOHANNESBURG - World-leading renewables companies are lining up to invest in South Africa's energy sector and help remedy a chronic generation shortfall that pushed the continent's most advanced economy into recession even before the COVID-19 pandemic struck.

Headlines: Pandemic exposes cracks in oil majors' bet on plastic
Description: The energy industry's bet that a petrochemicals boom would support decades of oil and gas sales growth is on shaky ground as an already saturated plastic market is hit by a coronavirus demand shock.

Headlines: Ford's China ventures increase May sales as market rebounds
Description: Ford Motor's  China ventures have reported year-on-year sales growth for May in a sign of how the world's biggest auto market is continuing its recovery from coronavirus-induced lows.

Headlines: LVMH's Arnault mulls ways to renegotiate deal with Tiffany: sources
Description: LVMH  CEO Bernard Arnault is exploring ways to reopen negotiations on the French luxury goods giant's $16.2 billion acquisition of U.S. jewelry chain Tiffany & Co , as U.S. social unrest and the coronavirus pandemic weigh on the retail sector, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Adidas says China sales back to growth faster than expected
Description: German sportswear firm Adidas  said on Thursday that sales had returned to growth in greater China faster than it had expected after the coronavirus lockdown, while the reopening of business in Europe and the Americas was going more gradually.

Headlines: Carnival's Princess Cruises extends suspension of some voyages
Description: Carnival Corp's  Princess Cruises on Thursday extended the suspension of some of its voyages in Australia, Canada and Taiwan as ports around the world remain shut due to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Exclusive: Rosneft replaces sanctioned trading arm with new one - sources
Description: Russia's Rosneft , which closed its oil trading arm after sanctions were imposed by U.S. authorities in February, has set up a new Geneva-based trading business, four trading sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Oil refineries, offshore drillers face hurricane challenges amid pandemic
Description: As oil and gas companies began shutting offshore production before the first tropical storm of the season in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico, experts said restarting wells and refineries will take longer and prove more costly this year because of COVID-19.

Headlines: Amid pandemic, investors bet on India's Jio and its giant-killer playbook
Description: From its Silicon Valley-like campus near Mumbai, Indian billionaire Mukesh Ambani's Jio telecom carrier is emerging as a winner from changes in the way Indian consumers plug into a digital economy made more urgent by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: From wagyu beef to melons, Japan's $2.2 trillion virus rescue piques struggling firms
Description: As the coronavirus jolts Japan, the government's huge stimulus package has come under fire from hard-hit restaurant owners for channelling funds for items like wagyu beef, melons and tourism rather than accelerating help for firms with burning cash needs.

Headlines: Snapchat removes Trump account from curated promotional section
Description: Snap Inc said it would no longer promote U.S. President Donald Trump's account in Snapchat's Discover section, saying his incendiary comments last week made the account ineligible for the curated section where users explore new content.

Headlines: Amazon is sued over warehouses after New York worker brings coronavirus home, cousin dies
Description: Amazon.com Inc has been sued for allegedly fostering the spread of the coronavirus by mandating unsafe working conditions, causing at least one employee to contract COVID-19, bring it home, and see her cousin die.

Headlines: Pilgrim's Pride CEO indicted over alleged U.S. chicken price-fixing
Description: The chief executive of Pilgrim's Pride Corp, a major U.S. poultry company, was indicted along with three other current and former industry executives on charges of seeking to fix the price of chickens, the Justice Department said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. HR executives see working from home as part of new normal: survey
Description: More than three out of four U.S. human resource executives think more employees will continue to work from home even after the threat of the novel coronavirus subsides, according to a survey by a large business association released on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. prosecutor says UAW takeover remains option after ex-president pleads guilty
Description: The United Auto Workers still needs to reform and a federal takeover remains an option, the U.S. prosecutor leading the investigation of corruption within the union told Reuters on Wednesday after the UAW's former president pleaded guilty to embezzlement.

Headlines: Early Facebook staffers denounce Zuckerberg stance on Trump posts
Description: Nearly three dozen former employees from Facebook's early days on Wednesday blasted Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg's decision not to act against incendiary posts by U.S. President Donald Trump as "cowardly" and a "betrayal" of company ideals.

Headlines: On Raul Castro's birthday, U.S. threatens Cuba remittances
Description: The Trump administration expanded on Wednesday its list of Cuban entities that Americans are banned from doing business with to include the financial corporation that handles U.S. remittances to the Communist-run country.

Headlines: U.S. dollar's shine fading, but risk high of rush to safe havens: Reuters poll
Description: A fading of the U.S. dollar's allure will continue as global funding strains ease, but a majority of analysts polled by Reuters said there was a high risk that the U.S.-China trade standoff will renew safe-haven bets in the next six months.

Headlines: Senate passes bill lengthening coronavirus small-business loan terms
Description: The U.S. Senate unanimously approved legislation on Wednesday giving small businesses up to 24 weeks to use Paycheck Protection Program loans created during the coronavirus pandemic, up from the current eight-week deadline.

Headlines: Wall Street closes sharply higher on signs of economic rebound
Description: Wall Street rallied broadly on Wednesday with the Nasdaq approaching record highs as signs of an economic recovery from mandated shutdowns helped investors look beyond U.S. social unrest and pandemic worries.

Headlines: Warner Music strikes a chord as shares pop on Nasdaq debut
Description: Warner Music Group Corp's  stock popped 8% on its Nasdaq debut on Wednesday, after the world's third-largest recording label sold shares in its $1.9-billion initial public offering towards the higher end of its target.

Headlines: Democratic-led U.S. House panel opposes any U.S. trade deal with Brazil
Description: The U.S. House Ways and Means Committee said on Wednesday it opposed the Trump administration's plan to expand economic ties with Brazil given its record on human rights and the environment under President Jair Bolsonaro.

Headlines: Amazon leases 12 aircraft to bolster air cargo fleet
Description: Amazon.com Inc  said on Wednesday it leased 12 Boeing 767-300 converted cargo aircraft from Air Transport Services Group Inc , bringing its total fleet to more than 80, as it pushes for faster delivery to meet a surge in online orders.

Headlines: Uber signals recovery in rides as lockdown restrictions ease
Description: Uber Technologies Inc said on Wednesday trip requests were gradually picking up, but still remained significantly below prior year levels, as several countries start to lift coronavirus-led restrictions.

Headlines: Shares, euro climb on robust risk appetite as lockdowns ease
Description: Global equity markets rallied and the euro rose against the dollar on Wednesday, both for a seventh straight session, indicating strong risk appetite as easing lockdowns and hopes for more monetary stimulus boosted investor confidence.

Headlines: Bacardi family member fights for reshuffle at spirits group
Description: Monika Bacardi, a member of the family owning the maker of the eponymous rum, said her Liechtenstein-based trust was blocking her attempt to reshuffle the management team at the spirits group, uncovering a fight inside the family.

Headlines: U.S. labor market stabilizing as layoffs abate
Description: U.S. private payrolls fell less than expected in May, suggesting layoffs were abating as businesses reopen, though the overall economy's recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic will be slow.

Headlines: Oil moves higher, hovers below $40 as doubts emerge over next step on OPEC cuts
