Description: Oil ended slightly higher on Wednesday but remained below the session's early highs above $40 a barrel, the highest since March, retreating as doubts emerged about the timing and scale of a potential extension to the pact between OPEC and its allies to cut crude supplies.

Headlines: Delta will extend social distancing through Sept. 30
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc  said on Wednesday it will extend social distancing measures on its flights through Sept. 30 and will block the selection of middle seats and cap seating in every cabin.

Headlines: Trump administration to bar Chinese passenger carriers from flying to U.S.
Description: President Donald Trump's administration on Wednesday barred Chinese passenger carriers from flying to the United States starting on June 16 as it pressures Beijing to let U.S. air carriers resume flights amid simmering tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: Exclusive: Ex-Enron CEO Skilling launching new digital marketplace for oil investors - sources
Description: Former Enron CEO Jeffrey Skilling, released last year after a 14-year prison term stemming from the energy firm's collapse, is raising funds to launch a digital marketplace catering to professional oil and gas investors, according to four people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Virus-hit U.S. state revenue could start slow recovery in third quarter: analysts
Description: U.S. state tax revenue, which plunged due to the economic fallout from the coronavirus pandemic, could start to slowly recover this summer as long as the outbreak does not undergo a resurgence, analysts said.

Headlines: Apple must face U.S. shareholder lawsuit over CEO's iPhone, China comments
Description: A federal judge said Apple Inc must face part of a lawsuit claiming it fraudulently concealed falling demand for iPhones, especially in China, leading to tens of billions of dollars in shareholder losses.

Headlines: New U.S. restrictions on 33 Chinese firms and institutions take effect June 5
Description: The U.S Commerce Department said on Wednesday that new restrictions on 33 Chinese firms and institutions it announced last month will take effect Friday.

Headlines: Citigroup chief compliance officer Mark Carawan retires
Description: Citigroup Inc  said on Wednesday its chief compliance officer Mark Carawan is retiring after eight years at the firm, effective June 8.

Headlines: Walmart removes firearms, ammunition from floor display as protests rage in U.S.
Description: Walmart Inc said on Wednesday it shifted firearms and ammunition out of sales floors of some U.S. stores amid nationwide protests over the death of an unarmed black man at the hands of police last week.

Headlines: Gilead's remdesivir could see $7 billion in annual sales on stockpiling boost: analyst
Description: Gilead Sciences Inc's  potential COVID-19 treatment, remdesivir, could bring in more than $7 billion in annual sales by 2022, spurred by governments stockpiling the drug to guard against future outbreaks, SVB Leerink said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Heads of U.S. automakers, other Michigan companies condemn racism, injustice
Description: Top executives of the Detroit Three automakers and other major Michigan employers on Wednesday condemned racism and injustice in the United States following the death last week of an unarmed black man at the hands of Minneapolis police, carefully joining a charged national debate.

Headlines: Global smartphone shipments to fall 12% this year on virus woes: IDC
Description: Global smartphone shipments will fall nearly 12% to 1.2 billion units in 2020, market research firm IDC said on Wednesday, citing lower consumer spending due to the economic impact of the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Coty in talks to collaborate with Kim Kardashian for cosmetics line
Description: Coty Inc  is in talks with reality TV star Kim Kardashian West over a potential collaboration for a beauty line, the cosmetics maker disclosed in a regulatory filing on Wednesday.

Headlines: TUI strikes compensation deal with Boeing, delays 737 MAX deliveries
Description: Europe's biggest travel company, TUI Group , said it has struck a deal with Boeing  for compensation and deferred deliveries of the grounded 737 MAX jet, boosting its finances as it seeks to survive the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: LVMH's takeover of Tiffany seen as uncertain: WWD
Description: French luxury goods group LVMH's  $16.2 billion takeover of Tiffany & Co  is looking less certain as the jeweler grapples with a deteriorating situation in the U.S. market brought on by a global pandemic and severe social unrest, fashion trade publication WWD reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Nissan warns UK plant 'unsustainable' without EU trade deal: BBC
Description: Nissan's  car manufacturing plant in Sunderland, northern England, which employs 7,000, is "unsustainable" if Britain leaves the European Union without a trade deal, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank faces action from NY regulators over Epstein ties: sources
Description: Deutsche Bank  could face enforcement action by New York regulators investigating its ties to the late U.S. financier and accused sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, two sources familiar with the investigation told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: France nears 1-billion-euro crisis fund for aero suppliers: sources
Description: French government and industry officials are negotiating a 1-billion-euro, privately led investment fund for small aerospace suppliers in which major manufacturers could invest 200 million euros, people familiar with the proposals said on Wednesday.

Headlines: SoftBank launches $100 mln fund investing in 'people of colour'
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  is launching a $100 million fund to invest in "companies led by founders and entrepreneurs of colour", in the latest corporate action as protests roil the United States.

Headlines: U.S. factory orders extend decline in April
Description: New orders for U.S.-made goods plunged in April and business spending plans on equipment were much weaker than initially thought, suggesting business investment remained depressed early in the second quarter amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Airbus jobs on wire as underlying output falls 40%: sources
Description: Airbus  is looking to hold underlying jet output at 40% below pre-pandemic plans for two years, an approach which adds new pressure to cut thousands of jobs, industry sources said.

Headlines: Lufthansa vows extensive revamp as losses balloon
Description: Lufthansa has pledged a wide-ranging restructuring, from thousands of job cuts to asset sales, as it seeks to repay a 9 billion euro ($10.1 billion) state bailout and navigate deepening losses in the face of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Air fares decline in further threat to profit: IATA
Description: Airlines cut domestic fares by an average 23% last month as traffic picked up from April lows, global industry body IATA said on Wednesday, warning that post-coronavirus discounting posed a further threat to profitability.

Headlines: U.S. services sector off 11-year trough; still contracting
Description: U.S. services industry activity pushed off an 11-year low in May, but businesses appeared in no rush to rehire workers as they reopen, supporting views the economy could take years to recover from the devastation caused by the COVID-19 crisis.

Headlines: Saudi, Russia agree oil cuts extension, raise pressure for compliance
Description: OPEC leader Saudi Arabia and non-OPEC Russia have agreed a preliminary deal to extend existing record oil output cuts by one month while raising pressure on countries with poor compliance to deepen their cuts, OPEC+ sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Will Americans still travel abroad? Only with cast-iron coronavirus cover
Description: In the new reality of COVID-19, some Americans may still be willing to travel abroad - but they're going to make sure they're insured up to the hilt.

Headlines: 3M names General Electric exec Monish Patolawala as CFO
Description: U.S. industrial conglomerate 3M Co  on Wednesday appointed General Electric Co  executive Monish Patolawala as the company's chief financial officer, effective July 1.

Headlines: China drives global oil demand recovery out of coronavirus collapse
Description: China's oil demand has recovered to more than 90% of the levels seen before the coronavirus pandemic struck early this year, a surprisingly robust rebound that could be mirrored elsewhere in the third quarter as more countries emerge from lockdowns.

Headlines: Renault finalises 5 billion euro state-backed loan
Description: Renault  finalised on Wednesday a 5 billion euro ($5.60 billion) loan from with the French government, strengthening the carmaker's finances in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic which has ravaged the auto industry.

Headlines: Iberdrola to invest up to 4 billion euros in French renewable energy
Description: Spanish utility Iberdrola  said on Wednesday it will invest up to 4 billion euros ($4.5 billion) over the next four years in France to develop renewable energy.

Headlines: Shell weighs sale of $2 billion-plus stake in Queensland LNG facilities
Description: Royal Dutch Shell  is considering raising more than $2 billion from the sale of a stake in the common facilities at its Queensland Curtis LNG plant in Australia, according to a sale flyer reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Geely's Volvo Cars sales soar 40% in May vs month-ago as virus curbs ease
Description: Volvo Cars, owned by China's Geely Holding, said on Wednesday it sold 40% more cars in May than in April, as restrictions to contain the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic started to ease in several markets.

Headlines: Nomura considers having fewer staff at headquarters permanently
Description: Nomura Holdings Inc  is considering having fewer staff work at its Tokyo headquarters permanently now that the coronavirus pandemic has spurred a huge shift to remote working, its chief executive said.

Headlines: U.S. senator Cotton cautions Britain over Huawei cooperation
Description: U.S. Republican Senator Tom Cotton cautioned Britain on Wednesday that a decision to allow China's Huawei a role in 5G networks could hurt military cooperation and be an issue in trade talks.

Headlines: Geely's Polestar to open 20 showrooms in China to compete with Tesla
Description: Polestar, the premium electric vehicle maker owned by China's Geely, plans to open 20 showrooms in the mainland, as it prepares for delivery of its Polestar 2 electric sedans to compete with Tesla Inc's locally made Model 3.

Headlines: Virgin Australia bidders get 10-day extension for final offers, source says
Description: Virgin Australia Holdings Ltd's administrator has given final bidders Bain Capital and Cyrus Capital Partners until June 22 to lodge binding offers, an extension of 10 days from the original date, a person with knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: BlackRock focuses on China credit, oil and travel in Asia
Description: The world's biggest asset manager, BlackRock Inc, called out oil stocks, domestic tourism and debt in China and India as investment opportunities in its Asia outlook on Wednesday.

Headlines: As Asia's tropical storm season arrives, grounded airplanes at risk of damage
Description: Airlines, airports and insurers across Asia are bracing for the prospect of unusually high damage as the region's tropical storm season begins, as hundreds of aircraft grounded by the coronavirus pandemic can't be moved easily.

Headlines: Big in China and tiny in the U.S., Fast Retailing seen weathering pandemic
Description: The coronavirus pandemic is shredding the global apparel industry, stripping hundreds of billions of dollars from sales and thrusting big names like J.Crew into bankruptcy protection.

Headlines: Google faces $5 billion lawsuit in U.S. for tracking 'private' internet use
Description: Google was sued on Tuesday in a proposed class action accusing the internet search company of illegally invading the privacy of millions of users by pervasively tracking their internet use through browsers set in "private" mode.

Headlines: U.S. FAA chief to testify at Senate hearing on Boeing 737 MAX
Description: U.S. Federal Aviation Administration chief Steve Dickson will testify June 17 before a U.S. Senate panel on certification of the Boeing 737 MAX that was involved in two fatal crashes in five months that killed 346 people.

Headlines: Wells Fargo stops giving loans to most independent car dealerships
Description: Wells Fargo & Co will stop providing loans to a majority of its independent auto dealer customers due to the economic challenges brought on by the COVID-19 pandemic, a spokeswoman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Tech advocacy group's lawsuit says Trump's order on social media is unconstitutional
Description: An advocacy group backed by the tech industry sued President Donald Trump on Tuesday over his executive order that would weaken a law protecting online platforms including social media companies that label or fact-check his posts.

Headlines: After Facebook staff walkout, Zuckerberg defends no action on Trump posts
Description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg told employees on Tuesday that he stood by his decision not to challenge inflammatory posts by U.S. President Donald Trump, refusing to give ground a day after staff members staged a rare public protest.

Headlines: Zoom nearly doubles revenue forecast on remote-work boost, but costs rising
Description: Zoom Video Communications Inc  nearly doubled its expectations for annual sales on Tuesday, driven by a surge in users as more people work from home and connect with friends online during coronavirus lockdowns.

Headlines: Twitter names ex Google CFO Pichette as chair, Kordestani to stay on
Description: Twitter Inc  on Tuesday appointed Patrick Pichette, a former chief financial officer at Google, as the social network's board chairman, marking the first time in Twitter's history that an outsider will preside over the group.

Headlines: Wall Street closes up on signs of economic rebound
Description: A late-session rally pushed Wall Street to solid gains on Tuesday as market participants looked past widespread social unrest and pandemic worries to focus instead on easing lockdown restrictions and signs of economic recovery.

Headlines: Rental fleet collapse drags down U.S. vehicle sales
Description: The collapse in demand for new vehicles from U.S. rental car fleets hit automakers hard in May, even as consumer sales were stronger than expected as coronavirus stay-at-home orders began to ease.

Headlines: Lyft says May rides jump 26% from prior month
Description: Ride-hailing firm Lyft Inc said on Tuesday that rides on its platform rose 26% in May from the previous month helped by strong growth in cities where coronavirus-induced restrictions have been eased.

Headlines: Oil up more than 3% ahead of OPEC+ meeting and on easing lockdowns
Description: Oil prices climbed by more than $1 a barrel on Tuesday on hopes that major crude producers will agree to extend output cuts during a video conference expected to be held this week and as countries and U.S. states begin to reopen after coronavirus lockdowns.

Headlines: Equities cruise to three-month highs, dollar under protest pressure
Description: World stock markets hit their highest levels since March and oil prices jumped on Tuesday as signs of a global economic recovery from the coronavirus pandemic offset concerns over the worst civil unrest in the United States in decades.

Headlines: GM should emerge from pandemic with permanently lower costs: CEO
Description: General Motors Co  should emerge from the coronavirus pandemic with a permanently reduced cost base after it scrambled to reduce its cash burn to withstand a two-month shutdown in North American production as part of efforts to halt the spread of COVID-19, its top executive said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Advocacy group sues to block Trump social media executive order
Description: A Washington-based advocacy group on Tuesday asked a U.S. judge to invalidate an executive order on social media companies President Donald Trump signed last week claiming it violates the First Amendment.

Headlines: U.S. launches trade probe into digital taxes, plowing ground for new tariffs
Description: The United States is investigating digital services taxes being adopted or considered by Britain, Italy, Brazil and other countries, the U.S. Trade Representative's office said on Tuesday, a move that could lead to new punitive tariffs and heighten trade tensions.

Headlines: U.S. sanctions four shipping firms for transporting Venezuelan oil
Description: The U.S. Treasury Department on Tuesday said it had sanctioned four shipping firms for transporting Venezuelan oil, the latest escalation in Washington's effort to oust socialist President Nicolas Maduro by cutting off the OPEC nation's crude exports.

Headlines: Geely's Polestar plans China showroom expansion to compete with Tesla: sources
Description: Polestar, the premium electric vehicle maker owned by China's Geely, plans a big expansion of its showroom network in the mainland, sources said, as it prepares for delivery of cars to compete with Tesla Inc's  locally made Model 3.

Headlines: California court hears appeal of $289 million verdict against Bayer in first Roundup cancer trial
Description: A California appeals court on Tuesday heard arguments in the first case that went to trial over allegations that Bayer AG's glyphosate-based weed killer Roundup causes cancer, resulting in a $289 million judgment against the company.

Headlines: JPMorgan, Barclays settle Mexican bond rigging litigation
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co and Barclays Plc will pay $20.7 million to resolve investors' claims they conspired to rig the Mexican government bond market, the first of nine banks in the proposed class-action litigation to settle.

Headlines: U.S. board urges helicopter manufacturers to add crash-data recorders
Description: The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) on Tuesday urged six major manufacturers to equip turbine-powered helicopters with crash-resistant systems to record data, audio and images, after former NBA star Kobe Bryant and eight others were killed in a helicopter crash in January.

Headlines: Factbox: Who are the first members of Facebook's oversight board?
Description: Facebook Inc  on Wednesday named the first members of its independent oversight board, which will be able to overturn the company's decisions on individual pieces of content and recommend policy changes.

Headlines: China is using Huawei to drive a wedge in the UK-U.S. special relationship: senator
Description: China is using telecoms giant Huawei to try to drive a wedge between Britain and the United States, Republican senator Tom Cotton told British lawmakers on Tuesday.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs commits to new central Paris headquarters
Description: U.S. bank Goldman Sachs  has signed a lease for a new Paris headquarters building, committing to a city centre office development at a time when many banks are weighing scaling back their presence in cities amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Southwest offers buyout packages, temporary leaves to 'ensure survival'
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  on Monday extended buyout packages and temporary paid leaves to employees in what its chief executive said was an effort to "ensure survival" as the carrier braces for a slow recovery from the coronavirus pandemic, according to documents detailing the packages that were seen by Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. auto sales in May encourage Detroit plan to rebuild inventories
Description: Several automakers on Tuesday reported stronger-than-expected May sales in the United States, and the Detroit automakers said they will work through their annual summer shutdowns to rebuild inventories as demand recovers from coronavirus shutdowns.

Headlines: No major conditions on Renault's state-backed loan, chairman says
Description: France has not attached any major conditions to a 5 billion euro ($5.6 billion) state-backed loan for Renault, the carmaker's chairman said on Tuesday, although the finance minister called on the company to hold "exemplary" talks with unions.

Headlines: Financing hunt during pandemic lifts May U.S. convertible debt issuance to record
Description: U.S. issuance of convertible bonds in May hit a record high of $20.7 billion, according to Bank of America data, as companies struggling with the impact of the coronavirus pandemic ventured into the one-time niche market seeking cheaper and easier ways to borrow cash.

Headlines: Britain, EU clash over financial market access: diplomats
Description: Britain wants binding commitments from the European Union on financial market access to avoid the country's finance industry suddenly being cut off from the bloc, a request Brussels has rejected, EU officials and diplomats said.

Headlines: U.S. opens national security probe into vanadium imports
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Tuesday it was opening an investigation into whether imports of vanadium, a metal used in aerospace, defense and energy applications, impair U.S. national security.

Headlines: H&M closes U.S. stores amid protests, says it stands behind black community
Description: H&M, the world's second-biggest fashion retailer, said on Tuesday it had temporarily closed 95 of its stores in the United States because of the violent protests following the death of George Floyd in police custody.

Headlines: GM, Ford join U.S. companies condemning George Floyd death, racism
Description: General Motors Co and Ford Motor Co condemned racial inequality in the United States following the death of George Floyd, an unarmed black man, at the hands of police in Minneapolis last week.

Headlines: Global airport group says pandemic safety rules to lengthen pre-departure waits
Description: New global guidelines featuring physical distancing to restart aviation safely during the coronavirus pandemic could add up to two hours of pre-departure time for passengers at some airports during peak hours, the head of an international airports' group said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Pfizer to invest up to $500 million in public drug developers
Description: Pfizer Inc  said on Tuesday it will invest up to $500 million into publicly traded drug developers to fund their treatment candidates and provide access to the U.S. drugmaker's scientific expertise.

Headlines: Bank of America pledges $1 billion to address racial, economic inequality
Description: Bank of America Corp on Tuesday pledged $1 billion to help communities across the country address economic and racial inequality, the first big bank to vow monetary support following violent protests after the death of an unarmed black man at the hands of police in Minneapolis.

Headlines: EU seeks feedback on new antitrust power to investigate companies
Description: EU regulators are seeking feedback about a possible new power to investigate businesses and demand changes even when no competition rules have been broken, in a move aimed at stopping companies from abusing their dominance.

Headlines: Relief rally or bear market bubble? For investors, it's hard to tell
Description: What started as a bear market bounce in U.S. equities has transformed into one of the most dramatic rallies in memory, leaving investors looking to past rebounds, options markets and technical analysis for clues on how far it could run.

Headlines: Volkswagen to install Porsche's CEO as VW brand chief: Auto Motor and Sport
Description: Volkswagen  Chief Executive (CEO) Herbert Diess will promote Porsche CEO Oliver Blume to become head of the VW brand as part of a broader management reshuffle, Auto Motor und Sport said on Tuesday citing company sources.

Headlines: China buys U.S. soybeans after halt to U.S. purchases ordered: sources
Description: State-owned Chinese firms bought at least three cargoes of U.S. soybeans on Monday, even as sources in China said the government had told them to halt purchases after Washington said it would eliminate special treatment for Hong Kong to punish Beijing.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. small business program handed out virus aid to many borrowers twice
Description: A technical snafu in a U.S. government system caused many small businesses to receive loans twice or more under a federal aid program to help businesses hurt by the COVID-19 pandemic, nearly a dozen people with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Amid pandemic, crypto crime surges in first 5 months: CipherTrace
Description: Crypto intelligence company CipherTrace, which started tracking cryptocurrency crime a few years ago, said it has started to see coronavirus-related frauds that require some form of digital currency payment.

Headlines: How grab-and-go food chains are adjusting to coronavirus reality
Description: Restaurants devoted mainly to quick bites and drinks are reconfiguring their businesses to limit traffic in tight quarters and maintain coronavirus social distancing.

Headlines: Sell, stow or dump? Retailers wrestle with mountain of unsold stock
Description: Forget fast or slow fashion, now it's ground to a halt.

Headlines: Exclusive: Winning bidder for Grindr has ties to Chinese owner
Description: An investor group that got U.S. approval to buy Grindr Inc has financial and personal links to the dating app's current owner, China's Beijing Kunlun Tech Co Ltd , Reuters has found, in a possible departure from Washington’s national security policy on deals.

Headlines: George Floyd protests recall earlier tensions, promises of economic change
Description: In November 2015, the shooting death of Jamar Clark by Minneapolis police touched off a debate on race and economic inequality that challenged the city's progressive image and led local corporate leaders to back efforts at better sharing the spoils of a booming Midwestern state.

Headlines: EU to rule on AMS's 4.6 billion euro bid for Osram by July 6
Description: EU antitrust regulators will decide by July 6 whether to clear Austrian sensor maker AMS's  4.6 billion euro ($5.14 billion) bid for German lighting group Osram  after a preliminary review, a European Commission filing showed on Monday.

Headlines: Qatar Petroleum's $19 billion LNG vessel order boon for South Korean shipbuilders
Description: South Korea's ailing shipbuilders have been thrown a lifeline in an increasingly tough market with a $19 billion order from Qatar Petroleum (QP) for liquefied natural gas (LNG) ships, analysts said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China auto sales growth seen for second straight month, boosting recovery hopes
Description: China's vehicle sales are estimated to rise 11.7% on year in May, its top auto industry body said on Tuesday, cementing hopes of a recovery in the world's biggest auto market with the first back to back monthly sales increase in about two years.

Headlines: Embraer seeks business partners but not a repeat of the Boeing deal
Description: The world's No. 3 planemaker Embraer  is open to new business partners after Boeing Co  ditched a $4.2 billion deal that was years in the making, the Brazilian company's chief executive told Reuters.

Headlines: Australia's Woolworths to reward over 100,000 staff with shares for virus efforts
Description: Australia's biggest supermarket chain Woolworths Group said on Tuesday it will reward more than 100,000 of its staff with free company shares for their efforts during a period of upheaval amid bushfires and the coronavirus buying frenzy.

Headlines: Virgin Australia administrator picks Bain, Cyrus as final bidders
Description: Virgin Australia Holdings Ltd's  administrator said on Tuesday it had selected Bain Capital and Cyrus Capital Partners as the final bidders for the country's second-biggest airline.

Headlines: French Finance Minister: Renault loan not signed yet, but should be soon
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Tuesday the government had not yet signed off on a planned 5 billion euro ($5.6 billion) loan for carmaker Renault , though he hoped the loan would be agreed soon.

Headlines: Plunging cost of wind and solar marks turning point in energy transition: IRENA
Description: Plunging costs of renewables mark a turning point in a global transition to low-carbon energy, with new solar or wind farms increasingly cheaper to build than running existing coal plants, according to a report published on Tuesday.

Headlines: Natgas flows to U.S. LNG export plants sink to 9-month low due to coronavirus
Description: The amount of natural gas flowing on pipelines to U.S. liquefied natural gas export plants is at its lowest levels since August, a signal of weak worldwide demand due to government lockdowns to repress the coronavirus.

Headlines: Volkswagen closes $2.6 billion investment in self-driving startup Argo AI
Description: German automaker Volkswagen AG  has closed its $2.6 billion investment in Argo AI, the Pittsburgh-based self-driving startup disclosed in a blog post on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook staffers walk out saying Trump's posts should be reined in
Description: Facebook employees walked away from their work-from-home desks on Monday and took to Twitter to accuse Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg of inadequately policing U.S. President Donald Trump's posts as strictly as the rival platform has done.

Headlines: Ryanair must face U.S. shareholder lawsuit over unionization comments
Description: Ryanair Holdings Plc and Chief Executive Michael O'Leary failed to persuade a U.S. judge to dismiss a securities fraud lawsuit accusing Europe's largest budget airline of defrauding them by downplaying its willingness to recognize labor unions.

Headlines: SoftBank Vision Fund head's pay doubled last year despite massive losses
Description: (This May 29 story corrects Mizuho borrowing to 912 million, not 1.39 trillion yen, in paragraph 6 and borrowing from the three big Japanese banks to almost 2 trillion yen, not 2.45 trillion yen, in paragraph 7 after SoftBank issues corrected filing)

Headlines: Workers return to Mexico's border factories as auto sector reopens
Description: Tens of thousands of workers lined up before dawn to return to work at automotive factories along Mexico's northern border on Monday, the first day that industries joined the country's list of essential activities beginning to reopen.

Headlines: U.S. court refuses to shield Volkswagen in diesel scandal lawsuits
Description: A U.S. appeals court ruled on Monday that Volkswagen AG  cannot escape potential financial penalties from two counties in Florida and Utah that may amount to a "staggering" additional liability arising from the German automaker's diesel emissions scandal.

Headlines: Boeing takes Embraer to arbitration over failed aviation deal
Description: Boeing Co  has taken former partner Embraer SA  to arbitration over a failed $4.2 billion deal, the Brazilian planemaker said in a securities filing on Monday night.

Headlines: Facebook, Snapchat join chorus of companies condemning George Floyd death, racism
Description: Facebook Inc  and Snapchat developer Snap Inc  became the latest  U.S. companies condemning racial inequality in the United States as violent protests flared up across major cities over the death of George Floyd, an unarmed black man who died while in police custody in Minneapolis last week.

Headlines: Wall Street closes higher as recovery signs soothe protest, pandemic worries
Description: U.S. stocks posted gains on Monday as signs of U.S. economic recovery helped offset jitters over increasingly violent social unrest amid an ongoing pandemic and rising U.S.-China tensions.

Headlines: Visa sees recovery in U.S. payments volume in May
Description: Visa Inc's  total U.S. payments volume fell at a much slower pace in May from the previous month, indicating that consumer spending was picking up as the government starts to ease coronavirus-induced lockdowns.

Headlines: U.S. companies issue shares at fastest rate ever, selling the rally
Description: U.S. public companies sold more than $60 billion in shares in May, the biggest monthly haul ever, as they capitalized on a stock market rally fueled by hopes that the COVID-19 pandemic is subsiding.

Headlines: World equities edge higher despite U.S.-China tensions
Description: World stock markets hovered near three-month highs and safe-haven government bonds inched lower as risk appetite grew on signs that the global economic downturn has bottomed, despite worries over violent protests in the United States and unease over Washington's standoff with Beijing.

Headlines: Oil steady; U.S.-China tensions weigh, possible output cuts support
Description: Oil futures steadied on Monday as rising U.S.-China tensions weighed on sentiment, but prices drew support from reports that OPEC and Russia were close to a deal extending output cuts.

Headlines: Volkswagen says ready to restart Mexico operations on June 15
Description: The Mexican unit of Germany's Volkswagen AG said on Monday the automaker was ready to restart operations in the states of Puebla and Guanajuato on June 15 after activity was idled in late March due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Nestle to appeal ban on 'Incredible Burger' branding in Europe
Description: Nestle  said on Monday it would appeal a Dutch court's ruling that prohibits the Swiss food giant from selling its plant-based burgers in Europe under the "Incredible Burger" name after a challenge from U.S.-based Impossible Foods.

Headlines: Marriott opens all hotels in China, sees steady U.S. recovery: CEO
Description: Marriott International  has reopened all its hotels in China and is seeing a steady recovery in the United States, its biggest market, Chief Executive Officer Arne Sorenson said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court rebuffs investors' bid to block Madoff trustee lawsuits
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday refused to hear a bid by major banks and companies including Koch Industries Inc to prevent a trustee chasing money for victims of imprisoned Ponzi scheme swindler Bernard Madoff from recouping funds that were transferred overseas.

Headlines: Sign here first: U.S. salons, gyms, offices require coronavirus waivers
Description: As U.S. businesses reopen after weeks of pandemic lockdowns, many have been posting coronavirus disclaimers or requiring employees and patrons to sign waivers before entering.

Headlines: Argentina flag carrier Aerolineas seeks to suspend workers' contracts
Description: Aerolineas Argentinas will begin negotiations with unions to suspend the contracts of thousands of employees until August after the flag carrier's income plunged about 97% due to the coronavirus outbreak, it said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing activity crawls off 11-year low
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity eased off an 11-year low in May, the strongest sign yet that the worst of the economic downturn was behind as businesses reopen, though the recovery from the COVID-19 crisis could take years because of high unemployment.

Headlines: Nissan sees cost of quitting Barcelona at up to $1.7 billion, source says
Description: Nissan Motor Co  has estimated the closure of its plants in Barcelona could cost up to around 1.5 billion euros ($1.7 billion), a union source told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Coty names Chairman Harf as CEO to oversee turnaround
Description: Coty Inc  said on Monday Peter Harf, chairman of both the company and its top investor JAB Holdings, would return as chief executive officer after nearly two decades to help the cosmetics maker revive its business amid the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Eli Lilly starts human study of potential COVID-19 antibody treatment
Description: Eli Lilly and Co said on Monday it had started an early-stage trial to test its potential treatment for COVID-19, in the world's first study of an antibody treatment against the disease.

Headlines: 'Lemon' or not, Trump stuck with Phase 1 China trade deal for now
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has little choice but to stick with his Phase 1 China trade deal for now despite his anger at Beijing over the coronavirus pandemic, new Hong Kong security rules, and dwindling hopes China can meet U.S. goods purchase targets, people familiar with his administration's deliberations say.

Headlines: Major Aston Martin shareholder cuts stake in British carmaker
Description: A top Aston Martin  shareholder cut its stake in the British carmaker by nearly 5%, a regulatory filing showed on Monday.

Headlines: Construction spending falls less than expected
Description: U.S. construction spending fell less than expected in April even as other sectors of the economy buckle under the COVID-19 crisis.

Headlines: Zynga to buy Turkish mobile game-maker Peak for $1.8 billion
Description: Zynga Inc  said on Monday it would buy Turkish mobile-game maker Peak for $1.8 billion, in a move that will boost the company's daily active user base by 60%.

Headlines: Lufthansa supervisory board rubber stamps $10 billion state bailout
Description: Lufthansa's  supervisory board has approved a 9 billion euro ($10 billion) government bailout that will force the German airline to give some of its prized landing slots to rivals.

Headlines: Global remittances could fall by $100 billion in 2020, says Citi
Description: Slower economic growth expectations prompted Citi on Monday to slash its forecasts for global remittances, saying this raised the risk to credit ratings of smaller emerging market countries and was set to push up their borrowing costs.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler to list robot-making business after PSA merger
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA)  said it planned to list robot making business, giving more detail on Monday about the future of Turin-based Comau, which it already planned to spin off.

Headlines: Embraer says China, India are potential partners after failed Boeing deal
Description: Brazil's Embraer SA  said on Monday that China and India could be potential new partners, following a Reuters report last week that said those two countries as well as Russia were interested in the planemaker's commercial jets division.

Headlines: Pfizer declines about 8% after setback to breast cancer treatment
Description: Shares of Pfizer Inc  fell nearly 8% on Monday after an independent data monitoring committee determined the drugmaker's breast cancer treatment was unlikely to meet the main goal of a late-stage study.

Headlines: Nasdaq keeps Philadelphia trading floor closed due to protests
Description: Nasdaq Inc said it postponed Monday's planned reopening of its PHLX options trading floor in Philadelphia, which had been closed because of the coronavirus pandemic, due to the demonstrations over the death of a black man, George Floyd, in police custody.

Headlines: Rich world's jobs crisis jolts money flows to millions
Description: Carlos Sosa, a Salvadoran waiter in New York, used to send up to $500 a month back home to his mother to help pay for her medical bills and food. But now, after the coronavirus hit and he lost his job in early March, Sosa has burned through his savings and the wire transfers have stopped.

Headlines: Spanish telecom operator MasMovil agrees $3.3 billion private equity bid
Description: KKR , Cinven and Providence said on Monday they had made a 2.96 billion euro ($3.3 billion) board-backed bid for Spanish telecoms operator MasMovil .

Headlines: Aircraft makers go digital to fight coronavirus delivery logjam
Description: Helicopter and jet makers are turning to digital technology so customers can inspect their big-ticket purchases remotely before taking delivery, as they strive to push through deals paralyzed by the coronavirus pandemic and bring in much needed cash.

Headlines: Gilead trades that made millions on COVID-19 drug news raise eyebrows
Description: Well-timed trades in Gilead Sciences Inc's  options ahead of good news on the biopharmaceutical company's COVID-19 drug treatment may draw regulatory scrutiny, experts said.

Headlines: U.S. utilities look newly cheap, but face COVID-19 headwinds this summer
Description: U.S. utility stocks have started to look like bargains after being considered expensive relative to the broader market for well over a year. Still, the outlook is far from certain as demand this summer is set to be hard hit by the contraction in commercial and industrial usage.

Headlines: London Stock Exchange finds broad backing for shorter trading day
Description: There is broad backing in stock markets for cutting the trading day by 90 minutes in a coordinated way across European exchanges, the London Stock Exchange said on Monday.

Headlines: Walmart's Flipkart to re-apply for food retail license in India
Description: Walmart Inc's  Indian e-commerce unit Flipkart said on Monday it would re-apply for a food retail license in India after reports said its earlier proposal was rejected by the government last week.

Headlines: Wall Street and Fed fly blind as coronavirus upends annual stress tests
Description: U.S. financial regulators, banks and their investors will get their first glimpse into the health of the nation's banking system as it confronts soaring corporate and consumer defaults in the economic crisis sparked by the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Factbox: What's new with the Fed's 2020 bank stress tests?
Description: The Federal Reserve's bank stress tests will look significantly different in 2020, thanks to regulatory changes and the dramatic economic turmoil brought on by coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Europe's factories starting to recover, Asia's pain worsens
Description: European manufacturers may be over the worst of a coronavirus-driven downturn, but Asia's pain deepened in May due to a slump in global trade, with export powerhouses Japan and South Korea seeing the sharpest falls in activity in over a decade, surveys showed.

Headlines: Buffett-backed BYD to supply EV batteries to Ford
Description: Chinese electric vehicle (EV) maker BYD Co Ltd ,  will supply EV batteries to U.S. automaker Ford Motor Co , a document on the website of the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology showed on Monday.

Headlines: Opel to add PSA model to Ruesselsheim production: Handelsblatt
Description: German automaker Opel is planning to start manufacturing a compact car for French parent PSA at its main Ruesselsheim plant from mid-2021 onwards, German business daily Handelsblatt reported, citing company sources.

Headlines: Yum China to bring Beyond Meat's plant-based burgers to China
Description: Yum China Holdings Inc  said on Monday it will introduce Beyond Meat Inc's  plant-based burgers at its fast-food restaurants in mainland China starting June 3.

Headlines: Emirates could take four years to resume flying to entire network
Description: Emirates' outgoing President Tim Clark on Monday said it could take the state carrier up to four years to resume flying to its entire network that has been decimated by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Worst may be over for euro zone factories, recovery to be slow: PMI
Description: Euro zone manufacturers appear to have passed their nadir, a survey showed on Monday, but activity is still contracting sharply as government-imposed lockdowns due to the coronavirus pandemic keep demand in check.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor's May sales fall sharply year-on-year on COVID-19 impact
Description: South Korea's Hyundai Motor Co  said on Monday its provisional May sales fell 39% year-on-year to 217,510 vehicles globally, as the coronavirus outbreak continued to hit demand in key markets.

Headlines: Analysts' View: Impact of the U.S. protests on financial markets
Description: National Guard troops have been deployed in 15 U.S. states and the U.S. capital after five nights of violence and destruction that began with peaceful protests over the death of a black man, George Floyd, in police custody.

Headlines: Workers nervously eye return to Lear's coronavirus-hit plant in Mexico
Description: Lear Corp is implementing costly safety measures that may hurt productivity at its operations in Mexico after suffering the deadliest known factory-related coronavirus outbreak in the Americas, but the U.S. auto parts maker still faces a battle to win back workers' trust.

Headlines: Escalating China tensions could become an obstacle for U.S. stock rally
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's directive on Friday to begin the process of eliminating special treatment for Hong Kong is likely to put China-U.S. tensions back in the headlines over the coming months, creating a new driver of volatility in global equity markets.

Headlines: Retailers already hit by coronavirus board up as U.S. protests rage
Description: Target Corp and Walmart said on Sunday they shuttered stores across the United States as retailers already reeling from closures because of the coronavirus pandemic shut outlets amid protests that included looting in many U.S. cities.

Headlines: Delta, union working to avoid furloughs of 2,300 pilots
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc  and its pilots union said on Sunday they are working to avoid furloughs of roughly 2,300 pilots following a reshuffling process meant to match staffing to summer 2021 flying.

Headlines: Coty to appoint Chairman Peter Harf as its new CEO: WSJ
Description: Coty Inc  is set to announce that Peter Harf, its current chairman, will become the cosmetics company's new chief executive officer, replacing Pierre Laubies, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Amazon's Jeff Bezos invests in UK digital freight forwarder Beacon
Description: Amazon.com Inc Chief Executive Jeff Bezos has picked British startup Beacon, a digital freight forwarder, for his latest investment.

Headlines: Exclusive: Mexican broadcaster Televisa to launch mobile phone service, challenging Slim
Description: Mexican broadcaster Televisa said on Sunday it will start offering mobile phone service, a bid to challenge billionaire Carlos Slim's America Movil, which has long dominated the country's telecommunications market.

Headlines: Embraer negotiating $600 million bank financing for exports
Description: Brazilian planemaker Embraer SA , the world's third largest commercial jet builder, should obtain $600 million in credit lines from Brazil's state development bank BNDES and private banks in June, government sources said on Sunday.

Headlines: Russia has no objection to earlier OPEC+ meeting: sources
Description: Russia has no objection to the next meeting of OPEC and its allies, known as OPEC+, being brought forward to June 4 from the following week, three OPEC+ sources familiar with the meeting's preparations told Reuters on Sunday.

Headlines: Renault chairman dismisses fears over potential Maubeuge closure
Description: Renault  has no plans to close its Maubeuge plant in northern France, Chairman Jean-Dominique Senard said on Sunday, two days after the carmaker announced 15,000 job cuts globally as part of a major restructuring.

Headlines: EU trade commissioner Hogan mulling candidacy for WTO chief
Description: European trade commissioner Phil Hogan is considering putting his name forward as a candidate to be the next director-general of the World Trade Organization, his spokesman said on Sunday.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Investors eye consumer discretionary stocks as U.S. reopens
Description: Investors are taking a closer look at the market's consumer discretionary companies as a reopening U.S. economy fuels hopes of a turnaround for some of the sector's hardest-hit names.

Headlines: Exclusive: Zoom plans to roll out strong encryption for paying customers
Description: Video conferencing provider Zoom  plans to strengthen encryption of video calls hosted by paying clients and institutions such as schools, but not by users of its free consumer accounts, a company official said on Friday.

Headlines: Amazon removes racist messages after they appear on some product listings
Description: Amazon.com Inc  said it was removing certain images after messages using extremely strong racist abuse appeared on some listings on its UK website when users searched for Apple's  AirPods and other similar products.

Headlines: Google postpones Android 11 unveiling amid U.S. protests
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google on Saturday said it has postponed next week's planned unveiling of the beta version of its latest Android 11 mobile operating system in light of protests and unrest in the United States.

Headlines: Credit Suisse's Rohner sees no big hit from oil & gas exposure: SRF
Description: Credit Suisse will not take a significant hit from its exposure to the battered oil and gas sector, Chairman Urs Rohner told Swiss state broadcaster SRF on Saturday.

Headlines: Lufthansa accepts tweaked demands by Brussels over state bailout
Description: Lufthansa's management board has accepted a more favourable set of demands from the European Commission in exchange for approval of a 9 billion euro ($10 billion) government bailout, the carrier said on Saturday, paving the way for its rescue.

Headlines: U.S. pipeline operator Energy Transfer warns of coming job cuts
Description: U.S. pipeline operator Energy Transfer LP  will begin cutting about 6% of its workforce next week, underscoring the spreading impact of weak oil and gas prices on the energy business.

Headlines: Sale of shut Philly refinery to real estate developer delayed
Description: The closing of a $252 million sale of the Philadelphia Energy Solutions (PES) oil refinery to a Chicago-based real estate developer has been delayed, a city official and source with knowledge of the agreement said on Friday.

Headlines: Lyft violates Washington DC sick day law during pandemic, lawsuit claims
Description: Lyft Inc was sued on Friday by a former driver who accused the ride-sharing company of failing to provide required paid sick leave to drivers in Washington, D.C., a policy she said could fuel the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Wall Street ends mostly higher as U.S.-China spat simmers
Description: U.S. stocks finished mostly higher on Friday after President Donald Trump announced measures against China in response to new security legislation that were less threatening to the U.S. economy than investors had feared.

Headlines: United Airlines cutting 13 top jobs, adding international flights in July
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  said on Friday it will eliminate 13 officer positions even as it adds international flights back to its network, part of a restructuring to address the hit on its business from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Southwest Airlines CEO sees low-fare environment when traffic returns
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  Chief Executive Officer Gary Kelly said on Friday he expects a "brutal low-fare" environment when traffic returns after coronavirus-induced restrictions ease.

Headlines: Stocks rebound on relief at Trump's response to China over Hong Kong
Description: A gauge of global equities rebounded and crude oil rose on Friday after U.S. President Donald Trump ordered an end to Washington's special treatment of Hong Kong, a move investors welcomed as unlikely to jeopardize a trade accord with China.

Headlines: U.N. agency task force urges uniform approach to flying during coronavirus
Description: A United Nations aviation-led task force is urging airlines, airports and countries to come up with a uniform approach to flying safely during the coronavirus pandemic, although it stopped short of providing specific requirements for the hard hit industry's recovery.

Headlines: Trump administration to study ways to protect for U.S. investors from Chinese firms
Description: The Trump administration will study ways to safeguard Americans from the risks of investing in Chinese companies, U.S. president Donald Trump said on Friday, ratcheting up pressure on the firms to comply with U.S. accounting and disclosure rules.

Headlines: U.S. senators urge probe of TikTok on children's privacy
Description: Four U.S. senators, including a China hawk, urged the Federal Trade Commission on Friday to investigate allegations that the popular video app TikTok violated a consent decree protecting children's privacy.

Headlines: Oil surges 5% on U.S.-China trade optimism, falling crude output
Description: Oil prices soared on Friday, with U.S. futures closing out May with record monthly gains, on hopes that the U.S.-China trade deal would remain intact and on falling crude production.

Headlines: Tencent in talks to buy Warner Music stake: WSJ
Description: Chinese internet giant Tencent Holdings Ltd  is in talks to invest $200 million in Warner Music Group, ahead of the record company's slated initial public offering next week, the Wall Street Journal reported https://www.wsj.com/articles/tencent-in-talks-to-buy-warner-music-stake-11590774885 on Friday.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley plans June return of some traders to New York headquarters: CNBC
Description: Morgan Stanley  is planning to start getting some traders to return to its New York headquarters in mid- to late-June, CNBC reported on Friday, citing people with knowledge of the situation.

Headlines: Los Angeles union, joined by 'Pandemic Pig,' demands meatpacking plant closure
Description: The union representing workers at a meatpacking plant near Los Angeles where at least 153 employees have come down with COVID-19 called on Thursday for the plant's immediate closure, saying measures to control the outbreak were not working.

Headlines: Coffee maker JDE Peet's IPO wrapped up in just 72 hours: sources
Description: It took just three days to sell shares in JDE Peet's  as investors facing a dearth of opportunities because of the coronavirus-induced slow-down rushed to secure a dose of the world's No. 2 maker of packaged coffee.

Headlines: Coronavirus sinks U.S. consumer spending; savings hit record high
Description: U.S. consumers cut spending by the most on record for the second straight month in April while boosting savings to an all-time high, and the growing frugality reinforced expectations the economy could take years to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: China's Kunlun says U.S approves sale of Grindr to investor group
Description: Chinese gaming company Beijing Kunlun Tech Co Ltd said on Friday that a U.S. national security panel approved the $620 million sale of popular gay dating app Grindr to an investor group called San Vicente Acquisition LLC.

Headlines: Wells Fargo reveals new risk management structure
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  on Friday appointed Kevin Reen as chief risk officer (CRO) for its consumer lending arm and Bill Juliano to lead its operational risk management team as it revealed a new organizational structure to provide risk oversight.

Headlines: Ryanair's Lauda airline shuts down Vienna base
Description: Ryanair's  Austrian carrier Lauda said on Friday it was closing down its Vienna base after failing to reach an agreement with unions on pay, and had already relocated many of its 15 planes to other bases.

Headlines: Exclusive: Brazil's Embraer draws foreign interest after Boeing rift - sources
Description: Aircraft makers are circling Brazil's Embraer  weeks after Boeing  ditched plans for a historic commercial aviation tie-up, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Take Five: Hong Kong takes center stage
Description: China just concluded its closed-door annual meeting of parliament, the National People's Congress (NPC), with top officials making clear that employment is the top priority.

Headlines: OPEC delivers three quarters of record oil cut in May: survey
Description: OPEC oil output hit the lowest in two decades in May as Saudi Arabia and other members started to deliver a record supply cut, a Reuters survey found, although Nigeria and Iraq are laggards in making their share of the reduction.

Headlines: Uber launches hourly ride booking option in some U.S. cities
Description: Uber Technologies Inc on Friday said it would offer rides by the hour in some U.S. cities, a feature aimed at helping Americans with essential trips during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: We thought too big, Renault says as it axes 15,000 jobs in cost-cutting reboot
Description: Renault acknowledged that its global ambitions had been unrealistic, announcing plans to cut about 15,000 jobs, shrink production and restructure French plants as it pressed the reset button and sought to banish the spectre of Carlos Ghosn.

Headlines: Renault factory worker spared layoffs - for now
Description: Giovanni Pili, a worker at a Renault factory in France, was on Friday savoring the fact that he was not laid off in a global shakeup at the carmaker, and trying not to think too much about the uncertain future facing his plant, and his industry.

Headlines: Volkswagen pumps 2 billion euros into China electric vehicle bet
Description: Volkswagen AG  plans to boost its electric push in China, the world's biggest auto market, by pumping 2.1 billion euros in two Chinese electric vehicle players.

Headlines: Volkswagen says it will have full control of JAC-VW Chinese venture
Description: German automaker Volkswagen  will have full management control of its JAC-VW joint venture, the company's China CEO said on Friday.

Headlines: Danish state prosecutor drops investigation of Danske Bank auditor EY
Description: Denmark's state prosecutor has dropped its investigation into whether accounting firm EY breached anti-money laundering laws in connection with its audit of Danske Bank , the Danish Business Authority said on Friday.

Headlines: German official sees Lufthansa bailout in reach, demands fairness
Description: The Berlin government is likely to reach a deal with Brussels on a $10 billion government bailout of stricken airline Lufthansa , senior government official Thomas Jarzombek said on Friday, but stressed the German airline needed fair treatment.

Headlines: EU's Vestager denies making Lufthansa bailout more difficult
Description: EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager denied on Friday that she was putting hurdles in the way of Lufthansa's  $10 billion government rescue, saying companies getting big capital injections from the state have to offset their competitive advantage.

Headlines: 'Intensive' talks on Lufthansa with EU Commission ongoing: Germany
Description: Berlin is in intensive talks with the European Commission over a planned bailout for flagship German carrier Lufthansa , a government spokesman said on Friday.

Headlines: As lockdowns ease, a Bronx nail salon plans a careful reopening
Description: When Yahaira Caraballo opened her nail salon in the Bronx, New York nearly seven years ago, it was a bare-bones shop with two nail technicians.

Headlines: Ukraine expects $5 billion IMF loan approval on June 5 - PM
Description: Ukraine expects the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to approve a $5 billion (4.05 billion pounds) loan package at a board meeting on June 5 and the first tranche of $1.9 billion to be disbursed the following day, Prime Minister Denys Shmygal told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: SoftBank leads $500 million fundraising for Didi's self-driving unit
Description: China's Didi Chuxing said on Friday it had completed a fundraising round of over $500 million for its autonomous driving subsidiary that was led by SoftBank Group's  Vision Fund 2.

Headlines: Japan backs nearly a third of $6.6 billion loans to Nissan: sources
Description: The Japanese government has guaranteed almost a third of the 7l3 billion yen ($6.65 billion) in loans Nissan Motor Co  has secured from its main lenders to weather the COVID-19 pandemic, according to three people with knowledge of the plans.

Headlines: Canada's Huawei extradition ruling could unleash more Chinese backlash
Description: A Canadian court ruling that could permit the extradition of a senior Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] executive to the United States leaves Canada vulnerable to further retaliation from Beijing, analysts said.

Headlines: China says Canada is an accomplice of U.S. in Huawei case
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Friday that Canada is an accomplice to the U.S. government's efforts to bring down Chinese tech giant Huawei and said Canada should immediate release Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou.

Headlines: Exclusive: Russia's Rosneft finds extended oil cuts painful - sources
Description: Rosneft  does not have enough crude to ship to buyers with which it has long-term supply deals, making it hard for the Russian company to continue with record oil cuts beyond June, four sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Virgin Australia administrator to shortlist two bidders early next week
Description: The administrator of Virgin Australia Holdings  expects to shortlist two preferred bidders early next week after parties on Friday confirmed non-binding indicative proposals to acquire the airline.

Headlines: Travel disruptions, cost cutting key issues for U.S. business in China: report
Description: Global travel disruptions are the top concern for American businesses in China, of which many are cutting compensation and bonuses amid the fallout of the COVID-19 epidemic, according to a report from a business group.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley not given advisory role on Aramco pipeline sale: sources
Description: Morgan Stanley  has not been given an advisory role on the potential sale of a stake in Saudi Aramco's pipeline business, a deal worth over $10 billion, two sources told Reuters.

Headlines: China's Geely raises $836 million from share sale
Description: Geely Automobile Holdings Ltd  said on Friday it raised HK$6.48 billion ($836 million) from a share placement as the Chinese automaker looks to replenish its coffers to finance growth in the world's largest auto market.

Headlines: With 'Main Street' in view, Fed weighs risks of job, productivity shocks
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve officials have talked broadly about helping households and firms through the current economic crisis and quickly unleashed trillions of dollars in cash and credit guarantees to build a "bridge" to the post-pandemic world.

Headlines: Virgin Australia's administrator to shortlist two bidders early next week
Description: The administrator of Virgin Australia Holdings Ltd  said it expected to shortlist two preferred bidders early next week after parties confirmed non-binding indicative proposals to acquire the airline on Friday.

Headlines: Trump move could scrap or weaken law that protects social media companies
Description: President Donald Trump said he will introduce legislation that may scrap or weaken a law that has protected internet companies, including Twitter and Facebook, in an extraordinary attempt to regulate social media platforms where he has been criticized.

Headlines: Exclusive: Argentina says new debt revamp proposal in right direction, still falls short
Description: Argentina's economy minister said on Friday that a newly received debt restructuring proposal from two creditor groups was a step in the right direction, but still fell short of what the country needed to strike a deal.

Headlines: Tyson Foods will shut U.S. pork plant as more workers catch COVID-19
Description: Tyson Foods Inc  said on Thursday it will temporarily close an Iowa pork plant due to the coronavirus pandemic, a month after U.S. President Donald Trump ordered slaughterhouses to stay open to protect the country's food supply.

Headlines: U.S. judge orders 15 banks to face big investors' currency rigging lawsuit
Description: A U.S. judge on Thursday said institutional investors, including BlackRock Inc  and Allianz SE's  Pacific Investment Management Co, can pursue much of their lawsuit accusing 15 major banks of rigging prices in the $6.6 trillion-a-day foreign exchange market.

Headlines: California regulator approves PG&E's Chapter 11 reorganization plan
Description: PG&E Corp said on Thursday its Chapter 11 reorganization plan has been confirmed by a California power regulator, bringing the power provider one step closer to emerge from bankruptcy and participate in a state-backed wildfire fund.

Headlines: Sainsbury's new boss Roberts faces unexpected in-tray
Description: When Sainsbury's  new boss Simon Roberts hosts a virtual focus group with supermarket shoppers on his first day in charge on Monday, the conversation will be radically different from the one he might have imagined when he got the job.

Headlines: Costco profit falls on coronavirus-related costs
Description: Costco Wholesale Corp  reported a 7.5% fall in quarterly profit on Thursday, as it spent more on wages and sanitizing its warehouse clubs and halted sales of some high-margin products due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Wall Street ends down in late selloff; Facebook and China weigh
Description: Wall Street ended lower on Thursday following a late-session reversal, with Facebook weighing on the market after President Donald Trump said he would sign an executive order related to social media companies and would hold a news conference on China on Friday.

Headlines: Salesforce cuts annual estimates on COVID-19 hit
Description: Salesforce.com Inc cut its annual revenue and profit forecasts on Thursday, as the cloud-based business software maker allowed clients to defer payments and provided its sales team one-time commissions amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: GM to increase North America vehicle production
Description: General Motors  said on Thursday it would start increasing vehicle production in North America from next week to meet rising demand.

Headlines: Nordstrom sales plunge nearly 40% on pandemic-led store closures
Description: Upscale department store chain Nordstrom Inc  on Thursday reported a nearly 40% slump in quarterly sales, as lockdowns to contain the COVID-19 pandemic shut stores.

Headlines: UPS adds 'peak' surcharge amid coronavirus fueled delivery spike
Description: United Parcel Service Inc  on May 31 will slap surcharges on U.S. e-commerce companies that have flooded its delivery network with shipments of everything from packaged food to patio furniture since the coronavirus took hold in March.

Headlines: Renault poised to announce 15,000 layoffs worldwide: union
Description: French carmaker Renault is poised to announce 15,000 layoffs worldwide on Friday as it unveils a plan to boost its profitability and cope with faltering sales, a representative for the CFDT union said after meeting with the company.

Headlines: Stocks, euro rise on recovery hopes; U.S.-China rift lifts gold
Description: A gauge of global equity markets climbed on Thursday on optimism for a speedy economic recovery and a massive stimulus plan in Europe helped lift regional stocks and the euro, while gold rebounded on a safety bid on deteriorating U.S.-China relations.

Headlines: ViacomCBS slashes up to 400 jobs as part of merger restructuring: source
Description: ViacomCBS Inc  is cutting up to 400 employees across CBS as part of its plan to save $750 million from its merger with CBS, a source familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. major airlines roll out more options to avoid staff layoffs
Description: The top three U.S. airlines, hit hard by the coronavirus pandemic, are rolling out fresh programs to induce tens of thousands of employees to accept voluntary leave or early retirement in the hope of avoiding widespread furloughs in the fall, company memos show.

Headlines: Cisco to acquire software firm ThousandEyes
Description: Cisco Systems Inc  has agreed to acquire privately held software maker ThousandEyes Inc, the network gear maker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Dell beats revenue estimates as remote working lifts workstation demand
Description: Dell Technologies Inc beat analysts' estimates for quarterly revenue on Thursday, boosted by demand for its workstations from companies moving more employees to work from home due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Italy's credit agency SACE approves state guarantees for FCA $7 billion bank loan: source
Description: The board of Italy's export credit agency SACE has approved state guarantees covering 80% of a 6.3 billion euro ($7 billion) bank loan for Fiat Chrysler  , a  source close to the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: LATAM's bankruptcy filing to delay its Brazil bailout to at least July: sources
Description: LATAM Airlines Group's  U.S. bankruptcy filing this week will delay its potential bailout in Brazil to at least July and also push back aid to its rivals at least through the end of June, two sources said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: TikTok owner ByteDance moves to shift power out of China - sources
Description: TikTok's poaching of Disney's Kevin Mayer to be its CEO was just the most visible part of a broader strategy by its Chinese owner to shift its centre of power away from China at a time of rising global tensions, several people familiar with the plans said.

Headlines: Trump directs AG to boost enforcement of state laws on social media companies
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that he is directing Attorney General William Barr to work with states to enforce their own laws against what he described as deceptive business practices by social media companies.

Headlines: S&P cuts Rolls-Royce credit rating to junk on COVID-19 hit
Description: Ratings agency Standard & Poor's cut engine maker Rolls-Royce's  credit rating to junk on Thursday, citing the disruption caused to global air travel from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Oil rises as higher U.S. refinery rates offsets surprise crude build
Description: Oil futures rose about 2% on Thursday as a steady improvement in U.S. refining activity offset a surprise build in crude and diesel inventories and on worries that China's new Hong Kong security law could result in trade sanctions.

Headlines: Masks, cleaning, filtration better than blocking middle seats: United CEO
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  Chief Executive Scott Kirby said on Thursday that facial masks, aircraft cleaning and air filtration systems are better measures for preventing the spread of the coronavirus on airplanes than trying to social distance.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan says U.S. economy has bottomed, ties rebound to testing
Description: The U.S. economy has likely bottomed, Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Robert Kaplan said on Thursday, but a healthy rebound depends on a massive increase in testing so that people feel comfortable resuming traveling, dining out and other pre-crisis activities.

Headlines: German auto supplier ZF Friedrichshafen to cut up to 15,000 jobs: memo
Description: German car parts supplier ZF Friedrichshafen plans to reduce the workforce by up to 15,000 jobs, or around 10%, by 2025 as a result of a slump in demand, according to a memo on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump could sign order on social media companies later on Thursday: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump could sign an executive order on social media companies later on Thursday, but the timing could change, White House Press Secretary Kayleigh MacEnany said, after Twitter urged readers to check facts in tweets sent by Trump earlier this week for the first time.

Headlines: General Electric cash flow forecast disappoints, shares fall
Description: General Electric  expects to burn more cash than expected in the second quarter, as the industrial conglomerate struggles with weakness in its aviation business due to the coronavirus crisis, Chief Executive Officer Larry Culp said on Thursday.

Headlines: New York's Cuomo says businesses can turn away people not wearing masks
Description: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo said he would sign an executive order on Thursday authorizing businesses to deny entry to anyone who does not wear a mask or face covering, stressing masks were critical to preventing the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Latin America grabs world spotlight for airline bankruptcies
Description: LATAM Airlines and Avianca Holdings  survived the Great Depression, but just a few weeks of quarantines forced both companies into bankruptcy, marking Latin America as the world's top spot for airline financial ruin.

Headlines: U.S. state of Arizona files consumer fraud lawsuit against Google
Description: Arizona filed a consumer fraud lawsuit against Alphabet Inc's Google on Wednesday, alleging that the U.S. tech giant used "deceptive" and "unfair" practices to obtain the location data of users.

Headlines: Senator sees U.S. sticking to trade deal with China despite pandemic concerns
Description: U.S. Senate Finance Committee Chairman Chuck Grassley on Thursday said he did not expect President Donald Trump to walk away from a Phase 1 trade deal with China despite concerns over Beijing's handling of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Talks on support for German car industry delayed: Bild
Description: Closely-watched talks between top German politicians and car industry representatives to discuss support for a sector hit hard by the coronavirus crisis will no longer take place on Tuesday, the head of the VDA car association told Bild.

Headlines: Small-business loan terms eased under U.S. House-passed bill
Description: The U.S. House of Representatives on Thursday approved legislation increasing the amount of time, to 24 weeks from the current eight weeks, for small businesses to use Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loans spurred by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. taxpayers' virus relief went to firms that avoided U.S. taxes
Description: Last month Zagg Inc, a Utah-based company that makes mobile device accessories, received more than $9.4 million in cash from a U.S. government program that has provided emergency loans to millions of businesses hit by the coronavirus.

Headlines: If Trump kicks out Twitter, there's always Germany
Description: If U.S. President Donald Trump goes ahead with his threat to close Twitter, the micro-blogging site can always relocate to Germany.

Headlines: Volkswagen board formally okays Ford alliance projects
Description: Volkswagen  said on Thursday its supervisory board had approved several projects in a multibillion-dollar alliance with Ford Motor  that was first announced last July.

Headlines: Dollar chains expect robust demand as shoppers brace for recession
Description: America's top dollar store chains beat profit estimates on Thursday and said they would benefit from demand for affordable groceries and household essentials in coming months as rising unemployment threatens to spur a deep recession.

Headlines: German union accuses Volkswagen of 'management errors' that put jobs at risks
Description: Germany's biggest labor union criticized Volkswagen  on Thursday for a recent advert deemed racist and other "errors", saying management had damaged the carmaker's reputation and put jobs at risk.

Headlines: Amazon to offer permanent roles to 70% of 175,000 new U.S. hires
Description: Amazon.com Inc  plans to offer permanent jobs to about 70% of the U.S. workforce it has hired temporarily to meet consumer demand during the coronavirus pandemic, the company told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims drop, but economic recovery still elusive
Description: The number of Americans seeking jobless benefits fell for an eighth straight week last week, likely as some people returned to work, but claims remained at astonishingly high levels, suggesting it could take the economy a while to rebound as businesses reopen.

Headlines: Nissan plans big cuts to go small after first loss in 11 years
Description: Nissan Motor Co outlined a new plan on Thursday to become a smaller, more efficient carmaker after the coronavirus pandemic exacerbated a slide in profitability that culminated in its first annual loss in 11 years.

Headlines: Spain says it will do all it can to reverse Nissan closure, workers protest
Description: Spain said on Thursday it would do everything possible to stop Nissan from closing its main car factory in the country as angry workers burned tyres and shouted "War" outside the Barcelona plant.

Headlines: Citigroup looks to return some staff to NY headquarters over the summer: Bloomberg News
Description: Citigroup Inc looks to return a small number of staff to its New York headquarters in July or possibly August, with workers reentering its London offices possibly even earlier, Chief Executive Officer Michael Corbat told Bloomberg News in an interview.

Headlines: Gum, mints and snack bar sales slump, as U.S. consumers order online amid COVID-19 crisis
Description: Impulse purchases - gum, mints and snack bars tossed into a shopping basket as one snakes through the supermarket checkout line - are falling as more people get groceries delivered or pick them up curbside.

Headlines: KKR to inject money into vending machine group Selecta: sources
Description: U.S. buyout group KKR  is preparing to inject funds into Swiss vending machine company Selecta, which is saddled with debts and faces a loss of business due to the coronavirus crisis, four sources close to the matter said.

Headlines: Spain aims to convince Nissan to change mind on Barcelona plant, hopes Renault stays
Description: Spain will do everything it can to get Nissan  to reverse its decision to close its Barcelona plant, Foreign Minister Arancha Gonzalez Laya said on Thursday.

Headlines: Southwest Airlines adds routes catering to business travelers
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  said on Thursday it was adding new routes with more frequencies and nonstop flights from Phoenix, Denver, Las Vegas and Nashville.

Headlines: Home trading triggers bank 'black hole' surveillance alerts
Description: Potential breaches of market rules have spiked since traders began working from home in March, drawing scrutiny from regulators and piling pressure on banks to plug "black holes" in surveillance systems, industry officials say.

Headlines: Champagne sales sink in a world with little to celebrate
Description: Global champagne sales are forecast to slump by a third, or 100 million bottles, this year as the coronavirus crisis shuts bars and restaurants worldwide and hammers economies.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nissan settles dispute with Indian state over unpaid dues - sources
Description: Nissan Motor Co  has agreed to settle a long-running dispute with the Indian state of Tamil Nadu after claiming it was owed 50 billion rupees ($660 million) in unpaid dues and damages, six sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Despite rally, 2020 to be worst year for stocks in nearly a decade: Reuters poll
Description: This year will be the worst for many world stock markets in nearly a decade at least, although a majority of equity strategists polled by Reuters say top indexes will not revisit lows struck this March following an explosive rally since then.

Headlines: Exclusive: UK retailer Debenhams cuts 'hundreds' of head office staff - sources
Description: British department store group Debenhams has cut "hundreds" of head office jobs as it slims down its administrative functions to support a smaller business in the future, two people with knowledge of the situation told Reuters.

Headlines: Nissan must watch cash given possible risk of second virus outbreak: CEO
