Description: Nissan Motor Co's cash situation is "tough" as the coronavirus has sapped car sales, and the automaker must be vigilant in the coming months as a second wave of infections may add to liquidity issues, CEO Makoto Uchida told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. firms shield CEO pay as pandemic hits workers, investors
Description: Sonic Automotive Inc , which operates 95 U.S. car dealerships, started laying off and furloughing about a third of its workforce as the coronavirus pandemic crushed its sales. Then it changed its executives' pay packages - handing them a multimillion-dollar windfall.

Headlines: Dollar Tree quarterly same-store sales rise 7%
Description: Dollar Tree Inc  reported a surge in quarterly same-store sales on Thursday, joining rival Dollar General , as the discount retailer benefited from consumers stockpiling on groceries and other essentials due to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: U.S. states, cities may snub Fed lending program over high rates
Description: High borrowing costs will limit participation in a $500 billion U.S. Federal Reserve short-term borrowing program set up to address state and city revenue shortfalls due to the economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak, analysts said.

Headlines: EasyJet to cut 4,500 jobs to stay competitive after crisis
Description: Britain's easyJet  plans to cut up to 4,500 jobs and shrink its fleet to adjust to the smaller travel market which is forecast to emerge from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Nissan says to close Barcelona plant from December
Description: Nissan Motor Co intends to close its Barcelona main plant and two nearby facilities starting from December 2020, but it will keep open two facilities in northern Spain, the chairman of Nissan in Europe, Gianluca De Ficchy, said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump leapfrogs back ahead of Obama in stock market gains
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is once again beating predecessor Barack Obama in stock market performance following a stunning recovery on Wall Street.

Headlines: GM, Ford turn to fast-payment programs to aid suppliers hit by shutdowns
Description: General Motors Co  and Ford Motor Co  are using fast-payment programs set up with financial lenders to help cash-strapped small suppliers survive production shutdowns caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Renault to take 3.6 billion euro hit from Nissan losses
Description: French carmaker Renault  said on Thursday that losses at its Japanese partner Nissan , in which it has a 43% stake, would drag on its on net earnings by 3.6 billion euro ($3.96 billion) in the first quarter.

Headlines: U.S. senators weigh additional sanctions on Russia's Nord Stream 2
Description: Two U.S. senators are considering drafting further sanctions on Russia's Nord Stream 2 natural gas pipeline if Moscow goes ahead and finishes laying pipes, in another blow to a project which has already faced delays.

Headlines: From bikes to blockchain: Shipping industry goes digital in lockdown
Description: The coronavirus lockdown has accelerated a digitalisation drive in a global shipping and logistics sector that still routinely delivers many documents by bike messenger in some countries, according to industry leaders.

Headlines: French carmaker PSA to make surgical masks at Mulhouse site
Description: French carmaker PSA said on Thursday that it would start manufacturing surgical masks at its site in Mulhouse in eastern France from August.

Headlines: American Airlines says to cut management and support staff by 30%
Description: American Airlines Group Inc must reduce its management and support staff by about 30% and may have to cut frontline employees as it downsizes due to the coronavirus outbreak, showed a letter to employees made public on Wednesday.

Headlines: Alibaba extends its reach in China as coronavirus outbreak opens doors
Description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd is emerging as one of China's biggest corporate winners of the coronavirus crisis, gaining the opportunity to expand its businesses and solidify its status as a critical part of the country's socio-economic engine.

Headlines: Huawei CFO Meng loses key court fight against extradition to United States
Description: Huawei Technologies Co's Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou was dealt a setback by a Canadian court on Wednesday as she tries to avoid extradition to the United States to face bank fraud charges, dashing hopes for an end to her 18-month house arrest in Vancouver.

Headlines: Nissan slashes capacity by a fifth after first loss in 11 years
Description: Nissan Motor Co  said on Thursday it would slash its production capacity by a fifth to help reduce its fixed costs by 300 billion yen ($2.8 billion) as it looks to become a smaller, more cost-efficient automaker following a slide in sales.

Headlines: Trump to sign executive order on social media on Thursday: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will sign an executive order on social media companies on Thursday, White House officials said after Trump threatened to shut down websites he accused of stifling conservative voices.

Headlines: Explainer: What happens next in Huawei CFO's U.S. extradition case
Description: A Canadian judge will rule Wednesday on a key aspect of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou's extradition to the United States. The judge will rule on double criminality, meaning whether the charges against Meng were illegal in both Canada and the United States at the time of her December 2018 arrest.

Headlines: Timeline: Key events in Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou's extradition case
Description: A Canadian judge will rule Wednesday on a key aspect of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou's extradition to the United States. The judge will rule on double criminality, meaning whether the charges against Meng were illegal in both Canada and the United States at the time of her December 2018 arrest.

Headlines: Safran shares lifted by Boeing 737 MAX restart plan
Description: Safran  shares rose on Thursday after Boeing  said it would restart production of its 737 MAX jet and announced further cost-cutting measures.

Headlines: EasyJet not planning equity raise, doesn't rule it out in future: CEO
Description: Britain's easyJet  is not planning on raising new equity currently but its chief executive did not rule it out in future as the low-cost airline seeks to survive the coronavirus pandemic which has wiped out air travel.

Headlines: EasyJet will not fly to Italy with distancing on planes: report
Description: EasyJet  will not fly to Italy if Rome prolongs social distancing rules on planes beyond June 15, the budget airline's chief executive said in a newspaper interview.

Headlines: Greensill drops libel suit against Reuters over bond story
Description: Greensill Capital said it has dropped a libel suit against Reuters over a story which said that the financing group had provided a false statement to market participants in 2018.

Headlines: Renault loan still not signed, site closures must be last resort: Le Maire
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire on Thursday said that the government had yet to sign off on a planned 5 billion euro ($5.5 billion) loan for Renault , and that the carmaker's site closures and job cuts could only ever be a last resort.

Headlines: Tencent raises $6 billion in largest Asian corporate debt deal this year
Description: Chinese social media and gaming giant Tencent Holdings Ltd said on Thursday it raised $6 billion in a U.S. dollar bond sale - the largest debt deal by an Asian corporate in 2020.

Headlines: U.S. business to Trump: Go slowly on Hong Kong response
Description: Business groups are urging U.S. President Donald Trump to go slowly in responding to Beijing's planned imposition of new national security laws on Hong Kong, warning revoking the city's special U.S. privileges will hurt the territory and its people.

Headlines: Boeing cutting more than 12,000 U.S. jobs, thousands more planned
Description: Boeing Co  said on Wednesday it was eliminating more than 12,000 U.S. jobs, including 6,770 involuntary layoffs, as the largest American planemaker restructures in the face of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. stocks to end year around current levels as virus takes toll: Reuters poll
Description: U.S. stocks will end this year around current levels as the coronavirus pandemic cripples the economy and eats into earnings, according to strategists polled by Reuters.

Headlines: New wave of U.S. layoffs feared as coronavirus pain deepens
Description: Job cuts by U.S. state and local governments whose budgets have been crushed fighting the COVID-19 pandemic and more second-wave layoffs in the private sector likely contributed last week to a 10th straight week of more than 2 million Americans seeking unemployment benefits.

Headlines: Germany's Bosch to begin restarting operations in Mexico
Description: German automotive supplier Bosch on Monday said it has received government approval in Mexico to restart operations, which had been suspended since late March due to measures taken to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Factbox: Where do Trump and Biden stand on tech policy issues?
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday threatened to regulate or shut down social media companies, a day after Twitter Inc for the first time added a fact-checking label to some of his tweets about mail-in ballots.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg says government censoring social media not the 'right reflex'
Description: Facebook Inc's Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg, commenting on U.S. President Donald Trump's threats against social media companies, said on Wednesday censoring a platform would not be the "right reflex" for a government worried about censorship.

Headlines: Micron raises third-quarter revenue forecast
Description: Micron Technology Inc  raised its revenue forecast for the third quarter on Wednesday to a range of $5.2 billion to $5.4 billion from $4.6 billion to $5.2 billion, sending its shares about 3% higher.

Headlines: Billionaire Icahn exits Hertz with 'significant' loss after bankruptcy filing
Description: Billionaire investor Carl Icahn, who was the largest shareholder in Hertz Global Holdings Inc, unloaded his entire stake in the rental car company at a "significant loss" days after it filed for bankruptcy protection.

Headlines: Nissan to set out survival plan after expected annual loss
Description: Nissan Motor Co  will unveil its plan to become a smaller, more cost-efficient automaker on Thursday as it looks to recover from four years of tumbling profits which are set to culminate in its first annual operating loss in 11 years.

Headlines: Nissan Motor to close Barcelona plant: El Pais
Description: Japan's Nissan Motor Co  will close its factory in Barcelona, resulting in the loss of about 2,800 jobs, Spanish newspaper El Pais reported, citing government and union sources.

Headlines: Wall Street rises with economic hopes; bank stocks jump
Description: U.S. stocks rose on Wednesday, with the S&P 500 closing above 3,000 for the first time since March 5, as the further easing of lockdowns lifted optimism for an economic recovery.

Headlines: U.S. states sue Trump administration over fuel efficiency rollback
Description: A group of 23 U.S. states and the District of Columbia filed a lawsuit on Wednesday challenging a Trump administration decision to weaken Obama-era fuel efficiency standards.

Headlines: Trump will sign an executive order on social media companies: White House spokeswoman
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will sign an executive order shortly regarding social media companies, a White House spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exxon shareholders soundly reject splitting CEO/chairman roles
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp  shareholders soundly rejected climate-related proposals and splitting the chairman and chief executive's roles at the oil major's shareholder meeting on Wednesday.

Headlines: JPMorgan's investment banking head: quarterly revenues tracking 50% up from 2019
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co's  head of its corporate and investment banking division said second-quarter revenues for its markets unit are on track to be up more than 50% higher than the same period last year, thanks to extremely strong fixed income and equities trading revenues.

Headlines: Luxury homebuilder Toll Brothers scraps 2020 forecast on COVID-19 woes
Description: U.S. luxury homebuilder Toll Brothers Inc  on Wednesday withdrew its full-year forecast and warned it would not provide such guidance for the foreseeable future due to uncertainty caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: United reshuffles management as it prepares for uncertain recovery
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  is reshuffling its management team to help the airline prepare for the near-term uncertainty of travel demand, new Chief Executive Scott Kirby told employees on Wednesday, as restrictions to keep the coronavirus from spreading are lifted.

Headlines: Boeing resumes 737 MAX production at low rate
Description: Boeing Co  on Wednesday said it has resumed production of its 737 MAX passenger jet at the company’s Renton, Washington, plant at a "low rate" after halting production in January following two crashes that killed 346 people.

Headlines: American Airlines CEO quells U.S. bankruptcy talk, says demand improving
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  is not considering a Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing, Chief Executive Doug Parker said on Wednesday and dismissed speculation that a major U.S. carrier could disappear due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Oil slides on U.S.-China tensions, OPEC+ uncertainty
Description: Oil futures tumbled on Wednesday after U.S. President Donald Trump said he was working on a strong response to China's proposed security law in Hong Kong and as some traders doubted Russia's commitment to deep production cuts.

Headlines: FedEx set to take stake in German deliver firm Hermes: report
Description: U.S. logistics company FedEx Corp  is close to taking a stake in German parcel delivery firm Hermes, the Handelsblatt newspaper reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Nissan to begin restart of U.S. auto plants on June 1
Description: Japanese automaker Nissan Motor Co  said Wednesday it plans to begin restarting its shuttered U.S. manufacturing operations beginning June 1.

Headlines: Ackman says hedge fund up 27% year to date, dumped Berkshire
Description: William Ackman's hedge fund is boasting double-digit gains at a time many portfolios have sunk along with the economy during the coronavirus pandemic, after the billionaire investor plowed cash into a number of companies he already owned and dumped Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway among other stocks.

Headlines: MGM Resorts to re-open its Las Vegas casinos on June 4
Description: MGM Resorts said on Wednesday it would re-open its Las Vegas casinos on June 4 after months of closure due to public health restrictions aimed at curbing the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Stocks rally on EU stimulus plan, euro gains
Description: Equity markets rallied on Wednesday, lifted by enthusiasm for the European Union's plans for a 750 billion euro ($823 billion) recovery fund, but crude prices slid on concerns about unrest in Hong Kong over Beijing's proposed national security laws.

Headlines: BlackRock votes to split CEO, chairman roles at Exxon Mobil
Description: Top fund manager BlackRock Inc  on Wednesday said it cast an advisory vote in favor of an independent chairman at Exxon Mobil Corp  and cast votes against the reelection of two directors over the company's approach to climate risks.

Headlines: U.S. businesses hammered by pandemic but see some green shoots, Fed says
Description: U.S. businesses continued to be slammed by the effects of the novel coronavirus epidemic into the middle of May, a Federal Reserve report showed on Wednesday, and few expected a swift recovery despite some signs of hope.

Headlines: Exclusive: Chevron to cut up to 15% of staff amid restructuring
Description: Chevron Corp  will cut 10% to 15% of its worldwide workforce as part of an ongoing restructuring at the second-largest U.S. oil producer.

Headlines: Dollar treads water against euro; yuan sinks on U.S.-China tensions
Description: The dollar steadied against the euro on Wednesday even as the common currency remained supported by news of a proposal for an economic recovery package to help the euro zone region recover from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Moderna rally loses steam over COVID-19 vaccine worries
Description: Shares of biotechs racing to make coronavirus vaccines, including Moderna Inc , fell about 10% on Wednesday, as investor concerns grew about the prospects of the experimental products that are still in early stages of development.

Headlines: Occidental is sued by shareholders, bondholders over Anadarko merger
Description: Occidental Petroleum Corp  has been sued by investors who claim they suffered billions of dollars of losses because the heavily indebted company concealed its inability to weather plunging oil prices, after paying $35.7 billion to acquire Anadarko Petroleum Corp.

Headlines: Ferragamo calls back Norsa to help weather COVID storm
Description: Italian luxury group Salvatore Ferragamo  has called back former CEO Michele Norsa as executive director to help management revamp the brand and weather the COVID-19 storm.

Headlines: Exclusive: Google faces antitrust case in India over payments app - sources
Description: India's antitrust body is looking into allegations that Alphabet Inc's Google is abusing its market position to unfairly promote its mobile payments app in the country, five sources familiar with the case told Reuters.

Headlines: Wall Street frets as 'unloved' stock rally powers on
Description: The love-hate relationship many investors had with U.S. stocks during the more-than-decade-long bull market is reemerging, as equities steadily climb in the face of economic devastation and uncertainty over the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Huawei CFO loses key aspect of U.S. extradition case in Canada court
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou has lost a key aspect of the trial on her extradition to the United States, a Canadian court announced on Wednesday.

Headlines: Lufthansa board rejects EU conditions on $10 billion bailout
Description: Lufthansa's  $10 billion government bailout was thrown into doubt on Wednesday after the German airline's supervisory board refused to accept the conditions attached by Brussels.

Headlines: South African Airways can still be saved with funding: administrators
Description: South African Airways (SAA) can still be saved if it gets the necessary funding, the state-owned airline's administrators said on Wednesday, adding they were talking to the government about a potential restructuring.

Headlines: Ford to gradually resume operations, production at Mexican plants
Description: Ford Motor Co  will gradually resume operations and production at several of its Mexican plants, the automaker said on Wednesday, as the sector begins to come back online as coronavirus contingencies are relaxed.

Headlines: All three Detroit automakers had workers test positive for COVID-19 since plants reopened
Description: In the week since U.S. auto factories reopened after coronavirus lockdowns, workers at all three Detroit automakers have tested positive for COVID-19 but only Ford Motor Co has temporarily closed plants.

Headlines: U.S. mortgage applications rise for sixth straight week
Description: U.S. applications for home mortgages jumped last week, in a sixth straight weekly increase, suggesting the housing market could lead the economy's recovery from the novel coronavirus crisis even as high unemployment is expected to linger.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs president says bank on track to meet growth goals
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  President and Chief Operating Officer John Waldron said Wednesday that the bank remains on track to achieve its medium and long term growth targets despite the economic shocks caused by the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Hershey says mint, gum sales hit as lockdowns restrict social gatherings
Description: Hershey Co  said on Wednesday sales of gums and mints have taken a hit as social distancing protocols spurred by the COVID-19 pandemic discouraged people from participating in gatherings.

Headlines: Nokia veteran Sari Baldauf takes over as 5G battle rages
Description: Sari Baldauf took over as chairwoman of telecoms equipment maker Nokia  on Wednesday, succeeding Risto Siilasmaa who chaired the Finnish firm for eight years.

Headlines: Italy's RCS says court ruled 2013 sale to Blackstone valid, may still win damages
Description: Milan's Arbitral Tribunal has judged that the 2013 sale of RCS'  headquarters to Blackstone Group  was valid but found that the purchaser's behaviour may entitle the Italian publisher to compensatory damages, RCS said late on Tuesday.

Headlines: Online sales surge helps Ralph Lauren recover in China
Description: Ralph Lauren Corp said on Wednesday a surge in online shopping was helping it get back on track in China and putting it on course for a recovery from the financial damage wrought by the COVID-19 lockdowns in other markets as well.

Headlines: Tesla cuts prices by as much as 6% in North America to boost demand
Description: Tesla Inc  has cut prices of its electric vehicles by as much as 6% in North America following a decline in auto demand in the region during weeks of lockdown that have now started to ease.

Headlines: Renault and Nissan rule out merger as they unveil survival plan
Description: Renault , Nissan Motor Co  and Mitsubishi Motors Corp  ruled out a merger on Wednesday and doubled down on a plan to cooperate more closely on car production to save costs and salvage their troubled alliance.

Headlines: Germany's Altmaier: Lufthansa bailout is in Europe's own interests
Description: German Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Wednesday he expected the European Commission to approve a 9-billion euro bailout of flagship carrier Lufthansa, adding that it was also in Europe's interests to avoid a sell-off of such companies.

Headlines: Factbox: Renault and Nissan's plan to rebuild their alliance
Description: The automaking alliance of Renault SA , Nissan Motor Co  and Mitsubishi Motors Corp  outlined a new strategy on Wednesday whereby the strongest partner takes the lead in areas such as new technologies and parts procurement.

Headlines: Americas will be hardest hit by COVID-19 job losses :ILO
Description: The Americas will bear the brunt of an estimated 305 million job losses that the COVID-19 pandemic will cause worldwide between April and June, the International Labour Organization (ILO) said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ryanair's holiday bookings surge, sees UK dropping quarantine
Description: Ryanair  expects Britain to join other European nations in dropping COVID-19 quarantine plans in the coming weeks, its CEO told Reuters on Wednesday, as he reported a "big surge" in holiday bookings from the country.

Headlines: LATAM becomes largest airline driven to bankruptcy by coronavirus
Description: LATAM Airlines Group , the continent's largest carrier, filed for U.S. bankruptcy protection on Tuesday, becoming the world's largest carrier so far to seek an emergency reorganization due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Timeline: From boom to bottom: Renault and Nissan bet on deeper cooperation
Description: Renault SA , Nissan Motor Co  and Mitsubishi Motors have no plans to merge and will instead focus on a new production sharing plan to cut costs and improve efficiency, Chairman Jean-Dominique Senard said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Renault-Nissan announce plan to deepen cooperation to ensure group's survival
Description: Renault SA, Nissan Motor Co and Mitsubishi Motors Corp on Wednesday announced details of a new strategy plan pledging to deepen cooperation in developing and producing cars to survive as an automaking group.

Headlines: Exclusive: Volkswagen in final talks to seal biggest M&A deals in China EV sector - sources
Description: Volkswagen AG  is in final talks to seal its largest investment deals with Chinese electric vehicle (EV) firms, two sources said, as the German automaker accelerates its push into the world's largest market for environmentally friendlier cars.

Headlines: Why U.S. energy CEOs will get big payouts despite oil meltdown
Description: National Oilwell Varco Inc (NOV) has had a rough few years: Since 2017, the Houston company, whose drilling equipment is in major oilfields worldwide, has lost two-thirds of its value, costing shareholders a combined $9 billion.

Headlines: Hong Kong lines up MSCI derivatives launch amid doubts on city's future
Description: Hong Kong's exchange is launching derivatives with index provider MSCI in a deal that hurts rival Singapore and boosts its global appeal amid U.S. warnings that Chinese pressure on the city’s autonomy threatens its future as a financial hub.

Headlines: China's Chery Auto plans to sell cars in EU, United States: chairman
Description: China's Chery Automobile, which has a manufacturing partnership with Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) , is planning to sell its own-branded cars in the European Union and United States for the first time, its chairman said.

Headlines: Hugo Boss sees recovery in third quarter at earliest
Description: Hugo Boss  expects a recovery in its business in the third quarter at the earliest due to store closures and consumer caution during the coronavirus pandemic, the chief executive of German fashion house said on Wednesday.

Headlines: H&M sees furloughed HQ staff returning to work in July
Description: Sweden's H&M  expects the 2,500 furloughed staff at its headquarters in Stockholm to return to work in July, the world's second-largest fashion retailer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Turkish Airlines may delay delivery of Airbus, Boeing planes: report
Description: Turkish Airlines , which halted nearly all of its passenger flights as a result of the coronavirus crisis, may delay the delivery of some Boeing  and Airbus  planes, its chairman was quoted as saying on Wednesday.

Headlines: Boeing set to announce significant U.S. job cuts this week: union
Description: Boeing Co is expected to announce U.S. job cuts this week after disclosing last month it planned to shed 10% of its worldwide workforce of 160,000 employees, people briefed on the plans and a union said.

Headlines: Renault has no problems in relations with French state: chairman
Description: Renault  Chairman Jean-Dominique Senard said on Wednesday that relations with the French government were fine, even as the state continues to haggle over finalising a 5 billion euros ($5.5 billion) loan for Renault.

Headlines: Renault's Senard says it does not need to merge with Nissan
Description: Renault  Chairman Jean-Dominique Senard said on Wednesday that there was no need for a merger with its partners Nissan  and Mitsubishi .

Headlines: Fears of coronavirus second wave prompt flu push at U.S. pharmacies, drugmakers
Description: U.S. pharmacy chains are preparing a big push for flu vaccinations when the season kicks off in October, hoping to curb tens of thousands of serious cases that could coincide with a second wave of coronavirus infections.

Headlines: Drugmaker Sanofi to raise over $11 billion via sale of Regeneron shares
Description: Sanofi  will raise over $11 billion from the sale of 21.6 million shares in its U.S. partner Regeneron , the French drugmaker said on Wednesday, adding it would use the proceeds for innovation and general growth.

Headlines: Mexico's auto industry restart gathers steam as lockdown eases
Description: Mexico's auto industry reopening picked up pace on Tuesday, with Fiat Chrysler  and BMW AG  joining peers in gradually dusting off operations even as the wait for approvals slowed the return of some companies.

Headlines: China's GAC keeps target of 3% sales growth despite coronavirus pressure
Description: Chinese automaker GAC , which has partnered with Toyota , Honda  and FCA , will stick to an annual target of 3% in sales growth this year despite fallout from the coronavirus pandemic, its chairman said.

Headlines: Ford sets May 28 as provisional date for gradual restart of Mexican plant
Description: U.S. automaker Ford has set May 28 as a provisional date for the gradual restart of its plant in Hermosillo, Mexico, according to a letter to workers seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Amazon in advanced talks to buy self-driving startup Zoox: WSJ
Description: Amazon.com Inc  is in advanced talks to buy self-driving startup Zoox Inc, in a move that would expand the e-commerce giant's reach in autonomous-vehicle technology, the Wall Street Journal reported https://on.wsj.com/36wXJUV on Tuesday.

Headlines: World economic prospects darken, rebound delayed: Reuters poll
Description: Economic prospects for the developed world this year have darkened again in the past month as the coronavirus pandemic has rolled from Asia to the Americas, with a V-shaped sharp recovery expected by less than one-fifth of economists polled by Reuters.

Headlines: Amtrak needs $1.5 billion bailout, prepares to cut up to 20% of workforce
Description: U.S. passenger railroad service Amtrak said on Tuesday it needs a further $1.475 billion bailout and disclosed plans to cut its workforce by up to 20% in the coming budget year.

Headlines: Stocks rally, S&P 500 crosses 3,000 barrier; oil gains
Description: Global equities and oil rose on Tuesday as China's promise of more stimulus and prospects of a world economic recovery cheered investors, who set aside concerns about tense rhetoric between Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: S&P 500 rises on economic recovery and vaccine hopes, pulls back from highs
Description: U.S. stocks closed higher on Tuesday on optimism about the development of coronavirus vaccines and a revival of business activity, but the S&P 500 failed to hold above the key psychological level of 3,000 points.

Headlines: Used car dealer charged with price gouging New York City on 3M's N95 masks
Description: A New Jersey used car dealer was criminally charged on Tuesday with exploiting the coronavirus pandemic by trying to defraud and price gouge New York City into buying N95 respirator masks in a roughly $45 million scheme.

Headlines: Renault and Nissan rebuild their alliance to ride out the coronavirus storm
Description: When Renault SA , Nissan Motor Co  and Mitsubishi Motors Corp  announced the last strategy plan for their Alliance in September 2017, the goal was to become the world's biggest automaker by 2022.

Headlines: Timeline: From boom to bottom: Renault and Nissan bet on deeper cooperation
Description: The Franco-Japanese automaking alliance of Renault SA , Nissan Motor Co  and Mitsubishi Motors is banking on a new recovery plan, set to be announced later on Wednesday, to salvage profitability.

Headlines: U.S. lawmaker wants insurers, govt. to share future pandemic business losses
Description: U.S. legislation introduced on Tuesday would create a taxpayer-backed insurance program to protect businesses from revenue losses during future pandemics and require insurers to pay a slice of the claims.

Headlines: COVID-19 lawsuit takes on McDonald's like it was a rowdy bar
Description: As U.S. businesses reopen, worried workers and their advocates are borrowing a legal strategy commonly used to shut down rowdy topless bars to try and force employers to strengthen protection against further spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Google to start reopening offices, targets 30% capacity in September
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Tuesday it would reopen buildings in more cities at roughly 10% of their capacity beginning July 6 and scale it up to 30% in September, if conditions permit.

Headlines: NYSE reopens trading floor after two-month coronavirus closure
Description: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo donned a face mask and rang the opening bell at the New York Stock Exchange on Tuesday, marking the partial reopening of the trading floor at 11 Wall Street, which had been shuttered since March 23 due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: 'Rally of hope': Why the S&P soared back past 3,000
Description: Unthinkable just two months ago as the world economy shut down in response to the coronavirus pandemic, the U.S. stock benchmark S&P 500 index broke through the psychologically-important 3,000 level on Tuesday, capping a 37% stock rally since its March low.

Headlines: Instant View: S&P rises above 3,000 level for first time since March
Description: U.S. stocks rose above the 3,000 level for the first time since March 5 on Tuesday, continuing a rally that has pushed the benchmark index up nearly 35% from its March 23 closing low on hopes for a potential coronavirus vaccine and the reopening of businesses across the country.

Headlines: Merck to buy Austrian vaccine maker as it jumps into COVID-19 race
Description: Merck & Co Inc , which has largely kept to the sidelines of the race for COVID-19 treatments, said it was buying Austrian vaccine maker Themis Bioscience and would collaborate with research nonprofit IAVI to develop two separate vaccines.

Headlines: NYSE to reopen trading floor closed by coronavirus
Description: The New York Stock Exchange will partially reopen the trading floors at its iconic 11 Wall Street building on Tuesday for the first time since March 20 when the bourse was forced to go all-electronic due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. business borrowing for equipment falls about 7% in April: ELFA
Description: U.S. companies' borrowings for capital investments fell about 7% in April from a year earlier, the Equipment Leasing and Finance Association (ELFA) said on Tuesday.

Headlines: French carmaker Renault to cut 5,000 jobs by 2024: Le Figaro
Description: French carmaker Renault  is about to announce plans to cut 5,000 jobs by 2024 in its drive to save 2 billion euros  ($2.20 billion) in costs, according to a report published Tuesday by Le Figaro.

Headlines: Oil prices climb, bolstered by ongoing supply curbs
Description: Oil prices rose on Tuesday, supported by signs that producers are following through on commitments to cut supplies and as fuel demand picks up with coronavirus restrictions easing.

Headlines: Armed with whistleblower tips, U.S. SEC cracks down on coronavirus misconduct
Description: The novel coronavirus outbreak and economic fallout is proving to be a bonanza for whistleblower lawyers as the U.S. securities regulator cracks down on a range of related misconduct from companies touting sham cures to misuse of federal aid.

Headlines: JPMorgan CEO: bank will again boost credit reserves in second quarter
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon said on Tuesday that he expects the bank will boost its credit reserves again in the second quarter by an amount "roughly equivalent" to the $7 billion it added in the first quarter to protect the bank from a potential wave of loan defaults.

Headlines: Warner Music kicks off $1.8 billion Nasdaq IPO
Description: Warner Music Group said on Tuesday it is aiming to sell up to $1.82 billion in stock in its U.S. initial public offering, potentially the largest New York IPO so far in 2020 as the market for new stocks rebounds after the COVID-19 pandemic put many debuts on hold.

Headlines: Apple to reopen about 100 U.S. stores, most with curbside pickup
Description: Apple Inc plans to reopen about 100 U.S. stores, mostly with curbside pickup but some with walk-in service, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence stabilizes; new home sales surprise
Description: U.S. consumer confidence nudged up in May, suggesting the worst of the novel coronavirus-driven economic slump was likely in the past as the country starts to reopen, but it could take a while for the economy to dig out of its hole amid record unemployment.

Headlines: Exclusive: Coronavirus spreads in Brazil's oilfields, as six offshore operators register cases
Description: Norway's Equinor ASA , Brazil's Dommo Energia SA  and Anglo-French firm Perenco are among at least six oil producers that have registered coronavirus cases among employees or contractors at facilities off the coast of Brazil, according to industry and regulatory sources.

Headlines: Austrian Airlines, government agree financing package: Kurier
Description: Austria's government and Lufthansa-owned carrier Austrian Airlines  on Tuesday reached agreement on loans for the airline and to keep Vienna airport as a long-haul hub, a major step forward in the rescue negotiations, daily Kurier said.

Headlines: French restaurant ruling puts coronavirus claims on global menu
Description: AXA  will meet the bulk of business interruption claims from some restaurant owners in France, it said on Tuesday, after losing a court case seen as a potential precedent for coronavirus-related disputes across the world.

Headlines: Ryanair challenges Lufthansa's bailout package
Description: Low-cost carrier Ryanair  challenged Germany's 9 billion euro rescue package for Lufthansa  on Tuesday, saying it distorted competition, while the German carrier moves towards finalising the deal next month.

Headlines: BMW to begin gradual restart in San Luis Potosi, Mexico on May 27
Description: German carmaker BMW said on Tuesday it would begin a gradual restart of operations at its plant in the central Mexican state of San Luis Potosi on Wednesday, May 27.

Headlines: LATAM airline shares plunge 51% following bankruptcy announcement
Description: Shares in LATAM Airlines Group SA  plunged 51% on Santiago´s  stock exchange after the region´s top carrier filed for U.S. bankruptcy protection on Tuesday.

Headlines: Hertz awards over $16 million in retention bonus to key executives
Description: U.S. car rental company Hertz Global Holdings  said on Tuesday it has paid about $16.2 million in retention bonuses to a range of key executives at the director level and above, days after the company filed for bankruptcy protection.

Headlines: Global airlines body raises alarm over bailout debts
Description: Heavy debts inherited from government bailouts and other fund-raising moves will delay the airline industry's recovery from the coronavirus crisis, a trade body said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Pandemic forces virtual safety checks for oil tankers
Description: Ship assessors are resorting to virtual inspections of oil tankers to keep vessels afloat, as the coronavirus pandemic makes physical visits to check for seaworthiness tougher and a slump in fuel demand increases the need for ships as storage.

Headlines: UK's John Lewis plans 'phased' re-opening of department stores
Description: British retailer John Lewis Partnership said on Tuesday it will re-open its department stores on a "phased basis" after the government said non-essential retail could re-open from June 15.

Headlines: Nissan and Renault shelve merger plans to repair their alliance: sources
Description: Renault  and Nissan  have shelved plans to push towards the full merger former leader Carlos Ghosn craved and will instead fix their troubled alliance to try to recover from the coronavirus pandemic, five senior sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Factbox: Airlines crumble around the globe amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: The coronavirus crisis, which has virtually grounded global air traffic since March, has pushed several struggling airlines over the edge.

Headlines: Swiss trial begins of banker alleged to have ignored 1MDB warnings
Description: A banker went on trial in Switzerland on Tuesday charged with  failing to sound the alarm over millions of dollars linked to scandal-tainted Malaysian sovereign wealth fund 1MDB.

Headlines: Supercar group McLaren to cut 1,200 jobs across group amid pandemic
Description: British supercar manufacturer McLaren Group, which includes the Formula One team, said on Tuesday it would cut 1,200 jobs under a proposed restructuring programme as it deals with the fallout from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. new home sales unexpectedly rise in April
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes unexpectedly rose in April, but the gains are likely temporary as the coronavirus crisis ravages the economy, unleashing record unemployment.

Headlines: Lithium producers must wait as pandemic slows electric vehicle revolution
Description: The coronavirus pandemic has paused the electric vehicle revolution, forcing producers of battery metal lithium into survival mode with output cuts, expansion delays and sales of major assets.

Headlines: Uber cuts 600 jobs in India as lockdown hits business
Description: Uber Technologies Inc has cut about 600 jobs in India as part of plans to reduce its global workforce by 23%, the company said on Tuesday, joining local rival Ola as the COVID-19 pandemic crushes demand for app-based cab services.

Headlines: Investment bank Moelis in talks to represent Latam bondholders in bankruptcy- source
Description: Investment bank Moelis & Co  is in talks with a group owning around $3 billion in bonds and loans owed by Latam Airlines Group SA  to represent them in the company's bankruptcy, one source with knowledge of the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: KFC to test revamped sandwich after last year's fried chicken frenzy
Description: Kentucky Fried Chicken on Tuesday will begin testing an overhauled sandwich featuring a bigger chicken filet and other modifications that could reignite last year's Great Chicken Sandwich Wars with rivals Popeyes and Chick-fil-A.

Headlines: Qatar Airways plans summer flights to over 80 destinations
Description: Qatar Airways said on Twitter on Tuesday that it planned to fly a summer schedule to over 80 destinations worldwide.

Headlines: Macy's announces $1 billion bond offering to repay credit facility
Description: Macy's Inc  said on Tuesday it planned to raise $1.1 billion in a bond offering, backed by a first mortgage on some of its properties, to repay funds borrowed under a revolving credit facility.

Headlines: Exclusive: ECB prepares for the worst: life without the Bundesbank - sources
Description: The European Central Bank (ECB) is drafting contingency plans to carry out its multi-trillion bond-buying programme without the Bundesbank in case Germany's top court forces the main participant in the scheme to quit, four sources told Reuters.

Headlines: S&P 500 futures surge on recovery, vaccine hopes
Description: U.S. stock futures surged on Tuesday as business restarts and optimism about a potential coronavirus vaccine helped investors returning from a long weekend to overlook Sino-U.S. tensions.

Headlines: Sanofi shares down despite $13 billion Regeneron payday
Description: Shares in Sanofi  fell on Tuesday despite the French drugmaker's impending $13 billion payday from selling most of its 20.6% stake in U.S. partner Regeneron .

Headlines: Hedge funds target France as short-selling bans lifted
Description: A cluster of big name hedge funds have started betting against French companies, moving in after the lifting of a short-selling ban imposed earlier this year to calm financial markets, an analysis of regulatory filings showed.

Headlines: Demand rise, output cuts could mean oil market balance in June
Description: Recovering demand as coronavirus lockdowns ease combined with output cuts by top producers could balance global oil markets as soon as June, some analysts and banks predict.

Headlines: Germany stamps authority on Lufthansa with $9.8 billion lifeline
Description: Germany threw Lufthansa  a 9 billion euro ($9.8 billion) lifeline on Monday, agreeing a bailout which gives Berlin a veto in the event of a hostile bid for the airline.

Headlines: Travel and leisure stocks rejoice on summer holiday hopes
Description: European travel and leisure stocks soared on Tuesday amid reports Spain and Germany would ease travel restrictions, and no noticeable increase in infections were reported during the re-opening of businesses after a two-month lockdown.

Headlines: A Florida toy importer braces for retail upheaval
Description: Most U.S. states have begun to reopen their economies, but Jay Foreman, chief executive of Basic Fun, said he's more worried than ever.

Headlines: Ryanair vows to appeal against Lufthansa aid package
Description: Ryanair  will contest a 9 billion-euro ($9.9 billion) German aid package for Lufthansa, the budget airline's Chief Executive Michael O'Leary said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: 'How about next June?' Small meat processors backlogged as virus idles big plants
Description: Inside the small-scale Iowa abattoir Stanhope Locker and Market, owner Shaunna Zanker yawns with exhaustion as she listens to yet another farmer asking her to slaughter his pigs.

Headlines: U.S. small firms leave $150 billion in coronavirus stimulus untapped
Description: When the U.S. government first rolled out forgivable loans to small businesses in early April under the Paycheck Protection Program, loan officers at Bank of the West in Grapevine, Texas worked nights and weekends to process a tsunami of applications.

Headlines: Exclusive: Cathay Pacific's brand merger hits roadblock from China's aviation regulator
Description: China's aviation regulator may make it difficult for Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd  to merge regional arm Cathay Dragon into its main brand because of infractions during last year's pro-democracy protests, two sources said.

Headlines: EasyJet says finance chief Findlay to leave in 2021
Description: British low cost airline easyJet  said chief financial officer Andrew Findlay plans to leave the company next year, in an announcement made just days after he survived an attempt by the airline's founder to oust him.

Headlines: Total's entry into Spanish power market shows rising competition: Naturgy CEO
Description: France's Total entering Spain's electricity market through the purchase of assets from Portugal's EDP  shows how competition is increasing in the country, the Chief Executive of utility Naturgy said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Israel taps local desalination firm IDE over Hong Kong rival
Description: Israel on Tuesday chose local company IDE Technologies over a Chinese-linked rival to build the country's largest desalination plant to tackle water shortages in one of the driest parts of the world.

Headlines: Macau gambling king Stanley Ho dies aged 98
Description: Macau gambling king Stanley Ho, who built a business empire from scratch in the former Portuguese colony and became one of Asia's richest men, died peacefully at the age of 98, his family confirmed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Korean prosecutors question Samsung heir in succession-related probe
Description: Samsung Group heir Jay Y. Lee was questioned on Tuesday by prosecutors about a controversial 2015 merger and alleged accounting fraud that they said may have helped him advance his succession-planning agenda at the country's top conglomerate.

Headlines: Take Five: Coronavirus vaccine race is on
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has put his faith in anti-malarial drug hydroxychloroquine to ward off COVID-19, but governments and investors are focusing on a vaccine. Without one, it's unlikely economic activity can resume fully.

Headlines: Lufthansa unit Eurowings to cut a third of head-office staff
Description: Eurowings, the low-cost airline owned by Lufthansa , said it would cut a third of the jobs at its headquarters as part of wider efforts to return the German airline group to profitability after a major state bailout.

Headlines: Tencent to invest $70 billion in 'new infrastructure'
Description: Chinese tech giant Tencent Holdings  will invest 500 billion yuan ($70 billion) over the next five years in technology infrastructure including cloud computing, artificial intelligence and cybersecurity, the company said Tuesday.

Headlines: Macau gambling king Stanley Ho's family confirms his death at age 98
Description: Macau gambling king Stanley Ho, who built a business empire from scratch in the former Portuguese colony and became one of Asia's richest men, died peacefully at the age of 98, his family confirmed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Casino king Stanley Ho: the man who built the gambling hub of Macau
Description: Macau gambling king Stanley Ho, who built a business empire from scratch in the former Portuguese colony and became one of Asia's richest men, died on Tuesday at the age of 98.

Headlines: Aston Martin confirms Mercedes boss Moers will replace CEO Palmer
Description: Aston Martin  confirmed on Tuesday that Tobias Moers, CEO of Mercedes-AMG, would become chief executive on August 1, replacing Andy Palmer who stepped down on Monday.

Headlines: 'This could be the one that gets me,' says oilfield service veteran
Description: Tim Harris was preparing to relocate for an assignment with energy services firm Halliburton Co  for the fifth time in 15 years when his career came to a halt.

Headlines: Uber-rival Bolt raises 100 million euros
Description: Ride-hailing service Bolt said on Tuesday it has raised 100 million euros ($109 million) from London-based investment firm Naya Capital Management in a deal valuing the European rival of Uber at 1.7 billion euros.

Headlines: Daimler to invest in Chinese EV battery maker Farasis' $480 million IPO: sources
Description: Daimler AG  plans to invest in Farasis Energy's planned $480 million IPO, aiming to ensure a stable supply of batteries from the Chinese firm as it ramps up electric vehicle production, three people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico unit pays scaled-down tax of $358 million after government talks
Description: Walmart de Mexico paid $358 million in taxes after talks with the Mexican government over an even larger sum authorities had aimed to charge the retailer for the sale of a restaurant chain, the company said on Monday.

Headlines: Chile's Latam Airlines Group hires PJT Partners to restructure debt: report
Description: Chile's Latam Airlines Group SA  has hired U.S. investment boutique PJT Partners to explore debt restructuring options that may include bankruptcy protection filings in three countries, Brazilian newspaper O Estado de S. Paulo reported late on Monday.

Headlines: Michelin says its Mexican plants have resumed operations
Description: French tire maker Michelin resumed operations at its two plants in Mexico on Monday, saying that activity will be staggered at first.

Headlines: Germany still in talks with EU over Lufthansa bailout, expects green light: Altmaier
Description: Germany is still in talks with the European Commission over its rescue package for flagship carrier Lufthansa , Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Monday, adding that Berlin expected Brussels to give the green light for the bailout.

Headlines: Air Canada, Transat deal faces intense EU antitrust scrutiny
Description: Air Canada's  bid for Canadian tour operator Transat AT Inc  may result in higher prices and less choice for flights between Europe and Canada, EU antitrust regulators said on Monday as they opened a full-scale investigation into the deal.

Headlines: Toyota, Nissan and Honda gear up for Mexico reboot after COVID-19 lockdowns
Description: Japanese automakers Toyota, Nissan and Honda said they are gradually restarting in Mexico as the nation's automotive industry reboots in line with a broader economic reopening, despite still-high numbers of new coronavirus cases.

Headlines: Volkswagen Mexico won't talk of restart while state decree in place
Description: German automaker Volkswagen  said on Monday it had satisfied federal requirements to resume production in Mexico but would not make announcements about renewing operations as long as a decree in the state of Puebla remains in effect.

Headlines: UBS announces global financing team
Description: UBS  said on Monday it has created a new global financing team, a group that will span across divisions under one group in order to serve clients in a faster and simpler fashion.

Headlines: French billionaires raise stakes in defence of publisher Lagardere
Description: France's business elite closed ranks around publishing group Lagardere  on Monday with LVMH's Bernard Arnault and Vivendi's  Vincent Bollore swooping in to bolster its defences against London-based hedge fund Amber Capital.

Headlines: Toyota prepping for gradual re-start in Mexico: spokesman
Description: Toyota Motor Corp's Mexico unit is in a preparation phase for the gradual re-start of its operations in the states of Baja California and Guanajuato, a spokesman told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Canada's banks to cement status as solid investments in a crisis
Description: Canadian banks, whose dividends yields climbed during the financial crisis, are again gaining favor with investors, as their pledges to maintain payouts gives them an edge over global counterparts who have shunned them.

Headlines: Japan lifts Tokyo's state of emergency, eyes fresh stimulus
Description: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe lifted a state of emergency for Tokyo and four remaining areas on Monday after the number of infections fell across the country, but warned that it could be reimposed if the virus started spreading again.

Headlines: German sentiment survey boosts stocks, Europe focuses on recovery fund
Description: Stocks gained modestly on Monday with many countries on holiday as German business morale rebounded strongly in May, offering a glimpse of optimism to battered investors of what lay beyond weeks of economic lockdowns.

Headlines: Lufthansa says Germany approves stabilization package
Description: Germany's new Economic Stabilization Fund (WSF) has approved a 9 billion euro ($9.80 billion) stabilization package for Lufthansa  , Germany's flagship carrier said on Monday.

Headlines: Germany's Scholz: Lufthansa rescue package should yield 'small profit' for state
Description: Germany's rescue package for flagship carrier Lufthansa  is a "very, very good solution" that is taking into account the needs of both the company and taxpayers, Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Monday.

Headlines: Lufthansa has good prospects for future: German ministries
Description: The German Finance and Economy Ministries on Monday said Lufthansa  was an operationally healthy company before the coronavirus outbreak, as well as profitable and with good future prospects, but had got into trouble due to the pandemic.

Headlines: Nissan says preparing to gradually restart Mexico operations
Description: The Mexican unit of Nissan Motor Co Ltd unit said on Monday that it is preparing to gradually reopen under strict safety measures, beginning with activities that are directly related to vehicle and autoparts manufacturing.

Headlines: French carmaker Renault could close plants and cut jobs: union
Description: French carmaker Renault  could unveil job cuts and plants closures on Thursday as the company looks to save 2 billion euros ($2.2 billion) in costs, a representative for far-left union CGT said on Monday.

Headlines: Talks on Lufthansa aid not concluded yet: ministry
Description: Negotiations on a government bailout for coronavirus-stricken airline Lufthansa  are in their last phase but have not been concluded yet, a spokeswoman of the German economy ministry said on Monday.

Headlines: Merkel won't allow EU to deprive Lufthansa of key slots: Handelsblatt
Description: Chancellor Angela Merkel told senior members of her party that the German government would not allow the European Commission to deprive Lufthansa  of valuable take-off and landing slots at Frankfurt and Munich airports, Handelsblatt reported.

Headlines: New emissions blow for VW as German court backs damages claims
Description: Volkswagen  must pay compensation to owners of vehicles with rigged diesel engines in Germany, a court ruled on Monday, dealing a fresh blow to the automaker almost five years after its emissions scandal erupted.

Headlines: Investing in Spanish Nissan factory cheaper than closing it: Spanish official
Description: Nissan Motor  would find it cheaper to invest in its Barcelona factory than to close it, a senior Spanish industry ministry official said on Monday, pegging the estimated cost of a shutdown at more than 1 billion euros ($1.1 billion).

Headlines: Aston Martin chief to leave, Mercedes-AMG CEO to replace him: source
Description: Aston Martin  Chief Executive Andy Palmer is leaving the business as part of a management shake-up and will be replaced by Tobias Moers, CEO of Mercedes-AMG, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Sunday.

Headlines: China's Great Wall expects mild domestic auto sales growth in second half
Description: Great Wall Motor  expects China's overall auto sales in the second half this year to return to the same level as last year, its president said, as the world's biggest auto market recovers from a coronavirus-driven low.

Headlines: Lufthansa to resume flights to 20 destinations from mid-June
Description: Lufthansa , which is in talks with the German government over a 9 billion euro ($9.8 billion) bailout, will resume flights to 20 destinations from mid-June, including some holiday hot-spots, a spokeswoman said on Sunday.

Headlines: Most publicly listed companies keep U.S. small-business aid loans
Description: More than four-fifths of publicly listed companies that received emergency small-business loans from the U.S. government have held onto them, sticking with a certification that they need the money, according to data from market research firm FactSquared.

Headlines: Air France must slash domestic traffic in exchange for state guarantees -minister
Description: Air France  will have to "drastically" reduce its domestic air traffic in exchange for state loan guarantees, French Environment Minister Elisabeth Borne said on Sunday.

Headlines: Hertz files for U.S. bankruptcy protection as car rentals evaporate in pandemic
Description: The more than a century old car rental firm Hertz Global Holdings Inc filed for bankruptcy protection on Friday after its business was decimated during the coronavirus pandemic and talks with creditors failed to result in much needed relief.

Headlines: Jaguar seeks state loan as coronavirus pandemic takes toll: Sky News
Description: Jaguar Land Rover  is in talks with the British government about a request for temporary state funding of more than 1 billion pounds ($1.22 billion), Sky News said on Saturday, a report the company said was inaccurate.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Investors look beyond drug makers as hunt for COVID-19 treatment heats up
Description: Investors are diversifying bets in the healthcare sector, as the rush to develop treatments for Covid-19 has driven up prices for some pharmaceutical stocks.

Headlines: Large employers push back on U.S. healthcare mergers during coronavirus crisis
Description: A group representing some of the largest U.S. employers has asked Congress for a year-long ban on mergers and acquisitions among hospitals and doctors groups that received government money to cope with the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Kuehne+Nagel owner sees about 20,000 job cuts: Die Welt
Description: Freight-forwarder Kuehne+Nagel  may cut more than 20,000 jobs, with warehouse workers most affected, as the coronavirus-caused economic crisis hits shipping, controlling shareholder Klaus-Michael Kuehne said in an interview.

Headlines: Uber customer claims company won price-fixing suit because arbitrator was scared
Description: An Uber customer on Friday asked a Manhattan federal judge to overturn an arbitration win for the company in a price-fixing case, arguing that the arbitrator only ruled in Uber's favor because he was scared.

Headlines: U.S. agencies ask FCC to rescind Ligado spectrum decision
Description: A group of U.S. agencies on Friday asked the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to reconsider its unanimous April 22 decision to allow Ligado Networks [MOSAV.UL] to deploy a low-power nationwide mobile broadband network, saying it could pose a threat to global positioning systems (GPS).

Headlines: Business groups push Trump to keep skilled-worker visas amid pandemic
Description: A range of business groups have made an 11th-hour appeal to U.S. President Donald Trump as he weighs whether to restrict temporary work visas, warning of negative economic consequences if he blocks the flow of skilled foreign workers into the United States.

Headlines: Dozens of Chinese companies added to U.S. blacklist in latest Beijing rebuke
Description: The United States said on Friday it would add 33 Chinese firms and institutions to an economic blacklist for helping Beijing spy on its minority Uighur population or because of ties to weapons of mass destruction and China's military.

Headlines: All 50 U.S. states shed jobs in April: Labor Department
Description: Unemployment rates rose and total employment fell in all 50 U.S. states and the District of Columbia in April as efforts to contain the coronavirus pandemic forced businesses to close across the country, the Labor Department said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. charges ousted Hollywood executive with defrauding pandemic loan program, BlackRock fund
Description: U.S. prosecutors have charged the recently ousted owner of a Hollywood movie distributor with defrauding a federal coronavirus emergency relief program and a BlackRock Inc investment fund, including to pay for a Beverly Hills mansion and other luxuries.

Headlines: Automaker trade backs U.S. on effort to weaken fuel efficiency rules
Description: A group representing many major automakers on Friday backed the Trump administration's decision to weaken Obama administration fuel efficiency standards but said it opposed further reductions in requirements.

Headlines: U.S. grants tentative OK for 15 air carriers to suspend service to 75 airports
Description: The U.S. Transportation Department said late on Friday it had granted tentative approval to 15 airlines to temporarily halt service to 75 U.S. airports because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Wall Street ends mixed as China-U.S. tensions weigh
Description: Wall Street ended mixed on Friday in a mostly tame finish to a week of strong gains, as investors gauged China-U.S. tensions and amid ongoing uncertainty about the pace of economic recovery from the coronavirus.

Headlines: United Airlines CEO Kirby's annual base salary lower than predecessor
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc said on Friday it would pay Chief Executive Officer Scott Kirby an annual base salary of $1 million, lower than what prior head Oscar Munoz received.

Headlines: Hertz preparing to file for bankruptcy as soon as Friday night: WSJ
Description: Car rental firm Hertz Global Holdings Inc  is preparing to file for bankruptcy as soon as Friday night after failing to reach a standstill agreement with its top lenders, the Wall Street Journal reported https://on.wsj.com/2A4ONKs, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Explainer: How ending Hong Kong's 'special status' could affect U.S. companies
Description: New Chinese national security restrictions imposed on Hong Kong could draw a U.S. revocation of the former British colony's "special status" under U.S. law, a move that would have far-reaching trade and investment implications.

Headlines: Delta to provide care kit containing masks to passengers
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc  said https://news.delta.com/complimentary-care-kits-provide-delta-customers-travel-safety-essentials on Friday a care kit containing a disposable face mask and a Purell hand sanitizer gel will be available on request at ticket counters and gates by June 5.

Headlines: Hong Kong tensions rattle world stock markets, oil tumbles
Description: Oil prices tumbled and global equity markets fell on Friday as China's move to impose a new security law on Hong Kong further strained U.S.-China relations and clouded economic recovery prospects.

Headlines: Oil falls on China-U.S. tensions, energy demand doubts
Description: Oil prices tumbled about 2% on Friday on rising U.S.-China tensions and doubts about how quickly fuel demand would recover from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Italy Economy Minister confident government, Fiat can complete state-backed loan
Description: Italy's Economy Minister Roberto Gualtieri said on Friday he was confident the government and Fiat Chrysler  would be able to complete a deal over a state-backed loan for the carmaker.

Headlines: Organizers cancel 2020 New York auto show
Description: Organizers said Friday they were canceling the 2020 New York auto show that had previously been pushed back until August, citing the ongoing coronavirus pandemic and the venue's use as a field hospital.

Headlines: With remote work plan, Facebook dashes hopes of paycheck arbitrage
Description: With Facebook's adoption of permanent remote work on Thursday, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg has untethered one of Silicon Valley's biggest companies from the place that incubated it.

Headlines: U.S. senators urge Delta, JetBlue to restore employee hours
Description: A group of U.S. senators is urging Delta Air Lines Inc and JetBlue Airways Corp to immediately reverse their decisions to reduce employees' hours, calling them contrary to the requirements of taxpayer-funded payroll assistance.

Headlines: France warns Renault could disappear; Nissan plans job cuts
Description: Europe's car industry was put on alert for more job losses on Friday as a French minister warned Renault could disappear if it didn't get help soon and a Japanese news report said partner Nissan was considering 20,000 layoffs, with many in Europe.

Headlines: EasyJet founder loses bid to oust management in strategy showdown
Description: EasyJet  founder Stelios Haji-Ioannou failed in his attempt to oust the airline's top three bosses on Friday, giving it a brief respite in its battle for survival during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Hedge funds increased exposure to growth favorites in first quarter: Goldman
Description: Hedge funds concentrated their portfolios even further into growth stocks including Amazon.com Inc  and Microsoft Corp  in the first quarter of 2020 as the COVID-19 pandemic pummeled U.S. markets, Goldman Sachs analysts said in a report.

Headlines: Alibaba's sales surge as people shop online during lockdown
Description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd on Friday reported forecast-beating fourth-quarter revenues and profits, as more people shopped online for essentials because of the coronavirus lockdowns.

Headlines: GM delays resumption of second shift at 3 North American truck plants -source
Description: General Motors Co  is delaying the resumption of second shifts at truck assembly plants in Michigan, Indiana and Mexico because of a lack of parts from Mexico, a person briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: Exclusive: BP's Looney halves top management roles in energy transition plan
Description: BP  is more than halving the size of its senior management team as part of Chief Executive Bernard Looney's drive to make the 111-year-old oil company more nimble as it prepares for the shift to low-carbon energy.

Headlines: Deere signals recovery as U.S. farmers to benefit from relief program
Description: Deere & Co  on Friday topped quarterly sales and profit estimates and forecast a smaller-than-expected fall in farm equipment sales for the year, signaling a recovery in demand for its harvesters and tractors.

Headlines: Kohl's exits Jennifer Lopez, other women's brands as losses mount
Description: Kohl's Corp  said the coronavirus crisis would have a material impact on results this year as it removed eight brands including Jennifer Lopez, Juicy Couture and Popsugar from its stores and warned demand for women's apparel would remain weak.

Headlines: U.S. shale bust slams rural economies as oil checks shrivel
Description: Royalties from oil pumped on Paul Ruckman's land allowed the South Texas retiree to build a six-bedroom, seven-bathroom vacation home. He had plenty left over, and donated some of it to Helena, Texas, an 1800s ghost town that draws hundreds to historic buildings and gunfight re-enactments.

Headlines: NetEase and JD.com set dates for $5 billion Hong Kong listings
Description: Chinese technology company NetEase  plans to carry out a secondary listing on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on June 11, which will be followed one week later by web retailer JD.com , four sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Lufthansa bailout talks hit snag, drag on - Handelsblatt
Description: Talks over a 9-billion euro German government bailout of Lufthansa  have hit a snag and will continue over the weekend, a German newspaper reported on Friday.

Headlines: Angola's oil exploration evaporates as COVID-19 overshadows historic reforms
Description: The coronavirus pandemic has done in a handful of months what even a 27-year civil war did not: it has brought oil drilling to a halt in Angola, Africa's second-largest oil producer.

Headlines: Why bond investors are willing to bet on money-losing Pemex after oil price crash
Description: Mexico's state-owned oil company Petroleos Mexicanos has seen investor sentiment improve in recent weeks despite sky-high debts, a slump in demand and no clear direction about how the government will turn the money-losing driller around.

Headlines: EasyJet board looks set to win latest battle with Stelios
Description: EasyJet's  board looks poised to win a shareholder vote on Friday and deal a blow to its founder and long-term critic over the British low-cost airline's plan to stick with a $5.5 billion plane order.

Headlines: EasyJet shareholders reject founder's proposals to oust key management
Description: EasyJet  on Friday said all four resolutions put forth by its founder Stelios Haji-Ioannou to oust key management were rejected by its shareholders, with nearly 60% of votes cast against his proposals at a general meeting.

Headlines: U.S. strikes at a Huawei prize: chip juggernaut HiSilicon
Description: The latest U.S. government action against China's Huawei takes direct aim at the company's HiSilicon chip division -- a business that in a few short years has become central to China's ambitions in semiconductor technology but will now lose access to tools that are central to its success.

Headlines: China's Geely to explore deeper cooperation with Daimler: chairman
Description: China's Geely will explore the possibility of deeper cooperation with German luxury automaker Daimler AG , its Chairman Li Shufu said on Friday.

Headlines: Ryanair's Lauda airline to close Vienna base, 300 jobs to go
Description: Ryanair's  Austrian airline Lauda on Friday said it would shut down its main Vienna base on May 29 with the loss of more than 300 jobs in Austria after it did not manage to agree new labour contracts with the union.

Headlines: Amazon to hire 50,000 temp workers in India as lockdown boosts demand
Description: Amazon.com Inc's  India unit said it would hire 50,000 temporary workers to meet a surge in online shopping in the country, where customers have been stuck indoors for two months in a lockdown to fight the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Nissan considering 20,000 job cuts, mainly in Europe, developing nations: Kyodo
Description: Nissan Motor Co  is considering cutting 20,000 jobs from its global workforce, focusing on Europe and developing countries, Kyodo news reported on Friday, as the Japanese automaker struggles to recover from plunging car sales.

Headlines: Banks pursue Luckin Coffee chairman's assets after loan default
Description: The banks that lent $518 million to Luckin Coffee  Chairman Charles Zhengyao Lu have started court proceedings to liquidate his private company, a government gazette for the British Virgin Islands showed.

Headlines: Vodafone names Heineken's Van Boxmeer as new chairman
Description: Vodafone , the world's second-biggest mobile operator, has recruited Jean-Francois Van Boxmeer, the current CEO of brewer Heineken , to succeed Gerard Kleisterlee as chairman from November this year.

Headlines: China's biggest automaker expects domestic car sales to pick up in second quarter
Description: China's biggest automaker SAIC Motor  expects the nation's auto sales to post year-on-year growth in the second quarter due to recovering demand and supportive policies, its chairman said on Friday.

Headlines: Trump visits Ford plant in politically crucial Michigan, leaves mask off for cameras
Description: President Donald Trump traveled on Thursday to the crucial U.S. election battleground state of Michigan to visit a Ford Motor Co  plant amid tensions with its Democratic governor during the coronavirus pandemic, opting not to wear a protective face mask for the cameras.

Headlines: Roche buys U.S. gene sequencing tech company Stratos Genomics
Description: Pharmaceutical group Roche  has acquired U.S.-based Stratos Genomics to further develop DNA-based sequencing for diagnostic use, it said on Friday.

Headlines: Rudderless after a rally, stock markets look for next catalyst
Description: Global equity markets have shuffled up about 1% this month despite the world starting to re-open after the coronavirus-driven lockdowns and U.S. and European economic data showing glimmers of a recovery.

Headlines: Australia's Wesfarmers to shut or rebrand over 100 Target stores in virus slump
Description: Australian retail giant Wesfarmers Ltd  said it will close or rebrand nearly two-thirds of its Target department stores and take one-off charges totalling up to A$650 million ($426 million) as it reels from the coronavirus fallout.

Headlines: GM gradually restarts in Mexico as Lear Corp readies for return
Description: General Motors Co  said on Thursday it was gradually restarting the transmission and motor lines at its Mexican facilities in Silao and Ramos Arizpe, while U.S. auto parts maker Lear Corp  also geared up for production.

Headlines: Judgment on key aspect of Huawei CFO's extradition trial in Canada due next Wednesday
Description: A decision on a key legal aspect of the trial over whether Huawei Technologies Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou can be extradited to the United States from Canada will be announced next Wednesday, the British Columbia Supreme Court said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. secures 300 million doses of potential AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine
Description: The United States has secured almost a third of the first 1 billion doses planned for AstraZeneca's experimental COVID-19 vaccine by pledging up to $1.2 billion, as world powers scramble for medicines to get their economies back to work.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg embraces remote work beyond Silicon Valley
Description: Facebook Inc will permanently embrace remote work even after coronavirus lockdowns ease, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Thursday, accelerating the tech sector's geographic diversification away from its home in Silicon Valley.

Headlines: Proxy adviser ISS recommends vote 'against' executive pay at Alphabet
Description: Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) has recommended shareholders of Google-parent Alphabet Inc to vote "against" the company's proposed executive pay at its annual meet in June, according to a report seen by Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: SoftBank Group's sale of 5% telco unit stake to raise $2.9 billion
Description: SoftBank Group Corp said on Friday its planned sale of 5% in its domestic telco SoftBank Corp would fetch  310.2 billion yen ($2.9 billion), as part of a programme to raise $41 billion through asset sales.

Headlines: Nvidia forecasts sales above estimates, powered by data center results
Description: Nvidia Corp  on Thursday forecast second-quarter revenue above analysts' estimates, as demand surges for its chips used in the data centers that power the shift to working remotely because of the new coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Wall Street finishes down as U.S.-China tensions heighten trade deal worries
Description: Wall Street ended lower on Thursday, a day after hitting two-month highs, on a fresh wave of China-U.S. tensions that raised doubts about the trade deal reached early this year between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: GM starts to reopen plants in Mexico
Description: General Motors Co  said that it was on Thursday gradually restarting the transmissions and motors lines at its Mexican plants in Ramos Arizpe in the northern state of Coahuila and in the central city of Silao.

Headlines: Hewlett Packard Enterprise lays out $1 billion savings plan, pay cuts
Description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise  on Thursday unveiled a plan targeting gross savings of at least $1 billion by 2022 and cut the base salaries of top executives by 25% as the software maker seeks to weather the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Lear Corp asks some Mexico workers to restart activity on Friday
Description: U.S. auto parts maker Lear Corp has asked some workers in Mexico to restart activity on Friday, including training sessions on safety, the company said in a message to employees.

Headlines: Senators attempt to advance bill lengthening coronavirus business loan terms
Description: Negotiators in the U.S. Senate reached agreement on Thursday on legislation that would double the period of time in which small businesses can use Paycheck Protection Program loans, to 16 weeks from the current eight-week limit, according to a Senate aide.

Headlines: Indiana mattress business adapts to lure customers back
Description: Lauren Taylor is figuring out what’s required to run a mattress store in the age of a deadly pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. meat inventories tightened as virus shut slaughterhouses: USDA
Description: U.S. frozen pork inventories fell in April, when they typically rise, and beef inventories dropped more than normal as the coronavirus pandemic shut slaughterhouses and prompted grocers to limit customers' buying, government data showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Top safety official at Waymo self-driving unit stepping down
Description: Alphabet Inc’s Waymo self-driving unit said on Thursday that its chief safety officer, Debbie Hersman, was stepping down but would remain as a consultant to the company.

Headlines: 'I've not yet signed Renault loan', says French finance minister
Description: France's Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said he has not signed off on a 5 billion euro ($5.47 billion) state-guaranteed loan to help Renault  cope with the fallout from the coronavirus, and that discussions continued.

Headlines: Stocks slip on U.S.-China tensions; oil rises to 2-1/2-month high
Description: Global equities slid on Thursday on concerns about the long-term impact of the new coronavirus and resurgent U.S.-China tensions, though oil markets ignored those worries and marched to 2-1/2 month highs.

Headlines: Macy's to be 'smaller company' as loss to hit $1 billion in quarter amid lockdowns
Description: Macy's Inc  said on Thursday it could rack up operating losses of up to $1.11 billion in the first quarter, as the department store operator was forced to shut stores due to lockdowns aimed at curbing the spread of the new coronavirus.

Headlines: Brent at highest since March on U.S. stock draw, recovering demand
