Description: The U.S. Justice Department has sent grand jury subpoenas to big banks seeking records as part of a broader investigation into potential abuse of a $660 billion emergency loan program to help small businesses hurt by the novel coronavirus, two people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. state attorneys general likely to bring antitrust lawsuits against Google -source
Description: A group of state attorneys general led by Texas are likely to file an antitrust lawsuit against Alphabet Inc's Google and are working on potential litigation for later this year, a person familiar with the situation said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. moves to cut Huawei off from global chip suppliers as China eyes retaliation
Description: The Trump administration on Friday moved to block global chip supplies to blacklisted telecoms equipment giant Huawei Technologies, spurring fears of Chinese retaliation and hammering shares of U.S. producers of chipmaking equipment.

Headlines: U.S. gave no assurances to Taiwan's TSMC for license to sell to Huawei: official
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd, which unveiled a $12 billion investment plan in Arizona on Friday, has not been given any assurances that it will be granted a license to allow it to sell U.S. technology to China's Huawei, a senior U.S. official said.

Headlines: U.S. employers wary of coronavirus 'immunity' tests as they move to reopen
Description: U.S. employers have cooled to the idea of testing workers for possible immunity to the coronavirus as they prepare to reopen factories and other workplaces.

Headlines: Wall Street ends up after swings on reopening hopes, weak data, trade woes
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes closed higher after swinging between gains and losses on Friday as investors weighed worries about Sino-U.S. trade relations and weaker-than-expected U.S. economic data against growing optimism that easing coronavirus restrictions would boost activity this month.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade deal not falling apart: White House adviser
Description: The U.S.-China "Phase 1" trade deal reached in January is not falling apart and the two countries are still working to implement it, the White House's top economic adviser said on Friday, but President Donald Trump added that he was not "thrilled" with the agreement.

Headlines: Wall Street ends up after swings on reopening hopes, weak data, trade woes
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes closed higher after swinging between gains and losses on Friday as investors weighed worries about Sino-U.S. trade relations and weaker-than-expected U.S. economic data against growing optimism that easing coronavirus restrictions would boost activity this month.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade deal not falling apart: White House adviser
Description: The U.S.-China "Phase 1" trade deal reached in January is not falling apart and the two countries are still working to implement it, the White House's top economic adviser said on Friday, but President Donald Trump added that he was not "thrilled" with the agreement.

Headlines: U.S. stock market swings higher despite rising U.S.-China tensions; oil up
Description: U.S. stocks gyrated on Friday before ending slightly higher, as investors worried about increased China-U.S. trade hostilities and disappointing retail sales figures, while signs of a pick-up in crude demand boosted oil prices.

Headlines: Companies fear coronavirus liability lawsuits. So far, few exist
Description: Businesses are urging U.S. lawmakers to shield companies from what they fear could be a flood of lawsuits by workers and consumers blaming employers for exposing them to the new coronavirus.

Headlines: SAA has spent $539 million since filing for bankruptcy protection: practitioners
Description: South African Airways (SAA) has spent just under 10 billion rand ($540 million) since it entered a form of bankruptcy protection, business rescue practitioners said on Friday as they flagged a structured wind-down process as their preferred option for the carrier.

Headlines: Coronavirus boosts U.S. layoffs; job openings fall
Description: Layoffs in the United States jumped to a record high in March, while the number of people voluntarily quitting their jobs dropped to a 4-1/2-year low as the novel coronavirus crisis rapidly changed labor market dynamics.

Headlines: Wirecard shares plunge as Dubai-based partner shuts shop
Description: Shares in Wirecard  fell to more than two-year lows on Friday after a Dubai-based business partner closed its doors even as the German payments company played down the impact on operations.

Headlines: As Air France restores some flights, pilots queue for simulator
Description: Air France  is putting its grounded pilots through their paces in the flight simulator as the airline prepares to restore flights to dozens of destinations that had been suspended under coronavirus lockdown measures.

Headlines: Exclusive: United Airlines only needs 3,000 of 25,000 flight attendants in June - sources
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  has told staff that it only has work for about 3,000 of its about 25,000 flight attendants in June, sources said, and warned of job losses if demand does not recover by the time government payroll aid expires in the fall.

Headlines: U.S. consumer sentiment edges up in May but worries about social isolation grow
Description: U.S. consumer sentiment rose unexpectedly in early May after a record plunge a month earlier as emergency assistance payments improved household finances hurt by mass layoffs from the coronavirus crisis, a survey released on Friday showed.

Headlines: India's farmers gather record wheat crop, but cannot move it
Description: Late last month, Sukrampal had to beg and borrow farmhands from nearby villages to gather his part of the country's largest-ever wheat harvest in Haryana state near New Delhi.

Headlines: White House's Kudlow floats cutting U.S. corporate tax rate in half
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow on Friday floated the idea of cutting the corporate tax rate in half for U.S. companies who bring their operations back from other countries.

Headlines: Exclusive: Virgin Atlantic won't resume flights until August if UK introduces quarantine - source
Description: Virgin Atlantic will not be able to resume passenger flights until August at the earliest if Britain introduces a 14-day quarantine for travellers, according to a source at the airline.

Headlines: Coronavirus pummels U.S. retail sales, industrial production
Description: U.S. retail sales endured a second straight month of record declines in April as the novel coronavirus pandemic kept Americans at home, putting the economy on track for its biggest contraction in the second quarter since the Great Depression.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin to pay $300 million more to suppliers hit by coronavirus
Description: U.S. weapons maker Lockheed Martin Corp  said on Friday it would pay an additional $300 million to its suppliers hurt by a sharp economic slowdown caused by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler in talks over 6.3 billion euro state-guaranteed loan: source
Description: Fiat Chrysler  is in talks with Italian lender Intesa Sanpaolo  over a 6.3 billion euro ($6.8 billion) state-guaranteed loan to help the automaker weather the coronavirus crisis, a source close to the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Belgium tells Lufthansa state aid possible if conditions met
Description: The Belgian government said on Friday it was committed to reaching a deal with Lufthansa  to save its Belgian subsidiary Brussels Airlines if the future of the national carrier was guaranteed.

Headlines: Taiwan's TSMC to build Arizona chip plant as U.S.-China tech rivalry escalates
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd , the biggest contract chipmaker, said it plans to build a $12 billion factory in Arizona in an apparent win for the Trump administration's efforts to wrestle global tech supply chains back from China.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nissan sees bigger role for U.S., China markets in global car sales - sources
Description: Nissan Motor Co expects equal contributions to global car sales from China, the United States and elsewhere in coming years as the struggling Japanese carmaker strategises to recover profitability, two people with knowledge of the issue said.

Headlines: Pandemic stirs Wall Street’s social conscience
Description: Worker welfare is having a moment on Wall Street.

Headlines: Trump says doesn't want to talk to Xi, could even cut China ties
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump signaled a further deterioration of his relationship with China over the coronavirus outbreak, saying he has no interest in speaking to President Xi Jinping right now and going so far as to suggest he could even cut ties with the world's second largest economy.

Headlines: Pompeo says TSMC's $12 billion investment to increase U.S. economic independence from China
Description: Chipmaker Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co's  $12 billion investment in the United States will increase U.S. economic independence from China, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said in a statement early on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. extends temporary general license for Huawei
Description: The U.S. Department of Commerce on Friday announced that it was extending the Temporary General License that allows certain transactions with Huawei Technologies Co Ltd for another 90 days.

Headlines: Ryanair cuts more than 250 office staff across Europe
Description: Ryanair has cut more than 250 staff in offices in Dublin, London, Madrid and Wroclaw, Poland, Europe's largest low-cost airline said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. food aid program launches with companies scrambling to deliver
Description: Texas-based CRE8AD8 LLC bid for a federal government contract to quickly rescue food from struggling farmers and deliver it to U.S. food banks as fallout from the coronavirus pandemic has put millions of Americans out of work and driven many to seek help putting food on the table.

Headlines: Cathay Pacific loses money, flags 'very bleak' outlook
Description: Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd  said on Friday it made an unaudited loss of HK$4.5 billion ($580.53 million) at its full-service airlines during January-April and flagged a "very bleak" outlook as the coronavirus crisis grounded planes globally.

Headlines: Fincantieri says cooperation with Thyssenkrupp chance to talk about consolidation
Description: Cooperation between Fincantieri  and Thyssenkrupp  to build submarines is a good opportunity to talk about future consolidation in the European defence sector, the Italian shipbuilder's general manager Alberto Maestrini said on Friday.

Headlines: Check-up after check-in: Accor bets on online medicine for hotel rebound
Description: France's Accor , which runs hotels such as Ibis and Movenpick, said on Friday it would offer its clients free access to online medical consultations run by insurer AXA  as it prepares for a recovery from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Swedish central bank to use Blackrock for corporate bond market analysis
Description: Sweden's central bank will engage BlackRock’s Financial Markets Advisory for analysis work on the Swedish corporate bonds market, it said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: Australia's Westpac admits to breaches of money-laundering laws
Description: Westpac Banking Corp  admitted to millions of breaches of anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism laws in a filing in Australia's Federal Court on Friday, but denied accusations it enabled illegal payments between known child sex offenders.

Headlines: U.S. regulator is reviewing Abbott's fast COVID test after studies raise accuracy concerns
Description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Thursday that Abbott Laboratories’  speedy coronavirus test, which can deliver results within minutes and is used at the White House, could potentially be inaccurate but can still be used to test patients.

Headlines: Coronavirus forces HSBC to cut global growth forecasts, again
Description: Europe's biggest bank, HSBC  has cut already bleak global growth forecasts even further, as lockdown restrictions extended through April and tentative economic re-openings drag on a return to business, trade and spending.

Headlines: Airline industry not likely to recover for at least a year: Southwest CEO
Description: The airline industry is not likely to recover to pre-coronavirus levels for at least the next six to 12 months, Southwest Airlines Co  Chief Executive Officer Gary Kelly said on Thursday.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs to buy boutique wealth management custodian Folio
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc plans to buy a boutique wealth management custodian and technology company called Folio Financial Inc for an undisclosed amount of money, according to a letter that Folio sent to its customers on Thursday and was viewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Taiwan's TSMC announces plan to build $12 billion U.S. factory
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd, the world's biggest contract manufacturer of computer chips, on Friday announced plans to build an approximately $12 billion advanced chip factory in Arizona.

Headlines: WeWork reports slower cash burn in first quarter: CFO email
Description: The We Company, owner of WeWork, said on Thursday that for the first time quarterly revenue surpassed $1 billion and cash burn improved 60% sequentially, but the money-losing shared office operator did not mention profitability in an email to employees that was reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Wall Street closes with strong gains as recovery hopes offset pandemic fears
Description: Wall Street surged on Thursday as investors weighed the prospect of economic recovery against bellicose remarks from President Donald Trump regarding U.S.-China trade and a whistleblower's dire warnings about the U.S. response to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Walt Disney World and unions agree on safeguards for returning to work
Description: Walt Disney Co  and unions representing workers at Florida's Walt Disney World have reached an agreement on safeguards to protect employees from coronavirus, a union statement said on Thursday, removing one of the company's hurdles to reopening its popular theme parks.

Headlines: Fed's credit operation launched, but job already done
Description: The Federal Reserve's pledged support for exchange-traded funds may not end up costing the central bank much, but will still have the desired effect of keeping the credit market afloat.

Headlines: Nike warns of fourth-quarter hit from virus-related store closures
Description: Nike Inc  said on Thursday store closures across the globe will hurt its retail and wholesales businesses in the fourth quarter, even as it ramps up its e-commerce capabilities to address increased online orders amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Second layoffs, backlogs wave keeps U.S. jobless claims elevated
Description: The novel coronavirus crisis continues to pummel the U.S. labor market, with the number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits falling less than expected last week, suggesting a second wave of layoffs in industries and jobs not initially impacted by business closures caused by the pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Tesla's secret batteries aim to rework the math for electric cars and the grid
Description: Electric car maker Tesla Inc  plans to introduce a new low-cost, long-life battery in its Model 3 sedan in China later this year or early next that it expects will bring the cost of electric vehicles in line with gasoline models, and allow EV batteries to have second and third lives in the electric power grid.

Headlines: GM self-driving unit Cruise cuts jobs as pandemic hits sector
Description: General Motors Co's  self-driving car unit Cruise told staff on Thursday it has decided to lay off workers, the latest start-up in the nascent industry to cut jobs during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Equities edge higher, bonds rise on hopes of stimulus
Description: Global equity benchmarks gained late on Thursday, with safe-haven bonds also rising as investors shrugged off disappointing U.S. jobs data and took comfort in the possibility of states re-opening after lockdowns and fueling an economic recovery.

Headlines: Seven weeks into coronavirus lockdowns, Fed has a new, darker message
Description: One Thursday morning seven weeks ago, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell made a rare appearance on NBC's "Today Show" to offer a reassuring message to Americans dealing with economic fallout from measures to contain the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Delta, others wrestle with too many planes, too many pilots
Description: Delta Air Lines  moved to retire its Boeing Co  777 fleet and reduce its pilot ranks on Thursday as it joins other airlines wrestling with the need to shrink their operations to match reduced air travel due to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Lufthansa restores routes, targets 1,800 weekly flights
Description: Lufthansa  plans to resume flights to destinations including Los Angeles, Toronto and Mumbai next month as it begins to restore some of the capacity grounded by the coronavirus crisis, the German airline group said on Thursday.

Headlines: Lower-income workers hit harder by coronavirus job losses, Fed survey finds
Description: The coronavirus crisis drove a dramatic weakening in American households' finances as millions of people lost work or had their hours or pay reduced, with low-wage workers taking the biggest hit, according to a report released by the Federal Reserve on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. SEC charges two companies, CEO over misleading COVID-19 claims
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Thursday it has charged two companies and a chief executive officer with making misleading claims related to COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Uber offer for Grubhub fans worries over delivery fees charged to restaurants
Description: The possibility that Uber Technologies Inc , which runs Uber Eats, could acquire Grubhub Inc  is reigniting some restaurants' worries over the commissions charged to eateries by the third-party delivery companies.

Headlines: Acquitted former Barclays rainmaker Jenkins plots gentler comeback
Description: A near decade-long battle to clear his name has ended in victory, but the star rainmaker credited with playing a pivotal role in saving one of Britain's biggest banks from a government bailout in 2008 is still waiting to put his life back on track.

Headlines: Most Ford U.S. dealers got federal payroll protection loans: COO
Description: Most of Ford Motor Co's  U.S. dealers received payroll protection loans from the U.S. government amid the coronavirus pandemic, the automaker's chief operating officer said on Thursday.

Headlines: Amazon's livestreaming platform Twitch announces safety advisory council
Description: Amazon Inc 's video game live-streaming platform Twitch is forming an advisory council of experienced users, online safety experts and anti-bullying advocates to help improve safety on the site, Twitch said in a blog post on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: IKEA's shopping malls arm Ingka Centres plans U.S. entry in major play
Description: IKEA's shopping malls business, one of the world's biggest, is looking to enter the United States in the next couple of years and is in talks to snap up central properties in major cities, its boss told Reuters.

Headlines: McDonald's issues new guidelines to U.S. franchisees on restaurant reopenings: WSJ
Description: McDonald's Corp  has asked its U.S. franchisees to make a series of changes in restaurants before reopening to diners in an effort avoid the spread of the new coronavirus, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Renault to discontinue Espace model as carmaker cuts costs - sources
Description: Renault  is preparing to substantially reduce its vehicle range, withdrawing well-known but ailing models like the Espace minivans, as part of looming cost cutting plans, four sources in the industry and close to the French carmaker said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Airbus to be 'resized,' could cut output again - sources
Description: Planemaker Airbus  has told senior staff the company must be "resized" in plans to be set out around end-June and is ready to cut jet production again to tackle any second wave of the coronavirus crisis, people briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: Trump threatens new taxes on companies that make goods outside United States
Description: President Donald Trump threatened on Thursday to impose new taxes on American companies that produce goods outside the United States, another move his administration could make to push supply chains away from China and raise new trade barriers.

Headlines: Nissan could look at shutting Barcelona plant, no decision made: sources
Description: Nissan Motor  may be looking at the possibility of closing its Barcelona factory but no final decision has been made as the Japanese carmaker plans a new global strategic direction, two sources with direct knowledge told Reuters.

Headlines: Trump rips into China over coronavirus, 'very disappointed'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said he was very disappointed in China over its failure to contain the novel coronavirus, saying the worldwide pandemic cast a pall over his U.S.-China trade deal.

Headlines: JPMorgan's U.S. credit card holders spent 40% less due to coronavirus
Description: Credit card spending among some of JP Morgan Chase & Co's U.S. customers fell 40% during March and early April compared to last year, as Americans stayed home to protect against the novel coronavirus, according to a new report on Thursday.

Headlines: Delta to retire Boeing 777 aircraft fleet to rein in costs
Description: Delta Air Lines  said on Thursday it would no longer fly Boeing Co's  wide-body 777 aircraft and some of the other older high-maintenance jets, as the U.S. carrier looks to cut costs amid a steep fall in bookings due to travel restrictions around the world.

Headlines: Nvidia turns to driver-assistance market as robo-taxis stall
Description: Nvidia Corp, whose semiconductors power data centers, autonomous cars and robots, said on Thursday it plans to enter the market for technology that helps cars with automated lane-keeping, cruise control and other driver-assistance features.

Headlines: Zoom to expand in U.S. with engineering centers in Phoenix, Pittsburgh
Description: Zoom Video Communications Inc  said Thursday it plans to hire 500 software engineers for research and development locations in Phoenix and Pittsburgh over the next two years, expanding its engineering workforce by about 60%.

Headlines: Deutsche Boerse says acquisitions to play major role in strategy
Description: Acquisitions will play a "major role" in Deutsche Boerse's  strategy update later this year, the chief of the stock exchange said.

Headlines: How Tesla tapped a tiny Canadian lab for battery breakthroughs
Description: Tesla Inc  is a leader in electric vehicle battery technology, but the company doesn't do all its own research.

Headlines: Coronavirus crisis a window of opportunity for bankers to the rich
Description: When markets slumped in March as the spread of coronavirus gathered pace, wealth managers' trading volumes soared as ultra rich clients reshuffled their portfolios.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp, union call for further consolidation in warship sector
Description: Thyssenkrupp  and Germany's largest union IG Metall on Thursday called for further consolidation of the country's warship sector, saying a tie-up of rivals Luerssen and German Naval Yards (GNYK) did not go far enough.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler/Peugeot deal in spotlight after Exor setbacks
Description: Fiat Chrysler's  decision to scrap its dividend marks another setback for plans by the Agnelli family's Exor  arm to raise cash after a $9 billion sale of its reinsurer unit PartnerRe collapsed this week.

Headlines: IAG's Walsh says Britain is throttling a travel recovery
Description: Britain's quarantine plans and a minister's comment that big foreign holidays were unlikely this year are seriously hindering any travel recovery, said Willie Walsh the boss of British Airways parent company IAG .

Headlines: Temperature checks, masks the new normal for air travel, says Dubai airport CEO
Description: Temperature screening and face masks will become common sights at airports to mitigate the spread of the new coronavirus but physical distancing could make flying more expensive, the head of Dubai airport said.

Headlines: Tesla starts building Long Range Model 3 cars at China plant
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc  said on Thursday it had started producing Long Range Model 3 vehicles in its Shanghai factory and aimed to deliver them to customers soon.

Headlines: BMW CEO sees 'very slow' U.S. recovery after corona rebound in China
Description: BMW  on Thursday said China sales of luxury passenger cars rebounded in April but the German premium car and motorbike manufacturer cautioned that other markets including the United States will be "very slow" to recover from the corona pandemic.

Headlines: Merck KGaA says profit could slip as fertility treatments shunned
Description: Merck KGaA  said a slight decline in operating earnings was on the cards this year as the coronavirus pandemic weighs on demand for chemicals in TV screens and is putting couples off seeking the German group's fertility treatments.

Headlines: Storm clouds gather over U.S. stocks as hopes of quick recovery fade
Description: A lightning-quick rally in U.S. equities is showing cracks, as investors face mounting evidence that the economy's coronavirus-fueled woes may be far longer-lasting than many had anticipated.

Headlines: Clariant sticks to extra $1 billion payout, scrubs dividend in crisis
Description: Clariant  is scrapping a regular dividend as it hunkers down to survive the COVID-19 crisis, the Swiss specialty chemicals maker said on Thursday, while still planning a special $1 billion payout from asset-sale proceeds, if they go through.

Headlines: Dolce & Gabbana will lose out from virus crisis, founders tell paper
Description: Italian fashion group Dolce & Gabbana will lose out "a lot" this year, after the coronavirus emergency, founders Domenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana said on Thursday.

Headlines: All eyes on Detroit as automakers ready slow, careful reopening of plants
Description: The U.S. factories that make Fords, Chevys and Jeeps are coming back to life this week as workers install new safety equipment and wake up machines ahead of the high-stakes restart the Detroit automakers plan to launch on Monday.

Headlines: United Airlines employee files class action lawsuit over unpaid days off policy
Description: A United Airlines Holdings Inc non-union employee filed a class action lawsuit on Wednesday alleging that a requirement that management and administration employees take 20 unpaid days off breaches the terms of federal payroll aid.

Headlines: Sanofi to accelerate European COVID-19 vaccine access after CEO prioritizes U.S. preorders
Description: French drugmaker Sanofi SA said on Wednesday that it is working with European regulators to speed up access to a potential coronavirus vaccine in Europe after its chief executive suggested Americans would likely get the vaccine first.

Headlines: Trump extends U.S. telecom supply chain order aimed at Huawei, ZTE
Description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday extended for another year an executive order signed in May 2019 declaring a national emergency and barring U.S. companies from using telecommunications equipment made by firms posing a national security risk.

Headlines: Fast Retailing reopens more Uniqlo stores as pandemic measures ease
Description: Casual clothing chain Uniqlo has reopened more stores in the past week and plans to resume business at more shops in coming days as governments ease coronavirus restrictions, its owner Fast Retailing  said on Thursday.

Headlines: Uber to require drivers, riders to wear masks around the world
Description: Uber Technologies, Inc.  on Wednesday said it will require drivers, delivery workers and riders globally to wear a mask as countries around the world begin easing restrictions aimed at curbing the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Uber approaches Grubhub with acquisition offer: sources
Description: Uber Technologies Inc is in negotiations to buy online food delivery company Grubhub Inc in an all-stock deal, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Wall Street ends down on Powell's sober outlook, call to Congress for help
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes closed lower for the second day in a row after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell warned on Wednesday of extended economic weakness due to the coronavirus pandemic and called for Congress to agree on additional fiscal support.

Headlines: Mexico green lights auto industry restart, heeding U.S. calls
Description: Mexico will begin opening some automotive factories from May 18 under a plan unveiled on Wednesday that loosens coronavirus restrictions and paves the way for U.S. car giants to ramp up output dependent on parts made south of the border.

Headlines: Less than zero? Fed's Powell shows no love for negative rates
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell had a clear message to interest rate futures traders on Wednesday: Bets that the U.S. central bank will pursue a negative interest-rate policy are off-base.

Headlines: U.S. March, April job losses revised higher
Description: The U.S. economy lost a record 20.537 million jobs in April and not 20.5 million as reported last Friday, according to revised data published by the Labor Department this week.

Headlines: Brazil's Gol values Boeing's 737 MAX compensation at up to $412 million
Description: Brazil airline Gol Linhas Aereas Inteligentes  said on Wednesday it will receive up to 2.4 billion reais ($412 million) from Boeing Co  as compensation for the grounding of the 737 MAX plane, in a mix of cash and credits.

Headlines: Tesla, California county reach deal to reopen U.S. plant next week
Description: Tesla Inc and officials in California have resolved their acrimonious clash over safety procedures at the automaker’s sole U.S. assembly plant with a deal that allows production to resume as early as Monday, county officials said.

Headlines: Equities slide, bonds rise on Fed warning of prolonged recession
Description: Stock markets tumbled on Wednesday on fears about a second wave of coronavirus infections and warnings from Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell that the U.S. faces a "significantly worse" recession than any downturn since World War Two, while bonds rose on a safety bid.

Headlines: Airbus examining restructuring including job cuts -sources
Description: Airbus  is exploring restructuring plans involving the possibility of "deep" job cuts as it braces for a prolonged coronavirus crisis after furloughing thousands of workers, industry sources said, though no decision is imminent.

Headlines: Climate activists up stakes at Exxon, backing calls for independent board chairman
Description: Shareholder activists prodding Exxon Mobil Corp on climate-change proposals are backing calls for an independent board chairman as the oil major steps up efforts to keep climate proposals off its ballot.

Headlines: Amazon.com asks for federal law against price gouging during national emergencies
Description: Online retailer Amazon.com, criticized for not acting quickly enough to curb sellers who charged hundreds of dollars for high-demand hand sanitizer during the early phase of the new coronavirus pandemic, urged Congress on Wednesday to pass a law against price gouging during times of national emergency.

Headlines: In nod to grim U.S. outlook, Fed's Powell calls for more fiscal support
Description: The head of the Federal Reserve warned on Wednesday of an "extended period" of weak economic growth, vowed to use the U.S. central bank's power as needed, and called for additional fiscal spending to stem the fallout from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Fed Chair Powell warns of prolonged U.S. recession after coronavirus
Description: Jerome Powell, chairman of the Federal Reserve board of governors, warned Wednesday that the long-term health of the U.S. economy may depend on more fiscal stimulus to fight the economic impacts of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Powell: Fed not looking at negative rates
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, in a sober review of where the U.S. economy stands on the cusp of its reopening, said on Wednesday the country could face an "extended period" of weak growth and stagnant incomes, pledged to use more Fed power as needed, and issued a call for more fiscal spending.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank criticised in internal N.Y. Fed audit: German newspaper
Description: Deutsche Bank's  regulators in the United States have criticised the German lender in an internal audit for weaknesses in fighting money laundering and in risk management, according to a German newspaper on Wednesday.

Headlines: Amazon extends temporary raise in pay through May 30
Description: Amazon.com Inc  said on Wednesday it would extend the temporary increase in its hourly pay and double the overtime pay through May 30, bringing its total salary cost for hourly employees to nearly $800 million.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. airlines tell crews not to force passengers to wear masks
Description: The top three U.S. airlines have told their flight attendants not to force passengers to comply with their new policy requiring face coverings, just encourage them to do so, according to employee policies reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Return of Big Mac - McDonald's UK emerges from lockdown
Description: After over seven weeks of coronavirus lockdown, Britons hankering for a Big Mac may be a step closer to getting their hands on one after McDonald's  reopened 15 restaurants on Wednesday for delivery only.

Headlines: Japan´s Softbank sees consolidation in Latam food delivery
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp , a shareholder in some of Latin America's largest food delivery companies, expects consolidation in most markets, a senior executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. producer prices record largest drop since 2009 as coronavirus suppresses demand
Description: U.S. producer prices fell by the most since 2009 in April, leading to the largest annual decline in nearly 4-1/2 years, bolstering some economists' predictions for a brief period of deflation as the novel coronavirus depresses demand.

Headlines: Exclusive: Europe nears crisis plan for public stakes in key companies - sources
Description: EU officials are seeking to finalise a plan for public stakes to be taken in key European companies to shield them from the economic fallout of the COVID-19 pandemic, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: OPEC slashes oil demand forecast again, sees biggest hit this quarter
Description: OPEC slashed its forecast on Wednesday for global oil demand this year and predicted this quarter would see the steepest decline even as some countries ease lockdown measures designed to stem the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Wall Street bonuses set to fall by as much as 30% in 2020: report
Description: Wall Street bonuses for 2020 could fall by as much as 25%-30% due to the deep cuts to revenues recorded by banks and hedge funds earlier this year as a result of the novel coronavirus, according to a report published Wednesday by compensation consulting firm Johnson Associates Inc.

Headlines: Jersey jackpot of $2 million awaits Deutsche's lost shareholders
Description: While Deutsche Bank  employees fret about their jobs and pay, Germany's largest lender is trying to track down several hundred former staff to claim share payouts it has been holding in Jersey.

Headlines: S.Korean shoppers go the distance to beat Chanel price hike
Description: More than a hundred shoppers waited in line outside a Chanel store in Seoul on Wednesday, shrugging off concerns about a second wave of coronavirus infections to beat imminent price hikes by the French luxury brand.

Headlines: Over 300 lawmakers worldwide urge IMF, World Bank to cancel poor countries' debt
Description: Over 300 lawmakers from around the world on Wednesday urged the International Monetary Fund and World Bank to cancel the debt of the poorest countries in response to the coronavirus pandemic, and to boost funding to avert a global economic meltdown.

Headlines: U.S. producer prices post biggest drop since 2009
Description: U.S. producer prices fell by the most since 2009 in April, leading to the largest annual decline in nearly 4-1/2 years, which could bolster some economists' predictions for a brief period of deflation as the novel coronavirus depresses demand.

Headlines: Chanel says increasing prices on handbags, small leather goods
Description: French luxury house Chanel said on Wednesday it was increasing prices on its handbags and some small leather goods worldwide to take into account a rise in the cost of raw materials amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Sony braces for lowest profit in four years, hit broadly by coronavirus
Description: Sony Corp  expects operating profit to drop at least 30% this financial year to its lowest in four years as the company anticipates a hit to demand for its TVs, cameras and smartphone image sensors from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Airline SAS to require face masks on all flights
Description: Swedish-Danish airline SAS  said on Wednesday wearing a face mask would be compulsory on all its flights through to the end of August to reduce the risk of coronavirus contagion.

Headlines: Qatar Airways in talks to defer Airbus, Boeing orders: SCMP
Description: Qatar Airways, one of the Middle East's biggest airlines, is in talks with Airbus  and Boeing  to defer aircraft orders for several years, its chief executive was quoted as saying on Wednesday.

Headlines: Mitsubishi slashes SpaceJet budget, drops variant
Description: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries  (MHI) said it was more than halving the annual development budget for its SpaceJet regional jet as the coronavirus pandemic squeezes profit, and will suspend plans for a possible variant seen as key to winning future orders, particularly from U.S. airlines.

Headlines: CMA CGM taps French loan scheme to boost cash in coronavirus crisis
Description: Shipping group CMA CGM has obtained a 1.05 billion euro ($1.1 billion) loan to be 70% guaranteed by the French government as it seeks to bolster its cash position during the coronavirus pandemic, which has hammered international trade.

Headlines: EasyJet, Germanwings lose legal fight against EU's Italian airport ruling
Description: Easyjet  and Lufthansa's  Germanwings on Wednesday lost their challenge against an EU ruling ordering Italy to recover illegal state aid granted to airlines serving Sardinia.

Headlines: Maersk sees drop in global ship container demand this year
Description: Shipping group A.P. Moller-Maersk  warned of a sharp drop in global container volumes due to the coronavirus pandemic, with weaker retail sales and depressed car production dampening demand.

Headlines: TUI to cut jobs and costs as it prepares for July holiday restart
Description: Travel group TUI  will cut 8,000 jobs and look to shed 30% of its costs as it gears up for a July restart to European tourism, the German company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: European holidays to restart in July, tourism to recover by 2022: TUI CEO
Description: Tourism will recover to its pre-coronavirus levels by 2022 at the latest and European holidays will restart in July said Fritz Joussen, the chief executive of travel group TUI .

Headlines: Tesla's California fight heats up competition for jobs
Description: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk's fight with local  authorities over the reopening of its California plant has gotten the attention of those who scout sites for new factories and corporate offices, as well as economic development officials hungry for more jobs.

Headlines: Korean Air to issue $817 mln in new shares as virus strains industry
Description: South Korea's largest airline, Korean Air , plans to sell around 1 trillion won ($816.55 million) in new shares in its biggest rights issue in 20 years to raise funds amid mounting strains in the industry due to the pandemic.

Headlines: Forex firm Travelex to default on coupon payment
Description: Troubled currency services provider Travelex [TFPI.UL] on Wednesday warned of defaulting on a 14.4 million euro ($15.6 million) coupon payment on some of its senior notes as it grapples with a hit to earnings amid the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Emirates plans scheduled flights from May 21 to nine cities
Description: Emirates Airline from May 21 plans to operate scheduled flight services from Dubai to London Heathrow, Frankfurt, Paris, Milan, Madrid, Chicago, Toronto, Sydney and Melbourne, it said in a statement on Wednesday.

Headlines: Resurgent Wall Street disconnected from reality on the ground
Description: With the U.S. economy facing its potentially deepest economic decline in nearly a century, Wall Street is pulling further and further ahead from Main Street.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank targets 200 billion euros of sustainable investment by 2025
Description: German lender Deutsche Bank  plans to pump at least 200 billion euros ($216.8 billion) into so-called sustainable financing and investments by 2025, its first formal targets for doing so.

Headlines: Amazon expects to extend France warehouse closures to May 18
Description: Amazon  plans to extend until May 18 the closure of its six French warehouses, which have been closed since April 16 after court rulings ordering the U.S. e-commerce giant to restrict deliveries during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Japan stands by its integrated resort policy despite Sands' move
Description: Japan has no plan to change its schedule regarding the launch of integrated resorts (IR) - Las Vegas-style complexes that include casinos and shopping arcades - despite Las Vegas Sands'  decision to end its plan to open an IR casino in Japan, a top government spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Aston Martin posts deep quarterly loss as pandemic slams brakes on sales
Description: Aston Martin  posted a deep first-quarter loss after sales dropped by nearly a third due to the impact of the coronavirus crisis, though the luxury car maker said production of a crucial sport utility vehicle was on track.

Headlines: TUI burning 250 million euros cash a month: CEO
Description: Travel group TUI  , which is struggling with the impact of the coronavirus pandemic, is burning cash at a rate of 250 million euros ($271 million) a month, its CEO said on Wednesday.

Headlines: For Hire: Central Europe's business services firms spy a chance in crisis
Description: As the COVID-19 pandemic wipes out jobs and empties offices across the world, companies in Central Europe that provide remote, lower-cost services for multinationals are emerging as winners in the new business order.

Headlines: Las Vegas Sands scraps plans for Japan integrated resort casino project
Description: Las Vegas Sands  said it has ended plans to open an integrated resort (IR) casino in Japan, dealing another blow to Japan's attempts to energise its economy through tourism.

Headlines: Nissan plans $2.8 billion in cuts as part of restructuring plan: Bloomberg
Description: Nissan Motor Co  plans to cut $2.8 billion in annual fixed costs as part of its restructuring plan, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, as it braces for a drop in sales that could complicate its recovery from years of poor profitability.

Headlines: Trump wants California to let automaker Tesla reopen assembly plant
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday urged that Tesla Inc  be allowed to reopen its electric vehicle assembly plant in California, joining CEO Elon Musk's bid to defy county officials who have ordered it to remain closed.

Headlines: Intel Capital invests in Chinese chip companies amid tech tensions
Description: Intel Capital, the venture arm of chipmaker Intel Corp , has invested in two Chinese startups in the semiconductor sector, the company announced on Wednesday, as part of its latest batch of deals.

Headlines: Musk, Texas governor talk about potential Tesla move to Lone Star state
Description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott said on Tuesday that he spoke with Elon Musk, the chief executive of Tesla Inc , in recent days about a potential move of the company's electric vehicle assembly plant to the Lone Star state.

Headlines: Contact tracing, temperature checks and masks: airline industry outlines new norms
Description: Airlines and airports are recommending a layered approach to temporary safety measures as air travel restarts, warning that no single measure can mitigate all of the risks during the pandemic, according to a briefing document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Exclusive: Neiman Marcus creditor calls for deal with Saks Fifth Avenue - letter
Description: Hedge fund Mudrick Capital Management LP asked Neiman Marcus Group's independent directors on Tuesday to explore a combination with rival department store chain Saks Fifth Avenue, challenging the company's plan to reorganize under bankruptcy protection.

Headlines: Occidental offering voluntary job buyouts, citing need for spending cuts: document
Description: Occidental Petroleum Corp  is offering its employees voluntary buyouts over the next two weeks, according to a document seen by Reuters on Tuesday, citing the sharp decline in oil prices and the coronavirus pandemic for "severe dislocations" in its business.

Headlines: The U.S. needs more fiscal help to fight coronavirus, Fed officials say
Description: U.S. businesses and households are going to need more fiscal support to get through what will likely be a longer period of recovery from the coronavirus shutdown than initially expected, Federal Reserve policymakers said on Tuesday.

Headlines: S&P 500 tumbles on fears of virus resurgence in economic reopening
Description: The S&P 500 dropped 2% on Tuesday as investors took profits following a warning from the top U.S. infectious disease expert that premature moves to reopen the nation's economy could lead to novel coronavirus outbreaks and set back economic recovery.

Headlines: U.S. federal court tells SEC, Justice Dept to review RBS whistleblower case
Description: The U.S. Justice Department and Securities and Exchange Commission must review whether an ex-Royal Bank of Scotland employee is owed a whistleblower payout and provide documents relating to his case, a federal U.S. court said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. attorneys seek Amazon data on coronavirus-linked worker deaths, infections
Description: A group of 13 U.S. attorneys general on Tuesday asked Amazon.com Inc  to provide data on coronavirus-related deaths and  infections among its workforce, along with evidence of the company's compliance with paid sick leave laws.

Headlines: Fed's Quarles defends decision to let banks maintain dividends
Description: A senior Federal Reserve official on Tuesday defended before Congress the central bank's decision to allow lenders to continue issuing dividends, even as the regulator seeks permission from lawmakers to further relax capital rules.

Headlines: KKR leads $43 million investment round in Slice pizza platform
Description: U.S. private equity firm KKR & Co Inc  said on Tuesday it led an investor group making a $43 million investment in Slice, an online delivery platform for local pizza shops across the country.

Headlines: Stock market rally pauses, bonds edge higher on fears of second virus wave
Description: World equity markets slid and safe-haven bonds climbed on Tuesday as rising concerns about a second wave of coronavirus infections outweighed stronger economic data from China and upbeat corporate earnings in Europe.

Headlines: Twitter to let some employees to work from home permanently
Description: Twitter Inc  on Tuesday became the first major tech company to allow employees who can work remotely to do so indefinitely, as the coronavirus outbreak forces unprecedented changes in work culture across the world.

Headlines: U.S. reports record $738 billion budget deficit in April
Description: The United States on Tuesday reported a record $738 billion budget deficit in April as an explosion in government spending and a shrinking of revenues amid the novel coronavirus pandemic pushed it deeply into the red.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley pays $5 million fine to settle SEC charges it misled investing clients
Description: A unit of Morgan Stanley agreed to pay a $5 million fine to settle U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission charges it misled retail investing clients about the costs of a "wrap fee" program, the regulator said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Montana judge upholds ruling that canceled Keystone XL pipeline permit
Description: A federal judge in Montana on Monday upheld his ruling last month that canceled an environmental permit for the long-delayed Keystone XL oil pipeline and threatened other oil and natural gas pipeline projects with delays.

Headlines: Vodafone keeps dividend as pandemic hits roaming, but boosts data
Description: Vodafone  maintained its dividend on Tuesday, bucking a corporate trend to cut or scrap payouts due to the coronavirus crisis, as the world's second-biggest mobile operator met expectations with a 2.6% rise in full-year core earnings.

Headlines: Coronavirus crisis leads to largest U.S. consumer price decline since 2008
Description: U.S. consumer prices dropped by the most since the Great Recession in April, weighed down by a plunge in demand for gasoline and services including airline travel as Americans stayed home during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: China working to fulfil pledge on U.S. purchases despite import slowdown: sources
Description: China is committed to its Phase 1 trade deal with the United States and is working towards meeting its promise to boost U.S. purchases, even though the pace of buying has been restrained by the coronavirus outbreak, three Chinese sources said.

Headlines: Luckin Coffee sacks CEO, COO for alleged fraud
Description: Chinese coffee chain Luckin Coffee Inc  fired its chief executive and chief operating officers following an internal probe on fabrication of annual sales numbers, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Truck maker Volvo ditches dividend payment amid COVID-19 crisis
Description: Swedish truck maker Volvo  will withdraw its proposed dividend for 2019, it said on Tuesday, joining a slew of firms opting not to make payments to shareholders because of the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: BOC Aviation scoops up deals with airlines in sector's biggest crisis
Description: Armed with strong funding, Asian lessor BOC Aviation has struck an estimated $5.5 billion of deals with carriers including Southwest  and United Airlines  to buy and lease back aircraft as the sector faces its deepest ever crisis.

Headlines: Hyatt to lay off 1,300 employees as pandemic cripples travel
Description: Hyatt Hotels Corp  said late Monday it would lay off 1,300 people globally as it tries to cope with the coronavirus crisis, which has virtually halted global travel by keeping people indoors.

Headlines: Pfizer to outsource some drug production, focus on coronavirus vaccine
Description: (This May 8 story corrects to delete word "intravenously" in para 8 in reference to Pfizer's 1.5 billion doses of injected vaccines)

Headlines: Saudi Aramco profit falls 25% but dividend in line with planned payout for year
Description: Saudi Aramco, the world's top oil exporting company, on Tuesday reported a 25% fall in first-quarter net profit, missing analyst estimates, but its quarterly dividend was in line with a plan for a $75 billion payout for the year.

Headlines: Boeing sees zero orders again in April, MAX cancellations mount
Description: Boeing Co  recorded zero orders for the second time this year in April and customers canceled another 108 orders for its grounded 737 MAX plane compounding its worst start to a year since 1962.

Headlines: Logitech sales surge as locked-down families, workers stay connected
Description: Logitech International  reported a big jump in sales of computer products during its fourth quarter on Tuesday as more people worked from home and families turned to technology to keep in touch during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Tesla's Musk says ready for arrest as he reopens California plant against local order
Description: Tesla Inc  Chief Executive Elon Musk on Monday said production was resuming at the automaker's sole U.S. vehicle factory, in California, defying an order to stay closed and saying if anyone had to be arrested it should be him.

Headlines: Ryanair expects Europe travel surge despite masks, quarantine
Description: Temperature checks, masks and quarantine will not deter people from a holiday in the sun after three months "locked up" at home, Ryanair's chief executive Michael O'Leary said on Tuesday as he announced plans for 1,000 flights a day from July.

Headlines: Trump again urges Fed to adopt negative U.S. interest rates
Description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday again pushed the Federal Reserve to adopt negative interest rates, even as several members of the U.S. central bank have said they do not see a need for rates - now near zero - to move into negative territory.

Headlines: German watchdog investigates payments company Wirecard
Description: Germany's financial watchdog BaFin said on Tuesday it was conducting multiple investigations into Wirecard , sending its shares lower and adding to pressure over allegations it has denied.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp in informal talks about warship unit consolidation
Description: Thyssenkrupp  is in informal talks about consolidation in the shipbuilding sector, its finance chief said on Tuesday, responding to speculation that the group might sell parts of its Marine Systems (TKMS) unit or merge it with rivals German Naval Yards and Luerssen.

Headlines: Embraer blames failed Boeing deal for sharp drop in commercial jet deliveries
Description: Planemaker Embraer  said Tuesday that its commercial jet deliveries slumped by more than half during the first three months of 2020 compared to a year ago, blaming the drop on preparations for its failed deal with Boeing Co .

Headlines: EasyJet founder offers $6 million reward for help in cancelling Airbus order
Description: EasyJet  founder Stelios Haji-Ioannou is offering 5 million pounds ($6.2 million) for any information that leads to the cancellation of its order for 107 Airbus  jets as he steps up his campaign to oust the budget airline's management.

Headlines: Brussels Airlines slashes jobs, fleet as COVID-19 bites
Description: Brussels Airlines, part of Germany's Lufthansa , said on Tuesday it would reduce its fleet by 30% and its workforce by a quarter to guarantee its survival during and after the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: China's Tesla wannabes risk running out of road in virus-stricken times
Description: Challenged by the arrival of Tesla in China last year, domestic electric vehicle (EV) start-ups were struggling even before the economic shock wrought by the coronavirus, but now for some it has become a battle for survival.

Headlines: AIG approaches shareholder pay vote with cautious approval from proxy firms
Description: American International Group Inc  faces a crucial test on Wednesday, when shareholders are to vote on whether the board of directors has adequately addressed their concerns about executive pay.

Headlines: Ryanair cools on Airbus, moves back towards all-Boeing fleet
Description: Ryanair plans to move back towards an all-Boeing fleet by cancelling leases for Airbus A320s for its Lauda subsidiary and likely replacing 30 Airbus jets at the Austrian airline with Boeing 737s, Chief Executive Michael O'Leary told Reuters.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp faces deep quarterly loss due to coronavirus, shares tank
Description: German conglomerate Thyssenkrupp  warned on Tuesday that its operating loss could swell to 1 billion euros ($1.1 billion) in the April to June quarter due to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Toyota sees 80% profit drop as virus wipes $14 billion off car sales
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  said on Tuesday it expects profit to drop by 80% to its lowest in nine years, as Japan's biggest automaker grapples with the impact of the novel coronavirus which has sapped global demand for vehicles.

Headlines: ArcelorMittal offers $2 billion of shares, convertibles at discount
Description: ArcelorMittal , the world's largest steelmaker, is issuing $2 billion of shares and convertible notes at a deep discount to accelerate debt reduction plans that have been slowed by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Honda profits shrink to four-year low, coronavirus clouds outlook
Description: Honda Motor Co  on Tuesday posted its lowest operating profit in four years and refrained from releasing an earnings outlook for the current year because of uncertainty about the longer-term impact of the coronavirus on global car demand.

Headlines: China announces new tariff waivers for some U.S. imports
Description: China announced on Tuesday a new list of 79 U.S. products eligible for waivers from retaliatory tariffs imposed at the height of the bilateral trade war, amid continued pressure on Beijing to boost imports from the United States.

Headlines: Popeyes sticks to China expansion plan in spite of virus
Description: Fried chicken chain Popeyes is forging ahead with the opening of its first outlet in China despite the coronavirus outbreak and plans to set up "a few more" by the end of the year in several  Chinese cities, its executives said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Honda says has enough cash but may issue bonds if new coronavirus waves hit
Description: Honda Motor Co  has enough cash on hand, equivalent to almost two months of sales, to weather the downturn caused by the coronavirus pandemic, but may issue bonds to raise funds if there is second or third wave of infections, a senior managing director at the company, Kohei Takeuchi said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp CFO: we don't have a liquidity problem
Description: Thyssenkrupp  does not have a liquidity problem due to a 1 billion euro loan from state-owned lender KfW [KFW.UL] and the expected transfer of funds from the sale of its elevator division, its chief financial officer said.

Headlines: Trump 'not interested' in reopening U.S.-China trade deal after report of Beijing discontent
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he opposed renegotiating the U.S.-China "Phase 1" trade deal after a Chinese state-run newspaper reported some government advisers in Beijing were urging fresh talks and possibly invalidating the agreement.

Headlines: Ryanair CEO says UK quarantine plan is idiotic, unenforceable
Description: Ryanair  CEO Michael O'Leary on Tuesday said Britain's plan to have arriving passengers self-isolate in their accommodation for 14 days upon arrival was "idiotic" and effectively unenforceable.

Headlines: Once taboo, investors begin to imagine negative U.S. rates
Description: Negative interest rates in the United States were once unimaginable. The coronavirus has changed that.

Headlines: Tencent Music misses quarterly revenue estimates, signals better second quarter
Description: China's Tencent Music Entertainment  narrowly missed market estimates for quarterly revenue on Monday as the COVID-19 crisis hurt the company's social entertainment services business, sending its shares down 4.5% in extended trade overnight.

Headlines: Tim Hortons China says Tencent has invested, did not disclose amount
Description: Tim Hortons China said Tuesday it received an investment from Chinese tech giant Tencent, as the Canadian coffee brewer seeks to expand in the Chinese market.

Headlines: Potbelly settlement with activists includes twist: stock, not cash, for outlays
Description: Sandwich maker Potbelly Corp on Monday promised to reimburse activist shareholders' expenses with stock not cash, creating a situation that lawyers call an outlier for now but which they said could find traction in tough economic times.

Headlines: WeWork directors seek to preserve right to sue owner SoftBank
Description: A special committee of WeWork board members filed a motion in Delaware on Monday to prevent it from being disbanded, as it pursues legal action against majority owner SoftBank Group Corp  over an abandoned $3 billion tender offer for the office space-sharing start-up.

Headlines: Boeing CEO sees passenger levels under 25% in September, pain for airlines: NBC interview
Description: Boeing Co  Chief Executive Dave Calhoun does not expect passenger traffic to reach even a quarter of its levels in September, creating the need for airlines to make "adjustments" as they weather the impact of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Bitcoin goes through third 'halving', falls vs U.S. dollar
Description: Bitcoin slid on Monday in volatile trading, after it went through a technical adjustment that reduced the rate at which new coins are created, but the outlook remained upbeat as the increase in supply slows down.

Headlines: United to notify flyers about full flights after social media backlash
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  said on Monday that starting next week it will notify passengers ahead of time if their flight is expected to be "closer to full capacity," allowing them to re-book on a different flight or receive a travel credit.

Headlines: Shut casinos hit Caesars as COVID-19 puts gambling industry in survival mode
Description: Caesars Entertainment Corp  missed quarterly revenue estimates on Monday as it shuttered its casinos amid nationwide lockdowns to contain the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: S&P 500 closes barely higher as investors balance pandemic with recovery
Description: The S&P 500 closed barely higher, eking out a nominal gain on Monday as investors weighed new spikes in coronavirus infections with expectations that an economy crippled by mandated shutdowns will soon be re-opened for business.

Headlines: Oklahoma regulators take no action after oil output hearing
Description: Oklahoma's energy regulators on Monday took no action on applications from oil and gas producers seeking to win state-support for measures they said would help stabilize oil prices.

Headlines: Global equities markets waver, bonds dip on fears of second wave of infections
Description: Global equities wavered on Monday as investors weighed a jump in coronavirus cases in South Korea and Germany against signs that more parts of the U.S. economy could soon emerge from economic lockdown. Safe havens such as U.S. Treasuries edged higher in anticipation of further stimulus measures to limit the damage of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Tesla sues California county in virus factory closure fight, threatens to leave
Description: Tesla Inc sued local authorities in California on Saturday as the electric carmaker pushed to re-open its factory there and Chief Executive Elon Musk threatened to move Tesla's headquarters and future programs from the state to Texas or Nevada.

Headlines: California governor to look into Tesla reopening in defiance of health order
Description: California Governor Gavin Newsom said both he and local health officials would speak to officials at Tesla Inc, after the company ordered workers back on the job despite ongoing coronavirus restrictions in Alameda County, where its auto plant is located.

Headlines: Richard Branson to sell 25 million shares in Virgin Galactic to battle pandemic impact
Description: Billionaire Richard Branson's Virgin Group said on Monday that it may sell up to 25 million shares of space tourism company Virgin Galactic Holdings Inc to raise funds amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Marriott profit misses as bookings, revenue per room plunge
Description: U.S. hotel operator Marriott  missed already lowered estimates for first-quarter profit by a huge margin on Monday, as bookings plunged due to the coronavirus-led lockdowns that kept a quarter of its hotels closed.

Headlines: KKR builds 5.2% stake in ProSieben, says company undervalued
Description: U.S. private equity house KKR  said on Monday it had acquired a stake of 5.2% in ProSiebenSat.1 Media , becoming the third investor to amass a sizable shareholding in the struggling German broadcaster.

Headlines: Oil falls on fears of second coronavirus wave
Description: Oil prices fell on Monday as investors worried about a second wave of coronavirus infections, but new output cuts from Saudi Arabia tempered worries about oversupply and limited price losses.

Headlines: BA owner says burning cash, quarantine plan will make it worse
Description: British Airways owner IAG has exhausted every avenue to shore up its finances and is burning through cash, its CEO said on Monday, as the aviation industry warned of the fresh damage it would suffer if Britain quarantines international arrivals.

Headlines: Pandemic could rip 105 billion pound hole in small company finances
Description: Britain's smaller companies could be saddled with up to 105 billion pounds ($129 billion) in "unsustainable" debt by March next year that will need recapitalising, a financial services body told the Bank of England on Monday.

Headlines: Wizz Air tells UK: we need more detail on quarantine
Description: Wizz Air  needs more details on British plans to quarantine travellers before it can assess their impact after seeing strong demand for the routes it has started operating during the coronavirus crisis, its chief executive told Reuters.

Headlines: Chinese investment in the U.S. drops to lowest level since global financial crisis
Description: Chinese investment in the United States dropped to $5 billion in 2019, a slight decrease from a year earlier and the lowest level since the global financial crisis a decade ago, according to a new analysis by the U.S.-China Investment Project.

Headlines: NBCUniversal, Sky expand ad-buying tool globally
Description: Comcast Corp  units NBCUniversal and Sky said Monday that advertising across both of the media companies can now be purchased through the same tool, as the firms look to attract more global advertisers and weather the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: As U.S. meat workers fall sick and supplies dwindle, exports to China soar
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump ordered meat processing plants to stay open to protect the nation's food supply even as workers got sick and died. Yet the plants have increasingly been exporting to China while U.S. consumers face shortages, a Reuters analysis of government data showed.

Headlines: Starbucks to reopen 150 drive-thru locations in UK this week
Description: Starbucks Corp  said on Monday it would begin a phased reopening of 150 of its drive-thru locations and some takeaway-only stores in the United Kingdom as the country eases coronavirus-led restrictions on road travel.

Headlines: U.S. has no need to buy back debt, will take advantage of low interest rates: Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Monday he sees no need for the country to buy back debt and that he plans to borrow money long-term to lock in low interest rates, as the coronavirus pandemic rocks the economy.

Headlines: Exclusive: Toyota to cut North American output by 29% through October
Description: Toyota Motor Corp plans to slash production in North America by nearly a third through October due to the coronavirus crisis and expects it will take some time for output to return to normal, a person familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Fritz Gerber, who steered Roche from infamy to biotech success, dies at 91
Description: Fritz Gerber, the long-time head of Roche Holding  who helped transform the Swiss company from an image-tarnished vitamins, drugs and chemicals conglomerate into a biotechnology and diagnostics giant, has died at the age of 91.

Headlines: Under Armour warns 2nd quarter revenue could more than halve, shares tank
Description: Under Armour Inc   forecast on Monday a 50% to 60% drop in second-quarter revenue as most of its stores remained closed because of the COVID-19 pandemic, sending the athletic apparel maker's shares down about 11%.

Headlines: Munich court to drop case against British short seller over Wirecard shares
Description: A Munich court is planning to drop proceedings against British short seller Fraser Perring for suspected manipulation of the share price of German payment processor Wirecard , a court spokesman said on Monday.

Headlines: Chinese advisers call for talks on new trade deal with U.S.: Global Times
Description: Hawkish voices have emerged in China seeking a reevaluation of its Phase 1 trade deal with the United States, with some advisers urging fresh talks, a state-controlled tabloid said, citing sources close to the Chinese government.

Headlines: Over 80% of U.S. small businesses expect longer impact of pandemic: survey
Description: Eighty-one percent of small U.S. companies surveyed by Veem, a global payments network, expect the new coronavirus pandemic to affect their business over the next 12-16 months, and nearly 90% are bracing for an economic slowdown, the company said Monday.

Headlines: EU regulators to decide on $50 billion Fiat Chrysler, Peugeot deal by June 17
Description: EU antitrust regulators will decide by June 17 whether to clear Fiat Chrysler  and Peugeot maker PSA 's $50 billion merger, according to a European Commission filing on Monday.

Headlines: BA-owner IAG not in a position where it needs UK bailout: CEO
Description: British Airways-owner IAG  is not in a position where it has to ask for a specific bailout from the government to see it through the coronavirus pandemic, its chief executive said on Monday.

Headlines: LafargeHolcim to keep Philippines business after San Miguel deal collapses
Description: LafargeHolcim  has decided to keep its $2.15 billion Philippines business after a deal to sell the operation collapsed, the world's biggest cement maker said on Monday.

Headlines: Britain's embattled aviation industry demands alternative to quarantine
Description: Britain's aviation industry called on the government to find an alternative to quarantine plans for international arrivals, or risk seeing airlines and airports being dealt a fatal blow from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: BA-owner will review resumption of flying if British quarantine introduced
Description: British Airways owner IAG  will have to review its plans to resume flying in July if Britain introduces quarantine measures for international arrivals, its chief executive said on Monday.

Headlines: Halfords shares soar after Britons told cycle to work as lockdown eases
Description: Shares in British bicycles and car parts retailer Halfords  soared as much as 26% on Monday, boosted by the government's announcement that people should consider cycling to work as the coronavirus lockdown is eased.

Headlines: KLM passengers must bring their own face masks on all flights
Description: Passengers on all flights of KLM, the Dutch subsidiary of Air France KLM,  must wear face masks during travel starting on Monday, the airline said in a statement.

Headlines: Exclusive: Wuhan, recovering from virus, weighs policies to help hometown automaker Dongfeng
Description: China's Wuhan city is considering steps to support its biggest local automaker Dongfeng Motor Corp, according to a draft policy document reviewed by Reuters, as the epicentre of China's novel coronavirus outbreak tries to revive its economy.

Headlines: Telco SoftBank sees stable profit, offering Son respite from virus
Description: SoftBank Corp  on Monday forecast operating profit for the current financial year at 920 billion yen ($8.6 billion), largely unchanged from a year earlier, as it continues to generate cash amid the coronavirus-induced economic downturn.

Headlines: Nissan's China sales grew 1.1% in April as market recovered
Description: Japanese automaker Nissan Motor  said on Monday its April sales in China grew 1.1% from a year earlier to 122,846 vehicles, as the world's biggest auto market recovered from the coronavirus.

Headlines: Korean Air to decide up to $820 million rights issue this week: Yonhap
Description: South Korea's largest airline Korean Air  will decide whether to sell up to about 1 trillion won ($820.24 million) in shares in a board meeting on Wednesday, Yonhap said on Monday, as finances come under strain from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Toshiba sees FY2019 profit roughly in line with forecast, limited virus impact
Description: Toshiba Corp said on Monday it expects operating profit for the year ended March to more than triple, as the Japanese industrial conglomerate sees a limited impact from the coronavirus outbreak on its earnings for the financial year.

Headlines: Roche's U.S. gRED research head to retire, be replaced by MIT's Regev
Description: Roche  said Monday it has hired a Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) professor as the new head of the Swiss drugmaker's U.S. research arm that was responsible for some of the company's best-selling medicines of the last few decades.

Headlines: For central banks, hope for precision fades amid pandemic uncertainty
Description: Central bankers who have spent a generation researching how their words influence the economy and honing the craft of "forward guidance" are now effectively tongue-tied by a health crisis that has no clear destination yet to guide households and investors toward.

Headlines: Coronavirus sows doubt over bitcoin's rally after third 'halving'
Description: As bitcoin investors brace for a long-awaited technical adjustment that will halve new supply of the cryptocurrency, the coronavirus pandemic has cast uncertainty over the expected rally that has historically accompanied such events.

Headlines: Chinese investment in U.S. drops, pandemic to weigh on this year's bilateral flows: report
Description: Chinese direct investment in the United States dropped to the lowest level since 2009 last year amid bilateral tensions, and the COVID-19 pandemic will continue to weigh on investment flows between the world's two biggest economies, according to a report.

Headlines: Washington in talks with chipmakers about building U.S. factories
Description: The Trump administration is in talks with semiconductor companies about building chip factories in the United States, representatives from two chipmakers said on Sunday.

Headlines: Tesla China sold 3,635 Model 3 vehicles in April, down 64% vs March: CPCA
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc  sold 3,635 Shanghai-made Model 3 vehicles in China in April, down 64% from March, according to the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA).

Headlines: Qantas pauses plane deliveries from Airbus, Boeing due to virus
Description: Qantas Airways Ltd  said on Monday it had advised Airbus SE  and Boeing Co  that it did not expect to take delivery of any new planes in the near term as it grapples with a plunge in demand due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: After the triumph of Animal Crossing, a thin pipeline for Nintendo
Description: The runaway success of Nintendo Co Ltd's  island life simulator Animal Crossing: New Horizons has overshadowed an uncomfortable fact for fans of the Switch console - it lacks upcoming titles.

Headlines: Nintendo smashes Switch sales view; says Animal Crossing is device's fastest-selling game
Description: Japan's Nintendo Co Ltd  said on Thursday its fourth-quarter profit soared 200% due to surging demand for its Switch games console, and that title Animal Crossing: New Horizons shifted a record 13.4 million units in its first six weeks.

Headlines: Debt-stricken Chesapeake Energy to advance incentive executive pay
Description: Chesapeake Energy Corp said it would prepay a total of $25 million in incentive compensation to 21 top executives to ensure they are motivated, even as it prepares to file for bankruptcy protection to tackle its nearly $9 billion debt pile.

Headlines: White House considers more coronavirus aid as jobs picture worsens
Description: The White House has begun informal talks with Republicans and Democrats in Congress about what to include in another round of coronavirus relief legislation, officials said on Sunday, while predicting further U.S. jobs losses in the coming months.

Headlines: French, Dutch join forces to urge EU to show teeth on trade
Description: France and the Netherlands have joined forces to urge the European Union to enforce environmental and labour standards more forcefully with countries the bloc signs trade deals with, according to a document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. unemployment rate will get worse, Treasury's Mnuchin says
Description: The staggering U.S. unemployment rate reported by the government on Friday amid coronavirus lockdowns may get even worse, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Sunday.

Headlines: Major U.S. airlines endorse temperature checks for passengers
Description: A major U.S. airline trade group on Saturday said it backed the U.S. Transportation Security Administration (TSA) checking the temperatures of passengers and customer-facing employees during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: EU could open legal case against Germany over ECB bond-purchases ruling: Commission
Description: The European Commission could open a legal case against Germany over a ruling by the country's constitutional court that the European Central Bank had overstepped its mandate with bond purchases, the EU executive arm said on Sunday.

Headlines: Germany's Altmaier opposes active state role at Lufthansa
Description: Germany is working on a "concrete model" to aid Lufthansa, Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Sunday, amid a political row over whether the state should take a strategic shareholding and play an active role in the stricken airline.

Headlines: Emirates to raise debt as it braces for most difficult months ever
Description: Emirates, one of the world's biggest long-haul airlines, said on Sunday it will raise debt to help it through the coronavirus pandemic and may have to take tougher measures as it faces the most difficult months in its history.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp overhaul must happen faster due to COVID-19: CEO
Description: Thyssenkrupp  has less time for a wide-ranging restructuring plan than previously thought as the coronavirus pandemic is significantly burdening the already ailing conglomerate, its chief executive said in a note to staff.

Headlines: Exclusive: Saudi Aramco seeking to review price of SABIC deal - sources
Description: Saudi Aramco is looking to restructure its deal to acquire a controlling stake in petrochemicals maker SABIC after a more than 40% drop in SABIC's value following a slump in oil prices in coronavirus pandemic, two sources told Reuters.

Headlines: China central bank signals more policy measures to support virus-ravaged economy
Description: China's central bank said on Sunday it will step up counter-cyclical adjustments to support the economy and make monetary policy more flexible to fend off financial risks.
