Headlines: Mazda Motor seeks $2.8 billion in loans to ride out pandemic: source
Description: Mazda Motor Corp  has sought loans totalling about 300 billion yen ($2.8 billion) from Japan's three megabanks and other lenders to ride out the coronavirus epidemic, a source with direct knowledge of the matter said on Saturday.

Headlines: NCAA president: Sports won't return until campuses reopen
Description: College sports will not resume until all students are back on campus, NCAA president Mark Emmert said Friday.

Headlines: No 'V'-shape return from devastating U.S. job loss, Fed policymakers say
Description: As many parts of the world's biggest economy begin to reopen after weeks of stay-at-home orders that slowed the spread of the coronavirus but gutted jobs, Americans should not expect a quick return to growth, U.S. Federal Reserve officials said on Friday.

Headlines: Bankruptcy court approves Neiman Marcus' plea to access financing
Description: U.S. luxury department store chain Neiman Marcus Group said on Friday it received court approval to access $675 million of its debtor-in-possession financing, which will allow continuity of the company's business during Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings and enable it to pay employees and vendors.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: U.S. data deluge to underscore divide between roaring market, plunging economy
Description: A week packed with U.S. economic data is likely to provide investors with more evidence of the extent to which the coronavirus pandemic has hit growth, sharpening the debate on whether a rebound in stocks has been justified amid an unprecedented slowdown.

Headlines: U.S. small business rescue program ignored Congress: watchdog
Description: The U.S. government's $660 billion program to rescue small businesses hit by the coronavirus pandemic thwarts the intention of Congress by making it hard for some borrowers to convert loans to grants and failing to prioritize the right businesses, a government watchdog said on Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street jumps as historic job losses fewer than feared
Description: Major U.S. stock indexes jumped on Friday and logged solid gains for the week after data on historic job losses due to the coronavirus crisis showed they were slightly fewer than feared.

Headlines: California county says Tesla may not reopen vehicle factory, stifling Musk's plans
Description: Tesla Inc "must not reopen" its vehicle factory in the San Francisco Bay area as local lockdown measures to curb the spread of the coronavirus remain in effect, the local county health department said on Friday.

Headlines: Trump 'torn' over U.S.-China trade deal as officials push to fulfill its terms
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he was "very torn" about whether to end the so-called Phase 1 U.S.-China trade deal, just hours after top trade officials from both countries pledged to press ahead with implementing it despite coronavirus economic wreckage.

Headlines: Southwest to raise $815 million through sale and leaseback of 20 planes
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  will sell and lease back 20 planes for gross proceeds of about $815 million, the company said in a regulatory filing on Friday.

Headlines: Explainer: Fed funds futures market sees negative rates by next April
Description: The fed funds futures market is pricing in negative U.S. interest rates next year, a scenario the Federal Reserve has said it wants to avoid as many doubt that it would be an effective tool to stimulate growth.

Headlines: Chipotle secures $600 million credit line amid coronavirus crisis
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc  has secured a new year-long $600 million revolving credit line, a regulatory filing showed https://bit.ly/2SOtm6L on Friday, as the restaurant chain looks to deal with the fallout from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Stocks hit weekly highs as markets shrug off dismal U.S. jobs data
Description: Equity markets rallied on Friday, hitting weekly highs, and oil prices gained as more governments around the world began gradually reopening their economies and Sino-American trade tensions eased.

Headlines: Coronavirus deals U.S. economy Great Depression-like job losses, high unemployment
Description: The U.S. economy lost a staggering 20.5 million jobs in April, the steepest plunge in payrolls since the Great Depression, laying bare both the economic and human tragedy wrought by the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: 'The government is failing us': Laid-off Americans struggle in coronavirus crisis
Description: (This May 7 story changes monthly to weekly in paragraph 35)

Headlines: Great Depression-like U.S. job losses, unemployment rate expected in April
Description: The U.S. economy likely lost a staggering 22 million jobs in April, in what would be the steepest plunge in payrolls since the Great Depression and the starkest sign yet of how the novel coronavirus pandemic is battering the world's biggest economy.

Headlines: U.S. post office loss doubles as it warns COVID-19 will hit its finances
Description: The U.S. Postal Service on Friday said its losses more than doubled to $4.5 billion in the quarter ending in March and warned the economic slowdown spurred by the spread of COVID-19 could severely hurt its finances over the next 18 months.

Headlines: Wirecard revamps management board amid probes
Description: Wirecard  Chief Executive Markus Braun apologised to shareholders on Friday as the company announced a reshuffle of its management board and appointed a new compliance officer, days after the hedge fund TCI demanded Braun's removal.

Headlines: U.S. private payrolls dive by a record 20.2 million
Description: U.S. private employers laid off a record 20.236 million workers in April as mandatory business closures in response to the novel coronavirus outbreak savaged the economy, setting up the overall labor market for historic job losses last month.

Headlines: Exclusive: Iran-linked hackers recently targeted coronavirus drugmaker Gilead - sources
Description: Hackers linked to Iran have targeted staff at U.S. drugmaker Gilead Sciences Inc in recent weeks, according to publicly-available web archives reviewed by Reuters and three cybersecurity researchers, as the company races to deploy a treatment for the COVID-19 virus.

Headlines: Exclusive: J.C. Penney to file for bankruptcy as soon as next week, sources say
Description: J.C. Penney Co Inc  is preparing to file for bankruptcy protection as soon as next week with plans to permanently close about a quarter of its roughly 850 stores, becoming the latest major U.S. retailer to succumb to fallout from the coronavirus outbreak, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Still hiring! Walmart, other superstores buck U.S. employment trend
Description: Amid the carnage of the U.S. employment report for April was one bright spot: superstores led by Walmart Inc , the world's largest retailer, added more than 90,000 jobs.

Headlines: U.S. wholesale inventories revised up in March
Description: U.S. wholesale inventories fell in March, albeit less than initially estimated, and further decreases are likely as the novel coronavirus outbreak continues to weigh on imports of goods.

Headlines: Explainer: Why 14.7% unemployment rate doesn't capture the true state of the coronavirus economy
Description: The U.S. economy shed 20.5 million jobs in April, and the unemployment rate rose to 14.7%, a government report Friday showed.

Headlines: Microsoft to invest $1.5 billion in Italian cloud business
Description: Microsoft Corp. said on Friday it would create its first datacentre region in Italy under a $1.5 billion investment plan as the U.S. company expands its cloud computing services to more locations across the world.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. drafts rule to allow Huawei and U.S. firms to work together on 5G standards - sources
Description: The U.S. Department of Commerce is close to signing off on a new rule that would allow U.S. companies to work with China's Huawei Technologies on setting standards for next generation 5G networks, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: U.S. joblessness slams Latinos, less educated with brutal force
Description: The U.S. economy's record run of job growth and historically low unemployment has been stopped in its tracks by the fight against the coronavirus pandemic: joblessness hit 14.7% in April, and even if it starts to fall in coming weeks there will be scars.

Headlines: Instant view: Coronavirus ravaged U.S. payrolls in April, 20.5 mln jobs lost
Description: The U.S. economy lost a staggering 20.5 million jobs in April, the steepest plunge in payrolls since the Great Depression and the starkest sign yet of how the novel coronavirus pandemic is battering the world's biggest economy.

Headlines: Take Five: Trade War II
Description: China's exports rebound has been quickly overshadowed by dire predictions of Trade War II between the world's two biggest economies.

Headlines: Turkey charges seven people over Ghosn escape: lawyer
Description: Turkish prosecutors have prepared an indictment charging seven people, including four pilots, over former Nissan  boss Carlos Ghosn's escape via Istanbul to Lebanon after fleeing Japan, a lawyer for one of the suspects said on Friday.

Headlines: Lufthansa to start flying 80 more aircraft in June to meet travel demand
Description: German flagship carrier Lufthansa  on Friday said it would start flying 80 more of its aircraft again in June, including to serve tourism destinations after the company grounded much of its vast fleet due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Green hydrogen's time has come, say advocates eying post-pandemic world
Description: Hydrogen has long been touted as a clean alternative to fossil fuels. Now, as major economies prepare green investments to kickstart growth, advocates spy a golden chance to drag the niche energy into the mainstream of a post-pandemic world.

Headlines: Siemens surges as cuts costs and presses on with energy IPO
Description: Siemens  stock surged on Friday after the German engineering company said it was speeding up cost savings to tackle the coronavirus downturn and the flotation of its energy business remained on track.

Headlines: Rupert Murdoch gives up bonus after News Corp post $1 billion loss
Description: News Corp  Executive Chairman Rupert Murdoch is forgoing his cash bonus for the year after the media company posted a $1 billion quarterly loss due to a write-down in the value of its Australian pay TV unit and the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on its businesses.

Headlines: Germany's BaFin investigating Wirecard communication ahead of audit publication
Description: Germany's financial market watchdog BaFin is investigating Wirecard's  communication with investors directly ahead of the publication of a critical audit by KPMG, a spokeswoman for the regulator said on Friday.

Headlines: Investors exit stocks at fastest rate since March, 'tech fatigue' sets in: BOFA
Description: Investors pulled $16.2 billion from stocks in the past week in the largest weekly redemption since the March stock market slump, according to the Bank of America's weekly flows data.

Headlines: Sony to make, donate face shields to Japan hospitals
Description: Sony Corp said on Friday it will manufacture and donate medical face shields to hospitals in Japan, amid worries about the availability of protective equipment for healthcare workers dealing with the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Indonesia's Garuda to seek restructuring of $500-mln Islamic bonds
Description: National flag carrier Garuda Indonesia  will seek to restructure $500 million of Islamic bonds due to mature next month, the deputy of the state-owned enterprises ministry said on Friday.

Headlines: China, U.S. hold trade talks on implementation of signed phase one deal
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and United States Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer held a phone call late on Thursday in which they spoke about U.S.-China trade, the U.S. government said in a statement.

Headlines: Siemens has secured 3 billion euro loan for Energy spin-off: BBG TV
Description: Siemens  has secured a 3 billion euro ($3.25 billion) loan that will be transferred to the group's Energy unit, which is scheduled to be spun off at the end of September, Chief Executive Joe Kaeser told Bloomberg TV on Friday.

Headlines: Siemens prepares for COVID-19 trough to last 6-9 months: CNBC
Description: Siemens  is preparing for a prolonged economic trough triggered by the COVID-19 pandemic, Chief Executive Joe Kaeser told CNBC on Friday after releasing fiscal second-quarter results.

Headlines: Siemens sees sales decline of up to 5% for 2020 financial year
Description: Siemens  Chief Financial Officer Ralf Thomas said the moderate sales decline expected by the German industrial company for its 2020 business year would mean a decline of up to 5%.

Headlines: Neiman Marcus's attempt to manage crushing debt undone by COVID-19
Description: On March 17, about a week after the World Health Organization declared COVID-19 a pandemic, Neiman Marcus Group had no choice but to close its 67 stores.

Headlines: Air New Zealand to boost capacity as virus curbs ease, but higher fares expected
Description: Air New Zealand Ltd  said on Friday it would boost domestic capacity to 20% of usual levels once the country further loosens pandemic restrictions, but it cannot offer its lowest fares due to social distancing requirements.

Headlines: Siemens steps up cost-saving programme to tackle coronavirus downturn
Description: German industrial company Siemens  is accelerating its cost-savings programme to deal with the impact of the coronavirus pandemic, Deputy Chief Executive Roland Busch said on Friday.

Headlines: Japan's ANA suspends recruitment citing coronavirus fallout
Description: ANA Holdings Inc , the operator of Japan's top airline, said on Friday it would suspend its recruitment process at its 37 group companies due to an uncertain business climate caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: After surprise apology, Samsung heir pressed to explain family's intentions
Description: Samsung Group heir Jay Y. Lee's vow to end dynastic succession at South Korea's biggest conglomerate following three generations of family control sparked skepticism in some quarters and worry in others for the future of the country's corporate champions.

Headlines: Payments giant Fiserv names Bisignano to succeed Yabuki as CEO
Description: Payments giant Fiserv Inc  said Thursday that Frank Bisignano would become the company's chief executive on July 1, with long-time head Jeffery Yabuki remaining on as executive chairman until the end of the year.

Headlines: Lyft to require passengers and drivers to wear masks
Description: Lyft  will require both passengers and drivers to wear masks and complete a health certification program, including confirming before each ride that they are not displaying symptoms associated with the novel coronavirus, the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. companies got emergency government loans despite having months of cash
Description: When American companies recently applied for U.S. government loans meant to help small businesses survive the coronavirus crisis, they had to certify they needed the cash to cover basic needs like salaries and rent. The money, up to $10 million, was meant to tide them over for eight weeks.

Headlines: How Deere, Caterpillar kept plants running during the coronavirus outbreak
Description: While Detroit automakers' unionized auto factories have been idled by the coronavirus pandemic, farm and construction equipment makers Deere  and Caterpillar  have won the support of the United Auto Workers and other unions to run their facilities during the pandemic.

Headlines: The great potato giveaway: U.S. farmers hand out spuds to avoid food waste
Description: When Tina Yates pulled her truck up to a mall in western Washington state on Thursday, workers waved her past hundreds of cars waiting to pick up free russet potatoes.

Headlines: Michigan governor allows coronavirus-hit manufacturers to reopen on May 11
Description: Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer on Thursday said the state's factories can reopen on May 11, removing one of the last major obstacles to North American automakers bringing thousands of laid-off employees back to work amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Government aid for Brazil's airlines shrinks, while Panama's Copa shrugs off bailout
Description: Stress has been mounting for Latin American airlines as carriers brace for a slow recovery from the coronavirus pandemic, but Brazil's government on Thursday reduced the loan aid available for carriers, while Panama's Copa Airlines said it did not need a bailout.

Headlines: Uber sees rides recovering from coronavirus lows, banks on food-delivery momentum
Description: Uber Technologies Inc's  ride service bookings slowly recovered in recent weeks as the company expects a coronavirus-related slowdown will delay the goal of becoming profitable by a matter of quarters, not years, Chief Executive Dara Khosrowshahi said on Thursday.

Headlines: Luxury retailer Neiman Marcus files for bankruptcy amid COVID-19 pandemic
Description: Neiman Marcus Group filed for bankruptcy protection on Thursday, marking one of the highest-profile collapses yet among retailers forced to temporarily close stores in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Wall Street gets PayPal lift as Nasdaq wipes out 2020 declines
Description: Wall Street's indexes climbed on Thursday, with the Nasdaq erasing losses for 2020, following a clutch of upbeat earnings reports led by PayPal as investors looked past more weak jobs data caused by the coronavirus-induced economic downturn.

Headlines: Ford plans to restart North America production from May 18
Description: U.S. automaker Ford Motor Co  said on Thursday it is planning to restart production and operations in North America in a phased manner, starting May 18.

Headlines: Macy's delays first-quarter results to July 1, citing COVID-19 disruption
Description: Department store chain Macy's Inc  on Thursday delayed its first-quarter earnings report to July 1, citing significant business disruption due to the COVID-19 pandemic, which has also led to delay in financial statement preparation.

Headlines: World stocks climb on China trade relief, while U.S. jobs data dents dollar
Description: World shares rose on Thursday after China's exports came in far stronger than expected, suggesting an economic recovery was under way, but the dollar fell from two-week highs as U.S. data showed millions more Americans joined the ranks of the unemployed.

Headlines: Tesla's Musk delays release of Roadster sports car, repeats coronavirus lockdown criticism
Description: Tesla Inc  Chief Executive Elon Musk said in a podcast  interview released on Thursday that the company's planned Roadster sports car would take a backseat to the development of other vehicle models.

Headlines: Stay-at-home stocks Amazon, Microsoft lift Nasdaq into gain for 2020
Description: The Nasdaq  was on track to end Thursday in positive territory for 2020 after winning back the vast majority of steep losses caused in recent months by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Free beer! German brewery gives away beverages it can't sell
Description: Unable to deliver to hotels and restaurants closed due to coronavirus restrictions, a German brewery on Thursday gave away some 2,600 litres (690 gallons) of beer.

Headlines: As U.S. states start to reopen, Fed official sees little sign of economic resurgence
Description: Though states have begun to reopen their economies, it is not clear consumers are ready to venture back to the marketplace, Atlanta Federal Reserve Bank President Raphael Bostic said on Thursday, citing conversations with business officials in his region and his staff's study of cellphone tracking data.

Headlines: U.S. reaches settlement to recover over $49 million involving Malaysia's 1MDB: DOJ
Description: The United States has reached a settlement to recover more than $49 million involving Malaysian sovereign wealth fund 1MDB, the Department of Justice said.

Headlines: Airbus deliveries plunge 80% in April
Description: Airbus  deliveries tumbled 80% to just 14 aircraft in April, compared with a year earlier, as operations were hit by the coronavirus crisis, company data showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Virgin Atlantic job cuts will help win new investment -internal memo
Description: Virgin Atlantic's planned 3,150 job cuts will show the airline is taking "self-help" measures and help it to win financial support from either the British government or a private sector investor, an internal memo to pilots seen by Reuters said.

Headlines: H&M's sales tumble, stockpiles grow in March to May
Description: H&M , the world's second-biggest fashion retailer, said  local currency sales had tumbled 57% since the start of March compared with a year ago as the COVID-19 pandemic and lockdowns kept most of its stores closed.

Headlines: Wall Street bullish on ride-hailing firms on lower driver costs, recovery signs
Description: Wall Street gave a resounding vote of confidence to ride-hailing stocks ahead of Uber's  results on Thursday, after Lyft indicated a slow recovery in demand and lower costs as rising unemployment creates greater supply of drivers.

Headlines: Lufthansa seeks 9 billion euro bailout amid political discussions
Description: Lufthansa  is negotiating a 9 billion euro ($9.71 billion) bailout with Germany's economic stabilisation fund to ensure its future, the airline said on Thursday, confirming an earlier Reuters report.

Headlines: Millions more Americans file for jobless benefits; productivity tanks
Description: Millions more Americans sought unemployment benefits last week, suggesting layoffs broadened from consumer-facing industries to other segments of the economy and could remain elevated even as many parts of the country start to reopen.

Headlines: U.S. employers must try to accommodate workers vulnerable to coronavirus: agency
Description: The U.S. agency that enforces laws prohibiting disability discrimination said on Thursday that employers must try to accommodate workers with medical conditions that make them vulnerable to the novel coronavirus before sending them home.

Headlines: AB InBev sees worse ahead, but some light in China
Description: Anheuser-Busch InBev , the world's largest beer maker, forecast a "materially worse" second quarter as coronavirus restrictions curb drinking across the globe, although China was showing early signs of recovery.

Headlines: Liberty and Telefonica agree $38 billion UK tie-up to take on BT
Description: Liberty Global  and Telefonica  have agreed to merge their British businesses in a $38 billion deal that will create a powerhouse in mobile and broadband to take on market leader BT .

Headlines: Air France job cuts to test CEO Smith's consensual style
Description: Air France-KLM  is opening talks with its French unions on workforce cuts, Chief Executive Ben Smith told Reuters, as the airline group warned of mounting losses with no clear end in sight to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Air France-KLM boss right to tackle subject of jobs: minister
Description: Air France-KLM  Chief Executive Ben Smith is right to tackle the subject of jobs at the struggling airline, said French government minister Jean-Baptiste Djebbari on Thursday, as trade unions brace for possible cuts.

Headlines: JetBlue posts quarterly loss, scales back Airbus orders
Description: JetBlue Airways Corp  on Thursday posted a $268 million quarterly loss as the coronavirus pandemic hurt air travel demand, and cut its order book with Airbus SE  by about 34% through 2022 to save $1.1 billion in aircraft spending.

Headlines: Facebook names first members of oversight board that can overrule Zuckerberg
Description: Facebook Inc's  new content oversight board will include a former prime minister, a Nobel Peace Prize laureate and several constitutional law experts and rights advocates among its first 20 members, the company announced on Wednesday.

Headlines: Harley appoints turnaround specialist Jochen Zeitz to revive sales
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc  on Thursday appointed board member and turnaround specialist Jochen Zeitz to the role of chief executive officer, as the struggling motorcycle maker looks to tap into his expertise to woo customers and revive sales.

Headlines: Next enters British beauty contest in former Debenhams stores
Description: British clothes retailer Next  will open five standalone beauty halls in former Debenhams stores across the country as a first step in its ambition to become a new force in beauty retailing, the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: Twilio shares surge 32% after results crush Wall Street estimates
Description: Twilio Inc  shares surged 32% to a record high after the cloud communication provider's quarterly results and forecast smashed Wall Street estimates on increased demand from telehealth and education companies amid widespread lockdowns.

Headlines: Kohl's to reopen 25% of stores as states lift lockdown restrictions
Description: Kohl's Corp  said on Thursday it plans to reopen a quarter of its stores by next week, as retailers start to get business going again in states where coronavirus-induced lockdown restrictions have eased.

Headlines: U.S. demand for cars expected to rebound while travel, dining lag: ad agency
Description: Consumer demand for cars could begin to recover this month in the United States after steep declines due to the coronavirus pandemic, but the hard-hit travel and dining industries will likely continue to face difficult times, according to a major U.S. advertising agency.

Headlines: Fashion shift online picks up even as stores reopen
Description: Retailers selling fashion online are emerging as the winners of the coronavirus crisis as consumers are staying home even as stores start to reopen, results from major companies showed on Thursday.

Headlines: PayPal, Square eye boost as crisis spurs online shopping shift
Description: Wall Street analysts looked past a surprisingly shaky first quarter for payment processors PayPal Holdings Inc  and Square Inc  hoping that the shift towards more online buying will see their businesses surge this year.

Headlines: Rolls-Royce signals job cuts as lowers engine output forecast
Description: British aero-engine maker Rolls-Royce signalled on Thursday it expects to cut some of its workforce, after reports that it was considering cutting up to 8,000 jobs to weather a global aerospace sector slump.

Headlines: BT scraps dividend, invests in fibre as rivals agree merger
Description: Britain's biggest telecoms group BT  suspended its dividend and said it would spend billions more on faster fibre broadband connections, as it prepares to meet the challenge posed by the merger of two of its biggest rivals.

Headlines: GSK sells $3.4 billion Hindustan Unilever stake in largest India block trade
Description: GlaxoSmithKline  has sold its stake in Unilever's  Indian business  for $3.4 billion, marking India's largest block trade, which will help the British company in its goal of reinvigorating its drug development pipeline.

Headlines: Apple awards $10 million to nasal swab maker COPAN Diagnostics to help boost factory output
Description: Apple Inc said on Thursday that it was awarding $10 million to a maker of nasal swabs and other materials for collecting samples for Covid-19 tests in a move aimed at boosting the swab maker's production to 1 million collection kits per week by early July.

Headlines: U.S. and Europe spar over next stage of aircraft subsidy dispute
Description: The United States said there was "no valid basis" for the European Union to retaliate against U.S. goods in a long-running subsidy row after Boeing lost state tax breaks, but the EU said it was pressing ahead with its demand for tariffs.

Headlines: British Airways owner IAG must restructure across the board: Walsh
Description: The owner of British Airways, Iberia, Vueling and Aer Lingus must cut costs across the board to weather the coronavirus crisis as air travel won't return to normal until at least 2023, its chief executive Willie Walsh said on Thursday.

Headlines: PayPal sees strong second quarter as online spending surges (May 6)
Description: PayPal Holdings Inc  said it expects a strong recovery in payments volumes in the second quarter as social distancing drives more people to shop online, even as lockdowns start to ease, sending its shares up 8% in extended trading.

Headlines: Global luxury gloom to deepen despite easing lockdowns: Bain
Description: Global sales of luxury goods are expected to slump by 50% to 60% in the second quarter even as some countries begin to ease coronavirus lockdowns and despite signs of recovery in the Chinese market, consultancy Bain said on Thursday.

Headlines: IAG CEO says would like group to continue to have presence at Gatwick
Description: The chief executive of British Airways-owner IAG  Willie Walsh said on Thursday that his personal was that the airline group should continue to have a presence at London's Gatwick Airport.

Headlines: Qatar Airways in talks with banks for billions of dollars in loans: sources
Description: Qatar Airways is in talks with banks for loans worth billions of dollars, three sources familiar with the matter said, as the state-owned airline readies to begin rebuilding its network that has been crushed by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Italy to inject 3 billion euros in new Alitalia: industry minister
Description: Italy's government will inject fresh capital worth at least 3 billion euros ($3.24 billion) in the ailing carrier Alitalia, which is being nationalised following financial problems, Industry Minister Stefano Patuanelli said on Thursday.

Headlines: German economy minister: We'll prevent Lufthansa from being sold out
Description: The German government will prevent Lufthansa , the country's flagship carrier, from being sold out, Economy Minister Peter Altmaier told Bild newspaper on Thursday.

Headlines: World food prices fall sharply in April because of coronavirus: U.N.
Description: World food prices fell for a third consecutive month in April, hit by the economic and logistical impact of the coronavirus pandemic, the United Nations food agency said on Thursday.

Headlines: Media giant Vivendi raises stake in Lagardere to 13.36%
Description: French media conglomerate Vivendi  has increased its stake in Lagardere  to 13.36% from 10.6%, an AMF regulatory filing published on Thursday showed.

Headlines: Norwegian Air secures shareholder funds in fight to stay aloft
Description: Norwegian Air  has secured vital funding from shareholders as it battles to survive the novel coronavirus pandemic that drove down April passenger volumes by 98.7%, the budget carrier said on Thursday.

Headlines: Climate activists spray 'fake oil' onto Barclays HQ in London's Canary Wharf
Description: Climate activists from the Extinction Rebellion group sprayed "fake oil" onto the Barclays headquarters in London's Canary Wharf on Thursday, calling on the bank to divest from fossil fuels.

Headlines: Britain's Superdry sales plunge 37% as stores shuttered
Description: British fashion retailer Superdry  said its revenue plunged 37% in its latest quarter, reflecting the closure of its stores across the world because of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: UK parliament tells Barclays CEO: explain emergency business loans delays
Description: The British parliament's treasury committee chairman has told the chief executive of Barclays  to explain delays to granting emergency loans to small businesses.

Headlines: Britain's GSK to sell entire stake in Hindustan Unilever
Description: (Reporting by Pushkala Aripaka in Bengaluru; Editing by Anil D'Silva)

Headlines: Bottler Coca Cola HBC's April sales lose fizz as lockdowns weigh
Description: Soft drinks bottler Coca Cola HBC AG  on Thursday said sales in April fell by more than a third as fast-food chains, theatres and other public arenas stayed shut to limit the spread of the new coronavirus during stay-at-home orders.

Headlines: Liberty Global expects no major regulatory challenge to O2-Virgin deal: CEO
Description: Liberty Global  expects no major regulatory challenge to a deal to merge its Virgin Media unit with British mobile operator O2, owned by Spain's Telefonica , its chief executive said on Thursday.

Headlines: Air France-KLM loss gives first taste of coronavirus impact
Description: Two weeks of coronavirus shutdown were enough to hit Air France-KLM  with an 815 million-euro ($880 million) first-quarter operating loss, the airline group said on Thursday - predicting demand could take "several years" to recover.

Headlines: Liberty Global, Telefónica agree 24 billion pound deal to merge UK groups: FT
Description: The British units of Liberty Global Plc  and Telefónica SA  will merge in a deal worth 24 billion pounds ($29.57 billion), the Financial Times reported https://www.ft.com/content/2b73a385-7218-47dc-83bf-18e6e3d5f8f4 on Thursday.

Headlines: Smithfield Foods to restart South Dakota pork plant from May 7
Description: Smithfield Foods Inc will restart its plant in Sioux Falls, South Dakota from May 7 after being idled for more than three weeks due to the coronavirus outbreak, the world's biggest pork processor said late on Wednesday.

Headlines: Frontier Airlines rescinds empty middle seat charge after lawmaker pressure
Description: U.S. budget carrier Frontier Airlines withdrew on Wednesday a "More Room" policy that would have given passengers the option of paying extra to keep the middle seat empty on flights after a backlash from politicians, according to a letter to lawmakers seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Sinclair agrees to pay record-setting $48 million FCC civil penalty
Description: Sinclair Broadcast Group has agreed to pay a $48 million fine to the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) resolving the probe into the company's abandoned deal to buy Tribune Media in what the agency said was its largest-ever civil penalty.

Headlines: Ford's China ventures saw sales growth in April as market rebounds
Description: U.S. automaker Ford Motor Co's  two ventures in China have reported year-on-year sales growth for April, indicating the world's biggest auto market has started its recovery from coronavirus-induced lows.

Headlines: T-Mobile beats phone subscriber estimates as lockdown creates demand surge
Description: T-Mobile US Inc  said on Wednesday it added more monthly bill paying phone subscribers than expected in the first quarter, thanks to a surge in demand for cheaper phone services as people work from home amid coronavirus lockdowns.

Headlines: Lyft sees rider demand improve in late April, 'on path to profitability'
Description: Lyft Inc  on Wednesday posted higher-than-expected revenue and the ride-hailing company vowed further cost cuts to become profitable, saying ridership hit by the coronavirus pandemic had improved in late April.

Headlines: Peloton gets lockdown boost as home workouts drive exercise bike sales
Description: Peloton Interactive Inc  raised its forecast for full-year revenue on Wednesday as "stay at home" orders led to a surge in sales of the company's exercise bikes and fitness subscriptions, sending its shares up 5%.

Headlines: S&P 500, Dow drop as financial sector declines counter tech gains
Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow fell on Wednesday as declines in financials and defensive groups countered gains in tech shares and as data showed U.S. private employers laid off 20 million workers in April, underscoring the economic fallout of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Fox Corp quarterly revenue tops estimates as Super Bowl boosts viewership
Description: Fox Corp  beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter revenue and profit on Wednesday as Super Bowl broadcast boosted television viewership, sending the company's shares up more than 2% in extended trading.

Headlines: World shares mixed amid hopes for business pickup; oil slips
Description: Oil prices slid and world equity markets seesawed on Wednesday as investor hopes for a pickup in business activity were dashed by downbeat economic data and a rise in U.S. crude stockpiles to three-year highs that highlighted low fuel demand.

Headlines: New York Times adds record digital subscribers, posts upbeat first-quarter results
Description: The New York Times Co  crossed five million digital subscribers, adding a record number and withstanding a heavy drop in ad revenue in the first quarter that was dominated by heavy news coverage around the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Surging small cap stocks offer hope of U.S. growth rebound
Description: Big gains in small caps stocks are fueling hopes that a bounce in broader equity markets may stick, as investors ponder how quickly the U.S. economy can emerge from its coronavirus-fueled slowdown.

Headlines: The magic word for Detroit automakers is trucks
Description: The coronavirus pandemic brought the U.S. auto industry to its knees, but Americans' love affair with beefy pickup trucks is helping the Detroit automakers get on the road to recovery.

Headlines: Uber to cut 3,700 jobs, CEO Khosrowshahi to waive base salary
Description: Uber Technologies Inc will cut about 3,700 full-time jobs and Chief Executive Officer Dara Khosrowshahi will forgo his base salary for the remainder of the year, the company said on Wednesday, as the COVID-19 pandemic decimates ride-hailing businesses.

Headlines: Breakout time behind plexiglass: Renault factory restarts in France
Description: With temperature scanners on the door and tables partitioned by plexiglass shields in the breakout area, workers at one of Renault's  French plants are adjusting to new routines as carmakers try to cope with the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Fed lending program not for insolvent oil drillers, Kaplan says
Description: Insolvent or overly leveraged firms, including oil drillers and oil services firms, won't be able to tap the U.S. central bank's "Main Street" emergency lending program, Dallas Federal Reserve President Robert Kaplan said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Breakout time behind plexiglass: Renault factory restarts in France
Description: With temperature scanners on the door and tables partitioned by plexiglass shields in the breakout area, workers at one of Renault's  French plants are adjusting to new routines as carmakers try to cope with the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Fed lending program not for insolvent oil drillers, Kaplan says
Description: Insolvent or overly leveraged firms, including oil drillers and oil services firms, won't be able to tap the U.S. central bank's "Main Street" emergency lending program, Dallas Federal Reserve President Robert Kaplan said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Gold price boosts Barrick profit as miner eyes copper deals
Description: Barrick Gold Corp   reported a nearly 55% rise in quarterly profit on Wednesday as gold prices surged, bolstering its ability to snap up mines including in copper, its chief executive said.

Headlines: Factbox: What to know about Facebook's content oversight board
Description: Facebook Inc  on Wednesday announced the first 20 members of its independent oversight board that can overrule the company’s own content moderation decisions. Here are some key facts about how the board will work:

Headlines: WTO must decide if U.S. complied with Boeing aid ruling, Airbus says
Description: The World Trade Organization must decide whether the United States has fully complied with WTO rulings on illegal government aid to Boeing Co , and that process could take some time, a spokesman for Airbus said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Abercrombie, Gap prepare to reopen stores as lockdowns ease
Description: Abercrombie & Fitch Co  and cash-strapped Gap Inc  on Wednesday laid out plans to reopen stores in areas where lockdown curbs have eased, while also introducing social-distancing measures.

Headlines: GM sets May 18 North American restart as profit tops estimates
Description: General Motors Co  on Wednesday outlined plans for a May 18 restart of most of its North American plants shut down by the coronavirus pandemic as it reported a stronger than expected quarterly profit, sending its shares up 5.3%.

Headlines: KKR's first-quarter profit rises 11% on stronger asset sales
Description: Private equity firm KKR & Co Inc  reported an 11% jump in after-tax distributable earnings in the first quarter on Wednesday, driven by growth in asset sales and management fees ahead of the coronavirus-linked market turmoil.

Headlines: VW sees multi-speed coronavirus rebound led by China
Description: Volkswagen  sees demand rebounding in China, helped by new buyers switching from public transport and sales of premium vehicles, but warned business would not recover from the coronavirus crisis as quickly in other parts of the world.

Headlines: BMW cuts outlook, sees coronavirus pain lasting all year
Description: BMW AG  expects the coronavirus pandemic to hit demand and earnings throughout this year, prompting the German automaker to cut its profitability forecast for passenger cars following a drop in first-quarter deliveries.

Headlines: StanChart highlights climate goals amid criticism over carbon financing
Description: Standard Chartered  defended its environmental credentials after renewed criticism from climate campaigners for its funding of fossil fuel companies as the bank held its annual shareholder meeting on Wednesday.

Headlines: CVS Health maintains 2020 profit forecast despite coronavirus hit
Description: CVS Health Corp  on Wednesday said it was sticking to its 2020 forecast and expected a strong second quarter, as reduced medical service use for its Aetna insurance business offset  coronavirus-related expenses and the pandemic's impact on pharmacy sales and prescriptions.

Headlines: As central banks break the junk debt barrier, investors will follow
Description: May 6 (Reuters)- Recent central bank bond-buying to calm market turmoil has breached the wall dividing top-grade debt from so-called junk-rated issues, raising the likelihood of the investment industry and even regulators eventually dismantling the barrier.

Headlines: United Airlines to raise $2.25 billion in bonds, rolls back plan to cut work hours
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  said on Wednesday it plans to raise $2.25 billion through a bond offering amid a coronavirus-linked slump in air travel demand, and backtracked on a controversial plan to cut working hours for thousands of employees.

Headlines: Fed's Bullard: Drop in U.S. payrolls 'not a surprise' given shutdowns - CNBC
Description: The massive drop in U.S. private payrolls for April, reported on Wednesday, is "not a surprise" but employment could recover dramatically in the second half of the year if the coronavirus pandemic is controlled, St. Louis Federal Reserve president James Bullard said.

Headlines: UK watchdog clears Shell's 'drive carbon neutral' ad on petrol pumps
Description: Britain's advertising watchdog has ruled Royal Dutch Shell's  ad campaign on petrol pumps promising customers they can "drive carbon neutral" is acceptable, following complaints.

Headlines: China's Alibaba launches 'outlet' platform to shift luxury overstock
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd  has launched a new luxury platform targeting younger consumers that also aims to help high-end brands shed excess inventory built up during the global coronavirus lockdown.

Headlines: Qatar Airways expects to re-open routes this month
Description: Qatar Airways said on Wednesday it would this month start to rebuild its network, in anticipation countries will ease air travel restrictions and based on monitoring of passenger trends.

Headlines: Tyson Foods to resume limited production at largest U.S. pork plant
Description: Tyson Foods Inc  will resume limited production at its largest U.S. pork plant this week, the company said late on Tuesday, a week after President Donald Trump ordered companies to keep meat-processing plants open to protect the supply chain.

Headlines: Yum China keeps bets on dine-in, sticks to expansion plans after virus
Description: Yum China  is betting that Chinese consumers will still choose to dine-in in the aftermath of the coronavirus crisis and plans to open more Pizza Hut and KFC outlets in China's smaller cities in the coming months, its chief executive said.

Headlines: E-cigarette maker Juul Labs to exit South Korea after year of health controversies
Description: U.S. e-cigarette maker Juul Labs said on Wednesday it would end operations in South Korea, a year after it entered the market there but failed to gain traction amid government health warnings.

Headlines: Britain's mid-sized banks coping with coronavirus, but warn of pain ahead
Description: A slew of Britain's mid-sized banks on Wednesday reported steady deposits and demand in the face of the COVID-19 pandemic, but warned it was too early to assess the long-term damage of the outbreak to their businesses.

Headlines: Turkish Airlines plans to resume limited flights in June: draft
Description: Turkish Airlines plans a gradual resumption of flights from June and will take four months to return to near full operation, a draft plan seen by Reuters showed, as the economy reopens following a slowdown in coronavirus cases.

Headlines: Hapag-Lloyd seeks savings to offset coronavirus losses: CEO
Description: German container line Hapag-Lloyd  is to implement cost cuts to take account of the coronavirus crisis, its chief executive Rolf Habben Jansen said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Disney takes $1.4 billion coronavirus hit, sets date to reopen Shanghai park
Description: Walt Disney Co  estimated on Tuesday that global measures to contain the coronavirus pandemic cut profits by $1.4 billion, mostly from its shuttered theme parks, but said it would reopen Shanghai Disneyland to a reduced number of visitors next week.

Headlines: Disney tests reopening strategy at Shanghai Disneyland
Description: Walt Disney Co.  will kick off its strategy next week to begin restoring its lucrative parks business that has suffered $1 billion in lost profits from the coronavirus-led shutdown.

Headlines: Allianz aims to maintain dividend amid coronavirus outbreak, CEO says
Description: The chief executive of German insurance giant Allianz  said on Wednesday that 2020 will not be another record earnings year but that the company aims to maintain its dividend as it deals with the wrath of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Samsung heir Lee apologises over succession, won't hand control to children
Description: Samsung Group heir Jay Y. Lee, embroiled in a bribery scandal, on Wednesday made a rare apology over controversial succession plans and said he will not hand over management rights to his children at the family-controlled conglomerate.

Headlines: BMW to delay Hungary plant in coronavirus savings drive
Description: BMW  will put investments on hold as it seeks to conserve cash to counter a fall in demand caused by the spread of the coronavirus pandemic, Chief Financial Officer Nicolas Peter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor sales down 57% amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: South Korea's Hyundai Motor  said on Wednesday its provisional April sales fell 57% on year to 159,079 vehicles globally, as the coronavirus pandemic and efforts to curb its spread sharply contracted auto demand and dealership traffic.

Headlines: Amber Capital: no plans to sell Lagardere stake and it may even raise it
Description: The founder of activist investment company Amber Capital, which lost out this week in a bid to shake up the governance at French group Lagardere , said on Wednesday he had no plans to exit his stake in Lagardere and added that he could even raise it.

Headlines: Metro Bank posts rising deposits, lower first quarter lending
Description: Britain's Metro Bank  reported a modest dip in lending in the first quarter and a 77 million pounds rise in total deposits to 14.6 billion pounds ($18.15 billion) as customers shrugged off lower fixed term deposit rates.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. airlines burn through $10 billion a month as traffic plummets
Description: U.S. airlines are collectively burning more than $10 billion in cash a month and averaging fewer than two dozen passengers per domestic flight because of the coronavirus pandemic, industry trade group Airlines for America said in prepared testimony seen by Reuters ahead of a U.S. Senate hearing on Wednesday.

Headlines: Impossible Foods to sell plant-based burgers in Kroger's 1,700 stores
Description: Plant-based meat maker Impossible Foods will start selling its flagship burgers in supermarket chain Kroger Co's  1,700 stores in the United States, as it taps growing demand for vegan alternatives among home chefs.

Headlines: Exclusive: Lord & Taylor to liquidate its stores as soon as they reopen - sources
Description: Venerable U.S. retailer Lord & Taylor plans to liquidate inventory in its 38 department stores once restrictions to curb the spread of coronavirus are lifted as it braces for a bankruptcy process from which it does not expect to emerge, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: California sues Uber, Lyft over misclassifying drivers as contractors
Description: California and three of its largest cities on Tuesday sued Uber Technologies Inc and Lyft Inc, accusing them of classifying their drivers improperly as independent contractors instead of employees, evading workplace protections and withholding worker benefits.

Headlines: 3M wins injunction against mask seller accused of price gouging
Description: 3M Co won an injunction from a federal judge against a New Jersey company it accused of illegally using its trademarks to sell 3M-branded N95 respirator masks at inflated prices to exploit the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: United Airlines to cut 30% of management in October, preparing pilot changes too: company memos
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc plans to cut at least 3,400 management and administrative positions in October as the coronavirus pandemic crushes air travel demand, and has told pilots to brace for changes as well, according to two memos seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Wall Street rises as lockdowns ease, healthcare shares jump
Description: Wall Street's main indexes gained on Tuesday as healthcare stocks rallied, oil prices surged and a number of countries and U.S. states eased coronavirus-induced restrictions in an attempt to revive their economies.

Headlines: Beyond Meat plans U.S. discounts, hopes to replace beef on summer grills
Description: Plant-based burger maker Beyond Meat plans to offer large value packs and discounts to some U.S. retailers this summer, hoping to grab a greater share of the market as prices for beef rise amid production disruptions caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: EA sees full-year revenue above estimates as home-sheltering boosts gaming
Description: Video game publisher Electronic Arts Inc forecast full-year adjusted revenue above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, riding on the broader surge in videogame sales as people shelter at home due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Mattel looks to Christmas for recovery as sales warning hits shares
Description: Mattel Inc  will have a new line of "Baby Yoda" toys ready to hit shelves in time for Christmas, the company said on Tuesday, even as it predicted a steep drop in second-quarter sales due to the coronavirus lockdowns.

Headlines: Spirit AeroSystems says Boeing wants 125 737 MAX shipsets for 2020, down from 216
Description: Spirit AeroSystems Holdings  said on Tuesday it has reached an agreement with Boeing Co  to deliver 125 737 MAX shipsets to the planemaker in 2020, down from the 216 it had previously announced.

Headlines: Occidental posts $2.2 billion loss on charges, deepens spending cuts
Description: Occidental Petroleum Corp on Tuesday swung to a first quarter loss on writedowns and charges, and the troubled U.S. oil producer cut its budget for the third time since March in response to a historic oil-price crash.

Headlines: Airbnb cuts 1,900 jobs as coronavirus hits home rentals
Description: Airbnb Inc is laying off 25% of its workforce, or nearly 1,900 employees, the home rental startup said on Tuesday, as the COVID-19 pandemic brings global travel to a near standstill.

Headlines: Fed policymakers see slow, uneven U.S. recovery after coronavirus downturn
Description: The U.S. economy could start to recover in the second half of the year after what is shaping up to be the worst recession in decades, but growth is likely to be slow and uneven, several top Federal Reserve policymakers indicated on Tuesday.

Headlines: Beyond Meat results beat, suspends 2020 forecast on COVID-19 concerns
Description: Beyond Meat Inc reported better-than-expected quarterly results on Tuesday as it sold more of its plant-based meat products and cut costs on packaging and labor, sending its shares up 3% after the bell.

Headlines: Match quarterly revenue hit by slowing Tinder growth
Description: Match Group Inc  reported quarterly revenue that fell short of Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, hit by slowing growth in its popular dating app "Tinder" as fewer people signed up and paid for its premium features amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Oil surge lifts global stocks out of three-day losing streak
Description: A gauge of global stock markets rose on Tuesday, snapping a three-day losing streak, while oil prices soared as investors shrugged off grim economic data on hopes the easing of coronavirus lockdowns will jump start economies and revive fuel demand.

Headlines: BMW cuts margin outlook for cars division, citing coronavirus woes
Description: BMW  on Tuesday lowered the outlook for the profitability of its automotive and motorcycles divisions, citing worse-than-expected demand which has been hit by  measures to contain the coronavirus.

Headlines: Lyft offers new cheaper rides with more waiting time
Description: Lyft Inc  said on Tuesday it would expand its program that provides cheaper rides to customers willing to wait longer for their pick-ups, at a time when curbs against the coronavirus outbreak have brought its affordable shared services to a halt.

Headlines: Delta caps aircraft seating capacity to ensure safety amid COVID-19
Description: Delta Air Lines  said on Tuesday it was putting a limit to seating capacity in its airplanes, as the U.S. carrier looks to provide a safe flying experience to customers amid the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Book a table for fast food? Burger King trials post-lockdown app in Italy
Description: Burger King is trialling an app for ordering food and booking a table at its outlets in Italy, as it seeks to persuade locals it is safe to eat out again after more than two months of coronavirus lockdown.

Headlines: Walgreens to restore standard operating hours at most U.S. stores
Description: Drugstore chain Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc  said it would resume standard operating hours at most of its stores across the United States, beginning Tuesday.

Headlines: France's Lagardere sees off activist Amber in shareholder showdown
Description: French publishing and media group Lagardere  on Tuesday fended off Amber Capital's most daring attempt yet to shake up governance at the company, after shareholders rejected the activist investor's call to replace the supervisory board.

Headlines: Fed's Evans says 'reasonable' to expect U.S. growth in second half of 2020
Description: Chicago Federal Reserve President Charles Evans said on Tuesday it's "reasonable" to expect the U.S. economy to return to growth in the second half of the year, but that such an outcome is only slightly more likely than other, more pessimistic views.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit widens, services sector contracts amid coronavirus
Description: The U.S. trade deficit increased by the most in more than a year in March as a record drop in exports offset a shrinking import bill, suggesting the novel coronavirus outbreak was upending the global flow of goods and services.

Headlines: Lufthansa to pay no dividend for 2019 as airline seeks bailout
Description: Lufthansa  shareholders on Tuesday agreed to not distribute 298 million euros ($323 million) in retained profits as a dividend for 2019, as the airline enters the final stretch of negotiations for a 10 billion euro bailout.

Headlines: Wendy's menu runs short as virus hits U.S. beef supplies
Description: Wendy's Co  said on Tuesday its restaurants may face a shortage of many menu items, including hamburgers, as beef processors in the United States struggle to keep their plants open amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. household debt reached $14.3 trillion, credit standards tightened in first quarter
Description: American households added $155 billion of debt in the first quarter and overall debt levels rose to a new record at $14.30 trillion, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York said on Tuesday in a report that provides a snapshot of where household balance sheets stood before the coronavirus pandemic brought much of the economy to a halt.

Headlines: Thomson Reuters cuts sales outlook, narrowly misses earnings estimates
Description: Thomson Reuters  cut its full-year sales outlook due to disruption to the global economy from the coronavirus crisis on Tuesday as it reported higher quarterly sales and earnings which fell slightly short of Wall Street estimates.

Headlines: White House adviser expects U.S. unemployment rate for April to be 'north of 16%'
Description: White House economic adviser Kevin Hassett on Tuesday said he expects the U.S. unemployment rate was above 16% in April, as the coronavirus pandemic began to devastate the country's economy.

Headlines: Global airlines body IATA backs face masks for safe flying
Description: The body representing global airlines came out in favour of passengers wearing masks onboard on Tuesday, as debate intensifies over how to get airlines flying while respecting social-distancing rules following the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: IATA says face masks should be worn on flights in future
Description: The body representing global airlines says that it is recommending the wearing of masks on flights to prevent the spread of coronavirus when flying restarts.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler plunges to loss, to reopen U.S. plants on May 18
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) plunged to a first-quarter loss of $1.8 billion and warned of a "significant" loss this quarter, even as it prepares to reopen its most profitable North American truck plants on May 18 as coronavirus lockdowns ease.

Headlines: Virgin Atlantic to cut 3,000 jobs, stop using Gatwick: Sky News
Description: Virgin Atlantic is to cut just over 3,000 jobs, or up to a third of its workforce, and stop using Gatwick Airport as part of its battle to survive, Sky News reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Judge questions VW's defence in landmark case over diesel damages
Description: A German federal court judge cast doubt on Volkswagen's  reasoning after the carmaker urged the court to dismiss a claim for damages brought by an owner of a diesel powered VW Sharan family van.

Headlines: Carbon emissions cuts do not mean Repsol will exit oil sector: CEO
Description: A target to reduce carbon emissions to net zero by 2050 does not mean Spanish oil and gas firm Repsol  will stop producing oil though it will focus on certain projects, Chief Executive Josu Jon Imaz said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Tesla stock rise appears to qualify CEO Musk for $700 million payday
Description: Tesla Chief Executive Elon Musk appeared to qualify on Monday for a $700 million payday, just three days after he said the electric car company's stock price was too high.

Headlines: Wizz Air plans for easing of restrictions with holiday flights from June
Description: Low cost airline Wizz Air  said it is planning for the easing of travel restrictions by starting new routes from Britain's London Luton airport to holiday destinations in Portugal from 16 June and to Greece from July.

Headlines: Uber, Lyft investors want to hear plans to get riders back in cars
Description: As U.S. lockdowns and fears of the coronavirus pandemic stretch into a third month, who wants to take an Uber ride?

Headlines: Beiersdorf sells more hand cream, less sunscreen
Description: Nivea-maker Beiersdorf  said on Tuesday its La Prairie premium skincare brand and sun care products have been hit by the drop in international travel due to the coronavirus pandemic while sales of hand wash, hand creams and plasters jumped.

Headlines: Microsoft to invest $1 billion in Polish cloud project
Description: Microsoft will invest $1 billion in Poland as part of a plan that will involve opening a data centre in the country to provide cloud services to businesses and government institutions, the company said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: Thai Airways rescue plan is its last chance, says PM
Description: The government is ready to back a rescue package for Thai Airways International Pcl , but it will entail a full restructuring and there will be no second chances, the prime minister.

Headlines: Hugo Boss expects 50% sales drop next quarter as crisis impact worsens
Description: Hugo Boss  is seeing signs of a sales rebound in China and online, but expects the impact of the coronavirus crisis to worsen before any recovery kicks in after first quarter sales fell by 17%, which knocked its shares.

Headlines: BNP warns of 2020 profit fall as crisis wipes out equity trading
Description: BNP Paribas set aside more than half a billion euros in loan provisions on Tuesday as the coronavirus crisis wiped out the French bank's revenue from equity derivatives trading and knocked a third off its first quarter profit.

Headlines: Italy's CNH Industrial aims for full production by end of May
Description: Vehicle and equipment maker CNH Industrial  said on Tuesday it planned to return progressively to full operations at most of its facilities around the world by the end of May, in line with the easing of coronavirus lockdowns.

Headlines: Liechtenstein's LGT Group to be split up in 2021
Description: Liechtenstein-based financial group LGT will be split into three separate firms in 2021, all directly held by the Prince of Liechtenstein Foundation, LGT said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Aer Lingus says reviewing social distancing procedures after packed flight
Description: Irish airline Aer Lingus said it was reviewing its social distancing procedures after a flight on Monday was packed with passengers.

Headlines: Airline SAS agrees credit facility backed by Sweden, Denmark
Description: Airline SAS said on Tuesday it had signed a 3.3 billion Swedish crown ($336 million) three-year revolving credit facility agreement, 90% guaranteed by Sweden and Denmark's governments, as it looked to beat a path through the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Air France says passengers must wear masks from May 11
Description: French carrier Air France is to require all passengers on board its flights to wear masks from May 11 to comply with French government guidelines on COVID-19 protection measures.

Headlines: Ryanair passengers down by 99.6% in April, Wizz Air down by 97.6%
Description: Europe's biggest budget airline Ryanair  posted a 99.6% fall in passenger numbers in April, while smaller low cost carrier Wizz Air  said numbers plunged 97.6%, as the novel coronavirus halted most flying across Europe.

Headlines: EssilorLuxottica sales slump on coronavirus hit, worst yet to come
Description: Oakley and Ray-Ban maker EssilorLuxottica  reported a slump in first-quarter sales on Tuesday and warned of an even bigger hit in the current quarter as the coronavirus outbreak prompted store closures.

Headlines: WeWork co-founder Neumann sues SoftBank over failed tender offer
Description: WeWork co-founder Adam Neumann filed a lawsuit against Japan's SoftBank Group Corp and its Vision Fund on Monday for terminating a $3 billion tender offer to the office-sharing startup's shareholders.

Headlines: Duterte says sorry to Philippine tycoons, their firms' shares surge
Description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has apologised for his "hurting words" about two tycoons whom he openly dislikes, responding to their help in fighting the coronavirus by offering an olive branch to settle a costly regulatory row.

Headlines: Qantas secures more funding to wait out coronavirus crisis; shares rise
Description: Qantas Airways Ltd  said on Tuesday it had secured enough funding to last it through the end of next year, boosting its shares, as it reviews its fleet with the expectation that most international travel could take years to rebound.

Headlines: U.S. SEC eases crowdfunding rules for firms due to coronavirus disruption
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on Monday said it would provide relief to smaller firms seeking to raise capital via online platforms to meet "urgent funding needs" due to the coronavirus-related disruption.

Headlines: Apple borrows on the cheap to fund buybacks, dividends
Description: Apple Inc  on Monday capitalized on the Federal Reserve's emergency measures in response to the coronavirus outbreak to issue its cheapest bonds in years, making it the latest blue-chip company to do so to fund stock buybacks and dividends.

Headlines: Trump administration pushing to rip global supply chains from China: officials
Description: The Trump administration is "turbocharging" an initiative to remove global industrial supply chains from China as it weighs new tariffs to punish Beijing for its handling of the coronavirus outbreak, according to officials familiar with U.S. planning.

Headlines: Intel buys Moovit transit app for $900 million to help develop robotaxis
Description: Chipmaker Intel Corp  has bought Israeli public transit app maker Moovit for about $900 million to help it develop self-driving "robotaxis" that could take to the streets in early 2022, the company said on Monday.

Headlines: Global shares fall on U.S.-Sino spat but Wall Street rebounds
Description: The dollar rose on risk aversion and global stock markets fell on Monday as U.S.-Chinese bickering over the origin of the coronavirus outbreak sparked fear of a new trade war, but Wall Street rebounded as the lifting of lockdowns in some U.S. states boosted optimism.

Headlines: J. Crew files for bankruptcy as preppy retailer succumbs to COVID-19 fallout
Description: J. Crew Group Inc filed for bankruptcy protection on Monday with a plan to hand over control to lenders, adding to a list of brick-and-mortar retailers pushed to the brink by widespread store closures in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Wall Street snaps two-day slump on lift from tech titans
Description: U.S. stocks ended higher on Monday as increases in large tech and internet companies and oil price gains outweighed concerns about the latest U.S.-China tensions and downbeat sentiment from the annual meeting of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway.

Headlines: U.S. coronavirus tariff exemptions sought for robots, drones, elevators
Description: Major U.S. firms and trade groups want the U.S. Trade Representative's Office to waive tariffs on a wide range of Chinese-made products as a result of the coronavirus pandemic, including drones, robots, personal computers and 3D printers.

Headlines: AIG quarterly profit nosedives as COVID-19 claims loom
Description: Insurer American International Group Inc  on Monday posted a 93% drop in quarterly adjusted profit, as it set aside money to cover claims related to the COVID-19 outbreak, which it called the single largest catastrophe loss the industry has ever seen.

Headlines: Air France-KLM union tensions surface in bailout's wake
Description: Air France-KLM's  French unions on Monday criticised calls by their Dutch counterparts for KLM to be given greater autonomy, amid signs that a multibillion-euro coronavirus bailout is increasing tensions within the airline group.

Headlines: Coronavirus will constrain U.S. meat supply despite Trump order: Tyson Foods
Description: The coronavirus crisis will continue to idle U.S. meat plants and slow production, Tyson Foods Inc said on Monday, signaling more disruptions to the U.S. food supply after U.S. President Donald Trump ordered facilities to stay open.

Headlines: Oil up 3% as countries ease lockdowns, production falls
Description: Oil was up 3% on Monday as more countries announced they would begin easing coronavirus lockdowns and as crude supply cuts by the world's top producing nations and companies take hold.

Headlines: France deals blow to Amazon as warehouses remain shut
Description: France has rejected a request from e-commerce giant Amazon  to tap a state-funded scheme to subsidise furloughed employees at its six closed warehouses in the country.

Headlines: Massive U.S. stock bounce stokes doubts, provokes bears
Description: Investors are treating the U.S. equity market’s blistering rally with a dose of caution, socking away cash, staying on the sidelines or buying insurance against a reversal even as markets scream higher in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. airline shares tumble as Buffett sell-off adds to worries
Description: Shares of the top four U.S. airlines dropped on Monday after billionaire investor Warren Buffett said Berkshire Hathaway  offloaded its entire stake in the carriers last month, adding to the sense of crisis around the industry.

Headlines: Amazon plans to extend closure of French warehouses until May 8
Description: Amazon  plans to extend the closure of its French warehouses until May 8 included, the e-commerce giant said on Monday.

Headlines: 'Like watching a train wreck': The coronavirus effect on North Dakota shale oilfields
Description: Oil executive Bill Kent was with fellow managers in the Colorado board room of Resource Energy headquarters on April 20 when benchmark U.S. crude prices collapsed to minus $37 a barrel. Sitting six feet apart because of the coronavirus, they knew the pandemic was not only a personal matter.

Headlines: Ferrari slowed by coronavirus, but not driven off course
Description: Luxury sports car maker Ferrari  still expects to make more than $1 billion in core profit this year, providing a relative beacon of stability in an auto industry ravaged by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: It's okay to laugh again: Advertisers prepare for post-coronavirus economy
Description: Sad piano chords, somber shots of empty streets and close-ups of people staring out their windows. So prevalent were coronavirus-themed ads that followed a similar template just a few weeks ago, they were parodied in a YouTube compilation video: "Every COVID-19 Commercial is Exactly the Same."

Headlines: VW's Skoda braces for second quarter hit after earnings drop
Description: Czech carmaker Skoda Auto, part of the Volkswagen Group , reported a 25% drop in first-quarter operating profit on Monday, but said the biggest hit from the coronavirus outbreak would come in the second quarter.

Headlines: Wells Fargo receives 'outstanding' rating for community lending
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  said on Monday it has received an "outstanding" rating on a U.S. regulatory test for community lending between 2012 and 2018.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nissan to retrench further in new plan to focus on U.S., Japan, China
Description: Nissan Motor Co Ltd  will pull back from Europe and elsewhere to focus on the United States, China and Japan under a plan that represents a new strategic direction for the embattled carmaker, people with direct knowledge of the plan told Reuters.

Headlines: Banks baffle investors as art meets science in accounting rule
Description: Like the myriad approaches governments are taking to tackle the coronavirus crisis, the way the world's top banks are calculating their potential losses also differs widely, with puzzling outcomes for investors.

Headlines: GE Aviation to cut workforce by up to 13,000 jobs, or 25%
Description: General Electric Co  said on Monday it was planning to cut the global workforce of its aviation unit this year by as much as 25%, or up to 13,000 jobs, including both voluntary and involuntary layoffs, citing prolonged aircraft reduction schedules caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Norwegian Air gets $1 billion rescue after financial cliffhanger
Description: Norwegian Air  shareholders backed its financial survival plan on Monday, with more than 95% of votes cast supporting the conversion of nearly $1 billion of debt into equity and raising more cash from its owners.

Headlines: Disney, hit hard by coronavirus, to face Wall Street questions on impact on company
Description: Walt Disney Co's  acquisitions spree that included swallowing much of Rupert Murdoch's 21st Century Fox last year, and a reputation for operational excellence, turned the company into the world's most powerful entertainment machine.

Headlines: Telefonica shares rise on O2-Virgin Media merger talks
Description: Shares in Spain's Telefonica SA  rose on Monday to post the only strong gains on an otherwise almost entirely red Madrid index, after the company confirmed it was in talks with billionaire John Malone's Liberty Global Plc  over a possible merger of their respective businesses in Britain.

Headlines: Factbox: Connecting Britons: Major telecom players in the UK
Description: Telefonica  is in talks with billionaire John Malone's Liberty Global  to explore a merger of its British mobile operator O2 with Liberty's Virgin Media cable network company, the Spanish company said on Monday.

Headlines: Discounts may help cure U.S. auto market's coronavirus hangover
Description: Texas auto dealer Hayden Elder says March was his worst month in 42 years selling cars thanks to the coronavirus, but April brought days that were "almost normal" and he expects bigger customer discounts to help him sell more Dodge Ram pickup trucks this month.

Headlines: Fasten seatbelts: Norwegian Air's battle for survival
Description: After growing rapidly to become Europe's third-largest low-cost airline and one of the few to apply the budget model to transatlantic flights, Norwegian Air  is fighting for its survival after racking up debts and liabilities of close to $8 billion by the end of 2019.

Headlines: Pandemic slams global factories, activity sinks to new lows
Description: Factory activity was ravaged across the world in April, business surveys showed, and the outlook looked bleak as government lockdowns to contain the new coronavirus pandemic froze global production and slashed demand.

Headlines: Uber closes Eats operations in eight smaller markets
Description: Uber  said on Monday it was closing down its Uber Eats operations in eight markets because they did not offer a clear route to becoming the number one or number two online food delivery operator, its stated aim for its Eats business.

Headlines: French carmaker PSA to re-start production gradually over this week
Description: Peugeot carmaker PSA , one of many car companies around the world to have been hit hard by the coronavirus, said on Monday that it would gradually restart production at sites over the course of this week.

Headlines: Carmakers Dacia and Ford resume production in Romania
Description: Romanian carmaker Dacia, owned by France's Renault  and Ford Motor Co's  Craiova plant resumed operations on Monday after output was halted due to the coronavirus pandemic in March, they said.

Headlines: HSBC to buy out life insurance joint venture partner in China
Description: HSBC Holdings PLC  said on Monday its insurance unit had agreed to acquire its China life insurance venture partner's 50% stake to own fully the company under the new rules on foreign ownership that came into effect in January.

Headlines: Mirae Asset scraps $5.8 billion deal to buy U.S. hotels from China's Anbang
Description: South Korea's Mirae Asset Global Investments said on Monday that it has terminated a $5.8 billion deal to buy 15 U.S. hotels from China's Anbang Insurance Group [ANBANG.UL], accusing the insurer of breaching contract obligations.

Headlines: Mastercard promotes Mark Barnett to European president role
Description: Mastercard  has promoted Mark Barnett to the role of president of its European business, responsible for the payment giant's strategy and operations across 53 countries.

Headlines: UK watchdog investigates EY audit of NMC Health
Description: Britain's accounting regulator said it has opened an investigation into EY's audit of NMC Health, the troubled hospital operator that was placed into administration in April.

Headlines: EU clears 7 billion euros in state aid for Air France
Description: The European Union's competition watchdog on Monday approved  French state aid worth 7 billion euros ($7.66 billion) for Air France , saying the support would provide cash to soften the economic shock of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Britain's Hotel Chocolat bolsters finances to get through coronavirus crisis
Description: British chocolatier Hotel Chocolat  has increased its banking facilities to help get it through the coronavirus crisis, it said on Monday.

Headlines: India's Reliance to sell $750 million stake in unit to Silver Lake, on track to cut debt
Description: India's Reliance Industries Ltd  said on Monday private equity firm Silver Lake will invest nearly $750 million in its digital arm, days after securing a $5.7 billion investment from Facebook Inc , boosting its efforts to cut debt.

Headlines: Citi names veteran Rizvi as APAC corporate banking head: memo
Description: Citigroup Inc  has named veteran banker Kaleem Rizvi as its Asia Pacific head of the corporate banking business, according to an internal memo reviewed by Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: GM Korea to cut output of key SUV as virus hits U.S. exports: document
Description: General Motors Co's  South Korean unit plans to sharply cut output this month at a factory producing its new Trailblazer sport-utility vehicle (SUV), as the coronavirus outbreak weighs on its U.S. exports and also disrupts parts supplies.

Headlines: U.S. airlines now requiring masks, promise more safety measures
Description: With the largest U.S. airlines now set to mandate - and provide - facial coverings for all passengers over the next two weeks, many are turning their focus to other measures to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus during air travel.

Headlines: U.S. airlines now requiring masks, promise more safety measures
Description: With the largest U.S. airlines now set to mandate - and provide - facial coverings for all passengers over the next two weeks, many are turning their focus to other measures to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus during air travel.

Headlines: White House adviser will not rule out more money for states, small businesses
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Sunday he would not rule out anything in a new relief bill to ease the "tremendous hardships" of the coronavirus outbreak, including more money for state and local governments and small businesses.

Headlines: U.S. aviation sector cuts more jobs amid travel meltdown
