Description: The administrators of troubled hospital operator NMC Health  said on Tuesday they had replaced the company's board and asked its main lender, Abu Dhabi Commercial Bank (ADCB), to lead a steering group to discuss cutting its debt pile.

Headlines: Spain denies requisitioning coronavirus tests bound for workers
Description: Spain's health minister denied on Tuesday that authorities had requisitioned 2,000 antibody tests which a workers union said Siemens Gamesa  had expected to receive to check whether its staff have been infected with the coronavirus.

Headlines: Fauci: May 1 target for reopening U.S. economy 'overly optimistic' - AP
Description: The top U.S. infectious disease expert, Anthony Fauci, said on Tuesday that a May 1 target date for reopening the economy was "a bit overly optimistic," citing a lack of critical testing and tracing procedures.

Headlines: U.S. funds that beat market plunge seek recession-proof stocks
Description: Beating the first quarter's market crash took some extreme strategies, such as moving nearly everything to cash, or going very short. Now, fund managers who prevailed during the worst start to a year for U.S. stocks are betting on recession-resilient companies to take them to the next leg.

Headlines: Honda extends Mexico plant suspensions to April 30 due to coronavirus
Description: The Mexican unit of Japanese automaker Honda Motor Co said on Tuesday it would extend a suspenion of operations at its plants in the states of Guanajuato and Jalisco until April 30 due to the impact of the novel coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Renault quits its main China venture after weak sales
Description: French automaker Renault SA  is ditching its main passenger car business in China following poor sales at the loss-making venture with Dongfeng Motor Group .

Headlines: Barclays delays incentive payments to CEO, CFO due to coronavirus
Description: Barclays  is delaying the release of portions of Chief Executive Jes Staley and Chief Financial Officer Tushar Morzaria's bonuses in light of the new coronavirus pandemic, it said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Norwegian Air shares plummet as survival hinges on creditors
Description: Norwegian Air  shares plummeted again on Tuesday, and are now trading down around 97% from their 2015 peak, with the airline's survival depending on creditors accepting a rescue plan proposed last week.

Headlines: U.S. awards airports $10 billion in grants amid travel falloff
Description: The U.S. Transportation Department on Tuesday awarded nearly $10 billion to U.S. airports struggling with a massive falloff in travel demand because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Saudi Aramco in talks with banks to borrow about $10 billion - sources
Description: Saudi Aramco, the world's largest oil producer, is in early talks with banks for a loan of about $10 billion to help finance its acquisition of a 70% stake in Saudi Basic Industries Corp (SABIC), according to three banking sources.

Headlines: J.C. Penney to hire advisors as it mulls debt management options: Bloomberg News
Description: J.C. Penney Co Inc  has approached consulting firm AlixPartners LLP as the U.S. retailer looks at options for managing its debt, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Qatar Airways signs $850 million financing deal with Standard Chartered
Description: Qatar Airways and Standard Chartered have signed an $850 million financing deal for seven Boeing 787-9 aircraft, a statement from the Qatari airline said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. import prices post biggest decline in over five years; more to come
Description: U.S. import prices dropped by the most in more than five years in March amid declines in the costs of petroleum products and a range of other goods, pointing to import deflation that could deepen amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: G7 backs debt moratorium for poor countries if G20 creditors, Paris Club join
Description: Group of Seven (G7) finance officials on Tuesday vowed to continue to act as needed to combat the coronavirus pandemic and stabilize the global economy, and threw their support behind a push to provide temporary debt relief to the poorest countries.

Headlines: BOJ's Kuroda told G7 ready to ease policy to combat coronavirus fallout
Description: Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda said on Tuesday he explained to his G7 counterparts that the central bank would not hesitate easing monetary policy further depending on how the coronavirus pandemic affects the country's economy.

Headlines: G7 agreed on need to aid emerging economies battling with virus: Japan's Aso
Description: G7 finance leaders agreed on Tuesday on the need to provide financial and technical assistance to emerging economies battling with the fallout from the coronavirus pandemic, Japanese Finance Minister Taro Aso said.

Headlines: Hyundai first to restart Czech production, others still shut
Description: Hyundai Motor Co's  Czech car plant was the first in the central European country to get back to work on Tuesday after a three-week outage, potentially easing some of the strain on the hard-hit economy.

Headlines: Bombardier to resume some operations in UK
Description: Bombardier Inc  said on Tuesday it plans to resume production at some of its facilities in the United Kingdom, which had been halted in March due to government-mandated social distancing to battle the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Spain says IMF outlook confirms view of strong, short-lived crisis
Description: The Spanish government said on Tuesday the International Monetary Fund's forecast of an 8% economic slump this year due to the coronavirus pandemic, to be followed by a recovery in 2021, confirmed the view that the crisis would be intense, but short-lived.

Headlines: Debt levels expected to sharply increase in 2020, stabilize as economies recover: IMF
Description: Global debt is expected to increase significantly over the next year, the top economist of the International Monetary Fund said on Tuesday, while moratoriums on debt payments and debt restructuring may need to be continued as the world economy emerges from the coronavirus pandemic lockdown.

Headlines: Hyundai to provide COVID 19 tests, 'drive through' testing support in U.S.
Description: Hyundai Motor Co's North American unit will expand its support for "drive through" testing for the coronavirus and donate 65,000 tests to hospitals in the United States, the South Korean automaker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Cisco offers big payment deferrals until 2021 as companies seek remote-work tools
Description: Cisco Systems Inc  on Tuesday launched a $2.5 billion financing program that lets its customers defer 95% of payments until 2021, giving companies additional leeway at time when some are facing a cash crunch but also need more remote-work tools.

Headlines: Alphabet soup: How will post-virus economic recovery shape up?
Description: (This story had been refiled to add missing words in paragraph 16 of story first published April 9.)

Headlines: Dash for cash as most investors expect drawn-out recovery: BofA survey
Description: Investors have been hoarding cash at a rate not seen since the immediate aftermath of the 9/11 attacks of 2001, BofA's April fund manager survey showed, as the coronavirus roiled global financial markets.

Headlines: Britain's Next re-opens online before maxing out daily limit
Description: British clothing retailer Next  hit a self-imposed daily limit within hours of re-opening its online business on Tuesday, indicating consumer demand during the coronavirus lockdown.

Headlines: Barclays halts new job cuts during coronavirus crisis: memo
Description: Barclays  has halted new job cuts while the coronavirus crisis is ongoing, the bank said in an internal memo seen by Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Ten U.S. states developing 'reopening' plans account for 38% of U.S. economy
Description: The ten U.S. states coordinating plans separately from the White House to reopen businesses shut by the coronavirus are responsible for an outsized proportion of the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Pandemic survival plans: U.S. businesses scramble to conserve cash, boost liquidity
Description: Charlie Straface, president of Norwegian aluminum maker Norsk Hydro's North American extrusion operations, convenes a coronavirus task force every other day to draw up cost-cutting measures to offset declining revenues and protect the unit's cash balance during the economic slump related to the outbreak.

Headlines: SoftBank record loss estimate renews asset sale focus
Description: SoftBank Group Corp's  estimate it will post a record $13 billion full-year loss, dragged down by its spluttering $100 billion Vision Fund, has renewed attention on a planned asset sell-down aimed at raising cash and restoring confidence.

Headlines: Wizz Air not considering plane deferrals, sees growth returning in 2022: CEO
Description: European low cost airline Wizz Air  is not looking to defer any of the Airbus  narrowbody planes it has on order even though it does not expect the market to grow again until 2022, its chief executive said.

Headlines: Turkish Airlines extends flight cancellations until May 20
Description: Turkish Airlines  has extended the cancellation of international flights to May 20 from May 1 over the coronavirus outbreak, the airline said on Tuesday, adding that domestic flights would remain suspended until April 20.

Headlines: Tobacco giant BAT slides on report of U.S. criminal investigation
Description: British American Tobacco (BAT)  is the subject of a U.S. criminal investigation over suspected sanctions-busting, The Times reported https://bit.ly/2ydR5Wm on Tuesday, sending the company's shares down more than 5%.

Headlines: Toyota plans limited operations in France, Poland from April 22
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  on Monday said it plans to restart limited production at vehicle plants in France and Poland from April 22 after closing them due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Next's reopened website closed to new orders by 0730 GMT
Description: British clothing retailer Next  has closed its re-opened website to orders until Wednesday after reaching a self-imposed daily order limit.

Headlines: Pandemic shows investment fund vulnerabilities, G20 watchdog says
Description: Non-bank financial firms such as investment funds have exhibited  vulnerabilities during the coronavirus crisis that may need fixing to help economies recover, a global regulatory watchdog said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Brewer AB InBev halves final dividend and pushes back AGM
Description: Anheuser-Busch InBev , the world's largest brewer, proposes to halve its final dividend and has postponed its annual shareholder meeting owing to uncertainty around the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Car parts group Valeo drops 2020 targets, gets 1 billion euros of new credit lines
Description: French car parts group Valeo  abandoned its 2020 financial targets on Tuesday because of the hit to its business from the coronavirus outbreak, although it got 1 billion euros  ($1.1 billion) in extra credit lines to shore up its finances.

Headlines: Julius Baer to postpone AGM, propose split dividend
Description: Swiss wealth manager Julius Baer  will propose splitting its 2019 dividend payment into two halves following a regulatory request, it said on Tuesday, postponing by a month its annual general meeting in order to meet notification requirements.

Headlines: Apple shipped 2.5 million iPhones in China in March following virus slump: government data
Description: Apple Inc  shipped roughly 2.5 million iPhones in China in March, a slight rebound after one of its worst months in the country ever, according to government data published on Friday.

Headlines: Trump says plan to re-open shuttered U.S. economy to be completed soon
Description: President Donald Trump said on Monday that his administration was close to completing a plan to re-open the U.S. economy, which has been largely shut down to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Exxon raises $9.5 billion to load up on cash while debt market still open to new deals
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp on Monday raised $9.5 billion in new debt, with the largest U.S. oil producer seeking to bolster its finances while debt markets remain open to new deals.

Headlines: Disney enters $5 billion credit agreement
Description: Walt Disney Co said on Monday it has entered an unsecured credit agreement for $5 billion, at a time when companies across industries are scrambling to bolster their liquidity to weather the fallout from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: U.S. airlines nearing acceptance of payroll aid plan: sources
Description: Some large U.S. passenger airlines are close to accepting the terms of a $25 billion offer for government coronavirus payroll aid, with announcements possible as early as Tuesday, people briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: Grubhub, DoorDash, Postmates, Uber Eats are sued over restaurant prices amid pandemic
Description: GrubHub, DoorDash, Postmates and Uber Eats were sued on Monday for allegedly exploiting their dominance in restaurant meal deliveries to impose fees that consumers ultimately bear through higher menu prices, including during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Record oil output cuts fail to make waves in coronavirus-hit market
Description: The minimal impact on oil prices from a global deal for record output cuts showed that oil producers have a mountain to climb if they are to restore market balance as the coronavirus shreds demand and sends stockpiles soaring, industry watchers said.

Headlines: Factbox: Non OPEC+ crude oil supply cuts
Description: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and its allies, known as OPEC+, agreed on Sunday to reduce output by 9.7 million barrels per day (bpd) for May and June in an effort to prop up oil prices as the coronavirus outbreak slashes fuel demand.

Headlines: Smithfield shutting U.S. pork plant indefinitely, warns of meat shortages during pandemic
Description: Smithfield Foods, the world's biggest pork processor, said on Sunday it will shut a U.S. plant indefinitely due to a rash of coronavirus cases among employees and warned the country was  moving "perilously close to the edge" in supplies for grocers.

Headlines: Factbox: Spread of coronavirus closes North American meat plants
Description: Major meat companies in the United States and Canada have closed plants temporarily due to cases of the new coronavirus among employees and concerns about its spread.

Headlines: Trump says plan to re-open shuttered U.S. economy to be completed soon
Description: President Donald Trump said on Monday that his administration was close to completing a plan to re-open the U.S. economy, which has been largely shut down to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Dow, S&P 500 slide as focus shifts to earnings; Nasdaq gains
Description: The Dow and S&P 500 fell on Monday as U.S. companies prepared to kick off a quarterly earnings season expected to be rough due to the coronavirus pandemic, while Amazon.com  gains helped the Nasdaq end higher.

Headlines: Telco shares are surprise losers as lockdown drives internet boom
Description: As lockdowns worldwide drive a surge in internet use, boosting online sales for businesses as varied as gaming and food delivery, the stocks of internet providers are an unlikely laggard on global markets.

Headlines: The list of U.S. Treasury questions for airlines seeking bailout cash
Description: U.S. Treasury officials have asked airlines seeking money from a $25 billion fund for payroll support to provide detailed information on their capital structure, liquidity and collateral, people briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: News Corp sees hit to ad revenue from coronavirus pandemic
Description: Rupert Murdoch's News Corp  said on Monday its newspaper advertising revenue would take a hit from widespread business closures caused by the coronavirus outbreak, although paid digital subscriptions for the Wall Street Journal are rising.

Headlines: 'Elbow to elbow:' North America meat plant workers fall ill, walk off jobs
Description: At a Wayne Farms chicken processing plant in Alabama, workers recently had to pay the company 10 cents a day to buy masks to protect themselves from the new coronavirus, according to a meat inspector.

Headlines: Reasons for hope: the drugs, tests and tactics that may conquer coronavirus
Description: With much of the world living in lockdown, the spread of the new coronavirus, SARS-CoV-2, that was first detected in China late last year is beginning to slow in some places. As of April 12, 1.8 million had been infected and 115,000 killed  by COVID-19, the disease caused by the virus.

Headlines: Crude mixed on output deal, recession fears; shares slip
Description: Stocks on Wall Street mostly slid on Monday over concerns of what the coronavirus pandemic will do to corporate earnings, while crude prices were mixed as a global deal on record output cuts failed to quell doubts the pact would head off an oil glut.

Headlines: Amazon stops accepting new online grocery customers amid surging demand
Description: Amazon will begin to put new grocery delivery customers on a wait list and curtail shopping hours at some Whole Foods stores to prioritize orders from existing customers buying food online during the coronavirus outbreak, the company said on Sunday.

Headlines: Trump: It's my decision when to reopen U.S. economy
Description: President Donald Trump said on Monday it was his decision when to reopen the U.S. economy, not that of state governors, but legal experts disagree and governors are going their own way.

Headlines: Oil mixed as demand worries offset gains from output cut deal
Description: Oil prices were mixed on Monday, as the historic production-cut deal inked by major global oil producers was not enough to assuage existing worries about the demand destruction brought on by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. Treasury wants details on airline debt, liquidity, loyalty programs - sources
Description: U.S. Treasury officials have asked airlines seeking government payroll support to provide additional detailed information on capital structure, liquidity and loyalty programs, people briefed on the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Exclusive: Treasury wants warrants, repayment from major U.S. airlines on 30% of grant money - sources
Description: (This April 10 story has been refiled to fix typo in 'aid' in paragraph nineteen.)

Headlines: U.S. airlines ease loyalty programs in coronavirus travel slump
Description: U.S. airlines are extending loyalty program benefits and status into 2021 for members homebound because of the new coronavirus.

Headlines: Single passenger flights: The daily woes of airlines, and the crew still working
Description: When Reuters photographer Carlos Barria boarded American Airlines flight 4511 from Washington Reagan National Airport to New Orleans on Friday for an assignment, he was the only passenger on the 76-seat jet.

Headlines: U.S. GDP will contract 30% in second quarter, 5% in 2020: PIMCO
Description: (This April 8 story corrects to clarify that 30% contraction is the annualized rate)

Headlines: After pandemic, Fed policymakers see slow U.S. recovery
Description: The U.S. economy is set for a deep slide in coming months with the coronavirus forcing businesses to shut and putting millions out of work, but Federal Reserve policymakers are also warning of a slugging recovery once the pandemic subsides.

Headlines: Fashion giant Inditex working at reduced capacity despite loosened Spanish lockdown
Description: Employees at global fashion giant Inditex's 10 logistics centres in Spain - from where it sends garments to its stores worldwide - returned to work on Monday but only to less than half their normal levels of activity, workers said.

Headlines: Athene pays $45 million fine in first settlement of New York pension transfer probe
Description: Athene Holding Ltd agreed on Monday to pay a $45 million civil fine to settle charges it conducted insurance business in New York without a license, the first settlement in a probe into an industry where life insurers take over corporate pension plans.

Headlines: McDonald's faces class action over 'pervasive sexual harassment'
Description: McDonald's Corp has been hit with a class action lawsuit accusing it of subjecting female employees in its corporate-owned fast-food restaurants in Florida to widespread sexual harassment.

Headlines: Ford making masks to protect workers against COVID-19
Description: Ford Motor Co said on Monday it is producing face masks at a Michigan plant to protect its workers from the coronavirus pandemic and is seeking to have those masks certified for medical use.

Headlines: Russia hails oil deal it says will save millions of U.S.jobs
Description: The global oil production deal clinched at the weekend will help  establish a price floor and save millions of jobs in the United States, senior Russian officials said on Monday.

Headlines: GE offers to buy back at least $9 billion in debt, plans new longer-maturities issue
Description: General Electric Co  offered on Monday to buy back at least $9 billion in debt as part of a plan to cut its financial risk and manage liquidity in response to the downturn in business caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Explainer: Big cuts in oil production from OPEC and others
Description: Worldwide oil producers, led by OPEC, are expected to cut production by roughly 20 million barrels per day (bpd), roughly equal to 20% of global daily supply, through a combination of mandated cuts, production falls due to poor economics, and purchases into oil reserves.

Headlines: Dish Network cuts jobs, re-evaluates business in coronavirus fallout
Description: Dish Network Corp  has cut staff and is re-evaluating  its business to cope better with the fallout from the coronavirus pandemic, the U.S. satellite TV provider told Reuters, without disclosing the number of employees laid off.

Headlines: Volkswagen offers cars for relief efforts in U.S. virus-hit regions
Description: Germany's Volkswagen AG  said on Monday its U.S. dealers would provide cars for free delivery of essential supplies to people in need during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Aurora Cannabis falls on capital raise, reverse stock split
Description: Aurora Cannabis Inc's   U.S.-listed shares fell nearly 14% in morning trade on Monday after the Canadian pot producer renewed an at-the-market offering under which it can raise as much as $350 million in equity capital.

Headlines: Ford expects coronavirus shutdown to cause $600 million quarterly loss
Description: Ford Motor Co  said on Monday it expects to post a pre-tax loss of about $600 million for the first quarter as the coronavirus outbreak pummeled its sales and shuttered vehicle assembly plants, resulting in a 21% drop in vehicle sales to dealers versus the same quarter in 2019.

Headlines: Performance Food furloughs 3,000 employees as coronavirus takes toll
Description: Grocery distributor Performance Food Group Co  said on Monday it had furloughed about 3,000 employees and cut pay, while funneling 1,100 workers to help keep its retail clients' shelves stacked as it deals with the pressures exerted on supply chains and its business by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: OPEC, Russia approve biggest-ever oil cut to support prices amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: OPEC and allies led by Russia agreed on Sunday to a record cut in output to prop up oil prices amid the coronavirus pandemic in  an unprecedented deal with fellow oil nations, including the United States, that could curb global oil supply by 20%.

Headlines: Trump says global oil production cut should help industry recover
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday the OPEC+ group of oil producers is looking to cut output by 20 million barrels per day (bpd), a figure that appeared to include a wider group of producers, including the United States.

Headlines: Saudi energy minister says effective global oil cuts above 19 million bpd
Description: Saudi Arabia's energy minister said on Monday that effective global oil supply cuts would amount to around 19.5 million barrels per day, taking into account the reduction pact agreed by OPEC+, pledges by other G20 nations and oil purchases into reserves.

Headlines: AutoNation CEO Cheryl Miller on leave for health reasons
Description: AutoNation Inc , the largest U.S. auto dealership chain, said on Monday Chief Executive Officer Cheryl Miller has been granted a leave of absence for health reasons.

Headlines: Toyota joins GM in suspending auto production in Brazil until June
Description: Toyota Motor Co  on Monday said it was suspending auto production in its Brazil plants until at least June 22, joining General Motors Co  which also expects to resume production in the same month.

Headlines: Fading Vision Fund to tip SoftBank into first loss in 15 years
Description: SoftBank expects its $100 billion Vision Fund to book a loss of 1.8 trillion yen due to the worsening performance of its tech bets, which will tip the group as a whole into its first loss for 15 years.

Headlines: GM plans to extend shutdown of Brazil auto production by 60 days
Description: (This April 9 story corrects start date of production shutdown to March 23, with furloughs starting on March 30.)

Headlines: Norway will announce oil output decision soon: minister
Description: Norway, Western Europe's largest oil producer, will announce its decision on whether to slash crude output soon, potentially adding its weight to a global push to shore up prices, the energy minister said on Monday.

Headlines: Russia fund says will continue to invest in Saudi Arabia: Al-Arabiya
Description: Russia's sovereign wealth fund will continue to invest in Saudi Arabia's Vision 2030 development programme, the Saudi-owned Al-Arabiya channel on Monday cited the head of the fund as saying.

Headlines: Trading gains for big U.S. banks may not last past first quarter
Description: Big U.S. banks made a pretty penny in trading during the first quarter as the coronavirus pandemic caused wild market swings, analysts said, but those gains will likely be overshadowed by declines in other businesses and a bleak outlook for the rest of the year.

Headlines: Global footwear group's Vietnam operations suspended for two days
Description: Pou Chen Corp , the world's largest manufacturer of branded athletic and casual footwear for the likes of Nike  and Adidas , has been ordered to suspend production at its Pouyuen Vietnam business over COVID-19 concerns, Vietnamese state media reported on Monday.

Headlines: Emirates to operate limited passenger services to U.S., Asia, North Africa
Description: Dubai's Emirates said on Monday it planned to operate limited passenger services to Algiers, Tunis, Jakarta, Manila, Taipei, Kabul and Chicago.

Headlines: Russia's oil output down to 11.24 million bpd on April 1-12: source
Description: Russia's average oil production was down to 11.24 million barrels per day (bpd) on April 1-12, an oil industry source told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs still sees crude prices falling after OPEC+ deal
Description: Goldman Sachs said on Sunday that oil prices would continue to fall in the coming weeks, reasoning that a "historic yet insufficient" deal by major oil producers to cut output is unlikely to offset a coronavirus-led demand rout.

Headlines: Japan petroleum industry head says OPEC+ deal falls short of expectations
Description: The agreement by the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) and its allies to cut output failed to reach the reduction levels expected by the market, leading to oil prices remaining stagnant, the head of the Japanese petroleum industry said.

Headlines: Kia Motors considers halting three South Korean plants as virus hits exports
Description: Kia Motors Corp  told its labour union in South Korea that it wants to suspend operations at three of its domestic factories as the coronavirus outbreak weighs on exports to Europe and the United States, a union official said on Monday.

Headlines: Oil agreement could support stocks, providing a floor
Description: An agreement by oil-producing nations on Sunday to cut output by a record amount may sustain a recent bounce in stocks, although stay-at-home restrictions and closures tied to the coronavirus pandemic still weigh on the global economy.

Headlines: Iraqi oil minister says big oil cut deal will help to stabilize oil market
Description: Iraq's oil minister said late on Sunday that the big oil cut deal reached at an OPEC+ meeting would help stabilize the market.

Headlines: Virgin Galactic to run as a critical infrastructure business during pandemic
Description: Billionaire Richard Branson's space tourism company Virgin Galactic Holdings Inc  will keep running as a critical infrastructure business, even as many U.S. states in which it operates have mandated business closures during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Canada welcomes oil cut deal, says it is committed to achieving price certainty
Description: Canada on Sunday formally welcomed a deal by OPEC and allies to cut oil output by a record amount, saying Ottawa was committed to achieving price certainty and economic stability.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia, Russia, U.S. welcome outcome of OPEC+ meeting: SPA
Description: Saudi Arabia's king Salman, Russia's president Vladimir Putin and his U.S. counterpart Donald Trump welcomed the outcome of OPEC+ meeting during a joint phone call, Saudi state news agency SPA said on late Sunday.

Headlines: Saudi energy minister says OPEC+ effective oil cuts are 12.5 million bpd
Description: The Saudi energy minister said on Sunday that effective oil supply cuts by OPEC and its allies, a group known as OPEC+, will amount to 12.5 million barrels per day, because of higher output in April from Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Kuwait.

Headlines: Trump says 'great' OPEC+ deal will save U.S. jobs
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Sunday praised a deal among the world's top oil producers to cut global petroleum output, saying it would save jobs in the U.S. energy industry.

Headlines: Mexico to cut oil output by 100,000 bpd from May: officials
Description: Mexico will reduce its oil output by 100,000 barrels per day (bpd) from May after top oil producers collectively agreed to cut production by 9.7 million barrels per day at OPEC+ talks, Mexican officials said on Sunday.

Headlines: Kuwait says its effective oil cut is above 1 million bpd: oil minister
Description: Kuwait's oil minister said on Sunday that his country would be cutting more than 1 million barrels per day in actual oil supply, taking into consideration its current April production of around 3.25 million bpd.

Headlines: EU's Vestager says EU nations should buy stakes to block Chinese takeovers: FT
Description: The European Union's competition chief told the Financial Times that member countries should buy stakes in companies to counter the threat of Chinese takeovers, with her comments coming as the EU formulates plans to protect its businesses amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: UAE committed to reducing oil production from its current 4.1 million bpd:  Energy minister
Description: The United Arab Emirates is committed to reducing oil production from its current level of 4.1 million barrels per day (MBOPD), energy minister Suhail Al Mazrouei said in a tweet on Sunday.

Headlines: Kremlin says leaders of Russia, U.S., Saudi Arabia support OPEC+ oil deal
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin, U.S. President Donald Trump and Saudi Arabia's King Salman all supported the OPEC+ deal to cut global crude output, the Kremlin said on Sunday.

Headlines: OPEC+ agrees largest ever oil output cut of 9.7 million bpd: sources
Description: OPEC, Russia and other oil producing nations agreed on Sunday to cut output by a record amount, representing around 10% of global supply, to support oil prices amid the coronavirus pandemic, sources said.

Headlines: Kazakhstan confirms global deal to cut oil output by 9.7 million bpd
Description: Kazakhastan's Energy Ministry said on Sunday it confirmed reports that the OPEC+ group of countries had agreed to cut the global oil output by 9.7 million barrels per day for two months starting on May 1.

Headlines: OPEC, allies to confer on Sunday to try to end standoff over cuts plan: sources
Description: OPEC and its allies will hold a virtual meeting on Sunday evening in a bid to end a standoff that has prevented the finalisation of a global oil supply cut pact, six OPEC+ sources said.

Headlines: U.S. senators press Saudi officials to put oil cut in motion
Description: (This April 11 story has been refiled to replace "boost" with "cut" in paragraph six.)

Headlines: Seen everywhere in last U.S. crisis, moral hazard is nowhere in this one
Description: As the U.S. Federal Reserve rolls out trillions of dollars to blunt the economic fallout of the coronavirus pandemic, there's a notable difference to the last financial crisis: close to zero concern over "moral hazard" - the sticky business of bailing out those whose dilemma is of their own making.

Headlines: Exclusive: Macy's taps Lazard to bolster finances as coronavirus saps sales - sources
Description: Macy's Inc  has hired investment bank Lazard Ltd  to explore options for bolstering its finances after the department store operator lost most of its revenue as it shut down all its stores as a result of the coronavirus outbreak, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Malaysia's AirAsia founders not taking salary; staff accepts up to 75% pay cut
Description: The founders of Malaysia's AirAsia Group Bhd  will not take salaries and its staff has agreed to an as much as 75% cut in pay due to the impact of the novel coronavirus outbreak on the airline, its chief executive said late on Saturday.

Headlines: Airlines want U.S. Treasury to scrap proposal to make some grant money repayable
Description: Major U.S. airlines were urging Treasury officials and the federal government's outside advisers on Saturday to scrap or revise a proposal that would make part of the $25 billion earmarked by Congress to help keep workers on the payroll repayable in the form of low-cost loans.

Headlines: Mexican president's nationalist oil vision fuels standoff with Saudis
Description: The biggest supply cut ever contemplated by the world's top oil producers is hanging in the balance as a refusal by Mexico's leftist leader to imperil his plans to rebuild state oil company Pemex has angered the Saudi prince who helped craft the deal.

Headlines: Exclusive: JPMorgan Chase to raise mortgage borrowing standards as economic outlook darkens
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co , the country's largest lender by assets, is raising borrowing standards this week for most new home loans as the bank moves to mitigate lending risk stemming from the novel coronavirus disruption.

Headlines: U.S. senators hold call with Saudi officials urging them to put oil cut in motion
Description: Republican U.S. senators from oil states who recently introduced  legislation to remove American troops from Saudi Arabia said on Saturday they had spoken with three officials from the kingdom and urged them to take concrete action to cut crude output.

Headlines: Warehouse workers risk COVID-19 to ship Gucci shades, face cream, sofas
Description: As U.S. authorities ordered shutdowns of non-essential businesses to fight coronavirus, retailer Nordstrom Inc closed hundreds of stores and gave in-store workers three weeks’ pay, calling their safety its top priority.

Headlines: Air France in talks with French govt over emergency funding: Les Echos
Description: Air France KLM  has requested several billion euros of emergency funds from the French state while it negotiates a loan package from banks, which would be guaranteed by France and the Netherlands, French business daily Les Echos reported.

Headlines: Staff mailboxes at Italy's Monte dei Paschi suffer hacker attack: document
Description: Hackers have accessed the mailboxes of some employees at Italian state-owned bank Monte dei Paschi ‹BMPS.MI› and sent emails to clients, according to a notice to customers seen by Reuters.

Headlines: EU puts anti-dumping duties on stainless steel from China, Indonesia and Taiwan
Description: The European Commission has imposed provisional anti-dumping duties on some stainless steel products from China, Indonesia and Taiwan, according to the official EU journal, nearly eight months after launching a probe into low-price imports.

Headlines: Siemens CEO rules out job cuts from coronavirus impact
Description: Siemens will not cut its workforce because of the economic downturn triggered by the new coronavirus, Chief Executive Joe Kaeser said, although short-time working measures could be extended in Germany.

Headlines: Apple, Google plan software to slow virus, joining global debate on tracking
Description: Apple Inc  and Alphabet Inc's  Google said on Friday that they will work together to create contact tracing technology that aims to slow the spread of the coronavirus by allowing users to opt into logging other phones they have been near.

Headlines: Boeing supplier furloughs 2,300 employees on closure of Boeing facilities amid COVID-19
Description: U.S. aero parts maker Triumph Group Inc  said it was furloughing about 2,300 employees across its U.S. and European plants for two to four weeks to cut capacity linked to Boeing  commercial aircraft programs amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Honeywell renews $1.5 billion revolving credit agreement
Description: Honeywell International Inc  said on Friday it had renewed a revolving credit agreement for $1.5 billion, to be used for general corporate purposes when needed.

Headlines: Boeing hires Lazard, Evercore to assess government aid or private loans: source
Description: Boeing Co has hired investment banks Lazard and Evercore Inc to assess potential U.S. government assistance or private sector loans, a person briefed on the matter confirmed on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. approves $168 billion of small business loans under coronavirus plan: Kudlow
Description: The United States has approved 661,000 loans to small businesses totaling $168 billion under a program to address the fallout from the novel coronavirus epidemic, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Friday.

Headlines: Saudi-Mexican clash halts record oil cut deal despite Trump pressure
Description: Top oil nations struggled to finalise record output cuts at G20 talks on Friday to boost prices slammed by the coronavirus crisis, as Saudi Arabia clashed with Mexico despite U.S. President Donald Trump's mediation offer.

Headlines: Saudi crown prince, Russia's Putin discuss efforts to stabilize oil markets: SPA
Description: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince and Russian President Vladimir Putin  reviewed in a telephone conversation on Friday the efforts to achieve stability of energy markets to support the growth of the global economy, Saudi state news agency (SPA) reported.

Headlines: Saudi, others resist Mexican plan to make small oil output cuts - sources
Description: Saudi Arabia and other oil producers in the OPEC+ group pushed back on Friday on a Mexican plan to cut less than requested under plans for global supply curbs, two sources from the OPEC+ group said on Friday.

Headlines: Trump agrees to help Mexico meet global oil cut target
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he would help Mexico contribute to global oil output reductions, in a surprise move that could break an impasse among the world's major oil producers over cutbacks aimed at stabilizing crude prices.

Headlines: U.S. six-month deficit rises to $744 billion ahead of virus budget storm in April
Description: The United States racked up a $744 billion budget deficit in the first half of fiscal 2020, up 8% from a year earlier, the Treasury said on Friday, ahead of an expected April spending explosion and withering of revenues amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Fed policymakers working to limit damage as pandemic puts U.S. economy on pause
Description: The U.S. economy was on a strong footing before the coronavirus pandemic and Federal Reserve officials are working to help the economy rebound quickly once businesses that were shuttered because of the virus begin to reopen, two policymakers said Friday.

Headlines: How COVID-19 affected U.S. consumer prices in March
Description: Coast-to-coast shutdowns of businesses and stay-at-home orders from the effort to contain the new coronavirus pandemic took their toll on U.S. consumer prices in March, sending them down by the most in five years.

Headlines: Russia's Putin, Saudi crown prince discuss OPEC+: Kremlin
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman discussed a planned OPEC+ reduction of oil output, the Kremlin said.

Headlines: Economists see uneven jobs recovery, high U.S. unemployment through 2021
Description: The trillions of dollars in cash and loans unleashed by the Federal Reserve and U.S. political leaders in recent weeks is meant to build a financial bridge for the country to get beyond the coronavirus pandemic and restart the economy with little or no long-term damage.

Headlines: Millions filed for U.S. unemployment - many are still waiting for the cash
Description: A shocking 16.8 million people filed for U.S. unemployment benefits in the last three weeks as the country shut down to stop the spread of the novel coronavirus, overwhelming state labor departments and creating a large backlog of pending applications.

Headlines: U.S. agencies back revoking ability of China Telecom to operate in U.S.
Description: The U.S. Justice Department and other federal agencies on Thursday called on the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to revoke China Telecom (Americas) Corp's  authorization to provide international telecommunications services to and from the United States.

Headlines: Johnson & Johnson abandons deal for Takeda's TachoSil surgical patch
Description: Johnson & Johnson  said on Friday it abandoned plans to buy Takeda Pharmaceutical’s surgical patch product TachoSil, citing regulatory issues.

Headlines: Apple, Google to create contact tracing technology to fight coronavirus spread
Description: Apple Inc  and Alphabet Inc's  Google said on Friday that they will work together to create contact tracing technology that aims to slow the spread of the coronavirus by allowing users to opt into a system that catalogs other phones they have been near.

Headlines: U.S. consumer prices post largest drop in five years amid coronavirus disruptions
Description: U.S. consumer prices fell by the most in more than five years in March and further decreases are likely as the novel coronavirus outbreak suppresses demand for some goods and services, offsetting price increases related to shortages resulting from disruptions to the supply chain.

Headlines: 3M sues distributor for alleged price gouging of N95 respirators in New York
Description: 3M Co  said it filed a lawsuit against Performance Supply LLC on Friday, alleging that the New Jersey-based company had posed as an authorized vendor of 3M-branded N95 respirators and offered millions of them for sale to New York City officials at prices as much as 600% over the list price.

Headlines: Crisis blocks Airbus plan for new A321 jet plant in France
Description: Airbus  has shelved plans to add a French assembly line for its A321neo just 10 weeks after the expansion was launched, as the coronavirus fallout spreads to its best-selling jetliner.

Headlines: U.S. Energy Secretary tells G20 all nations should help reduce oil surplus
Description: U.S. Energy Secretary Dan Brouillette on Friday described a  dire situation in global energy markets, saying that the coronavirus pandemic and massive oil surplus have created a lethal combination.

Headlines: G20 ministers to propose task force on next steps to help oil market: India
Description: G20 energy ministers in their joint statement will propose setting up a task force to advise ministers on the steps needed to stabilise the oil markets amid the coronavirus pandemic, India's oil ministry said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: Kremlin: Putin and Trump discuss OPEC+ oil cuts deal
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and U.S. President Donald Trump, in a phone call on Friday, discussed a potential global deal on oil production cuts by the group known as OPEC+, the Kremlin said.

Headlines: Trump, Putin discuss coronavirus, global energy markets: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump spoke with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin on Friday about the coronavirus and energy markets, the White House said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Coronavirus-hit airlines in push for divisive route subsidies
Description: Major airlines are seeking operating subsidies for key routes once coronavirus restrictions are lifted, a leaked lobbying document shows, stoking tensions with some low-cost carriers that are less likely to benefit from the additional funds.

Headlines: Congratulations, it's a fudge: EU crisis deal leaves much unresolved
Description: EU finance ministers gave themselves a round of applause as they wrapped up talks on Thursday night with agreement on a package of measures worth half a trillion euros to cushion the blow of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Turkey held talks with U.S. on possible Fed swap line: Turkish officials
Description: Turkey has held talks with the United States about possibly securing a swap line from the U.S. Federal Reserve and has discussed other funding options to mitigate fallout from the coronavirus outbreak, Turkish officials said on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Italy's government set to reappoint Eni and Enel CEOs - source
Description: The chief executives of Italy's top two energy groups Eni  and Enel  are on course to secure third terms next week when Rome decides on roles at key state-controlled companies, a senior government official said.

Headlines: Russia calls on G20 to join efforts with OPEC+ on oil market
Description: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak called on the G20 group of the world's largest economies on Friday to join the efforts of the group of leading oil producers, known as the OPEC+, to stabilize energy markets.

Headlines: Kremlin says 'work' on Mexico joining oil cuts under way
Description: The Kremlin said on Friday that "work" to persuade Mexico to join efforts to curb oil production was under way a day after marathon talks among producers produced a deal on cutting out conditional on Mexico's participation.

Headlines: Trump: 'Have to save the airlines!'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that American airlines must be saved, as his administration prepares to give them details this weekend about the terms of a $32 billion payroll grant to offset the impact of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Saudi energy minister calls for affordable energy supply at G20 meeting
Description: The Saudi energy minister told a conference of the G20 group of the world's largest economies on Friday that ensuring affordable energy supply is key to facilitating a global economic recovery.

Headlines: Russia's Putin to hold new talks on oil - TASS
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Friday he was planning to hold new talks on oil prices after phone calls with U.S. President Donald Trump and the leadership of Saudi Arabia, TASS news agency reported.

Headlines: Trump says he is speeding help to farmers hurt by coronavirus dislocation
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he has directed his agriculture secretary to expedite help to farmers, especially small farmers, hurt by the economic disruption caused by the new coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Japan's battle with pandemic may mark end of Abe's fiscal experiment
Description: The huge cost of the coronavirus pandemic is upending Japan's seven-year experiment to rescue the economy from its debt timebomb, as recession fears prompt calls for "helicopter money" - unlimited spending bankrolled by the central bank.

Headlines: Global oil output cuts held hostage to standoff
Description: Oil producers in the OPEC+ group, led by Saudi Arabia and Russia, were expected to pressure Mexico on Friday to seal an accord for a collective cut in output of 10 million barrels per day, before asking other nations for a further 5 million bpd of cuts.

Headlines: Nissan restructuring may assume cut of 1 million cars to annual sales target: sources
Description: Nissan Motor Co Ltd's  management has become convinced the struggling automaker needs to be much smaller and a restructuring plan due out next month would likely assume a cut of 1 million cars to its annual sales target, senior company sources said.

Headlines: Tesla expands locally made line-up, blunting trade war impact
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc  said on Friday it has started China sales of two more Model 3 variants built at its Shanghai plant, meaning all Model 3 sedans sold in the country are now locally made and not subject to import tax.

Headlines: Kering luxury goods billionaire Pinault agrees to pay cut
Description: François-Henri Pinault, the French billionaire chairman and CEO of luxury goods group Kering , has agreed to a pay cut in the latest example of top executives accepting lower salaries as a gesture of solidarity during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Renault chairman: could seek 4-5 billion euros worth of bank loans
Description: Renault  Chairman Jean-Dominique Senard said on Friday that the carmaker could seek bank loans worth 4-5 billion euros  ($4.4-$5.4 billion).

Headlines: Saudi, Russia outline record oil cut under U.S. pressure as demand crashes
Description: OPEC, Russia and other allies outlined plans on Thursday to cut their oil output by more than a fifth and said they expected the United States and other producers to join in their effort to prop up prices hammered by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Saudi energy minister says OPEC+ oil pact hinges on Mexico joining
Description: Saudi Arabia's energy minister said on Friday that a final OPEC+ oil supply pact to reduce 10 million barrels per day (bpd), which was agreed on Thursday, hinges on Mexico joining in the cuts.

Headlines: Kremlin says Putin, Trump, Saudi king seek to stabilise oil trade
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin, U.S. President Donald Trump and Saudi Arabia's King Salman, discussed the OPEC+ oil group meeting in a phone call on Friday and confirmed their aim was to  stabilise the global oil trade, the Kremlin said.

Headlines: Boeing considers potential 10% cut to workforce: WSJ
Description: Boeing Co  is considering a plan to cut its workforce by about 10%, which could involve buyouts, early retirements and involuntary layoffs, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Saudi king, Trump, Putin review importance of cooperation between oil producing countries
Description: Saudi Arabia's King Salman, U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin reviewed, in a phone call, the importance of cooperation between oil producing countries, after Thursday's OPEC+ meeting, Saudi state news agency SPA reported.

Headlines: Trump says airlines could receive grant details this weekend; sources say around 275 applied
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that airlines could receive details this weekend about the terms of a $32 billion payroll grant to offset the impact of the coronavirus outbreak, which sources told Reuters has received around 275 applicants.

Headlines: Mexico proposes 100,000 bpd oil output cut at OPEC meeting
Description: In a meeting with OPEC and its allies, Mexico proposed reducing its oil output by 100,000 barrels per day (bpd) in the next two months, Energy Minister Rocio Nahle said on Thursday.

Headlines: OPEC+ outlines oil cut deal, but Mexico holds up final agreement: sources
Description: OPEC, Russia and other allies outlined plans on Thursday to cut their oil output by more than a fifth and said they expected the United States and other producers to join in their effort to prop up prices hammered by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Trump says he had good call with Russia's Putin, Saudi king on oil
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he had a good conversation with Russian President Vladimir Putin and Saudi Arabia's King Salman and expected that OPEC and other countries would be announcing a deal soon.

Headlines: Delta says 35,000 workers taking up voluntary unpaid leaves, still seeking more
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc  Chief Executive Ed Bastian said on Thursday that nearly 35,000 workers had volunteered so far for voluntary unpaid leaves of absence the company is offering in an attempt to stem costs because of the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Volkswagen furloughs 1,500 workers at Tennessee auto plant starting April 11
Description: Volkswagen AG  said Thursday it will furlough 1,500 workers at its U.S. assembly plant in Tennessee starting April 11 as the industry grapples with the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Wall Street rises on latest Fed rescue program
Description: Wall Street closed out the trading week on a high note on Thursday as the U.S. Federal Reserve unleashed another program designed to buoy local governments and businesses crushed by massive closures to stem the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Oil sinks as market doubts OPEC supply cuts will be enough
Description: Oil prices tumbled on Thursday on doubts that a deal between OPEC and allies to make a record oil supply cut would be enough to offset the collapse in global fuel demand caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: As fever checks become the norm in coronavirus era, demand for thermal cameras soars
Description: The makers of specialized cameras to quickly scan for fevers as people enter crowded workplaces are grappling with soaring demand while confronting supply disruptions, forcing some to prioritize customers such as hospitals, executives told Reuters.

Headlines: Trump says administration likely to release details on airline aid this weekend
Description: President Donald Trump said on Thursday his administration would be releasing details over the weekend about its program to help U.S. airlines hit hard by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Facebook must face renewed privacy lawsuit over user tracking
Description: A federal appeals court on Thursday revived nationwide litigation accusing Facebook Inc  of violating users' privacy rights by tracking their internet activity even after they logged out of the social media website.

Headlines: Mnuchin, Kudlow say U.S. economy could open in May, defying experts
Description: The Trump administration's top economic officials said on Thursday they believe the U.S. economy could start to reopen for normal business in May, despite health experts' emphasis on prolonged social distancing measures to defeat the coronavirus.

Headlines: Trump administration official says U.S. welcomes reports of OPEC+ oil cut deal
Description: The United States welcomed on Thursday reports that OPEC and its allies agreed in principal to reduce oil production by 10 million barrels per day (bpd), a senior Trump administration official said on Thursday.

Headlines: Instant View: OPEC+ cuts will not be enough to halt oil collapse - analysts
Description: OPEC and other major oil producers on Thursday said they would cut output by 10 million barrels per day for two months in the face of a huge fall in demand due to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Caterpillar seeks fresh $3 billion loan to boost liquidity: source
Description: Caterpillar Inc  is in talks with banks for a fresh $3 billion nine-month revolving credit facility, a person familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Investors caution cement, steel firms on EU climate lobbying
Description: Cement and steel companies are being warned by investors over their lobbying on planned European Union carbon costs, saying they are effectively asking to be compensated twice over.

Headlines: Global stock markets jump on Fed stimulus, oil pulls back from earlier surge
Description: Global equity benchmarks moved higher on Thursday following signs of some success by governments and central banks which have taken additional steps to bolster their economies during the COVID-19 pandemic, while oil prices pulled back from an earlier surge.

Headlines: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink's pay fell 8.4% in 2019: filing
Description: BlackRock Inc , the world's largest asset manager, cut total compensation for Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Larry Fink by 8.4% in 2019, a second straight year of decline, according to a filing on Thursday.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley CEO diagnosed with coronavirus in March, since recovered: bank video
Description: Morgan Stanley  Chief Executive Officer James Gorman was diagnosed as being infected by the novel coronavirus after first experiencing symptoms nearly a month ago and has fully recovered, according to a video that was sent to the bank's employees on Thursday.

Headlines: As delivery workers emerge as frontline soldiers, India's government warms to e-commerce
Description: Three days after India imposed a nationwide lockdown, Devender Singh revved up his motorcycle to deliver meat and eggs to customers - but his heart was in his mouth as he closed in on a police barricade on a deserted New Delhi road.

Headlines: Facebook sues Bangkok resident for selling fraudulent ad tools
Description: Facebook Inc  sued a Bangkok-based Indian man on Thursday for developing and marketing a software to bypass the social network's advertising review process and deliver prohibited ads to users.

Headlines: Dollar drops after Fed launches new loan program, curbing safety bids
Description: The dollar dropped broadly on Thursday after the Federal Reserve rolled out a $2.3 trillion effort to bolster local governments and small and mid-sized businesses in its latest move to keep the U.S. economy intact as the country battles the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: A day in the life of an Amazon courier on the frontlines of the U.S. pandemic
Description: Excelso Sabulao delivers groceries for Amazon.com Inc in California so he can help provide his parents an income. Now, with endless interactions at stores and at homes during a pandemic, he worries his work will kill them.

Headlines: Fed, BoE push deeper into uncharted territory in face of coronavirus slump
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve and the Bank of England ramped up their emergency responses to the world's escalating coronavirus recession on Thursday as they pushed deeper into territory once considered fraught with risk for central bankers.

Headlines: Citigroup starts accepting paycheck protection program application
Description: Citigroup Inc  said on Thursday, that it has started accepting applications for the $349 billion small business bailout fund.

Headlines: Air France KLM says it needs government support to continue operations
Description: Air France KLM said that despite cost-cutting measures to stave off the impact of the coronavirus crisis, it expects it will be short of cash in the third quarter, but said it was confident that the French and Dutch governments would support the group.

Headlines: BAT files patent suits against Philip Morris' IQOS products
Description: British American Tobacco said on Thursday that it sued Philip Morris International Inc in the United States and Germany, alleging that the tobacco heating technology used in its bigger rival's IQOS devices infringed its patents.

Headlines: California developer says virus an act of God, sues Exxon over stalled deal
Description: A California retail developer claims the state's coronavirus lockdown was an act of God that prevented it from completing a $4.2 million property acquisition, asking a court to prevent owner Exxon Mobil Corp from selling to any other buyers.

Headlines: EasyJet to defer delivery of 24 Airbus planes, hold shareholder meeting
Description: British airline easyJet  on Thursday said it would defer the delivery of 24 Airbus  jets and hold a shareholder meeting after the airline's founder Stelios Haji-Ioannou stepped up a disagreement over the airline's expansion plans.

Headlines: Uber to give drivers millions of face masks to battle coronavirus
Description: Uber Technologies Inc  on Thursday said it plans to ship millions of face masks to its active drivers and food delivery people around the world to help prevent the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. jobless claims exceed six million for second week in a row
Description: A staggering 16.8 million Americans have filed for unemployment benefits in the last three weeks, with weekly new claims topping 6 million for the second straight time last week as the novel coronavirus outbreak relentlessly savages the economy.

Headlines: Airbus's landmark jet output cut faces crucial test
Description: Airbus's  decision to cut output of its best-selling jet by a third amid coronavirus marks a huge shift for the European planemaker, which has enjoyed virtually unbroken growth since it began competing toe-to-toe with Boeing  almost 20 years ago.

Headlines: Fed rolls out $2.3 trillion to backstop 'Main Street,' local governments
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Thursday announced a broad, $2.3 trillion effort to bolster local governments and small and mid-sized businesses, the latest in an expanding suite of programs meant to keep the U.S. economy intact as the country battles the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Explainer: Next from the Fed - Help for Main Street
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve responded fast to the coronavirus crisis with open-ended programs to keep financial markets running and ensure major companies could raise cash as they usually do through large capital markets.

Headlines: Factbox: Even big OPEC+ cuts won't offset oil demand collapse - analysts
Description: OPEC and other major oil producers were due to discuss on Thursday big output cuts in the face of a huge fall in demand due to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Russia's Novak calls on all oil producers to join efforts
Description: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak said on Thursday that all the leading global oil producers should join their efforts to tackle falling oil demand.

Headlines: Russia, Saudi Arabia overcome differences holding up big oil cut deal: Dmitriev
Description: Russia and Saudi Arabia have overcome differences that had presented potential hurdles to a plan for major oil output cuts aimed at shoring up crude prices hammered by the coranavirus crisis, the head of Russia's wealth fund said on Thursday.

Headlines: OPEC+ works on two-year oil cut deal, implemented gradually: sources
Description: OPEC and its allies, a group known as OPEC+, are discussing plans to cut oil production for at least two years with reductions implemented gradually, two OPEC+ sources said on Thursday.

Headlines: Pelosi pushes need for money for smallest U.S. businesses
Description: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Thursday the country's smallest businesses need to be protected against the ravages of the coronavirus outbreak and pushed for $60 billion to be allocated to those enterprises in the next funding allocation.

Headlines: Explainer: What the Federal Reserve has done in the coronavirus crisis
Description: The Federal Reserve has moved into overdrive to try to keep the U.S. economy from suffering lasting damage from the coronavirus pandemic, announcing an emergency interest rate cut on March 3 and rolling out new efforts almost weekly since, including slashing rates to zero and relaunching large-scale asset purchases.

Headlines: Fiat reaches deal with unions on measures for production restart in Italy
Description: Fiat Chrysler  reached a deal with unions on Thursday over measures to adopt in its Italian plants once the government eases restrictions on business activity put in place to contain the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Fed studying if new facility for small business loans might be opened to non-bank lenders
Description: The Federal Reserve may expand a program to back Small Business Administration loans to include non-bank lenders as a way to help speed distribution of $350 billion in loans considered critical to helping the smallest firms through the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: U.S. railroads push against oil industry demands for storage in rail cars
Description: Railroads are clamping down on rising demand from oil companies to store crude in rail cars due to safety concerns, sources said, even as the number of places available to stockpile oil is rapidly dwindling.

Headlines: UK retailer Debenhams enters administration again
Description: British department store group Debenhams went into administration for the second time in 12 months on Thursday, seeking to protect itself from legal action by creditors during the coronavirus crisis that could have pushed it into liquidation.

Headlines: Timeline: Fed's response - pandemic downturn vs financial crisis
Description: The economic dislocation caused by the coronavirus crisis is unfolding with breathtaking speed.

Headlines: Fed will continue to act 'forcefully, proactively and aggressively,' Powell says
Description: The Federal Reserve will continue to use all the tools at its disposal until the U.S. economy begins to fully rebound from the harm caused by the novel coronavirus outbreak, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said on Thursday, even as he acknowledged the limits of the central bank's powers.

Headlines: Fed chief Powell sees road to recovery, warns on 'false start'
Description: The U.S. economy could be headed "fairly quickly" toward recovery if people stay home, government gets aid to businesses and households, and public health officials create a national plan to restart the economy, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Thursday.

Headlines: Iraqi oil minister says it's necessary to determine oil cuts' limits
Description: Iraqi oil minister Thamer Ghadhban said on Thursday it was necessary to determine the limit of oil cuts, the timeline, the start date of applying the measures and to distribute the shares fairly and equally, a statement from oil ministry said.

Headlines: France's carmaker Renault drops dividend over coronavirus crisis: source
Description: French carmaker Renault's board has decided to cancel its dividend on 2019 earnings in light of the coronavirus crisis, a source close to the matter told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: White House to announce economic coronavirus task force soon: senior administration official
Description: The White House is expected to announce soon formation of a second coronavirus task force, this one devoted to getting the U.S. economy going again when the time is right, a senior administration official said on Thursday.

Headlines: Smithfield Foods closes U.S. pork plant due to new coronavirus
Description: Smithfield Foods Inc, the world's biggest pork processor, said on Thursday it is temporarily closing a plant in Sioux Falls, South Dakota, because of the new coronavirus, the latest disruption to the U.S. food supply chain from the outbreak.

Headlines: Automakers push to reopen plants with testing and lots of masks
Description: Global automakers reeling from the COVID-19 pandemic are accelerating efforts to restart factories from Wuhan to Maranello to Michigan, using safety protocols developed for China and U.S. ventilator production operations launched in recent weeks.

Headlines: Citigroup offers full-time positions to interns amid coronavirus crisis
Description: Citigroup Inc  said on Thursday it is offering full-time positions to its interns, but delaying the new class of summer intern program to July 6 amid the current coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: UBS executives pledge $5 million of own cash to coronavirus fight
Description: Top managers at UBS  will each contribute the equivalent of three months' salary to fight the coronavirus, its chief executive Sergio Ermotti said on Thursday after the Swiss bank bowed to pressure to suspend its dividend.

Headlines: Exclusive: Airbnb restricts bookings on its platform in Britain
Description: Home rental firm Airbnb blocked British bookings on its platform for the vast majority of customers on Thursday, allowing only key workers to stay in properties for as long as emergency government coronavirus restrictions are in place.

Headlines: Timeline: Fed's response - pandemic downturn vs financial crisis
Description: The economic dislocation caused by the coronavirus crisis is unfolding with breathtaking speed.

Headlines: RenCap removes line from Rosneft note saying 10 million bpd cut would rebalance markets
Description: Renaissance Capital updated a note giving a readout on a call with Rosneft  to remove a line saying the Russian energy giant believed a cut in oil output by OPEC+ of 10 million barrels per day (bpd) would be sufficient to balance markets.

Headlines: OPEC+ to debate oil cuts as big as 20 million bpd: sources
Description: OPEC and other oil producers will debate on Thursday oil cuts as big as 20 million barrels per day, equivalent to about 20% of global supplies, one OPEC source and a Russian source told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury's Mnuchin says airline aid 'next big thing' to be rolled out
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday that aid for airlines will be the "next big thing" to be rolled out after the Federal Reserve announced new lending backstops for smaller and midsize companies and municipal bonds.

Headlines: IMF chief says pandemic will unleash worst recession since Great Depression
Description: The pandemic sweeping the world will turn global economic growth "sharply negative" in 2020, triggering the worst fallout since the 1930s Great Depression, with only a partial recovery seen in 2021, the head of the International Monetary Fund said.

Headlines: IMF chief says engaged with all members including Turkey
Description: The International Monetary Fund remains engaged with all members, including Turkey, as they respond to the new coronavirus pandemic sweeping the globe, IMF Managing Director Kristalian Georgieva said on Thursday.

Headlines: Bloomin' Brands, Jana Partners agree to nominate two new directors
Description: Bloomin' Brands Inc  and Jana Partners said on Thursday they have agreed to add two new independent directors to the Outback Steakhouse owner's board, months after the activist hedge fund pushed for changes due to struggling restaurant sales.

Headlines: Hyundai's Czech plant set to restart after coronavirus halt
Description: Hyundai Motor Co's  Czech plant plans to restart on April 14 after a three-week production outage as part of efforts to fight the coronavirus, becoming the first of the three major carmakers in the central European country to resume work.

Headlines: Exclusive: JPMorgan looking to offload Saudi and UAE sovereign fund loans - sources
Description: JPMorgan  is seeking to sell at a discount loans raised by the sovereign wealth funds of Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates, according to two sources and a document, as banks brace for a borrowing spree in the Gulf due to low oil prices.

Headlines: Index Ventures raises $2 billion for early-stage, growth investments
Description: Venture capital firm Index Ventures said on Thursday it had raised $2 billion for early-stage and growth investments, backing entrepreneurs it reckons will lead the way out of the economic slump caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Costco set to open new store in China's Suzhou city
Description: U.S. retail giant Costco  will open a new store in China's eastern city of Suzhou, near Shanghai, state media reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Putin has no plans to talk oil with Trump, Saudis on Thursday: Kremlin
Description: Russian President Putin has no plans as of Thursday to discuss oil markets with U.S. President Donald Trump and Saudi Arabia's leadership, a Kremlin spokesman told Reuters.

Headlines: Factbox: OPEC+ talks face challenges over baseline for cuts and U.S. role
Description: OPEC and its allies hold talks on Thursday to discuss plans for the biggest coordinated oil output cut in history but two hurdles remain: reaching a deal on the levels from which to make reductions and securing the participation of the United States.

Headlines: S&P cuts Renault bonds to 'junk' and downgrades outlook on PSA
Description: Credit rating agency Standard & Poor's (S&P) delivered downgrades on Thursday to France's top car companies Renault  and PSA , cutting Renault's bonds to 'junk' status due to the impact of the new coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. bank results to focus on looming loan losses during coronavirus
Description: How much money will U.S. banks lose on loans because of the coronavirus recession?

Headlines: Prague aims to get a grip on Airbnb with coronavirus crisis laws
Description: Officials in Prague are using the coronavirus crisis to get a firmer grip on short-term rentals like Airbnb, which they say have squeezed locals out of the Czech capital's centre.

Headlines: Streaming service Disney+ crosses 50 million paid subscribers globally
Description: Walt Disney Co  said on Wednesday that Disney+ has attracted more than 50 million paid users, with 8 million of them coming from India where the video streaming service was rolled out last week.

Headlines: Exclusive: Wall Street firm dangled up to 175% returns to investors using U.S. aid programs
Description: A New York investment firm pitched wealthy investors in recent days on a way to make returns of 22% to 175% using U.S. government programs designed to help Americans keep their jobs and boost the coronavirus-stricken economy, according to a marketing document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: UniCredit renews commitment to boosting shareholder returns: chairman
Description: UniCredit  remains strongly committed to increasing returns for investors in Italy's biggest bank, its chairman said, following a decision to suspend dividend payments and a share buyback to comply with supervisory guidance.

Headlines: May is crunch time for U.S. auto suppliers amid coronavirus shutdown
Description: Auto parts maker Kevin Clay landed a series of new contracts from customers early this year, and was bullish on 2020 after two challenging years.

Headlines: Kremlin calls for coordinated joint action on global oil markets
Description: Russia wants coordinated joint action to stabilise global oil markets, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Thursday ahead of a meeting between OPEC and non-OPEC producers.

Headlines: Nissan seeks $4.6 billion credit line as coronavirus hammers car demand: sources
Description: Nissan Motor Co Ltd  has requested a $4.6 billion commitment line from major lenders to cushion the impact of the coronavirus pandemic while it seeks to engineer a desperately needed turnaround, people with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Tesla's China sales hit record high in March: industry association
Description: Tesla Inc sold 10,160 vehicles in China in March, its highest ever monthly sales in the world's largest auto market, the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA) said on Thursday.

Headlines: Virgin Australia grounds almost all domestic flights, seeks government aid
Description: Virgin Australia Holdings Ltd  said on Thursday it would ground all domestic flights, except a single daily Sydney-Melbourne service through June 15, as it continues to seek government aid to weather the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: UBS and Credit Suisse bow to regulator pressure on dividends
Description: Swiss banks UBS  and Credit Suisse  will postpone paying out part of their 2019 dividends until later this year after mounting pressure from authorities over lenders' payouts during the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Advertisers shun coronavirus coverage, hastening news media battle for survival
Description: From Rupert Murdoch's News UK to McClatchy's chain of local newspapers across the United States, news publishers are attracting record numbers of readers as people in lockdown seek information about the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Swiss financial watchdog welcomes UBS' and Credit Suisse's dividend decisions
Description: Swiss financial watchdog Finma said on Thursday it welcomed a decision by UBS  and Credit Suisse  to pay out half of their dividends for 2019 in the fourth quarter of 2020 despite their strong capital decisions.

Headlines: Zoom sued for overstating, not disclosing privacy, security flaws
Description: Zoom Video Communications Inc was slapped with a class action suit by one of its shareholders on Tuesday, accusing the video-conferencing app of overstating its privacy standards and failing to disclose that its service was not end-to-end encrypted.

Headlines: Zoom hires ex-Facebook security chief as Google bans desktop app
Description: Zoom Video Communications Inc  has tapped former Facebook security chief Alex Stamos as an adviser as safety and privacy concerns about its fast-growing video-conferencing app drive a global backlash against the company.

Headlines: U.S. senator to liquidate individual stock shares after coronavirus flap
Description: U.S. Senator Kelly Loeffler said on Wednesday she would liquidate her individual stock share positions after the wealthy Republican and her husband were criticized over sales of millions of dollars in stock during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Exxon used economic uncertainty to push for Paulsboro, N.J., contract: sources
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp  used economic uncertainty tied to the coronavirus pandemic to urge workers at its lubricants and packaging plant in Paulsboro, New Jersey, to vote for a proposed contract, according to two sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Mexican president lashes out at companies over layoffs, taxes as big business seethes
Description: Mexico's president threw himself into a new confrontation with businesses on Wednesday, accusing big companies of not paying taxes and upbraiding others for laying off workers during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Mexico auto sector to resume operations once U.S. industry gears up
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Wednesday the domestic auto sector can resume operations shortly after the U.S. industry gears up from a coronavirus-led halt, to avoid further disruption to closely interconnected supply chains.

Headlines: U.S. senators question Amazon CEO about firing of warehouse protest leader
Description: Five Democratic lawmakers on Wednesday wrote Amazon.com Inc to raise concern about its firing of a worker who protested warehouse operations during the coronavirus pandemic, according to a copy of the letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Coming next from the Fed: How much for Main Street?
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve responded fast to the coronavirus crisis with open-ended programs to keep financial markets running and ensure major companies could raise cash as they usually do through large capital markets.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies on hopeful coronavirus signs, healthcare lift
