Description: U.S. stock markets jumped on Wednesday on hopeful signs about the coronavirus outbreak in the United States was close to a peak, with health insurers getting an additional lift from Bernie Sanders' decision to suspend his presidential campaign.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. producers have already cut back oil production
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday U.S. oil producers have already cut production and he had many options if Saudi Arabia and Russia do not reduce their output when they and other exporters meet on Thursday.

Headlines: German foreign ministry restricts use of Zoom over security concerns
Description: The German foreign ministry has restricted use of the video conferencing service Zoom to fixed-connection computers due to concerns about security issues, two German government sources said.

Headlines: BlackRock will not layoff employees due to COVID-19 pandemic: CEO
Description: BlackRock Inc , the world's largest asset manager, will not layoff any employees during the year due to the coronavirus outbreak, Chief Executive Officer Larry Fink said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Virus lockdown threatens $60 billion in UK dividends: report
Description: UK-listed companies could cancel about $60 billion in dividend payments this year following Britain's lockdown and calls from regulators to preserve cash during the coronavirus crisis, according to a report by analytics company Link Group.

Headlines: Starbucks sees 47% drop in second-quarter earnings on coronavirus hit
Description: Starbucks Corp  on Wednesday forecast a 47% drop in second-quarter earnings, scrapped its full-year forecast and warned that the financial hit from the coronavirus pandemic would extend into the final quarter of the fiscal year 2020.

Headlines: Factbox: Insurers return part of auto premiums as coronavirus cuts driving
Description: Major U.S. insurers are offering credit to auto and motorcycle policyholders following a decline in driving, as most Americans stay at home to help contain the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. approves Google request to use segment of U.S.-Asia undersea cable
Description: The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) on Wednesday approved Alphabet Inc unit Google's  request to use part of an U.S.-Asia undersea telecommunications cable after the company warned it would face significantly higher prices to carry traffic by other means.

Headlines: Costco's March same-store sales jump as coronavirus triggers surge in buying
Description: Costco Wholesale Corp  reported a 9.6% jump in March comparable sales, as customers stocked up on essentials to weather coronavirus-led lockdowns.

Headlines: Hundreds of U.S. lenders get access to small-business rescue program with new system launch
Description: The U.S. government's $350 billion program to help ailing businesses took an important step forward on Wednesday, with the launch of a system that will allow hundreds of new lenders to participate in the unprecedented scheme.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan sees U.S. growth returning in second half, but consumers staying cautious
Description: The U.S. economy is headed for a return to growth in the second half of the year after a steep decline this quarter, Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Robert Kaplan said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Airbus slashes jet output to tackle coronavirus crisis
Description: Airbus  announced plans on Wednesday to cut jetliner production across the board after the coronavirus epidemic triggered aviation's worst industrial crisis and drastically reduced deliveries to cash-starved airlines.

Headlines: JPMorgan takes action against traders for using WhatsApp at work: Bloomberg News
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co, the largest U.S. bank, has taken action against more than a dozen traders for using WhatsApp at work, firing one and cutting bonuses for the rest, Bloomberg news reported on Wednesday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: JetBlue seeks U.S. approval to temporarily halt flights to 11 airports
Description: JetBlue Airways Corp on Wednesday asked the U.S. Transportation Department for emergency approval to temporarily suspend service to 11 U.S. airports, including Dallas, Houston, Minneapolis, Portland, Sacramento and Albuquerque.

Headlines: Philips says U.S. deal will enable it to ramp up ventilator production
Description: Dutch health technology company Philips  said on Wednesday it struck a deal with the White House that will enable it to significantly ramp up its production of hospital ventilators as promised.

Headlines: Pelosi: more small business spending alone would not pass U.S. House
Description: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Wednesday that $250 billion in coronavirus relief for small businesses desired by Republicans could not pass the House of Representatives on its own under current procedures, which require a unanimous vote of those present while most of Congress is out of town.

Headlines: Dow Jones Chief Executive Lewis to step down
Description: Dow Jones Chief Executive Officer Will Lewis is stepping down, parent company News Corp  said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Oil futures rise on hopes of production cuts
Description: Oil futures strengthened late in the session on Wednesday, buoyed by hopes that OPEC and its allies will strike a production cut agreement on Thursday.

Headlines: McDonald's pulls forecast as coronavirus outbreak hits sales
Description: McDonald's Corp  global comparable sales tumbled 22.2% in March and the burger chain pulled its full-year forecast as coronavirus-related lockdowns forced it to shutter stores and stick to delivery or take-out.

Headlines: Ferrari to pilot 'Back on Track' employee screening for coronavirus
Description: Ferrari  said on Wednesday it was piloting a project to conduct voluntary screening of employees and their families for coronavirus once the supercarmaker's factories in Italy reopen.

Headlines: GM, Philips to supply 73,000 U.S. ventilators in $1.1 billion effort
Description: The U.S. Health and Human Services Department (HHS) on Wednesday awarded two contracts worth more than $1 billion to make ventilators needed to treat severely sick coronavirus patients and plans to announce five additional contracts later this week.

Headlines: Equities climb on hopes coronavirus pandemic is peaking
Description: World equity markets surged and oil prices jumped on Wednesday on hopes the coronavirus pandemic is getting close to peaking and that more government stimulus measures could be on the way.

Headlines: U.S. dollar drifts higher as optimism ebbs on coronavirus crisis
Description: The U.S. dollar gained on Wednesday in choppy trading as some optimism faded that the coronavirus crisis may be nearing a peak faded and as investor concerns remained over the economic fallout of the pandemic.

Headlines: Airbnb warns 2020 revenue can fall by half amid COVID-19 hit: The Information
Description: Home rental company Airbnb has projected its revenue can fall about 54% to some $2.2 billion this year due to the COVID-19 pandemic, The Information reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Google bans Zoom software from employee laptops
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google on Wednesday banned Zoom video conferencing application from its employees' laptops, citing security concerns.

Headlines: White House looks to bolster small business lending program
Description: The White House hopes Congress will nearly double the size of its program to support ailing small businesses by the end of the week, as some of the nation's largest lenders still sit on the sidelines and others remain unable to access the system.

Headlines: Trump administration seeks $250 billion more in aid for small U.S. businesses: Mnuchin
Description: The Trump administration on Tuesday asked Congress for an additional $250 billion in emergency economic aid for small U.S. businesses reeling from the coronavirus pandemic, as Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell pushed for passage as soon as Thursday.

Headlines: Nasdaq CEO hopeful IPOs will pickup again in second half
Description: Nasdaq Inc  is hopeful initial public offerings will pick up in the second half of 2020, but much depends on how well companies and investors emerge from the coronavirus pandemic, the head of the exchange operator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Lufthansa CEO says it's seeking state aid in Germany, other countries
Description: Lufthansa  will seek state aid in Germany, Switzerland, Belgium and Austria as the coronavirus crisis that forced it to ground almost all of its planes will persist longer than feared, the German airline's chief executive said.

Headlines: VIX futures point to coronavirus worries for months to come
Description: Investors are betting on stocks to remain volatile well into the year, suggesting that many expect the long-term economic and public health impact of the pandemic caused by the novel coronavirus to continue roiling markets despite a recent rally.

Headlines: Wobbly U.S. fiscal response could deepen coronavirus recession
Description: The U.S. government's massive effort to nurse the economy through the coronavirus crisis was billed as a send-money-and-don't-sweat-the-details flood of cash to people and businesses in a $22 trillion system that has ground to a halt.

Headlines: Centerview turns to Matthieu Pigasse to lead new Paris hub
Description: U.S. investment bank Centerview has hired Lazard's former France boss, Matthieu Pigasse, to lead its newly-launched Paris office and win business from European companies grappling with the economic damage caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Airbus to review production cuts after 'some months': CEO
Description: Airbus production cuts announced on Wednesday in response to the coronavirus crisis are likely to be in place for "some months" and then reviewed as the market outlook becomes clearer, Chief Executive Guillaume Faury said on Wednesday.

Headlines: BMW to start producing face masks
Description: German carmaker BMW  will start producing face masks to help protect its own staff and the public against the spread of the new coronavirus, Chief Executive Oliver Zipse said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fed modifying asset cap so Wells Fargo can make more small business loans
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve said on Wednesday it would "temporarily and narrowly" modify the growth restriction on Wells Fargo & Co's  balance sheet, allowing the bank to make more loans under government assistance programs for small businesses hurt by the coronavirus disruption.

Headlines: Pulp friction: Border jams delay supply of toilet paper's only ingredient
Description: As several European borders limit travel to stop the spread of COVID-19, two of the world's biggest pulp makers say transportation logjams are delaying shipments of the raw material - the only ingredient in the toilet paper that people are hoarding to weather quarantines.

Headlines: U.S. oil firms likely to 'organically' cut four million barrels per day: regulator
Description: OPEC members and other oil producers need to cut at least 20 million barrels per day of output, a Texas oil and gas regulator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Agnelli family's Exor vows to push through big deals despite pandemic
Description: The boss of Exor  showed confidence on Wednesday in the success of three transformative deals set to reshape its multi-billion portfolio of corporate holdings, despite being caught at mid-air by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Toyota extends North American plant shutdown; will stop paying 5,000 temporary workers
Description: Toyota Motor Corp said Wednesday it plans to reopen its North American auto plants on May 4, extending its current shutdown by two additional weeks.

Headlines: Norwegian Air seeks $4.3 billion debt-for-equity deal as crisis deepens
Description: Norwegian Air  plans to convert up to $4.3 billion of its debt into equity and to issue new shares as it seeks to stay in business following the COVID-19 outbreak that has grounded almost all of its fleet, the budget carrier said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Timeline: Norwegian Air targets relaunch with debt-for-equity deal
Description: Norwegian Air  plans to convert up to $4.3 billion of its debt into equity and to issue new shares as it seeks to stay in business following the COVID-19 outbreak that has grounded almost all of its fleet.

Headlines: Lufthansa's Austrian unit negotiates state aid, job cuts
Description: Austrian Airlines is in negotiations with the government regarding state aid to save jobs and keep Vienna as a transfer hub for long-haul flights, the carrier said on Wednesday, adding the talks were at an early stage and will probably take weeks.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico unit hires over 7,700 employees to manage higher demand
Description: Walmart de Mexico, known locally as Walmex , has hired 7,741 employees to manage higher volume and demand at its stores, the retailer said in a statement on Wednesday

Headlines: Nordstrom temporarily shutters headquarters on coronavirus fears
Description: Nordstrom Inc  has temporarily shut down its corporate headquarters in Seattle due to the spread of the coronavirus in the area, the retailer said in a filing on Wednesday.

Headlines: Video service Zoom taking security seriously: U.S. government memo
Description: Video conferencing company Zoom has been responsive to concerns over its software, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) said in a memo recently distributed to top government cybersecurity officials and seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuela gasoline shortages worsen as U.S. tells firms to avoid supply - sources
Description: Gasoline shortages in Venezuela are worsening after U.S. officials have told foreign firms to refrain from supplying the fuel to the sanctioned South American nation and only provide diesel, according to five people familiar with the situation.

Headlines: Corona beer maker Constellation to reduce production in Mexico during pandemic
Description: Constellation Brands Inc , the U.S. distributor of Corona beer, said on Wednesday it would reduce production at its Mexican breweries, just days after it announced they were fully operational.

Headlines: EasyJet founder seeks to oust directors over Airbus plane order
Description: EasyJet's  founder Stelios Haji-Ioannou demanded on Wednesday a shareholder vote to remove two directors, as part of his battle to try to force the British airline to cancel an order for 107 Airbus  planes.

Headlines: Tesco defends dividend payout as warns coronavirus costs could top $1 billion
Description: Tesco  has defended its decision to pay investors a 635 million pound ($782 million) dividend while accepting business tax relief from the British government aimed at helping distressed retailers through the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Constellation Brands cuts back Mexico operations to protect workers
Description: U.S. brewer Constellation Brands has begun reducing operations at its breweries in Mexico to protect its workers in line with government directives to contain the spread of the coronavirus, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: HSBC reports potential money laundering breaches in Australia
Description: HSBC  has reported itself to Australia's financial regulator for possible breaches of anti-money laundering rules, the bank disclosed in a regulatory filing by its Australian subsidiary.

Headlines: Spirit AeroSystems halts production for Boeing jets indefinitely
Description: Spirit AeroSystems Holdings Inc , Boeing's top supplier, said on Wednesday it had stopped production for the planemaker for an indefinite period and would furlough workers supporting Boeing programs in Kansas and Oklahoma.

Headlines: Tiffany says Australian regulators seek more time to review LVMH deal
Description: Tiffany & Co  said on Wednesday Australian regulators have sought more time to review LVMH's  multi-billion dollar purchase of the U.S. jeweler due to the coronavirus outbreak, potentially delaying closure of the deal.

Headlines: H&M borrows 980 million euros to boost liquidity buffer amid pandemic
Description: H&M , the world's second-biggest fashion retailer, said on Wednesday it had signed a 980 million euro ($1.1 billion) revolving credit facility to strengthen its liquidity buffer in light of the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: SoftBank-backed Oyo furloughs some U.S. workers as coronavirus hits revenue
Description: SoftBank-backed  Oyo Hotels and Homes is furloughing some employees to cut costs, it said on Wednesday, as lower travel due to the coronavirus pandemic slams the hospitality industry.

Headlines: Tesla to furlough workers, cut employee salaries due to coronavirus
Description: Tesla Inc  told employees on Tuesday it would furlough all non-essential workers and implement salary cuts during a shut down of its U.S. production facilities because of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler in talks with unions for production restart in Italy
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA)  and unions are discussing plans for beefed-up health measures at Italian plants to pave the way for most profitable production to restart as soon as the government eases a national lockdown, unions said on Wednesday.

Headlines: OECD says leading indicators flag biggest monthly drop on record
Description: Major economies are seeing the biggest monthly slump in activity ever amid the coronavirus crisis and no end is in sight without clarity about how long lockdowns will last, the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Coronavirus rout spurs China investors to dividend plays
Description: Wild swings in global equities markets are prompting brokers and fund managers to urge patience with a strategy still alien to many of China's momentum-driven stock investors: switch into companies offering high and stable dividends.

Headlines: Honda back to work in China's Wuhan with temperature checks and masks
Description: Temperature checkpoints and posters telling workers to keep more than a metre apart at Japanese automaker Honda Motor Co's reopened plant in the Chinese city of Wuhan show how the coronavirus has created a new normal on the factory floor.

Headlines: BAE Systems to raise $1.3 billion in debt to fund pension deficit
Description: Britain's BAE Systems  is looking to raise $1.3 billion in debt to fund its pension deficit and repay related loans, the company said on Wednesday, as it prepares to deal with the fallout of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Figure of $6.5 billion in loans for Air France KLM 'not unrealistic': minister
Description: A figure of 6 billion euros ($6.5 billion) in loans to help Air France KLM  amid the coronavirus crisis is "not unrealistic", French junior transport minister Jean-Baptiste Djebbari said on Wednesday.

Headlines: French carmaker PSA sets up fund for staff and new health check measures
Description: French carmaker and Peugeot owner PSA  announced on Wednesday the creation of a solidarity fund to help staff affected by the closures of plants due to the COVID-19 outbreak, and new steps to protect the health of its workers.

Headlines: UK fashion retailer ASOS raises 247 million pounds in placing
Description: British online fashion retailer ASOS Plc  said it had raised 247 million pounds ($304 million) via a placing, to help it shore up its finances in case of a prolonged business downturn from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Jack Dorsey pledges $1 billion of his Square stake for COVID-19 relief efforts
Description: Twitter Inc  Chief Executive Officer Jack Dorsey on Tuesday pledged $1 billion of his stake in Square Inc , the payments processor that he co-founded and heads, to help fund relief efforts related to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Amazon to suspend delivery service competing with UPS, FedEx
Description: Amazon.com Inc  will suspend a delivery service that aims to compete with UPS  and FedEx  in the United States.

Headlines: U.S. oil state senators to talk crude markets with Saudi officials Saturday: source
Description: Republican U.S. senators who have introduced a bill that would remove U.S. defense systems and troops in Saudi Arabia unless it cuts oil output will hold a call with the kingdom's officials on Saturday, a source familiar with the planning said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Australia's Treasury Wine, to cope with virus, weighs Penfolds demerger, U.S. cutback
Description: Australia's Treasury Wine Estates Ltd  said it may spin off the prestigious Penfolds label and shrink its low-end "commercial" division in the United States as it seeks ways to grow profit amid upheaval brought by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Nissan's China sales drop 44.9% in March due to virus
Description: Japanese automaker Nissan  said on Wednesday its sales in China fell 44.9% from a year earlier to 73,297 units in March, as the coronavirus epidemic continues to hit the world's biggest car market.

Headlines: U.S. pushes back on call by OPEC+ to join big oil output cuts
Description: Saudi Arabia, Russia and allied oil producers will agree to deep cuts to their crude output at talks this week only if the United States and several others join in with curbs to help prop up prices that have been hammered by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Volkswagen Mexico says employee died in potential case of COVID-19
Description: Volkswagen Mexico issued a statement saying one of its employees in the country had died in a potential case of coronavirus.

Headlines: Airbnb's new $1 billion investment comes at lower valuation: sources
Description: Airbnb Inc's new $1 billion investment from private equity firms Silver Lake and Sixth Street Partners has terms that imply a reduced valuation of the home rental company, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wynn, NCR deals a sign of yet more risk returning to bond market
Description: U.S. casino operator Wynn Resorts Ltd  and automated teller machines maker NCR Corp  jointly raised $1 billion on Tuesday, in the first unsecured junk-rated bond offerings since the market was roiled by the coronavirus outbreak at the start of March.

Headlines: Boeing making new 737 MAX software updates to address computer issue
Description: Boeing Co  said late on Tuesday it will make two new software updates to the 737 MAX's flight control computer as it works to win regulatory approval to resume flights after the jet was grounded following two fatal crashes in five months.

Headlines: Levi's coming back to life in China as stores reopen, online sales rise
Description: Levi Strauss & Co  said on Tuesday a majority of its stores in China, where the coronavirus outbreak first emerged in December, were open with sales recovering on a weekly basis and digital sales rising last month.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury talks continue on $25 billion in aviation grants
Description: Talks between U.S. airlines and the Treasury Department over  how to award $25 billion in cash grants earmarked for payroll assistance due to the coronavirus outbreak were set to continue into the evening Tuesday, people briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: KKR sets up $50 million international coronavirus relief fund
Description: KKR & Co Inc  has established a $50 million global relief fund to help people affected by the new coronavirus, according to a letter the U.S. private equity firm sent to its investors on Tuesday.

Headlines: WeWork sues SoftBank for dropping $3 billion tender offer
Description: A WeWork board committee that negotiated a $3 billion tender offer with SoftBank Group sued the Japanese conglomerate on Tuesday for abandoning the deal, accusing it of succumbing to "buyer's remorse" amid the novel coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Amazon testing disinfectant fog at New York warehouse after coronavirus protests
Description: Amazon.com Inc is testing the use of disinfectant fog at a warehouse in Staten Island, New York starting on Tuesday, the company told Reuters, following worker protests over the risk of coronavirus infection at the site.

Headlines: Mnuchin seeks additional $250 billion in small business relief from Congress by Friday
Description: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Tuesday he wants Congress to approve an additional $250 billion for a small business relief program by Friday.

Headlines: Trump says $70 billion in coronavirus rescue loans authorized. But where's the cash?
Description: Roughly $70 billion of a $350 billion pot of loans to cover the payrolls of ailing small businesses have been originated by U.S. lenders in recent days, President Donald Trump said on Tuesday, adding that that money was "essentially loaned."

Headlines: Refunds row escalates as airlines warn millions of jobs at risk
Description: Global airlines warned that 25 million jobs across the world could be at risk from the coronavirus air travel downturn, and held out against offering refunds to passengers as cash runs out.

Headlines: Airlines cannot afford to refund cancelled tickets: IATA
Description: Global airlines cannot afford to refund cancelled flights because of the coronavirus crisis, said the head of the industry's representative body IATA, and carriers are issuing vouchers instead as they conserve cash to survive.

Headlines: U.S. SEC issues compliance focus areas for brokers before new rules take effect
Description: The head of the examination office at the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on Tuesday published details about the expected scope and content for compliance with a new rule requiring broker-dealers and investment advisers to disclose potential conflicts of interest.

Headlines: Oil drop saps gains as Wall Street fades late
Description: Wall Street fell on Tuesday, as a drop in oil prices steepened in the latter stages of the session and erased early gains built on tentative signs that coronavirus outbreaks in some of the biggest U.S. hot spots may be leveling.

Headlines: U.S. economy will eventually reopen but with big changes: Kudlow
Description: The Trump administration is aiming to reopen the U.S. economy when the nation's top health experts give the go-ahead, but Americans' lives will be drastically different, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Former Fed chief Bernanke sees bad year, no quick recovery
Description: The U.S. economy could shrink 30% or more this quarter as stay-at-home orders aimed at slowing the coronavirus outbreak choke off business, and it could be a couple of years before the economy regains its footing, former Federal Reserve Chair Ben Bernanke said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wall Street volatility raises fears of another selloff
Description: The evaporation of a rally on Wall Street in the closing minutes of Tuesday's session shows that many investors fear the U.S. stock market is in danger of a renewed tumble due to uncertainty surrounding  the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Jobless Americans to see extra payments as soon as this week
Description: Americans who have lost their jobs due to the coronavirus outbreak will start getting enhanced jobless benefits as soon as this week as states deploy hundreds of billions of dollars in federal aid, state officials said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Oil drops on growing crude glut, doubts over output cuts
Description: Oil slumped on Tuesday in the face of swelling crude supplies and weak fuel demand due to the coronavirus pandemic, while investors also grew cautious over expectations that the world's biggest producers would quickly agree on output cuts.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury liquidity on the mend, but without Fed remains fragile
Description: Some measures of liquidity in the $17 trillion U.S. Treasury market are almost back to normal, thanks to the Federal Reserve's giant purchases, after drying up two weeks ago at the height of the coronavirus panic, but trading conditions remain challenging.

Headlines: Exxon lops 30% off 2020 spending, deeper and later than rivals
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp  on Tuesday throttled back investment in shale, natural gas and deep water production, cutting planned capital spending by 30% this year as the coronavirus pandemic saps energy demand and oil prices tumble.

Headlines: Exxon could delay third Guyana project as government review drags on
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp  said on Tuesday that production at the Payara project, its third development in Guyana, could be postponed due to delays in government approvals as the company scales back spending elsewhere due to the crude price crash.

Headlines: BlackRock's Aladdin investment management platform to be hosted on Microsoft's cloud
Description: BlackRock Inc, the world's largest asset manager, has partnered with Microsoft Corp to have its Aladdin investment and risk management system hosted on the Microsoft Azure cloud platform, the companies said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Investors await data on coronavirus drugs as market rally builds
Description: Clinical data on potential treatments for the new coronavirus could help sustain a market bounce that has buoyed stocks after last month's plunge, as investors look for signs that authorities may be able to stabilize the pandemic.

Headlines: Small U.S. businesses were already struggling. Then coronavirus hit
Description: Many small businesses were struggling with funding shortfalls and financial challenges even before the coronavirus pandemic hit, leaving them with little cash on hand to weather the slowdown caused by the virus, according to data released by the Federal Reserve on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. banking regulators encourage 'prudent efforts' by banks to help borrowers
Description: U.S. banks should feel welcome to pursue "prudent efforts" to help borrowers impacted by the coronavirus pandemic, according to a new joint statement issued by banking regulators Tuesday.

Headlines: Mexico asks U.S., Canada to grant automakers transition for USMCA rules
Description: Mexico's government on Tuesday asked the United States and Canada to grant its automotive industry extra time to adapt its supply chains as the deadline for implementing a new North American trade deal approaches.

Headlines: Hopes of progress against virus lift stocks; dollar falls
Description: World stock markets posted sharp gains on Tuesday as signs of progress in curbing the spread of the novel coronavirus in both Europe and the United States fueled investors' appetite for risk.

Headlines: Netflix rolls out more features for parental control globally
Description: Netflix Inc on Tuesday rolled out a number of features for parental control on its streaming platform, including options to filter out select titles and review what children are watching.

Headlines: United Airlines drastically cuts California flights to match demand
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc said on Tuesday it was temporarily, but significantly, reducing daily flying in and out of Los Angeles and San Francisco airports to better match demand that has dropped due to the new coronavirus.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs must face class action over conflicts of interest, risky mortgages
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc must face a shareholder class action accusing the bank of hiding conflicts of interest, including behind-the-scenes dealings with a prominent hedge fund manager, when creating risky subprime securities before the 2008 financial crisis.

Headlines: Facebook launches new chat app for couples
Description: Facebook Inc on Tuesday launched a new messaging app for couples called "Tuned" that allows them to chat, share photos and music as well as have a timeline of shared memories.

Headlines: U.S. SEC's Clayton says companies seeking bailouts must disclose plans, communicate with investors
Description: The head of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) said on Tuesday that companies in discussions about bailouts resulting from the economic impact of the coronavirus outbreak should disclose to investors where they stand.

Headlines: U.S. treasury secretary to seek additional $250 billion for small business
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Tuesday that he would seek an additional $250 billion to support small businesses hurt by the widespread economic slowdown.

Headlines: TJX to furlough most of about 286,000 staff as stores stay shut amid pandemic
Description: Off-price retailer TJX Companies Inc  said on Tuesday it would furlough most of the employees at its stores and distribution centers, as outlets remain closed to curb the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Layoffs, closures to wipe out 6.7% of working hours worldwide in second quarter: ILO
Description: Workplace disruptions caused by the COVID-19 pandemic are expected to wipe out labor equivalent to the effort of 195 million full-time workers, or 6.7% of hours clocked worldwide, in the second quarter of this year, the International Labour Organization (ILO) said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Colombian businesses call for more aid after quarantine extension
Description: Colombian businesses on Tuesday called on the government to expand measures to help companies weather coronavirus, after President Ivan Duque extended a nationwide lockdown by two weeks.

Headlines: OPEC+ needs to agree output numbers before meeting: Iran oil minister
Description: There needs to be an agreement on oil production numbers before any future meeting between OPEC and non-OPEC members, Iran's Oil Minister Bijan Zanganeh tweeted on Tuesday.

Headlines: Lufthansa to discontinue Germanwings in sweeping restructuring
Description: Lufthansa  will close its Germanwings low-cost airline as part of a broader overhaul including capacity cuts across the group, it said on Tuesday as it warned it could take years for the industry to recover from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Online meal delivery firms knocked off course by coronavirus crisis
Description: The lockdown of millions of people at home across the globe due to the coronavirus should have been the perfect recipe for success for the burgeoning online meal delivery market.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. grants GE license to sell engines for China's new airplane
Description: The Trump administration on Tuesday granted a license to General Electric Co  to supply engines for China's new COMAC C919 passenger jet, a spokeswoman for the company said.

Headlines: AT&T takes on $5.5 billion loan to boost 'financial flexibility'
Description: AT&T Inc.  on Tuesday announced a $5.5 billion term-loan agreement, which it said would give the company "financial flexibility" during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Side effects: Fuel demand crash shuts U.S. ethanol plants, meatpackers lack refrigerant
Description: A slew of U.S. ethanol plants have shut down as fuel demand has collapsed during the coronavirus outbreak, and meatpackers have been hit by a worrying side-effect: less carbon dioxide is now available to chill beef, poultry and pork.

Headlines: Huawei laments U.S. plans to crimp its global chip supply
Description: A Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] executive on Tuesday described as "unfortunate" plans by the U.S. government to curb the Chinese telecom equipment maker's access to global chip supplies.

Headlines: Southwest building June flight schedule to reflect 'different phases of recovery'
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  said on Tuesday it would publish this week a new flight schedule for June 6 to June 27 with overall flight activity dropping by about 50% while taking into account "different phases of the recovery anticipated ahead."

Headlines: Honda, Nissan furlough U.S. workers as auto demand plummets
Description: Honda Motor Co  and Nissan Motor Co  on Tuesday said they had furloughed thousands of workers at their U.S. operations as the coronavirus pandemic slashes demand for cars in the country.

Headlines: Cineworld suspends dividend, defers pay to cushion virus hit; shares soar
Description: Cineworld's  shares soared 36% on Tuesday after it suspended its dividend and said it was in talks with landlords, film studios and major suppliers to offset the impact of the closure of all its 787 cinemas due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Japan's SoftBank to invest $48 million in Brazil pet products site Petlove
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp  reached an agreement to invest 250 million reais ($48 million) in pet products online retailer Petlove, the companies said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: In a first, China knocks U.S. from top spot in global patent race
Description: China was the biggest source of applications for international patents in the world last year, pushing the United States out of the top spot it has held since the global system was set up more than 40 years ago, the U.N. patent agency said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Graphic: Oil majors cut 2020 spending by 22% after prices slump
Description: The world's biggest oil and gas companies are cutting spending this year following a collapse in oil prices driven by a slump in demand because of the coronavirus crisis and a price war between top exporters Saudi Arabia and Russia.

Headlines: Macy's finance chief Paula Price to step down in May
Description: Department store chain operator Macy's Inc  said on Tuesday Chief Financial Officer Paula Price would step down from the role next month after nearly two years on the job.

Headlines: Global health fund calls for $8 billion to begin COVID-19 exit strategy
Description: A leading global health fund has asked international businesses and governments to provide $8 billion to support development and production of COVID-19 tests, drugs and vaccines.

Headlines: Samsung first-quarter beats estimates; chips likely to prop up virus-hit second-quarter
Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  said on Tuesday its first-quarter operating profit likely managed to rise slightly from a slump a year earlier, as solid chip sales helped cushion the blow from the coronavirus pandemic on smartphones and TVs.

Headlines: VW plans to partially reopen plant in Spain's Navarra on April 20
Description: German carmaker Volkswagen  hopes to partially reopen its plant in Spain's Navarra region on April 20 after its closure in mid-March due to the coronavirus outbreak, a spokesman for the plant said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Size of OPEC+ oil cuts will depend on how much others cut: source
Description: Any final agreement for how much OPEC and its allies, a group know as OPEC+, will cut during their talks on Thursday would depend on the volumes that other producers such as the United States, Canada and Brazil are willing to reduce, an OPEC source said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Demand for Luckin app surges as Chinese rush to drink up after admission of fraud
Description: Luckin Coffee's app has rocketed to become the second most popular in China as consumers rushed to claim a free drink that it has long offered for downloading, worried the chain might collapse after it said much of its sales last year were fabricated.

Headlines: As coronavirus hits tourism, Wizz Air finds new role
Description: Hungarian low-cost airline Wizz Air  is repatriating citizens and transporting medical equipment for east European governments, in a move coupling one-off charter traffic with savvy government relations amid the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: France's ADP loses 3 million euros a day in sales due to coronavirus - CEO
Description: French airports operator ADP is losing more than 3 million euros  ($3.25 million) in sales a day due to the coronavirus crisis, Chief Executive Augustin de Romanet said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Asian companies pose lower dividend risk due to stronger finances
Description: Asian firms appear better equipped to pay stable dividends compared with their western counterparts that are constrained by highly levered balance-sheets and a need to preserve cash during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Employees worried about Valero response to virus cases at Texas refinery: sources
Description: Employees at Valero Energy Corp's Port Arthur, Texas, refinery expressed worries about the company's slow response to keep the coronavirus from spreading there after two workers tested positive, four people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Outbreak shows signs of leveling off in New York, New Jersey, but vigilance urged
Description: The governors of New York, New Jersey and Louisiana pointed to tentative signs on Monday that the coronavirus outbreak may be starting to plateau in their states but warned against complacency as the death toll nationwide approached 11,000.

Headlines: France's Thales withdraws final dividend, suspends outlook
Description: France's Thales  on Tuesday became the latest major company to slash its dividend, suspend profit guidance and top up liquidity in response to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: China's Ucar, in which Luckin chairman is top shareholder, halts shares
Description: China's Ucar Inc, in which Luckin Coffee  Chairman Charles Zhengyao Lu is the biggest shareholder, suspended trading of its shares on Tuesday after regulators questioned the car service provider about how the alleged fraud at Luckin would impact it.

Headlines: Toshiba should sell stake in ex-chip unit at IPO, says HK activist fund in letter
Description: A Hong Kong-based activist investor in Toshiba Corp  has asked the Japanese conglomerate to sell its entire stake in Kioxia Holdings when the flash memory chip firm is listed in an IPO that could raise up to $32 billion, according to a letter reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Cemex resumes Mexico operations after brief pause due to coronavirus
Description: Mexican cement company Cemex said on Monday it would resume operations in the country, hours after announcing a pause, as fresh guidelines from the government permitted such a move.

Headlines: UPS employee dies of COVID-19 infection in Kentucky
Description: A United Parcel Service Inc worker employed in Kentucky died over the weekend from a COVID-19 infection, Gov. Andy Beshear said at a public health briefing on Monday.

Headlines: Hit by coronavirus, Fiat Chrysler, Peugeot seek to boost cash before merger
Description: With their sales hammered by the coronavirus outbreak, car makers Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot's owner PSA have postponed their shareholder meetings and are looking at ways to boost cash reserves ahead of their planned merger.

Headlines: NYSE in talks with SEC to ease listing rules during coronavirus volatility
Description: The New York Stock Exchange said on Monday it was in talks with regulators to temporarily ease its listing requirements to take the strain off companies that may have fallen out of compliance due to the market rout spurred by the coronavirus.

Headlines: Fed says it will provide financing against new U.S. 'payroll protection' loans
Description: The Federal Reserve on Monday moved to bolster a new small-business lending program by allowing banks to turn those loans over to the U.S. central bank for cash, easing concerns among banks about getting stuck holding the low interest loans.

Headlines: Wall Street soars on hopes of slowing coronavirus deaths
Description: U.S. stocks rocketed higher on Monday, with each of the major indexes rallying at least 7%, after a fall in the daily death toll in New York, the country's biggest coronavirus hot spot, fueled optimism a leveling off of the pandemic was on the horizon.

Headlines: Trump says OPEC has not asked him for a U.S. oil production cut
Description: President Donald Trump said on Monday that OPEC had not pressed him to ask U.S. oil producers to reduce their output to support global prices, which have been hard-hit by the economic fallout of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Alaska warned U.S. government its largest regional airline was on verge of collapse: letter
Description: Alaska's congressional delegation warned U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin last week that many of its airlines, including its largest regional carrier, RavnAir Group, were on the verge of collapse, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Airbnb secures $1 billion investment from Silver Lake, Sixth Street
Description: Airbnb said on Monday private equity firms Silver Lake and Sixth Street Partners will invest $1 billion in the U.S. home rental company, bolstering its finances at a time when the coronavirus outbreak has roiled the travel and leisure industry.

Headlines: Allstate to return $600 million in auto premiums as coronavirus cuts driving
Description: Allstate Corp , one of the largest U.S. auto insurers, said on Monday it would return more than $600 million in premiums to customers as many Americans drive less due to stay-at-home orders aimed at curbing the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Boeing suspending 787 production at South Carolina plant
Description: Boeing Co  said on Monday it would suspend production of its 787 airplane at its facilities in South Carolina amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: White House considering U.S. Treasury coronavirus bond: Kudlow
Description: White House advisers have been discussing the possibility of a coronavirus-related U.S. Treasury bond, President Donald Trump's economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Monday.

Headlines: OPEC+ likely to agree to cut production if U.S. joins effort: sources
Description: Major oil producers including Saudi Arabia and Russia are likely to agree to cut production at a Thursday meeting but only if the United States joins the effort, aimed at coping with the disastrous effect of the coronavirus on fuel demand, three OPEC+ sources told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: World stocks jump on less dire virus data, oil falls after OPEC+ delay
Description: World stock markets jumped on Monday, encouraged by slowdowns in coronavirus-related deaths and new cases in some global hot spots, while oil prices tumbled again due to a delay in talks between Saudi Arabia and Russia to cut supply.

Headlines: Honda, Fiat Chrysler aim to restart U.S., Canada auto production in May
Description: Honda Motor Co  and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV said on Monday they hope to restart U.S. and Canadian auto production in May amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Lufthansa to discuss permanently grounding Germanwings: sources
Description: Lufthansa  will discuss permanently grounding its Germanwings low-cost airline unit at a management board meeting on Tuesday, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Coronavirus muddies U.S. economic data as business closures push down response rates
Description: A near total closure of U.S. businesses as authorities try to control the spread of the novel coronavirus could make U.S. economic data unreliable in the coming months and harder to get a clearer picture of the severity of the recession caused by the virus.

Headlines: Oil falls after Saudi Arabia, Russia delay meeting, Cushing stockpiles soar
Description: Oil prices slumped on Monday, pulling back from last week's gains after Saudi Arabia and Russia delayed a meeting of oil producers aimed at resolving growing worldwide oversupply as the coronavirus pandemic pummels demand.

Headlines: CVS ramps up drive-through coronavirus testing sites with faster kits
Description: CVS Health Corp , called on by the Trump administration last month to help test Americans for infections from the new coronavirus, said it was launching two offsite testing locations with Abbott Laboratories'  faster diagnostic kit and would be able to handle 1,000 tests per day.

Headlines: Tiger at New York's Bronx Zoo tests positive for coronavirus
Description: A tiger at the Bronx Zoo in New York City has tested positive for the respiratory disease caused by the novel coronavirus, in the first known case of a human infecting an animal and making it sick, the zoo's chief veterinarian said on Sunday.

Headlines: Airbus announces additional production pauses
Description: Airbus  said on Monday it had decided additional production pauses, in Germany and in the United States, in response to an industry-wide slowdown triggered by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Capri furloughs all North America retail staff, sees stores opening around June 1
Description: Capri Holdings Ltd  will furlough all its 7,000 retail staff in North America due to the coronavirus outbreak and expects to reopen stores around June 1, the owner of Michael Kors and Versace brands said on Monday.

Headlines: Zoom shares slip over security concerns, rising competition
Description: Shares of Zoom Video Communications Inc  fell 8% on Monday, adding to their sharp declines in the past few days, as the video conferencing app battles privacy concerns and increased competition from deep-pocketed rivals.

Headlines: Alaska Air expects to lower April and May capacity by 80%
Description: The U.S. carrier had earlier planned to reduce its April capacity by at least 10% and May capacity by at least 15%.

Headlines: Canada, U.S. farms face crop losses due to foreign worker delays
Description: Mandatory coronavirus quarantines of seasonal foreign workers in Canada could hurt that country's fruit and vegetable output this year, and travel problems related to the pandemic could also leave U.S. farmers with fewer workers than usual.

Headlines: Exclusive: Qatar Petroleum - coronavirus turmoil will not stop LNG expansion abroad
Description: Qatar Petroleum (QP) is pressing ahead with foreign as well as domestic expansion despite the global market turmoil caused by the coronavirus pandemic, its chief executive told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Luckin Coffee chairman defaults on loan, surrenders company shares
Description: Luckin Coffee  Chairman Charles Zhengyao Lu and Chief Executive Jenny Zhiya Qian have handed over shares in the embattled Chinese coffee chain to lenders after a company controlled by Lu's family defaulted on a $518 million margin loan, one of the banks said on Monday.

Headlines: GSK to partner with Vir for potential COVID-19 treatments, invest $250 million
Description: British drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline will invest $250 million in Vir Biotechnology Inc and collaborate to develop potential antibody treatments for COVID-19, the disease caused by the new coronavirus, the companies said on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Qatar Petroleum not scaling down LNG expansion despite delay in bids - CEO
Description: Qatar Petroleum will postpone the start of production from its new gas facilities to 2025 due to a delay in the bidding process, but is not downsizing the world's largest liquefied natural gas project despite concerns of a mounting glut, its chief executive told Reuters.

Headlines: JPMorgan CEO Dimon calls 'bad recession', mulls suspending 2020 dividend
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co's top boss, Jamie Dimon , on Monday said he sees a "bad recession" in 2020, and that the largest U.S. bank could suspend its dividend if the coronavirus crisis deepens.

Headlines: Peugeot parent secures further 3 billion euros of loans
Description: Peugeot-owner PSA  said on Monday it had secured a further 3 billion euros ($3.3 billion) of loans, strengthening its financial position in the wake of the hit to the global automotive industry from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: BMW sees demand falling further after first quarter sales plunge due to coronavirus
Description: BMW  is expecting a further decline in global demand as the coronavirus outbreak takes its toll, a spokesman said on Monday, after the German carmaker reported a 20.6% drop in first quarter sales to 477,111 vehicles.

Headlines: IBM taps former Bank of America CTO to oversee cloud business
Description: International Business Machines Corp  on Monday named former Bank of America Corp  top technology executive Howard Boville head of its cloud business, as Arvind Krishna takes over from long-time chief Ginni Rometty.

Headlines: Total among companies seeking force majeure on EDF contracts: sources
Description: Energy major Total  is among several power suppliers that tried to declare force majeure on buying nuclear power from EDF, sources said, as the coronavirus outbreak has pushed prices in the French electricity market far below existing contracts.

Headlines: As infections balloon, coronavirus squeezes Europe's armed forces
Description: Military forces across Europe have scaled back operations and imposed stricter rules on personnel to try to stem the spread of the coronavirus among staff who often live and work in close quarters, making them more vulnerable to infection.

Headlines: ILO annual gathering of labour ministers postponed for a year
Description: An annual gathering of the world's labour ministers will not take place this year because of the coronavirus pandemic, but will convene in June 2021, the International Labour Organization (ILO) said on Monday.

Headlines: Uber connects out-of-work U.S. ride-hail drivers to delivery, production jobs
Description: Uber Technologies Inc  said on Monday its app will list job openings in the delivery, food production and grocery industry that its U.S. drivers can access during a slump in ride-hailing demand due to the coronavirus.

Headlines: EasyJet founder steps up battle with management over Airbus order
Description: Stelios Haji-Ioannou, easyJet's  founder and biggest shareholder, on Monday intensified his battle with the airline's management over a huge aircraft order with Airbus  which he says it should cancel.

Headlines: EasyJet requests draw down of $500 million credit facility, explores more funding
Description: EasyJet  said on Monday it has requested to fully draw down its $500 million credit facility, secured against aircraft assets, and will continue to explore funding options due to a possibly prolonged grounding of its jets following the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Norwegian Air's March traffic tumbles 60% amid virus lockdown
Description: Norwegian Air's  passenger volume fell by 60% year-on-year in March as it grounded planes amid efforts to halt the spread of the new coronavirus, and will book a hedging loss of $102 million as the cost of fuel has plunged.

Headlines: BT boss gives salary to health workers, lifts pay for key staff
Description: The head of Britain's biggest telecoms firm BT  said he would donate his salary to health workers for at least six months and award a pay rise to his frontline staff who are maintaining broadband networks during the COVID-19 shutdown.

Headlines: SeaWorld CEO steps down after just five months on the job
Description: SeaWorld Entertainment Inc  said on Monday Sergio Rivera, the theme park operator's chief executive officer for just five months, has resigned due to disagreements with the board.

Headlines: HSBC Hong Kong shareholders mull legal action over dividend suspension
Description: HSBC  shareholders in Hong Kong are calling for an extraordinary meeting with the bank's management and considering legal action against its decision to scrap dividend payments.

Headlines: Safaricom, Vodacom finalise M-Pesa acquisition from Britain's Vodafone
Description: Kenya's leading telecom firm Safaricom  and South Africa's Vodacom  said on Monday that they had completed the acquisition of popular mobile money platform M-Pesa from Britain's Vodafone .

Headlines: American joins United, others in suspending more NYC flights on coronavirus spike
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  said late Sunday it would suspend more flights in and out of New York City's three main airports for about a month, joining other airlines that have cut flights to the area following a spike in coronavirus cases.

Headlines: Kia compact vehicles contractor suspends production
Description: A South Korean contract manufacturer for Kia Motors'  compact vehicles has suspended production, a company official said on Monday, citing a drop in overseas demand as the coronavirus outbreak has spread across Europe.

Headlines: Tesla engineers show ventilator prototype on YouTube
Description: Engineers at Tesla Inc  showed a prototype for a ventilator on Sunday evening in a video published on the company's YouTube channel, as hospitals around the country overwhelmed by coronavirus patients face device shortages.

Headlines: Solid chip sales unlikely to cushion Samsung's virus-hit first quarter profit
Description: The coronavirus-driven global shift to working from home is set to have boosted demand for Samsung Electronics' memory chips from laptop makers and data centres, but first-quarter profits are likely to remain flat as the outbreak weakened consumer electronics sales.

Headlines: Lufthansa's Belgian carrier suspends flights until mid-May
Description: Belgium's Brussels Airlines, a Lufthansa  subsidiary, has extended its suspension of flights until at least May 15, it said on Monday.

Headlines: Top Michelin executives agree to pay cuts to help with COVID-19 response
Description: French tyre company Michelin  said on Monday that its leading executives had agreed to take pay cuts as a gesture of solidarity to help deal with the negative effects of the hit to its business from the COVID-19 outbreak.

Headlines: As Germany reels from coronavirus, some officials debate impact on banks
Description: As Germany rolls out a 750 billion-euro economic stimulus package, officials and experts are discussing whether German lenders, including Deutsche Bank AG and Commerzbank AG, will be able to weather the economic fallout of coronavirus without state help.

Headlines: Dubai's Emaar suspends construction projects due to virus - sources
Description: Emaar Properties , the largest listed developer in the United Arab Emirates, has suspended work on major projects in Dubai, sources familiar with the matter said, as the coronavirus pandemic exacerbates a real estate slowdown in the business hub.

Headlines: Take Five: Life in the time of corona
Description: The world's biggest economy won't be open for business by Easter, as U.S. President Donald Trump had hoped, but the second biggest economy may come close. How China fares offers a guide to other countries when their coronavirus lockdowns lift.

Headlines: Rolls-Royce scraps targets, dividend on pandemic hit
Description: Rolls-Royce  is scrapping its targets and final dividend to shore up its finances as the British aero-engine maker's customers around the world ground planes due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: NMC in talks with lenders to avoid administration
Description: Troubled hospital group NMC Health  said on Monday it is in talks with Abu Dhabi Commercial Bank , seeking to convince it to withdraw an application that the lender had filed proposing that NMC be placed under administration.

Headlines: Wall St. looks for light at end of tunnel, sees risk stocks will re-test lows
Description: Wall Street analysts and investors see a risk that stocks could retest recent lows in the coming days or weeks as they worry about the spread of the virus and its impact on the economy, although some spot glimmers of light at the end of the tunnel.

Headlines: Rolls-Royce to ditch targets and suspend dividend due to coronavirus: FT
Description: British aero-engine maker Rolls-Royce  will abandon its targets on profits, cash and deliveries, and suspend its dividend, as airlines around the world ground planes due to the coronavirus outbreak, the Financial Times reported late on Sunday.

Headlines: Oil prices decline $3 a barrel as market remains uncertain on supply outlook
Description: Global benchmark oil prices traded as much as $3 a barrel lower as the market opened for Monday's trading session, reflecting fears of oversupply after Saudi Arabia and Russia postponed to Thursday a meeting about a potential pact to cut production.

Headlines: Exclusive: Silver Lake to seek more than $16 billion for buyout fund - sources
Description: Private equity firm Silver Lake Partners is preparing to seek at least $16 billion from investors for its sixth flagship buyout fund, braving the economic uncertainty of the coronavirus outbreak, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Boeing extends Washington state production shutdown indefinitely
Description: Boeing Co  said on Sunday it would extend the suspension of production operations at its Washington state facilities until further notice amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. banks to defend dividend payments in stress tests: FT
Description: U.S. banks are expected to defend their dividend payments when they submit their annual capital plans to the Federal Reserve on Monday for the upcoming stress tests, the Financial Times reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the situation.

Headlines: Fed's Bullard says another coronavirus economic relief bill may not be needed
Description: A top official at the U.S. Federal Reserve said on Sunday the $2.3 trillion economic relief bill approved by Congress was appropriately sized and that a further relief effort may not be needed if support efforts are well executed.

Headlines: How one Silicon Valley factory keeps running in the age of coronavirus
Description: The managers at Green Circuits — a small Silicon Valley electronics factory — thought they would have to close when the San Francisco Bay Area directed non-essential businesses to shut almost three weeks ago.

Headlines: United slashes New York-area flights due to coronavirus
Description: United Airlines  said late Saturday it will drastically reduce flights to two New York City airports amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: How the coronavirus job cuts played out by sector and demographics
Description: The job losses suffered in March as the U.S. economy shut down in the face of the novel coronavirus pandemic were widespread but still were disproportionately felt in a handful of employment sectors and by women, the young and the less educated.

Headlines: OPEC+ meeting delayed as Saudi Arabia and Russia row over oil price collapse: sources
Description: OPEC and Russia have postponed a Monday meeting to discuss oil output cuts until April 9, OPEC sources said on Saturday, as a dispute between Moscow and Saudi Arabia over who is to blame for plunging crude prices intensified.

Headlines: Trump threatens tariffs on oil imports to 'protect' U.S. energy workers
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he would impose tariffs on crude imports if he has to "protect" U.S. energy workers from the oil price crash that has been exacerbated by a war between Russia and Saudi Arabia over market share.

Headlines: U.S. dairy farmers dump milk as pandemic upends food markets
Description: Dairy farmer Jason Leedle felt his stomach churn when he got the call on Tuesday evening.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon in contact with coronavirus test makers for potential screenings on employees
Description: Amazon.com Inc has been in contact with the CEOs of two coronavirus test makers as it considers how to screen its staff and reduce the risk of infection at its warehouses, according to internal meeting notes seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Capital One says it won't use CFTC waiver related to oil lending
Description: U.S. lender Capital One Financial Corp  said on Saturday it would not use a U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) waiver after commodity price volatility lifted the bank's derivatives exposure toward a key regulatory threshold.

Headlines: The watchdogs overseeing the $2.3 trillion U.S. bailout
Description: Who's watching over the U.S. government's largest bailout in history - the $2.3 trillion in fiscal stimulus to fight the economic impact of the coronavirus?

Headlines: Mexican president calls on Russia, Saudi Arabia to end oil price war
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Saturday called on Russia and Saudi Arabia to reach a deal soon and end their oil price war to avoid deepening the oil price crisis.

Headlines: Trump says will ask Congress for more small business funds if money runs out
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he would ask Congress for more money to make loans to small businesses struggling with the economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak if the original $349 billion allocated in a fiscal stimulus bill runs out.

Headlines: Tesla cuts contractors from California, Nevada factories: CNBC
Description: Tesla Inc  is cutting contractors from its U.S. car and battery plants, CNBC reported on Friday, citing workers and a contract staffing agency.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Investors look to coronavirus data to support stabilizing markets
Description: Investors are parsing a broad range of signals, from infection counts to more traditional indicators, for clues on the trajectory markets may take in coming weeks as the pandemic caused by the novel coronavirus continues to spread.

Headlines: OPEC+ debates biggest-ever oil cut, awaits U.S. efforts
Description: By Rania El Gamal, Alex Lawler, Vladimir Soldatkin and Laila Kearney

Headlines: Saudi energy minister rejects Russian comments about kingdom's withdrawal from OPEC+ deal
Description: The Saudi energy minister on Saturday rejected Russia's remarks that the kingdom withdrew last month from a deal to cut output.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia denies withdrawing from OPEC+ deal, says Russia was the one that withdrew
Description: The Saudi foreign minister said early on Saturday that a statement attributed to Russia's President Vladimir Putin about the kingdom's withdrawal from the OPEC+ deal is not correct, and that Russia is the one that withdrew, state agency (SPA) reported.

Headlines: U.S. airlines apply for U.S. payroll help but terms still unclear
Description: Major U.S. airlines applied on Friday for payroll grants from the U.S. Treasury meant to keep workers employed during a sharp downturn resulting from the coronavirus outbreak, but while talks over the terms were expected to continue in coming days some warned the funds would not be enough to help them through their toughest crisis ever.

Headlines: U.S. SEC official urges delay in public comment on agency rule changes
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's lone Democratic commissioner on Friday called for a delay in pending rule changes due to the coronavirus outbreak, while cautioning against excessive regulatory relief in the rush to assist companies struggling with fallout from the pandemic.

Headlines: Why sweetened layoff benefits may be at odds with U.S. loan program
Description: The generous U.S. unemployment benefits rolled out to blunt the economic harm caused by the coronavirus could have an unintended effect: it may actually be an incentive for companies to choose layoffs rather than keep staff on their books.

Headlines: Explainer: Antitrust law won't get in the way of U.S. acting to raise oil prices
Description: It is illegal for oil producers to meet to discuss pushing up oil prices under U.S. antitrust law, but perfectly legal if state regulators or the federal government set lower production levels for them, U.S. antitrust experts said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. warns airlines to quickly refund tickets after canceled flights
Description: The U.S. Transportation Department on Friday issued a notice to airlines reminding them they are obligated to refund tickets when they cancel a flight or make a significant flight schedule change that passengers opt not to accept, but will not take any immediate action against airlines.

Headlines: Exxon plays on virus worries in Baytown contract talks: union official
Description: A union official accused Exxon Mobil Corp on Friday of using "scare" tactics and exploiting economic uncertainty caused by the coronavirus pandemic in negotiations with workers at its Baytown, Texas, refinery, allegations the company denied.

Headlines: Trump invokes Defense Production Act to stop export of masks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday signed an order directing his administration to stop N-95 face masks and other personal protective equipment needed in the fight against the coronavirus pandemic from being exported to other countries.

Headlines: Berkshire Hathaway sells part of Delta, Southwest airline stakes
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  said on Friday it sold about 18% of its stake in Delta Air Lines Inc  and 4% of its holdings in Southwest Airlines Co  this week, as the coronavirus pandemic drives the airline industry into perhaps its biggest crisis ever.

Headlines: GM reduces loan refinancing target, may pay up for new debt
Description: NEW YORK (LPC) - General Motors Co (GM) will seek to extend maturities on US$6bn in revolving loans rather than refinance a US$16.5bn credit facility following discussions with its bank group during an unprecedented health crisis in the US.

Headlines: U.S. businesses swarm coronavirus bailout fund after days of confusion
Description: Like many small business owners, New York City restaurateur Dan Kluger spent his Friday scrambling to apply for a loan under the U.S. government's $349 billion small business bailout fund, which officially launched in the morning.

Headlines: Mexico without Corona: Brewers suspend production during pandemic
Description: Mexicans fretted about beer supplies on Friday after Dutch brewer Heineken said it will suspend production at its seven plants in Mexico to comply with coronavirus containment measures, following a similar announcement by rival Modelo.

Headlines: Trump aims to ease U.S. oil industry's cash crunch, no plan to trim output: sources
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has directed his cabinet to find ways to ease a cash crunch in the drilling industry after oil company executives told him in a Friday meeting it was among their top concerns, according to three sources briefed on the matter.

Headlines: Southwest expects talks on U.S. payroll grant terms over next several days
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  said on Friday it has applied for U.S. payroll grants but cannot disclose details as the next several days could involve conversations on the terms of any agreement.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz cuts output at three plants, adds shifts for mac & cheese
Description: Kraft Heinz Co  said on Friday it has moved to significantly reduce production at three plants providing restaurant supplies amid the new coronavirus outbreak, but its CEO noted the company has added shifts at others to meet demand for packaged foods like macaroni and cheese.

Headlines: Wall Street falls as coronavirus shreds U.S. payrolls
Description: Wall Street's main indexes fell more than 1.5% on Friday as the coronavirus abruptly ended a record U.S. job growth streak of 113 months, intensifying fears of a deep economic slowdown.

Headlines: Soaring unemployment increases odds U.S. banks will cut dividends
Description: Questions are building about whether big U.S. banks will have to cut dividends later this year as the coronavirus crisis puts a record portion of Americans out of work, making it difficult for borrowers to pay back loans.

Headlines: Occidental names new CFO in latest management change
Description: Oil and gas producer Occidental Petroleum Corp  on Friday named company insider Robert Peterson as its new chief financial officer.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon to delay Prime Day event due to coronavirus, outlines cloud risks
Description: Amazon.com Inc  is postponing its major summer shopping event, Prime Day, until at least August and expects a potential $100 million hit from excess devices it might now sell at a discount, according to internal meeting notes seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Large U.S. banks to take small business loan applications next week: Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday he expects all large U.S. banks to be participating in a newly launched, $350 billion small business coronavirus rescue loan program by next week, with community banks issuing most of the loans so far.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler postpones shareholders' meeting and resolution on dividend to late June
Description: Fiat Chrysler  said on Friday it decided to postpone to late June its shareholders' meeting scheduled for April 16, as a consequence of the continuing coronavirus emergency.

Headlines: Walmart to limit number of customers at stores as virus crisis deepens
Description: Walmart Inc  said on Friday it would limit the number of customers in a store at a time, starting April 4, to encourage social distancing among its customers.

Headlines: Big U.S. banks start accepting small business aid requests
Description: Bank of America Corp  and JPMorgan Chase & Co  are now accepting applications for federally backed small-business loans, a sign that big U.S. banks have warmed up to the relief program after initially resisting participation.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley plans to hold annual meeting in person
Description: Morgan Stanley  plans to hold in person its annual shareholder meeting, scheduled for May 21, the Wall Street bank said on Friday, even as many companies have moved their meetings online amid the novel coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Deep oil output cuts won't offset unprecedented demand loss: IEA
Description: Deep output cuts by OPEC and other oil producing nations will not prevent a huge build up of crude, the head of the IEA said on Friday, urging the world's richest economies to discuss broader ways to stabilise oil markets.

Headlines: Canada signs agreement with Amazon Canada to manage distribution of medical equipment
Description: Canada has signed an agreement with Amazon Canada  to manage the distribution of medical equipment like masks, gloves and ventilators purchased by the Canadian government to help in its fight against the cornonavirus outbreak, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Friday.

Headlines: Dollar climbs on safe-haven bids; shrugs off horrible U.S. jobs number
Description: The dollar firmed against major currencies for a third straight day on Friday, as investors took shelter in the U.S. currency amid worsening economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Global stocks edge lower on economic toll from coronavirus, oil rallies
Description: Global stock markets sank on Friday following more signs that the COVID-19 pandemic would take a massive toll on economic growth, while oil prices continued to rally on hopes of a cut to global supply.

Headlines: Avolon cancels order for 75 Boeing MAX jets, 4 Airbus A330neo
Description: Aircraft lessor Avolon on Friday announced the cancellation of an order for 75 Boeing  737 MAX planes that were due to be delivered by 2023, saying it was adjusting its order book to the disruption caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Fed Chair Powell spoke with Trump as virus took aim at U.S.
Description: As the coronavirus bore down on the United States in February and President Donald Trump renewed his public call for interest rate cuts, he and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell conducted two previously undisclosed phone calls, calendars released by the U.S. central bank on Friday show.

Headlines: Oil surges more than 13% on hopes of output deal
Description: Crude futures surged for a second day on Friday, with both U.S. and Brent contracts posting their largest weekly percentage gains on record due to hopes that a global deal to cut crude supply worldwide will emerge early next week.

Headlines: Russia says U.S. has legal curbs on oil output cuts, but should be flexible
Description: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak said on Friday that the United States has legal restrictions on oil output cuts, but the country should be flexible with them, RIA news agency reported.

Headlines: Richmond Fed's Barkin: Employment numbers to get worse before getting better
Description: U.S. employment numbers will get worse amid the ongoing coronavirus outbreak before getting better, Richmond Federal Reserve President Thomas Barkin said in an interview with Bloomberg News.

Headlines: American Airlines applies for U.S. payroll assistance grants
Description: American Airlines, the largest U.S. airline, confirmed Friday it has applied to the U.S. Treasury for a chunk of the $25 billion payroll assistance grants approved by Congress last week.

Headlines: Global currency funds notch wins amid coronavirus volatility
Description: Global currency fund managers racked up gains in the first quarter as they benefited from the extreme volatility that the coronavirus pandemic has stoked across financial markets.

Headlines: JPMorgan says now accepting applications for federal loan program
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co , the largest U.S. lender by assets,  started accepting at Friday midday applications for loans from the federal government's paycheck protection program, according to a post on the bank's website.

Headlines: Trump says Bank of America, others doing 'great job' on small-business loans
Description: President Donald Trump hailed one of the country's largest banks, as well as many small lenders, for making small business emergency loans on the first day of a new U.S. coronavirus economic relief program.

Headlines: Constellation Brands says Mexico breweries still running amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Constellation Brands Inc , the U.S. distributor of Corona beer, said on Friday its Mexican breweries were still operational and supply to the United States was intact even as rivals suspended production due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Neiman Marcus advances bankruptcy preparations - sources
Description: Neiman Marcus Group is stepping up preparations to seek bankruptcy protection, after the coronavirus pandemic forced the debt-laden U.S. luxury department store chain to close its stores, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump says 3M 'will have a big price to pay' over face masks
Description: President Donald Trump slammed 3M Co  in a tweet late on Thursday after earlier announcing he was invoking the Defense Production Act to get the company to produce face masks.

Headlines: 3M warns against Trump's order to limit face mask exports
Description: 3M Co  said on Friday it would make more face masks for the United States to fight the coronavirus pandemic, but warned of the "humanitarian implications" of limiting supply to other countries as President Donald Trump directed.

Headlines: Coronavirus depresses U.S. payrolls, more job losses coming
Description: The U.S. economy shed 701,000 jobs in March, abruptly ending a historic 113 straight months of employment growth as stringent measures to control the novel coronavirus outbreak shuttered businesses and factories, confirming a recession is underway.

Headlines: Hedge fund Glenview off 30% as coronavirus weighs on portfolio
Description: Glenview Capital Management, the hedge fund run by Larry Robbins, has lost roughly 30% in the first three months of 2020 as the spread of the new coronavirus hurt the healthcare facilities and hospital operators the firm has invested in.

Headlines: Cisco's Webex draws record 324 million users in March
Description: Cisco Systems Inc's video-conferencing app Webex registered a record 324 million attendees in March, with usage more than doubling in the Americas, as the coronavirus-led lockdowns forced businesses to have employees work from home.

Headlines: Italy looks to safeguard biomedical valley leading fight against COVID-19
