Description: Italy plans to tighten health checks to ensure that work is not disrupted in a small northern town specialising in the production of medical supplies to tackle its coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: FedEx hoards cash, slashes CEO pay amid coronavirus threat
Description: FedEx Corp  said on Friday it would pull $1.5 billion from a credit line and slash CEO pay as stay-at-home orders aimed at stemming the spread of the coronavirus in the United States and Europe hammer demand for its lucrative express services.

Headlines: Exclusive: Airline crisis forces Airbus to consider A320 output cuts
Description: Airbus is studying a sharp cut in output of its top-selling A320 plane series amid an industry-wide slowdown triggered by the coronavirus crisis, sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Helicopters? Bailouts? Central banks move to stem coronavirus crisis
Description: Central banks are pulling out all the stops to try to shield their economies from the new coronavirus pandemic, raising questions about whether they risk crossing a line by bailing out governments that are massively raising their spending.

Headlines: Coronavirus-led global recession to be deeper than thought but hopefully short: Reuters poll
Description: The global recession that economists polled by Reuters say is under way will be deeper than thought a few weeks ago due to the coronavirus pandemic, although most are clinging to hopes for a swift rebound.

Headlines: U.S. biofuels industry seeks bailout to weather 'collapsing demand': letter
Description: The U.S. biofuel industry has asked the Trump administration for funds from the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Commodity Credit Corporation to help it survive a demand slump triggered by the coronavirus outbreak, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Exclusive: Spain's coronavirus crisis stalls global fashion giant Inditex
Description: Inditex  has switched its clothes factories in Spain over to making medical supplies and its logistics hub has almost ground to a halt, effectively freezing the nerve centre of its business from which it supplies stores worldwide.

Headlines: Grounded planes insured for more than $160 billion: report
Description: Aeroplanes with a total insured value of more than $160 billion are grounded around the world, presenting risks for insurers, a report said on Friday.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin adds jobs, increases supplier payments to counter coronavirus impact
Description: Defense contractor Lockheed Martin Corp  said on Friday it hired about 1,000 employees in the last two weeks and increased payments to suppliers to counter the impact from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Lufthansa reviewing future of Germanwings
Description: Lufthansa  is reviewing options for its Germanwings business after ruling out a union proposal to consider shortened work hours, also known as Kurzarbeit, as a stop-gap solution for helping the low-cost unit conserve cash.

Headlines: Ford to keep Europe manufacturing ops offline at least until May 4
Description: Ford Motor Co  on Friday extended the temporary suspension of vehicle and engine production at most of its European manufacturing sites at least until May 4.

Headlines: Google data shines light on whether coronavirus lockdowns worldwide are working
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google has published charts showing how the coronavirus has brought hard-hit Italy to a standstill, led to runs on grocery stores around the world and prompted a stark drop in going-out between Mardi Gras and St. Patrick's Day.

Headlines: When will U.S. economy bottom? Economists hunt for the right view
Description: The economic crisis spawned by the coronavirus pandemic has produced a wave of grim U.S. data, with likely more to come as millions lose jobs, businesses shutter and spending stops.

Headlines: U.S. small banks have processed more than 700 small business relief loans for $2.5 million: Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday that community banks have processed hundreds of small-business loans aimed at shoring up the economy during the global coronavirus pandemic, and sounded a positive note about a new program that lenders have greeted with skepticism.

Headlines: White House's Kudlow says banks are 'ready to go' in giving small business loans
Description: Top White House economic advisor Larry Kudlow said on Friday that there would be big demand for a small-business loan program but that the banks were prepared for it despite concerns that they would be overwhelmed by the need created by an economic shutdown aimed at slowing the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. services sector growth slows; employment drops: ISM
Description: U.S. services sector activity slowed to a more than 3-1/2-year low in March, with industries reporting a moderation in new orders and decline in employment amid the coronavirus pandemic, which has brought the country to sudden stop.

Headlines: Venezuela's financial crisis exacerbated by oil price war, coronavirus
Description: A price war between world oil producers has slashed Venezuela's revenue for its top export and exacerbated the country's financial crisis as it also faces the coronavirus pandemic, U.S. sanctions and sliding crude output.

Headlines: Ford CEO Hackett's salary fell to $17.4 million in 2019
Description: Ford Motor Co  said on Friday Chief Executive Officer Jim Hackett's total compensation fell to $17.4 million in 2019 from $17.8 million in 2018.

Headlines: Instant View: Coronavirus slams U.S. jobs growth in March
Description: The U.S. economy abruptly ended a historic 113 straight months of employment growth in March, as stringent measures to control the novel coronavirus pandemic shuttered businesses and factories, all but confirming a recession is underway.

Headlines: Exclusive: Air France-KLM in talks on multibillion euro state-backed loan package
Description: Air France-KLM is in talks with banks to receive up to 6 billion euros ($6.5 billion) in loans guaranteed by the French and Dutch governments, as the airline group braces for a sustained coronavirus shutdown, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Factbox: Google location data shows slump in trips to malls, offices
Description: Google on Thursday published reports for 131 countries showing whether visits to shops, parks and workplaces dropped in March, when many governments issued stay-at-home orders to rein in the spread of COVID-19.

Headlines: Crisis haunts British banks in coronavirus relief effort
Description: With the future of many coronavirus hit firms in their hands, British banks, still scarred by the financial crisis, are worried that they are being asked by a desperate government to make loans that will never be repaid.

Headlines: Factbox: British business loan scheme strained by coronavirus
Description: Britain's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak on Friday announced updates to a scheme designed to get banks to help businesses hit by the coronavirus.

Headlines: China probes alleged fraud at Luckin Coffee, banks review IPO work
Description: China's securities regulator said on Friday it would investigate claims of fraud at Luckin Coffee Inc  and sources said some of the banks involved in the Chinese chain's successful U.S. IPO last year were reviewing their work in the listing.

Headlines: Business booms for coffin-makers in coronavirus-hit France
Description: Two hauliers load their lorries with what is fast becoming a precious commodity in France as the coronavirus pandemic takes its dreadful toll - coffins.

Headlines: BMW CEO: working to safeguard liquidity during coronavirus crisis
Description: BMW  Chief Executive Oliver Zipse said the carmaker is focussing on preserving the health of its balance sheet and workforce which have come under strain during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: 'Mom & Pop' shops worry they will be squeezed out of small business coronavirus aid
Description: Family-owned restaurants fear they could be pitted against larger competitors, hotel chains and potentially investment funds in a race starting on Friday for a $349 billion pot of money the U.S. government will offer businesses hard-hit by coronavirus.

Headlines: UK facing Depression-style hit as firms slump in March
Description: Britain's economy looks set for a slump that in the short term could be deeper than during the depression of the 1930s, as a survey showed the coronavirus crisis caused a record downturn among services and manufacturing firms in March.

Headlines: Factbox: Oil analysts sceptical about Saudi-Russian 'deal'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is stoking the possibility of Saudi Arabia and Russia negotiating oil output cuts as the coronavirus outbreak hammers demand.

Headlines: JPMorgan reaches agreement to increase stake in China mutual fund venture to 100%
Description: JPMorgan  has reached agreement with its Chinese partner to increase its stake in its Chinese mutual fund venture to 100%, joining BlackRock and Neuberger Berman to grow its presence in the world's second biggest economy.

Headlines: Mexico stops brewing Corona beer, deemed non-essential in epidemic
Description: Mexico's Grupo Modelo said on Thursday it will temporarily stop brewing Corona beer and other brands exported to 180 countries after its business activities were declared non-essential under a government order aimed at curbing the spread of the  coronavirus.

Headlines: Luckin Coffee's journey from hot startup to $5billion share wipeout
Description: Here is a timeline of the Nasdaq-listed Luckin Coffee Inc's  journey from a hot Chinese start-up to U.S. IPO and now an investigation for alleged fraud.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler starts ventilator component output in Italy
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA)   has begun producing  ventilator parts to help Italy's Siare Engineering boost its output of the medical equipment needed to treat patients during the coronavirus crisis, the carmaker said on Friday.

Headlines: H&M sees second-quarter loss, plans cost cuts as pandemic slams sales in March
Description: Sweden's H&M , the world's second-biggest clothing retailer, said on Friday it expected a loss in the second quarter after reporting a 46% plunge in March sales as the coronavirus pandemic took a toll on the retail sector.

Headlines: Explainer: How the coronavirus crisis is affecting food supply
Description: The coronavirus pandemic has disrupted global food supplies and is causing labour shortages in agriculture worldwide.

Headlines: Mnuchin says small business rescue loans launch Friday, despite lender confusion
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said he was pressing ahead with the Friday launch of a $349 billion coronavirus rescue loan program for small businesses, after conceding to bank demands to fix aspects of the program that they said could cause participating lenders legal and financial risks.

Headlines: What's in the U.S. small business rescue program?
Description: Amid confusion over a $349 billion rescue program for small businesses struggling to survive the coronavirus pandemic, the U.S. Treasury released guidelines it hopes will pave the way to getting the spigots flowing on Friday, as promised.

Headlines: Fed's dilemma: Picking winners for $4 trillion in credit
Description: When the Federal Reserve polled Wall Street about financial stability risks last fall, "global pandemic" didn't make the list.

Headlines: Beijing autoshow postponed to September due to virus
Description: Organisers of the Beijing autoshow, which was scheduled to be held in late-April, said on Friday the event would be held between Sept. 26 and Oct. 5 due to the coronavirus pandamic.

Headlines: Ryanair misses traffic target, braces for hedging hit
Description: Ryanair  missed its 2020 target for passenger traffic and expects to book an exceptional charge of around 300 million euros for the year which ended last month, it said on Friday.

Headlines: Sportswear maker Puma proposes suspending dividend due to virus
Description: German sportswear maker Puma  proposed on Friday to suspend its 2019 dividend given the impact of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: British supermarket Sainsbury's to remove most customer purchasing limits
Description: British supermarket group Sainsbury's  said on Friday it would start to remove the customer purchasing limits it imposed to prevent coronavirus stockpiling as customers start to buy just what they need.

Headlines: Airline industry braces for lengthy recovery from coronavirus crisis
Description: International seat capacity has dropped by almost 80% from a year ago and half the world's airplanes are in storage, new data shows, suggesting the aviation industry may take years to recover from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Traton sees some order cancellations, can't rule out job cuts: WiWo
Description: Volkswagen's  Traton  commercial truck unit has seen cancellations of orders due to the coronavirus outbreak but these are manageable, its chief told a German magazine in an article published on Friday.

Headlines: Trump touts 'great' Saudi-Russia oil deal to halt price rout, but details unclear
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he had brokered a deal with top crude producers Russia and Saudi Arabia to cut output and arrest an oil price rout amid the global coronavirus pandemic, though details of how cuts would work were unclear.

Headlines: Petrobras says talks among Russia, Saudi Arabia, U.S. 'irrelevant' for oil prices
Description: Recent negotiations involving leaders from major oil-producing nations and the United States will prove irrelevant for oil prices, which are low because of depressed demand, the chief executive of Brazil's Petrobras said on Thursday evening.

Headlines: Boeing to temporarily suspend Philadelphia area operations amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Boeing Co  said on Thursday it will temporarily suspend production at facilities in Ridley Township, Pennsylvania, amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, adding that the suspension will last two weeks, with work to resume on April 20.

Headlines: Airbnb lowers internal valuation to $26 billion as coronavirus hits bookings: source
Description: Airbnb lowered its internal valuation by 16% to $26 billion, as the U.S. home rental firm grapples with a slowdown in bookings due to the global spread of the coronavirus pandemic, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil futures pare record gains as doubts creep in on Trump's Saudi-Russia output deal
Description: Oil prices fell on Friday, coming off their biggest one-day gains in the previous session after U.S. President Donald Trump said he had brokered a deal between Saudi Arabia and Russia to cut output, but made no offer to reduce U.S. production.

Headlines: Uber to start shipping car disinfectants to drivers
Description: Uber Technologies Inc will begin shipping disinfecting car spray to selected drivers in areas most affected by the coronavirus outbreak, an executive said on Thursday.

Headlines: Healthcare stocks show their defensive allure in ailing market
Description: The coronavirus pandemic is throwing a spotlight on stocks in the U.S. healthcare sector, home to the companies that could develop treatments, vaccines and improved diagnostics needed to tackle the greatest public health crisis in a century.

Headlines: FCC proposes to fine TracFone Wireless $6 million for subsidy violations
Description: The Federal Communications Commission on Thursday proposed to fine TracFone Wireless $6 million for allegedly violating its rules governing the subsidy program for telecommunications services for low income users.

Headlines: GM rolls out safety protocols for ventilator-making workers
Description: General Motors Co on Thursday rolled out a series of safety measures for workers in Indiana who will make ventilators, outlining what could be a blueprint for opening U.S. auto plants in the coming weeks.

Headlines: Chipotle under pressure in New York over coronavirus sick leave
Description: Less than two months after settling with New York City regulators over paid sick leave, Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc is under pressure for its policies amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. gig workers seeking coronavirus jobless benefits hit bureaucratic wall
Description: Uber and Lyft drivers are hitting a wall in their efforts to apply for the coronavirus jobless benefits promised by Congress as state agencies say they are not ready to handle a class of workers who are totally new to the U.S. unemployment system.

Headlines: American Airlines slashes flights but has no plans to halt U.S. service
Description: American Airlines Co  said on Thursday it is cutting additional flights this summer as travel demand has drastically shrunk amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. SEC delays ruling on controversial NYSE high-speed data plan
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said it needs more time to decide whether to allow a plan by the New York Stock Exchange to offer a new high-speed wireless connection to the exchange that some brokers have blasted as anti-competitive.

Headlines: Trump invokes Defense Production Act for ventilator manufacturing
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday invoked the Defense Production Act to aid companies building ventilators for coronavirus patients to receive the supply of materials they need.

Headlines: Bed Bath sues 1-800-Flowers for trying to renege on deal over COVID-19
Description: Bed Bath & Beyond Inc has asked a judge to hold 1-800-Flowers.Com Inc to a $252 million deal between the companies in what appears to one of the first examples of a corporate sale coming unraveled due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: As millions lose jobs, Fed policymakers say recession is here
Description: The U.S. recession is here. How long it will last will depend on the course of a viral pandemic that could still kill hundreds of thousands of Americans, and has most of the country under lockdowns aimed at slowing the infection's spread.

Headlines: Asian markets look to follow Wall Street rally as oil surges
Description: Asian markets on Friday looked to latch onto Wall Street's overnight gains after crude prices notched their biggest one-day surge on record, helping offset concerns about the depth of a global recession.

Headlines: Samsung Electronics shuts U.S. factory after two coronavirus cases
Description: Samsung Electronics  said on Friday that it has suspended its home appliance factory in the United States after two of its workers had tested positive for coronavirus.

Headlines: Oil jump lifts Wall Street as jobless claims data surges
Description: U.S. stocks rallied on Thursday as hopes for a truce in the price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia and a cut in oil output drove gains, taking some sting out of a shocking jump in Americans filing jobless claims due to coronavirus-led lockdowns.

Headlines: Retail sector companies turn to masks, gloves in coronavirus fight
Description: Major U.S. retail sector companies on Thursday moved to allay health and safety concerns of staff working at warehouses and stores through the coronavirus pandemic by promising face masks, gloves and sanitizers.

Headlines: Disney to furlough some U.S. employees in wake of coronavirus
Description: Walt Disney Co said on Thursday it will start furloughs of non-essential U.S. employees across the company on April 19, a response to the global coronavirus outbreak that has shut down or disrupted its media and theme park businesses.

Headlines: Dress to impress at home: Retailers recast spring looks for coronavirus lockdowns
Description: Desperate to sell pricey spring looks during the coronavirus lockdown, retailers are turning to social media to show their latest styles in somber, stay-at-home settings.

Headlines: Oil ends lower after U.S. crude stockpiles jump, gasoline demand sinks
Description: Oil prices fell on Wednesday after U.S. crude inventories rose last week by the most since 2016, while gasoline demand suffered its biggest weekly drop ever due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Fed balance sheet increases to record $5.86 trillion
Description: The Federal Reserve's balance sheet increased to a record $5.86 trillion this week and the central bank reported greater use of some of its newly launched liquidity facilities, all part of its efforts to keep markets functioning smoothly amid heightened volatility related to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: JPMorgan Chase probably unable to accept small business loan applications Friday: memo
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  emailed many small business customers on Thursday to tell them it is still awaiting federal guidance on the small business loans program Congress approved last week, and it may not be ready to accept applications when the program launches on Friday.

Headlines: Tesla sees strong Model Y production, deliveries; shares rise
Description: Tesla Inc  said on Thursday production and deliveries of its Model Y sport utility vehicle was significantly ahead of schedule, as the company delivered the highest number of vehicles in any first quarter to date.

Headlines: U.S. Air Force to release $882 million to Boeing: official
Description: The U.S. Air Force will release $882 million in payments to Boeing that were held back due to flaws in the KC-46 air refueling tanker, a Pentagon official said on Thursday.

Headlines: General Motors, Honda to jointly develop two new electric vehicles
Description: General Motors Co  and Honda Motor Co Ltd  said on Thursday they would jointly develop two new electric vehicles for Honda and are exploring more ways to expand their alliance.

Headlines: Stocks climb on oil price surge despite grim U.S. jobs data
Description: World equity markets climbed on Thursday on a surge in risky assets like oil, offsetting concerns over an increasing death toll from the coronavirus pandemic that is expected to push the global economy into recession.

Headlines: Dollar gains for second day; U.S. non-farm payrolls loom
Description: The dollar rose against a basket of currencies for a second straight day on Thursday as investors, worried about the prospect of a global recession, continued to take shelter in the greenback.

Headlines: Oil crash poses severe test for OPEC+ after Moscow, Riyadh miscalculate
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump says he has brokered a deal with Saudi Arabia and Russia that would see sweeping oil output cuts. Riyadh has called for emergency talks, and Moscow has said it no longer plans to hike production in a battle for market share.

Headlines: Coronavirus punishes Warren Buffett's equity holdings
Description: The coronavirus pandemic may have erased around $64 billion of value from Warren Buffett's equity portfolio at Berkshire Hathaway Inc , setting up the conglomerate for one of the largest quarterly losses ever by an American company.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump does not plan to ask U.S. oil producers for coordinated cuts - official
Description: The United States will not ask U.S. domestic oil companies for a coordinated cut in production to counter a historic meltdown in global prices and is still awaiting the details of planned cuts in Saudi Arabia and Russia, a senior administration official told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. unemployment to shoot up while GDP declines in second quarter: congressional estimators
Description: The U.S. unemployment rate will shoot past 10% in the second quarter and the growth rate of gross domestic product will decline by more than 7% as the coronavirus crisis grips the U.S. economy, according to projections released by the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) on Thursday.

Headlines: Yield-thirsty investors eye stock dividends as virus fears shrink bond payouts
Description: Battered S&P 500 stocks may get fresh interest from investors turning to dividends in a world of shrinking bond yields.

Headlines: U.S. financial industry asking SEC to delay broker disclosure rule, citing coronavirus: sources
Description: The financial industry wants the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to hold off on parts of a new rule requiring brokers to disclose potential conflicts of interest, citing disruptions caused by the coronavirus, four people with knowledge of the discussions said.

Headlines: GE to furlough 50% of U.S. engine assembly, component manufacturing ops staff
Description: General Electric Co  said on Thursday it would furlough about half its workers in the U.S. engine assembly and component manufacturing operations, a move that would affect thousands of employees, as the coronavirus pandemic hurts travel demand.

Headlines: Luckin Coffee shares sink after COO accused of financial misconduct
Description: Shares of Luckin Coffee Inc  sank as much as 81% on Thursday after the Chinese coffee chain said an internal investigation had shown that its chief operating officer and other employees fabricated sales transactions.

Headlines: Ford to build face shields at Brazil and Argentina car plants
Description: Ford Motor Co  said on Thursday it will make 50,000 face shields at factories in Brazil and Argentina to donate in the fight against the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Walgreens shares fall as coronavirus pandemic hits store sales
Description: Shares of Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc  fell 6% on Thursday after the drugstore retailer reported a steep decline in U.S.  same-store sales in the last week of March as customers stayed indoors due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Facebook launches fact-checking service on WhatsApp in Italy to fight coronavirus hoaxes
Description: Facebook Inc. launched a service in Italy to check the accuracy of information on coronavirus circulating on its messaging platform WhatsApp, the U.S. tech firm said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon to deploy masks and temperature checks for workers by next week
Description: Amazon.com Inc  plans to roll out temperature checks and face masks for staff at all its U.S. and European warehouses plus Whole Foods stores by early next week, a huge deployment for workers on the front lines of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: WeWork troubles deepen as SoftBank pulls $3 billion tender offer
Description: SoftBank Group Corp said it has terminated a $3 billion tender offer for additional WeWork shares agreed last year with shareholders, drawing threats of legal action and plunging the floundering office space company further into crisis.

Headlines: Walmart puts partial sale of UK's Asda on hold due to coronavirus crisis: source
Description: Walmart , the world's largest retailer, has put the possible sale of a majority stake in its British supermarket arm Asda on hold until the coronavirus crisis is over, said a person familiar with the situation.

Headlines: U.S. borrowers struggle to get coronavirus relief from big banks
Description: U.S. borrowers seeking a reprieve from mortgage, auto or credit card payments because of coronavirus hardships are not getting the help they expected from big banks that promised assistance in recent weeks.

Headlines: BA suspends more than 30,000 staff, owner scraps dividend
Description: British Airways  said on Thursday it has struck a deal with its unions to suspend more than 30,000 cabin crew and ground staff in one of the airline industry's most dramatic moves yet to survive the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Nivea-maker Beiersdorf scraps 2020 outlook due to coronavirus crisis
Description: Nivea-maker Beiersdorf  on Thursday scrapped its 2020 outlook due to the coronavirus pandemic, and also released preliminary first-quarter sales that showed a 3.6% fall from a year earlier.

Headlines: Oil refiners face reckoning as demand plummets
Description: The global oil refining industry is facing a reckoning from falling fuel demand that is the deepest and fastest ever.

Headlines: Honda extends North American auto plant shutdowns
Description: Honda Motor Co  said Thursday it will extend a shutdown of all U.S. and Canadian auto plant production through April 10 and at its plant in Celaya, central Mexico, until April 13, because of the ongoing coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Bank of America cuts Brazil 2020 GDP forecast to -3.5% from -0.5%: report
Description: Bank of America on Thursday cut its 2020 forecast for Brazil's gross domestic product (GDP) to a 3.5% contraction from a 0.5% fall, it said in a report, citing the strong impact on consumption and investment stemming amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Bank of England doubles size of corporate bond purchase program
Description: The Bank of England said on Thursday it will double the size of its corporate bond purchase program to at least 20 billion pounds ($24.7 billion), part of a previously announced stimulus package to help the economy during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Thousands of U.S. banks may sit out small-business rescue plan on liability worries: sources
Description: Thousands of U.S. banks, including some of the country's largest lenders, have said they may not participate in the federal government's small-business rescue program due to concerns about taking on too much legal and financial risk, five people with direct knowledge of industry discussions told Reuters.

Headlines: Output at Nissan's UK car plant suspended throughout April over coronavirus
Description: Production at Nissan's  British factory, the country's biggest car plant, is suspended throughout April, continuing a shutdown in place since mid-March as the coronavirus outbreak continues across Europe.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims blow past six million as coronavirus lockdowns spread
Description: The number of Americans filing claims for unemployment benefits shot to a record high of more than 6 million last week as more jurisdictions enforced stay-at-home measures to curb the coronavirus pandemic, which economists say has pushed the economy into recession.

Headlines: Instant View: Weekly US jobless claims top 6 million for first time
Description: The number of Americans filing claims for unemployment benefits last week shot to a record high for a second week in a row - topping 6 million - as more jurisdictions enforced stay-at-home measures to curb the coronavirus pandemic, which economists say has pushed the economy into recession.

Headlines: Exclusive: Germany in talks to inject billions into Lufthansa - sources
Description: Germany is in talks to provide Lufthansa  with billions of euros in state aid and could take a stake in the airline,  which has grounded 95% of its fleet due to the coronavirus pandemic, people close to the matter said.

Headlines: Boeing to offer voluntary layoffs to employees to tide over coronavirus fallout
Description: Boeing Co  Chief Executive Officer Dave Calhoun outlined a plan of voluntary layoffs for employees on Thursday, while warning that the coronavirus pandemic would have a lasting impact on the global aerospace industry.

Headlines: German carmakers had crisis call with Merkel: Handelsblatt
Description: The bosses of Volkswagen , BMW  and Daimler  held a crisis call with German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Wednesday to discuss how to get production restarted, Germany's Handelsblatt newspaper reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Lights, camera, audit: accountants grapple with remote company check-ups
Description: As audit season begins for British companies, some auditors stuck at home in coronavirus lockdown are turning to cameras to check clients' inventories, plant and equipment for compiling annual accounts.

Headlines: Virus forces Luxottica to break Italian August holiday tradition
Description: Eyewear maker Luxottica said it would cut to just one week its customary August closure, a move which other firms may seek to replicate to relaunch production after the forced shutdown in the current coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: 'Dear Elon': Ukraine takes up Tesla's ventilator offer via Twitter
Description: Ukraine has taken to Twitter to ask Elon Musk to send it ventilators after the billionaire chief executive of Tesla Inc  offered to ship them across the world during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Russia does not rule out returning to oil talks with Saudi Arabia
Description: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak said on Thursday that Moscow may return to oil negotiations with Saudi Arabia after talks collapsed last month, which, coupled with the spread of the new coronavirus, dragged oil prices to their 18-year lows.

Headlines: Planemakers brace for sharp cuts in wide-body output: sources
Description: Planemakers are looking at drastic cuts in wide-body production amid a slump in demand for the industry's largest jetliners, manufacturing and supplier sources said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. factory orders unchanged in February
Description: New orders for U.S.-made goods were unexpectedly flat in February, and could remain weak as a global coronavirus outbreak strains supply chains and undercuts the manufacturing sector.

Headlines: Ford says post-crisis support for U.S. customers 'would be appropriate'
Description: Ford Motor Co's  U.S. sales chief said on Thursday the automaker believes some level of government stimulus will be needed for consumers once the coronavirus pandemic recedes and that the crisis will spur a permanent shift toward more online vehicle sales in America.

Headlines: Southwest Airlines to apply for U.S. government aid as demand craters
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  said on Thursday it intends to apply for U.S. government aid to help it ride out the sharp drop in travel demand caused by the massive lockdowns because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler to start three Italian sites immediately after lockdown ends: union
Description: Fiat Chrysler  aims to restart operations at three Italian sites as soon as the government lifts coronavirus restrictions on manufacturing, a union representative said on Thursday, adding unions would monitor health precautions.

Headlines: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon back at work after heart surgery
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon has returned to lead the largest U.S bank, after recovering from recent heart surgery, according to an internal memo to employees seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Fund managers freeze UK institutional property funds
Description: Investment managers BlackRock  and Schroders  have suspended trading in UK real estate funds aimed at institutional investors, citing difficulty in getting an accurate price for their assets.

Headlines: EU consumers may be able to bring dieselgate claims in home court: adviser
Description: EU consumers should be able to sue carmakers in their national courts if they have bought cars with emission cheat devices installed, an adviser to the Court of Justice of the European Union said on Thursday.

Headlines: Aerospace suppliers face bailout dilemma over job cuts
Description: Aerospace suppliers are drawing up plans to lay off workers as coronavirus quarantines cripple their cash balances - but bailout conditions and fears of losing critical skilled labor are forcing managements to juggle survival and future growth.

Headlines: Boeing CEO sees lasting impact of coronavirus pandemic on aerospace industry: memo
Description: Boeing Co  Chief Executive Dave Calhoun said on Thursday the coronavirus pandemic was going to have a lasting impact on the global aerospace industry, as he outlined steps for a voluntary layoff plan for employees.

Headlines: British Airways could suspend 36,000 employees: BBC
Description: IAG-owned British Airways  is expected to announce a suspension of about 36,000 of its employees, BBC News reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: In blow to Airbnb, EU court adviser says solving housing shortage is priority
Description: European cities cracking down on short-term rentals of private homes like those on Airbnb got a boost on Thursday after an adviser to Europe's top court said they have the right to vet such rentals to tackle the shortage of long-term housing.

Headlines: Trump says expects Russia-Saudi oil deal soon, invites U.S. oil chiefs to White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he has invited U.S. oil executives to the White House to discuss ways to help the industry "ravaged" by slumping energy demand during the coronavirus outbreak and a price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia.

Headlines: H&M in talks with tens of thousands of staff to cut working hours due to pandemic
Description: Sweden's H&M  said on Thursday it was in talks with tens of thousands of its staff about shortening working hours with the firm among many retailers hit by the coronavirus pandemic and fewer customers in many markets.

Headlines: Airlines facing what official calls 'deepest crisis ever'
Description: (This April 1 story corrects from 14 to 26 European countries in paragraph 16)

Headlines: Oil market shock to spill over into global supply chains: IEA
Description: The global crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic will be felt throughout oil's global supply chains and ripple into other parts of the energy sector, the International Energy Agency (IEA) said in a report on Wednesday.

Headlines: Pigs fly in as China replenishes world's biggest hog herd
Description: Six planes carrying more than 4,000 high-quality French breeding pigs have arrived in China so far this year, the first of an expected dozens of plane-loads as the world's top pork producer rebuilds its decimated hog herd.

Headlines: Bayer says glyphosate settlement talks delayed by coronavirus-Handelsblatt
Description: Talks between Bayer AG  and plaintiff lawyers to settle claims that the German company's glyphosate-based weedkillers cause cancer have been slowed by the coronavirus pandemic, Bayer's Chief Executive told daily Handelsblatt.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. officials agree on new ways to control high tech exports to China - sources
Description: The Trump administration is tightening rules to prevent China from obtaining advanced U.S. technology for commercial purposes and then diverting it to military use, several sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Elon Musk's SpaceX bans Zoom over privacy concerns -memo
Description: Elon Musk's rocket company SpaceX has banned its employees from using video conferencing app Zoom, citing "significant privacy and security concerns," according to a memo seen by Reuters, days after U.S. law enforcement warned users about the security of the popular app.

Headlines: Disney+ content to make exclusive Middle East debut on OSN
Description: Walt Disney Co's  Disney+ content will be available for the first time in the Middle East and North Africa on regional pay television and online streaming service provider OSN from April 9.

Headlines: Delivery Hero takes steps to support struggling restaurants
Description: Delivery Hero , one of the world's top online food delivery marketplaces, announced measures on Thursday to support restaurants that are trying to survive coronavirus lockdowns by ramping up deliveries to consumers stuck at home.

Headlines: Trump says he expects Saudi-Russia oil production deal in coming days
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he expected Saudi Arabia and Russia to reach a deal in the next few days on oil production to end a price war that has "ravaged" the oil industry worldwide.

Headlines: U.S. Energy Department urges Saudi, Russia to calm oil markets
Description: The U.S. Energy Department on Wednesday urged Saudi Arabia and Russia to calm oil markets after the kingdom's crude supply rose to a record of more than 12 million barrels per day even as oil demand falters on the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Volkswagen extends Mexico production halt as coronavirus bites
Description: German automaker Volkswagen said on Wednesday it would extend until April 30 a suspension of activities at two production plants in central Mexico after the government declared a health emergency because of coronavirus.

Headlines: Cruise operator Carnival pays high price to get credit investors on board
Description: Carnival Corp , the world's largest cruise operator, said it has raised $6.25 billion by issuing new debt and equity on Wednesday, borrowing at a high cost to weather the economic storm of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury taps Wall Street firms for aid advice: sources
Description: The U.S. Treasury Department has hired Wall Street bankers and lawyers to advise on providing tens of billions of dollars in aid to the airline, cargo and defense sectors, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Almost all bets are off: casino capitals Macau, Las Vegas slammed by virus
Description: The vast, glitzy gaming halls of Macau are open, but thousands of baccarat tables are empty. The world's biggest gambling hub has barred entry to most travellers and hotels are being used to isolate new arrivals in case they have been infected by coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. sues to force Altria to unwind investment in Juul
Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission said on Wednesday it had filed a complaint aimed at forcing Marlboro maker Altria Group to sell its investment in e-cigarette maker Juul Labs Inc.

Headlines: China's ports brace for second hit as virus spread wipes out exports
Description: China's ports and shipping firms are bracing for a second wave of supply chain disruptions that may be deeper and more prolonged than during the country's coronavirus lockdown as the global spread of the virus chokes off international demand.

Headlines: Apple will stop taking cut of some Amazon video purchases on App Store
Description: Apple Inc said on Wednesday it would stop taking a cut of some sales for "qualifying" streaming video services on iPhones and other Apple devices, including Amazon.com's Prime Video.

Headlines: EU exec proposes shorter work hours to prevent layoffs amid epidemic
Description: The EU executive proposed on Wednesday a wage-subsidy scheme to encourage employers to cut workers' hours rather than their jobs amid the coronavirus epidemic, a plan that could be worth 100 billion euros in borrowing guaranteed by all EU countries.

Headlines: Swiss manufacturing PMI sinks to lowest level since 2009 on coronavirus fears
Description: From expensive watches to chocolates and cement, Swiss industry is being battered by the coronavirus epidemic, data showed on Wednesday, with the country's PMI survey sinking to its lowest level in more than a decade.

Headlines: Amazon warehouse workers protest near Detroit, days after NYC walkout
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Wednesday a handful of workers staged a demonstration at one of its warehouses near Detroit, another U.S. protest this week over staff concerns about contracting the novel coronavirus on the job.

Headlines: U.S. light vehicle sales in March fall 27% on month as virus outbreak intensifies
Description: Light vehicle sales in the United States fell nearly 27% in March compared with a month earlier, data released by an automotive research group showed on Wednesday, as the coronavirus outbreak intensified and shuttered dealerships across much of the country.

Headlines: Banks wary of liquidity extend expensive, shorter-dated credit to GE
Description: NEW YORK (LPC) - General Electric Co is asking its lenders to replace US$20bn in revolving loans with a new debt package that will come with a smaller size and shorter maturities, sources said.

Headlines: Wall Street dives 4% as virus pandemic fears intensify
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes fell more than 4% on Wednesday, after President Donald Trump's dire warning on the U.S. death toll from the coronavirus sent investors running from even the most defensive equities.

Headlines: Booking Holdings CEO tests positive for coronavirus
Description: Online travel agency Booking Holdings said on Wednesday Chief Executive Officer Glenn Fogel has tested positive for coronavirus.

Headlines: Starbucks extends coronavirus provisions for two weeks, explores more changes
Description: Starbucks Corp  on Wednesday said it will extend special coronavirus provisions, including pay increases for U.S. workers and closed dining areas, for two weeks to May 3.

Headlines: Nissan says U.S. auto plants will remain closed through late April
Description: Nissan Motor Co  said on Wednesday its U.S. auto plants  will remain closed through late April to help reduce the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler, GM try discounts, online buying to lift plunging U.S. sales
Description: With auto showrooms shut during the coronavirus pandemic, Fiat Chrysler and General Motors Co  moved to reboot demand with seven-year, no-interest loans and programs allowing customers to buy vehicles online.

Headlines: WarnerMedia taps ex-Hulu chief Jason Kilar as CEO
Description: AT&T Inc  on Wednesday named Jason Kilar, former head of video streaming platform Hulu, as chief executive officer of its WarnerMedia unit starting in May, when it plans to launch its HBO Max service to compete with streaming heavyweights Netflix and Disney+.

Headlines: Challengers rev their engines to fight Trump's auto emissions weakening
Description: Just two months after taking office, President Donald Trump in March 2017 traveled to Michigan to announce that he would undo ambitious vehicle emissions standards mandated under his predecessor Barack Obama, portraying the reversal as a boost to the U.S. auto industry centered in the Midwestern state.

Headlines: Multi-strategy hedge funds outperformed peers as market plunged
Description: Multi-strategy hedge funds - those that bet on a broad array of markets using teams of traders, leverage and centralized risk management - have flourished as stocks ended their worst three months since the 2008 financial crisis.

Headlines: EU industry chief sees no quid pro quo in Chinese firms' 'mask diplomacy'
Description: EU industry chief Thierry Breton says he does not see any ulterior motive behind Huawei [HWT.UL] and other Chinese companies' donations of face masks to the bloc and that solidarity is the best way to tackle the global coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Volkswagen to extend U.S. production halt until April 12
Description: Volkswagen AG  said on Wednesday it is extending a production halt at its Chattanooga, Tennessee, assembly plant until April 12 because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. shale company Whiting becomes first major bankruptcy of oil-price crash
Description: Whiting Petroleum Corp filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, the U.S. shale producer said on Wednesday, the first publicly traded casualty of crashing crude oil prices that are expected to bite into record U.S. output.

Headlines: U.S. dollar gains as global recession looms
Description: The dollar advanced on Wednesday, with markets bracing for what is shaping up to be one of the worst economic contractions in decades as the world confronts the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Equities drop as evidence mounts of deep global recession
Description: World equity markets began the new quarter with steep losses on Wednesday as evidence mounted that the coronavirus pandemic was sending the global economy into a deep recession.

Headlines: Fed's Rosengren: Virus likely to hit real estate, office loans
Description: The coronavirus crisis is likely to cut home and office building prices, may lead to a permanent shift in the demand for office space, and could push highly indebted households and companies toward default, Boston Federal Reserve bank president Eric Rosengren said on Wednesday.

Headlines: T-Mobile completes merger with Sprint
Description: T-Mobile US Inc said on Wednesday it officially completed the $23 billion merger with Sprint Corp, solidifying its position as the No.3 wireless providers in the United States.

Headlines: Putin calls for action on 'challenging' energy market, Trump laments cheap oil
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin called on Wednesday for global oil producers and consumers to address "challenging" oil markets while U.S. President Donald Trump complained that oil cheaper "than water" was hurting the industry.

Headlines: Insurers fret as company bosses face coronavirus legal claims
Description: Insurers are increasingly worried about shareholders, employees or customers bringing coronavirus-related claims against company executives and are considering excluding the virus from policies which protect the bosses, industry sources say.

Headlines: Zoom takes lead over Microsoft Teams as virus keeps Americans at home: Apptopia
Description: Zoom Video Communications Inc's  average mobile user numbers in March were nearly three times that of its nearest rival Microsoft Corp's  Teams, according to research firm Apptopia, as the cornonavirus-driven stay-at-home lifted demand for video conferencing applications.

Headlines: Explainer: Euro zone eyes package to support economy against coronavirus
Description: With the euro zone economy in need of help from the coronavirus pandemic, officials have until April 9 to design a package that satisfies members with completely opposing views: those calling for joint debt issuance and those fiercely against it.

Headlines: Democrats urge U.S. Treasury not to delay $25 billion in grants to airlines
Description: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi urged the U.S. Treasury on Wednesday not to hold up $25 billion in cash grants approved by Congress last week to airlines for payroll costs.

Headlines: Factory activity plunges as coronavirus shock deepens
Description: Factories fell quiet across much of the world in March as the coronavirus pandemic paralyzed economic activity, with evidence mounting that the world is sliding into deep recession.

Headlines: Pelosi urges U.S. Treasury not to delay $25 billion in grants to airlines
Description: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi urged the U.S. Treasury on Wednesday not to hold up $25 billion in cash grants approved by Congress last week to airlines for payroll costs.

Headlines: Meal delivery firms branch out into groceries during crisis
Description: Uber Eats  and Delivery Hero  are expanding from providing restaurant meals into supplying groceries to customers stuck at home during lockdowns triggered by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing contracts; private payrolls post first drop since 2017
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity contracted less than expected in March, but disruptions caused by the coronavirus pandemic pushed new orders received by factories to an 11-year low, reinforcing economists' views that the economy was in recession.

Headlines: U.S. restaurants seek $325 bln of federal aid due to coronavirus hit
Description: ((This March 18 story, corrects headline and first paragraph to say aid requested was $325, not $455 billion.))

Headlines: U.S. factory activity contracts in March; orders tumble to 11-year low: ISM
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity contracted less than expected in March, but disruptions caused by the coronavirus pandemic pushed new orders received by factories to an 11-year low, reinforcing economists' views that the economy was in recession.

Headlines: Kroger posts 30% jump in March comparable sales, borrows $1 billion
Description: Kroger Co's  comparable sales surged about 30% in March as consumers stockpiled due to the coronavirus pandemic, and the grocer said it had borrowed $1 billion to boost its cash reserve as it prepared for any fallout from the health crisis.

Headlines: Swiss distillery shifts from schnapps to sanitizer
Description: A Swiss distillery has converted its production of pear schnapps to make disinfectant hand gel for use against the coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. construction spending unexpectedly falls in February
Description: U.S. construction spending unexpectedly fell in February and could decline further as the coronavirus pandemic wreaks havoc on the economy.

Headlines: U.S. factory activity in March was weakest since 2009: IHS Markit
Description: The U.S. manufacturing sector contracted in March, with activity hitting its lowest level since 2009, as the coronavirus pandemic caused widespread shortages, a survey confirmed on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. small businesses wait impatiently for government aid that could be slow to come
Description: As soon as New York officials began detailing their response to the coronavirus, Matt Preis knew his staff might be in trouble.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank mulls waiving 2020 management bonuses due to coronavirus: source
Description: Deutsche Bank  is discussing whether it will waive bonuses for its management board in 2020 due to the fallout from the coronavirus crisis, a person with knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Germany ready to nationalise airline Condor - sources
Description: The German government stands ready to take over Condor as a deal for the airline to be bought by Polish rival LOT is likely to collapse in the industry turmoil caused by the coronavirus crisis, several people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Adidas apologizes for deferring store rent, will pay up
Description: German sportswear maker Adidas  apologizes on Wednesday for saying it would stop paying rent for stores around the world forced to close by coronavirus lockdowns after a storm of criticism, saying it would pay up for April after all.

Headlines: Income funds sift for survivors as coronavirus cuts into dividends
Description: As companies cut dividends in response to the financial havoc caused by the coronavirus, fund managers whose portfolios rely on the payouts are sifting for those most likely to deliver a sustainable yield when the world recovers.

Headlines: Argentina to continue talks with creditors after missing deadline: economy minister
Description: Argentina will continue talks this week and next with creditors over restructuring its $83 billion in foreign debt, Economy Minister Martin Guzman said on Tuesday, after the South American country missed the March 31 deadline it had set previously.

Headlines: Worker crunch hits world's top medical glove maker as demand spikes
Description: The world's biggest maker of medical gloves is grappling with a serious shortage of workers as it tries to meet a huge surge in demand as countries such as the United States run out of personal protective gear due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Oilfield spending to fall 21% as producers slash outlays: report
Description: Global spending on oilfield equipment and services this year will fall 21% from 2019 to $211 billion, the lowest level since 2005, according to a report to be released on Wednesday by consultancy Spears & Associates, as oil and gas producers slash spending.

Headlines: Chinese buyers snap up U.S. oil purchases at widest discounts ever
Description: China has increased U.S. crude purchases with some buyers snapping up cargoes at the widest discounts ever as sellers seek to offload excess supplies in Asia, six trade sources said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Glencore's chrome joint venture in South Africa with Merafe declares force majeure
Description: Glencore's  chrome joint venture in South Africa with Merafe Resources  has declared force majeure on qualifying contracts after a nationwide lockdown forced operations to shut, a Merafe executive said.

Headlines: Tariff pain turns to gain: U.S. computer, toy stockpiles help meet virus rush
Description: As the coronavirus outbreak forced classes online, Boston Public Schools ordered 20,000 laptops and had them in hand in four days - an unusually fast turnaround made possible by a build-up of inventory prompted by the U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: Mother of invention: the new gadgets dreamt up to fight coronavirus
Description: Driving to work at his factory to the west of London last week, designer Steve Brooks had coronavirus on his mind. What could he make that would let him open a door without touching the handle?

Headlines: UK banks scrap dividends on coronavirus fears, pressure on bonuses
Description: Britain's top banks have axed dividend payments after pressure from the regulator, saving their capital as a buffer against expected losses from the economic fallout from the coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: KKR shelves $2 billion sale of Singapore-based Goodpack due to market slump: sources
Description: KKR & Co  has shelved a plan to sell Singapore-based Goodpack, which provides shipping containers and logistics services, after the coronavirus outbreak hit valuations, sources with knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Apple doubles China donations for COVID-19 recovery efforts
Description: Apple more than doubled its donation to China's efforts to fight COVID-19 to over 50 million yuan ($7 million), CEO Tim Cook posted on Weibo on Wednesday, weeks after the iPhone maker said it had opened all its 42 stores in one of its largest markets.

Headlines: U.S. pension funds may pour $400 billion into stocks, lifting virus-hit markets: JP Morgan
Description: U.S. pension funds that delayed rebalancing their portfolios are likely to pump about $400 billion into stocks over the next two quarters, analysts at JP Morgan said, providing a potential boost to equity markets battered by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: New York City to probe Amazon firing of warehouse worker
Description: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio said on Tuesday he had ordered the city's human rights commission to open an  investigation into the dismissal of a worker at an Amazon.com warehouse who participated in a walkout.

Headlines: Xerox abandons $35 billion hostile bid for HP
Description: U.S. printer maker Xerox Holdings Corp walked away from its $35 billion hostile cash-and-stock bid for HP Inc on Tuesday, after the coronavirus outbreak weighed on its campaign to take over the PC and printing equipment manufacturer.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler does not see delay in PSA merger, FIOM union says
Description: Fiat Chrysler did not mention any possible delay in the merger process with France's PSA during a call with unions on Tuesday, metal workers' union FIOM said.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. aims to lease space in emergency oil stockpile, after buying plan canceled - sources
Description: The Trump administration plans to lease out space for energy companies to store oil in the nation's Strategic Petroleum Reserve, after a previous effort to buy millions of barrels for the emergency stockpile was canceled over a lack of funding, according to two people briefed on the matter.

Headlines: Bond investor Jeffrey Gundlach bets stocks March lows to be surpassed in April
Description: Bond investor and DoubleLine Capital Chief Executive Jeffrey Gundlach said on Tuesday he believes the coronavirus sell-off is not over yet and that the lows stocks hit in March will be surpassed in April due to uncertainty over the outbreak.

Headlines: U.S.-Saudi oil alliance idea born at White House, put on back burner for now
Description: Top U.S. officials have for now put aside a proposal for an alliance with Saudi Arabia to manage the global oil market, according to three sources with knowledge of the matter, an idea one of them said came from White House national security advisers.

Headlines: Trump says he may join Saudi, Russia in talks on oil prices
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he would join Saudi Arabia and Russia, if need be, for talks about the sharp fall in oil prices resulting from a price war between the two countries.

Headlines: U.S. backs minimum flights on airline routes in assistance review
Description: The U.S. Transportation Department on Tuesday proposed that passenger airlines should be required to maintain minimum numbers of flights as a condition for receiving aid from the government's $50 billion grant and loan fund.

Headlines: Macy's to drop from S&P 500 to small-cap index
Description: Macy's Inc  will be removed from the benchmark S&P 500 stock index , the S&P Dow Jones Indices said on Tuesday, as coronavirus-induced store closures compound the retail sector's struggles with a shift to online shopping.

Headlines: Independent worker group calls for Whole Foods 'sick out' over coronavirus
Description: An independent group of workers at Whole Foods Market called on colleagues to phone in sick to the grocer's stores on Tuesday to protest what they say is a lack of adequate compensation and protections from the coronavirus.

Headlines: Dow sinks, virus pushes it to sharpest quarterly plunge in over three decades
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes tumbled on Tuesday, with the Dow registering its biggest quarterly decline since 1987 and the S&P 500 suffering its deepest quarterly drop since the financial crisis on growing evidence of massive economic damage from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Caterpillar says it will not give annual salary increases this year
Description: Caterpillar Inc  on Tuesday said it will not hand out annual salary increases this year as part of cost cut plan to deal with the coronavirus economic fallout.

Headlines: Citi postpones 2020 investor day due to coronavirus outbreak
Description: Citigroup Inc  said on Tuesday it would postpone its 2020 investor day that was scheduled to take place on May 13 due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: JetBlue to cut flights in and out of hometown New York by as much as 80%
Description: JetBlue Airways Corp  plans to reduce daily flights in and out of the four New York City-area airports where it operates by as much as 80% in April as part of wider schedule cuts due to the coronavirus outbreak, a spokesman said.

Headlines: Tesla plans to supply FDA-approved ventilators free of cost: Musk
Description: Tesla Inc  Chief Executive Elon Musk said on Tuesday the company has extra FDA-approved ventilators that can be shipped free of cost to hospitals within regions where the electric carmaker delivers.

Headlines: Trump signs off on deferring tariffs for most-favored nations for three months
Description: President Donald Trump has signed off on a plan to defer U.S. tariffs for most-favored nations for three months, according to a source familiar with the decision.

Headlines: Senators urge U.S. airlines to issue ticket refunds after bailout
Description: Nine Democratic U.S. senators on Tuesday urged the chief executives of 11 major airlines to issue full cash refunds to customers canceling flights during the coronavirus pandemic after Congress approved a massive rescue package for the hard-hit industry.

Headlines: Stocks fall, close out biggest quarterly drop since 2008
Description: Global stock markets fell in volatile trading on Tuesday, and the economic damage from the coronavirus pandemic left the MSCI benchmark of world equities with its biggest quarterly decline since the financial crisis of 2008.

Headlines: U.S. dollar weakens as Fed measure weighs
Description: The dollar fell against a basket of major currencies on Tuesday modestly pressured by the weight of Federal Reserve measures meant to ensure there was enough liquidity in the global financial system.

Headlines: UniCredit says top managers to forego entire 2020 bonus pay
Description: Italy's biggest bank by assets, UniCredit SpA , said on Tuesday its top managers had decided to waive their entire 2020 bonus pay and that the bank would donate an equivalent amount to the UniCredit Foundation to support social initiatives.

Headlines: Oil ends March with biggest monthly and quarterly losses ever
Description: Crude oil benchmarks ended a volatile quarter with their biggest losses in history, as both U.S. and Brent futures were hammered throughout March on the global economic freeze due to the coronavirus pandemic and the eruption of a price war between Russia and Saudi Arabia.

Headlines: Architect of Trump tax cut may run $500 billion coronavirus loan program
Description: U.S. Deputy Treasury Secretary Justin Muzinich, an architect of the sweeping 2017 Republican tax cut, is under consideration to oversee a newly created $500 billion coronavirus rescue loan program for large companies, cities and states, two sources familiar with the agency's plans said.

Headlines: Special Report: The Mask Middlemen - How pop-up brokers seek big paydays in a frenzied market
Description: Brian Kolfage, a Florida military veteran, recently convinced Americans to donate millions of dollars for a privately built wall on the U.S. southern border. Now he has jumped into a new venture: hawking millions of protective face masks that are in critically short supply during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Trump holds call with U.S. internet, mobile phone providers
Description: President Donald Trump spoke with the biggest U.S. internet and mobile phone providers on Tuesday to talk about how the networks are holding up as tens of millions of Americans work from home.

Headlines: SocGen, Natixis skip 2019 dividends, may consider payments in second half
Description: French banks, Societe Generale and Natixis joined a cohort of European peers that announced plans to skip 2019 dividends following the European Central Bank's guidance to direct profits toward supporting the economy during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Chanel turns its workshops to making face masks against coronavirus
Description: (This Mar 29 story corrects number of staff, clarifies they are in France.)

Headlines: Coronavirus shows U.S. too dependent on cheap medical imports, USTR says
Description: (This Mar 30 story adds missing word "from" in last paragraph.)

Headlines: U.S. court rules for Teva in migraine patent dispute with Eli Lilly
Description: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd on Tuesday won a ruling from a U.S. administrative court that could help it fend off competition from Eli Lilly and Co in the market for migraine drugs.

Headlines: Fed will do 'whatever it takes' to help U.S. economy likely in recession, Daly says
Description: The Federal Reserve is ready to do more to help a U.S. economy ground to a sudden halt as businesses shutter and people stay home to slow the coronavirus pandemic, San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Goldman gives staff 10 days paid family leave due to coronavirus: memo
Description: Wall Street bank Goldman Sachs  is offering employees 10 days of paid family leave to care for children or elderly parents who are at home during the coronavirus pandemic, according to a memo sent to staff on Tuesday that was seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Billionaire investor Steve Cohen: 'After an earthquake there are tremors'
Description: Billionaire trader Steven A. Cohen is cautioning the staff of his investment firm, Point72 Asset Management, to remain cautious amid markets that have recovered slightly from coronavirus-driven lows.

Headlines: Exclusive: American Airlines to retire more jets, including vintage 737s, in coronavirus downturn
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  is set to sharply increase the number of jets it is planning to retire beyond its announced plans as it accelerates a fleet transformation to respond to the coronavirus crisis, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: J.C. Penney furloughs staff, extends store closures amid pandemic
Description: J. C. Penney Co Inc  said on Tuesday it would furlough a majority of its hourly staff and salaried associates next month, the latest U.S. retailer looking to weather the financial strain from store closures due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Britain's Tesco recruits 35,000 workers to get through coronavirus crisis
Description: Britain's biggest retailer Tesco  said on Tuesday it had recruited 35,000 additional workers in the last 10 days to help get it through the coronavirus emergency, which has triggered a dramatic increase in demand for groceries.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs slashes U.S. GDP estimate further
Description: Goldman Sachs said on Tuesday the second-quarter U.S. economic decline would be much greater than it had previously forecast and unemployment would be higher, citing anecdotal evidence and "sky-high jobless claims numbers" resulting from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Adidas stops 1 billion euros share buyback
Description: Germany's Adidas  on Tuesday said it will suspend a 1 billion euros share buyback it had planned for this year as a way to conserve cash after closing its retail outlets in Europe and North America.

Headlines: What the Federal Reserve has done in the coronavirus crisis
Description: The Federal Reserve has moved into overdrive to try to keep the U.S. economy from suffering lasting damage from the coronavirus pandemic, announcing an emergency interest rate cut on March 3 and rolling out new efforts almost weekly since, including slashing rates to zero and relaunching large-scale asset purchases.

Headlines: Walt Disney to launch streaming service in India on Friday
Description: Walt Disney Co  will launch its Disney+ service in India on April 3, the company said on Tuesday, intensifying rivalry with Netflix Inc  and Amazon.com Inc's  Prime Video in a country where demand for online streaming is surging.

Headlines: Huawei warns China will strike back against new U.S. restrictions
Description: Huawei warned on Tuesday that 2020 would be its most difficult year yet due to American trade restrictions which dealt a blow to its overseas sales in 2019, and predicted the Chinese government would retaliate against the United States.

Headlines: JPMorgan, addressing racism allegations, reforms customer complaint system, access
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  told employees on Tuesday it is changing its customer complaint system and how staff choose which customers are eligible for certain banking products after the New York Times reported allegations of racial discrimination against black customers at the bank last year.

Headlines: Coronavirus drives U.S. March auto sales off a cliff
Description: U.S. new vehicle sales likely drove off a cliff in March as the coronavirus pandemic pounded consumer confidence and shuttered dealerships across much of the country, and sales are likely to take a further beating in April as social distancing guidelines remain in place.

Headlines: Southwest Airlines cutting more than 40% of flights in May as demand sags
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  said Tuesday it will cut more than 40% of flights from May 3 through June 5 amid a sharp decline in travel demand from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Three months that shook global markets
Description: How much damage has the coronavirus and the oil price collapse inflicted on global financial markets this year? Put simply, it has probably been the most destructive sell-off since the Great Depression.

Headlines: U.S. unemployment offices sitting on mountain of pending claims
Description: Last week's record-setting U.S. jobless claims number will be quickly surpassed, economists and state officials predict, as local labor offices digest a pile of pending applications, and the new stimulus bill extends benefits to the self-employed.

Headlines: Furniture giant IKEA making masks to help fight coronavirus
Description: Furniture giant IKEA is producing face masks and other protective gear for hospitals, joining a growing list of companies branching out of their normal business areas to help meet equipment shortages in the fight against coronavirus.

Headlines: IMF extends bilateral borrowing arrangements through 2023
Description: The International Monetary Fund said on Tuesday its board approved a new three-year framework for bilateral borrowing agreements, ensuring that its full $1 trillion lending capacity will be maintained as member countries battle the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Rolls-Royce targets in jeopardy as pandemic brings air travel slump
Description: British aero-engine maker Rolls-Royce  will likely have to slash its 2020 cash flow target after airline customers parked hundreds of planes due to the coronavirus pandemic, analysts said.

Headlines: Coronavirus concerns delay restart of Ford's North American production
Description: Ford Motor Co  said on Tuesday it was postponing its plan to restart production at its North America plants due to safety concerns for its workers amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Global M&A dwindles as coronavirus batters world’s economies
Description: Global mergers and acquisitions activity plunged 28% in the first quarter to its lowest level since 2016 as the devastating economic effects of the coronavirus pandemic took hold in March, compounding a slow start to the year for dealmakers.

Headlines: Ford, GE to produce 50,000 ventilators in 100 days
Description: Ford Motor Co said on Monday it will produce 50,000 ventilators over the next 100 days at a plant in Michigan in cooperation with General Electric's healthcare unit, and can then build 30,000 per month as needed to treat patients afflicted with the coronavirus.

Headlines: Google Japan defends impartiality of search results amid lockdown rumors
Description: Google  on Tuesday defended the impartiality of its search results after users in Japan seeking to corroborate rumors of an imminent state of emergency declaration by the government were met with no results on its website.

Headlines: Crisis-hit airlines face crippling cash squeeze, IATA says
Description: Global airlines warned on Tuesday that many carriers may not survive a record cash squeeze in the second quarter, as revenues and traffic plunge because of the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Virgin Money delays branch closures and job cuts due to coronavirus lockdown
Description: British bank Virgin Money  said on Tuesday that it will halt until further notice the planned closure of 52 branches and 500 job losses, as it grapples with the fallout from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: INEOS to build third European hand sanitiser plant in ten days
Description: Chemicals manufacturer INEOS [INEOSG.UL] said on Tuesday it will build a hand sanitiser plant in France in 10 days to help meet a European shortage and has begun production at its new British and German plants ahead of schedule.

Headlines: Microsoft clarifies Teams usage surged 775% in Italy
Description: Microsoft Corp  said it has seen a 775% jump in a month for Teams calling and meeting in Italy, withdrawing an earlier statement that the surge was for its cloud services in regions around the world that enforced social distancing to curb transmission of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Factbox: Airlines ground flights, count mounting costs of the coronavirus shock
Description: Airlines across the globe are feeling the pain as travel demand withers because of the coronavirus outbreak, scrapping flights and ditching financial forecasts.

Headlines: Russia's Gazprom says Bovanenkovo airport partially reopens
Description: Russia's Gazprom  said on Tuesday that the Bovanenkovo airport, shut due to a coronavirus scare, has partially resumed operations to handle industrial cargoes and food, though there are no plans to rotate staff at the gas field.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank to sponsor Eintracht Frankfurt soccer team - sources
Description: Deutsche Bank  is set to ink a sponsorship deal with its local soccer team Eintracht Frankfurt, two people with knowledge of the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Russia's Sistema-backed online retailer Ozon raises $50 million from U.S. fund
Description: Russian online retailer Ozon, part-owned by the Sistema  conglomerate, said on Tuesday it had raised $50 million from U.S. investment fund Princeville Capital through a convertible loan that can be turned into equity.

Headlines: Instacart, Amazon workers strike as labor unrest grows during coronavirus crisis
Description: Warehouse, delivery and retail gig workers in the United States went on strike on Monday to call attention to safety and wage concerns for people laboring through the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Factbox: Coronavirus cases reported at 19 of Amazon's U.S. warehouses
Description: Amazon.com Inc  is at the front line of responding to outbreaks of the novel coronavirus in the United States, delivering essential goods while more than half the population faces government stay-at-home orders.

Headlines: Ad giant WPP pulls dividend, buyback and outlook as clients cut spending
Description: The world's biggest advertising company WPP  has pulled its dividend and share buyback and withdrawn its 2020 guidance after the coronavirus pandemic sparked the most uncertain time in its 35-year history.

Headlines: Apple supplier Japan Display finalises deal to raise $200 million from 'customer'
Description: Japan Display said on Tuesday it has finalised a deal to raise $200 million from "an overseas customer," which sources have said is Apple.

Headlines: Vivendi closes sale of 10% stake in Universal to Tencent consortium
Description: Vivendi  closed on Tuesday the sale of a 10% stake in Universal Music Group (UMG) - home to Taylor Swift and The Beatles - to a Tencent-led consortium, in a deal giving UMG an enterprise value of 30 billion euros ($33 billion).

Headlines: China sales seen picking up after coronavirus blow: Volkswagen
Description: Volkswagen  expects vehicle sales in China, the world's largest car market, to quadruple in March, it said, pointing to a recovery following the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: China factory activity unexpectedly expands, but economy cannot shake off virus shock
Description: Factory activity in China unexpectedly expanded in March from a collapse the month before, but analysts caution that a durable near-term recovery is far from assured as the global coronavirus crisis knocks foreign demand and threatens a steep economic slump.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler executives, salaried employees to take pay cuts during coronavirus pandemic
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV's   top executives and salaried workers around the globe will take pay cuts in an act of "shared sacrifice" brought on by the coronavirus pandemic that has shuttered the automaker's plants in Europe and North America, according to a company memo seen by Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. airlines must suggest possible compensation for cash grants: Treasury
Description: Airlines must suggest possible compensation in return for government cash assistance and agree to conditions that include not cutting pay or laying off employees through Sept. 30, the U.S. Treasury Department said in guidelines issued on Monday as it prepares to quickly hand out $25 billion.

Headlines: Coronavirus could force GM to delay its redesigned 2021 SUVs
Description: General Motors  told suppliers on Monday it is postponing work on at least half a dozen future models to conserve cash during the coronavirus pandemic and suggested it could delay the planned launch in late April of its highly profitable large sport utility vehicles.

Headlines: Airlines plan furloughs; Air New Zealand sees smaller carrier in a year
Description: Major global airlines projected layoffs, furloughs and capacity cuts over the next few months, with Air New Zealand on Tuesday warning it expected staffing levels to be 30% lower than it is now, due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: KFC owner Yum Brands breaks junk debt market's four-week fast
Description: Yum Brands Inc , owner of Pizza Hut, KFC and Taco Bell restaurant chains, sold $600 million in bonds on Monday, reopening the U.S. market for junk-rated debt issues after its longest lull since the 2008 financial crisis.
