Headlines: Virgin Australia seeking government loan to weather coronavirus crisis
Description: Virgin Australia Holdings Ltd  said on Tuesday it is seeking a government loan of A$1.4 billion ($862.68 million) and exploring other options to get through the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: U.S. Air Force finds additional deficiency in Boeing's aerial fuel system
Description: The U.S. Air Force announced on Monday an additional deficiency in the KC-46 Pegasus aerial fuel system built by Boeing , classifying it at the Category I level, meaning it is a major technical issue that may endanger the aircrew and aircraft.

Headlines: Amazon's FBA service waiving two weeks of March storage fees: email
Description: Amazon.com Inc's Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) service will waive two weeks of storage fees in March, according to an email seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Samsung says chip factory worker tests positive for virus, output not affected
Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Tuesday that one of its chip factory workers in South Korea had tested positive for coronavirus, but its output has not been affected.

Headlines: U.S. senators urge coronavirus delay to June 1 USMCA trade deal start date
Description: A bipartisan group of 19 U.S. senators urged the Trump administration to push back the planned June 1 start date for the new U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade pact, saying the short lead time would add to pressures on U.S. companies due to the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Activist investor Starboard says it has 9.3% stake in software firm Commvault
Description: Activist investor Starboard Value LP has built a stake in U.S. data protection and data management software company Commvault, saying in a regulatory filing that it felt the shares were undervalued when it purchased them.

Headlines: American Airlines seeking up to $12 billion from aid package: memo
Description: American Airlines Holdings Inc  intends to apply for up to $12 billion in government aid, ensuring no involuntary layoffs or pay cuts in the next six months, executives said in a memo to employees on Monday.

Headlines: Airbnb to pay out $250 million to hosts to help ease coronavirus cancellation pain
Description: U.S. home rental firm Airbnb said on Monday it was allocating $250 million to help offset losses by hosts around the world whose guests have canceled bookings in the face of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. FAA juggles air traffic staffing as flights plummet amid coronavirus
Description: The Federal Aviation Administration is rejiggering staffing at air traffic control centers to respond to the dramatic falloff in flights and to reduce the impact of coronavirus cases.

Headlines: Spirit cancels New York, Connecticut, New Jersey flights after CDC warning
Description: Low-cost U.S. carrier Spirit Airlines Inc said on Monday it will cancel all flights to and from New York, Connecticut and New Jersey after U.S. officials warned against travel to the area because of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies, led by healthcare jump
Description: U.S. stocks rose on Monday, led in part by healthcare stocks as investors looked for shares that have become cheap and can withstand the impact to the economy from efforts to stem the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Deaths, intubations swamp New Orleans doctors in coronavirus surge
Description: Emergency room doctor Thomas Krajewski stopped at the hospital room door at 2 a.m. to glance at the chart. He knew instantly the long odds faced by the patient inside: A man in his 70s, with a fever, short of breath.

Headlines: The U.S. weighs the grim math of death vs. the economy
Description: Hollstadt Consulting CEO Molly Jungbauer has had to let go 30 of the 150 employees at her St. Paul, Minnesota firm to weather the drop in revenue from travel industry clients because of the coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. grocers add plexiglass sneeze guards to protect cashiers from coronavirus
Description: Kroger Co, Walmart Inc, Albertsons and other grocery sellers are installing plexiglass partitions at checkout counters to protect cashiers from the highly contagious coronavirus.

Headlines: Credit Suisse weighs curbing bonuses at time of coronavirus: CEO
Description: Credit Suisse  bank could restrain 2020 bonuses in a show of unity with victims of the coronavirus epidemic in Switzerland, Chief Executive Thomas Gottstein said on Monday.

Headlines: J&J, Moderna sign deals with U.S. to produce huge quantity of possible coronavirus vaccines
Description: The U.S. government has cut deals with Johnson & Johnson  and Moderna Inc  and said it is in talks with at least two other companies to prepare them to produce massive quantities of coronavirus vaccines even before safe and effective ones become available.

Headlines: Visa transaction volumes hurt as coronavirus crisis deepens
Description: Visa Inc  said on Monday its transaction volumes had been hit as the coronavirus pandemic wreaks havoc on consumer spending, leading it to forecast mid-single-digit percentage revenue growth for the second quarter.

Headlines: Macy's, Kohl's, Gap turn to mass furloughs as virus crisis deepens
Description: Major U.S. retailers Macy's Inc , Kohl's Corp  and Gap Inc  said on Monday they would furlough tens of thousands of employees, as they prepare to keep stores shut for longer to curb the spread of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Air New Zealand to lay off 3,500 employees as virus halts travel
Description: Air New Zealand  said on Tuesday nearly a third of its employees, about 3,500, will be laid off in the coming months, as it grapples with severe global travel curbs due to the coronavirus that has forced it to cancel nearly all flights.

Headlines: Workers go on strike at Amazon delivery site in Italy amid coronavirus
Description: Around one-third of those working at an Amazon  delivery station in central Italy went on strike on Monday, a union representative said, citing a request for enhanced safety measures for workers amid the coronavirus health emergency.

Headlines: Spread of coronavirus accelerates in U.S. jails and prisons
Description: Sean Hernandez says he covers his mouth and nose with a t-shirt or towel when he leaves his cell, the only defense he can improvise against the coronavirus outbreak now sweeping through New York’s Rikers Island jail system.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler CEO to halve his salary for three months in virus response: letter
Description: Fiat Chrysler  top executives will temporarily cut their salaries to preserve the automaker's financial soundness during the coronavirus emergency, Chief Executive Mike Manley told employees on Monday.

Headlines: World equity markets edge higher; oil plunges to 2002 lows
Description: Global equity benchmarks rose on Monday despite a drop in oil prices to their lowest levels since 2002, as central banks and the United States tried to contain damage from the rapidly spreading coronavirus that has upended the global economy.

Headlines: U.S. senators scrutinize meat packers' big profits during pandemic
Description: U.S. senators are calling for investigations of record profit margins for beef processors like Tyson Foods  and Cargill, after ranchers complained surging meat prices due to coronavirus hoarding did not translate into higher cattle prices.

Headlines: JPMorgan plans to raise up to $10 billion for alternative investments: source
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co's  alternative investments unit is looking to raise up to $10 billion to boost its spending power in the face of the coronavirus pandemic, a source familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: AmEx to avoid job cuts as it rides out coronavirus storm
Description: American Express Co  will avoid job cuts in 2020 as the credit card issuer "rides out the storm" brought on by the coronavirus pandemic, Chief Executive Officer Steve Squeri said in a video message to employees on LinkedIn.

Headlines: U.S. markets watchdog Clayton says SEC should not ban short-selling of shares
Description: The head of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Monday that it should not ban short-selling of shares, amid speculation on further measures the agency might take to arrest a market rout that stems from fears the coronavirus will spark a global recession.

Headlines: Explainer: The transatlantic divide on how banks handle coronavirus loans
Description: The United States has given banks a two-year break from provisions for loans soured by the coronavirus pandemic, seeking to keep credit flowing while borrowers struggle to stay afloat as economic activity grinds to a halt.

Headlines: BP will not cut jobs over next three months: CEO Looney
Description: Oil major BP PLC  will not cut jobs over the next three months, Chief Executive Officer Bernard Looney said, even as the company seeks to reduce spending following an oil price crash.

Headlines: Kohl's extends store closure, draws down $1 billion credit facility amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Kohl's Corp  said on Monday it would extend the duration of store closure, and fully draw down on its $1 billion revolving credit facility to control damages from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Bostic: Fed programs could be broadened if they have missed important parts of economy
Description: As U.S. officials role out trillions of dollars in new economic support, a Federal Reserve policymaker on Monday said focus will now shift to whether those programs prove adequate or need to be expanded even further.

Headlines: Partisan divide returns in U.S. Congress on coronavirus next steps
Description: Fresh partisan divisions flared on Sunday on the next steps for the U.S. Congress in dealing with the coronavirus crisis, with the top House of Representatives Republican casting doubt on the need for more economic stimulus legislation while House Speaker Nancy Pelosi signaled she plans to move forward with it.

Headlines: Aston Martin furloughing some staff after coronavirus plant closures
Description: Britain's Aston Martin said on Monday it is furloughing some employees as it handles the fallout from the coronavirus outbreak which has closed its car factories.

Headlines: Williams-Sonoma, Pottery Barn unit made unsubstantiated 'made in America' claims: FTC
Description: Luxury kitchenware company Williams-Sonoma Inc  and its Pottery Barn unit have agreed to stop making unsubstantiated "made in America" claims and to pay $1 million, the Federal Trade Commission said on Monday.

Headlines: Disney Chairman Bob Iger to forgo salary amid virus crisis
Description: Walt Disney Inc  Executive Chairman Bob Iger will forgo his salary and newly named Chief Executive Officer Bob Chapek will take a 50% pay cut amid the coronavirus crisis, according to an internal email from Chapek.

Headlines: Harley-Davidson settles board fight with investor Impala
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc  said on Monday it settled a board fight with Impala Asset Management just days after the investor began pressing to replace two directors at America's oldest and best-known motorcycle maker.

Headlines: France's Carrefour gives masks after staff walkout over coronavirus
Description: Staff working in a supermarket of French retailer Carrefour  in the southern city of Vitrolles will receive protective masks after some employees walked out over health risks associated with the coronavirus, a union said on Monday.

Headlines: Microsoft says Skype users surge 70% amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: The number of people using Microsoft's Skype video calling system has surged by 70% in a month to 40 million people presently, as more individuals stay home due to the coronavirus outbreak, the company said on Monday.

Headlines: Mexico's President says will comply with public vote to halt brewery project
Description: Mexico's President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Saturday said his government will comply with a public consultation to halt the construction of U.S. brewer Constellation Brands Inc's  more than $1 billion brewery project in the border city of Mexicali.

Headlines: Lockdown set to stymie Fiat attempt to restart some Italian production
Description: A probable extension of Italy's lockdown could frustrate an attempt by Fiat Chrysler  to resume some vehicle production at three Italian plants next week, a union representative said on Monday.

Headlines: Standard Chartered freezes hiring, warns of bonus cuts: memo
Description: Standard Chartered  has told staff it is freezing all external and internal hiring for two months and signaled it is likely to cut bonuses for 2020, as the Asia and Africa-focused lender grapples with the fallout from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Ray-Ban maker EssilorLuxottica halts dividend as postpones AGM
Description: Ray-Ban maker EssilorLuxottica  is suspending its dividend due to the coronavirus pandemic and said on Monday it was delaying its annual shareholder meeting by a month.

Headlines: Barclays sets 2050 'net zero' carbon goal after investor pressure
Description: Barclays , one of the biggest lenders in Europe to the fossil fuel industry, on Monday set itself a target to reach "net zero" for its own carbon emissions and the activities it finances by 2050.

Headlines: Airbus struggles to lift crisis-hit jet output
Description: Europe's Airbus  is grappling with labor and supply chain shortages and may only be able to restore aircraft production to some 10-20% of normal levels for now because of partial shutdowns, industry and union sources said.

Headlines: flydubai to reduce staff pay for three months due to coronavirus
Description: United Arab Emirates carrier flydubai will reduce pay for its employees for three months from April due to the impact of the global coronavirus crisis on its business, a spokeswoman said on Monday.

Headlines: Finnish government pushes Fortum to strive for carbon neutrality
Description: Finland's center-left government on Monday gave its blessing to majority state-owned Fortum's  strategy to cut emissions, but promised to push the company further towards carbon neutrality, the minister in charge wrote.

Headlines: UBS defies Swiss dividend freeze call with $2.6 billion payout plan
Description: UBS  plans to pay a 2019 dividend that is more than half its annual profit, defying calls by the Swiss government and financial markets supervisor for lenders to limit payouts during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: France's Renault puts Paris white collar staff on partial unemployment
Description: French carmaker Renault  put most of its white collar staff in the Ile-de-France region around Paris on partial unemployment on Monday as the lockdown imposed due to the coronavirus outbreak lowered activity.

Headlines: IMF says ECB, ESM support key to strong EU coronavirus response
Description: The International Monetary Fund said on Monday the relaxation of the euro zone's fiscal rules and support from the European Central Bank and the European Stability Mechanism is critical to a strong regional response to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Commerzbank cancels its 2019 dividend recommendation
Description: Commerzbank  said on Monday that it will not propose a dividend for 2019.

Headlines: Exclusive: American Airlines in talks to hire Millstein for aid advice
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  is in advanced talks to hire Guggenheim Securities co-chairman James Millstein for advice on tapping a $50 billion industry relief package available from the U.S. Treasury Department to cope with the coronavirus pandemic, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: China's big banks flag asset pressure due to virus, boding ill for smaller kin
Description: China's largest state banks said the impact of restrictions on movement imposed to slow the spread of the coronavirus could pull down asset quality as borrowers struggle to repay loans, though they are likely big enough to weather any fallout.

Headlines: Facebook commits $100 million to support news media hurt by virus crisis
Description: Facebook Inc  on Monday pledged $100 million in financing and advertising spending to support news organizations, including local publishers in the United States, reeling from pressure due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: EasyJet grounds fleet as pandemic pushes airlines to the brink
Description: British budget airline easyJet  has grounded its fleet of 344 planes and has no clear idea when it might resume flights, it said on Monday, highlighting the strain on airlines trying to survive the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Mylan offers concessions to address EU concerns about Pfizer deal
Description: Generic drugmaker Mylan NV  has offered concessions to address European Union antitrust concerns about its bid for Pfizer's  off-patent branded drugs business Upjohn, a filing on the European Commission site showed on Monday.

Headlines: BNY Mellon names interim head Gibbons as CEO
Description: Bank of New York Mellon Corp  on Monday named interim head Thomas Gibbons as chief executive officer, effective immediately.

Headlines: Activist investor makes new push for HC2 board to remove chief Falcone: letter
Description: An activist investor is stepping up calls for the board of HC2 Holdings Inc  to remove Chief Executive and Chairman Philip Falcone as the former hedge fund manager faces mounting legal and financial troubles.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs sees S&P 500 dividends declining 25% in 2020
Description: Goldman Sachs said on Monday it expects S&P 500 dividends to fall by 25% in 2020 as certain large dividend-paying industries are particularly vulnerable to the economic shock of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. stimulus package is biggest ever, but may not be big enough
Description: The Federal Reserve has offered more than $3 trillion in loans and asset purchases in recent weeks to stop the U.S. financial system from seizing up, but it has not yet directly helped large swaths of the real economy: companies, municipalities and other borrowers with less than perfect credit.

Headlines: Ted Baker names finance chief Rachel Osborne as CEO
Description: Troubled fashion retailer Ted Baker  on Monday named Chief Financial Officer Rachel Osborne to the permanent role of chief executive officer, replacing Lindsay Page who stepped down last year.

Headlines: Trump's attack on GM over ventilators quickly turns to praise
Description: President Donald Trump, who excoriated General Motors Co on Friday and invoked emergency powers to compel the production of badly needed ventilators to tackle the coronavirus pandemic, has abruptly shifted gears to praise the automaker.

Headlines: China unexpectedly cuts reverse repo rate by most in five years to support virus-hit economy
Description: China's central bank unexpectedly cut the rate on reverse repurchase agreements by 20 basis points on Monday, the largest in nearly five years, as authorities ramped up steps to relieve pressure on an economy ravaged by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Major airlines urge U.S. Treasury to disburse assistance quickly
Description: Major U.S. airlines asked the U.S. Treasury to move quickly to release up to $58 billion in government grants and loans and recommended a formula to divide up the money.

Headlines: Toyota says most Europe plants won't restart until April 20 at earliest
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  said on Monday that it would extend a suspension at all of its factories in Europe with the exception of Russia until further notice, with a restart expected no earlier than April 20.

Headlines: From quills to qwerty: Lloyd's underwriters adapt to home working
Description: Thousands of London's underwriters took their stamps and fountain pens home last week, which they use to sign insurance contracts, but they won't need them.

Headlines: Coronavirus worries and strife: Investors fear markets not out of woods despite big rally
Description: After a brutal meltdown, some investors have been wading back into U.S. stocks. But others are wary of another leg down as the coronavirus spreads and its economic impact is difficult to predict.

Headlines: Governments, central banks must boost efforts to help economies cope with crisis: BIS chief
Description: Governments and central banks need to step up efforts urgently to support their economies in the face of the coronavirus crisis, the head of the Bank for International Settlements said on Sunday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Qatar Airways says it will need state support as cash runs out
Description: Qatar Airways will have to seek government support eventually, Chief Executive Akbar al-Baker told Reuters on Sunday, warning that the Middle East carrier could soon run out of the cash needed to continue flying.

Headlines: Clothing rental service Rent the Runway lays off workers amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: U.S. clothing rental firm Rent the Runway said on Saturday it had laid off retail employees following temporary store closures amid the ongoing coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Pence says virus taskforce soon to deliver recommendation on whether to re-open economy
Description: Vice President Mike Pence, heading the Trump administration's response to the coronavirus outbreak, said on Saturday that he would deliver a recommendation to the president on whether to re-open the U.S. economy in the coming week.

Headlines: Airbnb hosts to provide free rooms for British health workers
Description: Airbnb hosts will provide free rooms for workers in Britain's National Health Service (NHS) to support their work during the coronavirus outbreak, the company said on Sunday.

Headlines: UK broadband providers lift data caps during coronavirus crisis
Description: Britain's big telecoms providers have agreed to remove all data caps on fixed-line broadband services that have become a lifeline for people isolated at home during the coronavirus crisis, the government said on Sunday.

Headlines: Ackman says Pershing Square no longer has hedges on stocks
Description: William Ackman's Pershing Square Capital Management no longer has hedges on its stock portfolio, but still has some cash to invest if equities decline further as the United States battles the coronavirus outbreak, the billionaire investor said on Saturday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon entices warehouse employees to grocery unit with higher pay
Description: Amazon.com Inc is offering higher pay to recruit its own warehouse employees to pick and pack Whole Foods groceries amid rising demand and a worker shortage, according to an internal document reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: As virus threatens, U.S. embraces big government, for now
Description: It may, as House Majority Leader and Maryland Democrat Steny Hoyer said on Friday, be out of love that the United States agreed to shut down much of its economy to stop a viral epidemic and save lives.

Headlines: Condom shortage looms after coronavirus lockdown shuts world's top producer
Description: A global shortage of condoms is looming, the world's biggest producer said, after a coronavirus lockdown forced it to shut down production.

Headlines: Trump tells GM: Stop 'wasting time', build ventilators to address coronavirus
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday invoked emergency powers to require General Motors Co to build much-needed ventilators for coronavirus patients after he accused the largest U.S. automaker of "wasting time" during negotiations.

Headlines: Factbox: Carmakers churn out machines, masks to help fight coronavirus
Description: Auto companies and suppliers around the world are ramping up production of critical healthcare products and machines - everything from cloth face masks to sophisticated ventilator systems - to meet a critical shortage of those items at hospitals and care facilities in North America, Europe and Asia.

Headlines: GM reaches settlement over lost vehicle value from defective ignition switches
Description: General Motors Co has reached a $120 million settlement with owners who claimed that their vehicles lost value because of defective ignition switches, which have been linked to 124 deaths.

Headlines: Apple's factories are running, but suppliers wary about iPhone demand
Description: As China reopens its economy after months of lockdown, Apple Inc's  iPhone factories are largely up and running. But  with the coronavirus pandemic spreading across the world, the urgent question for the company is how many buyers there will be both for current models and the new slate of phones expected in the fall.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Fund rebalancing could help buoy stock rebound
Description: Money managers rebalancing their portfolios to boost equity exposure into the end of the quarter may support the nascent stock rally that has followed the steep coronavirus-fueled market drop.

Headlines: U.S. regulators give banks relief on accounting standard, derivatives rule
Description: U.S. banking regulators told banks Friday they could ignore the capital implications of a new accounting standard for two years and adopt early a new, more sensitive way to measure risk in a bid to ensure banks continue lending through the pandemic.

Headlines: Airbnb suspends marketing to save $800 million, top executives take pay cut: source
Description: Airbnb Inc has suspended all its marketing activities to save $800 million this year, and its founders will take no salary for the next six months while top executives will take a 50% cut, according to a person familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Treasury: U.S. will be 'compensated' for assistance to airlines
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin said on Friday that taxpayers will "compensated" for providing up to $25 billion in direct grants to the airline industry.

Headlines: Wall Street tumbles as U.S. virus cases pass 100,000
Description: Wall Street stocks tumbled on Friday, ending a massive three-day surge after doubts about the fate of the U.S. economy resurfaced and the number of coronavirus cases in the country climbed.

Headlines: Bipartisan majority of Americans reject Trump idea to reopen by Easter: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Description: A bipartisan majority of Americans appear to reject an idea floated by President Donald Trump to reopen businesses by Easter, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll, which also showed that nearly one in four have been laid off or furloughed during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. airlines cheer government relief but warn it is no 'cure' for deep industry crisis
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc and Delta Air Lines welcomed on Friday a $50 billion relief package they said would protect jobs through September but warned that the continued challenges facing the industry will require more action.

Headlines: European airlines resist mounting coronavirus refund claims
Description: European airlines waiting in line for coronavirus bailouts want to tap another source of interest-free loans: their customers.

Headlines: U.S. airlines expect clarity on terms of payroll grants in 5-10 days: UAL senior executives
Description: U.S. airlines expect to learn the terms of federal aid meant to protect workers' payrolls in the midst of a sharp downturn from the coronavirus in the next five to 10 days, senior executives at United Airlines Holdings Inc said on Friday.

Headlines: Fed sets fee structure for BlackRock's role in mortgage bond purchases
Description: BlackRock Inc will earn less than $8 million a year in fees for its role assisting the Federal Reserve with its purchases of commercial mortgage-backed securities, one of the new programs the central bank is rolling out to backstop an economy under threat from the coronavirus outbreak, according to details of the arrangement released on Friday.

Headlines: Stocks down on virus' economic toll; dollar falls further
Description: Stocks across the globe fell on Friday after a historic three-day run-up, as skittish investors kept indices on track for their worst monthly and quarterly performances since 2008, while the dollar fell by the most in any week since 2009.

Headlines: Oil plunges posting fifth straight weekly loss despite stimulus efforts
Description: Oil prices plunged 5% on Friday and posted a fifth straight weekly loss as demand destruction caused by the coronavirus outweighed stimulus efforts by policymakers around the world.

Headlines: U.S. consumer sentiment near three-and-a-half year low, spending sluggish
Description: U.S. consumer sentiment dropped to near a 3-1/2-year low in March as the coronavirus epidemic upended life for Americans, and consumer spending was sluggish in February, strengthening economists' expectations of a deep recession.

Headlines: ECB tells euro zone banks to skip payouts as virus hits economy
Description: The European Central Bank told euro zone banks on Friday to skip dividend payments and share buybacks until October at the earliest and use their profits to support the economy as it is hit by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Global oil refiners shut down as coronavirus destroys demand
Description: The first oil refinery shutdowns in India and Europe were announced on Friday while global refinery runs drop like a stone in response to plunging demand as countries worldwide implement lockdowns.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia says no talks on new oil deal, Moscow suggests larger OPEC+
Description: Saudi Arabia said on Friday it was not in talks with Russia to balance oil markets despite rising pressure from Washington to stop a price rout amid the coronavirus pandemic and an attempt by Moscow to fix a rift with the de facto OPEC leader.

Headlines: More than 100 British companies halt dividend payments due to coronavirus pandemic
Description: More than 100 British companies have postponed or ditched dividend payments in a bid to preserve cash for what could be a lengthy enforced shutdown of large parts of the UK and global economy due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Delta CEO says gov't aid ensures no industry lay-offs through September 30
Description: Delta Air Lines Chief Executive Ed Bastian said payroll assistance funds from the government under a massive stimulus package approved on Friday ensure there will not be any involuntary furloughs or pay cuts in the U.S. airline industry through Sept. 30.

Headlines: Bank of America capital levels allow operational focus during crisis: CEO
Description: Bank of America Corp  is better positioned to focus on operations rather than financial risk during the coronavirus outbreak, thanks to regulatory safeguards put in place after the financial crisis in 2008, Chief Executive Brian Moynihan said on Friday.

Headlines: Google-parent Alphabet to donate $800 million in response to coronavirus crisis
Description: Alphabet Inc  will donate more than $800 million in funds towards producing medical supplies used to fight COVID-19, and in ad credits to government and health organizations and businesses, Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai said on Friday.

Headlines: A U.S. recession? Probably. Depression? Only if the virus is untamed
Description: WASHINGTON - A U.S. recession may already be underway. Could it be worse?

Headlines: S&P cuts Airbus outlook amid concern over deliveries, advances
Description: Ratings agency Standard & Poors placed Airbus  on its watch list for a possible downgrade as doubts surfaced over the future level of aircraft deliveries and advance payments from airlines battered by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Lufthansa applies for short-time work for 31,000 employees
Description: Lufthansa  has applied for short-time work for around 31,000 crew and ground staff at its core brand until the end of August, a spokesman said on Friday, as Germany's flagship carrier has slashed flights due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Take Five: Quarter-life crisis
Description: Few will regret the end of the first 2020 quarter. Fears of a U.S.-Iran war gave way to the coronavirus pandemic which JPMorgan reckons will have pushed the world economy into a 12% contraction over January to March. The quarter saw the most brutal global equity collapse since the Great Depression, exacerbated by a 60% oil price slump.

Headlines: Newly jobless Americans worry about making ends meet
Description: Optician Ali Nelson sent the final few orders of eyeglasses to clients last week before her Washington D.C.-based store closed to help prevent the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Toyota to make face masks in U.S. to aid coronavirus battle
Description: Toyota Motor Corp's  North American unit said on Friday it would produce face shields, ventilators and respirators, as the death toll from the coronavirus exceeds 1,200 in the United States.

Headlines: Equinor to quit U.S. lobby group over climate policy
Description: Equinor  will leave industry the Independent Petroleum Association of America (IPAA) lobby group over a disagreement on climate policy, the energy producer said on Friday.

Headlines: Africa's web of creditors complicates coronavirus debt relief
Description: Africa is crying out for debt relief to weather a perfect storm of coronavirus, plummeting oil and commodity prices, mounting budget deficits and weaker currencies.

Headlines: Forex volatility to make providers hike prices: Walmart de Mexico
Description: Walmart de Mexico said on Friday that foreign exchange fluctuations will make its providers increase some of their prices, pointing to the depreciation of the peso and other currencies during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Apple works with White House to release 'COVID-19' app, website
Description: Apple Inc and the White House said on Friday that the iPhone maker worked with the Trump administration and federal agencies to release an app and website that will direct users to guidance from the Centers for Disease Control on the disease caused by the coronavirus.

Headlines: Virgin Atlantic set to ask for state aid: FT
Description: UK-based airline Virgin Atlantic will ask the British government for a package of commercial loans and guarantees worth hundreds of millions of pounds, the Financial Times reported https://www.ft.com/content/c2d817d9-8a73-4bb8-89e7-e5ca67ed41d7 on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: H&M starts protective face mask production at Chinese supplier
Description: Sweden's H&M, the world's second-biggest fashion retailer, said on Friday it had started production of protective face masks for hospital staff and would ship the first batches to Spain and Italy.

Headlines: Car maker PSA wants to restart two French plants, unions disagree
Description: French car maker PSA,  which makes the Peugeot and Citroen brands, said on Friday it had presented health measures to its unions with a view to gradually restarting its European plants, which have been closed for fear of coronavirus infection.

Headlines: Britain's Next shuts online operation to protect workers
Description: Leading British fashion chain Next  has bowed to pressure from workers worried about their health and shut its online business, cutting off its remaining source of revenue during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Fed working to bolster credit during 'self-mandated' recession: Kaplan
Description: A raft of programs from the U.S. central bank and a $2 trillion rescue bill nearing approval in Congress are aimed at providing relief during a "self-mandated" recession "so that when the virus is defeated we can walk, we can run, and then we can sprint out of this," Dallas Federal Reserve bank President Robert Kaplan said on Friday.

Headlines: Fed's term repo operation receives no bids for first time
Description: The Federal Reserve's term repurchase agreement (repo) operation on Friday morning received no bids out of a possible $500 billion for the first time since regular operations began last year.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin speeds up payments to suppliers amid coronavirus slowdown
Description: Defense contractor Lockheed Martin Corp  said on Friday that it would advance more than $50 million to suppliers hurt by a sharp economic slowdown caused by efforts to stop the coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. prepares crackdown on Huawei's global chip supply - sources
Description: Senior officials in the Trump administration agreed to new measures to restrict the global supply of chips to China's Huawei Technologies, sources familiar with the matter said, as the White House ramps up criticism of China over coronavirus.

Headlines: Singapore Airlines obtains $13 billion rescue package amid coronavirus shock
Description: State investor Temasek Holdings and others put together a funding package of up to S$19 billion ($13.27 billion) for Singapore Airlines (SIA)  in the single biggest rescue for an airline slammed by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Nestle staff to get full salary for three months where COVID-19 halts work
Description: Nestle , the world's biggest food company, said it would  pay full salaries for at least three months to employees affected by work stoppages to prevent the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Indian lockdown disrupts Amazon, Flipkart deliveries: sources
Description: India's coronavirus lockdown is disrupting e-commerce companies including Amazon and Flipkart, despite government assurances it would not, four sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: 'This is a war and we want to survive,' says Polish retailer
Description: Polish fashion retailers may not survive the coronavirus crisis if the government, banks and shopping mall owners do not help them bear the costs, a lobby group said on Friday, as Poland closed non-essential shops to stop the spread of the virus.

Headlines: We need to act, ECB's Lagarde tells feuding EU on coronavirus rescue: sources
Description: European Central Bank chief Christine Lagarde urged wrangling EU leaders to act more decisively to cushion the economic hit of the coronavirus pandemic, three sources familiar with the matter said on Friday, as the bloc feuds over how far to go.

Headlines: Singapore Airlines latest to get massive rescue amid coronavirus crisis
Description: Singapore Airlines  said it had secured up to S$19 billion ($13 billion) of funding to help see it through the coronavirus crisis and expand afterward, in a sign of confidence travel demand will eventually return.

Headlines: Alitalia seeks to place 2,900 more staff in layoff scheme: document
Description: Alitalia's administrator has asked Italy's government to raise to nearly 7,000 the number of its employees under a temporary lay-off scheme, with most of its aircraft standing idle during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: 'Maximum bearish': funds in record rush to cash in past week
Description: Investors rushed into cash and out of bonds at a record pace over the past week as the coronavirus pandemic caused mayhem in  markets, BofA said on Friday, though it noted a key positioning signal at "maximum bearish" could signal a big rally ahead.

Headlines: Nestle says cuts deforestation in its cocoa supply chain
Description: Nestle, the world's biggest food company, says it has made significant progress removing cocoa produced in protected forests in West Africa from its supply chain as pressure builds from consumers and governments for ethically sourced cocoa.

Headlines: Exclusive: India's Reliance seeks to sell Mideast crude cargoes in rare move
Description: India's Reliance Industries Ltd  is seeking to sell some April-loading crude cargoes in a rare move as it plans to cut crude processing after the coronavirus pandemic hit global fuel demand, four sources said on Friday.

Headlines: Travelex shuts UK forex bureaus on virus fears, starts funding talks
Description: Foreign exchange company Travelex said on Friday it was shutting its UK bureaus for about eight weeks or more due to the coronavirus pandemic and that it was in talks with its stakeholders for continued access to funds.

Headlines: Travel slump, sick staff force cash-worried U.S. airports to downsize
Description: With fewer planes flying and more security and traffic control officers testing positive for the coronavirus, airports are closing terminals, concessions and checkpoints, even while trying to retain jobs with the hope of a post-crisis pickup.

Headlines: Goldman, Morgan Stanley receive approvals for majority stakes in China ventures
Description: Goldman Sachs  and Morgan Stanley  said on Friday they had received the final regulatory approvals to take majority stakes in their China securities joint ventures, as Beijing continues to open its financial sector to foreigners.

Headlines: Rolls-Royce to cut UK aerospace site activity for a week over coronavirus
Description: Rolls-Royce  will significantly reduce all non-essential activity at its civil aerospace sites in Britain for one week starting from midnight on March 27, due to the coronavirus pandemic, the company said on Friday.

Headlines: ViacomCBS withdraws forecast as virus delays movie launches, sports events
Description: ViacomCBS Inc  on Friday withdrew its forecast for the year as the ongoing coronavirus pandemic and related lockdowns force the media conglomerate to delay movie releases.

Headlines: ProSieben shares rally after CEO Conze's departure
Description: Shares in ProSiebenSat.1 Media  rallied by 9% on Friday after the abrupt departure of Chief Executive Officer Max Conze ended a drama-filled tenure that unraveled after his deputy denounced a "soap opera" at the German broadcaster.

Headlines: Brazil headed for 'whatever it takes' QE as coronavirus crash looms
Description: Brazil's central bank could soon be forced to fire up the money printing presses if the coronavirus-fueled recession facing Latin America's largest economy is as devastating as some economists fear.

Headlines: India's Tata Motors to spin off car division as separate unit
Description: Tata Motors Ltd  said on Friday it would spin off its passenger vehicles arm as a separate unit within the company, at a time when the coronavirus has disrupted auto production.

Headlines: How multi-strategy funds are faring as coronavirus slashes returns
Description: Just one of the world's biggest multi-strategy funds available to retail investors is in the black for the year after coronavirus panic saw markets fall across the board, data from Morningstar showed.

Headlines: U.S. airlines to dash for cash grants, not loans, even with potential government stake
Description: U.S. airlines are preparing to tap the government for up to $25 billion in grants to cover payroll in a sharp travel downturn triggered by the coronavirus, even after the government warned it may take stakes in exchange for bailout funds, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Volkswagen's Skoda extends Czech factory outages to April 14
Description: Czech carmaker Skoda Auto, part of the Volkswagen Group , will extend a stoppage at its domestic plants to April 14 from an original return date of April 6, the company said on Friday.

Headlines: Britain's Tesco limits online shop to 80 items during coronavirus crisis
Description: Britain's biggest supermarket group Tesco will limit the number of items customers can order in an online shop to 80 during the coronavirus emergency, it said on Friday.

Headlines: Coronavirus delays Royal Mail 'Journey 2024' turnaround plan
Description: Britain's Royal Mail  on Friday became the latest company to say the coronavirus had delayed plans for a radical turnaround and also canceled its dividend and suspended financial forecasts for the next year.

Headlines: Volkswagen burning through $2.2 billion a week as coronavirus halts production: CEO
Description: Volkswagen  may have to cut jobs if the coronavirus pandemic is not brought under control as the carmaker is still spending about 2 billion euros ($2.2 billion) a week, Chief Executive Herbert Diess told German TV channel ZDF.

Headlines: Alitalia asks to put more workers under layoff scheme-document
Description: Alitalia's administrator has asked the Italian government to increase the number of employees under temporary lay-off scheme to nearly 7,000, a document showed, to help mitigate the impact the coronavirus outbreak had on the airline and the wider sector.

Headlines: China's auto industry wastes no time coaxing drivers back to showrooms after lockdown
Description: China's auto industry has gone from zero to sixty in its post-pandemic campaign drive, with manufacturers and dealers quick to woo back lockdown-weary consumers through campaigns as unusual as a makeup-promoting personality touting car leasing.

Headlines: U.S. companies, labs rush to produce blood test for coronavirus immunity
Description: As the United States works overtime to screen thousands for the novel coronavirus, a new blood test offers the chance to find out who may have immunity - a potential game changer in the battle to contain infections and get the economy back on track.

Headlines: Ferrari extends Italian plant closures to April 14 subject to supplies
Description: Luxury carmaker Ferrari  said on Friday it would  extend the shutdown of its two Italian plants and reopen on April 14, provided it had supplies, and update 2020 forecasts in May when it releases its first-quarter earnings.

Headlines: Exclusive: Russia calls for new enlarged OPEC deal to tackle oil demand collapse
Description: A new OPEC+ deal to balance oil markets might be possible if other countries join in, Kirill Dmitriev, head of Russia's sovereign wealth fund said, adding that countries should also cooperate to cushion the economic fallout from coronavirus.

Headlines: Toyota seeks $9.2-billion credit line from Sumitomo Mitsui, MUFG Bank: Kyodo
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  has sought a credit line totaling 1 trillion yen ($9.23 billion) from Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp and MUFG Bank as a coronavirus pandemic drives up fund-raising costs, Kyodo News said on Friday.

Headlines: Olympics delay deals setback to Samsung's plans to win over Japan market
Description: For Samsung Electronics Co Ltd , the 2020 Tokyo Olympics were going to be its springboard to attain a long-held goal - making significant inroads into Japan's lucrative smartphone market where Apple Inc  dominates.

Headlines: Factbox: Global oil, gas producers cut spending after crude price crash
Description: Oil and gas companies are cutting spending plans in response to the coronavirus pandemic and a push by Saudi Arabia and Russia to ramp up output.

Headlines: Mini-bull, tired bear, or something in-between
Description: Investors could be forgiven for doing a double-take: Wait, we're back in a bull market?

Headlines: Tesla to slash on-site staff at Nevada factory by 75% due to virus: county manager
Description: U.S. electric carmaker Tesla Inc  plans to slash on-site staff at its Nevada battery plant by around 75% due to the coronavirus pandemic, the local county manager said on Thursday.

Headlines: World's ailing airlines appeal for aid as U.S. offers $58 billion
Description: Global airlines urged the world's major economies to act quickly to prevent irreversible damage to an industry that has seen demand decimated almost overnight by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Fed balance sheet tops $5 trillion for first time as it enters coronavirus war mode
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve's balance sheet soared past $5 trillion in assets for the first time this week as it scooped up bonds and extended loans to banks, mutual funds and other central banks in its unprecedented effort to backstop the economy in the face of the global coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Factbox: Coronavirus cases reported at 13 of Amazon's U.S. warehouses
Description: Amazon.com Inc  is at the front line of responding to outbreaks of the novel coronavirus in the United States, delivering essential goods while about half the population faces government stay-at-home orders.

Headlines: UTC, Raytheon deal wins U.S. antitrust approval, with divestitures
Description: The U.S. Justice Department has approved United Technologies Corporation's planned merger with Raytheon Co, subject to conditions, the agency said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. banks borrow at discount window after Fed offers stigma relief
Description: With encouragement from the Federal Reserve, U.S. banks have turned to a long-shunned lending facility known as the discount window to borrow $50.8 billion, according to data the central bank released on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. House leaders determined to pass $2.2 trillion coronavirus bill
Description: Leaders of the U.S. House of Representatives are determined to pass a $2.2 trillion coronavirus relief bill on Friday, or at the very latest on Saturday, hoping to provide the quickest help possible as deaths mount and the economy reels.

Headlines: Big banks reassure staff about potential job cuts
Description: Big banks are postponing decisions about staff cuts as the coronavirus outbreak hits their businesses hard, with executives saying they are unsure how long the outbreak will hurt the economy and worried about being unprepared if business suddenly snaps back.

Headlines: U.S. House sets Friday debate for coronavirus aid bill
Description: The U.S. House of Representatives will begin a two-hour debate on a sweeping, $2.2 trillion coronavirus aid bill at 9 a.m. (1300 GMT) on Friday but it was not clear whether the measure would be able to pass on a voice vote, the House Majority Leader's office said late on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. egg prices hit record levels as pandemic buying boosts demand
Description: Increased demand for eggs in the United States has sent egg prices soaring in recent weeks as consumers scramble to stock up on staples due to coronavirus shutdowns.

Headlines: Factbox: Latest on the spread of the coronavirus around the world
Description: Leaders of the Group of 20 major economies pledged to inject $5 trillion in fiscal spending into the global economy to blunt the economic impact of the coronavirus and "do whatever it takes to overcome the pandemic."

Headlines: Senate passes $2 trillion bill for 'strange and evil' coronavirus crisis
Description: The U.S. Senate on Wednesday unanimously backed a $2 trillion bill aimed at helping unemployed workers and industries hurt by the coronavirus epidemic, as well as providing billions of dollars to buy urgently needed medical equipment.

Headlines: U.S. carmakers move to shore up cash, Ford to restart some plants
Description: The two largest U.S. automakers on Thursday announced measures to shore up their finances as the coronavirus pandemic takes a deep economic bite, with Ford Motor Co  aiming to resume production next month of its most profitable vehicles while cutting costs further.

Headlines: Dow wraps up strongest three days since 1931
Description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average  wrapped up its strongest three days in nine decades on Thursday as record weekly U.S. jobless claims came in below investors' worst fears and the focus stayed on an unprecedented $2 trillion stimulus awaiting approval by the U.S. House of Representatives.

Headlines: Lululemon holds back forecast on virus uncertainty as results beat
Description: Lululemon Athletica Inc  beat analysts' estimates for quarterly results on Thursday, lifted by strong holiday season demand, but the athletic apparel maker did not provide a full-year forecast as the coronavirus outbreak fuels uncertainty.

Headlines: EU lawmakers back aid for virus-hit economy in remote vote
Description: European Union lawmakers approved on Thursday emergency funds to cushion the bloc's economic slump triggered by the coronavirus pandemic and shore up battered airlines by preserving their landing slots.

Headlines: To avoid a repeat of 2008, Main Street America says help needs to be fast
Description: Small businesses in the United States say promised help from the federal government and the Federal Reserve is welcome news in the battle to stay afloat through the coronavirus crisis, but needs to hit their bank accounts fast if it's to make a difference as they barter with landlords, hold onto tax receipts, haggle with vendors and hope furloughed staff can get by on unemployment aid.

Headlines: Factbox: What's in the $2.2 trillion Senate coronavirus rescue package
Description: The U.S. Senate on Thursday unanimously approved an unprecedented stimulus package to alleviate the devastating economic impact of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Gap pulls forecast, suspends dividend, taps $500 million credit as coronavirus bites
Description: Gap Inc  on Thursday withdrew its full-year forecast issued just two weeks ago, suspended its dividend and said it will draw down on its entire $500 million credit facility as the apparel retailer looks to weather the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: EU lawmakers back suspension of airline slots rule until October
Description: European lawmakers overwhelmingly agreed on Thursday to suspend until Oct. 24 a rule requiring airlines to use at least 80% of their flight slots to keep them the following year so as to ease an industry crisis unleashed by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Ross Stores, other retailers cancel vendor orders following coronavirus hit
Description: After closing stores around the world to curb the spread of the coronavirus, retailers are now telling some vendors to immediately cancel orders.

Headlines: GM extends North American shutdown, does not set restart date
Description: General Motors Co  said Thursday it will extend a shutdown of its North American plants beyond March 30, but added it does not know when it will restart operations.

Headlines: Time to buy stocks again, market mavens say
Description: BlackRock, Credit Suisse and some other big banks reckon it is time to get back into equities after markets rallied this week following massive government and central bank stimulus packages to fight fallout from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Wall Street powers stocks higher on $2 trillion stimulus; dollar takes a hit
Description: A Wall Street rally led global gains in stocks on Thursday despite a record number of new unemployment filings in the United States, as traders focused on the unanimous passage of a $2 trillion coronavirus relief bill in the U.S. Senate and the possibility of more stimuli to come.

Headlines: Petrobras' divestment push in Brazil challenged by oil price war
Description: A move by Brazil's Petrobras on Thursday to slash output, capital spending and dividends brings the state-run oil firm into alignment with global rivals confronted with a global pandemic and a plunge in crude prices.

Headlines: U.S. home healthcare industry warns of possible 'collapse'
Description: Home healthcare providers, the lifelines to 12 million vulnerable Americans, are scrambling to decide how to serve patients who show symptoms of coronavirus -- and how to ensure that the providers themselves neither catch nor spread it.

Headlines: Ford to restart U.S. truck plants in April to beat pandemic-linked cash squeeze
Description: Ford Motor Co  announced plans on Thursday to shore up its finances amid the coronavirus pandemic, aiming to generate more cash by resuming production next month of its most profitable vehicles while saving money through further cost cuts.

Headlines: Oil sheds more than $1 as weakening demand outweighs stimulus hopes
Description: Oil prices dropped more than $1 a barrel on Thursday as a growing number of virus-related restrictions on travel slashed global fuel demand, overshadowing expectations that a $2 trillion U.S. stimulus package will bolster economic activity.

Headlines: Two Tesla employees test positive for coronavirus: company email
Description: Two employees of Tesla Inc have tested positive for coronavirus but have been working from home for the past two weeks and had not been symptomatic at work, Tesla said in an email to employees on Thursday.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank studies state aid for staff in coronavirus crisis
Description: Deutsche Bank is for the first time considering asking its German staff to cut their hours and take government money instead as it tries to navigate the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Exclusive: Capital One got CFTC waiver after oil price plunge increased swap exposure - sources
Description: U.S. lender Capital One Financial Corp got a waiver from the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) after plunging oil prices increased the bank's derivatives exposure above a key regulatory threshold, according to two sources with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Exclusive: Cirque du Soleil explores options including bankruptcy - sources
Description: Cirque du Soleil Entertainment Group is exploring debt restructuring options that include a potential bankruptcy filing, after it was forced to cancel shows because of the coronavirus outbreak, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Czech breweries roll back the barrels, turn to bottles and cans
Description: Czech breweries -- including Pilsner Urquell and Budejovicky Budvar -- have stopped refilling kegs and started storing their beer in cooled cellars as they seek to limit damage from pub closures caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Virtual tours, coronavirus clauses: Pandemic up-ends homebuying across the U.S.
Description: Prospective buyers arriving at Betsy and Eric Melby's house for sale in Memphis, Tennessee, last week were greeted by a large pump bottle of hand sanitizer and a box of disposable gloves.

Headlines: Online learning rockets in coronavirus pandemic, says Pearson
Description: Britain's Pearson  has seen an "explosion" in demand for online learning, with traffic across its platforms quadrupling as millions of children start to adapt to home schooling during the coronavirus pandemic, its chief executive said.

Headlines: U.S. corporate crisis bailouts may prove bonanza for insider trading, new study warns
Description: White-collar crime prosecutors and defense attorneys are likely to be busy following a massive economic stimulus package from the U.S. Congress aimed at mitigating the fallout from the coronavirus, according to a new academic study of insider trading.

Headlines: Daimler in talks for 10 billion euro credit line: Bloomberg
Description: Daimler  is in talks with lenders for a credit facility of at least 10 billion euros ($11.03 billion) to help the car company cope with the coronavirus outbreak, Bloomberg reported on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims soar to record 3.28 million
Description: The number of Americans filing claims for unemployment benefits surged to a record of more than 3 million last week as strict measures to contain the coronavirus pandemic brought the country to a sudden halt, unleashing a wave of layoffs that likely ended the longest employment boom in U.S. history.

Headlines: Wendy's to ease payments for franchisees to stem coronavirus fallout
Description: Fast-food chain Wendy's Co  said on Thursday it would defer rent and ease royalty and marketing fee payments for franchisees, amid growing pressure in the restaurant industry due to coronavirus-related outlet closures.

Headlines: Federal Reserve gives small banks more time to file March financial statements
Description: The Federal Reserve announced Thursday it was giving small U.S. banks another month to file financial statements due at the end of March.

Headlines: European stock exchanges working well in extreme conditions
Description: Stock exchanges across Europe have implemented their business continuity plans due to the coronavirus epidemic and markets are working well under extreme conditions, the Federation of European Securities Exchanges said on Thursday.

Headlines: IEA says global oil demand could drop 20% as 3 billion people in lockdown
Description: Global oil demand could drop as much as 20 million barrels per day or 20% of total demand as 3 billion people are currently in a lockdown because of the coronavirus outbreak, the head of the International Energy Agency said.

Headlines: Oil majors slash 2020 spending 20% after prices slump
Description: The world's biggest oil and gas companies are slashing spending this year following a collapse in oil prices driven by a slump in demand because of coronavirus and a price war between the top exporters Saudi Arabia and Russia.

Headlines: Toyota extends shutdown of North American plants through April 17
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  said it will extend a shutdown of all North American plants for two weeks due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic and decline in vehicle demand.

Headlines: German airline Condor applies for 200 million euro in state aid: sources
Description: The German airline Condor has applied for an additional 200 million euros in state aid in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak, two people with knowledge of the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: IMF asks G20 to back doubling of its emergency financing to fight coronavirus
Description: The International Monetary Fund on Thursday asked G20 leaders to back a doubling of its emergency financing capacity to strengthen its response to the rapidly spreading coronavirus pandemic that is set to cause a global recession in 2020.

Headlines: WeWork has enough cash to meet coronavirus challenges: letter
Description: Shared-office operator WeWork told investors on Thursday the $4.4 billion in cash and cash commitments it had at year-end 2019 is enough to execute its five-year plan and manage the challenges posed by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Geely's Volvo Cars warns virus outbreak to hit 2020 earnings
Description: Sweden's Volvo Car Group, owned by China's Geely, scaled back its guidance for the full year, warning that sales, earnings and cash flow in the first half of 2020 would decline from a year ago as the coronavirus pandemic weighed on its business.

Headlines: 'Most photographed' NYSE trader contracts coronavirus
Description: Peter Tuchman, dubbed the "most photographed trader on Wall Street", took to Instagram on Thursday to tell his 10,000-odd followers that he had tested positive for coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: Coronavirus crisis could destroy far more than 25 million jobs - ILO official
Description: The number of jobs lost around the world due to the coronavirus crisis could be "far higher" than the 25 million the International Labour Organization (ILO) estimated just a week ago, a senior ILO official said on Thursday.

Headlines: IATA urges G20 to support airline industry
Description: The International Air Transport Association on Thursday urged the group of the 20 major economies to act quickly to prevent irrecoverable damage to the airline industry that has been shaken by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Caterpillar withdraws 2020 outlook, suspends some operations, amid pandemic
Description: Caterpillar Inc  withdrew its earnings guidance for 2020 on Thursday and suspended some operations, citing economic uncertainty amid the novel coronavirus pandemic that has dented equipment sales and hit supply chains.

Headlines: Explainer: Hobbled IRS tax agency may need months to get cash to Americans
Description: In order to put recession-fighting checks into the hands of millions of Americans, the U.S. government will rely on a tax agency that has fewer workers, a smaller budget and the same 1960s-era computer systems it had the last time it was asked to do so.

Headlines: Fed's Powell says virus to dictate when U.S. economy reopens
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell told Americans on Thursday progress in controlling the spread of the coronavirus would determine when the economy reopens but assured them the Fed was taking every action to support a vigorous rebound when it comes.

Headlines: Trump says reopen by Easter, Corporate America says not so fast
Description: (This March 25 story corrects paragraph 11 to show Sean Kennedy represents the National Restaurant Association)

Headlines: U.S. Senate approves big rescue for struggling aviation sector
Description: The U.S. Senate voted late Wednesday 96-0 to give the U.S. aviation industry $58 billion in a coronavirus-rescue package, half in the form of grants to cover some 750,000 employees' paychecks, in a badly needed lifeline for an industry facing the worst travel downturn in history.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler agrees new 3.5 billion euro credit facility with banks
Description: Fiat Chrysler  said on Thursday it has agreed a new credit facility with two banks, at a time when major carmakers are having to shut down plants, losing revenue as demand slumps in the wake of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Mnuchin says Americans to get coronavirus aid within three weeks
Description: Americans should receive cash payments within three weeks to help offset the financial hardships of the coronavirus crisis, Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin said, adding that the record jobless claims announced on Thursday are not relevant.

Headlines: Mitsubishi Corp could take Renault stake in alliance rejig: sources
Description: Japan's Mitsubishi Corp  could potentially invest in Renault  as part of scenarios being discussed to reinforce an alliance between the French carmaker, Nissan and Mitsubishi Motors, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: CVS says membership, payment collection hit by coronavirus
Description: U.S. drugstore operator CVS Health Corp  said on Thursday its medical membership and payment collection have been hit due to the coronavirus pandemic, although it cannot reasonably estimate the impact on its businesses, cash flows or operating results.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. jobless claims balloon to record on coronavirus impact
Description: The number of Americans filing claims for unemployment benefits shot to record of more than 3 million last week as strict measures to contain the coronavirus pandemic ground the country to a sudden halt, unleashing a wave of layoffs that likely brought an end to the longest employment boom in U.S. history.[]

Headlines: India's Yes Bank to raise up to 50 billion rupees after government-led rescue
Description: Yes Bank Ltd  said on Thursday it was looking to raise up to 50 billion rupees ($665.88 million) in an effort to shore up its capital base after a government-led rescue of the private sector lender.

Headlines: Harley-Davidson withdraws outlook due to coronavirus disruption
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc  on Thursday withdrew its financial forecasts as the coronavirus outbreak hurts its supply chain, and warned further disruptions could dent its ability to supply and sell motorcycles.

Headlines: HSBC delays job cuts in face of coronavirus
Description: HSBC has said it is delaying the "vast majority" of its planned redundancies to deal with the fallout from the coronavirus pandemic, a memo sent to staff seen by Reuters said.

Headlines: Hedge fund manager to lead Norway sovereign fund after $124 billion loss
Description: Norway's sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, named a London-based hedge fund manager as its new chief executive on Thursday and said it had lost $124 billion this year as stock markets tanked due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Danish charity network to 3D print protective visors
Description: A group of Danish entrepreneurs have started a charity network that stands ready to make up to 20,000 protective visors a day using 3D printers, in an attempt to meet rising demand from doctors and nurses combating the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Pilots' union criticises UK's coronavirus job retention scheme
Description: The union representing British pilots has described the government's scheme to retain jobs through the coronavirus outbreak as confusing, lacking detail and taking too long to help those who are being laid off now.

Headlines: U.S. business groups warn 'Buy America' order would harm pandemic response
Description: White House plans to expand "Buy America" mandates to the medical equipment and pharmaceutical sectors could worsen shortages of urgently needed medicines and delay discovery of a vaccine for the new coronavirus, over 80 business groups warned.

Headlines: LSE offers fee waiver for market makers to smooth coronavirus hit trading
Description: The London Stock Exchange said on Thursday it was waiving registration fees for market makers to attract more liquidity in trading that has become volatile due to economic fallout from the coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: ECB doesn't plan to use crisis-era OMT bond scheme against coronavirus - sources
Description: The European Central Bank has no plans to deploy its OMT emergency bond purchase scheme and sees it as an inappropriate tool to fight the coronavirus crisis, two sources familiar with the bank's thinking said on Thursday.

Headlines: Drugmakers Mylan, Pfizer delay merger due to coronavirus outbreak
Description: Drugmaker Mylan NV's  merger with Pfizer Inc's  off-patent branded drug unit, Upjohn, will now close in the second half of this year, the companies said on Thursday, blaming the coronavirus pandemic for the delay.

Headlines: Explainer: How U.S. emissions rules encourage larger SUVs and trucks
Description: Drivers around the world want more roomy and powerful cars. Rules made under the administration of President Barack Obama make it easier for U.S. automakers to give customers what they want and to keep expanding the size of their vehicles.

Headlines: Detroit's near future based on SUVs, not EVs, production plans show
Description: General Motors Co  and Ford Motor Co  have widely touted their commitment to emission-free electric cars, but their production plans show a growing reliance on ever-larger gas-powered vehicles.

Headlines: Factbox: Ford and General Motors' electric vehicle plans
Description: Ford Motor Co  and General Motors Co , the top two U.S. automakers, have more than two dozen new battery electric vehicles (EVs) in the pipeline, according to their executives and suppliers familiar with the companies' plans.

Headlines: Norway names Nicolai Tangen as new head of sovereign wealth fund
Description: The new chief executive for Norway's $930 billion sovereign wealth fund is Nicolai Tangen, until now chief executive of investment firm AKO Capital, which he established in 2005.

Headlines: Credit Suisse turns slightly bullish on stocks, wants to be early mover
Description: Credit Suisse on Thursday moved to a "small overweight" on global equities, especially developed markets, saying the risk of a "very bad" economic outcome had come down significantly after the massive $2 trillion U.S. stimulus package.

Headlines: Norway wealth fund will bump stock portfolio back up to 70%, outgoing CEO says
Description: Norway's sovereign wealth fund will raise its stock market investments back to 70% of its portfolio from the current 65.3%, outgoing Chief Executive Yngve Slyngstad told a news conference on Thursday.

Headlines: SoftBank Group's share rally ends, bonds fall after Moody's downgrade
Description: SoftBank Group (SBG) Corp's  shares plunged after three days of huge gains and the cost of credit derivatives to insure against bankruptcy rose on Thursday after Moody's downgraded the tech conglomerate's debt rating by two notches.

Headlines: BlackRock says 'rebalancing into risky assets' after $2 trillion U.S. stimulus
Description: Asset manager BlackRock said on Thursday the market selloff had created significant value for long-term investors and told clients it now favored "rebalancing into risk assets".

Headlines: EU leaders to shield strategic firms from hostile interest amid crisis
Description: European Union leaders will on Thursday back plans to defend healthcare, infrastructure and other firms seen as having strategic role from hostile foreign takeovers, draft EU summit conclusions show.

Headlines: Norway's wealth fund lost $124 billion this year as stocks crash
Description: Norway's $930 billion sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, has lost 1.33 trillion Norwegian crowns ($124 billion) so far this year as stock markets plunged amid the coronavirus outbreak, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Investors look to 2008 for guidance on when to jump back in
Description: (This March 25 story has been refiled to fix typo and clarify quote in paragraph 11)

Headlines: UK's Daily Mirror, Mail predict coronavirus financial hit
Description: The publishers of Britain's Daily Mail and Daily Mirror newspapers both flagged expected financial hits from the coronavirus crisis on Thursday, saying advertising and other revenue would be weakened.

Headlines: What you need to know about the coronavirus right now
Description: Here's what you need to know about the coronavirus right now:

Headlines: Britain-based airlines seek industry tax breaks in coronavirus battle
Description: A representative body for airlines based in Britain has written to its transport minister seeking industry-specific tax and air traffic fee holidays to help survive a coronavirus pandemic that has brought air travel to a standstill.

Headlines: Ten signs the oil industry is bent out of shape
Description: The oil industry has been hit by a simultaneous demand and supply shock in March as the coronavirus pandemic cuts fuel consumption and top producer Saudi Arabia raises output to full capacity to fight a price war with rivals.

Headlines: Airbus says reducing wing production for three weeks
Description: Airbus SE  is reducing the production of aircraft wings for three weeks as it slows operations to put in place extra health and safety measures due to the coronavirus pandemic, the planemaker said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. braces for record surge in jobless claims amid coronavirus fallout
Description: The number of Americans filing claims for unemployment benefits likely raced to as high as a record 4 million last week as strict measures to contain the coronavirus pandemic ground the country to a sudden halt, unleashing a wave of layoffs.

Headlines: China, U.S. to set aside differences in G20 coronavirus summit: SCMP
Description: China and the United States are expected to call a timeout on their coronavirus blame game and focus on the challenges of the pandemic when leaders of the G20 nations hold talks via video conference on Thursday, the South China Morning Post said.

Headlines: U.S. coronavirus stimulus bill adds billions in support for farmers
Description: The U.S. coronavirus stimulus bill would add $14 billion to the Agriculture Department's Commodity Credit Corp spending authority, and authorize another $9.5 billion for U.S. farmers hurt by the fast-spreading pandemic, according to a copy of the bill's text.

Headlines: Airbnb holds meeting with bankers to extend $1 billion debt facility: source
Description: Airbnb Inc on Wednesday held a phone meeting with bankers to discuss extending an existing $1 billion debt facility as the home rental start-up grapples with a slowdown due to the coronavirus, a source who participated in the meeting said.

Headlines: Airbnb says U.S. coronavirus stimulus bill could offer its hosts some relief
Description: Airbnb Inc hosts in the United States could get some relief from a $2 trillion coronavirus stimulus bill that is nearing a vote in Congress, the home-rental startup said on Wednesday.

Headlines: McDonald's to trim U.S. menu during coronavirus pandemic
Description: McDonald's Corp  said on Wednesday it would temporarily remove some items from its U.S. menu as it focuses on simplifying operations in the face of the fast-spreading coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: AMC Theatres furloughs CEO, corporate employees due to virus
Description: AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc , the world's largest theater operator, has placed its chief executive and all of its  corporate employees on furlough to preserve cash during the coronavirus outbreak, a company spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Home-bound users fume as video apps do not sync with TVs
Description: Kat Volpe laid out an exercise mat and tried to sync her iPhone with her big screen TV for a fitness class webcast on Instagram last week during New York's coronavirus lockdown.

Headlines: U.S. auto sales in states with coronavirus lockdown orders to drop 80%: analysts
Description: Vehicle sales in U.S. states that implemented lockdown orders to curb the spread of the coronavirus will drop 80% or more, analysts said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ackman's hedge funds make money this year as hedges help
Description: Billionaire investor William Ackman, who hedged his Pershing Square Capital management portfolio weeks ago to guard against coronavirus-inspired panic selling, told investors his private hedge fund is making money this year, an investor said on Wednesday.

Headlines: S&P 500 rallies for second day as investors await $2 trillion aid package
Description: The S&P 500 rallied for a second straight session on Wednesday as the U.S. Senate appeared near a vote on a $2 trillion package to support businesses and households devastated by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: India's huge outsourcing industry struggles with work-from-home scenario
Description: As the coronavirus pandemic pushes India into a lockdown, the call centres and IT services firms that function as the world's back office are struggling to piece together work-from-home solutions and other business-continuity plans.

Headlines: Canadian oil companies ask government for cash, credit to survive
Description: Canadian oil and gas companies are urging Ottawa to free up credit and cash to help them survive the twin shocks of COVID-19 spread and a crude price war, pitching ideas ranging from tax deferrals to backstopping bank loans.

Headlines: U.S. set to grant automakers a lifeline -- but no bailout
Description: The $2 trillion economic rescue package before the U.S. Senate on Wednesday would send the federal government to the auto industry's rescue for the second time in a dozen years.

Headlines: Tesla to reopen New York plant 'as soon as humanly possible' to make ventilators: Musk
Description: Tesla Inc  will reopen its New York factory "as soon as humanly possible" to manufacture ventilators for coronavirus patients, Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk said on Twitter on Wednesday.

Headlines: Computer chip makers seek U.S. permission to work during pandemic
Description: A group representing major U.S. semiconductor companies on Wednesday said it was working with federal officials to make clear to state and local officials overseeing lockdowns that chip companies are essential businesses that should continue operations.

Headlines: Do more to stop coronavirus price gouging, U.S. states tell Amazon, Walmart, Facebook
Description: A group of 32 U.S. states have a message for the nation's leading online platforms: You are not doing enough to stop price gouging amid the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon pauses sellers' loan repayments amid coronavirus
Description: Amazon.com Inc  on Wednesday said it temporarily would not require sellers in its marketplace to repay loans it had made to them, as merchants confront the prospect of declining sales during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Coronavirus exposes U.S. Uber, Lyft drivers' lack of safety net
Description: As independent contractors, U.S. ride-hail drivers for Uber and Lyft benefited from soaring trip demand and flexible work hours.

Headlines: Stocks rebound further as markets await $2 trillion U.S. stimulus boost
