Description: The dollar slid and global equity markets marched higher on Wednesday for a second day of gains, on optimism $2 trillion in U.S. fiscal stimulus will dampen the economic shock the coronavirus pandemic has started to inflict.U.S. senators will vote Wednesday. Top aides to Republican President Donald Trump and senior Republican and Democrat senators agreed on the unprecedented bill after five days of marathon talks.

Headlines: Oil prices settle higher on stimulus package, fuel demand sinks
Description: U.S. crude prices settled higher on Wednesday, bolstered by progress on a massive pending U.S. economic stimulus package, even as government data showed the coronavirus pandemic started undercutting U.S. fuel demand last week.

Headlines: Qantas shares soar on financing deal as rivals cut more capacity
Description: Qantas Airways Ltd  on Wednesday secured A$1.05 billion ($627.8 million) against its aircraft fleet to help it ride out the coronavirus crisis, sending its shares soaring, as airlines in the Asia-Pacific region sliced away capacity and jobs.

Headlines: Sales of essential goods at Target soar in March as shoppers stock up
Description: Target Corp  said on Wednesday it saw a more than 50% rise in same-store sales so far in March for certain essential goods, joining a list of grocery chains benefiting from consumers hunkering down for an extended period due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Who needs Instacart? U.S. farmers expand food deliveries during coronavirus outbreak
Description: Farmers in rural America are expanding food delivery services to meet rising demand from consumers seeking to isolate themselves during the coronavirus pandemic and frustrated by empty grocery-store shelves.

Headlines: U.S. stocks seesaw as vote awaited on stimulus deal
Description: U.S stocks seesawed on Wednesday, digesting the previous session's huge rebound, with investors torn as optimism about an imminent $2 trillion coronavirus package was offset by concerned about the lasting economic impact from the pandemic. [.N]

Headlines: Volkswagen expects car market to recover in summer: FAZ
Description: Volkswagen  expects the German car market to recover in the summer after the automaker was forced to suspend output because of the coronavirus pandemic, an executive told a newspaper on Wednesday.

Headlines: Coronavirus-stricken U.S. companies pop poison pills
Description: More U.S. companies are rushing to adopt so-called poison pills,  dusting off a nearly 40-year-old takeover defense tool to ward off hostile bidders and activist shareholders eager to exploit the coronavirus-induced market sell-off.

Headlines: Softbank-backed Ola seeks relief for drivers and taxi firms in India
Description: Indian ride-hailing company Ola, backed by Softbank Group , wants loan waivers for drivers and a delay in tax payments to make up for coronavirus-related lost income, according to a source and document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. SEC extends conditional relief for public companies hit by coronavirus
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) said on Wednesday it would extend its prior conditional regulatory relief from disclosure requirements for public companies affected by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: First UK-listed firms edge towards BoE loan scheme
Description: A handful of large British companies had emerged on Wednesday as likely candidates for the government's emergency lending scheme aimed at helping them tide over the coronavirus shutdowns afflicting many of the world's biggest economies.

Headlines: For ECB, coronabonds could be shield against legal challenges
Description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde has a concrete reason for putting pressure on euro zone governments to finance the fight against coronavirus with joint debt -- avoiding trouble with the courts.

Headlines: Eni cuts 2020, 2021 capex to mitigate Coronavirus hit
Description: Italian oil and gas group Eni  said on Wednesday it would reduce its capital expenditure this year by around 2 billion euros ($2.17 billion) to mitigate the impact from falling commodity prices following the coronavirus emergency.

Headlines: Coronavirus slowdown starts to rival Fed's doomsday bank stress test scenario
Description: The unfolding market shock and economic crisis wrought by the coronavirus disruption is shaping up to be a nightmare for the Federal Reserve – literally.

Headlines: U.S. core capital goods orders point to worsening business investment downturn
Description: New orders for key U.S.-made capital goods fell sharply in February as demand for machinery and other products slumped, suggesting a deepening contraction in business investment that analysts said signaled the economy was already in recession.

Headlines: UK PM Johnson says talks continue over support for airlines
Description: Britain is continuing talks with the aviation industry about how best to support the sector, Prime Minister Boris Johnson and a pilots' union said on Wednesday, reviving the prospect of a sector-specific support package that had seemed to be on hold.

Headlines: Red tape holding up medical supplies, airlines say
Description: Red tape is holding up medical and other emergency supplies needed to help tackle the coronavirus crisis, airlines warn.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuela in talks with China over support amid pandemic, oil price drop - sources
Description: Venezuela has opened talks with China over possible financial support to cope with a sharp drop in oil prices and the arrival of the novel coronavirus, four sources familiar with the negotiations said.

Headlines: EssilorLuxottica says Essilor targeted by cyberattack
Description: EssilorLuxottica said on Wednesday Essilor had been subject of a cyberattack on March 21 which disrupted access to some of its group servers and computers.

Headlines: EU says Johnson & Johnson's deal for Takeda patch may harm competition
Description: EU antitrust regulators have opened a full investigation into Johnson & Johnson's acquisition of Takeda Pharmaceutical's surgical patch product TachoSil, concerned that the deal could lead to reduced choice and higher prices for customers.

Headlines: Peugeot restarts car production in virus-hit Wuhan with Dongfeng
Description: French automaker Peugeot SA's  joint venture in China with Dongfeng Motor Group  said on Wednesday it had restarted car production at its plant in Wuhan city, the epicenter of China's coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Layoffs and food lines: How the pandemic slams the poorest U.S. workers
Description: Alberto Mendoza figures he can make it a couple of weeks on unemployment benefits before starting to decide which bills won't get paid. The 26-year-old father of three lost his job training cooks when all the local restaurants started closing their doors and laying off staff.

Headlines: China suspends Bristol-Myers' cancer drug sales over findings at U.S. plant
Description: Sales of Bristol-Myers Squibb Co's cancer drug Abraxane have been suspended in China based on findings at a third-party manufacturing plant in the United States.

Headlines: Exclusive: UK industry expects ventilator production go-ahead on Wednesday
Description: British industry expects the government to give the go-ahead for an emergency ventilator production plan on Wednesday that will see a number of firms join forces to tackle the coronavirus outbreak, sources close to the process told Reuters.

Headlines: Bullard: $2 trillion package working through Congress 'scaled about right' for crisis
Description: The roughly $2 trillion emergency aid package being negotiated in Congress is "scaled about right" to match an economic hit that could throw as many as 46 million people out of work until the coronavirus outbreak is controlled, St. Louis Federal Reserve President James Bullard said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Citigroup will temporarily close up to 15% of U.S. branches
Description: Citigroup Inc  said on Tuesday it will temporarily shutter up to 15% of its U.S. branches amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Citigroup makes senior hires in United States, Asia
Description: (This March 24 story corrects the description of Chris Fred's previous role at Goldman Sachs)

Headlines: Global oil demand forecast to fall by 4.9 mln bpd in 2020: Rystad
Description: Global oil demand could fall by as much as 4.9 million barrels per day (bpd), or by about 4.9%, in 2020 due to the coronavirus outbreak, Norway's biggest independent energy consultancy Rystad Energy said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Occidental slashes budget, salaries in bid to cope with falling oil prices
Description: Occidental Petroleum Corp  on Wednesday unveiled a new round of deep spending cuts, slashing budget for a second time this month and sharply reducing salaries, as the debt-laden U.S. oil producer tries to save cash amid tumbling energy prices.

Headlines: New CEO pay limits loom as investors confront coronavirus crisis
Description: The havoc wrought by the coronavirus crisis could give investors leverage to put new limits on CEO pay packages and link them more closely to a range of social and environmental issues at companies' annual meetings this spring.

Headlines: Bullard: 46 million workers could be jobless in short-term
Description: As many as 46 million people in the U.S. may be left jobless in the short term as companies shut down services that have "high contact" with the public during the battle against the coronavirus epidemic, St. Louis Federal Reserve president James Bullard said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Nike shares rise as Wall Street lauds recovery in China sales
Description: Nike Inc  shares rose 8% on Wednesday after the sportswear maker's impressive recovery in China sales offered hope that it was prepared to cope with the financial fallout of the coronavirus pandemic in other markets.

Headlines: Occidental to add three of Icahn's associates to board
Description: Occidental Petroleum Corp  said on Wednesday it would add to its board three of activist investor Carl Icahn's associates, ending a long and bitter fight that began after its ill-timed acquisition of rival Anadarko Petroleum.

Headlines: Johnson says UK doing everything it can to help aviation industry
Description: The British government has not washed its hands of any sector and is doing everything it can to help the aviation industry through the coronavirus crisis, Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Oil majors slash 2020 spending 18% after prices slump
Description: The world's biggest oil and gas companies are slashing spending this year following a collapse in oil prices driven by a slump in demand because of coronavirus and a price war between the top exporters Saudi Arabia and Russia.

Headlines: Exclusive: ECB's Lagarde asked euro zone ministers to consider one-off 'coronabonds' issue - officials
Description: European Central Bank chief Christine Lagarde asked euro zone finance ministers during a videoconference on Tuesday evening to seriously consider a one-off joint debt issue of "coronabonds" to help fight the coronavirus pandemic, four officials said.

Headlines: Treat with caution: rocketing stocks aren't cause for comfort
Description: Those pining for a bottom to the gut-wrenching stock market selloff may be disappointed to learn that mega one-day rallies like the historic one witnessed on Tuesday are typically not the start of a durable recovery.

Headlines: A falling yen may not be the economic cure Japan seeks
Description: Fallout from the coronavirus outbreak may finally lift the curse of the safe-haven yen for Japan but policymakers fear fiscal laxity could lead to a currency free-fall eventually, undermining efforts to cushion the economy from the pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: India likely to unveil $20 billion-plus stimulus package to tackle coronavirus downturn - sources
Description: India is likely to agree an economic stimulus package of more than 1.5 trillion rupees ($19.6 billion) to fight a downturn in the country that is currently locked down to stem the spread of coronavirus, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: UK's Sainsbury's to assist smaller suppliers during coronavirus pandemic
Description: British supermarket Sainsbury's  said on Wednesday it would help its smaller suppliers during the coronavirus emergency by paying them immediately and making finance available.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp to cut 3,000 jobs at struggling steel unit
Description: German conglomerate Thyssenkrupp  will cut 3,000 jobs and invest 4.2 billion euros ($4.6 billion) at its struggling  steel division by 2026 as part of a wage deal struck with powerful labor union IG Metall, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Walmart taps Sameer Aggarwal as CEO of Indian unit, says in touch with suppliers
Description: Walmart Inc  on Wednesday named Sameer Aggarwal chief executive officer of Best Price, its Indian cash and carry business, and said it was in touch with supplier partners for adequate stocking at its stores during the 21-day government sanctioned lockdown.

Headlines: China to resume U.S. LPG imports as Beijing waives trade-war tariff: sources
Description: China has begun buying U.S. liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) again after a hiatus of nearly 20 months as Beijing waived punitive tariffs to boost imports of U.S. goods as part of the Sino-U.S. Phase 1 trade deal, industry sources said.

Headlines: Kia Motors may make face masks at China factory to fight coronavirus
Description: South Korea's Kia Motors Corp  is considering making face masks at its Chinese factory to help battle the spread of the coronavirus, a spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Factbox: Global oil, gas producers cut spending after crude price crash
Description: Oil and gas companies are cutting spending plans in response to the new coronavirus and a push by Saudi Arabia and Russia to ramp up output.

Headlines: AB Volvo postpones AGM due to uncertainty over coronavirus impact
Description: Truckmaker AB Volvo  said on Wednesday it had decided to postpone its annual shareholders meeting due to the prevailing uncertainty around the effects from the global coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Exclusive: Boeing plans 737 MAX production restart by May - sources
Description: Boeing Co  plans to restart 737 MAX production by May, ending a months-long halt triggered by a safety ban on its best-selling jet after fatal crashes, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. automakers to extend shutdown into April: sources
Description: Detroit's Big Three automakers plan to extend a current shutdown of vehicle production in North America into April as the coronavirus pandemic continues, people briefed on the matter said Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed's stimulus eases global market fears, gets cash flowing
Description: By Gertrude Chavez-Dreyfuss, Kate Duguid and Abhinav Ramnarayan

Headlines: Explainer: Trump has little power to restart U.S. economy
Description: U.S.  President Donald Trump on Tuesday said he wants the U.S. economy to reopen by Easter Sunday, April 12, despite the rapid spread of the novel coronavirus in some U.S. states and a rising death toll from the disease.

Headlines: Two more NYSE floor traders test positive for coronavirus: memo
Description: At least two more New York Stock Exchange floor traders tested positive for the coronavirus on Tuesday despite measures taken to prevent people infected by the virus from entering the exchange while it remained physically open last week, according to a memo seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Nike revenue beats as digital growth offsets rare China sales fall on virus hit
Description: Nike Inc  beat estimates for quarterly revenue on Tuesday as strong digital demand offset the first China sales drop in nearly six years from the coronavirus-fueled shutdowns, but the company held back from providing a forecast due to the outbreak.

Headlines: Coronavirus redraws battle lines on airline emissions
Description: European airlines crippled by the coronavirus have demanded lasting relief from environmental taxes - in a move that pits their immediate survival against longer-term emissions goals.

Headlines: Dow soars over 11% in strongest one-day performance since 1933
Description: The Dow soared on Tuesday to its biggest one-day percentage gain since 1933, after U.S. lawmakers said they were close to a deal for an economic rescue package in response to the coronavirus outbreak, injecting optimism following the biggest selloff since the financial crisis.

Headlines: Airlines beg for rescue as coronavirus hit soars to $250 billion
Description: Global airlines urged governments on Tuesday to speed up bailouts to rescue the air transport industry as they doubled their estimate of 2020 revenue losses from the coronavirus crisis to more than $250 billion.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico unit says CFO to step down
Description: Walmart de Mexico said on Tuesday that its chief financial officer Olga Gonzalez has resigned for personal reasons and will leave her post by April 30.

Headlines: Stocks, gold surge as Congress nears $2 trillion aid package
Description: Stock markets soared on Tuesday, with a gauge of global equities posting its biggest gain since the coronavirus roiled financial markets a month ago, as the U.S. Congress zoned in on a $2 trillion stimulus package to curb the pandemic's economic toll.

Headlines: Dollar pares losses as investors wait on stimulus bill
Description: The dollar gave up most of its early losses on Tuesday as investors waited on a Senate stimulus bill meant to blunt the economic impact of the spreading coronavirus, and after U.S. President Donald Trump pressed his case for a re-opening of the U.S. economy by mid-April.

Headlines: Boeing CFO says aerospace industry needs credit urgently, markets closed to new debt
Description: Boeing Co's  chief financial officer said on Tuesday the U.S. aerospace industry urgently needs credit to cope with the coronavirus pandemic but "markets essentially are closed" to new debt.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers nearing deal for massive aviation sector bailout: sources
Description: U.S. lawmakers are nearing agreement on a $61 billion rescue package for the aviation sector that would include $25 billion in payroll grants for passenger airlines weathering a sharp falloff in travel demand amid rising coronavirus outbreaks, three people briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: Trump says he will not let Boeing go out of business: Fox News interview
Description: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he would not let airplane maker Boeing Co  go out of business as a result of the economic disruption caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. drilling lease sales draw few bids during oil market meltdown
Description: Oil and gas lease sales offered by the Trump administration in three Western states on Tuesday drew few bids as a crash in energy prices tamped down interest among drillers.

Headlines: Apple expects to start reopening some stores in first half of April: Bloomberg News
Description: Apple Inc could start re-opening some of its retail stores in the first half of April, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing an internal memo.

Headlines: USDA, USTR cite progress on farm provisions of U.S.-China trade deal
Description: The United States and China have made progress in implementing the agriculture-related provisions of a Phase 1 trade deal that took effect on Feb. 14, the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) and U.S. Trade Representative said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. locks in tariffs on wooden cabinets from China
Description: The U.S. International Trade Commission said on Tuesday it made a final determination that dumped and subsidized imports of wood cabinets and vanities from China were harming American producers, locking in steep U.S. tariffs for five years.

Headlines: Banks, regulators move to protect customers from wave of coronavirus scams in UK, U.S.
Description: UK banks are stepping up fraud prevention measures to protect customers from scammers eager to exploit the coronavirus pandemic with a whole range of new tricks, including fake sales of medical supplies and bogus government relief schemes.

Headlines: Oil little changed as falling demand offsets hopes of U.S. aid package
Description: Oil prices rose modestly on Tuesday, but settled off the day's highs as the coronavirus pandemic's heavy toll on demand offset hopes for a forthcoming $2 trillion U.S. economic relief package.

Headlines: Ford joins GE, 3M in speeding up ventilator, respirator production
Description: Carmaker Ford Motor Co  on Tuesday jumped into the emergency push by major U.S. manufacturers to produce thousands of ventilators and respirators needed to help combat the spread of the coronavirus under a partnership code-named "Project Apollo."

Headlines: Fed's 'bazooka' soothes dollar funding squeeze
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve's efforts to shield the economy from coronavirus effects have, for now, slowed a scramble for dollars that threatened to clog funding markets, bringing back some calm on Tuesday.

Headlines: Boeing CEO does not want U.S. to take stake in company after coronavirus stimulus
Description: Boeing Co  Chief Executive Dave Calhoun said on Tuesday he does not want the U.S. Treasury to take an equity stake in the planemaker as a condition of government loans as credit markets freeze amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: As customers hoard pot brownies, North American weed firms see lockdown boost
Description: Cannabis sales are touching new highs as customers across the United States and Canada stockpile weed to prepare for long spells of isolation because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Bombardier halts most operations in Canada due to coronavirus
Description: Bombardier pulled its 2020 outlook on Tuesday and said it would stop work at most of its Canadian operations until April 26 to help slow the spread of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Halliburton to 'significantly' cut 2020 capex below $1.2 billion budget
Description: Oilfield services firm Halliburton  is accelerating its cost-cutting and will significantly reduce spending this year below its original $1.2 billion budget, its finance chief said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Netflix, Facebook to cut data traffic in India to ease network congestion
Description: Streaming service Netflix Inc  and social media giant Facebook Inc  said on Tuesday they would reduce the amount of data their services use to ease congested telecoms networks in India, where millions are using home internet amid a lockdown to contain the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Renault workers use 3D printers to make medical visors
Description: Renault workers in Spain have begun using 3D printers to manufacture visors for health workers from home, the French carmaker said on Tuesday, in a scheme that could be expanded to make other medical equipment elsewhere.

Headlines: Coronavirus crisis rocks airlines and planemakers
Description: The grounding of virtually all flights by Europe's largest budget airline and European air traffic data on Tuesday highlighted the enormity of the shock to aviation industries from the coronavirus now emptying skies around the globe.

Headlines: Britain to stricken airlines: try raising your own money first
Description: Britain has told airlines it will only consider stepping in to help them survive the coronavirus crisis once they have explored  the possibility of raising capital from other sources including existing investors.

Headlines: Chevron leads another wave of massive oil-industry spending cuts
Description: Chevron Corp  cut its capital spending budget by $4 billion on Tuesday, leading a wave of cost-cutting announcements across the oil-and-gas industry as it reels from declining demand in the face of the coronavirus pandemic and a dramatic slide in prices.

Headlines: Coronavirus to bring deep U.S. capital return letdowns
Description: U.S. investors will likely see sharp declines in capital returns this year as companies look to conserve cash during the coronavirus crisis, according to S&P Dow Jones Indices which is predicting a significant first-quarter decline in buybacks and a dismal second quarter.

Headlines: Shutdowns stoke debate over what's an 'essential industry'
Description: Shortly after British Prime Minister Boris Johnson ordered the closure of non-essential retailers on Monday to curb the spread of coronavirus, the parent company of Sports Direct wrote to its staff to let them know: the next day would be business as usual.

Headlines: Latin America's oil producers sweat to cover costs as price war takes toll
Description: A price war between the world's oil powerhouses is leaving many producers in Latin American struggling to cover production costs, boosting chances of output cuts and investment delays in coming months.

Headlines: Philips warns protectionism could derail critical medical supplies
Description: Broad powers over U.S. factories brought in by President Donald Trump could fuel protectionism and jeopardize the supply of critical medical equipment to fight the coronavirus pandemic,  Dutch health technology company Philips warned on Tuesday.

Headlines: Spirit AeroSystems suspends Boeing-related production for two weeks
Description: Spirit Aerosystems , Boeing Co's largest supplier, is temporarily suspending production for the airplane maker at many of its facilities in the United States for two weeks, as the global coronavirus pandemic saps demand across the industry.

Headlines: How the U.S. could intervene to weaken its surging dollar
Description: A blistering dollar rally has revived speculation that the U.S. may rein in its currency if the buck goes much higher.

Headlines: As Europe fights coronavirus and climate, is 'green stimulus' the way?
Description: For European governments battling to brace economies pummeled by the coronavirus, there might be no better time to go green.

Headlines: Phillips 66 delays scheduled refinery shutdowns on coronavirus concerns
Description: Phillips 66 is delaying three sizeable scheduled shutdowns at its refineries this year, the company said on Tuesday, because of concerns that coronavirus could spread among the refineries' workers if the maintenance goes ahead.

Headlines: Facebook eyes multi billion dollar stake in Reliance Jio: FT
Description: Facebook Inc  is in talks to buy a multi billion dollar stake in Reliance Industries Ltd's  telecom unit, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday, citing two people with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: U.S. new home sales fall in February, January revised up sharply
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes fell in February after surging in the prior month, and could decline further because of the coronavirus pandemic which is boosting unemployment and severely disrupting economic activity.

Headlines: France's Air Liquide aims to boost production of ventilators
Description: The healthcare unit of French industrial gases company Air Liquide said on Tuesday it was ramping up production of ventilators needed by hospitals to deal with the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Auto industry urges U.S. lawmakers to ensure 'sufficient liquidity'
Description: Major automakers, parts suppliers and auto dealers urged U.S. lawmakers on Monday to provide "robust credit facilities" to ensure "sufficient liquidity" in the auto industry despite the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Investors eye cracks in $4.4 trillion U.S. ETF market as sell-off rages
Description: Wild swings in asset prices have thrown a spotlight on liquidity in corners of the $4.4 trillion market for U.S. exchange-traded funds, which have played a key role for investors in Wall Street's coronavirus-fueled sell-off.

Headlines: Coca-Cola to suspend production in India amid coronavirus lockdowns
Description: Coca-Cola's India unit said on Tuesday it has temporarily suspended production at its manufacturing facilities across the country following widespread lockdowns to halt the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Aston Martin to temporarily shut UK manufacturing facilities
Description: British luxury carmaker Aston Martin  said on Tuesday it would suspend production at its UK manufacturing facilities starting Wednesday until April 20 to cope with the coronavirus pandemic, which has hurt demand for its cars.

Headlines: Amazon to stop non-essential sales in India
Description: Amazon.com Inc's  India unit on Tuesday said it will halt orders for non-essential products in India to prioritize customers' critical needs at a time when much of the country is under lockdown to prevent the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Ford extends production halt at U.S. plants beyond March 30
Description: Ford Motor Co  said on Tuesday it does not plan to restart production at its manufacturing plants in the United States, Canada and Mexico on March 30, as was originally planned.

Headlines: Comcast shuts theme parks, delays film distribution due to COVID-19
Description: Comcast Corp  on Tuesday warned of a hit to its results from the coronavirus outbreak as it shut all its theme parks and delayed distribution of films in theaters worldwide.

Headlines: France's Accor, Airbnb help provide rooms for medics during crisis
Description: French hotel group Accor  and home rental company Airbnb are launching online services to help medical staff fighting the coronavirus epidemic in France find emergency housing.

Headlines: General Motors to draw down $16 billion in credit, suspends 2020 outlook
Description: General Motors Co said on Tuesday it will draw about $16 billion from its credit lines in a bid to beef up liquidity amid rising business impact from the fast-spreading coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Global airlines face emergency, need rescue package now: IATA
Description: Global airlines are in an emergency situation and government rescue packages are needed as quickly as possible to avoid multiple airline collapses, the head of the International Air Transport Association warned on Tuesday.

Headlines: Unilever to shield workers from financial impact of coronavirus
Description: Consumer goods giant Unilever Plc  said on Tuesday it would protect its workforce from the financial impact of the coronavirus by continuing to pay contractors and other part time staff for up to three months.

Headlines: Britain to outline support package for airline industry soon: Sunak
Description: British finance minister Rishi Sunak said he expects to make an announcement soon on discussions over a support package for the airlines industry, which has been devastated by travel restrictions, to limit the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Norwegian Air gets small cash infusion, starts talks with creditors
Description: Norwegian Air  received a small government cash injection on Tuesday as part of the state coronavirus rescue package, and began talks with creditors complaining of missing payments amid growing worries about the carrier's liquidity.

Headlines: Exclusive: Citadel turns 2020 profit after spotting virus risk early
Description: Citadel, the Chicago-based hedge fund giant led by billionaire Ken Griffin, has so far weathered the coronavirus market storm well, turning a slight profit in its flagship Wellington hedge fund for the year through Monday, according to a person familiar with the situation.

Headlines: Occidental names former CEO Stephen Chazen as non-executive chair
Description: Occidental Petroleum Corp  on Tuesday named its former chief executive officer, Stephen Chazen, as non-executive chairman of its board in a bid to end a long and bitter fight with activist investor Carl Icahn.

Headlines: Japan Airlines to slash international flights by 64% as coronavirus dents demand
Description: Japan Airlines  said on Tuesday it will cut flights on international routes from the country by about 64% between March 29 and April 30, as the coronavirus pandemic has hammers travel demand.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler to make face masks for North America
Description: Italian-U.S. car giant Fiat Chrysler has confirmed plans to produce a million face masks a month and said it will distribute them to emergency services in North America to help the fight against coronavirus.

Headlines: Refiner Phillips 66 cuts spending forecast by 18%, commits to dividend
Description: Refiner Phillips 66  on Tuesday cut its 2020 spending forecast by about 18% and assured investors their dividend was secure even as the coronavirus outbreak and a price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia threaten the oil market with massive oversupply.

Headlines: Parking pain: Airlines, airports hunt for storage space as pandemic idles planes
Description: As airlines idle thousands of aircraft for which there are no passengers, they are hitting an unprecedented problem: finding a place to park them.

Headlines: UK manufacturers' most pessimistic since financial crisis: CBI
Description: British manufacturers are the most pessimistic about the outlook than they have been at any time since the global financial crisis more than a decade ago because of the spread of coronavirus, a survey showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. industries scramble for exemptions as state shutdown orders grow
Description: As several more U.S. states moved to impose stay-at-home orders to limit the spread of the coronavirus, industries from steelmakers to auto dealerships were scrambling for exemptions that would allow them to remain open.

Headlines: Bank of England says coronavirus tougher than banks' stress test
Description: The shock from coronavirus to banks is set to be greater but less prolonged than lenders faced in last year's stress test and the financial system remains resilient, the Bank of England said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Ryanair will not operate flights in April or May
Description: Ryanair on Tuesday said it does not expect to operate flights in April or May and has offered its aircraft to European governments for rescue or the essential movement of medicines and personal protective equipment.

Headlines: House Democrats would give airlines, contractors $40 billion bailout
Description: Democratic U.S. lawmakers on Monday proposed giving struggling U.S. airlines and contractors $40 billion in cash grants that would not have to be paid back but require significant new environmental, labor and other conditions.

Headlines: Tesla CEO says bought ventilators in China for U.S
Description: Tesla bought hospital ventilators in China and shipped them to the United States, CEO Elon Musk said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Reopening economy too early could backfire for humans and markets, investors say
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's desire to rapidly reopen the economy despite signs the coronavirus is still spreading may backfire, with higher deaths and citizens remaining fearful of going out, some investors said.

Headlines: Volkswagen to halt production in Russia due to supply shortage from Europe
Description: Volkswagen  will suspend its car production in Russia over a supply shortage caused by the coronavirus outbreak in Europe, Volkswagen Group Rus said on Tuesday.

Headlines: March forex daily turnover hits $2.3 trillion as virus fuels volatility: CLS
Description: The meltdown in financial markets over the coronavirus has sparked a huge jump in foreign exchange trading volumes, with average daily turnover so far in March up 27% on February as volatility soared, CLS said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wizz Air suspends all flights to and from Varna over coronavirus
Description: Wizz Air  has suspended all flights to and from Bulgarian city of Varna in an attempt to help curb the spread of the coronavirus, the low-cost carrier said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: Puma sets short-time work for 1,400 staff
Description: German sportswear company Puma  announced on Tuesday that 1,400 staff would switch to shorter work hours until April 13 as sales slump due to the coronavirus and said its three top executives would not take their pay for April.

Headlines: JD Sports delays results to May, cites ample cash resources
Description: Britain's biggest sportswear retailer JD Sports  said on Tuesday it has delayed the publication of its financial results to May and has enough cash resources to ride out the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Crude oil futures rise, but support seen weak
Description: U.S. crude oil futures climbed nearly 3% on Tuesday in light trading as the Trump administration launched an effort to work with Saudi Arabia to stabilise oil prices.

Headlines: At Alibaba's Lazada, coronavirus measures become the latest culture conflict
Description: At Lazada, the Southeast Asian arm of Alibaba Group Holding , staff are furious over demands they submit health reports daily and other coronavirus-prevention steps seen as too invasive, highlighting a long-running culture clash with management from China.

Headlines: Mexican referendum rejects U.S. Modelo brewer in new investment blow
Description: Residents of a Mexican city on the U.S. border voted against completing a billion-dollar brewery being built by Constellation Brands Inc, the government said Monday, dealing a fresh blow to investor confidence under President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador.

Headlines: Wells Fargo to pay special compensation to front-line workers amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  will join other large U.S. banks in paying out special compensation to front-line employees, according to a memo seen on Monday by Reuters.

Headlines: SoftBank shares jump 20% on record buyback announcement
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  stock jumped 20% on Tuesday, extending a run that began a day earlier when the Japanese tech investor announced up to $41 billion in asset sales and a record share buyback to shore up its collapsing share price.

Headlines: U.S. SEC warns against illegal trading during coronavirus disruption
Description: The U.S. securities regulator on Monday warned corporate executives against insider trading during disruption caused by the coronavirus, in an unusual statement that underscores the chaos coursing through financial markets.

Headlines: Tipping goes virtual as coronavirus decimates U.S. restaurant jobs
Description: As restaurants and bars across the United States shut their doors and lay off their staff in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak, America’s famed service culture is moving online - with regulars paying their out-of-work waiters, favorite bar staff, and even total strangers via virtual tip jars.

Headlines: Mnuchin: Negotiators 'very close' to deal on coronavirus stimulus
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Monday that Republican and Democratic senators and Trump administration negotiators were nearing a deal on a coronavirus stimulus bill.

Headlines: Fast food closures sweep U.K., as even drive-thrus deemed unsafe
Description: McDonald's Corp, Yum! Brands Inc's KFC fried chicken chain, Coca-Cola Co unit Costa Coffee and Subway sandwich shops were among restaurants that shuttered all locations in the United Kingdom and Ireland by the end of Monday to help slow the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Neiman Marcus in bankruptcy talks with lenders: Bloomberg Law
Description: Luxury retailer Neiman Marcus Group Inc is in talks with lenders to file for bankruptcy as it struggles to ease its $4.3 billion debt load, Bloomberg reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Trump says won't allow long-lasting damage to economy from virus
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he will not allow the coronavirus to do long-lasting damage to the U.S. economy and that he would consider how to move forward after a 15-day shutdown ends next week.

Headlines: As coronavirus fuels meat demand, processors raise pay for North American farmers, workers
Description: North American meat processors said on Monday they would pay extra money to farmers and slaughterhouse workers as the companies scramble to meet surging demand from consumers unnerved by the spread of the new coronavirus.

Headlines: Mondelez raises hourly wage, hands out weekly bonus as virus worries fuel demand
Description: Mondelez International Inc  on Monday said it would increase hourly wage by $2 and pay a $125 weekly bonus for its sales representatives as it rushes to meet a surge in demand for its packaged food due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Bombardier to suspend business jet production in Canada over coronavirus: source
Description: Bombardier  will suspend Canadian production of its corporate jets to comply with restrictions imposed by provincial governments aimed at curbing the spread of the coronavirus, a source familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Fed's money market move lifts Northern Trust fund above key threshold
Description: Liquidity at a $2.2 billion prime money-market fund run by Northern Trust Corp fell below the key 30% U.S. regulatory threshold twice last week, but rebounded above that level after the U.S. Federal Reserve shored up the industry.

Headlines: U.S. Fed aims 'bazooka' to backstop coronavirus-hit economy
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Monday rolled out an extraordinary array of programs to backstop an economy reeling from sweeping restrictions on commerce that scientists say are needed to slow the coronavirus pandemic and ultimately keep more people safe.

Headlines: Nordstrom joins Macy's in suspending dividend amid coronavirus
Description: Nordstrom Inc  said on Monday it would suspend its quarterly cash dividend and share repurchases as it looks to weather the impact from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Coronavirus drags car dealers into digital commerce
Description: Auto retailers have been slow to embrace e-commerce, but the coronavirus pandemic is changing that.

Headlines: Fed's big move could help U.S. Treasury liquidity, but effects may not last long
Description: The Federal Reserve's unparalleled steps to directly backstop the U.S. economy and its willingness to purchase vast sums of U.S. government debt, mortgage-backed securities and even corporate bonds could help boost depleted liquidity in the $17-trillion Treasury market.

Headlines: Historic Fed boost fails to stop Wall Street's coronavirus-driven sell-off
Description: Wall Street's slide deepened on Monday as an unprecedented moves by the U.S. Federal Reserve to shore up credit across the economy proved insufficient to sooth investors' fears about the swiftly-spreading coronavirus.

Headlines: Twitter ad sales hit by coronavirus but active users soar
Description: Twitter Inc  pulled its first-quarter revenue outlook and forecast an operating loss on Monday as the coronavirus outbreak crimped ad sales, but said the pandemic boosted the number of active users on the microblogging platform.

Headlines: GM accelerates 'Project V' to build ventilators in Indiana
Description: General Motors Co  and medical equipment maker Ventec are speeding up efforts under a partnership code-named "Project V" to build ventilators at a GM plant in Kokomo, Indiana, to help combat the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. trade regulators approve tariff exemption for Apple Watches
Description: U.S. trade regulators have approved Apple Inc's  request to waive tariffs on China-made Apple Watches, the Office of the United States Trade Representative said in a letter dated Friday.

Headlines: What's in the nearly $2 trillion U.S. Senate coronavirus stimulus
Description: The U.S. Senate on Monday was negotiating a nearly $2 trillion emergency bill that aims to stem some of the economic toll of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Uber appoints former Mattel CEO Robert Eckert to board
Description: Uber Technologies Inc  said on Monday it had appointed consumer industry veteran Robert Eckert to its board as an independent director.

Headlines: With latest moves, Fed becomes creditor in chief for U.S. business
Description: In undertaking what will undoubtedly be its largest rescue effort ever, the Federal Reserve on Monday announced programs that represent a never-before-seen intervention by the central bank into the heart of the "real" American economy.

Headlines: Explainer: How the Fed's latest move will get money to Main Street
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve said on Monday it would backstop an unprecedented range of credit for households, small businesses and major employers in an attempt to stop the economy from sliding into depression as the coronavirus spreads.

Headlines: Some U.S. wealth advisers tell clients to stay put as markets fall
Description: The deepest U.S. stock market sell-off since the 2008 financial crisis is prompting some financial advisers to tell wealthy clients to hold steady or even increase their equity exposure if they have at least 10 years until retirement.

Headlines: U.S. junk bonds fall despite unprecedented Fed stimulus
Description: Prices of the riskiest U.S. corporate bonds fell on Monday as investors bet that the Federal Reserve's pledge to backstop an unprecedented range of debt would not materially change the outlook for less financially stable companies, particularly those at risk of default.

Headlines: Market panic lingers despite unprecedented Fed support
Description: Global equities slid further and safe-haven assets rose on Monday after a massive array of new programs from the U.S. Federal Reserve underscored the "severe" disruptions the coronavirus pandemic poses to a fast-weakening world economy.

Headlines: U.S. prosecutors charge PDVSA contractor with money laundering
Description: U.S. prosecutors have charged a Venezuelan oilfield contractor with money laundering for bribing officials at state oil company Petroleos de Venezuela to win overpriced contracts, and then seeking to hide the proceeds in the United States.

Headlines: Airbus sees airlines seeking to defer or cancel orders
Description: Airbus  said in a stock market filing on Monday that customers could seek to cancel or postpone delivery of airliners and helicopters as the coronavirus crisis continues to escalate.

Headlines: Boeing suspending Washington state production due to coronavirus risks
Description: Boeing Co  said on Monday it would halt production at its Washington state twin-aisle jetliner factory as a temporary measure to help fight the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Fed alone can’t stop coronavirus selloff, investors say, as stocks tumble again
Description: The Federal Reserve's unprecedented stimulus measures did little to brighten Wall Street's immediate outlook on coronavirus-ravaged stocks, as concerns remained about the lack of a government stimulus package and the ability to contain the pandemic.

Headlines: PG&E to plead guilty to 84 involuntary manslaughter counts over 2018 wildfire
Description: Pacific Gas & Electric has agreed to plead guilty to 84 involuntary manslaughter counts in connection with the 2018 Camp Fire, the most destructive wildfire in California's history.

Headlines: U.S. businesses see big hit from coronavirus, Fed survey shows
Description: U.S. businesses expect a "very large and very negative impact" from the coronavirus pandemic and efforts to slow its spread, according to a survey published on Monday by the Atlanta Federal Reserve Bank.

Headlines: GE's aviation unit to cut 10% of U.S. workforce: CEO
Description: General Electric Co's  aviation unit will cut its U.S. workforce by about 10%, Chief Executive Officer Larry Culp said in a letter to staff on Monday, as a shattered airline industry sought state support to survive the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: U.S. banks hand out bonuses to staff as coronavirus crisis intensifies
Description: Some U.S. banks on Monday offered employees one-time bonuses to help ease the financial burden of the coronavirus pandemic and as a reward for working through the crisis.

Headlines: IMF sees pandemic causing global recession in 2020, recovery in 2021
Description: The coronavirus pandemic will cause a global recession in 2020 that could be worse than the one triggered by the global financial crisis of 2008-2009, but world economic output should recover in 2021, the International Monetary Fund said on Monday.

Headlines: Coronavirus grounds more flights, takes toll on jobs
Description: Widening travel curbs to contain the spread of the coronavirus prompted more flight cancellations on Monday, with new restrictions spanning India, Australia, New Zealand, the United Arab Emirates (UAE), Hong Kong, Singapore and Taiwan.

Headlines: Airlines ground flights, count mounting costs of the coronavirus shock
Description: Airlines across the globe are feeling the pain as travel demand withers because of the coronavirus outbreak, scrapping flights and ditching financial forecasts.

Headlines: Alitalia to relaunch with much smaller fleet: sources
Description: The Italian government plans to take control of loss-making carrier Alitalia [CAITLA.UL] in a month or so, creating a new company that will start off with a much smaller fleet, union sources said on Monday.

Headlines: North American millers, bakers scramble to satisfy bread-buying binge
Description: North American flour mills and bakeries are rushing to boost production as the spread of the new coronavirus leads to stockpiling of staples like bread and pasta.

Headlines: Western supply chains buckle as coronavirus lockdowns spread
Description: Freight carriers are struggling to deliver goods by land, sea or air as the coronavirus pandemic forces Western governments to impose lockdowns, threatening supplies of vital products including medicines into the most affected areas, such as Italy.

Headlines: Shell cuts 2020 spending by $5 billion, suspends share buyback
Description: Royal Dutch Shell  will lower spending by $5 billion and suspended its vast $25 billion share buyback plan in an effort to weather the recent collapse in oil prices, it said on Monday.

Headlines: SoftBank plans $41 billion of asset sales to expand buyback and cut debt
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  plans to raise as much as $41 billion to buy back shares and reduce debt in an unprecedented move to restore investor confidence as a financial market rout pummels its shares and its portfolio companies.

Headlines: Home work triggers demand jump for chips, laptops and network goods
Description: With more employees working from home to help slow the spread of the coronavirus, demand is surging for laptops and network peripherals as well as components along the supply chain such as chips, as companies rush to build virtual offices.

Headlines: Airbus adds 15 billion euro credit line, scraps dividend
Description: Airbus  boosted its liquidity with a 15 billion euro  ($16 billion) expanded credit facility on Monday while suspending its 2020 outlook in response to the coronavirus crisis that has grounded much of the global airlines fleet.

Headlines: Coronavirus fears spark surge in a volatility-focused ETN, but with a downside
Description: A product that traders use to profit from surges in volatility has soared as coronavirus fears ravaged stocks, prompting concern about a plunge if the market's wild swings subside.

Headlines: Instant View: Fed launches unprecedented range of credit support
Description: The S&P 500  opened lower, reversing a brief bounce in U.S. stock futures after the U.S. Federal Reserve on Monday said it would backstop an unprecedented range of credit for households, small businesses and major employers to offset the "tremendous hardship," caused by coronavirus.

Headlines: Central banks deploy record sums to break financial logjam, but may need more
Description: Central banks have offered trillions of dollars of support to markets in recent days to keep them from freezing up, as investors worried about the economic damage from the coronavirus and made a chaotic dash for the exits.

Headlines: Fed: New Main Street program meant to ensure all firms have access to credit
Description: A Federal Reserve "Main Street" lending program still under development is meant to dovetail with proposals under consideration by Congress to make sure the full range of U.S. companies, from the smallest to the largest, have access to credit during the coronavirus health scare, the Fed said on Monday.

Headlines: H&M scraps dividend due to coronavirus as all costs under review
Description: Sweden's H&M , the world's second largest clothing retailer, said on Monday it had decided to scrap its proposed dividend due to the coronavirus outbreak, and that it was reviewing all parts of its operations, including all costs.

Headlines: Walmart ups minimum wage in e-commerce warehouses by $2 as orders surge on virus worries
Description: Walmart Inc said on Monday it has temporarily raised entry wages for workers in its e-commerce warehouses by $2, following similar moves by rivals, as it attempts to manage a shopping surge brought about by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Ford decides to halt production in India, South Africa on coronavirus impact
Description: Ford Motor Co  said on Monday it has decided to temporarily halt vehicle and engine production at its factories in India, South Africa, Thailand and Vietnam in response to the growing impact of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Netflix to reduce traffic in Israel by 25% to help ISPs
Description: Netflix said on Monday it would reduce network traffic in Israel over the next month following a government request to ease data congestion from people staying home due to the coronavirus.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler CEO says group to produce face masks in Asia: union representative
Description: Fiat Chrysler Chief Executive Mike Manley told employees that the carmaker would help with the production of masks during the coronavirus emergency, a union representative said on Monday.

Headlines: Virus hit UK companies told to delay financial statements
Description: Companies should not publish preliminary financial statements for at least two weeks to better assess how the coronavirus epidemic is affecting their business, Britain's Financial Conduct Authority said on Saturday.

Headlines: Factbox: UK companies delay results after regulators relax reporting rules
Description: British companies on Monday rushed to heed unprecedented calls by regulators to mothball their results so they can better assess how the coronavirus pandemic is affecting their business.

Headlines: Nestle CEO tells staff to get ready for coronavirus storm: memo
Description: Food giant Nestle  told employees to prepare for difficult times ahead and make all the necessary efforts to supply customers with the food and beverages they need, Chief Executive Mark Schneider said in a memorandum seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Factbox: Global oil, gas producers cut spending after crude price crash
Description: Oil and gas companies are cutting spending plans in response to the new coronavirus and a push by Saudi Arabia and Russia to ramp up output. [O/R]

Headlines: Factbox: SoftBank's key assets
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  plans to raise up to 4.5 trillion yen ($41 billion) by selling or monetizing assets to buy back 2 trillion yen of its shares and reduce debt, it said on Monday.

Headlines: Panasonic to suspend battery production at Tesla joint venture in Nevada due to coronavirus
Description: (This story was refiled to say news was earlier reported by the Reno Gazette Journal)

Headlines: Apple scraps curbs on online buyers of iPhones amid virus outbreak
Description: Apple has dropped a two-device limit on online purchases of iPhones, a check of its web stores showed on Monday, just days after changing the checkout procedure amid a coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs sees 1% drop in global GDP due to 'coronacrisis'
Description: Goldman Sachs said it expected global real gross domestic product to contract by about 1% in 2020, a sharper economic decline than in the year following the 2008 global financial crisis.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor heir apparent buys $15 million shares in automaker, parts affiliate
Description: Hyundai Motor Group's heir apparent Euisun Chung bought shares in automaker Hyundai Motor  and parts affiliate Hyundai Mobis  for a combined 19 billion won ($15 million), according to stock exchange filings.

Headlines: Senate GOP virus bill aids U.S. transport sector; offers airlines loans, not cash
Description: A Senate Republican coronavirus stimulus package would provide financial aid to U.S. airports, transit systems and passenger railroad Amtrak, but $50 billion for struggling U.S. airlines would be a loan, not a cash payout, the proposal showed.

Headlines: Exxon notifies contractors, vendors of spending cuts over coronavirus
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp  is notifying contractors and vendors of planned near-term cuts in capital and operating expenses over a coronavirus pandemic, and will announce the plans once they are final, company spokesman Jeremy Eikenberry said on Sunday.

Headlines: Boeing worker at Everett plant dies from coronavirus: Seattle Times
Description: A worker at Boeing Co's  Everett factory outside Seattle who had the coronavirus has died, the Seattle Times reported on Sunday, citing co-workers, a union official and a Facebook post by the man's brother.

Headlines: Airbus says plants to reopen at slower production rate
Description: Airbus  confirmed on Sunday it would resume only partial aircraft production when its French and Spanish factories reopen on Monday after a four-down shutdown to tackle health concerns over the coronavirus.

Headlines: Occidental nears deal with activist Icahn on proxy battle: source
Description: U.S. oil and gas producer Occidental Petroleum Corp  is nearing an agreement with activist investor Carl Icahn to halt a proxy battle in return for board seats, according to a person familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Wall Street stares down another bleak week, with coronavirus risks amplified
Description: Wall Street analysts and investment managers expect another rough week for U.S. markets due to coronavirus fears, with a wild open for futures on Sunday evening as lawmakers battled over an economic aid package in Washington.

Headlines: WeWork board's special committee prepares for fight against SoftBank
Description: The special committee of WeWork's board is preparing for a fight against Japan's SoftBank Group Corp  saying that SoftBank should complete its tender offer promised to the office sharing company's employees and shareholders.

Headlines: Embraer puts Brazil-based workers on furlough to protect them from coronavirus
Description: Brazilian planemaker Embraer  is putting all its Brazil-based employees who cannot work remotely on paid leave until March 31, the company said on Sunday, adding that only "a few essential operations" will be maintained.

Headlines: McDonald's to temporarily close all UK, Ireland restaurants amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: McDonald's Corp  said on Sunday it would temporarily close all its restaurants in the UK and Ireland by Monday evening because of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Virgin companies to invest $250 million to save jobs after virus outbreak: Branson
Description: British entrepreneur Richard Branson said on Sunday companies in his Virgin empire will be investing $250 million in coming weeks and months to save jobs from the impact of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Coronavirus supplies donated by Alibaba's Ma arrive in Africa
Description: A first planeload of protective and medical equipment donated to Africa by Chinese billionaire and Alibaba co-founder Jack Ma to help it fight the coronavirus arrived in the Ethiopian capital Addis Ababa on Sunday.

Headlines: Facebook donates emergency reserve of 720,000 masks due to coronavirus outbreak
Description: Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Sunday that the social media company has donated its emergency reserve of 720,000 masks to provide health workers with more protective gear.

Headlines: Facebook to cut video streaming quality in virus-hit Europe
Description: Facebook will downgrade video streaming quality on its platform and on Instagram in Europe, the latest U.S. tech giant to respond to an EU call to stave off internet gridlock as thousands work from home due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Emirates stops nearly all passenger flights, slashes wages
Description: Emirates, one of the world's biggest long-haul airlines, said on Sunday it would stop nearly all passenger flights this week and cut staff wages by as much as half because of the coronavirus impact on travel demand.

Headlines: Ford, GM, Tesla getting 'go ahead' to make ventilators: Trump
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Sunday that U.S. automakers Ford Motor Co, General Motors Co and Tesla Inc had been given the green light to produce ventilators and other items needed during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Coronavirus aid bill includes $3,000 for families, $4 trillion liquidity for Fed: Mnuchin
Description: The coronavirus economic relief bill being finalized by the U.S. Congress will include a one-time $3,000 payment for families and allow the Federal Reserve to leverage up to $4 trillion of liquidity to support the nation's economy, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Sunday.

Headlines: Fed's Bullard: Coronavirus shutdown not a recession but an investment in survival
Description: In normal times massive unemployment and a collapse in economic output would be tragic.

Headlines: Factbox: Latest on the spread of the coronavirus around the world
Description: Coronavirus cases ballooned in Europe, prompting more lockdown measures to try to slow the spread. New Jersey's governor followed four other U.S. states that have imposed unprecedented restrictions. Australia announced it was shutting a large array of businesses from Monday.

Headlines: Coronavirus deaths in Italy overtake China as economic damage mounts
Description: The world's richest nations poured unprecedented aid into the  global economy on Thursday as coronavirus cases ballooned in the new epicentre Europe, with the number of deaths in Italy outstripping those in mainland China, where the virus originated.

Headlines: Explainer: Hobbled IRS tax agency may need months to put cash into Americans' hands
Description: In order to put recession-fighting checks into the hands of millions of Americans, President Donald Trump will rely on a tax agency that has fewer workers, a smaller budget, and the same 1960s-era computer systems it had the last time it was asked to do so.

Headlines: Netflix to slash traffic across Europe to relieve virus strain on internet providers
Description: Netflix Inc  said it will cut traffic by 25% on networks across Europe in a relief measure for internet service providers (ISPs) experiencing a surge in usage due to government "shelter in place" orders aimed at slowing the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Airlines appear to come up short in bid to win cash grants in rescue package
Description: A last-ditch effort by the chief executives of major U.S. airlines to try to win cash grants to weather the coronavirus crisis looked to be unsuccessful, four congressional aides and airline officials said late Saturday.

Headlines: U.S. Senate races to agree on massive coronavirus relief package
Description: Republicans and Democrats in the U.S. Senate on Saturday scrambled to complete a deal on a $1 trillion-plus bill aimed at stemming the coronavirus pandemic's economic fallout for workers, industries and small businesses.

Headlines: Amazon raises overtime pay for warehouse workers
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Saturday it is raising overtime pay for associates working in its U.S. warehouses as the world's largest online retailer tries to meet the rapidly growing demand for online shopping from consumers stuck at home during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Musk, Medtronic discuss ventilators amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: As the United States is combating a shortage of ventilators and respirators amid the coronavirus outbreak, Tesla Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk said he has had a discussion about ventilators with medical device maker Medtronic.

Headlines: Volkswagen CEO warns factory closures may drag on for weeks
Description: Volkswagen AG  CEO Herbert Diess on Saturday warned that the coronavirus crisis may force the company to keep its factories shut for longer than initially planned.

Headlines: Shame on you, Britain tells coronavirus panic-buyers
Description: Britain on Saturday told people who were panic-buying and hoarding food due to the coronavirus outbreak to calm down, pointing to a video on social media showing an exhausted nurse driven to tears by finding shelves bare after her shift.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon.com to stop shipping non-essentials to consumers in Italy and France
Description: Amazon.com will stop shipping non-essential products to consumers in Italy and France, the company said on Saturday, representing an escalation in the e-commerce giant's response in regions hard hit by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Exclusive: Goldman injects $1 billion into own money-market funds after heavy withdrawals
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  poured more than $1 billion into two of its prime money-market portfolios this week due to heavy investor withdrawals, according to a filing with the U.S. securities regulator.

Headlines: Emirates stops flights to New York and other cities as virus crushes demand
Description: Emirates is suspending flights to cities including New York, Delhi and Melbourne due to the coronavirus outbreak that has severely hit travel demand.

Headlines: Exclusive: Agitating bondholders press Argentina to step up efforts
Description: Agitating bondholders have written to Argentina's government, accusing it of not doing enough to allow the country's crucial debt restructuring negotiations to make progress, according to bondholder sources involved in the process.

Headlines: Best Buy withdraws fiscal 2021 financial guidance
Description: Best Buy Co Inc  said on Saturday that the company withdrew all financial guidance for fiscal 2021, for both the first quarter and full year, due to increased uncertainty related to the potential impacts of the coronavirus.

Headlines: LVMH orders 40 million masks from China for France
Description: LVMH , the world's biggest luxury goods group, is ordering 40 million health masks from a Chinese supplier to help France cope with the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Wells Fargo asks Fed to lift cap on growth to support customers: FT
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  has asked the U.S. Federal Reserve to remove an asset cap introduced during its accounts scandal in order to allow it to support businesses and customers hit by the coronavirus economic fallout, the Financial Times reported.

Headlines: Starbucks closes most U.S., Canada cafes, moves to drive-through
Description: Starbucks Corp  said on Friday it will close most of its company operated cafes across north America for two weeks, limiting its services to drive-throughs, to help stem the spread of the highly contagious coronavirus.

Headlines: Google launches coronavirus website in the United States
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Saturday it launched a United States-focused website with information about coronavirus guidance and testing, as the country works on slowing the spread of the highly contagious virus.

Headlines: Volkswagen to close factories in Mexico to protect public health
Description: German automaker Volkswagen will temporarily close its factories in Mexico's Puebla and Guanajuato states in a bid to preserve public health, the company's Mexican unit said in a statement on Friday, amid growing worries over the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Uber suspends taxi booking option in Saudi Arabia
Description: Uber Technologies has suspended the option to book regular taxi services through its app in Saudi Arabia until further notice, a company statement said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. seeks comments on tariff cuts for Chinese imports to aid coronavirus battle
Description: The Trump administration on Friday said it was soliciting public comments on lifting additional tariffs on Chinese imports that could help the United States battle the coronavirus pandemic, showing some flexibility in its trade war against Beijing.

Headlines: United Airlines slashes international schedule by 95% for April
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  said on Friday it would slash its international schedule by 95% for April because of government restrictions prohibiting travel in an effort to curb the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. airlines call for payroll protections as aid talks continue
Description: U.S. airlines called on Friday for a government stimulus package to help them weather the coronavirus crisis by providing payroll protections, warning that around 750,000 jobs depend on the airline industry.

Headlines: U.S. senators question Amazon on coronavirus safety at warehouses
Description: Four Democratic U.S. senators on Friday expressed concern in a letter to Amazon.com Inc Chief Executive Jeff Bezos that the world's largest online retailer has not given enough support to warehouse staff during the coronavirus outbreak, according to a copy of the message seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Wells Fargo rolls out waivers, aid in response to coronavirus outbreak
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  said on Friday it is suspending residential property foreclosure sales, evictions and involuntary automobile repossessions due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Bank of America boosts hiring, worker pay amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Bank of America Corp's consumer division has hired 1,700 people in critical support roles so far this month, a spokesman said on Friday, as the industry faces a surge in customer service demand due to concerns about the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. auto industry backs tax relief, delaying USMCA start after coronavirus
Description: Groups representing major automakers and suppliers asked U.S. lawmakers on Friday to consider new tax relief and delay the start of a new trade deal as auto sales decline as a result of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. extends tax filing deadline to July 15: Mnuchin
Description: The U.S. government will give individuals and companies an extra three months to file their 2019 tax returns, extending the deadline to July 15 amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: States rush to prepare for wave of U.S. unemployed
Description: The U.S. unemployment benefits program, a key part of the safety net for the labor market, is facing its biggest test in more than a decade.

Headlines: Lyft drivers can join new delivery service, founders donate salaries
Description: Lyft Inc on Friday told drivers they could sign up for work driving deliveries under a new service as ride-hailing demand plummets during the rapid spread of coronavirus in the United States.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs CEO's 2019 compensation rises 19%
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  Chief Executive David Solomon's total compensation rose by 19%, or $4 million, for 2019 compared with 2018, according to a regulatory filing released on Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street weekahead: Coronavirus uncertainty muddies views on buying opportunities for plunging stocks
Description: U.S. stock valuations are tumbling in the wake of the coronavirus-fueled market rout, but determining when equities are cheap enough to buy is a tricky proposition.

Headlines: Volkswagen tests ventilator output as carmakers join coronavirus fight
Description: German carmaker Volkswagen  said on Friday it was joining other manufacturers around the world to explore using 3D printing to make hospital ventilators to combat the coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. to send envoy to Saudi Arabia; Texas suggests oil output cuts
Description: The Trump administration plans to send a special energy envoy to Saudi Arabia to work with the kingdom on stabilizing the global oil market, officials said on Friday, as the U.S. scrambles to deal with a price crash so deep that regulators in Texas considered curbing production there for the first time in nearly 50 years.

Headlines: Boeing suspends dividend, CEO foregoes pay after coronavirus-related aid request
Description: Boeing Co  will cancel CEO pay, suspend its dividend and extend a pause on share buybacks, the U.S. planemaker said on Friday, as companies eager for government aid to curb fallout from the coronavirus face pressure to cut payouts to investors.

Headlines: Wall Street dives, ends worst week since 2008, as New York, California impose restrictions
Description: Wall Street wrapped up its worst week since October 2008, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 sliding more than 4% on Friday as tough restrictions imposed by New York and California to try to limit the spread of the coronavirus fueled worries about damage to the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Panama's Copa Airlines cancels all flights as coronavirus crisis spreads
Description: Panama's Copa Airlines  on Friday said it will suspend all operations from March 22 until April 21, making it the first Latin American carrier to take such a drastic measure in order to weather the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico unit pulls elderly workers from checkouts on coronavirus concerns
Description: Grocers including Walmart de Mexico have begun bowing to pressure to pull from stores tens of thousands of elderly workers who pack bags at checkouts as concerns grow about their vulnerability to coronavirus amid panic buying nationwide.

Headlines: Coronavirus death toll in Italy's Lombardy jumps some 380 in a day -source
Description: The death toll from an outbreak of coronavirus in the northern Italian region of Lombardy, which has borne the brunt of a nationwide contagion, has risen by around 380 in a day to some 2,550, a source said on Friday.

Headlines: BMW will idle South Carolina plant for two weeks starting April 3
Description: BMW AG  said on Friday it will temporarily close its South Carolina plant for two weeks starting April 3.

Headlines: Ted Baker says 38% of global retail sales hit by coronavirus
Description: Troubled fashion retailer Ted Baker Plc  said on Friday it has shut businesses that accounted for about 38% of its global retail sales in 2020 due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp's Merz stays on as CEO to handle overhaul
Description: Martina Merz, who took over as interim chief executive of Thyssenkrupp , will remain in the job until 2023 after successfully selling the group's elevator unit in a landmark deal last month, the conglomerate said on Friday.

Headlines: Macy's suspends quarterly dividend, withdraws 2020 forecast
Description: Macy's Inc  said on Friday it would suspend its quarterly dividend and withdrew its 2020 sales and profit forecasts due to ongoing disruptions from store closures on the back of the fast-spreading coronavirus.

Headlines: Oil falls for fourth week; U.S. crude posts steepest weekly loss since 1991
Description: U.S. crude tumbled 10.7% on Friday and posted its biggest weekly decline since the 1991 Gulf War as the coronavirus epidemic dried up global demand and as officials in Washington said an envoy would head to Saudi Arabia to deal with fallout of a Saudi-Russia oil price war.

Headlines: New York order spooks Wall Street, offsets calm from policy efforts
Description: Wall Street retreated on Friday after New York ordered residents to stay home, rattling investors who had welcomed this week's fiscal and monetary measures to counter the coronavirus shock and help revive the safe-haven appeal of bonds and gold.

Headlines: Retailers offer discounts, waive shipping fees to boost online sales
Description: After closing their stores earlier this week to limit the spread of the coronavirus, several retailers are dangling site-wide discounts and free shipping to entice people stuck at home to shop.

Headlines: Google cancels annual developer conference on coronavirus fears
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Friday canceled its annual developer conference, two weeks after calling off the in-person portion of the event due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Trump slams companies for using U.S. tax credit to buy back stocks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday took Boeing Co  and some airlines to task for buying back shares with the cash boost from a 2018 tax break, vowing to ensure that companies benefiting from coronavirus stimulus won't follow suit.

Headlines: Delta Air expects quarterly revenue to fall by $10 billion, beefs up line of credit
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc  expects its second-quarter revenue to fall by $10 billion, representing an 80% reduction compared with a year earlier, the company said on Friday, as the coronavirus hurts travel demand.

Headlines: Blackrock to freeze global hiring for 'a few weeks' amid coronavirus: source
Description: Blackrock , the world's largest asset manager, will freeze global hiring for "a few weeks" amid the coronavirus pandemic, a source familiar with the situation said on condition of anonymity.

Headlines: McDonald's suspends buybacks, leaves dividend policy unchanged: CEO to CNBC
Description: McDonald's Corp  has suspended share buybacks to help it navigate thorough the coronavirus crisis, but has not changed its dividend policy, Chief Executive Officer Chris Kempczinski told CNBC https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/20/mcdonalds-suspended-its-15-billion-buyback-program-several-weeks-ago.html?__source=twitter%7Cmain in an interview on Friday.

Headlines: Coronavirus death toll in UK rises by 33 to 177
Description: A total of 177 patients have died in the United Kingdom after testing positive for coronavirus, the health ministry said on Friday, up from 144 on Thursday.

Headlines: Stretched British supermarkets step up hiring to weather coronavirus epidemic
Description: With food flying off the shelves as fast as exhausted shop assistants can replenish them, British supermarkets have stepped up their hiring to see them through the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: WHO message to youth on coronavirus: 'You are not invincible'
Description: Coronavirus can sicken or kill young people as well and they must also avoid mingling and spreading it to older and more vulnerable people, the World Health Organization said on Friday.

Headlines: This is no 2008: Mnuchin borrows from Paulson's economic crisis playbook
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin has stepped into the breach as the Trump administration's point man to rescue the economy from coronavirus devastation, taking on the role his former Goldman Sachs boss, Hank Paulson, played over a decade ago.

Headlines: Global airline capacity may fall up to 35% in 2020 on coronavirus: Moody's
Description: Global airline capacity may fall up to 35% this year, hamper credit quality of many airlines and push the weaker ones to default, credit ratings agency Moody's said on Friday, as a drop in demand due to the coronavirus leads to cancelled flights.

Headlines: Spain to treat thousands of coronavirus patients in conference hall as toll tops 1,000
Description: Spanish authorities said on Friday they would turn a Madrid conference centre into a giant military hospital for coronavirus patients, as Europe's second-worst outbreak claimed another 235 lives and the government warned the worst days lay ahead.
