Headlines: Fed announces more emergency moves to stem dollar, liquidity strains
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve continued to roll out emergency support on Friday as it enhanced efforts with other major central banks to ease a global dollar-funding crunch, backstopped a market essential for U.S. state and local government finances and ramped up its purchases of mortgage-backed securities.

Headlines: Bayer mediator says glyphosate settlement talks slowed by coronavirus
Description: Negotiations between Bayer AG and plaintiff lawyers to settle claims its glyphosate-based weedkillers cause cancer have been slowed by the coronavirus outbreak, according to the mediator in the talks.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz talks with Amazon, Walmart daily to speed food deliveries
Description: Kraft Heinz  speaks daily with Amazon.com  and Walmart Inc , hoping to speed up deliveries as customers worldwide stay home and shop online to protect themselves from the COVID-19 pandemic, Kraft Heinz's CEO said on Friday.

Headlines: Fiat, Toyota, Renault latest to announce auto production halt in Brazil over coronavirus
Description: Fiat Chrysler , Toyota Motor Corp  and Renault  announced on Friday they will stop auto production in Brazil temporarily due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Farnborough Airshow canceled in sign of aerospace slump
Description: The Farnborough Airshow - this year's largest aerospace expo and a showcase for tens of billions of dollars of business deals - has become the latest major event to be canceled because of the coronavirus crisis, organizers said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. banks switch to drive-through, ATMs to guard against coronavirus
Description: Banks across the United States announced plans to close branches this week, switching many to drive-through and ATM operations only, as financial institutions work to keep going despite the coronavirus and widespread closures of schools and businesses.

Headlines: UK's Tesco to hire 20,000 people to cope with rush on supermarkets
Description: Britain's market-leading supermarket chain Tesco said on Friday it would hire 20,000 people to work in its stores for at least the next 12 weeks to cope with an unprecedented increase in demand for food and household products.

Headlines: Coronavirus shutdown to cut Europe, Americas auto production by 1.44 million: IHS Markit
Description: As carmakers grapple with growing signs of coronavirus damage, vehicle production could be reduced by about 1.44 million in Europe, North America and Latin America, according to an estimate by information provider IHS Markit.

Headlines: Airlines face reckoning as government help comes with strings attached
Description: Shattered airlines were left counting the cost of government support as countries from the United States to New Zealand set out conditions for bailouts needed to absorb the shock of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Texas regulator urges state to consider oil output limits as prices crash
Description: Texas should consider production limits for oil companies in an effort to stabilize crashing prices, one of three commissioners at the state's oil and gas regulator said Friday.

Headlines: Orange CEO asks for delay of Disney+ streaming launch in France
Description: The chief executive of telecoms operator Orange called on Friday for a delay to the launch of Walt Disney's streaming services in France to avoid overloading networks amid the country's lockdown following the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: EasyJet to ground most flights, BA pilots face unpaid leave
Description: Britain's easyJet  said on Friday it would ground most of its flights, while pilots at rival British Airways will be required to take two weeks' unpaid leave in both April and May as the battered aviation sector frantically seeks to cut costs.

Headlines: UK to pay firms not to sack workers over coronavirus
Description: Britain's government will pay businesses hit by the coronavirus outbreak not to lay off workers, as part of what finance minister Rishi Sunak said would be an unprecedented economic intervention.

Headlines: 3M doubles production of respirator masks amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: U.S. industrial giant 3M Co  said on Friday it has doubled the production of N95 respirator masks over the last two months as a result of a surge in demand due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: CNH Industrial halts most European plants due to virus-related supply constraints
Description: Vehicle maker CNH Industrial  said on Friday it was suspending most of its European assembly operations for two weeks due to the coronavirus outbreak, citing supply chain constraints.

Headlines: Downgrade doom looms for coronavirus-hit firms and markets
Description: A wave of credit rating downgrades in the corporate sector risks deepening a funding crisis for company bosses and spreading it to other markets.

Headlines: Dollar rampage spurs forex interventions, speculation of big G7 move
Description: (This March 19 story corrects to fix dollar gain in paragraph 4)

Headlines: Madagascar confirms first cases of coronavirus: president
Description: The island nation of Madagascar confirmed its first cases of coronavirus on Friday, the president said in a televised statement.

Headlines: easyJet says will ground most of its fleet from Tuesday
Description: British low-cost airline easyJet  said it would ground most of its aircraft from Tuesday in response to travel restrictions aimed to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: AT&T stops share repurchase plans in response to COVID-19 outbreak
Description: AT&T Inc withdrew plans to repurchase $4 billion in common stock as it was unable to predict the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on its business, the company said on Friday in a regulatory filing.

Headlines: Amazon notifies shopper about U.S. probe of third-party sellers
Description: (This March 19 story corrects to say Amazon notified one shopper and not shoppers, adds Amazon statement)

Headlines: Germany will block foreign takeovers to avoid economy sell-out
Description: Germany will protect domestic firms from foreign takeovers, two leading politicians said on Friday, after company valuations in Europe's largest economy have been hammered by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. home sales race to 13-year high; coronavirus disruption looms
Description: U.S. home sales surged to a 13-year high in February, but the housing market recovery is likely to be derailed by the coronavirus pandemic, which has unleashed a wave of layoffs and left the economy teetering on the brink of a recession.

Headlines: Inditex considers 25,000 temporary layoffs in Spain
Description: Inditex, the owner of fashion chain Zara, may temporarily lay off all 25,000 of its store staff in Spain if the country's state of emergency extends beyond April 15, in what would be one of the largest such moves in Europe due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Airbus says in talks with governments, declines comment on loans
Description: Airbus  said on Friday it is in regular dialogue with European governments, but declined to comment on a report that the European planemaker may seek government support to tackle the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Coronavirus leaves 300,000 EU citizens stranded abroad - Borrell
Description: As many as 300,000 European Union citizens are seeking repatriation due to the coronavirus outbreak, with Latin America and Southeast Asia two regions from where it is proving tough to get people home, the EU's top diplomat said on Friday.

Headlines: Steep capacity cut leaves airlines with overhedged jet fuel headache
Description: The collapse in global passenger flights has left airlines with fresh challenges: how to manage overhedged jet fuel positions as oil prices crashed to just a third of some contracts agreed in anticipation of rising prices and solid air travel demand.

Headlines: French nuclear plants tighten hygiene procedures over coronavirus worries
Description: French utility EDF is introducing stricter hygiene procedures at its nuclear plants after walk-outs by a small number of workers who feared getting infected with coronavirus during radiation screening, union and industrial sources said on Friday.

Headlines: Poland donates 430 thousand litres of confiscated spirits for disinfectant
Description: Nearly half a million litres of confiscated vodka and rectified spirit will be sent to Polish public institutions in need of disinfectant amid the coronavirus outbreak, Poland's prosecutor's office said on Friday.

Headlines: Glencore says coronavirus-related restrictions affect its smaller operations
Description: Glencore  said on Friday that restrictions imposed by governments to curb the coronavirus outbreak has had some impact on its smaller operations in different countries.

Headlines: Brazil Senate approves state of emergency to fight coronavirus
Description: Brazil's Senate on Friday approved a presidential decree declaring a national emergency over the coronavirus epidemic, allowing the government to waive fiscal targets and free up budget resources to fight the virus that has killed seven and infected 621 in the country.

Headlines: Sri Lanka imposes curfew as South Asia steps up coronavirus battle
Description: Sri Lanka imposed a nationwide weekend curfew on Friday as South Asian countries escalated efforts to check the spread of coronavirus across the densely populated region of 1.9 billion people.

Headlines: Ford to bring forward UK summer shutdown due to coronavirus
Description: Ford  will bring forward part of the summer shutdown for its British engine plants to Easter due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Fed increases frequency of swap line operations with other major central banks
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve said on Friday that it would enhance the U.S. dollar liquidity swap line arrangements it has with several major central banks.

Headlines: 'Demand destruction' - analysts race to lower outlooks for oil
Description: Traders and analysts are struggling to revise down their forecasts for oil demand fast enough, as government lockdowns to contain the coronavirus outbreak have rapidly cut fuel consumption.

Headlines: Divided G20 faces pressure to lead global response to coronavirus
Description: The Group of 20 major economies faces mounting pressure to bridge internal divisions and unite against the coronavirus, just as it coalesced to address the 2008-09 global financial crisis.

Headlines: BOJ says enhanced dollar swap lines will ease strains in funding markets
Description: A decision by the world's major central banks to enhance their dollar swap lines will serve as an important backstop to ease strains in global funding markets, the Bank of Japan said on Friday.

Headlines: JPMorgan Chase to pay 'front-line' workers $1,000 bonus: memo
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  said Friday it would give "front line employees," workers who are staffing branches and call centers through the coronavirus pandemic, a sweetener for their efforts: a one-time $1,000 bonus.

Headlines: Ryanair could survive without revenue for 'maybe even 12 months', CEO tells FT
Description: Ryanair  has the cash to survive for "maybe even 12 months" with no flights or revenue as the coronavirus shuts the air travel industry down, CEO Michael O'Leary said in an interview with the Financial Times on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. existing home sales surge to 13-year high in February
Description: U.S. home sales surged to a 13-year high in February, but the housing market recovery is likely to be derailed by the coronavirus pandemic, which has unleashed a wave of layoffs and left the economy teetering on the brink of a recession.

Headlines: Exclusive: Italy Treasury sees 2020 GDP falling around 3% amid coronavirus chaos - sources
Description: The Italian Treasury currently expects the economy to contract around 3% this year, hit by the lockdown imposed to fight the country's coronavirus outbreak, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. finance industry says markets must stay open during epidemic
Description: Keeping U.S. markets open during the coronavirus epidemic is critical for maintaining investor confidence, exchanges and market industry bodies said in a joint statement on Friday.

Headlines: Come back to fight coronavirus, UK begs 65,000 former nurses and doctors
Description: Britain has asked 65,000 former nurses and doctors to return to work and will deploy final-year medical students to fight the coronavirus health crisis, the health ministry said.

Headlines: Malaysia to deploy army amid movement curbs to contain coronavirus
Description: Malaysia will deploy the army from Sunday to assist police in enforcing a restricted movement order aimed at reining in the spread of a coronavirus, the government said.

Headlines: Norwegian Air gets lifeline but it may not be enough
Description: Budget carrier Norwegian Air  may struggle to meet the tough conditions set by the government as part of its financial aid, raising fresh doubts about its liquidity as coronavirus inflicts more financial pain on the airline sector.

Headlines: Nissan's UK factory closed until further notice over coronavirus
Description: Nissan said on Friday its British car factory would remain closed until further notice over the coronavirus outbreak, having previously said it would be shut until the end of the week.

Headlines: Anglo American says to reschedule work at mines to contain virus
Description: Anglo American said on Friday it would reschedule work at mines in countries such as Chile to contain the spread of coronavirus but added there had been no material disruption on production.

Headlines: EU states agree to suspend airline slot requirements until October
Description: The EU agreed on Friday to suspend requirements that oblige airlines to use at least 80% of their take-off and landing slots in order to keep them the following year until Oct. 24 due to the aviation industry crisis unleashed by coronavirus.

Headlines: Japan to reopen schools closed for coronavirus after spring recess
Description: Japanese Education Minister Koichi Hagiuda said on Friday the government would not extend its request that schools be closed until spring break to stem coronavirus infections, setting the stage for classes to resume at the start of the academic year in April.

Headlines: U.S. power industry may ask key employees to live at work if coronavirus worsens
Description: The U.S. electric industry may ask essential staff to live on site at power plants and control centers to keep operations running if the coronavirus outbreak worsens, and has been stockpiling beds, blankets, and food for them, according to industry trade groups and electric cooperatives.

Headlines: Malaysia's AirAsia says review found Airbus procurement process robust
Description: AirAsia Group Bhd  said on Friday an independent probe  into corruption allegations from Britain's Serious Fraud Office (SFO) has found the Malaysian airline's procurement process with European planemaker Airbus SE  robust and justifiable.

Headlines: Crowds form at Olympic torch event in Japan despite coronavirus caution
Description: An Olympic torch event in Japan drew hundreds of spectators on the day of the flame's arrival on Friday, creating the type of packed gathering the government and Tokyo 2020 organisers have warned against to prevent coronavirus from spreading further.

Headlines: Finnish health boss questions WHO coronavirus testing advice
Description: Finland's national health authority questioned on Friday the  World Health Organization's call on countries to test as many patients as possible for coronavirus, after the country ran out of testing capacity this week.

Headlines: Muslims in Indonesia divided over Friday prayers amid coronavirus fears
Description: While many Muslims in Indonesia's capital accepted advice to avoid religious gatherings and prayed at home on Friday elsewhere in the world's most populous Muslim country, people ignored the risk of coronavirus and crowded into their mosques.

Headlines: Factbox: What's left in the tank for the big three central banks?
Description: The world's top three central banks have deployed an array of weapons to fight the profound economic threat posed by the global coronavirus pandemic, increasingly seen as likely to spur the first outright contraction in the world economy since the 2007-09 financial crisis.

Headlines: Restaurant chain Vapiano reports 'cash flow insolvency'
Description: German restaurant chain Vapiano SE  on Friday said it was insolvent and would apply for government assistance to avoid formally filing for insolvency, blaming the coronavirus crisis for a drop in sales.

Headlines: Boeing eyes production pause as virus spreads: sources
Description: Boeing Co  is leaning toward a temporary work stoppage at its twin-aisle jetliner factories due to the spread of coronavirus, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday, echoing a similar move by European rival Airbus SE .

Headlines: Tesla's China car registrations fall 35% month-on-month in February
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc's  China car registrations fell 35% in February, month on month, data from auto consultancy LMC Automotive showed.

Headlines: Truckmaker Volvo to put all 20,000 Swedish staff on temporary lay off-scheme
Description: Truckmaker AB Volvo  said on Friday it would put all its 20,000 staff in Sweden on a short-term, temporary lay off-scheme starting next week as it plans to close all production in the country due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: What you need to know about coronavirus right now
Description: Here's what you need to know about the coronavirus today:

Headlines: EU okays Danish aid for rail-road link to Germany
Description: EU state aid regulators cleared on Friday Danish financial support for a rail-road link between Denmark and Germany, part of the North-South route connecting central Europe and the Nordic countries.

Headlines: Global oil, gas producers cut spending after crude price crash
Description: Oil and gas companies are cutting spending plans in response to the new coronavirus and a push by Saudi Arabia and Russia to ramp up output.

Headlines: Frontier Airlines private equity owner sees good buys in industry turmoil
Description: Airlines hit hard by the travel restrictions imposed as a result of the coronavirus pandemic may soon present buying opportunities for investors, the co-founder of the buyout firm that owns budget carrier Frontier Airlines said in an interview.

Headlines: British public unprepared for BoE rate cut: survey
Description: Almost none of the British public surveyed by the Bank of England last month expected it would soon need to cut interest rates, a BoE report showed on Friday.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank warns virus may 'materially' impact targets
Description: Deutsche Bank  said on Friday that the impact of the coronavirus outbreak may affect the lender's ability to meet its financial targets as the fragile bank undergoes a major revamp  after years of losses.

Headlines: 'How did things end up like this?' America's newly unemployed grapple with coronavirus fallout
Description: By Barbara Goldberg, Nate Raymond, Jessica Resnick-Ault and Lucy Nicholson

Headlines: Britain's M&S warns of severe impact from coronavirus
Description: British retailer Marks & Spencer  warned on Friday trading over the next 9-12 months in its clothing, homewares and international businesses was likely to be "severely impacted" by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Qatar eases exit restrictions on migrant employees in the oil and gas industry
Description: Qatar has removed exit visa requirements for an additional segment of its foreign labour force, including some of those working in the oil and gas industry, according to official tweets posted on Friday.

Headlines: A poorer student falls behind in Hong Kong as coronavirus forces online learning
Description: When Hong Kong student Wendy received a question from her geography teacher during an online class, she scrambled to unmute her mother's cellphone, but the screen kept freezing. She had already used up her monthly five gigabytes data allowance.

Headlines: France says 130,000 of its nationals trying to return home
Description: France is trying to facilitate the repatriation of 130,000 of its nationals stuck overseas due to the coronavirus outbreak, Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian said on Friday.

Headlines: Volvo cars to temporarily close plants in U.S. and Sweden
Description: Swedish carmaker Volvo is suspending production at its factories in Sweden, the United States and Belgium, to curb the spread of the coronavirus, it said on Friday, even as it resumes manufacturing in China where the infection rate has slowed.

Headlines: Taiwan's new 'electronic fence' for quarantines leads wave of virus monitoring
Description: Taiwan, which has won global praise for its effective action against the coronavirus, is rolling out a mobile phone-based "electronic fence" that uses location-tracking to ensure people who are quarantined stay in their homes.

Headlines: Russia starts testing coronavirus vaccine prototypes on animals
Description: Russian scientists have begun testing prototypes of potential vaccines against the new coronavirus on animals in a laboratory in Siberia, Russia's consumer health regulator said on Friday.

Headlines: Apple limits online iPhone purchases to two per person amid coronavirus
Description: Apple Inc  is limiting customer purchases of iPhones over its online stores in many countries including the United States and China to a maximum of two handsets per person, checks on its website on Friday revealed.

Headlines: OPEC supply curbs, U.S. measures could support oil prices near term: Goldman
Description: Supply restraint by core-OPEC producers could push second-quarter Brent oil prices up to $30 a barrel, while U.S. measures to support the market could underpin prices in the near term, Goldman Sachs said in a research note.

Headlines: South Korea, China, Japan foreign ministers to hold video conference over coronavirus response: Seoul
Description: The foreign ministers of South Korea, China and Japan will hold a video conference on Friday to foster cooperation on the coronavirus pandemic, Seoul's foreign ministry said.

Headlines: Thailand reports 50 new coronavirus infections for total of 322
Description: Thailand reported 50 new coronavirus infections, taking its tally to 322, a health official said on Friday, with the majority located in Bangkok, the capital.

Headlines: Unity will help Iran overcome coronavirus, Rouhani says
Description: Iranians will overcome a coronavirus outbreak with unity, President Hassan Rouhani said in a televised speech on Friday, praising doctors and nurses for their courage in fighting the disease that has killed 1,284 in the Middle East country.

Headlines: CDC reports 10,491 coronavirus cases, 150 deaths
Description: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Thursday reported 10,491 cases of coronavirus, an increase of 3,404 from its previous count, and said the death toll had risen by 53 to 150, the biggest one-day jump so far.

Headlines: Air Canada to lay off over 5,100 employees due to virus outbreak: union
Description: Air Canada  will temporarily lay off more than 5,100 employees as it attempts to check the impact of the coronavirus pandemic, the union representing the Canadian airline's flight attendants said on Friday.

Headlines: Tesla suspends production at U.S. vehicle factory due to coronavirus
Description: Tesla Inc said on Thursday it will suspend production at its San Francisco Bay Area vehicle factory on March 24, ending a standoff with California authorities concerned about the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Latin American airlines slash flights, salaries in response to coronavirus
Description: Latin America's major airlines sharply curtailed international flights on Thursday because of the coronavirus outbreak as Panama and Colombia imposed month-long travel bans and the largest carrier cut the salaries of 43,000 employees.

Headlines: Walmart to hire 150,000 workers as shoppers surge on coronavirus fears
Description: Big-box retailer Walmart Inc  said on Thursday it would hire more than 150,000 hourly workers in the United States, citing a jump in shoppers due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Former Uber self-driving head Levandowski agrees to plea deal over Google secrets
Description: Engineer Anthony Levandowski, known for advancing self-driving car technology in the last decade, agreed to plead guilty on Thursday to taking sensitive documents from his former employer Google before joining rival Uber Technologies Inc.

Headlines: Trump says he would support government taking stake in certain companies
Description: President Donald Trump on Thursday opened the door to a radical shift in the U.S. government's relationship to private industry as the coronavirus outbreak upends the nation's economy, saying he would back the government taking stakes in certain companies.

Headlines: Explainer: What is herd immunity and will it affect the pandemic?
Description: The outbreak of disease caused by the new coronavirus has raised questions about a phenomenon known as "herd immunity" and whether it might play a role in how the pandemic progresses.

Headlines: China asks airlines to cut international flights, redirects some due to virus
Description: China's aviation regulator has asked airlines to cut international flights and ordered some Beijing ones to be rerouted, as the country grapples with a rising number of imported coronavirus cases, especially in the capital.

Headlines: U.S. conglomerates see borrowing costs spike
Description: Walt Disney Co , JPMorgan Chase & Co  and United Parcel Service Inc  were among seven major U.S. companies that accepted a big rise in their borrowing costs to issue bonds on Thursday, as the coronavirus outbreak roiled credit markets.

Headlines: JLR to suspend production at UK manufacturing facilities from next week
Description: Luxury automaker Jaguar Land Rover  said late on Thursday it would temporarily suspend production at its UK manufacturing facilities from next week to curb the coronavirus' spread.

Headlines: Colombia to suspend entry for all travelers from abroad
Description: Colombia will block entry to everyone traveling from abroad from midnight on Monday in an effort to control the spread of coronavirus, President Ivan Duque said on Thursday.

Headlines: Brazil coronavirus cases top 600, diplomatic spat with China bubbles
Description: Confirmed coronavirus cases in Brazil surged past 600 on Thursday, more than doubling in two days, as a diplomatic spat over the disease's origins between President Jair Bolsonaro's son and the Chinese ambassador threatened relations with Brazil's top trading partner.

Headlines: Carmaker Bentley to suspend production for four weeks over coronavirus
Description: Bentley will stop car production at its British factory from the end of Friday for four weeks over the coronavirus outbreak, one of the final automakers in Britain to announce such plans.

Headlines: For U.S. small restaurants, coronavirus impact is swift and brutal
Description: On St. Patrick's Day last year, Amy and Chris Hillyard marked the 30th anniversary of Farley's, their pair of cafes in San Francisco and Oakland, California, with live bagpipes and noisy crowds.

Headlines: Fast food chains easing rent, fees for franchisees amid coronavirus
Description: Dunkin' Brands Group Inc on Thursday said it will ease royalty and advertising fee payments for franchisees in the United States and Canada, while McDonald's Corp  is in talks to reduce some payments for franchisees.

Headlines: Renault board to meet, discuss coronavirus crisis: sources
Description: The board of French carmaker Renault  will meet on Friday to discuss the coronavirus outbreak and its effect on operations, three sources close to the company said.

Headlines: GM Mexico to halt operations at San Luis Potosi plant from March 20-April 13
Description: General Motors Co  said on Thursday that it will suspend operations at its plant in Mexico's San Luis Potosi state from March 20 to April 13 due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Sellers' Amazon loans at risk as company limits warehouses to essential goods
Description: Some Amazon sellers say the online retailer's abrupt decision to stop receiving non-essential inventory in response to the coronavirus pandemic could strangle the sales they need to make payments on their Amazon loans.

Headlines: JPMorgan Chase to close 1,000 Chase branches on coronavirus concerns
Description: (This March 18 story corrects in seventh paragraph to clarify dress code is relaxed for operations staff but not Chase branch staff)

Headlines: Former U.N. ambassador Nikki Haley leaves Boeing board, opposing federal aid
Description: Former U.N. ambassador Nikki Haley has resigned from Boeing Co's board after opposing its bid for government financial assistance due to the crisis caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: JPMorgan's Jamie Dimon recovering well, mid-April return possible: source
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon's recovery from recent heart surgery is going well and the face of the U.S. banking industry could be back to work as soon as mid-April, a source said on Thursday.

Headlines: LVMH considering buying Tiffany's shares on open market: Bloomberg News
Description: French luxury goods maker LVMH , which last year agreed to buy Tiffany & Co  for $16.2 billion, is considering buying shares of the U.S. jeweler for less on the open market, Bloomberg News reported https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-19/lvmh-is-said-to-consider-buying-tiffany-shares-on-open-market on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Senate Republican proposal rejects grants for U.S. airlines, could get equity
Description: A Republican proposal introduced in the U.S. Senate on Thursday would grant up to $58 billion in secured loans to help passenger and cargo airlines hit by the coronavirus crisis, but bar cash grants and could result in the government getting equity stakes.

Headlines: James Bell, Laban Jackson to retire from JPMorgan board
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  said in a regulatory filing on Thursday that James Bell and Laban Jackson have decided to retire from board.

Headlines: Wall Street ends higher to stem coronavirus sell-off
Description: U.S. stocks managed to post gains on Thursday after recent steep losses as policymakers around the world took further emergency actions to try to help financial markets cope with deep coronavirus-driven economic damage.

Headlines: Airbnb fields interest from investors seeking a stake: sources
Description: Airbnb Inc has received inquiries from potential investors who want to acquire a stake in the U.S. home rental company in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: World's governments draft manufacturers for virus treatment arsenal
Description: By Sarah Young, Costas Pitas, Giulio Piovaccari and Elvira Pollina

Headlines: U.S. aviation industry calls for immediate grants, loans to ensure survival
Description: The leading U.S. airline trade group and dozens of other U.S. aviation industry trade groups on Thursday called for immediate grants, unsecured loans and limited tax measures to ensure the industry's ability to survive the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Starboard nominates four to eBay's board, wants outsider as CEO
Description: Activist investor Starboard Value is pressuring eBay for the second time in two years and said on Thursday that it plans to install four directors on the e-commerce company's 14-member board.

Headlines: Catholics worldwide pray with pope for end to coronavirus pandemic
Description: Catholics around the world joined Pope Francis in praying the rosary on Thursday night to ask God to end the coronavirus pandemic, which has killed more people in Italy than anywhere else.

Headlines: Factbox: From Boeing to Tennessee whiskey, coronavirus U.S. bailout requests top $2 trillion
Description: As the coronavirus pandemic threatens to bring U.S. economic activity to a halt, American businesses are jockeying for a financial lifeline from President Donald Trump's administration and Congress.

Headlines: Ford hoards cash, withdraws profit forecast amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Ford Motor Co  on Thursday moved to hoard cash on its balance sheet, drawing down $15.4 billion from two credit lines and suspending its dividend, in a move to bolster reserves to ride out damage to its business from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. auto suppliers seek government aid to cope with coronavirus hit
Description: The trade group for U.S. auto parts makers on Thursday asked the government for emergency grants "to keep the doors open," tariff relief and other assistance to cope with mounting pressures from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Ford to suspend production in Brazil, Argentina due to coronavirus
Description: Ford Motor Co  on Thursday said it will suspend production in Brazil and Argentina starting next week due to the coronavirus outbreak, joining General Motors Co and Mercedes Benz which have also announced similar measures in Brazil.

Headlines: Airline industry crisis deepens as coronavirus kills demand
Description: The crisis for airlines deepened on Thursday as Lufthansa , which has grounded most of its fleet, warned the industry may not survive coronavirus pandemic without government aid to offset nosediving demand.

Headlines: Technology issues strain work from home efforts at big U.S. banks
Description: Citigroup Inc  asked its non-essential workers across North America to hold off on logging into its remote access system until 1 p.m. on Thursday, as it braced for many employees to begin working from home, according to sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. oil reverses losses, posts largest one-day gain on record
Description: U.S. crude oil prices spiked by 25% on Thursday, the largest single-day gain on record, recouping some losses from three days of selling that drove the benchmark to near 20-year lows.

Headlines: U.S. grocery meat supply to improve soon, after virus-fueled demand surge: Tyson Foods
Description: Demand for U.S. meat at grocery stores will likely exceed supplies for at least another week, the chief executive of Tyson Foods Inc told Reuters on Thursday, as the coronavirus pandemic fuels panic buying among shoppers.

Headlines: Markets rebound as policymakers further boost liquidity
Description: European and American stocks rebounded on Thursday, halting further declines, in a sign further steps to boost liquidity by the U.S. Federal Reserve and other central banks has tentatively calmed markets that still fear a coronavirus-induced slowdown.

Headlines: Remote work during coronavirus outbreak puts millions more on Microsoft Teams, Slack
Description: Microsoft Corp's  Teams chat and conferencing app gained more than 12 million daily users in one week, a 37.5% jump as more people worked from home during the coronavirus outbreak,  the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: Bank of England ramps up bond-buying, cuts rates to near zero
Description: The Bank of England promised 200 billion pounds of bond purchases and cut its key interest rate to 0.1% in a second emergency move in just over a week to try to mitigate the hit to Britain's economy from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Siemens board member Sen leaves, Siemens Energy gets new CEO
Description: Siemens  managing board member Michael Sen will no longer take charge of the new energy business which the German engineering group wants to spin off later this year, it said on Thursday, after he agreed to leave the company.

Headlines: Trump says he will enter Saudi-Russia oil fray at appropriate time
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said he would get involved in the oil price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia at the appropriate time, saying low gasoline prices were good for U.S. consumers even as they were hurting the industry.

Headlines: Amazon halts grocery orders to restock amid surging demand
Description: Amazon.com Inc  said on Thursday it has halted its Prime Pantry delivery service in the United States to restock groceries, following a surge in online orders by shoppers worried about the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. jobless claims could top record 1.5 million next week: economists
Description: A wave of layoffs at restaurants, bars and hotels, as efforts to contain the coronavirus pandemic bring much of everyday American life to a halt, could drive new applications for U.S. unemployment benefits to a record 1.5 million or more next week, economists warned on Thursday.

Headlines: Prince Albert of Monaco tests positive for coronavirus
Description: Prince Albert of Monaco has tested positive for coronavirus but his health is not a cause for concern, his office said on Thursday.

Headlines: Toyota extends North America production shutdown through April 3
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  said on Thursday it will extend a planned two-day shutdown of all North American plants through April 3 as the spread of coronavirus continues.

Headlines: Coronavirus patients flood hospitals in Swiss canton next to Italy
Description: The southern Swiss canton of Ticino on the border with Italy is being swamped with coronavirus patients and authorities are battling to find enough intensive care beds, a top public health official said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exhausted Dutch minister leading coronavirus fight quits
Description: The minister leading the Dutch government's fight against the coronavirus resigned on Thursday, a day after collapsing from exhaustion during a parliamentary debate on the epidemic.

Headlines: U.S. to buy initial 30 million bbls of oil for emergency stockpile
Description: The U.S. Department of Energy said on Thursday it will buy up to 30 million barrels of crude oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve by the end of June as a first step in fulfilling President Donald Trump's directive to fill the emergency stockpile to help domestic crude producers.

Headlines: Uber shares soar after CEO says enough cash to ride out coronavirus crisis
Description: Shares of Uber Technologies Inc  surged as much as 44% on Thursday after Chief Executive Officer Dara Khosrowshahi said it had plenty of cash on hand to tide over the coronavirus crisis and signaled a recovery in some parts of its business.

Headlines: H&M issues notice of temporary lay-offs to 2,000 staff in Norway: DN
Description: Swedish retailer H&M  has sent notice of temporary lay-offs to 2,000 employees in Norway due to the coronavirus outbreak, Norwegian business daily Dagens Naeringsliv reported on Thursday, citing the head of the Norwegian business.

Headlines: Exclusive: Ferrari and Fiat look at helping Italy make ventilators in coronavirus crisis
Description: Italian carmakers Ferrari and Fiat Chrysler are in talks with the nation's biggest ventilator manufacturer to help to boost production of the life-saving machines that are urgently needed in the coronavirus crisis, company officials said on Thursday.

Headlines: American Airlines says bookings still falling, working on more flight cuts
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  is working on more network reductions "in real-time" as it sees booking continuing to decline, President Robert Isom told employees in a letter on Thursday.

Headlines: WHO working to ensure supplies of diagnostics, protective gear - Tedros
Description: The World Health Organization (WHO) is finalizing arrangements for Chinese suppliers to export protective gear for health workers and aims to build a "continuous pipeline", WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said on Thursday.

Headlines: Coronavirus turmoil poses test as Canada's Bombardier sheds assets
Description: Canada's Bombardier Inc  could face its first test as a standalone business jet maker as economic uncertainty linked to the rapid spread of coronavirus crimps demand for new corporate aircraft and has sparked fears of a recession, industry executives and analysts said.

Headlines: U.S. recession chances now at 80% despite Fed emergency moves: Reuters poll
Description: The coronavirus crisis has almost certainly ended the longest U.S. expansion on record and pushed the economy into the start of a short slump, according to analysts polled by Reuters who gave a median 80% chance of recession this year.

Headlines: Coronavirus to have short-lived drastic impact on Armenian economy: minister
Description: The spread of the coronavirus will have a short-lived, drastic impact on Armenia's economy, Economy Minister Tigran Khachatryan said on Thursday.

Headlines: Amazon shuts New York delivery station after worker gets coronavirus
Description: Amazon.com Inc  on Thursday said it was closing a small New York warehouse temporarily after one of its associates tested positive for the coronavirus, a move that highlights the operational risk it faces as the disease spreads.

Headlines: U.N. chief says global recession due to coronavirus 'a near certainty'
Description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned on Thursday that a global recession "is a near certainty" and current national responses to the coronavirus pandemic "will not address the global scale and complexity of the crisis."

Headlines: Coronavirus layoffs push U.S. weekly jobless claims to two-and-a-half-year high
Description: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits surged by the most since 2012 to a 2-1/2-year high last week, as companies in the services sectors laid off workers because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: SoftBank seeks $10 billion for Vision Fund in coronavirus fight
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  is looking to raise an additional $10 billion to help its first Vision Fund support portfolio companies hit by the coronavirus pandemic, Bloomberg reported https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-19/softbank-seeks-10-billion-to-supplement-vision-fund-amid-crisis on Thursday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Factbox: Europeans ask what has EU done for us? Answer: 2.5 trillion euro stimulus
Description: The European Union has responded to the coronavirus, seen by German Chancellor Angela Merkel as the biggest challenge since World War Two, with a wide range of measures to limit the spread of the disease and the resulting economic damage.

Headlines: 'Quadruple witching' may spell some relief to stressed stocks
Description: In calm markets "quadruple witching" usually passes unnoticed, but some market players are hoping this Friday's concurrent quarterly expiration of U.S. options and futures contracts could shake some sense back into stocks.

Headlines: UK's Queen Elizabeth addresses message to nation over virus crisis
Description: Queen Elizabeth said on Thursday that the royal family would play its part as Britain rises to the challenge of overcoming the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Disney says coronavirus could impact consumer behavior
Description: Walt Disney Co  said on Thursday the spread of the coronavirus could lead to consumer behavior changes, further disrupting its business.

Headlines: Government bans Norwegians from traveling to cabins amid coronavirus
Description: Norway on Thursday banned people from going to their country cabins to prevent the spread of coronavirus and lessen the burden on local public services.

Headlines: Fed opens dollar swap lines for nine additional foreign central banks
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve opened the taps on Thursday for central banks in nine additional countries to access dollars in hopes of preventing the coronavirus epidemic from causing a global economic rout.

Headlines: Richmond Fed's Barkin: Fed moving 'aggressively' to ensure market function
Description: The Federal Reserve is "aggressively" addressing problems in financial markets as it sees them arise, but may not be suited to tackle some of the deeper challenges such as funding for small businesses that the coronavirus epidemic is posing, Richmond Federal Reserve president Thomas Barkin said in an interview on Thursday.

Headlines: Greece has registered 464 coronavirus cases, six deaths: health min official
Description: Greece has so far confirmed 464 coronavirus cases and registered six deaths, a health ministry official said on Thursday.

Headlines: Advertisers stare into the coronavirus abyss
Description: The cancellation of major sporting events and the decimation of the luxury, entertainment and travel industries is delivering a hammer blow to a global advertising industry that was already reeling from years of tech-led turmoil.

Headlines: America's money market industry: is it at risk?
Description: Seen as a quintessentially safe bet for many Americans, the $3.8 trillion money-market fund industry is under severe duress for a second time in the past decade as investors weigh the risk of a global economic shutdown.

Headlines: Cambodia reports 10 new cases of coronavirus, bringing total to 47
Description: Cambodia reported 10 new cases of coronavirus on Thursday, raising its tally to 47.

Headlines: British banks grapple with business demands for coronavirus lifelines
Description: Some banks in Britain are struggling to provide financial support to homeowners and businesses battered by the coronavirus pandemic, with demand surging after the government announced a series of aid measures including an emergency lending scheme.

Headlines: Analyst View: Fed opens central bank swap lines to stave off coronavirus slump
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Thursday opened the taps for central banks in nine new countries to access dollars in hopes of preventing the coronavirus epidemic from causing a global economic rout.

Headlines: Russia's Putin, China's Xi discuss coronavirus, agree medical cooperation: Kremlin
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping discussed the coronavirus by phone on Thursday and agreed to deepen cooperation on developing pharmaceuticals, the Kremlin said.

Headlines: France says pressure on Amazon workers 'unacceptable' amid lockdown
Description: Amazon  workers in France are coming under unacceptable pressure, Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Thursday, after staff complained they faced not getting paid if they stopped showing up due to fears of coronavirus contamination.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs employees in New York have contracted the new coronavirus: sources
Description: Several employees at Goldman Sachs Group Inc's  New York headquarters are believed to have contracted the novel coronavirus, according to two sources, making it the latest Wall Street bank whose staff have been affected by the pandemic.

Headlines: Germany expects more than 2 million people to use short-time scheme in 2020
Description: Germany expects a record 2.15 million people to this year make use of a scheme that allows employees to work shorter hours but keep their jobs, as the impact of the coronavirus causes havoc in the labor market, a ministry document seen by Reuters showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Mideast, Africa airlines in crisis as coronavirus stifles demand: IATA
Description: Middle East and African airlines are in crisis with hundreds of thousands of jobs at risk from the coronavirus outbreak, the International Air Transport Association (IATA) said on Thursday, calling for state intervention.

Headlines: Iran's death toll from coronavirus rises to 1,284: official
Description: The new coronavirus is killing one person every 10 minutes in Iran, the health ministry spokesman tweeted on Thursday, as the death toll in the Middle East's worst-affected country climbed to 1,284.

Headlines: Chad confirms first case of coronavirus: government statement
Description: Chad confirmed its first case of coronavirus on Thursday, a Moroccan national who had traveled to the country from Cameroon, the government said in a statement.

Headlines: Investor Ackman tweets to Trump: Close down the country
Description: Billionaire investor William Ackman, who has long worried about risks posed by the coronavirus, called on the Trump administration on Wednesday to seal off the country for 30 days and said stocks would "soar" if such restrictions were imposed.

Headlines: Ukrainian man in wetsuit arrested after smuggling surgical masks into Romania
Description: Border guards have arrested a man in a wetsuit who admitted to smuggling surgical masks across a river from Ukraine into Romania, Ukraine's border guard service said on Thursday.

Headlines: Big Utah cash pool puts brakes on corporate debt that juiced its yields
Description: One of the most aggressive state-run cash pools that regularly trounces the returns of peers and money-market funds with big bets on short-term corporate debt is no longer eager to buy some of the blue-chip names that produce those juicy yields.

Headlines: Billionaire Dalio sees U.S. corporate losses over $4 trillion: CNBC
Description: Ray Dalio, founder of hedge fund Bridgewater Associates LP, said on Thursday corporations in the United States will lose as much as $4 trillion due to the economic damage from coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco to cut refinery runs in April, May to boost oil exports: official
Description: Saudi Aramco will continue reducing operations at its local refineries in April and May to boost the state energy company’s potential to export crude oil, a company official said on Thursday.

Headlines: GE Healthcare to produce ventilators round-the-clock to meet coronavirus-led demand
Description: General Electric's  healthcare unit said on Thursday it will hire more people and increase the number of shifts as it races to produce ventilators round-the-clock to meet the surge in demand caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Dutch confirmed coronavirus cases at 2,460: health authorities
Description: The number of confirmed cases of coronavirus in the Netherlands has risen by 409 to a total of 2,460, Dutch health authorities said in their daily update on Thursday, with 18 new deaths.

Headlines: ASEAN summit in Vietnam postponed until end-June over coronavirus
Description: A summit of Southeast Asian and other international leaders scheduled in Vietnam early next month has been postponed until end-June due to worries about coronavirus, Vietnam's Ministry of Foreign Affairs said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. life insurers impose waiting periods to skirt coronavirus risk
Description: U.S. life insurers are trying to curb their own risks to coronavirus by imposing waiting periods for applicants who have traveled to regions with widespread outbreaks, industry experts said.

Headlines: Boutique shops in central London on the brink as coronavirus kills trade
Description: Horlis Ramirez packed shoes with silk bags into boxes in his empty store in London's West End shopping district, voicing fears that coronavirus could deal a fatal blow to his business.

Headlines: How U.S. aluminum recyclers reap dividends from tariffs
Description: North American aluminum recyclers and producers are using import tariffs to boost revenue at the expense of local beer and beverage firms, even though most of the metal used in their cans is not subject to the levy, industry data seen by Reuters show.

Headlines: Coronavirus border curbs disrupt EU food supplies: industry
Description: Restrictions imposed by some European Union countries at their borders with other member states in response to the coronavirus outbreak are disrupting food supplies, representatives of the industry and farmers said on Thursday.

Headlines: Dutch PM tells citizens to relax, saying there's enough toilet paper for 10 years
Description: The prime minister in the Netherlands has offered reassurances amid the global coronavirus outbreak: telling citizens on Thursday there is no shortage of toilet paper.

Headlines: Exclusive: ECB's Lagarde overruled German and Dutch resistance to 'no-limits' pledge - sources
Description: ECB President Christine Lagarde overruled objections from Germany and the Netherlands to adopt a historic "no-limits" commitment to shore up the region's economy in the face of the coronavirus meltdown, three sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Croatia reports first death of person infected with coronavirus
Description: Croatia registered its first death of a person infected with the coronavirus, the state public health institute said on the official government web page for the crisis.

Headlines: German army on standby to help with coronavirus crisis
Description: The German military is making preparations to help with efforts to tackle the coronavirus crisis should other civil servant organisations become overwhelmed with the outbreak, Defence Minister Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer said on Thursday.

Headlines: American Airlines secures $1 billion credit line to deal with coronavirus crisis
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  has secured a new year-long $1 billion credit line, taking its available liquidity to $8.4 billion, a regulatory filing showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Three people have coronavirus at U.S. mission in Geneva: official
Description: Three people employed by the U.S. diplomatic mission in Geneva have contracted coronavirus, but are in "good condition", a spokesperson told Reuters on Thursday, declining to give specifics.

Headlines: Air France working with government to help repatriate French, European travelers
Description: Air France said on Thursday that it was working closely with the French government to help repatriate French and European nationals abroad who might be stranded as a result of transport link closures prompted by the coronavirus.

Headlines: Credit markets flash red as coronavirus hits corporate America
Description: From airlines and cruise lines to retailers and energy companies, investors are fleeing large pockets of the corporate credit market, worried that the coronavirus pandemic will lead to bankruptcies, defaults and credit rating downgrades.

Headlines: UK says has no plans for travel restrictions or to use military to keep order
Description: The British government has no plans to bring in blanket travel restrictions for London or to close down the capital's transport system, Prime Minister Boris Johnson's spokesman said on Thursday.

Headlines: Banks aim to keep trading floors open in event of any London lockdown
Description: London-based banks plan to keep trading floors open even in the event of a formal lockdown of the British capital, betting that their frontline staff will be treated by authorities as "key workers".

Headlines: Exclusive: China to ramp up spending to revive economy, could cut growth target - sources
Description: China is set to unleash trillions of yuan of fiscal stimulus to revive an economy expected to shrink for the first time in four decades amid the coronavirus pandemic, while a planned growth target is likely to be cut, according to four policy sources.

Headlines: Turkey says it sent 500,000 coronavirus test kits to United States
Description: Turkey has sent 500,000 coronavirus test kits to the United States upon their request, Health Minister Fahrettin Koca said on Thursday.

Headlines: IATA says Middle East airlines need state aid due to liquidity crisis
Description: Governments must urgently consider providing aid to airlines in the Middle East to help them cope with a liquidity crisis due the coronavirus outbreak, the International Air Transport Association (IATA) said on Thursday.

Headlines: Factbox: Airlines ground flights, count mounting costs of the coronavirus shock
Description: Airlines across the globe are feeling the pain as travel demand withers because of the coronavirus outbreak, scrapping flights and ditching financial forecasts.

Headlines: Exclusive: Dubai signs up banks for $9 billion DP World debt deal - sources
Description: Dubai has received commitments from a group of 10 banks for $9 billion in loans to take full control of port operator DP World  and refinance debt of state investment vehicle Dubai World, two sources told Reuters.

Headlines: What you need to know about the coronavirus right now
Description: Here's what you need to know about the coronavirus right now:

Headlines: Google critics see its Firebase tools as another squeeze play
Description: Some app developers say Alphabet Inc's  Google is increasingly pressing them to embed code in their own products that will deepen Google's access to data on consumers, giving the company a leg up on rivals.

Headlines: Dutch test blood donations for unseen coronavirus spread
Description: Dutch health authorities have begun a major project testing blood donation samples to see how many people in the Netherlands may have already had the new coronavirus, often with symptoms so mild they hardly noticed.

Headlines: Airline industry may not survive without state aid: Lufthansa
Description: The airline industry may not survive without state aid if the coronavirus pandemic lasts a long time, Lufthansa  warned on Thursday, predicting it would emerge into a "different world" after the crisis.

Headlines: Coronavirus sees India's biggest airline cut employee pay: internal memo
Description: India's biggest airline IndiGo has cut the salaries of most employees by between 5% and 20% in response to the coronavirus outbreak, which has paralyzed air travel and dented its revenues, an internal memo seen by Reuters said.

Headlines: Harley-Davidson faces proxy fight with investor Impala
Description: (This March 18 story has been refiled to correct extraneous words in first paragraph)

Headlines: Xiaomi says 80% of supply chain operational ahead of 5G phone launch
Description: China's Xiaomi had resumed operations for over 80% of its supply chain as of Thursday in the wake of the country's coronavirus outbreak, the company's president said.

Headlines: Factbox: Carmakers suspend European production over coronavirus
Description: Automakers are halting production at plants across Europe as they grapple with a coronavirus and diving demand.

Headlines: How a Texas oil CEO's luxury land deals cost him his job
Description: In July 2018, oilfield service executive Dale Redman took out a loan to buy the Whitehead Ranch - a 20,000-acre cattle and hunting property in central Texas, featuring two luxury homes, livestock barns, and meadows stocked with deer and turkey.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank expects German economy to contract 4%-5% in 2020
Description: Deutsche Bank slashed its forecast for Germany's economy on the coronavirus fallout, saying it now expected the euro zone's largest economy to contract between 4-5% in 2020 while industrial production could shrink by 10%.

Headlines: Factbox: Global oil, gas producers cut spending after crude price crash
Description: Oil and gas companies aim to cut spending as the impact of the new coronavirus on demand and a push by Saudi Arabia and Russia to ramp up output have hammered oil markets.

Headlines: Qantas to cease international flying, tells majority of workforce to take leave
Description: Qantas Airways Ltd  said on Thursday it will halt all international flights from late March until at least the end of May and is putting two-thirds of its workforce on leave after Australia told citizens not to travel overseas due to the coronavirus.

Headlines: Chile´s Pinera declares 90-day state of catastrophe over coronavirus outbreak
Description: Chilean President Sebastian Pinera on Wednesday declared a 90-day state of catastrophe as cases of the new coronavirus mounted in the nation, giving the government extraordinary powers to restrict freedom of movement and assure food supply and basic services.

Headlines: WHO says testing, tracing must be 'backbone' of COVID-19 response
Description: Countries across the world must take a comprehensive approach to fighting the pandemic of COVID-19 disease caused by the new coronavirus and isolate, test and trace as many cases as possible, the World Health Organization said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Emirates asks pilots and cabin crew to take unpaid leave
Description: Emirates is asking pilots and cabin crew to take unpaid leave and rival Qatar Airways laid off about 200 staff in Doha this week as the coronavirus outbreak hammers demand for travel.

Headlines: GM, Ford in talks with Trump administration on medical equipment production
Description: General Motors Co  and Ford Motor Co  said on Wednesday they were in talks with White House officials about how they could support production of medical equipment like ventilators that may be needed to combat the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: GM, Mercedes to furlough all workers in Brazil, suggesting production stop
Description: General Motors Co  and Mercedes Benz will furlough all employees in Brazil later this month, the companies said on Wednesday, suggesting that production in South America's main auto center will be heavily impacted by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Crypto-market infrastructure creaks amid volatility test
Description: As worries over the economic hit from the coronavirus outbreak spread from stocks, oil and bonds to cryptocurrencies late last week, bitcoin crashed to its worst day in seven years. But plummeting prices weren't the only problem for investors.

Headlines: SoftBank shares close down 17% in biggest one-day fall
Description: Shares of SoftBank Group Corp  closed down 17% on Thursday in their biggest one-day fall, hammered by investor scepticism over the outlook for tech bets, such as office sharing firm WeWork and ridehailer Uber .

Headlines: NYSE to shift fully to e-trading from Monday after two coronavirus cases
Description: The New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) will temporarily close its trading floors and move fully to electronic trading from Monday, its owner Intercontinental Exchange Inc said after an  employee and a trader were tested positive for the coronavirus.

Headlines: Just another trading day: Wild swings and dash for cash trigger selling
Description: Another day of massive swings across asset prices was marked by scant liquidity as investors dashed for cash while systematic strategies triggered automated selling amid rising volatility, market participants said.

Headlines: Boeing-Embraer deal on knife-edge as markets tumble
Description: Brazil has upheld proposals by Boeing Co  to buy the jetmaking arm of Embraer , but plunging markets have raised urgent questions over the fate of the $4.2 billion deal as aviation reels from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: BlackRock stands by climate priorities, sees tougher shareholder votes
Description: BlackRock Inc executives who set the asset manager's influential proxy votes on Tuesday outlined tougher priorities tied to climate change and executive pay for the upcoming corporate annual meeting season taking place amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Tesla to limit workers at California factory with virus lockdown order, county says
Description: Tesla Inc has agreed to reduce the number of active workers at its California vehicle factory, but remains in talks about other measures to comply with a regional lockdown to curb the spread of coronavirus, a county spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Detroit automakers idle U.S. plants to combat coronavirus outbreak
Description: The Detroit Three automakers will shut down their U.S. plants to stop the spread of coronavirus, bowing to pressure from the union representing about 150,000 hourly workers at those facilities, industry officials said.

Headlines: Wall Street slumps again as fears continue to spiral, Dow all but erases 'Trump-bump'
Description: U.S. stocks deepened their selloff on Wednesday and the Dow erased virtually the last of its gains since President Donald Trump's 2017 inauguration, as the widening repercussions of the coronavirus pandemic threatened to cripple economic activity.

Headlines: Dow loses almost all that it gained during Trump's presidency
Description: As Wall Street extended its deep sell-off on Wednesday over fears about the coronavirus, the Dow Jones Industrial Average effectively erased the last of the once sizeable gains it made under U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Nissan will suspend U.S. production through April 6
Description: Nissan Motor Co  said Wednesday it will temporarily suspend production at its U.S. manufacturing to boost containment efforts around the COVID-19 coronavirus.

Headlines: Air Canada to suspend majority of its international, U.S. trans-border flights
Description: Air Canada said on Wednesday it would gradually suspend the majority of its international and U.S. trans-borderflights by March 31 in response to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Japan's MUFG takes big loss on loan to Glencore-led coal port: sources
Description: Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG)  sold off its $85 million loan to Glencore's Wiggins Island Coal Export Terminal (WICET) in Australia to a hedge fund on Wednesday at about 52 cents on the dollar, two sources said.

Headlines: Hugo Boss scraps 2020 outlook, to guard cash flow
Description: German fashion house Hugo Boss  on Wednesday scrapped the outlook it gave for 2020 results less than two weeks ago and took action to protect its cash balance, suspending store renovations and new openings and limiting the inflow of stock.

Headlines: Trump administration wants to send taxpayers $500 billion, $50 billion in loans for airlines
Description: The Trump administration on Wednesday asked Congress to approve $500 billion in cash payments to taxpayers in two rounds that would start April 6 and $50 billion in secured loans to U.S. airlines to address the financial impact of the coronavirus, according to a document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Tesla prepares to reduce staff by 75% at California plant: Bloomberg News
Description: Tesla Inc  is preparing to reduce staffing by about 75% at its lone U.S. assembly plant after initially resisting an order from the local sheriff, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing a county spokesman.

Headlines: Marriott withdraws 2020 outlook as cancellations mount due to coronavirus
Description: U.S. hotel operator Marriott International Inc  said on Wednesday it was withdrawing its 2020 financial outlook as cancellations mount due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Markets tumble as scale of stimulus programs numbs investors
Description: Global equities tumbled further on Wednesday, with bond and gold prices also sliding in an unusual tandem, as markets grappled with the scale of government programs aimed at softening the economic shockwave from the coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. airlines shares plunge after cash-free Washington rescue proposal
Description: Shares in U.S. airlines fell sharply on Wednesday after Washington proposed a rescue package of $50 billion in loans, but no grants as the industry had requested, to help address the financial impact from the deepening coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Jeweler Pandora temporarily closes stores in some countries
Description: Jeweler Pandora A/S  said on Wednesday it has temporarily closed all its physical owned- and operated-stores in Italy, Spain, France, Germany and the United States, among other places, in line with government guidelines amidst the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Shell to suspend construction of Pennsylvania chemical facility
Description: Royal Dutch Shell Plc  will temporarily suspend construction activities on a multi-billion dollar ethane cracker being constructed along the Ohio River in Beaver County, Pennsylvania, amid concerns about coronavirus spreading, the company said in a statement late Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. oil plunges to 18-year low as lockdowns trigger market meltdown
Description: Oil prices plunged on Wednesday, with U.S. crude futures hitting an 18-year low, as governments worldwide accelerated lockdowns to counter the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Factbox: Global oil, gas producers slash spending after crude price rout
Description: Oil and gas companies around the world aim to slash spending as crude prices have plunged due to the impact of the coronavirus and a push by Saudi Arabia and Russia to ramp up output. [O/R]

Headlines: Simon Property to close U.S. malls, retail outlets as coronavirus spreads
Description: Simon Property Group Inc , America's biggest mall operator, said on Wednesday it would temporarily close all its retail properties, including the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, to tackle the fast-spreading coronavirus.

Headlines: UK faces 'massive shortage' of ventilators - Swiss manufacturer
Description: Britain faces a "massive shortage" of ventilators that will be needed to treat critically ill patients suffering from coronavirus, after it failed to invest enough in intensive care equipment, a leading ventilator manufacturer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. may give banks bonus points for low-income lending amid coronavirus crisis - source
Description: U.S. regulators are considering giving banks additional regulatory points for lending to mid- to low-income Americans hurt by the coronavirus, as they seek to mitigate the economic impact of the pandemic, an official within a banking agency told Reuters.

Headlines: Government borrowing costs jump as virus-related support costs climb
Description: Borrowing costs in the United States, euro zone, Britain and Japan surged on Wednesday after two days in which governments across the globe announced trillions of dollars of spending to support locked-down economies frozen by the coronavirus.

Headlines: Japan's Sharp sues Tesla for patent infringement over network gear: source
Description: Sharp Corp has filed a patent infringement lawsuit against the Japanese unit of Tesla Inc, seeking an injunction to halt imports of some electric vehicles (EV) to Japan, a source familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Boeing calls for $60 billion lifeline for U.S. aerospace industry
Description: Boeing Co on Tuesday called for a $60 billion lifeline for the struggling U.S. aerospace manufacturing industry, which faces huge losses from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Brazil's antitrust watchdog again approves Boeing-Embraer deal
Description: Brazil's antitrust watchdog on Wednesday dismissed allegations against a proposed takeover by Boeing Co  of Embraer SA's  commercial plane division, maintaining its approval of the deal.

Headlines: Delta parks 600 jets and scales back flights as revenue tanks
Description: Delta Air Lines  said on Wednesday it was parking more than 600 jets, cutting corporate pay by as much as 50%, and scaling back its flying by more than 70% until demand begins to recover from the coronavirus epidemic hit.

Headlines: Audi says will temporarily suspend Mexican car production due to coronavirus
Description: German carmaker Audi AG  said on Wednesday that it will suspend production at its plant in Mexico's Puebla state from March 23 through April 13 as the coronavirus hits global supply chains.

Headlines: Textron Aviation furloughs thousands of U.S workers
Description: Textron Aviation, a unit of Textron Inc , announced furloughs for most of its U.S.-based workforce on Wednesday as concerns over depressed demand due to the spreading coronavirus ripples through global aviation.

Headlines: S&P 500 earnings expected to decline 0.2% in first quarter from year earlier
Description: S&P 500 companies'  earnings are expected to decline in the first quarter from the year-earlier period, reversing a forecast for profit gains, according to IBES data from Refinitiv, as companies face the toll from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: French Amazon workers protest in coronavirus pushback
Description: Several hundred Amazon workers protested in France on Wednesday, calling on the online retailer to cease operations or make it easier for employees not wanting to work during the coronavirus outbreak to stay away.

Headlines: Zara owner offers to make scrubs for Spain's coronavirus-stretched hospitals
Description: Zara owner Inditex, whose polka dot dress was a high-street sensation in 2019, may soon be stitching hospital scrubs, helping its home country Spain fight the coronavirus epidemic, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: BAT says no material impact yet from COVID-19 outbreak
Description: British American Tobacco , the world's No.2 tobacco maker, said on Wednesday the coronavirus outbreak has not had any material impact on it as consumers continue to make purchases even in harder hit countries.

Headlines: Factbox: Carmakers suspend European production in face of coronavirus crisis
Description: Automakers are halting production at plants across Europe as they grapple with coronavirus and diving demand.

Headlines: France to consult Dutch over Air France support: finance minister
Description: The French government will consult with its Dutch counterpart before making any decision over support for Air France, the French subsidiary of Air France-KLM , Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Governments scramble to prop up airlines as virus forces more flight, job cuts
Description: Australia and Taiwan joined governments offering financial aid to airlines, while authorities in Europe rushed on Wednesday to agree steps to rescue carriers which have had to park planes and cut jobs as the coronavirus puts the brake on travel.

Headlines: FedEx suspends 2020 profit outlook; coronavirus and turnaround pressure weigh
Description: U.S. package delivery company FedEx Corp  suspended its 2020 profit outlook on Tuesday, citing the "significant impact" of the coronavirus, and said it would cut costs due to the uncertainty wrought by the pandemic.

Headlines: Southwest cancels more than 50 flights after Chicago Midway tower closes
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  said Wednesday it is canceling more than 50 flights after the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) extended the shutdown of the air traffic control tower at Chicago Midway International Airport following reported coronavirus cases.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp considers production cuts as coronavirus spreads
Description: Thyssenkrupp , a major supplier to the automotive industry, on Wednesday said it was considering shortened working hours as carmarkers reduce or suspend production due to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Goldman tells most staff in Americas, EMEA to work from home
Description: Goldman Sachs  said it has instructed most of its staff in the Americas, Europe, the Middle East and Africa to work from home from Wednesday until further notice, according to an internal notice the bank posted on its website late on Tuesday.

Headlines: EU underscores desire to settle aircraft subsidy issue with U.S
Description: The European Union on Wednesday emphasized its desire to negotiate an end to a longstanding dispute with the United States over aircraft subsidies even as Washington raised duties on Airbus  aircraft by 50%.

Headlines: Renault and PSA can benefit from French coronavirus measures: finance ministry
Description: French carmakers PSA  and Renault  are entitled to benefit from all measures put in place to fight the economic impact of the coronavirus outbreak, France's Finance Ministry told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Brazil's big privatizations, the latest coronavirus victim
Description: As Brazil's stock market hit record highs in January, Economy Minister Paulo Guedes said the country could raise up to 150 billion reais ($30 billion) with sales of state-owned companies through share offerings, mergers and acquisitions.

Headlines: AT&T closing 40% of company owned retail stores, cutting hours
Description: AT&T Inc  said Wednesday it will close 40% of its U.S-company owned retail stores nationwide as a result of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Blindsided by bear market, stock-pickers struggle to stay relevant
Description: The carnage in stock markets is getting uglier by the day. Should you "buy", "sell" or "hold" on tight?

Headlines: U.S housing market shows strength before coronavirus outbreak
Description: U.S. homebuilding fell less than expected in February as a plunge in the construction of multi-family housing units was blunted by a surge in single-family projects, suggesting some strength in the housing sector before the coronavirus pandemic severely disrupted economic activity.

Headlines: Belgian government holds talks with airline and travel sectors
Description: The Belgian government held talks with representatives from the country's airline and travel industries on Wednesday as they seek state support to help with their fight for survival in the face of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: UK paves way for multi-billion pound bailout of airlines: Times
Description: The British government is paving the way for a multi-billion pound bailout of airlines by lifting a cap on level of financial support it can provide, the Times newspaper reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Factbox: Airlines count mounting costs of the coronavirus shock
Description: Airlines across the globe are feeling the pain as travel demand withers because of the coronavirus outbreak, scrapping flights and ditching financial forecasts.

Headlines: As China's coronavirus outbreak eases, a wary return to shops for consumers
Description: As shops shut their doors across Europe and the United States, in China the sharp drop in new coronavirus cases has encouraged consumers to venture back into malls and restaurants - for the most part quite gingerly but occasionally in throngs.

Headlines: Apple brings back 'scissor' keyboards in latest MacBook Air
Description: Apple Inc  launched an updated version of its MacBook Air on Wednesday, modifying keyboards on its laptop line that have faced criticism for typing-related problems.

Headlines: Honda will halt all North American production for six days
Description: Honda Motor Co  said Wednesday it is temporarily halting production in North America for six days because of the anticipated decline in auto sales due to the coronavirus outbreak and will reduce production by about 40,000 vehicles.

Headlines: JPMorgan commits $50 million to businesses, people affected by coronavirus
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  said on Wednesday that it committed $50 million to funds and community groups that are providing food, support and medical supplies for people hurt by the coronavirus in the United States, Europe and Asia.

Headlines: Exclusive: HSBC CEO Quinn faces strategy rethink as coronavirus bites - source
Description: One of Noel Quinn's first jobs as chief executive of HSBC  will be to review the radical revamp he unveiled last month as interim boss, a senior source at the bank said.

Headlines: Ryanair to ground most if not all flights from March 24
Description: Ryanair expects to ground most if not all of its flights from March 24 except a very small number mostly between Britain and Ireland to maintain essential connectivity, the airline said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Toymaker Lego shuts all stores outside of China due to virus
Description: Danish toymaker Lego said on Wednesday it would close all of its stores, except for those in China, until at least March 27 due to the spread of coronavirus.
