Headlines: Fiat again halts Atessa, its only functioning assembly site in Europe
Description: Fiat Chrysler  has again halted its Atessa plant in Italy due to disruptions in parts supply linked to the coronavirus outbreak, after it was reopened on Tuesday, a union representative said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Nissan to stop producing cars in Indonesia as part of reorganization plan
Description: Nissan Motor Co  said on Wednesday it would stop producing vehicles in Indonesia, consolidating its global production in the face of falling sales which have pummeled its profitability.

Headlines: IKEA closes all U.S. stores, China back up except for Wuhan store
Description: IKEA, the world's biggest furniture brand, is temporarily closing more stores as the coronavirus spreads, including all 50 in its second-biggest market the United States.

Headlines: Chinese EV maker Nio raises doubts about its future
Description: Cash-strapped Chinese electric vehicle (EV) maker Nio Inc  said on Wednesday there was substantial doubt in its ability to continue as a going concern, sending its shares down 12% in premarket U.S. trading.

Headlines: Rolls-Royce motor cars suspend production in UK over coronavirus
Description: Rolls-Royce motor cars said it would suspend production at its British plant for two weeks to ensure the health of its employees.

Headlines: EasyJet launches winter sale in coronavirus rebooking push
Description: EasyJet  launched an early sale on cut-price winter 2020-21 flights, even as the airline industry heads into a deepening coronavirus crisis that threatens to ground most of the British low-cost carrier's planes.

Headlines: Israel's Hapoalim will pay $870 million to end U.S. tax probe
Description: Israel's biggest bank, Hapoalim,  said on Wednesday it expects to pay $870 million to settle a U.S. tax evasion investigation.

Headlines: Japanese automakers close more plants in Europe, Asia due to virus
Description: Japanese automakers on Wednesday said they would temporarily close more vehicle plants in Europe and Asia as the spread of the coronavirus prompts countries to instruct non-essential businesses to suspend operations.

Headlines: Impact of virus turmoil would hit Deutsche Bank later this year, not in first-quarter: executive
Description: The impact of the current turmoil related to the coronavirus is more likely to affect Deutsche Bank  later this year rather than in the first quarter, an executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Chairman of Santander's Portuguese unit dies from coronavirus
Description: The chairman of the Portuguese unit of Spain's largest bank, Santander, Antonio Vieira Monteiro, died from the coronavirus on Wednesday, the second victim of the disease in Portugal, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Factbox: Oil products markets in turmoil as coronavirus infects demand
Description: The oil products markets globally are caught between a rock and a hard place as the impact of ultra cheap oil, which should be a boon for refiners, is mitigated by record low prices for gasoline and jet fuel.

Headlines: German retailers plead for state aid as stores close
Description: Germany's HDE retail association called on Wednesday for the government to give immediate state aid and tax relief to stop businesses going bust as stores closed to stem the spread of the coronavirus, losing 7 billion euros ($7.70 billion) per week.

Headlines: UBS weathers coronavirus ramp-up with low losses: CFO
Description: Swiss bank UBS  has seen relatively low losses in its lending portfolio and feels comfortable with its liquidity despite market drops amidst the coronavirus pandemic, Chief Financial Officer Kirt Gardner said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Unions urge Airbus to extend output freeze due to virus fears
Description: French unions are urging Airbus  to keep its French factories closed beyond March 23, when it plans to resume production after a four-day shutdown, raising questions over the knock-on impact on plants elsewhere in Europe.

Headlines: Fujifilm shares jump 15% on China coronavirus drug trial boost
Description: Shares in Japan's Fujifilm Holdings Corp  surged 15% on Wednesday after a Chinese official said an active ingredient of the company's Avigan anti-flu drug appeared to help coronavirus patients recover.

Headlines: Barclays says it is 'very unlikely' to meet profit goal amid virus outbreak
Description: Barclays  is 'very very unlikely' to meet its goal of a 10% return on equity this year given the impact on its business of the coronavirus pandemic, its Chief Financial Officer Tushar Morzaria said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Coronavirus empties airlines' cash drawers, knocks $157 billion off share values
Description: Global airlines are fast running out of cash after cutting capacity by 90% or even grounding entire fleets due to the broad travel restrictions to contain the spread of the coronavirus, calling into question the survival of several firms.

Headlines: SoftBank Group's market cap dips below domestic telco as scepticism grows
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  shares fell as much as 11.6% on Wednesday, with its market capitalization dipping below the value of its domestic telco, as uncertainty grows over its management of a portfolio of unproven startups.

Headlines: Tesla plant can't run normally in coronavirus shutdown: California county
Description: Tesla Inc  cannot continue to operate its main U.S. vehicle plant normally as its San Francisco Bay Area home began a three-week lockdown on Tuesday to slow the spread of coronavirus, a county sheriff's office spokesman said.

Headlines: HSBC appoints insider Quinn as CEO amid growth headwinds
Description: HSBC Holdings PLC  has appointed Noel Quinn as chief executive officer, handing the insider and interim boss the reins of Europe's biggest bank and ending months of speculation an external candidate could get the role.

Headlines: U.S. airlines, saying it will take a 'long time' to recover, try to quickly reduce workforce
Description: U.S. airlines are seeking to quickly reduce their workforces through early retirement packages or unpaid leave of up to 12 months with medical benefits in an effort to cut costs as the rapid spread of the coronavirus keeps people from flying.

Headlines: Detroit automakers, UAW agree to curb production to contain coronavirus
Description: The Detroit Three automakers and United Auto Workers agreed on Tuesday to curtail production at U.S. factories and limit the number of workers on the job at one time to prevent the spread of the coronavirus among roughly 150,000 factory employees.

Headlines: United Airlines further cuts April domestic, international schedules
Description: United Airlines  on Tuesday announced a 60% schedule reduction in April, citing the impact of the coronavirus pandemic on travel demand.

Headlines: U.S. regulator proposes path for non-banks to gain deposit license
Description: A U.S. banking regulator proposed a set of standards Tuesday for how it would consider special charters to allow non-banks to accept deposits and engage in other limited banking activities.

Headlines: World Bank adds $2 billion to funds available for coronavirus response
Description: The World Bank on Tuesday said it had increased to $14 billion the amount of fast-track financing available to members to respond to the global coronavirus pandemic, adding $2 billion to an initial package announced on March 3.

Headlines: Latam carriers see 'bankruptcy pandemic' risk, Chile opposes bailout
Description: Latin American airlines need prompt government aid or many of them could go out of business as the global coronavirus outbreak forces widespread flight cancellations, the chief of regional airline association ALTA said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exxon pays more to borrow amid market turmoil
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp  paid a big premium to raise $8.5 billion in new debt on Tuesday, as a rout in energy prices and stock market jitters fueled by the coronavirus outbreak eroded investor confidence in the largest U.S. oil producer.

Headlines: SoftBank lays ground to abandon $3 billion WeWork tender offer: sources
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  is considering pulling out of a $3 billion bid to buy additional shares in WeWork, because it feels the office-space sharing firm has not met the conditions for the deal, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Credit Suisse sharply cuts Mexico's 2020 GDP, sees economy shrinking by 4%
Description: Credit Suisse sharply lowered its forecast for Mexico's economic performance this year and now expects a 4.0% contraction, according to a note sent to the bank's clients on Tuesday, adding to a series of downgrades since the coronavirus spread.

Headlines: California county says Tesla factory cannot operate normally in coronavirus shutdown
Description: Tesla Inc  cannot operate its main U.S. vehicle factory normally as the San Francisco Bay Area has begun a three-week lockdown to rein in the spread of coronavirus, a spokesman for the county's sheriff's office said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Amazon warehouses receive only vital supplies in U.S., Europe amid coronavirus
Description: Amazon.com Inc  will only receive vital supplies at its U.S. and UK and other European warehouses until April 5, its latest move to free up inventory space for medical and household goods in high demand as a result of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: H&M closes all stores in biggest markets Germany and the United States
Description: H&M  is temporarily closing all its 460 stores in Germany, its number one market for sales, and all 590 in its second largest market the United States, due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: UK's Sainsbury's to limit customer purchases, close cafes to get through coronavirus
Description: British supermarket group Sainsbury's  is to restrict customer purchases to combat panic buying, close its in-store cafes and counters and beef-up online services to get it through the coronavirus crisis, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Adidas joins Nike in announcing store closures over coronavirus
Description: German sportswear maker Adidas  on Tuesday joined rivals in announcing store closures in response to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Tiffany & Co to temporarily shut several stores, cuts hours at others
Description: Luxury jeweler Tiffany & Co  said on Tuesday it would temporarily close several stores, including its Fifth Avenue flagship store in New York, and reduce working hours at other outlets, in an effort to contain the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: More than 4,500 Delta flight attendants request unpaid leave in April: document
Description: Delta Air Lines  has received over 4,500 requests from flight attendants for voluntary unpaid leave in April, according to a March 14 paper seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Fed moves to backstop funding for U.S. companies as coronavirus fallout spreads
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve moved Tuesday to ensure the flow of credit to U.S. companies, banks and even local governments amid a nationwide scramble for ways to blunt the economic fallout from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Fed officials flag possible further steps in Fed crisis response
Description: Federal Reserve officials are deliberating over next steps in their response to the fallout from the coronavirus epidemic, with some urging a broad debate about how the central bank might help small and medium-sized businesses, policymakers said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wall Street jumps after Monday's historic sell-off as Fed boosts liquidity to fight coronavirus effect
Description: The S&P 500 rose 6% on Tuesday, clawing back a significant portion of Monday's steep losses, as the Federal Reserve and the White House took further steps to boost liquidity and stem damage from the coronavirus outbreak that has gripped the global economy.

Headlines: Fed's short-term corporate funding plan boosts stocks, gold, dollar
Description: Gold, the dollar and global equity markets rose on Tuesday after the Federal Reserve said it would buy short-term corporate debt directly from companies to help relieve credit markets under strain from the economic impact of the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Trump pushes Congress for new coronavirus spending as Senate mulls second emergency bill
Description: Than U.S. President Donald Trump's administration pushed lawmakers to send money directly to Americans to counter the economic toll of the coronavirus outbreak, as the Senate weighed a multibillion-dollar emergency bill passed by the House of Representatives.

Headlines: Peru miners halt operations to slow coronavirus spread; Chile braces for impact
Description: Miners shuttered or wound down operations in Peru on Tuesday and were girding for extended supply chain disruptions in neighboring Chile as governments tightened restrictions to try to slow the spread of the coronavirus in the resource-rich region.

Headlines: Democrats agree on 'big immediate action' to back U.S. airline industry
Description: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi told the CEOs of U.S. airlines on Tuesday that Democrats agree on the need for "big immediate action" to boost the sagging U.S. aviation industry but have not reached agreement on what a bailout would look like.

Headlines: Fed extends loan offer to primary dealers in further credit easing
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve moved again late on Tuesday to broaden the flow of credit in response to the coronavirus epidemic, saying it would offer short-term loans to the two dozen Wall Street primary dealers who are important conduits for the sale of a broad range of bonds and other financial assets.

Headlines: Virgin Australia to suspend all international flying as coronavirus sinks demand
Description: Virgin Australia Holdings Ltd  said on Wednesday it would suspend all international flying from March 30 to June 14 and cut its domestic capacity in half because of government travel restrictions and lower demand because of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Factbox: Stock exchanges revise trading rules, circuit breakers as volatility surges
Description: As the coronavirus outbreak and global growth worries cause global stock markets to sink, stock exchanges are tweaking trading rules to protect their markets from intense volatility and speculative trading.

Headlines: Exclusive: Impossible Foods explores credit line to tackle coronavirus fallout - sources
Description: Impossible Foods is discussing a new credit line worth several hundred million dollars with its lenders, as the plant-based meat company braces for the economic fallout of the coronavirus outbreak, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Coronavirus-stricken airlines call for state aid to avert ruin
Description: Airlines demanded urgent tax relief to avoid multiple bankruptcies as coronavirus disruption continued its spread across the global industry on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wall Street gives thumbs down to potential shortened trading day
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin's suggestion on Tuesday that the country's stock exchanges might shorten their trading hours did not go over well with investors reeling from Wall Street's recent plunge sparked by growing fears about the coronavirus.

Headlines: Key U.S. business group opposes shutting U.S. stock trading, short-selling bans
Description: Shutting down the U.S. stock market would be "exactly the wrong thing to do" by depriving businesses and investors of capital just when they need it most, a U.S. Chamber of Commerce official said on Tuesday, adding that the group also opposes any ban on short selling.

Headlines: Wall Street gives thumbs down to potential shortened trading day
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin's suggestion on Tuesday that the country's stock exchanges might shorten their trading hours did not go over well with investors reeling from Wall Street's recent plunge sparked by growing fears about the coronavirus.

Headlines: Key U.S. business group opposes shutting U.S. stock trading, short-selling bans
Description: Shutting down the U.S. stock market would be "exactly the wrong thing to do" by depriving businesses and investors of capital just when they need it most, a U.S. Chamber of Commerce official said on Tuesday, adding that the group also opposes any ban on short selling.

Headlines: Brent crude sinks below $30 a barrel as recession fears weigh
Description: Crude oil prices settled below $30 a barrel on Tuesday as the coronavirus pandemic slowed economic growth and oil demand while Saudi Arabia and Russia kept up their battle for market share.

Headlines: Fed's George says standing by to lend in 'this extraordinary time'
Description: Kansas City Federal Reserve President Esther George said on Tuesday that the regional Fed bank continues to carry on with its key functions, and is ready to extend credit when needed through the U.S. central bank's emergency lending window.

Headlines: Target reduces store hours to restock, clean amid virus outbreak
Description: Target Corp  said on Tuesday it would reduce store hours for cleaning and restocking, as more consumers shop at its outlets for essentials amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Fed's Harker says central bank works to keep markets liquid amid coronavirus 'black swan' shock
Description: Philadelphia Federal Reserve Bank President Patrick Harker said on Tuesday the global economy is reeling from the shock caused by the coronavirus, and that central bankers need to do what they can to stimulate the economy and keep markets functioning.

Headlines: McDonald's, Starbucks limit dine-in service in U.S. to slow coronavirus
Description: McDonald's Corp  and Starbucks Corp  have decided to close dine-in areas at many U.S. stores and shifted to take-away and delivery services, even as major cities ordered restaurants and bars closed to stop spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Stay-at-home stocks soar as Wall Street rebounds
Description: Speculative stocks that stand to benefit from social distancing during the coronavirus pandemic soared on Tuesday, lifted by a broad rebound market following Wall Street's worst day in three decades.

Headlines: Macy's, Hudson's Bay to temporarily close U.S. stores due to virus outbreak
Description: Department store operators Macy's Inc  and Hudson's Bay decided on Tuesday to temporarily close all its stores in the United States due to the coronavirus pandemic, but said their e-commerce sites would continue to operate.

Headlines: Norwegian Air asks for similar help to regional rival SAS
Description: Struggling Norwegian Air  needs government support similar to that which SAS  received from the Danish and Swedish governments if it is to protect jobs in Norway as demand is strangled by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Explainer: How your bank deposits are (and aren't) protected
Description: In the United States and many other countries, the government guarantees a certain amount of each customer's deposits in the event of a bank failure, to protect both consumers and the broader financial system.

Headlines: Most British companies not insured for coronavirus closures: industry body
Description: Most companies in Britain don't have insurance cover for closures caused by the coronavirus outbreak, the Association of British Insurers said on Tuesday.

Headlines: UK launches coronavirus lending scheme for business
Description: The Bank of England and Britain's finance ministry launched a scheme on Tuesday to purchase debt known as commercial paper issued by companies hit by the coronavirus.

Headlines: Explainer - How your bank deposits are (and aren't) protected
Description: In the United States and many other countries, the government guarantees a certain amount of each customer's deposits in the event of a bank failure, to protect both consumers and the broader financial system.

Headlines: 'Single biggest shock': Aviation battles coronavirus cash crunch
Description: Boeing and other U.S. aviation companies are seeking billions of dollars in aid as they battle to survive a plunge in demand caused by the coronavirus pandemic, while Airbus is pausing production at two sites to bolster health and safety measures.

Headlines: Factbox: Airlines count mounting costs of the coronavirus shock
Description: Airlines across the globe are feeling the pain as travel demand withers because of the coronavirus outbreak. Several have scrapped flights and ditched financial forecasts.

Headlines: Brazil airline Gol to suspend all international flights March 23-June 30
Description: Brazilian airline Gol  said in a statement on Tuesday that it is suspending all international flights from March 23 to June 30.

Headlines: Airbus suspends production in France and Spain, shares slide
Description: Airbus  announced plans to halt operations at its plants in France and Spain for four days as the coronavirus crisis spread from battered airlines to the manufacturing sector.

Headlines: Tiffany to temporarily close several stores, cuts hours at others
Description: Luxury jeweler Tiffany & Co  said on Tuesday it would temporarily close several stores, including its Fifth Avenue flagship store in New York, and reduce working hours at other outlets, in an effort to contain the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Wells Fargo implements work-from-home policy amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  said on Tuesday it is implementing work-from-home policies for most of its employees who don't interact with customers and can effectively work remotely, in response to the quickly-spreading coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Tiffany to temporarily close several stores, cuts hours at others
Description: Luxury jeweler Tiffany & Co  said on Tuesday it would temporarily close several stores, including its Fifth Avenue flagship store in New York, and reduce working hours at other outlets, in an effort to contain the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Wells Fargo implements work-from-home policy amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  said on Tuesday it is implementing work-from-home policies for most of its employees who don't interact with customers and can effectively work remotely, in response to the quickly-spreading coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Boeing shares plunge 22% to six-year low on S&P downgrade
Description: Boeing Co  shares tumbled as much as 22% to a more-than-six-year low on Tuesday following a rating downgrade that reflected its worsening cash flow due to the extended grounding of its 737 MAX jet and the blow from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. government will provide assistance to Boeing
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said the government would provide financial assistance to Boeing Co  as the entire aviation sector faces economic turmoil over the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Can networks cope with millions working from home? So far, yes
Description: Some European telecoms operators reported connectivity problems on Tuesday as millions of people logged on for work at home due to the coronavirus pandemic, driving up data traffic by as much as 30% and testing networks.

Headlines: Jaguar plans to keep making cars at UK plants until at least end of week
Description: Britain's biggest automaker Jaguar Land Rover  plans to keep making vehicles at its domestic factories until at least the end of the week despite the impact from coronavirus which has shut many other car plants.

Headlines: United Auto Workers union sought two-week U.S. auto plant shutdown over coronavirus
Description: The United Auto Workers said Tuesday it had asked Detroit's Big Three workers to shutdown all U.S. plants for two weeks in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. retail sales post biggest drop in a year; coronavirus drag coming
Description: U.S. retail sales fell by the most in more than a year in February and the coronavirus pandemic is expected to depress sales in the months ahead, which could strengthen economists' expectations of a consumer-led recession by the second quarter.

Headlines: Factbox: Retailers close stores around globe to curb coronavirus spread
Description: Retailers have been closing stores around the globe to reduce the risk of transmission of the coronavirus, which has killed over 6,500 people and infected more than 174,000 while disrupting supply and production chains.

Headlines: Another black Monday as coronavirus response upends Wall Street
Description: Wall Street suffered its biggest drop since the crash of 1987 on Monday after unprecedented steps taken by the Federal Reserve, lawmakers and the White House to slow the spread and blunt the economic hit of the coronavirus failed to restore order to markets.

Headlines: U.S. markets should stay open despite turmoil, says securities regulator
Description: U.S. markets should stay open despite intense volatility, the head of the U.S. securities regulator said on Monday, quashing industry speculation that the government might shut down the country's exchanges to stop a plunge in stock prices.

Headlines: German coronavirus vaccine developer CureVac denies any U.S. bid
Description: CureVac, the German biotech firm at the center of a row over alleged U.S. attempts to gain access to an experimental coronavirus vaccine it is developing, denied on Tuesday it had received U.S. offers for the company or its assets.

Headlines: Daimler suspends most of its production in Europe
Description: Daimler , which owns the Mercedes-Benz luxury car brand, on Tuesday said it will suspend most of its production in Europe for two weeks in an effort to contain the spread of the new coronavirus.

Headlines: UK working with airlines to offer support: minister
Description: British foreign minister Dominic Raab said on Tuesday the government was working with airlines to come up with the ways to support an industry badly hurt by travel restrictions put in place to combat a growing outbreak of coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. Fed revives commercial paper facility to boost lending
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve said on Tuesday it would reinstate a funding facility used during the 2008 financial crisis to get credit directly to businesses and households as fears over a liquidity crunch due to the coronavirus have grown in recent days.

Headlines: Swedish IKEA store finds 50,000 forgotten face masks, gives them to local hospital
Description: Staff at an IKEA furniture store on Sweden's west coast stumbled across a pile of around 50,000 face masks gathering dust in a warehouse and donated them to a nearby hospital this weekend.

Headlines: American Express sees hit to spending volumes from coronavirus
Description: American Express  said http://pdf.reuters.com/htmlnews/htmlnews.asp?i=43059c3bf0e37541&u=urn:newsml:reuters.com:20200317:nBwbFGJpRa on Tuesday spending volumes fell at the end of February and well into March as the coronavirus pandemic wreaks havoc on consumer spending, leading it to forecast low-single-digit percentage revenue growth for the first quarter.

Headlines: Global airlines need up to $200 billion of state support: IATA
Description: Global airlines need to up to $200 billion of government support to help them survive the coronavirus crisis, the International Air Transport Association said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Airbus signals government help needed if crisis lasts months - sources
Description: Europe's Airbus  has signaled that some government support may be needed if the coronavirus crisis lasts for several months, three people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Nissan stops production at UK factory over coronavirus impact
Description: Nissan has stopped output at Britain's biggest car factory due to the impact from coronavirus as it assesses supply-chain disruption and the drop in demand, the most significant closure to affect the country's autos sector so far from the outbreak.

Headlines: Facebook to award $100 mln in cash grants, ad credits to small businesses
Description: Facebook Inc said Tuesday it plans to award $100 million in cash grants and ad credits for up to 30,000 small businesses in over 30 countries to address the economic impact of the  coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: 'D' word rears head as coronavirus-hit markets brace for recession
Description: The coronavirus shockwaves rippling through U.S. stocks are forcing investors to contemplate outcomes more dire than a recession, including several quarters of declining economic activity, a credit crisis or even a depression.

Headlines: Boeing in talks for short-term U.S. government assistance
Description: (The March 16 story clarifies that part of paragraph 14 came from source familiar, not company email)

Headlines: U.S. job openings rebound; labor market strong before coronavirus outbreak
Description: U.S. job openings rebounded in January after two straight monthly declines, but signs of strength in the labor market at the start of the year have been overshadowed by the coronavirus pandemic, which has severely disrupted economic activity.

Headlines: Ford suspends production at two German plants - source
Description: Carmaker Ford  is suspending production at its plants in the western German cities of Cologne and Saarlouis due to the coronavirus epidemic, a source told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. business inventories slip in January
Description: U.S. business inventories fell as expected in January, suggesting that any lift to gross domestic product in the first quarter from a shrinking trade deficit was likely to be offset by a slow pace of inventory accumulation.

Headlines: Amazon to hire 100,000 workers as online orders surge on coronavirus worries
Description: Amazon.com Inc  on Monday said it would hire 100,000 warehouse and delivery workers in the United States to deal with a surge in online orders, as many consumers have turned to the web to meet their needs during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: McDonald's considering deferring rent for franchisees amid virus outbreak
Description: McDonald's Corp  is considering rent deferral and other measures to ensure liquidity at its franchisees around the world, amid curbs on dine-in restaurants to contain the spread of the coronavirus, a regulatory filing showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: VW to start using high-nickel batteries for electric car
Description: Volkswagen  will raise the amount of nickel used in it electric car battery cells to 80% in the next year from 65% at present, Frank Blome, head of battery cells at the carmaker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: StanChart expects record fall in global oil demand in 2020
Description: Standard Chartered on Tuesday said it expects global oil demand to decline by a record amount in 2020 citing the rapidly spreading coronavirus and the travel restrictions imposed to contain it.

Headlines: European airlines plead for rescue package as coronavirus crisis intensifies
Description: European airlines on Tuesday called on governments to draw up a package of measures including deferring taxes to rescue the struggling industry as the crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic deepens.

Headlines: Southwest suspends beverage, snack service on short flights
Description: (This March 16 story corrects spelling error in headline and first paragraph)

Headlines: Ventas sees slowdown in move-ins to senior centers amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: Ventas Inc  said on Tuesday it was experiencing a slowdown in move-ins at its senior housing business and withdrew its 2020 financial forecasts, as the coronavirus pandemic raises the risk of tenants moving out.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler's only open Italian plant running at reduced capacity
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA) has resumed limited production at its Atessa facility in Italy, the automaker's only open assembly plant, having halted operations at most of its European factories, a spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Volkswagen says diesel scandal has cost it 31.3 billion euros
Description: Volkswagen  said its diesel cheating scandal has cost it 31.3 billion euros ($34.69 bln) in fines and settlements, and the German carmaker expects cash outflows to continue until 2021, adding that these have already been provisioned for.

Headlines: Volkswagen suspends production as coronavirus hits sales
Description: Volkswagen Group , the world's biggest carmaker, is suspending production at factories across Europe as the coronavirus pandemic hits sales and disrupts supply chains, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: L Brands temporarily closes stores, draws down $950 million from existing credit line
Description: L Brands Inc  said on Tuesday it would temporarily close all its stores, including those of Bath & Body Works and Victoria's Secret, in the United States and Canada through March 29 and that it has drawn down $950 million from an existing credit line due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: China's JD.com to buy back $2 billion shares
Description: China's JD.com Inc  said on Tuesday it would buy back up to $2 billion of its shares, after the e-commerce company estimated a growth in sales in the current quarter that has been ravaged by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Glencore charters world largest tanker to store crude at sea: sources
Description: Trading house Glencore  has chartered the 3 million barrel crude carrier 'Europe' to store oil at sea for at least 6 months, trading sources on Tuesday.

Headlines: Abu Dhabi's Etihad adds cargo flights as coronavirus batters passenger demand
Description: Abu Dhabi's Etihad Airways said on Tuesday it was expanding its cargo network to markets where passenger operations have decreased due to the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Russian airlines could lose $1.4 billion due to coronavirus: Ifax cites aviation agency
Description: Russia's airlines could lose 100 billion roubles ($1.4 billion) due to the coronavirus outbreak and risk going bankrupt, the head of Russia's Federal Air Transport Agency, also known as Rosaviatsiya, told the Interfax news agency.

Headlines: Singapore Airlines to cut capacity further as coronavirus weighs
Description: Singapore Airlines on Tuesday said it would cut capacity further as border controls are enforced across the world in a bid to curb the spread of the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: British Airways due to make pilot redundancies: union
Description: British Airways is due to make an unspecified number of pilots redundant according to UK pilot union BALPA, as the airline seeks to reduce its costs to try survive the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Coronavirus pushes China to show mercy rather than pursue companies in court
Description: Fearful of causing further harm to an economy laid low by the coronavirus epidemic, authorities in China have become a lot more lenient dealing with entrepreneurs breaking the law.

Headlines: Audi's Hungarian plant to halt production on Monday
Description: Volkswagen Group's  Audi brand will halt output at its plant in Hungary on Monday, the factory said, after Volkswagen announced a suspension of production at plants in Italy, Portugal, Slovakia and Spain.

Headlines: Lufthansa preparing 'air bridge' to supply Germany through epidemic
Description: Germany's largest airline, Lufthansa , is working with the government to prepare an "air bridge" to ensure that necessary goods would continue to arrive in Germany during the coronavirus epidemic, the airline's boss said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Surging borrowing costs, vanishing buyers: more pain ahead for European junk bonds
Description: Borrowing costs for junk-rated European companies have nearly tripled in less than a month, and with the market for new debt issuance shuttered, there could be a lot more pain in store for firms needing to raise fresh money to redeem debt.

Headlines: Planemakers grapple with delivery delays as airline crisis grows
Description: Boeing and Airbus face a drop in planned deliveries as airlines struggle to survive the coronavirus crisis, sending shares in planemakers plunging on Monday.

Headlines: Airline bailouts? Cash handouts? Debate deepens on inoculating economy against coronavirus
Description: The United States and other rich countries need to start spending their way out of the coronavirus crisis, White House advisers, the International Monetary Fund and business groups said Monday, amid growing market panic about the pandemic.

Headlines: Factbox: Global oil, gas producers slash spending after price rout
Description: Oil and gas companies around the world are planning to slash spending in the face of a plunge in oil prices caused by the spread of the coronavirus and a push by Saudi Arabia and Russia to flood the market with supply. [O/R]

Headlines: Credit Suisse offers paid leave for workers needing to care for children, elderly
Description: Credit Suisse  will be giving employees needing to care for children and family members affected by the coronavirus outbreak a month of paid leave through mid-April, its chairman and CEO told staff in a memo late on Monday.

Headlines: Musk told Tesla employees in memo to stay home if unwell: sources
Description: Tesla Inc  Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk sent employees an email on Monday telling them to stay at home if they felt ill or uncomfortable, two people who saw the memo told Reuters.

Headlines: Renault halts Spain operations after state of emergency declared
Description: French carmaker Renault  said on Tuesday that it was halting operations in Spain following the declaration of a state of emergency there in light of the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Nordstrom shuts stores, pulls 2020 outlook due to coronavirus
Description: Nordstrom Inc  said on Monday it would temporarily shut its stores in the United States and Canada and pull its fiscal 2020 forecast, as the upscale retailer joins its peers in an effort to limit the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: PG&E wins approval for $23 billion bankruptcy financing package
Description: Power producer PG&E Corp said on Monday that it won bankruptcy court approval to use up to $23 billion in financing after California Governor Gavin Newsom dropped his opposition to those financing commitments.

Headlines: Exclusive: Shale gas pioneer Chesapeake Energy taps restructuring advisers - sources
Description: Chesapeake Energy Corp, the oil and gas exploration and production company that helped spearhead the U.S. shale revolution, has tapped debt restructuring advisers amid a rout in energy prices, people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor's China plant sales in February fall 97% from a year ago
Description: Hyundai Motor's  China domestic plant sales in February was 1,007 vehicles, company data showed on Tuesday, down 97% from 38,017 vehicles a year ago.

Headlines: Exxon pledges 'significant' spending cuts amid coronavirus, oil slide
Description: Exxon Mobil  on Monday said it will make "significant" cuts to spending in the face of the unprecedented slide in oil prices due to the global coronavirus outbreak, which sent its shares to a 17-year low.

Headlines: Oil slumps below $30 a barrel as coronavirus spreads, OPEC rancor remains elevated
Description: Oil prices fell below $30 a barrel on Monday after the worldwide coronavirus outbreak worsened over the weekend, exacerbating fears that government lockdowns to contain the spread of the disease would spark a global recession.

Headlines: U.S. gasoline refining profits slump to 2008 levels amid coronavirus fears
Description: U.S. gasoline refining margins fell a whopping 95% on Monday - even briefly turning negative - with the cost of gasoline plunging faster than crude oil in anticipation that the coronavirus will keep people off the road and in their homes.

Headlines: Australia's Afterpay settles with California regulator for loans issued without license
Description: Australia's buy-now-pay-later firm Afterpay Ltd  will refund late fees paid by customers in California for loans, which were deemed "illegal" by the U.S. state's financial regulator, the two sides said as part of a settlement.

Headlines: EU regulators ask companies to delay merger filings over coronavirus disruption
Description: European Union regulators have asked companies seeking to complete their desired mergers to delay submitting antitrust filings due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Brought to the brink by coronavirus, airlines seek emergency aid
Description: Airlines made unprecedented cuts to flights, costs and staffing on Monday, stepping up calls for emergency aid as coronavirus lockdowns and new travel restrictions hit more major routes.

Headlines: Latin America's largest airline to cancel 90% of its international flights
Description: LATAM Airlines Group, South America's largest carrier, on Monday canceled 90% of its international flights as demand collapsed and countries shut down borders due to the coronavirus outbreak, leaving the region increasingly isolated.

Headlines: U.S. airlines seek $50 billion coronavirus bailout to avoid collapse
Description: Major U.S. airlines sought a government bailout of more than $50 billion as the White House is urgently drafting a financial assistance package in the wake of the steep falloff in U.S. travel demand sparked by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Boeing stock wipes out gains made during ousted CEO Muilenburg's term
Description: Boeing Co's shares on Monday erased all gains recorded during ousted CEO Dennis Muilenburg's tenure due to the economic fallout of the coronavirus pandemic and uncertainty around the 737 MAX's return to service, which also led to a credit rating downgrade by S&P Global Ratings.

Headlines: Qantas to slash 90% of international capacity as new virus restrictions bite
Description: Qantas Airways Ltd  said on Tuesday it would cut its international capacity by around 90% until at least the end of May as travel demand to Australia plunges because of new restrictions on arrivals related to the coronavirus.

Headlines: Some European banks shut branches to limit coronavirus spread
Description: Two of Germany's largest banks have temporarily shut hundreds of branches, while Italian lenders have shortened opening hours as they grapple with staff shortages and the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Q&A: Government coronavirus directives shield employers from bias, safety claims: MoFo partners
Description: The coronavirus pandemic is forcing employers to make tough decisions that could lead to legal liability, but most companies should be in the clear if they follow the advice of government authorities, according to Morrison & Foerster partners Janie Schulman and Christine Lyon.

Headlines: Markets crater as coronavirus fears overwhelm central bank emergency measures
Description: Markets reeled on Monday, with stocks on Wall Street and the price of Brent crude tumbling more than 10%, as the Federal Reserve's second emergency rate cut in as many weeks failed to calm fears of a coronavirus-induced recession.

Headlines: Exclusive: Airbus draws up contingency plan to slow or halt output - sources
Description: Airbus  has drawn up contingency plans to slow or stop production if France is placed under a drastic lockdown due to coronavirus, two people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Make us ventilators to fight coronavirus, UK asks Ford and Rolls Royce
Description: Britain has asked manufacturers including Ford , Honda  and Rolls Royce  to help make health equipment including ventilators to cope with the coronavirus outbreak and will look at using hotels as hospitals.

Headlines: Fed slashes rates, global central banks coordinate to cushion coronavirus blow
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve and global central banks moved aggressively on Sunday to buttress a world economy unraveling rapidly amid the coronavirus pandemic, with the Fed slashing interest rates to near zero, pledging hundreds of billions of dollars in asset purchases and backstopping foreign authorities with the offer of cheap dollar financing.

Headlines: Fed slashes rates again to shore up economy as coronavirus spreads
Description: The Federal Reserve unexpectedly cut interest rates on Sunday for the second time in less than two weeks, an emergency move to help shore up the U.S. economy as a coronavirus pandemic spreads worldwide.

Headlines: JPMorgan says it resolved outage in trading platform last week
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  said on Monday it had resolved an outage experienced on Thursday in its U.S. electronic trading platform on the same evening.

Headlines: Coronavirus: First test of a U.S. financial system 10 years in repair
Description: A health emergency dismissed at first as a fleeting risk to the U.S. economy has turned into a full-on test of whether a decade of planning, regulation, research and soul-searching has left the financial system resilient to a major shock and its central bank able to mount a rescue.

Headlines: Factbox: History of extended New York Stock Exchange market closings
Description: With state and local governments across the United States taking steps to contain the coronavirus spread, including requiring the closing of schools, restaurants and other meeting places, questions have begun to swirl on whether stock markets will shutter.

Headlines: UK's Johnson: Northern Ireland as well protected from virus as Ireland
Description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Monday that people in Northern Ireland were being as well protected from the coronavirus outbreak as people just across the border in the Republic of Ireland, which has adopted more stringent measures.

Headlines: UK PM Johnson describes coronavirus measures as most far-reaching in peacetime
Description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson said that the government has announced the most far-reaching measures the population has experienced in peacetime to slow the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Carrefour mounts shields for French cashiers in coronavirus crisis
Description: Carrefour  began putting up protective barriers for cashiers in its French supermarkets on Monday, as it beefs up sanitary measures and looks to keep business flowing as France shuts down other sectors to fight the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Amtrak, U.S. state rail agencies need $1 billion after coronavirus outbreak
Description: U.S. railroad Amtrak said the passenger rail service and its state partners need $1 billion in government assistance after a dramatic decline in travel because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Hedge fund Bridgewater places $15 billion in bets against Europe and UK
Description: Hedge fund behemoth Bridgewater has shown its hand in Europe with roughly $15 billion in bets against companies on the continent and in Great Britain, filings reviewed by Reuters show.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs lets customers delay March payments on loans, credit cards
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  told customers of its online bank, Marcus, and its Apple credit card on Monday that they can take an extra month to make payments, with no penalty or additional interest, if they are financially stretched due to the coronavirus.

Headlines: After Trump boasts about rally, Wall Street tanks again
Description: Less than 48 hours after U.S. President Donald Trump bragged about his soothing influence on the stock market, Wall Street tanked again.

Headlines: Google parent Alphabet shared YouTube revenue after U.S. SEC request
Description: Alphabet Inc began disclosing revenue for its YouTube video service this year after U.S. securities regulators asked the Google parent to give more "quantitative and qualitative" data on the business, according to filings released Monday.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin's Marillyn Hewson to step down as CEO
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp  said on Monday company veteran Marillyn Hewson will step down as chief executive officer, and tapped board member and American Tower Corp  boss James Taiclet as her replacement.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. airports seek $10 billion in government assistance over travel demand collapse - sources
Description: U.S. airports are seeking $10 billion in U.S. government assistance to help offset losses incurred by the sharp drop in travel due to coronavirus, two people briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: French carmaker PSA closes European factories due to virus spread
Description: French carmaker PSA  said on Monday the company will close its European factories until March 27 due to the coronavirus outbreak spread.

Headlines: U.S. car buyers may get a break on loans as coronavirus threatens auto sales
Description: Several automakers on Monday said U.S. buyers of new vehicles will have the option to defer their payments and customers with existing car loans could ask for payment rescheduling if impacted by shutdowns due to the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Developing nations may lose up to 85% of oil and gas income this year: IEA, OPEC
Description: Developing nations' oil and gas income will fall by 50% to 85% this year to a more than two-decade low if current market conditions persist, the International Energy Agency and OPEC said in a rare joint statement on Monday, citing recent IEA analysis.

Headlines: U.S. shale oil output to rise to record 9.08 million barrels per day in April - EIA
Description: U.S. oil output growth from the Permian basin is expected to offset declines in every other shale formation in April, helping push overall production up by about 18,000 barrels per day (bpd) to a record 9.08 million bpd, data showed on Monday.

Headlines: Factbox: Oil products markets in turmoil as coronavirus infects demand
Description: The oil products markets globally are caught between a rock and a hard place as the impact of ultra cheap oil, which should be a boon for refiners, is mitigated by record low prices for gasoline and jet fuel.

Headlines: Uber Eats waives delivery fee for independent restaurants as virus spreads
Description: Uber Technologies Inc's  food delivery business, Uber Eats, said on Monday it would waive delivery fee for independent restaurants across the United States and Canada.

Headlines: U.S. airlines urgently need $50 billion in grants, loans - letter
Description: A group representing major U.S. airlines said the industry needs $50 billion in grants and loans to survive the dramatic falloff in travel demand from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Powell's whatever-it-takes pledge puts limits of Fed's reach in spotlight
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's message in announcing a barrage of monetary policy and liquidity actions was clear: The U.S. central bank will use all the tools at its disposal to keep credit flowing through the U.S. and global financial system.

Headlines: LATAM Airlines to cancel 90% of its international flights
Description: LATAM Airlines Group, the continent's largest carrier, said on Monday it is canceling 90% of its international flights, in light of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Exclusive: UK supermarkets may cut services to stay open as coronavirus spreads - sources
Description: Britain's major supermarkets are working on plans to streamline their operations by cutting cafes, counters and other services to enable a depleted workforce to maintain basic provisions during the coronavirus outbreak, industry sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Carmakers put brakes on European production as coronavirus hits
Description: Carmakers including Fiat Chrysler, Peugeot and Volkswagen cut production at European plants on Monday as they grappled with the coronavirus crisis and diving demand.

Headlines: Deutsche Telekom postpones shareholder meeting over coronavirus
Description: Deutsche Telekom  on Monday postponed its March 26 annual general shareholders meeting due to the coronavirus, saying it planned to hold the gathering during the first eight months of this year as required by law.

Headlines: U.S. could start buying crude for Strategic Petroleum Reserve in two weeks
Description: The United States could begin purchasing U.S. produced crude oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve as soon as two weeks from now, and fill it in several months, an Energy Department source said on Monday.

Headlines: French carmaker Renault to halt production in France
Description: French carmaker Renault  said on Monday it was shutting down production at its industrial sites in France until further notice because of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Near-zero U.S. rates may not sink the dollar
Description: When the U.S. Federal Reserve cut interest rates to near zero on Sunday, the dollar fell, since the move blew away the yield on owning dollars and with it much of their attraction.

Headlines: Brazil likely to announce relief package for airlines amid coronavirus
Description: Brazil's government will likely announce a package of measures to prop up the civil aviation sector later on Monday, as business evaporates and flights are canceled due to the coronavirus outbreak, the Infrastructure Ministry said.

Headlines: Norwegian Air to cancel 85% of flights and lay off 90% of staff
Description: Norwegian Air  will cancel 85% of its flights and temporarily lay off 7,300 employees as a result of the growing coronavirus crisis that has strangled demand for air travel, the carrier said on Monday.

Headlines: Big UK airlines ground most of their fleets to survive coronavirus
Description: Britain's big airlines said on Monday they would have to ground most of their fleets to survive the coronavirus crisis, with easyJet and Virgin - though not British Airways - appealing for government bailouts to save the industry from collapse.

Headlines: Airlines count mounting costs of the coronavirus shock
Description: Airlines across the globe are feeling the pain as travel demand withers because of the coronavirus outbreak. Several have scrapped flights and ditched financial forecasts.

Headlines: Lufthansa cuts 90% of long-haul flights: statement
Description: German airline Lufthansa said it would further cut its flight schedule after Monday's announcement that its Austrian Airlines division was scrapping all flights in response to the coronavirus-induced collapse in passenger demand.

Headlines: China's airlines to cut international flights due to coronavirus: Global Times
Description: Chinese airlines including Air China, China Southern Airlines and China Eastern Airlines are planning to reduce international flights in response to the coronavirus pandemic, the Global Times reported on Monday, citing unidentified sources.

Headlines: More U.S. producers cut budgets as crude falls below $30 a barrel
Description: EOG Resources Inc , Whiting Petroleum Corp  and EQT Corp  cut drilling activity and budgets on Monday, becoming the latest North American shale producers to be hit by lower oil prices, which fell below $30.    Oil producers are trying to shore up cash as demand dwindles because of the global coronavirus outbreak and the double-whammy of a price war that threatens shale companies, which had budgeted for oil prices at $55 per barrel to $65 per bar

Headlines: Cowen expects Nike's sales fall $3.5 billion for May quarter
Description: Nike Inc's  revenue could fall by a third in the fourth quarter, Cowen estimated, as the sportswear giant reels from store closures, supply disruptions and the suspension of this year's NBA season due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: India plans to top up strategic tanks with cheap Saudi, UAE oil - sources
Description: India plans to take advantage of low prices for oil from Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates to top up its strategic petroleum reserves (SPR), two sources familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Stock market rout doubles pain for energy firms that took shares for deals
Description: Energy investor EnCap Investments pulled off a rarity in the U.S. shale business earlier this month, the $2.5 billion sale of oil producer Felix Energy to rival WPX Energy Inc, striking a deal at a time when energy mergers have all but dried up.

Headlines: Italian government to take control of Alitalia: draft decree
Description: The Italian government plans to take control of Alitalia, a draft decree seen by Reuters showed on Monday, as  the loss-making carrier risks going belly up due to the impact of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Virgin Atlantic to ground up to 85% of fleet in coronavirus crisis
Description: Virgin Atlantic, the UK-based airline, said it would ground 75% of its fleet by 26 March and by up to 85% at points in April, as it canceled more flights due to coronavirus.

Headlines: Fed brings out big guns, investors fear the worst
Description: A massive rollout of easing measures by the Federal Reserve served to deepen some investors' anxiety over how effectively policymakers will be able to mitigate the economic damage from a spreading coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: LSE gets U.S. nod for Refinitiv deal
Description: The London Stock Exchange Group  said on Monday it had gained approval from the U.S. Committee on Foreign Investment for its $27 billion takeover of analytics firm Refinitiv, judging there were no national security concerns with the deal.

Headlines: JPMorgan allows employees to work from home as coronavirus spreads: memo
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  has asked all managers globally to allow employees who can effectively work from home to begin doing so to help with social distancing as the coronavirus pandemic spreads, according to a memo seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Feed the hamster: German retailer asks students to restock shelves
Description: A German supermarket chain called on Monday for students whose universities have shut due to the coronavirus crisis to help it refill its shelves after shoppers stockpiled many essential goods, known as "hamstering" in German.

Headlines: Ryanair slashes flights, says could ground entire fleet
Description: Ryanair  will ground most of its aircraft over the next seven to 10 days as Europe's biggest low-cost airline braces for an up to 80% cut in capacity over the next two months and could even ground its entire fleet due to coronavirus travel restrictions.

Headlines: Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific to sell six Boeing aircraft to BOC Aviation
Description: Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd  on Monday said it would sell six Boeing  777-300ER aircraft and its associated equipment for $703.8 million to BOC Aviation Ltd .

Headlines: French antitrust regulator fines Apple $1.2 billion
Description: France's competition watchdog on Monday fined iPhone maker Apple 1.1 billion euros ($ 1.23 billion), saying it was guilty of anti-competitive behavior towards its distribution and retail network.

Headlines: Skoda, Hyundai's Czech plant unions call for production halt: CTK
Description: Unions at the Czech car factories of Volkswagen's  Skoda Auto and Hyundai Motor Co.  have called for a 14-day quarantine for employees, which would halt production for that time, news agency CTK reported on Monday.

Headlines: Finablr raises doubts about its future, CEO leaves
Description: Payments group Finablr  on Monday expressed doubts about its ability to continue as a going concern and said its chief executive would step down.

Headlines: Exclusive: Flying blind - Marubeni's Gavilon ignored Brazilian red flags
Description: When Japanese conglomerate Marubeni  booked a loss of 3.9 billion yen ($35 million) at its U.S. grain trader Gavilon in November, it blamed adjustments for "inappropriate transactions" with Italy and Spain.

Headlines: Airlines slash schedules, jobs and pay after new travel restrictions
Description: Airlines around the world said they would make more drastic cuts to their flying schedules, shed jobs and seek government aid after countries further tightened border restrictions because of the fast spreading coronavirus.

Headlines: Major airline alliances call on governments for support due to coronavirus
Description: The three major airline alliances — Star, SkyTeam and oneworld — on Monday jointly called on governments and stakeholders to extend extraordinary support to airlines to alleviate pressure caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Volkswagen's Portugal plant reduces output by 16% due to coronavirus
Description: Volkswagen's Autoeuropa car assembly plant near Lisbon has reduced its daily output by 16% because of a shortage of workers after Portugal ordered all schools closed amid the coronavirus outbreak, the plant said on Monday in a statement. ´

Headlines: The plumbing behind world's financial markets is creaking. Loudly
Description: The coronavirus panic is jolting stock markets, with steep drops in major indexes grabbing the public’s attention. But behind the scenes, there is less understood and potentially more worrying evidence that stress is building to dangerous levels in crucial arteries of the financial system.

Headlines: What do the Fed's latest moves mean for U.S. consumers?
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve unleashed new emergency measures on Sunday night to limit the economic harm from the coronavirus, including making it easier for banks to get money and slashing its benchmark borrowing rate to near zero.

Headlines: Quarantined bankers, video roadshows: coronavirus hits Argentine debt talks
Description: Argentina's ambitious target to strike a deal with bondholders to revamp almost $70 billion in debts by the end of March was never going to be easy. Now a coronavirus outbreak and crashing bond markets threaten to complicate things further.

Headlines: Nike, Under Armour join retailers shutting stores to limit virus spread
Description: Nike Inc, Lululemon Athletica Inc and Under Armour Inc on Sunday said they would close stores in the United States and other markets, joining a growing list of major retailers moving to help limit the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Sanofi says production running as per normal, sees no shortages
Description: Sanofi  on Monday said its production sites were running normally in Europe and elsewhere as the coronavirus outbreak hits business activity globally, although the drugmaker has put in place contigency plans to ensure continuity.

Headlines: Global central banks pull out all stops as coronavirus paralyzes economies
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve and its global counterparts moved aggressively with sweeping emergency rate cuts and offers of cheap dollars to help combat the coronavirus pandemic that has jolted markets and paralyzed large parts of the world economy.

Headlines: Uniqlo owner says most shops in China outside Hubei have reopened
Description: Japan's Fast Retailing  said only 30 of its 750 Uniqlo stores in China were still closed, meaning most of its shops outside Hubei province, the epicenter of the coronavirus outbreak, had reopened.

Headlines: BA-owner has not asked for state aid: CEO
Description: British Airways-owner IAG  has not asked for state aid, said its CEO, as he detailed the group's response to the coronavirus crisis, including accelerating the retirement of some aircraft and possible cuts to 2021 capacity.

Headlines: British Airways-owner to cut capacity by 75%, CEO Walsh staying on
Description: The owner of British Airways said it would cut its flying capacity by at least 75% in April and May and its outgoing boss Willie Walsh would defer his retirement in its fight to survive the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Trump congratulates Fed for rates cut, calls action 'terrific'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said the Federal Reserve's decision on Sunday to cut interest rates was "good news" and "makes me very happy" as he congratulated the central bank for taking further action aimed at helping shore up the U.S. economy amid the global coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Gasoline becomes more affordable, just when Americans don't need it
Description: At two gasoline stations in Scarsdale, a wealthy suburb of New York City not far from one of the nation's worst outbreaks of coronavirus, attendants whiled away the minutes on a rainy Friday morning at what would normally be their busiest time of day.

Headlines: United warns of cash bleed, empty planes even after more schedule cuts
Description: United Airlines Holdings booked $1.5 billion less revenue in March than the same time last year and warned employees that planes could be flying nearly empty into the summer, even after drastic flight capacity cuts.

Headlines: Quotes from Federal Reserve Chair Powell's press conference
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve and global central banks moved aggressively on Sunday to buttress a world economy unraveling rapidly amid the coronavirus pandemic, with the Fed slashing interest rates to near zero, pledging hundreds of billions of dollars in asset purchases and backstopping foreign authorities with the offer of cheap dollar financing.

Headlines: Big U.S. banks halt stock buybacks, citing customer needs during coronavirus
Description: The United States' biggest banks will stop buying back their own shares, and will instead use that capital to lend to individuals and businesses affected by the coronavirus, an industry trade group said on Sunday.

Headlines: S&P 500 stock futures tumble after Fed slashes rates
Description: U.S. stock index futures tumbled to open trading on Sunday, hitting their daily down limit, after the Federal Reserve took drastic action to cushion the economic blow from the escalating coronavirus.

Headlines: Under water? Banks play home loan lottery as insurers bail out
Description: Only a year after losing their homes to floods in parts of Australia's north eastern coast of Queensland, people are moving into new houses built on or near the same plots.

Headlines: Germany tries to halt U.S. interest in firm working on coronavirus vaccine
Description: Berlin is trying to stop Washington from persuading a German company seeking a coronavirus vaccine to move its research to the United States, prompting German politicians to insist no country should have a monopoly on any future vaccine.

Headlines: Goldman cuts U.S. growth forecast for first and second quarter due to coronavirus
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  has downgraded its U.S. growth forecast for the first and second quarters in the wake of the economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Automakers, union form joint task force to limit coronavirus outbreak
Description: Automakers General Motors , Ford Motor Co  and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA)  are forming a coronavirus task force along with the United Auto Workers (UAW) union to improve protections for their employees and limit the spread of the highly contagious virus.

Headlines: Factories shift operations in scramble to restock supermarket shelves
Description: With supermarkets stripped of food and many other essentials, consumer product companies halted factory runs of niche items such as scented bleach in order to speed up production of more basic merchandise that is in high demand.

Headlines: New York Fed full statement: Treasuries, mortgage-backed securities
Description: The Federal Reserve announced a series of coordinated monetary policy moves aimed at offsetting the economic impact of the coronavirus on Sunday night.

Headlines: Federal Reserve statement - lowering federal funds rate to 0 to .25%
Description: The Federal Reserve issued coordinated actions to combat the economic impacts of the coronavirus Sunday night, including cutting its key lending rate to zero.

Headlines: Volkswagen says preparing to suspend production at Bratislava plant
Description: Volkswagen  is preparing to suspend operations at its manufacturing plant in Bratislava, the company said on Sunday, after Slovakia declared a state of emergency due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Oil giants set health checks for critical staff, work-from-home rules
Description: Major energy companies in the United States imposed work-from-home rules for office staff and began health checks for remote or critical workers as coronavirus spread and threatened an industry reeling from falling demand and profits.

Headlines: Investors prepare for more market swings as virus spreads in the U.S.
Description: With one of Wall Street's wildest weeks in recent memory now in the history books, investors are bracing for more uncertainty and big market swings ahead.

Headlines: LVMH to make disinfectant gels to aid French coronavirus fight
Description: Louis Vuitton owner LVMH  said on Sunday that its cosmetics unit would manufacture large quantities of hand disinfectant gel to help stave off a nationwide shortage across France as the coronavirus rapidly spreads.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz ask employees to work from home; provide travel restriction
Description: Kraft Heinz Co  said on Sunday it has asked office employees to work from home as the coronavirus continues to spread.

Headlines: Haven assets losing their mojo in virus-stricken market
Description: A rush to safety amid a massive drop in stocks has stretched prices for haven assets, leaving investors fewer places to hide in the wake of a freshly-minted bear market.

Headlines: UK wants more ventilators, hospital beds as coronavirus spreads
Description: Britain told manufacturers to ramp up the country's production of ventilators and ordered private hospitals to prepare for an overspill of patients from the public health service as the death toll from coronavirus grew on Saturday.

Headlines: Ford to shut Spanish factory for one week due to coronavirus outbreak
Description: Ford  said on Sunday it would shut its Spanish plant in the eastern region of Valencia for one week starting on Monday after three employees tested positive for coronavirus.

Headlines: Aramco to cut capital spending over coronavirus; 2019 profits plunge
Description: Saudi Aramco  on Sunday said it plans to cut capital spending in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak, and also posted a plunge in profit for last year, missing forecasts in its first earnings announcement as a listed company.

Headlines: Factbox: Aramco 2019 profit drops, a week after shares fell below IPO
Description: Saudi Arabia's state-run oil giant Saudi Aramco announced a drop in its 2019 profit of nearly 21% on Sunday, falling well below analysts' expectations just three months after selling shares to the public in a record-setting IPO.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco's 2019 profit down 21%, cuts spending
Description: Saudi Arabia's state oil giant Aramco said on Sunday its 2019 profit fell almost 21% due to lower crude oil prices and a drop in production volumes.

Headlines: Israel to use anti-terror tech to counter coronavirus 'invisible enemy'
Description: Israel plans to use anti-terrorism tracking technology and a partial shutdown of its economy to minimize the risk of coronavirus transmission, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Saturday.

Headlines: American Airlines cutting international flights by 75% amid demand collapse
Description: American Airlines Inc said Saturday it plans to cut 75% of its international flights through May 6 and ground nearly all its widebody fleet, as airlines respond to the global collapse in travel demand due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Apple, some U.S. retailers close stores to contain virus
Description: Apple Inc  said it is closing all its retail stores, except those in Greater China, for the next two weeks to minimize the risk of coronavirus transmission, a move that was followed by several U.S. retailers on Saturday.

Headlines: American Airlines to suspend nearly all long-haul international flights starting March 16
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  on Saturday said it will implement a phased suspension of nearly all long-haul international flights starting March 16, amid reduced demand and travel restrictions due to the ongoing coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Factbox: Sports events around the world hit by coronavirus pandemic
Description: Major sports events around the world that have been hit by the coronavirus outbreak:

Headlines: Virgin Atlantic boss seeks 7.5 billion-pound UK airline bailout: Sky News
Description: Virgin Atlantic's chairman Peter Norris will write to British Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Monday saying the country's airline industry needs emergency government support worth 7.5 billion pounds ($9.20 billion) or risks the loss of tens of thousands of jobs, Sky News reported on Saturday.

Headlines: Southwest says 'seriously considering' cutting flights in short term
Description: Southwest Airlines , one of the few U.S. airlines still flying a full schedule even as the spreading coronavirus has sapped demand, said on Saturday it was "seriously considering" cutting flights in the short term.

Headlines: As coronavirus chaos spreads globally, Trump declares U.S. emergency
Description: President Donald Trump declared a U.S. national emergency over the quickly spreading coronavirus on Friday, opening the door to more government aid to combat a pathogen that has infected more than 138,000 people worldwide and left over 5,000 dead.

Headlines: U.S. hospitals say coronavirus school closures add to staffing pressure
Description: U.S. hospitals, gearing up for a large surge in patients as the new coronavirus spreads throughout the country, are reaching out to temporary staff agencies and exploring other ways to maintain workforce levels as school closures add to pressure on doctors and nurses.

Headlines: Royal Caribbean suspends global operations after virus outbreak
Description: Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd  said on Saturday it has suspended the voyages of its fleet globally from midnight  tonight following the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Jack Ma donates two million masks for coronavirus crisis in Europe
Description: Chinese billionaire and Alibaba co-founder Jack Ma has pledged to donate two million protective masks for distribution across Europe, with a first consignment arriving in Belgium late on Friday.

Headlines: Here's what the new U.S. restrictions on Europe mean for travelers
Description: The United States will suspend travel from certain European countries for 30 days beginning at midnight on Friday as part of an effort to stem the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: As Wall Street reels, veterans recall '87 while the young look to textbooks
Description: As U.S. financial markets reel from a week of historic swings, industry veterans are drawing on memories from their earliest years on Wall Street, while younger professionals are looking to lessons from history books.

Headlines: Wall Street weekahead: Investors hope Fed can help calm markets as big rate cut expected
Description: Interest rate cuts won't cure the coronavirus but investors are still hoping the Federal Reserve can take some actions to help soothe the roiled stock market.

Headlines: Stocks stage furious rally late after national emergency declared
Description: Wall Street staged a furious rally in the waning moments of the session on Friday after U.S. President Donald Trump declared a national emergency to combat the rapidly spreading coronavirus, although major averages still suffered sharp losses for the week.

Headlines: Berkshire taps former AmEx CEO Kenneth Chenault for board, as Bill Gates steps aside
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc said on Friday that former American Express Co Chief Executive Officer Kenneth Chenault has been nominated to the conglomerate's board of directors, replacing Microsoft Corp co-founder Bill Gates.

Headlines: Google, Walmart join U.S. effort to speed up coronavirus testing
Description: Corporate America joined the fight against the spread of coronavirus on Friday, as President Donald Trump and executives announced that Google would offer a website to help people determine whether they needed tests and retailers would set up drive-through testing in parking lots.

Headlines: China's coronavirus epicenter reports just five cases; Beijing tomb-sweepers urged to stay back
Description: The Chinese city of Wuhan, ground zero of the coronavirus outbreak, reported just five new cases on Friday, the second day in a row the tally has been less than 10, while no locally transmitted infections were reported in the rest of the country.

Headlines: Americans rush to stock up on essentials, retailers scramble to keep up
Description: From Jersey City on the East Coast to Los Angeles on the West Coast, American shoppers picked grocery store shelves clean on products ranging from disinfectants to rice, causing retailers to race to restock their stores as the worsening coronavirus crisis stoked fears of shortages.

Headlines: Associated Press closes D.C. office after journalist shows coronavirus symptoms
Description: The Associated Press is temporarily closing its office from Friday in Washington, D.C. after one of its staff journalists, who had direct contact with a possible coronavirus patient, showed some symptoms of illness, the AP reported.

Headlines: Trump encountered second person who later tested positive for coronavirus, White House physician says
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump encountered a second individual last weekend who later tested positive for coronavirus, but the president did not require testing for the virus or quarantining, the White House physician said on Friday.

Headlines: South Korea reports 107 new coronavirus cases, total 8,086: KCDC
Description: South Korea reported more recoveries from the coronavirus than new infections on Saturday for the second day in a row, as a downward trend in daily cases raised hopes that Asia's biggest epidemic outside China may be slowing.

Headlines: New Zealand, Australia tighten lockdown to combat coronavirus
Description: New Zealand on Saturday announced the world's tightest border controls to combat the spread of coronavirus, requiring all incoming travellers, including its own citizens, to self-isolate for two weeks starting midnight Sunday.

Headlines: Guatemala bans arrivals from U.S., Canada to fight coronavirus
Description: Guatemala will from Monday widen travel restrictions to fight the spread of coronavirus, banning arrivals from the United States and Canada, President Alejandro Giammattei said on Friday.

Headlines: Major U.S. internet firms agree not to cancel service over next 60 days
Description: The U.S. telecoms regulator said Friday that major internet providers - including Comcast Corp, AT&T Inc and Verizon Communications Inc - agreed not to terminate service for subscribers for the next 60 days if they are unable to pay their bills due to disruptions caused by the coronavirus.

Headlines: Chile bans large public events over coronavirus fears, ahead of planned protests
Description: Chilean President Sebastian Pinera announced a ban on public events with more than 500 people on Friday, as the government tries to curtail the spread of coronavirus even as massive social demonstrations are planned in the coming weeks.

Headlines: Tesla chief Elon Musk's trial postponed due to coronavirus
Description: Elon Musk's expected defense of a $2.2 billion deal in court was postponed on Friday from its expected Monday start, due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Factbox: Latest on the spread of coronavirus around the world
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday declared a national emergency over the fast-spreading coronavirus to free up $50 billion in federal aid to combat a disease that has infected over 138,000 people worldwide and left more than 5,000 dead.
