Headlines: Keep calm and carry on: what is the logic behind Britain's coronavirus bet?
Description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson has cautioned that more families will lose their loved ones to the coronavirus but has taken a distinctly different approach to tackling the outbreak.

Headlines: Jamaica declares disaster over coronavirus, seeks Cuban nurses
Description: Jamaican Prime Minister Andrew Holness on Friday declared the island a disaster area because of the threat of coronavirus infection and said his country is seeking 100 Cuban nurses to help it to cope.

Headlines: Mexican coronavirus tally increases to 26: health ministry
Description: Mexico has registered a rise in the number of confirmed coronavirus cases to 26 from 15 a day earlier, the Mexican health ministry on Friday.

Headlines: Panama coronavirus tally rises to 36, includes three foreigners
Description: Panama's Health Minister Rosario Turner on Friday said the number of confirmed coronavirus cases in the Central American country has risen to 36, and includes three foreigners.

Headlines: Drumbeat of bad coronavirus news starts to hit U.S. auto dealers
Description: A relentless barrage of bad news surrounding the coronavirus epidemic has begun to affect customer visits at some U.S. auto dealers and even those businesses that have thrived so far believe a big sales decline is imminent if China's experience is any guide.

Headlines: IMF, World Bank staff to work from home after coronavirus case at Fund headquarters
Description: The International Monetary Fund and World Bank Group on Friday advised their Washington headquarters staff to work from home after an IMF employee was diagnosed with COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.

Headlines: How the longest bull run in history ended in pandemic panic
Description: As a collapse in the oil price unleashed chaos in financial markets, Madrid money manager Diego Parrilla phoned a colleague who agreed: they had better head to work early in the morning.

Headlines: FAA launches probe after in-flight incident reveals 12-inch crack on 737 jet
Description: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) said on Friday it has begun a probe following an in-flight incident involving an older 737 aircraft manufactured by Boeing Co  and flown by Southwest Airlines .

Headlines: Travel industry under siege as coronavirus contagion grows
Description: The fallout from the coronavirus spread across the Pacific on Friday, with Australian travel firms issuing profit warnings and Japanese carriers cutting capacity, while U.S. airlines rushed to cut flights to Europe in the wake of new travel restrictions.

Headlines: Lufthansa slashes flight schedule further, may seek state aid
Description: German flagship carrier Lufthansa  on Friday said it would scrap its annual dividend, slash its flight schedule further and is also considering a request for state aid to help it deal with the impact of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Four cruise companies will suspend outbound voyages for 30 days: Trump
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that four cruise line companies had agreed to suspend outbound cruises for 30 days, at his request, amid the global coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler plant resumes production after 24-hour halt over coronavirus fears
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV   said production at its assembly plant in Windsor, Ontario, which was halted for 24 hours over fears of an employee being possibly exposed to the coronavirus, has resumed on Friday afternoon.

Headlines: Citigroup, JPMorgan report New York cases of coronavirus
Description: New York-based banks Citigroup Inc  and JPMorgan Chase & Co  both reported on Friday that they have employees who have tested positive for the coronavirus.

Headlines: Bill Gates steps down from Microsoft board
Description: Microsoft Corp co-founder Bill Gates, who made the company one of the world's most valuable technology firms, stepped down from the board on Friday to focus on philanthropic works related to global health, education and climate change.

Headlines: Boeing supplier woes increase as coronavirus grounds more jets
Description: Boeing Co's  suppliers, already reeling from a 737 MAX grounding one year ago on Friday, face an even slimmer workload as flight cancellations spurred by the spreading coronavirus mean less airline demand for spare parts and services.

Headlines: Late Wall Street rally leads global stocks higher; oil also jumps
Description: A gauge of stocks across the globe bounced back on Friday led by a late rally on Wall Street, after U.S. President Donald Trump freed $50 billion to tackle the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: JPMorgan says two employees at NYC headquarters contract coronavirus
Description: JPMorgan Chase and Co  said on Friday two employees at its headquarters in New York City have contracted the coronavirus.

Headlines: Dollar bounces vs yen as stocks rally, Trump declares U.S. coronavirus emergency
Description: The dollar surged on Friday, posting sharp gains against the safe-haven Japanese yen as stock markets recovered globally and investors cheered efforts by governments and policymakers to address the economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Crude posts biggest weekly losses since 2008, hit by coronavirus and Saudi price war
Description: Oil prices on Friday posted their biggest week of losses since the 2008 global financial crisis, rocked by the coronavirus outbreak and efforts by top exporter Saudi Arabia and its allies to flood the market with record levels of supply.

Headlines: U.S. airports up forecast losses this year to $5.7 bln on sagging travel demand
Description: A group representing major U.S. airports on Friday revised upward its forecast for estimated losses this year to $5.7 billion after President Donald Trump instituted new European travel curbs and as flight reductions rose.

Headlines: Delivery fees, commissions cut as Americans stop dining out
Description: As Americans hole up at home to wait out the coronavirus pandemic, fewer people are going out to eat, leading some fast food chains to cut delivery fees and meal delivery platforms to suspend commissions.

Headlines: Poland to close borders to foreigners, quarantine returnees
Description: Poland will ban foreigners from entering the country from Sunday and impose a 14-day quarantine on its citizens returning home in a bid to curb the spread of coronavirus, Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki said on Friday.

Headlines: Kosovo confirms first coronavirus cases, an Italian and a Kosovar
Description: Kosovo reported its first coronavirus cases on Friday, in a 20-year-old Italian woman and a 77-year-old Kosovar man.

Headlines: GM, Ford to have white-collar employees work remotely starting Monday
Description: U.S. automakers General Motors Co  and Ford Motor Co  said on Friday they will have most of their white-collar workforce working remotely as of Monday to protect against the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. Fed, banks discuss possible leniency on liquidity threshold to aid lending - sources
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is talking with lenders about potentially going easy on them if they deplete their liquidity reserves while trying to support customers hurt by coronavirus disruption, according to three people with knowledge of the discussions.

Headlines: Egypt reports 13 new cases of coronavirus, bringing total to 93
Description: Egypt reported on Friday 13 new cases of coronavirus, bringing the total of cases detected in the country to 93, the health ministry said in a statement.

Headlines: Suriname confirms first coronavirus case, authorities will close borders
Description: Suriname on Friday confirmed its first case of coronavirus infection in a person who traveled to the South American country last week from the Netherlands, the vice president told the national assembly.

Headlines: Bayer inches toward glyphosate settlement: WSJ
Description: Bayer AG has agreed on draft settlement terms with half a dozen law firms representing tens of thousands of plaintiffs alleging that its Roundup weedkiller causes cancer, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Teleconference apps and new tech surge in demand amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Global downloads of business apps including Tencent Conference, WeChat Work, Zoom, Microsoft Teams and Slack have risen nearly five fold since the start of the year, data showed, as the coronavirus outbreak changes how corporations work.

Headlines: Denmark shuts its borders for one month to curb spread of coronavirus
Description: Denmark announced on Friday it would shut its borders to most foreign visitors for a month from Saturday, in a move unprecedented in peacetime as part of efforts to halt the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Airlines seek cost cuts and aid to survive coronavirus
Description: British Airways warned of job losses and Norwegian Air said it had "weeks not months" to avert collapse, as airlines look for cost cuts and government help in the face of a crippling travel slump brought on by the coronavirus.

Headlines: United Airlines in talks with U.S. officials about financial support
Description: United Airlines  confirmed Friday it is in talks with U.S. government officials about possible financial assistance in the middle of a dramatic falloff in travel demand due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Azerbaijan bans wedding celebrations, public events after coronavirus death
Description: Azerbaijan has banned wedding celebrations and other public events, the authorities said on Friday, a day after it recorded its first death from the coronavirus.

Headlines: Explainer: Dollar demand reveals market's pain point
Description: This month's dramatic selloff in financial markets is causing ructions in vital funding markets that keep money flowing between banks and companies and underpin anything from global trade to corporate cashflow.

Headlines: Coronavirus cases in Germany rise by 671 to top 3,000
Description: The number of confirmed coronavirus cases in Germany has risen by 671 to reach 3,062, the Robert Koch Institute for infectious diseases said on Friday.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia detects 24 cases of coronavirus, bringing total to 86: SPA
Description: Saudi Arabia detected on Friday new 24 cases of coronavirus, including 14 Egyptians, state news agency (SPA) said citing the health ministry.

Headlines: Demand dives at apparel retailers as virus-wary shoppers stay home
Description: As virus-wary shoppers stayed home in the United States and Europe, apparel retailers braced for a blow to sales and a potential inventory glut. Some slashed orders at garment factories while others began discounting merchandise.

Headlines: Montenegro bars gatherings, closes schools, ports and border crossings
Description: Montenegro barred public gatherings, closed schools for at least two weeks and adopted an array of other measures on Friday, including a ban on arrivals of ships at its Adriatic ports, in an effort to pre-empt the onset of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Volkswagen's Spanish unit SEAT to stop on Monday: spokesman
Description: The main plant of Volkswagen AG's  Spanish unit Seat in Martorell near Barcelona will stop output on Monday for an unspecified time due to logistical problems linked to the coronavirus epidemic, a company spokesman said on Friday.

Headlines: AT&T asks employees to work from home amid virus fears
Description: U.S. carrier AT&T Inc  on Friday asked its employees to work from home amid rising fears of the coronavirus, joining a list of tech majors working to curb the spread.

Headlines: Several Renault-Nissan plants in Spain halted amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Several Renault-Nissan  plants in Spain halted production temporarily on Friday or were planning stoppages next week due to a lack of parts amid the coronavirus epidemic, company officials said.

Headlines: Apple shifts annual developers conference to online-only format
Description: Apple Inc  on Friday moved its annual developers conference in San Jose, California, in June entirely online, citing the "current health situation."

Headlines: Musk trial over Tesla-Solarcity deal postponed due to coronavirus outbreak
Description: Monday's trial over shareholder accusations that Telsa Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk pushed the electric vehicle maker to buy an allegedly worthless SolarCity for $2.2 billion to benefit himself has postponed without a new date being set, a spokesman at Delaware's Court of Chancery said on Friday.

Headlines: SoftBank unveils $4.8 billion buyback after stock tumble, Elliott backs move
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  is buying back up to $4.8 billion of its shares after their recent slump, a move that partially met the demand of activist fund Elliott Management but failed to soothe investors panicking from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury chief dashes hopes for broad tariff cut to fight coronavirus
Description: The Trump administration is not considering broad relief from import tariffs on Chinese goods to ease economic pain from the coronavirus, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday, dashing the hopes of industry and some lawmakers.

Headlines: Coronavirus weighs on U.S. consumer sentiment in early February
Description: U.S. consumer sentiment fell less than expected in early March as households responded to the coronavirus pandemic and a sharp stock market sell-off, but also hoped that any disruptions to economic activity would be temporary.

Headlines: Iran security forces to empty city streets to fight coronavirus
Description: Security forces will empty the streets of cities across Iran in the next 24 hours in a drive to fight the spread of the new coronavirus, state television reported on Friday.

Headlines: British Airways in battle for 'survival' over coronavirus
Description: British Airways warned that its survival was at stake on Friday as its CEO told staff of plans to cut jobs and ground aircraft to tackle the "worsening situation" caused by coronavirus.

Headlines: Activist fund Elliott backs SoftBank's $4.8 billion buyback plan
Description: Activist investor Elliott Management said on Friday it supports SoftBank Group Corp's  latest move to buy back up to $4.8 billion of its shares.

Headlines: EU clears UTC purchase of Raytheon, subject to conditions
Description: The European Union has cleared United Technologies Corporation's (UTC)  planned acquisition of Raytheon , subject to conditions, the European Commission said on Friday.

Headlines: FDA works to speed coronavirus tests with Roche, New York approvals
Description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) issued emergency authorization for a faster coronavirus test made by Swiss diagnostics maker Roche  and allowed New York state to authorize certain labs to test for the virus, moves aimed at boosting screening capacity to help contain the growing epidemic.

Headlines: Romanian president taps quarantined interim PM to form new government
Description: Romanian President Klaus Iohannis asked quarantined interim Prime Minister Ludovic Orban to form a new government on Friday that parliament could approve as early as Saturday, ending a political stalemate and focusing on the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Take Five: Panic stations
Description: Recent blowouts in dollar swap prices are a sign economic lockdowns across the world are starting to pressure business cashflows, forcing companies to look elsewhere for greenbacks to pay suppliers and creditors.

Headlines: Coronavirus forces Warren Buffett to cancel 'Woodstock for Capitalists'
Description: Warren Buffett on Friday said the coronavirus pandemic forced him to cancel Berkshire Hathaway Inc's  annual shareholder weekend, the largest gathering in corporate America, because the safety of participants and the wider community was paramount.

Headlines: Bulgaria closes schools, restricts travel over coronavirus
Description: Bulgaria closed schools and restricted travel to 14 countries on Friday to contain the spread of coronavirus after the number of confirmed cases in the Balkan country more than tripled to 23 over one day.

Headlines: Charles Schwab reports strongest start to year as coronavirus fears grow
Description: Charles Schwab  reported the strongest start to a year with $45.3 billion in fresh assets under management during the first two months of 2020, driven by heightened volatility faced by equity markets amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Apple says reopening all its branded stores in China
Description: Apple Inc  is reopening all 42 of its branded stores in China on Friday, a company spokesman said, more than a month after they were shut in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Xerox to postpone meetings with HP shareholders amid coronavirus scare
Description: Xerox Holdings Corp, which is in a proxy fight for control of HP Inc, said on Friday it would postpone meetings with shareholders of the personal computer maker amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Fidelity Investments urges employees to work from home
Description: Fidelity Investments became the latest large financial firm to urge employees to work from home in order to slow the transmission of the coronavirus, according to a company memo.

Headlines: U.S. consumer sentiment drops in early February, coronavirus blamed
Description: U.S. consumer sentiment fell in early March as households responded to the coronavirus pandemic and steep declines in stock market prices, a survey showed on Friday.

Headlines: Ukraine to block entry to residents registered in separatist-held areas to stop coronavirus spread
Description: Ukraine's government at a televised meeting on Friday decided to ban citizens registered in separatist-held territory in the eastern Donbass region from entering government-controlled areas.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury chief sees short-term economic hit from coronavirus
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Friday said he expected the U.S. economic hit from the coronavirus outbreak to be short-term, and that the Trump administration was keeping its options open for any other future steps that may be needed.

Headlines: Canada may soon advise against foreign travel - PM Trudeau
Description: Canada may soon advise against non-essential foreign travel, and it will be taking a number of new measures at airports in a bid to slow the spread of coronavirus, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Friday.

Headlines: Morocco suspends all passenger sea and air trips to France - state news agency
Description: Morocco on Friday suspended all flights and passenger ship traffic to and from France, the state news agency said.

Headlines: No more nut rage: activist fund takes on family-controlled Korean Air
Description: Days after photographs of broken windows and smashed china hit the newsstands revealing a Christmas Day family squabble in the home of Korean Air's late patriarch, an activist fund received an unsolicited offer to help unseat the current chairman.

Headlines: World travel may shrink 25% on coronavirus in 2020, shed 50 million jobs - WTTC
Description: The coronavirus epidemic is putting up to 50 million jobs in the global travel and tourism sector at risk, with travel likely to slump by a quarter this year, Asia being the most affected continent, the World Travel and Tourism Council said on Friday.

Headlines: Spain's coronavirus tally jumps to 4,209 cases, 120 dead
Description: The Spanish health ministry said the number of coronavirus cases in the country jumped to 4,209 on Friday from Thursday's 3,004 e as the disease spread mostly in Madrid, the Basque Country and La Rioja regions.

Headlines: Sudan reports first coronavirus case
Description: Sudan on Friday reported its first confirmed coronavirus case, a man who died on Thursday and had visited the United Arab Emirates in the first week of March.

Headlines: Dutch coronavirus infections rise by 188 to 804, deaths double to 10
Description: The number of deaths in people with the coronavirus in the Netherlands has doubled to 10, Dutch health authorities said on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: France to allow some Huawei gear in its 5G network  - sources
Description: France will authorize the use of some of Huawei's equipment in the rollout of its 5G network, two sources close to the matter told Reuters, despite U.S. calls to exclude the Chinese telecoms giant from the West's next-generation communications.

Headlines: U.S. import prices post biggest drop in six months
Description: U.S. import prices fell by the most in six months in February as the cost of petroleum products dropped, and economists said they could decline further because of the coronavirus pandemic and an oil price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia.

Headlines: Nepal closes Mount Everest for climbers because of coronavirus fears
Description: Nepal has closed all of its Himalayan peaks including Mount Everest this climbing season because of fears of the coronavirus outbreak, a government minister said on Friday.

Headlines: Factbox: Latest on the spread of coronavirus around the world
Description: Global markets suffered record falls on Thursday as alarm over the coronavirus intensified and governments from Ireland to Italy unveiled measures to try to slow the spread of a disease that has infected more than 127,000 people worldwide.

Headlines: North Korea had military forces on lockdown for 30 days over coronavirus - U.S. general
Description: North Korea had its military forces on lockdown for about 30 days and in one instance did not fly a plane for 24 days, even though it has not confirmed any cases of coronavirus, the head of U.S. forces in South Korea said on Friday.

Headlines: Bulgaria bans travel to Iran, raises risk on travels to 11 countries
Description: Bulgaria's foreign ministry on Friday banned all travel to Iran and advised Bulgarians to cancel all non-urgent travel to Spain and South Korea in a bid to curb the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Fed's economic forecasts to give window into extent of coronavirus fears
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve policymakers have already begun responding to the coronavirus with an emergency interest rate cut and a reopening of their crisis tool kit, all without a clear idea of what damage is being done outside of plummeting financial markets.

Headlines: Why Brazilian airline shares are hardest hit by the coronavirus panic
Description: The airline stocks that suffered the most after U.S. President Donald Trump barred continental Europeans from traveling to the United States do not even operate flights between those two regions.

Headlines: Airline SAS to cut, suspend U.S. flights
Description: SAS  said on Friday it would cut flights to some U.S. destinations and suspend traffic to others in the wake of new U.S. travel restrictions from March 14.

Headlines: North Macedonia bars foreigners arriving from 'high-risk countries' over coronavirus
Description: North Macedonia's outgoing government barred public gatherings on Friday and said it would deny entry to foreign nationals arriving from "high-risk countries" affected by the coronavirus.

Headlines: UK's Johnson to talk to world leaders on coronavirus response: spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson will have conversations with other world leaders on Friday regarding the global response to the coronavirus outbreak, his spokesman said.

Headlines: Iraq puts Germany and Qatar on coronavirus entry ban list
Description: Iraq has banned entry to travelers coming from Germany and Qatar, its health minister said on Friday, bringing the total number of countries on its entry ban list to 13 as it tries to stem the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Ethiopia confirms its first case of coronavirus
Description: Ethiopia has confirmed its first case of the new coronavirus, the country's public health institute told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: What you need to know about coronavirus today
Description: Here's what you need to know about the coronavirus epidemic today:

Headlines: Czech government bans most travel in and out of country to fight coronavirus
Description: The Czech government has imposed a ban on foreigners entering the country and Czechs traveling abroad as of Monday as it tries to curb the coronavirus outbreak, Prime Minister Andrej Babis said on Friday.

Headlines: South Korea reports more recoveries than coronavirus cases for the first time
Description: South Korea reported more recoveries from the coronavirus than new infections on Friday for the first time since its outbreak emerged in January, as a downward trend in daily cases raised hopes that Asia's biggest epidemic outside China may be slowing.

Headlines: Zhang Yiming, founder of TikTok owner ByteDance, gears up for the global stage
Description: The founder of China's ByteDance, owner of the wildly successful TikTok app, has for years aspired to make ByteDance the first Chinese firm to rival U.S. internet giants on the global stage. On Thursday Zhang Yiming made a key move to achieve that.

Headlines: U.S. companies draw on credit lines, fearing they may lose them
Description: Banks have hundreds of billions of dollars in credit lines extended to corporate America. Some companies are no longer banking on them.

Headlines: After miracle recovery, Fukushima brewers look to the Games to push sake globally
Description: The earth in Fukushima still trembled when Yoshihiro Miyamori drove in the dark towards his sake brewery. When he got back after midnight, he found smashed sake bottles and a crack in the wall of the building. It was March 11, 2011.

Headlines: Buffett-backed Chinese EV maker BYD says making 5 million masks daily to fight virus
Description: Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD  said on Friday it is making 5 million masks a day to fight the coronavirus pandemic that has killed nearly 3,200 people in China.

Headlines: Canada's Trudeau to be in isolation after wife tests positive for coronavirus
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will be in isolation for two weeks after his wife, Sophie, tested positive for coronavirus on Thursday, and the outbreak prompted the province of Ontario to shutter schools to limit the spread.

Headlines: Starbucks to invest $130 million for roasting plant in China's Kunshan
Description: Starbucks will invest 900 million yuan ($130 million) to build the first phase of a coffee complex in the Chinese city of Kunshan, near the commercial hub of Shanghai, with completion targeted for 2022, it said on Friday.

Headlines: Hong Kong records fourth coronavirus-related death - hospital spokeswoman
Description: An 80-year old man became the fourth patient in Hong Kong to die due to the coronavirus, a Nethersole Eastern Hospital spokeswoman said on Friday.

Headlines: Singapore to bar recent visitors to Italy, Spain, Germany, France
Description: Singapore will deny from Monday entry or transit to visitors who have been in Italy, France, Spain or Germany in the last 14 days, as part of measures to control the fast-spreading coronavirus, the health ministry said on Friday.

Headlines: Bob Dylan concerts in Japan canceled as coronavirus spreads
Description: Bob Dylan's upcoming concerts in Japan have been canceled because of the coronavirus outbreak, the tour organizer said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. excludes some Chinese medical products from tariffs
Description: The U.S. Trade Representative's office said it granted on Thursday exclusions from import tariffs for some medical products imported from China, including face masks, stethoscope covers and blood pressure cuff sleeves.

Headlines: Juul co-founder James Monsees plans to leave
Description: Juul Labs Inc said on Thursday co-founder James Monsees plans to leave the e-cigarette maker, stepping down as an adviser and board member.

Headlines: Washington state repeals pro-Boeing tax break; U.S. hopes to avoid EU tariffs
Description: Washington state on Thursday moved to formally repeal an aerospace tax break that benefited U.S. planemaker Boeing and avert looming European Union tariffs on U.S. goods.

Headlines: Airbus: End of Washington state tax break of Boeing just 'initial step'
Description: Europe's Airbus on Thursday welcomed a move by Washington state to remove what it called "illegal subsidies" to Boeing, but said the U.S. planemaker had received billions of dollars in other subsidies and tax breaks.

Headlines: Global airlines call for government aid and United warns of cuts to U.S. routes
Description: Airlines on Thursday appealed for urgent government financial support as U.S. carriers rushed to cut flights to Europe in the wake of new U.S. travel restrictions aimed at combating the coronavirus outbreak, while United Airlines warned of U.S. travel disruption as the virus spreads domestically.

Headlines: U.S. airlines capping fares from Europe as Americans seek flights home
Description: American Airlines Inc , United Airlines  and Delta Air Lines Inc  on Thursday said they were capping fares for U.S.-bound flights from Europe as U.S. citizens flock to European airports trying to return home after new air travel restrictions ordered by U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Ford takes aim at Jeep with new Bronco SUVs
Description: Nearly 55 years after the debut of the original Ford Bronco — and 24 years after the demise of the last one — Ford Motor Co.  is dusting off one of its treasured nameplates this spring in hopes of reviving a decades-old rivalry with Fiat Chrysler Automobile’s  popular Jeep brand.

Headlines: Canada revising deal aimed at validating U.S.-certified planes
Description: Transport Canada said on Thursday it is revising a deal that would have reduced technical work done by the Canadian regulator when validating Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) certified aircraft like the Boeing 737 MAX.

Headlines: Wall Street dazed and confused after worst day since 1987
Description: As trading ended on Thursday in Wall Street's worst day for three decades, shell-shocked investors had no idea how much further the market was likely to fall as the coronavirus pandemic spread fear of a global recession.

Headlines: Wall Street sell-off batters bitcoin, pounds palladium as investors go to cash
Description: Crushing asset sell-offs ranging from bitcoin to precious metals and European stocks accompanied Wall Street's slide into bear market territory on Thursday, as investors liquidated positions across their portfolios to raise cash.

Headlines: Walgreens, Kroger limit purchase of some essential products amid virus outbreak
Description: Pharmacy chain Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc  and supermarket chain Kroger Co  on Thursday placed purchase limits on certain products to stabilize inventory, as customers stock up on essentials amid a global coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Gap sees 2020 profit above estimates, flags $100 mln virus hit to sales
Description: Gap Inc  leaned on its turnaround plan to forecast 2020 profit above market expectations on Thursday, but flagged a $100 million sales hit in Asia and Europe from the coronavirus, which has also started impacting its home market.

Headlines: Business jet operators see demand surge on U.S. travel restrictions, coronavirus
Description: New U.S. restrictions on Europeans entering the United States are fueling additional bookings for business jet flights, which were already in higher demand this year because of coronavirus, executives said on Thursday.

Headlines: Broadcom withdraws 2020 revenue forecast on coronavirus worries
Description: Broadcom Inc withdrew its revenue forecast for 2020 on Thursday, joining a host of chipmakers that have either cut or pulled their sales outlook due to demand and supply disruptions caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Plunging Wall Street stocks end record bull run
Description: Wall Street tanked on Thursday, slamming the book on the longest-ever U.S. bull market after new travel restrictions to curb the coronavirus spread spooked investors and rattled world markets.

Headlines: Wall Street's 'fear gauge' marks record surge after stock sell-off
Description: An avalanche of selling in stocks on fears over the coronavirus outbreak took Wall Street's "fear gauge" to its highest level since the financial crisis on Thursday.

Headlines: Oracle's cloud push powers quarterly profit, revenue beat
Description: Growth in cloud business helped Oracle Corp top quarterly profit and revenue on Thursday and said the coronavirus will have "minimal impact" on the fourth-quarter revenue, which is usually skewed toward software licenses rather than hardware.

Headlines: Slack shares slump on soft outlook, slower growth
Description: Workplace communication platform Slack Technologies Inc forecast a soft revenue outlook for the first quarter on Thursday, sending its shares down more than 20% aftermarket, on a day major U.S. stock indexes went into a tailspin amid coronavirus fears.

Headlines: Amazon tells staff globally to work from home if possible
Description: Amazon.com Inc  on Thursday said it was recommending that employees globally work from home this month if they are able to do so, while warehouses and other facilities stayed operational so packages could keep shipping to customers.

Headlines: AT&T waives data overage fees for home subscribers; Comcast boosts speeds for some users
Description: AT&T Inc  said on Thursday it is waiving data overage fees for all home internet users who are not currently on unlimited data plans, citing the coronavirus outbreak, while Comcast Holdings Corp  said it was raising data speeds on the internet service it offers low-income people.

Headlines: Banks remind customers they can bank online amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Banks are talking up their online and mobile banking capabilities to customers as more Americans look to avoid public places amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Wall Street empties out as New York City declares state of emergency
Description: Working from home went from optional to mandatory across Wall Street this week as financial firms reported their first confirmed cases of coronavirus and the outbreak triggered a state of emergency in New York City.

Headlines: Panic grips financial markets after U.S. travel curbs, ECB move
Description: Panic hit world financial markets on Thursday after stimulus efforts from the European Central Bank failed to calm investors alarmed by U.S. moves to restrict travel from Europe because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: As Trump's stock market gains shrink, he says it will 'work out fine'
Description: For three years, U.S. President Donald Trump has touted a stunning run-up in the stock market as evidence of his success in the White House. In the space of three weeks, most of those gains have evaporated.

Headlines: United to scale back flights to Europe after March 19
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  said on Thursday it will continue to fly its regular schedule from Europe to the United States through March 19 but is scaling back flights after that date.

Headlines: Boeing shares plummet as travel restrictions hit airlines
Description: Shares in Boeing Co  fell sharply for a second day on Thursday as sweeping U.S. travel restrictions on Europe, meant to curb the spreading coronavirus, heightened jitters about the company's growing cash burn.

Headlines: JetBlue CEO latest airline executive to take salary cut amid coronavirus
Description: JetBlue Airways  Chief Executive Robin Hayes is taking a temporary salary cut of 20%, the company said on Thursday, the latest airline executive to reduce or forgo base pay in an effort to rein in costs amid the spreading coronavirus.

Headlines: Trump signs law to prevent U.S. rural telecom carriers from using Huawei network equipment
Description: President Donald Trump signed legislation on Thursday to bar telecom carriers from using U.S. subsidies to purchase network equipment from Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL], ZTE Corp   and other companies deemed a national security threat.

Headlines: Airbnb bookings take hit amid global coronavirus outbreak
Description: U.S. home rental company Airbnb Inc's bookings in major cities across the world have taken a blow due to coronavirus-fueled uncertainty in the travel industry, data from Airbnb-analytics firm AirDNA shows.

Headlines: Oil falls 7% after Trump surprises with travel curbs
Description: Brent crude slid 7% on Thursday after President Donald Trump restricted travel to the United States from Europe as part of measures to try to halt the spread of coronavirus after the World Health Organization described the outbreak as a pandemic.

Headlines: Rio Tinto to pay ex-CEO's deferred bonus with interest
Description: Rio Tinto Ltd will pay out part of a delayed bonus to former Chief Executive Sam Walsh after a dispute resolution process found that the payments should not be held up, both parties said on Thursday.

Headlines: Explainer: Fed may go into its crisis tool kit soon. What's in it?
Description: Analysts and economists increasingly expect the Federal Reserve to roll out measures beyond interest rate cuts and bond purchases to ensure financial markets keep operating smoothly and banks have ample liquidity during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Verizon raises 2020 capital expenditure in 5G push
Description: Verizon Communications Inc on Thursday raised its full-year capital expenditure as it accelerates its transition to 5G network.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims drop, but coronavirus layoffs loom
Description: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits unexpectedly fell last week as employers continued to hold on to their workers, but the coronavirus pandemic is expected to lead to an increase in layoffs as companies battle supply chain disruptions and sagging demand for some goods and services.

Headlines: U.S. Labor Department allows jobless benefits for coronavirus
Description: The U.S. Labor Department on Thursday gave states flexibility to amend their laws to provide unemployment benefits in events related to the coronavirus in an effort to limit the damage on the economy from the pandemic.

Headlines: French watchdog to fine Apple over anti-competitive behaviour, sources say
Description: France's competition watchdog is set to fine iPhone maker Apple Inc  next Monday over anti-competitive behaviour in its distribution and sales network, two sources close to the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: American Airlines flight attendants brace for more flight cancellations
Description: American Airlines Group Inc's flight attendants union said on Thursday it was bracing for an increase in flight cancellations after sweeping U.S. restrictions on travel from Europe.

Headlines: Activist investor Icahn raises stake in Occidental to nearly 10%
Description: Billionaire investor Carl Icahn has raised his stake in Occidental Corp  to nearly 10% from 2.53% at the end of last year and once again pushed for an overhaul of the oil and gas producer's board, an SEC filing http://bit.ly/2Qb9byt on Thursday showed.

Headlines: Emirates freezes recruitment as airline braces for further coronavirus impact
Description: Emirates, one of the world's biggest international airlines, expects to cancel more flights and has frozen recruitment as it faces what could be its biggest challenge in many years, the coronavirus outbreak, internal emails seen by Reuters showed.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank seeks to reassure employees, investors as stock slides
Description: Deutsche Bank's  top executives sought to assure employees and investors over its ability to weather the coronavirus as shares in the German lender hit a new low on Thursday amid a wider stock market sell-off.

Headlines: Markets in virus panic: day's plunge in charts
Description: A coronavirus-induced meltdown on Wall Street and other financial markets saw prices plunge on Thursday for everything from stocks and corporate bonds to bitcoin, oil and gold -- wiping trillions of dollars from investment portfolios and company valuations.

Headlines: Volkswagen plans to tap electric car batteries to compete with power firms
Description: Volkswagen's  expansion in electric cars will open up new business opportunities in storing and managing energy, encroaching on business currently dominated by utilities and energy firms, chief strategist Michael Jost said on Thursday.

Headlines: IATA urges governments to support airlines in wake of U.S. travel ban
Description: The airlines industry body called on governments on Thursday to support transatlantic carriers hit by cash-flow problems due to the coronavirus crisis by offering measures such as credit lines and tax breaks.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers seek to curb Huawei's access to U.S. banks: document
Description: U.S. lawmakers plan to unveil a bill on Thursday that could be used to block Huawei Technologies Ltd from accessing U.S. banks for certain transactions, in a bid to thwart the Chinese telecoms giant amid frustration over the failure of prior sanctions to curb its business.

Headlines: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon home from hospital, recovering 'well': bank
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon was released from a New York hospital and is now at home recovering from an emergency heart surgery he underwent last week, the bank said on Thursday.

Headlines: Coronavirus halts Lufthansa's sale of international catering ops
Description: German carrier Lufthansa  has been forced by the coronavirus epidemic to halt the sale of the international operations of its airline caterer LSG, the company said on Thursday, confirming an earlier Reuters report.

Headlines: OAG says United, Delta, Lufthansa to bear brunt of U.S. travel curbs
Description: U.S. travel restrictions on passengers arriving from Europe's border-free Schengen area will affect passengers arriving on 6,747 flights over the next four weeks or 11% of all international flights, flight data provider OAG said.

Headlines: Volkswagen hopes new software will banish accidents by 2050
Description: Volkswagen  will launch a new software operating system this year that it hopes will make accidents involving its cars a thing of the past by 2050, the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: LATAM Airlines, Azul to cut international flights up to 30% due to coronavirus
Description: LATAM Airlines Group  and Brazil carrier Azul SA  said on Thursday they will cut capacity on international flights by up to 30% as demand collapses due to the global coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sinclair Oil weighs offers for company sale: sources
Description: Sinclair Oil Corp, which operates two Wyoming refineries and has licensed more than 1,000 branded gasoline stations, is reviewing offers to buy the company, according to three people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: NYSE president says no plan to close trading floor now
Description: The New York Stock Exchange does not currently plan to close its trading floor and the markets are functioning as expected, even as concerns over the coronavirus cause sharp spikes in volatility, NYSE President Stacey Cunningham said on Thursday.

Headlines: GameStop investors seek board seat after expiry of standstill pact
Description: A group of investors in GameStop Corp  on Thursday asked the video game retailer to appoint a shareholder nominee on its board, after a year-long standstill agreement with the company to not express concerns publicly expired recently.

Headlines: Italian businesses count heavy cost of coronavirus lockdown
Description: Even if Italy's draconian measures to stop the spread of coronavirus prove successful, they will leave an economy in tatters, with small and medium-sized businesses the hardest hit.

Headlines: Airline SAS sees double-digit percentage fall in bookings
Description: Airline SAS  has seen a double-digit percentage fall in bookings due to the coronavirus outbreak, its chief executive told Danish daily Berlingske in an interview on Thursday.

Headlines: Cineworld could breach debt terms in worst-case virus scenario
Description: Cineworld  could fail to meet its debt commitments in a worst-case coronavirus scenario, it warned on Thursday, though it plans to press ahead with its $1.65 billion takeover of Canadian rival Cineplex .

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims unexpectedly fall
Description: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefit unexpectedly fell last week, but could rise in the coming weeks as the coronavirus pandemic causes companies to layoff workers amid supply chain disruptions and waning demand for some goods and services.

Headlines: United Airlines borrows $2 billion as coronavirus slams industry
Description: United Airlines  said on Thursday it had borrowed $2 billion to cope with an unprecedented disruption to the travel industry as the coronavirus pandemic leads to widescale flight cancellations and global travel bans.

Headlines: Corporate credit risk heightens as coronavirus impact spreads
Description: Investor worries about corporate credit are heating up as the coronavirus spreads, with the prices of bond funds taking a hit, companies starting to draw on credit lines and some market watchers warning of the possibility that investors pull out of products.

Headlines: Insurers face double whammy from coronavirus crisis
Description: Having initially brushed off the potential impact from coronavirus-linked claims, global insurers are waking up to the prospect of a double whammy - a sharp rise in payouts at a time of big investment losses.

Headlines: Blackstone says no blanket policy to tap credit lines
Description: Private equity firm Blackstone Group Inc  does not have a sweeping directive in place to encourage companies in its portfolio to draw down credit lines in a bid to ride out the coronavirus pandemic, the company said in a statement.

Headlines: Travel curbs on European travelers to U.S. to hit airlines: trade body
Description: A United States travel ban on European visitors will hit U.S. airlines, their employees, and travelers "extremely hard", trade group Airlines for America said on Wednesday.

Headlines: China airlines report $3 billion loss in Feb as virus erodes travel demand: regulator
Description: Chinese airlines reported a total loss of 20.96 billion yuan ($3 billion) in February as the coronavirus epidemic spread and hit travel demand, the aviation regulator said on Thursday.

Headlines: European airline stocks in tailspin after Trump travel ban
Description: European airline stocks plunged as much as 20% on Thursday after U.S. President Donald Trump said he would restrict travel from Europe to the United States for 30 days to try to contain the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: As one of China's 'Detroits' reopens, world's automakers worry about disruptions
Description: Automakers across the world face the possibility of extended supply chain disruptions as factories in China stutter back to life after closures due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Factbox: Automakers' sales sink in China due to coronavirus epidemic
Description: Vehicle sales in China, the world's biggest car market, tumbled in February as customers stayed at home and away from dealerships due to the coronavirus epidemic that has killed more than 3,100 people in the world's second-biggest economy.

Headlines: Shell CEO's 2019 pay halves after fatalities, revenue fall
Description: Royal Dutch Shell  Chief Executive Ben van Beurden's pay package halved last year to 10 million euros ($11.3 million) after the energy company suffered seven deaths and saw a drop in revenue.

Headlines: China automakers seek government relief after February sales dive 79% on coronavirus
Description: Automakers in China are calling on the government to help after industry-wide sales plunged 79% in February to mark their biggest ever monthly decline, with demand pummelled by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: BOJ's Kuroda meets with PM Abe and vows response to coronavirus
Description: The Bank of Japan is ready to take further steps to support the economy in the face of the coronavirus epidemic, Governor Haruhiko Kuroda said after a meeting with Prime Minister Shinzo Abe on Thursday.

Headlines: JP Morgan abandons Boeing buy call after three years
Description: JP Morgan analysts have given up on their long-term "overweight" call on Boeing Co  shares, cutting their price target for the company by $160 to just $210 dollars in a note to clients on Thursday.

Headlines: Silver lining for some: virus shutdown boosts China non-life insurers
Description: Chinese non-life insurers are discovering a silver lining to the cloud spreading over China's economic performance from the coronavirus outbreak - a sharp drop in car accident claims.

Headlines: Sell signal: Trump's shallow virus plan blows floor out of markets
Description: All global investors got from U.S. President Donald Trump's coronavirus package were a shock travel ban on Europe and a flashing signal to sell, and none of the large-scale tax breaks or medical tests for Americans they'd been expecting.

Headlines: As S&P 500 selloff approaches 20%, what next?
Description: Fear about the coronavirus has pulled the S&P 500 down nearly 20% from its record high. So what?

Headlines: Tesco does not expect more than short-term shortages over coronavirus
Description: Britain's biggest supermarket Tesco  does not expect to see anything more than short-term shortages of certain products as customers stockpile over coronavirus, its chairmain said on Thursday.

Headlines: Nestle mandates JPMorgan to handle Yinlu sale: Bloomberg
Description: Food giant Nestle  has mandated JPMorgan Chase & Co. to handle the sale of its struggling Chinese peanut milk business Yinlu that could be valued at about $1 billion, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Seeking to avoid EU tariffs, Washington state House passes bill to drop Boeing tax break
Description: Washington state's House of Representatives passed a measure on Wednesday night that removes a key tax break for Boeing Co  and other aerospace firms, in a bid to head off possible European tariffs on U.S. goods and ease a transatlantic trade dispute over aircraft subsidies.

Headlines: Bombardier CEO Alain Bellemare to step down
Description: Canada's Bombardier Inc  said late Wednesday Chief Executive Officer Alain Bellemare would step down and be replaced by former company executive and Hydro-Quebec CEO Eric Martel.

Headlines: U.S. will loan $50 billion to small businesses, defer taxes to fight coronavirus, Trump says
Description: The United States will give individuals, and small and mid-sized businesses a three-month tax holiday to try to fight the economic impact of the novel coronavirus, President Donald Trump said Wednesday night.

Headlines: Japan's Sharp files patent infringement lawsuit against U.S. TV brand Vizio
Description: Japan's Sharp Corp said on Wednesday it has filed a patent infringement lawsuit against U.S. TV brand Vizio Inc and two others, seeking an injunction to ban one of Vizio's TV products in the United States.

Headlines: Carl Icahn lifts stake in Occidental Petroleum to nearly 10%: WSJ
Description: Activist investor Carl Icahn has increased his stake in Occidental Petroleum Corp to almost 10%, scaling up his fight to take control of the oil producer, the Wall Street Journal (WSJ) reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wall Street tumbles, Dow confirms bear market
Description: Wall Street stocks plunged on Wednesday, with the Dow  confirming a bear market for the first time since the financial crisis after the World Health Organization called the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Boeing to separate 737 MAX wire bundles before jet's return to service - sources
Description: Boeing Co  plans to separate 737 MAX wiring bundles, flagged by regulators as potentially dangerous, before the jet returns to service, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. companies add cash, credit lines as coronavirus leaves markets rattled
Description: U.S. companies rushed to bulk up their cash reserves amid market turmoil fueled by the global coronavirus outbreak and a plunge in oil prices.

Headlines: U.S. oil company workers make big, bad retirement bet: their own stock
Description: Employees at the largest U.S. oil companies have lost around $5 billion in retirement savings since the end of 2018 because of outsized bets on their own slumping stock, according to a Reuters analysis of company disclosures, a trend exacerbated by the recent crash in oil prices.

Headlines: Wall Street tells Trump financial system strong, ready to support borrowers
Description: The U.S. banking industry is strong and ready to help businesses and consumers weather economic fallout from the fast-spreading coronavirus, Wall Street chief executives told President Donald Trump during a meeting at the White House on Wednesday.

Headlines: Coronavirus raises fears of U.S. auto sales slowdown, but production not suffering yet
Description: Fears of a U.S. sales slowdown in auto showrooms due to the coronavirus outbreak that has spread globally are appearing in analysts' forecasts, but industry executives said the pandemic has yet to affect demand or factory production.

Headlines: Cost of General Electric credit insurance rises along with coronavirus concerns
Description: The cost to insure General Electric Co  debt has shot up to levels last seen in 2018, possibly reflecting concern about the company's exposure to coronavirus-induced declines in interest rates, air travel and global growth.

Headlines: U.S. 'looking at' CalPERS holdings in Chinese defense firms: top White House official
Description: The Trump administration is "looking at" investments in Chinese military companies by the California Public Employees' Retirement System (CalPERS), U.S. national security adviser Robert O'Brien said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Coronavirus leads Warren Buffett to mull changes to Berkshire Hathaway shareholder weekend: Omaha mayor
Description: Warren Buffett plans to wait until around April 1 to decide whether the coronavirus pandemic will require changes to Berkshire Hathaway Inc's  annual shareholder weekend a month later, Omaha, Nebraska's mayor Jean Stothert said.

Headlines: California, other states end opposition to T-Mobile, Sprint merger
Description: California and other states which had fought a merger of Sprint Corp  and T-Mobile US Inc  over concerns about higher prices for consumers and less innovation have agreed to end their opposition to the deal in a settlement with the companies.

Headlines: Dow enters bear market territory on coronavirus uncertainty as WHO declares pandemic
Description: The dollar weakened and the Dow Jones industrials entered bear market territory on Wednesday on mounting worries about the global economy after world health officials declared a coronavirus pandemic and Reuters reported a White House gag order on top-level U.S. meetings on the outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. sporting goods retailer Modell's files for bankruptcy protection
Description: Sporting goods retailer Modell's Sporting Goods filed for Chapter 11 protection in the U.S. bankruptcy court in New Jersey on Wednesday, citing a challenging retail environment.

Headlines: Best Buy executive chairman to step down
Description: Retailer Best Buy Co Inc  said on Wednesday Executive Chairman Hubert Joly would step down and will not stand for re-election at the shareholder meeting on June 11.

Headlines: Bankers meet with Trump, say prepared to help economy
Description: Leading U.S. bank executives in a meeting with President Donald Trump at the White House said banks are strongly capitalized and prepared to help small businesses and American consumers weather the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Boeing to freeze hiring as cash woes mount over coronavirus, 737 MAX
Description: Boeing Co  is freezing new hiring and overtime except in certain critical areas to preserve cash, the U.S. planemaker's CEO said on Wednesday, as the coronavirus outbreak compounds the fallout from a year-old grounding of its money-spinning 737 MAX.

Headlines: U.S. again postpones high-level meeting on Huawei and China: sources
Description: Trump administration officials have postponed for a second time a critical meeting originally set for Wednesday to discuss potential new U.S. restrictions on sales of technology to Huawei and China, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Amtrak says bookings plunge, is set to lose several hundred million dollars on coronavirus fears
Description: U.S. passenger railroad Amtrak said on Wednesday that bookings had plunged 50% since the coronavirus outbreak and that it now expected significant service reductions and losses of hundreds of millions of dollars.

Headlines: Oil slumps as stock markets sink, while Saudi, UAE plan to boost capacity
Description: Oil prices fell 4% on Wednesday, sinking into the close of trading with renewed weakness in the stock market after the World Health Organization said the global coronavirus outbreak is now a pandemic, and as major oil producers announced plans to escalate the burgeoning price war.

Headlines: Saudi, UAE gear up for long-term oil market fight with capacity plans
Description: Top oil exporter Saudi Arabia said on Wednesday it would launch a program to boost production capacity for the first time in more than a decade, signaling to Russia and other rivals it was ready for a long battle over production levels and market share.

Headlines: Explainer: Coronavirus fears hit the market hard. How much did ordinary Americans lose?
Description: The deep declines in the U.S. stock market over coronavirus fears the last three weeks have left a dent in retirement portfolios and brokerage accounts, costing on average each person in the United States around $16,000 as of Monday's close before a rebound Tuesday erased some of those losses.

Headlines: Coronavirus shifts U.S. recession debate from 'if' to 'what shape'?
Description: Until recently, economists were debating what it would take for the U.S. economy to fall into a recession. But after taking a cue from markets, the conversation for some economists has shifted from whether there will be a sharp downturn, to figuring out what shape the recovery could take.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. SEC steps up scrutiny of private debt 'financial games'
Description: The top U.S. securities regulator has increased its scrutiny of private funds that make higher-risk loans over the last two years, according to a Reuters review of SEC actions and industry and regulatory sources -- just as fears of a global recession hit the booming private credit market.

Headlines: Rising food costs lift U.S. consumer prices; coronavirus to weigh on inflation
Description: U.S. consumer prices unexpectedly rose in February but could drop in the months ahead as the coronavirus outbreak depresses demand for some goods and services, outweighing price increases related to shortages caused by disruptions to the supply chain.

Headlines: U.S. government posts $235 billion budget deficit in February
Description: The U.S. government recorded a $235 billion budget deficit in February, the Treasury Department said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Delta Air extends suspension of U.S.-China flights through May 31
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc  said on Wednesday it was extending the suspension of all flights between the United States and China from April 30 to May 31 due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Starboard nominates minority slate of directors to eBay board: WSJ
Description: Activist investor Starboard Value LP has nominated a minority slate of directors to eBay Inc's board, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Factbox: Airlines count mounting costs of the coronavirus shock
Description: Airlines across the globe are feeling the pain as travel demand withers because of the coronavirus outbreak. Several have  grounded many flights and ditched their financial outlooks.

Headlines: Uber may suspend accounts of riders, drivers who test positive for coronavirus
Description: Uber Technologies Inc  on Wednesday said it may temporarily suspend accounts of riders and drivers who have tested positive for the coronavirus or been exposed to it at the direction of health authorities.

Headlines: NYSE takes steps to keep coronavirus from trading floor: memo
Description: The New York Stock Exchange is taking steps to separate traders on the floor of its iconic 11 Wall Street building and employees of the NYSE and its parent Intercontinental Exchange Inc , to reduce the risk of spreading coronavirus, according to an internal memo sent Wednesday.

Headlines: FAA chief confirms agency did not approve Boeing wiring bundles proposal
Description: Federal Aviation Administration chief Steve Dickson confirmed Wednesday the agency has rejected Boeing Co's  proposal to leave wiring bundles in place on the grounded 737 MAX.

Headlines: S&P 500 bull market will soon end: Goldman Sachs
Description: Goldman Sachs said on Wednesday the S&P 500 bull market, the longest on record, is likely to end soon, forecasting a 28% slump from its February peak as the fast-spreading coronavirus is seen taking a toll on corporate profits.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia asked state agencies to implement big budget cuts: sources
Description: Saudi Arabia has asked state agencies to submit proposals for cuts of at least 20% to their budgets in a fresh austerity drive to cope with a sharp drop in oil prices, four sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: U.S. senator says Trump administration mulling use of oil reserve to help crude producers
Description: U.S. Senator John Thune said on Wednesday he believes the Trump administration is evaluating use of the Strategic Petroleum Reserve, and other measures, to help oil producers deal with the plunge in crude prices due to the coronavirus and a price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia.

Headlines: Many Disney shareholders push back against executive pay
Description: A large minority of Walt Disney Co  shareholders who cast votes at the company's annual meeting on Wednesday opposed the company's executive pay plan, Disney said.

Headlines: Adidas sees $1.1 billion coronavirus hit to China sales, Puma warns on profit
Description: German sportswear makers Adidas  and Puma  warned on Wednesday of a major decline in sales in China due to the coronavirus and said while there were early signs of improvement there the impact had spread to other markets.

Headlines: Boeing to draw down billions in loan cash as pressure builds
Description: Boeing Co  is planning to draw down the rest of a $13.8 billion loan it agreed last month, a source told Reuters on Wednesday, as the coronavirus outbreak adds to pressure on the U.S. plane-maker due to the grounding of its 737 MAX jets.

Headlines: BlackRock says voted against Qualcomm executive pay, director
Description: Top fund manager BlackRock Inc  said on Wednesday it cast an advisory vote against the pay of executives at chipmaker Qualcomm Inc, , and against a compensation committee member, citing a concern that a one-time stock award was "not aligned" with shareholder interests.

Headlines: Equinor's offshore oil rig infection exposes coronavirus dangers
Description: Equinor  reported the oil industry's first coronavirus infection on an offshore installation on Wednesday, highlighting the challenge in preventing contamination for thousands of workers living in the close quarters on rigs and platforms.

Headlines: Boeing scores widebody orders in February, MAX cancellations mount
Description: Boeing Co  said on Wednesday it took in 18 new orders for widebody planes in February but saw more customers cancel orders of its grounded and previously best-selling 737 MAX jet, as it faced another blow to demand from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: PepsiCo aims for energy boost with $3.85 billion Rockstar deal
Description: PepsiCo Inc  on Wednesday made its biggest bet in the energy drinks market with a $3.85 billion deal to buy Rockstar Energy Beverages, opening a new front in its long-running battle with Coca-Cola Co .

Headlines: Telefonica, TIM plan joint bid for Oi's mobile business in Brazil
Description: Shares in Telefonica Brasil SA  and TIM Participações SA  rose in the morning trading as both companies said they are planning a joint offer to buy the mobile unit of bankrupt Brazilian carrier Oi SA .

Headlines: Britain fires with both barrels: emergency rate cut and budget boost
Description: The Bank of England slashed interest rates by half a percentage point on Wednesday and announced support for bank lending just hours before the unveiling of a budget splurge designed to stave off a recession triggered by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: BoE allows banks to tap capital cushion during coronavirus
Description: The Bank of England told banks on Wednesday they can tap one of their capital buffers to maintain lending during the coronavirus epidemic, but warned they must not use the cash for bumping up bonuses or dividends.

Headlines: U.S. farmers still dependent on trade aid after China deal
Description: As U.S. President Donald Trump touted the signing of a U.S.-China trade deal in January, he told cash-strapped farmers they would soon need bigger tractors and "a little more land" to meet additional Chinese demand for U.S. agricultural goods.

Headlines: Highlights: Bank of England governor speaks at press conference
Description: The Bank of England governor Mark Carney and his successor, Andrew Bailey, spoke at a press conference after the central bank unexpectedly cut interest rates by half a percentage point to 0.25% on Wednesday.

Headlines: BoE's Carney: No reason why UK economy should be hit as badly as 2008
Description: There is no reason why the coronavirus outbreak should damage Britain's economy as badly as the financial crisis did in 2008, Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Factbox: The economic remedies for the coronavirus
Description: Policymakers have taken a range of approaches to deal with the economic fallout from the coronavirus, from emergency interest rate cuts and big spending packages to a wait-and-see-stance and pledges of action if required.

Headlines: Fed faces headache, taps epidemiologists in hunt for policy clues
Description: The escalating coronavirus outbreak is giving the U.S. Federal Reserve a policy headache like never before: how to judge the potential impact on the economy in the absence of reliable data on how fast the flu-like illness is spreading across the United States.

Headlines: U.S. senator calls for action on forced labor in China's Xinjiang
Description: A senior U.S. senator on Tuesday accused U.S. firms of willfully ignoring "horrific" forced labor conditions in China's Xinjiang region and called on the Commerce Department to stop American companies and consumers buying goods produced by such labor.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler temporarily halts some Italian plants to battle virus
Description: Fiat Chrysler  is temporarily halting operations at some plants in Italy and will reduce production rates in response to the coronavirus outbreak in the country, the largest in Europe, a spokesman for the automaker said on Wednesday.

Headlines: BoE's Carney says coordinating with finance ministry for max impact
Description: Governor Mark Carney said on Wednesday the Bank of England was coordinating with Britain's finance minister to ensure its surprise interest rate cut and other measures announced on Wednesday would have maximum impact.

Headlines: Text: Bank of England cuts rates to 0.25% to bolster UK economy
Description: The Bank of England cut its key interest rate to 0.25 percent on Wednesday and announced a raft of other measures to bolster Britain's economy against disruption caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Business travel sector to lose $820 billion in revenue on coronavirus hit: industry group
Description: The global business travel sector is expected to take a revenue hit of about $820 billion, with China accounting for nearly half of the losses, as corporates curb travel plans in the face of the coronavirus epidemic, an industry body said http://bit.ly/38HSMrG on Tuesday.

Headlines: Banks at risk of losing billions of dollars in fee-based revenues: study
Description: Major banks are at risk of losing billions of dollars of fee-based retail revenue as they face increased regulatory pressure and growing competition from new entrants offering no-fee services, Accenture Plc  said on Wednesday.

Headlines: China's building work stalls in February, as virus keeps workers indoors
Description: China's construction activities were stalled in February as the government extended Lunar New Year holidays and advised people to stay indoors as a precaution against a coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Air freight rates skyrocket amid passenger flight cuts, Chinese factory restarts
Description: Air freight rates are skyrocketing after the grounding of many passenger flights in Asia has left shippers scrambling to book limited spots on cargo planes as Chinese industrial production restarts, according to industry insiders.

Headlines: Citigroup hires Loretta Ko to head financial institution group
Description: Citigroup  has hired Loretta Ko to return to the  investment bank and head its financial institutions group (FIG) for Hong Kong, the bank said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. coronavirus stimulus according to Trump, Republicans, and Democrats
Description: President Donald Trump met with fellow Republicans in the U.S. Senate on Tuesday to discuss a fiscal stimulus plan to bolster the nation's economy in the face of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Trump's coronavirus stimulus is still evolving. Here's what it should include, experts say
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he will ask Congress for a payroll tax cut and other "very major" stimulus moves on Tuesday to ease the economic pain of the coronavirus, but the details remain unclear.

Headlines: Factbox: Sports events hit by the coronavirus epidemic
Description: Here is a list of international sports events hit by the coronavirus outbreak:

Headlines: College textbook merger raises 'serious concern' among U.S. lawmakers
Description: Two U.S. lawmakers expressed serious concern on Tuesday about the effect of a planned merger of college textbook publishers Cengage Learning Holdings II and McGraw-Hill Education Inc, saying the deal would create a new industry leader with nearly half the market.

Headlines: Wells Fargo CEO tells Congress bank has doubled down on regulatory issues
Description: New Wells Fargo & Co Chief Executive Charlie Scharf testified on Tuesday that substantial change was underway at the bank as lawmakers grilled him on the status of its remediation efforts and contingency plans related to coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. lawmaker cites conflicts in Fifth Third phony accounts probe
Description: A senior Democratic senator on Tuesday raised concerns that a federal regulator probing allegations that Fifth Third Bancorp employees created phony accounts may be conflicted because one of its staffers previously worked at the bank.

Headlines: Tesla scouting central U.S. for new factory, Musk says
Description: Tesla Inc  Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk said on Tuesday he was looking for locations in the central United States to build a new factory for the company's electric pickup truck.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia, Russia raise stakes in oil production standoff
Description: Saudi Arabia said on Tuesday it would boost its oil supplies to a record high in April, raising the stakes in a standoff with Russia and effectively rebuffing Moscow's suggestion for new talks.

Headlines: Citing past success, Mexico seeks to mediate Russia, Saudi Arabia oil row
Description: Mexico and other nations are seeking to mediate between Russia and Saudi Arabia to end a price war that has battered world markets, Mexico's finance minister said on Tuesday, citing his country's prior experience in calming a crude producer feud.

Headlines: Wall Street bounces back as stimulus hopes soothe recession fears
Description: Wall Street roared back to life on Tuesday, rebounding from the brink of bear market confirmation as bargain-hunting and hopes of government stimulus calmed investors' fears surrounding the coronavirus and growing signs of imminent recession.

Headlines: Uber's challenge to balance driver safety with customer privacy
Description: Margaret Bordelon can still feel the hands of the drunk man who tried to pull her in for a kiss at the end of his Uber ride last September in Lafayette, Louisiana.

Headlines: From Exxon to Royal Caribbean Cruises, U.S. companies rush to hoard cash
Description: Corporate America is gearing up for leaner times.

Headlines: U.S. airlines see distant recovery as coronoavirus hits travel
Description: Leading U.S. airlines on Tuesday ditched 2020 forecasts and unveiled more sweeping capacity cuts and cost-saving measures in response to the spreading coronavirus, while United Airlines  warned of a deep hit to the sector.

Headlines: Financial firms around the world ramp up contingency plans as coronavirus hits
Description: Banks and other large financial companies in major cities across the world ramped up their emergency measures to combat the spread of the coronavirus on Tuesday, with Barclays Plc   and BlackRock Inc  confirming one case in their New York offices.

Headlines: Bank of America top technology officer Boville has left: source
Description: Bank of America Corp's  chief technology officer, Howard Boville, has left the company, according to a source familiar with the matter.

Headlines: McDonald's hourly workers in U.S. demand paid sick leave as virus spreads
Description: Hourly wage workers at McDonald's Corp on Tuesday sought paid sick leave for those working at its U.S. restaurants and an update to the safety protocols as coronavirus cases in the United States rise.

Headlines: Reasons for optimism - and wariness - about the U.S. stock market
Description: A day after Wall Street suffered its worst one-day drop since the financial crisis, investors are faced with an unfamiliar dilemma: bet that stocks will bounce back from the cusp of a bear market, or avoid scooping them up for now over fears they are far from a bottom.

Headlines: Oil jumps 8% on stimulus hopes, spending cuts by U.S. producers
Description: Oil prices jumped over 8% on Tuesday, bouncing from the biggest rout in nearly 30 years a day earlier, as the possibility of economic stimulus encouraged buying and U.S. producers slashed spending in a move that could cut output.

Headlines: NYSE short interest rose 2.74% in late Feb.
Description: Short interest on the New York Stock Exchange rose 2.74% in late February, the exchange said on Tuesday, suggesting an increase in bearish sentiment in the stock market.

Headlines: Nasdaq short interest up 0.3% in late February
Description: Short interest on the Nasdaq rose 0.3% in late February, the exchange said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Oil jumps 10%, U.S. stocks rebound after market rout
Description: Oil and global equity markets charged back on Tuesday after the prior day's steep losses as the world's biggest economies moved to cushion the impact of the coronavirus, but stock gains in Europe failed to hold as investors remained skittish.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs is 'very open' to acquisitions: CFO
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  Chief Financial Officer Stephen Scherr said on Tuesday the bank is "very open" to acquisitions, especially those that would speed the growth of its existing  businesses.

Headlines: Closely watched opioid trial in New York postponed due to coronavirus
Description: A highly anticipated trial pitting New York state against McKesson Corp , Johnson & Johnson , CVS Health Corp  and others for allegedly fueling the opioid epidemic has been postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak, according to the court.

Headlines: Fidelity names veteran Maggie Serravalli as CFO
Description: Fidelity Investments named company veteran Maggie Serravalli as chief financial officer, replacing Gerard McGraw, according to a note viewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley confirms New York employee tests positive for coronavirus
Description: Morgan Stanley  confirmed on Tuesday that an employee at the bank's campus in Purchase, New York, has tested positive for coronavirus, according to a bank memo obtained by Reuters that was verified by the bank.

Headlines: Airlines try to stave off calamity as coronavirus locks down Italy
Description: Airlines around the world sank deeper into crisis on Tuesday as the worsening coronavirus epidemic and Italy's lockdown hammered passenger numbers, forced the cancellation of thousands of flights and led to the delaying of plane orders.

Headlines: Airline SAS asks employees to take a 20% pay cut
Description: Airline SAS has invited unions to discuss a 20% work and pay cut for all employees as it fights to mitigate the effects of a slump in demand due to the coronavirus outbreak, it said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Barclays reports coronavirus case on New York trading floor
Description: Barclays Plc  has told employees that a member of its trading staff in its Manhattan office has tested positive for the coronavirus, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wall Street regulator paves way for home trading as coronavirus spreads
Description: (This 10th March story corrects fifth paragraph to clarify brokers' own inspections may be delayed)

Headlines: Intel says flawed EU antitrust decision underpins $1.2 billion fine
Description: Intel on Tuesday said EU antitrust regulators got it wrong when they fined the chipmaker 1.06 billion euros ($1.2 billion) more than a decade ago for thwarting a British rival in a case that could affect Google and Qualcomm.

Headlines: U.S. House lawmaker asks Justice Department whether former Wells Fargo CEO Sloan broke law in 'misleading' Congress
Description: The chair of the U.S. House Financial Services Committee has asked the Justice Department to review whether former Wells Fargo CEO Timothy Sloan broke the law in giving "misleading" sworn testimony to Congress.

Headlines: Coronavirus brings no-contact food delivery to United States
Description: Leaving bags of food on doorsteps or texting your delivery driver a picture of where you want your meal dropped off - these are new methods for U.S. consumers to get their orders as the coronavirus spreads.

Headlines: Saudi energy minister: no need for OPEC+ meet if no agreement on handling oil market crisis
Description: Saudi Arabia’s energy minister said on Tuesday he does not see a need to hold an OPEC+ meeting in May-June if there was no agreement on what measures should be taken to deal with the impact of the coronavirus on oil demand and prices.

Headlines: Russian ministry, oil firms to meet after OPEC talks collapse -sources
Description: Russia's Energy Ministry will meet with the country's oil companies on Wednesday to discuss future cooperation with the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries, among other issues, two sources familiar with the plan told Reuters.
