Description: Wells Fargo & Co  said on Wednesday it plans to increase minimum wage to between $15 and $20 per hour for most of its U.S. markets, joining other Wall Street banks that have raised hourly pay in recent years.

Headlines: U.S. senator's trade advice to EU: Keep calm and put agriculture on the table
Description: The Trump administration would face resistance from the U.S. Congress if it tried to push through a mini trade deal with the European Union that did not include agriculture, U.S. Senate Finance Committee Chairman Chuck Grassley said on Wednesday.

Headlines: United Airlines, JetBlue cut flights, spending as coronavirus hits demand
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  and JetBlue Airways Corp  are cutting flights and implementing cost controls in the most drastic actions by U.S. airlines to get ahead of depressed travel demand due to the spreading coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers seek to step up pressure on UK to reverse Huawei 5G decision
Description: Members of the U.S. Congress on Wednesday took another step to try to prod Britain to reverse its decision to allow China's Huawei Technologies Co to build portions of the UK's next generation 5G networks.

Headlines: Wall Street surges on Biden bounce
Description: Wall Street roared back to life on Wednesday, with both the Dow and the S&P 500 surging more than 4%, after former Vice President Joe Biden's strong showing in the Super Tuesday Democratic primary contests injected a dose of confidence.

Headlines: IMF chief says coronavirus erases hopes for stronger growth in 2020
Description: The global spread of the novel coronavirus has crushed hopes for stronger growth this year and will hold 2020 global output gains to their slowest pace since the 2008-2009 financial crisis, International Monetary Fund Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Canopy Growth to close two greenhouses, cut about 500 positions
Description: Pot producer Canopy Growth Corp  said on Wednesday it plans to close two of its greenhouses in Aldergrove and Delta, British Columbia, cutting about 500 positions.

Headlines: Stocks rally as Biden surge offsets coronavirus fears
Description: The dollar and global equities rose on Wednesday as a strong showing by Joe Biden in the U.S. Democratic presidential primaries cheered the markets, though the economy-slowing coronavirus outbreak kept investors on tenterhooks.

Headlines: EU executive seeks to crack down on gender pay gap
Description: The European Union's executive aims to introduce laws to combat gender pay gap across the bloc for the first time ever in a bid to fight inequality and boost the economy, according to a document seen by Reuters ahead of official publication.

Headlines: Oil gives up gains even as OPEC works on big output cut
Description: Crude oil prices ended lower, giving up early gains as major oil producers, including Saudi Arabia, struggled to bring Russia on board for deeper supply cuts to try to offset a slump in demand caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Huawei pleads not guilty to new U.S. criminal charges in 2018 case
Description: China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, the world's largest telecommunications equipment maker, on Wednesday pleaded not guilty in a New York federal court to new charges in a 2018 case against the company.

Headlines: GM takes aim at Tesla with 'Ultium' batteries and fleet of electric vehicles
Description: General Motors Co  Chief Executive Mary Barra said Wednesday the Detroit automaker will invest $20 billion by 2025 in electric and automated vehicles as it races to catch up with Elon Musk's Tesla Inc  as vehicles go electric.

Headlines: Uber open to using self-driving tech from competition: CEO
Description: Uber Technologies Inc's self-driving unit is open to using technology from competitors in the industry, the company's chief executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Data show U.S. economy on solid footing as coronavirus fears mount
Description: U.S. services sector activity jumped to a one-year high in February, suggesting strength in the economy before a recent escalation of recession fears ignited by the coronavirus epidemic that prompted an emergency interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: U.S. businesses show growing concern over impact of coronavirus, Fed survey shows
Description: There are signs the escalating coronavirus outbreak has begun to weigh on business sentiment in the United States, a report by the Federal Reserve released on Wednesday showed, even as the U.S. economy expanded at a modest to moderate pace over the past several weeks.

Headlines: Factbox: From shadow banking to coronavirus, U.S. regulators eye lurking risks
Description: U.S. regulators will gather Wednesday at a scheduled meeting of the Financial Stability Oversight Council (FSOC) to discuss risks to the United States and beyond. With fears around coronavirus driving market turmoil not seen since the 2007-2009 financial crisis, here are some of the top risks in their sights.

Headlines: New BoE boss Bailey does not back immediate virus rate cut
Description: The Bank of England should wait until it has more clarity about the economic hit from the coronavirus outbreak before making any decision to cut interest rates, its next governor Andrew Bailey said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Family clan members back Volkswagen CEO's electric strategy: Bild
Description: Wolfgang Porsche and Hans-Michel Piech, members of the family which controls German carmaker Volkswagen , fully support the shift towards electric cars being driven by Chief Executive Herbert Diess, they told the Bild newspaper.

Headlines: Follow the Fed? Why central banks will not be rushed on coronavirus response
Description: Will the world's big central banks leave U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell hanging? They are certainly going to try.

Headlines: Campbell Soup boosts guidance as profit beats forecasts; shares jump
Description: Campbell Soup Co  on Wednesday raised its fiscal full-year earnings forecast and posted better-than-expected quarterly profit and sales due to strong demand for soups and snacks, and its shares rose 5% in early trade.

Headlines: As Americans hoard food, Campbell Soup speeds up ingredients orders
Description: Campbell Soup  said it is ordering more ingredients to ensure it can keep enough soups, sauces and snacks on hand to meet growing demand from retailers as U.S. consumers hoard food in preparation for potential coronavirus quarantines.

Headlines: Keep calm and work from home during coronavirus, European banks tell workers
Description: Global banks and small investment firms in Europe are urging staff to work from home and curb travel as the financial industry braces for disruption from the rapidly spreading coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: GM CEO: North American plants secure 'quite far into this month'
Description: General Motors Co  Chief Executive Mary Barra said on Wednesday the automaker's North American vehicle production should be secure from parts shortages caused by the coronavirus outbreak "quite far into this month."

Headlines: GM launches advanced electric batteries to power its EVs
Description: U.S. automaker General Motors Co  on Wednesday launched Ultium, a battery with higher capacity and fast charging capabilities, to power its upcoming line of electric vehicles.

Headlines: Next BoE boss Bailey wants clearer view on coronavirus hit before rate decision
Description: Andrew Bailey, the next governor of the Bank of England, said on Wednesday that he wanted to see more evidence about the economic impact of the coronavirus outbreak before deciding whether to cut interest rates.

Headlines: GE says coronavirus will hit first-quarter cash flow, sticks to full-year forecast
Description: General Electric Co  predicted on Wednesday that the coronavirus would wipe out a substantial chunk of industrial free cash flow in the first quarter, but stuck to full-year financial targets the company set in January.GE predicted that the outbreak would erase $300 million to $500 million from industrial free cash flow and cause a hit of $200 million to $300 million to its first-quarter operating profit. GE set a forecast for first-quarter earnings of about 10 cents a sh

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler's U.S. sales chief Reid Bigland who sued company steps down
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles  said on Wednesday its U.S. sales chief, Reid Bigland, is leaving the company to pursue other interests.

Headlines: U.S. service sector races to one-year high in February
Description: U.S. services sector activity accelerated to a one-year high in February, suggesting underlying strength in the economy despite the coronavirus outbreak, which has triggered financial market fears of a recession and led to an emergency interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Johnson & Johnson ordered to pay $1.7 million to three Australian women in pelvic mesh class action
Description: An Australian court on Tuesday ordered Johnson & Johnson  to pay three women a total of A$2.6 million ($1.7 million) plus legal costs as compensation for misleading patients and surgeons about the risks of its pelvic mesh implants.

Headlines: Bayer's top seed faces U.S. soybean challenge from Corteva
Description: Bayer AG's takeover of Monsanto has been beset by problems, and now a decades-long dominance of the $4 billion U.S. soybean seed market is under threat from rival Corteva Inc.

Headlines: Facebook gives WHO free ads in battle with coronavirus misinformation
Description: Facebook Inc  will provide free advertisements to the World Health Organization (WHO) as it seeks to ensure users are not misinformed about the virus, its risks and how to react to it, Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Investor Stroll eyes sharing Formula One tech with Aston Martin road cars
Description: Canadian billionaire Lawrence Stroll, who is investing in carmaker Aston Martin , sees the opportunity to share Formula One technology with the firm's range of road cars, he said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Lego classics build growth for Danish toymaker in shrinking market
Description: Model fire stations and garbage trucks helped Lego defy a shrinking toy market with a rise in sales last year, as the plastic brick maker outpaced rivals with the latest versions of its classic kits, as well as new stores and a revamped website.

Headlines: Factbox: Airlines' steps to revive bookings hit by global coronavirus outbreak
Description: In an effort to win over passengers hesitant about traveling in the midst of a spreading coronavirus outbreak, some airlines are offering free rebooking options.

Headlines: How an ill-timed bet on a U.S. oil refinery cost ICBCS millions
Description: A team of ICBC Standard bankers celebrated in London last June after closing its first major U.S. refinery deal and gaining a foothold in the biggest energy market in the world.

Headlines: Resiliency test: How well can Chinese firms cope financially from a virus hit?
Description: As companies in China gradually restart business following the extended Lunar New Year break, investors are fretting over the  financial impact of the coronavirus outbreak that has squeezed cash flow and hammered revenues in many sectors.

Headlines: Amazon confirms first coronavirus case among U.S. employees
Description: Online retailer Amazon.com Inc  said on Tuesday an employee in the United States tested positive for the coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: SoftBank-backed CloudMinds blocked from exporting U.S. tech to China
Description: SoftBank-backed startup CloudMinds has been blocked from sharing U.S.-origin technology with its China business, documents showed, illustrating how increased U.S. government restrictions are creating new headaches for tech firms and their investors.

Headlines: HK's Bank of East Asia to review assets with Elliott Management
Description: Hong Kong-based Bank of East Asia  said on Wednesday it would carry out a comprehensive review of its portfolio of businesses and assets with the support of activist investor Elliott Management.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court leans toward SEC's power to recover ill-gotten gains
Description: U.S. Supreme Court justices on Tuesday appeared inclined to back the Securities and Exchange Commission's power to use federal courts to force defendants to surrender profits obtained through fraud as part of enforcement of investor-protection laws.

Headlines: SoftBank CEO hosts 'pre-IPO summit' in New York as he courts investors
Description: SoftBank Group Corp Chief Executive Masayoshi Son held his first "pre-IPO summit" for the Japanese conglomerate's portfolio companies on Tuesday, introducing them to Wall Street investors who could be backing their stock market debuts.

Headlines: Fed cuts rates to blunt coronavirus impact, markets drop
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve cut interest rates on Tuesday in a bid to shield the world's largest economy from the impact of the coronavirus, but the emergency move failed to comfort U.S. financial markets roiled by worries about a deeper, lasting slowdown.

Headlines: Fed's Evans expects virus impacts on economy to be short-lived
Description: The coronavirus outbreak will likely have only a "short-lived imprint" on the U.S. economy, Chicago Federal Reserve bank President Charles Evans said on Tuesday night.

Headlines: Another foul day on Wall Street after surprise Fed rate cut
Description: Wall Street tumbled in a volatile session on Tuesday after the U.S. Federal Reserve surprised investors with a half percentage-point cut in interest rates, amplifying fears about the magnitude of the coronavirus' impact on the economy.

Headlines: Wall Street prepares as coronavirus gets closer to home
Description: Wall Street stepped up preparations to deal with the impact of the coronavirus on Tuesday, testing backup plans and asking employees to work from home, as a New Yorker tested positive for the virus, bringing the prospect of the spread of the infection closer to home.

Headlines: Nordstrom sales miss, sees 2020 earnings below estimates
Description: Nordstrom Inc  forecast a 2020 profit largely below market expectations on Tuesday, after the upscale apparel retailer missed estimates for fourth-quarter revenue, sending its shares down nearly 8% in after-market trading.

Headlines: Impossible Foods cuts prices of plant-based meat sold to distributors
Description: Impossible Foods on Tuesday announced an average 15% cut in prices of its vegan products sold to U.S. distributors as the plant-based meat maker tries to make its patties more affordable to compete better with beef.

Headlines: Hewlett Packard Enterprise cuts cash flow outlook on coronavirus impact, shares down
Description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise  on Tuesday cut its free cash flow forecast for the year citing supply constraints due to the coronavirus outbreak, and reported a lower-than-expected quarterly revenue.

Headlines: Ackman hedges to protect against coronavirus' 'negative' impact
Description: Billionaire hedge fund investor William Ackman on Tuesday said he has moved to protect the firm's $6.6 billion portfolio, which includes restaurant chain and hotel stocks, as the spread of the coronavirus has sparked prolonged panic selling in markets.

Headlines: NBCUniversal sells record $1.25 billion in Tokyo Olympic ads
Description: Comcast Corp's  NBCUniversal said on Tuesday it had sold more than $1.25 billion in national advertising for the Tokyo Olympics, a new record for any broadcaster for the games.

Headlines: Berkshire Hathaway to hold May 2 annual meeting, despite coronavirus, but may curb events
Description: Berkshire Hathaway Inc , the conglomerate run Warren Buffett, said it will hold its annual shareholder meeting on May 2 despite the coronavirus outbreak, but may curtail some of the surrounding events.

Headlines: Fed's Mester sees possible economic impact from coronavirus outbreak
Description: The coronavirus outbreak has muddied the outlook for the U.S. economy and could weigh on growth in the first half of this year, Cleveland Federal Reserve Bank President Loretta Mester said in London on Tuesday.

Headlines: JPMorgan to test emergency coronavirus plans with some employees working from home: sources
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  is asking thousands of U.S. employees to spend a day working from home in the coming weeks to test its contingency plans should the coronavirus spread, sources familiar with the plan told Reuters.

Headlines: Stocks slide, 10-year Treasury at record low after Fed's rate cut
Description: Global equity markets slid on Tuesday and the yield on 10-year U.S. Treasuries fell below 1% for the first time after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates to shield the U.S. economy from the impact of the fast-spreading coronavirus.

Headlines: Latest coronavirus news to drive next Fed decision: Mester
Description: The Federal Reserve's next policy decision in two weeks' time will be driven by the latest news on how the coronavirus is affecting the economy, Cleveland Federal Reserve Bank President Loretta Mester said on Tuesday after an emergency rate cut.

Headlines: WeWork offloads office management platform Managed by Q to Eden
Description: Office management platform Eden said on Tuesday it has acquired shared workplace operator WeWork's Managed by Q for an undisclosed sum.

Headlines: U.S. sues Mallinckrodt, accuses drugmaker of defrauding Medicaid
Description: The United States sued a unit of the drugmaker Mallinckrodt Plc on Tuesday, accusing it of defrauding Medicaid out of hundreds of millions of dollars as a result of "meteoric" price increases for its biggest-selling drug, Acthar Gel.

Headlines: Top central banks appear primed to act to combat coronavirus risk
Description: The world's top three central banks look set to take steps to limit the economic damage from the fast-spreading coronavirus, with the heads of the European Central Bank and Bank of Japan issuing emergency statements on Monday that echoed one from U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell late last week.

Headlines: Exclusive: ECB working on lending scheme for coronavirus-hit companies: sources
Description: The European Central Bank is preparing possible measures to provide liquidity to businesses hit by the economic fallout of the coronavirus outbreak, three sources familiar with the discussion told Reuters.

Headlines: BoE's Carney sees 'powerful and timely' global response to coronavirus
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said policymakers around the world are working on a "powerful and timely" response to the economic hit from coronavirus which has raised fears of a new global recession.

Headlines: Oil lower on coronavirus fears despite Fed rate cut and hopes for OPEC+ output cut
Description: The global oil benchmark ended Tuesday slightly lower under pressure from falling equities, but the losses were contained slightly as top producers considered more output cuts to support prices and the Federal Reserve cut U.S. interest rates to support the economy.

Headlines: Fed virus-driven cut may test new approach to inflation
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve officials have slashed interest rates half a percentage point because of the coronavirus.

Headlines: OPEC, Russia moving closer to big oil cut as coronavirus hits demand
Description: A panel of OPEC and its allies recommended cutting oil output by an extra 1 million barrels per day (bpd) on Tuesday signaling that Russia and Saudi Arabia were moving closer to a deal to prop up prices which have been hit by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: UPS and FedEx warn coronavirus outbreak could hurt operations
Description: U.S. package delivery companies United Parcel Service Inc  and FedEx Corp  warned on Tuesday that the coronavirus outbreak could disrupt shipment of goods in affected countries and possibly weigh on their first-quarter results.

Headlines: Nokia says will cut up to 148 jobs in Finland this year
Description: Finnish network equipment maker Nokia will cut up to 148 jobs in Finland in 2020 excluding its 5G development operations, it said on Tuesday evening.

Headlines: Lufthansa CEO supports Boeing-Embraer tie-up
Description: Germany's Lufthansa  threw its weight behind a proposed $4.2 billion takeover of Embraer's commercial aircraft activities by Boeing , saying it would preserve a level playing field.

Headlines: OPEC+ panel considered oil output cut of 600,000-1 mln bpd: sources
Description: A technical committee of OPEC and its allies considered a cut in oil production of 600,000 to 1 million barrels per day (bpd), and recommended a reduction in output of at least 600,000 bpd, two sources said.

Headlines: Fidelity 2019 profit rose 10% on strong flows into index and money-market funds
Description: Fidelity Investments said on Tuesday operating profit in 2019 climbed 10% to $6.9 billion as investors pushed their cash into money-market and passively managed products while pulling billions of dollars from actively managed stock funds.

Headlines: Hudson's Bay Co Chairman Richard Baker to take over as CEO
Description: Hudson's Bay Co  Chairman Richard Baker will take over as chief executive officer, the company said on Tuesday, after his bid to take the owner of Saks Fifth Avenue private was approved by shareholders.

Headlines: Saudi SABIC lifts Swiss chemicals maker Clariant stake
Description: Chemical giant Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC)  said on Tuesday that it had raised its stake in Swiss chemicals maker Clariant  to 31.5% from 25%.

Headlines: Thermo Fisher agrees to buy genetic tester Qiagen in $11.5 billion deal
Description: Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc  said on Tuesday it agreed to acquire German genetic testing company Qiagen NV   in an $11.5 billion deal as the U.S.-based company looks to bolster its health diagnostic business.

Headlines: ECB ready to support economy, but governments must help, Villeroy says
Description: The European Central Bank is ready to support the economy in the face of the coronavirus outbreak, but governments with budget leeway also need to help, ECB policymaker Francois Villeroy de Galhau said in a Dutch newspaper interview released on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exxon Mobil calls for tighter methane regulations
Description: Exxon Mobil on Tuesday called for tighter regulation of the greenhouse gas methane and offered up its own in-house rules as a model for companies and lawmakers worldwide.

Headlines: OPEC and allies to consider significant oil output cuts as coronavirus hits demand
Description: OPEC and its allies will consider making substantial oil production cuts to lift prices that have been battered by the coronavirus outbreak, Algeria's oil minister said on Tuesday, as ministers began arriving for talks in Vienna this week.

Headlines: BMW says coronavirus hit China sales but sticks to 2020 global target
Description: BMW  on Tuesday said its China sales have taken a hit this year because of the new coronavirus, but stuck to its target for growing passenger car sales for the year, and said its global supply chain has not been disrupted.

Headlines: Daimler says cost cut plans may see entire platforms eliminated
Description: Mercedes-Benz is embarking on a sweeping cost cutting plan to free up cash to build electric and self-driving cars, a step which could see entire engine families and platforms eliminated, Daimler  board member Markus Schaefer said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Instant View: Fed announces surprise rate cut to counter coronavirus impact
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve cut interest rates on Tuesday in an emergency move designed to shield the world's largest economy from the impact of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Powell says coronavirus outbreak poses material risk to outlook
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Tuesday said the coronavirus poses a material risk to the economic outlook, and that change to the balance of risks drove the U.S. central bank to deliver its first emergency interest rate cut since the financial crisis.

Headlines: World Bank plans financial and technical aid package to help with coronavirus
Description: The World Bank said it would announce a package of financial and technical support later on Tuesday to assist with the health and economic impacts of the global coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Emirates airline asks staff to take one month unpaid leave over coronavirus
Description: Major international airline Emirates is asking staff to take unpaid leave for up to a month at a time due to the rapidly spreading coronavirus that has led to flight cancellations around the world.

Headlines: Airlines face worsening coronavirus impact, European bosses warn
Description: The worst is still to come for the airline industry in terms of economic damage from the coronavirus outbreak, European bosses warned on Tuesday, but they predicted that travel demand could stabilise in the coming weeks.

Headlines: Mnuchin says supports Fed on rate cut move, says it's 'non-political'
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Tuesday said he supports the Federal Reserve's decision to cut interest rates in response to the fast-spreading coronavirus, its first emergency rate cut since 2008 at the height of the financial crisis.

Headlines: Trump calls on Fed to cut rates further after emergency move
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump called for further cut rates after the Federal Reserve earlier on Tuesday slashed rates by half percentage point in an emergency move designed to insulate the nation's economy from the impact of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Virus to dent Foxconn's consumer electronics revenue in first-quarter
Description: Apple supplier Foxconn  warned revenue would drop 15% in businesses including consumer electronics and enterprise products in the first quarter, but that it would recover thereafter as production returns to normal in virus-hit China.

Headlines: Too early for U.S. dollar sell-off despite Fed rate cuts: Reuters poll
Description: The U.S. dollar's strength will remain in place and for longer than expected just a month ago, despite Federal Reserve interest rate cuts intended to limit the economic damage from the spreading coronavirus, a Reuters poll showed.

Headlines: U.S. not considering suspending tariffs on China in response to coronavirus: Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Tuesday said the United States was not considering lowering tariffs on goods from China in response to the fast-spreading coronavirus, but would look at all options as the situation evolved.

Headlines: Futures traders greet Fed rate cut with bets on more to come
Description: Traders of futures contracts tied to the Federal Reserve's policy rate reacted to a sooner-than-expected reduction in borrowing costs Tuesday with bets on more to come as the central bank moves to try to shield the U.S. economy from the effects of the new coronavirus.

Headlines: Airbus, Boeing executives say too early to gauge coronavirus impact on aircraft demand
Description: Executives from planemakers Airbus  and Boeing  said on Tuesday that it was too early to say whether the outbreak of a new coronavirus would affect demand for aircraft.

Headlines: SoftBank CEO tells U.S. investors he'll be more careful
Description: ((This March 2 story removes incorrect reference to Sprint as a Vision Fund investment))

Headlines: Chevron shows off war chest by pledging up to $80 billion in returns
Description: Chevron Corp  on Tuesday said it would keep its spending in check and return up to $80 billion to shareholders over the next five years, with Chief Executive Mike Wirth making the case that his company is the oil major best able to produce oil and generate profits at the lowest cost.

Headlines: Ryanair, IAG bosses see travel demand returning for summer
Description: The bosses of Ryanair  and British Airways-owner IAG  expect the drop-off in travel demand to stabilize in the coming weeks, before bookings return for the summer, they said at a conference on Tuesday.

Headlines: Peugeot maker says UK factory plans dependent on Brexit talks
Description: Peugeot maker PSA  does not expect to make a call before the end of 2020 on whether to keep its British factory at Ellesmere Port running, depending on how Brexit talks evolve, Chief Executive Carlos Tavares said on Tuesday.

Headlines: BMW, Daimler aim to cut emissions 20% this year with new electric models
Description: New electric models will help BMW  and Daimler  cut emissions from the cars they sell by an average of 20% this year, the German automakers predicted on Tuesday, as they strive to meet tough new European pollution rules.

Headlines: Explainer: Why automakers are on a drive to sell electric cars in Europe
Description: Carmakers are under pressure in Europe to sell more electric cars or face huge fines for breaching new emissions rules aimed at tackling global warming.

Headlines: Algeria energy minister says OPEC+ countries to discuss 'substantial' oil output cuts
Description: Algeria energy minister and OPEC president said on Tuesday OPEC+ countries will discuss new "substantial" oil production cuts at their meetings in Vienna this week, Algerian state news agency APS reported.

Headlines: No need for imminent ECB action on coronavirus: ECB's Kazimir
Description: There is no need for any imminent action from the European Central Bank to combat the impact of the coronavirus outbreak, but global coordination to shield the world economy is a welcome step, ECB policymaker Peter Kazimir said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Daimler says production in China stable but too early to forecast coronavirus impact
Description: Daimler's  car production in China is stable and the supply chains are secure but it is too early to forecast the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on the German carmaker's sales, Mercedes-Benz's sales chief said on Monday.

Headlines: ECB's Holzmann sees no need for rate cut to combat coronavirus
Description: European Central Bank policymaker Robert Holzmann said he would not support an interest rate cut to insulate the euro zone from the effects of the coronavirus epidemic but he could consider giving firms ultra cheap loans.

Headlines: Kuwait oil minister says optimistic on outcome of OPEC meetings
Description: Kuwait's oil minister said on Tuesday he is optimistic about the outcome of OPEC meetings this week and continued cooperation among OPEC+ countries, Kuwait state news agency KUNA reported.

Headlines: High-fives, hugs, kisses discouraged as U.S. companies respond to growing coronavirus threat
Description: As news broke of more cases of coronavirus spreading across the United States, T-Mobile had a novel response to the threat: fewer hugs, kisses or high-fives.

Headlines: Kremlin stays silent on Russia oil cut plans ahead of OPEC+ meeting
Description: The Kremlin told reporters on Tuesday it would not say whether Moscow was ready to make additional oil output cuts as part of the cooperation between OPEC and non-OPEC countries and said it was necessary to wait for their meeting later this week.

Headlines: Lindt promises sweet dividend and further growth
Description: Swiss chocolate maker Lindt & Spruengli   on Tuesday proposed a sweeter payout to shareholders, increasing its dividend by 75% to mark its 175th anniversary.

Headlines: Swiss Re lines up UBS CEO Ermotti to become chairman in 2021
Description: Swiss Re  plans to make UBS Group Chief Executive Sergio Ermotti its chairman from next year, the world's second-biggest reinsurer said on Tuesday, turning to a financial industry veteran with scant insurance experience.

Headlines: Olympics: Tokyo 2020 wheelchair rugby test event canceled over coronavirus
Description: This month's wheelchair rugby test event has been canceled due to the coronavirus outbreak, Tokyo 2020 organizers said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Toyota names new finance chief in executive shake-up
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  named Kenta Kon as its next chief financial officer on Tuesday and said it would scrap executive vice president (EVP) roles as part of a drive to streamline the company's structure, improve production systems and cut costs.

Headlines: Amazon adds warehouse network closer to cities to speed up same-day delivery
Description: Amazon.com Inc  has quietly opened a series of small warehouses closer to big U.S. cities in a move to shave hours off delivery times, the company told Reuters.

Headlines: Xerox, HP blame each other as takeover battle heats up
Description: U.S. printer maker Xerox Holdings Corp took its $35 billion bid for HP Inc to the U.S. personal computer maker's shareholders on Monday, with a formal tender offer and a rebuttal to HP's account of why they could not negotiate a deal.

Headlines: Think-tank report on Uighur labor in China lists global brands
Description: Tens of thousands of ethnic Uighurs were moved to work in conditions suggestive of "forced labor" in factories across China supplying 83 global brands, an Australian think tank said in a report released on Sunday.

Headlines: Apple to pay up to $500 million to settle U.S. lawsuit over slow iPhones
Description: Apple Inc has agreed to pay up to $500 million to settle litigation accusing it of quietly slowing down older iPhones as it launched new models, to induce owners to buy replacement phones or batteries.

Headlines: Tencent extends warranty for Nintendo Switches in China as virus hits sales
Description: Chinese tech giant Tencent  said on Tuesday it would extend warranty for Nintendo Switches purchased in China via official channels before March 31 by six months as sales have been hit by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Musk tweets support for Dorsey remaining as Twitter CEO
Description: Elon Musk said late on Monday he supported Jack Dorsey remaining as Twitter Inc's chief executive officer, two days after reports that activist investor Elliott Management Corp has pushed for his removal from the role.

Headlines: Facebook pulls out of South by Southwest festival over coronavirus fears
Description: Facebook Inc is pulling out of this year's South by Southwest (SXSW) music and tech festival over growing concerns about the coronavirus outbreak, a spokesperson for the company said on Monday.

Headlines: GFL raises $1.4 billion in IPO amid volatile markets
Description: GFL Environmental Inc on Monday raised about $1.4 billion in its initial public offering, pricing it below the target range in a conservative step to ride out market volatility in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Dow has biggest daily jump since 2009 as Wall Street buys the dip
Description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average surged over 5% on Monday while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq each jumped more than 4% in a major rebound following last week's steep sell-off sparked by fears about the coronavirus.

Headlines: Recording Academy fires first female CEO, alleging misconduct
Description: The organizers of the Grammy Awards said on Monday they fired the chief executive they had placed on administrative leave in January.

Headlines: Google's self-driving sister, Waymo, gets first outside investors
Description: Waymo, the self-driving unit of Alphabet Inc , said on Monday it had raised $2.25 billion in its first external investment round and expects to add more outside investors.

Headlines: Chevron offering U.S. workers buyouts to trim staffing: sources
Description: Chevron Corp  is offering buyouts to reduce its U.S. oil exploration and production workforce, three sources told Reuters, as the oil major moves to cut costs in the face of sharply lower oil and gas prices.

Headlines: Shareholder calls for separation of J&J's CEO and chairman roles
Description: Trillium Asset Management LLC has called for the separation of Johnson & Johnson's  chairman and chief executive officer roles, currently held by Alex Gorsky, according to a regulatory filing https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/200406/000020040620000014/a2020jnjproxy.htm by the healthcare conglomerate on Monday.

Headlines: 'Neutron Jack' Welch, who led GE's rapid expansion, dies at 84
Description: Jack Welch, who upended the business world in the 1980s and 1990s by transforming General Electric Co  from a stolid  maker of light bulbs and washing machines into the most valuable U.S. public company, has died at 84, GE said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump, business leaders comment on Jack Welch's death
Description: Jack Welch, the legendary CEO who led General Electric Co  for two decades to create the most valuable public company in the United States, died at the age of 84.

Headlines: Qualcomm says China virus threatens phone industry disruption
Description: (This February 5 story corrects number of 5G license agreements in paragraph 16)

Headlines: White House set to meet with airline, cruise industry CEOs
Description: The White House will hold meetings this week with top executives from U.S. airlines and the cruise industry amid the growing coronavirus outbreak, a spokeswoman for Vice President Mike Pence confirmed on Monday.

Headlines: Novartis unit Sandoz agrees to pay $195 million to resolve antitrust charges
Description: Novartis' generic drugs unit Sandoz has agreed to pay $195 million to reach a deferred prosecution agreement aimed at resolving antitrust charges, the Justice Department said on Monday.

Headlines: Britain vows 'hard bargain' in list of demands for U.S. trade deal
Description: Britain on Monday unveiled its mandate for trade talks with the United States, with Prime Minister Boris Johnson vowing to drive a hard bargain in negotiations that are set to test the two allies' "special relationship".

Headlines: Honda to cut production at Japanese plants on sourcing concerns
Description: Japan's Honda Motor Co Ltd  said on Tuesday it will temporarily cut back local production due to difficulty in sourcing parts amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Trump presses U.S. Federal Reserve to cut rates
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday reiterated his call for the U.S. central bank to lower interest rates, tweeting that the Federal Reserve has been "slow to act" and should be more aggressive.

Headlines: Bets on big Fed rate cuts rise as virus spreads, ECB vows action
Description: Traders on Monday piled into bets the U.S. Federal Reserve will deliver a big dose of stimulus starting this month amid mounting concern over the economic impact from the coronavirus and indications that global central banks are readying a monetary rescue.

Headlines: Stocks rally after last week's rout on central bank policy hopes
Description: Equity markets around the world rose on Monday as speculation that central banks will cut interest rates to soften the economic blow of the coronavirus heartened investors and drove U.S. government debt yields to record lows.

Headlines: Global growth plunging into downturn over coronavirus, OECD says
Description: The coronavirus outbreak is plunging the world economy into its worst downturn since the global financial crisis, the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development warned on Monday, urging governments and central banks to fight back to avoid an even steeper slump.

Headlines: U.S.' Mnuchin, Powell to lead G7 finance call on coronavirus response
Description: G7 finance ministers and central bank governors will hold a conference call on Tuesday to discuss measures to deal with the widening coronavirus outbreak and its economic impact, a U.S. Treasury spokeswoman said on Monday.

Headlines: Amtrak names new CEO to head money-losing passenger railroad
Description: Amtrak said Monday it had tapped Atlas Air's chief executive to run the money-losing U.S. passenger railroad that has seen record traffic.

Headlines: Amazon's fight against $277 million EU tax order kicks off in court on Thursday
Description: Amazon will on Thursday seek to overturn an EU order to repay about 250 million euros ($277 million) in back taxes to Luxembourg at Europe's second-highest court, one of a series of high-profile cases marking the bloc's crackdown on unfair tax deals.

Headlines: Oil up over 4% as hopes of OPEC cut, stimulus counter virus gloom
Description: Oil prices rose over 4% on Monday, reversing an early fall to multi-year lows as hopes of a deeper cut in output by OPEC and stimulus from central banks countered worries about damage to demand from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing sector stalls as coronavirus hits supply chains
Description: U.S. factory manufacturing activity slowed in February as new orders contracted, reflecting worries about supply chain disruptions related to the fast-spreading coronavirus outbreak, which has revived financial market fears of a recession.

Headlines: IMF, World Bank say ready to address economic challenges of coronavirus
Description: The International Monetary Fund and the World Bank on Monday said they stood ready to help member countries address the human and economic challenges of the fast-spreading coronavirus outbreak, including through emergency funding.

Headlines: Banco BPM sets up new 'disaster recovery rooms' in Italy's virus emergency: sources
Description: Italy's Banco BPM  is rushing to set up new "disaster recovery rooms" after an area close to one of its existing crisis facilities emerged as the epicenter of the coronavirus outbreak, three sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Exclusive: UBS CEO Ermotti poised to get Swiss Re chairman role - sources
Description: UBS Group  Chief Executive Sergio Ermotti is poised to become chairman of Swiss Re  next year after leaving the helm of Switzerland's biggest bank, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: UK wants retaliatory tariffs removed early on in U.S. trade talks: Truss
Description: British trade minister Liz Truss said she wanted with the United States to agree to the removal of retaliatory tariffs on some British and U.S. products over EU subsidies on large aircraft early in trade negotiations to show goodwill.

Headlines: Apple stock rebounds almost 7% to head for strongest day since 2018
Description: Shares in Apple  surged 6.9% on Monday, helped by a broad Wall Street rebound and an upgraded rating from an analyst who said the iPhone maker's stock had become oversold following last week's rout related to fears about the new coronavirus.

Headlines: Factbox: Jack Welch proteges who led Corporate America
Description: Jack Welch, one of the most influential business leaders and former chief executive officer of General Electric Co , has died at the age of 84.

Headlines: Ryanair to cut Italy flights by 25% due to coronavirus
Description: Ryanair  will cut capacity in and out of Italy, its largest market, by 25% for three weeks due to a significant drop off in bookings since a coronavirus outbreak, Europe's biggest low-cost airline said on Monday.

Headlines: Banks in Europe step up coronavirus contingency trading plans
Description: Banks and exchanges in Europe are readying out-of-town offices, splitting shifts and isolating some teams to ensure they can keep trading if coronavirus spreads in more major financial centers.

Headlines: Gilead buys Forty Seven for $4.9 billion to bolster cancer drug pipeline
Description: Gilead Sciences Inc  said on Monday it would buy Forty Seven Inc  for $4.9 billion in cash, adding an experimental treatment that targets blood cancer to its portfolio of oncology drugs.

Headlines: UK to consider opposition to digital tax in pursuit of U.S. trade deal
Description: Britain said on Monday it would consider opposition to its plan to impose a new digital tax on big tech companies like Google, Facebook and Amazon as part of its ambition to agree a free trade deal with the United States.

Headlines: UK trade minister says hopes to start U.S. trade deal talks as quickly as possible
Description: Britain is aiming to begin negotiations on a post-Brexit trade deal with the United States as quickly as possible, trade minister Liz Truss said on Monday.

Headlines: Coronavirus hits global factories; chances of monetary policy easing rise
Description: Global factories took a beating in February from the coronavirus outbreak, with activity in China shrinking at a record pace, surveys showed on Monday, raising the prospect of a coordinated  policy response by central banks to prevent a global recession.

Headlines: British Airways cancels some flights to United States as coronavirus hits demand
Description: British Airways on Monday said it was cancelling some flights from London to the United States to match reduced demand for flying due to the impact of a new coronavirus on consumer sentiment.

Headlines: Exclusive: Newly obtained documents show Huawei role in shipping prohibited U.S. gear to Iran
Description: China’s Huawei Technologies, which for years has denied violating American trade sanctions on Iran, produced internal company records in 2010 that show it was directly involved in sending prohibited U.S. computer equipment to Iran’s largest mobile-phone operator.

Headlines: Blackstone reshuffles London energy team amid Siccar Point sale attempt
Description: Blackstone Group Inc  has reshuffled its London-based private equity team in charge of energy while trying to sell all or part of its flagship investment, North Sea oil and gas producer Siccar Point.

Headlines: Japanese minister tells Lebanon Ghosn should stand trial in Japan
Description: Fugitive ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn should stand trial in Japan, a Japanese government minister told the Lebanese government during a visit to Beirut on Monday, adding that Beirut had agreed to cooperate but without saying how.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs halts non-essential foreign business travel: memo
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  has told its staff that all non-essential international business travel should be postponed, according to a memo seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Deere names CEO John May chairman
Description: Farm equipment maker Deere & Co  on Monday named Chief Executive Officer John May chairman, effective May 1.

Headlines: Advent/Cinven-led consortium to spend 'billions' on expanding Thyssenkrupp Elevator
Description: (This March 1 story has been refiled to show that the consortium is led by Advent and Cinven)

Headlines: Nike temporarily closes European HQ in the Netherlands due to coronavirus case
Description: U.S. sportswear giant Nike  said on Monday its European headquarters in the Netherlands would be closed until Wednesday after an employee was infected with the new coronavirus.

Headlines: UK finance could be eclipsed by cars in U.S. trade deal
Description: Britain's financial services industry could fare less well than energy, autos and other sectors under a free trade deal with the United States, the government said on Monday.

Headlines: Nokia replaces CEO with Fortum boss Lundmark to revive 5G business
Description: Nokia has rehired former executive Pekka Lundmark from energy group Fortum to lead the Finnish telecoms company's efforts to revive its faltering 5G business.

Headlines: Barclays investor Sherborne renews attacks on CEO over Epstein link
Description: Barclays'  chairman and board should rescind their support for Chief Executive Jes Staley following the disclosure of regulatory probes into his links with U.S. financier Jeffrey Epstein, the bank's third biggest investor said on Monday.

Headlines: UK says any system for resolving U.S. investor disputes will be fair
Description: The British government said any system to protect U.S. companies' interests in the country after a free trade agreement - typically a sensitive issue for civil society groups worried about the power of multinationals - would have to be fair and transparent.

Headlines: Britain says it will not compromise on food standards in U.S. trade talks
Description: Britain will not lower its regulation around environmental protection, animal welfare and food standards as part of trade talks with the United States, it said in a document setting out its mandate on Monday.

Headlines: Britain says health service, drug prices not up for negotiation in U.S. talks
Description: Britain said on Monday that the price its state funded National Health Service (NHS) pays for drugs would not be on the table in trade talks with the United States.

Headlines: Factbox: What Britain wants from a trade deal with the United States
Description: Britain outlined its negotiating mandate for talks with the United States on Monday, with the hope of reducing tariffs while shielding the public health service and protecting food and animal welfare standards.

Headlines: UK wants a big U.S. trade deal but health and food standards not up for grabs
Description: Britain said on Monday it will seek to achieve huge gains by removing barriers to trade with the United States in talks for a deal this year but its health service would not be on the table in talks.

Headlines: Incoming Nokia CEO says too early to comment on strategic changes
Description: Finnish telecom equipment maker Nokia's incoming chief executive Pekka Lundmark told a news conference on Monday it was too soon to talk about any strategic changes.

Headlines: More traffic, night lights show China's factories restart as new virus cases drop
Description: Nearly 300 million people have gone back to work in China since the Lunar New Year break as more companies restart business and coronavirus travel restrictions ease, although many small firms are still struggling to find enough workers to run plants.

Headlines: Airline body IATA calls on Mideast governments to help airlines handle coronavirus outbreak
Description: Middle East governments should consider providing support to airlines to help them manage the impact of the coronavirus outbreak, which has led to a raft of flight cancellations, the industry's largest global body said on Monday.

Headlines: Take Five: The virus data fog
Description: The first data releases coming out for February make for grim reading: China's factories were dealt a devastating blow last month as the coronavirus epidemic triggered the sharpest contraction in activity on record, with the health crisis paralysing large parts of the economy.

Headlines: China Inc thinks outside the box as coronavirus keeps consumers at home
Description: With Chinese consumers hit by quarantine and travel restrictions as well as just wary about venturing out to the shops due to the coronavirus epidemic, companies in the world's most populous nation are experimenting with new tricks to make sales.

Headlines: Nokia has no plans to assess strategic options: outgoing chairman
Description: Finnish telecom equipment maker Nokia has no plans to assess strategic options for the company, its outgoing chairman Risto Siiliasma told a news conference on Monday.

Headlines: Lufthansa extends China, Tehran flight suspensions due to coronavirus
Description: German airline group Lufthansa  said on Monday that it was extending the suspension of flights to China until April 24, to Tehran until April 30 and reducing services to northern Italy due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: HNA Group-controlled companies' shares rise after government help sought
Description: Shares in HNA Group-controlled companies rose on Monday after the Chinese aviation and tourism conglomerate said it had asked the government to help it resolve liquidity risk caused by the coronavirus outbreak which has put heavy pressure on the airline industry.

Headlines: Coronavirus expected to hurt U.S. earnings harder and longer
Description: The hit to U.S. corporate earnings from the coronavirus epidemic is getting harder and messier to predict.

Headlines: Hyundai reports lowest monthly sales in decade as virus dents demand
Description: Hyundai Motor  reported its lowest monthly global sales in a decade in February as the coronavirus outbreak hurt demand, in what is the first major indicator of damage to the broader auto sector from the epidemic.

Headlines: CERAWeek energy conference in Houston scrapped over coronavirus worries
Description: Coronavirus concerns prompted organizers on Sunday to cancel one of the world's most prestigious gatherings of oil ministers and top executives from the energy and financial industries scheduled for this month in Houston.

Headlines: Swiss National Bank to double payout after posting $50 billion profit
Description: The Swiss National Bank  posted an annual profit of 48.9 billion Swiss francs ($50.71 billion), the central bank said on Monday, and said it would double its payout to Switzerland's regional and central governments.

Headlines: Samsung starts building $220 million R&D center in Vietnam
Description: Samsung Electronics has started building a $220 million research and development center in Vietnam, the South Korean tech giant's local unit said on Monday.

Headlines: Amazon confirms two employees in Italy have contracted coronavirus
Description: Amazon.com Inc said late on Sunday that two employees in Milan, Italy, have contracted the coronavirus and are under quarantine.

Headlines: South Korea's Jeju Air buys Eastar Jet at lower price amid virus outbreak
Description: South Korean budget carrier Jeju Air Co Ltd  said on Monday it would acquire a 51% stake in competitor Eastar Jet for 54.5 billion won ($45.49 million), a lower price than previously announced.

Headlines: U.S. officials talk down coronavirus market panic, tout economic strength
Description: Senior officials in President Donald Trump's administration on Sunday tried to calm market panic that the coronavirus could cause a global recession, saying the U.S. public had over-reacted and that stocks would rebound due to the American economy's underlying strength.

Headlines: U.S. stock futures resume coronavirus rout
Description: U.S. stock index futures tumbled as trading reopened on Sunday night with investors still unnerved by the coronavirus and taking little solace from weekend comments by U.S. officials that aimed to soothe panic about a pandemic.

Headlines: Implied yield on U.S. 10-Year treasury futures trading below 1% for first time
Description: The implied yield on U.S. 10-Year Treasury futures  traded below 1% for the first time, as investors grew increasingly unnerved by the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs sees Fed cutting soon, perhaps before March 17-18 meeting
Description: Goldman Sachs economists on Sunday predicted the U.S. Federal Reserve will cut interest rates aggressively perhaps before its next scheduled meeting in two weeks time, saying the head of the U.S. central bank sent a clear signal with his unscheduled statement on Friday.

Headlines: American Airlines waives change fees as United braces for new flight cancellations
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  said on Sunday it was waiving change fees on all newly purchased tickets amid declining air travel demand because of the new coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. bank lobby economist predicts global rate cut coming ... this Wednesday
Description: Investors battered by the breathtaking drop in global stock markets on coronavirus fears are ever more convinced the world's big central banks, including the Federal Reserve, will soon step in to try to quell the storm.

Headlines: Canada and indigenous group reach tentative deal in dispute that led to road, rail blockades
Description: Canadian authorities on Sunday reached a tentative deal with an indigenous group in the Pacific province of British Columbia that could end solidarity protests across Canada that have been blocking rail lines and roads for weeks.

Headlines: Exclusive: Norway wealth fund could blacklist four major climate culprits
Description: Norway's $1 trillion wealth fund will exclude four companies for their vast emissions of greenhouse gases, or at least put them on probation to force them to change, the chairman of its ethics watchdog told Reuters.

Headlines: Citgo, Aruba reach deal to transfer control of refinery to island government
Description: U.S. refiner Citgo has reached an agreement with Aruba to transfer control of the San Nicolas refinery to the island's government, Citgo said late on Saturday, after the two parties last year suspended a contract to overhaul the facility.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco shares hit lowest since IPO, down over 2%
Description: Shares of Saudi Aramco  hit 32.50 riyals ($8.66) in intraday trade on Sunday, the lowest since it began trading in December following a record initial public offering, as oil prices plunged amid worries about the global spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: American Airlines suspending flights to Milan after U.S. travel warning
Description: American Airlines Inc  will suspend all U.S. flights to Milan, the airline said late on Saturday, just hours after the U.S. State Department said it was raising its travel warning for parts of Italy due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Venezuela revamps PDVSA leadership after Maduro launches restructuring
Description: Venezuela has named new vice presidents for four units of state oil company PDVSA, as well as a new president for the unit that handles joint ventures with private oil companies, PDVSA said on Saturday.

Headlines: Wall Street Weekahead: Main Street leans toward Sanders, but Wall Street says Trump
Description: Vermont Senator Bernie Sanders may be surging in the polls ahead of Super Tuesday, but some on Wall Street have made their own conclusions on what November will bring: four more years of President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Toyota plans new $1.2 billion EV plant in Tianjin with FAW: document
Description: Japanese automaker Toyota plans to build a new electric vehicle plant in the Chinese city of Tianjin with its local partner FAW Group, a document from the local authorities showed.

Headlines: Elliott targets Twitter, seeking CEO Dorsey's removal: sources
Description: Hedge fund Elliott Management Corp has amassed a stake in Twitter Inc  and is pushing for changes, including removal of the social media company's chief executive, Jack Dorsey, two people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: USTR vows to push for trade deals with Britain, EU; seeks reforms at WTO
Description: The Trump administration on Friday said it would focus on concluding new trade agreements with Britain, the European Union and Kenya over the coming year, while strictly enforcing trade laws and pushing for reforms of the World Trade Organization.

Headlines: Harley-Davidson looks for new leadership to end its sales struggle
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc  on Friday named a board member hailed for turning around the Puma brand's near-bankrupt business as its interim chief as the motorcycle maker gropes for an effective strategy to woo young customers and revive sales.

Headlines: UBS CEO's pay slips to $1 million a month as Swiss bank's top bosses pocket $113 million
Description: UBS Chief Executive Sergio Ermotti, one of Europe's best paid bankers, earned 12.5 million francs in 2019, down from 14.1 million in 2018 after the bank was hit with a multi-billion-euro court case and it missed earnings goals.

Headlines: Sanofi to pay $11.9 million to resolve U.S. drug charity kickback probe
Description: Sanofi SA has agreed to pay $11.85 million to resolve U.S. allegations that it used a charity that helps cover Medicare patients' out-of-pocket drug costs as a means to pay them kickbacks to use a high-priced multiple sclerosis drug.

Headlines: S&P falls for seventh day, suffers biggest weekly plunge since 2008 crisis
Description: The S&P 500 fell for the seventh straight day on Friday and the benchmark index suffered its biggest weekly drop since the 2008 global financial crisis on growing fears the fast-spreading coronavirus could push the economy into recession, although stocks regained some ground right at the end of a volatile session.

Headlines: Wall Street in coronavirus contingency mode with staff, visitors, regulators
Description: Big U.S. banks have been rolling out contingency plans to respond to the global coronavirus outbreak - requiring some staff to work from home, implementing travel restrictions, and talking to regulators about potential stresses.

Headlines: United Airlines sharply cuts flights to Asia, cancels investor day
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  said on Friday it was sharply cutting flights to Japan and South Korea, as travelers worried about the coronavirus outbreak slash ticket purchases for those destinations.

Headlines: Intesa, UBI line up advisers to face off in takeover battle
Description: Intesa Sanpaolo said on Friday it had hired JP Morgan, Morgan Stanley, UBS and local broker Equita SIM to complete a team of advisers led by Mediobanca supporting Italy's biggest retail bank in its takeover offer of rival UBI Banca.

Headlines: Wall Street bounce too little, too late as world stocks post shock weekly decline
Description: Coronavirus panic sent world stock markets tumbling again on Friday, with an index of global stocks setting its largest weekly fall since the 2008 global financial crisis, and over $5 trillion wiped from global market value this week.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs Asset Management added to stocks portfolio as markets tumbled
Description: Portfolio managers at Goldman Sachs Asset Management have used the recent selloff in global stocks caused by the coronavirus as an opportunity to take positions in a range of companies focusing on everything from concerts to cosmetics.

Headlines: U.S. moves high-level U.S. meeting on China tech, possible new Huawei curbs to March: sources
Description: Trump administration officials have rescheduled for March 11 a critical meeting to discuss potential new U.S. restrictions on sales of technology to Huawei and China, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Coronavirus outbreak rains on dealmakers' M&A parade
Description: The steep market drop triggered by the global coronavirus outbreak has led many companies to hit the 'pause' button on mergers and acquisitions (M&A), sabotaging the hopes of corporate advisers who expected a dealmaking bonanza this year.

Headlines: Fasten your seat belts, U.S. Congress sets hearing on air travel
Description: The airline industry could run into turbulence on Capitol Hill next week as a U.S. Congressional panel tackles passenger complaints about unpleasant airline experiences, holding a hearing that will include budget airline Spirit Airlines Inc  and passenger advocates.

Headlines: Citron's Andrew Left closes Wayfair short bet after long wait
Description: This week's sharp stock sell-off helped activist short-seller Andrew Left profitably close a long-held bet against online retailer Wayfair  on Friday.

Headlines: Central banks may mount a coronavirus rescue. It may not be enough
Description: Cratering markets are pushing global central banks to the point they all warned against and worried about, of an evolving global economic shock hitting at a time when their capacity to respond in force is in doubt even as investors hound them for action.

Headlines: Factbox: Global central bankers on coronavirus, possibility of rate cuts
Description: With the rapid global spread of the new coronavirus and the U.S. stock market suffering its worst week since the Great Recession, central bankers around the world are under rising pressure to reduce borrowing costs to create a cushion against economic harm. So far they have largely resisted. Following are some of their recent remarks:

Headlines: Corona beer maker says U.S. sales remain strong despite virus outbreak
Description: Corona beer maker Constellation Brands Inc  said on Friday sales of its Corona Extra beer remained strong in the United States in the four weeks to Feb. 16, amid the rapid global spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Oil prices sink to lowest in over a year, biggest weekly drop since 2016
Description: Oil prices slumped for a sixth day in a row on Friday to their lowest in more than a year, causing futures to drop by the most in a week since 2016, as the spread of coronavirus stoked fears that a slowing global economy would hit energy demand.

Headlines: Think the S&P 500 is in bad shape? Its components look worse
Description: Wall Street's worst week since 2008, sparked by fears about the fast-spreading coronavirus, has left almost half of the S&P 500's stocks in bear market territory, just nine days after the leading benchmark closed at a record high.

Headlines: Pandemic fears send investors running as Wall Street confirms correction
Description: (This Feb. 27 version of the U.S. stocks copy has been republished)

Headlines: Activist investor Robbins shutting hedge fund to pursue other things
Description: Activist investor Clifton S. Robbins told clients on Friday that he is shuttering his Blue Harbour Group not because investors want their money back or because returns have lagged, but because he wants to do something different.

Headlines: Cooling consumer spending, inflation put spotlight on Fed amid coronavirus
Description: U.S. consumer spending slowed in January and could lose further momentum as the fast-spreading coronavirus outbreak, which has sparked a stock market sell-off and revived fears of a recession, causes households to tighten their purse strings.

Headlines: Madoff customer payout nears $14 billion, as dying swindler seeks freedom
Description: Bernard Madoff's former customers will soon see their total recovery approach $14 billion, a court-appointed trustee said on Friday, as the dying swindler awaits a decision on whether the U.S. government will support his request to leave prison early.

Headlines: Volkswagen, accordo da 830 mln euro con consumatori per scandalo diesel
Description: Volkswagen  e una delle maggiori organizzazioni tedesche di consumatori hanno annunciato di aver raggiunto un accordo da 830 milioni di euro nell'ambito della class action per i test sulle emissioni diesel truccati.

Headlines: Ex-Barclays bankers cleared over 2008 Qatar fees in blow to UK fraud office
Description: Three former Barclays executives were unanimously acquitted on Friday of charges they helped funnel 322 million pounds ($418 million) in secret fees to Qatar in return for rescue financing during the credit crisis.

Headlines: Factbox: Barclays bosses cleared of credit crisis-era fraud
Description: Three former Barclays executives were cleared of credit-crisis era fraud charges by a jury on Friday after a landmark London trial over undisclosed payments to Qatar in 2008.

Headlines: 'Big Dog' and the 'omnipotent sheikh' - how Qatar saved Barclays
Description: When Roger Jenkins was asked to help Barclays avoid a state bailout at the height of the financial crisis in 2008, he was expecting a bonus not a prosecution for his efforts.

Headlines: Airlines at center of storm as coronavirus spreads
Description: European airlines stepped up their warnings over the coronavirus outbreak on Friday, with British Airways-owner IAG and Finnair flagging a hit to profits and easyJet reporting a big drop in demand into and out of a virus-affected region in Italy.

Headlines: Kuwait to check visiting ships for coronavirus, evacuate citizens from Thailand
Description: Kuwait will check visiting ships for the new coronavirus before allowing them to dock and require crew members to stay on board as part of measures to prevent the spread of the disease, state news agency KUNA said.

Headlines: Factbox: Airlines suspend flights due to coronavirus outbreak
Description: Airlines have been suspending flights or modifying service in response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Explainer: How U.S. markets will function if coronavirus breaks out in NYC
Description: If an outbreak of coronavirus hits New York, it could cause more sharp selling of stocks, but markets would likely continue to function even if the floor of the New York Stock Exchange had to close.

Headlines: U.S. regulators to rate new auto tech, but Europe leads in safety testing
Description: Autopilot, Super Cruise and Drive Pilot are different names given to technology that automates steering and braking in a growing number of vehicles, but none of it can safely "pilot" cars without regular human intervention.

Headlines: SoftBank communications chief Gary Ginsberg takes leave to aid Bloomberg campaign: sources
Description: Gary Ginsberg, the global head of communications for SoftBank Group Corp , has taken an indefinite leave of absence to advise Michael Bloomberg's U.S. presidential campaign, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: GM to add 1,200 jobs at Michigan plants to meet SUV demand
Description: No. 1 U.S. automaker General Motors Co  said on Friday it plans to add more than 1,200 jobs at its Lansing plants in Michigan to meet growing demand for its SUVs.

Headlines: Goldman expects 75 bps of Fed rate cuts by June
Description: Goldman Sachs expects the coronavirus to drive the Federal Reserve to cut U.S. interest rates by 75 basis points by June it said on Friday, implying as many as three cuts starting at its next meeting in March.

Headlines: Italy's Alitalia reduces flights on 38 routes as coronavirus deters passengers
Description: Italy's flagship carrier Alitalia said on Friday it was reducing flights on 38 national and international routes because coronavirus was leading to fewer passengers.

Headlines: Fed's Bullard: U.S. rate cuts 'a possibility' if coronavirus intensifies, not base case
Description: Federal Reserve rate cuts are "a possibility" if the coronavirus outbreak intensifies into a global pandemic, St. Louis Fed president James Bullard said Friday, while adding that market pricing for a rate cut will not force the central bank's hand.

Headlines: Swiss anti-viral ban on large events hits Geneva car show head-on
Description: Switzerland on Friday banned large events expected to draw more than 1,000 people in a drive to curb the new coronavirus epidemic, prompting cancellation of the Geneva car show and grumbling from businesses watching demand vanish.

Headlines: Axing of Geneva car show forces manufacturers to rethink car launches
Description: Carmakers were scrambling to reorganise press conferences and vehicle presentations after Swiss authorities forced the cancellation of the Geneva car show on Friday in an effort to contain the coronavirus.

Headlines: Going viral: Six charts and the $6 trillion loss
Description: The rapid worldwide spread of coronavirus and the economic implications of the outbreak have triggered the biggest weekly stock market rout since the 2008 financial crisis, wiping $6 trillion off global equities.

Headlines: Lion Air puts $500 million IPO on hold as global equity markets tumble: sources
Description: Indonesia's Lion Air has deferred plans for an initial public offering (IPO) due to a sharp fall in global stock markets, people close to the matter said on Friday, as the spreading coronavirus sparks worries of a global pandemic.

Headlines: Bullard: Market pricing will not dictate rate cut, Fed policymakers will monitor events up to March FOMC
Description: The Federal Reserve does not need to cut U.S. interest rates just because markets have priced in aggressive central bank action, but policymakers will be monitoring events closely up to the upcoming March 17-18 meeting, St. Louis Federal Reserve bank president James Bullard said on Friday.

Headlines: Trafigura forms venture with Phillips 66 for deepwater Texas oil port
Description: Global commodities trader Trafigura said on Friday it had formed a joint venture with U.S. refiner Phillips 66  to build a major deepwater port in Texas capable of handling supertankers, ditching its own competing project.

Headlines: As coronavirus fears grow, private equity eyes distressed investments
Description: Major private equity firms, which have built up big distressed debt funds in recent years, are ready to snap up assets on the cheap if the coronavirus outbreak causes deeper market disruptions, executives told an industry meeting this week.

Headlines: Elliott presses SoftBank to identify $10 billion of investments it holds: sources
Description: Elliott Management Corp is pressing SoftBank Group Corp  for details of nearly-$10 billion of investment securities on its balance sheet, as part of its campaign to improve the value of the Japanese conglomerate in which it holds a stake, sources said.

Headlines: Bullard: Fed already insured against shocks like coronavirus
Description: The Federal Reserve has already insured against shocks like the coronavirus, St. Louis Federal Reserve bank president James Bullard said on Friday.

Headlines: Coty taps Jimmy Choo boss Pierre Denis as next CEO
Description: Coty Inc on Friday named Jimmy Choo boss Pierre Denis as its next chief executive officer, replacing Pierre Laubies, betting on deep luxury fashion sector experience as the company tries to turnaround sales of its core hair care and cosmetics products.

Headlines: Revival gives Rolls-Royce confidence despite coronavirus
Description: Rolls-Royce  has got to grips with a long-running engine problem and enjoyed a strong end to 2019, leaving it well placed to cope with any disruption caused by the coronavirus outbreak, it said on Friday.

Headlines: United cuts more flights to Asia, extends China cancellations
Description: United Airlines  said Friday it was cutting flights to Japan, South Korea and Singapore and extending flight cancellations to China in response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Prudential investors back Loeb but in no rush to execute break-up plan
Description: Shareholders in Prudential Plc  have given their blessing to a bid by activist investor Third Point to carve up Britain’s largest insurer but advise against a hasty sale of its U.S business.

Headlines: ECB rate setters see no need for action as coronavirus spreads
Description: The European Central Bank does not need to take immediate action in response to the coronavirus epidemic, two ECB policymakers said on Friday, confounding market bets on a rate cut.

Headlines: Kenya's high court orders suspension of flights from China over coronavirus
Description: Kenya's High Court on Friday ordered flights from China to be temporarily suspended over the coronavirus outbreak, following a petition by the Law Society of Kenya.

Headlines: OPEC leaning towards larger oil cuts as virus hits prices, demand: sources
Description: Several key OPEC members are leaning towards a bigger than previously expected oil output cut, four sources with knowledge of the talks said, as oil prices fell to $50 per barrel on fears the coronavirus outbreak will hit oil demand badly.

Headlines: Chinese maker of 'Amazon coat' weathers coronavirus impact with tax breaks, rent waivers
Description: Orolay, the maker of the 'Amazon coat' that became a darling of U.S. fashion and social media a year ago, knows it is luckier than most Chinese small businesses trying to get back on their feet amid huge disruptions caused by the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: ECB's Weidmann: No need for immediate monetary policy action due to coronavirus
Description: There is no need to take immediate monetary policy action due to the coronavirus outbreak, the European Central Bank's Jens Weidmann said on Friday, adding that remaining alert was however warranted.

Headlines: Investment advisers worry U.S. response to coronavirus is too little too late
Description: Investment-advisers are increasingly worried that U.S. authorities are not be doing enough to prevent a widespread outbreak of coronavirus in the country, potentially adding further downside to already-battered markets.

Headlines: Japan minister flying to Lebanon to make case for Ghosn's return
Description: Japan's deputy justice minister is traveling to Lebanon this weekend to try to make the case that fugitive ex-Nissan  Chairman Carlos Ghosn should stand trial in Japan.

Headlines: Aramco secures unconditional EU okay for $69 billion SABIC deal
Description: World No. 1 oil producer Saudi Aramco has gained unconditional EU antitrust approval for its $69 billion bid for a 70% stake in petrochemicals group Saudi Basic Industries Corp (SABIC), according to an EU filing.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor halts work at factory after worker tests positive for coronavirus
Description: Hyundai Motor  shut down a factory in South Korea on Friday after a worker tested positive for the new coronavirus, disrupting production of popular models such as Palisade sport utility vehicle.

Headlines: London Stock Exchange on track to close Refinitiv deal as clearing jumps
Description: - The London Stock Exchange Group  said on Friday it would complete its $27 billion takeover of analytics company Refinitiv on time this year as it reported a rise in annual income driven by a jump in clearing activity.

Headlines: China's big airlines resume some global flights halted by coronavirus
Description: China's three biggest airlines have restored a fraction of the international flights they halted in the wake of a coronavirus outbreak, heeding a call from the aviation regulator as business activity recovers slowly.

Headlines: EasyJet to cancel flights as coronavirus hits demand
Description: British budget airline easyJet  said on Friday it would cancel flights and cut costs across its business after the coronavirus outbreak hit demand for travel to Italy and other European markets.

Headlines: Powered by hydrogen, Hyundai's trucks aim to conquer the Swiss Alps
Description: Hyundai's  hydrogen-powered 18-tonne trucks are set to hit the roads in Switzerland next month as the South Korean automaker looks to establish a case for its zero-emissions technology in a low carbon world.

Headlines: JPMorgan restricts global travel to protect against virus: Bloomberg News
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  has issued global restrictions on non-essential travel to protect its employees and business from the coronavirus epidemic, Bloomberg News https://bloom.bg/2vnxhyW reported late on Thursday.

Headlines: British Airways owner says earnings bets are off as coronavirus hits
Description: British Airways-owner IAG  said on Friday that coronavirus would hit its earnings this year but it wasn't sure by how much, becoming the latest airline to warn about the impact of the rapidly evolving outbreak.

Headlines: Malaysia's AirAsia X defers A330neo deliveries as virus pressures frail finances
Description: Malaysian long-haul budget airline AirAsia X  said it will defer delivery of 78 Airbus SE  A330neo planes and consider other changes to reduce its fleet, as the coronavirus outbreak adds pressure on the loss-making carrier.

Headlines: Tokyo Disneyland to close through mid-March on coronavirus concerns
Description: Tokyo Disneyland will be closed from Saturday to March 15 due to concerns about coronavirus infections spreading in Japan, its operator said on Friday, leaving all of Walt Disney Co's  theme parks in Asia temporarily shut.

Headlines: Uniqlo reopens more China stores, most partner factories restart
Description: Fast Retailing , which operates casual clothing chain Uniqlo, said on Friday it had reopened more than 100 stores in China in the past week, while 125 remained closed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Exclusive: Aluminum smelter resurrected on Trump tariffs may close as losses mount
