Description: A bankrupt aluminum smelter that re-opened in 2018, after U.S. President Donald Trump imposed tariffs on imported metals, is losing money at such a rapid clip that it could close within 60 days, the top executive at the Missouri plant said on Thursday.

Headlines: Public Storage only bidder left for National Storage with $1.25 billion bid
Description: U.S.-based Public Storage  emerged on Friday as the likely buyer of Australia's largest self-storage operator National Storage REIT  with its current A$1.89 billion ($1.25 billion) offer, after two rivals dropped out of the race.

Headlines: Japan's January factory output beats forecasts but slowdown expected
Description: Japan's factory output rose more than expected in January, providing some relief for policymakers amid heightened risks of a recession as the coronavirus outbreak in China disrupts supply chains and business activity.

Headlines: SEC orders Wells Fargo pay $35 million for recommendations of high-risk products
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Thursday it ordered Wells Fargo & Co to pay $35 million to settle charges it failed to adequately supervise investment advisers who were recommending high-risk products.

Headlines: Texas prosecutors accuse Arkema, executives of failures over chemical fire
Description: Jurors in the criminal case against the U.S. arm of a French company on Thursday heard it routinely stored combustible chemicals where floodwaters could reach them and failed to alert emergency workers as toxic fires erupted.

Headlines: Too white, too male: Fed takes on diversity one bank board member at a time
Description: The Federal Reserve, long criticized for being too white and male, crossed a substantial milestone last year: for the first time in its 107-year history, white men held fewer than half of board seats at the Fed's 12 regional outposts.

Headlines: Highlights: Fed policymakers on why diversity matters and how to get there
Description: Several U.S. Federal Reserve policymakers told Reuters why increasing diversity within the U.S. central bank system matters. Here are some highlights:

Headlines: Global funds cut equity exposure in turbulent February, eye virus risk: Reuters poll
Description: Global funds changed course in February and recommended a cut to equity allocations in their model balanced portfolio after taking them to a two-year high in January, instead suggesting an increase in bond holdings, Reuters polls showed.

Headlines: Beyond Meat posts profit miss, dragged by investment, marketing costs; shares fall
Description: Beyond Meat Inc  on Thursday missed quarterly earnings expectations due to higher costs, and said Executive Chairman Seth Goldman would give up his executive status, while remaining chair of the board, sending shares down 10% in after-hours trade.

Headlines: Facebook cancels developer conference as tech companies respond to virus
Description: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it would cancel its annual developer conference due to fears over the coronavirus, as growing concerns about the economic impact of the global outbreak drove Wall Street to tumble for a sixth straight day.

Headlines: Blowout fear for forex markets as coronavirus stirs dormant volatility trades
Description: With this week's coronavirus-driven rout having shaken awake previously slumbering euro-dollar markets, the spotlight is back on the "short volatility" trades that some regulators fear could trigger a blowup on world markets.

Headlines: Is new Disney CEO Bob Chapek up to the task?
Description: A global pandemic and the challenge of figuring out the future of entertainment greeted Bob Chapek on Wednesday as he took over as Chief Executive Officer of Walt Disney Co .

Headlines: Mexico's state-run Pemex posts steep 2019 loss in blow to president's revival plan
Description: Petroleos Mexicanos posted a $18.3 billion net loss for 2019 on Thursday, nearly doubling the previous year's loss and dealing a major blow to the Mexican president's quest to revive the heavily-indebted state oil company.

Headlines: Mylan warns of possible drug shortages, financial hit due to coronavirus
Description: Drugmaker Mylan NV  said on Thursday it expects the coronavirus outbreak to impact its financial results and warned of drug shortages in case of continued spread of the virus, sending shares of the company down 3.6%.

Headlines: Europe looking for positive signal from U.S. on trade: EU lawmaker
Description: The European Union hopes to de-escalate trade tensions with the United States but wants Washington to lower steel tariffs or make another goodwill gesture after a series of concessions by Brussels in recent years, a top EU lawmaker said Thursday.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp sells elevator unit for $18.7 billion to Advent, Cinven consortium
Description: By Christoph Steitz, Edward Taylor, Matthias Inverardi and Tom Käckenhoff

Headlines: Fed seen cutting rates amid virus threat, low inflation
Description: The Federal Reserve may need to move aggressively to cut borrowing costs to cushion the economy from the effects of the rapid spread of the new coronavirus, which sent global stocks tumbling this week.

Headlines: Facebook to publicly track political sponsored content after Bloomberg's paid memes
Description: Facebook Inc  will provide a way for people to track political sponsored content on Facebook and Instagram ahead of the U.S. presidential election, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Investors ditch market risk as stocks fall into correction
Description: Fears of a sustained global economic impact as the coronavirus rapidly spreads beyond China have sent investors scrambling to find safety less than 10 days after the U.S. stock market set  record highs.

Headlines: Occidental posts quarterly loss on impairment, charges
Description: Occidental Petroleum Corp  reported a quarterly loss on Thursday, as the oil and gas producer took more than $1.7 billion in impairment and other charges.

Headlines: Bed Bath & Beyond to cut about 500 jobs; expects about $26 million charge
Description: Bed Bath & Beyond Inc  would cut about 500 jobs, including management positions, as part of a restructuring program to turn around its business, the home-furnishing retailer said on Thursday.

Headlines: Tellurian stock falls after company extends U.S. LNG sale negotiations with Petronet
Description: Tellurian Inc  stock dropped on Thursday after the company said it extended the amount of time India's Petronet LNG Ltd  had to finalize an agreement to buy liquefied natural gas (LNG) from Tellurian's Driftwood plant in Louisiana.

Headlines: FCC to propose $200 million fines for U.S. cellphone carriers over consumer data disclosures
Description: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission is set to propose fining four major U.S. mobile phone companies at least $200 million in total for improperly disclosing some consumer real-time location data, two people briefed on the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Dow suffers record decline in points as Wall Street leads global stocks lower
Description: The Dow industrials posted the largest-ever points drop on Thursday as Wall Street led stocks across the globe lower, with traders fretting over the economic impact of the spreading coronavirus.

Headlines: Oil prices dive to lowest in over a year on coronavirus fears
Description: Oil prices tumbled for a fifth day on Thursday to their lowest level in more than a year, as new reports of novel coronavirus cases outside China spurred investor fears that the rapidly spreading outbreak could slow the global economy.

Headlines: Telecom Italia picks KKR as partner for Italian broadband
Description: Telecom Italia (TIM) on Thursday picked KKR  as an exclusive partner to develop its ultra-broadband business, saying its board had taken positive note of a non-binding proposal by the U.S. investment firm.

Headlines: Financial firms discussing coronavirus contingency plans with regulators: official
Description: U.S.-based banks and brokers are in discussions with federal regulators about allowing staff to work from home and other business continuity arrangements amid the spread of the coronavirus, the head of a top financial trade group said on Thursday.

Headlines: Amazon bars one million products for false coronavirus claims
Description: Amazon.com Inc has barred more than 1 million products from sale in recent weeks that had inaccurately claimed to cure or defend against the coronavirus, the company told Reuters on  Thursday.

Headlines: Opioid companies say lawyers' fee demand threatens settlement talks
Description: Johnson & Johnson  and other drug companies facing  thousands of lawsuits over their role in the opioid epidemic have warned that settlement talks will be "severely" jeopardized if plaintiffs' lawyers are allowed to assess a fee payment worth billions of dollars.

Headlines: Microsoft shares slip after warning of coronavirus hit to supply chain
Description: Shares of Microsoft Corp  fell 4% on Thursday after the company warned of weakness in its PC business after a hit to its supply chain from the coronavirus outbreak, echoing similar statements from Apple Inc  and HP .

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. business forecasts earnings pressure as coronavirus spreads
Description: As the coronavirus epidemic spreads in China and beyond, U.S. companies will see profits stagnate in 2020, according to a Goldman Sachs report.

Headlines: Pfizer warns of hit to financial results on continued coronavirus outbreak
Description: Pfizer Inc  on Thursday warned that the continued spread of the coronavirus globally could have an adverse impact on its business and financial results.

Headlines: U.S. economy grows steadily in fourth-quarter, but coronavirus looms large
Description: The U.S. economy grew moderately in the fourth quarter, the government confirmed, and is facing a bumpy road in early 2020 amid the fast-spreading coronavirus that has left financial markets fearing a recession.

Headlines: U.S. pending home sales jump 5.2% in January
Description: Contracts to buy previously owned U.S. homes rebounded in January to their second-highest monthly figure in about two years as low mortgage rates boosted sales.

Headlines: Thomson Reuters names new CEO, earnings top estimates
Description: (This February 25 story refiles to delete "organic" from paragraph 8)

Headlines: Fed's Evans: too early to cut growth outlook or rates on coronavirus
Description: Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Charles Evans said on Thursday it was too soon to say if the U.S. growth forecast would be lowered due to the coronavirus epidemic, let alone if the U.S. central bank would need to cut rates. .

Headlines: Fed's Evans says above-target inflation 'essential' in future
Description: Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Charles Evans on Thursday suggested that "extraordinary accommodation" and a period of elevated inflation will be integral to the U.S. central bank's approach to fighting the next severe economic downturn.

Headlines: Mastercard says coronavirus to hit first-quarter revenue
Description: (This February 24 story corrects to say revenue to be hit between "2 and 3 percentage points" not "2% and 3%" in first paragraph)

Headlines: Bayer cools prospect of imminent glyphosate settlement
Description: German drugs and pesticides company Bayer was at pains on Thursday to quell expectations it was nearing an out-of-court settlement laying to rest claims its glyphosate-based weedkillers cause cancer.

Headlines: Alphabet still facing questions over data use in its Toronto smart city project proposal
Description: Alphabet's proposed "smart" city development in Toronto is facing fresh questions over the project's data-gathering technology from a panel advising the Canadian government-mandated body in charge of getting it built.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs asks some to skip conference over coronavirus concerns
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  is asking people not to attend the bank's New York conference next week if they or someone they are close to had recently traveled to China, South Korea or parts of Italy, according to the conference website.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp sells elevator unit for $18.7 billion to Advent-led consortium
Description: Thyssenkrupp  on Thursday said it agreed to sell its prized elevator division to a private equity consortium including Advent, Cinven and Germany's RAG foundation for 17.2 billion euros ($18.7 billion).

Headlines: TIM board views positively KKR's non-binding bid for fiber-optic network
Description: Telecom Italia (TIM) said on Thursday its board viewed positively a non-binding offer by U.S. investment firm KKR to become the Italian telecoms group's exclusive partner in developing a fiber-optic network.

Headlines: Vivendi files appeal against Milan court OK to Mediaset revamp
Description: France's Vivendi  has filed an appeal against a  decision by a Milan judge to clear the way for a planned reorganization at Mediaset , Italy's biggest commercial broadcaster said on Thursday.

Headlines: With West divided, Huawei plans first European 5G factory in France
Description: Huawei will build its first European manufacturing plant in France, the chairman said on Thursday, as the Chinese telecom giant seeks to ease worldwide concerns stoked by U.S. charges that Beijing could use its equipment for spying.

Headlines: China's top container ports unclog backlog as virus curbs ease
Description: China's top container ports are loosening the backlog of cargoes on their docks as workers return to their jobs after coronavirus travel curbs that kept them away and jammed up global supply chains have been eased.

Headlines: Tesla shares slump as coronavirus hits China car registrations
Description: Shares of Tesla Inc  fell as much as 14% on Thursday on concerns about the impact of the coronavirus on the electric-car maker's vehicle registrations in China.

Headlines: DoorDash files to go public in latest IPO test for unprofitable startups
Description: DoorDash Inc, the loss-making U.S. food delivery startup backed by SoftBank Group Corp , said on Thursday it has filed for an initial public offering (IPO), setting it up to be one of the most high-profile listings of 2020.

Headlines: Starbucks' CEO says 85% of stores in China are open
Description: Starbucks Corp  said on Thursday 85% of its stores in China were open, weeks after the coffee chain shut nearly half of its over 4,000 stores in the world's second-largest economy due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. stocks confirm correction on pandemic fears
Description: Wall Street's main indexes tumbled on Thursday, putting them  more than 10% below record highs set earlier this month and indicating that they then entered an intraday correction, as the rapid spread of the coronavirus globally deepened worries about growth and corporate earnings.

Headlines: Cargill bans international travel for staff amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: International grains trader and processor Cargill Inc has banned all non-essential travel for its employees for the next two weeks due to the coronavirus outbreak, company spokeswoman April Nelson told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: French carmaker PSA unveils mini electric Citroen car
Description: Citroen, one of French carmaker PSA's brands, unveiled a mini electric car on Thursday aimed at young city dwellers.

Headlines: South African unit of Philip Morris welcomes tax stance on cigarette alternatives
Description: The South African unit of cigarette maker Philip Morris International Inc  welcomed the government's decision to introduce a lower excise tax on heated tobacco products than on regular cigarettes.

Headlines: Wall Street set for steep fall on alarm over fast-spreading virus
Description: Futures indicated that the Dow Jones Industrials index would shed more than 300 points at the open on Thursday after the rapid spread of the coronavirus outside China deepened worries about growth and corporate earnings.

Headlines: Taxi group wins right to join Uber's London license appeal case
Description: A taxi association will be able to participate in Uber's appeal against the loss of its operating license in the British capital city set to be heard in full from July 6, a British judge decided on Thursday.

Headlines: Nokia shares rise on report of possible mergers, assets sales
Description: Shares in Nokia Oyj  rose in a falling market on Thursday, after Bloomberg News reported that the Finnish telecom network equipment maker was considering asset sales and mergers.

Headlines: WPP shares slump to lowest since 2012 as sales slide
Description: WPP  shares plunged to their lowest level in nearly eight years on Thursday after a sharp slowdown in fourth-quarter trading derailed the latest recovery attempt at the world's biggest advertising company.

Headlines: Zalando to tap designer labels, vintage to boost sales
Description: Zalando  plans to offer more premium and luxury ranges and move into the vintage clothing market as the online fashion retailer predicted slower sales growth in 2020 after a strong final quarter to 2019.

Headlines: U.S. airlines, hotels extend rebooking options as coronavirus spreads
Description: (This February 25 story corrects to say that Marriott has issued cancellation waiver until March 15 in paragraph 13)

Headlines: Blackstone's Schwarzman says cannot buy Bloomberg while owning Refinitiv
Description: Blackstone Group Inc  Chief Executive Stephen Schwarzman said the world's biggest private equity firm cannot buy Bloomberg should it come up for sale as long as the firm owns competitor Refinitiv.

Headlines: Banks must step up climate risk disclosures, Lagarde says
Description: Banks must improve transparency on their exposure to climate- change risk and central banks need to pay closer attention as the entire financial sector is at risk, European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said on Thursday.

Headlines: AB InBev sees 10% hit to first-quarter profit from coronavirus
Description: The world's largest brewer Anheuser-Busch InBev  forecast a 10% decline in first-quarter profit on Thursday after the coronavirus outbreak hit beer sales during the Chinese New Year, sending its shares skidding.

Headlines: Aston Martin shares slide as losses deepen and finance chief leaves
Description: Aston Martin  shares slumped to a record low on Thursday after the British luxury carmaker said its losses ballooned last year and its chief financial officer would leave by the end of April.

Headlines: StanChart posts strong results but coronavirus, economic headwinds to hamper profit growth
Description: Standard Chartered  booked a robust 46% jump in annual profit but warned a key earnings target would take longer to meet as the coronavirus epidemic adds to headwinds in its main markets of China and Hong Kong.

Headlines: Thai tycoons in fray as Tesco sets bid deadline for $9 billion Asia business: sources
Description: British retailer Tesco  has asked bidders to submit binding offers for its Asian business by Friday, in a deal that will see Thai billionaires fight for an asset valued at up to $9 billion, sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: IKEA reduces climate footprint for the first time
Description: Carbon emissions throughout the full value chain of IKEA furniture fell for the first time last year, brand owner Inter IKEA said on Thursday citing increased use of renewable energy.

Headlines: ABB confirms profit goals for robotics division
Description: ABB's  robotics division is "well placed" to increase sales by broadening its business beyond the struggling automotive sector, the Swiss engineering company said on Thursday, confirming its profitability goal.

Headlines: Microsoft wants to invest in Indonesia data centers, says Indonesian president
Description: Microsoft Corp is keen to invest in data centers in Indonesia which will soon make regulatory changes to facilitate the move, the country's president said after meeting with the software giant's CEO on Thursday.

Headlines: Panera Bread launches $8.99 monthly unlimited coffee subscription
Description: Panera Bread Co on Thursday is launching an $8.99 per month unlimited coffee subscription as it aims to grow its breakfast traffic and loyalty program membership.

Headlines: Delta cutting flights to South Korea; JetBlue waives U.S. change fees
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc  said on Wednesday it would temporarily cut flights to and from South Korea in half, citing global health concerns related to the coronavirus outbreak as U.S. airlines grapple with lagging travel demand.

Headlines: JPMorgan names veteran Gori as new Asia Pacific chief executive
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  on Thursday named veteran Filippo Gori as its new Asia Pacific chief executive officer to oversee strategy and operations of the Wall Street bank across 17 markets in the region.

Headlines: Waymo joins backlash against California self-driving data requirement
Description: Alphabet Inc's Waymo and General Motors Co's Cruise are leading a backlash against a California reporting requirement on self-driving vehicle test data that the companies claim is not relevant or accurate in measuring performance or progress.

Headlines: Google defeats conservative nonprofit's YouTube censorship appeal
Description: Google persuaded a federal appeals court on Wednesday to reject claims that YouTube illegally censors conservative content.

Headlines: Facebook to ban misleading ads about coronavirus
Description: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it would ban advertisements for products offering any cures or prevention around the coronavirus outbreak, and those that create a sense of urgency around the situation.

Headlines: China's CATL aims to raise $2.85 billion for EV battery projects
Description: CATL , China's top electric vehicle battery maker, said it aims to raise up to 20 billion yuan ($2.85 billion) in a private placement of shares to fund its battery projects and boost working capital.

Headlines: Coronavirus clouds Apple's timeline for new iPhones
Description: Travel restrictions to China because of the coronavirus have come just as Apple Inc's engineers usually jet off to Asia to perfect the production of this fall's new iPhones, former employees and supply chain experts told Reuters.

Headlines: Hyundai to decide hydrogen fuel-cell factory location this year - exec
Description: Hyundai Motor Co  and its affiliates are ready to decide the location of a new hydrogen fuel-cell system factory this year, which could be in South Korea or overseas, an executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Senator Rubio seeks U.S. review of sale of AT&T unit to Czech-owned conglomerate
Description: U.S. Senator Marco Rubio on Wednesday asked the Trump administration to review the national security implications of AT&T's Inc's planned sale of its majority stake in Central European Media Group Enterprises (CME) to the Czech-owned conglomerate PPF Group.

Headlines: Global stocks outlook still positive, but vulnerable to coronavirus: Reuters poll
Description: Global stocks have further to run this year, but the likelihood of a correction of 10% or more is high, according to Reuters polls of market strategists, with the severity of the economic hit from the coronavirus outbreak being the biggest risk.

Headlines: Exclusive: IMF, World Bank consider 'virtual' Spring Meetings as virus spreads
Description: Growing concerns inside the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank about the spread of the new coronavirus have prompted the institutions to consider scaling back their Spring Meetings in April or hold them by teleconference, people familiar with the discussions said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Apple investor vote sounds 'warning' over China app takedowns
Description: An Apple Inc shareholder proposal critical of the company's app removals in China received a relatively high level of support at the iPhone maker's annual meeting on Wednesday,  enough to push the company to respond, experts said.

Headlines: Canada mulling made-in-Ottawa supplement to Boeing's 737 MAX flight manual
Description: Transport Canada is mulling a Canadian supplement to the Boeing  737 MAX's U.S.-developed flight manual, as the regulator  weighs going beyond steps taken by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to end a global grounding of the model after two fatal crashes.

Headlines: Wall Street falls more slowly as investors parse coronavirus fears
Description: The S&P 500 fell for a fifth straight day on Wednesday and while its decline was slower than the last few days, the session was volatile as investors reacted to headlines about coronavirus and sought to gauge its economic fallout.

Headlines: Toll Brothers says 11 home sales in California impacted by coronavirus
Description: Home builder Toll Brothers Inc  said on Wednesday that the coronavirus outbreak in China had led to shortages of lighting fixtures and small appliances, forcing it to delay the sales of 11 homes in California, one of its biggest markets.

Headlines: A new calculator sheds light on high-flying U.S. unicorn price tags
Description: Common shares in many high-flying venture-backed startup companies are worth less than headlines lead some people to believe, and an online calculator that two finance professors debuted on Wednesday can now quantify that discrepancy.

Headlines: Microsoft expects Windows unit to miss revenue outlook on coronavirus impact
Description: Microsoft Inc said on Wednesday it does not expect to meet its quarterly revenue forecast for its Windows and personal computing business as a result of the coronavirus outbreak, sending its shares down more than 1% in after-market trading.

Headlines: NMC Health removes CEO amid investigation of UAE firm's finances
Description: NMC Health  has removed Chief Executive Prasanth Manghat with immediate effect and granted its finance chief extended sick leave, as more details emerge from an investigation into the UAE healthcare firm's finances.

Headlines: Stocks, oil fall as coronavirus fears grip markets
Description: Stocks and oil prices resumed their fall on Wednesday after  authorities said more than 80 people were being monitored for the novel coronavirus in New York state's Long Island, adding to concern over its spread in Europe, Asia and the Middle East.

Headlines: U.S. stock exchanges say prepared for coronavirus
Description: U.S. stock exchanges said on Wednesday they were watching coronavirus-related developments closely and had contingency plans in place to continue running if any of their operations were affected.

Headlines: EU open to more spending in countries hit by coronavirus outbreak
Description: Italy and other euro zone countries hit by the coronavirus outbreak are expected to benefit from waivers under EU fiscal rules that will allow them to spend more to tackle the emergency, the bloc's economics commissioner said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Oil prices drop to lowest in more than a year as coronavirus spreads
Description: Oil prices fell to their lowest in more than a year on Wednesday after hundreds of new coronavirus cases reported in Europe and the Middle East stoked fears that energy demand would decline, and on concerns that the virus could spread across the United States.

Headlines: Nokia explores strategic options: Bloomberg News
Description: Finnish telecom network equipment maker Nokia Oyj is exploring strategic options and is working with advisers to consider potential asset sales and mergers, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court allows retirement plan lawsuit against Intel
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Wednesday refused to back stricter deadlines for workers to sue retirement plans over alleged mismanagement, ruling Intel Corp cannot avoid a suit accusing it of unlawfully making high-risk investments that cost retirement plan beneficiaries hundreds of millions of dollars.

Headlines: Wells Fargo workers seek Washington's help with internal gripes
Description: A contingent of aggrieved Wells Fargo & Co workers are taking complaints to Capitol Hill, saying they feel brushed aside by management.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending could see one-two punch from stocks drop, coronavirus
Description: The coronavirus outbreak has yet to spread meaningfully to U.S. shores, but fears of it alone have already eviscerated some $2 trillion of American stock market value, setting off a market rout that could stymie consumer spending - even before other economic effects of the disease are felt.

Headlines: Aston Martin investor blazes green trail for buyout fund
Description: The top shareholder of carmaker Aston Martin is on a mission to turn investments from theme parks to high-end furniture brands "carbon positive" by the end of 2020, as buyout funds battle to woo investors increasingly focused on tackling global warming.

Headlines: Starbucks to launch Beyond Meat plant-based breakfast sandwich in Canada
Description: Starbucks Corp  said on Wednesday its Canadian stores will start selling a Beyond Meat Inc  plant-based breakfast sandwich next week, the first time the world's biggest coffee chain will offer an imitation meat product.

Headlines: Nestle asks staff to stop international travel amid coronavirus epidemic
Description: Nestle SA  has asked its staff to halt international travel for business purposes through March 15 as a precautionary measure amid the rapid spread of the coronavirus globally, the Swiss company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Bayer chairman quits as Roundup settlement talks progress
Description: Bayer  Chairman Werner Wenning, one of the architects of a $63 billion takeover deal that has left the German crop protection company fighting costly lawsuits, will step down in April, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Pressure mounts on Bayer CEO to fix legal problems as chairman quits
Description: The departure of Bayer  Chairman Werner Wenning will turn up the heat on CEO Werner Baumann to resolve the healthcare to agriculture group's legal problems, two of the firm's biggest German shareholders said on Wednesday.

Headlines: SmileDirectClub sell-off gives short sellers reason to grin
Description: Traders short selling SmileDirectClub had a lot to smile about on Wednesday, earning paper profits of over $115 million as the online dental company's stock plummeted 26% following a disappointing quarterly report.

Headlines: Walmart in talks with possible buyers for Asda stake
Description: Walmart , the world's largest retailer, is in talks with possible buyers of a stake in its British supermarket Asda, which it failed to combine with Sainsbury's  last year.

Headlines: Lloyds, Virgin Money cut jobs as UK bank customers shift online
Description: Lloyds Banking Group  and Virgin Money  pressed ahead with hundreds of job cuts in the face of union opposition, as British banks try to keep up with customers moving online.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley deputy chief financial officer to retire
Description: Morgan Stanley's Deputy Chief Financial Officer Paul Wirth will retire after 15 years with the bank, according to a memo sent to employees seen by Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley conference-goers asked to self-report coronavirus exposure
Description: Morgan Stanley  is asking people attending its technology, media and telecom conference in San Francisco next week to report if they had visited several countries with reported coronavirus cases in recent weeks.

Headlines: Fund investors retreat from U.S. stocks as coronavirus fears weigh
Description: Investors pulled nearly $3.3 billion out of mutual funds and exchange-traded funds that hold U.S. stocks last week, snapping the longest streak of asset gains since July, according to data released Wednesday by the Investment Company Institute.

Headlines: BP to quit main U.S. refining lobby over carbon policy
Description: BP  will leave the main U.S. refining lobby and two other trade groups as new Chief Executive Bernard Looney spurs some of the oil sector's most ambitious targets for curbing carbon emissions.

Headlines: Panasonic to exit solar production at Tesla's New York plant as partnership frays
Description: Panasonic Corp  said it would exit solar cell production at Tesla Inc's New York plant, the latest sign of strain in a partnership where Panasonic's status as the U.S. electric vehicle (EV) maker's exclusive battery supplier is ending.

Headlines: Virgin Money plans to cut 500 jobs and close 52 branches
Description: British challenger bank Virgin Money  is planning to cut 500 jobs as it presses ahead with cost-cutting after bulking up through the merger of Virgin Money and Clydesdale and Yorkshire Banking Group in 2018, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Lufthansa and United weigh takeover of Portugal's TAP: Sueddeutsche
Description: Lufthansa  and United Airlines  are considering taking over TAP-Air Portugal, a German newspaper reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Delta Air waives travel change fees for South Korea as coronavirus spreads
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc  said on Wednesday it has expanded its travel change fee waiver to include Seoul, South Korea, through April 30, as coronavirus spreads to regions outside China.

Headlines: Jury weighs verdict for ex-Barclays bankers in Qatar fee trial
Description: The jury in the London trial of three former Barclays bankers accused of funneling secret fees to Qatar in return for emergency funding during the financial crisis in 2008, retired to consider its verdict on Wednesday.

Headlines: BlackRock Vice Chairman and co-Founder Barbara Novick to step down
Description: BlackRock Inc  vice chairman and co-founder Barbara Novick will step down from her day-to-day duties at the asset manager, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Disney shares down 2% after 'surprise' CEO change
Description: Shares of Walt Disney Co  fell 2% on Wednesday after the media giant's surprise move to replace top boss Bob Iger raised questions on Wall Street if his successor Bob Chapek had sufficient experience in the entertainment business.

Headlines: Walt Disney's Iger steps down as CEO, parks head Chapek to take reins
Description: Walt Disney Co's  Robert Iger will step down as chief executive officer, handing the reins to Disney Parks head Bob Chapek, the company said on Tuesday, ending years of speculation on who will take over Hollywood's most powerful studio.

Headlines: Electrolux says implementing Italy travel ban until March 9 due to Coronavirus
Description: Swedish home appliance maker Electrolux  said on Wednesday it had decided on ban travel by its employees to and from Italy, where it has manufacturing facilities in some regions affected by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Google to invest over $10 billion in 2020 on U.S. data centers, offices
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google said on Wednesday it would invest more than $10 billion in offices and data centers across the United States this year.

Headlines: Profit rise lifts Peugeot shares ahead of Fiat merger
Description: Peugeot maker PSA Group said on Wednesday profitability reached a record high in 2019, results that contrasted with those of many rivals and boosted the group's shares as it beds down a merger with Italy's Fiat Chrysler.

Headlines: Ford's incoming COO focuses on cost cuts, launches, change
Description: Ford Motor Co's  incoming chief operating officer outlined his priorities for the company's turnaround on Wednesday, including cost cuts and more efficient new-vehicle launches in a year in which it will introduce a redesigned F-150 full-sized pickup truck.

Headlines: Too early for the ECB to contemplate coronavirus response: Makhlouf
Description: It is too early for the European Central Bank to assess whether it needs to respond to the coronavirus epidemic with policy, even if the epidemic presents a risk to growth, Irish central bank chief Gabriel Makhlouf said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Toyota says Japan plants may be affected by virus-related supply issues
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  on Wednesday said that operations at its plants in Japan may be affected by supply chain issues linked to the new coronavirus outbreak in the coming weeks, as the global outbreak gathers pace.

Headlines: Trump, Modi hope talks lead to phase one of U.S.-India trade deal: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi have agreed to "promptly" conclude ongoing trade talks that they hope can lead to the first phase of a bilateral U.S.-India trade deal, the White House said.

Headlines: PG&E plans to raise up to $25.68 billion by selling securities
Description: California power producer PG&E Corp said on Tuesday it plans to raise up to $25.68 billion by selling securities, as it works its way out of the bankruptcy process.

Headlines: Salesforce co-CEO Keith Block steps down, Marc Benioff to be sole chief
Description: Salesforce.com Inc  said on Tuesday Keith Block has stepped down as co-chief executive officer, making Marc Benioff the sole CEO of the business software company, sending its shares down nearly 3% in extended trading.

Headlines: AI computing startup SambaNova raises $250 million in BlackRock-led funding
Description: Artificial intelligence computing firm SambaNova Systems said on Tuesday it has raised $250 million in a funding round led by BlackRock Inc to expand its customer base, reflecting investors' appetite for the market.

Headlines: Musk's SpaceX rocket production facility approved by Port of Los Angeles
Description: SpaceX, the private rocket company of high tech entrepreneur Elon Musk, won final approval on Tuesday to build a research and manufacturing plant for its deep-space Starship project on a tract of vacant land at the Port of Los Angeles.

Headlines: Mattel receives SEC subpoena on whistleblower letter
Description: Mattel Inc  had received a subpoena in December from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission seeking documents related to a whistleblower letter and subsequent investigation, the U.S. toymaker said in a filing on Tuesday.

Headlines: Economic contagion spreads beyond China to other Asian economies: Reuters poll
Description: The effects of the coronavirus outbreak are likely to reverberate beyond China as most major economies in the region are expected to either slow down significantly, halt or shrink outright in the current quarter, Reuters polls found.

Headlines: Liberian former IMF Africa chief named as deputy managing director
Description: International Monetary Fund Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva on Tuesday nominated former IMF official Antoinette Sayeh to become a deputy managing director at the Fund.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan says unclear right now if coronavirus calls for U.S. rate change: WSJ
Description: Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Robert Kaplan said on Tuesday events are still too fluid around the coronavirus outbreak to say the U.S. central bank needs to lower short-term rates, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wall Street's sell-off deepens as coronavirus fears intensify
Description: The Dow and the S&P 500 tumbled 3% on Tuesday in their fourth straight day of losses as the coronavirus spread further around the world and investors offloaded risky assets as they struggled to gauge the economic impact.

Headlines: Coronavirus fears pull U.S. chip index into a correction
Description: Wall Street's main semiconductor benchmark tumbled into correction territory on Tuesday in its deepest four-day rout since the financial crisis, as the coronavirus spread further around the world and deepened fears about the global economy.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler CEO Manley received 13.3 million euros in 2019 compensation: filing
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV (FCA) Chief Executive Mike Manley received compensation of 13.28 million euros ($14.45 million) for 2019, in line with a target set by the company, the Italian-American automaker said in a filing on Tuesday.

Headlines: In first public results, Branson's Virgin Galactic posts $73 million quarterly loss
Description: Billionaire Richard Branson's space tourism company, Virgin Galactic Holdings Inc , said on Tuesday its fourth-quarter net loss widened to $73 million from a year-ago loss of $46 million as it reported its first results as a publicly traded company.

Headlines: U.S. trade rep Lighthizer to meet British counterpart as allies gear up for talks
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer will meet with Britain's trade minister Liz Truss this week, British government officials said on Tuesday, as the two allies gear up for post-Brexit trade talks that could prove contentious.

Headlines: Tesla and U.S. regulators strongly criticized over role of Autopilot in crash
Description: The National Transportation Safety Board on Tuesday sharply criticized Tesla Inc.'s lack of system safeguards in a fatal 2018 Autopilot crash in California and called U.S. regulators' approach in overseeing the driver assistance systems "misguided."

Headlines: Mallinckrodt agrees to $1.6 billion opioid settlement, unit to seek bankruptcy
Description: Mallinckrodt Plc on Tuesday said it had agreed to a $1.6 billion settlement proposal in which its generic drug business would file for bankruptcy in order to resolve thousands of lawsuits alleging it helped fuel the U.S. opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Three U.S. Senate Democrats propose sweeping reforms after Boeing 737 MAX crashes
Description: Three Democratic U.S. senators on Tuesday introduced sweeping legislation to reform how new airplanes are certified and overseen by U.S. regulators after two fatal Boeing 737 MAX crashes killed 346 people.

Headlines: Once bulletproof, tech stocks now among market's biggest losers
Description: Technology shares -- a key engine of the stock market's climb to records over the last several months -- are now among those leading Wall Street's plunge on growing concerns over the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Stocks, oil fall further on accelerating coronavirus concerns
Description: Stocks and oil prices tumbled again on Tuesday and the benchmark U.S. debt yield hit a record low on growing concern about the effects of the spread of coronavirus on the global economy.

Headlines: Oil falls for 3rd day as virus fears accelerate on U.S. warning
Description: Crude prices fell about 3% on Tuesday, dropping for a third day, as concerns about the spread of the coronavirus grew after the U.S. government warned Americans to prepare for the disease.

Headlines: JPMorgan executives say bank is big enough to weather any storm
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  executives tried to reassure investors on Tuesday that the bank can thrive during times of market and economic stress, due to the sheer size and breadth of its global operations.

Headlines: JPMorgan gets busy in repo lending after regulatory nod: CFO
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  is putting more cash into overnight lending markets and holding less for a rainy day, after discussing the matter with regulators, the bank's finance chief said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed's Clarida: We are 'closely monitoring' impact of coronavirus
Description: The Federal Reserve is "closely monitoring" the escalating coronavirus outbreak but it is still too soon to gauge if it would require a change in monetary policy, Fed Vice Chair Richard Clarida said on Tuesday as the central bank continues to patiently monitor the impact of the epidemic on the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Fed's Clarida says too soon to tell coronavirus impact on U.S. economy
Description: The impact of the coronavirus on the U.S. economy would likely need to be "material and persistent" for the central bank to change its outlook, U.S. Federal Reserve Vice Chair Richard Clarida indicated on Tuesday.

Headlines: Juul under scrutiny by 39 state attorneys general
Description: A group of 39 state attorneys general on Tuesday announced an investigation into Juul Labs Inc's marketing practices, adding to mounting legal and regulatory problems for the e-cigarette maker over its role in the nation's youth vaping epidemic.

Headlines: Facebook would have to pay $3.50 per month to U.S. users for sharing contact info: study
Description: German Facebook users would want the social media platform to pay them about $8 per month for sharing their contact information, while U.S. users would only seek $3.50, according to a study of how people in various countries value their private information.

Headlines: U.S. labor board limits companies' liability for franchisee labor-law violations
Description: A U.S. labor board on Tuesday finalized a rule that will make it more difficult to hold companies liable for unlawful labor practices by franchisees and contractors, reversing a more worker-friendly Obama-era standard criticized by business groups.

Headlines: For Wells Fargo and former executives, $3 billion-deal with U.S. may not be the end
Description: Although Wells Fargo & Co settled major probes with federal agencies over abusive sales practices last week, the bank and its former executives are not out of the woods yet, legal and regulatory experts said.

Headlines: Authentic Brands taps former H&M executive to helm Forever 21
Description: Forever 21's new co-owner Authentic Brands Group said on Tuesday it had appointed former H&M  executive Daniel Kulle as the new chief executive officer of the bankrupt apparel retailer.

Headlines: Deere taps tractor-hailing tech in bid to break ground in Africa
Description: It's ride-hailing, farm style. Deere & Co.  is teaming up with the "Uber of tractors" in Africa and betting on a future where farmers summon machines with the touch of a button.

Headlines: Trump administration in talks about Chevron's operations in Venezuela: envoy
Description: The Trump administration is in discussions about whether to renew a license for Chevron Corp's operations in Venezuela as Washington looks to increase pressure on its socialist leader, the U.S. special envoy to the South American country said.

Headlines: Tesco completes China exit with $357 million stake sale
Description: Britain's biggest retailer Tesco  has completed its exit from China with the 275 million pound ($357 million) sale of its joint venture stake to state-run partner China Resources Holdings (CRH).

Headlines: Coronavirus clouds Apple's timeline for new iPhones
Description: Travel restrictions to China because of the coronavirus have come just as Apple Inc's  engineers usually jet off to Asia to perfect the production of this fall's new iPhones, former employees and supply chain experts told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. regulator: Airlines should complete inspections on 737 MAX panels before flying
Description: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) on Tuesday proposed that airlines complete inspections on a key component that could make Boeing 737 MAX airplanes vulnerable to lightning strikes and interference from high-power radio frequency transmitters before returning to service.

Headlines: Investors piled into volatility bets before market tumble
Description: Fears of a coronavirus-fueled slowdown have injected volatility back into markets, but some investors may be less exposed this time around.

Headlines: TPC plans to cut staff at Texas plant hit by November blast: sources
Description: Chemical maker TPC Group [TPCL.UL] plans to cut at least 100 employees by the end of April at its Port Neches, Texas, petrochemical plant, the site of devastating explosions in November that forced evacuations of up to 60,000 people, said sources familiar with plant operations.

Headlines: Amazon expands physical footprint with bigger cashier-less grocery shop
Description: Amazon.com Inc  is bringing its cashier-less store technology to a larger stage.

Headlines: Airlines should complete inspections on 737 MAX panels before flying: FAA
Description: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) on Tuesday proposed that airlines complete inspections on a key component that could make Boeing 737 MAX airplanes vulnerable to lightning strikes and interference from high-power radio frequency transmitters before returning to service.

Headlines: Stocks, oil fall further on accelerating coronavirus concerns
Description: Stocks across the globe fell on Tuesday to their lowest since early December and the benchmark U.S. debt yield hit a record low on concerns about the economic hit of the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Markets bet Fed is pushed to cut rates in coronavirus response
Description: Financial markets on Monday ratcheted up bets the U.S. Federal Reserve will be pressed to cut interest rates to cushion a feared hit to economic growth from the spread of the coronavirus, although one official cautioned against expecting the central bank to over-react to short-term market moves.

Headlines: Fed banks unanimously voted to keep discount rate unchanged - minutes
Description: All of the Federal Reserve's 12 regional banks wanted to keep unchanged the rate commercial banks are charged for emergency loans ahead of the U.S. central bank's last policy meeting, minutes from the discussion of the discount rate showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. stock rout continues as virus spreads, Treasury yields sink
Description: Wall Street's main stock indexes fell almost 2% on Tuesday as the coronavirus spread further and officials described it as "a rapidly escalating epidemic," a day after the S&P 500 and the Dow Industrials' biggest daily decline in two years.

Headlines: JPMorgan Chase plans to unveil climate initiatives at investor day
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  executives plan to announce new climate-change initiatives on Tuesday, including restrictions on financing coal mining and Arctic drilling, as well as a $200 billion target to provide financing for sustainable projects.

Headlines: Goldman, Citi among banks curbing Italy trips over coronavirus fears - sources
Description: Goldman Sachs, Citigroup Inc, Credit Suisse and other investment banks have curbed trips to Italy amid fears that the coronavirus outbreak across the north of the country could quickly spread across Europe, sources said.

Headlines: Housing market strength underpins Home Depot's holiday-quarter results
Description: Home Depot Inc  benefited from a solid U.S. housing market and higher job growth that led consumers to spend more at its stores in the holiday shopping quarter, helping the home improvement chain beat sales and profit estimates.

Headlines: Macy's holiday quarter beats Street, investors skeptical on strategy
Description: Macy's Inc  holiday-quarter results beat analyst expectations on Tuesday, but investor skepticism around its cost-cutting strategy at a time of intense online competition sent shares down nearly 5%.

Headlines: Goldman, Citi among banks curbing Italy trips over coronavirus fears
Description: Goldman Sachs , Citigroup Inc , Credit Suisse  and other investment banks have curbed trips to Italy amid fears that the coronavirus outbreak across the north of the country could quickly spread across Europe, sources said.

Headlines: Wall Street deepens losses with virus spread in focus
Description: Wall Street added to losses on Tuesday with its three major stock indexes falling 1%, after officials said the coronavirus was "a rapidly escalating epidemic," a day after virus worries sent the S&P 500 and the Dow Industrials to their biggest daily declines in two years.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence holds at higher levels despite coronavirus
Description: U.S. consumer confidence edged up in February, suggesting a steady pace of consumer spending that could support the economy despite growing fears over the fast-spreading coronavirus, which have roiled financial markets.

Headlines: Disney to serve Impossible Foods burgers at parks, resorts
Description: Walt Disney Co's theme parks, resorts and cruise line will serve Impossible Foods' plant-based meat burgers, the companies said on Tuesday, a new win for the vegan patty maker that is broadening its reach across fast-food chains.

Headlines: Eight men in frame to run Norway wealth fund, including deputy CEO
Description: Eight candidates have applied to head Norway's sovereign wealth fund, the country's central bank said on Tuesday, as its board prepares to decide who should steer the global portfolio of assets worth $1.1 trillion through a time of transition.

Headlines: JPMorgan raises clean energy spending goals, profit targets unchanged
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  largely maintained its key profit goals for the medium term on Tuesday, signaling steady but slower growth, and raised its financial commitment for clean-energy initiatives after years of pressure from environmental activists.

Headlines: HSBC targets the globally mobile with $1.4 trillion wealth business
Description: HSBC  plans to invest heavily in its newly combined retail and private banking business as it targets internationally minded customers in markets such as China, the United States and Singapore, the unit's Chief Executive Charlie Nunn told Reuters.

Headlines: British fintech Revolut hits $5.5 billion valuation after funding round
Description: Digital banking app Revolut has raised $500 million in a fresh funding round, confirming the British-based business as one of the world's most valuable financial technology firms with a valuation of $5.5 billion.

Headlines: Japan's ANA orders 15 more Boeing 787 Dreamliners worth $5 billion at list prices
Description: Japan's ANA Holdings Inc  will buy 15 Boeing Co  787 Dreamliners worth $5 billion at list prices, it said, the first commercial order announcement for the U.S. planemaker this year as it wrestles with the grounding of the smaller 737 MAX.

Headlines: Mastercard CEO Ajay Banga to step down, insider Miebach tapped
Description: Mastercard's chief executive officer of 10 years, Ajay Banga, will step down at the start of the next year, the company said on Tuesday, and be replaced by Chief Product Officer Michael Miebach.

Headlines: American Airlines, Qatar Airways sign strategic partnership, codeshare deal
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  said Tuesday it has signed a strategic partnership deal with Qatar Airways and is reviving its codeshare agreement.

Headlines: Investors eye bleach, food and tissues as virus fears intensify
Description: While Wall Street's broader indexes fell sharply on Monday on concerns about coronavirus, investors turned to some consumer companies as they bet on stock-piling of products such as disinfectants and shelf-stable foods.

Headlines: IEA says virus-hit oil growth outlook lowest in a decade, could go lower
Description: The International Energy Agency's (IEA) outlook on global oil demand growth has fallen to its lowest level in a decade, IEA Executive Director Fatih Birol said on Tuesday, adding it could be reduced further due to the impact of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Chinese consumers snap up yoga mats, video games, condoms as coronavirus keeps them at home
Description: As the coronavirus epidemic keeps hundreds of millions of Chinese stuck at home, they're shopping online to stave off boredom with games for Nintendo's  Switch console, yoga mats, books and condoms all showing big jumps in orders.

Headlines: EU extends EssilorLuxottica, GrandVision antitrust investigation to July 6
Description: EU antitrust regulators on Tuesday extended their investigation into Ray-Ban maker EssilorLuxottica's  7.2 billion-euro ($7.8 billion) bid for Dutch opticians group GrandVision  by two weeks to July 6, according to an EU filing.

Headlines: Health insurer shares pummeled by Sanders surge, virus worries
Description: As concerns over the spreading coronavirus outbreak hammered U.S. stocks, one corner of the market was confronted with another potentially game-changing prospect: a Bernie Sanders nomination.

Headlines: Exclusive: Japan to further ease rules on foreign ownership of stocks: sources
Description: Japan will add exemptions to new foreign investment restrictions for companies exposed to sensitive national security issues, government sources said, in a move aimed at keeping overseas capital in the country.

Headlines: China's main manufacturing hubs reboot after virus shutdown
Description: As many parts of China ease coronavirus travel curbs, main manufacturing hubs in the east and south are seeing hundreds of thousands of migrant workers returning to work and more traffic on the roads during rush hours.

Headlines: SoftBank-backed Grab raises $856 million from Japanese investors in financial services push
Description: Southeast Asia's Grab said Japan's Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc (MUFG)  and IT services firm TIS Inc  have agreed to invest a combined $856 million in the ride-hailing firm, as it seeks to expand aggressively into financial services.

Headlines: UBS, Credit Suisse's emergency plans are effective: financial watchdog
Description: The emergency plans of UBS  and Credit Suisse  to deal with a financial crisis are effective, Switzerland's regulator FINMA said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China's Didi to launch Japan food delivery service from April
Description: China's ride hailing company Didi Chuxing plans to launch a food delivery service in Japan from April, the firm, backed by SoftBank Group Corp , said on Tuesday, as it seeks to grow its overseas business.

Headlines: Mallinckrodt proposes $1.6 billion opioid deal, Chapter 11 for generics unit: WSJ
Description: Mallinckrodt Plc  is finalizing a settlement proposal of at least $1.6 billion that would place its U.S. generic drug business into bankruptcy to address the debt maturities and liabilities arising out of the opioid crisis, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.

Headlines: UBS releases diversity figures for Americas staff
Description: UBS Group AG said on Monday that 38% of its employees in the Americas at the end of last year were women and 25% were people of color, adding that it aims to increase the diversity of its workforce.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court turns away religious bias claim against Walgreens
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday handed a victory to Walgreens, turning away an appeal by a fired former Florida employee of the pharmacy chain who asked not to work on Saturdays for religious reasons as a member of the Seventh-day Adventist Church.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court rejects Apple appeal in patent fight with VirnetX
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday refused to hear Apple Inc's bid to avoid paying about $440 million in damages for using patent licensing firm VirnetX Inc's internet security technology without permission in features such as FaceTime video calling.

Headlines: K-pop sensation BTS' label picks JPMorgan, others for IPO: media
Description: Big Hit Entertainment, the music label of South Korean boy band BTS, has chosen JPMorgan , NH Investment and Securities  and others to handle its initial public offering (IPO), according to media reports.

Headlines: U.S. still eyeing ways to curb sales to Huawei after Trump's chipmaker comments: sources
Description: U.S. government officials are still considering ways to further curb sales to China's Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL], despite President Donald Trump's tweets and comments last week in support of sales to China, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Shake Shack sees delivery disruption thru 2020 with Grubhub partnership
Description: Shake Shack Inc  expects its delivery sales to be volatile throughout 2020 after its move last year to an exclusive partnership with third-party platform Grubhub Inc , it said on Monday.

Headlines: United Airlines suspends 2020 guidance on coronavirus uncertainty
Description: United Airlines Inc  on Monday withdrew its full-year 2020 guidance, citing heightened uncertainty over how the duration and spread of the coronavirus to other regions could impact overall air travel demand.

Headlines: U.S. safety board to issue new recommendations in probe of fatal Tesla Autopilot crash
Description: The National Transportation Safety Board will hold a public hearing on Tuesday to establish the probable cause of a fatal March 2018 Tesla Autopilot crash in California and will issue a series of safety recommendations, two people briefed on the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Europe's top firms must double low-carbon investment: study
Description: Europe's top companies need to more than double their current level of spending on low-carbon projects to meet the European Commission's flagship goal of 'climate neutrality' by 2050, according to a report released on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed's Mester sees U.S. economy performing well, coronavirus a 'big risk'
Description: The U.S. economy should continue to perform well this year and monetary policy is currently well positioned despite the risk posed by the coronavirus outbreak, Cleveland Fed President Loretta Mester said on Monday, as Wall Street stocks tumbled on worries the spread of the virus to multiple countries outside China could pose an escalating threat to global growth.

Headlines: Europe's top firms must double low-carbon investment: study
Description: Europe's top companies need to more than double their current level of spending on low-carbon projects to meet the European Commission's flagship goal of 'climate neutrality' by 2050, according to a report released on Tuesday.

Headlines: Coronavirus sparks deepest S&P 500 drop since early 2018
Description: The S&P 500 suffered its worst day in two years on Monday as a surge in coronavirus cases outside China rattled investors already worried about valuations following recent record highs.

Headlines: Cancelled Teck oil sands project underscores global climate-energy policy tension
Description: Teck Resources Ltd's surprise decision to cancel a planned C$20.6 billion ($15.6 billion) oil sands mine in northern Alberta, citing uncertainty about Canada's climate policy, underscores a global struggle to balance energy growth with environmental concerns.

Headlines: Stocks tumble, oil falls, gold spikes as virus fears grip markets
Description: Stocks across the globe fell by the most since mid-2016 on Monday and oil prices tumbled as a jump in coronavirus cases outside of China drove investors to the perceived safety of gold and government bonds on fears of the impact on the global economy.

Headlines: Cargill to challenge Beyond Meat, Impossible Foods with new plant-based burger
Description: Cargill Inc will launch plant-based hamburger patties and ground "fake meat" products in April, the company said on Monday, challenging Beyond Meat and Impossible Foods for sales in grocery stores, cafeterias and restaurants.

Headlines: Shale pioneer Mark Papa to retire as Centennial Resource's CEO, chairman
Description: Centennial Resource Development Inc  said on Monday shale pioneer and Chief Executive Officer Mark Papa would retire at the end of May.

Headlines: Hedge fund Third Point calls on Britain's Prudential to break up
Description: Hedge fund Third Point LLC amassed a more than $2 billion stake in Prudential Plc  and called on the British insurer on Monday to split into two companies.

Headlines: Renault says reserves the right to seek damages depending on Ghosn probe
Description: Renault  said on Monday it had filed a civil-party petition after French prosecutors last week opened a formal investigation into alleged misappropriation of funds at the French carmaker.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco launches largest shale gas development outside U.S.
Description: Saudi Aramco is launching the biggest shale gas development outside of the United States to boost domestic gas supply and end the burning of oil at its power generation plants, Chief Executive Officer Amin Nasser told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Boeing nominates Qualcomm's Mollenkopf to its board
Description: Boeing Co  on Monday nominated Steve Mollenkopf and Akhil Johri to its board and said two of its directors will retire.

Headlines: Defending against Xerox, HP doubles down on share buybacks, cost cuts
Description: HP Inc  said on Monday it would step up efforts to slash costs and buy back stock, as it seeks investor support to defend against a $35 billion takeover offer from U.S. printer maker Xerox Holdings Corp .

Headlines: Oil sinks 4% on demand concerns as coronavirus spreads
Description: Oil prices slumped by nearly 4% on Monday as the rapid spread of the coronavirus in countries outside China added to investor concerns over the effect on demand for crude.

Headlines: Bank of America names new French investment banking boss: memo
Description: Bank of America  has appointed Jérôme Morisseau as its head of investment banking for France as it seeks to bolster its Paris franchise and win more business from large French clients, a memo seen by Reuters said.

Headlines: Virus fears rise: Investors worry about supply chain and pandemic-type spread
Description: As fears about the coronavirus catch up to U.S. markets, investors are watching closely to see if the outbreak freezes global supply chains and spreads far enough to be called a pandemic.

Headlines: Bank of America veteran deal-maker Boueiz resigns after 21 years: source
Description: Bank of America's  seasoned deal-maker Wadih Boueiz has resigned after a career spanning 21 years, a source with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: France's Sanofi to carve out active drug ingredients business
Description: Sanofi  plans to create a standalone company dedicated to making active pharmaceutical ingredients (API), components that are biologically active in a drug, and will decide whether to list it on Euronext Paris by 2022.

Headlines: Group of UBI investors says Intesa Sanpaolo's offer undervalues stock
Description: A group of UBI Banca  investors holding 1.6% of the Italian bank's capital on Monday said a takeover offer by Intesa Sanpaolo  significantly undervalues the stock.

Headlines: Coronavirus concerns spur odd market moves
Description: Some asset prices are moving together in unusual ways, an indication that investors may be preparing their portfolios for a coronavirus-led global slowdown.

Headlines: SoftBank leads $265 million investments in two U.S.-based start-ups
Description: SoftBank on Monday led a new funding round of $165 million in California-based Karius and invested $100 million in New York-headquartered AI company Behavox, as the technology giant builds a portfolio under its second Vision Fund.

Headlines: Warren Buffett calls coronavirus outbreak 'scary stuff,' but says he won't be selling stocks
Description: Warren Buffett, the billionaire chairman of Berkshire Hathaway Inc , on Monday called the coronavirus outbreak "scary stuff" but said that it was no time to sell stocks despite the threat of a pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court rejects Apple appeal in patent fight with VirnetX
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday refused to hear Apple Inc's bid to avoid paying about $440 million (339.4 million pounds) in damages for using patent licensing firm VirnetX Inc's internet security technology without permission in features such as FaceTime video calling.

Headlines: Factbox: Charting the impact of the new coronavirus
Description: The following charts aim to capture the scale and trajectory of stock market moves in response to the new coronavirus outbreak, the growing number of cases beyond China, the reaction of China's central bank and the impact on safe haven investments.

Headlines: German industrial sectors see supply shortage over virus: BDI
Description: Several sectors of Germany's manufacturing sector are expecting a shortness of supplies from the Far East region in the coming weeks due to the outbreak of the coronavirus in China, business association BDI said on Monday.

Headlines: Boeing scours idle 737 MAX plant for industrial snags
Description: Insiders note an "eerie" calm at Boeing Co's  737 MAX factory, formerly a bustling hub that has helped fuel the aviation industry's record growth over the last two decades.

Headlines: Exclusive: Juul halts Indonesia e-cigarette sales, throwing Asia expansion in doubt
Description: Juul Labs Inc is halting sales in Indonesia, citing concerns that it can't stop retailers from selling its high-nicotine e-cigarettes to young people in a largely unregulated tobacco market.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. sees no material impact from virus on U.S.-China trade deal - for now
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin told Reuters he does not expect the coronavirus outbreak to have a material impact on the Phase 1 U.S.-China trade deal, although that could change as more data becomes available in coming weeks.

Headlines: United Technologies, Raytheon offer EU concessions over $120 billion merger deal
Description: United Technologies Corp  and Raytheon Co  have offered concessions to address EU antitrust concerns about their plan to create a $120 billion U.S. aerospace and defense giant, a filing on the European Commission website showed on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Germany's Stada buys 15 GSK consumer health brands
Description: Private equity-backed generic drugmaker Stada  said it has agreed to buy 15 consumer healthcare products from British drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline  to further strengthen its prescription-free drugs business in Europe.

Headlines: Blackstone raises offer for Japan's Unizo, tops Lone Star's bid
Description: Blackstone Group  has raised its proposed offer to buy Japanese hotel chain Unizo Holdings  to 6,000 yen ($53.78) from 5,600 yen per share, the U.S. private equity firm said on Monday, topping a bid by U.S. investment fund Lone Star.

Headlines: Mastercard to add 1,500 technology jobs in Ireland
Description: Mastercard Inc plans to hire 1,500 more staff in Dublin over the next three to five years, more than trebling its workforce in one of Ireland's largest single multinational jobs announcements.

Headlines: Some Samsung, Hyundai workers self-quarantine as Korea Inc braces for virus impact
Description: Some South Korean workers at Samsung Electronics  and Hyundai Motor  are staying home as a precautionary measure as corporate Korea scrambles to prevent the coronavirus outbreak from causing widespread disruption in its home market.

Headlines: Take Five: 'Our currency, your problem' - all over again
Description: The dollar juggernaut rolls on. The U.S. currency <=USD> has rocketed to a near three-year high versus the euro, a 10-month high against the yen and an 11-year peak versus the Aussie. This month alone it's added 2.5% against six currency peers.     Economic indicators are reinforcing the U.S growth engine's outperformance. The United States has the highest bond yields among developed nations and its companies keep beating earnings forecasts. It's relative resilience to coronavirus damage m

Headlines: 'Our currency, your problem': all over again
Description: The dollar juggernaut rolls on. The U.S. currency <=USD> has rocketed to a near three-year high versus the euro, a 10-month high against the yen and an 11-year peak versus the Aussie. This month alone it's added 2.5% against six currency peers.     Economic indicators are reinforcing the U.S growth engine's outperformance. The United States has the highest bond yields among developed nations and its companies keep beating earnings forecasts. It's relative resilience to coronavirus damage m

Headlines: Primark owner warns coronavirus threatens clothing supplies
Description: Primark owner Associated British Foods  warned on Monday there was a risk of shortages of some clothing lines later this year if delays in factory production in China are prolonged because of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Italy's UniCredit says Mustier to stay on as CEO
Description: Italy's biggest bank UniCredit  said on Monday boss Jean Pierre Mustier had confirmed he would remain in his role, after a source told Reuters the French banker had ruled himself out for the top job at rival HSBC .

Headlines: Goldman Sachs pleads not guilty in Malaysia over 1MDB bond sales: state media
Description: Three units of Goldman Sachs  pleaded not guilty to charges of misleading investors regarding $6.5 billion in bond sales that the U.S. investment bank helped raise for state fund 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB), Bernama state news agency reported on Monday.

Headlines: Large parts of China ease coronavirus curbs, many report no new cases
Description: Urged to restore economic activity by President Xi Jinping, large parts of China relaxed curbs on transport and travel on Monday as reported new cases of coronavirus outside the worst-hit province fell to the lowest in a month.

Headlines: Amazon in Holocaust row about 'Hunters' series, anti-Semitic books
Description: The Auschwitz Memorial criticized Amazon on Sunday for fictitious depictions of the Holocaust in its Prime series "Hunters" and for selling books of Nazi propaganda.

Headlines: PepsiCo buys Chinese snack brand Be & Cheery for $705 million
Description: PepsiCo Inc  has agreed to buy Chinese snack brand Be & Cheery from local jujube maker Haoxiangni Health Food Co Ltd  for $705 million, the companies said.

Headlines: Ex-Facebook executive starts group to help employees push companies on climate
Description: Facebook's former sustainability chief has launched an organization to help employees at big companies press their bosses for more aggressive policies to fight climate change.

Headlines: Teck drops C$20.6 billion oil sands Frontier project, to take writedown
Description: Canadian miner Teck Resources Ltd has withdrawn an application to build its C$20.6 billion ($15.7 billion) Frontier oil sands mine in Alberta, days before the federal government was to decide on whether to approve a project opposed by environmentalists and indigenous groups.

Headlines: Rising stocks fuel record profit for Buffett's Berkshire; operating profit disappoints
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  on Saturday posted a 23% decrease in quarterly operating profit, while soaring prices in stock holdings such as Apple Inc  enabled the conglomerate to smash its old record for full-year earnings.

Headlines: Buffett calls for more accountability for corporate directors
Description: Warren Buffett on Saturday called on corporate America to make their boards of directors more accountable to shareholders and less beholden to chief executive officers, perhaps by reducing their pay and requiring that they buy more stock.

Headlines: Buffett defends Berkshire stock push, reassures on future as profit smashes record
Description: Warren Buffett on Saturday forcefully defended Berkshire Hathaway Inc's  decision to invest heavily in stocks of companies such as Apple Inc  as he labors through a four-year drought since his last major acquisition of a company.

Headlines: Exclusive: If Lebanon needs financial aid, France will be there, finmin says
Description: France is ready to support Lebanon financially - bilaterally or multilaterally - its finance minister said on Sunday, warning against mixing economic recovery in the small Mediterranean state with U.S.-led efforts to counter Iran in the region.

Headlines: UniCredit CEO Mustier ruled out of HSBC role: source
Description: UniCredit Chief Executive Jean Pierre Mustier has ruled himself out of a switch to European rival HSBC , a source with knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Sunday.

Headlines: No global digital tax by end-2020 would mean chaos: France
Description: Failure to reach a global deal on where and how much to tax digital giants such as Google , Amazon  or Facebook  would result in many digital tax regimes emerging all over the world, France's Finance Minister said on Sunday.

Headlines: G20 finance heads eye impact of coronavirus outbreak on growth, see modest pickup
Description: Finance chiefs of the world's top 20 economies vowed to monitor the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on global growth and act if needed, as they said loose monetary policy and easing trade tensions would prompt a pick-up in 2020 and 2021.

Headlines: As Teck oil sands mine hopes for okay from Canada's Trudeau, 20 other projects on hold
Description: As Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau considers whether to approve Teck Resources' Frontier oil sands project, roughly 20 others sit on the shelf as companies delay investment decisions hoping for new pipelines and higher prices.

Headlines: Japan criticizes U.S. digital tax proposal at G20
Description: Japanese finance minister Taro Aso criticized on Sunday a U.S. tax reform proposal that he said could undermine global efforts to agree new rules on taxing big tech companies.

Headlines: Banned Thai opposition party says junta helped 1MDB cover-up
Description: A banned Thai opposition party on Sunday accused the former military junta of helping cover up Malaysia's multi-billion-dollar 1MDB scandal, urging Thais to demand the truth ahead of a censure debate against Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha.

Headlines: Shifting sands of inflation unsettle top bankers at Riyadh G20 meeting
Description: Central bankers from the United States, Japan and the euro zone meeting in the desert kingdom of Saudi Arabia this weekend had their own shifting sands to cross – those of elusive inflation.

Headlines: Hughes fears Indian closure, bank disruptions over unpaid fees
Description: U.S. satellite broadband provider Hughes Network Systems may have to shut its Indian operations due to unpaid levies owed to the government, which could put thousands of banking services at risk, a company letter seen by Reuters showed.

Headlines: TurboTax maker Intuit nears agreement to buy Credit Karma for $7 billion: WSJ
Description: Intuit Inc is nearing an agreement to buy financial technology portal Credit Karma Inc for about $7 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported.

Headlines: Samsung Electronics confirms coronavirus case at phone factory complex in South Korea
Description: Samsung Electronics  said on Saturday that one coronavirus case had been confirmed at its mobile device factory complex in the southeastern city of Gumi, causing a shutdown of its entire facility there until Monday morning.

Headlines: Let's come together to tax tech giants, say G20 officials eyeing $100 billion boost
Description: Leading world economies must show unity in dealing with aggressive "tax optimization" by global digital giants like Google , Amazon  and Facebook , G20 officials said on Saturday.

Headlines: G20 sees need to coordinate coronavirus response as IMF trims growth forecasts
Description: The world's top economies called on Saturday for a coordinated response to the coronavirus outbreak, which the IMF predicted would lower China's growth this year to 5.6% and shave 0.1 percentage points from global growth.

Headlines: Honda's Philippine unit to close auto production plant
Description: The Philippine unit of Honda Motor Co Ltd  said on Saturday its production facility will shut down next month, as the Japanese automaker struggles to shore up global automobile operations.

Headlines: Japan urges G20 members with fiscal scope to boost spending
Description: Japan called on G20 countries with fiscal space to ramp up spending to help the global economy weather risks, including the fallout from the coronavirus outbreak, Finance Minister Taro Aso said on Saturday.

Headlines: The ECB wants to talk to you about inflation. But will it listen?
