Description: For many people, the language of European Central Bank policymakers is so impenetrable, it could be beamed from another planet.

Headlines: Encryption on Facebook, Google, others threatened by planned new bill
Description: U.S. legislation will be introduced in the coming weeks that could hurt technology companies' ability to offer end-to-end encryption, two sources with knowledge of the matter said, and it aims to curb the distribution of child sexual abuse material on such platforms.

Headlines: Tesla resumes tree cutting in Germany to build Gigafactory
Description: Tesla Inc  said it had resumed tree cutting in Gruenheide, Germany so it can construct its first European car and battery factory following moves by environmentalists to stop local deforestation.

Headlines: Markets underprice coronavirus risk: UBS chairman on Bloomberg TV
Description: Markets are underpricing the risk that the coronavirus outbreak poses to the global economy, and central banks need to help business survive the impact of the virus, the chairman of Swiss lender UBS , Axel Weber, said.

Headlines: RBC to launch U.S. consumer bank betting on wealthy clients
Description: Royal Bank of Canada plans to open a consumer bank in the United States early next year targeting wealthy clients, with the aim of expanding deposits, its chief financial officer told Reuters on Friday after the bank posted first-quarter profit that beat expectations.

Headlines: Wells Fargo to pay $3 billion to U.S., admits pressuring workers in fake-accounts scandal
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  has agreed to pay $3 billion to resolve criminal and civil probes into fraudulent sales practices and has admitted to pressuring employees in a fake-accounts scandal, U.S. officials said on Friday, wrapping up one of the last major investigations looming over the bank.

Headlines: Boeing finds debris in fuel tanks of many undelivered 737 MAX jets
Description: Boeing Co  has found debris in the fuel tanks of dozens of undelivered 737 MAX jets amid ongoing inspections as the Chicago-based planemaker struggles to restore the trust of airlines and the wider public in the grounded fleet.

Headlines: France ready to hear U.S. proposal on digital tax
Description: France is ready to listen to the U.S. administration's proposal of offering U.S. companies a "safe harbor" from a new, international digital tax, its finance minister said on Saturday, while admitting that he still didn't know what that meant in practice.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury's Mnuchin: Tax certainty needed on global basis
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Saturday it was very important to have tax certainty on a global basis and that the OECD was very close to consensus on a framework for minimum corporate tax.

Headlines: Federal prosecutors probing if Boeing pilot knowingly lied to FAA: NYT
Description: Federal prosecutors investigating Boeing Co  are examining whether the U.S. planemaker knowingly misled the Federal Aviation Administration while it was seeking approval for its 737 MAX jet, the New York Times reported, citing two people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley to get $375 million termination fee if E*Trade walks away from deal
Description: Morgan Stanley will receive a $375 million breakup fee if E*Trade Financial Corp walks away from its $13 billion deal for the discount brokerage, the U.S. bank said on Friday.

Headlines: Inside the Philip Morris campaign to 'normalize' a tobacco device
Description: At Germany's Bambi Awards for the media industry in November, celebrities posed for red-carpet photos against a backdrop of established luxury brands. Alongside the likes of Mercedes-Benz and Swiss watchmaker Chopard was a newer name: IQOS, a "reduced risk" heated-tobacco device sold by cigarette maker Philip Morris International Inc.

Headlines: U.S. SEC probes Altria's investment in Juul: source
Description: U.S. regulators have opened a probe regarding Marlboro maker Altria Group Inc's  investment in e-cigarette maker Juul Labs Inc, according to a person familiar with the matter.

Headlines: EBay in discussions with multiple parties for sale of classified business
Description: EBay Inc  is in discussions with multiple candidates regarding a potential transaction for its classified-ads business, the company said on Friday.

Headlines: Coronavirus fears, U.S. business data drag down Wall Street
Description: U.S. stocks sold off and the Nasdaq had its worst daily percentage decline in about three weeks on Friday as a spike in new coronavirus cases and data showing a stall in U.S. business activity in February fueled investors' fears about economic growth.

Headlines: Branson says new Virgin cruise line will overcome coronavirus fears
Description: British entrepreneur Richard Branson heralded his first cruise ship "Scarlet Lady" on Friday as targeting a younger generation of holidaymakers with a range of attractions that he believes will outweigh any fears around coronavirus.

Headlines: Factbox: Remaining hurdles for scandal-hit Wells Fargo
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  has racked up well over $7 billion in penalties since a sales practices scandal erupted in 2016, and continues to face headwinds.

Headlines: Stocks slip as coronavirus fears spur safe-haven buying
Description: Global equity markets slumped on Friday as the fast-spreading coronavirus drove investors into safe havens, with gold hitting a fresh seven-year high and the yield on the 30-year U.S. Treasury bond sliding to an all-time low.

Headlines: In next downturn, Fed may opt for quick, strong action
Description: In the next economic downturn, the Federal Reserve and other central banks may need to roll out their big guns sooner and use them more aggressively, or risk getting mired in growth-sapping deflation or worse.

Headlines: Big tech cos pull out of San Francisco conferences on coronavirus concerns
Description: Verizon Communications Inc  has pulled out of the RSA  cyber security conference due to coronavirus-related concerns, the organizer said https://www.rsaconference.com/novel-coronavirus-update on Friday.

Headlines: Elon Musk's SpaceX to raise $250 million, valuing it at $36 billion: CNBC
Description: Elon Musk's SpaceX is looking to raise about $250 million, taking the private rocket company's valuation to about $36 billion, CNBC reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the financing.

Headlines: U.S. watchdog proposes national standard for disclosing expired debt
Description: The U.S. consumer watchdog on Friday proposed establishing a national standard for how debt collectors must inform borrowers when they cannot be sued for expired debt.

Headlines: Deere's shares hit all-time high on unexpected rise in quarterly profit
Description: Deere & Co's  shares hit an all-time high on Friday after the company reported an unexpected increase in first-quarter profit, but the world's largest farm equipment maker warned the outbreak of coronavirus would hit sales and earnings in the second quarter.

Headlines: Oil slides 1% on renewed fears over toll from coronavirus
Description: Oil prices fell about 1% on Friday on renewed concerns about crude demand being pinched by the economic impact of the coronavirus outbreak, while OPEC and allied producers appeared to be in no rush to curb output.

Headlines: UniCredit may make announcement soon on CEO Mustier's future: sources
Description: Italy's biggest bank UniCredit  may make an announcement as early as Friday night on the future of boss Jean Pierre Mustier, two sources familiar with the matter said, after reports he is vying for the top job at rival HSBC .

Headlines: New York Times plans to name Meredith Kopit Levien as next CEO: Bloomberg News
Description: New York Times Co  is expected to name company insider Meredith Kopit Levien as its next chief executive officer to succeed Mark Thompson, Bloomberg News reported https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-21/new-york-times-poised-to-name-meredith-kopit-levien-as-next-ceo on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Lyft buys digital car-top advertising startup Halo Cars
Description: Lyft Inc has bought U.S.-based startup Halo Cars, which allows drivers to make money through digital advertisements displayed on top of their vehicles.

Headlines: Lawsuit in NY says ex-hedge fund manager Falcone reneged on loans, wrongly sold a Warhol
Description: Former hedge fund manager Philip Falcone has been sued for more than $65.8 million after he allegedly defaulted on a series of loans and improperly sold some of the underlying collateral, including an Andy Warhol painting.

Headlines: Samsung Electronics names non-executive director as board chairman in company first
Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Friday it has named a non-executive director as board chairman for the first time, to increase transparency and independence.

Headlines: Timberland sees eco-green with slower delivery speeds
Description: Outdoor apparel retailer Timberland is testing online shoppers' willingness to help the environment by slowing down delivery as Amazon.com  drives retailers toward pricier, more polluting one-day shipping.

Headlines: Coronavirus fears weigh on U.S. manufacturing, services sectors
Description: U.S. manufacturing and services sectors activity stalled in February amid growing concerns about the deadly coronavirus' impact on the economy, boosting investor demand for safe-haven assets like government bonds.

Headlines: Self-driving car companies complain California test data may mislead
Description: Developers of self-driving cars are amping up criticism of a California reporting requirement on test data, saying the data could mislead, as the state prepares to release the latest results for 2019.

Headlines: Shopify to join Facebook-led Libra currency group
Description: Canadian e-commerce company Shopify Inc  said on Friday  it would join Libra Association, a group that manages Facebook Inc  led efforts to launch a global digital currency, Libra.

Headlines: Exclusive: Aramco to win unconditional EU clearance for $69 billion SABIC deal - sources
Description: World No. 1 oil producer Saudi Aramco  is set to gain unconditional EU antitrust approval for its $69 billion buy of a 70% stake in petrochemicals group Saudi Basic Industries Corp (SABIC) , people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Xerox to press ahead despite HP's poison pill plan against takeover offer
Description: Xerox Holdings Corp said on Friday it would continue to pursue HP Inc, even after the PC maker said it would implement a poison pill plan to shield itself against a takeover offer from the U.S. printer maker.

Headlines: King Dollar rules the FX heap as virus threatens global growth
Description: A powerful surge in the dollar threatens to magnify the pain for companies and nations already struggling with the economic fallout of the coronavirus.

Headlines: L'Oreal's online sales of make-up rose in China in February: CEO
Description: Online sales of L'Oreal  make-up and skincare products had picked up in China in February and were even stronger than a year earlier, Chief Executive Jean-Paul Agon said on Friday.

Headlines: Qatar Airways not interested in investing in Air Italy
Description: Qatar Airways said on Friday it was not interested in investing in struggling Italian carrier Air Italy, but would do all it could as minority shareholder for workers and passengers.

Headlines: Tesla gets court approval to clear forest for German Gigafactory
Description: Tesla Inc  got approval from a German court on Thursday to continue to cut down forest near the capital Berlin to build its first European car and battery factory, in a defeat for local environmental activists.

Headlines: Global telcos join Alphabet, SoftBank's flying cellphone antenna lobbying effort
Description: Alphabet and SoftBank's attempts to launch flying cellphone antennas high into the atmosphere have received backing from global telcos, energizing lobbying efforts aimed at driving regulatory approval for the emerging technology.

Headlines: Daimler warns of "significant adverse effects" of virus outbreak
Description: German luxury carmaker Daimler  on Friday warned of risks for the economy and its own business from the outbreak of coronavirus that is spreading in China and around the world.

Headlines: Tod's sees Coronavirus hit after 'excellent' start to 2020, pickup in six weeks
Description: Italian luxury leather goods maker Tod's  made an "excellent" start to 2020 before the coronavirus hit sales but the situation could start to improve in the next few weeks, Chairman Diego Della Valle said on Friday.

Headlines: China firms in $10 billion share sale rush as funding rules eased amid virus worries
Description: Listed Chinese companies are queuing up to issue shares and have already announced plans to raise more than $10 billion in the past week after fundraising rules were relaxed to help ease cash strains caused by the coronavirus.

Headlines: China's Geely starts online auto sales as virus epidemic keeps buyers at home
Description: Chinese automaker Geely [GEELY.UL] has launched a service for customers to buy cars online and get them delivered directly to their homes, in a bid to drum up sales as the coronavirus outbreak prompts buyers to stay away from showrooms.

Headlines: Outbreak will not change China's commitments to buy U.S. goods: senior U.S. official
Description: The U.S. government expects China to honor its commitments to buy more U.S. goods under a trade deal signed by the world's two largest economies in January despite the fast-spreading coronavirus outbreak, a senior U.S. official said on Thursday.

Headlines: China says to exempt extra tariffs on 65 U.S. goods from Feb. 28
Description: China’s finance ministry said it will begin exempting 65 U.S. goods from retaliatory tariffs implemented amid the bilateral trade dispute with the United States for one year starting Feb. 28.

Headlines: T-Mobile, Sprint amend merger terms, SoftBank takes a hit
Description: T-Mobile US  and Sprint Corp  said on Thursday that they had agreed on new merger terms that would reduce the stake of major Sprint shareholder SoftBank, while leaving the offer to other shareholders unchanged.

Headlines: UniCredit shares fall at open after report Mustier vying for HSBC top job
Description: Shares in Italy's biggest bank UniCredit fell more than 1% at open on Friday following reports Chief Executive Jean Pierre Mustier is being considered for the top job at rival HSBC .

Headlines: Global central bankers scour shopping malls, manufacturers for coronavirus playbook
Description: In the days after a new virus was identified in China on Dec. 31, global central bankers fell back on past experience for a comforting early analysis.

Headlines: Telus says 5,000 jobs at risk if forced to open network to wireless resellers: report
Description: Telus Corp could cut 5,000 jobs and C$1 billion in investments over the next five years if the Canadian telecom operator is forced to slash prices by 25% or open its network to wireless resellers, The Globe and Mail reported https://tgam.ca/39JGaRY on Thursday.

Headlines: Airbus investing up to 1 billion euros in A220 passenger jet program this year
Description: Airbus SE  plans to invest between 500 million euros  and 1 billion euros ($539 million-$1.08 billion) this year on its A220 passenger jet program, Chief Executive Guillaume Faury said on Thursday at the company's A220 factory in Mirabel, just outside Montreal.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley's Gorman charts ambitious course with $13 billion E*Trade deal
Description: Morgan Stanley said on Thursday it would buy discount brokerage E*Trade Financial Corp in a stock deal worth about $13 billion, the biggest acquisition by a Wall Street bank since the 2008-2009 financial crisis.

Headlines: New Mexico AG sues Google for collecting school kids' personal data
Description: New Mexico Attorney General Hector Balderas on Thursday sued Alphabet Inc's  Google search engine, alleging that its educational software collects young students' personal information without the required parental consent.

Headlines: Dropbox shares rise after upbeat results, share buyback plan
Description: Dropbox Inc on Thursday reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit, raised its outlook for operating margin and announced a $600 million share buyback, sending its shares up 11% in trading after the bell.

Headlines: Wall St. eases, led by tech decline on mounting fears coronavirus could spread
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Thursday, led by declines in technology heavyweights, after reports of new coronavirus cases in China and other countries intensified fears over its spread and  impact on the global economy.

Headlines: Dollar slams yen and safe-haven status, gold gains
Description: The rally in U.S. equities took a pause and the strong dollar got stronger on Thursday, rising to a three-year high against a basket of trading partner currencies, after a steep slide in the Japanese yen called into question its safe-haven status.

Headlines: L Brands sells majority stake in Victoria's Secret, CEO Wexner to step down
Description: L Brands Inc  said on Thursday it will sell a controlling stake in its Victoria's Secret unit to investment firm Sycamore Partners, valuing the lingerie brand at $1.1 billion, as it focuses on its core Bath & Body Works brand.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sears snags new financial lifeline as losses continue - sources
Description: U.S. department store operator Sears has reached a deal for a fresh financial lifeline totaling roughly $100 million from hedge fund Brigade Capital Management LP, as it tries to stabilize after bankruptcy, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil prices rise as U.S. crude stocks build less than expected
Description: Oil prices were up slightly on Thursday after the U.S. government reported a much smaller-than-anticipated rise in crude stocks, but gains were capped by worries about the spread of Coronavirus outside China.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley's E*Trade deal to test Washington's regulatory mood in election year
Description: Morgan Stanley's takeover of brokerage E*Trade Financial Corp  reflects a more relaxed regulatory mood in Washington, but it is still a gamble in an election year that will see Democrats continue to shine a spotlight on Wall Street excesses, said analysts.

Headlines: What secrets? Apple embroiled in row over book by German former executive
Description: Apple has become embroiled in a publishing row in Germany after it tried to halt sales of a book written by a former executive, saying it disclosed secrets about the App Store.

Headlines: EU privacy body warns of privacy risks in Google, Fitbit deal
Description: Alphabet Inc-owned Google's $2.1 billion bid for fitness trackers company Fitbit could pose privacy risks, the European Data Protection Board (EDPB) warned on Thursday, adding its voice to other critics of the deal.

Headlines: Exclusive: Westinghouse set to sign pact with Indian firm for nuclear reactors during Trump visit
Description: U.S. energy firm Westinghouse is expected to sign a new agreement with state-run Nuclear Power Corporation of India for the supply of six nuclear reactors during U.S. President Donald Trump's visit next week, officials said, aiming to kickstart a long-running project.

Headlines: Exclusive: Canadian regulator considers changes to new drug pricing plan
Description: Canada's drug pricing agency is contemplating significant changes to how it will apply new regulations aimed at lowering costs, Reuters has learned, as drugmakers unhappy with the policy delay introducing new medicines in the country and blame it for job cuts.

Headlines: Uber returns to Colombia less than a month after exit
Description: Uber Technologies Inc  resumed transporting passengers in Colombia on Thursday with a new service model that allows users to rent cars with drivers, just 20 days after it exited the Andean country following a ruling by regulators which the company described as arbitrary.

Headlines: Exclusive: France's Engie eyes U.S. energy services firm Ameresco - sources
Description: French power utility Engie SA has approached Ameresco Inc, a U.S. provider of energy efficiency solutions and developer of renewable energy plants, to express interest in acquiring it, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Unicredit boss Mustier emerges as contender for HSBC CEO role: Bloomberg
Description: Unicredit Spa  Chief Executive Officer Jean-Pierre Mustier has emerged as one of the main external candidates for the top job at HSBC Holdings Plc , Bloomberg reported on Thursday, citing sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. labor market remains strong; manufacturing likely stabilizing
Description: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits rose modestly last week, suggesting sustained labor market strength that could help to support the economy amid risks from the coronavirus and weak business investment.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp nears full sale of $17 billion elevator division: sources
Description: Thyssenkrupp  is nearing a full sale of its elevator division, three people familiar with the matter said, adding that this would secure the highest valuation of about 16 billion euros ($17.3 billion) to help the company pay down debt.

Headlines: UBS's tech-savvy new boss Hamers not always loved by the Dutch
Description: Ralph Hamers made his mark as a tech-savvy chief executive who led Dutch bank ING  back to profitability after cementing its position as a no-frills lender in Germany and simplifying its product portfolio.

Headlines: Domino's shares hit new high on first U.S. same-store sales beat in a year
Description: Domino's Pizza Inc's  shares soared 25% to a record high after the pizza chain comfortably beat quarterly U.S. same-store sales and profit estimates on Thursday, benefiting from its focus on faster delivery and new promotions.

Headlines: P&G expects coronavirus outbreak to hit current-quarter revenue, profit
Description: Procter & Gamble Co  said on Thursday its current-quarter revenue and profit would take a hit from supply chain disruptions and weak demand due to the coronavirus outbreak in China, the consumer goods company's second-biggest market.

Headlines: Watchdog faults Swiss bank Julius Baer for money laundering lapses
Description: Swiss bank Julius Baer  has been reprimanded by the country's financial watchdog for ignoring money laundering risks in handling millions of francs of payments linked to corruption in Venezuela and world soccer body FIFA.

Headlines: IMF begins visit as Lebanon grapples with financial crisis
Description: A team from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) met Lebanese government officials on Thursday at the start of a visit to advise on how to tackle the country's crippling financial and economic crisis.

Headlines: Lebanon's Aoun vows accountability over financial crisis-Twitter
Description: Lebanese President Michel Aoun said on Thursday measures would be taken to hold to account all those who contributed to Lebanon's financial crisis through illegal actions be they transfers abroad, manipulation of Eurobonds or other acts.

Headlines: Microsoft to invest $1.1 billion in Mexico over next five years: CEO
Description: Microsoft  Chief Executive Satya Nadella said the technology giant will invest $1.1 billion in Mexico over the next five years, according to a promotional video released by the Mexican government on Thursday.

Headlines: Thomson Reuters close to naming ex-Nielsen president Hasker as CEO: sources
Description: Thomson Reuters Corp   is close to naming former Nielsen Holdings Plc  president Steve Hasker as its next chief executive, succeeding Jim Smith, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: WeWork names COO in first major appointment under new CEO
Description: Office-sharing startup WeWork on Thursday named Shyam Gidumal, a former Ernst & Young executive, as its new chief operating officer in the first major executive appointment under new head Sandeep Mathrani.

Headlines: Shares of HNA affiliates rally after report of China bailout plan
Description: Shares in affiliates of HNA Group surged on Thursday following a news report that China plans to take over the debt-laden conglomerate as the coronavirus outbreak has further hit its ability to meet financial obligations.

Headlines: Israel's Wix.com sees 2020 revenue reaching almost $1 billion
Description: Wix.com, which helps small businesses build and operate websites, reported a smaller-than-expected decline in fourth-quarter net profit and forecast a revenue rise of about 25% this year to nearly $1 billion as it expands into the professional web creator market.

Headlines: Volkswagen CFO will leave in summer next year: Manager Magazin
Description: Volkswagen  finance chief Frank Witter will leave the German car group in the summer of 2021, business publication Manager Magazin reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Foxconn says cautiously resuming China output, warns coronavirus will hit revenue
Description: Apple iPhone maker Foxconn  said on Thursday it is cautiously restarting production at its main plants in China and warned revenue will be hurt this year by the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: BAE Systems predicts 2020 growth despite Saudi ban
Description: Britain's BAE Systems  forecast another year of growth in 2020, saying the company was well-placed to take advantage of increased defence spending that could help to offset any future impact from a German ban on arms exports to Saudi Arabia.

Headlines: BAE Systems CEO optimistic about future Typhoon orders
Description: The chief executive of BAE Systems  is optimistic about the future of the Typhoon fighter jet, saying that more orders were possible.

Headlines: Daimler slims down Mercedes management in efficiency drive
Description: German cars and trucks maker Daimler  said it would revamp the management of its finance, production and development portfolios to remove duplicate layers between Mercedes-Benz and Daimler AG.

Headlines: Walmart's struggling Japan unit finally delivers with online grocery growth
Description: Walmart Inc  might finally have found the sweet spot in Japan's food market with a fast-growing venture ranked third in a nascent online grocery sector, as the brick-and-mortar stores it bought into two decades ago continue their search for profit.

Headlines: Trump economist says 'uncertainty' from trade disputes hit business investment
Description: A slowdown in U.S. growth last year was at least partly the fault of President Donald Trump's global trade battles and the resulting hit to business investment, the administration's top economist said on Thursday in an outlook for the coming years.

Headlines: Forever 21 snapped up by mall owners, Authentic Brands
Description: Forever 21 has a new lease on life after Simon Property Group Inc , Brookfield Property Partners LP  and Authentic Brands Group agreed to acquire the bankrupt teen fashion retailer.

Headlines: Google plans to move UK users' accounts outside EU jurisdiction
Description: Google is planning to move its British users' accounts out of the control of European Union privacy regulators, placing them under U.S. jurisdiction instead, the company confirmed late on Wednesday.

Headlines: Manufacturers entangled in logistical nightmare as virus-hit China limps back to work
Description: Blocked highways. Stranded workers. Dwindling supplies. Shipping and air freight companies also hamstrung.

Headlines: U.S. meeting on Huawei, China policy still on for Thursday despite Trump tweets: sources
Description: A meeting of U.S. government officials to discuss further curbs on exports to Huawei and China is still on for Thursday, two sources said, despite pushback from President Donald Trump against the restrictions.

Headlines: Fed policymakers cautiously optimistic on U.S. economy despite new risks, minutes show
Description: Federal Reserve policymakers were cautiously optimistic about their ability to hold interest rates steady this year, minutes of the central bank's last policy meeting showed, even as they acknowledged new risks caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Fed staff float plan to end term-repo after April, minutes show
Description: Senior Federal Reserve staff proposed ending longer-term loans to banks after April as part of a broader blueprint laying out how the central bank could scale back the support provided to money markets, the minutes from the January policy meeting showed.

Headlines: Lofty stocks, hefty debt sow seeds of worry for some at Fed
Description: Rock-bottom corporate bond yields, high levels of business debt and one of the fastest expansions of stock market valuations on record are worrying some Federal Reserve officials who fret such financial imbalances could aggravate any negative shocks to the U.S. economy.

Headlines: S&P 500, Nasdaq hit record closing highs, lifted by China stimulus hopes
Description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq rose to record closing highs on Wednesday as optimism that China would take more measures to prop up its economy eased concerns about the economic impact of the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Fresenius Medical says fourth-quarter operating profit up 3%
Description: Germany's Fresenius Medical Care  on Wednesday said quarterly adjusted operating income edged 3% higher as growth in dialysis services and products was partly offset by a negative adjustment for accounts receivable in a legal dispute in North America.

Headlines: Boeing, crash victims' lawyers negotiate over access to 737 MAX documents
Description: Boeing Co and lawyers representing families of victims of a 737 MAX crash agreed in court on Wednesday to hold a conference call with U.S. government crash probe authorities over access to documents related to the now-grounded aircraft's design, development and two fatal disasters involving it.

Headlines: China's HNA emerges as recent buyer of A330neo jets amid revamp: sources
Description: Debt-laden HNA Group has restructured jet orders with Europe's Airbus in a compromise deal that includes an order for dozens of A330neo jets, two people familiar with the matter said, amid reports of a wider shake-up at the Chinese conglomerate.

Headlines: Virgin Galactic looks like newest cult stock as short sellers dig in
Description: Wall Street's newest cult stock appears to be Richard Branson's Virgin Galactic Holdings Inc , as investors drive shares of the space tourism company to sky-high levels and short sellers dig in their heels.

Headlines: French judges step up Ghosn probe over palace party, Oman dealings
Description: French prosecutors have stepped up their investigation into alleged misappropriation of funds at Renault by former boss Carlos Ghosn, saying a judge had now been assigned to the case to launch a formal investigation.

Headlines: Stocks scale fresh peaks on slowing virus, dollar gains
Description: The dollar gained while several U.S. and European equity indexes scaled fresh peaks on Wednesday after China reported another decline in new coronavirus cases and on expectations of Chinese stimulus to counter a slowdown in growth.

Headlines: Exclusive: Google users in UK to lose EU data protection - sources
Description: Google is planning to move its British users' accounts out of the control of European Union privacy regulators, placing them under U.S. jurisdiction instead, sources said.

Headlines: Should Facebook, Google be liable for user posts? asks U.S. Attorney General Barr
Description: U.S. Attorney General William Barr on Wednesday questioned whether Facebook, Google and other major online platforms still need the immunity from legal liability that has prevented them from being sued over material their users post.

Headlines: Oil up more than 2% on slowing coronavirus cases, U.S. move on Venezuela
Description: Oil prices gained more than 2% on Wednesday as worries eased about demand declining due to the spread of coronavirus cases in China, while supplies tightened as the United States moved to cut off more Venezuelan crude from the market.

Headlines: Business jet deliveries hit decade high in 2019, helped by new models
Description: Business jet deliveries across the globe hit a decade high in 2019, the General Aviation Manufacturers Association (GAMA) said on Wednesday, helped by strong market demand for new models.

Headlines: U.S. housing starts fall, building permits near 13-year high
Description: U.S. homebuilding fell less than expected in January while permits surged to a near 13-year high, pointing to sustained housing market strength that could help keep the longest economic expansion in history on track.

Headlines: Exclusive: 'Made in Russia' passenger jet finds a single buyer, Aeroflot
Description: Russia's main home-grown passenger jet, the Sukhoi Superjet 100,  conceived as a rival to Airbus, Bombardier and Embraer, has no confirmed orders this year beyond a long-standing deal with state carrier Aeroflot , two sources told Reuters.

Headlines: This revamp will be different, says HSBC boss; staff not so sure
Description: Noel Quinn, the interim chief executive of HSBC , says this time things are going to be different.

Headlines: Airbus defense division plans to cut more than 2,300 jobs
Description: The defense business of Airbus  on Wednesday laid out plans to cut more than 2,300 jobs, citing a flat space market and postponed defense contracts.

Headlines: T-Mobile owner sets sights on becoming U.S. number one
Description: Deutsche Telekom  is aiming to become market leader in the United States, CEO Tim Hoettges said on Wednesday, now that a deal for its T-Mobile US  unit to take over Sprint  is within reach.

Headlines: We can live with German, EU ideas on vendor regulation: Deutsche Telekom
Description: It looks as though German and European policy makers are working towards rules governing vendors of telecoms network equipment that Deutsche Telekom  can live with,

Headlines: Lyft resumes shared electric bike rentals in NYC
Description: Lyft Inc  will roll out a fleet of several hundred electric bikes for rent across New York City, the company said on Wednesday, 10 months after it pulled them following complaints and injury reports.

Headlines: Regulators need to get up to speed on digital currencies
Description: Global financial regulators risk falling behind on rapid innovation in the digital payments industry and need to work more quickly to devise rules for crypto-currencies or "stablecoins", the chair of a global finance watchdog said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Boeing finds debris in 737 MAX jetliners: company memo
Description: Boeing Co  found debris that could pose potential safety risks in the fuel tanks of several 737 MAX aircraft that are in storage and waiting to be delivered to airlines, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Nokia to acquire optical networking tech firm Elenion
Description: Finnish telecom networks maker Nokia Oyj said on Wednesday it has agreed to acquire privately-held U.S.-based company Elenion Technologies to boost its optical networking business and broaden its offering to telecoms operators.

Headlines: Kuwaiti parliament to investigate Airbus aircraft orders
Description: Kuwaiti lawmakers agreed on Wednesday to set up a committee to look into whether Airbus's  aircraft orders from the Gulf Arab state involved alleged corruption, the state news agency reported.

Headlines: U.S. urges EU to use 5G by Ericsson, Nokia, Samsung, seen on par with Huawei
Description: EU countries have no reason to use 5G mobile technology from Huawei because Sweden's Ericsson , Finland's Nokia  and South Korea's Samsung  are on par with the Chinese group in the field, a senior U.S. diplomat said.

Headlines: Air France faces new strikes over domestic network cuts
Description: Air France  unions have called for strikes at its domestic carrier Hop as pilots seek improved pay and conditions and ground staff press for job guarantees, union officials said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Vodafone, Telecom Italia offer rivals access to some sites to ease EU concerns - EU paper
Description: Vodafone  and Telekom Italia  have offered to allow rivals access to sites in some cities for up to nine years, a proposal aimed at allaying EU antitrust concerns over the creation of Italy’s largest mobile tower company, according to an EU document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Qatar Airways spends $600 million to lift stake in BA owner to 25%
Description: Qatar Airways has bought a $600 million stake in British Airways-owner IAG  to increase its holding to 25.1%, strengthening its position ahead of a change in IAG management.

Headlines: Their market shut, traders in China's Silicon Valley do business from bags
Description: While coronavirus fears curtail much of China's bustle, traders are getting back to business at the world's largest electronics market, buying and selling from bags and suitcases on the streets outside their shut premises.

Headlines: Adidas, Puma warn of coronavirus hit to China business
Description: German sportswear makers Adidas  and Puma  have both warned that the coronavirus outbreak was hurting their business in China due to store closures and fewer Chinese tourists travelling and shopping in other markets.

Headlines: UniCredit CEO says no M&A deal after Intesa's surprise UBI bid
Description: The head of UniCredit  repeated in a letter to staff on Wednesday that Italy's biggest bank had no intention of engaging in merger and acquisition deals following Intesa's  blitz move to buy rival UBI Banca .

Headlines: General Motors to lay off all 1,500 plant workers in Thailand following sale
Description: General Motors will begin laying off around 1,500 employees in Thailand in June, after announcing the sale of its production plants in the country, a government official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Citi, Deutsche start talks to sell $9 billion Dubai port company debt: sources
Description: Citi  and Deutsche Bank  have started talks with other banks to sell roughly $9 billion in debt Dubai raised to take full control of DP World  and refinance borrowings of Dubai World, sources familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Renault shares fall after Moody's cuts its debt to 'junk' status
Description: Renault's  shares fell on Wednesday after Moody's cut its rating on the French carmaker's debt to "junk" status, citing weaker profitability as the company restructures and grapples with falling demand.

Headlines: BlackRock bolsters European management as part of regional expansion: memo
Description: BlackRock , the world's biggest asset manager, has appointed two executives to oversee its operations in continental Europe as part of efforts to expand in the region, a memo to staff on Wednesday seen by Reuters showed.

Headlines: Merged T-Mobile U.S. to close valuation gap on Big Two: Deutsche Telekom CEO
Description: The merger between T-Mobile US  and Sprint  is within reach, the head of its main owner Deutsche Telekom said, forecasting that the combined business would quickly close a valuation gap on market leaders AT&T  and Verizon .

Headlines: Puma warns of hit to sales and profits from coronavirus
Description: German sportswear group Puma  on Wednesday said it expected China's coronavirus outbreak to hit its sales and profits in the first quarter but it still hopes to reach its targets for 2020.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor chairman to give up board seat as succession looms
Description: Hyundai Motor Group  Chairman Mong-Koo Chung plans to give up his board seat, in the latest sign that the octogenarian patriarch of South Korea's second-largest conglomerate is preparing to hand the reins over to his son.

Headlines: Exclusive: Unilever, 3M on list of firms eligible for China loans to ease coronavirus crisis - sources
Description: Shanghai has compiled a list of firms, including local units of multi-nationals Unilever PLC  and 3M Co , as eligible for millions of dollars in subsidized loans to ease any blow from the coronavirus outbreak, according to bankers and documents seen by Reuters.

Headlines: SoftBank to borrow $4.5 billion pledging domestic telco's shares
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  said on Wednesday it plans to borrow up to 500 billion yen ($4.5 billion) from 16 domestic and foreign financial institutions using almost a third of its stake in telco SoftBank Corp  as collateral.

Headlines: Exclusive: India antitrust investigators see no evidence of collusion by IndiGo, SpiceJet and others - sources
Description: Investigators with India's antitrust watchdog have found no evidence that the country's biggest airline, IndiGo , and four rival carriers colluded to fix ticket prices, three sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Metro Bank names interim boss Dan Frumkin CEO
Description: Metro Bank  on Wednesday named interim Chief Executive Dan Frumkin to the role permanently, tasking him with leading the British lender past an accounting scandal that plunged it into crisis last year.

Headlines: Uber closing office in downtown Los Angeles
Description: Uber Technologies Inc  is closing its office in downtown Los Angeles, where the ride-hailing company employs customer support staff, to focus on its bigger locations.

Headlines: Hormel joins Tyson Foods, JBS in removing drug banned by China from hog supply
Description: Spam-maker Hormel Foods Corp  is eliminating a growth drug banned by China from its hog supply, the company said on Tuesday, joining rivals that are seeking to increase meat sales to Chinese buyers grappling with a pork shortage.

Headlines: U.S. judge rejects Huawei challenge to federal law restricting its business
Description: A federal judge in Texas on Tuesday rejected Chinese telecommunications equipment maker Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's constitutional challenge to a U.S. law that restricted its ability to do business with federal agencies and their contractors.

Headlines: China races to contain job losses as coronavirus batters economy
Description: When cameraman Mark Xia returned to his job this month after holidays, the Shanghai video production house where he worked told him to take three months of leave with no pay, as a coronavirus epidemic takes a toll of China's businesses.

Headlines: Oil near flat; virus impact offsets Libya supply disruptions
Description: Oil prices were near flat on Tuesday, pressured by concerns over the impact on crude demand from the coronavirus outbreak in China, but prices drew support from a reduction in supply from Libya.

Headlines: Samsung poised to benefit from China virus woes afflicting Apple, other rivals
Description: Samsung Electronics stands to be a major beneficiary of the China production problems announced by rival Apple Inc on Monday, reaping the rewards of a decade-long bet on low-cost smartphone manufacturing in Vietnam.

Headlines: Trump blasts proposed U.S. restrictions on sale of jet parts to China
Description: President Donald Trump objected on Tuesday to U.S. proposals that would prevent companies from supplying jet engines and other components to China's aviation industry and suggested he had instructed his administration not to implement them.

Headlines: Stocks slide on Apple's virus warning, euro near three-year low
Description: Gold rose and global equity markets slid on Tuesday after Apple Inc  said it was unlikely to meet its sales guidance because of the coronavirus outbreak in China, a warning highlighting the epidemic's threat to global growth and corporate profits.

Headlines: Huawei accuses U.S. of overlooking HSBC misconduct to go after Chinese firm
Description: U.S. prosecutors overlooked apparent violations of U.S. sanctions against Iran by HSBC Holdings in exchange for the British bank's cooperation with a government investigation of Huawei Technologies, lawyers for the Chinese telecoms giant said.

Headlines: HSBC to slash investment bank, 35,000 jobs in strategy overhaul
Description: HSBC Holdings PLC said on Tuesday it would shed $100 billion in assets, shrink its investment bank and revamp its U.S. and European businesses in a drastic overhaul that will mean 35,000 jobs cut over three years.

Headlines: HSBC eyes $600 million in losses if Coronavirus persists
Description: HSBC could be forced to take $600 million in additional provisions against loan losses if the Coronavirus outbreak persists into the second half of this year, Chief Financial Officer Ewan Stevenson said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Boy Scouts of America files bankruptcy in wake of abuse lawsuits
Description: The Boy Scouts of America said on Tuesday it had filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy amid a flood of lawsuits over allegations of child sexual abuse stretching back decades.

Headlines: Coronavirus threatens Apple supply chain, sales; shares drop
Description: Shares of Apple Inc  fell 2 % on Tuesday and dragged the stocks of its suppliers across the globe lower, after the iPhone maker warned of lower sales in the current quarter acknowledging that the coronavirus outbreak was pressuring its supply chain.

Headlines: Dow, S&P 500 decline after Apple's sales warning
Description: The Dow and S&P 500 fell on Tuesday after a sales warning from Apple left investors assessing the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on U.S. companies.

Headlines: Alstom, Bombardier shares fall after $6.7 billion rail deal
Description: Shares of Alstom SA and Montreal-based Bombardier Inc fell on Tuesday after the French firm agreed to buy its Canadian rival's rail division for up to 6.2 billion euros ($6.7 billion), a deal likely to draw scrutiny from competition regulators and unions concerned about job cuts.

Headlines: Consumer groups, unions oppose fix for planned merger of AbbVie and Allergan
Description: A group of unions and consumer groups wrote to U.S. antitrust enforcers on Tuesday to oppose a proposed remedy that could lead to U.S. approval for AbbVie Inc's  planned purchase of Allergan Plc .

Headlines: Virgin Galactic's stock soars, fueled by retail investors
Description: Virgin Galactic Holdings Inc  shares surged 24% on Tuesday, extending a rally since early December to over 400% and evoking a warning from an analyst who likes the space tourism company but warns it has become overbought.

Headlines: Coronavirus dents bookings for Holiday Inn owner IHG
Description: InterContinental Hotels (IHG) warned on Tuesday that fewer travellers are booking its rooms in China because of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Walmart sees slower online sales growth after tepid holiday quarter
Description: Walmart Inc  on Tuesday forecast online sales growth to slow this year after posting lower-than-expected holiday quarter results, revealing the pressure traditional retailers are facing to keep pace with consumers who are increasingly shopping online.

Headlines: U.S. mulls cutting Huawei off from global chip suppliers, with TSMC in crosshairs
Description: The Trump administration is considering changing U.S. regulations to allow it to block shipments of chips to Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL] from companies such as Taiwan's TSMC , the world's largest contract chipmaker, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Vodafone, Telecom Italia offer rivals access to some sites to ease EU concerns – document
Description: Vodafone  and Telecom Italia (TIM)  have offered to give rivals access to some of their infrastructure for up to nine years to allay EU antitrust concerns over plans to merge their tower units, according to a document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover's UK output at risk from coronavirus-hit supplies
Description: Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) has flown Chinese parts in suitcases to Britain to maintain production and could run out after two weeks as the impact of the coronavirus outbreak hits firms across countries and industries.

Headlines: Hedge funds use DIY strategies to gauge coronavirus impact
Description: As investors crunch numbers to determine how the coronavirus will hit China’s economy, hedge fund manager Nathaniel Polachek has tied much of his outlook to the fate of a ship anchored near Weihai, China.

Headlines: Shades of Detroit? Germany's auto heartlands in peril as 'golden age' fades
Description: When Kristin and Thomas Schmitt took out a mortgage and bought a house last summer, the German couple's dream looked as if it was coming true. Two months later, they learned that the tire factory where both work would be shut down early next year.

Headlines: Dell to sell cybersecurity unit for $2.08 billion
Description: Dell Technologies Inc  said on Tuesday it would sell its cybersecurity unit RSA for $2.08 billion to a consortium led by Symphony Technology Group, Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan Board and AlpInvest Partners.

Headlines: 20 years after dot-com peak, tech dominance keeps investors on edge
Description: As Wall Street approaches the 20th anniversary of the piercing of the dot-com bubble, today's decade-old rally led by a few small players shows some similarities that cautious investors are keeping an eye on.

Headlines: Exclusive: JPMorgan shakes up investment bank in leadership makeover - sources
Description: JPMorgan  is reshuffling senior management at the top of its investment bank, naming two new global co-heads and shifting some of its most senior dealmakers into new jobs focused purely on bringing in business, two sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Factbox: JPMorgan names new global leaders at investment bank - sources
Description: JPMorgan  has shifted some of its top dealmakers to a newly-created executive committee of global chairs of investment banking to deepen ties with major clients and mentor the next generation of star bankers, two sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Breen to return as DuPont CEO
Description: DuPont  has brought back management veteran Edward Breen as its chief executive officer, in a move that the industrial materials maker is hoping will help lift sluggish sales since its split from DowDuPont Inc.

Headlines: Exclusive: Samsung wins 5-nanometer modem chip contract from Qualcomm - sources
Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd's  semiconductor manufacturing division has won a contract to make new Qualcomm Inc  5G chips using its most advanced chip-making technology, two sources familiar with the matter said, boosting the Korean firm's efforts to gain market share against rival Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co .

Headlines: Exclusive: Tesla in talks to use CATL's cobalt-free batteries in China-made cars - sources
Description: Tesla  is in advanced stages of talks to use batteries from CATL  that contain no cobalt - one of the most expensive metals in electric vehicle (EV) batteries - in cars made at its China plant, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Amazon's Bezos pledges $10 billion to climate change fight
Description: Amazon  Chief Executive Officer Jeff Bezos will commit $10 billion to fund scientists, activists, nonprofits and other groups fighting to protect the environment and counter the effects of climate change, he said on Monday.

Headlines: StanChart commits $75 billion toward sustainable development goals
Description: Standard Chartered on Tuesday said it will provide $75 billion in financing by 2024 toward sustainable development and clean energy projects, as it expands on its aspirations to support the Paris Agreement on climate change.

Headlines: Nissan CEO tells angry shareholders he is ready to be sacked if no turnaround
Description: Nissan's  new chief executive said on Tuesday he would accept being fired if he fails to turn around Japan's second biggest automaker which is grappling with plunging sales in the aftermath of the scandal surrounding ex-chairman Carlos Ghosn.

Headlines: If Apple is hurting due to the coronavirus, its suppliers and rivals likely are too
Description: Apple Inc's  surprise warning that it will likely fall short of this quarter's sales target due to the coronavirus epidemic points to much pain for its chip and other suppliers as well as for rivals who also rely on China to build their products.

Headlines: Apple warns sales to fall short of target due to coronavirus impact
Description: Apple Inc  warned on Monday it was unlikely to meet its March quarter sales guidance set just three weeks ago as the world's most valuable technology firm became one of the biggest corporate casualties of China's coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: French finance minister warns Renault against job cuts, factory closures
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire warned Renault  on Tuesday against shutting factories in France and cutting jobs there after the carmaker announced "no taboos" cost cuts last week.

Headlines: Recession risk forces BOJ to row back on inflation goal
Description: The widening economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak and soft consumption are forcing the Bank of Japan to message more strongly that it is no longer inclined to chase its elusive 2% inflation target, sources familiar with its thinking say.

Headlines: BTG Pactual founder Esteves returns to center stage amid speculation on role
Description: Banco BTG Pactual SA  founder Andre Esteves will be the marquee speaker at a wide-ranging event on Tuesday sponsored by the Brazilian investment bank, marking a return to the limelight for one of the country's best-known bankers.

Headlines: China to grant tariff exemptions on 696 U.S. goods to support purchases
Description: China will grant exemptions on retaliatory duties imposed against 696 U.S. goods, the most substantial tariff relief to be offered so far, as Beijing seeks to fulfill commitments made in its interim trade deal with the United States.

Headlines: SoftBank spends $2.5 billion to get second Vision Fund off the ground: sources
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  has pumped $2.5 billion of its own cash into new investments since October, people familiar with the matter said, hoping to restore its money-making credentials as it courts investors for a successor to its Vision Fund.

Headlines: European new car sales down 7.4% in January: ACEA
Description: European car sales fell in January, hit by a sluggish global economy, higher car taxes in some EU countries and uncertainty over Britain's departure from the bloc, the European Auto Industry Association (ACEA) said on Tuesday.

Headlines: France's Accor partners with Visa under loyalty program
Description: Accor , Europe's largest hotel group, said on Tuesday it was joining forces with American card giant Visa  to offer a payment card to members of its lifestyle loyalty program named ALL-Accor Live Limitless.

Headlines: DP World returns to full state ownership, takes on $8.1 billion debt
Description: (This 17th Feb. story corrects final paragraph to "raised" not "valued")

Headlines: GM shuts Australia, NZ operations; sells Thai plant to Great Wall
Description: General Motors Co  said it would wind down its Australian and New Zealand operations and sell a Thai plant in the latest restructuring of its global business, costing the U.S. auto maker $1.1 billion.

Headlines: Alstom to buy Bombardier rail unit for up to $6.7 billion
Description: France's Alstom SA has agreed to buy the rail division of Canada's Bombardier Inc for up to 6.2 billion euros ($6.7 billion) to create the world's No. 2 train manufacturer and better take on Chinese leader CRRC Corp.

Headlines: Timeline: Bombardier's journey from Ski-Doo maker to business jet maker
Description: Alstom SA on Monday agreed to buy Bombardier Inc's train business for up to 6.2 billion euros ($6.7 billion), days after Airbus SE agreed to buy out Bombardier's remaining stake in the A220 passenger jet program, helping the company improve its financial position.

Headlines: Xerox courts HP shareholders as takeover battle heats up
Description: U.S. printer maker Xerox Holdings Corp  is hosting a dinner for HP Inc  shareholders this week as it seeks investor support to overcome the personal computer maker's resistance to its $35 billion takeover bid, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: EU industry chief tells Facebook to adapt to EU, not other way round
Description: EU industry commissioner Thierry Breton said on Monday it was for Facebook to adapt to Europe's standards, not the other way round, as he criticized the U.S. social media giant's proposed internet rules as insufficient.

Headlines: Euro zone ministers discuss fiscal boost options as virus worries weigh
Description: Euro zone finance ministers discussed ways to pursue a more growth-friendly fiscal policy mix on Monday, in a potential nudge to Germany and the Netherlands to spend more as fears of a downturn grow in the wake of the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Oil edges up as output cut hopes offset coronavirus concern
Description: Oil prices inched up on Monday as concerns over the economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak in China were offset by expectations that potential production cuts from major producers could tighten global crude supply.

Headlines: French government to ensure Alstom-Bombardier deal creates value: minister
Description: The French government will make sure the acquisition of Bombardier's train business by Alstom creates value for the European rail industry and the staff of both companies, Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Italian government leaning towards third term for Eni CEO - sources
Description: The Italian government is leaning toward reappointing Claudio Descalzi as CEO of state-controlled oil firm Eni, provided he will work with a new board to speed up efforts to cut carbon emissions, four senior political sources told Reuters.

Headlines: New York drops fight against T-Mobile-Sprint merger
Description: New York on Sunday dropped its fight against the $40 billion merger of U.S. wireless carriers T-Mobile US Inc  and Sprint Corp , saying the state would not appeal a judge's approval of the deal.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp shortlists buyout firms for elevator unit, Kone out
Description: By Christoph Steitz, Tom Käckenhoff, Arno Schuetze and Edward Taylor

Headlines: EU industry chief warns of more onerous tech rules by year end
Description: The European Union will decide by the end of the year whether to impose rules reining in the market power of U.S. tech giants, the bloc's industry chief said on Monday as he criticised Facebook's proposals as insufficient to address EU concerns.

Headlines: Chinese support measures buoy world stocks
Description: Global shares were buoyant on Monday as the promise of further policy stimulus from China to counteract the economic hit from a coronavirus outbreak calmed nervous investors.

Headlines: WTO gives somber goods trade outlook, sees virus threat
Description: Growth of global trade in goods is likely to remain weak in early 2020, the World Trade Organization (WTO) said on Monday, adding that the below-trend performance could become even worse due to the new coronavirus.

Headlines: Alibaba offers $2.86 billion in loans to firms hit by coronavirus outbreak
Description: Alibaba Group Holdings  said on Monday its affiliate Ant Financial's MYBank unit would offer 20 billion yuan ($2.86 billion) in loans to companies in China in light of the coronavirus outbreak, with preferential terms for Hubei firms.

Headlines: Cathay Pacific flags 'significant' drop in first-half profit, capacity cuts due to coronavirus
Description: Cathay Pacific Airways  is expecting a significant drop in its first-half results and has also cut capacity due to the coronavirus outbreak, it said on Monday.

Headlines: NMC Health founder Shetty resigns as turmoil deepens
Description: NMC Health  said on Monday its founder BR Shetty had resigned as the Emirati healthcare group's joint non-executive chairman, leaving UK businessman H.J. Mark Tompkins as sole chairman.

Headlines: Timeline: NMC Health's expansion and ailments
Description: NMC Health  said on Monday its founder BR Shetty had resigned as joint non-executive chairman, months after the UAE healthcare group was thrown into turmoil by doubts over its finances.

Headlines: Japan on brink of recession as economy contracts, virus heightens risk
Description: Japan's economy shrank at the fastest pace in almost six years in the December quarter as a sales tax hike hit consumer and business spending, raising the risk of a recession as China's coronavirus outbreak chills global activity.

Headlines: William Hill names DS Smith's Adrian Marsh as CFO
Description: British bookmaker William Hill  on Monday named cardboard maker DS Smith's  Chief Financial Officer Adrian Marsh as its finance head.

Headlines: U.S. firms in China report staff shortages, say coronavirus hitting global operations: AmCham
Description: Nearly half of the U.S. companies in China say their global operations are already seeing an impact from business shutdowns due to the coronavirus epidemic, according to a poll by Shanghai's American Chamber of Commerce (AmCham).

Headlines: BOJ's Kuroda flags more easing if virus impact worsens: Sankei
Description: Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda said the central bank would consider additional rapid easing if the coronavirus outbreak significantly threatened Japan's economy and price trends, the Sankei newspaper reported on Monday.

Headlines: Timeline: General Motors streamlines its international operations
Description: General Motors Co  is retreating from more markets outside the United States and China, saying on Sunday that it will wind down its Australian and New Zealand operations, while selling a plant in Thailand.

Headlines: Climate change could make premiums unaffordable: QBE Insurance
Description: Australia's QBE Insurance Group  said on Monday climate change could make some premiums unaffordable, especially for customers exposed to extreme weather events, and was a "material risk" for its operations across the globe.

Headlines: UK digital bank Monzo plans to hire 500 and relaunch paid accounts
Description: Fast-growing British digital bank Monzo plans to hire up to 500 people and forecasts it will get 5.5 million users this year, as it prepares to have another crack at charging some customers to turn a profit.

Headlines: Japan ready to take steps vs virus impact on tourism: Economy Minister
Description: Japanese Economy Minister Yasutoshi Nishimura said on Monday the government was ready to take all necessary steps flexibly with an eye on the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on the economy and tourism.

Headlines: Great Wall says to buy GM's Thailand car plant
Description: China's Great Wall Motor  said on Monday it had signed a binding agreement to purchase a car plant from General Motors  in Thailand.

Headlines: Clock's ticking for Nissan boss Uchida to show he has a plan: sources
Description: Nissan's new CEO Makoto Uchida doesn't have time to work his way into the job. He is effectively on probation and has a matter of months to show he can revive the ailing automaker, according to three people familiar with the thinking of some on the company's board.

Headlines: British Airways COO and director of people to leave
Description: British Airways said on Sunday its Chief Operating Officer, Klaus Goersch, and its Director of People, Angela Williams, were leaving the company.

Headlines: U.S. peach grower awarded $265 million from Bayer, BASF in weedkiller lawsuit
Description: A Missouri jury's $265 million award to peach grower Bill Bader in his lawsuit against herbicide providers Bayer and BASF has raised the stakes for the two companies as at least 140 similar cases head to U.S. courts later this year.

Headlines: Alstom nears deal to buy Bombardier's train unit: source
Description: France's Alstom SA  is close to clinching a deal to buy Bombardier Inc's  train business which will give the unit an enterprise value of $7 billion, according to a source familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Tesla ordered by German court to stop cutting down trees for Gigafactory
Description: A German court on Sunday ordered Tesla Inc to stop clearing forest land near the capital Berlin to build its first European car and battery factory, a victory for local environmental activists.

Headlines: Lebanon's MEA reverses move to charge in dollars
Description: Lebanon's state-owned carrier Middle East Airlines (MEA) reversed a decision to accept payment only in U.S. dollars after a backlash on Sunday, Lebanese media and an MEA source said.

Headlines: Amazon, Flipkart seek rollback of new Indian tax on online sellers
Description: Amazon and Walmart's Flipkart are among online retailers demanding that India scale back a proposed tax on third-party sellers on their platforms, saying the burden of compliance will hurt the fledgling industry, according to documents seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Carrefour to buy 30 stores in Brazil from rival Makro
Description: The Brazilian unit of France's Carrefour SA  has agreed to buy 30 stores from rival retailer Makro's Brazilian subsidiary for 1.95 billion reais ($453.69 million), the French retailer said in a securities filing on Sunday.

Headlines: Regulators should allow RTL and ProSieben to merge: Rabe
Description: The head of publisher Bertelsmann  said its TV arm RTL  should be allowed to merge with German rival ProSiebenSat.1 , to give them a fighting chance against U.S. streaming giants.

Headlines: Treat us like something between a telco and a newspaper, says Facebook's Zuckerberg
Description: Online content should be regulated with a system somewhere between the existing rules used for the telecoms and media industries, Facebook  CEO Mark Zuckerberg told global leaders and security chiefs on Saturday.

Headlines: U.S. weighs blocking GE engine sales for China's new airplane: sources
Description: The U.S. government is considering whether to stop General Electric Co from continuing to supply engines for a new Chinese passenger jet, according to people familiar with the matter, casting uncertainty over China's efforts to enter the civil aviation market.

Headlines: Toyota to resume China output at three plants next week
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  said on Saturday it plans to resume output at three of its four main auto plants in China next week.

Headlines: Factbox: Carmakers look to resume China output after virus forced closures
Description: Automakers including Daimler, Ford and Tesla are looking to resume production in China after being forced to shut factories following the outbreak of a new coronavirus.

Headlines: Rebuffed by UK, U.S. pitches 'big tent' for Huawei rivals in Europe
Description: The United States is seeking to rally European support for competitors to Huawei Technologies following disappointment in Washington over Britain's decision to use 5G equipment made by the Chinese company.

Headlines: Vodafone assesses payment to India in dispute over dues
Description: Vodafone Idea Ltd said on Saturday it was assessing how much it would pay the Indian government as part of dues owed and said it proposed making a payment in the next few days.

Headlines: From wind power to cow manure: oil traders seek new profit recipe
Description: The world's largest oil traders are pouring hundreds of millions of dollars into climate-friendly projects - including wind farms, cow manure plants and blue hydrogen - as they seek to match the profits they make from trading oil.

Headlines: Factbox: Big oil traders start investing in renewables
Description: The world's big oil trading firms are investing heavily in environmentally-friendly projects as they face increasing  pressure from investors, governments, activists and financiers to find a sustainable business model.

Headlines: Investment bank loss mars Thiam's final act at Credit Suisse
Description: Credit Suisse posted its highest annual profit in nearly a decade on Thursday, but volatile earnings at its investment bank and trading divisions muted outgoing Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam's swan song.

Headlines: Activists in dinghy urge Credit Suisse off climate 'collision course'
Description: Climate activists clad in Titanic-era costumes gathered in a rubber dinghy outside Credit Suisse's headquarters on Thursday, to urge incoming chief executive Thomas Gottstein to steer the bank off a climate "collision course".

Headlines: U.S. accuses Huawei of stealing trade secrets, assisting Iran
Description: U.S. prosecutors on Thursday accused Huawei of stealing trade secrets and helping Iran track protesters in its latest indictment against the Chinese company, escalating the U.S. battle with the world's largest telecommunications equipment maker.

Headlines: Huawei cyber security chief says no operator gives it access to intercept equipment
Description: Huawei's cyber security chief said on Friday that he was not aware of any mobile operator ever having given the Chinese company access to the equipment used to intercept calls when required to do so by security services.

Headlines: Univision in talks with investor group for possible sale: source
Description: Spanish-language broadcaster Univision Communications Inc is in sale talks with a consortium of investors, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. SEC Commissioner defends proposal on shareholder voting rules
Description: A top official at the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Thursday defended an agency shareholder voting proposal amid "misconception" received from the SEC's public consultation process over new limits to vote on thorny issues like climate change disclosure and executive pay.

Headlines: AllianzGI pushes for more climate data ahead of AGM season
Description: German fund manager Allianz Global Investors is pushing every company it invests in to improve their climate-related disclosures ahead of the season for annual shareholder meetings.

Headlines: Airbus defense division to start talks on job cuts
Description: The head of the defense business of Airbus  said he would start talks with labor representatives next week on job cuts, as the German-based group retrenches following setbacks with its A400M military transporter.

Headlines: Airbus regrets U.S. tariffs, hopes for change when WTO authorizes EU retaliation
Description: European aerospace group Airbus  said on Saturday it deeply regretted the U.S. decision to increase tariffs on aircraft imported from the European Union and said it would hurt U.S. airlines and their customers.

Headlines: U.S. raises tariffs on European aircraft in ongoing dispute over subsidies
Description: The U.S. government on Friday said it would increase tariffs on aircraft imported from the European Union to 15% from 10%, ratcheting up pressure on Brussels in a nearly 16-year transatlantic dispute over aircraft subsidies.

Headlines: Airbus says higher U.S. tariffs on EU planes will harm U.S. airlines, consumers
Description: The U.S. government's decision to raise tariffs on European-built aircraft will hit U.S. airlines already facing a shortage of aircraft and complicate efforts to reach a negotiated settlement with the European Union, Airbus  said.

Headlines: Timeline: Highlights of the 16-year Airbus, Boeing trade war
Description: The U.S. government on Friday raised tariffs on aircraft imported from the European Union, ratcheting up pressure on the EU to resolve an epic 16-year-old dispute over support for airplane makers, and raising the stakes in broader talks to reach a U.S.-EU trade deal.

Headlines: U.S. firm wins reprieve from expanded duties on steel products
Description: The U.S. Court of International Trade has issued a temporary order under which U.S. customs agents cannot collect duties from a U.S. company under President Donald Trump's recently-announced expansion of steel and aluminum tariffs.

Headlines: Buffett's Berkshire buys Kroger and Biogen, reduces Wells Fargo and Goldman stakes
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc on Friday said it has taken a $549.1 million stake in Kroger Co, investing in the largest U.S. supermarket chain as smaller rivals struggle.

Headlines: India court stalls Amazon, Flipkart antitrust probes: lawyers
Description: An Indian antitrust investigation of Amazon.com Inc and Walmart's Flipkart has been put on hold by a court, three lawyers involved in the proceedings told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: IBM withdraws from RSA conference over coronavirus fears
Description: International Business Machines Corp  on Friday said it had canceled its participation in the RSA cyber security conference due to coronavirus-related concerns.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Investors bet emerging markets will weather coronavirus impact
Description: Investors are edging back into emerging markets, even though worries about the coronavirus' impact on global economic growth have clouded prospects for the boom-and-bust asset class.

Headlines: Boeing tells FAA it does not believe 737 MAX wiring should be moved: sources
Description: Boeing Co  told the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration it does not believe it needs to separate or move wiring bundles on its grounded 737 MAX jetliner that regulators have warned could short circuit with catastrophic consequences, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Injured by China's trade practices? Call 202-395-3900, USTR says
Description: The U.S. Trade Representative's office said on Friday it has established a dispute resolution office and complaint hotline to enforce President Donald Trump's "Phase 1" trade deal with China, which takes effect on Saturday.

Headlines: S&P 500, Nasdaq gain on Nvidia, White House stock incentive report
Description: The S&P 500 ended modestly higher on Friday following strong earnings from Nvidia and a report late in the session that the White House was considering a tax incentive for Americans to buy stocks.

Headlines: American, United push back 737 MAX return amid new approval delays
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  and United Airlines Holdings Inc  are pushing back the return of Boeing 737 MAX flights until August and September, respectively, a fresh delay that comes after sources told Reuters that the timing of a key certification flight may not occur until at least April.

Headlines: Saks Fifth Avenue plans expansion into bankrupt Barneys shop in Los Angeles
Description: Luxury department store operator Saks Fifth Avenue, owned by Canada's Hudson's Bay Co , is expanding into bankrupt fashion chain Barneys' Beverly Hills shop, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Stocks edge up with positive chipmaker forecast, oil gains for the week
Description: Global stock markets rose slightly on Friday as investors bet on a lull in proliferation of the coronavirus, while oil prices registered their first weekly gain since early January.

Headlines: Citigroup CEO Corbat's 2019 compensation unchanged at $24 million
Description: Citigroup Inc  kept its Chief Executive Officer Michael Corbat's 2019 compensation unchanged at $24 million, according to a regulatory filing on Friday.

Headlines: Canadian pot producer Canopy may face challenges offloading assets, CEO says
Description: Canada's biggest cannabis producer, Canopy Growth Corp , could face challenges offloading assets as it seeks to winnow its facilities down to focus on its most lucrative markets and products, its chief executive told Reuters.

Headlines: Google in talks with publishers to pay for premium news content: WSJ
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google is in talks with publishers on paying a licensing fee for content that would be packaged in a premium news product, the Wall Street Journal reported https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-in-talks-to-pay-publishers-for-content-in-premium-news-product-11581689169, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Oil rises over 1% on hopes demand will rebound from coronavirus effect
Description: Oil prices rose over 1% on Friday, posting their first weekly gain since early January as investors bet the economic impact of the coronavirus would be short-lived and hoped for further Chinese central bank stimulus to tackle any slowdown.

Headlines: Bridgewater, Viking among big hedge funds that added Tesla in fourth quarter before rally
Description: Billionaire Ray Dalio's Bridgewater Associates, Viking Global Investors, and Granite Point Capital were among prominent hedge funds placing new bets on electric carmaker Tesla Inc  in the fourth quarter, positioning them to gain from its nearly 100% rally over the first six weeks of the year.

Headlines: Google protests 'eye-catching' $2.6 billion EU fine, judge disagrees
Description: Google on Friday attacked what it called an eye-catching 2.4 billion euro ($2.6 billion) EU antitrust fine, prompting a judge to ask how a rich company can miss a relatively paltry amount.

Headlines: Volkswagen offers 830 million euros to compensate German buyers
Description: Volkswagen  said it will compensate owners of its heavily polluting diesel vehicles in Germany in a settlement that will cost the German carmaker 830 million euros.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuela's PDVSA steps up fuel shipments to Cuba as shortages bite
Description: Venezuela's state energy firm PDVSA has been shipping more oil this month to close ally Cuba, as tighter U.S. sanctions have worsened fuel shortages on the Caribbean island, according to sources and internal company documents seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Apple to reopen a store in Shanghai on February 15
Description: Apple Inc  said on Friday it would reopen one of the seven retail stores it has in Shanghai from Feb. 15 with reduced working hours, a day after the iPhone maker said a few retail stores in Beijing would start functioning from Feb. 14.

Headlines: U.S. January industrial output falls on weather, Boeing drop
Description: U.S. industrial production fell 0.3% in January as unseasonably warm weather held down the output of utilities and Boeing Co  cut production of civilian aircraft, the Federal Reserve said on Friday.

Headlines: Delta to invest $1 billion to curb global air travel's climate impact
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc said on Friday it will invest $1 billion over the next decade in initiatives that would limit the impact of global air travel on the environment, the first airline to make a commitment of that scale.

Headlines: New UK business minister urged to move fast on audit reform
Description: Britain's new business minister Alok Sharma was urged on Friday to come forward as soon as possible with a draft law to create a more powerful accounting watchdog.

Headlines: Europe wants G20 to make taxing digital giants top priority this year
Description: Europe wants the world's financial leaders to make it their top priority this year to reach a deal on global rules for taxing digital giants like Google , Amazon  and Facebook , a document showed.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz's credit rating cut to 'junk' by Fitch
Description: Kraft Heinz Co's  debt rating was cut to "junk" by global credit ratings agency Fitch on Friday, a day after the ketchup and sausage maker reported lower-than-expected quarterly sales and wrote down the value of some businesses.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler halts production in Serbia over China disruption
