Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA)  said on Friday it had temporarily halted production at its Serbian plant, the first such suspension by an automaker in Europe in response to the coronavirus outbreak in China.

Headlines: Exclusive: Jet buyers back Boeing-Embraer deal as Airbus expands reach
Description: Some of the world's biggest aircraft buyers are urging the European Union to clear Boeing's tie-up with Embraer, fearing Embraer's commercial aviation business would struggle on its own now Airbus has swallowed its main competitor in regional jets.

Headlines: Zuckerberg ready for Facebook to pay more tax as welcomes rules review
Description: Facebook  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg accepts that global tax reforms mean it may have to pay more taxes in different countries, excerpts of a speech he is due to deliver in Germany on Saturday show.

Headlines: NMC Health's vice chairman quits as further shareholder twists emerge
Description: NMC Health  is still trying to unravel details about the holdings of the company's top investors, it said on Friday after announcing that one of its controlling shareholders had resigned from the board.

Headlines: UK regulator raps Tesco for unlawfully preventing rival store openings
Description: Tesco , Britain's biggest retailer, unlawfully stopped major supermarket rivals from opening shops near its stores, the country's competition regulator said on Friday.

Headlines: MGM Resorts-led consortium named as lead bidder for Osaka casino project
Description: A consortium led by U.S. entertainment giant MGM Resorts International  has been named as the lead bidder for an integrated casino complex in Osaka, the local government said on Friday.

Headlines: Nvidia shares surge on signs of machine learning boom
Description: Shares of Nvidia Corp  rose 6% on Friday after the chipmaker stunned analysts with strong quarterly results and joined rivals Intel Corp  and Advanced Micro Devices Inc  in predicting strong demand for chips used in the latest generation of data centers and AI.

Headlines: Total considers stopping fuel oil sales for power: CEO
Description: France's Total  is considering stopping sales of fuel oil to power markets as the energy giant seeks to reduce its carbon footprint and grow its renewable power business, its chief executive told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. looking for industry partnership to counter Huawei: White House official
Description: The United States is looking to develop a partnership with the telecoms industry to provide alternatives to China's Huawei Technologies, a senior White House official said on Friday.

Headlines: Renault plans $2.2 billion 'no taboos' cost cuts after first loss in a decade
Description: Renault's  first loss in a decade triggered a no-taboos commitment to cut costs by 2 billion euros ($2.2 billion) over the next three years from the carmaker on Friday, as it tries to put the Carlos Ghosn affair behind it.

Headlines: 'Terrible' WeWork bet caused us headaches: T. Rowe Price
Description: Asset management firm T. Rowe Price Group Inc  has called its investment in WeWork a "debacle" that caused the firm "outsized headaches and disappointments" and left it holding shares worth just a fraction of their original value.

Headlines: Volkswagen to shut coal-fired power stations at main factory to cut CO2
Description: Volkswagen  is shutting down two coal-fired power stations at its main plant in Wolfsburg, Germany and has declined offers to sell them to cut down the company's carbon dioxide emissions, Chief Executive Herbert Diess said on Friday.

Headlines: Nissan shares tumble to ten-and-a-half year low after earnings rout; Renault also suffers
Description: Shares of Nissan Motor Co sank to their lowest in more than a decade on Friday, after deep cuts to the troubled Japanese automaker's earnings forecast and dividend raised questions about its future profitability.

Headlines: Mitsubishi Motors delays factory restart in China on coronavirus
Description: Mitsubishi Motors Corp  is postponing the restart of its factory with Guangzhou Automobile Group in Hunan province until 27 due to the coronavirus outbreak, the Japanese automaker said on Friday.

Headlines: Euro zone GDP slows as expected in fourth-quarter, but employment beats consensus
Description: Euro zone economic growth slowed as expected in the last three months of 2019 as gross domestic product shrank in France and Italy against the previous quarter, but employment growth picked up more than expected, official estimates showed on Friday.

Headlines: Nissan's South Korean unit planning voluntary redundancies: source
Description: Nissan Motor Co's  South Korean unit plans to seek applications for voluntary redundancy, a person with knowledge of the matter said on Friday, as the automaker's shares sank to their lowest in more than a decade.

Headlines: Boeing to extend labor contract with engineer's union by four years
Description: U.S. planemaker Boeing Co  said it has agreed to a tentative deal with its engineers' union to extend its labor contract by another four years.

Headlines: Samsung's jailed board chairman quits
Description: Samsung Electronics'  board Chairman Lee Sang-hoon, who was convicted and jailed for sabotaging union activities, has resigned from the South Korean company, it said on Friday.

Headlines: China urges U.S. to stop suppressing Chinese companies after Huawei indictment
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Friday it urges the United States to immediately stop suppressing Chinese companies without reason, after U.S. prosecutors unveiled a new indictment against Huawei Technologies.

Headlines: Cathay Pacific turns to old playbook for virus crisis amid employee resistance
Description: Leaning on its SARS experience, Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd  has slashed flights, asked staff to take unpaid leave and is re-assessing its fleet as it battles an epidemic and a crisis of morale after pro-democracy protests.

Headlines: KLM apologizes after airliner crew's coronavirus toilet note sparks outrage in South Korea
Description: KLM, the Dutch arm of Air France KLM , offered a public apology on Friday after a crew member sparked online outrage by posting a sign in Korean saying passengers on a recent flight were not allowed to use a toilet because of the new coronavirus.

Headlines: Chinese economy clobbered by coronavirus but set to recover soon: Reuters poll
Description: The coronavirus-hit Chinese economy will grow at its slowest rate since the financial crisis in the current quarter, according to a Reuters poll of economists who said the downturn will be short-lived if the outbreak is contained.

Headlines: Dolce & Gabbana founders have received offers but have no plans to sell: paper
Description: Italy's Dolce & Gabbana founder Stefano Gabbana said on Friday he had received proposals to buy the group but had no intention to sell.

Headlines: Portuguese communities lock horns with lithium miners to save their land
Description: The lush, green hills where Paulo Pires has for years brought sheep to graze above his picturesque Portuguese village may soon be transformed by the race to power electric vehicles.

Headlines: Hedge funds test Swiss tolerance with franc gambit
Description: Hedge funds betting that the Swiss franc will climb further against the euro will soon meet their match, according to investors who are taking the other side of the trade.

Headlines: Australia investigator met other regulators before Citi, Deutsche charges
Description: An Australian investigator who helped bring criminal cartel charges against Citigroup Inc  and Deutsche Bank AG  told a court he met agents from another regulator in a cafe to discuss the matter but the talks were "high level" only.

Headlines: Tesla to recall 3,183 Model X vehicles in China: market regulator
Description: Tesla Inc  will recall 3,183 Model X vehicles in China, because of a potential issue that could make steering harder and increase the risk of a crash, according to the country's market regulator.

Headlines: Woodside holds on to stake in Senegal oil field as FAR challenge fails
Description: ConocoPhillips'  sale of a stake in a $4.2 billion Senegal oil and gas project to Woodside Petroleum  has been cleared by an international tribunal, resolving a long-running challenge by Australian partner FAR Ltd .

Headlines: Judge grants Amazon motion for pause in Microsoft's Pentagon contract work
Description: A U.S. judge on Thursday granted Amazon.com Inc's request to temporarily halt the U.S. Department of Defense and Microsoft Corp from moving forward on an up-to-$10 billion cloud computing deal that Amazon says reflected undue influence by President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico unit blames government cash aid, as revenue rise slowest in three quarters
Description: Walmart de Mexico , Mexico's biggest retailer, reported on Thursday its slowest revenue growth in three quarters, with its core supermarket chain hit by competition after the government altered a welfare spending programme.

Headlines: Nvidia forecast tops expectations on cloud sales despite coronavirus hit
Description: Nvidia Corp  on Thursday forecast first-quarter revenue that topped Wall Street expectations, powered by sales of its chips to cloud computing vendors, even as it projected a $100 million hit from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: FTC antitrust victory on Qualcomm questioned by appeals court
Description: The U.S. government's antitrust victory over chip supplier Qualcomm Inc drew tough questions for the Federal Trade Commision from a panel of three appellate judges in San Francisco on Thursday.

Headlines: Judge OKs Philly refiner's bankruptcy plan, sale to property developer: documents
Description: The Philadelphia Energy Solutions oil refinery site will be sold for $252 million and redeveloped under a plan approved in bankruptcy court on Thursday, ending months of uncertainty over whether the idled plant would be restarted, court filings show.

Headlines: Mattel beats profit estimates as cost cuts take hold
Description: Mattel Inc  on Thursday beat estimates for quarterly profit as it benefited from a robust cost-cutting program, even as holiday season sales of its flagship Barbie brand in North America were pressured by Hasbro Inc's  "Frozen" dolls.

Headlines: Five things to look out for in HSBC's new strategy
Description: HSBC  on Tuesday reports 2019 results and will set out its new strategy, where interim Chief Executive Noel Quinn will audition for the permanent role by announcing major restructuring efforts. Here are five key things to look out for:

Headlines: Jet market oracle Tinseth bows out with Boeing at crossroads
Description: Years ago, when Randy Tinseth was still running Boeing's sales account for United Airlines, the plane company's designers pulled him aside.

Headlines: Royal Caribbean cancels 18 cruises, warns coronavirus hit to yearly profit
Description: Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd  on Thursday said it had canceled 18 cruises in Southeast Asia and joined larger rival Carnival Corp  in warning that its full-year earnings would be hit by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Emerson says will not pursue a break-up following internal review
Description: Emerson Electric Co  told investors on Thursday it would not pursue a break-up following a review it launched last year into whether to separate its industrial automation operations from its air-conditioning business.

Headlines: U.S. gives Huawei another 45 days to buy from American suppliers
Description: The Trump administration said Thursday it was issuing a 45-day extension allowing U.S. companies to continue doing some business with China’s Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.

Headlines: Tesla seeks to tap into stock surge with $2 billion share sale
Description: Tesla Inc on Thursday announced plans to raise $2 billion in a stock offering, tapping into an astronomical jump in its share price over the past few months and reversing the electric-car maker's often-stated policy of avoiding sales of new stock.

Headlines: Jump in coronavirus cases halts stock rally; dollar gains
Description: The dollar rose and global equity markets slumped on Thursday after a new methodology that boosted the coronavirus death toll in China unnerved investors, curbing a rally that had lifted U.S. and European stocks to a series of record peaks.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuela's PDVSA to unload $57 million oil cargo disputed by rival Citgo boards
Description: Venezuela's state-run oil company PDVSA this week plans to discharge nearly 1 million barrels of crude stranded for over a year at sea over U.S. sanctions against the company and an ownership dispute with its refining unit, Citgo Petroleum, according to internal documents viewed by Reuters.

Headlines: JPMorgan sets July deadline for fintechs to sign new data access deals: sources
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  has told financial technology companies they will be barred from accessing its customer information by July 30 unless they sign data access agreements with the bank and back a plan to stop using customer passwords to gather the data.

Headlines: Trump Fed nominee Shelton hits bipartisan skepticism in Senate hearing
Description: Federal Reserve board nominee Judy Shelton faced deep skepticism from Republicans and Democrats on the Senate Banking Committee on Thursday, as lawmakers challenged her independence from President Donald Trump and characterized her thinking as too far outside the mainstream to trust with the nation's economy.

Headlines: Trump Fed nominee Shelton apologizes for likening currency forger to Rosa Parks
Description: Federal Reserve board nominee Judy Shelton on Thursday apologized for having likened a convicted currency counterfeiter to U.S. civil rights icon Rosa Parks in an unusual exchange with a lawmaker weighing her appointment to the central bank.

Headlines: White House stands by Fed nominee after contentious Senate hearing
Description: The White House expects President Donald Trump's two nominees for the Federal Reserve Board, Judy Shelton and Christopher Waller, to win Senate confirmation, a spokesman said on Thursday, disputing a report that Shelton's nomination would be pulled.

Headlines: Investors expect any T-Mobile/Sprint deal price haircut to be small
Description: (This Feb 11 story corrects reference to value of Sprint's spectrum in paragraph 11)

Headlines: T-Mobile-Sprint merger wins approval from U.S. judge
Description: T-Mobile US Inc's edged closer to a takeover of Sprint Corp after a federal judge on Tuesday approved the deal, rejecting a claim by a group of states that said the proposed transaction would violate antitrust laws and raise prices.

Headlines: Fire damage at Exxon's second largest U.S. refinery leaves restart uncertain: sources
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp does not have a timeline for restarting fuel-producing units at its second-largest U.S. refinery following a fire Wednesday that cut production, sources said, as the shutdown boosted gasoline prices on Thursday.

Headlines: Barclays chief Staley probed over Epstein ties
Description: Britain's financial regulators are probing links between Barclays Chief Executive Jes Staley and the U.S. financier Jeffrey Epstein, who killed himself while awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges, after the Financial Times reported on a trove of emails between the two on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil prices climb on prospects for deeper OPEC+ output cuts
Description: Oil prices edged higher on Thursday as investors hoped the world's biggest producers would cut output more while they largely shrugged off forecasts of slumping demand due to the coronavirus outbreak in top oil importer China.

Headlines: Southwest extends 737 MAX flight cancellations through early August
Description: Southwest Airlines  on Thursday extended its cancellation of 737 MAX flights through early August as the grounding of the  Boeing Co  jet continued and threatened to impact nearly all of the busy U.S. summer travel season.

Headlines: Prosecutors challenge antitrust approval of Boeing-Embraer tie-up
Description: Brazilian prosecutors have filed an appeal with antitrust agency Cade asking the regulator to reconsider its approval of a deal selling control of Embraer SA's commercial aviation division to Boeing Co, according to public filings.

Headlines: Google seals takeover of Looker after UK green light
Description: Alphabet Inc-owned Google said on Thursday it has completed its $2.6 billion buyout of privately held big-data analytics firm Looker Data Sciences after winning clearance from Britain's competition watchdog.

Headlines: Airbus pledges profit gain after bribery settlement hit
Description: Airbus  pledged higher jet deliveries and operating profit this year, after an international bribery settlement and problems with the A400M transport plane plunged the aerospace group to a 1.36 billion euro ($1.48 billion) net loss for 2019.

Headlines: Trump Fed nominee Shelton apologises for likening currency forger to Rosa Parks
Description: Federal Reserve board nominee Judy Shelton on Thursday apologised for having likened a convicted currency counterfeiter to U.S. civil rights icon Rosa Parks in an unusual exchange with a lawmaker weighing her appointment to the central bank.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz takes $666 million charge, misses sales expectations
Description: Kraft Heinz Co  on Thursday missed quarterly sales estimates, forecast lower full-year core earnings, and wrote down the value of some businesses - including coffee brand Maxwell House - by $666 million.

Headlines: AIG profit beats on stronger underwriting in general insurance unit
Description: Insurer American International Group Inc  on Thursday reported a quarterly profit that beat estimates, as the company booked underwriting income in its general insurance business.

Headlines: Rents lift U.S. core inflation; weekly jobless claims rise slightly
Description: U.S. underlying consumer prices picked up in January, while the number of Americans filing claims for unemployment benefits rose slightly last week, suggesting the economy was stable enough for the Federal Reserve to keep interest rates on hold this year.

Headlines: Alibaba warns of drop in e-commerce revenues due to coronavirus
Description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd warned of a drop in revenues at its key e-commerce businesses this quarter as the coronavirus sweeping China hits supply chains and deliveries.

Headlines: Nestle boss Schneider eyes more deals to bolster growth ambitions
Description: Nestle Chief Executive Mark Schneider will fine-tune his transformation plans with more acquisitions, he said after the Swiss food group lowered growth expectations on Thursday.

Headlines: Competition heats up in turboprop market
Description: Competition is cranking up in the world of turboprops.

Headlines: Italian fashion brands Liu Jo and Blumarine aim for IPO within two years
Description: The holding company of Italian fashion brands Liu Jo and Blumarine aims to list on the stock market within two years, chief executive and founder Marco Marchi said on Thursday.

Headlines: Nissan slashes profit outlook after sales slide, says more restructuring needed
Description: Nissan Motor Co  on Thursday cut its annual operating profit forecast by 43%, hit by a slump in vehicle sales and heaping more pressure on new management to fix a company still reeling from the scandal surrounding former leader Carlos Ghosn.

Headlines: Steel becomes new problem child as Thyssenkrupp posts profit drop
Description: Thyssenkrupp's steel division swung to a loss in the first quarter, raising doubts over Europe's second-biggest steelmaker, the conglomerate's core following its planned sale of its elevator business.

Headlines: Plant building business auction shows promise: Thyssenkrupp CFO
Description: Thyssenkrupp  is seeing good initial feedback from potential suitors for its Plant Technology unit, its finance chief said, as the auction for the business is about to kick off officially.

Headlines: American Airlines selects Seattle for first direct U.S. flight to Bangalore
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  said on Thursday it would launch its first direct U.S. flight to Bangalore from Seattle, a new route meant to meet corporate customers' demand for travel to the center of India's high-tech industry.

Headlines: Apple to reopen some stores in Beijing on February 14: website
Description: Apple will reopen some stores in Beijing from Feb. 14 with reduced opening hours, it said on its website, while many of its other stores in mainland China will remain shut as the country continues to battle a coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Ousted Credit Suisse CEO Thiam to collect up to $30 million: sources
Description: Credit Suisse Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam, ousted over a spying scandal, stands to collect as much as 30 million Swiss francs ($30 million) after resigning this month, two people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Russian court fines Facebook $63,000 over data law breach: RIA
Description: A Russian court fined social media company Facebook 4 million roubles ($62,922) on Thursday for its failure to comply with a Russian data law, the RIA news agency reported.

Headlines: Gazprom to resume China gas route talks once virus quarantine lifted
Description: Russia's Gazprom  said on Thursday it will continue talks on new China natural gas routes once the coronavirus quarantine is lifted.

Headlines: Google's fight against EU antitrust fine comes up against critical judge
Description: Google's battle against a $2.6 billion EU antitrust fine was dealt an apparent setback on Thursday, when one of the judges hearing the case said the company had committed a "clear infraction" in its handling of price-comparison shopping services.

Headlines: Airbus, Quebec to buy out Bombardier's A220 stake
Description: Airbus has teamed up with the Quebec government to buy Bombardier's 33.5% stake in the A220 passenger jet program, completing the Canadian firm's exit from civil aviation and boosting Airbus's position in a new battleground with Boeing.

Headlines: Organisers of cancelled mobile conference play down compensation chances
Description: Companies that have spent money on a major telecoms conference in Barcelona that has been cancelled after mass withdrawals due to the coronavirus outbreak cannot expect compensation under the organisers' standard insurance, they said on Thursday.

Headlines: Tesla recalls 15,000 Model X SUVs for power steering issue in North America
Description: Tesla Inc  is recalling 15,000 Model X SUVs because of a potential issue that can lead to a loss of power steering assist that could make steering harder and increase the risk of a crash.

Headlines: Mobile World Congress in Barcelona called off over coronavirus fears
Description: The Mobile World Congress (MWC), the annual telecoms industry gathering that draws more than 100,000 visitors to Barcelona, was canceled on Wednesday after a mass exodus by exhibitors due to fears over the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Hyundai bet big on China. Now coronavirus is twisting its supply chain
Description: South Korean car giant Hyundai Motor  has increasingly relied on China to supply auto parts to its manufacturing hub at home in recent years. As the coronavirus spreads, its strategy could be backfiring.

Headlines: UK's Domino's finds buyers for Norway business
Description: Britain's biggest pizza delivery company Domino's Pizza Group  said on Thursday it would sell its Norwegian business to existing minority shareholders of the business, kicking off the sale of its loss-making overseas operations.

Headlines: Qantas raises the stakes in pilot pay dispute
Description: Australia's Qantas Airways  has urged its pilots to reach agreement on a pay deal for the world's longest commercial flights or face being replaced for those routes.

Headlines: Turkey's Atlasglobal suspends flight operations: news websites
Description: Turkish airline Atlasglobal has decided to suspend all its operations and told its personnel not to come to work on Thursday, the aviation sector news website AirportHaber and other media reported.

Headlines: Elevator sale in focus in competitive process: Thyssenkrupp CFO
Description: A sale of Thyssenkrupp's  elevator division is currently in focus, the group's finance chief said on Thursday, adding an ongoing auction was "very competitive".

Headlines: Factbox: Nestle CEO Schneider's top deals
Description: Nestle Chief Executive Mark Schneider has made great strides in positioning the world's largest food company for the future with his aggressive deal-making since taking over in January 2017.

Headlines: Akzo Nobel targets rival-beating growth
Description: Dutch paints and coatings maker Akzo Nobel  aims to outpace its competitors' revenue growth in the coming years while lifting profitability, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Japan's Asahi says Korean boycott cost it 3 billion yen last year
Description: Japanese beer and beverage maker Asahi Group Holdings  said a South Korean consumer boycott of Japanese goods cost it around 3 billion yen ($27.32 million) last year.

Headlines: Credit Suisse director Alexander Gut not to stand for re-election
Description: Credit Suisse supervisory board member Alexander Gut will not stand for re-election at the group's annual general meeting on April 30, the bank said alongside its annual results on Thursday.

Headlines: Airbus negotiating to win large preliminary order for A220 jets
Description: Airbus is negotiating a preliminary order for up to 100 A220 jets as it prepares to buy out Bombardier's  minority stake in the Canadian-designed jet, industry sources said.

Headlines: Mad cow fright keeps EU cautious on food rules
Description: The specter of the 1990s BSE crisis means the European Union is likely to reject U.S. demands it ease strict food safety rules, even with President Donald Trump threatening car tariffs if EU countries do not start importing more U.S. farm products.

Headlines: Hong Kong banks compare pandemic stress test with epidemic reality
Description: Last October, nearly four dozen banks in Hong Kong confronted a nightmare "stress test" scenario: a pandemic that swept through the city, followed by a major cyberattack and a telecoms breakdown.

Headlines: Wells Fargo ends forced arbitration for sexual harassment claims
Description: Wells Fargo & Co on Wednesday ended its forced arbitration policy for employee sexual harassment claims, opening the lender to potential lawsuits in the future.

Headlines: Australia court approves $10 billion Vodafone-TPG merger, overrules regulator
Description: An Australian court approved a A$15 billion ($10.1 billion) merger between a unit of Britain's Vodafone Group  and internet provider TPG Telecom  on Thursday, overruling a regulator and enabling a huge rival to the country's top telcos.

Headlines: Factbox: Vodafone-TPG merger advances in Australia after hiccups
Description: An Australian court on Thursday backed the A$15 billion ($10.1 billion) merger between TPG Telecom  and Vodafone's Australian joint venture   despite opposition from the country's competition regulator.

Headlines: Interest in private jets surges as coronavirus keeps airlines away from China
Description: A drop in airline flights from China and Hong Kong due to the coronavirus is increasing demand for private jets as wealthy passengers try to get out, executives say, but travel bans and nervous crew have kept that from translating to more business.

Headlines: Tesla seeks approval to build longer range Model 3s in China
Description: Tesla Inc is seeking approval from Chinese regulators to offer a new China-made Model 3 variant, a government document shows.

Headlines: Bezos buys Warner Estate in Beverly Hills for record $165 million
Description: Amazon Chief Executive Jeff Bezos, the world's wealthiest person, has purchased a Beverly Hills mansion known as the Warner Estate from media mogul David Geffen for $165 million, a source familiar with the deal said on Wednesday.

Headlines: SoftBank profit wiped out by Vision Fund losses, second fund scaled back
Description: Quarterly profit at SoftBank Group Corp  was almost wiped out as the Japanese technology giant was hit for a second straight quarter by losses at its $100 billion Vision Fund.

Headlines: Raytheon discloses SEC subpoena related to payments by Thales JV in Middle East
Description: Raytheon has received a subpoena from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission related to an investigation into the possibility of improper payments made for contracts in certain Middle East countries since 2014, the U.S. weapons maker disclosed in a filing https://www.sec.gov/ix?doc=/Archives/edgar/data/1047122/000104712220000009/rtn-12312019x10k.htm on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. lawmaker calls for ouster of CalPERS CIO over China ties: letter
Description: A U.S. Republican lawmaker on Wednesday urged California to fire the chief investment officer of its public pension fund, the nation's largest, citing what he called the CIO's "long and cozy" relationship with Beijing, and assailed the fund's investments in Chinese companies.

Headlines: Juul bought ad space on kids' websites, including Cartoon Network: lawsuit
Description: E-cigarette maker Juul Labs Inc bought online advertisements on teen-focused websites for Nickelodeon, Cartoon Network and Seventeen magazine after it launched its product in 2015, according to a lawsuit filed on Wednesday by the Massachusetts attorney general's office.

Headlines: Despite $1 trillion deficits, Trump tax cuts will still 'pay for themselves': Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin insisted on Wednesday that President Donald Trump's tax cuts will still pay for themselves over 10 years, even as the administration forecasts near-term deficits close to $1 trillion.

Headlines: Pentagon expected to back additional Huawei restrictions: source
Description: The Pentagon is likely to back new U.S. restrictions on Huawei Technologies, reversing earlier opposition to a proposal meant to further crack down on exports to the blacklisted Chinese company, a person briefed on the matter told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Thyssenkrupp-Kone elevator merger would trigger legal war - Schindler
Description: Swiss elevator maker Schindler  would embark on an all-out antitrust offensive in the courts to stall any deal to combine Thyssenkrupp's  lift division with rival Kone , board member Alfred Schindler told Reuters.

Headlines: MGM Resorts CEO Jim Murren to step down before contract ends
Description: MGM Resorts International's  Chief Executive Officer Jim Murren will step down before completing his contract, the U.S. casino operator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: MGM Resorts withdraws 2020 financial targets on coronavirus hit
Description: MGM Resorts International  withdrew its forecast for 2020 on Wednesday, as it assesses the fallout of the coronavirus epidemic on its business.

Headlines: Fed Chair Powell: 'no reason' rising wages, job gains can't continue
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Wednesday reiterated his confidence in the U.S. economic outlook, even as he said he expected some drag "soon" from China's new coronavirus epidemic and called out the threat from income inequality and an expanding federal debt.

Headlines: Stocks gain as China says fewer new coronavirus cases
Description: Global equity markets scaled fresh highs on Wednesday after China reported the lowest number of new coronavirus cases in two weeks, boosting hopes the epidemic will be contained and driving up the price of commodities sensitive to Chinese demand.

Headlines: Oil rises over 3% as demand worries ease amid fewer new coronavirus cases
Description: Oil prices rose over 3% on Wednesday as China reported its lowest daily number of new coronavirus cases since late January, stoking investor hopes that fuel demand in the world's second-largest oil consumer may begin to recover.

Headlines: Nestle bets on shark tank, startups and students to boost innovation
Description: Food giant Nestle  has set up new structures to turn innovative ideas from outside and inside the company into new products, its technology head told journalists on Wednesday ahead of the publication of the group's full-year results.

Headlines: U.S. judge drops some charges against Theranos's Holmes, leaves wire fraud
Description: A federal judge late on Tuesday dismissed some charges against Theranos Inc founder Elizabeth Holmes, but let stand wire fraud charges accusing her and an associate of misleading patients about the abilities of her company's blood tests.

Headlines: Insurance comparison firm SelectQuote taps banks for IPO: sources
Description: SelectQuote has hired investment banks for an initial public offering (IPO) that could value the owner of the eponymous insurance policy comparison website at more than $2 billion, including debt, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Alstom board to discuss buying Bombardier rail unit: sources
Description: Alstom's  board will meet late on Wednesday to discuss buying Bombardier's  rail unit, sources familiar with the matter said, and a media report said the French train maker had valued the business at just under $7 billion.

Headlines: Boeing unlikely to hit pre-grounding output targets for 737 MAX before 2022
Description: Boeing Co  is unlikely, for several years, to hit the monthly 57-unit production rate it had targeted for the 737 MAX preceding the grounding of the jet due to delays in regulatory approval, Chief Financial Officer Greg Smith said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Softbank's Vision Fund 2 stalls as key backers opt out
Description: Big investors who are critical to SoftBank Group's plans for a second massive technology investment fund are refusing to take part unless the first $100 billion Vision Fund can turn around its performance, sources familiar with the talks told Reuters.

Headlines: SoftBank executive flags some 50 'winners' in $100 billion Vision Fund
Description: SoftBank Vision Fund has around 50 winners in its $100 billion portfolio and a dozen or more companies could pursue listings over the next 18 months, Rajeev Misra, chief executive of SoftBank Investment Advisers, said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Mexico's America Movil to focus on bringing 5G to Latin America
Description: America Movil, Mexico's largest telecommunications provider, shed light on its plans to roll out 5G technology in Latin America on Wednesday as the company's shares surged on a strong earnings report.

Headlines: Fed's Powell reinforces regulation and defends repo support in letter to Congress
Description: U.S. central bank officials are considering options that would make it easier for banks to treat Treasury holdings similar to reserves when meeting liquidity requirements, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said this week in a letter to a top Senate Democrat.

Headlines: Bed Bath & Beyond's gloomy sales indicate tough turnaround ahead
Description: Shares of Bed Bath & Beyond Inc  were on pace for their worst day ever on Wednesday, as disappointing sales numbers  raised concerns on Wall Street that the retailer's turnaround would take longer and be much tougher than anticipated.

Headlines: BP boss Looney sets out to 'reinvent' oil giant with zero carbon goal
Description: BP set one of the oil sector's most ambitious targets for curbing carbon emissions on Wednesday as new chief executive Bernard Looney began the biggest revamp in its 111-year history.

Headlines: Shopify hits record high on better-than-expected 2020 sales forecast
Description: Canadian e-commerce company Shopify Inc's     full-year revenue forecast above analysts' estimates and  better-than-expected quarterly earnings on higher holiday sales, pushed its shares to a record high on Wednesday.

Headlines: Boeing sees airline profits hit, stagnant freight due to virus
Description: Airlines are facing a fall in profits as the coronavirus crisis hits passenger demand and prolongs weakness in economically sensitive air freight, planemaker Boeing  warned on Wednesday.

Headlines: New coronavirus: what markets should watch now
Description: World markets started shrugging off the worst of the coronavirus impact last week and stock markets have since reached record highs. China's announcement that new cases of the so-called COVID-19 detected on Tuesday were at their lowest since Jan 30 has only consolidated those gains.

Headlines: A stock and a hard place: SoftBank's $150 billion Alibaba warchest in spotlight
Description: SoftBank  CEO Masayoshi Son threw cold water on Wednesday on the idea of cutting his firm's $150 billion stake in e-commerce giant Alibaba , after prominent activist investor Elliott Management called for big buybacks.

Headlines: Shareholder activists test JPMorgan's Dimon on climate proposals
Description: Shareholder activists focused on climate issues vowed to press proxy battles with JPMorgan Chase & Co  after getting a cold reception from the top Wall Street bank, even though Chief Executive Jamie Dimon has vowed to protect the environment.

Headlines: Spanish health authorities say no reason to cancel Mobile World Congress
Description: Spanish health officials said on Wednesday there was no reason to cancel the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona over coronavirus fears, despite major companies pulling out of the event.

Headlines: Airbus unveils 'blended wing body' plane design after secret flight tests
Description: Airbus  on Tuesday unveiled a curvaceous aircraft design that blends wing and body, designed to slash carbon emissions by some 20%.

Headlines: Airbus confident can sell more than 1,000 A321XLRs over 10 years
Description: Airbus SE  is confident of selling more than 1,000 A321XLR aircraft, a longer-range version of the single-aisle A321neo jetliner, over the next 10 years, a senior executive at the manufacturer said on Tuesday.

Headlines: BASF picks German state of Brandenburg as battery materials production site
Description: Chemicals giant BASF  on Wednesday picked a site in the eastern German state of Brandenburg for its second European battery materials factory, part of a 400 million euro investment plan to tap into the growing electric vehicle market.

Headlines: Gucci owner Kering halts spending in China on virus fears
Description: Gucci-owner Kering has temporarily shut half of its stores in China, and shelved new openings and advertising campaigns there,  as the coronavirus outbreak throws luxury brands into turmoil.

Headlines: Nissan sues Ghosn for damages, risks plunging to loss
Description: Nissan Motor Co  could be heading for its first quarterly loss in more than a decade, three company sources said on Wednesday, as news emerged the Japanese carmaker is seeking $91 million in damages from ousted former boss Carlos Ghosn.

Headlines: Telecoms group Orange to also pull out from Mobile World Congress: source
Description: French telecoms group Orange  has also decided to pull out of the Mobile World Congress telecoms event in Barcelona due to concerns over the coronavirus, said a source close to the matter on Wednesday.

Headlines: Britain's BT pulls out of Mobile World Congress
Description: Britain's biggest telecoms group BT  said on Wednesday it was pulling out of the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona because of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Telecoms lobby to discuss Barcelona congress on Wednesday: source
Description: Telecoms industry lobby GSMA will hold a virtual board meeting on Wednesday to discuss a major conference later this month which is looking increasingly threatened by fears of coronavirus, a person with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Vodafone joins Mobile World Congress exodus
Description: Vodafone , the world's second largest mobile operator, said it was pulling out of Barcelona's Mobile World Congress because of the coronavirus outbreak, joining an exodus of major European players on Wednesday.

Headlines: We're monitoring coronavirus, say organizers of Barcelona telecoms meet
Description: The organizers of the Mobile World Congress (MWC) said on Wednesday they were monitoring "the fast-changing" development of the coronavirus, in a statement issued after sources said the event in Barcelona was likely to be called off.

Headlines: PVH closes most Calvin Klein, Tommy Hilfiger China stores on virus outbreak
Description: PVH Corp  said on Wednesday it had temporarily closed majority of its Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger stores in China due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Google says EU antitrust regulators holding back innovation
Description: Google defended its business model on Wednesday, saying that making innovative products was at its core rather than helping rivals, as it sought to overturn a 2.4-billion-euro ($2.6 billion) EU antitrust fine at Europe's second-highest court.

Headlines: Can a 'numbers guy' with insurance DNA finally fix AIG?
Description: Peter Zaffino sat at 2 World Trade Center poring over financial reports on the morning of Sept. 11, 2001, when the first plane struck a neighboring building. Zaffino, known by colleagues for his laser-like focus, remained at his desk as staff began fleeing.

Headlines: Kering frustrated with slow progress in cosmetics development
Description: Gucci-owner Kering's  chairman Francois-Henri Pinault said on Wednesday the company was frustrated with the slow pace of progress in cosmetics development with license holder Coty .

Headlines: Airbus Helicopters signs order from Royal Thai Air Force
Description: Airbus said on Wednesday its Airbus Helicopters unit had signed an order for six H135 military training helicopters from the Royal Thai Air Force.

Headlines: Souring energy loans wipe out ABN Amro's profit growth
Description: Souring energy loans eroded ABN Amro's  fourth quarter profit growth, it said on Wednesday, prompting the Dutch bank to launch another review of its trade and commodity finance operations.

Headlines: Coronavirus brings jet refinancing boost: Avolon CEO
Description: Major aircraft lessor Avolon and its peers stand to benefit from the coronavirus outbreak as airlines shore up cash by refinancing their planes, the Dublin-based firm said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. stores, online sales boost Ahold's quarterly profit
Description: Food retailer Ahold Delhaize  met forecasts with a 3% rise in fourth-quarter core earnings on Wednesday helped by its Food Lion and Hannaford U.S. grocery chains and strong online sales.

Headlines: Heineken sees more profit growth in final year for long-serving CEO
Description: Heineken , the world's second largest brewer, forecast lower barley and aluminum costs would help to boost profits this year, when its long-serving chief executive will step down.

Headlines: Nissan may report first quarterly loss since March 2009: sources
Description: Nissan Motor Co  may report its first quarterly loss in more than a decade on Thursday because of slumping sales, sources familiar with the company said, adding more pressure on efforts to rebuild the company after Carlos Ghosn's ouster.

Headlines: JPMorgan appoints new heads of Australia and NZ investment banking
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  appointed Jabe Jerram and Simon Ranson as co-heads of investment banking (IB) for Australia and New Zealand, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters and confirmed by a spokesman in Sydney.

Headlines: Sainsbury's Bank chairman Davis to step down
Description: British supermarket group Sainsbury's  said on Wednesday that Roger Davis, chairman of its poorly performing banking division, will step down.

Headlines: JPMorgan picked as adviser for sale of stake in $7.3 billion Turkish motorway: sources
Description: JPMorgan  has been picked as an adviser for the sale of a stake in a $7.3 billion motorway in Turkey, four sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: 'Everyone is guessing' about coronavirus economic impacts, say experts
Description: The coronavirus that spread from a seafood market in Wuhan, China to infect tens of thousands has shuttered businesses, grounded flights and killed over 1,000 people so far, mostly in China.

Headlines: Clariant's leadership reshuffle continues as CFO jumps ship to Maersk
Description: Clariant  Chief Financial Officer Patrick Jany is exiting for a post at Maersk , the world's biggest shipping company, marking the latest management change at the Swiss speciality chemicals maker after its CEO jumped ship last year.

Headlines: Rolls-Royce 'open-minded' on new Boeing mid-market jet study: executive
Description: Rolls-Royce  is "open-minded" on whether it will join Boeing  in a fresh attempt at addressing the mid=size jet market after pulling out of an earlier effort over timing, a top company official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Lyft forecasts slower growth in 2020, leaves target profit date unchanged
Description: Lyft Inc  on Tuesday forecast slower revenue growth in the new year and the company refused to match larger rival Uber, which recently moved up a key profit target by a year, sticking to its later date of projected profitability.

Headlines: China's GDP goal on track despite virus impact: government economist
Description: China will be able to achieve its long-term goal of doubling gross domestic product and incomes this year despite the impact from a conoravirus outbreak, an influential economist at a top government think tank said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Samsung unveils compact foldable phone, 5G Galaxy S20 to fend off Apple, Huawei
Description: Samsung Electronics  on Tuesday unveiled a foldable smartphone shaped like a large makeup compact and put 5G mobile network capabilities into all of its other flagship devices as it strives to retain the mantle of biggest global phone company.

Headlines: SoftBank stock surges to seven-month high after judge OKs Sprint-T-Mobile merger
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  stock surged to its highest price in over half a year in Tokyo on Wednesday, after a U.S. federal judge rejected an antitrust challenge to the proposed takeover of subsidiary Sprint Corp  by T-Mobile US Inc .

Headlines: FAA agrees it must boost safety oversight for Southwest Airlines
Description: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration says it should have done a better job of ensuring Southwest Airlines Co  had certified completion of maintenance on 88 used Boeing 737 jets, as noted in a report by the U.S. Transportation Department's Inspector General released on Tuesday.

Headlines: Bankers in Asia brace for a virus-related deal drought
Description: Bankers in Asia are bracing for a deal drought as efforts to limit the spread of the coronavirus epidemic have put key meetings and roadshows on hold.

Headlines: FTC demands data on small buys by Google, Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Microsoft
Description: Concerned that big tech companies are unfairly engaging in potential anti-competitive behavior, the Federal Trade Commission said on Tuesday it ordered Alphabet Inc's  Google unit, Amazon.com Inc , Apple Inc , Facebook Inc  and Microsoft Corp  to provide information on mergers that were too small to report to antitrust regulators.

Headlines: S&P 500, Nasdaq eke out new closing highs
Description: S&P 500 and the Nasdaq inched to their second consecutive record closing highs on Tuesday as Chinese officials said the deadly coronavirus epidemic could be contained by April.

Headlines: Wells Fargo CEO Scharf shakes up management at scandal-hit bank
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  Chief Executive Charles Scharf on Tuesday announced his first major reshuffle since taking over in October, naming several executives to new roles while also tapping a JPMorgan veteran to head consumer lending.

Headlines: Oil prices rise about 1%, up from 13-month low as virus cases slow
Description: Oil prices rose about 1% on Tuesday, up from 13-month lows as the number of new coronavirus cases slowed in China, easing some concern over the potential for lengthy oil demand destruction.

Headlines: Exclusive: Germany's Volkswagen and Daimler push for more 'sustainable' Chile lithium
Description: German automakers Volkswagen  and Daimler  have launched a study to push for more "sustainable" lithium mining in Chile, according to lobbyist filings reviewed by Reuters, a sign of growing supply chain concerns ahead of an expected electric vehicle boom.

Headlines: Fed's Powell says economy in good place, warns on coronavirus
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell told Congress on Tuesday that the U.S. economy is in a good place, even as he cited the potential threat from the coronavirus in China and concerns about the economy's long-term health.

Headlines: Stocks surge to record highs on hopes virus is peaking, gold ebbs
Description: Major U.S. and European stock indexes surged to fresh records on Tuesday after China's senior medical adviser suggested the deadly coronavirus may be over by April, an outlook that also helped crude prices gain on hopes of renewed Chinese demand.

Headlines: Hyundai signs development deal with another electric vehicle startup
Description: Korean automaker Hyundai Motor Co broadened its future transportation portfolio with an agreement to jointly develop electric vehicles with California startup Canoo, the companies said on Tuesday.

Headlines: NY attorney general considers appealing ruling OK'ing Sprint T-Mobile merger
Description: New York Attorney General Letitia James said Tuesday the state may appeal a court ruling approving a merger between No.3 and No.4 wireless carriers T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp.

Headlines: Exclusive: JPMorgan in talks to merge blockchain unit Quorum with startup ConsenSys - sources
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co is in talks to merge its marquee blockchain unit Quorum with Brooklyn-based startup ConsenSys, according to people familiar with the plans.

Headlines: China c.bank gives green light to Mastercard's China JV for clearing business
Description: China's central bank said on Tuesday it has approved an application by Mastercard's China joint venture to conduct bank card clearing operations in the country.

Headlines: Airbnb swings to a loss as costs climb: WSJ
Description: Home rentals giant Airbnb Inc swung to a loss for the first nine months of last year as costs climbed sharply, The Wall Street Journal reported https://www.wsj.com/articles/airbnb-swings-to-a-loss-as-costs-climb-ahead-of-ipo-11581443123?mod=searchresults&page=1&pos=1 on Tuesday, citing people close to the company.

Headlines: PayPal funds academic research on illegal firearms transactions
Description: PayPal Holdings Inc  is teaming up with criminologists and experts at several universities to probe the payment systems used in the trafficking of illegal firearms in the United States, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Merkel's conservatives stop short of Huawei 5G ban in Germany
Description: Lawmakers from German Chancellor Angela Merkel's ruling conservatives have backed a position paper on 5G mobile networks that recommends tougher rules on foreign vendors while stopping short of banning China's Huawei [HWT.UL], sources said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Argentina's Aerolineas to add new flights to New York and Madrid - chairman
Description: Aerolineas Argentinas will add new flights to New York and Madrid as the government-controlled carrier seeks to ramp up sales outside its home country and boost income in an effort to beat back persistent operating losses.

Headlines: Tesla driver in fatal crash had reported problems before with 'Autopilot' feature
Description: A Tesla driver killed in a March 2018 crash in California while using the Autopilot driver-assistance system had reported that on prior trips, the car had steered away from the highway, the National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) disclosed in documents made public Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump lashes out at Fed while Powell testifies before U.S. House committee
Description: President Donald Trump reiterated his criticism that the Federal Reserve has kept interest rates too high and seemed to say the U.S. central bank's chair, Jerome Powell, had hurt stock prices during his testimony to Congress on Tuesday.

Headlines: German conservative lawmakers back compromise on 5G: sources
Description: Lawmakers from German Chancellor Angela Merkel's ruling conservatives have backed a position paper on 5G mobile networks that recommends tougher rules on foreign vendors while stopping short of banning China's Huawei, sources said.

Headlines: Boeing scores no January orders for first time since 1962
Description: Boeing Co  booked no new orders for airplanes last month, the first time it has come up empty-handed in January since 1962, as the U.S. planemaker's once best-selling jet, the 737 MAX, remained grounded following two fatal crashes.

Headlines: WeWork sets hard free cash flow, revenue targets as part of five-year plan
Description: WeWork on Tuesday brought forward its target of becoming free cash flow positive by a year to 2022 as Chairman Marcelo Claure pushes ahead with his five-year turnaround plan aimed at boosting valuation and winning back investor trust.

Headlines: Finland's Supercell reports sales up 2% while core earnings slip
Description: Finland's biggest game maker Supercell reported on Tuesday its full-year 2019 sales rose 2% to 1.39 billion euros ($1.52 billion) although core earnings slipped 4%.

Headlines: Japan's MUFG, Mizuho in London rehiring spree despite Brexit
Description: Japan's MUFG  and Mizuho  have hired a total of nearly 100 staff in London in the last 6 months, bolstering their trading and investment banking teams despite industry concerns over Brexit's impact on financial services in Britain.

Headlines: Under Armour shares drop after surprise profit decline warning for 2020
Description: Under Armour Inc   on Tuesday forecast a surprise drop in 2020 profit, blaming ongoing weakness in its North American business and the coronavirus outbreak in China, sending its shares tumbling as much as 16%.

Headlines: Daimler's Mercedes sales drive higher but charges put brakes on profit
Description: Daimler  reported its biggest drop in annual profit in a decade on Tuesday, a 64% drop reflecting more than 5 billion euros in charges as well as investment as Mercedes-Benz pushes into electric and hybrid vehicles.

Headlines: Daimler CEO says meeting CO2 targets in 2020, 2021 a challenge
Description: Daimler  will not sacrifice the profitability of next generation electric cars Chief Executive Ola Kaellenius said on Tuesday, as the carmaker struggles to meet more stringent European Union anti-pollution rules.

Headlines: IKEA new CEO targets 'even more affordable' furniture as habits shift
Description: IKEA named insider Jon Abrahamsson Ring to succeed Torbjorn Loof as chief executive of the world's biggest furniture brand on Tuesday as it adapts to seismic shifts in shopping.

Headlines: U.S. federal judge allows merger between T-Mobile and Sprint
Description: T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp won a federal court fight as a judge ruled on Tuesday that their $26 billion merger was legal and should be allowed.

Headlines: U.S. companies cut back on installing robots in 2019
Description: U.S. companies installed fewer robots in 2019 than they did the year before, the first cut back since 2015, as a downturn in manufacturing fueled by trade wars and weaker demand dampened appetite for the machines.

Headlines: U.S. downgrade could stoke bias against Malaysian airlines: regulator
Description: Malaysia's aviation regulator said on Tuesday its airlines could be discriminated against by foreign authorities after the country's air safety rating was downgraded by the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) late last year.

Headlines: Mercedes has re-started China production, still assessing virus impact
Description: Mercedes-Benz has re-started production of luxury passenger cars in Beijing this week, Ola Kaellenius, Chief Executive of parent company Daimler , said on Tuesday.

Headlines: M&S names Greencore's Eoin Tonge as new finance chief
Description: Marks & Spencer  on Tuesday appointed Eoin Tonge, currently the chief financial officer of Irish food group Greencore , as its new finance chief, filling a void left by the departure of Humphrey Singer at the end of last year.

Headlines: Sleeping giant awakens? Downside risks for euro grow
Description: A drop in the euro/dollar exchange rate to a four-month low raises the prospect of a repricing of one of the world’s most important macro-economic metrics and a potential re-rating of the U.S. currency across the globe.

Headlines: Barren streets but bustling stock markets in virus-stricken China
Description: Shops, restaurants and cinemas may be deserted in many parts of virus-plagued China, but online trading forums, internet roadshows and analyst calls are teeming with investors who have driven up stock trading volumes to nine-month highs.

Headlines: Small Hong Kong businesses count the cost of coronavirus
Description: As the spread of coronavirus sends jitters across Hong Kong, usually bustling shopping malls, restaurants and retailers are deserted, leaving some small business owners contemplating their future in the global financial hub.

Headlines: JD Sports may have to sell Footasylum if it doesn't address competition concerns: watchdog
Description: UK sportswear retailer JD Sports  may have to sell Footasylum if it does not address competition concerns about last year's acquisition of its smaller rival, Britain's competition watchdog said on Tuesday after an in-depth review of the takeover.

Headlines: Geely to deepen ties with Volvo, plans to list under one umbrella
Description: Geely Automobile  and its sister company Volvo Cars are planning to merge and list in Hong Kong and possibly Stockholm, giving Volvo access to public markets after it dropped a move to list its stock two years ago.

Headlines: KKR rules out offer for NMC, Italian-backed group confirms interest
Description: Private equity firm KKR  on Tuesday said it does not intend to make an offer for troubled NMC Health  but  Italian-backed GKSD Investment Holding confirmed it could bid.

Headlines: Exclusive: Deutsche Bank taps U.S. tech companies for makeover - sources
Description: Deutsche Bank has invited bids from Microsoft, Google and Amazon to overhaul the German bank's outdated and fragmented technology networks, people with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: FAA says approaching 737 MAX test flight, awaits Boeing proposals
Description: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration is narrowing the issues needed before it can conduct a certification test flight on the grounded Boeing  737 MAX, but will not commit to a timetable for lifting a flight ban, its top official said.

Headlines: TUI says exceptional holiday bookings helps to offset 737 MAX woes
Description: European travel company TUI   said an exceptional number of holiday bookings would help offset the impact of the Boeing 737 MAX grounding on its annual profit, enabling it to lift the bottom end of annual earnings guidance.

Headlines: Lloyd's of London sets up independent group to improve culture
Description: Lloyd's of London said on Tuesday that former Virgin Money boss Jayne-Anne Gadhia would be part of a committee to "drive long-term culture change" in the world's oldest insurance market.

Headlines: Metro CEO expects less than 30 Real stores to be closed - letter
Description: German wholesaler Metro  on Tuesday said it expects the future owners of its struggling Real hypermarkets unit to close less than 30 of the division's stores, according to a staff letter by Metro CEO Olaf Koch that was seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Michelin shares fall after tire maker sees lower 2020 operating income
Description: Shares in French tire maker Michelin  fell on Tuesday after the company forecast a slightly lower operating income for 2020 and flagged uncertainty to its business from the coronavirus crisis in China.

Headlines: Virus fears, China diplomacy loom over Singapore Airshow
Description: Singapore kicked off Asia's largest aerospace event under heightened scrutiny on Tuesday as thousands of visitors shunned the Singapore Airshow over coronavirus fears, while all eyes were on a sensitive fly-off between U.S. and Chinese fighters.

Headlines: China firms cut staff on virus outbreak as Xi vows no large-scale layoffs
Description: A Chinese media company said it will lay off 500 employees due to the coronavirus outbreak, the latest among a string of firms to do so in the past two weeks as the epidemic takes a toll on small-to-medium sized businesses.

Headlines: Delivery Hero expects Europe to remain break-even in 2020
Description: Delivery Hero  expects its Europe business to remain break-even during 2020 after hitting this mark, as forecast, in the fourth-quarter of 2019, the German food delivery group said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China's first-quarter smartphone sales may halve due to coronavirus: analysts
Description: China's smartphone sales may plunge by as much as 50% in the first quarter, as many retail shops have closed for an extended period and production has yet to fully resume due to the fast spread of a new coronavirus, according to research reports.

Headlines: Coronavirus prompts Sony, NTT and Intel to join Barcelona congress exodus
Description: Japanese wireless carrier NTT Docomo , Sony Corp  and California-based chip giant Intel Corp  pulled out of the Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona on Monday because of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Australia investigator in Citi cartel case learned of concerns from rival agency
Description: An Australian investigator who helped bring criminal cartel charges against Citigroup Inc  and Deutsche Bank AG  said he first heard concerns about a stock issue they worked on from a rival regulator, but the agencies acted independently.

Headlines: Lessor BBAM orders three 737-800 converted freighters from Boeing
Description: Boeing Co  said on Tuesday that lessor BBAM had ordered three 737-800 converted freighters to serve the growing e-commerce market and express sectors of the air cargo market.

Headlines: Judge denies Uber's, Postmates' request to halt California gig worker law
Description: A U.S. judge on Monday rejected a request by Uber Technologies Inc and courier services provider Postmates Inc to block a California labor law from taking effect, saying the bill's public benefits outweighed the companies' concerns.

Headlines: Trump's $4.8 trillion budget gets chilly reception from Congress
Description: President Donald Trump's $4.8 trillion budget plan for the coming fiscal year drew a prompt rejection on Monday from congressional Democrats, who said it betrayed his promise to protect popular health and safety-net programs.

Headlines: Trump budget proposes $150 million for creation of uranium reserve
Description: President Donald Trump's 2021 budget proposed $150 million for the creation of a U.S. uranium reserve as the administration seeks to help struggling producers of the fuel for nuclear power reactors.

Headlines: Climate activists invade BlackRock office in Paris
Description: Dozens of climate activists invaded U.S. asset manager BlackRock's office in central Paris on Monday, calling for the fund to pull out of fossil fuel investments.

Headlines: U.S. appeals court denies Apple bid for rehearing in VirnetX patent case
Description: A U.S. appeals court on Monday denied a request by Apple Inc  that it reconsider a decision upholding a finding Apple iPhones infringed VirnetX Holding Corp patents relating to secure communications technology.

Headlines: Amazon challenges India antitrust probe in court: filing
Description: Amazon.com Inc has begun legal action in India to quash an antitrust investigation against the company, saying it could cause "irreparable" loss and damage to its reputation, according to its court filing seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Pratt & Whitney says Korean Air orders its engines for up to 50 A321neos
Description: Korean Air Lines Co Ltd  has ordered Pratt & Whitney engines to power up to 50 Airbus SE  A321neo jets for delivery from 2021, the enginemaker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Hundreds of Chinese businesses seek billions in loans to contend with coronavirus - sources
Description: More than 300 Chinese companies are seeking bank loans totaling at least 57.4 billion yuan ($8.2 billion) to help to soften the impact of the coronavirus outbreak, two banking sources said.

Headlines: How Brazil's JBS became collateral damage in war between billionaires
Description: A business dispute between the disgraced billionaire Batista brothers in Brazil and the heir to an Indonesian pulp and paper fortune is throwing a wrench in meatpacker JBS SA’s plans to list its international operations in the United States.

Headlines: Hudson's Bay Co seeks to bolster Saks off-price stores with staff move
Description: Saks Fifth Avenue owner Hudson's Bay Co  on Monday named a president to lead its off-price business, known as Saks Off 5th, the latest example of a department store chain trying to bolster its outlet stores.

Headlines: S&P 500, Nasdaq reach record closing highs; Chinese workers return
Description: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq closed at record highs on Monday as Chinese workers and factories slowly returned to business following a Lunar New Year holiday that was protracted by the deadly coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Trump's budget proposes sale from emergency oil reserve
Description: President Donald Trump's 2021 budget released on Monday proposed a sale of 15 million barrels of oil from the emergency petroleum reserve to help pay for projects overseen by the Department of Energy.

Headlines: U.S. Transportation Dept. IG to audit FAA pilot training requirements after Boeing 737 MAX crashes
Description: The U.S. Transportation Department's Office of Inspector General said on Monday it will audit Federal Aviation Administration pilot training requirements for U.S. and foreign air carriers after two deadly crashes of Boeing's  737 MAX.

Headlines: Caterpillar says most of its Chinese facilities reopened on February 10
Description: Caterpillar  reopened most of its facilities in China on Monday after getting the go-ahead from the local government following the coronavirus outbreak, the company said.

Headlines: White House calls for biggest NASA budget in decades to reach the moon, Mars
Description: The White House on Monday asked Congress for $25.2 billion for NASA in 2021, the agency's biggest budget in decades, calling for steady increases over five years to meet President Donald Trump's goal of landing astronauts on the moon and Mars.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico unit posts 2.7% rise in January same-store sales
Description: Walmart de Mexico, the country's biggest retailer, said on Monday that sales at stores in Mexico open for more than a year rose 2.7% in January, compared with the same month last year.

Headlines: Safe-havens rise on coronavirus concerns, stocks rebound
Description: Gold rose and the dollar hit a four-month high against the euro on Monday on safe-haven appeal as the death toll from the coronavirus outbreak passed that of the SARS epidemic two decades ago, but Wall Street rallied to record highs.

Headlines: Brookfield a potential suitor for Trans Mountain, analyst says
Description: Brookfield Infrastructure Partners LP could be a potential buyer of the Canadian government-owned Trans Mountain oil pipeline, a Stifel FirstEnergy analyst said, as the project expansion struggles with increasing costs arising from regulatory delays.

Headlines: Oil drops to 13-month low on weak Chinese demand, traders eye OPEC+ cuts
Description: Oil prices fell to their lowest level since December 2018 on Monday on weaker Chinese demand in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak and as traders waited to see if Russia would join other producers in seeking further output cuts.

Headlines: Ghosn used Nissan-Mitsubishi venture to inflate pay: lawyers
Description: Carlos Ghosn, the fugitive former auto executive, used a joint venture between Nissan and Mitsubishi to inflate his pay, effectively clawing back a cut to his declared wages, and to cover a personal tax debt, lawyers for the companies said on Monday.

Headlines: Austria's AMS aims for domination agreement with Osram
Description: Austrian sensor specialist AMS   made clear on Monday that it aims to secure a so-called domination agreement with Osram  to allow it to use the lighting group's cash flow to pay back debt.

Headlines: New Renault CEO de Meo will be much better paid than predecessor
Description: French carmaker Renault  will grant its new chief executive, Luca de Meo, a pay package of around 5.8 million euros ($6.33 million), which is an increase of nearly 57 percent of what his predecessor was awarded last year.

Headlines: Exclusive: Top lithium miner seeks to monitor water scarcity in parched Chile salt flat
Description: With residents and courts ringing the alarm about depleted water supplies in Chile's Atacama salt flat, the world's top lithium miner Albemarle  quietly filed a proposal in December for a network to monitor flows beneath the parched desert floor.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank to issue at least $1 billion in AT1 securities
Description: Deutsche Bank  said on Monday it would issue at least $1 billion in Additional Tier 1 (AT1) securities as the bank manages its regulatory capital requirements.

Headlines: Amazon wants Trump to testify on ‘order to screw Amazon’ in Pentagon deal
Description: Amazon Web Services said on Monday it was seeking to depose President Donald Trump and Defense Secretary Mark Esper in its lawsuit over whether the president was trying "to screw Amazon" when the Pentagon awarded a contract for cloud computing to rival Microsoft Corp.

Headlines: Google plan to buy into largest African wind farm ended by delay
Description: Google's  plans to buy a 12.5% stake in Africa's largest wind farm have been canceled after delays to the project, Danish wind turbine maker Vestas  said on Monday.

Headlines: Apple's main iPhone maker Foxconn to resume some Chinese production: source
Description: Apple's main iPhone maker Foxconn  got the green light on Monday to reopen two major plants in China closed because of the coronavirus and aims to resume production even though only 10% of the workforce has returned so far, a source told Reuters.

Headlines: Nissan to request Ghosn repay compensation received from Dutch venture: source
Description: Nissan  informed a Dutch court on Monday that it would request that former boss Carlos Ghosn repay the compensation he received from its Dutch-based joint venture with Mitsubishi , a source close to the Japanese carmaker said.

Headlines: Exor expects $13 billion for careful acquisitions after PartnerRe sale
Description: Investment group Exor  will have around $13 billion in cash provided it closes a deal to sell its reinsurance unit PartnerRe and it would spend most of that on acquisitions, a source close to the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Xerox sweetens offer for HP
Description: Xerox Holdings Corp raised its offer to buy HP Inc by $2 to $24 per share on Monday, following several rejections of its previous buyout offer by the PC maker.

Headlines: Credit Suisse CEO Thiam toppled by espionage scandal
Description: Tidjane Thiam has quit as Credit Suisse chief executive after a spying scandal that has hit the reputation of one of Europe's largest banks and shocked Switzerland's financial community.

Headlines: Credit Suisse's new CEO Gottstein seeks growth offensive
Description: Credit Suisse's incoming chief executive, Thomas Gottstein, plans to put Switzerland's second-biggest bank on a growth offensive following predecessor Tidjane Thiam's cost-cutting exercise, he told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Investor backing proved poison chalice for Credit Suisse CEO
Description: As the chairman of Credit Suisse prepared for a crunch meeting of directors over the future of its chief executive, the vocal backing of a U.S. investor for Tidjane Thiam had unintended consequences, helping seal the ousted CEO's fate.

Headlines: No phones, no leaks: How Lagarde is making her mark on ECB
Description: Gathered in a German mountain castle last November for an evening retreat that ended with a whiskey-tasting, rebel European Central Bank policymakers and Christine Lagarde, their newly confirmed president, made a pact.

Headlines: Apple iPhone maker Foxconn approved to resume Shenzhen plant production: source
Description: Apple iPhone maker Foxconn  has received Chinese government approval to resume production at a key plant in the southern city of Shenzhen, a source with direct knowledge of the situation told Reuters late on Monday.

Headlines: WeWork temporarily closes 100 buildings in China over coronavirus: CNBC
Description: Office sharing startup WeWork has temporarily closed 100 buildings in China due to the coronavirus outbreak, Chairman Marcelo Claure said in a CNBC interview on Monday.

Headlines: Nissan to halt production at Japan factory due to coronavirus
Description: Nissan Motor Co  will temporarily halt production at its plant in Kyushu, southwestern Japan, due to the coronavirus, the Japanese automaker said on Monday, as the outbreak starts to strain the global supply chain.

Headlines: Exclusive: Ryanair marketing chief Kenny Jacobs to leave company
Description: Ryanair  Chief Marketing Officer Kenny Jacobs, who spearheaded the airline's drive to improve customer service, is to leave his position after six years at the end of April to pursue other challenges, he told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: China rejects Foxconn's request to resume production in key Shenzhen plant: source
Description: Taiwan's Foxconn  was not allowed to resume production in its plant in the southern Chinese city of Shenzhen that had been shut due to the coronavirus outbreak, a person with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: GM to restart production in China from Feb. 15
Description: General Motors said on Monday it would restart production in from Feb. 15 in China, where the country is dealing with a coronavirus epidemic which has killed more than 900 people.

Headlines: Israel's Elbit Systems wins $136 million in contracts in Asia-Pacific
Description: Israeli defense firm Elbit Systems Ltd  said on Monday it won contracts worth $136 million to provide customers in Asia-Pacific with airborne laser direct infrared countermeasure (DIRCM) systems.

Headlines: Britain 'reasonably confident' of U.S. trade deal despite Huawei concerns
Description: Britain takes U.S. concerns about its use of Huawei equipment seriously but is confident a trade deal with the United States will be among its first after leaving the European Union, its foreign secretary said on Monday.

Headlines: Australia cartel investigator says no impropriety in exchanges with JPMorgan lawyers
Description: An Australian antitrust investigator who helped bring criminal cartel charges against Citigroup Inc  and Deutsche Bank AG  denied acting with "impropriety" when presented with communications between the regulator and informants' lawyers.

Headlines: SoftBank set for sharp quarterly profit drop amid pressure from Elliott
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group  is expected to post a slide in profits for the past quarter, deepening concern about its ability to secure funding for a second Vision Fund and giving activist fund Elliott Management more fodder for a shake-up.

Headlines: Boral shares plunge after bushfire profit hit, accounts probe
Description: Australia's Boral Ltd  said on Monday delays to building projects due to bushfires will likely cause a plunge in its second-half results, while revealing an investigation had found inflated earnings at its North American window-making business.

Headlines: Wall Street futures fall as coronavirus toll rises, China plans return to work
Description: U.S. stock futures fell on Sunday after China's death toll from the coronavirus outbreak exceeded the global total from the SARS epidemic and as authorities prepared for millions of people to return to work after an extended Lunar New Year break.

Headlines: China to France: Don't discriminate against Huawei on 5G networks
Description: The Chinese embassy in Paris on Sunday urged the French government not to discriminate against Huawei as it selects suppliers for its 5G mobile network, saying it feared the company would face more constraints than rivals.

Headlines: Mattel will close Canada factory after shuttering two manufacturing sites in Asia: WSJ
Description: Mattel Inc  will close a factory in Canada after shutting down two plants in Asia, as the toymaker reduces its manufacturing footprint to cut costs, the Wall Street Journal said on Sunday.

Headlines: China's Shenzhen denies blocking Apple supplier Foxconn from resuming production
Description: Local Chinese authorities have not blocked Apple  supplier Foxconn  from resuming production amid a coronavirus outbreak, they said in a statement on Sunday, denying an earlier report in the Nikkei Business Daily.

Headlines: U.S. energy secretary hopes Mexico, Canada will help export American coal
Description: U.S. Energy Secretary Dan Brouillette said on Friday that  Canada and Mexico could help export U.S. coal to Asia to get around the blocking of shipments by West Coast states concerned about the impact of the fuel on climate change.

Headlines: Anti-Huawei UK lawmakers conducting 'witch-hunt': Chinese ambassador
Description: Senior members of Prime Minister Boris Johnson's Conservatives who have demanded Chinese telecoms giant Huawei must not have a role in Britain's 5G mobile network are conducting "a kind of witch-hunt", China's ambassador to London said on Sunday.

Headlines: Route cuts intended to make South African Airways sustainable: rescue team
Description: Plans to cut some of South African Airways' (SAA) domestic and international routes are aimed at making the airline sustainable and free from government funding after restructuring, experts  appointed to try to rescue the company said on Sunday.

Headlines: Tesla can get support for German factory: Economy Minister
Description: Tesla could get state subsidies in its plan to set up a gigafactory in Germany, the country's economy minister told a weekly newspaper.

Headlines: Credit Suisse chairman expects to see out term after spy scandal
Description: Credit Suisse Chairman Urs Rohner does not expect to be voted out of office before his term ends after this week's departure of Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam over a spying scandal.

Headlines: Exclusive: South Africa seeks to unlock stalled arms sales to Saudi, UAE
Description: South Africa aims to free up over a billion dollars in stalled weapons sales, including to Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates, by amending a document at the heart of an export row, a senior arms control official told Reuters.

Headlines: Volkswagen says restart of some China plants postponed until February 17
Description: Volkswagen  has postponed restarting production at most China plants in its joint venture with SAIC Motor  and the Tianjin plant in its JV with FAW Group until Feb. 17 amid the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Uber and Lyft take different roads in search of profit
