Description: Uber Technologies Inc  and Lyft Inc , the two leading U.S. ride-hailing companies, are on divergent paths as Uber pours money into money-losing side businesses while smaller rival Lyft focuses on moving people around.

Headlines: Blue collar boom? College grads, baby boomers big winners in Trump's economy
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump rolled out an eye-catching statistic in his State of the Union address Tuesday: the wealth held by the poorest half of American households increased three times as fast as the wealth held by the "1%" since he became president.

Headlines: Shanghai to help Tesla resume production amid coronavirus spread
Description: U.S. electric carmaker Tesla's  factory in China's financial hub of Shanghai will resume production on Feb. 10 with assistance to help it cope with a spreading epidemic of coronavirus, a Shanghai government official said on Saturday.

Headlines: Treasury's Mnuchin sees U.S. GDP growth less than 3% in 2020
Description: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday he expects 2020 U.S. GDP growth to be less than 3%, partly due to problems at Boeing Co , which halted production of its 737 MAX planes over safety issues.

Headlines: White House dismisses idea of U.S. buying Nokia, Ericsson to challenge Huawei
Description: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence on Friday and the top White House economic adviser dismissed an unusual suggestion from U.S. Attorney General William Barr that the United States consider taking control of two major foreign rivals of China-based Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.

Headlines: Bank of America CEO Moynihan's 2019 compensation unchanged at $26.5 million
Description: Bank of America Corp  kept Chief Executive Officer Brian Moynihan's 2019 compensation flat at $26.5 million, according a filing on Friday.

Headlines: Consumer discretionary names could see bumpy ride
Description: A raft of earnings reports from consumer discretionary companies and U.S. retail sales data set for the coming week could help investors determine to what extent the coronavirus is hitting consumer demand.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin drops out of Singapore Airshow over coronavirus concerns
Description: U.S. weapons maker Lockheed Martin Corp said on Friday it will not participate in next week's Singapore Airshow over coronavirus concerns.

Headlines: Airbus likely to acquire Bombardier's remaining stake in A220 passenger jet: sources
Description: Europe's Airbus SE  is likely to acquire Canadian plane and train maker Bombardier Inc's  remaining stake in the A220 passenger jet program, two industry sources said.

Headlines: More pain in store for Canadian marijuana companies after Aurora Cannabis, Tilray cut jobs
Description: Investors are bracing for more job cuts and writedowns at Canadian cannabis producers before the industry stabilizes and becomes profitable, after two of the biggest weed companies, Aurora Cannabis  and Tilray  announced cost reductions this week.

Headlines: Indexes drop from record highs, but tally strong weekly gains
Description: Wall Street fell from record levels on Friday after a four-day rally as investors digested the monthly U.S. jobs report and braced for the next coronavirus developments, but stocks still posted solid gains for the week.

Headlines: Lifeblood of Amazon merchants threatened as coronavirus infects Chinese workers
Description: Amazon.com Inc  sellers are bracing for product shortages as Chinese workers - worried about the fast-spreading coronavirus - may be unable or unwilling to return to idled factories.

Headlines: Mild weather boosts U.S. job growth; jobless rate ticks up
Description: U.S. job growth accelerated in January, with unseasonably mild temperatures boosting hiring in weather-sensitive sectors, indicating the economy will probably continue to grow moderately despite a deepening slump in business investment.

Headlines: Apple to delay reopening of retail stores in China
Description: Apple Inc is extending its retail store closures in China due to the coronavirus outbreak, even as it worked toward opening its corporate offices and contact centers, the iPhone maker said on Friday.

Headlines: Stocks fall on fears China virus to slow growth, gold gains
Description: Global equity markets and government debt yields slumped on Friday as nagging concerns about the impact of the coronavirus on global growth overshadowed a strong U.S. jobs report that indicated an economy on pace to grow moderately.

Headlines: Ford shakes up top management, promises faster turnaround
Description: Ford Motor Co  on Friday shook up its top management, naming strategy chief Jim Farley as chief operating officer of the No. 2 U.S. automaker and promising skeptical investors the company will kick a slow-moving turnaround into a higher gear.

Headlines: Boeing's fraying 737 MAX suppliers see capacity crunch
Description: Boeing Co suppliers are shedding jobs and capacity to cope with a halt in 737 MAX output, but while that staves off chaos, aerospace executives worry the industry might be unable to ramp factories quickly enough when the plane wins approval to fly again.

Headlines: Boeing supplier Spirit slashes dividend due to 737 MAX crisis
Description: Spirit AeroSystems Inc, Boeing Co's largest supplier, said on Friday it would slash its quarterly dividend to just 1 cent per share as it grapples with the grounding of the planemaker's 737 MAX jets.

Headlines: Tightrope Thiam: comeback CEO stung by a spying scandal
Description: Tidjane Thiam is unlikely to quietly retire after his abrupt exit as chief executive of Credit Suisse, some of those who have worked with him predict.

Headlines: Fed says risks to economy easing, but calls out coronavirus in report to Congress
Description: A "moderately" expanding U.S. economy was slowed last year by a manufacturing slump and weak global growth, but key risks have receded and the likelihood of recession has declined, the U.S. Federal Reserve said in its latest monetary policy report to the U.S. Congress.

Headlines: Tesla's surge inspires fans to buy, skeptics to dig in, drives fear of missing out
Description: Pretty much everyone on Wall Street has an opinion about Tesla .

Headlines: EU goes into meeting frenzy ahead of February 20 summit on next seven-year budget
Description: European Union leaders and institutions went into a frenzy of meetings this week to start the toughest job the bloc faces this year: agreeing on a seven-year budget that for many is the most tangible sign of what a united Europe will look like after Brexit.

Headlines: U.S. 'Section 232' auto decision on hold for possible U.S.-EU trade deal: Kudlow
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Friday a U.S. decision to impose "Section 232" national security tariffs on cars and auto parts imported from the European Union is on pause amid attempts to reach a U.S.-EU trade deal.

Headlines: White House adviser says UK's 5G actions won't hinder trade deal
Description: Britain's decision to grant China-based Huawei Technologies  a limited role in its 5G network despite U.S. concerns will not hinder efforts to reach a U.S.-UK trade deal, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Friday.

Headlines: 'We'll see; - U.S. Vice President on whether U.K.'s 5G decision could hurt possible trade deal
Description: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence said on Friday that Britain's decision to let Huawei Technologies have a limited role in its 5G network remains a point of issue between the two traditional allies.

Headlines: Mediaset set to win more time to complete merger of Italy, Spain units: sources
Description: Mediaset  will submit revised plans to merge its Italian and Spanish broadcasting units  under a Dutch entity to authorities in the Netherlands, securing a six-month extension to complete the project, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: New drugs contribute to AbbVie's upbeat 2020 view; shares hit year-high
Description: AbbVie Inc  on Friday forecast full-year earnings well above Wall Street estimates, as the U.S. drugmaker looks to new treatments and its pending acquisition of Allergan Plc  to drive growth beyond 2023, when its cash cow Humira loses patent protection.

Headlines: From black swan to bubble: investors weigh coronavirus risks
Description: When worries over the coronavirus shook U.S. stocks out of a period of quiet trading last week, investors wondered if the outbreak was the “Black Swan” event that would trigger a sharp decline. Less than a week later, talk has turned instead to a market melt-up.

Headlines: Take Five: China's virus paralysis
Description: The coronavirus continues to claim lives, yet the impact on global demand and companies is just starting to be felt. Recent days have seen an unremitting flow of dire headlines as supply chains from New Zealand to the United States felt the impact of a paralyzed China.

Headlines: Swedish central bank set to keep rates steady on Feb. 12, and through 2021: Reuters Poll
Description: Sweden's central bank is expected to keep its benchmark interest rate at zero at a policy meeting next week and is not expected to alter its stance for the foreseeable future, a Reuters poll showed on Friday.

Headlines: White House sees minimal impact on U.S. economy from China's coronavirus
Description: The White House's economic adviser on Friday said that President Donald Trump's administration does not expect the coronavirus in China will have a major effect on the U.S. economy.

Headlines: White House adviser: Xi told Trump that China will meet trade targets despite virus
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping told U.S. President Donald Trump that China would still meet its Phase 1 trade deal purchasing targets despite delays linked to the coronavirus, White House adviser Larry Kudlow told Bloomberg Television on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. jobs growth beats expectations for January
Description: U.S. non-farm payrolls data for January came in above analysts expectations, bolstering the view that the economy continues to grow at a healthy pace.

Headlines: U.S. December wholesale inventories revised lower
Description: U.S. wholesale inventories were a bit weaker than initially estimated in December amid a broad decline in stocks, including motor vehicles.

Headlines: Sparkle fades as coronavirus risks wiping out luxury goods growth
Description: The luxury goods industry normally relishes the spotlight, but in the case of China's coronavirus it is ruing being one of the most globally exposed sectors to an epidemic that risks all-but wiping out its sales growth this year.

Headlines: Uber's new roadmap to profitability draws Wall Street praise
Description: Shares of Uber Technologies Inc  rose on Friday after the ride-hailing company laid out an ambitious plan to be profitable by the end of 2020, a year ahead of its previous target as it tries to squash Wall Street doubts over its long-term viability.

Headlines: Exclusive: Fearing Huawei curbs, Deutsche Telekom tells Nokia to shape up
Description: Deutsche Telekom has told supplier Nokia it must improve its products and service to win business installing the German group's 5G wireless networks in Europe, according to internal documents and a source with direct knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Burberry says coronavirus hurting luxury demand
Description: Burberry  said the outbreak of the coronavirus was hitting luxury demand in China and Hong Kong, both important markets for the British fashion brand, sending its shares lower for a second day in a row.

Headlines: Exclusive: France ramps up pressure to shift $200 billion euro clearing away from London - sources
Description: France is looking at ways to lure clearing in euro derivatives away from London to the European Union to lessen the risk of any forced "relocation" backfiring by driving business instead to the U.S., financial industry officials said.

Headlines: 'No concrete proposition' from U.S. to back Huawei rival Ericsson: Swedish minister
Description: Sweden's digital minister stressed Ericsson's  importance for jobs and technology in Europe on Friday after a U.S. official suggested the United States buy stakes in the telecoms gear maker or Finland's Nokia  to counter Huawei's dominance in 5G.

Headlines: Global automaker supplies threatened by China coronavirus crisis
Description: The threat from the coronavirus crisis closed in on the global auto industry on Thursday, as Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV warned that a European plant could shut down within two to four weeks if Chinese parts suppliers cannot get back to work.

Headlines: Carmakers close Chinese factories because of coronavirus
Description: Automakers and parts suppliers have shut factories in China, in line with government guidelines, or have flagged a hit to profits following the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Swiss watchdog continues Credit Suisse probe after CEO goes
Description: Swiss markets watchdog FINMA is still examining corporate governance issues at Credit Suisse after Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam resigned amid a scandal over surveillance of managers, the agency said on Friday.

Headlines: Sweden says U.S. interest in Ericsson logical for 5G capability
Description: U.S. interest in Ericsson  is logical given that it is one of only a few companies offering a complete portfolio for the rollout of super-fast 5G mobile telecoms networks, Sweden's Minister for Energy and Digital Development said on Friday.

Headlines: Credit Suisse chairman says many shareholders back board on CEO exit
Description: Credit Suisse  Chairman Urs Rohner said many shareholders have backed the board following the departure of Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam in the fallout from a spying scandal.

Headlines: ArcelorMittal, commissioners extend talks on Italy's Ilva plant: lawyer
Description: ArcelorMittal  and commissioners of the Ilva steelworks in southern Italy have agreed to extend talks to the end of the month after making progress towards a possible deal to buy the plant, a lawyer for the company said on Friday.

Headlines: Japan telecom SoftBank Corp CEO sees Elliott investment as 'positive'
Description: Japanese telecom SoftBank Corp's CEO Ken Miyauchi on Friday welcomed hedge fund Elliott Management's investment in parent SoftBank Group Corp saying the activist investor's assessment of the stock as undervalued was "positive".

Headlines: Toyota keeps China plant output stopped through February 16 as virus hits supply, logistics
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  on Friday said production at all of its China plants would remain suspended through Feb. 16, joining a growing number of automakers facing stoppages due to supply chain issues as the coronavirus spreads.

Headlines: Majority of U.S. firms in China see revenue hit from coronavirus: AmCham survey
Description: The majority of U.S. firms with operations in China expect a virus outbreak to cut revenue this year, and some are accelerating plans to shift their supply chains out of the country, according to a poll by Shanghai's American Chamber of Commerce.

Headlines: L'Oreal rallies as sales increase offsets China concerns
Description: L'Oreal's  shares rose on Friday after fourth-quarter earnings from the French cosmetics company helped to offset concerns over the impact of China's coronavirus health crisis on its business.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor, Kia Motors to keep Chinese factories idled until February 16
Description: Hyundai Motor  and affiliate Kia Motors  plan to restart production at their Chinese factories on Feb. 17, a spokesperson said on Friday.

Headlines: BP's downstream boss Erginbilgic to leave next month
Description: BP's  head of downstream Tufan Erginbilgic will step down next month after six years in the job, the energy company said in a statement, becoming the latest top executive to leave as CEO Bernard Looney takes over.

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover to cut output at two UK factories
Description: Jaguar Land Rover  will reduce or stop production on certain days at two of its British factories over the next few weeks as Britain's biggest carmaker pursues cost-cutting measures in response to falling demand.

Headlines: Nissan's China sales fell 12% in January as coronavirus epidemic weighs
Description: Japanese carmaker Nissan  said on Friday its sales in China, the world's biggest auto market, fell by 11.8% in January year-on-year, as the Lunar New Year holiday began earlier than usual and the outbreak of coronavirus stymied economic activity.

Headlines: L'Oreal CEO says coronavirus will hamper sales in coming weeks
Description: L'Oreal  CEO Jean-Paul Agon said on Friday that the French cosmetics company had a good January in China but that the spread of the coronavirus would have an impact on demand in the coming weeks.

Headlines: Credit Suisse CDS jump after CEO Thiam quits
Description: The cost of insuring exposure to debt issued by Credit Suisse  jumped by 3 basis points (bps) on Friday after Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam quit amid a power struggle at Switzerland's second-biggest bank.

Headlines: Honda raises profit forecast, sticks to Wuhan plant schedule
Description: Honda Motor Co  raised its forecast for full-year operating profit by 6% on Friday as a weaker yen increased the value of its overseas sales.

Headlines: Hargreaves top investor sells shares at discount; stock drops
Description: Hargreaves Lansdown  co-founder and biggest shareholder Peter Hargreaves has sold 34.4 million shares in the investment platform, at more than a 6% discount to the stock's last close, a bookrunner said on Friday.

Headlines: Malaysia's Mahathir clarifies comments on AirAsia
Description: Malaysia's Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad on Friday sought to clarify comments he made on bribery allegations linked to AirAsia Group .

Headlines: Fiat reaches settlement with Italy tax agency over Chrysler value claim
Description: Fiat Chrysler has reached a settlement with Italian tax authorities over the valuing of its U.S. Chrysler business involving no cash payment or penalty, the group's chief financial officer said.

Headlines: Hong Kong Airlines to cut 400 jobs, operations as coronavirus hits travel
Description: Hong Kong Airlines said on Friday that it will slash 400 jobs and cut operations given weak travel demand because of the coronavirus outbreak, adding to financial woes for the city's second-largest carrier.

Headlines: Suzuki considers China supply options, third-quarter profit falls 11%
Description: Suzuki Motor Corp  said on Friday it was considering sourcing vehicle components from outside China, as the spread of a new coronavirus in the country threatens to disrupt vehicle production in its biggest market, India.

Headlines: Exclusive: Goldman Sachs to raise $8 billion for new buyout fund - sources
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  plans to raise $8 billion in only its second buyout fund since the 2008 financial crisis, bolstering its ability to secure deals worldwide, said two people with direct knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: ECB's house price headache too big to solve
Description: What if vital inflation data used to justify trillions of euros worth of central bank stimulus to support Europe's economy is flawed?

Headlines: Exclusive: China's mobile giants to take on Google's Play store - sources
Description: China's Xiaomi , Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL], Oppo and Vivo are joining forces to create a platform for developers outside China to upload apps onto all of their app stores simultaneously, in a move analysts say is meant to challenge the dominance of Google's Play store.

Headlines: Foxconn, Chinese firms refit production lines to make masks amid virus outbreak
Description: A number of Chinese manufacturers including a subsidiary of Apple Inc  partner Foxconn  have refitted production lines to make masks and medical clothing, as a deadly coronavirus spreads across China.

Headlines: Fish talks: U.S. official says successful talks crucial for WTO
Description: The United States said on Thursday it was pushing hard for the World Trade Organization to reach agreement on cutting fishing subsidies in coming months and viewed those talks as a test of whether the global body can still achieve multilateral deals.

Headlines: Trump, Xi reaffirm backing for Phase 1 of U.S.-China trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump expressed confidence in China's strength and resilience in confronting its coronavirus outbreak during a conversation with President Xi Jinping on Thursday, a White House spokesman said.

Headlines: Honda to keep vehicle plants in Wuhan suspended through Feb. 13
Description: Honda Motor Co  said Friday it will keep operations at its vehicle plants in Wuhan, China, suspended through Feb. 13, as previously planned.

Headlines: ViacomCBS to launch new streaming platform: source
Description: ViacomCBS Inc is preparing to launch a subscription streaming video service that will combine the free and paid services of CBS, programming from brands including MTV, Nickelodeon, Comedy Central and BET as well as films from the Paramount movies studio, a source familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: South Korea asks China for help in resuming production at auto parts plants
Description: The South Korean government said on Friday it has asked Chinese regional governments for help in resuming production at South Korean auto parts suppliers' factories in China.

Headlines: Jury orders Johnson & Johnson to pay $750 million in New Jersey talc case
Description: Johnson & Johnson was ordered on Thursday by a New Jersey state jury to pay punitive damages of $750 million to four plaintiffs who allege that the company's Baby Powder caused their cancer, a ruling that will be reduced to around $185 million because of state laws, according to a lawyer for the plaintiffs and the company.

Headlines: U.S. trade panel opens patent probe into Google speakers after Sonos complaint
Description: The U.S. International Trade Commission said on Thursday it was launching a patent investigation into certain audio players and controllers sold by Alphabet Inc's Google based on a complaint by rival smart speaker maker Sonos Inc.

Headlines: Huawei sues Verizon over patents; Verizon blasts 'PR stunt'
Description: China's biggest telecommunications equipment maker will square off in court against the No. 1 U.S. wireless carrier over whether Verizon Communications Inc should pay Huawei Technologies Co Ltd for patent infringement.

Headlines: To counter Huawei, U.S. could take 'controlling stake' in Ericsson, Nokia: attorney general
Description: U.S. Attorney General William Barr said on Thursday the United States and its allies should consider the highly unusual step of taking a "controlling stake" in Finland's Nokia and Sweden's Ericsson to counter China-based Huawei's dominance in next-generation 5G wireless technology.

Headlines: Hedge fund Elliott Management builds $3 billion stake in SoftBank: sources
Description: Hedge fund Elliott Management Corp, one of the world's most powerful activist investors, has amassed a nearly $3 billion stake in SoftBank Group Corp and is pushing for changes to boost the Japanese conglomerate's value, sources said.

Headlines: Boeing's botched Starliner test flirted with 'catastrophic' failure: NASA panel
Description: Boeing narrowly missed a "catastrophic failure" during its December flight test of an unmanned space taxi that was cut short by an unrelated problem, a NASA safety review panel said Thursday, recommending that the agency examine Boeing's software verification process before letting it fly humans to space.

Headlines: Aurora Cannabis to take C$1 billion in charges, cuts 500 jobs as CEO exits
Description: Aurora Cannabis said Chief Executive Terry Booth will retire and Executive Chairman Michael Singer become interim CEO as the beleaguered marijuana producer announced C$1 billion ($752.79 million) in impairment charges on Thursday.

Headlines: Uber sees profit by end of 2020, but still expects full-year loss
Description: Uber Technologies Inc  on Thursday moved forward by a year its target to achieve a measure of profitability to the fourth quarter of 2020, but the ride-hailing company still expects to lose a total of more than $1 billion this year.

Headlines: On shareholder vote reforms, BlackRock sits on the fence
Description: BlackRock Inc  declined to back or reject a regulatory proposal to reform the shareholder resolution process in a long-awaited letter distributed on Thursday, seeking instead a middle ground on a hotly contested, politicized issue.

Headlines: China to halve tariffs on some U.S. imports as coronavirus risks grow
Description: China on Thursday said it would halve additional tariffs levied against 1,717 U.S. goods last year, following the signing of a Phase 1 deal that defused a bruising trade war between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: T-Mobile beats quarterly estimates as Sprint merger decision looms
Description: T-Mobile US Inc  beat analysts' estimates for quarterly revenue and profit on Thursday, as the wireless carrier added more mobile phone subscribers to its monthly plans, some of which come bundled with Netflix Inc  service.

Headlines: Wall St. reaches new highs as China moves to limit coronavirus impact
Description: U.S. stocks gained for a fourth straight session on Thursday and Wall Street's main indexes hit record highs as concerns eased over the economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak in China.

Headlines: Intercontinental Exchange abandons deal talks with eBay
Description: New York Stock Exchange owner Intercontinental Exchange Inc (ICE)  said it had decided to stop exploring deal options with eBay Inc , just hours after its chief executive said he would "love" to speak with the e-commerce company.

Headlines: EU trade chief Hogan returns to Washington as auto tariffs loom
Description: European Trade Commissioner Phil Hogan returned to Washington on Thursday for talks with U.S. counterpart Robert Lighthizer designed to improve transatlantic ties as the threat of auto tariffs looms.

Headlines: Toyota to make more pickup trucks at Mexican plant in shift from U.S.
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  will ramp up production at its new Mexican plant to 100,000 vehicles a year by 2021 in a major step to shift production of its popular mid-size Tacoma pickup truck to Mexico from the United States, the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: Fed includes 'heightened stress' in leveraged loans in 2020 bank stress tests
Description: Large banks with significant trading operations will have their finances tested in 2020 against a scenario that includes "heightened stress" in leveraged loans, the Federal Reserve announced on Thursday.

Headlines: Musk's SpaceX plans IPO for Starlink business
Description: Elon Musk's SpaceX plans to list its space internet venture, Starlink, but not for several years, a company official told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Stocks rally, safe-haven currencies drop, on China plan to cut tariffs
Description: World equity markets rallied for a fourth day on Thursday, with key stock indexes touching fresh peaks, as news that China plans to cut tariffs in half on some U.S. goods buoyed risk sentiment and pushed safe-haven currencies lower.

Headlines: Juul raises $700 million in debt from investors: source
Description: Juul Labs Inc has raised more than $700 million in convertible debt from investors to fund its operations, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters, as the e-cigarette maker battles growing regulatory scrutiny on vaping.

Headlines: Factbox: Real estate veteran Mathrani to lead WeWork turnaround as CEO
Description: (This February 3 story was corrected to remove reference to Mathrani attending British boarding school Eton)

Headlines: New 737 MAX software flaw found during tests, Boeing sticks to return timeline
Description: Flight testers discovered another flaw in the software of Boeing Co's grounded 737 MAX, the plane that suffered two fatal crashes, though the company and the top U.S. aviation regulator said on Thursday the issue most likely could be fixed without extending the target date for the plane's return to service.

Headlines: Oil prices flat; OPEC+ mulls supply cut as virus hits demand
Description: Oil futures gave up early gains and settled narrowly mixed on Thursday, as OPEC and its partner Russia gave mixed signals about possible further output cuts to mitigate the impact of any weakening in global demand due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Airbus posts strong January orders, delivers 31 jets
Description: Airbus  posted its biggest January order haul in at least 15 years on Thursday as it booked a major leasing order that has been in the pipeline for several months, and carried out 31 aircraft deliveries.

Headlines: Twitter notches first $1 billion quarterly revenue, beating estimates; shares jump
Description: Twitter Inc pulled in $1 billion in quarterly revenue for the first time on Thursday, beating expectations as efforts to make its platform more user-friendly brought in more people, and sending its shares up 14% in early trading.

Headlines: Canadian agency asks federal court to declare Facebook contravened privacy law
Description: Canada's privacy commissioner asked a federal court to declare that Facebook had broken federal privacy law for the private sector, according to a notice of application filed on Thursday.

Headlines: Yum Brands misses sales, profit estimates as Pizza Hut battles rivals; shares drop
Description: Yum Brands Inc  shares fell 4.7% after it reported quarterly same-store sales and profit that missed analyst expectations on Thursday, as stiff competition took a bite out of sales at its Pizza Hut chain in the United States.

Headlines: Software update to address 737 MAX indicator light issue will not delay return schedule - Boeing
Description: Boeing Co said Thursday that a new software update to address an indicator light issue on the grounded 737 MAX will not impact its mid-2020 estimate for the plane's return to service.

Headlines: Kuwait seeks information on alleged Airbus bribery case: KUNA
Description: Kuwait's anti-corruption authority (NAZAHA) said on Thursday it was open to receiving any information about alleged bribes paid to secure Airbus  plane orders involving Kuwaiti parties, according to the state news agency.

Headlines: Exclusive: Coronavirus outbreak delays Carlyle's Atotech IPO - sources
Description: (This January 31 story was refiled to correct spelling of coronavirus in headline)

Headlines: EU regulators to investigate EssilorLuxottica's 7.2-billion-euro Dutch deal
Description: EU antitrust regulators opened on Thursday an in-depth investigation into Ray-Ban maker EssilorLuxottica's  7.2 billion euro bid for Dutch opticians group GrandVision , saying the deal could push up prices.

Headlines: Google Maps seeks business, transit reviews in new look as it turns 15
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google Maps on Thursday launched a redesign that prominently solicits users' reviews and photos of places they visit, seeking to increase its data in a field led by local search apps such as Zomato, TripAdvisor and Yelp.

Headlines: British Airways owner IAG sees coronavirus having only marginal impact on global travel
Description: (This Feb. 5 corrects story to remove erroneous reference to non-British Airways IAG airlines not flying to China in paragraph five)

Headlines: Total beats quarterly forecasts despite low oil price, raises payout
Description: Total  beat forecasts on Thursday by keeping net adjusted fourth-quarter profit steady at $3.2 billion despite low oil prices and fulfilled a pledge to boost dividends, lifting the French energy firm's shares.

Headlines: WTO sides against U.S. over its tariffs on Canadian paper
Description: World Trade Organization arbiters sided against the United States on Thursday over duties it had applied on Canadian paper in one of the final verdicts of the WTO's appeals body.

Headlines: Pizza-toting robots: U.S. lets Nuro deploy driverless delivery vehicles
Description: In a first-of-its-kind approval by U.S. regulators, a federal agency on Thursday gave permission for autonomous vehicle startup Nuro Inc over the next two years to deploy up to 5,000 low-speed electric delivery vehicles without human controls like mirrors and steering wheels.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims hit nine-month low; productivity rebounds
Description: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits dropped to a nine-month low last week, suggesting a tightening labor market would continue to keep the longest economic expansion in history on track despite weak business investment.

Headlines: EU antitrust regulator stresses fair rules as Germany, France call for overhaul
Description: Europe's future must be based on fair competition rules, EU antitrust regulators said on Monday, after Germany and France reiterated calls for a speedy overhaul of the bloc's rules to help EU companies better compete with U.S. and Chinese rivals.

Headlines: Coronavirus impact on financial markets and economies
Description: Financial markets appear to be recovering from the damage done in late January by the coronavirus outbreak in China.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank shares soar after new shareholder steps in
Description: Deutsche Bank  on Thursday said Los Angeles-based Capital Group has taken a 3.1% stake, boosting shares in  Germany's largest bank which has been hit by losses and misconduct scandals.

Headlines: S&P 500, Dow ease from record highs after three-day rally
Description: The S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrials indexes eased from their record highs on Thursday, as investors took a breather after a stellar run this week on waning worries about the economic damage from the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Norwegian Air's shares jump as turnaround takes off
Description: Norwegian Air's  turnaround gathered pace last month as the budget carrier removed unprofitable routes from its network and boosted the income from remaining flights, sending its shares up almost 6% in early trade.

Headlines: Goldman bolsters Marcus staff as Britain spearheads consumer bank push
Description: Goldman Sachs  plans to expand its retail brand Marcus in Britain this year with more than 65 new staff, a mobile app and more savings products, as part of the group's global shift towards consumer banking.

Headlines: Toyota lifts profit outlook, mulls alternatives to China-made parts amid virus outbreak
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  nudged up its annual operating profit forecast by 4.2% on favorable currency rates and better-than-expected sales, but added the impact of the new coronavirus was hard to gauge and had not yet been factored in.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler profit rises, outlook 'firm' ahead of Peugeot merger
Description: Fiat Chrysler   posted a 7% rise in fourth-quarter profit on Thursday, boosted by strong business in North America and better results in Latin America as it headed into a merger with France's PSA .

Headlines: Nike carves out South American strategy in consumer focus push
Description: Nike Inc  on Thursday said it would partner with some South American distributors, as a part of the footwear maker's wider plan to sell new products directly to consumers faster.

Headlines: Swiss investor adviser calls for Credit Suisse chairman to go
Description: Prominent Swiss investment adviser Ethos Foundation has called on Credit Suisse  Chairman Urs Rohner to step down to take responsibility for the Swiss bank's spying on executives.

Headlines: How Chinese tariffs on U.S. imports will stand after February 14 cuts
Description: China is preparing to halve the extra tariffs on U.S goods that went into effect last September, including on crude oil, soybeans, pork and beef.

Headlines: AB InBev gets relief against New Delhi sales ban
Description: A tribunal in New Delhi has put on hold a sales ban imposed last year on Anheuser-Busch InBev , an order seen by Reuters showed, allowing the world's largest brewer to resume sales of its beer products in the city for now.

Headlines: U.S. productivity rebounds in fourth quarter; labor costs growth slows
Description: U.S. worker productivity rebounded in the fourth quarter, keeping labor costs in check.

Headlines: Exclusive: Prudential eyes full control of China venture, considers U.S. options
Description: Prudential  is in talks that could lead to it taking full control of its 50:50 joint venture with China's CITIC  and is considering selling some or all of its U.S. business to sharpen its focus on Asia, a source told Reuters.

Headlines: Equinor broadens scope of carbon targets to match rivals
Description: Equinor joined other major European oil and gas companies on Thursday by including emissions from the fuel it sells to customers in its carbon reduction targets as investors step up the pressure on fossil fuel producers.

Headlines: Payments in high-value deals not a bribe, Mahathir says about AirAsia probe
Description: Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said on Thursday payments received to offset the costs of a high-value order could not be constituted as a bribe.

Headlines: Exxon and Papua New Guinea should return to LNG negotiating table, says Total CEO
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp  and the Papua New Guinea government must return to the negotiating table so that a $13 billion expansion of gas production can proceed, the head of French oil major Total , a partner in the plan, said on Thursday.

Headlines: UK seeks big tariff reductions in U.S. trade deal
Description: Britain is seeking far-reaching reductions in tariffs from a trade deal with the United States, trade minister Liz Truss said on Thursday, setting out the broad aims of a post-Brexit push to secure new free-trade agreements.

Headlines: What does Britain want from trade deal with United States?
Description: British trade minister Liz Truss on Thursday set out the country's priorities for a post-Brexit trade deal with the United States.

Headlines: Drugmaker Sanofi expects further profit growth from narrowed focus
Description: French drugmaker Sanofi  on Thursday forecast further profit growth for 2020 even as it drops some research in areas such as diabetes in a shake-up to narrow its focus on blockbuster treatments including eczema medicine Dupixent.

Headlines: Honda may keep Wuhan plants closed longer due to outbreak: Nikkei
Description: Honda Motor Co  is considering keeping operations suspended for longer than planned at its three plants in the Chinese city at the center of the new coronavirus outbreak, the Nikkei newspaper reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Nokia's surprise profit rise fails to salvage 2019 dividend
Description: Cost cuts provided an unexpected boost to Nokia's  fourth-quarter underlying profit on Thursday, driving its share price to a four-month high, although the Finnish telecom company said it was not ready to propose a dividend.

Headlines: Britain seeking far-reaching tariff cuts in post Brexit U.S. trade deal
Description: Britain is seeking far-reaching reductions in tariffs in a trade deal with the United States, trade minister Liz Truss said on Thursday, setting out the broad aims of her post-Brexit push to secure new free trade agreements.

Headlines: Exclusive: BP eyes sale of Algerian gas plant after Rosneft talks fail - sources
Description: BP  is seeking buyers for its stake in a major Algerian gas plant deep in the Sahara desert after recent talks on a sale to Russian oil giant Rosneft  failed, three industry sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Mitsubishi postpones SpaceJet delivery again, books $4.5 billion special loss
Description: Japan's Mitsubishi Heavy Industries  said on Thursday it will book a 496.4 billion yen ($4.5 billion) special loss after its aircraft unit delayed the delivery of its SpaceJet regional jet for at least another year until after March 2021.

Headlines: Volvo Cars posts rise in fourth-quarter profit, helped by cost cuts and sales growth
Description: Sweden's Volvo Car Group, owned by China's Geely, reported an 18% rise in fourth-quarter operating profit as cost cuts and growing sales more than offset the impact of subdued global auto markets.

Headlines: UniCredit cuts further its stake in Turkey's Yapi Kredi
Description: Italy's biggest bank by assets UniCredit  took a further step on Wednesday in a strategy to streamline its structure, announcing the placement of a 12% stake in Turkish bank Yapi Kredi .

Headlines: China likely considering disaster clause in Phase 1 deal with U.S.: Global Times
Description: China is likely considering using a disaster-related clause in its Phase 1 trade deal with the United States due to the coronavirus outbreak that has killed more than 500 and infected tens of thousands, the Global Times reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Yum China warns of first-quarter losses, 2020 sales hit after virus outbreak
Description: KFC licensee Yum China  said it could report an operating loss in the first quarter and take a significant hit to sales and productivity due to a coronavirus outbreak in China, after it was forced to shut nearly a third of its stores.

Headlines: Korean Air says will sell a property in Seoul, non-core unit
Description: Korean Air Lines  said on Thursday it will sell a property in downtown Seoul and one of its non-core business units in line with its goal of improving financial stability.

Headlines: Drugmakers see long road ahead in coronavirus vaccine race
Description: Drugmakers racing to find a vaccine or effective treatment for the deadly new coronavirus in China cautioned that they have a long way to go.

Headlines: Uber wins appeal in Brazil, court says drivers are not employees
Description: A Brazilian higher court for labor ruled on Wednesday that there was no employment relationship between Uber and its drivers, siding with the ride-hailing company against a Sao Paulo driver.

Headlines: Foxconn sees full China production resuming late-February: source
Description: Taiwan's Foxconn  aims to gradually restart operations at factories in China next week but it could take one to two weeks from then to resume full production due to the coronavirus outbreak, a person with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Fedcoin? The U.S. central bank is looking into it
Description: The Federal Reserve is looking at a broad range of issues around digital payments and currencies, including policy, design and legal considerations around potentially issuing its own digital currency, Governor Lael Brainard said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. warns energy cos like Rosneft, Chevron over ties to Venezuela's Maduro
Description: The Trump administration is ramping up pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro's government, and energy companies with ties to it, from Russia's Rosneft  to U.S.-based Chevron Corp , should "tread cautiously," a senior administration official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Brazil's BNDES raises $5.2 billion selling Petrobras stake: sources
Description: Brazil's development bank BNDES sold on Wednesday $5.2 billion in common shares it owned in state-controlled oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA , two people with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: S&P 500, Nasdaq mint record highs after strong U.S. data, waning virus fears
Description: The benchmark S&P 500 posted a record closing high on Wednesday as U.S. stocks rallied for a third straight day on encouraging U.S. economic data and waning fears of the financial fallout from the corona virus in China.

Headlines: Trump touts stock market's record run, but who benefits?
Description: Donald Trump loves to trumpet the hot U.S. stock market as a key achievement of his presidency, and he was in full self-congratulatory mode on that front during Tuesday night's State of the Union address.

Headlines: Australia central bank looks to rid Visa, Mastercard of debit payments edge
Description: Australian regulators will consider intervening to stop banks from automatically directing "tap-and-go" card payments through the world's largest payment processors Visa  and Mastercard Inc. , the central bank said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Baby Yoda powers Disney streaming subscriptions to fast start
Description: Walt Disney Co's new streaming service Disney+ reached 28.6 million paying subscribers this week, the company said on Tuesday as it reported quarterly earnings that beat Wall Street forecasts.

Headlines: Stocks rally on virus vaccine hopes, dollar gains
Description: The dollar gained and a gauge of global equity markets surged for a third day on Wednesday, as investors cheered expectations of more central bank stimulus and reports that scientists were developing a vaccine for the deadly coronavirus.

Headlines: With lipsticks, Hermes branches into competitive cosmetics world
Description: France's Hermes  said on Wednesday it would start selling make-up from March, as the brand best known for its pricey Birkin handbags branches into a competitive beauty industry where its luxury rivals include Chanel.

Headlines: American Revolut-ion: European banking apps face crowded U.S. market
Description: When London-based Revolut opens its virtual doors in America this year, it will be the latest European digital bank to challenge incumbent U.S. lending giants after forays by Monzo and N26, but the challenges it faces have not diminished.

Headlines: Tesla tumbles 17% as electrifying rally loses power
Description: Tesla's  stock tumbled 17% on Wednesday, hitting the brakes on a dramatic rally as a senior executive said the coronavirus outbreak in China would delay deliveries of its Model 3 cars and analysts warned of its high valuation.

Headlines: Oil prices jump 2% as virus vaccine reports spur hope
Description: Oil prices jumped about 2% on Wednesday on media reports that suggested scientists were developing a vaccine for the fast-spreading coronavirus, even as world health experts said treatments have not yet been found.

Headlines: Avianca's top shareholder says has no knowledge of alleged Airbus bribes
Description: German Efromovich, the majority shareholder in Latin American airline Avianca , said on Wednesday he does not have any knowledge of widespread bribes allegedly paid by European manufacturer Airbus .

Headlines: Texas AG says break-up, all other remedies on the table in Google probe
Description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton, who is leading a multistate investigation into Alphabet Inc's Google unit, said on Wednesday he has not taken any possible punishment off the table, including breaking up the search and advertising giant.

Headlines: With Tesla stock envy, GM hopes to sell investors on its EV, tech future
Description: General Motors Co  has watched with frustration and envy as the market value of electric carmaker Tesla Inc  has ballooned to about two and a half times GM's size, but on Wednesday the Detroit automaker made the case that its EV and self-driving technology strategy deserves a higher value.

Headlines: Ackman's Pershing Square exits Starbucks, sticks by Chipotle, sees gains at Agilent
Description: Investor William Ackman told clients on Wednesday that Pershing Square Capital Management exited its Starbucks Corp  position as future growth looks less robust but will stick with last year's biggest winner, Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc. .

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit narrows in 2019 for first time in six years
Description: The U.S. trade deficit fell for the first time in six years in 2019 as the White House's trade war with China curbed the import bill, keeping the economy on a moderate growth path despite a slowdown in consumer spending and weak business investment.

Headlines: Ford says Canadian agency investigating emissions certification process
Description: Ford Motor Co said Wednesday Canadian officials have opened a preliminary investigation into the automaker's emissions certification process.

Headlines: Nasdaq proposes exclusive exchange trading for illiquid stocks
Description: Nasdaq Inc  asked regulators on Wednesday to allow issuers of thinly-traded stocks listed on its exchange to trade almost exclusively on Nasdaq, as part of a broader plan to boost trading in small- and mid-sized companies.

Headlines: Exclusive: Kia in talks over moving $1.1 billion plant to another Indian state - sources
Description: South Korea's Kia Motors is discussing with the Indian state of Tamil Nadu the possibility of moving a $1.1 billion plant out of neighboring Andhra Pradesh only months after it fully opened, due to policy changes last year, sources close to the talks told Reuters.

Headlines: France's BNP Paribas on prowl for further European expansion
Description: BNP Paribas  is looking for further opportunities to expand its investment banking franchise in Europe and fortify its lead over local rivals after last year taking over Deutsche Bank's electronic equity and prime broking operations.

Headlines: LinkedIn CEO Jeff Weiner to step down
Description: Professional networking platform LinkedIn's chief executive officer, Jeff Weiner, said on Wednesday that he would step down from his position effective June 1.

Headlines: GM rolls back 'radical' plan to offer only three-cylinder engines in some China cars: sources
Description: General Motors Co  is backtracking on an aggressive promotion of three-cylinder engines in China that saw some Buick and Chevrolet models offered only in that option - a move which proved highly unpopular and helped sales slide, people familiar with matter said.

Headlines: Adidas closes "considerable" number of stores in China due to coronavirus
Description: German sportswear company Adidas  on Wednesday said it was temporarily shutting a "considerable" number of its stores in China due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Coty earnings top estimates, downplays coronavirus hit; shares surge
Description: Coty Inc  reported quarterly profit above expectations on Wednesday and said the recent coronavirus outbreak would have a relatively small impact on its earnings, sending the cosmetics and fragrance maker's shares surging as much as 22%.

Headlines: GM forecasts flat 2020 profit after a rough 2019; shares gain
Description: General Motors Co  on Wednesday forecast flat profits for 2020 and reported a better-than-expected fourth quarter result as it kicked off a new effort to win over investors stampeding into shares of electric car rival Tesla Inc .

Headlines: Vodafone to remove Huawei from core of European network
Description: Vodafone  will remove Huawei technology from the core of its European networks following Britain's decision to restrict the Chinese company's role in 5G and new EU guidelines on the firm's equipment, Chief Executive Nick Read said.

Headlines: Green protesters step up pressure on Siemens over coal mine project
Description: Siemens  came under increased pressure from climate change protesters and its own shareholders on Wednesday over a contract to supply an Australian coal mine, demanding that Chief Executive Joe Kaeser cancel the deal.

Headlines: Qatar Airways swoops for RwandAir stake and eyes bigger LATAM holding
Description: Qatar Airways is in talks to buy a 49% stake in Africa's RwandAir and is interested in doubling its holding in LATAM Airlines Group  to 20%, its chief executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ford shares fall 8% after disappointing 2020 profit outlook
Description: Shares of Ford Motor Co  fell nearly 8% on Wednesday, a day after the automaker forecast a lower profit for 2020, surprising analysts who also criticized the company's management for holding back details on the earnings shortfall.

Headlines: Intercontinental Exchange says it explored deal with eBay
Description: Intercontinental Exchange Inc (ICE), the owner of the New York Stock Exchange, said on Tuesday it had approached e-commerce company eBay Inc to explore "a range of potential opportunities".

Headlines: Exclusive: HSBC to axe senior managers in strategy shift - sources
Description: HSBC  is set to unveil a new round of job cuts targeting senior international managers and reduce its presence in some smaller markets as part of a wider strategy overhaul, people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: British Airways owner IAG sees coronavirus having only marginal impact on global travel
Description: The coronavirus epidemic will have a only a marginal impact on global travel demand and the airline industry is healthy enough to absorb any economic slowdown in China, the chief executive of British Airways parent IAG  said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Cathay Pacific asks employees to take unpaid leave as virus hits demand
Description: Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways  asked its 27,000 employees to take three weeks of unpaid leave, saying preserving cash was key for the carrier and that conditions were as grave as during the 2009 financial crisis due to the virus outbreak.

Headlines: Trading house Mitsubishi voices concern over coronavirus impact
Description: Japan's Mitsubishi Corp  is watching developments from the coronavirus outbreak for effects on the global economy and prices of natural resources, its finance chief said after the trading house reported a drop in net profit

Headlines: Airbus halts output at Tianjin assembly plant due to coronavirus
Description: Airbus  has prolonged a planned closure of its final assembly plant in Tianjin, China, as a result of the coronavirus emergency, the planemaker said on Wednesday, adding it was monitoring for any signs of impact on deliveries.

Headlines: Malaysia's AirAsia X forms committee to review Airbus bribery allegations
Description: Malaysian long-haul budget airline AirAsia X  has formed a board committee to review corruption allegations by Britain's Serious Fraud Office (SFO), a stock exchange filing showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: Argentina's 'little trees' blossom as forex controls fuel black market
Description: On the streets of Buenos Aires, money changers known as "arbolitos" or "little trees" are taking advantage of Argentina's capital controls to take a slice of a booming black market trade in U.S. dollars.

Headlines: Visa planning biggest changes to U.S. swipe fees in a decade: Bloomberg
Description: Visa Inc  is planning the biggest changes in a decade to the rates U.S. merchants pay to accept its cards, Bloomberg reported https://bloom.bg/2vGWtA7 on Tuesday, citing a document Visa sent to banks.

Headlines: China's Zhejiang to prioritize restarts at key exporters, manufacturers after virus lockdown
Description: China's eastern province of Zhejiang, the second worst-hit by the coronavirus epidemic, will push major exporters, listed companies and key manufacturers to be the first to return to work after the extended Lunar New Year holiday.

Headlines: 'Giga Texas?' Musk asks Twitter users to vote on new gigafactory
Description: Elon Musk, the billionaire chief executive officer of Tesla Inc , went on Twitter to ask users if the electric carmaker should build a new gigafactory in Texas.

Headlines: Intel bets on smart buildings in Israel to attract tech talent
Description: Intel Corp  is investing heavily in "smart buildings" in Israel that will be full of perks to keep employees happy, helping the U.S. chipmaker compete for the country's top professionals.

Headlines: Imperial Brands' profit growth evaporates after U.S. vaping crackdown
Description: Tobacco group Imperial Brands  said it would not see any profit growth this year after tighter regulation in the United States, the world's biggest vaping market, has sapped demand.

Headlines: IAG CEO says coronavirus impact on air travel demand will be marginal
Description: The chief executive of International Airlines Group (IAG) said he believes the overall impact of coronavirus on global air travel demand will be marginal.

Headlines: Qatar Airways in talks for a 49% stake in RwandAir: CEO
Description: Qatar Airways is in talks to acquire a 49% stake in RwandAir, its chief executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wilted flowers, empty cafes: China's small businesses bear coronavirus costs
Description: What is worrying Rao Yong more than the daily news updates of a virus outbreak gripping China is that he may soon have to shut his online handicraft store and tell the 1,400 craftswomen he employs he is no longer able to sell their work.

Headlines: British engineer Babcock's Archie Bethel to retire as CEO
Description: Babcock International  said on Wednesday Archie Bethel would be retiring as the British engineering firm's chief executive officer after being in the role for more than three years.

Headlines: Danske Bank beats fourth-quarter net profit expectations
Description: Danske Bank  beat fourth-quarter net profit forecasts on Wednesday and said it expects to earn a net profit between 8 to 10 billion Danish crowns ($1.18-1.48 billion) in 2020.

Headlines: Cold Turkey: investor exodus tests Erdogan's economic experiment
Description: A run on the lira proved a pivotal moment for Turkey's financial markets in 2018, prompting action from Ankara that has tilted the economy inward and frightened off foreign investors.

Headlines: U.S. to review new curbs on Huawei, China in Feb. meeting: sources
Description: The Trump administration plans to meet this month to discuss further curbing technology exports to China and its flagship telecoms company Huawei, two sources said, in a bid to resolve differences within the government over the possible crackdown.

Headlines: Australia court fines AMP $3.5 million over incorrect insurance advice
Description: Australia's Federal Court has ordered wealth manager AMP Ltd  to pay a penalty of A$5.2 million ($3.5 million) for  failing to prevent incorrect insurance advice by financial planners, the corporate watchdog said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Great American Comeback? Trump's economy has both boom and gloom
Description: The United States is in its 11th year of a record-setting economic expansion, a fact that President Donald Trump highlighted in his State of the Union speech to Congress on Tuesday.

Headlines: State AGs, Justice Department discuss Google antitrust probe
Description: State attorneys general investigating Alphabet Inc's Google unit  met on Tuesday with U.S. Justice Department officials to coordinate efforts to probe the search and advertising giant, officials told Reuters.

Headlines: Australia's wine exports could take a hit from coronavirus: industry body
Description: Australia's wine export growth slowed last year and could take another hit in 2020 from the coronavirus outbreak if China, its biggest market, orders fewer crates, a report by an industry body said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Marubeni cuts annual profit forecast, warns virus may hit global economy
Description: Japanese trading house Marubeni Corp  on Wednesday cut its full-year net profit forecast by 17% due to a one-off loss on its energy assets and lower profits from U.S. agri-business in the wake of a prolonged U.S.-Sino trade war.

Headlines: Credit Suisse revisits ex-U.S. employee's spying claim
Description: Lawyers for Credit Suisse  last week re-interviewed a former bank executive who said the Swiss lender had her followed in New York, according to a person familiar with the matter, weeks after the company dismissed her allegation as baseless.

Headlines: Credit Suisse also spied on Greenpeace: newspaper
Description: Credit Suisse , which has faced a scandal related to spying on senior executives, also conducted espionage against Greenpeace, Swiss newspaper SonntagsZeitung reported.

Headlines: Ford shares dive after carmaker posts fourth-quarter loss, disappointing 2020 outlook
Description: Investors sent Ford Motor Co shares skidding on Tuesday after the company delivered a weaker-than-expected 2020 forecast, warning of higher warranty costs, lower profits at its credit arm and continued investments in future technology such as self-driving cars.

Headlines: American, United suspending U.S. flights to and from Hong Kong through February 20
Description: American Airlines Group  and United Airlines  on Tuesday both said they are suspending all flights to and from Hong Kong.

Headlines: Snap misses quarterly revenue estimates, shares sink
Description: Snap Inc  missed Wall Street estimates for fourth quarter revenue on Tuesday as it faced tough competition from digital advertising giants Google and Facebook, sending its shares down 10%.

Headlines: Exclusive: iPhone app makers questioned in U.S. antitrust probe of Apple - sources
Description: The U.S. Justice Department has reached out to app developers as part of its investigation into Apple Inc , one of the four big tech companies being probed for alleged anti-competitive behavior, according one of the developers and another person familiar with the investigation.

Headlines: Tesla rally fueled by fear of missing out, not short squeeze - investors
Description: A nearly 14% gain in Tesla Inc's stock on Tuesday was likely sparked by investors looking to hop aboard its remarkable rally, rather than a reversal of bearish bets, an analysis of positioning dynamics showed.

Headlines: Musk's Tesla stake worth $30 billion after electrifying stock surge
Description: Tesla is making Elon Musk a lot richer without paying him a dime.

Headlines: Wall Street jumps as China stimulus measures soothe virus worries
Description: The Nasdaq hit a record high on Tuesday and the S&P 500 posted its biggest one-day gain in about six months as fears of a heavy economic impact from the coronavirus outbreak waned after China's central bank intervened.

Headlines: Chipotle's earnings beat estimates on higher prices, digital boost
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc  raised menu prices and consumers bit, helping the fast-casual burrito chain beat analysts' estimates for quarterly sales and profit on Tuesday.

Headlines: Factbox: Companies feel impact of coronavirus outbreak in China
Description: Companies around the world have warned that a coronavirus outbreak in China could disrupt supply chains or hurt bottom lines as factories and shops shut and airlines suspend flights.

Headlines: Factbox: Airlines suspend China flights because of coronavirus outbreak
Description: Airlines are suspending flights to China in the wake of the new coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: China's airlines told not to axe global flights as thousands cut
Description: China's civil aviation authority has urged domestic carriers to continue flying international routes as they consider cuts in response to a drop in demand due to the coronavirus outbreak, state news agency Xinhua reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Federal Reserve bars former Goldman Sachs executive for role in 1MDB scandal
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve said on Tuesday that it permanently barred a former Goldman Sachs Group Inc executive from the banking industry over his role in Malaysia's multi-billion-dollar 1MDB corruption scandal.

Headlines: Boeing will not cancel CEO incentive award tied to 737 MAX return
Description: Boeing Co  told U.S. lawmakers it will not cancel an incentive award for its new chief executive tied to the return of its grounded 737 MAX despite criticism from Congress, according to a letter made public on Tuesday.

Headlines: Macy's to close 125 stores, cut more than 2,000 jobs
Description: Macy's Inc  said on Tuesday it plans to close 125 of its least productive stores over the next three years to tackle slowing mall traffic and will slash more than 2,000 corporate jobs as a part of a cost-savings effort.

Headlines: Nike warns of financial impact from coronavirus outbreak
Description: Nike Inc  said on Tuesday the coronavirus outbreak in China would have a financial impact on its operations in the country, its biggest growth market, sending the footwear maker's shares down 3%.

Headlines: Best Buy board clears CEO of misconduct allegations
Description: U.S. consumer electronics retailer Best Buy Co  said on Tuesday its board had cleared Chief Executive Officer Corie Barry of misconduct allegations following an independent review.

Headlines: U.S. government experts, industry spar over asbestos testing in talc
Description: For the first time in nearly 50 years, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration examined asbestos testing for talc powders and cosmetics at a hearing on Tuesday, after traces of the known carcinogen were found in several such products, including Johnson & Johnson's Baby Powder.

Headlines: Stocks surge, safe-havens fall as confidence grows in China's virus efforts
Description: The dollar strengthened and global equity markets surged on Tuesday, with Wall Street's Nasdaq index hitting a record high, as investors took heart from China's efforts to minimize the economic impact from the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Another day, another record: Tesla shares march toward $1,000
Description: Shares of Tesla Inc  surged 20% on Tuesday to hit $940, extending a stunning rally that has more than doubled the company's market value since the start of the year as more investors bet on Chief Executive Elon Musk's vision.

Headlines: Oil falls 1% as demand fears outweigh hopes for bigger OPEC+ cuts
Description: Oil prices sank about 1% on Tuesday as fears that energy demand would take a long-term hit from the growing coronavirus outbreak outweighed hopes for more production cuts from OPEC and its allies.

Headlines: ConocoPhillips' outlook weighed down by coronavirus, disruptions in Malaysia, Libya
Description: ConocoPhillips issued a muted annual outlook on Tuesday,  expecting a hit from weaker oil demand growth due to the coronavirus outbreak and disruptions at its operations in Malaysia and Libya.

Headlines: Ups and downs: the battle to buy Thyssenkrupp's elevator unit
Description: Finland's Kone  and private equity firms are battling to buy ThyssenKrupp's  prized elevator division worth more than 15 billion euros ($16.6 billion), a deal which would be Europe's biggest private equity deal in 13 years.

Headlines: Siemens to buy Iberdrola's stake in Siemens Gamesa for 1.1 billion euros
Description: Siemens  is buying Iberdrola's  stake in Siemens Gamesa renewable energy , the German engineering company said, as it prepares to merge the business with its own energy unit ahead of a floatation later this year.

Headlines: Exclusive: First Petrobras employee flips in Brazil commodity traders probe
Description: A former trader at oil firm Petrobras has signed a plea bargain agreement with Brazilian prosecutors investigating bribery allegations, defense lawyers and prosecutors said, a potential breakthrough in a case involving some of the world's top commodity trading houses.

Headlines: Tesla up 20% after Panasonic posts first quarterly profit at battery business
Description: Tesla Inc's stock surged 20% on Monday in its largest one-day gain since 2013, fueled by a quarterly profit at Panasonic's battery business with the U.S. car maker and an investor report predicting its shares would rise more than ten-fold by 2024.

Headlines: Hedge funds hold their nerve on China, seek opportunities
Description: Hedge funds are holding their nerve on China's ability to rebound quickly from a coronavirus outbreak that has rattled global markets, but many are also adding caveats as they try to predict the potential economic fallout.

Headlines: Ralph Lauren holiday margin gets boost from higher prices for winter wear
Description: Higher prices for Ralph Lauren Corp's  down jackets and fleeces during the crucial holiday season boosted its margin and helped the company beat quarterly profit estimates on Tuesday, sending the fashion house's shares up over 8%.

Headlines: Google mum on hardware as it divulges revenue for other two big bets
Description: Google Chief Executive Sundar Pichai over the last three years has touted the business prospects of what he has called "three of our biggest bets: YouTube, cloud and hardware."

Headlines: VW's Skoda targets Indian revival with tougher safety, emission rules
Description: Skoda is hoping government moves to drag regulations for cars sold in India up to developed market standards will help turn around its fortunes in a market where it has stalled.

Headlines: Beat laments Uber's Colombia departure, but will not hold back in its absence
Description: Ride-hailing company Beat hopes rival Uber  will return to Colombia, but meanwhile, it will capitalize on the void it left and try to fill it, the company said.

Headlines: Shale pioneer John Hess says key U.S. fields starting to plateau
Description: Shale pioneer John Hess said on Tuesday that key U.S. shale fields are starting to plateau, calling shale "important but not the next Saudi Arabia."

Headlines: Bombardier in talks to sell business-jet unit to Textron: WSJ
Description: Canada's Bombardier Inc is in talks to sell its business-jet unit to U.S. maker of Cessna jets, Textron Inc, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Ferrari tempers 2020 expectations with cautious upgrade
Description: Demand for Ferrari's  Portofino and 812 Superfast models helped the Italian supercar maker hit last year's profit targets though it only provided a cautious upgrade to its outlook for 2020.

Headlines: Luckin Coffee share price may nearly double to $60 on U.S. exchanges: hedge fund Citron Capital
Description: China-based Luckin Coffee Inc's  shares could double in price after it overcomes the negative impact of the coronavirus outbreak and a widely publicized bearish bet against its stock, according to Andrew Left, managing partner at hedge fund Citron Capital.

Headlines: Defense aircraft demand lifts U.S. factory orders; underlying softness remains
Description: New orders for U.S.-made goods increased by the most in nearly 1-1/2 years in December, flattered by robust demand for defense aircraft, but persistently weak business spending on equipment pointed to limited scope for a sharp rebound in manufacturing.

Headlines: Electric dream: Britain to ban new petrol and hybrid cars from 2035
Description: Britain will ban the sale of new petrol, diesel and hybrid cars from 2035, five years earlier than planned, in an attempt to reduce air pollution that could herald the end of over a century of reliance on the internal combustion engine.

Headlines: Factbox: Britain's 2035 ban on new combustion car sales puts jobs at risk
Description: Britain will ban the sale of new petrol and diesel cars from 2035 in an attempt to reduce air pollution, a step which accelerates a shift toward electric vehicles. Following are some of the possible challenges and consequences related to the decision:

Headlines: Bottled water firms turn on the taps with filters, flavors and fizz
Description: A German firm backed by bottled water giant Danone  plans to launch a sparkling-water machine for the home early next year, its chief executive told Reuters, squarely taking aim at PepsiCo's  SodaStream.

Headlines: Hyundai to halt South Korea output as China virus disrupts parts supply
Description: Hyundai Motor  will suspend production in South Korea because the coronavirus outbreak has disrupted the supply of parts, it said, becoming the first major carmaker to do so outside of China.

Headlines: Carlsberg beer sales hit by China's shuttered karaoke bars
Description: Empty Chinese streets and karaoke bars will hit short-term sales in Carlsberg's  biggest market, but the Danish brewer said on Tuesday it was not changing its forecast or strategy for China as a result of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Google parent Alphabet loses trillion-dollar status after revenue miss
Description: Alphabet Inc  shares fell 4% on Tuesday after the search giant posted its first holiday-quarter revenue miss in five years, even as new disclosures on the company's smaller YouTube unit were warmly welcomed by Wall Street.

Headlines: Ralph Lauren closes half of China stores on coronavirus outbreak
Description: Ralph Lauren Corp  said on Tuesday it has shut about half of its 110 stores in China due to the coronavirus outbreak, which has so far killed over 420 people.

Headlines: Justice Department's Delrahim recused from Google antitrust review
Description: The head of the Justice Department's Antitrust Division, Makan Delrahim, has been recused from the Google portion of the agency's review of big technology platforms due to potential conflicts of interest, a spokesman for the agency said on Tuesday.

Headlines: BP boosts dividend as profit tops forecast and CEO bows out
Description: BP  raised its dividend and said it had completed a $1.5 billion share buyback program in a sign of confidence in its growing oil and gas business on the last day in office for Chief Executive Bob Dudley.

Headlines: Taps open for Saudi listings after Aramco's record IPO
Description: Several Saudi Arabian companies are planning to list shares on the Riyadh exchange in coming months in the wake of oil giant Aramco's record IPO.

Headlines: Siemens Gamesa boosting risk management to fend off project delays: CEO
Description: Wind turbine maker Siemens Gamesa is acting fast to manage risks on its projects around the world to avoid a repeat of the delays that dragged it to a loss at the beginning of this year, Chief Executive Marcus Tacke said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Jeweler Pandora says China business at a 'standstill'
Description: Pandora's  business in China has ground to a halt, the jewelry maker and retailer said on Tuesday, as a new flu-like virus forced the company to shut around a third of its stores in one of its top markets and shoppers stay at home.

Headlines: Exclusive: Fund giant Vanguard bypasses banks with forex algos
Description: Vanguard, the $5.6 trillion asset manager, plans to start using computer-run algorithms this year to trade FX directly with other funds, depriving banks of some of the fees they earn as the middlemen in currency deals.

Headlines: Vodacom to launch 5G services in South Africa in 2020
Description: Vodacom Group  expects to offer 5G mobile services to its South African customers this year by using a network being built by another African operator Liquid Telecom, Vodacom Chief Executive Shameel Joosub said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Hong Kong to ease reporting rules for companies' results due to virus
Description: Hong Kong's markets regulator and stock exchange will relax rules on how companies must publish their annual results in response to challenges caused by the newly identified coronavirus, they said in a joint statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: Cathay Pacific to cut global capacity by 30% amid coronavirus epidemic
Description: Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd  plans to cut 30% of its global capacity over the short-term, including 90% of capacity to mainland China as it grapples with a sharp fall in demand due to the coronavirus epidemic, its CEO said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuelan banks begin storing dollars amid Maduro's liberalization - sources
Description: At least half a dozen Venezuelan banks have begun storing in vaults millions of dollars and euros accumulated in cash by businesses during an unexpected economic liberalization by President Nicolas Maduro, according to sources.

Headlines: Automakers close factories in China due to virus outbreak
Description: Automakers and parts suppliers have had to shut factories in China, in line with government guidelines, or have flagged a hit to profits.

Headlines: Indonesia says to stop livestock imports from China
Description: Indonesia said on Tuesday its plan to temporarily stop some imports from China over coronavirus concerns would only apply to shipments of live animals, and not all food and beverage products, a senior minister said.

Headlines: Mitsui CFO: China virus outbreak may slow manufacturing activity
Description: Japan's Mitsui & Co  sees China's coronavirus outbreak possibly slowing manufacturing activity, while slumping commodities prices, including iron ore, may weigh on its earnings, the trading house's executive said on Tuesday.

Headlines: AirAsia CEO Fernandes and chairman step aside as Airbus bribery allegations probed
Description: AirAsia Group  CEO Tony Fernandes and Chairman Kamarudin Meranun will step aside for at least two months while the airline and authorities investigate allegations Airbus paid a bribe of $50 million to win plane orders from the company.

Headlines: China to push medical factories to resume, expand production
Description: The Chinese government will push medical products factories to resume or expand production, state television said on Tuesday after a meeting chaired by Premier Li Keqiang on the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Exclusive: India may issue $5 billion of bonds next year with no foreign investment cap, sources say
Description: India is likely to issue at least $5 billion worth of bonds with  no limits on foreign investment next year, in a bid to list the bonds on global indices and attract more foreign funds, according to two finance ministry sources.

Headlines: ING ordered to pay 30 million euros to settle Italy money-laundering probe: source
Description: A Milan court ordered Dutch lender ING  to pay 30 million euros ($33.17 million) to settle a money-laundering case in Italy, a judicial source said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Sanofi investigated over epilepsy drug linked to birth defects
Description: French drugmaker Sanofi  said on Tuesday it was being investigated over Depakine, an epilepsy drug which caused birth malfunctions and slow neurological development when taken during pregnancy.

Headlines: Sony raises outlook on strong sensor demand, warns of virus risks on supply chain
Description: Sony Corp raised its annual profit outlook on strong sales of smartphone image sensors after reporting a smaller-than-expected decline in quarterly profit, but it warned of an impact from the Wuhan coronavirus on its global supply chain.

Headlines: Wizz Air's top shareholder cuts stake to comply with ownership rules
Description: Wizz Air's  largest shareholder, U.S.-based private equity firm Indigo Partners, carried out a long-time plan to cut its stake in the company as the Budapest-based low-cost airline works to comply with European Union ownership rules.

Headlines: Exclusive: As virus fallout widens, China readies more measures to stabilize economy - sources
Description: Chinese policymakers are readying measures to support an economy jolted by a coronavirus outbreak that is expected to have a devastating impact on first-quarter growth, policy sources said.

Headlines: Japan's Takeda forecasts surprise full-year operating profit
Description: Takeda Pharmaceutical Co Ltd  said it now expects an operating profit for the full year, as opposed to its earlier projection for a loss, due to stronger sales and cost savings from its integration with Shire Plc.

Headlines: Glencore's 2019 cobalt up, copper down; share price rises
Description: Glencore said its 2019 copper output fell 6% and battery mineral cobalt rose 10% as it boosted production at its Katanga mine in the Democratic Republic of Congo, offsetting the impact of the early closure of another operation.

Headlines: Exclusive: Outbreak to hit iPhone output if China extends Foxconn factory halt - source
Description: Foxconn could see a "big" production impact and shipments to customers including Apple face disruption if a Chinese factory halt due to the coronavirus outbreak extends into a second week, a person with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Airlines suspend China flights because of coronavirus
