Description: OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP and its controlling Sackler family have been negotiating with cities, counties and states on a proposed settlement worth an estimated $10 billion to resolve more than 2,600 lawsuits alleging they helped fuel the U.S. opioid crisis.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs sets growth targets but urges investor patience
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  on Wednesday set targets to grow its fledgling consumer unit, while improving efficiency and shareholder returns, but urged patience at its first-ever investor day presentation.

Headlines: Investors sound out Tesla ahead of earnings report
Description: Tesla Inc investors compiled a list of questions to the company ahead of the electric carmaker's quarterly earnings report on Wednesday, ranging from requests for updates on the company's insurance policy to complaints about questions asked by analysts.

Headlines: Google temporarily shutting down all China offices
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Wednesday it is temporarily shutting down all its offices in China due to the outbreak of a new coronavirus in the country.

Headlines: Fed holds rates steady, offers no new guidance on balance sheet
Description: The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady on Wednesday at its first policy meeting of the year, with officials pointing to continued moderate U.S. economic growth and a "strong" job market.

Headlines: L Brands CEO in talks to step aside and sell Victoria's Secret: WSJ
Description: Victoria's Secret-owner L Brands  Chief Executive Officer Leslie Wexner is in talks to step aside from the role and is exploring strategic alternatives for the lingerie brand, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Oil mixed as virus fears, U.S. stock build face talk of further OPEC cuts
Description: Oil prices were mixed on Wednesday as worries about the coronavirus outbreak and swelling U.S. crude inventories weighed on prices, counter-balanced by talk that OPEC could extend oil output cuts.

Headlines: British Airways, Iberia suspend direct flights to mainland China amid virus fears
Description: British Airways  has suspended all direct flights to and from mainland China, one of the biggest names in aviation to do so, as worries grow about the impact of the spreading coronavirus on global travel.

Headlines: KLM says it will scrap some flights to China due to the coronavirus outbreak
Description: KLM, the Dutch arm of Air France KLM, will scrap some flights to China due to the coronavirus outbreak in the North Asian country, it said late on Wednesday.

Headlines: Pompeo to Britain: Look again at Huawei 5G decision
Description: The United States on Wednesday urged Britain to rethink its decision to allow China's Huawei a role in 5G networks, cautioning that American information would only be allowed to pass across trusted networks.

Headlines: GE shares jump 10% on profit beat, higher 2020 cash target
Description: General Electric Co  sold more investors on its turnaround story on Wednesday, sending shares 10% higher on its quarterly profit and cash results that beat forecasts, and its bullish cash target for 2020.

Headlines: FOMC statement from January 28-29 meeting
Description: Following is the full text of the statement released by the Federal Reserve's Federal Open Market Committee on Wednesday following a two-day meeting:

Headlines: Traders maintain bets on Fed pausing on policy till later in year
Description: U.S. short-term interest rate futures dropped but only slightly on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve wrapped up its January meeting without changing interest rates or signaling it was in any rush to do so.

Headlines: Shell appoints director Goh as deputy chair
Description: Royal Dutch Shell  said on Wednesday director Euleen Goh would take over as its deputy chair from May 20.

Headlines: Boeing posts first annual loss in two decades as 737 MAX costs near $19 billion
Description: Boeing Co  on Wednesday swung to its first annual loss since 1997 as 737 MAX costs doubled to nearly $19 billion, and the plane manufacturer indicated it would again cut production of its bigger 787 Dreamliner aircraft, currently its main source of cash.

Headlines: KFC to sell Beyond Meat's plant-based 'fried chicken' in the southern U.S.
Description: Beyond Meat said on Wednesday it will supply plant-based "fried chicken" to several KFC stores in Tennessee and North Carolina, after a test conducted last year showed strong consumer demand.

Headlines: Argentina needs policy clarity to reinvigorate economy: IMF
Description: Greater certainty around Argentina's public policies could help reactivate growth and investments in the recession-hit South American country, the International Monetary Fund said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Mediobanca CEO expects second-tier banks to look at M&A in 2020
Description: Second-tier banks in Italy, Spain and possibly Germany are likely to consider mergers this year in a bid to boost returns which are insufficient to cover their cost of equity, the chief executive of investment bank Mediobanca said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Do or die - Nissan takes the axe to the house Ghosn built
Description: Nissan  is planning aggressive cost cuts to deal with an unexpected slump in sales as the expansionist strategy it inherited from fugitive former Chairman Carlos Ghosn flounders, four people familiar with the plans said.

Headlines: Ford's Lincoln to partner with Rivian to make electric vehicles
Description: Ford Motor Co owned Lincoln Motor on Wednesday confirmed its plans to make battery-powered electric vehicles in partnership with Ford-backed startup Rivian.

Headlines: U.S. banks on Hong Kong Exchange's 'named and shamed' list
Description: Wall Street investment banks JPMorgan  and Morgan Stanley  have been placed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange's "named and shamed" list after the $300 million initial public offering (IPO) of Chinese biotech company Akeso Inc. was sent back for not meeting the correct regulatory requirements.

Headlines: Apple's iPhone strength is back and analysts say it is here to stay
Description: Wall Street analysts were smitten by a rebound in sales of Apple Inc's  iPhones after a year of decline and said strong demand for new models, spurred by trade-in programs and heavy discounts on older models, will drive growth this year.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley warns coronavirus could drag on global, Chinese GDP growth
Description: Morgan Stanley said on Wednesday the coronavirus outbreak in China was likely to hurt global growth in the near-term and could shave up to 1 percentage point off Chinese growth in the first quarter.

Headlines: McDonald's sees 2020 spending on tech after sales beat; breakfast competition looms
Description: McDonald's Corp  beat quarterly sales forecasts on Wednesday and said it would spend more on technology and research in 2020, as the world's largest burger chain bets on revamped stores and menu additions to lure diners and gain market share.

Headlines: Explainer: What the U.S. Federal Reserve is watching this year
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is expected to keep interest rates unchanged when it wraps up its first policy meeting of the year on Wednesday.

Headlines: Warren Buffett gives up on newspapers; Berkshire sells unit to Lee Enterprises
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  agreed to sell its newspaper business to Lee Enterprises Inc  for $140 million in cash, abandoning an industry the billionaire investor had long defended even as its financial prospects deteriorated.

Headlines: Dow profit beats on Asia demand and cost cuts, sees recovery in 2020
Description: Dow Inc  beat Wall Street's estimates for quarterly profit and revenue on Wednesday, helped by growth in volumes in Asia as well as lower costs, and the chemicals maker pointed to a recovery in demand this year as trade tensions ease.

Headlines: For airlines, China boom now exposes them to risk as coronavirus slams market
Description: China's growth has helped power a global aviation boom over the last decade, but as the country curtails travel in the face of a new coronavirus, a slowdown could hit the industry harder than ever before.

Headlines: Britain's BBC to axe 450 newsroom jobs in cost-cutting drive
Description: The BBC said on Wednesday it will axe 450 jobs from its news division in a cost-saving plan that will result in cuts at the World Service and its 5Live radio station and in fewer reports being made by analysis show Newsnight.

Headlines: UK's Huawei decision will not affect intelligence-sharing: PM's spokesman
Description: Britain's decision to allow China's Huawei to have a role in its 5G networks does not affect the country's ability to securely share intelligence data, Prime Minister Boris Johnson's spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Shades of Ronaldo; Agnelli heir swoops for soccer star's sunglasses
Description: Luxury eyewear group Italia Independent  is hoping to borrow some of Cristiano Ronaldo's star appeal.

Headlines: Exclusive: HSBC considering exit from Turkey - sources
Description: HSBC  is considering selling its Turkey business amid concerns about the country's volatile currency and economic outlook, sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: EU deals another blow to U.S., allowing members to decide on Huawei's 5G role
Description: The EU followed Britain's example on Wednesday, allowing members to decide what part China's Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL] can play in its 5G telecoms networks and resisting pressure from Washington for an outright ban.

Headlines: Huawei says it welcomes EU guidelines on 5G security
Description: Chinese telecoms equipment maker Huawei [HWT.UL] on Wednesday welcomed the European Union's 5G guidelines that are likely to limit its business in Europe, but which fall short of a U.S. call for a total ban.

Headlines: Factbox: Huawei's involvement in telecoms networks around the world
Description: European Union countries can either restrict or exclude high-risk 5G vendors from core parts of their telecoms networks, according to new EU guidelines announced on Wednesday, a move targeting China's Huawei Technologies but falling short of a U.S. call for a complete ban.

Headlines: Big volatility options trade points to mystery investor '50 Cent'
Description: Large options trades some people have attributed to the mysterious investor known as "50 Cent" have become more profitable in recent days, as fears of the economic impact of the coronavirus injected volatility back into stock markets.

Headlines: Mastercard beats profit estimates on strong holiday season spending
Description: Mastercard Inc  beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit on Wednesday as customers spent more on its cards during the U.S. holiday shopping season, boosting fees for the world's second-largest payment processor.

Headlines: Centerview lures top French dealmakers to its new Paris hub: sources
Description: U.S. boutique investment bank Centerview has found an office in the heart of Paris and is hiring senior bankers to establish a second European hub as Brexit looms, three sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Adidas to launch new fabrics from recycled ocean plastic, polyester
Description: Adidas  will launch new fabrics made from recycled polyester and marine plastic waste and expand the product lines that use them after the success of shoes made with the Parley for the Oceans initiative, the sportswear firm said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Huawei denies German report it colluded with Chinese intelligence
Description: Huawei [HWT.UL], the leading maker of telecoms network equipment, denied a newspaper report on Wednesday that alleged the German government was in possession of evidence that it had cooperated with Chinese intelligence.

Headlines: Huawei denies German report it colluded with Chinese intelligence
Description: Huawei, the leading maker of telecoms network equipment, denied a newspaper report on Wednesday which said the German government was in possession of evidence that it had cooperated with Chinese intelligence.

Headlines: Investors find some Unilever foods hard to swallow
Description: Six months after Unilever's   Alan Jope suggested he may get rid of brands without "purpose", investors are wondering when he will deliver.

Headlines: World may have hit peak car output, says auto-parts supplier Bosch
Description: Global automotive production may have peaked, auto supplier Robert Bosch said on Wednesday, announcing job cuts and a review of its business to cope with a 44% drop in full-year operating profit and a downturn in demand for cars.

Headlines: Crowded Lagos to ban motorbikes from most of Nigerian metropolis
Description: Nigeria's business capital Lagos will ban commercial motorcycles from nearly the entire city, citing overcrowding and safety, authorities said on Monday, a move that could change the commute for thousands and threaten ride-hailing startups.

Headlines: China flexes oil refining muscle, upping pain for Asian rivals
Description: China is set to further expand its massive oil refining capacity this year, offering support to global oil prices, and U.S. producers in particular, but its plans spell more gloom for Asia's hard-hit refining industry.

Headlines: Factbox: Apple, Starbucks warn of hit from virus; firms restrict travel, airlines cancel flights
Description: Apple said it had baked into its outlook uncertainty related to a virus outbreak in China that has killed 132 and infected nearly 6,000. Starbucks warned results would be hit after it shut over half its cafes in the country.

Headlines: Bosch CEO warns coronavirus could hit global auto supply chains
Description: The chief executive of Robert Bosch, the world's biggest auto components supplier, warned that coronavirus could impact its global supply chain, which is heavily dependent on China.

Headlines: Ford to resume production at China joint venture with Changan on February 10
Description: Ford Motor  plans to resume production on Feb. 10 at its manufacturing facilities in China with joint venture partner Chongqing Changan Automobile , a spokesman for the U.S. automaker said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Tim Hortons pulls Beyond Meat products from Ontario, British Columbia
Description: Restaurant Brands International Inc's  Tim Hortons said on Tuesday it has removed Beyond Meat Inc's  products from its coffee and donut shops in the Canadian provinces of Ontario and British Columbia.

Headlines: Foxconn says plans in place to meet production obligations after virus outbreak
Description: TAIPEI - Apple Inc supplier Foxconn said it could continue to meet all manufacturing obligations in the wake of a coronavirus outbreak in China even as the iPhone maker flagged uncertainty created by the disease.

Headlines: Renault turns to VW's De Meo as car maker seeks fresh start
Description: Renault's  Tuesday named Luca de Meo, the former head of Volkswagen's  Seat brand, as its next chief executive, as the car maker looks to draw a line under a year of turmoil by finalizing a long-awaited management shake-up.

Headlines: JPMorgan plans to cut hundreds of jobs in consumer unit: Bloomberg
Description: U.S. bank JPMorgan Chase & Co  is planning to cut hundreds of jobs across its consumer division, Bloomberg reported https://bloom.bg/2GsDvzw on Tuesday, citing people briefed on the matter.

Headlines: Nissan says it plans to sell 1.6 million cars in China this year
Description: Japanese carmaker Nissan Motor Co  said on Wednesday it planned to sell about 1.6 million vehicles in China, the world’s biggest auto market.

Headlines: Airlines cut China flights as companies restrict travel on virus fears
Description: Airlines including United Airlines Holdings Inc  said they were canceling some flights to China as demand fell sharply and global companies told their employees not to travel on deepening fears over the spread of a flu-like virus.

Headlines: Proton-packed Geely takes on Honda and Toyota in Southeast Asia
Description: Li Chunrong was hired by Chinese automaker Geely to revive the fortunes of the Proton brand in Malaysia, and it took him two years to eclipse Japanese giants Honda and Toyota. Now he plans to take the fight across Southeast Asia and beyond.

Headlines: Apple's iPhone back to growth as company braces for coronavirus impact
Description: The iPhone is back. But Apple is girding for more disruptions in virus-hit China.

Headlines: 'Flash crash' trader sentenced to time served plus a year of home confinement: lawyers
Description: A Chicago-based U.S. federal district court judge on Tuesday sentenced Navinder Sarao, a London-based trader accused of contributing to Wall Street's 2010 "flash crash", to time already served in jail of four months, with a year of home confinement, Sarao's attorneys said in a statement.

Headlines: Starbucks sees hit as coronavirus prompts over 2,000 China store closures
Description: Starbucks Corp  on Tuesday became the first major U.S. company to warn of a financial hit from the new coronavirus outbreak in China, as it closed thousands of restaurants and adjusted operating hours in its biggest growth market.

Headlines: EBay forecast disappoints amid competition from Amazon, Walmart
Description: EBay Inc  forecast first-quarter revenue below analysts' estimates on Tuesday, as the e-commerce company faces fierce competition from Amazon.com Inc  and Walmart Inc .

Headlines: Starbucks plans to launch plant-based breakfast sandwich this year
Description: Starbucks Corp  said on Tuesday it would introduce a breakfast sandwich this year with a plant-based patty in the United States and Canada.

Headlines: Defying Trump, UK's Johnson refuses to ban Huawei from 5G
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson granted Huawei a limited role in Britain's 5G mobile network on Tuesday, frustrating a global attempt by the United States to exclude the Chinese telecoms giant from the West's next-generation communications.

Headlines: Pfizer profit misses estimates as revenue falls; plans no 2020 share repurchases
Description: Pfizer Inc  on Tuesday reported quarterly profit that fell short of Wall Street expectations for the first time in at least two years, and the drugmaker said it will no longer rely on share repurchases to help drive growth.

Headlines: Exclusive: OxyContin maker Purdue is 'Pharma Co X' in U.S. opioid kickback probe - sources
Description: OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP is the unnamed company that surfaced in criminal charging documents filed earlier this week in a probe of illegal kickbacks from drugmakers, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: AMD revenue forecast disappoints on weak console demand
Description: Advanced Micro Devices Inc's  first-quarter revenue estimate came in largely below analysts' estimates due to waning demand from gaming console makers, even as its data center and PC chips business tracked a recovery in the chip industry.

Headlines: How Facebook thinks its independent oversight board should work
Description: Facebook Inc recommended rules on Tuesday for how its independent oversight board will work and said a former human rights group director will lead the board's administrative staff.

Headlines: Facebook VP of engineering Jay Parikh says leaving company
Description: Facebook's vice president of engineering, Jay Parikh, said in a post on the social network on Tuesday that he was planning to leave the company, marking the exit of another key executive following a string of high-profile departures last year.

Headlines: Blink and you miss it: The U.S. yield curve inverts again
Description: A closely watched bond market phenomenon has again flashed yellow, but investors are loathe to give it much weight.

Headlines: Airbus faces record $4 billion fine after bribery probe
Description: Airbus faces a record $4 billion fine and lower 2019 profits after unveiling a preliminary deal with French, British and U.S. authorities following a crippling three-year probe into allegations of bribery and corruption over jetliner sales.

Headlines: Countdown to recession: What an inverted yield curve means
Description: NEW YORK - A dramatic rally in Treasuries this week led some key parts of the U.S. yield curve to reinvert, a signal that has traditionally been bearish for the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Apple sparks Wall Street bounce ahead of results
Description: U.S. stocks rebounded on Tuesday, as the S&P 500 bounced back from its worst day in nearly four months, led by a climb in Apple and other names hit by exposure concerns to the coronavirus outbreak in China that sparked a recent sell-off.

Headlines: J.Crew Group appoints former Victoria's Secret executive as CEO
Description: J.Crew Group Inc on Tuesday appointed former Victoria's Secret executive Jan Singer as chief executive officer, effective Feb. 2.

Headlines: Brazil antitrust regulator gives nod to Boeing-Embraer deal
Description: Brazilian antitrust regulator Cade on Monday approved Boeing Co's purchase of Embraer SA's commercial aviation division without restrictions, according to a statement on the agency's website.

Headlines: U.S. budget deficit to top $1 trillion in 2020 despite strong economy, CBO says
Description: The U.S. economy will grow at a "solid" rate of 2.2% this year, the non-partisan Congressional Budget Office forecast on Tuesday, but the federal budget deficit will hit $1.02 trillion.

Headlines: Global stocks rally in big rebound, safe-havens lose luster
Description: Global equity markets rebounded in a broad rally on Tuesday and some safe-haven assets eased as investors took a less pessimistic view of the potential economic fallout from China's coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank delays raises to fixed pay after changing annual date for pay adjustments
Description: Deutsche Bank AG  has delayed raises to fixed pay compensation at the German bank by three months until after April 1, citing the need to further improve cost management, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Lordstown Motors pursuing $200 million U.S. retooling loan, will show EV truck at Detroit show: CEO
Description: Electric pickup truck start-up Lordstown Motors is pursuing a $200 million loan from a U.S. Energy Department program to retool a former General Motors  factory in northeast Ohio, Chief Executive Steve Burns told Reuters.

Headlines: Oil edges up as stock markets rebound after virus-related selloff
Description: Oil futures edged up on Tuesday after falling for five days, gaining support from a rebound in Wall Street stocks and talk that OPEC and its allies might tighten the market amid fears the coronavirus could weigh on oil demand.

Headlines: 3M forecasts 2020 profit below estimates on weak China demand
Description: U.S. industrial giant 3M Co  forecast 2020 profit below expectations after narrowly missing quarterly revenue estimates on Tuesday as weak demand from China dents overall growth.

Headlines: Atlantia shares rise on hopes for truce with Italian government
Description: Atlantia  shares gained more than 6% on Tuesday as comments from a minister rekindled hopes that the infrastructure group could reach a compromise with the government over its lucrative motorway concession.

Headlines: Reaction to UK allowing Huawei a role in 5G network
Description: Britain will allow "high risk vendors" like Chinese telecoms giant Huawei a limited role in building its 5G networks, the government said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. laments UK decision allowing Huawei a limited 5G role: aide
Description: The United States is disappointed by the United Kingdom's decision to grant Chinese telecommunications firm Huawei a limited role in its 5G mobile network, a senior Trump administration official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: No threats to break UK intellgence ties after 5G decision: security source
Description: There have been no threats from other countries' intelligence agencies to break ties with Britain after it announced it would grant Huawei a limited role in its 5G mobile network, a British security source said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Huawei decision could "greatly complicate" a U.S.-Britain free trade agreement: Graham
Description: Britain's decision to give Chinese telecoms giant Huawei [HWT.UL] a limited role in building its 5G networks could greatly complicate a free trade agreement with the United States and jeapordize intelligence sharing with one of its closest allies, Republican U.S. Senator Lindsey Graham said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Factbox: Huawei's involvement in other countries' telecoms networks
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson granted Huawei [HWT.UL] a limited role in Britain's 5G mobile network on Tuesday, defying U.S. pressure to exclude the Chinese company from next-generation communications over fears Beijing could use them to spy.

Headlines: UK's Johnson tells Trump on Huawei that collaboration is needed to diversify market
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson told President Trump on Tuesday that countries should work together to break the dominance of a small number of companies after Britain granted Chinese firm Huawei [HWT.UL] a limited role in its 5G mobile network.

Headlines: Trump, Britain's Johnson discussed 'telecommunications' after Huawei decision: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Britain's Prime Minister Boris Johnson "discussed critical regional and bilateral issues, including telecommunications security" in a conversation on Tuesday, White House spokesman Judd Deere said in a statement.

Headlines: Harley-Davidson's sales growth struggle sends shares tumbling
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc  on Tuesday reported a decline in quarterly motorcycle revenue that outpaced Wall Street's estimates as retail sales in the United States dived again, sending its shares lower.

Headlines: High expectations for Tesla, and a long way to go to match rivals' steady profit
Description: Buckle up. Tesla's quarterly report could be another wild ride for investors.

Headlines: U.S. business investment weak; consumer confidence at five-month high
Description: New orders for key U.S.-made capital goods dropped by the most in eight months in December and shipments were weak, suggesting business investment contracted further in the fourth quarter and remained a drag on economic growth.

Headlines: Canada, isolated over Huawei 5G, is studying British decision
Description: Canada, the only member of an elite intelligence-sharing network yet to decide whether to allow the use of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd 5G technology, on Tuesday said it was studying Britain's decision not to ban the Chinese telecoms giant from the West's next-generation communications.

Headlines: Renault says will reopen Wuhan plant with partner Dongfeng on February 10
Description: Renault  will resume production at the factory it runs with Dongfeng Group  in Wuhan, Hubei province and the epicenter of the outbreak of a new flu-like virus, on Feb. 10, a spokeswoman for the French carmaker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Freeport CEO 'looking forward' to deals once expansion projects done
Description: Freeport-McMoran Inc , the world's largest publicly traded copper producer, would consider acquisitions, mergers or other deals once three ongoing expansion projects finish by 2022, Chief Executive Richard Adkerson said in an interview on Tuesday.

Headlines: United Airlines suspends some U.S. flights to China as demand drops over virus fears
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  said on Tuesday it was  suspending some flights between the United States and Beijing, Hong Kong and Shanghai between Feb. 1 and Feb. 8 due to a "significant decline in demand" as the new coronavirus spreads.

Headlines: McDonald's heats up breakfast war with new chicken sandwiches
Description: McDonald's Corp  will add chicken sandwiches to its breakfast menu at all of its U.S. restaurants, the world's largest burger chain said on Tuesday, to fend off competition from Chick-Fil-A and Popeyes Louisiana Kitchen .

Headlines: Huawei snatched market share from Apple, local rivals in China in 2019
Description: Top Chinese smartphone maker Huawei Technologies Co Ltd thrived in 2019 at the expense of smaller Chinese rivals and Apple  even as the smartphone market shrank further and consumers favored phones with 5G technology, data shows.

Headlines: UTC says Collins 2020 profit to be hurt mainly due to MAX grounding
Description: United Technologies Corp  Chief Financial Officer Neil Mitchill said he expects 2020 operating profit at the U.S. aircraft parts maker's Collins Aerospace unit, its biggest, to be hurt largely due to the grounding of Boeing Co's  737 MAX aircraft.

Headlines: French carmaker Renault names Luca de Meo as new CEO
Description: French carmaker Renault  on Tuesday named former Volkswagen's  Seat brand executive Luca de Meo as its new chief executive, as Renault moves to create a new management in the post-Ghosn era and shore up its alliance with Nissan .

Headlines: As Britain decides, Europe grapples with Huawei conundrum
Description: Britain's decision on whether to allow Huawei to supply equipment for 5G mobile networks comes at a delicate time, with debate raging in European capitals over the security implications of reliance on Chinese technology.

Headlines: Intelligence sharing will not be put at risk by Huawei decision-UK's Raab
Description: Britain's Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab said intelligence sharing would not be jeopardized by Tuesday's decision to allow China's Huawei [HWT.UL] a role in building the country's 5G telecoms network.

Headlines: In post-repo squeeze twist, Fed may nudge up interest paid to banks
Description: One potential side effect of the U.S. Federal Reserve's efforts to pump liquidity into the banking system and avoid further unwanted surges in short-term borrowing rates: The central bank may soon have to take measures to keep interest rates from getting too low.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin beats estimates, raises sales forecast on higher F-35 deliveries
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp  forecast 2020 revenue above analysts' estimates on Tuesday, as the Pentagon's No.1 weapons supplier's late 2019 results benefited from better jet and missile sales and heightened geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.

Headlines: Xerox's quarterly profit beats estimates, says firm on HP buyout
Description: Xerox Holdings Corp  on Tuesday posted a better-than-expected quarterly profit as it kept a tight lid on costs and said it plans to follow through with its $33 billion bid to buy rival HP Inc .

Headlines: Ryanair warns of job losses as 737 MAX delivery date slips
Description: Ryanair  has warned pilots of possible base closures and job cuts as the date for delivery of its first 10 of Boeing's  grounded 737 MAX aircraft slipped into the autumn.    In a memo dated Jan. 27 seen by Reuters, the low-cost airline said Boeing would not deliver the first aircraft until September or October at the earliest, as Ryanair does not take deliveries during its peak summer months of June, July and August.

Headlines: At Exxon, CEO's promised turnaround sapped by chemicals, refining
Description: At Exxon Mobil Corp , CEO Darren Woods' plan to revive earnings at the largest U.S. oil and gas company is being sidetracked by the two businesses he knows best: chemicals and refining.

Headlines: Services in spotlight after Apple stock market value hits $1.4 trillion
Description: When Apple Inc  posts quarterly results on Tuesday, investors will be looking for fresh evidence the iPhone maker should be treated as a producer of high-margin, subscription services after its stock market value touched $1.4 trillion and its earnings multiple trades at decade highs.

Headlines: Factbox: Return to Paris - De Meo set to take the wheel at Renault
Description: Renault's  board is expected to meet later on Tuesday to approve the nomination of Luca de Meo, the former head of Volkswagen's  Seat brand, as its next chief executive.

Headlines: Goldman says staff with mainland China exposure should avoid office
Description: Goldman Sachs  has instructed staff who have been in mainland China to work from home or be out of the office for 14 days since they were last there, according to an internal notice.

Headlines: Coronavirus infects Asia stocks with exposure to China
Description: Shares of companies highly exposed to China's economy tumbled across Asia on Tuesday on rising concern about the impact of global travel bans associated with a virus outbreak, and even as some stocks involved in preventative health spiked.

Headlines: Sainsbury's Coupe says exit not due to failure of Asda deal
Description: The boss of British supermarket group Sainsbury's , Mike Coupe, said he was not stepping down in May because of his failure to buy rival Asda last year.

Headlines: New York, FTC sue 'pharma bro' Shkreli, others over Daraprim price hikes
Description: Martin Shkreli, the "pharma bro" in prison for defrauding investors, faces a lawsuit filed by the Federal Trade Commission and New York attorney general's office for an alleged scheme to preserve his monopoly for the drug Daraprim, whose price increased by more than 4,000% in one day.

Headlines: Coronavirus outbreak may disrupt Apple's iPhone production ramp up plans: Nikkei
Description: Apple Inc's  plan to ramp up iPhone production by 10% in the first half of this year may hit a roadblock as the coronavirus outbreak spreads across China, the Nikkei Asian Review reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: J&J CEO questioned over stock sale ahead of story on asbestos in Baby Powder
Description: Johnson & Johnson Chief Executive Alex Gorsky on Monday faced questions from plaintiffs lawyers over the timing of his sale of company stock, as he testified for the first time in a jury trial over allegations that the company's Baby Powder causes cancer.

Headlines: Renault, Nissan chief engineers to meet, revive R&D projects: sources
Description: Renault's  engineering boss will meet his counterpart at Nissan  in Japan this week, two sources close to Renault said, as the carmakers seek to revive projects crucial to an alliance left reeling by the Carlos Ghosn affair.

Headlines: Sainsbury's targets 2040 for net zero emissions, criticizes UK goal
Description: Sainsbury's  committed itself on Tuesday to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2040, a decade ahead of the British government's own target which it said "isn't soon enough".

Headlines: Judge dismisses Wall Street 'fear gauge' lawsuit against Cboe
Description: A federal judge on Monday dismissed an antitrust lawsuit by investors who accused the parent of the Chicago Board Options Exchange of letting anonymous traders rig the "fear gauge," Wall Street's main gauge of future stock market volatility, at their expense.

Headlines: Task force pushes U.S. lawmakers to strengthen insider trading rules
Description: A group of former U.S. officials and lawyers is urging Congress to strengthen and clarify law around insider trading that has "generated confusion" and "failed to keep up with the times."

Headlines: Mexico's America Movil fined by regulator; calls it 'illegal and disproportionate'
Description: America Movil, the telecoms giant controlled by the family of Mexican billionaire Carlos Slim, said on Monday that one of its subsidiaries had been fined 1.3 billion pesos ($69.53 million) by Mexico's telecoms regulator.

Headlines: Beer, wine, spirit makers pledge age-restriction labels on drinks
Description: Twelve leading beer, wine and spirits companies have pledged to put clear age-restriction labels on their drinks and set tighter controls on access to their online content in a bid to reduce underage drinking.

Headlines: Whirlpool forecasts 2020 largely above estimates as profit beats
Description: Whirlpool Corp  beat analysts' estimates for quarterly earnings and forecast 2020 profit largely above expectations on Monday, as the appliances maker raised prices and reined in expenses to cushion the impact of higher production costs.

Headlines: Trump's 'massive' U.S.-UK trade deal faces big hurdles
Description: Britain is the United States' closest ally but their long friendship may be sorely tested as the two countries try to forge a new trade agreement after Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headlines: Renault board meeting Tuesday to seal De Meo's CEO nomination: report
Description: Renault's  board is set to meet on Tuesday to approve naming Luca de Meo, formerly the head of Volkswagen's  Seat brand, as its next chief executive, Le Figaro newspaper reported on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. stock rally faces major test as China virus spreads
Description: The latest rally in U.S. stocks is facing a serious test, as the S&P 500 heads toward its worst loss in months on concerns over how the coronavirus will impact the global economy.

Headlines: Wall Street tumbles as virus fuels economic worry
Description: U.S. stocks suffered their worst day in over three months on Monday as China extended the Lunar New Year holiday due to a virus outbreak, fueling worries about the economic impact of containment efforts in the world's second largest economy.

Headlines: Former Boeing CEO Muilenburg resigns from Caterpillar board
Description: Caterpillar Inc  said on Monday former Boeing Co  Chief Executive Officer Dennis Muilenburg had resigned from its board.

Headlines: Global stocks slide to two-week low on China virus fears, safe havens gain
Description: Stocks markets tumbled worldwide on Monday as investor worries about the potential economic impact of the coronavirus drove up prices of safe-haven assets such as the Japanese yen and government debt.

Headlines: Canada kicks off USMCA ratification process, urges bi-partisan co-operation
Description: Canada's minority Liberal government kicked off the ratification process for a new continental trade pact on Monday and urged opposition lawmakers to formally approve the deal as quickly as possible.

Headlines: Oil sinks to three-month lows as coronavirus raises demand fears
Description: Crude futures dropped 2% to three-month lows on Monday as the death toll from China's coronavirus grew, curtailing travel and fueling expectations of slowing oil demand.

Headlines: Boeing secures financing commitments for over $12 billion: source
Description: Boeing Co  has secured financing commitments for more than $12 billion from over a dozen banks, a source familiar with the matter said on Monday, as financial pressures mount due to a production halt on its 737 MAX aircraft.

Headlines: 'Buy the dip,' one stock options signal says
Description: As concerns over the spread of the coronavirus rattle stocks, a corner of the options market is signaling that the current selloff may be short-lived.

Headlines: German car supplier Webasto halts China corporate travel over coronavirus: spokeswoman
Description: The German auto supplier Webasto has halted all corporate travel to and from China because of the coronavirus outbreak and the infection of an employee, a spokeswoman for the company said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. motorists drove less in November than year earlier
Description: U.S. motorists traveled fewer miles in November than a year earlier, the U.S. Department of Transportation said in a report on Monday.

Headlines: Capgemini passes first hurdle in Altran bid despite Elliott resistance
Description: French consulting and IT services provider Capgemini  succeeded in securing more than half of the capital of smaller rival Altran Technologies, the French market regulator AMF said on Monday, marking a win against U.S. activist fund Elliott.

Headlines: India renews push to sell Air India, puts entire stake on the block
Description: India said on Monday it plans to sell its entire interest in Air India Ltd, making a renewed push to sell the flag carrier after it drew no bids in an effort to auction a majority stake almost two years ago.

Headlines: J&J CEO to testify at trial for first time on Baby Powder risks
Description: Johnson & Johnson Chief Executive Officer Alex Gorsky was set to be called as a witness on Monday in what would be his first appearance in a jury trial over allegations that the company's Baby Powder causes cancer.

Headlines: GM to invest $2.2 billion at Detroit factory to make electric trucks, SUVs
Description: General Motors Co will invest $2.2 billion in its Detroit-Hamtramck assembly plant to build electric trucks and sport utility vehicles, a move that would create 2,200 jobs, the No.1 U.S. automaker said on Monday.

Headlines: Fed's first hurdle in 2020: Dispensing with 'QE Lite'
Description: The Federal Reserve's bond portfolio is swelling again at a pace not seen since the "quantitative easing" heyday in the early 2010s. Prices for stocks and other risky assets are also rising at a fast clip - a state of affairs that a growing chorus of investors, economists and former Fed officials say is no coincidence, and potentially a problem.

Headlines: Casper IPO valuation dwindles from peak of $1 billion
Description: Casper Sleep Inc, the online mattress retailer whose investors include actor Leonardo DiCaprio and rapper 50 Cent, expects its initial public offering valuation to be well below the roughly $1 billion it commanded in the last funding round.

Headlines: EU to rule on $120 billion United Technologies, Raytheon deal by February 28
Description: EU antitrust enforcers will rule by Feb. 28 whether to approve United Technologies Corp  and U.S. contractor Raytheon Co's  bid to create a $121 billion aerospace and defense giant, a filing on the European Commission website showed.

Headlines: The week in business in five graphics
Description: Wuhan in central China is the size of London. But flights to and from the city are canceled, highways are shut and soldiers guard the railway station, as China tries to quarantine the center of a virus outbreak that has killed 81 people and infected thousands, spreading to more than 10 countries including the United States and Japan.

Headlines: Exclusive: Regulator probes board role in Credit Suisse spying scandal - sources
Description: The Credit Suisse  spying debacle risks tipping the bank into a crisis that could engulf its top executives.

Headlines: EU antitrust regulators to rule on $69 billion Aramco-SABIC deal by February 27
Description: EU antitrust regulators will decide by Feb. 27 whether to clear state energy firm Saudi Aramco's $69.1 billion acquisition of world number four petrochemicals group Saudi Basic Industries Corp (SABIC), a European Commission filing showed.

Headlines: AbbVie-Allergan $63 billion deal aided by Nestle, AstraZeneca buys
Description: U.S. drugmaker AbbVie's  $63 billion tie-up with Allergan  is getting help from Nestle  and AstraZeneca  buying up products the Irish-domiciled company is shedding to placate regulators.

Headlines: Business survey suggests U.S. labor market may have peaked
Description: There is an even balance in the share of U.S. businesses reporting decreases and increases in employment for the first time in a decade, a survey showed on Monday, the latest suggestion that the labor market has likely peaked and job growth could slow this year.

Headlines: Tesla's Musk seeks to allay water concerns at factory site after protests
Description: Tesla  Chief Executive Elon Musk sought to allay environmental concerns about the electric carmaker's planned factory in Germany, saying the plant would use less water than was estimated originally.

Headlines: U.S. stock futures fall more than 1 percent as coronavirus fears spread
Description: U.S. S&P500 e-mini futures  fell more than 1% in Asian trade on Monday on mounting worries the new coronavirus outbreak could severely disrupt the Chinese economy, an engine of global growth.

Headlines: WeWork inks office space deal with SoftBank-backed Gympass: sources
Description: WeWork has signed a deal to provide space to 250 employees of gym membership app company Gympass in New York, the latest example of the U.S. office-sharing start-up's majority owner, SoftBank Group Corp, using its connections to buoy its business, people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: U.S. state AGs, Justice Department officials to meet and coordinate on Google probe: sources
Description: U.S. state attorneys general will meet Justice Department attorneys next week to share information on their investigations into Alphabet Inc's Google, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Sunday. The probes revolve around monopolistic behavior that may harm consumers through Google's control of online advertising markets and search traffic.

Headlines: Boeing's 777X jetliner successfully completes maiden flight
Description: Boeing Co successfully staged the first flight of the world's largest twin-engined jetliner on Saturday in a respite from the crisis over its smallest model, the grounded 737 MAX.

Headlines: Electric vehicle maker Rivian: expect prices lower than previously announced
Description: Electric vehicle startup Rivian on Saturday displayed its pickup truck and SUV at an event in San Francisco's Bay Area and said that when their prices are unveiled soon they will be lower than has been previously announced.

Headlines: Boeing 777X jetliner successfully completes maiden flight
Description: Boeing Co  on Saturday successfully completed the maiden flight of the world's largest twin-engined jetliner, the 777X.

Headlines: Walmart testing higher minimum wage for some employees
Description: Walmart Inc is testing a higher starting wage for certain newly created jobs in about 500 U.S. stores, as it looks to improve in-store experience for customers amid intense competition.

Headlines: EU plans more protectionist antitrust rules, data sharing in policy shake-up
Description: The EU plans to adopt more protectionist antitrust rules and encourage businesses to share data as part of an industrial policy overhaul aimed at giving European companies a sharper edge in global markets, a strategy document seen by Reuters shows.

Headlines: Fashion retailer H&M says data protection breaches unacceptable
Description: Fashion retailer H&M  said on Saturday that data security breaches found at its German unit were unacceptable and it was cooperating with the local data protection supervisory authority in its investigation into the matter.

Headlines: Financier doubts add to Boeing's MAX headaches
Description: To restore faith in the 737 MAX, Boeing needs to prove its flagship jet is not just airworthy but also a safe investment.

Headlines: FAA tells U.S. airlines it could approve MAX return to service before mid-year -sources
Description: Federal Aviation Administrator Steve Dickson called senior U.S. airline officials on Friday and told them the agency could approve the grounded Boeing 737 MAX's return to service before mid-year - a faster time frame than the planemaker suggested this week, people briefed on the calls said.

Headlines: U.S. senator slams Tesla's 'misleading' name for Autopilot driver assistance system
Description: A U.S. senator on Friday urged Tesla Inc  to rebrand its driver assistance system Autopilot, saying it has "an inherently misleading name" and is subject to potentially dangerous misuse.

Headlines: Explainer: Bezos allegations put phone hacking technology in the spotlight
Description: Allegations that Amazon.com boss and Washington Post owner Jeff Bezos had his phone hacked by Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman have put a spotlight on the security of smartphones and the secretive tools used to hack them.

Headlines: Owners of solar company that caused loss for Buffett plead guilty over Ponzi scheme
Description: The husband-and-wife owners of DC Solar, a California solar company that caused Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  to take a $377 million charge last year, pleaded guilty on Friday to involvement in an estimated $912 million Ponzi scheme.

Headlines: Starbucks shuts shops, suspends delivery in China's Hubei amid virus outbreak
Description: Starbucks has closed all shops and suspended delivery services in China's Hubei province for the week-long Lunar New Year holiday, where a coronavirus outbreak originated from its capital Wuhan has caused 41 deaths in China.

Headlines: Trump speaks with British PM Johnson about telecoms security: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday discussed the security of telecommunications networks with British Prime Minister Boris Johnson, the White House said, as Britain nears a decision on Huawei's role in the country's future 5G network.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler asks U.S. court to toss out GM racketeering claims: filing
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV  on Friday urged a federal judge to throw out a General Motors Co's  lawsuit accusing Fiat Chrysler of racketeering and bribing officials of the United Auto Workers union to put GM at a multibillion dollar labor cost disadvantage.

Headlines: New U.S. curb on Huawei in limbo amid pushback from Pentagon: sources
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department has withdrawn a rule aimed at further reducing sales to China's Huawei Technologies amid concerns from the Defense Department the move would harm U.S. businesses, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Hopes are high for tech stock 'Cadillacs'; so are their prices
Description: Wall Street is betting that the most popular U.S. technology and internet stocks can keep outshining the broader equities market but their latest rally leaves little room for error this earnings season.

Headlines: Former top U.S. general Dunford joining Lockheed Martin's board
Description: The former top U.S. military official, General Joseph Dunford, has been elected to the board of Lockheed Martin Corp , the Pentagon's largest weapons supplier, the company said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. Justice Dept. plans to hold meeting to discuss tech industry liability: sources
Description: The U.S. Justice Department is planning to hold a conference to discuss the future of a federal law which largely exempts online platforms from legal liability for the material their users post, sources familiar with the plans said on Friday.

Headlines: Remaining hurdles for scandal-hit Wells Fargo
Description: Wells Fargo & Co and its officials have racked up well over $4 billion (3 billion pounds) in penalties since a sales practices scandal erupted in 2016, and continues to face headwinds.

Headlines: U.S. bank regulator sharpens teeth on Wells Fargo, surprising critics
Description: Long accused of being too soft, a U.S. bank regulator has surprised its critics with tough treatment of scandal-ridden lender Wells Fargo, culminating on Thursday in more than$58 million in fines against eight former executives at the bank.

Headlines: Bayer faces fourth U.S. Roundup cancer trial in Monsanto's hometown
Description: Bayer AG is set to face a fourth U.S. jury trial over allegations that its Roundup weed killer causes cancer, with four cancer patients in the hometown of its agricultural subsidiary Monsanto scheduled to begin making their case on Friday.

Headlines: The S&P 500 has worst day since October as virus fears mount
Description: Wall Street fell in a broad sell-off on Friday, as investors fled equities on growing concerns over the scope of the coronavirus outbreak, capping the S&P 500's worst week in six months.

Headlines: Habit Burger Grill plans to offer Impossible plant-based patty
Description: The Habit Restaurants Inc , known as the Habit Burger Grill, plans to put a plant-based meat patty from Impossible Foods Inc on its menu in the second half of this year as a limited-time offering.

Headlines: Impossible or Beyond: U.S. restaurants find partners to go vegan
Description: The world's largest burger chain McDonald's Corp  said this month that it would expand its test of a plant-based meat product with Beyond Meat  patties in Canada, and other chains also are looking to serve vegan customers.

Headlines: Boeing delays 777X first flight again due to bad weather
Description: Boeing has postponed again the first flight of its 777X long-haul jetliner that was scheduled to take place on Friday due to inclement weather.

Headlines: Brent logs worst weekly loss in a year as China virus fears swell
Description: Crude prices sank more than 2% on Friday and Brent logged its biggest weekly decline in more than a year as concerns that a coronavirus will spread farther in China, the world's second-largest oil consumer, curbing travel and oil demand.

Headlines: China virus fears spook U.S. shares, oil prices
Description: U.S. shares and crude prices fell sharply on Friday as investors moved into safe-haven assets amid concerns that a spreading virus from China would curb travel and hurt economic demand.

Headlines: Dollar dips vs yen as investors reach for safe havens on virus scare
Description: The U.S. dollar slipped against the safe-haven Japanese yen on Friday as investors fretted over concerns that a spreading virus from China would curb travel and hurt economic demand.

Headlines: Boeing weighing new 787 Dreamliner production cut: sources
Description: Boeing Co is weighing another production cut of its 787 Dreamliner, but may not have to take that step depending on the size and timing of orders from China stemming from a recent U.S. trade agreement, people briefed on the matter said Friday.

Headlines: Four-comma club: Predicting the next company to join trillion-dollar value elite
Description: The trillion-dollar market cap club expanded last week to a third U.S. company, with Google parent Alphabet Inc  topping the lofty valuation mark. Adding the next member, however, is likely to take a while.

Headlines: Nestle teams up with Canadian plant-based ingredient makers
Description: Food company Nestle SA  said on Friday it has teamed up with small Canadian plant-based food ingredient makers Burcon  and Merit Functional Foods, the second such supply agreement this month that targets Canadian crops.

Headlines: Intel's blockbuster results lift shares to dotcom peak, fire up sector
Description: Intel Corp's  shares hit their highest in nearly two decades on Friday after cloud computing demand fired up the chipmaker's data center business and allayed concerns of market share loss to rival AMD, lifting stocks across the sector.

Headlines: Bombardier scrambles to craft rail merger with Alstom, Hitachi: sources
Description: Bombardier  has approached France's Alstom  and Japan's Hitachi  to find a merger partner for its rail business as it struggles to contain costs that have eaten into margins, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Brazil investors pour record $5.4 billion into domestic equity funds: BAML
Description: Brazilian investors are pouring a record amount of cash into local equity funds, while foreign investors notched up their sixth straight week of buying, Bank of America Merrill Lynch said on Friday.

Headlines: Ericsson hit by higher 5G costs and weaker U.S. market
Description: Sweden's Ericsson  warned it faced higher costs this year as it rolls out new 5G networks and was also hit by a temporary slowdown in its U.S. market, sending its shares 7% lower on Friday.    After a number of lean years, Ericsson has been boosted by the roll-out of 5G, particularly in the United States, and analysts hope it can benefit from a U.S. campaign to shut out Chinese rival Huawei [HWT.UL] from supplying 5G equipment.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury Secretary Mnuchin expects next China trade talks in 'near future'
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday that he expects to begin negotiations with China on a so-called Phase 2 trade deal soon, with Washington and Beijing on the same page.

Headlines: BlackRock, Franklin Templeton eye partnership with Banco do Brasil's asset management unit: report
Description: Asset managers BlackRock Inc., Franklin Templeton and Principal Financial Group are vying for a partnership with state-controlled lender Banco do Brasil's asset management unit, a Brazilian newspaper reported on Friday.

Headlines: Italy watchdog threatens Facebook with another fine over improper use of data
Description: Italy's competition watchdog said on Friday it has launched proceedings against Facebook for non-compliance with a request to correct improper commercial practices in the group's treatment of user data.

Headlines: Bytedance's TikTok hires Microsoft IP chief as general counsel
Description: Popular mobile video app TikTok said on Friday it has hired attorney Erich Andersen from Microsoft to serve as the company's global general counsel, reporting to president Alex Zhu.

Headlines: JPMorgan hires senior tech executive from Goldman Sachs: memo
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  has hired senior banking technology executive Gavin Leo-Rhynie as head of engineering and architecture for the corporate and investment bank (CIB), according to a memo seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Lebanon and Japan have 40 days to agree on Ghosn's fate: sources
Description: Lebanon and Japan have about 40 days to decide whether ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn will be extradited to Japan or stand trial in Lebanon, a judicial source and a source close to Ghosn said on Thursday, following his escape from Japan last month.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. pushing India to buy $5-6 billion more farm goods to seal trade deal - sources
Description: The United States wants India to buy at least another $5-6 billion worth of American farm goods if New Delhi wants to win reinstatement of a key U.S. trade concession and seal a wider pact, four sources familiar with the talks told Reuters.

Headlines: AmEx profit beats on strong U.S. holiday season spending
Description: Credit card issuer American Express Co  reported a fourth-quarter profit on Friday that beat analysts' estimates, as more people used its cards for shopping and paying bills while a strong U.S. retail sales environment also helped.

Headlines: Sale of Renk, MAN Energy Solutions depends on buyer: Volkswagen labor chief
Description: Workers' approval of a possible divestment of Volkswagen's  transmissions making unit Renk  and MAN Energy Solutions depends on who the new owner will be, the carmaker's labor chief said on Friday.

Headlines: Bargain hunters fire up rally in cannabis stocks
Description: Some cannabis stocks are seeing their prices surge as investors hunt for winners in the ashes of an industry shakeout that hammered share prices last year.

Headlines: Bayer Shares up 2.3% on report about possible glyphosate settlement
Description: Shares in seeds and pesticides maker Bayer  opened 2.3% higher on Friday, driven by a report on a possible out-of-court settlement of a U.S. jury trial over allegations that its weed killer Roundup causes cancer.

Headlines: SoftBank-backed CloudMinds slashes workforce amid cash burn: sources
Description: SoftBank-backed cloud robotics and artificial intelligence startup CloudMinds is slashing its global workforce as it burns through cash after repeated attempts to list on the stock market, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump to sign USMCA trade deal Wednesday at the White House - source
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will sign a trade pact between the United States, Mexico and Canada on Wednesday during a ceremony at the White House, an administration official told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. extradition battle over Huawei's Meng ends first phase but Canada court fight continues
Description: The first phase of battle over whether Huawei Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou should be extradited to the United States wrapped up on Thursday after four days, with lawyers for Meng challenging prosecution claims that her alleged actions are a crime in Canada.

Headlines: Insys founder Kapoor sentenced to 66 months in prison for opioid scheme
Description: John Kapoor, the founder of Insys Therapeutics Inc, on Thursday was sentenced to 66 months in prison for his role in a bribery and fraud scheme that contributed to the U.S. opioid crisis.

Headlines: U.S. to unveil crackdown on counterfeit, pirated e-commerce goods
Description: The Trump administration plans to unveil efforts on Friday to crack down on counterfeit and pirated goods sold on major e-commerce sites and urge companies to do more to vet third-party sellers and increase self-policing efforts.

Headlines: Westpac economists now see RBA delaying rate cut to April
Description: Analysts at Westpac Banking Corp  now expect the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) will cut interest rates in April, rather than February, following a second month of surprisingly upbeat jobs data.

Headlines: Intel signals 2020 will be a turnaround year for chip industry leader
Description: Intel Corp  on Thursday cemented the market view that the chip industry is turning around after a prolonged slowdown, forecasting better 2020 revenue and profit than Wall Street anticipated, driven by cloud computing demand.

Headlines: Trump announces adjustments to tariff quotas for washing machines
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump announced on Thursday that tariff quotas on washing machines would be allocated on a quarterly rather than an annual basis, saying that domestic producers had begun to do better in the face of foreign competitors but more was left to be done.

Headlines: Boeing reschedules 777X plane's first test flight for Friday
Description: Boeing Co  said its 777X aircraft's first test flight would take place on Friday after bad weather delayed its scheduled takeoff on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. bank regulator charges ex-Wells Fargo executives for role in sales scandal
Description: Wells Fargo & Co's U.S. regulator on Thursday announced it had banned former Chief Executive John Stumpf from the banking industry and charged him and seven other former executives combined more than $58 million in civil penalties for their roles in the bank's multi-year sales practices scandal.

Headlines: S&P 500 gains, Nasdaq hits new high as investors eye earnings, coronavirus
Description: The S&P 500 ended slightly higher and the Nasdaq eked out a record closing high on Thursday, helped by a jump in Netflix, while news about the coronavirus outbreak spreading from China and mixed earnings results kept a lid on the market.

Headlines: Jeep, Suzuki models found to have broken EU emissions rules
Description: Fiat Chrysler's  Jeep Grand Cherokee and Suzuki's  Vitara diesel models both break emissions rules and must be fixed or face a ban on sales across Europe, the Dutch road authority ruled on Thursday.

Headlines: JPMorgan board raises CEO Dimon's pay to $31.5 million
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon got a half-million-dollar raise for 2019, bringing his total compensation for the year to $31.5 million, the company said in a filing on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Guyana opening search for oil firm to trade its crude - official
Description: Guyana's government next month plans to begin a search for an oil company or trading firm to market its share of the South American country's crude, the director of the Department of Energy, Mark Bynoe, said in an interview.

Headlines: Italy tax police search offices of Eni managers in obstruction probe: sources
Description: Italian tax police searched the Milan offices of three managers at Eni  on Thursday to widen an investigation into suspected obstruction of justice by officials at the Italian oil group, two sources said.

Headlines: Airlines scour the world for scarce 737 MAX simulators
Description: (This January 21 story corrects reference to Copa being the only Latin American airline with a 737 MAX simulator, clarifies 245 refers to 737 MAX pilots not total pilots in paragraph 20)

Headlines: Broadcom to supply wireless components to Apple
Description: Chipmaker Broadcom Inc  said on Thursday it has entered into two multi-year agreements with Apple Inc  for the supply of wireless components used in its products.

Headlines: Coronavirus fears weigh on global equity markets
Description: The biggest tumble in Chinese stocks in more than eight months led global equity markets lower on Thursday as concern mounted about the coronavirus outbreak in China.

Headlines: Insys founder Kapoor sentenced to 66 months in prison: judge
Description: Insys Therapeutics founder John Kapoor was sentenced to 66 months in prison for his role in an opioid fraud scheme by a U.S. district judge in Boston on Thursday.

Headlines: Ex-Wells Fargo executives face civil charges, multimillion-dollar fines from U.S. bank regulator
Description: A U.S. bank regulator announced Thursday that several senior former Wells Fargo executives face potential lifetime industry bans and millions of dollars in civil penalties for their roles in the bank's long-running sales practices scandal.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs to companies: Hire at least one woman director if you want to go public
Description: From June 30, Goldman Sachs Group Inc will only help take a company public if it has at least one diverse board member, as such companies perform better after listing, Chief Executive David Solomon said on CNBC on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. regulator to review recommendation on Fiat Chrysler's Jeep complaint against Mahindra
Description: A U.S. regulator said it will review part of a recommendation made last fall that India's Mahindra and Mahindra Ltd infringed upon the intellectual property rights of Fiat Chrysler Automobiles' Jeep SUV design.

Headlines: Xerox nominates new HP board after buyout rebuffs
Description: Xerox Holdings Corp said on Thursday it plans to nominate 11 independent candidates to HP Inc's board, seeking to take control of the personal computer maker after several rejections of its $33.5 billion buyout offer.

Headlines: Amazon asks court to pause Microsoft's work on Pentagon's JEDI contract
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Wednesday it filed a motion in court to pause the U.S. Department of Defense and Microsoft Corp from carrying out an up to $10 billion cloud computing deal until a court rules on its protest of the contract award.

Headlines: Oil falls 2% as specter of China virus threatens fuel demand
Description: Oil prices fell 2% on Thursday on concern that the spread of a virus from China could lower fuel demand if it stunts economic growth, but losses were limited by a drawdown in U.S. crude inventories.

Headlines: Dollar up vs euro as ECB holds rates steady, launches review
Description: The dollar rose against the euro on Thursday after the European Central Bank held interest rates steady and launched a broad review of its policy that was likely to see new President Christine Lagarde redefine the ECB's main goal and how to achieve it.

Headlines: American, Southwest say demand helping competitors while 737 MAX sits parked
Description: Healthy travel demand is cushioning results for American Airlines Group Inc  and Southwest Airlines Co , the two said on Thursday, while warning they are losing customers as their Boeing 737 MAX jets remain parked in a global grounding.

Headlines: French investigators to move ahead with Ghosn prosecution over palace party
Description: French prosecutors investigating a party that former Renault-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn threw for his wife at the sumptuous Versailles palace will in the next few weeks ask judges to examine the case, bringing a prosecution a step closer.

Headlines: JetBlue shares jump after airline surpasses cost-cutting target
Description: JetBlue Airways Corp  said on Thursday it had shaved $314 million from its cost base over the past three years, delivering on a cost-cutting drive designed to enable budget-friendly airfares over the next decade.

Headlines: S&P Global places Boeing's rating on credit watch negative
Description: S&P Global Ratings on Thursday placed Boeing Co's  'A-' credit rating on 'credit watch' with negative implications, citing a rise in costs and cash outflows at the U.S. planemaker due to a further delay in the grounded 737 MAX's recertification.

Headlines: ECB's Lagarde launches policy overhaul that will leave no stone unturned
Description: The European Central Bank launched a broad review of its policy on Thursday that is likely to see new President Christine Lagarde redefine the ECB's main goal and how to achieve it.

Headlines: Comcast takes aim at CNN with NBC-Sky global news channel: FT
Description: Comcast's  NBC and Sky will jointly launch a global news channel taking aim at CNN, the Financial Times reported https://www.ft.com/content/cf3aafce-3d30-11ea-a01a-bae547046735 on Thursday.

Headlines: Comcast results beat forecasts on broadband growth; 'Cats' hits NBC Universal unit
Description: Comcast Corp  on Thursday beat Wall Street's revenue and profit estimates due to growth in broadband customers, but the company lost more cable TV subscribers than Wall Street expected and its NBC Universal unit revenues were hurt as the film "Cats" bombed at the box office.

Headlines: Union Pacific shares rise as CEO says U.S.-China trade pact should help end rail slump
Description: Union Pacific Corp  shares rose more than 2% on Thursday after executives at the railroad operator said the U.S.-China trade pact should help reverse slumping volumes in the second half of 2020.

Headlines: PES creditors fight to reject refinery sale to Hilco: court documents
Description: Creditors of bankrupt Philadelphia Energy Solutions are opposing the sale of its oil refinery to Hilco Redevelopment Partners, saying another developer made a more lucrative bid for the site, according to court documents filed on Thursday.

Headlines: Carlyle looking at 'relatively cheap' energy assets: Rubenstein
Description: Fears about the future of energy assets have led to a sell-off, but this has created "very good opportunities" for the Carlyle Group, its founder, David Rubenstein, said on Thursday.

Headlines: Blues health insurers put up $55 million to take on generic drug makers
Description: A group of Blue Cross Blue Shield insurers is investing $55 million in a venture that aims to offer cheaper prices to their members on generic drugs that currently have little or no competition, the companies said on Thursday.

Headlines: Apple pushes back against EU common charger, warns of innovation risks
Description: iPhone maker Apple on Thursday pushed back against EU lawmakers' call for a common charger, warning the move could hamper innovation, create a mountain of electronic waste and irk consumers.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims rise modestly; labor market tight
Description: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits increased less than expected last week, suggesting the labor market continues to tighten even as job growth is slowing.

Headlines: Tesla's German factory gets off to an explosive start
Description: Seven U.S. bombs from World War Two have been found in the plot of land outside Berlin where electric car pioneer Tesla  wants to build its first European factory, local authorities said on Thursday.

Headlines: Tesla overtakes Volkswagen as world's second most valuable carmaker
Description: Tesla Inc  has overtaken Germany's Volkswagen  as the world's second most valuable carmaker behind Japan's Toyota , as the meteoric rise in the U.S. electric vehicle maker's shares reshuffles the global market.

Headlines: P&G sales growth shy of forecasts as slowing birthrate hurts diaper sales
Description: Procter & Gamble Co  on Thursday posted quarterly sales that missed analysts' expectations for the first time in five quarters, hurt by weakness in baby and feminine care products such as Pampers diapers and Tampax tampons.

Headlines: M&A strong though Chinese buyers lacking: Citigroup's Kalvaria
Description: Geopolitical uncertainties are not deterring Citigroup Inc clients from strategic deals and some unicorns' offer "great potential", but outbound Chinese buyers are lacking, Leon Kalvaria, chairman of the lender's institutional clients group said.

Headlines: United says does not expect to fly the 737 MAX this summer
Description: (This Jan. 22 story corrects attribution in first and second paragraphs to Chief Commerical Officer Andrew Nocella from President Scott Kirby)

Headlines: Britain's Morrisons axes 3,000 management jobs in stores shake-up
Description: British supermarket group Morrisons  plans to cut 3,000 management jobs as part of a workforce restructuring that will create 7,000 frontline jobs in its stores, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Southwest sees 737 MAX costs continuing to lash profits this year
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  said on Thursday that the Boeing 737 MAX grounding will continue weighing on its profits in the first quarter and warned that it will likely extend flight cancellations beyond June as the jets look set to remain parked longer than expected.

Headlines: Waymo to test autonomous trucks, vans in Texas and New Mexico
Description: Waymo, the self-driving unit of Alphabet Inc , said on Thursday it will start testing autonomous trucks and vans in Texas and New Mexico this week.

Headlines: From Communist-era roots to cash cows: Poland's gaming industry takes on the world
Description: The drab exteriors of a pair of 1970s buildings in an industrial Warsaw neighborhood belie the hive of high-tech activity inside where developers, screenplay writers and others at leading video game maker CD Projekt hustle to create the next global hit.

Headlines: Factbox: Polish video game productions that have hit the jackpot
Description: Poland's booming video game and esports market was worth $664 million in 2019, according to PwC, and is projected to climb to nearly $850 million over the next four years.

Headlines: American Airlines beats quarterly profit estimates on strong travel demand
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  edged past Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit on Thursday, as strong travel demand and lower fuel costs cushioned the U.S. carrier from flight cancellations due to the 737 MAX grounding.

Headlines: Lebanon's new government may have little reserves left to stabilize economy
Description: Lebanon's new government faces huge upcoming debt repayments and a currency peg at breaking point, but it may already have run out of the hard cash firepower it needs to tackle these problems.

Headlines: Mexico goes ghost as its oil hedge bill spirals
Description: Mexico is playing a risky game of hide and seek with the oil market.

Headlines: United States cautions Britain over Huawei
Description: The United States cautioned Britain ahead of a decision by Prime Minister Boris Johnson on what role Huawei will have in 5G telecommunications networks that Washington still had significant concerns about the Chinese telecoms behemoth.

Headlines: Volkswagen CEO: Seat's de Meo probably in talks with Renault - CNBC
Description: The chief executive of Volkswagen  said Luca de Meo, who stepped down as chief executive of the German carmaker's Spanish Seat brand this month, was probably in talks with French carmaker Renault .

Headlines: CITIC Capital bidding for 22% McDonald's China stake: chief
Description: Chinese private equity firm CITIC Capital is actively bidding for a 22% stake in McDonald's Corp's  mainland China and Hong Kong businesses, its chairman and chief executive told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: BP appoints new finance chief as Looney prepares to take over
Description: BP's  finance chief Brian Gilvary is to step down in June after eight years in the role and will be replaced by a close ally of Bernard Looney who takes over as chief executive next month.

Headlines: Australia's Westpac hires 'Mack the knife' McFarlane to chair crisis-hit bank
Description: Australia's Westpac Banking Corp  named a former Barclays  boss as chairman on Thursday, entrusting veteran banker John McFarlane with the task of steering it through the country's biggest money-laundering scandal.

Headlines: Britain to United States: We want a trade deal and a digital tax
Description: Britain wants a trade deal with the United States but will impose a digital service tax on the revenue of companies such as Google, Facebook and Amazon, business minister Andrea Leadsom said on Thursday.

Headlines: Boeing's new CEO orders rethink on key jetliner project
Description: Boeing Co's  new chief executive has sent the aerospace giant back to the drawing board on proposals for a new mid-market aircraft, effectively shelving in their current form plans worth $15 billion-$20 billion that had been overtaken by the 737 MAX crisis.

Headlines: Siemens CEO Kaeser asks Trump for equal treatment in Mideast
Description: Siemens  Chief Executive Joe Kaeser said he was seeing a more positive mood among the German engineering company's clients at the start of the year, he told CNBC on Thursday.

Headlines: Explainer: Global airlines on high alert as virus outbreak spreads
Description: Airlines and passengers are on guard against a new flu-like virus that originated in Wuhan, China.

Headlines: Chinese listed companies ramp up virus efforts after president's call
Description: A number of Chinese listed companies - ranging from biotech firms, drugmakers, mask producers and thermometer manufacturers - announced efforts in response to a national call to fight the outbreak of the Wuhan coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: Malaysia to buy more Indian sugar to resolve palm oil spat - sources
Description: Malaysia's top sugar refiner said it will increase purchases of the commodity from India, which according to two sources is part of efforts to placate New Delhi amid an ongoing spat over palm oil imports.

Headlines: U.S. economy to coast, no big boost expected from trade deal: Reuters poll
Description: The initial trade deal between Washington and Beijing is unlikely to provide a significant boost to the U.S. economy and will only reduce the downside risk or at best help activity moderately, a Reuters poll showed.

Headlines: After China trade deal, Europe and UK next on Trump's to-do list
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump vowed to rip up international trade deals and rebalance America's global trade relationships.

Headlines: Boeing delays 777X plane's first test flight due to bad weather
Description: Boeing Co  said on Wednesday it was delaying 777X airplane's first test flight, which was scheduled to take place on Thursday, due to bad weather.

Headlines: Activist hedge fund Elliott sells stakes in Hyundai Motor companies: paper
Description: Elliott Management sold all its shares in Hyundai Motor Group companies last year after it was thwarted in its campaign for huge special dividends and board seats, South Korean media reported.

Headlines: PG&E strikes deal with creditors over restructuring
Description: Bankrupt California power producer PG&E Corp  said on Wednesday it had reached a deal on its restructuring with creditors, who were pushing for a rival plan.

Headlines: Boeing CEO expects to resume 737 MAX production before mid-year
Description: Boeing Chief Executive Dave Calhoun told reporters on Wednesday the U.S. planemaker expects to resume 737 MAX production months before its forecasted mid-year return to service and said it did not plan to suspend or cut its dividend.

Headlines: Toyota union to seek smaller pay rise in 2020 vs last year: NHK
Description: Toyota Motor Corp's  labour union plans to seek an average pay rise of 10,100 yen ($91.98) per month in wage negotiations this year, public broadcaster NHK reported on Thursday, 600 yen less than the increase granted last year.
