Headlines: UK pay settlements slow in December, start 2020 cautiously: XpertHR
Description: British employers offered their staff a median annual pay settlement of 2.2% in the three months to December, down from 2.6% in the three months to November, industry data showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Finance wants competitiveness role for UK watchdogs after Brexit
Description: Britain's regulators should have a formal role after Brexit to keep the financial sector globally competitive and less prone to  "gold-plating" international norms, an industry think tank said on Thursday.

Headlines: Avolon CEO sees new Boeing MAX timeline as 'worst case scenario'
Description: The head of aircraft lessor Avolon, which has committed to a fleet of 148 Boeing  737 MAX jets, said he believed the planemaker's new June to July horizon for getting the grounded aircraft back in the air was a "worst case scenario."

Headlines: Commonwealth Bank of Australia's pension arm hit with another class-action lawsuit
Description: Commonwealth Bank of Australia  said on Thursday a class-action lawsuit was filed against its pension arm, Colonial First State, for allegedly not acting in customers interest for insurance policies.

Headlines: Canadian judge approves C$196.5 mln Volkswagen fine for diesel emissions
Description: A judge in Canada approved a C$196.5 million ($149.7 million) fine against Volkswagen AG  on Wednesday after the company pleaded guilty to dozens of counts of diesel emissions violations.

Headlines: Kinder Morgan profit, cash flow rise on Gulf Coast Express pipeline strength
Description: U.S. pipeline operator Kinder Morgan Inc  reported a 26% rise in quarterly profit on Wednesday, benefiting from higher gas takeaway from the Permian Basin through its Gulf Coast Express pipeline.

Headlines: Ford expects $2.2 billion pre-tax hit related to pension plans in fourth quarter
Description: Ford Motor Co  said on Wednesday its fourth quarter results will be hit by a pre-tax loss of about $2.2 billion due to higher contributions to its employees pension plans.

Headlines: Cathay to let crew wear masks on all flights due to new coronavirus
Description: Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd  will allow all crew members and frontline employees to wear surgical masks due to concerns over a new coronavirus, and said passengers to and from Wuhan, China, could change or cancel flights for free through March 31.

Headlines: Tech sector pushes the S&P 500 to slight gain
Description: Technology shares led the S&P 500 marginally higher on Wednesday, as a healthy forecast from IBM helped mitigate worries over the developing coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Stocks edge up, oil drops as China virus worries abate
Description: World stock markets gained back some ground on Wednesday as investors took heart from measures to curb the spread of a flu-like virus from China, while oil prices tumbled on a forecast for a market surplus.

Headlines: Oil slides 2% as glut forecast, China virus overshadow Libya disruption
Description: Oil prices fell more than 2% on Wednesday as a market surplus forecast by the International Energy Agency (IEA) and demand worries amid the outbreak of a virus in China outweighed concern over disruptions to Libya's crude output.

Headlines: U.S., Canadian oil company bankruptcies surge 50% in 2019: report
Description: The number of oil and gas company bankruptcies in the United States and Canada rose 50% in 2019 over the previous year, and is likely to increase as a slide in energy prices continues to shake producers  Dallas law firm Haynes and Boone said in a report released on Wednesday.

Headlines: Canada prosecutors say fraud at heart of Huawei CFO Meng's U.S. extradition case
Description: Huawei Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou returned to a Vancouver courtroom on Wednesday where Canadian prosecutors defended a U.S. extradition request, saying Meng's alleged bank fraud is the heart of the case that has strained relations between Ottawa and Beijing.

Headlines: Angola's dos Santos named suspect over alleged fraud, selling Eurobic stake
Description: Angola's billionaire former first daughter, Isabel dos Santos, has decided to sell her stake in Portuguese bank Eurobic, the small lender said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Dollar steady as coronavirus contagion fears abate
Description: The U.S. dollar was unchanged against a basket of currencies on Wednesday as safe-haven demand ebbed along with worries about whether the spread of a flu-like coronavirus would hurt the global economy.

Headlines: Google finds security flaws in Apple's web browser: FT
Description: Google researchers have found multiple security flaws in Apple Inc's Safari web browser that allowed the tracking of users' browsing behavior, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday, citing a soon-to-be published paper.

Headlines: Michigan, Tesla settle suit over direct vehicle sales
Description: Tesla Inc and the state of Michigan confirmed Wednesday they have resolved the company's 2016 lawsuit challenging the state's refusal to allow the company to sell vehicles directly to consumers.

Headlines: Real estate developer in $240 million deal to buy Philadelphia refinery
Description: Real estate developer Hilco Redevelopment Partners has entered into a $240 million agreement to purchase the Philadelphia Energy Solutions (PES) oil refinery, which was the largest and oldest on the East Coast, according to court documents on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump threatens big tariffs on car imports from EU
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday threatened to impose high tariffs on imports of cars from the European Union if the bloc doesn't agree to a trade deal.

Headlines: No alternative to grounded Boeing 737 MAX, Aercap CEO says
Description: There is no alternative to the grounded 737 MAX and it would be "absolutely stupid" for Boeing  to launch a replacement before the next wave of technology a decade from now, the head of one of the world's top aircraft lessors said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Tesla's furious rally pushes market value past $100 billion
Description: Tesla Inc shares surged on Wednesday, and the company became the first publicly listed U.S. automaker to cross $100 billion in market valuation, more than Ford Motor Co and General Motors Co combined.

Headlines: GM's Cruise unit unveils driverless prototype vehicle for ride-sharing service
Description: General Motors Co's  self-driving car unit, Cruise, on Tuesday unveiled a prototype electric vehicle with no steering wheel or pedals for use in its planned autonomous ride-sharing service.

Headlines: Lab-grown meat producer Memphis Meats raises $161 million in funding led by SoftBank
Description: Lab-grown meat producer Memphis Meats said on Wednesday it raised $161 million in a funding round led by Japan's SoftBank Group , Singapore's wealth fund Temasek Holdings and Norwest Venture Partners.

Headlines: U.S. stocks correction overdue, Bloomberg best placed to beat Trump: Scaramucci
Description: U.S. stocks are headed higher, although a 10% correction is "long overdue", Anthony Scaramucci, founder and co-managing partner of Skybridge Capital, said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Laid-off Philadelphia refinery workers struggle with shrinking sector
Description: Third-generation Philadelphia oil refinery worker Lee Murray wore his late father's hard hat every day of the 25 years he spent there.

Headlines: UniCredit shuffles top managers in Italy, names new Americas CIB head
Description: Italy's biggest bank UniCredit  said on Wednesday it had appointed a number of senior managers to new roles, shuffling people across jobs as it works to implement its 'Team 23' four-year plan unveiled in December.

Headlines: Explainer: As Britain decides, Europe grapples with Huawei conundrum
Description: Britain's impending decision on whether to allow Huawei [HWT.UL] to supply equipment for 5G mobile networks comes at a delicate time, with debate raging in European capitals over the security implications of reliance on Chinese technology.

Headlines: Coronavirus set to impact Chinese airlines' first quarter profit: Aercap CEO
Description: The chief executive of one of the world's largest aircraft lessors, Aercap , expects the new coronavirus that has emerged from Wuhan, China to impact Chinese airlines' profitability in the first quarter.

Headlines: Hainan Airlines to halt Prague flights from March: Czech authorities
Description: China's Hainan Airlines will halt regular direct flights between Beijing and Prague starting in March, the Prague Airport and the Czech Foreign Ministry said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Google CEO eyes major opportunity in healthcare, says will protect privacy
Description: Sundar Pichai, the CEO of Alphabet Inc and its Google subsidiary, said on Wednesday that healthcare offers the biggest potential over the next five to 10 years for using artificial intelligence to improve outcomes, and vowed that the technology giant will heed privacy concerns.

Headlines: French anti-corruption agency runs checks on Renault
Description: Renault  on Wednesday said France's anti-corruption agency was carrying out checks at the company, though a source at the carmaker, which was rocked by the arrest of former boss Carlos Ghosn, said the inspection was a routine matter.

Headlines: U.S. home sales surge to near two-year high; supply at record low
Description: U.S. home sales jumped to their highest level in nearly two years in December, the latest indication that lower mortgage rates are helping the housing market to regain its footing after hitting a soft patch in 2018, though record low inventory could be an obstacle to continued strong gains.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler CEO: Peugeot merger talks progressing well
Description: Fiat Chrysler's  chief executive Michael Manley said on Wednesday that merger talks with Peugeot owner PSA  to create the world's No. 4 carmaker are progressing well and he hopes to have a deal within 12-14 months.

Headlines: Abbott hits all-time high on quarterly revenue beat
Description: Abbott Laboratories Inc's  shares rose to an all-time high on Wednesday after the device maker beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly sales on higher demand for its nutrition products and generic drugs.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley executive Rich Portogallo to retire: memo
Description: Veteran Morgan Stanley  executive Rich Portogallo, who was key in building the bank's prime-brokerage business, is retiring, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wall Street analysts buy into Netflix optimism amid Disney threat
Description: Netflix Inc acknowledged pressure from Disney+ after the company reported its quarterly results. But executives largely brushed off the long-term global impact of rivals that also include Apple, Comcast Corp's NBCUniversal and AT&T Inc.

Headlines: Boeing says new MAX delay not due to new technical issues
Description: Boeing's  decision to advise customers its grounded 737 MAX jet was unlikely to secure flight approval until mid-year was not due to any new technical issues, a senior marketing executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Incoming Abbott CEO says not looking to do any deals
Description: Abbott Laboratories'  incoming Chief Executive Officer Robert Ford said on Wednesday that deal-making was not on the company's agenda.

Headlines: U.S. OKs Kinder Morgan request to start Texas Lockridge natgas pipe work
Description: The U.S. Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) on Wednesday approved Kinder Morgan Inc's  Dec. 13 request to start construction of its proposed Lockridge natural gas pipeline in the Permian basin in West Texas.

Headlines: J&J forecasts weak annual profit, misses revenue estimates
Description: Johnson & Johnson on Wednesday forecast 2020 profit  below Wall Street estimates and said increased competition for its off-patent treatments could somewhat limit growth in the top-earning pharmaceuticals unit.

Headlines: Baker Hughes profit misses estimates as LNG equipment demand wanes
Description: Oilfield services provider Baker Hughes Co  on Wednesday posted lower-than-expected earnings, hit by lower sales and orders in its business that supplies turbines and compressors to liquefied natural gas (LNG) producers.

Headlines: ValueAct CEO Jeff Ubben to step down: source
Description: ValueAct Capital Partners LP's founder Jeff Ubben is stepping down as chief executive officer and will be replaced by the activist hedge fund's president, Mason Morfit, according to a source familiar with the matter.

Headlines: WeWork offloads non-core business Teem, stake in The Wing
Description: Shared workplace operator WeWork said on Wednesday it sold cloud and analytics services provider Teem to digital workplace solutions provider iOFFICE, as it offloads non-core businesses after a botched initial public offering last year.

Headlines: Toyota recalls 361,000 vehicles for air bag inflator issue
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  said on Wednesday it is recalling 361,000 older vehicles worldwide for potentially defective air bag inflators.

Headlines: Air Canada to not fly the MAX until June 30
Description: Air Canada  said on Wednesday it has removed Boeing's  737 MAX from its flight schedule until June 30, 2020, a day after the U.S. planemaker warned the grounded jet would not win regulatory approval until mid-year.

Headlines: Wall Street pegs Boeing's 737 MAX bill at more than $25 billion
Description: Boeing Co's  bill for the 737 MAX grounding could balloon to more than $25 billion, analysts estimated on Wednesday, a day after the U.S. planemaker warned of further delay in returning its once best-selling jet to service.

Headlines: PSA not sure if engines it delivered to Mitsubishi are part of German probe
Description: French carmaker PSA  said on Wednesday it did not know if 1.6 liter diesel engines it supplied to Japanese carmaker Mitsubishi  between 2015 and 2018 are part of a probe in Germany.

Headlines: With record profits on Wall Street, small bonuses will annoy bankers: experts
Description: Most Wall Street banks announced their fourth quarter profits beat industry expectations last week. But by the end of this week, bank sources and compensation experts told Reuters, most of their staff will be underwhelmed by their bonuses.

Headlines: Airbus hits record highs, 737 MAX buyers fall on latest Boeing news
Description: Airbus'  shares hit record highs on Wednesday, after U.S. arch rival Boeing  warned of further delay in returning its grounded 737 MAX airliner to service, while Boeing customers and suppliers fell on the news.

Headlines: Exclusive: Eurazeo hires banks for $2.2 billion sale of payments firm Planet - sources
Description: European buyout fund Eurazeo  has hired Citigroup  and Evercore to prepare the sale of its payments business Planet in a deal that could value the Irish firm at up to 2 billion euros ($2.22 billion), three sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Daimler profits halve on diesel and restructuring charges
Description: Daimler  warned its earnings halved in 2019 and it faced further charges of up to 1.5 billion euros ($1.7 billion)related to diesel pollution, in the latest blow to the German luxury carmaker.

Headlines: Sainsbury's turns to retail boss as CEO checks out
Description: Sainsbury's  has picked retail and operations director Simon Roberts to succeed CEO Mike Coupe, the architect of the British supermarket group's failed bid for rival Asda who will step down in May after six years at the helm.

Headlines: Insurers look to curb ransomware exposure as U.S. cyber rates rise
Description: U.S. insurers are ramping up cyber-insurance rates by as much as 25% and trying to curb exposure to vulnerable customers after a surge of costly claims, industry sources said.

Headlines: Boeing warns of new 737 MAX delay, now sees mid-year return to service
Description: Boeing Co said on Tuesday it does not expect to win approval for the return of the 737 MAX to service until mid-year due to further potential developments in the certification process and regulatory scrutiny on its flight control system.

Headlines: Factbox: Boeing's changing schedule for 737 MAX fix, return to service
Description: Boeing Co said on Tuesday it does not expect to win approval for the return of the 737 MAX to service until mid-year due to further potential developments in the certification process and regulatory scrutiny on its flight control system.

Headlines: Trump says middle class tax cut to be announced over next 90 days: Fox Business
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday a tax cut for the middle class would be announced over the next 90 days.

Headlines: Trump to break bread with Apple's Cook and other CEOs: sources
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will attend a breakfast meeting on Wednesday with Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook and other business leaders on the sidelines of the annual meeting of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, according to sources familiar with the situation.

Headlines: Latest 737 MAX delay prompts big buyer flydubai to consider leasing options
Description: Airline flydubai, a major Boeing  737 MAX customer, is considering leasing additional aircraft following the latest setback to the grounded jet's return to service.

Headlines: Renault chairman hopes decision on new CEO is made 'in coming days'
Description: Renault  Chairman Jean-Dominique Senard said Wednesday he hoped the decision on the French carmaker's new CEO would be made in "the coming days".

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover to cut 10% of workforce at UK Halewood factory
Description: British carmaker Jaguar Land Rover (JLR)  said on Wednesday it will cut around 10% of the workforce at its northern English Halewood factory as it changes shift patterns to boost efficiency at the site.

Headlines: Exclusive: Bank of America to hire 50 bankers for Asia dealmaking team in 2020 - sources
Description: Bank of America Corp  will recruit about 50 bankers for its investment banking team in Asia this year, as it pushes to bolster its dealmaking business and shore up revenues from the unit, three people with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Activist investor calls on Toshiba Machine to put defense plans before shareholders
Description: Japan's most prominent activist investor on Wednesday demanded Toshiba Machine Co  hold an extraordinary shareholders meeting to discuss its plans to introduce defense measures against a hostile takeover.

Headlines: Major 737 MAX buyer Air Lease remains confident in demand for jet
Description: Aircraft lessor Air Lease Corp , which has ordered 150 of Boeing's  grounded 737 MAX, remains confident in the jet's long-term value, Chief Financial Officer Greg Willis said on Wednesday after Boeing announced a new delay to its return.

Headlines: BlackRock, partners eye initial $500 million for climate fund
Description: A BlackRock-backed  group aims to raise an initial $500 million for a private equity fund that will invest in climate change-linked infrastructure upgrades in emerging markets.

Headlines: Trump says Fed raising rates was a mistake: CNBC
Description: The United States' economy would be growing at a pace near 4% if wasn't for the lingering effect of Federal Reserve rate hikes, President Donald Trump told CNBC in an interview on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: BP's Looney goes all-in on climate goals and explores overhaul
Description: Change is afoot at BP. Incoming Chief Executive Bernard Looney plans to expand the company's climate targets and is considering overhauling the structure of the oil and gas major in one of the biggest shake-ups in its 111-year history.

Headlines: Tesla crosses $100 billion stock market valuation in extended trading
Description: Tesla Inc became the first $100 billion publicly listed U.S. carmaker in extended trading on Tuesday, in a sign of Wall Street's confidence in an all-electric future.

Headlines: Powered by SUVs, Hyundai turns in best quarter since early 2017
Description: Hyundai Motor Co  turned in its best quarterly operating profit in over two years and said it was on track for higher profit margins in 2020, powered by more sales of sport-utility vehicles (SUVs) such as the Palisade and Kona.

Headlines: Five facts about new Sainsbury's CEO Roberts
Description: Simon Roberts has been appointed to replace Mike Coupe as the boss of Britain's second-largest supermarket group Sainsbury's .

Headlines: Ghosn's right-hand man stands high chance of acquittal in Japan: ex-prosecutor
Description: A lieutenant to Carlos Ghosn who is facing charges in Japan for underreporting his salary at Nissan Motor Co  stands a very high chance of being acquitted, as would Ghosn had he remained in Japan to face trial, a former prosecutor said.

Headlines: Boeing eyes developing Israeli technology for light aircraft
Description: Boeing Co  said on Wednesday it has agreed with Israel-based Tactical Robotics to explore development of a ducted fan propulsion technology with potential uses for piloted and autonomous light aircraft.

Headlines: Facebook spurred central banks to study digital currencies: former Japan central banker
Description: The challenge posed by Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency likely prodded major central banks to set up a new group to study the potential for issuing their own digital currencies, a former Bank of Japan executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: 'Death Cross,' growth abroad threaten U.S. dollar
Description: Storm clouds are gathering over the U.S. dollar, threatening a two-year rally in the currency that has squeezed corporate profits and angered President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Netflix forecasts tough start to 2020; Disney+ going global
Description: Netflix Inc has entered a new year that will be far tougher than the one it left behind.

Headlines: Honda recalling 2.7 million North American vehicles for new air bag inflator defect
Description: Honda Motor Co said on Tuesday it will recall 2.7 million older U.S. vehicles in North America for potentially defective air bag inflators.

Headlines: Toyota to recall 3.4 million vehicles worldwide, air bags may not deploy in crashes
Description: Toyota Motor Corp said on Tuesday it will recall 3.4 million vehicles worldwide because of an electronic defect that can result in air bags not deploying in crashes.

Headlines: Facebook tweaks ad policy but still allows political lies in U.S. campaign 2020
Description: Facebook Inc  announced limited changes on Thursday to its approach to political ads, including allowing users to turn off certain ad-targeting tools, but defied critics' demands that it bar politicians from using its ads system to spread lies.

Headlines: Factbox: How social media services handle political ads
Description: (This January 9 story corrects to remove erroneous references to the dates of previous policy changes in paragraphs 13, 18, 32 and 34)

Headlines: Huawei CFO's lawyers argue U.S. extradition charges not a crime in Canada
Description: Huawei Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou returned to a Vancouver court on Tuesday, where her lawyers argued for a second straight day that Meng violated no Canadian laws and should not be extradited to the United States on charges she violated its sanctions.

Headlines: Judge dismisses defunct startup Sidecar's 2018 lawsuit against Uber
Description: Uber Technologies Inc  on Tuesday prevailed in a lawsuit accusing it of driving a smaller rival out of business through predatory pricing and other anticompetitive practices.

Headlines: Factbox: How a virus impacts the economy and markets
Description: The outbreak of a new virus in China has sent shivers through world financial markets, with investors drawing comparisons to the 2003 SARS (Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome) outbreak in order to assess its potential economic impact.

Headlines: Vodafone Group exits Facebook-led Libra currency group
Description: Britain's Vodafone Group PLC  has left the entity that manages the Facebook Inc  led effort to launch Libra, a global digital currency, Libra Association said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Oil market shrugs off Libya crisis amid ample global supply
Description: Oil prices fell on Tuesday on expectations that a well-supplied global market, including supplies from record U.S. production, would be able to absorb disruptions that have cut Libya's crude production to a trickle.

Headlines: Wall Street falls as China virus reaches the U.S.
Description: Wall Street lost ground on Tuesday, backing away from record highs as a viral outbreak from China found its way to U.S. shores and the International Monetary Fund (IMF) lowered its global economic growth forecast.

Headlines: United beats Wall Street expectations despite ongoing 737 MAX delays
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  on Tuesday beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit and held to its 2020 profit target, with a turnaround strategy overseen by its outgoing CEO underpinning growth even as the Boeing 737 MAX remains grounded.

Headlines: IBM forecasts full-year profit above estimates on cloud growth
Description: International Business Machines Corp  forecast full-year profit above market expectations on Tuesday after reporting surprise growth in quarterly revenue, boosted by its high-margin cloud computing business, sending its shares up more than 4%.

Headlines: NYC Transit expects return of Bombardier subway cars to service this week
Description: New York City Transit expects subway cars recently built by Bombardier Inc  to return to service this week, after an estimated 300 cars were yanked earlier in the month due to safety concerns, agency President Andy Byford said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Michigan, Tesla reach agreement for direct car delivery: source
Description: Tesla Inc  has reached a settlement with Michigan to allow the electric-car maker to directly deliver its vehicles to customers in the state, a person familiar with the agreement said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Risk assets fall as Chinese virus triggers anxiety
Description: Risk assets took a hit across the globe on Tuesday, while the Japanese yen and U.S. Treasury prices gained, as financial markets reacted to mounting concern about a new strain of flu-like virus out of China.

Headlines: Exclusive: Philadelphia refinery expected to be sold to real estate developer - sources
Description: The bankrupt Philadelphia Energy Solutions is expected to sell its fire-damaged refinery site to real estate developer Hilco Redevelopment Partners, three sources familiar with the situation said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Apple dropped plan for encrypting backups after FBI complained - sources
Description: Apple Inc  dropped plans to let iPhone users fully encrypt backups of their devices in the company's iCloud service after the FBI complained that the move would harm investigations, six sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Apple lawsuit tests if an employee can plan rival startup while on payroll
Description: Attorneys for a former Apple Inc executive on Tuesday will try to convince a skeptical judge of a core tenet of tech startup culture - that employees can plan a competing venture while still in a job.

Headlines: Facebook targets UK growth with 1,000 hires this year
Description: Facebook will hire 1,000 people in London this year in roles such as product development and safety as it continues to grow its biggest engineering center outside the United States after Britain leaves the European Union.

Headlines: Starbucks to add more plant-based food in latest green push; Beyond Meat shares jump
Description: Starbucks Corp  aims to add more plant-based food and drinks to its menu as part of the company's latest plan to become more environmentally friendly, Chief Executive Kevin Johnson said on Tuesday, prompting a surge in shares of Beyond Meat Inc .

Headlines: Goldman CEO says process on canceled WeWork IPO 'worked'
Description: Goldman Sachs Chief Executive David Solomon called WeWork's abandoned initial public offering (IPO) a great example of the listing process working on Tuesday, even if was "not as pretty as everybody would like it to be".

Headlines: Huawei CFO's lawyer attacks U.S. extradition case in Canadian trial
Description: A lawyer for Huawei Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou argued on Monday that "double criminality" was at the center of a trial to decide whether she can be extradited to the United States, a case that has strained relations between Ottawa and Beijing.

Headlines: Brazil's GOL sees 737 MAX flying by April, compensation talks ongoing
Description: Brazilian low-cost carrier GOL, which has 130 of Boeing's grounded 737 MAX jets on order, expects to be flying the jet by April and hopes to secure a compensation deal within months, chief financial officer Richard Lark said on Monday.

Headlines: Uber tests feature allowing some California drivers to set fares
Description: Uber Technologies Inc  on Tuesday said it is testing a feature that allows some drivers in California to set their own fares, hoping the change will help it show that its drivers are independent contractors rather than employees under state law.

Headlines: China virus scare sends shudder through European luxury goods sector
Description: European luxury stocks slumped across the board on Tuesday on fears that the coronavirus virus outbreak in China could hurt sales of high-end brands that had managed to weather months of protests in Hong Kong.

Headlines: Britain's Sainsbury's to cut hundreds of management jobs
Description: Britain's Sainsbury's  plans to cut hundreds of management jobs as it seeks to bring its main supermarket operation and its Argos general merchandise arm closer together, it said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Halliburton takes $2.2 billion charge on shale slump
Description: U.S. oilfield services firm Halliburton Co. on Tuesday disclosed a $2.2 billion charge to earnings as weakening North American shale activity continued to hit the industry.

Headlines: Honda to join White House initiative to boost U.S. job training
Description: Honda Motor Co  will join on Tuesday a growing number of companies signing a White House pledge to boost U.S. job training opportunities.

Headlines: Citibank to pay $18 million penalty for failing to insure flood-prone properties
Description: A U.S. banking regulator fined Citibank N.A.  $18 million for delays in purchasing mandatory flood insurance for properties where borrowers were located in flood-prone areas.

Headlines: KFC apologizes for 'sexist' Australian ad
Description: KFC on Tuesday apologized for an advertisement in Australia that shows two boys ogling a woman's breasts, after calls from a local campaign group to boycott the fast-food giant over the ad it called "sexist".

Headlines: Aramco IPO proceeds to fund Saudi industry, including defense: finance minister
Description: Saudi Arabia will pump the proceeds from last month's listing of oil giant Saudi Aramco into the local economy over several years, including building up the domestic defense industry amid tensions with Iran, its finance minister said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Air France-KLM proposes buying 49% of Malaysia Airlines, JAL seeks smaller stake: sources
Description: Proposals to invest in ailing Malaysia Airlines include one from Air France-KLM , which wants as much as 49%, while Japan Airlines  is looking at a 25% stake, people with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Air France-KLM says not involved in Malaysia Airlines sale talks
Description: Air France-KLM  said on Tuesday it had previously held talks with the owners of Malaysia Airlines but was not engaged in current efforts to find new investors for the carrier.

Headlines: Uber cuts losses from Eats business in India with sale to Zomato
Description: Uber  has sold its loss-making online food-ordering business in India to local rival Zomato in exchange for a 9.99% stake in the startup backed by China's Ant Financial.

Headlines: Boeing plans to stage first flight of 777X plane this week: sources
Description: Boeing  plans to carry out the first test flight of its delayed 777X airplane later this week, said two people familiar with the matter on Tuesday.

Headlines: EU decision on LSE-Refinitiv deal expected in a few months: LSE director
Description: European competition authorities are expected to rule on the London Stock Exchange's $27 billion takeover of data and analytics company Refinitiv "around the summer", an LSE board member said on Tuesday.

Headlines: BP appoints new finance chief as Looney prepares to take over
Description: BP's  finance chief Brian Gilvary is to step down in June after eight years in the role and will be replaced by a close ally of Bernard Looney who takes over as chief executive next month.

Headlines: Airbus adds new A321 production capabilities in France to meet strong demand
Description: European planemaker Airbus  said on Tuesday that it had decided to create new A321 production capacity at its French site in Toulouse, in order to cope with strong demand.

Headlines: Japan's Aeon aims to serve eco-certified sushi in time for Olympics
Description: Japanese supermarket chain Aeon Co Ltd , Asia's biggest retailer by sales, said it aims to start selling eco-certified sushi this year amid growing demand for sustainable seafood and in time for an expected surge in tourists during the Tokyo Olympics.

Headlines: Key events in Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou's extradition case
Description: Meng Wanzhou, chief financial officer of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, will appear in a Vancouver, Canada, courtroom on Monday for the first day of her extradition trial, a process expected to take months - possibly years - to decide whether she can be extradited from Canada to the United States.

Headlines: Boeing seeks to borrow $10 billion or more amid 737 MAX crisis: source
Description: Boeing Co  is in talks with banks about borrowing $10 billion or more amid rising costs for the U.S. planemaker after two crashes involving its 737 MAX jetliner, a source told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Air Niugini delays delivery of four 737 MAX jets until at least 2024
Description: Papua New Guinea carrier Air Niugini has updated its contract with Boeing Co  to delay the delivery of its four 737 MAX jets on order until at least 2024, the airline's chief executive said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Tesla rebuffs U.S. safety recall petition, says no unintended acceleration in vehicles
Description: Tesla Inc said on Monday there was no unintended acceleration in its vehicles, as it responded to a petition to a U.S. safety regulator to investigate and recall around 500,000 of the company's electric cars over the alleged defect.

Headlines: Mexican union suspends strike threat against Home Depot
Description: A top Mexican trade union said on Monday it has suspended its threat to launch a strike at Home Depot stores across Mexico over labor demands, adding it is in talks with the U.S. home improvement chain to improve pay and benefits for workers.

Headlines: Oil rises as Libya declares force majeure in oilfields
Description: Oil prices rose to their highest in more than a week on Monday after two large crude production bases in Libya began shutting down amid a military blockade, risking reducing crude flows from the OPEC member to a trickle.

Headlines: Brazil's Ambev sets ambitious target to end plastic pollution in packaging
Description: Brazilian beverages company Ambev SA has set an ambitious target of eliminating plastic pollution in its packaging by 2025, in a push that an executive said on Monday has the potential to generate approximately 1 billion reais ($239.09 million) in business.

Headlines: Embraer studies turboprop to be developed through Boeing venture
Description: Brazilian planemaker Embraer  is in the advanced stages of studying the launch of a new turboprop aircraft to be developed through a venture it is planning with Boeing, subject to necessary approvals, a top executive said on Monday.

Headlines: Global FDI dips, hit by Hong Kong divestment, Brexit: U.N.
Description: Global direct foreign investment (FDI) dipped slightly around the world last year, hit by massive divestment in Hong Kong and a drop in flows into Britain due to Brexit uncertainty, the United Nations said on Monday.

Headlines: AerCap CEO warns against panic discounts for Boeing 737 MAX jets
Description: Owners of Boeing's  grounded 737 MAX jet must keep cool heads and avoid offering panic discounts on sale or lease prices to avoid undermining its long-term value, the head of one of the world's largest aircraft lessors Aercap  said on Monday.

Headlines: JPMorgan says 'oui' to Paris expansion post-Brexit
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  is the latest investment bank to significantly expand its Paris hub as part of plans to relocate some services from London after Britain's exit from the European Union, snapping up new premises in the French capital.

Headlines: Boeing customer Air Lease says 'damaged' MAX brand should be dropped
Description: The chairman of major aircraft leasing firm Air Lease , which has 150 of Boeing's  grounded 737 MAX jet on order, on Monday called on the U.S. manufacturer to drop the "damaged" MAX brand to avoid it undermining the plane's value.

Headlines: BBC's Hall to step down ahead of crunch funding talks with British government
Description: The BBC's most powerful man will step down in six months to allow a new person to lead negotiations with Prime Minister Boris Johnson's government over a financing model for the publicly funded broadcaster.

Headlines: Global stocks stay near record highs; focus turns to central banks, earnings
Description: World stocks traded just below record highs on Monday, pausing ahead of this week's central bank meetings, economic data and earnings, while oil prices rose to their highest in over a week after blockades began shutting down two Libyan oilfields.

Headlines: No turning point in sight as IMF predicts sluggish global growth
Description: Global growth appears to have bottomed out but there is no rebound in sight and risks ranging from trade tensions to climate shocks makes the outlook uncertain, a top International Monetary Fund official said on Monday.

Headlines: Belgian labor authority launches court case against Deliveroo
Description: Belgium's labor authority launched the first stage of a court case against British food delivery group Deliveroo on Monday, challenging working conditions for the firm's 3,500 riders in Brussels.

Headlines: China repeats call on Canada to release Huawei CFO Meng
Description: China repeated its call on Monday for Canada to release detained Huawei Technologies Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou as soon as possible, ahead of the executive's first extradition hearing later in the day.

Headlines: Apple's Cook says global corporate tax system must be overhauled
Description: Everyone knows that the global corporate tax system needs to be overhauled, Apple  Chief Executive Tim Cook said on Monday, backing changes to global rules that are currently under consideration.

Headlines: Markets regulators struggling to keep up with technology: SEC's Jackson
Description: The rapid growth of digital assets and computer-driven investment advice has become a key challenge for regulators in trying to keep up with technological advances while seeking to protect investors, a U.S. markets regulator said on Monday.

Headlines: A thousand EU financial firms plan to open UK offices after Brexit
Description: More than a thousand banks, asset managers, payments companies and insurers in the European Union plan to open offices in post-Brexit Britain so they can continue serving UK clients, regulatory consultancy Bovill said on Monday.

Headlines: Capitalism seen doing 'more harm than good' in global survey
Description: A majority of people around the world believe capitalism in its current form is doing more harm than good, a survey found ahead of this week's Davos meeting of business and political leaders.

Headlines: Climate change pushes investors to take their temperature
Description: Move over revenue growth and dividend payouts: it's time to take your portfolio's temperature.

Headlines: Japan, U.S. lead survey's corporate climate change action 'A List'
Description: BT <BT,K>, Danone , Microsoft  and Sony  are among 178 companies with top marks in the latest global ranking of transparency and action on climate change.

Headlines: Subaru sets mid-2030s target to sell only electric vehicles
Description: Japan's Subaru Corp  set a target on Monday to sell only electric vehicles worldwide by the first half of the 2030s, in a move toward its long-term goal of a carbon-free society.

Headlines: Samsung appoints new mobile chief as Huawei chips away at market share
Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd on Monday named its youngest president as its new smartphone chief as the firm seeks to defend its lead in the handset market from rising challenges from rivals such as Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.

Headlines: Guoxuan says in talks with Volkswagen, hasn't reached binding agreement
Description: Guoxuan High-Tech Co Ltd  is in talks with Volkswagen AG  for potential strategic cooperation in technology, product, and capital, the Chinese battery maker wrote in a company filing on Monday.

Headlines: Airbus unit to offer product to help airlines with revenue volatility
Description: A subsidiary of Airbus , the world’s largest planemaker, is preparing to launch a financial product aimed at helping its airline customers hedge against risks to revenue, officials said.

Headlines: IEA warns oil companies doing nothing on emissions is not an option
Description: Oil and gas companies must boost investment in low carbon energies or face an increasing backlash that could threaten their long-term profits and social acceptance, the International Energy Agency (IEA) said on Monday.

Headlines: CEO says Bank of America aims to 'double' its U.S. consumer market share: FT
Description: Brian Moynihan, the chief executive officer of Bank of America Corp , has said the bank could double its consumer market share in the United States despite fears about the power of the country's largest banking institutions.

Headlines: Mexican official eyes stronger ties with China after U.S. trade deal
Description: Mexico should move to deepen its economic ties with China after U.S. congressional approval of a new North American trade deal, a senior Mexican official said late on Saturday.

Headlines: Tesla moves a step closer to opening first European factory with German property deal
Description: U.S. electric car pioneer Tesla  has agreed to buy a property on the outskirts of Berlin, bringing it a step closer to opening its first European factory, local authorities said on Sunday.

Headlines: EU industry chief dismisses fears strict security rules could delay 5G
Description: European industrial policy chief Thierry Breton dismissed claims that relying on European companies to build a 5G network would delay its rollout, weighing in on an increasingly tense debate in Germany over the risk posed by China's Huawei.

Headlines: Founder of South Korean retail giant Lotte dies
Description: Lotte Group founder Shin Kyuk-ho, who started manufacturing chewing gum in 1948 in Japan and built the business into South Korea's No.5 conglomerate with interests ranging from retail to chemicals, died on Sunday, the company said. He was 98.

Headlines: China will increase imports from U.S. according to 'market principles': official
Description: China will negotiate with American companies and increase imports of U.S. goods and products according to market principles, an official with its state planner said on Sunday.

Headlines: German cabin crew union plans further strikes at Lufthansa
Description: German cabin crew union UFO said on Saturday it was planning further strikes at Lufthansa  to increase pressure on management after talks with Germany's largest airline and two potential mediators did not yield any results.

Headlines: "You're stealing our water": Germans protest against Tesla gigafactory
Description: Around 250 Germans on Saturday protested in the outskirts of Berlin where electric car startup Tesla is planning to build a gigafactory, saying its construction will endanger water supply and wildlife in the area.

Headlines: With market at record highs, eyes on reports from chipmakers
Description: Reports from Netflix, Intel and Texas Instruments next week may hint at what is to come in the December quarterly earnings season, with some investors wary of possible danger signs that could knock Wall Street after its latest surge to record highs.

Headlines: Nokia October warning investigated by local FSA: newspaper report
Description: Finland's Financial Supervisory Authority (FSA) has started an investigation into Nokia's  sharp profit warning in October which sent its shares more than 20% lower, Finnish daily Helsingin Sanomat reported on Saturday.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley CEO Gorman's total 2019 pay falls 7% to $27 million
Description: Morgan Stanley  Chief Executive James Gorman is receiving $27 million in total compensation in 2019, nearly 7% less than what he got the year before, the company said in a filing on Friday, following a reduction of bonuses staff-wide.

Headlines: Lawyers for Huawei CFO call Canada prosecutor's arguments 'circular'
Description: Extraditing Huawei Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou to the United States based on American sanctions against Iran would set a dangerous precedent and could even undermine Canada's policy towards Iran, Meng's lawyers argued in court documents released on Friday.

Headlines: Best Buy starts investigation into CEO's personal conduct
Description: U.S. consumer electronics retailer Best Buy Co  said on Friday that its board was conducting an independent review on allegations of misconduct against Chief Executive Officer Corie Barry after receiving an anonymous letter.

Headlines: Bayer could be close to Roundup settlement, mediator says
Description: Bayer could be close to settling more than 75,000 cancer claims related to its Roundup herbicide, with mediator Ken Feinberg on Friday saying he was "cautiously optimistic that a settlement will ultimately be reached."

Headlines: U.S. will look at sudden acceleration complaints involving 500,000 Tesla vehicles
Description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said Friday it will review a petition asking the agency to formally investigate and recall 500,000 Tesla Inc vehicles over sudden unintended acceleration reports.

Headlines: Wall Street hits new highs in strongest week since August
Description: Wall Street climbed to record highs on Friday, with major indexes turning in their strongest weekly gains since August, after strong U.S. housing data and signs of resilience in the Chinese economy raised hopes of a rebound in global growth.

Headlines: Shares set fresh records, lifted by U.S. housing data
Description: Key world equity indexes scaled new highs on Friday, boosted by a surge in U.S. housing starts to levels last seen in 2006, while the greenback rose to a one-week high against the euro on expectations of solid economic growth.

Headlines: Netflix opens Paris office, plans new French-language series
Description: U.S. television streaming company Netflix has opened a new Paris office and plans to develop more than 20 original French-language productions in 2020, it said on Friday.

Headlines: Oil steadies as Chinese economy offsets trade optimism
Description: Oil prices steadied on Friday as sluggish economic growth in China, the world's biggest crude importer, raised concerns over fuel demand and countered optimism from the signing of a China-U.S. trade deal.

Headlines: After India's Amazon snub, Modi's party slams Bezos-owned Washington Post
Description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's ruling party on Friday slammed editorial policies of billionaire Jeff Bezos-owned Washington Post, even as his e-commerce firm Amazon  announced plans to create a million jobs in the country by 2025.

Headlines: Boeing addresses new 737 MAX software issue that could keep plane grounded longer
Description: Boeing Co  said on Friday it is addressing a new software issue discovered in Iowa last weekend during a technical review of the proposed update to the grounded Boeing 737 MAX, a development that could further delay the plane's return to service.

Headlines: Toyota to move Tacoma truck production to Mexico from U.S.
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  said on Friday it will move production of its mid-size Tacoma pick-up truck from the United States to Mexico as it adjusts production around North America.

Headlines: Toyota completes $1.3 billion modernization project at Indiana facility
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  said on Friday it had invested an additional $700 million and added 150 new jobs to complete a $1.3 billion modernization program at its Princeton, Indiana factory.

Headlines: U.S. housing starts at 13-year high, factory output gains
Description: U.S. homebuilding surged to a 13-year high in December as activity increased across the board, suggesting the housing market recovery was back on track amid low mortgage rates, and could help support the longest economic expansion on record.

Headlines: U.S. job openings post biggest drop in more than four years
Description: U.S. job openings recorded their biggest drop in more than four years in November, while hiring increased moderately, suggesting a loss of momentum in the labor market at the tail end of 2019.

Headlines: Walmart U.S. Chief Merchandising Officer Bratspies departs
Description: Chief merchandising officer of Walmart Inc's  U.S. operations, Steve Bratspies, is set to leave the big-box retailer, according to an internal memo sent on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sinopec to review potential $16 billion U.S. gas deal with Cheniere - sources
Description: China's Sinopec, expected to be the next major Chinese buyer of U.S. liquefied natural gas (LNG), is planning to review terms of a potential $16 billion supply deal with Cheniere Energy Inc after a sharp drop in LNG prices, industry officials said.

Headlines: Wall Street's trillion-dollar club dwarfs Europe Inc
Description: With Google parent Alphabet  becoming the latest entrant to Wall Street's trillion-dollar club, Europe's blue-chip companies are dwarfed by comparison -- the most valuable firm from the "old continent", Nestle, is worth just a third of that.

Headlines: Mexican autoparts firms eye fast lane after U.S. backs trade deal
Description: Mexican auto parts manufacturers with clients across North America expect a record year after U.S. approval of a trade deal mandating higher regional inputs, but the new rules pose a bigger challenge to carmakers.

Headlines: The yield curve's still weird. Fed's Bullard is okay with that
Description: It was more than a year ago when St. Louis Federal Reserve bank President James Bullard started raising the alarm about a U.S. bond market where interest rates seemed to show investors losing faith in the economy, a risky environment for the Fed to carry out planned rate increases.

Headlines: Fed's Bullard: "Material reassessment" is "big tent language"
Description: St. Louis Federal Reserve President James Bullard expounded on what might comprise a "material reassessment" of the economic outlook, the Treasury yield curve, the central bank's framework review and more in a Reuters interview.

Headlines: Facebook sued in U.S. federal court for alleged anticompetitive conduct
Description: Four companies sued Facebook Inc  in U.S. federal court on Thursday for alleged anticompetitive conduct, saying the social network inappropriately revoked developer access to its platform in order to harm prospective competitors.

Headlines: Senate passes North America trade deal, Canada still to approve
Description: The U.S. Senate on Thursday approved a revamp of the 26-year-old North American Free Trade Agreement that includes tougher rules on labor and automotive content but leaves $1.2 trillion in annual U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade flows largely unchanged.

Headlines: Mexico hails USMCA trade deal approval, expects more investment
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Thursday hailed the U.S. Senate's approval of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) trade deal, forecasting it would deliver a boost to the Mexican economy.

Headlines: Take Five: A week in central banking
Description: Geopolitics overshadowed monetary policy for the first time in many months in early January. But such distractions tend to be short-lived nowadays, with investors getting back to central bank-watching swiftly.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler and Foxconn plan push into Chinese electric car market
Description: Automaker Fiat Chrysler plans to set up a joint venture with the parent of iPhone assembler Foxconn to build electric cars and develop internet-connected vehicles in China, as it looks to make up ground in electric mobility.

Headlines: Exclusive: HSBC cutting around 100 staff in equities business - sources
Description: HSBC  is cutting around 100 roles in its equities business with the bulk of the layoffs falling on its continental European trading floors, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: China posts weakest growth in 29 years as trade war bites, but ends 2019 on better note
Description: China's economic growth cooled to its weakest in nearly 30 years in 2019 amid a bruising trade war with the United States, and more stimulus is expected this year as Beijing tries to boost sluggish investment and demand.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's Ant aims for $200 billion price tag in private share sales - sources
Description: Ant Financial [ANTFIN.UL] shares are being offered privately at levels which value the Chinese financial giant at $200 billion, two people with knowledge of the discussions said, lifting it up the ranks of the most valuable unlisted companies.

Headlines: Indonesian minister says SoftBank offering to invest up to $40 billion in new capital
Description: SoftBank has offered to invest up to $40 billion in the new capital city Indonesia plans to build on Borneo island, a minister said on Friday, though the Japanese tech conglomerate said no figure had been suggested yet.

Headlines: Exclusive: Temasek, Trustbridge target majority stake in WeWork China at $1 billion valuation – sources
Description: Temasek Holdings and Trustbridge Partners have held talks with WeWork China over increasing their stake in the China branch of the troubled co-working startup to take majority ownership, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: H&M to enter Panama in late 2020
Description: The world's second-biggest fashion retailer H&M  said on Friday it would open a first store in Panama at the end of 2020, making the country its first Central American market.

Headlines: Which company just hit $1 trillion? Google it.
Description: As Google-parent Alphabet Inc became on Thursday the fourth U.S. company to top a market value of more than $1 trillion, some funds holding its shares are wondering whether now is the time to cash in on the stock's extraordinary gains.

Headlines: Renault expects slight 2020 car market decline in Europe, Russia and China
Description: Renault  said on Friday it expected a slight decline in the car market in Europe, Russia and China this year after the French carmaker reported a 3.4% fall of worldwide sales in 2019 as China and Iran weighed.

Headlines: British Airways-owner IAG lifts ownership restrictions, boosting shares
Description: British Airways-owner IAG  lifted a restriction on non-EU investors' ability to buy its stock, helping boost its share price by more than 5%.

Headlines: Exclusive: Volkswagen to buy 20% of Chinese battery maker Guoxuan amid electric push - sources
Description: Volkswagen AG  is set to take a 20% stake in Chinese electric vehicle battery maker Guoxuan High-tech Co Ltd, two sources told Reuters, as the German firm accelerates its electric push into the world's largest auto market.

Headlines: China markets split on outcome of LPR lending benchmark in January
Description: China's financial markets are nearly evenly divided over whether the benchmark lending rate will be lowered or kept steady next Monday, a survey of participants showed, after the central bank kept rates on medium-term loans unchanged this week.

Headlines: China fourth-quarter GDP grows 6%, in line with expectations and hovering near 30-year low
Description: China's economy grew 6.0% in the fourth quarter of 2019 from a year earlier, official data showed on Friday, in line with expectations and unchanged from the previous quarter's pace.

Headlines: China 2019 crude steel output jumps 8.3%, sets second straight annual record
Description: Crude steel production in China climbed to a record just shy of 1 billion tonnes in 2019, boosted by a resilient property market and robust demand as Beijing beefed up infrastructure spending in a bid to weather a slowdown in economic growth.

Headlines: Instant View: China's economic growth slows to 6.1% in 2019, near 30-year low
Description: China's economy grew 6.0% in the fourth quarter of 2019 from a year earlier, official data showed on Friday, in line with expectations and steadying from the previous quarter's pace.

Headlines: China's annual aluminum output slips for first time in decade
Description: China's annual aluminum production fell for the first time in 10 years in 2019, official data showed on Friday, hit by softer demand amid the Sino-U.S. trade row and large-scale smelter outages.

Headlines: China's 2019 pork output plunges to 16-year low as disease culls herd
Description: China's 2019 pork output plunged to a 16-year low, official data showed on Friday, as the fatal hog disease African swine fever killed millions of pigs in the world's top producer.

Headlines: China to roll out more support measures as economy faces pressure: statistics head
Description: China will maintain a proactive fiscal policy and a prudent monetary policy in 2020 and roll out more support measures this year as the economy faces downward pressure, the chief of the country's statistics bureau said on Friday.

Headlines: China's 2019 property investment solid, but first sales drop in 5 years dents outlook
Description: China's property investment hit a two-year low in December even as it grew at a solid pace in 2019, adding to recent signs of a slackening in the sector and suggested Beijing might need to offer more stimulus to stabilize a cooling economy.

Headlines: China's 2019 and December crude oil runs hit record highs
Description: China's crude oil throughput rose to a record high in 2019 following the start-up of two mega-refineries, official data showed on Friday, with December posting the highest daily run-rate on record.

Headlines: China's 2019 birth rate slowest in 70 years: stats bureau
Description: China's birth rate fell to its lowest last year since the founding of the People's Republic of China 70 years ago, posing a long-term challenge for its government.

Headlines: Comcast bets ads work on streaming TV, plans NBC Peacock debut for April
Description: NBCUniversal's new Peacock streaming service will offer free and $5-per-month options with advertising to try to win customers for its belated entry into the online video wars, the company announced on Thursday.

Headlines: Gap pulls plug on Old Navy spinoff to focus on turning around sales
Description: Gap Inc  on Thursday scrapped its plan to spin-off Old Navy and said it would instead work to stem dropping sales, while fewer discounts during the holiday season helped full-year earnings, sending its shares up about 4%.

Headlines: Eli Lilly targets quarterly deals of $1 billion-$5 billion in 2020: CFO
Description: Eli Lilly and Co  aims to announce roughly one $1 billion to $5 billion deal every quarter in 2020, its chief financial officer told Reuters, as the U.S. drugmaker looks to build up its pipeline of future products.

Headlines: Factbox: How NBCUniversal's Peacock streaming service stacks up against others
Description: Comcast Corp's NBCUniversal on Thursday gave specifics on its planned Peacock video streaming service, which will do battle with industry leader Netflix Inc and others in the highly competitive field.

Headlines: S&P 500 blasts through 3,300 as tech stocks surge
Description: The S&P 500 rallied through the 3,300 mark for the first time on Thursday and the other main U.S. indexes also surged to record highs, fueled by tech stocks, solid retail sales data and upbeat quarterly earnings from Morgan Stanley.

Headlines: Alphabet public market capitalization tops $1 trillion
Description: The public market capitalization of Google parent Alphabet  topped the $1 trillion mark shortly before the close of trading on Thursday, making it the fourth S&P 500 component to top the lofty level.

Headlines: Dollar gains, stocks scale fresh highs on data, trade deal
Description: The dollar rose while key world and stock indexes on Wall Street scaled new records on Thursday as the U.S.-China trade deal, strong corporate earnings and encouraging U.S. economic data lifted equity markets.

Headlines: China, U.S. sign initial trade pact but doubts and tariffs linger
Description: China will boost purchases of U.S. goods and services by $200 billion over two years in exchange for the rolling back of some tariffs under an initial trade deal signed by the world's two largest economies, defusing an 18-month row that has hit global growth.

Headlines: Timeline: Key dates in the U.S.-China trade war
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese Vice Premier Liu He

Headlines: In U.S.-China Phase 1 trade deal, enforcement may end in 'We quit'
Description: The Trump administration is touting the U.S.-China Phase 1 trade deal's dispute settlement and enforcement mechanism as the major difference between the 86-page agreement unveiled on Tuesday and past pledges by Beijing to change its trade practices.

Headlines: Instant View: Signed U.S.-China trade deal removes one risk factor for markets
Description: U.S. stocks pared early gains but closed at record highs on Wednesday after the United States and China signed a Phase 1 trade deal that ended 18 months of uncertainty and will roll back some tariffs and boost Chinese purchases of U.S. goods and services.

Headlines: Trump takes time in China deal signing to lament his Fed chair pick, again
Description: A funny thing happened on the way to the U.S.-China trade deal signing: President Donald Trump may have tipped his next pick for head of the Federal Reserve -- if he gets the chance.

Headlines: With a mixture of fanfare and grievance, Trump signs U.S.-China trade deal
Description: He listed familiar grievances, praised and criticized his guests, and seemed to blow off some steam.

Headlines: Factbox: Foreign investment banks with majority stakes in China units
Description: The world's biggest investment banks will be able to wholly own their China securities businesses from April 1 as the U.S.- China Phase 1 trade deal accelerates a previous deadline for removing foreign ownership caps by nine months.

Headlines: Oil ends higher, as trade deal progress spurs energy demand hopes
Description: Oil rose about 1% on Thursday, as progress on another major trade deal fed optimism that energy demand will grow in 2020, which offset bearish market comments from the International Energy Agency.

Headlines: Exclusive: Cyber security firm McAfee hires new CEO
Description: McAfee LLC told Reuters on Thursday it has hired Peter Leav, the former CEO of BMC Software, as its new CEO, replacing Chris Young, who created the cyber security company in its current form by carving it out of Intel Corp four years ago.

Headlines: Factbox: How the North American trade deal will affect autos, digital trade, drugs
Description: The U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade agreement (USMCA) that was passed by the U.S. Senate today modernizes the 26-year-old North American Free Trade Agreement that has been blamed for  hollowing out the U.S. manufacturing sector.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley shares soar after Gorman boosts performance targets
Description: Morgan Stanley  lifted its performance goals on Thursday after beating Wall Street estimates by a wide margin, the latest sign that Chief Executive James Gorman's strategic vision for the bank is bearing fruit.

Headlines: Indigenous group vows peaceful pipeline opposition as Canadian police clamp down
Description: An indigenous group that opposes construction of the Coastal GasLink pipeline in British Columbia will refuse workers access to their land, but in peaceful fashion, according to one of its chiefs.

Headlines: Hyundai, Kia invest $110 million in UK electric van startup Arrival Ltd
Description: Korea's Hyundai Group is backing a UK electric vehicle startup that plans to begin selling battery-powered delivery vans in 2021, the companies said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. Senate approves U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade deal
Description: The U.S. Senate on Thursday approved a revamp of the 26-year-old North American Free Trade Agreement that includes tougher labor and automotive content rules but leaves $1.2 trillion in annual U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade flows largely unchanged.

Headlines: U.S. data point to moderate economic growth, tightening jobs market
Description: U.S. retail sales increased for a third straight month in December, with households buying a range of goods even as they cut back on purchases of motor vehicles, suggesting the economy maintained a moderate growth pace at the end of 2019.

Headlines: FAA should mandate safety management systems for Boeing, others: panel
Description: An expert committee on Thursday recommended the Federal Aviation Administration require Boeing Co  and other aircraft manufacturers to adopt new safety management tools in the wake of two fatal Boeing 737 MAX crashes that killed 346 people.

Headlines: JPMorgan says no notice from Supreme Court on Amrapali real estate case
Description: The local arm of JPMorgan  said on Thursday that the bank has not received any communication from India's Supreme Court in a case relating to past transactions between the bank and a New Delhi-based real estate firm.

Headlines: During Bezos visit, India minister says Amazon's $1 billion investment is no big favour
Description: Amazon  hasn't done India any big favours by announcing a new $1 billion investment, its trade minister said on Thursday, laying bare tensions with the U.S. online retail giant during a visit to the country by its CEO Jeff Bezos.

Headlines: European firms call for tougher EU approach to China
Description: European companies called on European Union policy-makers on Thursday to toughen their approach to China to secure a level playing field for European businesses.

Headlines: U.S. clean energy investment hits new record despite Trump administration views
Description: Clean energy investment in the United States surged to a fresh record of $55.5 billion last year, despite the government's attempts to roll back supportive policies, a report showed on Thursday.

Headlines: VW CEO says carmaker faces same fate as Nokia without urgent reforms
Description: Volkswagen  needs to accelerate the overhaul of its business to avoid becoming another Nokia , which lost its dominance in the handset market to Apple , the German carmaker's chief executive said.

Headlines: Tesla says it plans to open China design and research center
Description: U.S. electric car maker Tesla plans to open a design and research center in China to make "Chinese-style" vehicles, the company said in a recruitment notice on its official WeChat account.

Headlines: Southwest extends 737 MAX cancellations through June 6
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  said on Thursday it is extending cancellations of Boeing Co  737 MAX flights until June 6, citing the planemaker's decision to recommend pilot simulator training before resuming flights and uncertainty about when regulators will approve their return to service.

Headlines: What to watch as fourth-quarter earnings kick into high gear
Description: U.S. corporate reporting season is expected to show lackluster profit growth, and it has already gotten off to a bumpy start, with big banks kicking off the fourth quarter to mixed investor reaction so far on the stock market.

Headlines: Amazon orders electric vans from Deutsche Post's StreetScooter
Description: Amazon.com  has ordered 40 electric vans from Deutsche Post's  StreetScooter unit for deliveries in the German city of Munich as part of the plan to be carbon neutral by 2040, the online retailer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: BNY Mellon profit falls short on lower interest rates
Description: Bank of New York Mellon Corp  missed analysts' estimates for quarterly profit on Thursday, as the world's largest custodian bank earned less from its interest-earning assets due to rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Burger King makes Impossible Whopper cheaper by inclusion in value menu
Description: Burger King said on Thursday it would add its plant-based  Impossible Whopper sandwich to its popular 2 items for $6 promotion, a sign that fast-food chains are trying to reach more customers with affordable options.

Headlines: Renault, Nissan share 'real desire' to make alliance work: chairman
Description: Renault  Chairman Jean-Dominique Senard said on Thursday there was a "real desire" within the top ranks of both companies for its alliance with Nissan to succeed, dismissing suggestions the partnership was on the rocks.

Headlines: PSA Group 2019 sales slump 10% after record 2018
Description: French carmaker PSA Group  said on Thursday global sales fell 10% last year to 3.49 million units, compared with a record 3.88 million in 2018, as it suffered from declining volumes in China, the Middle East and Africa.

Headlines: Southwest Airlines push Boeing 737 MAX flight cancellations into June
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  said on Thursday it would extend cancellations of 737 MAX flights through June 6, as the grounding of the Boeing Co  jet threatens to hurt a second straight U.S. summer travel season.

Headlines: New Tesla registrations in California nearly halve in fourth quarter: data
Description: Tesla Inc's  overall vehicle registrations nearly halved in the U.S. state of California during the fourth quarter, according to a Dominion Cross-Sell report, which collates data from state motor vehicle records.

Headlines: Carlos Ghosn's Japanese lawyers quit after former Nissan chief absconds
Description: Japanese attorneys representing Carlos Ghosn, including lead lawyer Junichiro Hironaka, quit on Thursday following the former Nissan chief's flight to Lebanon from Japan, where he had been fighting financial misconduct charges.

Headlines: China says trade deal good for all, media discourages 'nitpicking'
Description: Chinese state media on Thursday warned against any "nitpicking" as Beijing portrayed the Phase 1 trade deal with United States and its new commitments to massive purchases of American goods as a boon for China's economy.

Headlines: Trade deal touts financial sector wins; China to scrap securities business cap faster
Description: The long-awaited U.S.-China trade deal touted wins for U.S. companies looking to access China's $40 trillion financial sector, but many of the changes were already in the works, with Beijing having stepped up the pace of liberalization last year.

Headlines: Renault chairman says 'no stress' to appoint new CEO
Description: Renault  chairman Jean-Dominique Senard said on Thursday there was "no stress" to appoint a new chief executive  at the helm of the French carmaker, adding current interim arrangements were working well.

Headlines: Renault-Nissan alliance operating board to meet by the end of January: Senard
Description: Renault  chairman Jean-Dominique Senard said on Thursday the operating board of the Renault-Nissan  alliance would meet by the end of January to decide on joint industrial initiatives.

Headlines: European firms get 'crumbs' from China's Belt and Road: business group
Description: China's Belt and Road investment scheme, which aims to connect Europe with Asia, is sidelining European companies and Brussels should review its competition law to level the playing field, a business lobby group said on Thursday.

Headlines: Hyundai unveils first Genesis SUV in renewed overseas premium push
Description: South Korea's Hyundai Motor Co  unveiled the first sport-utility vehicle (SUV) under its Genesis brand on Wednesday, a move analysts said was crucial for the premium marque's expansion in overseas markets.

Headlines: Chinese financial institutions can cope with foreign competition: central bank
Description: Chinese financial institutions are completely capable of coping with foreign competition as the $40 trillion financial sector is freed up, the central bank said on Thursday, after China and the United States signed a initial deal on trade.

Headlines: China's Liu: China will push forward capital account opening, yuan internationalization - state media
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He said China will steadily push forward capital account opening and yuan internationalization, under the premise of focusing on preventing risks, state media People's Daily reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Japan's Rakuten, Walmart's Seiyu to open logistics site as online sales jump
Description: Japanese online retailer Rakuten  and Walmart's  Seiyu said they plan to open a new logistics site in Yokohama later this year to deal with growing sales from their joint online supermarket business.

Headlines: Factbox: How China tariffs on U.S. commodities, energy stand after Phase 1 trade deal
Description: China and the United States have agreed to terms of a Phase 1 trade deal on Jan 15 but Beijing has not reduced or waived tariffs on any commodities or energy further.

Headlines: U.S. energy exports to climb as China pledges ramp-up in purchases
Description: U.S. oil and gas exports should jump over the next two years if China fulfills its pledges to increase energy purchases under the trade deal between the world's two largest economies signed on Wednesday, executives and traders said.

Headlines: U.S.-China deal could hurt Malaysia palm oil exports to China: Malaysian official
Description: Malaysia's palm oil exports to China jumped 33.9% in 2019 to 2.49 million tonnes but Beijing's latest trade deal with the United States could limit gains this year, a Malaysian palm official said on Thursday.

Headlines: China's 'market condition' caveat on U.S. ag purchases adds to trade deal doubts
Description: China's pledge to buy U.S. farm goods based on "market conditions" during the Phase 1 trade deal signing ceremony on Wednesday added to doubts among farmers and commodity traders over Beijing's lingering tariffs on U.S. exports.

Headlines: 'Phase 2' U.S.-China trade talks have already begun: Pence
Description: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence said on Wednesday that discussions had already begun on a "Phase 2" U.S.-China trade deal, hours after Washington and Beijing signed an initial trade pact that defused some tensions but left some major issues unresolved.

Headlines: Mexico trade official welcomes deal between U.S. and China
Description: A top Mexican official on Wednesday welcomed the signing of an initial trade deal between the United States and China, even though it could signal an end to benefits Mexico has enjoyed from an 18-month dispute between the world's top two economies.

Headlines: UnitedHealth bets on government health plan growth in 2020
Description: UnitedHealth Group Inc, the largest U.S. health insurer, reported a better-than-expected fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, and said it expects strong sales of its government health plans this year.

Headlines: General Motors moves over 1,350 temporary workers to full-time jobs
Description: General Motors Co. said on Wednesday more than 1,350 hourly employees at its assembly plants in the United States will transition into full-time roles in the first quarter of 2020.

Headlines: T-Mobile/Sprint urge court for deal approval, states warn of price hikes
Description: A group of U.S. states suing to block T-Mobile US Inc from merging with Sprint Corp on Wednesday told a federal judge that the deal would raise prices for consumers, while the phone companies pushed back and emphasized they would compete aggressively to push prices down.

Headlines: China to buy rare earths from U.S. as part of trade pact
Description: China has agreed to buy two types of rare earth metals from the United States as part of an initial trade deal inked on Wednesday, a move likely to boost U.S. production of the strategic minerals.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade deal, USMCA to boost economy: Mnuchin on Fox News
Description: Completion of the Phase 1 U.S.-China trade deal and a new North American trade agreement will boost the U.S. gross domestic product (GDP) by a combined 50 to 75 basis points, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin told Fox News on Wednesday.

Headlines: Dow closes above 29,000 after China and U.S. sign trade truce
Description: The Dow ended above 29,000 for the first time on Wednesday and the S&P 500 also closed at a record high after the United States and China signed a Phase 1 trade agreement and pledged to resolve a tariff dispute that has roiled Wall Street for over a year.

Headlines: Trump urges Boeing to move fast on resolving 737 MAX issues
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday urged Boeing Co  to move quickly to resolve issues with the grounded 737 MAX, noting the planemaker's significant impact on the U.S. economy.

Headlines: China's Liu: China to use trade deal to prove talks working to improve economy - CGTN
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He said China will use the results of the Phase 1 trade deal with the United States to prove that the negotiations are working to improve the economy, Chinese state television reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Stocks climb new peaks on trade deal, oil slips on demand worries
Description: Key world equity indexes climbed to new records on Wednesday on hopes a U.S.-China trade deal will reduce harmful tensions, but oil prices slid on doubts the pact will spur world growth and boost crude demand.

Headlines: Oil down slightly after U.S.-China trade deal, U.S. product build
Description: Oil prices were down slightly on Wednesday, pressured early by data showing big increases in U.S. refined products but recovered some of the losses later by the signing of a Phase 1 trade deal between Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: Airbus sales chief says no need to cut production of A330neo
Description: Airbus  sees enough demand for its wide-bodied A330neo passenger jet to keep production stable, Chief Commercial Officer Christian Scherer told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: South Africa's Telkom could cut 3,000 jobs: letter to unions
Description: South African telecoms company Telkom SA  told unions on Wednesday it could cut up to 3,000 of more than 15,000 staff as it struggles with declining performance in fixed voice and fixed data services.

Headlines: Trump: U.S. will lift tariffs on China after Phase 2 deal finished
