Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday said he would remove all U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports as soon as the two countries completed the Phase 2 part of their trade agreement, adding that he does not expect there to be a Phase 3 pact.

Headlines: Pratt & Whitney expects GTF engine software update on A220 jet in spring
Description: A software update for the GTF engine on Airbus' smallest jet, the A220, is expected in the spring, pending regulatory approval, a top executive at United Technologies Corp's  Pratt & Whitney aircraft engine division said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. producer prices nudge up as inflation remains benign
Description: U.S. producer prices edged up in December as a rise in the cost of goods was offset by weakness in services, the latest indication of tame inflation pressures that could allow the Federal Reserve to keep interest rates unchanged this year.

Headlines: Citigroup female employees earn 27% less than men
Description: Citigroup's  female employees earn 27% less than male employees on average, when factors like title and location are not taken into account, the Wall Street bank said on Wednesday.

Headlines: China's Xi tells Trump he welcomes Phase 1 trade deal
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping told U.S. President Donald Trump in a letter that he welcomes the Phase 1 trade deal reached with the United States and that he is willing to stay in close touch with the American leader.

Headlines: U.S. economy expands modestly but trade tensions weigh, Fed survey shows
Description: The U.S. economy expanded at a modest pace through the final six weeks of 2019 but uncertainty over U.S. trade policy continued to hurt firms, a survey conducted by the Federal Reserve said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Under fire in India, Amazon offers small business owners $1 billion olive branch
Description: Amazon.com Inc CEO Jeff Bezos said his company will invest $1 billion to bring small businesses online in India, reaching out to some of his fiercest critics in a goodwill visit that saw him donning traditional Indian attire and fly a kite with children.

Headlines: Holiday shock for Target as toys, electronics disappoint
Description: Target Corp  fell short of its own expectations for holiday season sales on Wednesday, reporting a drop off in online growth and demand for toys and electronics that sent a shiver through the wider U.S. retail sector.

Headlines: China to boost U.S. purchases by $76.7 billion in first year of trade deal: text
Description: China has agreed to increase purchase $76.7 billion worth of U.S. goods in the first year of the newly signed Phase 1 trade deal with the United States, with $123.3 billion slated for the second year, according to the text of the agreement released on Wednesday.

Headlines: Mexico union threatens Home Depot strike, inspired by USMCA trade deal
Description: Spurred on by labor protections in the new North American trade deal, a top Mexican trade union has accused Home Depot  of blocking union activity and threatened strikes next week if the U.S. home improvement chain does not improve pay and benefits for workers.

Headlines: What's in the U.S.-China Phase 1 trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese Vice Premier Liu He signed a deal on Wednesday in the White House that cut some U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods in exchange for Chinese pledges to purchase more of American farm, energy and  manufactured goods and address some U.S. complaints about intellectual property practices.

Headlines: Goldman pledges 'concrete' expense target after profit decline
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  will set an expense target at its investor day later this month, management said on Wednesday, after the bank missed Wall Street profit expectations due to inflated costs.

Headlines: Macron hopes China-U.S. trade deal will not bring new U.S.-EU tensions
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Wednesday that he hoped a new agreement between China and the United States on trade will not lead to new tensions between the United States and Europe.

Headlines: Delta beats profit forecast on strong demand as rivals battle 737 MAX crisis
Description: (This Jan. 14 story corrects reference in paragraph 12 to '$4.2 billion' from '$4.2 million.')

Headlines: ValueAct's Ubben cheers BlackRock's new stance on climate change
Description: Investor Jeffrey Ubben, already betting there is money to be made from coaxing corporations into being better citizens, gained an ally on Tuesday when BlackRock Inc chief Laurence Fink told companies to tackle climate change or face his wrath.

Headlines: Kudlow says U.S. will eye success of Phase 1 China trade deal
Description: U.S. tariffs will remain on Chinese imports while the Trump administration sees how enforcement plays out under the Phase 1 trade deal with Beijing, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Wednesday.

Headlines: BlackRock profit beats estimates as assets top $7 trillion
Description: BlackRock Inc , the world's largest asset manager, beat analysts' estimates for quarterly profit on Wednesday, helped by strong flows into its exchange-traded fund business that boosted overall assets under management to a record $7.43 trillion.

Headlines: BlackRock CEO Fink: Investors not 'overzealous' on equities despite rally
Description: Even as the stock market enjoyed a sharp rally recently, many of BlackRock's clients were under-invested in equities and remained heavily oriented towards fixed-income securities, BlackRock Inc  Chief Executive Larry Fink said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Low rates bruise Bank of America profits into 2020
Description: Bank of America Corp got stung by lower interest rates in the fourth quarter, sending its profit down 4%, a trend that management expects to continue this year.

Headlines: Polish watchdog fines Volkswagen over 'dieselgate' scandal
Description: Poland's consumer watchdog UOKiK said on Wednesday it was fining Volkswagen  more than 120 million zlotys ($31.6 million) for misleading customers about the emissions of its vehicles.

Headlines: U.S.-China Phase 2 trade talks may not start anytime soon: Global TImes
Description: Phase 2 trade deal talks between Washington and Beijing may not start anytime soon, China's Global Times reported on Wednesday citing an unnamed source.

Headlines: China's Liu says to work with U.S. to achieve tangible results after Phase 1 deal: Xinhua
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He said Beijing and Washington will work together following the signing of the Phase 1 trade deal to obtain tangible results, China's official Xinhua news agency reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: China to significantly increase U.S. soybean imports after Phase 1 deal: Global Times
Description: China will significantly increase imports of U.S. soybeans after the Phase 1 trade deal is signed, the Global Times reported on Wednesday, citing comments from a senior Chinese economist at a state think tank.

Headlines: OPEC expects lower demand for its oil as U.S. hits new milestone
Description: OPEC expects lower demand for its crude oil in 2020 even as global demand rises, it said on Wednesday, as rival producers grab market share and the United States looks set for another output record.

Headlines: Spain's Banco Sabadell hires IBM for 1 billion euro IT upgrade
Description: Spain's Banco Sabadell  has hired IBM  for a 1 billion euro ($1.11 billion) overhaul of its IT systems over the next ten years, Miguel Montes, the bank's director of operations and people, said on Wednesday.

Headlines: PNC Financial quarterly profit beats on higher loan growth
Description: PNC Financial Services Group Inc  on Wednesday posted a better-than-expected fourth-quarter profit, driven by growth in its loan book.

Headlines: JPMorgan first major brokerage to rate Saudi Aramco 'overweight'
Description: JPMorgan  is the first major brokerage to initiate coverage of Saudi Aramco  with an "overweight", setting a price target of 37 riyals ($9.86) per share and saying it sees scope for an increase in the energy giant's proposed $75 billion base dividend.

Headlines: As Aramco hails record IPO, Abu Dhabi's ADNOC whips up $19 billion
Description: The talk's all been about Saudi Aramco, and the suspense of its historic drive to whip up international cash. But, more quietly, its Gulf oil peer ADNOC has also been courting foreign funds - and its efforts compare favorably.

Headlines: Factbox: Abu Dhabi's ADNOC attracts billions from foreign investors
Description: Over the past three years, Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC) has expanded its oil and gas business and quietly raised more than $19 billion in a variety of ways. See main story:

Headlines: BofA gives Saudi Aramco 'neutral' rating, 36 riyal price target
Description: BofA Global Research started its coverage of Saudi Arabia's state oil giant Saudi Aramco  with a 'neutral' rating on Wednesday, setting a price target of 36 riyals ($9.60) per share and saying its fundamentals were now "fully priced".

Headlines: Ghosn says French envoy told him Nissan was turning against him
Description: Former Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn, speaking in Beirut after his dramatic escape from Japanese justice, said on Tuesday that the French ambassador had warned him shortly after his arrest that his own company was plotting against him.

Headlines: Exclusive: 'I'm happy he did it' - in Beirut, wife of fugitive Ghosn slams Japanese justice
Description: Carlos and Carole Ghosn, the former first couple of carmaker Nissan, are united again in Beirut. They hold hands in the street and whisper together in a mix of Arabic and French. They kiss.

Headlines: Race to refine: the bid to clean up Africa’s gold rush
Description: In a refinery just outside Uganda's main airport, workers slip bars of freshly refined gold into clear plastic bags sealed with a sticker of the national flag - black, yellow and red - and the label "Ugandan's Treasure."

Headlines: What is artisanal gold and why is it booming?
Description: A rapid rise in the price of gold since 2000 has driven millions of people to deposits in Africa, South America and elsewhere where they dig for gold using basic technology.

Headlines: Maersk chief warns EU antitrust policy benefits China, U.S.
Description: Strict EU enforcement of competition rules prevents the development of the global champions necessary to compete with Chinese and U.S. companies, the head of shipping company Maersk  warned in an interview.

Headlines: PSA names two former Renault, Nissan hires to head its DS, Citroen brands
Description: French carmaker PSA  on Wednesday appointed two executives it recently recruited from the Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi alliance to head up its DS and Citroen brands, and named them to its global executive committee.

Headlines: Honda, Isuzu power up fuel cell partnership for heavy-duty trucks
Description: Japan's Honda Motor Co  and Isuzu Motors Ltd  on Wednesday said they would jointly research the use of hydrogen fuel cells to power heavy-duty trucks, looking to expand fuel cell use by applying the zero-emission technology to larger vehicles.

Headlines: Malaysia Airlines suspends Boeing 737 MAX deliveries due to jet's grounding
Description: Malaysia Airlines said on Wednesday it had suspended deliveries of 25 Boeing Co  737 MAX jets, citing the plane's delayed return to service since it was grounded last year following two fatal crashes.

Headlines: China to ramp up U.S. buys under trade deal, but skeptics question targets
Description: China has pledged to buy almost $80 billion of additional manufactured goods from the United States over the next two years as part of a trade war truce, according to a source, though some U.S. trade experts call it an unrealistic target.

Headlines: Why the Ukrainian plane tragedy is unlikely to lead to global airspace rules
Description: Why was the Ukrainian airliner mistakenly shot down near Tehran by Iranian forces last week for the loss of 176 lives even allowed to take off from a country that had just fired missiles towards its neighbour? And why didn't the airline just delay or cancel the flight?

Headlines: Phase 1 commodity targets likely more than China can chew: analysts
Description: Commodity traders and analysts are struggling to map out how China will reach the eye-popping amounts it is committing to buy from the United States under Phase 1 of their trade deal.

Headlines: Documents to show U.S.-China trade deal fully enforceable: Mnuchin
Description: Documents to be released Wednesday will show skeptics that a Phase 1 U.S.-China trade agreement will be fully enforceable, including a pledge by China to refrain from manipulating its currency, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. to maintain tariffs on Chinese goods until Phase 2 deal: Mnuchin
Description: The United States will maintain tariffs on Chinese goods until the completion of a second phase of a U.S.-China trade agreement, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Tuesday, a day before the two sides are to sign an interim deal.

Headlines: F-35 logistics system to be reinvented and renamed, official says
Description: The computer-based logistics system of the F-35 stealth fighter jet made by Lockheed Martin , which has been plagued by delays, will be replaced by another network made by the same company, a Pentagon official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump administration moves toward blocking more sales to Huawei: sources
Description: The U.S. government is nearing publication of a rule that would vastly expand its powers to block shipments of foreign-made goods to China's Huawei, as it seeks to squeeze the blacklisted telecoms company, two sources said.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court tosses lower court ruling that allowed IBM retirement fund suit
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday threw out a lower court ruling that allowed a lawsuit to proceed against managers of a  retirement fund for IBM Corp employees centering on allegations that officials failed to disclose that IBM's microelectronics business was over-valued.

Headlines: Stocks rally, then ease on U.S.-China trade deal; oil gains
Description: Oil prices rose and a gauge of global equity markets hit a new high on Tuesday as investors awaited a China-U.S. trade deal they hope will spur world growth after the economy in 2019 saw its weakest year since the financial crisis.

Headlines: Wall Street dips from record in 'Jason Bourne market'
Description: U.S. stocks dipped on Tuesday, reversing earlier intraday record highs, following a report that the United States would likely maintain tariffs on Chinese goods until after November's presidential election.

Headlines: Oil edges up after five days of losses ahead of U.S.-China trade pact
Description: Oil prices edged higher on Tuesday after five days of declines as the United States and China prepared to sign a preliminary trade deal and as Middle East tensions eased.

Headlines: Citigroup beats estimates on credit card, trading revenue growth
Description: Citigroup Inc beat analysts' estimates for fourth-quarter profits on Tuesday, boosted by growth in its credit card business and a jump in trading revenue.

Headlines: Drag from Trump's trade wars continues to ripple through U.S. economy
Description: As U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese Vice Premier Liu He prepare to sign a "Phase 1" trade deal, new data show that the costs of Trump's trade wars are proving more widespread, deeper and longer-lasting than previously believed.

Headlines: BlackRock vows tougher stance on climate after activist heat
Description: BlackRock  Chief Executive Larry Fink warned company boards to step up efforts to tackle climate change, a  significant shift by the world's top asset manager as it faces mounting concerns about its fossil fuel investments.

Headlines: Yen gains, yuan weakens on report tariffs on China to stay through U.S. election
Description: China's yuan weakened on Tuesday and the Japanese yen reversed earlier losses after a report that the United States will keep tariffs on Chinese goods through the U.S. election hurt risk sentiment.

Headlines: Musk nears $346 million payday as Tesla market value soars
Description: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk is coming close to earning the first $346 million tranche of options in a record-breaking pay package, after the electric vehicle maker's stock more than doubled in the last three months.

Headlines: Boeing net orders slump to lowest in decades
Description: Boeing Co  reported its worst annual net orders in decades on Tuesday, along with its lowest numbers for plane deliveries in 11 years, as the grounding of its 737 MAX jet saw it fall far behind main competitor Airbus .

Headlines: Wells Fargo's new chief pledges more cost cuts as profit slumps
Description: Wells Fargo & Co's  profit slumped 55% in the fourth quarter as new boss Charles Scharf set aside another $1.5 billion for legal costs related to the bank's sales scandal and promised "fundamental changes."

Headlines: U.S. bank executives offer cautious optimism heading into 2020
Description: Despite trade wars, low interest rates and new geopolitical tensions, big U.S. banks have not experienced major disruption to their core businesses and top executives are hopeful they can generate growth this year.

Headlines: U.S. agency to determine cause of 2018 fatal Tesla 'Autopilot' crash
Description: The U.S. National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) will meet on Feb. 25 to determine the probable cause of the 2018 fatal crash of a Tesla Inc  vehicle in Mountain View, California, the agency said.

Headlines: Chile's Codelco says uncovered $22 million insurance fraud involving unions
Description: Chile's state-owned Codelco, the world's largest copper producer, said on Tuesday it had filed a lawsuit over an alleged scam in insurance contracts drawn up by unions for workers at its Chuquicamata and Radomiro Tomic mines.

Headlines: Former Barclays CEO suggested Qatari side deal in 2008, London court hears
Description: Former Barclays  chief executive John Varley first suggested the bank could use a side deal to satisfy Qatar's demands for extra cash in return for rescue funding for the bank during the 2008 credit crisis, a London court heard on Tuesday.

Headlines: American Airlines extends Boeing 737 MAX flight cancellations into June
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  will extend cancellations of Boeing Co  737 MAX flights through June 3 as the grounding threatens to impact a second busy U.S. summer travel season.

Headlines: Amazon boss Jeff Bezos arrives in India as local traders plan protests
Description: Amazon.com Inc  founder Jeff Bezos arrived in India on Tuesday, according to a post on his Twitter account, as thousands of small traders across 300 cities planned protests, claiming the firm is distorting local retail market.

Headlines: JPMorgan posts record annual profit as bond trading rebounds
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  posted its biggest-ever annual profit on Tuesday as its bond trading business bounced back in the last three months of the year, setting an upbeat tone for the big U.S. banks reporting this week.

Headlines: U.S. consumer prices gain slightly; underlying inflation tame
Description: U.S. consumer prices rose slightly in December even as households paid more for healthcare, and monthly underlying inflation slowed, supporting the Federal Reserve's desire to keep interest rates unchanged at least through this year.

Headlines: Former Stobart boss Tinkler dumps stake in company
Description: Former boss and the fifth-largest shareholder of Stobart Group Ltd  Andrew Tinkler dissolved his stake in the  infrastructure and support services company, according to a regulatory filing on Tuesday.

Headlines: SmileDirectClub jumps on plans to start selling aligners to dentists
Description: Shares of SmileDirectClub Inc  rose 17.4% on Tuesday after the online dentistry company said it would sell aligners directly to dentists, widening its distribution channel after a deal with rival Align Technology Inc  expired last month.

Headlines: U.S. bike firms face uphill slog to replace Chinese supply chains
Description: When Mehdi Farsi decided to shift production of State Bicycle Co's niche fixed-gear urban bikes out of China to escape U.S. tariffs, it took months to find another factory in Asia willing to do business with his Arizona company.

Headlines: UK's Johnson says Huawei critics need to suggest alternatives
Description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson said those opposed to the use of equipment made by China's Huawei in the UK's new 5G networks need to say what alternative technology should be used instead.

Headlines: Opel rules out forced redundancies until July 2025 but reopens voluntary leave scheme
Description: PSA's  German unit Opel on Tuesday said it was ruling out forced redundancies until July 2025 - extending its guarantee by two years - but was re-opening a voluntary leave program for older employees that would be limited to 2,100 jobs.

Headlines: China's 2019 annual crude imports set record for 17th year
Description: China's crude oil imports in 2019 surged 9.5% from a year earlier, setting a record for a 17th straight year, as demand growth from new refineries built last year propelled purchases by the world's biggest importer, data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: China posts strong December exports as world awaits Sino-U.S. trade deal signing
Description: China's exports rose for the first time in five months in December and by more than expected, signaling a modest recovery in demand as Beijing and Washington agreed to defuse their prolonged trade war.

Headlines: Ryanair says could start getting Boeing 737 MAX by April
Description: Ryanair  could receive its first deliveries of up to 10 grounded 737 MAX aircraft from Boeing  by April, Chief Marketing Officer Kenny Jacobs said on Tuesday, but cautioned  the timing was dependent on regulators.

Headlines: Lyft forms advisory council to improve platform safety
Description: Lyft Inc is putting together a council of experts to advise the ride-hailing company on its safety initiatives for riders and drivers, it said in a blog post on Tuesday.

Headlines: Renault, Nissan say alliance not headed for break-up
Description: Shares in Renault  recovered some lost ground on Tuesday after the French carmaker and its Japanese partner Nissan Motor  rejected media reports that their alliance was in danger of being dissolved.

Headlines: Ford invests $82 million to expand Vietnamese plant
Description: Ford Motor Co  said on Tuesday it is investing $82 million to expand its plant in northern Vietnam to boost production capacity.

Headlines: China December copper imports hit highest since March 2016; annual shipments fall
Description: China's unwrought copper imports rose 9.1% in December from the previous month to their highest since March 2016, customs data showed on Tuesday, as improving industrial activity and dwindling scrap metal supply lifted demand.

Headlines: Ahead of Bezos visit, India antitrust chief says e-commerce firms shouldn't offer heavy discounts
Description: Big e-commerce firms should not offer steep discounts, must disclose discounting policies and ensure they do not drive brick-and-mortar rivals out of business, India's antitrust chief said as his commission launched a probe into Amazon.com and Walmart's Flipkart.

Headlines: China's 2019 iron ore imports rise to second-highest ever
Description: China's iron ore imports rose 0.47% in 2019 to hover just below their all-time annual peak, fueled by strong demand at steel mills and a second-half recovery in shipments from big miners after disruptions earlier in the year.

Headlines: France expects Renault to name new CEO in few days: minister
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Tuesday he expected carmaker Renault  to name its new chief executive in a few days.

Headlines: China's 2019 trade surplus with U.S. narrows to $295.8 billion vs $323.3 billion in 2018
Description: China's trade surplus with the United States for December stood at $23.18 billion, Reuters calculation based on Chinese customs data showed on Tuesday, narrowing slightly from the $24.6 billion surplus posted for November.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury drops China currency manipulator label ahead of trade deal signing
Description: The U.S. Treasury Department on Monday dropped its designation of China as a currency manipulator days before top officials of the world's two largest economies were due to sign a preliminary trade agreement to ease an 18-month-old tariff war.

Headlines: China's December soybean imports surge on year as cargoes clear customs
Description: China's soybean imports in December surged 67% from a year earlier to a 19-month-high, customs data showed on Tuesday, as a flurry of U.S. and Brazilian cargoes booked earlier cleared customs.

Headlines: Amazon to seek order to block Microsoft from working on DoD's JEDI contract
Description: Amazon.com Inc  will ask a judge to temporarily block Microsoft Corp  from working on a $10 billion cloud contract from the Pentagon, a court filing showed on Monday.

Headlines: China rare earth exports rebound in December, but annual shipments lowest since 2015
Description: China's rare earth exports bounced back in December from a four-and-a-half-year low the previous month as buyers ramped up purchases ahead of the Lunar New Year holiday, though annual shipments still sank to their lowest in four years, hit by weaker global manufacturing demand.

Headlines: Nissan says not considering dissolving alliance with Renault
Description: Nissan Motor  said on Tuesday it was "in no way"  considering dissolving its alliance with France's Renault SA  and Mitsubishi Motors Corp  and that the alliance was the source of Nissan's competitiveness.

Headlines: Canadian court denies media request to broadcast Huawei CFO hearing
Description: A Canadian court on Monday denied a media consortium's request to broadcast a portion of hearing seeking to extradite Huawei Technologies Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou to the United States.

Headlines: Apple rejects claims it did not provide assistance in Pensacola shooting probe
Description: Apple Inc on Monday said it rejects "the characterization that Apple has not provided substantive assistance" in the investigation into a shooting in Pensacola, Florida, last month.

Headlines: Visa to pay $5.3 billion to buy fintech startup Plaid
Description: Visa Inc said on Monday it agreed to buy privately held software startup Plaid Inc in a $5.3 billion deal that will boost the payments giant's access to the booming financial technology space.

Headlines: U.S. rejects Avenatti claim that 'document dump' justifies Nike trial delay
Description: U.S. prosecutors on Monday rejected Michael Avenatti's claim that they overwhelmed him with large amounts of material for the Jan. 21 trial accusing the celebrity lawyer of trying to extort Nike Inc, and that the material should be excluded or the trial delayed by 30 days.

Headlines: New Boeing chief executive: planemaker can be 'much better'
Description: Boeing Co's  new chief executive, David Calhoun, assumed  the job on Monday as the U.S. planemaker battles to recover from two fatal crashes of 737 MAX planes that killed 346 people in five months and led to the model's worldwide grounding in March.

Headlines: Wall Street hits record, boosted by trade and earnings optimism
Description: Apple, Alphabet and other tech favorites propelled Wall Street to record highs on Monday, fueled by optimism about the signing of a preliminary U.S.-China trade deal, as well upcoming fourth-quarter earnings reports.

Headlines: U.S. coal-fired power plants closing fast despite Trump's pledge of support for industry
Description: U.S. coal-fired power plants shut down at the second-fastest pace on record in 2019, despite President Donald Trump’s efforts to prop up the industry, according to data from the federal government and Thomson Reuters.

Headlines: Boeing's worst year in decades
Description: Boeing's new Chief Executive Officer David Calhoun started work on Monday, inheriting a company that is reeling from the effects of two fatal crashes which led to the grounding of the 737 MAX last March.

Headlines: Stocks hit record ahead of U.S.-China trade deal, dollar gains
Description: Bond yields edged higher while a gauge of global equity markets hit a record high on Monday, lifted by optimism over the planned signing this week of a U.S.-China trade deal and hopes the start of the U.S. corporate earnings season will not disappoint.

Headlines: Amazon to ramp up counterfeit reporting to law enforcement
Description: Amazon.com Inc is planning to give more data on counterfeit goods to law enforcement in a further crackdown on fakes listed on its e-commerce sites, a person familiar with the program told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. gave Britain new evidence of 'madness' of using Huawei in 5G network: report
Description: U.S. government officials presented the British government with new evidence on Monday about the risks of including Huawei [HWT.UL] equipment in future 5G mobile networks, branding it "madness", the Guardian newspaper reported.

Headlines: Fed on hold, but will financial risks matter?
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve officials may be in broad agreement that interest rates are unlikely to change soon, but they differed Monday on how concerned they are about developing financial risks in assessing when a rate hike might be appropriate.

Headlines: Fed's Bostic: 'High bar' to any rate hike given need to raise inflation
Description: There is a "high bar" to the U.S. Federal Reserve raising interest rates given the need to raise inflation and guard against any drop in inflation expectations, Atlanta Fed president Raphael Bostic said on Monday.

Headlines: Oil falls 1% as focus shifts to high U.S. fuel stocks
Description: Oil prices fell about 1% on Monday as Middle East tensions eased and investors turned their focus to lackluster seasonal demand following last week's bearish U.S. report showing a large fuel stockbuilds.

Headlines: U.S. government posts $13.3 billion deficit in December
Description: The U.S. government recorded a $13.3 billion budget deficit in December, the Treasury Department said on Monday.

Headlines: Citi's corporate banking arm aims to pick up steam as market cools down
Description: When Citigroup Inc  combined businesses that cater to big companies in 2018, management wanted dealmakers, traders and traditional corporate bankers to combine forces and propel Citi toward the top of Wall Street market-share rankings.

Headlines: Maersk bets on cold storage to boost land transportation business
Description: Maersk , the world's biggest shipping company, plans to focus on premium services such as cold storage and digital solutions to avoid competing with its own freight-forwarding clients as it expands in the land transportation business.

Headlines: New Wells Fargo CEO brings Wall Street swagger to storied bank
Description: Charles Scharf will make his public debut as Wells Fargo & Co’s  chief executive during the bank’s quarterly earnings call on Tuesday, and those who have worked with him in the past say he is likely to strike a much different chord than his predecessors.

Headlines: Apple pushes recycling of iPhone with 'Daisy' robot
Description: (This corrects temperature conversion in seventh paragraph in the story dated January 10.)

Headlines: Ford's China vehicle sales drop 26% in third straight year of decline
Description: Ford Motor Co's  China vehicle sales fell for a third consecutive year, by 26.1%, as it battles a prolonged overall sales decline in its second-biggest market that has hit demand for its mass-market Ford brand and sports utility vehicles.

Headlines: India's Supreme Court asks crime fighting agency to seize local assets of JPMorgan: report
Description: India's Supreme Court on Monday directed the government's crime fighting agency to seize local assets of JPMorgan in relation to some transactions the bank engaged in with a local real estate company in 2010, according to a Press Trust of India report in Business Standard.

Headlines: U.S. makes it harder to sue corporations over franchise wage law violations
Description: The Trump administration has made it harder for employees of fast-food restaurants or other big franchises to sue corporations when individual franchise owners violate wage laws, a step that was a top priority for business groups.

Headlines: Banks lobby Aramco for incentive fee after slim IPO pickings: sources
Description: Global banks who worked on Saudi Aramco's  record initial public offering are pushing for an additional "incentive fee", three sources familiar with the matter said, as they try to boost relatively low earnings from the deal.

Headlines: India orders antitrust probe of Amazon, Walmart's Flipkart
Description: India ordered an investigation of Amazon.com Inc and Walmart's Flipkart on Monday over alleged violations of competition law in the latest setback for U.S. e-commerce giants operating in the country.

Headlines: Renault shares fall on worries Nissan alliance doomed without Ghosn
Description: Renault shares hit six-year lows on Monday as investors worried the French automaker's 20-year cost-sharing alliance with Nissan is headed for a break-up without Carlos Ghosn to hold it together.

Headlines: JPMorgan puts senior credit trader on leave over WhatsApp use: Bloomberg
Description: A senior JPMorgan Chase & Co  credit trader, Edward Koo, was placed on leave as the bank reviews whether he broke its policies by using WhatsApp group chats with colleagues, Bloomberg reported on Monday.

Headlines: Lululemon raises profit, sales forecast on upbeat holiday demand
Description: Lululemon Athletica Inc  raised its quarterly sales and profit outlook on Monday, as the Canadian apparel maker's efforts to ramp up its online presence and broaden its range helped drive sales during the all-important holiday period.

Headlines: Volkswagen's Skoda Auto 2019 deliveries dip to 1.24 million cars due to weaker sales in China
Description: Deliveries of Volkswagen's  Skoda Auto dropped slightly in 2019 to 1.24 million vehicles, from 1.25 million in 2018, mainly due to weaker sales in China, the company said on Monday.

Headlines: Stretched tech stocks leave some investors seeking off-ramp
Description: As the bull market in U.S. stocks hits new highs, some investors are searching for ways to pare their exposure to the small group of technology and communications stocks that has fueled market gains for years.

Headlines: UK, U.S. and industry officials to meet before Huawei decision: Downing Street
Description: Officials from the British and U.S. governments and the telecoms industry will meet on Monday, before Britain is due to take a decision on the possible use of Huawei [HWT.UL] equipment in future 5G mobile networks, Prime Minister Boris Johnson's spokesman said.

Headlines: WeWork debacle has unicorn investors seeking cover
Description: In the months since office-sharing startup WeWork's botched public debut, mid- and late-stage investors in big start-ups have been pushing for more safeguards in case their firms fail to go public or sell shares at a lower valuation than pre-IPO financing rounds.

Headlines: China's U.S. trade deal commitments not changed in translation: Mnuchin
Description: China's commitments in the Phase 1 trade deal with the United States were not changed during a lengthy translation process and will be released this week as the document is signed in Washington, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Sunday.

Headlines: Phase 1 trade deal stops bleeding, doesn't end U.S.-China dispute: U.S. Chamber
Description: The Phase 1 trade deal to be signed this week by China and the United States "stops the bleeding" but does not end the trade war, a senior U.S. Chamber of Commerce official said on Monday, warning that significant challenges remain.

Headlines: U.S. Champagne drinkers should expect costs to pop with new tariffs
Description: Lovers of Champagne and other French sparkling wines should brace for big cost increases if the United States makes good on a threat to impose 100% tariffs on French goods in a dispute over the country's planned digital services tax.

Headlines: As businesses hold back, U.S. consumers seen boosting big banks' profits
Description: Consumer lending is expected to propel profits for big U.S. banks when they unveil fourth-quarter results this week, though stress in corporate lending and uneven capital markets may cast a shadow over results.

Headlines: Take Five: The burning bush
Description: A swathe of Australia the size of South Korea is being razed by fire. The toll so far: 27 lives, more than 1,800 homes, a billion animals. But that's probably a fraction of the eventual costs. Analysts who have done the sums expect a drag as much as 0.4% this quarter on an economy already stuck in second gear. Given the bushfires have consumed an area 20 times greater than a similar conflagration in 2009, the cost will dwarf the $3 billion price attached to that disaster.

Headlines: Walmart sacks 56 executives in India as part of restructuring
Description: Walmart Inc, the world's largest retailer, has fired 56 of its executives in India as it restructures in the country.

Headlines: The real price of Occidental's 'costless' oil hedge
Description: In just 12 days, Occidental Petroleum Corp pulled off one of the biggest hedges against falling oil prices ever placed by a U.S. energy company. It characterized the transaction as "costless" but a Reuters review of regulatory filings, market data and interviews shows that's not the whole story.

Headlines: Walmart India says eight senior staff among 56 executives fired
Description: Walmart Inc , the world's largest retailer, has fired 56 of its India executives including eight from senior management, Krish Iyer, President and CEO of its India unit, said on Monday.

Headlines: China's BYD names former GM president Kevin Wale as senior adviser
Description: China's BYD Co Ltd  said on Monday it has appointed Kevin Wale, former General Motors  (GM) China President, as a senior adviser to the electric car maker's chairman.

Headlines: As Amazon.com flexes its muscle, Seattle moves to curb corporate political donations
Description: Seattle, the Pacific Northwest city where home-grown online retailer Amazon.com has increasingly flexed its political muscle, is expected to approve on Monday legislation banning political contributions by companies with at least 5% foreign ownership.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco raises IPO to record $29.4 billion by over-allotment of shares
Description: State-owned oil company Saudi Aramco said on Sunday it had exercised its "greenshoe option" to sell an additional 450 million shares, raising the size of its initial public offering (IPO) to a record $29.4 billion.

Headlines: U.S. officials to visit Britain, pushing for Huawei 5G ban
Description: A delegation of U.S. officials will arrive in Britain on Monday to try to persuade Britain not to use Huawei equipment in the upgrade of its telecoms network, two people with knowledge of the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: Peugeot family aims to quickly raise PSA-Fiat Chrysler stake: newspaper interview
Description: The Peugeot family, which will own a 6.2% stake in the new carmaker resulting from PSA  and Fiat Chrysler's  merger, aims to increase its holding as soon as possible, a representative said in a newspaper interview.

Headlines: Pressure for 2020 as U.S. companies report end of weak profit year
Description: As major U.S. corporations prepare to close the books on a lackluster year of profit growth, they may need to shore up confidence that 2020 will show significant improvement to keep the stock market's rally going.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp steps up efforts to sell Industrial Solutions unit: FT
Description: German conglomerate Thyssenkrupp AG  has stepped up efforts to sell its Industrial Solutions unit, which builds plants and industrial sites, the Financial Times newspaper reported https://on.ft.com/2uCjbc5 on Sunday.

Headlines: U.S., China agree to semi-annual talks aimed at reforms, resolving disputes
Description: The United States and China have agreed to restart semi-annual  talks aimed at resolving economic disputes between the two countries, a process abandoned at the start of the Trump administration as a trade conflict between the countries escalated.

Headlines: Amazon boss Bezos to face protests from traders during India trip
Description: Thousands of small-scale traders in India are planning to organize protests against Amazon.com Inc  founder Jeff Bezos, who will visit the country next week for a company event and potential meetings with government officials.

Headlines: 'Designed by clowns': Boeing employees ridicule 737 MAX, regulators in internal messages
Description: Boeing Co has released hundreds of internal messages that contained harshly critical comments about the development of the 737 MAX, including one that said the plane was "designed by clowns who in turn are supervised by monkeys".

Headlines: Factbox: In Boeing internal messages, employees distrust the 737 MAX and mock regulators
Description: Boeing Co has released hundreds of internal messages that show attempts to duck regulatory scrutiny in the development of the 737 MAX, as well as employees disparaging the plane, the company and aviation regulators.

Headlines: Japan seeks Interpol wanted notice for Carlos Ghosn's wife
Description: Japanese authorities have requested the International Criminal Police Organization (ICPO) for an Interpol wanted notice for the wife of former Nissan Motor  boss Carole Ghosn, local media reported on Saturday.

Headlines: Boeing's ousted CEO departs with $62 million, even without severance pay
Description: Boeing Co's  ousted chief executive officer, Dennis Muilenburg, is leaving the company with $62 million in compensation and pension benefits but will receive no severance pay in the wake of the 737 MAX crisis.

Headlines: Striking Cambodian casino workers return to work in NagaWorld deal
Description: Thousands of striking Cambodian workers of a Hong Kong-listed casino company returned to their jobs on Saturday after winning wage increases and the reinstatement of a suspended union leader in a rare labor victory.

Headlines: China's Communist Party expels ex-chairman of China Development Bank
Description: A former chairman of the China Development Bank, Hu Huaibang, has been expelled from the country's ruling Communist Party for serious violations of discipline, the party's graft watchdog said on Saturday.

Headlines: Mercedes-Benz to build smart brand cars with Geely in China's Xi'an: senior exec
Description: Mercedes-Benz will build smart-branded electric cars with Zhejiang Geely Holding Group [GEELY.UL] in the Chinese city of Xian from a base with annual capacity of around 150,000 vehicles, a senior official from its German parent Daimler AG  said on Saturday.

Headlines: WarnerMedia's CNN to pay $76 million to settle dispute with Team Video Services
Description: WarnerMedia's news channel CNN, owned by AT&T Inc, on Friday agreed to pay $76 million in backpay to settle a long-standing dispute over the termination of a contract with camera operators Team Video Services (TVS).

Headlines: U.S. regulator seeks to fine Boeing $5.4 million for defective parts on 737 MAX planes
Description: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) said on Friday it was  seeking to fine Boeing Co $5.4 million, alleging it failed to prevent the installation of defective parts on 737 MAX airplanes.

Headlines: Alphabet legal head Drummond exits, giving its new CEO chance to shake up team
Description: Alphabet's new Chief Executive Sundar Pichai on Friday gained the opportunity to reshape the leadership of Google's parent with the exit of Chief Legal Officer David Drummond, whose outsized strategic role was overshadowed by employee concerns about his personal relationship with a subordinate.

Headlines: Wall Street slips from records after jobs data, but posts weekly gains
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Friday from record-high levels as investors took profit and data showed slower-than-expected December U.S. jobs growth, but the major indexes posted gains for the week.

Headlines: GM to revive Hummer name with electric pickups, SUVs: sources
Description: General Motors Co  will revive the Hummer name to sell a new family of electric pickup trucks and sport utility vehicles and will tout the return with a Super Bowl ad featuring NBA star LeBron James, two people briefed on the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Uber to take exit ramp in Colombia after 'arbitrary' court ruling
Description: Uber Technologies Inc will stop operating in Colombia at the end of this month, following a court order late last year which the ride-hailing company on Friday called "arbitrary" and a violation of its right to due process.

Headlines: Boeing supplier Spirit to lay off more than 20% of workforce in Kansas
Description: Boeing Co's  biggest supplier, Spirit AeroSystems Holdings Inc , said on Friday it plans to lay off more than 20% of the workforce at its Wichita-Kansas base as it grapples with halted production and uncertainty over when 737 MAX jets will return to service.

Headlines: Dollar, stocks slide on renewed Middle East tensions
Description: The dollar fell and global equity markets retreated from fresh highs on Friday, as signs of renewed U.S.-Iranian tensions scuttled a rally triggered by a U.S. labor report showing a strong economy despite slowing job growth in December.

Headlines: Canadian prosecutors say case against Huawei CFO is about fraud, not sanctions
Description: Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou's conduct amounts to fraud under Canadian law and the court need not consider U.S. sanctions law, Canadian federal prosecutors argued in a court filing released on Friday.

Headlines: FAA proposes $3.92 million fine against Southwest for alleged weight infractions
Description: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) said on Friday it is seeking to impose a $3.92 million fine on Southwest Airlines Co  for alleged weight infractions on 21,505 flights on 44 aircraft between May 1, 2018 and Aug. 9, 2018.

Headlines: Facebook's stock hits record high, signaling recovery after extended historic slump
Description: Shares of Facebook , which have been doggedly crawling their way back from a historic slump after lapses in users' privacy sparked fears of lower profits, on Friday struck an intra-day record high for the first time in over a year.

Headlines: Airbus net orders rise but lag behind deliveries in 2019
Description: Airbus posted higher airplane orders for 2019 but failed to keep pace with deliveries for the second year in a row after axing its A380 superjumbo program and clearing its books of some defunct deals left over from a faltering industry order boom.

Headlines: U.S. employment in the 2010s in five charts
Description: The last U.S. employment report of the 2010s out Friday had few surprises, but it wrapped up a decade that featured some notable milestones in a job market that has changed dramatically in the space of 10 years.

Headlines: As U.S. election heats up, investors brace for volatility
Description: A U.S. stock market that has weathered trade wars, weak corporate earnings, and now a U.S.-Iran conflict to continually hit record highs faces a new obstacle: the 2020 U.S. election season.

Headlines: U.S. refinery sales hit the brakes, with 5% of capacity on block
Description: From coast to coast, U.S. refineries are available for the taking, but nobody is buying.

Headlines: U.S. to probe Fitbit, Garmin, other wearable devices after Philips complains
Description: U.S. trade regulators said on Friday they will investigate wearable monitoring devices, including those made by Fitbit Inc  and Garmin Ltd , following allegations of  patent violations by rival Koninklijke Philips  and its North America unit.

Headlines: Oil falls below $65/bbl in first weekly drop since November
Description: Oil fell below $65 a barrel on Friday in its first weekly loss since late November, erasing the week's risk premium added since a U.S. drone strike killed a top Iranian general as investors focused on rising U.S. inventories and other signs of ample supply.

Headlines: U.S. employment growth slows; labor market tightening
Description: U.S. job growth slowed in December after surging in the prior month, but the pace of hiring is enough to keep the longest economic expansion in history on track despite a deepening downturn in a manufacturing sector stung by trade disputes.

Headlines: Soaring SUV sales keep carmakers on collision course with climate policy
Description: Soaring demand for SUVs drove record sales for premium carmakers including BMW and Mercedes last year, leaving the industry on collision course with government efforts to tackle global warming despite big investments in electric vehicles.

Headlines: Factbox: Global passenger car sales by luxury brand
Description: Carmakers Daimler  BMW  Audi  and Jaguar Land Rover released annual sales figures for their premium brands.

Headlines: Olympics: Games must connect with gamers to keep Olympics relevant - Bach
Description: The International Olympic Committee has to connect with hundreds of millions of gamers worldwide if the Olympic body is to remain relevant with the younger generation, IOC President Thomas Bach said on Friday.

Headlines: China's Geely in talks to take stake in Aston Martin
Description: China’s Geely Automobile Holding  is in talks with Aston Martin  management and investors about taking a stake in the luxury carmaker, according to a source close to the discussions and a report by the Financial Times, sparking a sharp jump in the British company's share price.

Headlines: Takeaway seals victory in $8 billion Just Eat battle
Description: Online food ordering company Takeaway.com has won the  battle for Britain's Just Eat with a 6.2 billion pound ($8 billion) share offer that will create one of the world's largest meal delivery companies.

Headlines: Mediaset approves changes to keep pan-European TV plan afloat
Description: Italy's Mediaset on Friday won shareholder approval for governance tweaks needed to smooth a pan-European expansion plan despite opposition from its second-biggest investor Vivendi, which is fighting the project in court.

Headlines: Majority of Americans favor wealth tax on very rich: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Description: The idea of imposing a wealth tax on the richest Americans has elicited sharply divergent views across a spectrum of politicians, with President Donald Trump branding it socialist and progressive Democratic presidential contenders Senators Elizabeth Warren and Bernie Sanders prominently endorsing it.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs finally launches app for online bank Marcus
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc launched a long-awaited app this week for customers of its online bank Marcus.

Headlines: Japan failed to arrange fair trial for Ghosn: French lawyer
Description: Former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn's lawyer on Friday told Japan's government that the authorities had failed to arrange for a fair trial that respected universal rights.

Headlines: Lebanon may lift Ghosn's travel ban if files not received within 40 days: caretaker justice minister
Description: Lebanon may lift a travel ban on ousted Nissan  boss Carlos Ghosn if files pertaining to his case do not arrive from Japan within 40 days, caretaker justice minister Albert Serhan said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: As White House plans U.S.-China Phase 1 ceremony, still no final deal text
Description: The Trump administration has invited at least 200 people to a Jan. 15 ceremony to witness the signing of the Phase 1 trade deal between the United States and China, but the two nations have not yet finalized what, exactly, will be signed, White House officials said on Friday.

Headlines: Brookfield, Temasek team up for Thyssenkrupp elevator bid: sources
Description: Canada's Brookfield Asset Management  has teamed up with Singapore state investor Temasek Holdings [TEM.UL] in the auction for Thyssenkrupp's prized 15 billion euro ($16.6 billion) elevator division, two people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Sainsbury's Roberts is leading internal contender to be next CEO: sources
Description: Sainsbury's retail and operations director Simon Roberts has emerged as the internal favorite to succeed Mike Coupe as chief executive if the supermarket group opts to promote from within, two people with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: White House adviser says U.S.-China trade deal on track for January 15
Description: The Phase 1 U.S.-China trade deal is on track to be signed Jan. 15, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow told Fox Business Network on Friday.

Headlines: Factbox: Takeaway and Just Eat to form world leading food deliverer
Description: The takeover by Dutch food delivery company Takeaway.com of its British peer Just Eat is set to create the world's biggest online food delivery company outside China.

Headlines: U.S. December payrolls up less than expected
Description: U.S. job growth slowed more than expected in December, but the pace of hiring remains more than enough to keep the longest economic expansion in history on track despite a deepening downturn in a manufacturing sector stung by trade disputes.

Headlines: China's Ctrip in talks with banks to follow Alibaba with HK listing: sources
Description: U.S.-listed online travel giant Ctrip is talking to banks about a planned secondary listing in Hong Kong, putting the group at the head of a queue of Chinese companies expected to follow Alibaba in establishing an investor base closer to China.

Headlines: Timeline - Mediaset vs Vivendi: a TV courtroom drama unfolds
Description: Italy's biggest commercial broadcaster Mediaset  holds a shareholder meeting on Friday over governance changes needed to enable a pan-European expansion plan, which its second-largest investor Vivendi  is fighting in court.

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover's sales dip in 2019, but show signs of recovery
Description: Carmaker Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) posted a 6% fall in full-year sales on Friday after a challenging year in which its performance was hit by the weakening Chinese autos market and falling demand for diesel vehicles in Europe.

Headlines: BMW says it sold 2.52 million BMW, Mini and Rolls-Royce vehicles in 2019
Description: BMW  said it sold 2.52 million BMW, Mini and Rolls-Royce vehicles in 2019, making it the best-selling premium car group, ahead of rival Daimler .

Headlines: SoftBank's Son eyes further Indonesia investment
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  founder and chief executive, Masayoshi Son, said on Friday he wants to expand his tech conglomerate's investments in Indonesia, in remarks following a meeting with President Joko Widodo.

Headlines: U.S. dollar to dominate in directionless forex market: Reuters poll
Description: The U.S. dollar, which has dominated currency market trading for the last two years, looks set to do so again in 2020, according to the latest Reuters poll of foreign exchange strategists.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims fall, but labor market cooling
Description: New applications for U.S. jobless benefits fell more than expected last week, but the labor market appears to be cooling, with the number of Americans on unemployment rolls surging to more than a 1-1/2-year high at the end of 2019.

Headlines: Trump says China trade deal may be signed shortly after January 15
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump, who announced last month that the Phase 1 trade deal with China would be signed on Jan. 15, said on Thursday the agreement could be signed "shortly thereafter."

Headlines: Trade risks easing may mean bluer sky for 2020: Fed officials
Description: The global trade wars may not be over, but U.S. Federal Reserve officials on Thursday said the economy may have weathered the worst of it as risks begin to ease and businesses adjust to a new trade environment.

Headlines: China's bid to challenge Boeing and Airbus falters
Description: Development of China’s C919 single-aisle plane, already at least five years behind schedule, is going slower than expected, a dozen people familiar with the program told Reuters, as the state-owned Commercial Aircraft Corporation (COMAC) struggles with a range of technical issues that have severely restricted test flights.

Headlines: Waymo secures bigger award against workers who went to rival Uber
Description: Alphabet Inc's Waymo said on Thursday that arbitrators had finalized a judgment of $128 million, plus undisclosed legal costs and interest, against two former employees who went to rival Uber Technologies Inc.

Headlines: Wall Street notches records on trade optimism, Apple gains
Description: Major U.S. stock indexes registered record closing highs on Thursday as optimism about a U.S.-China trade deal firmed and as Apple and other market heavyweights posted strong gains.

Headlines: Samsung sets up anti-corruption panel as chief faces trials
Description: South Korea's Samsung Group, whose leader faces trials over a bribery scandal involving former president Park Geun-hye, has appointed external experts to a new oversight panel to stamp out criminal conduct, the chief of the committee said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg drops annual challenges to focus on longer-term goals
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said on Thursday he was dropping his annual challenges this year to take a longer-term focus on the decade ahead.

Headlines: Blackstone raises three-quarters of targeted $4.6 billion life sciences fund
Description: U.S. private equity firm Blackstone Group Inc  has secured $3.4 billion from investors for its first fund dedicated to investments in the life sciences sector, targeting $4.6 billion in total, a regulatory filing showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Global stocks scale records, oil dips as investors hail easing of Mideast tensions
Description: Crude oil prices slid and equity markets around the world set new highs on Thursday as investors took on greater risk in a relief rally after the United States and Iran moved to defuse escalating tensions in the Middle East.

Headlines: Ghosn 'very comfortable' after Lebanon questioning: lawyer
Description: Carlos Ghosn's lawyer said he was "very comfortable" with legal proceedings in Lebanon on Thursday, after the fugitive ex-Nissan boss was questioned over an extradition request from Japan where he faces financial misappropriation charges.

Headlines: After escaping Japan, Ghosn feels Lebanese crisis
Description: Carlos Ghosn's daring escape from Japan to Lebanon may have cast light on his wealth and influence, but in Beirut the ex-Nissan boss can only get a few hundred dollars a week from the bank because of the country's deep financial crisis.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin names Steven Walker as chief technology officer
Description: Weapons maker Lockheed Martin Corp  on Thursday named Steven Walker as its chief technology officer.

Headlines: Boeing may have to lower 787 Dreamliner production rate: Air Lease CEO
Description: Boeing Co  could be forced to cut production of its bigger 787 Dreamliners to 10 aircraft per month, amid a drought of orders from China, U.S. airplane leasing firm Air Lease Corp  Chief Executive Officer John Plueger said on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil eases as focus shifts from Iran tensions to U.S. crude build
Description: Oil prices retreated further on Thursday, adding to sharp losses in the previous session as the market shifted focus toward rising U.S. crude stocks and away from worries about the conflict between the United States and Iran.

Headlines: Italian court turns down Vivendi's request to suspend freeze on Mediaset stake
Description: An Italian court has thrown out a request by Vivendi  to suspend a ruling forcing it to freeze two-thirds of its stake in Italian broadcaster Mediaset , a court document showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump's tariffs cost U.S. companies $46 billion to date, data shows
Description: Tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump to restructure the United States's top trade relationships have cost American companies $46 billion since February 2018, and U.S. exports of goods hit by retaliatory tariffs have fallen sharply, according to an analysis of Commerce Department data.

Headlines: IKEA enters UK shopping centers market with London mall deal
Description: IKEA's shopping center business is spending 170 million pounds ($222 million) to buy and upgrade a London mall in its first foray into Britain, betting it can win over a nation increasingly doing its shopping online.

Headlines: Uber partners with Hyundai on electric air taxi
Description: U.S. ride-hailing company Uber Technologies Inc  and South Korean automaker Hyundai Motor  have teamed up to develop electric air taxis, joining the global race to make small self-flying cars to ease urban congestion.

Headlines: Mercedes-Benz poised to clinch premium sales crown for 2019
Description: Daimler  sold 2.34 million Mercedes-Benz passenger cars in 2019 for a ninth consecutive year of record sales, it said on Thursday, putting the German carmaker in pole position to retain the title of biggest-selling premium car brand.

Headlines: Trump says he may wait to finish Phase 2 China trade deal until after November
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said his administration will start negotiating the Phase 2 U.S.-China trade agreement soon but that he might wait to complete any agreement until after November's U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: NY Fed's Williams says central bank can avert 'downward trend' in inflation expectations
Description: U.S. central bank officials need to hold themselves accountable and boost communication of their strategy as they grapple with the challenge of preventing inflation - and inflation expectations - from falling too low, a senior Fed official said Thursday.

Headlines: Airbus boosts output at U.S. plant amid tariff dispute
Description: Airbus will increase production of A320-family jets at its Mobile, Alabama, plant to seven a month by the beginning of 2021, adding 275 jobs, the European planemaker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Weak holiday sales at Kohl's, J.C. Penney spell more trouble for stores
Description: Kohl's Corp  and J.C. Penney Co Inc  reported lower holiday season sales on Thursday, a sign that traditional brick-and-mortar retailers struggled to compete with record-breaking online shopping between Thanksgiving and New Year's Day.

Headlines: Ackman avoids limelight even as Pershing Square posts record 2019
Description: Two years ago, investor William Ackman, who pushes corporations to perform better, took his own advice and laid out a plan for a comeback after years of losses.

Headlines: Kinder Morgan sells Pembina shares for $764 million
Description: Pipeline operator Kinder Morgan Inc  said on Thursday it sold the 25 million shares in Canada's Pembina Pipeline Corp  that it received when Pembina bought Kinder Morgan Canada for $764 million.

Headlines: How Big Tech is helping transform cars into smartphones
Description: Technology companies transformed smartphones and televisions into continuous fountains of revenue. Now, big tech wants to work with automakers to do the same thing for your car.

Headlines: Walsh hands over the controls after building British Airways parent IAG
Description: Willie Walsh, who created British Airways parent IAG  by dragging old-fashioned flag carriers into the modern age of budget flying, will step down in March to be replaced by Iberia boss Luis Gallego.

Headlines: Takeaway shareholders approve Just Eat acquisition: company
Description: Dutch food ordering company Takeaway.com said on Thursday its shareholders had approved plans for the company's proposed 5.9 billion pound ($7.7 billion) acquisition of British peer Just Eat PLC.

Headlines: Concerns over U.S. Latecoere purchase overblown: Dassault CEO
Description: Concerns among French lawmakers about aerospace firm Latecoere's  sale to a U.S. fund are "overblown", the head of its major client Dassault Aviation said on Thursday.

Headlines: Japan minister launches counterattack after Ghosn blasts justice system
Description: Japan's justice minister launched a rare and forceful public takedown of auto executive-turned-fugitive Carlos Ghosn after he blasted the country's legal system as allowing him "zero chance" of a fair trial as he sought to justify his escape to Beirut.

Headlines: Grocers roll out plant-based burgers - at prices below Beyond Meat
Description: (This Jan. 8 story corrects para 11 to say private-label companies, and not retailers, will need to sell plant-based products at a net wholesale cost of $1.25 below Beyond Meat and rivals)

Headlines: Carlos Ghosn says will fully cooperate with Lebanese judiciary: broadcaster LBCI
Description: Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn said he will "fully cooperate" with Lebanon's judiciary in comments to broadcaster LBCI on Thursday, adding he was more comfortable with it than Japan's judiciary.

Headlines: Volkswagen's 2019 vehicle deliveries slightly above 2018
Description: Volkswagen Group  said on Thursday its vehicle deliveries last year were slightly above the previous year's level, revising up an earlier forecast which predicted 2019 sales would be level with the year before.

Headlines: China's Vice Premier Liu to sign U.S. trade deal in Washington next week
Description: China's Vice Premier Liu He, head of the country's negotiation team in Sino-U.S. trade talks, will sign a "Phase 1" deal in Washington next week, the commerce ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: Factbox: A look at British Airways-owner IAG's new first-in-command
Description: Willie Walsh, the chief executive of British Airways-owner IAG , will step down from the airlines group he helped to build later this year and hand the reins to Luis Gallego.

Headlines: Lebanon seeks Ghosn file from Japan-Lebanese judicial source
Description: Lebanese judicial authorities have asked Japan for its file on  Carlos Ghosn, including the charges against him, and will not question him again until the information is received, a Lebanese judicial source told Reuters on Thursday after Ghosn was questioned.

Headlines: Democratic lawmaker rebukes Wells Fargo rebate request
Description: Democratic Representative Katie Porter, a first-term lawmaker known as a tough Wall Street critic, accused Wells Fargo & Co  of passing on costs associated with its wide-ranging scandals to third parties, in a scathing letter sent to the bank's new chief executive on Thursday.

Headlines: First Abu Dhabi Bank to auction Al Jaber's Dubai Shangri-La hotel: sources
Description: First Abu Dhabi Bank (FAB)  has started an auction process for a Dubai hotel operated by Shangri-La and owned by indebted construction group Al Jaber with a starting price of 700 million dirhams ($190.59 million), two sources said.

Headlines: Apple's iPhone sales in China up 18% in December: government data
Description: Sales of Apple Inc's  iPhone in China in December jumped more than 18% year on year, government data showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Ghosn is "very comfortable" with judicial path in Lebanon: lawyer
Description: Former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn is very comfortable with the judicial path in Lebanon, a lawyer for him said on Thursday,  after he was questioned over an Interpol warrant issued by Japan seeking his arrest on financial misconduct charges.

Headlines: Lebanese investigators finish questioning Ghosn, file referred to prosecutor: judicial source
Description: Lebanese investigators finished questioning former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn on Thursday, a judicial source said, after he was summoned over an Interpol warrant issued by Japan seeking his arrest on financial misconduct charges.

Headlines: Lebanon imposes travel ban on Ghosn after questioning over warrant: judicial source
Description: A Lebanese prosecutor imposed a travel ban on former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn on Thursday, a judicial source said, after he was questioned over an Interpol warrant issued by Japan seeking his arrest on financial misconduct charges.

Headlines: EU resumes probe into Boeing-Embraer deal, sets new April 30 deadline
Description: The European Union's antitrust regulators have resumed their investigation into Boeing's  deal to buy the commercial arm of Brazil's Embraer , according to a filing posted on the EU's website on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: India reviewing anti-trust complaint against Maruti Suzuki over car insurance - sources
Description: India's antitrust regulator is looking into allegations that Maruti Suzuki , the country's biggest car maker, pushes buyers to purchase insurance policies offered by the company, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Tanker owners face insurance headache as Mideast war risk haunts shipping trade
Description: Even as the United States and Iran appear to signal a keenness to avoid further conflict, oil and gas shipowners are bracing to pay a price for the war of words that culminated in rocket strikes in Iraq over the last week - higher insurance bills.

Headlines: ABN Amro names PwC's former Dutch chairman as new CEO
Description: ABN Amro  said on Thursday that Robert Swaak, a former chairman of accounting firm PwC in the Netherlands, is to succeed Kees van Dijkhuizen as the Dutch bank's chief executive.

Headlines: 'Gold rush': Race is on for health data in East Europe's frontier market
Description: Eastern Europe is a new frontier for private medical care, and insurers and tech startups are racing to steal a march on their rivals by harnessing the region's health data.

Headlines: Divergent paths: Oil, natural gas going different directions
Description: The diverging fundamentals of U.S. oil and natural gas can be seen dramatically in the markets, where the oil-to-gas price ratio has surged to its highest in six years.

Headlines: Chairman Mao's favored Red Flag carmaker eyes 1 million customers by 2030
Description: China's FAW Group [SASACJ.UL] aims to double its annual sales of Chairman Mao Zedong's carmaker of choice, Hongqi, or Red Flag, to 200,000 units this year and grow them further to 1 million cars in the next decade, its chairman Xu Liuping said.

Headlines: Tesla's market value zooms past that of GM and Ford - combined
Description: For the first time, Tesla Inc's  stock market value has eclipsed the combined values of General Motors Co  and Ford Motor Co .

Headlines: Fugitive ex-Nissan boss Ghosn hits out at carmaker and Japan
Description: Carlos Ghosn, speaking publicly for the first time since his dramatic escape from Japanese justice, said on Wednesday he had been treated "brutally" by Tokyo prosecutors and was the victim of an inside job to oust him from the helm of automaker Nissan.

Headlines: Uber stops upfront ride pricing in response to California worker law
Description: Uber Technologies Inc on Wednesday informed its California customers that it would switch to providing estimates as opposed to fixed prices for its rides in response to a new law that makes it harder to qualify its drivers as contractors.

Headlines: Wall Street rises but ends well off day's highs amid renewed Middle East jitters
Description: U.S. stocks ended higher on Wednesday, but the day's uneven path showed investors' sensitivity to any signs of turmoil in the Middle East, with stocks rising on comments by President Donald Trump and paring gains on reports of blasts in Baghdad.

Headlines: Walmart opened 134 stores in Mexico in 2019, biggest expansion in six years
Description: Walmart last year launched its biggest expansion in Mexico since 2013, opening 134 new stores in its top foreign market and boosting its presence by nearly 5%, the retailer said Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. outlines strong support for self-driving cars at CES
Description: The Trump administration on Wednesday signaled strong support for self-driving vehicles as it released new guidance from federal agencies at the annual CES tech conference.

Headlines: Oil slides, stocks soar as Mideast conflict worries fade
Description: Oil prices tumbled and equity markets soared on Wednesday after U.S. President Donald Trump said an Iranian missile strike on bases in Iraq had not harmed American troops and damage was minimal, showing Tehran wanted to de-escalate the Middle East standoff.

Headlines: Deere bets on cost cuts, services push to boost profits
Description: Deere & Co.  on Wednesday said it will cut costs and ramp up investment in data-driven agriculture technology and its services business to make itself more profitable.

Headlines: Oil dives as U.S., Iran tensions ease and on U.S. crude build
Description: Oil futures fell more than 4% on Wednesday in a wild swing, soaring close to a four-month high in early trade on an Iranian rocket attack on U.S. forces in Iraq before retreating as the countries quickly ratcheted back tensions.

Headlines: Ghosn: I thought Versailles palace party venue was a gift
Description: Former Nissan-Renault boss Carlos Ghosn said on Wednesday he had not initially paid to hold a family party in the grounds of the sumptuous Versailles Palace because he thought the palace was offering him the use of the venue for free.

Headlines: Timeline: From arrest to flight - key dates in the Ghosn affair
Description: Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn decided to flee Japan after learning his trial had been delayed until April 2021 and also because he had not been allowed to speak to his wife, sources close to Ghosn told Reuters.

Headlines: Factbox: Carlos Ghosn joins list of execs fighting extradition
Description: Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn says he fled to Lebanon last week to escape a "rigged" justice system in Japan, where he believed he would not get a fair trial.

Headlines: Factbox: Financial wrongdoing allegations against Carlos Ghosn
Description: Carlos Ghosn, the ousted boss of the Renault-Nissan carmaking alliance who fled house arrest in Japan last week, denies the allegations of financial misconduct made against him.

Headlines: Former Nissan boss Ghosn points the finger at news conference
Description: Fugitive former Nissan chief Carlos Ghosn said that he was brought down by a plot cooked up at the company, some of whose executives he named at a news conference in Beirut on Wednesday.

Headlines: Former Nissan chief Ghosn says he was brutally taken from his family
Description: Former Nissan head Carlos Ghosn on Wednesday said he was brutally taken from his family and friends by Japanese prosecutors.

Headlines: Renault-Nissan should have merged with Fiat Chrysler: Ghosn
Description: Carlos Ghosn, the former head of the Renault-Nissan alliance, on Wednesday lamented the failure of the carmakers to merge with Fiat Chrysler (FCA), which has since combined with Peugeot (PSA).

Headlines: Seeking justice: the legal risks facing fugitive Carlos Ghosn
Description: Carlos Ghosn said on Wednesday he was the victim of a conspiracy to oust him from the helm of automaker Nissan and escaped from Japan because he could not defend himself against baseless charges of financial misconduct.

Headlines: Ghosn: Seeds of Renault-Nissan crisis were sown by Macron's move
Description: Ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn said on Wednesday that a surprise corporate move, orchestrated five years ago by French President Emmanuel Macron who was then economy minister, soured relations between Renault and Nissan and contributed to his ouster.

Headlines: Takata recalls 10 million U.S. replacement air bag inflators
Description: Takata is recalling 10 million replacement air bag inflators in the United States, the largest ever auto safety recall in history, as U.S. regulators consider whether to make it even wider.

Headlines: Exclusive: Impossible Foods has stopped McDonald's burger talks, shares of Beyond Meat jump
Description: Impossible Foods is no longer trying to win a coveted deal to supply McDonald's Corp  with plant-based burgers, telling Reuters it cannot produce enough of its imitation meat to partner with the world's No. 1 fast-food chain.

Headlines: McDonald's expands Beyond Meat plant-based burger trials in Canada
Description: McDonald's Corp  said on Wednesday it will expand its trial in Canada of vegan burgers made by Beyond Meat  as the world's biggest fast food chain tests the viability of a broader rollout.

Headlines: Lyft and Chase to offer credit card ride-hailing rewards
Description: Lyft Inc on Wednesday said it has teamed up with JPMorgan Chase & Co to offer extended rewards to Chase customers using their credit cards to pay for Lyft rides.

Headlines: Walgreens misses profit estimates on pharmacy weakness, shares fall 7%
Description: Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc's  quarterly profit missed Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, hit by lower payments from insurers on drugs sold at its U.S. pharmacies, knocking back its shares and those of rival CVS Health Corp .

Headlines: Boeing changes stance, recommends 737 MAX simulator training for pilots
Description: (This January 7 story corrects paragraph 11 to show CAE is based in Montreal, not Toronto)

Headlines: Would consider traveling to France with guarantees: Ghosn
Description: Former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn, asked in a French television interview if he would be willing to face trial in France, says he would maybe travel if he knew he would not face problems at the border.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco shares hit new low on U.S.-Iran tensions; debt markets steady
Description: Saudi Aramco shares hit a new low on Wednesday after Iran launched missiles against U.S. bases in Iraq, but Gulf debt markets were stable as some had feared stronger action in retaliation for the killing of an Iranian military commander.

Headlines: Crisis-hardened markets have learned to look past military flare-ups
Description: Iran's missile attack on U.S. army bases in Iraq overnight sent gold blasting above $1,600 an ounce, boosted the Japanese yen by almost 1% and oil by $3 a barrel.

Headlines: U.S. lawmaker seeks ban on intelligence sharing with countries that use Huawei
Description: U.S. Senator Tom Cotton on Wednesday introduced a bill that would prevent the United States from sharing intelligence with countries that allow Chinese telecoms giant Huawei Technologies to operate 5G network technology within their borders, according to a copy of the bill seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Airlines re-route or cancel flights around Iraq, Iran after missile strike on U.S. troops
Description: Major airlines canceled Iran and Iraq flights on Wednesday and re-routed others away from both countries' airspace following an Iranian missile strike on U.S.-led forces in Iraq.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz names Campbell executive to head U.S. business
Description: Kraft Heinz Co  on Wednesday named Campbell Soup Co  executive Carlos Abrams-Rivera president of its U.S. business, the Heinz ketchup maker's latest executive hire as it aims to revitalize its business after a troubling year.

Headlines: Ghosn says can help Lebanon as gets prosecutor summons
