Description: Ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn has been summoned for questioning by a Lebanese public prosecutor over an Interpol notice issued by Japan calling for his arrest on financial misconduct charges after he fled last month ahead of his trial.

Headlines: Macy's holiday season sales fall less than feared, to close 29 stores
Description: Macy's Inc  reported a small decline in holiday same-store sales on Wednesday, surprising investors who were bracing for a sharper drop following an earlier profit warning.

Headlines: Exclusive: Brazil prosecutor aims to charge Vale within days over mining waste dam disaster
Description: A Brazilian state prosecutor expects to bring criminal charges "in the next few days" against miner Vale  over a mining waste dam collapse that killed at least 259 people, even as the prosecutor's federal counterpart continues to investigate the case.

Headlines: U.S. Fed at odds with bank regulators on community lending standards
Description: A top U.S. Federal Reserve official said on Wednesday that bank regulators should pursue a more nuanced approach to updating community lending standards for banks.

Headlines: Oil price spike clouds U.S. corporate profit outlook, puts investors on edge
Description: Investors are worrying that rising energy costs due to an escalating conflict between the United States and Iran that has caused a spike in oil prices will hurt U.S. corporate earnings.

Headlines: Tokyo prosecutors say no conspiracy with Nissan, Ghosn failed to justify his acts
Description: Tokyo prosecutors struck back at ousted Nissan Motor boss Carlos Ghosn on Thursday, saying his allegations of a conspiracy between prosecutors and the automaker were false and that he had failed to justify his acts.

Headlines: U.S. private payrolls post largest gain in eight months
Description: U.S. private payrolls increased by the most in eight months in December, pointing to sustained labor market strength though job gains last month were likely flattered by a seasonal quirk.

Headlines: Ghosn ready to help Lebanon if asked
Description: Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn said on Wednesday he was ready to use his expertise if asked to help Lebanon, which is reeling from a deep economic and financial crisis.

Headlines: Ousted Nissan boss Ghosn: I hope France hasn't abandoned me
Description: Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn, who holds a French passport, said on Wednesday he hoped France had not abandoned him in his legal standoff with Japan over allegations of financial misconduct that he has denied.

Headlines: Japanese billionaire Maezawa in $9 million 'social experiment' giveaway
Description: Japanese fashion tycoon Yusaku Maezawa is giving away $9 million to his Twitter followers in what he says is a "social experiment" to see if the payment boosts their happiness.

Headlines: Private investigator in Credit Suisse spying scandal hits back at banker
Description: A private investigator from the firm tasked with tailing former Credit Suisse  banker Iqbal Khan has countered Khan's legal action with criminal complaints against the banker, his wife and the police, Swiss prosecutors said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Apple News users reach 100 million, App Store sales rise
Description: Apple Inc's  news service has reached 100 million monthly active users and customers spent more than $1.4 billion in the App Store between Christmas and New Year, the latest signs of growing revenue from the iPhone maker's services business.

Headlines: Ted Baker's lenders hire restructuring experts for independent review: Sky News
Description: Ted Baker's  lenders have hired advisers to carry out an independent review of the troubled British fashion retailer to assess its prospects, Sky News said https://news.sky.com/story/ted-baker-lenders-call-for-help-at-ailing-retail-chain-11903703 on Wednesday.

Headlines: Turkish jet firm met Japan ambassador to offer help with Ghosn
Description: The Turkish operator of private jets that ex-Nissan chief Carlos Ghosn used to escape Japan said on Wednesday it met with the Japanese ambassador to Turkey and offered to collaborate with the authorities in that country over the incident.

Headlines: Two U.S. auto trade groups merge as regulatory issues loom
Description: Two major U.S. automotive trade groups said Wednesday they will merge as the industry faces dramatic challenges, including regulatory, trade and emissions issues.

Headlines: Varta warns Chinese firms on patent infringements, shares plunge
Description: German battery maker Varta  said on Wednesday that it has warned electronic goods traders after finding products with batteries from Chinese manufacturers which infringe on its patents.

Headlines: 'Shot across the bow': U.S. steps up pressure on UK ahead of Huawei decision
Description: The United States is making a final pitch to Britain ahead of a UK decision on whether to upgrade its telecoms network with Huawei equipment, amid threats to cut intelligence-sharing ties, people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Bytedance's video app TikTok bans 'misleading information'
Description: Popular video-sharing app TikTok issued a broad ban on Wednesday against "misleading information" that could cause harm to its community or the public, setting itself apart from rivals like Facebook which say that they do not want to be arbiters of truth.

Headlines: Luckin Coffee seeks more of China market, launches equity deals worth $821 million
Description: Luckin Coffee Inc  said it is expanding into vending machines that sell freshly brewed hot beverages and snacks, seeking even more of the China market after overtaking Starbucks Corp  as the country's biggest coffee chain by number of stores.

Headlines: Samsung Electronics says profit fall likely milder than forecasts as chip prices bottom out
Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  on Wednesday said quarterly operating profit likely fell at a milder pace than analysts forecast, indicating memory chip prices bottomed out and strengthening hope of recovery from an industry downturn.

Headlines: Geely, Mercedes-Benz launch $780 million JV to make electric smart-branded cars
Description: Zhejiang Geely Holding Group Co Ltd and Mercedes-Benz on Wednesday said they would each invest 2.7 billion yuan ($388.77 million) in a China-based venture to build "premium and intelligent electrified" vehicles under the smart brand.

Headlines: Malaysia anti-graft body says audio clips show Najib tried to cover-up 1MDB scandal
Description: Malaysia’s former prime minister, Najib Razak, allegedly sought help from the United Arab Emirates' crown prince to fake evidence to cover up for the 1MDB scandal, according to audio clips revealed by Malaysian anti-graft officials on Wednesday.

Headlines: BMW achieves record 2019 sales, looks to 2020 with confidence
Description: German carmaker BMW  achieved record sales of 2.5 million vehicles in 2019, sales chief Pieter Nota said on Wednesday, adding that he was upbeat about the company's prospects in 2020.

Headlines: CITIC to sell 22% stake in McDonald's China business to PE arm: sources
Description: CITIC Ltd , the main listed arm of Chinese state-owned conglomerate CITIC Group, plans to sell a 22% stake in McDonald's Corp's  mainland China and Hong Kong business, which is likely to be bought by the group's private equity arm.

Headlines: Alibaba undercuts Amazon in Europe to woo wary brands
Description: After years of reconnaissance, China's retail king Alibaba is finally making its move on Europe. It is undercutting Amazon sellers' fees to attract vendors but has had mixed results, six sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Democratic lawmaker presses antitrust enforcers on company ties, settlements
Description: The chair of the U.S. House of Representatives antitrust subcommittee pressed top regulators on Tuesday over merger decisions, including the Justice Department's approval of T-Mobile US Inc's  proposed purchase of Sprint Corp .

Headlines: U.S., European regulators to meet with Boeing this week on 737 MAX software audit
Description: U.S. and European aviation safety regulators will meet with Boeing this week in an effort to complete a 737 MAX software documentation audit - a key step toward the grounded plane's eventual return to service.

Headlines: Wall Street dips as investors focus on Middle East, but chipmakers climb
Description: Wall Street's major indexes declined on Tuesday as investor caution persisted amid a dispute between the United States and Iran, while energy shares fell as oil prices gave back some recent gains.

Headlines: Stripteasing Musk launches Tesla SUV program in China
Description: Elon Musk raised an online storm by dancing on stage at the launch of Tesla's  Model Y electric sports utility vehicle program on Tuesday in its new Shanghai factory, where the company delivered its first cars built outside the United States to the public.

Headlines: Japan seeks arrest of Ghosn's wife amid efforts to snare him
Description: Japanese prosecutors on Tuesday issued an arrest warrant for Carlos Ghosn's wife for alleged perjury, as officials stepped up efforts to bring the fugitive car industry boss back to face trial on financial misconduct charges.

Headlines: Dollar gains, oil slips as markets focus on Mideast
Description: The dollar gained, helped by better-than-expected data in the U.S. non-manufacturing sector, and oil prices retreated on Tuesday as caution kept investors alert for developments in the U.S.-Iranian stand-off in the Middle East.

Headlines: Wife of ex-Nissan boss says arrest warrant an act of revenge: Le Parisien
Description: The wife of former Nissan boss Carols Ghosn on Tuesday said a Japanese arrest warrant against her was to avenge her husband's escape from Japan's judiciary and described the act as petty.

Headlines: United Airlines to record $90 million charge related to Hong Kong routes
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  said on Tuesday it expects a non-cash impairment charge of $90 million in the fourth quarter related to its Hong Kong routes, following anti-government protests in the city.

Headlines: Oil falls 1% as investors reassess Middle East risks
Description: Oil prices fell almost 1% on Tuesday, surrendering some recent gains as investors reconsidered the likelihood of immediate supply disruptions in the Middle East after the United States killed a top Iranian military commander last week.

Headlines: Starbucks launches oat milk drink as vegan movement grows
Description: Starbucks Corp on Tuesday added an oat milk beverage to its menu, as the coffee chain taps into the growing demand for vegan alternatives to dairy.

Headlines: Latin America's Avianca reduces Airbus order by 20 planes
Description: Latin American airline Avianca  has reached an agreement with airplane manufacturer Airbus  to reduce the number of planes it was set to buy by 20, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit at three-year low as imports tumble
Description: The U.S. trade deficit fell to a more than three-year low in November as imports declined further, weighed down by the Trump administration's trade war with China, and exports rebounded, suggesting solid economic growth in the fourth quarter.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs answers investor demands on consumer bank
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  unveiled details about its consumer business for the first time on Tuesday and will start disclosing its results regularly as part of a broader reporting-line shuffle, responding to long-standing requests for more transparency from analysts and investors.    The changes are part of Chief Executive Officer David Solomon's efforts to get Goldman in line with rivals like JPMorgan Chase & Co  and Citigroup  that have bigger con

Headlines: VW's Seat brand chief steps down as Renault continues CEO hunt
Description: Volkswagen  on Tuesday said that Luca de Meo has stepped down from his current role as head of its Spanish Seat brand just as rival Renault  intensifies efforts to find a new chief executive.

Headlines: GM's 2019 China sales drop for second year on weak economy
Description: General Motors Co's  vehicle sales in China fell for a second year as overall auto sales declined amid a slowing economy and because of competition in the key mid-priced sport utility vehicle (SUV) segment.

Headlines: U.S. Senate Finance panel advances new North American trade deal
Description: The U.S. Senate Finance Committee voted on Tuesday to approve the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement, moving the revamped North American trade deal a step closer to a final Senate vote in the coming days or weeks.

Headlines: Volkswagen says Luca de Meo steps down as CEO of Seat
Description: German carmaker Volkswagen  said on Tuesday Luca de Meo has stepped down as chief executive of its Spanish Seat brand.

Headlines: Alitalia bleeds around 300 million euros a year: administrator
Description: Struggling Italian carrier Alitalia [CAITLA.UL] is burning through its cash resources at the pace of around 300 million euros ($334 million) a year, its new temporary administrator Giuseppe Leogrande told members of a parliamentary committee.

Headlines: Volkswagen seeks damages from Prevent in ongoing legal dispute
Description: Volkswagen  is seeking more than 100 million euros ($112 million) in damages from former supplier Prevent, it said on Tuesday, adding it had filed a first claim for one of its subsidiaries.

Headlines: Waymo self-driving vehicles cover 20 million miles on public roads
Description: Waymo, the self-driving unit of Alphabet Inc , said its vehicles had covered more than 20 million miles (32.2 million km) on public roads since its creation in 2009.

Headlines: Canada posts Nov. trade deficit of C$1.09 billion, rail strike takes toll
Description: Canada posted a trade deficit of C$1.09 billion ($0.84 billion) in November, thanks in part to a major railway strike that slowed the shipment of imports and exports, Statistics Canada said on Tuesday.

Headlines: A Saudi family feud, a decade-long debt saga and a court's $14 billion decision
Description: Saudi Arabia's largest and longest debt saga, fueled by a feud that has split one of its richest families, could be nearing a resolution after a court approved about $14 billion in claims related to the collapse of two business empires a decade ago.

Headlines: Carmaker Rolls-Royce annual sales surge 25%
Description: Luxury carmaker Rolls-Royce said on Tuesday it recorded a 25% jump in sales in 2019, underpinned by solid demand for its first-ever SUV, Cullinan, just a year after the launch.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit drops to more than three-year low
Description: The U.S. trade deficit fell to a more than three-year low in November as imports declined further, likely weighed down by the Trump administration's trade war with China, and exports rebounded, suggesting the economy ended 2019 on solid footing.

Headlines: Impossible Foods to trial plant-based sausage patty with Burger King
Description: Impossible Foods Inc on Monday launched a plant-based sausage patty that will be tested in 139 Burger King restaurants later this month, entering a category dominated by rival Beyond Meat .

Headlines: Japanese ambassador to Lebanon requests more cooperation on Ghosn: statement
Description: Japan's ambassador to Lebanon on Tuesday requested greater cooperation from President Michel Aoun in dealing with former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn in order to avoid negative repercussions for their bilateral ties, Lebanon's presidency said in a statement.

Headlines: Lebanon says it will take the necessary steps over Interpol red notice for ex-Nissan boss Ghosn
Description: Lebanon's public prosecutor has received an Interpol red notice over fugitive ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn and will take the necessary steps, caretaker justice minister Albert Serhan said on Tuesday.

Headlines: American Airlines reaches settlement with Boeing for 737 MAX compensation in 2019
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  said on Monday it had reached a confidential agreement with Boeing Co  to address damages the airline incurred in 2019 due to the ongoing grounding of its fleet of Boeing 737 MAX aircraft.

Headlines: Toyota to build prototype city of the future in Japan
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  said on Monday it planned to build a prototype "city of the future" at the base of Japan's Mt. Fuji, powered by hydrogen fuel cells and functioning as a laboratory for autonomous cars, "smart homes," artificial intelligence and other technologies.

Headlines: Facebook defies China headwinds with new ad sales push
Description: Facebook Inc  is setting up a new engineering team in Singapore to focus on its lucrative China advertising business, according to three people familiar with the effort, even as chief executive Mark Zuckerberg ramps up criticism of a country that blocks the social network.

Headlines: South Korea's LG Display to end domestic production of LCD TV panels by end of 2020
Description: South Korean panel maker LG Display Co Ltd  will halt domestic production of liquid-crystal display (LCD) TV panels by the end of this year, its chief executive said on Monday, due to dropping LCD prices and a global supply glut.

Headlines: Factbox: Boeing's 737 MAX compensation deals with airlines
Description: American Airlines  is the latest airline to reach a settlement with Boeing Co  regarding the grounding of the Boeing 737 MAX airliner.

Headlines: Ferrari joins European auto lobby ACEA four years after spin-off
Description: Italian luxury carmaker Ferrari  has become the latest manufacturer to join the European carmakers' association (ACEA), the auto lobby said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Boeing will reassign 3,000 workers as airlines reach compensation deals over MAX
Description: Boeing Co  said Monday that it will reassign 3,000 workers to other jobs as it halts production of the grounded best-selling 737 MAX jet in mid-January.

Headlines: Nissan bolsters taskforce to prepare for Ghosn broadsides: sources
Description: Nissan Motor Co has strengthened a taskforce of senior officials ahead of an expected onslaught of criticism from former chairman Carlos Ghosn following his dramatic escape from house arrest in Japan, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Arrest warrant for Ghosn's wife 'pathetic', spokeswoman says
Description: A decision by Japanese prosecutors to issue an arrest warrant for Carlos Ghosn's wife shortly before the fugitive car boss was due to speak publicly about his case was "pathetic", a spokeswoman for Ghosn told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: German carmakers eye Brandenburg after Tesla expansion push
Description: The German state of Brandenburg has received a flurry of inquiries from German carmakers after electric car start-up Tesla  opted to build its European factory there, Brandenburg's Economy Minister Joerg Steinbach told Reuters.

Headlines: Japan to do utmost to have Ghosn return for trial: ministry official
Description: Japanese legal officials are poring over Lebanese laws in a bid to find a way to return ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn to Japan, a Ministry of Justice senior official said on Tuesday, adding that Tokyo will do its utmost to have him face trial on financial misconduct charges.

Headlines: Explainer: Ghosn to 'speak freely' after his escape; what's in store?
Description: Ousted Nissan Motor Co Ltd boss Carlos Ghosn is set to hold on Wednesday his first live news conference since his arrest in November 2018 on financial misconduct charges, saying his escape from Japan has meant he can communicate "freely".

Headlines: Daimler sued for $1 billion in German court over diesel cheating
Description: Investors have sued Daimler for 896 million euros ($1 billion) in a regional court in Stuttgart, accusing the carmaker of concealing its use of emissions cheating software, German law firm TILP said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Japan transport minister orders security checks for large luggage at airports
Description: Transport Minister Kazuyoshi Akaba said on Tuesday that inspections of large baggage were now mandatory at private jet facilities at Japan's major airports, following the stunning escape of ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn from the country.

Headlines: Ghosn took bullet train to Osaka en route to Lebanon: Kyodo
Description: Former Nissan  and Renault  boss Carlos Ghosn began his astonishing escape from Japan with a bullet train ride from Tokyo to Osaka, possibly accompanied by several people, Japanese news agency Kyodo reported Monday.

Headlines: Japan says it is in contact with Lebanon over Carlos Ghosn's flight
Description: Japan is in touch with Lebanon, and other relevant nations, over the departure of former Nissan Motor Co  boss Carlos Ghosn, the top government spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Left's Citron hedge fund posts 43% gain in first year
Description: Andrew Left, who has long targeted companies that he thinks are over-valued through his work at Citron Research, told investors on Monday that his new hedge fund returned 43% after fees in 2019, its first year in business.

Headlines: Wall St. brushes off Middle East tensions as tech-related shares gain
Description: U.S. stocks ended higher on Monday, rebounding from Friday's losses as investors brushed aside increased tensions in the Middle East, while shares of Alphabet and other internet names gained.

Headlines: Pier 1 to shut up to nearly half of its stores, raises going concern doubts
Description: Home decor and furniture retailer Pier 1 Imports Inc  said on Monday it plans to close up to almost half of its stores, cut jobs and warned about its ability to continue as a going concern in a tough retail environment.

Headlines: Qualcomm launches autonomous driving computer, aiming to hit roads by 2023
Description: Qualcomm Inc  on Monday announced a computing system for autonomous vehicles designed to handle everything from lane controls to full self-driving that it aims to have on the road by 2023.

Headlines: Gold surges on Mideast risk but stocks pare losses
Description: Gold prices shot to an almost seven-year high on Monday as U.S.-Iranian tensions drove demand for safe-haven assets and pushed a gauge of global equity markets lower, but shares on Wall Street rebounded on a less worrisome view of events.

Headlines: Oil steadies as market ponders Iran's next move
Description: Oil prices steadied on Monday after Brent touched above $70 a barrel on rhetoric from the United States, Iran and Iraq that fanned tensions in the Middle East after a U.S. air strike killed a top Iranian military commander.

Headlines: JetBlue to become carbon neutral in 2020
Description: JetBlue Airways Corp on Monday said it plans to become carbon neutral on all domestic flights by July 2020 and would use an alternative fuel source for flights leaving from San Francisco amid rising pressure to cut greenhouse emissions.

Headlines: Ford quarterly sales slip on slowdown in passenger cars demand
Description: Ford Motor Co on Monday posted a 1.3% fall in fourth-quarter vehicle sales as soft demand for passenger cars outweighed higher sales of pick-up trucks.

Headlines: Occidental to cut Western Midstream stake to reduce debt
Description: Occidental Petroleum Corp  said on Monday it would cut its majority stake in pipeline operator Western Midstream Partners LP  to less than 50% in 2020, to reduce its debt that grew significantly with the Anadarko Petroleum Corp deal.

Headlines: Xerox secures $24 billion financing for proposed HP takeover
Description: Xerox Holdings Corp  said on Monday it has secured $24 billion in financing for its $33.5 billion takeover offer for HP Inc , a deal that the personal computer maker is opposing.

Headlines: Louis Dreyfus owner pledged stake to raise $1 billion Credit Suisse loan
Description: Margarita Louis-Dreyfus borrowed $1 billion from Credit Suisse  last year to buy out minority shareholders of Louis Dreyfus Company (LDC), pledging her majority stake in the commodities trader as collateral, a company filing showed.

Headlines: Amazon to showcase its transportation drive at world's largest tech show
Description: From making cars talk using Alexa's voice to managing data from factories full of robots, Amazon.com Inc  wants a big piece of the action in transportation, and this week at CES will unveil more about its strategy to achieve that goal than ever before.

Headlines: Ghosn did not use French documents to travel to Lebanon: French minister
Description: Former Nissan  and Renault  boss Carlos Ghosn did not use French travel documents to travel from Japan to Lebanon, French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian said on Monday.

Headlines: HP had 'buyer's remorse' over ill-fated Autonomy deal, court hears
Description: Hewlett-Packard suffered "buyer's remorse" over its disastrous $11 billion acquisition of Autonomy and was trying to pin the blame on UK entrepreneur Mike Lynch, London's High Court heard on Monday in the closing stages of a multi-billion dollar case.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco hits new low since trading began on December 11
Description: Saudi Aramco  shares briefly hit 34.45 riyals ($9.18) in early trade, their lowest level since its shares began trading on December 11, following a record-setting initial public offering (IPO).

Headlines: Mexico's Aeromexico reaches compensation agreement with Boeing on MAX crisis
Description: Mexican airline Aeromexico  said on Monday it had reached a compensation agreement with Boeing Co  in relation to the temporary grounding of the planemaker's 737 MAX aircraft.

Headlines: Renault hires former PSA research chief
Description: French car marker Renault  said has hired former PSA  research and development chief Gilles Le Borgne as head of engineering.

Headlines: Defying gravity? What could bring U.S. stocks down to earth
Description: The U.S. stock market's relentless drive higher has caused some nail-biting on Wall Street that the rally is about to end. Geopolitical risks – such as the latest escalation of U.S. tensions with Iran - are just one on a list of worries for 2020.

Headlines: Data's the secret weapon for Rappi, SoftBank's big bet in Latin America
Description: "We're going to help you understand your missed opportunities," the boss of delivery app Rappi tells restaurants and food brands. "Why Wednesday is maybe not the best day for you, or why lunch is better than dinner."

Headlines: Trump administration pressed Dutch hard to cancel China chip-equipment sale: sources
Description: The Trump administration mounted an extensive campaign to block the sale of Dutch chip manufacturing technology to China, with Secretary of State Mike Pompeo lobbying the Netherlands government and White House officials sharing a classified intelligence report with the country's Prime Minister, people familiar with the effort told Reuters.

Headlines: Samsung to draw line under lackluster 2019 with chip revival in store
Description: With Samsung Electronics  expected to suffer its biggest annual profit drop in at least a decade, investors are counting on an expected uptick in the memory-chip market to cure the tech giant's ills this year.

Headlines: Fed focuses on repo market exit strategy after avoiding year-end crunch
Description: Wall Street's worst fears of a year-end funding squeeze never materialized thanks in large part to the quarter-trillion dollars the Federal Reserve stuffed into the market to ensure nothing became gummed up.

Headlines: South Korean restaurant owners voice concerns over $4 billion Delivery Hero deal
Description: South Korean restaurant owners expressed concern on Monday over food delivery giant Delivery Hero's  proposed $4 billion acquisition of its local rival, saying the move could undermine competition and lead to higher fees.

Headlines: Fugitive financier Jho Low denies being 'mastermind' behind 1MDB
Description: Fugitive Malaysian financier Low Taek Jho has said he only acted as an intermediary for deals involving 1MDB, denying in an interview published on Monday that he had set the stage for the theft of billions of dollars from the Malaysian state fund.

Headlines: Amazon is generating lots of free-cash flow, time to get on board: Barron's
Description: Amazon.com Inc is generating lots of free cash flow, which it often uses to invest in growing its business, making the e-commerce retailer a good investment, weekly newspaper Barron's said on Jan. 3.

Headlines: Boeing, FAA reviewing wiring issue on grounded 737 MAX
Description: Boeing Co  and the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) confirmed on Sunday they are reviewing a wiring issue that could potentially cause a short circuit on the grounded 737 MAX.

Headlines: Japan orders tighter immigration procedures after Ghosn flees country
Description: Japan on Sunday said it would tighten immigration measures after former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn fled the country while on bail, its first official response to an astonishing escape that has transformed the executive into an international fugitive.

Headlines: Chinese delegation plans to travel to Washington to sign trade deal: SCMP
Description: A Chinese trade delegation is planning to travel to Washington on Jan. 13 for the signing of the U.S.-China Phase 1 trade deal, the South China Morning Post reported on Sunday citing a source briefed on the matter.

Headlines: Gulf markets plunge on U.S.-Iran tensions, Aramco at lowest since IPO
Description: Kuwaiti and Saudi stocks led Gulf stocks sharply lower in late afternoon trade on Sunday in the wake of a U.S. drone strike in Baghdad that killed Iran's military commander.

Headlines: Daimler, Volvo mull combustion engine cooperation: report
Description: Luxury German carmaker Daimler  and Volvo Cars, owned by China's Geely, are considering cooperating to cut the costs of developing combustion engines, a magazine reported on Sunday, citing unnamed company sources.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco shares hit lowest since IPO, down 1.7%
Description: Shares of Saudi Aramco were down 1.7% in late afternoon trade on Sunday, hitting 34.55 riyals ($9.21) per share, its lowest level since it started trading last month after a record initial public offering (IPO).

Headlines: Daimler recalls 744,000 U.S. Mercedes-Benz vehicles for faulty sunroofs
Description: German automaker Daimler AG  said on Saturday it will recall 744,000 Mercedes-Benz vehicles in the United States from the 2001 through 2011 model years because the sunroof glass panel could detach and pose a hazard.

Headlines: Ghosn fled Japan after security firm hired by Nissan stopped surveillance
Description: Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn left his Tokyo residence after a private security firm hired by Nissan Motor Co stopped monitoring him, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Saturday.

Headlines: Manager at Turkish jet operator told authorities he helped Ghosn escape because of threats: newspaper
Description: A manager at Turkish jet operator MNG Jet has told authorities that he assisted unwittingly in the escape of ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn from Japan because he had been threatened by a former acquaintance, Hurriyet newspaper reported on Saturday.

Headlines: Ghosn used our jets illegally in escape from Japan, Turkish company says
Description: A Turkish private jet operator said on Friday that ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn used two of its planes illegally in his escape from Japan, with an employee falsifying lease records to exclude his name from the documents.

Headlines: Amazon considers opening stores in Germany: report
Description: Amazon.com  is considering opening stores in Germany, its second biggest market after the United States, the ecommerce company's head in the country was quoted as saying on Saturday.

Headlines: Fed policymakers broadly see eye to eye on 2020 outlook
Description: Federal Reserve policymakers who last year were frequently at odds over where to set U.S. borrowing costs opened 2020 telegraphing confidence in the state of the economy and signaling broad agreement that monetary policy is right where it should be.

Headlines: Fed may need new approach to boost inflation, Daly says
Description: The Federal Reserve could find itself fighting too-low inflation for years to come, San Francisco Federal Reserve President Mary Daly said on Friday, and may need a new policy framework to lift inflation back up to the Fed's 2% goal.

Headlines: Fed's Mester, who warned of inflation risks, says current policy 'well calibrated'
Description: Cleveland Federal Reserve Bank President Loretta Mester, among the Fed policymakers most concerned that easy monetary policy would risk excessive inflation, said on Friday she has put those fears to rest for now and is willing to leave rates at their current level absent some substantial change in the economy.

Headlines: Exclusive: Weakened by sanctions, Venezuela's PDVSA cedes oilfield operations to foreign firms
Description: Venezuelan state company PDVSA is letting some joint venture partners take over the day-to-day operation of oilfields as its own capacity dwindles due to sanctions and a lack of cash and staff, according to a former oil minister, an opposition lawmaker and industry sources.

Headlines: Take Five: Crude awakening
Description: Geopolitics is back in the driving seat. The U.S. killing of a top Iranian commander has doused the nascent New Year rally and delivered a $3 boost for oil prices on fears that any violent retaliation from Tehran would disrupt energy supplies.

Headlines: Police body camera maker Axon sues U.S. FTC over antitrust litigation
Description: Axon Enterprise Inc  on Friday sued the U.S. Federal Trade Commission in a bid to have antitrust proceedings over an acquisition heard in a federal court and not in an internal FTC process, claiming that the FTC's ability to both prosecute and judge cases deprives companies of their constitutional rights.

Headlines: S&P 500 snaps win streak as Middle East tensions push down Wall Street
Description: Wall Street's major indexes fell from record highs on Friday after a U.S. air strike in Iraq ratcheted up tensions in the Middle East and a bigger-than-expected contraction in the U.S. manufacturing sector raised concerns of slowing economic growth.

Headlines: Exxon signals fourth quarter weakness in chemicals and refining, offset by asset sale
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp's  fourth quarter operating results will decline from a year ago due to weakness in chemicals and refining, according to a regulatory filing and analyst comments on Friday.

Headlines: FTC challenges police body camera maker Axon's acquisition of rival Vievu
Description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) on Friday challenged police body camera maker Axon Enterprise Inc's  completed acquisition of rival Vievu, saying it allowed the company to impose substantial price increases.

Headlines: Oil, safe havens surge after U.S. strikes kill Iran commander
Description: Oil prices surged as much as $3 a barrel as gold, the yen and safe-haven bonds all rallied on Friday after the U.S. killing of Iran's top military commander in an air strike in Iraq ratcheted up tensions between Washington and Tehran.

Headlines: Novartis, Merck and Allergan join those raising U.S. drug prices for 2020
Description: Novartis AG, Merck & Co Inc and Allergan Plc were among companies that raised U.S. prices on more than 100 prescription medicines on Friday, bringing the tally to 445 drugs that will cost more in 2020, according to data analyzed by healthcare research firm 3 Axis Advisors.

Headlines: FCC says it will accept comments until February 3 on Huawei, ZTE security risks
Description: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) said on Friday it will accept public comments until Feb. 3 on its determination that China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd and ZTE Corp pose national security risks.

Headlines: Turkish court formally arrests five suspects over Ghosn's transit: Anadolu
Description: A Turkish court ruled on Friday to formally arrest five suspects who were detained as part of an investigation into ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn's transit through Turkey after fleeing Japan, state-owned Anadolu news agency reported.

Headlines: Oil prices jump after U.S. air strike kills top Iranian commander
Description: Oil prices jumped to the highest level in more than three months on Friday after the United States killed a top Iranian military commander in Iraq, sparking fears that escalating conflict in the region could disrupt global oil supplies.

Headlines: Story on Ghosn's exit from Japan is withdrawn
Description: This story, first published at 1243 GMT, has been withdrawn pending more reporting.

Headlines: Soleimani strike lifts safe-haven yen; grim U.S. data hits dollar
Description: Investors rushed into safe-haven assets on Friday after U.S. air strikes in Iraq killed a senior Iranian military official, sending the Japanese yen to a three-month high, while the U.S. dollar index was knocked by the weakest domestic factory activity in a decade.

Headlines: Musk defies skeptics, meets Tesla delivery goal; shares hit record
Description: Tesla Inc  beat Wall Street estimates for annual vehicle deliveries and met the low-end of its own target, sending shares to a record high in a vindication for Chief Executive Elon Musk after a few turbulent years.

Headlines: Tesla rally leaves short sellers down $3 billion since 2018
Description: Tesla Inc's  short sellers have suffered $3 billion in losses since the end of 2018, including a $500 million hit on Friday after the electric carmaker's quarterly deliveries beat investors' expectations and drove its stock to a record high.

Headlines: Discounts fuel U.S. pick-up truck sales in a slowing market
Description: U.S. automakers on Friday reported another year of stable sales of pick-up trucks, as discounts during the crucial holiday season and lower interest rates on vehicle loans attracted buyers while demand for passenger cars retreated further.

Headlines: U.S. factory sector in deepest slump in more than 10 years
Description: The U.S. manufacturing sector fell into its deepest slump in more than a decade in December as the U.S.-China trade war kept a lid on factory output, orders and employment, although the long-awaited Phase 1 deal between Washington and Beijing could limit further downside.

Headlines: Fed's Barkin says it's time to let rate cuts work through economy
Description: Richmond Federal Reserve bank president Thomas Barkin said on Friday it would take a "substantial" change in the economic outlook for him to support a rate change.

Headlines: Turkish operator says Ghosn used its jets illegally in escape from Japan
Description: Turkish private aircraft operator MNG Jet said on Friday that its planes were used illegally in the escape from Japan of ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn, adding it had filed a criminal complaint.

Headlines: Credit Suisse announces $1 billion 2020 share buyback program
Description: Credit Suisse  said on Friday it expects to buy back at least 1 billion Swiss francs ($1.03 billion) worth of shares until the end of 2020, subject to market and economic conditions, after completing a similar program last year.

Headlines: Sunrise's CEO Swantee, Chairman Kurer quit after failed Liberty Global deal
Description: Sunrise Communications  chief executive Olaf Swantee has quit and Chairman Peter Kurer said he will not run for re-election after a shareholder uprising blocked the group's $6.3 billion bid for Liberty Global's  Swiss cable unit.

Headlines: M&S names former Tesco executive as interim finance chief
Description: British retailer Marks & Spencer  on Friday named former Tesco  executive David Surdeau as its interim chief financial officer, temporarily filling a void left by the departure of Humphrey Singer.

Headlines: Louis Vuitton to close Hong Kong shop as protests bite: report
Description: Louis Vuitton, the world's biggest luxury goods brand by sales, is preparing to shut one of its shops in Hong Kong where protests have hit demand as high rental costs bite, the South China Morning Post newspaper reported on Friday.

Headlines: After Tesla's record year in Norway, rivals gear up for 2020
Description: New electric car sales in Norway rose by a third last year amid soaring demand for Tesla Inc's  vehicles, but the pioneering U.S. company will face a more competitive market in 2020 as rivals prepare to launch new electric models.

Headlines: U.S. farmers see another bleak year despite Phase 1 trade deal
Description: Across snow-covered North Dakota, U.S. farmers are stuck with fields full of weather-damaged corn - a crop they planted after the U.S.-China trade war killed their soybean market. Many don't know yet what crops they'll plant next season among a host of dicey options.

Headlines: Ryanair CEO says group may not get 737 MAX until October: report
Description: Ryanair  may only receive its first delivery of the grounded 737 MAX aircraft from Boeing  in October, chief executive Michael O'Leary said in an interview with German magazine Wirtschaftswoche.

Headlines: Exclusive: China to keep same inflation target in 2020 despite food price spike - sources
Description: China has decided to keep its inflation target unchanged this year at around 3%, sources say, suggesting policymakers will continue to roll out more economic support measures while avoiding aggressive stimulus.

Headlines: HSBC to stop weekend, overnight services at some Hong Kong ATMs after branches vandalized
Description: HSBC   will suspend overnight services at 19 ATM clusters in Hong Kong on weekends and public holidays, the bank said on Friday, two days after its branches and ATMs were targeted during anti-government protests.

Headlines: Tesla cuts price for China-made Model 3 vehicles before delivery
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc  cut the starting price for its China-made Model 3 sedans by 16% to 299,050 yuan  ($42,919) after receiving Chinese subsidies for electric vehicles, according to its China website.

Headlines: U.S. oil deals hit five-year high in 2019 on Occidental's blockbuster Anadarko buy
Description: The value of U.S. oil and gas mergers and acquisitions reached a five-year peak of $96 billion in 2019 on the back of competing bids for Anadarko Petroleum, energy data provider Enverus said on Thursday.

Headlines: Global stocks hit record as rally enters new year, dollar rebounds
Description: Global stock markets jumped on the first day of trading in 2020 as a shot of Chinese stimulus and economic data drove a gauge of world equity performance to the latest in a series of record highs, while the dollar snapped a four-day losing streak.

Headlines: Wall Street starts 2020 with new records on China stimulus, trade hopes
Description: Wall Street's major indexes notched record highs to open the new year on Thursday, as fresh economic stimulus from China added to optimism fueled by easing trade tensions and an improving global outlook.

Headlines: Lebanon receives Interpol arrest warrant for ex-Nissan boss Ghosn
Description: Lebanon received an Interpol arrest warrant on Thursday for former Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn, while Turkey launched an investigation into his daring escape from Japan via Istanbul.

Headlines: From arrest to flight - key dates in the Ghosn affair
Description: Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn decided to flee Japan after learning that his trial had been delayed until April 2021 and also because he had not been allowed to speak to his wife, sources close to Ghosn said on Thursday.

Headlines: Carlos Ghosn says family played no role in escape from Japan: statement
Description: The family of former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn played no role in his escape from Japan, Ghosn said in a statement on Thursday, days after his abrupt arrival in Beirut from Tokyo, where he faces trial for alleged financial misconduct.

Headlines: Lebanon played no official role in Ghosn exit: minister to MTV
Description: Lebanon played no official role in ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn's departure from Japan, caretaker defense minister Elias Bout Saab told Lebanese broadcaster MTV on Thursday.

Headlines: HSBC kicks off year with Hong Kong branches closed, vandalized
Description: HSBC   is being drawn into Hong Kong's political turmoil with protesters attacking some of its branches and graffiti daubed on the famous pair of lions that guard its city-center headquarters.

Headlines: Oil edges up on Mideast tensions, trade optimism
Description: Oil inched up on Thursday on rising tensions in the Middle East and signs of improving Washington-Beijing trade relations, but a strong U.S. dollar limited price gains.

Headlines: Uber Eats goes local to find its niche in South African food fight
Description: A stone's throw from Nelson Mandela's former home in South Africa's Soweto township, Dumile Badela's restaurant is now more hectic and lucrative than ever, thanks to Uber Eats, his hungriest customer yet.

Headlines: Dollar recovers from six-month low after year-end sell-off
Description: The dollar recovered from a six-month low to rise 0.46% on Thursday, the year's first trading day, after a downbeat December that left the index virtually flat at the end of 2019 .

Headlines: Tesla says will start delivering China-made Model 3s to public on Jan. 7
Description: Tesla Inc will deliver its first China-made Model 3 sedans to the public on Jan. 7 at an event at its Shanghai plant, a representative for the firm told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: China halts British stock link over political tensions - sources
Description: China has temporarily blocked planned cross-border listings between the Shanghai and London stock exchanges because of political tensions with Britain, five sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Ghosn met Lebanese president after fleeing Japan: sources
Description: Fugitive former Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn met Lebanon's president after fleeing from Japan, where he was smuggled out of house arrest by a private security company, two sources close to Ghosn said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Volkswagen starts settlement talks with German consumer groups over diesel scandal
Description: Volkswagen  on Thursday said it was in talks to discuss a settlement with German vehicle owners who are suing the carmaker over excessive pollution caused by VW's diesel cars.

Headlines: U.S. jobless claims edge lower but trend points to uptick in filings
Description: The number of Americans filing claims for jobless benefits edged lower last week, a positive signal for the U.S. labor market amid recent signs that new claims may be trending slightly higher.

Headlines: Asian shares outperform global peers in December, but yearly gains lag
Description: Asian shares gained for the fourth successive month in December as appetite for regional shares improved after the U.S. and China agreed on a preliminary deal to end their 17-month long trade war.

Headlines: Lebanon receives Interpol arrest warrant for Ghosn - Lebanese judicial source
Description: Lebanon received an Interpol arrest warrant on Thursday for ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn, a Lebanese judicial source told Reuters.

Headlines: Futures rise on China stimulus, trade optimism
Description: U.S. stock index futures rose on the first trading day of the new decade on Thursday, as fresh stimulus from Beijing to prop up its slowing economy added to the optimism fueled by easing trade tensions and an improving global outlook.

Headlines: U.S. shale producers to tap brakes in 2020 after years of rapid growth
Description: Vastly slower U.S. oil growth this year and the prospect of a plateau for the world's top oil producer have signaled a new and  unfamiliar era of self-restraint for the go-go shale industry.

Headlines: Germany's Bosch to offer lower-cost sensors for self-driving cars
Description: German automotive supplier Robert Bosch said Thursday it has developed a sensor that lets cars "see" a three-dimensional view of the road, aiming to lower the cost of technology that could speed the development of self-driving vehicles.

Headlines: Turkey detains pilots over Ghosn's escape through Istanbul
Description: Turkish police detained seven people, including four pilots, on Thursday in an investigation into how ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn transited through Istanbul en route to Lebanon after fleeing Japan, a police spokeswoman told Reuters.

Headlines: Turkish police detain four pilots over Ghosn's escape: NTV
Description: Turkish police have detained seven people, including four pilots, over the transit of ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn through Turkey after fleeing Japan on his way to Lebanon, broadcaster NTV said on Thursday.

Headlines: Hyundai, Kia sales drop to seven-year low on China weakness, forecast better 2020
Description: South Korea's Hyundai Motor  and affiliate Kia Motors  turned in their lowest sales in seven years in 2019 as business in China slumped, missing their target for a fifth straight time, but forecast better numbers for 2020.

Headlines: Xiaomi to invest $7 billion in 5G, AI and IoT over next five years
Description: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi Corp will invest more than 50 billion yuan ($7.18 billion) in artificial intelligence and fifth generation internet technologies over the next five years, as competition in the sector grows.

Headlines: Australia-listed Sezzle fails to win California lending license, shares dive
Description: California rejected Sezzle Inc's  request for a lending license, dealing the recently listed buy-now-pay-later firm a big blow weeks after bigger rival Afterpay  got a go ahead, sending Sezzle's shares down by more than a fifth.

Headlines: Major commercial plane crash deaths worldwide fell by more than 50% in 2019: group
Description: The number of people killed in large commercial airplane crashes fell by more than 50% in 2019 despite a high-profile Boeing 737 MAX crash in Ethiopia in March, a Dutch consulting firm said on Wednesday.

Headlines: More drugmakers hike U.S. prices as new year begins
Description: Drugmakers including Bristol-Myers Squibb Co , Gilead Sciences Inc , and Biogen Inc  hiked U.S. list prices on more than 50 drugs on Wednesday, bringing total New Year's Day drug price increases to more than 250, according to data analyzed by healthcare research firm 3 Axis Advisors.

Headlines: Nissan ex-boss Carlos Ghosn to hold press conference on Jan. 8: lawyer
Description: Nissan ex-boss Carlos Ghosn will hold a news conference in Beirut on Jan. 8, a lawyer for Ghosn said on Wednesday, two days after abruptly arriving from Japan, where he was under house arrest and accused of financial misconduct.

Headlines: Exclusive: Airbus beats goal with 863 jet deliveries in 2019, ousts Boeing from top spot
Description: Airbus has become the world's largest planemaker for the first time since 2011 after delivering a forecast-beating 863 aircraft in 2019, seizing the crown from embattled U.S. rival Boeing , airport and tracking sources said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Strike not extended at Lufthansa's Germanwings for now
Description: The trade union representing cabin crew at Lufthansa's  budget airline Germanwings decided on Wednesday not to continue their strike for the time being after three days of stoppages led to dozens of flights being canceled.

Headlines: Britain's Lloyds Banking Group suffers hours-long online outage
Description: Britain's Lloyds Banking Group  suffered an outage on Wednesday that left customers of its Lloyds, Halifax and Bank of Scotland operations unable to access accounts online for several hours.

Headlines: Surveillance in a leafy enclave, Ghosn's Tokyo life was under strict monitoring
Description: The imposing home where Carlos Ghosn lived for the last seven months and probably launched a daring escape to avoid Japanese prosecutors is nestled in a leafy enclave of Tokyo where most people pay little attention to Westerners or luxury cars.

Headlines: Ghosn flight prompts talk of more curbs in Japan's strict justice system
Description: Carlos Ghosn's daring flight from Japan, where he was awaiting trial on charges of financial wrongdoing, has revived global criticism of the nation's "hostage justice," but in Japan is prompting talk of reversing more lenient curbs on defendants.

Headlines: Surveillance in a leafy enclave, Ghosn's Tokyo life was under strict monitoring
Description: The imposing home where Carlos Ghosn lived for the last seven months and probably launched a daring escape to avoid Japanese prosecutors is nestled in a leafy enclave of Tokyo where most people pay little attention to Westerners or luxury cars.

Headlines: Samsung Electronics chip output at South Korea plant partly halted due to short blackout
Description: Samsung Electronics  partly halted some semiconductor production at its Hwaseong chip complex in South Korea after about a minute-long blackout on Tuesday afternoon, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. auto safety agency to investigate fatal Tesla crash in California
Description: The fatal Dec. 29 crash of a Tesla Inc vehicle in Southern California will be investigated by the U.S. government's auto safety regulator, the agency said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Tesla must face lawsuit claiming racism at California factory
Description: A federal judge rejected Tesla Inc's effort to dismiss claims by two former workers that the California electric car factory where they worked was a hotbed of racial hostility, clearing the way for a possible trial.

Headlines: Turkish Airlines says reaches compensation deal over Boeing 737 MAX
Description: Turkish Airlines has agreed a compensation deal with planemaker Boeing Co over the grounding of the Boeing 737 MAX following two fatal crashes, the carrier said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Global stocks end 2019 near record highs, dollar slides
Description: The dollar slid to a six-month low on Tuesday as progress on U.S.-China trade tensions led investors to higher-risk assets, while a year-end rally that lifted global equity markets to record highs stayed alive on the last trading day of 2019.

Headlines: Exclusive: Drugmakers from Pfizer to GSK to hike U.S. prices on over 200 drugs
Description: Drugmakers including Pfizer Inc , GlaxoSmithKline PLC  and Sanofi SA  are planning to hike U.S. list prices on more than 200 drugs in the United States on Wednesday, according to drugmakers and data analyzed by healthcare research firm 3 Axis Advisors.

Headlines: Uber, Postmates sue to block California gig worker law, claiming it's unconstitutional
Description: Ride-hailing company Uber Technologies Inc and courier services provider Postmates Inc asked a U.S. court to block a California labor law set to go into effect on Wednesday, arguing the bill violates the U.S. Constitution.

Headlines: Wall Street edges higher; S&P closes decade with nearly 190% gain
Description: Wall Street's major indexes edged higher on Tuesday on a renewed  rally fueled by trade optimism, capping off a decade of handsome returns in which the benchmark S&P 500 rose nearly 190%.

Headlines: Oil posts biggest yearly rise since 2016
Description: Oil prices fell 1% on Tuesday, the last trading day of the decade, but notched the biggest annual gain in three years, supported by a thaw in the prolonged U.S.-China trade war and ongoing supply cuts from major oil producers.

Headlines: U.S. holiday returns surge with booming e-commerce
Description: United Parcel Service Inc  on Thursday expects to ship 1.9 million gifts and other items back to U.S. retailers as e-commerce fuels an anticipated 26% year-over-year volume surge on "National Returns Day."

Headlines: Dollar index records smallest ever annual move in 2019
Description: The U.S. dollar index recorded its smallest-ever annual move in 2019, up just 0.24% for the year after a drop in December reversed early gains as trade hopes and investor confidence diminished demand for the safe-haven asset.

Headlines: Trump says U.S.-China trade deal will be signed on January 15
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that Phase 1 of trade deal with China would be signed on Jan. 15 at the White House, though considerable confusion remains about the details of the agreement.

Headlines: Hudson's Bay chairman considers sweetened bid for retailer
Description: Hudson's Bay Co  Chairman Richard Baker and his partners have approached the retailer's minority stockholders, including bidding rival Catalyst Capital, to potentially raise their take-private bid, a source familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Ghosn says he escaped 'injustice' in Japan; Lebanon calls arrival a private matter
Description: Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn said on Tuesday he had fled to Lebanon to escape a "rigged" justice system in Japan, raising questions about how one of the world's most-recognized executives had slipped away while on bail.

Headlines: Factbox: Carlos Ghosn joins list of execs fighting extradition
Description: Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn said on Tuesday he had fled to Lebanon to escape a "rigged" justice system in Japan, where he believed he would not get a fair trial.

Headlines: Google to end 'Double Irish, Dutch sandwich' tax scheme
Description: Google parent Alphabet  will no longer use an intellectual property licensing scheme, known as the "Double Irish, Dutch sandwich", which allowed it to delay paying U.S. taxes, 2018 tax filings show.

Headlines: Beirut says it doesn't know how Nissan ex-boss Ghosn made it to Lebanon
Description: The Lebanese government does not know how Nissan ex-boss Carlos Ghosn made it from Japan, where he was due to be tried for financial misconduct, to Lebanon, the foreign ministry said on Tuesday.

Headlines: France says it was not aware of Ghosn going to Lebanon
Description: France was not aware that ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn was jumping bail in Japan to go to Lebanon, the Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Nissan ex-boss Ghosn entered Lebanon legally: security directorate
Description: Nissan ex-boss Carlos Ghosn entered Lebanon legally and will not face any legal consequences, Lebanon's General Directorate of General Security said on Tuesday, according to the state news agency NNA.

Headlines: Tencent gets into global groove with stake in Vivendi's Universal
Description: A Tencent-led consortium is taking a 10% stake in Vivendi's Universal Music Group, valuing the music label that houses Lady Gaga and The Beatles at 30 billion euros ($34 billion) and giving the Chinese firm a global backstage pass.

Headlines: Singapore's GIC part of consortium investing in Vivendi's Universal Music: source
Description: Singapore's state investor GIC is part of the consortium led by China's Tencent that's buying up to 20% of Vivendi's  Universal Music Group (UMG), according to a source familiar with the deal.

Headlines: Qatar's state investor also part of Tencent's Universal deal
Description: Qatar Investment Authority (QIA) is another member of the Tencent-led consortium buying a 10% stake in Vivendi's  Universal Music Group, a source familiar with the deal said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Ghosn lawyers still in possession of his passports, lawyer says
Description: Ousted Nissan Motor Co boss Carlos Ghosn's three passports were held by his lawyers and he could not have used any of them to escape Japan, one of the lawyers told reporters on Tuesday, adding that his client's actions were "inexcusable".

Headlines: Huawei's 2019 revenue to jump 18%, forecasts 'difficult' 2020
Description: Huawei Technologies on Tuesday said its full-year revenue would likely jump 18% in 2019 to 850 billion yuan ($121.72 billion), lower than its earlier projections, as a U.S. trade blacklisting curbed growth and disrupted its ability to source key parts.

Headlines: Nissan ex-boss Ghosn entered Lebanon on French passport - MTV
Description: Former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn entered Lebanon using a French passport, the Lebanese broadcaster MTV reported on Tuesday, citing an official source.

Headlines: Factbox: Ghosn's bail conditions - Surveillance cameras, no internet access
Description: Carlos Ghosn, the ousted boss of the Renault-Nissan carmaking alliance who was awaiting trial in Japan, flew into Lebanon on Monday evening, France's Les Echos newspaper reported.

Headlines: Factbox: Financial wrongdoing allegations against Carlos Ghosn
Description: Carlos Ghosn, the ousted boss of the Renault-Nissan carmaking alliance who was awaiting trial in Japan, flew into Lebanon on Monday evening, France's Les Echos newspaper reported.

Headlines: Ghosn says in Lebanon, having 'escaped injustice'
Description: Former Nissan and Renault Chairman Carlos Ghosn, who was barred from leaving Japan whilst awaiting trial on charges of financial misconduct, on Tuesday said he was in Lebanon.

Headlines: French government minister 'very surprised' by Ghosn's move to Lebanon
Description: French junior economy minister Agnes Pannier-Runacher said on Tuesday that she was "very surprised" by news that Carlos Ghosn had left Japan and flown to Lebanon, adding she had heard of it via the media.

Headlines: White House adviser says China trade deal signing expected soon
Description: The White House's trade adviser on Monday said the U.S.-China Phase 1 trade deal would likely be signed in the next week, but said confirmation would come from President Donald Trump or the U.S. Trade Representative.

Headlines: From opioid deaths to student debt: A view of the 2010s economy in charts
Description: The 2010s saw the U.S. economy achieve its longest-ever expansion, with notable milestones such as 110 months of uninterrupted job gains and an unemployment rate near a half-century low becoming easy bragging points for politicians and economists alike.

Headlines: JP Morgan attempts full control of China futures JV -Bloomberg
Description: JPMorgan  is seeking 100% ownership of its futures joint venture in China, Bloomberg reported on Monday, citing a person familiar with the matter.

Headlines: MTN reviewing allegations after being named in U.S. complaint
Description: South African telecoms firm MTN on Monday said it was reviewing allegations raised in a U.S. complaint which accuses several firms of paying protection money to militant Islamist groups in Afghanistan.

Headlines: Ford says reservations full for high-end version of electric Mustang Mach-E
Description: Ford Motor Co  said on Monday reservations were full for the high-end Mustang Mach-E First Edition electric sport utility vehicle.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin hits 2019 F-35 delivery target of 131 jets
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp  said on Monday it has reached its 2019 target to deliver 131 F-35 fighter jets to the United States and its allies, as the defense contractor built 47% more jets this year.

Headlines: Wall Street slips from records as investors lock in year-end gains
Description: Wall Street's major stock indexes slipped from record highs on Monday as investors booked profits from gains made this month after the United States and China reached a trade deal.

Headlines: World stocks slip as rally pauses, dollar eases
Description: The dollar slid on Monday, and global stock markets fell as a year-end rally lost steam after pushing stocks to record highs in 2019.

Headlines: 'Do Not Sell My Info': U.S. retailers rush to comply with California privacy law
Description: U.S. retailers including Walmart Inc will add "Do Not Sell My Info" links to their websites and signage in stores starting Jan. 1, allowing California shoppers to understand for the first time what personal and other data the retailers collect, sources said.

Headlines: The Decade of Debt: big deals, bigger risk
Description: Whatever nickname ultimately gets attached to the now-ending Twenty-tens, on Wall Street and across Corporate America it arguably should be tagged as the "Decade of Debt."

Headlines: The decade that saw volatility trading come of age
Description: What do you do when daily stock market gyrations all but dry up? Apparently, trade volatility like never before.

Headlines: Oil hits three-month high on upbeat data, Middle East tension
Description: Oil prices rose on Monday to three-month highs, lifted by optimism over an expected China-U.S. trade deal and upbeat industrial data, while traders kept a close watch on the Middle East following U.S. air strikes in Iraq and Syria.

Headlines: Nestle wraps up 20 billion Swiss franc share buyback, launches new program
Description: Swiss food giant Nestle said on Monday it had completed a 20 billion Swiss franc ($20.7 billion) share buyback program and reiterated plans for a new one up to the same amount starting next year.

Headlines: Tesla delivers first China-made Model 3 sedans in just under a year
Description: Tesla has started delivering Model 3 electric cars built at its Shanghai factory in just under a year since it began work on the $2 billion plant, a record for global automakers in China, and said it would ramp up deliveries from next month.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade deal signing within week or so: White House adviser
Description: The United States and China will likely have a signing of Phase 1 of a new trade deal early in the new year, White House trade adviser Peter Navarro said on Monday.

Headlines: Satellite imagery company Maxar to sell Canadian unit for C$1 billion
Description: U.S. satellite imagery company Maxar Technologies Inc said on Monday it would sell its Canadian space robotics business to a consortium led by Northern Private Capital (NPC) for C$1 billion ($765 million), in a bid to ease its debt.

Headlines: U.S. sanctions block hurry-up work on Russian gas pipeline: officials
Description: Any companies that rush to finish building a Russian natural gas export pipeline to Germany that came under U.S. sanctions this month risk being penalized, senior U.S. officials said on Sunday.

Headlines: EU seeks reset in trade talks with U.S. - trade chief Hogan
Description: The European Union's new trade commissioner, Irishman Phil Hogan, was quoted on Monday as saying he would seek a reset of EU/US trade relations on a number of contentious issues when he meets his U.S. counterpart for the first time next month.

Headlines: More than 150 flights canceled in Germany as Lufthansa's Germanwings hit by strikes
Description: Around 180 flights in Germany were canceled on Monday due to cabin crew strikes at Lufthansa's budget airline Germanwings, in a bid to put pressure on management in wage talks.

Headlines: China's December factory activity set to expand for a second month: Reuters poll
Description: China's factory activity likely expanded again in December on stronger external demand and an infrastructure push at home, but the pace of growth is set to ease as markets await more certainty on a U.S.-China trade truce, a Reuters poll showed.

Headlines: BoE's Carney says finance must act faster on climate change
Description: Financial services have been too slow to cut investment in fossil fuels, a delay that could lead to a sharp increase in global temperatures, Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said in an interview broadcast on Monday.

Headlines: Oil price rise muted in 2019 despite sanctions, supply cuts, attack in Saudi Arabia
Description: Oil prices rose more than 20% this year but there were no sharp spikes and crude futures barely sniffed $70 a barrel despite attacks on the world's biggest oil producer, sanctions that crippled crude exports of two OPEC members and gigantic supply cuts from big oil producing countries.

Headlines: U.S. LNG exports soar in 2019 but supply glut may await in 2020
Description: U.S. exporters of liquefied natural gas (LNG) head into 2020 after a record year that saw exports soar by more than 60%, but growing concerns about weakened demand and heavy competition could act as headwinds in the coming year.

Headlines: Egypt competition watchdog approves Uber acquisition of Careem with conditions
Description: Egyptian regulators have approved Uber's $3.1 billion acquisition of regional rival Careem after agreeing to a set of commitments proposed by the U.S.-based ride-hailing service meant to reduce harm to competitors.

Headlines: China commerce ministry says it has proactively dealt with U.S. trade frictions
Description: China's Commerce Ministry has "proactively dealt with" trade frictions with the United States this year, it said on Sunday after an annual work conference.

Headlines: Musk says Boring Co's Las Vegas tunnel to 'hopefully' be operational next year
Description: Elon Musk, founder of tunneling enterprise Boring Company,  said in a tweet that a commercial tunnel in Las Vegas would "hopefully" be fully operational in 2020.

Headlines: U.S. eyes customs deal with Mexico, plans attorney general visit in January
Description: The United States is looking at ways to cooperate with Mexico on customs along their border to curb flows of illicit arms, drugs and money, the U.S. ambassador to Mexico said on Friday.

Headlines: Recession, robots and rockets: another roaring 20s for world markets?
Description: Helicopter cash, climate crises, smart cities and the space economy -- investors have all those possibilities ahead as they enter the third decade of the 21st century.

Headlines: Tim Hortons President Alex Macedo to leave next year
Description: Restaurant Brands International Inc said on Friday Alex Macedo, the president of coffee and breakfast chain Tim Hortons, will be stepping down after two years in the role.

Headlines: Sinochem unit gets $1.65 billion investment from state firms
Description: Sinochem Energy, a unit of China's Sinochem Group, has agreed to sell a 20% stake to five state-owned firms for 11.56 billion yuan ($1.65 billion), Xinhua news agency reported.

Headlines: Global shares gain in record year-end rally, dollar slips
Description: World equity markets scaled records on Friday with global growth prospects raised by upbeat Chinese economic data and optimism a U.S.-Sino trade deal is imminent, but the year-end rally ebbed on Wall Street and the dollar eased as risk appetite grew.

Headlines: S&P 500, Dow eke out records; Nasdaq win streak ends
Description: The Nasdaq snapped an 11-day streak of gains on Friday after some late-session weakness, but the S&P 500 and the Dow scratched out record closing highs with slight gains as a year-end rally chugged along.

Headlines: Amazon's Ring cameras are vulnerable to hackers, lawsuit in U.S. claims
Description: Amazon.com Inc  and its Ring home security camera unit have been sued by an Alabama homeowner who said the cameras' defective design leaves purchasers vulnerable to cyberattacks.

Headlines: Oil hits three-month high on falling oil stocks, investor optimism
Description: Oil prices rose to the fourth consecutive weekly gain on Friday, steadying at three-month highs after new data showed U.S. crude inventories fell far more than expected, while upbeat economic data and optimism over a U.S.-China trade deal fueled a year-end stock market rally.

Headlines: Oilfield service firms have a bearish outlook for 2020: Dallas Fed
Description: With their business outlook worsening, about half of oil field service firms plan to cut spending in 2020, the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas said on Friday in its quarterly energy survey.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra has failed in current form: Swiss president
Description: Facebook's  Libra project has failed in its current form and needs reworking to be approved, said the president of Switzerland where the cryptocurrency is seeking regulatory consent.

Headlines: Tesla set to begin deliveries of China-made Model 3 cars on Dec. 30
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc  will begin delivering Model 3 vehicles built at its Shanghai factory on Monday, a company representative told Reuters.

Headlines: Turkey unveils first fully homemade car in $3.7 billion bet on electric
Description: Turkey unveiled its first fully domestically-produced car on Friday, saying it aimed to eventually produce up to 175,000 a year of the electric vehicle in a project expected to cost 22 billion lira ($3.7 billion) over 13 years.

Headlines: China fines Toyota 87.6 million yuan over Lexus price-fixing
Description: China's market regulator on Friday has fined Japanese carmaker Toyota Motor  87.6 million yuan ($12.5 million) for price-fixing on its premium Lexus cars in eastern Jiangsu province, according to a document on its website.

Headlines: Volkswagen ahead of schedule in electric cars production
Description: Volkswagen  said on Friday that it would reach a key target in the production of electric autos earlier than previously anticipated.

Headlines: Uniqlo founder Yanai resigns as SoftBank board member after 18 years
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp  said Tadashi Yanai, founder and CEO of Uniqlo parent Fast Retailing , will resign as independent board member at the end of the month after 18 years on the job to focus on his fashion business.

Headlines: China's industrial profits grow at fastest in eight months, but sustained recovery uncertain
Description: Profits at China's industrial firms grew at the fastest pace in eight months in November, but broad weakness in domestic demand remains a risk for company earnings next year.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nissan orders drastic spending cuts to stem profit slide and 'conserve every yen' - sources
Description: Japan's Nissan Motor Co has told its managers to slash non-essential spending as the automaker grapples with slumping car sales and tumbling profits, three company sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. energy shareholders seek to leave behind a lost decade
Description: The 2010s was a lost decade for shares of U.S. energy companies overall. Volatile commodity prices amid growing supply, poor  financial performance and disfavor from some investor groups all contributed to the energy sector's transformation from investor darling to investor outcast.

Headlines: Nissan picks Sakamoto as board candidate after Seki's resignation
Description: Nissan Motor Co  has selected executive officer Hideyuki Sakamoto as a candidate for the board of directors, the company said on Friday, following the surprise resignation of vice-chief operating officer Jun Seki earlier this week.

Headlines: Astellas ramps up M&A, buys U.S. biotech Xyphos for as much as $665 million
Description: Astellas Pharma Inc  has bought U.S.-based Xyphos Biosciences Inc to expand its immuno-oncology business, a deal worth up to $665 million including potential development milestones and its second acquisition announced this month.

Headlines: Hyundai Development says consortium closes $2.2 billion acquisition of Asiana Airlines
Description: South Korean builder Hyundai Development Co  said on Friday its consortium has closed on its 2.5 trillion won ($2.16 billion) acquisition of a controlling stake in the country's second-biggest carrier Asiana Airlines Inc .

Headlines: Peru watchdog says McDonald's franchisee Arcos Dorados violated safety laws
Description: Peru´s labor watchdog has found McDonald's Corp´s Latin America franchisee Arcos Dorados guilty of six "very serious" violations of local safety and health laws following the deaths of two employees in a restaurant kitchen.

Headlines: Tesla secures $1.29 billion loan from Chinese banks for Shanghai factory
Description: Tesla Inc entered into agreements with lenders in China for a secured term loan facility of up to 9 billion yuan ($1.29 billion), according to a regulatory filing on Thursday.

Headlines: Global stocks rally to record highs; gold gains
Description: A gauge of global equity markets and Wall Street's three major indices finished at all-time highs on Thursday in light holiday trade as a year-end rally advanced further on optimism over a U.S.-China trade agreement.

Headlines: Nasdaq tops 9,000 on boosts from Amazon, trade optimism
Description: The Nasdaq crossed the 9,000-point mark for the first time on Thursday as all three major Wall Street indexes posted record closing highs, boosted by optimism over U.S.-China trade relations and gains in shares of Amazon.com after a report signaled robust online holiday sales.

Headlines: Boeing 737 MAX crisis adviser Michael Luttig to retire
Description: Boeing Co  said on Thursday Michael Luttig, who was appointed senior adviser to the planemaker's board amid the 737 MAX crisis in May, will retire at the end of the year.

Headlines: Oil up 1% at highest since September on trade pact and crude supplies
Description: Oil prices were up about 1% to the highest in more than three months on Thursday, boosted by hopes that the China-U.S. trade fight would soon come to an end and by a report showing lower U.S. crude inventories.

Headlines: Record online sales give U.S. holiday shopping season a boost: report
Description: U.S. shoppers spent more online during this year's holiday  shopping season, a report by Mastercard Inc  showed on Wednesday, with e-commerce sales hitting a record high.

Headlines: Tiffany sees rise in holiday sales on higher China spending
Description: Tiffany & Co , which is being bought by Louis Vuitton owner LVMH , on Thursday estimated sales growth of 1% to 3% during the holidays, with the biggest contribution coming from China and a recovery in the Americas.

Headlines: Emerging market stocks were laggards in the past decade
Description: Despite a strong start to this decade in 2010, emerging market stocks underperformed developed market peers and were weighed down by events such as the Chinese market sell-off, debt crises in Turkey and Argentina and the Sino-U.S. trade war.

Headlines: Holiday season package returns to hit a record high, says UPS
Description: United Parcel Service Inc  expects returned packages to hit a record high following this year's holiday shipping season, as consumers shopped more online, the package delivery company said on Thursday.

Headlines: Prosecutors claim Avenatti was over $15 million in debt during alleged Nike extortion
Description: California attorney Michael Avenatti, known for representing porn actress Stormy Daniels in a lawsuit against U.S. President Donald Trump, was more than $15 million in debt when he allegedly tried to extort as much as $25 million from Nike Inc , U.S. prosecutors claimed.

Headlines: China commerce ministry says in close touch with U.S. on signing trade deal
Description: China is in close touch with the United States on signing a Phase 1 trade deal, the country's commerce ministry said on Thursday, adding that both sides are still going through necessary procedures before the signing.

Headlines: China Southern Air Holding sets up one billion yuan cargo company
Description: China Southern Air Holding, the parent of China Southern Airlines , has set up a cargo company with registered capital of 1 billion yuan ($143 million), as it looks to consolidate its air cargo assets through state-led reforms.

Headlines: Indian IPOs fall to four-year low as economy falters
Description: Indian initial public offerings tumbled to a 4-year low by value in 2019 as the economy slowed, but some analysts are hoping for better in 2020 on the back of potential government reforms likely to boost stock markets.

Headlines: Trump says he and Xi will sign China trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he and Chinese President Xi Jinping will have a signing ceremony to sign the first phase of the U.S.-China trade deal agreed to this month.

Headlines: Exclusive: Russia's Sberbank to remain Yandex partner, may adjust some projects - CEO Gref
