Description: Russia's Sberbank  plans to continue its partnership with Yandex  even though it has transferred its 'golden share' in the country's leading internet company to another entity, Sberbank's Chief Executive German Gref told Reuters.

Headlines: Russian government plans to use rainy day fund to buy Sberbank from central bank: two sources
Description: The Russian government plans to use the country's National Wealth Fund (NWF) to buy the central bank's stake in Sberbank , a state banker and a source familiar with the plan told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Joint Saudi, Kuwaiti oil field expected to produce 320,000 bpd by end-2020
Description: Saudi Arabia's energy minister said on Wednesday the Khafji oil field which is jointly operated with Kuwait would produce 320,000 oil barrels per day (bpd) at the end of 2020, Saudi-owned al-Arabiya TV reported.

Headlines: Brash Uber co-founder Kalanick leaves board to focus on industrial kitchens
Description: Travis Kalanick, the pugnacious co-founder of Uber, has severed his last ties with the ride-services company, resigning from the board and selling all his shares as he turns his focus to a new venture creating "ghost kitchens" for food delivery services.

Headlines: China says it is in close touch with U.S. on trade deal signing ceremony
Description: China says it is in close touch with the United States on a trade deal signing ceremony, after U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he and Chinese President Xi Jinping will have a ceremony to sign the recently struck Phase 1 trade deal.

Headlines: China's November soybean imports from U.S. rise as tariff-free cargoes arrive
Description: China's November soybean purchases from the United States surged from a year earlier, data showed on Wednesday, as cargoes booked by importers with tariff-free quotas cleared customs.

Headlines: Questions over Hyundai construction of Chilean bridge amid row with government
Description: Chile's finance minister has sought to downplay a row between the government and the construction and engineering arm of South Korean giant Hyundai  over a $740 million suspension bridge, saying disputes in such mega projects were "quite common."

Headlines: Global stocks hover near record highs, gold breaches $1,500
Description: Gold surged past $1,500 an ounce and a gauge of global equity markets hovered near record highs on Tuesday in a year-end rally spurred by hopes of a U.S.-Sino Phase 1 trade deal and as China's latest policy easing pledge added to investor optimism.

Headlines: S&P 500, Dow pause near records in Christmas Eve trade
Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow industrials slipped in a shortened, pre-Christmas session on Tuesday, as investors paused after a record-setting rally fueled by improving U.S.-China trade relations that has put the market on course for its best year since 2013.

Headlines: New Boeing CEO Calhoun is hardened corporate crisis manager
Description: Beleaguered Boeing Co  is putting its future in the hands of a turnaround veteran who has led several companies in crisis, cut his teeth at engine maker General Electric Co  and has spent a decade on the board of the world's largest planemaker.

Headlines: New Boeing 737 MAX documents show 'very disturbing' employee concerns: U.S. House aide
Description: Boeing Co documents under review by a U.S. congressional panel appear to point to a "very disturbing" picture of commentary from the planemaker's employees over the grounded 737 MAX aircraft, a congressional aide said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Nissan top executive Seki to resign in blow to turnaround plan
Description: The executive tasked with leading a recovery at Nissan Motor Co Ltd said he had decided to resign just weeks into his new job, a move that could disrupt the automaker's push to turn the corner on scandal and slumping sales.

Headlines: Oil rises on supply cut pledges and slow return of Gulf field
Description: Oil prices rose on Tuesday in thin pre-Christmas trading after Russia said cooperation with OPEC on supply cuts would continue and amid optimism that the United States and China could finalize a trade agreement.

Headlines: After Ethiopia crash, victims’ relatives say they were hounded by U.S. law firms
Description: Days after the March 10 crash of a Kenya-bound Ethiopian Airlines’ Boeing jet that killed all 157 people on board, strangers began calling or visiting bereaved families, saying they represented U.S. law firms.

Headlines: Mexican businesses worry tweak to USMCA trade deal could slow exports
Description: Mexican businesses are concerned that a tweak to dispute resolution mechanisms under a new North American trade deal could be used to stifle exports, top industry associations say.

Headlines: New Boeing boss faces EU pressure over Embraer tie-up: sources
Description: As Boeing's  new boss tackles the immediate crisis over its grounded 737 MAX jet, he also faces pressing questions from European regulators over a deal to buy the commercial arm of Brazil's Embraer - seen as key to its longer-term strategy.

Headlines: Beauty brands tap TikTok influencers for holiday campaigns
Description: In a TikTok video with the hashtag #awesomekiss, viral teen star Charli D'Amelio uses an eos Products lipbalm before kissing the screen and transforming into a dancing, costumed Santa in an ad for her 12 million followers.

Headlines: Emaar says may raise funds against Burj Khalifa viewing decks, not selling them
Description: Dubai's Emaar Properties  said on Tuesday it was considering raising capital against cash flows generated by the observation decks on its Burj Khalifa skyscraper, but was not looking at selling them.

Headlines: Electric vehicle startup Rivian scores $1.3 billion investment from T.Rowe Price, others
Description: Electric vehicle startup Rivian said on Monday it closed a $1.3 billion investment round led by T. Rowe Price and including existing investors Amazon.com and Ford Motor Co.

Headlines: How risky ETFs won the decade - and why they might not repeat that performance
Description: Exchange-traded funds that use leverage to offer double or triple the daily return of benchmark U.S. stock indexes rank  among the 10 top-performing funds of the decade, with returns that in some cases neared 2,000%, despite warnings that they are not suitable for most investors.

Headlines: Credit Suisse hit with $6.5 million U.S. fine for supervisory lapses
Description: The U.S. Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) and major exchanges have fined Credit Suisse's  U.S.-based securities business $6.5 million for supervisory failings, FINRA said late on Monday.

Headlines: Boeing fires CEO Muilenburg to restore confidence amid 737 crisis
Description: Boeing Co has fired Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg after repeatedly failing to contain the fallout from a pair of fatal crashes that halted output of its best-selling jetliner and tarnished its reputation with airlines and regulators.

Headlines: Factbox: From GE to media, Boeing's new CEO
Description: Boeing Co appointed Chairman David Calhoun as chief executive to steer the world's largest planemaker through a crisis after two deadly crashes led to the grounding of its best-selling 737 MAX jetliner.

Headlines: U.S. activist investors post strong gains as needling companies pays off
Description: Activist investors who are shaking up Corporate America with calls for operational fixes, refreshed boards and even sales of a company are delivering their best returns in six years with double-digit gains for 2019 after big losses in 2018.

Headlines: ByteDance has no sale plans for TikTok, media report untrue - internal note
Description: Chinese social media firm ByteDance has no plans to sell part or all of its TikTok app, the short video platform's head said on Tuesday, denying a media report which said the company was currently weighing options to do so due to U.S. concerns.

Headlines: Tesco suspends Chinese supplier after suspected prisoner message
Description: (This Dec 22 story corrects part of factory's name to Zhejiang from Zheijiang in paragraph 8.)

Headlines: BMW says being investigated by U.S. SEC
Description: German automaker BMW AG said on Monday it was being investigated by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission following a report of a probe related to the company's sales practices.

Headlines: Roche dives deeper into gene therapy with $1.15 billion Sarepta licensing deal
Description: Roche Holding AG made its second major gene therapy deal in a year on Monday, spending $1.15 billion to obtain the rights to Sarepta Therapeutics Inc's investigational drug to treat duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) outside the United States.

Headlines: In win for Uber, Lyft, judge strikes down New York City's cruising cap
Description: A New York state judge on Monday ruled in favor of Uber Technologies Inc and Lyft Inc in a lawsuit against New York City, striking down a new rule limiting how much time drivers for ride-hailing services can spend cruising streets in busy areas of Manhattan without passengers.

Headlines: Key events leading up to the firing of Boeing's CEO over the 737 MAX
Description: Boeing Co has fired Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg  following a year of intense scrutiny and industrial setbacks set off by twin fatal crashes of its 737 MAX jetliner.

Headlines: Wall Street posts records amid trade optimism; Boeing juices Dow
Description: Wall Street's main indexes posted record closing highs on Monday after President Donald Trump said an initial U.S.-China trade pact would be signed soon, while Boeing gave the Dow a big boost after the planemaker ousted its chief executive officer.

Headlines: Spirit Airlines to buy 100 Airbus A320neo family aircraft
Description: U.S. budget carrier Spirit Airlines Inc  said on Monday it will buy 100 Airbus  A320neo-family jets to be delivered through 2027, with options to purchase up to 50 additional aircraft.

Headlines: Global shares inch to new highs on trade hopes; dollar little changed
Description: The dollar traded little changed while equity markets added to a year-end rally on Monday, with both a gauge of stock performance worldwide and Wall Street hitting new highs amid renewed optimism over U.S.-China trade and growth prospects.

Headlines: Forget store traffic and bag count: Gauging retail performance in an online world
Description: Marshal Cohen has religiously visited the same stores every holiday season since 1999.

Headlines: Factbox: Sizing up retailers' performance as online sales surge
Description: As online shopping upends the retail business, many Wall Street analysts say traditional measures such as counting the number of people who visit stores on major shopping days are no longer a reliable gauge of a company's performance.

Headlines: Oil steadies as Russia touts easing OPEC+ output
Description: Oil prices were little changed on Monday as Russia said an OPEC-led producer group may consider easing output cuts next year, offsetting support from some investor optimism that an initial U.S.-China trade deal would be signed soon.

Headlines: Exclusive: Tesla to take new $1.4 billion loan from Chinese banks for Shanghai factory - sources
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc  and a group of China banks have agreed a new 10 billion yuan ($1.4 billion), five-year loan facility for the automaker's Shanghai car plant, three sources familiar with the matter said, part of which will be used to roll over an existing loan.

Headlines: 'So high': Tesla shares cross $420 mark over a year after Musk buyout tweet
Description: Tesla Inc shares traded above $420 on Monday, more than a year after Elon Musk tweeted he had "funding secured" to take the electric car maker private at that price, only to later give up under investor pressure and regulatory concerns.

Headlines: U.S. business spending on equipment appears soft; housing steadies
Description: New orders for key U.S.-made capital goods barely rose in November and shipments fell, suggesting business investment will probably remain a drag on economic growth in the fourth quarter.

Headlines: Credit Suisse admits spying on second executive
Description: Credit Suisse  on Monday admitted to snooping on another of the bank's former executives, deepening a spying scandal at the Swiss group, which is already under investigation for putting its ex-wealth management chief under surveillance.

Headlines: Disruptive decade: Ten things the teen years brought world markets
Description: The 21st century's teen years, bookended by a financial crisis at the start and the fintech revolution at the end, were a decade of disruption. From negative borrowing costs to bitcoin, here are ten trends that have upended traditional economic and investment models in the past decade:

Headlines: S&P is the decade's runaway winner
Description: U.S. stocks are poised to close out the decade with the longest bull market in history still intact.

Headlines: China denies forced labor accusations after plea found in Christmas card
Description: China dismissed accusations of forced labor at a Shanghai prison on Monday, a day after media reports that a message had been found in a Christmas card saying it had been packed by inmates.

Headlines: Bombardier's new Global business jets get U.S. FAA certification
Description: Bombardier Inc  said on Monday its newest business jets, Global 5500 and 6500, received U.S. Federal Aviation Administration certification, clearing the way for the Canadian plane maker to start deliveries.

Headlines: Court rejects Ryanair's bid to delay operations chief's easyJet move
Description: The Irish High Court on Monday rejected Ryanair's  attempt to prevent operations chief Peter Bellew from joining rival easyJet  until 2021, saying a 12-month non-compete clause was unenforceable.

Headlines: Monetary stimulus? Low rates mean more babies, Bank of England says
Description: Cutting interest rates appears to stimulate more than just the economy - Bank of England researchers say an extra 14,500 babies were born in 2009 after the central bank slashed borrowing costs during the global financial crisis.

Headlines: Bank of England steps up monitoring of Lloyd's whistleblowing systems
Description: The Bank of England has stepped up its monitoring of Lloyd's of London's  whistleblowing systems, the central bank said on Monday, after reports this year about sexual harassment and bullying at the 330-year old insurance market.

Headlines: Exclusive: Dubai's Emaar to sell view from world's tallest tower - sources
Description: Emaar Properties  is selling the observation decks of the world's tallest skyscraper the Burj Khalifa, four sources told Reuters, potentially raising $1 billion for Dubai's biggest developer amid a real estate downturn.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank to no longer pay for advice from Cerberus: source
Description: Cerberus, one of Deutsche Bank's  largest shareholders, will no longer provide paid advice to the bank on how to run its business, a person with knowledge of the matter said on Monday, a role that has been criticized for potential conflicts of interest.

Headlines: The Yankees are coming! U.S. firms rush to euro debt markets
Description: From Harley Davidson to Colgate-Palmolive, U.S. companies are flocking to borrow in euros and their record issuance is breathing life into a market where yields have been hammered by the European Central Bank's renewed stimulus push.

Headlines: Bank of Italy chief defends regulator's role in Bari bank crisis
Description: The head of Italy's central bank rebuffed criticism of its role in supervising struggling lender Banca Popolare di Bari and said in an interview published on Monday that it was ready to account for its actions.

Headlines: Bayer shares up 3.5% after U.S. government's backing in glyphosate lawsuit
Description: Bayer  shares rose as much as 3.5% on Monday, reaching their highest level in 14 months, after the United States government said that a $25 million glyphosate decision against the company should be reversed.

Headlines: Credit Suisse surveillance probe to continue
Description: Credit Suisse  and law firm Homburger will continue their investigation into employee observation at the bank, a spokesman said, after the bank on Monday confirmed a second former executive was tailed. [nL8N28X0TX]

Headlines: JD.Com's logistics unit taps banks for potential $8-$10 billion IPO: sources
Description: The logistics unit of Chinese e-commerce company JD.com Inc  has held early discussions with banks about a potential overseas IPO that could raise $8 billion to $10 billion, two people with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: SoftBank's $3 billion WeWork financing talks stall with Japan banks: sources
Description: SoftBank Group Corp's talks to secure $3 billion from Japan's three biggest banks have stalled as the lenders have hit internal lending limits to the firm, two people said, complicating a $9.5 billion rescue package for WeWork.

Headlines: BlackRock, Temasek to take majority stake in wealth management JV with CCB: sources
Description: U.S. asset manager BlackRock Inc, Singapore state investor Temasek Holdings (Pte) Ltd and China Construction Bank Corp (CCB) have agreed to set up a wealth management joint venture in China, said people with direct knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Oil group Total to pay $100 million bonus as part of Apache Suriname deal
Description: French oil company Total  said on Monday that it would pay a bonus of $100 million as part of its previously announced deal with U.S. peer Apache  to develop an offshore block off Suriname.

Headlines: 'Bull's-eye' landing caps Boeing's faulty astronaut capsule test mission
Description: Boeing Co's  Starliner astronaut spacecraft made a "bull's-eye" landing in the New Mexico desert on Sunday, a successful ending to a crewless test mission that two days earlier failed to reach the orbit needed to dock with the International Space Station.

Headlines: Repo is Wall Street's big year-end worry. Why?
Description: The $2.2 trillion repurchase agreement market - part of the inner workings of the U.S. financial system - is facing what could be another strain as the year comes to a close. That could have wider implications than just Wall Street.

Headlines: China's industrial output to grow around 5.6% year-on-year in 2019: ministry
Description: China's industrial output is expected to grow around 5.6% in 2019, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology said on Monday.

Headlines: Lone Star emerges as white-knight bidder for Japanese hotel chain Unizo
Description: Japanese hotel chain Unizo Holdings  said on Sunday it had received a friendly buyout offer from U.S. investment fund Lone Star, a deal that could end a five-month takeover battle involving Blackstone Group , Fortress Investment Group and activist investor Elliott Management.

Headlines: Activist hedge fund Marcato Capital to shut down after drop in assets
Description: Activist hedge fund Marcato Capital Management, backed by Blackstone Group and billionaire William Ackman, is shutting down as assets have shriveled after two years of poor returns, sources said on Sunday.

Headlines: German cabin crew union threatens Lufthansa strikes after 'failed' talks
Description: German cabin crew union UFO said arbitration talks with Lufthansa  on Sunday had failed and its members could stage strikes any time from now on, though they would spare passengers industrial action on Dec. 24, 25 and 26.

Headlines: Lufthansa says arbitrators propose fresh talks with cabin crew union in January
Description: German airline Lufthansa  said arbitrators had proposed a further meeting with cabin crew union UFO in early January after they held wage talks on Sunday.

Headlines: Boeing's Starliner lands in desert: company
Description: Boeing Co's Starliner astronaut spacecraft landed in the New Mexico desert on Sunday, the company said, after faulty software forced officials to cut short an unmanned mission aimed at taking it to the International Space Station.

Headlines: Second Credit Suisse spying probe expected to clear CEO Thiam: SonntagsZeitung
Description: A second probe into staff surveillance at Credit Suisse  is set to clear Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam, Swiss newspaper SonntagsZeitung reported on Sunday.

Headlines: The best year financial markets have ever had?
Description: For all the angst about trade wars, geopolitics and a sputtering and overly indebted global economy, 2019 might just be the best year investors have ever had.

Headlines: Trump says trade deal with China to be signed 'very shortly'
Description: President Donald Trump on Saturday said the United States and China would "very shortly" sign their so-called Phase One trade pact.

Headlines: Manager of McDonald's franchise in Peru says faulty drinks machine caused deaths
Description: The general manager of the company that operates McDonald's restaurants in Peru told local television that the beverage machine at the restaurant where two employees were fatally electrocuted last weekend had experienced an electrical fault but it was not reported to the company's maintenance department.

Headlines: NASA, Boeing investigating why Starliner spacecraft missed orbit
Description: The Boeing Co Starliner spacecraft that failed to hit the right orbit to reach the International Space Station is healthy, in a stable orbit and expected to land in New Mexico on Sunday morning, NASA said.

Headlines: U.S. government says verdict in Bayer's Roundup case should be reversed
Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and the Justice Department said a federal appeals court should reverse a lower court verdict finding Bayer AG liable in the case of a California man who blamed its Roundup weed killer for his cancer.

Headlines: Britain gives U.S. investor go-ahead to buy Cobham for $5 billion
Description: Britain has approved the purchase of British defense company Cobham  by U.S. investor Advent International for $5 billion after the private equity group made commitments to address national security concerns.

Headlines: Nord Stream 2 to press on with Europe gas pipe, despite U.S. sanctions
Description: The group behind Nord Stream 2 said on Saturday it aimed to complete a pipeline to boost Russian gas supplies to Europe as soon as possible, after U.S. sanctions prompted a major contractor to suspend pipe-laying activities.

Headlines: Germany 'firmly rejects' U.S. sanctions on Nord Stream 2 firms
Description: Germany's finance minister and vice chancellor, Olaf Scholz, said Berlin "firmly rejects" U.S. legislation imposing sanctions on firms laying the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline from Russia to Europe.

Headlines: Russia gas export pipeline in jeopardy as Trump signs sanctions bill
Description: Swiss-Dutch company Allseas said it had suspended work on building a major Russia-to-Germany natural gas pipeline in order to avoid U.S. sanctions contained in legislation signed by President Donald Trump on Friday.

Headlines: Russia to go ahead with gas pipe project despite U.S. sanctions
Description: Russia's Foreign Ministry said on Saturday that Moscow will press ahead with a major Russia-to-Germany natural gas pipeline, disregarding U.S. sanctions.

Headlines: Boeing's failed Starliner mission strains 'reliability' pitch
Description: Boeing Co's  stunted Friday debut of its astronaut capsule threatens to dent the U.S. aerospace incumbent's self-declared competitive advantage of mission reliability against the price and innovation strengths of "new space" players like Elon Musk's SpaceX.

Headlines: Russia must press on with Nord Stream 2 gas line to Europe: Russian senator
Description: Russia must keep to schedule on implementing the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline link to Europe, a senior Russian senator told state news agency RIA on Saturday, after pipe-laying was suspended due to U.S. sanctions.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: History suggests rally may slow for U.S. stocks in 2020
Description: The outsized rally in the U.S. stock market this year may give way to a more muted performance in 2020 if history is any guide.

Headlines: Lone Star to buy BASF construction chemicals unit for $3.51 billion
Description: Private equity firm Lone Star has entered a deal to buy BASF's  construction chemicals business for 3.17 billion euros ($3.5 billion) on a cash and debt-free basis, the German chemicals company said on Saturday as it seeks to focus on more profitable operations.

Headlines: PG&E creditors offer California wildfire victims $13.5 billion in cash upfront
Description: PG&E Corp's  creditors have sweetened their offer to California wildfire victims, saying they are now prepared to pay $13.5 billion in cash upfront, according to a letter sent on Friday to state governor Gavin Newsom.

Headlines: Boeing's Starliner astronaut capsule fails key test to reach space station
Description: Boeing Co's  new astronaut capsule failed after liftoff on Friday to climb high enough in orbit to reach the International Space Station, cutting short a critical unmanned test mission in the embattled aerospace giant's race to send humans to the orbital outpost.

Headlines: SEC probes at least two trading firms over NYSE listings: source
Description: The U.S. securities regulator has asked at least two trading firms for information regarding a broad investigation into initial public offerings and direct listings going back five years on the New York Stock Exchange, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. Steel delivers unwelcome Christmas surprise to Michigan town
Description: The mayor of a Michigan steel town was attending his grandchildren's Christmas play Thursday evening when he got an unwelcome voicemail from an official of the town's top employer: United States Steel Corp .

Headlines: Colombia orders Uber to cease ride-hailing, cites competition rules violation
Description: Colombia on Friday ordered Uber  to cease its ride-hailing operations in the Andean country, effective immediately, after a judge ruled the company violated competition rules.

Headlines: U.S. Justice Department and FCC fight state effort to block merger of Sprint, T-Mobile
Description: The U.S. Justice Department and Federal Communications Commission filed in court on Friday to support a merger of T-Mobile  and Sprint , the third- and fourth-largest wireless carriers.

Headlines: Testimony ends in T-Mobile-Sprint merger trial in New York
Description: Testimony ended on Friday in a lawsuit by a group of states led by New York and California seeking to block the merger of Sprint Corp and T-Mobile US Inc, moving the trial a step closer to having a U.S. judge rule on whether the deal violates federal antitrust laws.

Headlines: France fines Google 150 million euros for opaque advertising rules
Description: France's competition watchdog fined Google 150 million euros ($167 million) on Friday for abusing its power over the treatment of advertisers, saying it applied opaque rules and changed them at will.

Headlines: JPMorgan pressed by Senate Democrats on racial discrimination reports
Description: A group of five U.S. senators sent a letter on Thursday to JPMorgan Chase & Co., asking it to explain what it was doing to address what they described as "a troubling list of discriminatory practices" related to race.

Headlines: Alphabet grants Pichai largest ever stock award, again
Description: Alphabet Inc's  newly instated Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai would receive a hefty $240 million in performance-based stock awards over the next three years, the highest ever promised to any executive of the search giant.

Headlines: U.S. transport chief said economic issues not a factor in 737 MAX's safety review
Description: The economic impact of Boeing Co's  planned halt of 737 MAX production will not be considered by U.S. regulators in their ongoing review of when to end the grounding of a plane involved in two major fatal crashes, U.S. Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao said on Friday.

Headlines: S&P 500 posts biggest weekly percent gain since September amid data, trade optimism
Description: U.S. stocks hit record closing highs again on Friday and the S&P 500 registered its biggest weekly percentage gain since early September after data showed a rise in consumer spending and investors continued to be optimistic about developments in the U.S.-China trade dispute.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. talks with GM over deploying self-driving cars without steering wheels
Description: The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is holding talks with General Motors Co  on the automaker's petition to deploy a limited number of self-driving vehicles on American roads without steering wheels or other human controls, the head of the agency said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. accuses FleetCor of charging hundreds of millions of dollars in hidden fees
Description: U.S. fuel card company FleetCor Technologies Inc  charged customers hundreds of millions of dollars in hidden fees after promising to help them spend less on fuel, the Federal Trade Commission said on Friday.

Headlines: Stocks extend record rally, sterling endures rough week
Description: A year-end rally in global equity markets extended gains on Friday, helped by data showing relatively strong U.S. growth, while sterling posted its worst week in more than two years on concerns over how Britain will leave the European Union.

Headlines: Oil prices down but log third weekly rise on trade hopes
Description: Oil prices fell on Friday, but both benchmarks logged a third straight weekly gain amid the easing of U.S.-Chinese trade tensions, which has boosted business confidence and the outlook for global economic growth.

Headlines: Amazon to raise U.S. fulfillment fees 3 percent for merchants next year
Description: Amazon.com Inc plans to raise the fees it charges merchants for warehousing and shipping their goods in the United States by an average 3% next year, the company said Friday, as it faces higher costs from infrastructure and programs such as one-day delivery.

Headlines: U.S. consumers put economy on moderate growth path in third quarter
Description: U.S. economic growth nudged up in the third quarter and the economy appears to have maintained the moderate pace of expansion as the year ended, supported by a strong labor market.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler unions received assurances on jobs, investment after merger
Description: Unions at carmaker Fiat Chrysler  said management had given assurances at a meeting on Friday on jobs and a 5 billion euro ($5.54 billion) investment plan in Italy following the group's planned merger with French rival PSA .

Headlines: Tesla shares inch closer to Musk's $420 take-private offer
Description: Shares of Tesla Inc  hit a fresh record high for the third straight session on Friday, and were just $7 shy from the $420 per share price at which founder Elon Musk sought to take the electric carmaker private more than a year ago.

Headlines: Graphic: For veteran Netflix shareholders, it's been a very good decade
Description: For long-term shareholders of Netflix , the end of December marks an extremely rewarding decade.

Headlines: United cancels 737 MAX flights into June as Spirit AeroSystems to freeze parts production
Description: United Airlines Co is extending its cancellations of Boeing 737 MAX flights until June 4 as Boeing's top supplier, Spirit AeroSystems Inc,  said it would stop making fuselages for the grounded jets.

Headlines: United Airlines pulls Boeing 737 MAX jets until early June
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  said on Friday it is extending cancellations of Boeing 737 MAX flights from early March until June 4, the longest that any U.S. carrier is scheduling without the grounded aircraft.

Headlines: FCA sticks to investment plan for Italy, no redundancies: unions
Description: Fiat Chrysler  will stick to its 5 billion euro ($5.5 billion) 2020 investment plan for Italy, union officials said on Friday, adding that the group had confirmed a pledge to get all employees off furlough arrangements and back to work by 2022.

Headlines: Novartis wins Medicaid approval for new sickle cell drug in key U.S. states
Description: Novartis AG  has secured Medicaid coverage for a pricey new sickle cell disease therapy in two U.S. states just weeks after winning U.S. approval, following an early campaign to convince local officials of its value, according to a company executive and a Reuters review of public filings.

Headlines: Shell writes down up to $2.3 billion on weaker economic outlook
Description: Royal Dutch Shell  said on Friday it expected to write down up to $2.3 billion in the fourth quarter, the latest major energy company forced to shrink estimates for sector values due to a weaker economic outlook.

Headlines: Just Eat food fight nears end as it backs Takeaway's final offer
Description: Just Eat  backed a final 5.5 billion pound ($7.2 billion) all-share offer from Takeaway.com on Friday, saying a tie-up to create one of the leading online food delivery companies was more compelling than a rival cash bid from Prosus.

Headlines: ViacomCBS to take 49% stake in film studio Miramax for $375 million
Description: Media company ViacomCBS Inc  said on Friday it would take a 49% stake in film studio Miramax, owned by Qatar's BeIN Media Group, for $375 million.

Headlines: Aramco, Alibaba rescue sluggish 2019 global ECM market
Description: Giant listings by Saudi Aramco  and Alibaba  rescued a sluggish year for equity capital markets (ECM) in 2019 after a string of shelved initial public offerings (IPOs) and share price slumps.

Headlines: French telco Orange found guilty over workers' suicides in landmark ruling
Description: French telecoms group Orange  and its former CEO Didier Lombard were guilty of "moral harassment" that prompted a spate of suicides during a restructuring at the company in the late 2000s, a Paris court ruled on Friday.

Headlines: Take Five: Ding dong markets merrily on high
Description: As end-December approaches, money market players' thoughts may be turning to a September scare, when rates in the $2.2 trillion U.S. repurchase or repo market spiked to 10%, boosting the premium to borrow dollars. The fear is a bigger crunch may erupt in the $2.2 trillion U.S. repo market towards year-end, a period when banks lend less and trading volumes fall.

Headlines: Wall Street analysts bullish over Nike's digital growth, look past margin weakness
Description: Wall Street analysts were upbeat about Nike Inc's  long-term growth, encouraged by the sportswear maker's robust online sales and strength in China that helped overcome slowing demand in North America, its biggest market.

Headlines: Veteran watchdog Bailey to guide Bank of England through Brexit
Description: Britain's new government named Andrew Bailey as the Bank of England's next boss on Friday, entrusting a veteran regulator and technocrat with steering the economy and its vast finance industry through Brexit.

Headlines: J&J to buy remaining stake in Verb Surgical to strengthen digital surgery portfolio
Description: Johnson & Johnson said on Friday it would acquire the remaining stake in Verb Surgical Inc, from Verily, Alphabet Inc's life sciences division.

Headlines: Exclusive: Huawei and Deutsche Telekom held advanced talks over 5G network deal - sources
Description: Deutsche Telekom was in advanced talks to retain China's Huawei as its main supplier of radio equipment for new mobile networks before it put the negotiations on hold for political reasons, according to three sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Ruling on Ryanair bid to delay COO's easyJet move set for December 23
Description: The Irish High Court will rule on Monday Dec. 23 on whether Ryanair  can prevent its operations chief Peter Bellew from joining arch-rival easyJet  until 2021, a court official said on Friday.

Headlines: China says case of detained Canadians turned over to prosecutors
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Friday that an investigation into two Canadians detained on state security charges since December last year had ended, and the case had been turned over to prosecutors.

Headlines: Volkswagen takes one-two punch in Australia with fine, lawsuit
Description: Volkswagen AG  took two raps in Australia on Friday as a court slapped a A$125 million ($86 million) fine on the German car maker as part of a global emissions cheating scandal and a regulator launched a civil lawsuit against a unit.

Headlines: China can fulfil $40 billion U.S. farm purchase pledge: consultancy
Description: China will make good on a pledge to purchase more than $40 billion per year of U.S. agricultural products under the recently agreed Phase 1 trade deal between the two countries, China's top agriculture consultancy said on Friday.

Headlines: Mahjong, cartoons coming to Tesla car screens in China next year
Description: Tesla Inc  said on Friday it will offer its Chinese customers more video and gaming content next year, marking the first time the automaker will offer internet-connected games in its vehicles.

Headlines: Factbox: Nestle CEO Mark Schneider's top deals since his appointment in 2017
Description: Mark Schneider, Nestle's  first outside chief executive officer in almost a century, has made big strides in positioning the world's largest food company for the future with aggressive deal making since taking over in January 2017.

Headlines: Dismal decade for emerging markets casts pall over repeated 'buy' notes
Description: One of the hardiest investment fixtures has been the annual 'buy' note on emerging markets equities, but their dismal performance over the past decade begs the question why.

Headlines: Two deals in pocket but no holiday cheer for U.S. trade chief Lighthizer
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer was looking forward to some holiday peace and quiet after wrapping up trade deals with the United States' most important trading partners - China, Mexico, and Canada - last week.

Headlines: Turkish Airlines prepping case against Boeing over 737 MAX: news agency
Description: Turkish Airlines  is preparing to open a court case against Boeing Co  due to uncertainty regarding the plane manufacturer's 737 MAX jetliner, Demiroren news agency said on Thursday evening.

Headlines: Australia's Westpac names two members of money laundering review panel
Description: Australia's second-largest lender Westpac Banking Corp  on Friday appointed two people to a panel which will assess the bank's accountability in a money laundering scandal.

Headlines: Chipotle accused of violating U.S. labor law on union organizing
Description: The general counsel of a U.S. labor agency has accused Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc of violating U.S. labor law by allegedly firing an employee in New York in retaliation for complaining about workplace problems and trying to organize with a union.

Headlines: U.S. House passes new North American trade deal, Senate timing unclear
Description: The U.S. House of Representatives overwhelmingly approved a new North American trade deal on Thursday that includes tougher labor and automotive content rules but leaves $1.2 trillion in annual U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade flows largely unchanged.

Headlines: Australia fines Volkswagen record $86 million for emissions breach: regulator
Description: Australia's competition regulator said the federal court has penalized Volkswagen AG  a record A$125 million ($86 million) for allegedly making false representations about compliance with the country's diesel emission standards.

Headlines: AFL-CIO's Trumka says USMCA is first step to undoing evils of NAFTA
Description: The new North American trade deal addresses most concerns of U.S. labor unions, Richard Trumka, head of the AFL-CIO union federation, said on Thursday, but even so he expects it could take more than a decade to reverse job losses resulting from the original 25-year-old trade pact.

Headlines: USMCA approval will trigger investment, growth: Mexico foreign minister
Description: Mexican Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard said on Thursday that a new North American trade deal will start a new phase of investment and growth for Mexico, ending a period of uncertainty.

Headlines: China's Great Wall revs up for India as rivals hit the brakes
Description: Chinese automakers Great Wall Motor  and Changan Automobile  are accelerating plans to build cars in India after the initial success of rival SAIC Motor  in one of the world's biggest markets, three sources said.

Headlines: Record-setting rally resumes as Mnuchin says trade deal to be signed
Description: Wall Street's major indexes resumed their rally with fresh records on Thursday as U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said an initial U.S.-China trade deal would be signed in early January.

Headlines: Nike quarterly results beat, but North America disappoints
Description: Nike Inc's  quarterly revenue and profit blew past Wall Street expectations on Thursday on strong sales in China, but lower-than-expected growth in North America, its biggest market, overshadowed the beat.

Headlines: Boeing astronaut capsule faces key test on trip to space station
Description: Boeing Co  is set to launch its new astronaut capsule on Friday on its first unmanned journey to the International Space Station, a milestone test for the U.S. aerospace firm that is vying with SpaceX to revive NASA's human spaceflight capabilities.

Headlines: Senior U.S. lawmaker to seek testimony of Wells Fargo's board
Description: A U.S. congressional committee will ask Wells Fargo & Co’s  board of directors to testify about the bank's sales scandal next year, a senior Democrat told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Brazil's Embraer plans to develop new light military transport plane
Description: Brazil's planemaker Embraer S.A. said it is studying the development of a new light military transport plane together with the Brazilian Air Force, the company said in a statement on Thursday.

Headlines: Amazon to deliver 3.5 billion packages through own network in 2019
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Thursday it was on track to deliver 3.5 billion customer packages globally this year through its in-house delivery network.

Headlines: Nvidia, Mellanox Technologies win EU approval for $6.8 billion deal
Description: Semiconductor company Mellanox Technologies  has received approval from EU antitrust and Mexico for its proposed acquisition by chipmaker Nvidia  for $6.8 billion, a regulatory filing showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Southwest can be sued for bumping passenger who spoke Arabic: U.S. judge
Description: A federal judge on Thursday rejected Southwest Airlines Co's  bid to dismiss a discrimination lawsuit by an American of Iraqi descent who was removed from a 2016 flight after another passenger heard him speak in Arabic and feared he might be a terrorist.

Headlines: Stocks rally anew; euro bonds rise on Swedish rate move
Description: Global equity markets extended a year-end rally on Thursday that has pushed U.S. and world stock benchmarks to record highs, while bond yields in Europe rose after Sweden stopped five years of negative interest rates, signaling the end of a sub-zero era.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs may admit guilt, pay $2 billion fine to settle U.S. 1MDB probes: source
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc is in talks with the U.S. government and a state regulator to possibly pay up to $2 billion and admit guilt to resolve investigations into its role in the 1MDB Malaysian corruption scandal, according to a source familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Starbucks settles New York probe into illegal sick leave policy
Description: Starbucks Corp agreed on Thursday to pay restitution and accept greater oversight to settle a multi-year probe finding that it had illegally required New York City employees to find substitutes when they needed to use sick leave.

Headlines: Airbnb wins fight to remain exempt from European property rules
Description: U.S. homesharing site Airbnb on Thursday won its battle to remain exempt from onerous European property regulations, as the EU's top court ruled it was an online platform and not a property agent.

Headlines: French 'AHTOP' tourism association urges France to act after Airbnb ruling
Description: France's 'AHTOP' tourism association urged the French government to take action after U.S. homesharing site Airbnb won its battle to remain exempt from onerous European property regulations.

Headlines: Daimler, BMW exiting North American car-sharing market, cutting in Europe
Description: BMW AG  and Daimler AG  said Wednesday they plan to exit the North American car-sharing market, with the joint venture partners halting operations in Montreal, New York, Seattle, Washington, D.C., and Vancouver, as they focus on the European market.

Headlines: Oil reaches three-month highs, supported by low U.S. inventories, trade progress
Description: Oil prices reached the highest level in three months in thin pre-Christmas trading on Thursday, buoyed by the previous day's news that U.S. crude inventories declined and as U.S.-China trade tensions continued to ease.

Headlines: U.S. business borrowing for equipment falls 3% in November: ELFA
Description: U.S. companies' borrowings for capital investments fell about 3% in November from a year earlier, the Equipment Leasing and Finance Association (ELFA) said on Thursday.

Headlines: Markets sleepy, dollar on hold ahead of U.S. GDP data
Description: The dollar was stalled on Thursday a day ahead of the release of U.S. gross domestic product data, little moved by weak factory activity data or President Donald Trump's impeachment.

Headlines: Apple held talks to add James Bond, live sports to streaming service: WSJ
Description: Apple Inc  executives met James Bond franchise-owner MGM Holdings Inc and the collegiate athletic conference Pac-12 earlier this year as part of its efforts to boost the Apple TV service, the Wall Street Journal reported https://on.wsj.com/2PEGhH7 on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook EU user data transfer contracts are legal, but risks ahead: EU court adviser
Description: Agreements that let Facebook and other firms send European citizens' data to the United States and other countries are valid, a key EU court adviser said on Thursday, although he left room for such transfers to be blocked if European data protection standards are not met in countries receiving the information.

Headlines: U.S. labor market on solid ground; mid-Atlantic factories sputter
Description: The number of Americans filing applications for unemployment benefits dropped from a more than two-year high last week, pointing to sustained labor market strength that should continue to underpin consumer spending and the economy.

Headlines: SEC proposes allowing more investors access to private companies
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Wednesday proposed changes to its decades-old definition of a professional investor in order to allow more Americans to buy shares in private companies.

Headlines: German court bans Uber's ride-hailing services in Germany
Description: A German court on Thursday banned Uber ride-hailing services in Germany, arguing the U.S. company lacks a necessary licence to offer passenger transport services using rental cars.

Headlines: China says in touch with U.S. on signing of Phase 1 trade deal
Description: China and the United States are in touch over the signing of their Phase 1 trade deal, China's commerce ministry said, which will see lower U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods and higher Chinese purchases of U.S. farm, energy and manufactured goods.

Headlines: U.S.-China to sign 'Phase one' trade pact in early January: Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday the United States and China would sign their so-called Phase one trade pact at the beginning of January, adding that it was completely finished and just undergoing a technical "scrub."

Headlines: GM issues two recalls for more than 900,000 new vehicles
Description: General Motors Co  said on Thursday it is issuing recalls for more than 900,000 vehicles worldwide in two separate campaigns to address brake software issues and fire risks.

Headlines: Trump called Boeing CEO to inquire about 737 MAX production halt: sources
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump called Boeing  Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg this week to ask about the status of 737 MAX production, two people briefed on the matter confirmed.

Headlines: Volkswagen attracts bids for MAN Energy Solutions unit: sources
Description: Volkswagen  has attracted bids from Europe's Innio, Japan's Mitsubishi Heavy  and U.S.-based Cummins  for its MAN Energy Solutions, which makes diesel engines for ships and power generators, people close to the matter said.

Headlines: China announces new tariff exemptions for U.S. chemical, oil products
Description: China on Thursday unveiled a new list of import tariff exemptions for six chemical and oil products from the United States, days after the world's two largest economies announced a Phase 1 trade deal.

Headlines: Adidas and Beyonce to launch gender-neutral collection
Description: Adidas will start selling a new collection designed with singer Beyonce on Jan. 18 in a relaunch of her Ivy Park brand that includes shoes, clothes and accessories, mostly in maroon, orange and cream.

Headlines: Citi, ValueAct Capital extend information sharing, engagement agreement through 2021
Description: Citi Group  and hedge fund ValueAct Capital said on Thursday they would extend an existing information-sharing  agreement for another two years through the end of 2021.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra lacks solid plan for launch- governing board member
Description: Facebook's  Libra project has no solid plan yet for how or where it will be launched next year, a member of the board that will oversee the cryptocurrency told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims fall from more than two-year high
Description: The number of Americans filing applications for unemployment benefits dropped from more than a two-year high last week, pointing to sustained labor market strength.

Headlines: Rolls-Royce gives first look at one-seater electric plane
Description: British engineering company Rolls-Royce gave a first look at a one-seater electric aircraft on Thursday it hopes will fly in late Spring next year and become the world's fastest all-electric aircraft.

Headlines: Swatch ticked off with Swiss anti-trust agency parts ban
Description: Swatch will be blocked from selling some parts to watchmakers, ranging from Richemont's Cartier to Chopard and Breitling, from next year in an escalation of a row between the world's biggest watchmaker and Switzerland's competition regulator.

Headlines: Accenture beats quarterly estimates on digital and cloud strength
Description: Accenture Plc  beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter earnings on Thursday, as investments in its fast-growing digital and cloud services businesses continue to pay off.

Headlines: Dongfeng and PSA extend joint venture despite stake sale to smooth mega-merger
Description: China's Dongfeng Motor Group  and Peugeot maker PSA  are extending their business cooperation, despite the Chinese company reducing its stake in PSA to help smooth the French carmaker's merger with Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA).

Headlines: Exclusive: Ant Financial takes stake in Vietnam's eMonkey: sources
Description: China's Ant Financial, a fintech affiliate of e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd , has quietly acquired a sizable stake in a Vietnamese e-wallet eMonkey, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Volkswagen brand to post record profit on SUVs, cost cuts: executive
Description: Volkswagen's  namesake core brand is on track to post a record operating profit this year thanks to cost savings and its increased sales of sports utility vehicles (SUV's), a senior manager of the unit said.

Headlines: Norwegian Air hoping to agree Boeing 737 MAX compensation this year
Description: Norwegian Air  hopes to agree compensation from Boeing  by year-end over the grounding of the 737 MAX, the airline's acting CEO said, as it counts the costs of having 18 of the aircraft grounded since March.

Headlines: Long road ahead as Fiat Chrysler, Peugeot agree to $50 billion merger
Description: Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot maker PSA face the challenge of winning over regulators and delivering on a pledge to slash costs without closing factories after sealing a binding deal to create the world's fourth biggest carmaker.

Headlines: Italian PM welcomes Fiat Chrysler merger with PSA, says jobs crucial
Description: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte welcomed the planned merger of Fiat Chrysler with its French rival PSA in an newspaper interview on Thursday, but said protecting jobs would be a top priority.

Headlines: SoftBank's Yahoo Japan exits Oyo's Japan apartment venture
Description: SoftBank-controlled Yahoo Japan has pulled out of a Japanese apartment rental venture with Oyo Hotels and Homes, in the latest setback for the loss-making Indian startup.

Headlines: Exclusive: BP's incoming CEO won't initially take up Rosneft board seat - company sources
Description: Incoming Chief Executive Bernard Looney will not take up either of BP's seats on the board of Rosneft when he takes over in February because of the complexity of the relationship with  the Russian oil giant, five company sources said.

Headlines: UK accounting watchdog extends probe into EY audit of Thomas Cook
Description: Britain's Financial Reporting Council (FRC) has added an extra year to its investigation into accountant EY's audit of Thomas Cook, the holiday company that collapsed in September leaving tens of thousands of people stranded abroad.

Headlines: Ant Financial appoints Simon Hu as CEO, part of Alibaba's executive shuffle
Description: E-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd  and its fintech affiliate Ant Financial announced a string of top level executive changes on Thursday, amid an ongoing restructuring following the appointment of Daniel Zhang as chairman of Alibaba.

Headlines: Philippines' Cebu Air orders 15 A320neo jets, pushing Airbus toward sales milestone
Description: Philippines' Cebu Air Inc  said on Thursday it had ordered 15 Airbus SE  A320neo family jets worth $2 billion at list prices, keeping the European manufacturer on track to reach a year-end sales milestone.

Headlines: Exclusive: India's NTPC snubs foreign emissions tech, shuts out GE, others from $2 billion orders
Description: Top Indian electricity generator NTPC has rejected the  emissions-cutting technology of GE and other foreign firms for its coal-fired plants, documents show, shutting them out of an estimated $2 billion in orders.

Headlines: Dish founder Ergen says he asked for senator's help on T-Mobile/Sprint
Description: Dish Network Corp Chairman Charlie Ergen testified on Wednesday that the Justice Department's antitrust chief advised him on June 10 to ask a senator to speak to the Federal Communications Commission about approving a key piece of the merger of wireless carriers T-Mobile and Sprint.

Headlines: Swatch threatens to seek damages over Swiss antitrust agency's measures
Description: Swatch Group threatened on Wednesday to pursue damages after it said the Swiss competition authority COMCO wants to prohibit the world's biggest watch maker from supplying watch mechanisms to other companies during 2020.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nvidia to win unconditional EU okay for $6.8 billion Mellanox buy - sources
Description: U.S. chipmaker Nvidia is set to win unconditional EU antitrust approval for its $6.8 billion acquisition of Mellanox Technologies , people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Daimler agrees to $20 million settlement over U.S. vehicle recalls
Description: Daimler AG's Mercedes-Benz USA has agreed to a $20 million civil penalty over its handling of U.S. vehicle recalls after a year-long U.S. government investigation into 1.4 million recalled vehicles.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler CEO Manley to be part of new group after PSA merger: chairman
Description: Fiat Chrysler Chief Executive Mike Manley will remain with the new group set to result from a planned merger with French rival PSA-Peugeot, Chairman John Elkann said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler has aggressive goals for 2020 independently of PSA merger: CEO
Description: Fiat Chrysler has its own goals to meet next year, independently of its planned merger with Peugeot owner PSA, Chief Executive Mike Manley said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Timeline: Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot merger marks next round of consolidation
Description: Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot maker PSA on Wednesday reached a binding agreement for their roughly $50 billion merger, as the auto industry scrambles to develop zero-emissions vehicles and tackle slowing demand.

Headlines: Factbox: Fiat Chrysler, Peugeot tie-up: how does it work?
Description: Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot maker PSA are pushing ahead with a planned merger worth about $50 billion aimed at creating the world's No. 4 carmaker.

Headlines: Factbox: World's top automakers as PSA, FCA prepare to merge
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) and Peugeot owner PSA have sealed a deal to join forces in a 50-50 share merger worth about $50 billion.

Headlines: UK union seeks guarantees on manufacturing after Peugeot-Fiat merger
Description: Britain's biggest union is seeking guarantees on the long-term future of Peugeot's plants in Britain after the French carmaker struck a binding deal on Wednesday with Fiat Chrysler to create the world's fourth-biggest carmaker.

Headlines: French designs on dominance of Peugeot-Fiat rest on Tavares
Description: Billed as a merger of equals, PSA's $50 billion tie-up with Fiat Chrysler (FCA) gives the Peugeot owner one potentially big advantage, its own boss will be firmly behind the new wheel.

Headlines: Peugeot boss Tavares has car manual for fixing Fiat Chrysler
Description: With a track record of streamlining Peugeot's portfolio of vehicles, engines and platforms and offering generous layoffs Carlos Tavares has a ready-made manual for combining France's most profitable carmaker with Fiat Chrysler (FCA).

Headlines: U.S. judge approves PG&E deal with California wildfire victims; stock jumps
Description: A U.S. bankruptcy judge approved on Tuesday PG&E Corp's $13.5 billion settlement with victims of Californian wildfires, and the company's stock rallied as the utility gained momentum to emerge from bankruptcy in June as planned.

Headlines: McDonald's Peru operator shuts restaurants for inspection after employee deaths
Description: All 29 McDonald's Peru locations will remain closed until its local operator Arcos Dorados Holdings Inc completes inspections following the deaths of two teenaged employees at the weekend, the franchisor said in a statement on Wednesday.

Headlines: Airbus sees strong sales haul this year on Asia demand, long-range A321
Description: Airbus  is on course to end 2019 with a rise in its order backlog after netting more sales than deliveries across its major products, a senior executive said on Wednesday, thanks partly to strong demand in Asia.

Headlines: Wall Street pauses record-setting rally as FedEx shares tumble
Description: The S&P 500 ended a five-day winning streak on Wednesday as investors' optimism about global economic growth was countered by a steep drop in FedEx Corp  shares, but the benchmark index managed to hover near all-time highs.

Headlines: Exclusive: Freddie Mac offers early retirement to 25% of workforce - sources
Description: Freddie Mac has offered early retirement to around 25% of its staff as it begins to overhaul its workforce amid a broader push by the Trump administration to reform the housing finance giant, according to four people briefed on the matter.

Headlines: Canada's SNC-Lavalin unit pleads guilty to fraud charge in Libya case
Description: A division of SNC-Lavalin Group Inc pleaded guilty to one fraud charge and will pay a C$280 million fine related to projects in Libya, the company said on Wednesday, in a case that engulfed Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's government in crisis.

Headlines: Online service or property agent? EU court to define Airbnb's status
Description: U.S. homesharing site Airbnb will get a better idea of how it should be labeled when Europe's top court rules on Thursday on the tricky question of whether it is an online booking service or a real estate agent subject to onerous rules.

Headlines: Tariffs, trade tensions worry Fortune 500 CEOs: U.S. Chamber of Commerce
Description: Tariffs and trade tensions are a huge source of worry for U.S. companies, with nearly half of Fortune 500 companies referencing such concerns during last quarter's earnings calls, the U.S. Chamber of Commerce said on Thursday.

Headlines: MetLife Inc to pay $10 million to settle with SEC after failure to pay pensions
Description: Insurer MetLife Inc.  will pay $10 million to settle with U.S. regulators over longstanding internal controls failures, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Dollar gains on Fed rates view, stocks falter
Description: The dollar gained on Wednesday as improving economic data squashed the likelihood of a Federal Reserve interest rate cut in 2020, while a rally in global equity markets wavered as financials shares slipped.

Headlines: Oil steadies on U.S. crude inventories fall, demand hopes
Description: Oil prices steadied on Wednesday after U.S. government data showed a decline in crude inventories and on expectations for an uptick in demand next year on the back of progress in resolving the U.S.-China trade fight.

Headlines: Brazilian regulator says Vale dam near Brumadinho is structurally sound
Description: A dam owned by iron ore company Vale SA  that was the subject of an investigative report by a TV program last week is structurally sound and there is no reason for concern, Brazil's national mining regulator said late on Tuesday.

Headlines: Despite IPO flameouts, 2019 sets record for U.S. unicorn births
Description: Unicorns like Uber, Lyft and Slack may have had disappointing IPOs, but U.S. venture capital firms gave birth to a record number of unicorns in 2019.

Headlines: Indian tribunal orders reinstatement of Mistry as chairman of Tata Sons
Description: Cyrus Mistry, who has been embroiled in a legal battle with Tata Group since being ousted in 2016, won backing from a tribunal to be reinstated as executive chairman of its holding company, lawyers said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Automakers to pay $3 billion in new U.S. tariffs under USMCA: budget estimate
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's rewrite of North American trade rules will cost automakers nearly $3 billion more in tariffs over the next decade for cars and parts that will not meet higher regional content requirements over the next decade, the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) estimates.

Headlines: FedEx shares dive 10% after profit warning; analysts see worse coming
Description: FedEx Corp  shares tumbled more than 10% on Wednesday after the company slashed its 2020 profit forecast a second time, as it revamps its business to replace slumping air shipments with lower-profit residential deliveries.

Headlines: Wall Street holiday parties try dropping booze for bootcamps, smoothies
Description: Fruit smoothies may become the new martini for Wall Street holiday parties.

Headlines: Apple, Amazon, Google partner to make smart home devices more compatible
Description: Amazon.com Inc , Apple Inc  and Alphabet Inc's  Google are partnering to lay the groundwork for better compatibility among their smart home products, the companies said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Saturday before Christmas expected to be the biggest U.S. shopping day of 2019
Description: U.S. retailers are expected to ring up record sales on Super Saturday this year, as fewer days than usual between Thanksgiving and Christmas have squeezed shoppers to finish their purchases.

Headlines: Boeing 737 MAX freeze divides suppliers into haves and have-nots
Description: Boeing Co's decision to suspend aerospace's biggest  production line exposes contrasts in the U.S.-dominated 737 MAX supply chain, severely straining some niche machine shops while giving engine giants time to iron out their own wrinkles.

Headlines: UK ad watchdog bans BAT from Instagram e-cigarette promotion
Description: British American Tobacco (BAT) must stop advertising its e-cigarettes from any public account on Instagram, including some influencers' accounts, the UK's advertising watchdog ruled on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fed's Brainard: Facebook's Libra faces 'core set' of regulatory hurdles
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve Governor Lael Brainard launched a broadside against Facebook's Libra digital currency project on Wednesday, saying it faces a "core set of legal and regulatory challenges" including clarity about how it would be tied to some basket of underlying assets.

Headlines: With or without Huawei? German coalition delays decision on 5G rollout
Description: Chancellor Angela Merkel's conservatives and their Social Democrat partners have delayed until next year a decision on security rules for Germany's 5G network that could bar China's Huawei, a highly divisive issue in an unhappy alliance.

Headlines: Merkel unaware of any pressure exerted by China over Huawei
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Wednesday she had not been told about the Chinese authorities making any threats of retaliation if Germany were to exclude Huawei from its 5G rollout.

Headlines: Aramco shares slip on day of MSCI, Tadawul inclusion
Description: Saudi Aramco  shares fell almost 3% on Wednesday as investors pocketed profits on the day it was included in the MSCI Emerging Markets Index  and the Saudi Tadawul index .

Headlines: Drive me crazy: Colombia ride-hailing apps, tech firms bristle at regulations
Description: Uber driver Juan Jose is quick to cover his cell phone with the red rag he keeps in his front seat whenever he spots a police officer on the streets of Bogota.

Headlines: AIG names COO Peter Zaffino as president
Description: American International Group Inc  on Thursday named Peter Zaffino, the executive overseeing a turnaround effort of the company's general insurance unit, as the company's president.

Headlines: Lenovo founder Liu Chuanzhi to retire
Description: Lenovo Group's founder, Liu Chuanzhi, will retire at the year end as chairman of its parent Legend Holdings, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: JPMorgan receives final approval for majority-owned securities venture in China
Description: JPMorgan  said on Wednesday it has received the final approval from Chinese regulators to set up a majority-owned securities venture in the country.

Headlines: U.S. finalizing rules to limit sensitive tech exports to China, others
Description: (This Dec. 17 story corrects translation in para 13, replacing 'abuse' with 'generalisation' in reference to the concept of national security)

Headlines: FCA-PSA deal 'good', government will monitor impact: Italy's Finance Minister
Description: Italy's Finance Minister Roberto Gualtieri on Wednesday welcomed  the binding merger agreement between Fiat Chrysler  and Peugeot maker PSA  saying it was "good" and said Rome would keep on eye on the deal's effects on jobs and investments.

Headlines: Fiat-PSA merger is good news for the car industry - France's finance minister
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA)  and Peugeot maker PSA  merger is good news for France, Europe and also for the car industry, France's Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler to meet unions Friday to discuss PSA merger deal
Description: Fiat Chrysler  will meet Italian trade unions in Turin on Friday to discuss the details of a merger deal with French rival PSA , the FIM-CISL union said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Google settles 'longstanding' tax dispute with Australia
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google has settled a "longstanding" tax dispute with Australia's tax office, it said on Wednesday, after paying an extra A$481.5 million ($326.75 million) on top of its previous tax bill.

Headlines: Tesla considers cutting China-built Model 3 sedan prices next year: Bloomberg
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc is considering cutting the prices of its China-built Model 3 sedans by 20% or more next year, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the plans.

Headlines: U.S.-India business groups plan to lobby for dilution of India's privacy bill: sources
Description: Trade groups representing some of the world's biggest firms plan to lobby U.S. officials and Indian lawmakers in a bid to dilute parts of an Indian privacy bill which could hurt businesses, three sources familiar with the plans told Reuters.

Headlines: Producer on U.S. TV show '60 Minutes' sues CBS for alleged gender discrimination
Description: An associate producer on the CBS current affairs TV show "60 Minutes" filed a lawsuit on Tuesday alleging gender discrimination and retaliation by the company after she complained about inappropriate conduct by her boss.

Headlines: Boards of Fiat Chrysler, Peugeot owner PSA, sign off on merger: sources
Description: The boards of French carmaker PSA , the owner of Peugeot, and Fiat Chrysler  (FCA) in separate meetings on Tuesday approved a binding agreement for a $50 billion merger, sources said.

Headlines: Dongfeng to reduce PSA stake in merger deal with Fiat: sources
Description: China's Dongfeng Motor  will have a reduced stake of around 4.5% in the new group resulting from the merger between Peugeot owner PSA  and rival Fiat Chrysler , two sources said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Irish plane lessor sues Boeing for 737 MAX-related losses
Description: An Ireland-based plane lessor sued Boeing Co  on Tuesday for breaching a contract for 22 of the U.S. planemaker's 737 MAX aircraft and sought a compensation of $185 million.

Headlines: PG&E submits multi-party proposal for California wildfires
Description: PG&E Corp  said on Tuesday it submitted a multi-party settlement agreement related to the 2017 and 2018 wildfires in Northern California to the California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC).

Headlines: Wall Street extends record-setting climb on upbeat economic data
Description: Wall Street's major indexes inched higher on Tuesday, extending their record-setting rally, as strong housing and manufacturing data bolstered investors' confidence in the U.S. economy.

Headlines: FedEx cuts 2020 profit forecast - again - as seven-day delivery costs weigh
Description: FedEx Corp on Tuesday issued its second warning for fiscal 2020 profit as it spent heavily to launch Sunday delivery in time for the holidays, the continued tariff fight restrained global trade, and it grappled with fallout from its breakup with Amazon.com.

Headlines: WeWork arranges $1.75 billion credit line with Goldman Sachs
Description: Shared workplace operator WeWork said on Tuesday it has arranged a $1.75 billion letter of credit with Goldman Sachs  that is in the process of being syndicated and whose funds are expected to be available in January.

Headlines: Boeing, suppliers slip as Wall Street counts MAX halt costs
Description: Shares of Boeing Co  and its global suppliers fell further on Tuesday as analysts began to tally the cost of the U.S. planemaker's decision to suspend production of 737 MAX jets in January, its biggest assembly-line halt in more than two decades.

Headlines: Oil rises further above $65 on trade hopes, supply cuts
Description: Oil prices rose more than 1% on Tuesday, supported by hopes the U.S.-China trade deal will bolster oil demand in 2020 after a prolonged dispute between the world's two largest economies dented global market sentiment.

Headlines: Sterling falls on new Brexit fears, stocks edge higher
Description: The dollar rose on Tuesday amid concerns about a hard deadline for Britain to reach a new trade deal with the European Union, while global equity markets edged higher, lifted by a resurgent U.S. housing market that bodes well for the economy.

Headlines: Boeing's 737 production halt could dent U.S. first-quarter GDP
Description: Boeing Co's  decision to stop production of its best-selling 737 MAX aircraft involved in two fatal crashes will impact U.S. economic growth and employment, but the pain may be brief and concentrated in areas where suppliers are located, analysts and executives say.

Headlines: AT&T says it will continue investing in Mexico: Mexican president
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Tuesday that he met with AT&T Inc  Chief Executive Randall Stephenson, who assured him the telecommunications firm will continue investing and strengthening its operations in Mexico.

Headlines: FAA must boost oversight to address Allegiant Air maintenance issues: audit
Description: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) needs to improve its oversight to address maintenance issues at Allegiant Air, the 11th largest U.S. carrier, according to a report seen by Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Daimler seeks majority control of its main China joint venture
Description: Daimler  is seeking to buy a majority stake in its Chinese operations, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters, after initial efforts to raise its stake failed and as Chinese investors tighten their grip on the German carmaker.

Headlines: UK regulator orders recall of fire-risk Whirlpool washing machines
Description: Half a million washing machines manufactured by Whirlpool Corp  and sold in Britain are to be recalled following an order from the country's safety regulator which found they pose a fire risk.

Headlines: U.S. agency upgrades probe into 1.7 million GM vehicles
Description: The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said Tuesday it is upgrading an investigation into 1.7 million General Motors Co vehicles for windshield wiper failures.

Headlines: Dow heavyweight Boeing ending strong decade with whimper
Description: Dow stalwart Boeing Co's  shares have nearly erased their gains for 2019 as the plane maker grapples with the fallout from its sidelined 737 MAX jetliner.

Headlines: Sacklers withdrew over $10 billion in a decade from Purdue Pharma: New York Times
Description: The Sackler family - owners of Purdue Pharma - transferred more than $10 billion in a decade from the OxyContin maker to its trusts and holding companies, the New York Times reported on Monday, citing a new audit commissioned by the drugmaker.

Headlines: U.S. housing market regaining steam; manufacturing stabilizing
Description: U.S. homebuilding increased more than expected in November and permits for future home construction surged to a 12-1/2-year high as lower mortgage rates continue to boost the housing market and support the broader economy.

Headlines: Ford to invest $1.45 billion in two Detroit plants, add 3,000 jobs
Description: Ford Motor Co  said on Tuesday it plans to invest more than $1.45 billion at two of its manufacturing facilities in Detroit to make electric, autonomous and sports utility vehicles, and add 3,000 jobs.

Headlines: Boeing's 737 crisis deepens as production stops for first time in two decades
Description: Boeing Co said on Monday it would suspend production of its best-selling 737 MAX jetliner in January, its biggest assembly-line halt in more than 20 years, as fallout from two fatal crashes of the now-grounded aircraft drags into 2020.

Headlines: Big banks settle Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac bond rigging litigation in U.S
Description: Thirteen prominent banks and financial services companies agreed to pay $337 million to resolve claims by investors that they conspired to rig prices of bonds issued by mortgage companies Fannie Mae  and Freddie Mac  for a decade.

Headlines: Exclusive: Daimler seeks majority control of its main China joint venture - sources
Description: Daimler  is seeking to buy a majority stake in its Chinese operations, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters, after initial efforts to raise its stake failed and as Chinese investors tighten their grip on the German carmaker.

Headlines: Boeing's production pause will not end 737 Max cash burn: analysts
Description: Boeing Co is expected to continue burning cash despite pausing production of its 737 MAX jet, as it will leave its workforce intact and likely provide support to suppliers, analysts said.

Headlines: German union calls more pre-Christmas Amazon strikes
Description: Workers at three Amazon logistics centers in Germany have joined a strike called by trade union Verdi that will last until Saturday as part of a long-running bid for better pay and conditions.

Headlines: BAE Systems names Tom Arseneault as new boss of U.S. division
Description: British defense company BAE Systems  said Tom Arseneault would replace Jerry DeMuro as chief executive of its U.S. business, BAE Systems Inc, next year.

Headlines: Southwest flight cancellations nearly double as 737 MAX crisis deepens
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  said on Tuesday it was cancelling nearly double the number of flights through April than it has done since the Boeing 737 MAX grounding last March amid uncertainty over when the aircraft will fly again.

Headlines: Hyundai's $1.8 billion deal with Daewoo hits EU antitrust hurdle
Description: World No. 1 shipbuilding group Hyundai Heavy Industries Holdings Co Ltd's  $1.8 billion merger with rival Daewoo  could inflate prices, EU antitrust regulators warned on Tuesday as they opened a full-scale investigation.

Headlines: Timeline: Boeing's changing schedule for 737 MAX fix, return to service
Description: Boeing Co said on Monday it would suspend production of its best-selling 737 MAX jetliner in January, the firm's biggest assembly-line halt in more than 20 years, as repercussions of two fatal crashes of the now-grounded aircraft drag into 2020.

Headlines: Aramco shares dip slightly ahead of MSCI inclusion
Description: Saudi Aramco shares closed down 0.66% at 37.75 riyals ($10.07) on Tuesday, Refinitiv data showed, ahead of their inclusion into the MSCI emerging markets index, which will be effective on Wednesday.

Headlines: British Boeing supplier Senior Plc reaffirms 2019 forecast
Description: British engineering firm Senior Plc reaffirmed its expectations for 2019 on Tuesday, a day after Boeing said it would suspend production of its 737 MAX jet in January.

Headlines: Credit Suisse investigates report of surveillance on second executive
Description: Credit Suisse  is looking into a report by a Swiss newspaper that its then-human resources boss was followed by private detectives in February, reviving concerns about its practices after a similar surveillance operation was uncovered in September.

Headlines: Explainer: How the 737 MAX production freeze affects airlines across the globe
Description: Boeing Co has decided to suspend production of its best-selling 737 MAX model from January, the plane maker's biggest assembly-line halt in more than 20 years, as repercussions from two deadly crashes drag into 2020.

Headlines: Peugeot family approves proposed MoU for PSA's planned merger with Fiat: source
