Description: Entities representing the Peugeot family have approved a proposed Memorandum of Understanding for PSA's  planned merger with Fiat Chrysler , a source familiar with the situation said.

Headlines: Roche to complete $4.3 billion Spark deal as regulators give all clear
Description: Swiss drugmaker Roche  plans to complete its $4.3 billion takeover of gene therapy specialist Spark Therapeutics  on Tuesday after U.S. and British authorities ruled the deal would not hurt competition in hemophilia A treatment.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's BAIC raising Daimler stake to unseat Geely as top shareholder - sources
Description: Daimler's  main China joint venture partner BAIC Group [BEJINS.UL] has set in motion a plan to double its stake to around 10% and win a board seat in the German luxury car maker, as it aims to upstage rival Geely, two sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Exclusive: ProSieben's NuCom looks at Meet Group acquisition - sources
Description: German broadcaster ProSiebenSat.1 Media SE's  e-commerce arm NuCom Group is exploring the acquisition of U.S. live streaming app developer Meet Group Inc , people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: British Boeing supplier Senior Plc shares fall after 737 MAX production halt
Description: Shares of Britain's Senior Plc, whose aerospace unit counts Boeing Co as its biggest customer, fell 5% after the U.S. planemaker said it would suspend production of its best-selling 737 MAX jet.

Headlines: Airbus shares rise after latest Boeing 737 MAX blow, Safran down
Description: Shares in European aerospace group Airbus rose on Tuesday, after archrival Boeing said it would suspend production of its best-selling 737 MAX jetliner in January.

Headlines: Toyota expects 2020 global car sales to stay at record-high levels
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  expects its global vehicle sales to stay at record highs in 2020, even as demand shows signs of slowing in China and the United States, the world's top car markets.

Headlines: SoftBank's Son says Japan should make AI mandatory subject for college students
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  Chief Executive Masayoshi Son said on Tuesday Japan should make artificial intelligence (AI) a mandatory subject for college entrance exams, to counter the yawning gap with the United States and China in the nascent field.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs says it will support 'green' initiatives more forcefully
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  outlined plans on Monday to put money and advice toward projects that fight climate change or help financially disadvantaged people, with executives arguing it is not only the right thing to do but can generate income.

Headlines: Australian regulator investigates Westpac directors, executives after scandal
Description: Australia's banking regulator will use its increased investigative powers for the first time to examine whether Westpac Banking Corp  directors and executives broke the law as part of the bank's money laundering scandal.

Headlines: Amazon blocks sellers from using FedEx for some Prime shipments
Description: Amazon.com Inc  is temporarily blocking third-party sellers from using FedEx Corp's  ground delivery network to handle Prime shipments as it strives to hit accelerated delivery deadlines this holiday season.

Headlines: Wall Street sets records anew on trade deal boost
Description: Wall Street stocks notched record closing highs on Monday as cooling trade tensions between Washington and Beijing and upbeat economic data from China boosted investor sentiment.

Headlines: Mexico, U.S. seek to dispel tension over labor tweak to trade deal
Description: The U.S. and Mexican governments on Monday sought to defuse a controversy over Washington's plan to monitor Mexican labor standards under a new regional trade deal, with Mexico saying it was satisfied by U.S. assurances it was not sending inspectors.

Headlines: Factbox: Key steps for Boeing to get 737 MAX cleared to fly - FAA
Description: Boeing Co said on Monday it will halt 737 commercial production in January as the grounding of its best-selling MAX following two fatal crashes within five months looks set to last well into next year.

Headlines: Netflix's Asia-Pacific business has biggest gains over the past three years
Description: Streaming giant Netflix is accelerating its growth overseas, with its Asia-Pacific business recording the biggest membership and revenue gains among all regions over the past three years.

Headlines: Spending deal does not hike EV credit, boosts aviation inspection funds
Description: The U.S. Congress declined to extend a $7,500 tax credit for electric vehicles but will boost funding for aviation safety after two deadly Boeing 737 MAX crashes.

Headlines: Kudlow: U.S.-China deal 'absolutely' done, U.S. exports to China will double
Description: The so-called Phase One trade deal between Washington and Beijing has been "absolutely completed," a top White House adviser said on Monday, adding that U.S. exports to China will double under the agreement.

Headlines: Oil rises on U.S.-China trade hopes, still below three-month highs
Description: Oil prices rose slightly Monday on hopes energy demand will benefit from the trade deal between the United States and China announced last week, but prices remained below the previous session's three-month highs.

Headlines: Boeing suspends 737 production for the first time in 20 years: WSJ
Description: Boeing Co  will halt 737 production in January for the first time in more than 20 years as the grounding of the planemaker's best-selling MAX looks set to last well into 2020, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.

Headlines: Stocks rally on preliminary U.S.-China trade deal, oil rises
Description: Global stock markets rallied on Monday, pushing Wall Street's three major indexes and a global gauge of equity performance to record highs after a preliminary U.S.-China trade deal pointed to stronger world growth, helping to lift oil prices.

Headlines: As Brazilian payment apps multiply, some warn of a shakeout
Description: Banking apps backed by SoftBank Group Corp, China's Tencent Holdings Ltd and others are proliferating in Brazil, offering such a dizzying array of choices that skeptics say a shakeout looks increasingly inevitable.

Headlines: U.S. SEC settles with former Goldman banker over 1MDB scandal
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has settled foreign corruption charges against former Goldman Sachs Group Inc  executive Tim Leissner for his involvement in Malaysia's multibillion-dollar 1MDB corruption scandal, the agency said on Monday.

Headlines: France's AMF watchdog fines Bloomberg €5 million over Vinci hoax
Description: France's markets watchdog AMF said on Monday it had fined U.S. news agency Bloomberg News 5 million euros ($5.5 million) for publishing a hoax press release relating to construction group Vinci  in November 2016.

Headlines: Factbox: Aircraft suppliers at risk as Boeing could freeze 737 MAX production
Description: Boeing Co's suppliers are bracing for a possible halt in production of the 737 MAX, as the grounding of the planemaker's fast-selling aircraft is pushed into 2020, possibly resulting in lost revenues and adding to billions of dollars in costs.

Headlines: U.S. reply satisfies Mexican concerns over labor attaches: Seade
Description: A letter by U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer has satisfied Mexican concerns over the United States' plan to appoint labor attaches to follow Mexico's application of its labor laws, a senior Mexican official said on Monday.

Headlines: Factbox: Beijing statements on trade deal differ from those of U.S. on imports, timing
Description: The U.S.-China trade deal announced https://ustr.gov/about-us/policy-offices/press-office/press-releases/2019/december/united-states-and-china-reach on Friday will be signed in early January, U.S. trade negotiators say.

Headlines: USMCA labor verifications will be done by independent panelists: USTR
Description: The USMCA trade deal does not include American "labor inspectors," U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer said on Monday in a letter to a senior Mexican official.

Headlines: IFF to merge with DuPont's $26.2 billion nutrition unit
Description: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc  on Sunday said it will merge with DuPont Inc's  $26.2 billion nutrition & biosciences unit in a deal that will create a new consumer giant valued at more than $45 billion.

Headlines: Airbnb, online service or property agent? EU court to rule December 19
Description: Is it an online booking service? Or a real estate agent? U.S. homesharing site Airbnb will on Dec. 19 know how it should be labeled when Europe's top court rules on the issue amidst a backlash from the hotel industry and some cities.

Headlines: Tyson Foods cleared to ship poultry to China from all U.S. plants
Description: Tyson Foods Inc received approval from U.S. and Chinese authorities to export American poultry to China from all 36 of its U.S. processing plants and expects to begin taking orders early next year, a chief supply chain officer for the company said.

Headlines: Intel buys Israeli AI startup Habana Labs for $2 billion
Description: Intel Corp has bought Israel-based artificial intelligence (AI) firm Habana Labs for about $2 billion, the chipmaker said on Monday, seeking to expand its AI portfolio to bolster its data-center business.

Headlines: Argo takes different road to skirt self-driving challenges
Description: Sky's the limit optimism about self-driving cars is giving way to tougher questions about how expensive automotive artificial intelligence will ever make a profit.

Headlines: Cineworld tops North American box office with Cineplex deal
Description: Cineworld  will buy Canada's Cineplex  for $1.65 billion in cash, making the British firm the biggest cinema operator in North America as it looks to tackle increasing competition from online streaming services.

Headlines: Factbox: What is actually in the U.S.-China 'Phase One' trade deal?
Description: The United States and China have agreed on the terms of a "Phase One" trade deal that reduces some U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods and is said to boost Chinese purchases of American farm, energy and manufactured goods while addressing some disputes over intellectual property.

Headlines: WPX Energy expands in Delaware basin with $2.5 billion Felix deal
Description: WPX Energy Inc  said on Monday it would buy privately held Felix Energy in a $2.5 billion deal, as the Permian basin operator looks to add oil-rich acreage in the Delaware region of the prolific shale field, sending its shares up more than 9%.

Headlines: Bayer asks U.S. appeals court to reverse $25 million Roundup verdict
Description: Bayer AG on Monday said it has asked a U.S. federal appeals court to throw out a $25 million judgment it was ordered to pay to a California man who blamed the company's Roundup weed killer for his cancer.

Headlines: Stocks of Boeing and its suppliers fall on reports of 737 MAX production halt
Description: Shares of Boeing  and its suppliers fell on Monday after reports that the U.S. planemaker could temporarily halt production of 737 MAX aircraft, potentially adding to billions of dollars in costs, as its return to service is pushed to 2020.

Headlines: U.S. top trade negotiator praises deal, China remains cautious
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's top trade negotiator praised a "phase one" U.S.-China trade deal which is expected to nearly double U.S. exports to China over the next two years, while China remained cautious ahead of the signing of the agreement.

Headlines: Factbox: How China tariffs on U.S. commodities, energy stand after 'phase one' trade deal
Description: China and the United States have agreed terms of a "phase one" trade deal under which Washington reduced some tariffs and Beijing canceled retaliatory duties that were previously scheduled to take effect on Dec. 15.

Headlines: H&M's recovery continues as fourth quarter sales jump 9%
Description: Fashion retailer H&M  said on Monday its sales rose 9% in the fourth quarter, putting it on course to increase annual profits for the first time in four years following heavy investment in online and other services to adapt to a changing market. Shares in the world's second-biggest apparel group were up 2% at 1000 GMT, outperforming the wider market in Stockholm .

Headlines: BAT shares rise on rare BofA Global double upgrade
Description: British American Tobacco's  efforts to shift away from the status quo of a traditional tobacco company and to quicken decision making won the company a rare double upgrade from Bank of America Global Research.

Headlines: Costco in Caracas: how Florida goods flood Venezuelan stores
Description: While U.S. President Donald Trump wants to drive Venezuela's socialist ruler out of power with economic sanctions, there has in fact been a burgeoning influx of American-bought goods from Nutella spread to Oreo cookies.

Headlines: Volvo Cars refinances $500 million worth of preference shares with Swedish investors
Description: Chinese-owned Volvo Cars said on Monday it had sold 5 billion Swedish crowns ($519 million) of convertible preference shares to a group of Swedish investors to replace an issue of preference shares of the same size that had matured.

Headlines: Villains or visionaries? Hedge funds short companies they say 'greenwash'
Description: Tens of trillions of global investment dollars are pouring into companies touting robust environmental, social and governance credentials. Now short-sellers spy an opportunity.

Headlines: Ousted Renault CEO Bollore raised concerns of governance problems at Nissan: report
Description: Renault's former chief executive Thierry Bollore, who was ousted in October, had sought to flag alleged conflicts of interest and governance problems at the company's Japanese alliance partner Nissan before his departure, Le Monde reported on Monday.

Headlines: Electrolux's shares skid after it warns of extra U.S. costs and savings delays
Description: Shares in Electrolux  plunged 12% on Monday after the appliance maker warned of a bigger than expected hit to fourth-quarter earnings at its North American business, and slashed its savings forecast for 2020 from its investment program.

Headlines: Jetstar to cut capacity, weigh sale of three planes as pilot dispute drags
Description: Budget airline Jetstar is cutting domestic capacity by around 10% in January and weighing the sale of three Boeing 787-8 jets to counter industrial action by its pilots that the Australian carrier expects will cost it up to A$25 million ($17 million).

Headlines: Qantas to put more experienced crew on board world's longest flights: sources
Description: Qantas Airways Ltd  plans to have more experienced pilots on board the world's longest non-stop flights than on its current long-haul flights for the first 18 months as it evaluates fatigue, said sources with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: China's factory, retail sectors shine as trade tensions thaw
Description: Growth in China's industrial and retail sectors beat expectations in November, as government support propped up demand in the world's second-largest economy and amid easing trade hostilities with Washington.

Headlines: China and U.S. should continue trade talks, remove tariffs: stats bureau
Description: China and the United States should continue bilateral trade talks and work toward removing all existing tariffs, China's National Bureau of Statistics spokesman Fu Linghui said on Monday.

Headlines: SoftBank’s China strategy wobbles as key bets disappoint
Description: For SoftBank Group Corp , financial technology firm OneConnect's IPO should have been a vindication of an aggressive China investing strategy.

Headlines: Boeing board meets as company considers 737 MAX production changes
Description: Boeing Co is considering whether to cut or halt production of its grounded 737 MAX after the Federal Aviation Administration said last week it would not approve the plane's return to service before 2020, a person briefed on the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: Disney+ to debut late March in France in exclusive deal with Canal+
Description: Walt Disney Co  will launch its Disney+ streaming service on Vivendi SA's  pay-TV business Canal+ platform by the end of March next year, executives of the two groups said in a joint interview released in the daily Les Echos on Sunday.

Headlines: Mexico will never accept 'disguised' labor inspectors under USMCA: foreign minister
Description: Mexico's deputy foreign minister for North America, Jesus Seade, on Sunday attempted to rebut claims his country would be subject to labor enforcement inspectors from other countries as part of the new North American trade deal.

Headlines: Sustainable investors face squeeze as larger firms move in
Description: Specialized fund managers who pioneered green investing for decades are missing out on some of the spoils as the sector goes mainstream and large firms move in.

Headlines: German union calls for pre-Christmas Amazon strike
Description: Trade union Verdi called for workers at a key Amazon  logistics center in Germany to go on strike over the crucial final shopping days before Christmas, demanding better pay and conditions for workers there.

Headlines: China suspends planned tariffs scheduled for December 15 on some U.S. goods
Description: China has suspended additional tariffs on some U.S. goods that were meant to be implemented on Dec. 15, the State Council's customs tariff commission said on Sunday, after the world's two largest economies agreed a "phase one" trade deal on Friday.

Headlines: Telenor says Huawei will still play role in 5G rollout
Description: Telenor  reiterated on Sunday Huawei would be involved in building Norway's 5G network along with Ericsson , one of several companies to continue working with the Chinese company despite U.S. pressure.

Headlines: Aramco shares up 1.6% in third consecutive day of gains
Description: Saudi Aramco  shares gained for a third consecutive day on Sunday, rising 1.63% to 37.4 Saudi riyal ($9.97), pushing the company's value back toward the $2 trillion level it topped last week.

Headlines: California governor rejects PG&E bankruptcy reorganization plan
Description: California Governor Gavin Newsom on Friday rejected a bankruptcy reorganization plan submitted by PG&E Corp , the state's largest investor-owned utility, saying its proposal fails to meet the requirements of a recently enacted wildfire law.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade deal cuts tariffs for Beijing promise of big farm purchases
Description: (This Dec. 13 story corrects title of Eller to legislative, not executive, director, paragraph 18)

Headlines: Mnuchin says trade deal with China to boost global economy
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Saturday a "phase one" trade deal between the United States and China was "very good" for global economic growth, and added that the second phase could come in several steps.

Headlines: Mexico objects to labor enforcement provision in North American trade deal
Description: Mexico's deputy foreign minister, Jesus Seade, said on Saturday he sent a letter to the top U.S. trade official expressing surprise and concern over a labor enforcement provision proposed by a U.S. congressional committee in the new North American trade deal.

Headlines: Swiss body considers ban on Swatch unit selling parts - Schweiz am Wochenende
Description: A Swatch  unit that supplies parts to much of the watch market faces a possible sales ban next year by Switzerland's Competition Commission (Weka), newspaper Schweiz am Wochenende reported on Saturday.

Headlines: China top diplomat says China-U.S. trade deal good news for all
Description: China and the United States' "phase one" trade agreement is  good news for all and will "provide stability in global trade", the Chinese government's top diplomat Wang Yi said during a visit to Slovenia on Saturday.

Headlines: China to target around 6% growth in 2020, step up state spending: sources
Description: China plans to set a lower economic growth target of around 6% in 2020 from this year's 6-6.5%, relying on increased state infrastructure spending to ward off a sharper slowdown, policy sources said.

Headlines: What's in the U.S.-China 'phase one' trade deal
Description: The United States and China have agreed on the terms of a "phase one" trade deal that reduces some U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods while boosting Chinese purchases of American farm, energy and manufactured goods and addressing some U.S. complaints about intellectual property practices.

Headlines: Renault offers CEO job to SEAT's Luca De Meo, says La Vanguardia
Description: French carmaker Renault  has offered the chairman of Volkswagen's  SEAT brand, Luca de Meo, the job of chief executive, Spanish newspaper La Vanguardia reported on Saturday, citing anonymous sources.

Headlines: Factbox: A lot of soy, a little rice - China's historical U.S. agricultural purchases
Description: The U.S. government said on Friday China would buy an additional $32 billion in U.S. farm goods over the next two years as part of an initial trade deal.

Headlines: Bristol-Myers wins $752 million in U.S. patent case against Gilead
Description: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co on Friday said it won a $752 million jury verdict against Gilead Sciences Inc in a U.S. patent dispute relating to technology for treating cancer.

Headlines: U.S. Justice Department preparing legal action against Live Nation: source
Description: The U.S. Justice Department is preparing to take legal action against Live Nation Entertainment  on allegations the concert promoter has sought to strong-arm concert venues into using its dominant Ticketmaster subsidiary, a source familiar with the planned legal action said on Friday.

Headlines: USTR files notice suspending Dec. 15 tariffs on Chinese goods
Description: The U.S. Trade Representative's office on Friday filed a Federal Register notice suspending the 15% U.S. tariffs slated to go into effect on Sunday on Chinese goods worth about $160 billion after reaching a "phase one" trade deal with Beijing.

Headlines: China's Ant Financial, Vanguard announce China advisory venture
Description: Chinese fintech company Ant Financial Services [ANTFIN.UL] and U.S. asset management firm The Vanguard Group have established a joint venture to provide retail investment advisory services in China, the companies said in a statement on Saturday.

Headlines: Take Five: What's the deal?
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese officials have agreed to a "phase one" trade deal that includes cutting U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods.

Headlines: Trade deal removes major hurdle for rally in Apple and tech
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's limited trade deal with China removes a major hurdle for Apple  and other technology stocks that have already surged this year to record highs.

Headlines: Exclusive: Hudson's Bay's take-private deal falls short - sources
Description: Saks Fifth Avenue owner Hudson's Bay Co  has fallen short of securing enough shareholder support for a C$1.9 billion($1.4 billion) deal to take the department store operator private, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Canadian regulator dismisses Catalyst request for cease trade order on Hudson's take private deal
Description: Canadian financial regulator the Ontario Securities Commission said on Friday it has dismissed a request by Catalyst for a cease trade order relating to proposed take-private deal of Hudson's Bay .

Headlines: U.S. agency probes 12th Tesla crash tied to possible Autopilot use
Description: The U.S. auto safety agency said Friday it will investigate a 12th Tesla crash that may be tied to the vehicle's advanced Autopilot driver assistance system after a Tesla Model 3 rear-ended a parked police car in Connecticut on Saturday.

Headlines: T-Mobile CEO takes the stand in T-Mobile/Sprint merger trial
Description: T-Mobile US Inc Chief Executive John Legere testified on Friday that he believes U.S. regulators considered Dish Network's history of attempting to build a wireless network when they approved the merger between T-Mobile and Sprint Corp.

Headlines: Uber submits appeal to regain London taxi license
Description: Uber submitted an appeal on Friday against a decision by London's transport regulator to strip the taxi app of its right to operate in one its most important markets, setting up a potentially lengthy legal process during which it can continue to take rides.

Headlines: Bankrupt Philadelphia refinery expects second insurance payment
Description: Insurers of Philadelphia Energy Solutions (PES) have indicated they will make a second payment of $15 million from its property policy in connection to the June fire and subsequent shutdown of the plant, court documents showed.

Headlines: U.S. prosecutor calls on UAW to cooperate, probe may widen
Description: The U.S. Attorney leading the investigation of corruption within the United Auto Workers (UAW) told Reuters on Friday the union's leadership still is not fully cooperating with the government, but that individuals are giving federal investigators tips that could expand the probe.

Headlines: Facebook, privacy activist Schrems battle nears end on Dec. 19
Description: Austrian privacy activist Max Schrems' seven-year battle against Facebook reaches a crucial point on Dec. 17 when an adviser to Europe's top court will issue his view on whether tools used by companies to transfer data abroad are legal or not.

Headlines: Google, Apple asked if apps like TikTok must disclose foreign ties
Description: The chair of a U.S. congressional panel wrote to Alphabet's  Google and to Apple  on Friday to ask what if any disclosures mobile apps are required to make regarding overseas ties, a concern that follows reports of Chinese investment in popular apps such as TikTok and Grindr.

Headlines: California power producer PG&E files amended reorganization plan
Description: California power producer PG&E Corp said late on Thursday that it has filed for an amended reorganization plan, adding that it remains on track to getting the plan confirmed before a June 2020 deadline to exit bankruptcy.

Headlines: U.S. agriculture wary of Trump's China sales pledge, more meat a must
Description: U.S. farmers and traders were reluctant to celebrate news of an interim U.S.-China trade deal on Friday, saying it remained unclear how China would manage to buy another $32 billion of additional farm products over two years as promised.

Headlines: Lackluster U.S. retail sales dim fourth quarter economic growth outlook
Description: U.S. retail sales increased less than expected in November as Americans cut back on discretionary spending despite a strong labor market, raising fears the economy was slowing a bit faster than anticipated in the fourth quarter.

Headlines: Boeing bows out of multibillion-dollar Minuteman missile replacement competition
Description: Boeing Co  has decided not to compete as a prime contractor to replace the Pentagon's aging U.S.-based Minuteman III missile system, paving the way for Northrop Grumman Corp  to win a contract worth tens of billions of dollars.

Headlines: Global shares gain, oil rises, but caution lingers on U.S.-China deal
Description: Global equity markets and oil prices rose on Friday after China and the United States agreed on an initial trade deal that rolls back some U.S. tariffs in exchange for China's increased purchase of farm goods, cooling a contentious trade war.

Headlines: Wall Street steady as U.S., China announce trade deal
Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow industrials ended little changed on Friday, hitting record highs in the session, as the United States and China announced an initial trade agreement, cooling tensions that have rattled markets.

Headlines: China says reached phase one deal with U.S., to cancel Sunday tariffs
Description: China and the United States have agreed on the text of a phase one trade deal, and Beijing has decided to cancel an earlier plan to impose additional tariffs on U.S. imports on Dec. 15, senior Chinese government officials said on Friday.

Headlines: Oil nears three-month high as trade hopes, UK election boost sentiment
Description: Oil rose on Friday to its highest in nearly three months as investors cheered progress in resolving the U.S.-China trade dispute and a decisive general election result in Britain.

Headlines: China to buy additional $32 billion in U.S. farm goods over two years, sign deal in January: USTR
Description: China has agreed to buy $32 billion of additional U.S. farm products over two years as part of a phase one trade pact, U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer told reporters on Friday, adding the deal would be signed the first week of January.

Headlines: U.S. may impose tariffs on Chinese imports if any disputes: Kudlow
Description: The United States could levy tariffs against China if there are any disputes, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said about the U.S.-China "phase one" trade agreement announced on Friday.

Headlines: SoftBank’s China strategy wobbles as key bets disappoint
Description: For SoftBank Group Inc, financial technology firm OneConnect's IPO should have been a vindication of an aggressive China investing strategy.

Headlines: Exclusive: French want PSA-Fiat board guarantee in $50 billion merger - sources
Description: French shareholders in the planned merger of PSA and Fiat Chrysler are seeking reassurances that they will retain a numerical advantage on a combined board if CEO Carlos Tavares leaves, two sources close to PSA said.

Headlines: How ethanol plant shutdowns deepen pain for U.S. corn farmers
Description: When the U.S. ethanol industry was booming, Indiana farmer Paul Hodgen made good money selling about a quarter of his crop to a local facility that produced the corn-based fuel.

Headlines: Britain's Aston Martin talking to investors as reviews funding
Description: Luxury British carmaker Aston Martin  is in early stage talks with potential investors about building "longer term relationships" which it said on Friday may or may not involve an equity investment, as part of a funding review.

Headlines: China to buy $50 billion in U.S. farm products under deal, Trump says
Description: China will likely hit $50 billion in purchases of U.S. agricultural products, U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday after earlier announcing that he would roll back scheduled tariffs on Chinese imports as Washington and Beijing finalized an initial trade deal.

Headlines: Ruling on Ryanair bid to delay COO's easyJet move set for next week
Description: An Irish High Court judge hopes to rule next week on whether Ryanair  can prevent its operations chief Peter Bellew from joining arch-rival easyJet  until 2021.

Headlines: Sanctions-hit refiner Nynas handed administrator by Swedish court
Description: Nynas AB, owned by Venezuela's state-run PDVSA and Finland's Neste Oil , on Friday filed for company reorganization at a Swedish court as the refiner failed to extend loans as it dealt with the fallout of U.S. sanctions.

Headlines: Power Financial shares jump on buyout offer by parent
Description: Shares of Power Financial Corp (PFC)  rose nearly 10% on Friday, their biggest jump in more than a decade, after parent Power Corp of Canada (PCC)  agreed to buy the rest of the stake it does not currently own.

Headlines: U.S. says agrees to lower tariffs on some Chinese imports in trade deal
Description: The United States agreed to modify its tariffs on Chinese goods in a "significant way" under a phase one trade agreement with Beijing, while China would buy substantially more U.S. goods and services, the U.S. Trade Representative's office said on Friday.

Headlines: Shares of SoftBank-backed OneConnect rise 5% in U.S. market debut
Description: Shares of OneConnect Financial Technology jumped 5% in their U.S. market debut on Friday, valuing the Chinese cloud tech firm at $3.79 billion.

Headlines: SoftBank more cautious after WeWork - Softbank Latam partner
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  has been more cautious on assessing its investments after myriad governance problems and large losses forced WeWork to shelve IPO plans, Latin America Softbank managing partner Andre Maciel, said on Friday.

Headlines: Trump: U.S. to suspend scheduled tariffs after reaching deal with China
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said the United States had reached a so-called Phase One trade deal with China in which Washington would suspend tariffs on Chinese imports scheduled for Sunday, while Beijing would step up purchases of U.S. agricultural products.

Headlines: U.S. business inventories rebound in October
Description: U.S. business inventories increased in October, lifted by stocks at retailers, suggesting inventory investment could again contribute to economic growth in the fourth quarter.

Headlines: U.S. sets China trade deal terms, sources say, but Beijing mum
Description: Washington has set its terms for a trade deal with China,  offering to suspend some tariffs on Chinese goods and cut others in exchange for Beijing's buying more American farm goods, U.S. sources said on Thursday.

Headlines: China delays media briefing on U.S. trade talk
Description: China has postponed a news briefing to give an update on progress in trade talks with the United States until around 11:00 p.m. local time (1500 GMT) on Friday, half an hour later than originally scheduled.

Headlines: Investors in collapsed Woodford fund to get half their cash in January
Description: Hundreds of thousands of investors trapped in the former flagship fund of veteran money manager Neil Woodford should get just over half their money back in January, but may have to wait some time to recover more from the collapsed business.

Headlines: Ford recalls 547,538 Super Duty pickup trucks on post-crash fire risk
Description: Ford Motor Co said on Friday it would recall 547,538 of its Ford Super Duty pickup trucks across the United States, Canada and Mexico, citing the risk of a post-crash interior fire.

Headlines: Trump: Wall Street Journal story on China trade deal 'completely wrong'
Description: President Donald Trump on Friday said a Wall Street Journal story on a U.S. trade deal with China is completely wrong.

Headlines: Mothercare rescues UK presence with Boots supply deal
Description: Mothercare Plc  said on Friday it had agreed to supply baby care and other products exclusively to Boots UK stores, keeping its goods on British shelves after the collapse of its retail network in its home market.

Headlines: U.S. chipmaker Nvidia offers no concessions to EU to ease through $6.8 billion Mellanox deal
Description: U.S. chipmaker Nvidia  has not offered any concessions to EU antitrust regulators examining its $6.8 billion bid for Mellanox Technologies , the European Commission website showed on Friday.

Headlines: Broker group warns of investor risks posed by U.S. direct share-listing proposal
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission risks weakening investor protections if it allows companies to raise money in the public market through a direct listing without the support of underwriting banks, an influential broker group said on Friday.

Headlines: China to brief media on U.S. trade talks shortly
Description: China will give a news briefing at 1030 pm local time (1430 GMT) on the state of trade discussions with the United States, the State Council Information Office said on Friday.

Headlines: Daimler upbeat on sales prospects in China: executive
Description: Daimler  is very positive about the prospects for selling luxury cars in China next year, the company's China boss Hubertus Troska said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. import prices rebound; underlying trend remains weak
Description: U.S. import prices rebounded modestly in November and the underlying trend remained soft, consistent with subdued imported inflation pressures.

Headlines: U.S. retail sales rise less than expected in November
Description: U.S. retail sales increased less than expected in November as Americans cut back on discretionary spending, which could see economists dialing back economic growth forecasts for the fourth quarter.

Headlines: China detains CEO of U.S.-listed P2P firm Fincera for suspected financial crime
Description: Chinese police on Friday detained the chairman and chief executive officer of New York-listed Fincera Inc  for suspected financial crime.

Headlines: Samsung Electronics executive receives jail term over union-busting: media
Description: Samsung Electronics  vice-president Kang Kyung-hoon received a 16-month jail term on Friday on charges of union-busting activities, South Korean media reported on Friday.

Headlines: 'Out of market today': Australia brandishes four words crucial to case against Citi, Deutsche
Description: A four-word handwritten note by a JPMorgan Chase & Co banker has been seized by Australian prosecutors as fundamental to a criminal cartel prosecution against Citigroup Inc and Deutsche Bank AG, a court heard on Friday.

Headlines: China says it is committed to resolving issues in trade deal with U.S.
Description: China's Foreign Ministry, when asked about the trade deal with the United States, said it is committed to resolving the issues but the deal must be mutually beneficial.

Headlines: Qantas selects Airbus over Boeing for world's longest flights
Description: Australia's Qantas Airways  picked Airbus SE  over Boeing Co  as the preferred supplier for jets capable of the world's longest commercial flights from Sydney to London, dealing the U.S. planemaker its latest setback this year.

Headlines: Regulator puts loading curbs on 737 jets converted to freighters by Israel Aerospace
Description: Israel's aviation regulator has ordered airlines with Boeing Co  737 jets converted to freighters by Israel Aerospace Industries (IAI) to comply with loading restrictions and use additional straps when needed before they can resume flying.

Headlines: U.S., China agree to reduce tariffs, delay duties scheduled for Dec. 15: source
Description: The United States has agreed to reduce some tariffs on Chinese goods and delay a tranche of tariffs that were slated to go into effect on Dec. 15 as part of a trade deal between the two economic giants, a U.S. source familiar with the situation said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. regulator weighs action against Facebook over how its apps interact: report
Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is considering asking a court to stop Facebook Inc from moving ahead with plans to integrate its WhatsApp, Instagram and Messenger subsidiaries, The Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. labor board approves McDonald's bid to settle case by franchise workers
Description: A U.S. labor board on Thursday approved McDonald's Corp's proposed settlement allowing the fast-food company to avoid a ruling on whether it is a “joint employer” of franchise workers and could be made to bargain with unions.

Headlines: Southwest reaches partial settlement with Boeing over projected 737 MAX damages
Description: Southwest Airlines Co said on Thursday it had reached a confidential compensation agreement with Boeing Co for a portion of a projected $830 million hit to operating income in 2019 arising from the grounding of its 737 MAX aircraft.

Headlines: Beijing's legal influence triggers disquiet in Hong Kong financial sector
Description: When China's top legislature criticized a Hong Kong court's rejection of a face mask ban there, some global firms began to fear the potential for mainland interference in commercial contracts, lawyers and finance executives said.

Headlines: Citi, Credit Suisse drop China's Ucommune U.S. IPO over valuation -sources
Description: Citigroup Inc  and Credit Suisse Group AG  have dropped out of the U.S. initial public offering of Chinese shared workspace provider Ucommune, baulking at its desired valuation, two people with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: U.S. reaches deal in principle on trade with China: source
Description: The United States has reached a "phase-one" trade deal in principle with China, a source briefed on talks between the two nations said on Thursday, saying a statement from the White House was expected soon.

Headlines: Wall Street hits records on news of U.S.-China trade deal
Description: Wall Street's main indexes hit record highs on Thursday following news that the United States had reached a "deal in principle" with China to resolve a trade war that has rattled markets for nearly two years.

Headlines: Broadcom's full-year forecast fails to impress Wall Street, shares down
Description: Broadcom Inc's  fourth-quarter earnings beat Street estimates on Thursday, but investors were put off by slowing growth in semiconductor business and a lukewarm revenue forecast for 2020, sending its shares down about 2% in extended trade.

Headlines: Exclusive: Boeing delays plans for record 737 production until 2021 - sources
Description: Boeing Co  has delayed plans to reach a record production rate of 57 737 jets per month next year, industry sources said on Thursday, even before the U.S. FAA announced a new delay in the 737 MAX's return to service which raised uncertainty over production plans.

Headlines: Boeing scuttles 2019 timeline for 737 MAX return after CEO meets with U.S. FAA
Description: Boeing Co  on Thursday abandoned its goal of winning approval this month from the Federal Aviation Administration to unground the 737 MAX after Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg met with senior U.S. aviation officials.

Headlines: Trump signs off on tariff deal with China: Bloomberg News
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday signed off on a trade deal with China that would delay a new round of tariffs that was to be put in place on Dec. 15, Bloomberg News reported.

Headlines: Hopes for U.S.-China trade progress push global stock index to record high
Description: MSCI's global stock index hit a record high on Thursday and the U.S. dollar gained along with U.S. Treasury yields after reports the United States has reached in principle a "phase one" trade deal with China.

Headlines: 'Boneheads' no more? Fed's rate cuts appear to defuse Trump's Twitter rage
Description: After three interest rate cuts and a fresh round of record highs for U.S. stock markets, has President Donald Trump lost interest in the Federal Reserve?

Headlines: Facebook pledges $130 million to content oversight board, delays naming members
Description: Facebook said on Thursday it committed an initial $130 million to fund an independent oversight board, but said it would not announce its members this year, as originally expected.

Headlines: FAA chief tells Boeing CEO to focus on quality, timeliness of data submissions: email
Description: The head of the U.S. FAA told Boeing Co's  chief executive on Thursday the U.S. planemaker should focus on the quality and timeliness of data submittals for FAA review, according to an email from an FAA official to U.S. lawmakers seen by Reuters.

Headlines: American Airlines pulls 737 MAX from schedule through April 6
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  will extend cancellations of Boeing Co  737 MAX flights through April 6, it said on Thursday, a day after the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration said it would not approve the plane's return to service before January.

Headlines: Oil rises 1% on optimism for a U.S.-China trade deal
Description: Oil prices gained nearly 1% on Thursday on hopes that the United States and China were close to reaching a deal on an ongoing trade dispute that has raised concerns about global demand for crude.

Headlines: Boeing says it will not win approval to return MAX to service before 2020
Description: Boeing Co  acknowledged on Thursday it will not win approval this year from the Federal Aviation Administration to return the 737 MAX to service after the company's chief executive met with senior officials in Washington.

Headlines: Wall Street hits records on hopes tariffs will be dropped
Description: U.S. stock indexes jumped to new highs on Thursday, and Treasury yields rose, on a tweet from President Donald Trump that a trade deal with China was "very close" and a report that U.S. trade negotiators had offered to cancel a fresh round of tariffs on Chinese goods.

Headlines: U.S. senator says Dec. 15 tariffs on Chinese imports may be averted
Description: It may be possible to avert the next round of tariffs on Chinese imports set to be imposed on Sunday, Republican U.S. Senator John Hoeven said on Thursday following a lunch with U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco hits Crown Prince's $2 trillion goal despite valuation doubts
Description: Saudi Aramco  hit the $2 trillion target sought by de-facto Saudi leader Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman on Thursday as its shares racked up a second day of gains, despite some scepticism about the state-owned oil firm's value.

Headlines: Saudis hail 'fortune-telling' prince for Aramco price prediction
Description: Saudis took to Twitter to celebrate Aramco's valuation hitting $2 trillion on Thursday, with one posting praising de-facto leader Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman as a fortune teller.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp in talks with Tesla about German factory: Handelsblatt
Description: Thyssenkrupp is hoping to win contracts for a planned factory Tesla plans to build near Berlin, a board member of the German conglomerate told a business daily.

Headlines: Sweden opens Ericsson bribery probe after U.S. settlement: paper
Description: Sweden's prosecution authority has opened an investigation into possible bribery by employees at mobile telecoms group Ericsson  that came to light during a U.S. probe into corruption, daily Dagens Industri wrote on Thursday.

Headlines: IMF would welcome U.S.-China tariff cuts, but wants 'trade peace': spokesman
Description: The International Monetary Fund would welcome any deal to reduce U.S.-China trade tensions and tariffs, but is urging the world's two largest economies to permanently resolve their 17-month trade war, IMF spokesman Gerry Rice said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. offers to cancel December 15 tariffs on Chinese goods: WSJ
Description: U.S. trade negotiators have offered to cancel a new round of tariffs on imported Chinese goods set to take effect on Sunday as part of an effort to cement a phase-one deal to de-escalate the trade relationship between the two powers, the Wall Street Journal said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. producer prices tepid; jobless claims at more than two-year high
Description: U.S. producer prices were unexpectedly unchanged in November as increases in food and gasoline prices were offset by declining costs for services, pointing to muted inflation despite a recent uptick in consumer prices.

Headlines: Cevian's Tischendorf to leave Thyssenkrupp supervisory board
Description: Jens Tischendorf, a partner at activist fund Cevian, will leave the supervisory board of Thyssenkrupp  after his five-year term ends next month, the ailing conglomerate said on Thursday.

Headlines: Repo is Wall Street's big year-end worry. Why?
Description: The $2.2 trillion repurchase agreement market - part of the inner workings of the U.S. financial system - is facing what could be another strain as the year comes to a close. That could have wider implications than just Wall Street.

Headlines: Subaru CEO expects record U.S. sales in 2020 despite market slowdown
Description: Subaru Corp  expects its U.S. vehicle sales to rise to a record high in 2020, as demand for its SUV crossover models helps it buck the trend of slowing car sales in the Japanese automaker's biggest market.

Headlines: Apple's China iPhone shipments fall 35% in November: Credit Suisse
Description: Apple Inc's iPhone shipments in China fell more than 35% in November, marking their second straight double-digit decline as sales of the cheaper iPhone 11 remained sluggish, brokerage Credit Suisse said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims race to more than two-year high
Description: The number of Americans filing applications for unemployment benefits jumped to more than a two-year high last week, but that probably does not signal a pickup in layoffs as the claims data tends to be volatile in the period following the Thanksgiving Day holiday.

Headlines: Factbox: Nestle CEO Mark Schneider's top deals over the past three years
Description: Mark Schneider, Nestle's  first outside chief executive officer in almost a century, has made big strides in positioning the world's largest food company for the future with aggressive deal making since taking over in January 2017.

Headlines: Nokia, Daimler, others agreed to mediation to resolve licensing dispute
Description: Nokia, German carmaker Daimler and several car parts suppliers have agreed to independent mediation to resolve their technology licensing dispute, the Finnish telecoms equipment maker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil market to remain oversupplied despite deepening OPEC+ cuts: IEA
Description: Global oil inventories could rise sharply despite OPEC and its allies deepening their output cuts and slowing U.S. production growth, the International Energy Agency (IEA) said on Thursday.

Headlines: Ferrari CEO does not expect fully-electric model until after 2025
Description: Ferrari won't have its first fully electric model ready until after 2025 as the battery technology requires more development, Chief Executive Louis Camilleri said, pushing back  expectations.

Headlines: Samsung to invest an extra $8 billion in China chip plant: media
Description: Samsung Electronics will increase investment at its chip factory in China by $8 billion to boost production of NAND flash memory chips, Chinese media reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Aramco shares closing price on Thursday put value slightly below $2 trillion
Description: Saudi Aramco's  shares closed at 36.8 Saudi riyals on Thursday, putting the company's market value slightly below $2 trillion.

Headlines: Delta predicts 2020 profit growth; CEO says more people turning to air travel
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc  sees another annual rise in profit and revenue in 2020 driven by what Chief Executive Ed Bastian called a growing interest in air travel by consumers across the generational spectrum.

Headlines: China has 'important concerns' about Boeing 737 MAX design changes: regulator
Description: China has raised "important concerns" with Boeing Co  regarding design changes proposed to end the grounding of the Boeing 737 MAX airliner, Beijing's aviation regulator said on Thursday, declining to say when it might fly in China again.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler boss Manley to head European auto lobby group ACEA
Description: The European carmakers' association (ACEA) has appointed Fiat Chrysler  Chief Executive Mike Manley as its new president from January 2020, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Haier Smart Home plans Hong Kong listing to take $7.7 billion unit private - sources
Description: Haier, the world's biggest maker of household appliances, is planning a major restructuring that will see its main unit Haier Smart Home  list in Hong Kong to take another group company valued at $7.7 billion private, two people with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Explainer: Just Eat caught up in 5 billion pound festive food fight
Description: The battle for Britain's Just Eat, which pits investment giant Prosus against Dutch food ordering service Takeaway.com, is set to roll on through the Christmas holidays.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco touches $2 trillion market value before paring gains
Description: Saudi Aramco's  shares jumped 10% at market open on Thursday to 38.7 riyals, implying a market value of $2 trillion, before dipping in early trade, Refinitiv data showed.

Headlines: Fed keeps rates on hold, points to 'favorable' economic outlook next year
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Wednesday held interest rates steady and signaled borrowing costs will not change anytime soon, with moderate economic growth and historically low unemployment expected to persist through the 2020 presidential election.

Headlines: Traders keep bets on extended Fed policy pause
Description: U.S. short-term interest rate futures were slightly lower Wednesday after the Federal Reserve held interest rates steady and signaled most policymakers see little chance they will need to tweak borrowing costs until after next year's presidential election.

Headlines: 'Black Swan' index flashes yellow: Wall Street is not scared
Description: The options-based Black Swan index may be signaling surging demand from investors for protection against a stock market crash, but Wall Street analysts see little reason to panic.

Headlines: Wall Street, Fed prep to avoid year end disruption in repo markets
Description: With memories of September's historic spike in short-term funding costs still raw, Wall Street and the Federal Reserve are gearing up for another potential cash crunch at year end.

Headlines: Australia tells Facebook and Google to commit to competition rules, or else
Description: Australia said on Thursday technology giants such as Facebook Inc  and Google  will have to agree to new rules to ensure they do not abuse their market power and damage competition, or the government will impose new controls on them.

Headlines: Instant View: Fed stands pat on rates, expects no change in 2020
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Wednesday held interest rates steady and signaled borrowing costs are likely to remain unchanged indefinitely, with moderate economic growth and low unemployment expected to continue through next year's presidential election.

Headlines: High-stakes White House meeting expected Thursday to debate U.S.-China tariffs: sources
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is expected to meet with top trade advisers on Thursday to discuss planned Dec. 15 tariffs on some $160 billion in Chinese goods, three sources familiar with the plans said, as markets braced for potential negative impacts.

Headlines: Factbox: Labor, environment, drugs top changes to North American trade deal
Description: Stronger worker and environmental protections top changes to a new version of the North American trade deal signed by U.S., Mexican and Canadian officials on Tuesday that clears the way for a long-delayed vote in the U.S. Congress.

Headlines: Meltdowns and touchdowns: How the U.S. scored a Canada-Mexico trade deal
Description: Revising the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade agreement took a year of acrimonious talks among Democrats, the chief U.S. negotiator and a labor union president - and may have set a world record for phones being slammed down in anger, according to one negotiator.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler's UAW members ratify new four-year contract
Description: The United Auto Workers (UAW) union said on Wednesday that rank-and-file members at Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV have voted in favor of a new four-year labor contract with the automaker, helping the Italian-American firm avoid a strike as it works to merge with France's Groupe PSA.

Headlines: FAA probes Boeing 737 MAX production, says it won't approve jets' return this year
Description: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration said on Wednesday it was investigating production issues involving Boeing Co's 737 MAX and confirmed the agency will not approve the grounded commercial jet for flight before year end.

Headlines: Global airlines chief warns on spiraling delays to Boeing 737 MAX
Description: Airlines face significant problems if the return to service of the Boeing 737 MAX drags on for months longer, the head of the International Air Transport Association said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Factbox: FAA chief says 737 MAX will not be cleared to fly in 2019
Description: U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) chief Steve Dickson confirmed on Wednesday the agency will not allow Boeing Co's grounded 737 MAX, involved in two fatal crashes in five months, to resume flying before the end of 2019.

Headlines: Factbox: Self-driving partnerships proliferate
Description: Alliances and partnerships involving development and deployment of autonomous vehicles continue to mushroom.

Headlines: Self-driving car firms rooted in U.S. government competition
Description: Bryan Salesky had little way of knowing in 2007 that his teammates and rivals in a U.S. Defense Department-sponsored competition were laying the foundations for future self-driving businesses now valued at billions of dollars.

Headlines: Mexican businesses focus on labor provisions as they pore over USMCA trade deal text
Description: Mexican business leaders on Wednesday began poring over texts of a new stricter trade deal with the United States and Canada, looking for details of how more intrusive enforcement of labor rules in Mexico would affect their operations.

Headlines: U.S. chief executives back revised USMCA trade deal
Description: The Business Roundtable, a trade group of top U.S. chief executives, announced Wednesday its members backed the revised U.S.-Mexico-Canada (USMCA) trade deal after negotiators brought the hard-won agreement across the finishing line.

Headlines: Wall Street posts modest gain as Fed signals rates to hold for some time
Description: Wall Street's main stock indexes ended modestly higher on Wednesday after the U.S. Federal Reserve held interest rates steady and signaled that borrowing costs are likely to remain unchanged indefinitely.

Headlines: Continental Resources founder Hamm to step down as CEO
Description: Legendary U.S. oilman Harold Hamm, who once called the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries a "toothless tiger," will step down as chief executive of Continental Resources  and become its executive chairman, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook sues ILikeAd, alleges ad fraud
Description: (This Dec. 5 story corrects first paragraph to clarify alleged timing of malware installation)

Headlines: Factbox: How the North American trade deal will affect labor, environment, drugs
Description: New amendments to the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade agreement (USMCA) focus heavily on stronger labor enforcement, outlining a detailed process to address any allegations that Mexican factories are violating workers' rights.

Headlines: Home Depot says peak investments to pressure 2020 margins
Description: Home Depot Inc , the No. 1 U.S. home improvement chain, on Wednesday forecast 2020 sales below Wall Street expectations and said major investments in its online overhaul program would pressure margins next year.

Headlines: Global stocks rise after Fed keeps rates on hold; oil falls
Description: Global equity markets rose on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve indicated interest rates would remain on hold for some time - a positive for risk assets - while oil prices fell after data showed an unexpected increase in U.S. crude inventories.

Headlines: Intel hires former GlobalFoundries, IBM chip executive
Description: Intel Corp  has hired Gary Patton, who was chief technology officer at semiconductor maker GlobalFoundries, according to an internal Intel memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: NYSE files amended direct listings proposal
Description: The New York Stock Exchange on Wednesday filed an amended proposal for a rule change that would allow U.S direct listings to raise new capital like in an initial public offering (IPO).

Headlines: JPMorgan to revamp wealth management business: WSJ
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  is combining its U.S. wealth-management operations for affluent clients and the Chase branch network's financial-advisory business into a new unit, The Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing a memo.

Headlines: CEO of GM's Cruise driverless vehicle unit hints at offering low-cost shared rides
Description: The chief executive of autonomous vehicle company Cruise signaled on Wednesday the General Motors Co  subsidiary intends to offer shared rides "at a radically lower cost" as part of a bid to move eventually "beyond the car."

Headlines: Nestle sells U.S. ice cream brands to joint venture Froneri in $4 billion deal
Description: Nestle SA  has agreed to sell its U.S. ice cream business to Froneri in a deal valued at $4 billion, moving control of brands including Häagen-Dazs to a joint venture the Swiss group set up in 2016.

Headlines: Oil drops on surprise U.S. crude build but tariff deadline eyed
Description: Oil prices dropped almost 1% on Wednesday following a surprise build in U.S. crude inventories, and as investors waited to see if a fresh round of tariffs by Washington on Chinese goods would come into force on Sunday.

Headlines: Gasoline, rents lift U.S. consumer inflation in November
Description: U.S. consumer prices increased solidly in November, which together with labor market strength could support the Federal Reserve's intention to keep interest rates steady indefinitely after reducing borrowing costs three times this year.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs names new head of Johannesburg office
Description: U.S. investment bank Goldman Sachs  has appointed Jonathan Penkin as head of its Johannesburg office, the bank's base for sub-Saharan Africa where the current chief executive is retiring at the end of the year.

Headlines: U.S. government posts $209 billion deficit in November
Description: The U.S. federal government recorded a $209 billion budget deficit in November as an increase in spending on programs like public health insurance outpaced gains in revenues, the Treasury Department said on Wednesday.

Headlines: FAA probing Boeing 737 production issues as Congress raises concerns
Description: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) said Wednesday it has an ongoing investigation into reported production problems involving the Boeing 737 after a former employee reported extensive issues.

Headlines: Factbox: Failure to launch - The biggest IPO pull-outs of 2019
Description: Private companies seeking to launch on stock markets have abandoned a series of initial public offerings (IPO) this year after a string of high-profile startups — most notably WeWork — failed to draw the expected interest from investors.

Headlines: Toyota names new North America CEO as industry faces unprecedented shift
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  on Wednesday said its North America chief executive, Jim Lentz, would retire on April 1, and tasked the unit's chief operating officer, Tetsuo "Ted" Ogawa, with navigating an industry shift to electrification and automation.

Headlines: China retaliatory tariffs cost billions in lost consumption: study
Description: Tariffs slapped by China on U.S. products cost the most affected communities billions of dollars in lost auto sales in 2018 as the hit to local incomes undercut household spending, according to an analysis released on Wednesday by the National Bureau of Economic Research.

Headlines: 'Vindication' - Saudi Arabia hails 10% debut jump in Aramco shares
Description: Saudi Aramco  shares surged the maximum permitted 10% above their IPO price on their Riyadh stock market debut on Wednesday, in a move hailed by the government as a vindication of its towering $2 trillion valuation of the state oil company.

Headlines: Explainer: What the U.S. Federal Reserve will be watching in 2020
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is expected to keep interest rates unchanged when it wraps up its final policy meeting of the year on Wednesday.

Headlines: How Uber drains carmaker profits in Latin America's biggest market
Description: Like many Uber  drivers in Sao Paulo, the ride-hailing app's busiest city in the world, Augusto Caio Pereira does not actually own or lease the car he nudges through the city's notorious traffic jams every day.

Headlines: American Eagle sees dull holiday quarter on higher markdowns
Description: American Eagle Outfitters Inc  forecast holiday-quarter profit and comparable sales below market expectations on Wednesday, as the apparel retailer ramps up promotions to counter sluggish demand for its flagship AE brand.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp's elevator unit eyes margin lift as sale nears
Description: Thyssenkrupp's elevator unit, which has been put up for sale by the ailing conglomerate, will cut costs, add lucrative service contracts and boost factory efficiency in a bid to raise margins and increase its appeal to potential buyers.

Headlines: Germany's Warburg offers to repay money in sham trading trial
Description: MM Warburg, part-owned by one of Germany's oldest banking dynasties, offered on Wednesday to repay some gains from a share trading scheme at the center of the country's biggest post-war fraud case, a letter seen by Reuters showed.

Headlines: Revamped USMCA allows Mexico to bring labor complaints in U.S.: Mexican official
Description: Mexico's Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard said on Wednesday that under changes to the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), Mexico will be able to bring labor complaints against companies and workplaces in the United States.

Headlines: U.S. consumer prices increase more than expected in November
Description: U.S. consumer prices rose more than expected in November, which could further support the Federal Reserve's intention not to cut interest rates again in the near term after reducing borrowing costs three times this year.

Headlines: Global airlines cut 2019 profit forecast over trade tensions
Description: Airline profits are on course to fall faster than expected in 2019 as trade wars hit global commerce and broader confidence, the industry's main global body said on Wednesday, while predicting a modest recovery next year.

Headlines: Tesla plans increasing imported Model 3 prices in China from January: sources
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc plans to increase prices of imported Model 3 vehicles in China in January, sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Massachusetts hand-dryer maker gets helping hand from U.S.-China trade war
Description: The U.S.-China trade war is creating something William Gagnon once thought impossible - a 100% American-made bathroom hand dryer.

Headlines: Germany to repay customers of insolvent Thomas Cook
Description: Germany will give financial assistance to customers hit by the insolvency of Thomas Cook because the tour operator's insurance cover has proved insufficient, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Siemens names strategy chief Kayser to lead portfolio companies
Description: Siemens named its strategy chief and former Kuka CEO Horst J. Kayser as boss of its loss-making portfolio companies, the German engineering company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp elevator boss says German sites need to be optimized
Description: The German factories operated by Thyssenkrupp's elevator division need to be optimized, the unit's chief executive said, adding talks with labor representatives have already started.

Headlines: Focus squarely on Trump as Dec 15 tariffs loom in US-China trade war
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has days to decide whether to impose tariffs on nearly $160 billion in Chinese consumer goods just weeks before Christmas, a move that could be unwelcome in both the United States and China.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco shares open 10% above IPO price, garners $1.88 trillion valuation
Description: Saudi Aramco  shares opened at 35.2 riyal ($9.39) on Wednesday, 10% above their IPO price of 32 riyals, in their first day of trading following a record initial public offering.

Headlines: Timeline: Saudi Aramco's winding road to an IPO
Description: Saudi Aramco  shares surged the maximum permitted 10% above their initial public offering (IPO) price on their Riyadh stock market debut on Wednesday, closing in on the $2 trillion valuation long sought by Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.

Headlines: Germany confirms it will repay customers of insolvent Thomas Cook
Description: The German government confirmed on Wednesday it was willing to repay customers of insolvent Thomas Cook as the tour operator's insurance coverage was not sufficient.

Headlines: GM, doubling down on big SUVs, unveils longer Chevy Tahoe, Suburban
Description: General Motors Co  could expand the lineup of vehicles using its large truck and sport utility vehicle architecture and sees big opportunities in over-the-air software updates, President Mark Reuss told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Aramco IPO to help Saudi economy shift from oil: finance minister
Description: Saudi Aramco's listing will boost the kingdom's efforts to diversify from oil as the bulk of proceeds will be injected in domestic projects, while the global buzz surrounding the deal will help lure foreign capital, the finance minister said.

Headlines: Aramco to become world's largest listed company -bourse
Description: Saudi Aramco will become the world's largest listed company when it debuts on the kingdom's stock exchange on Wednesday, the bourse's chairwoman said.

Headlines: Porsche's electric Taycan draws interest from 30,000 buyers: Handelsblatt
Description: Porsche has taken down payments from 30,000 customers in Europe for its Taycan, the luxury car maker's first fully electric model, CEO Oliver Blume told Germany's Handelsblatt newspaper.

Headlines: U.S., Canada and Mexico sign agreement - again - to replace NAFTA
Description: Top officials from Canada, Mexico and the United States signed a fresh overhaul of a quarter-century-old trade pact on Tuesday that aims to improve enforcement of worker rights and hold down prices for biologic drugs by eliminating a patent provision.

Headlines: Factbox: House Democrats back USMCA - What happens next?
Description: U.S. House Democrats on Tuesday backed a renegotiated version of the U.S.-Mexico-Canada (USMCA) trade agreement after a year of often acrimonious negotiations with the White House, and it was signed by the United States, Canada and Mexico.

Headlines: Huawei's CFO wins Canada court fight to see more documents on her arrest
Description: Lawyers for Huawei’s chief financial officer have won a court battle after a judge asked Canada’s attorney general to hand over more evidence and documents relating to the arrest of Meng Wanzhou, according to a court ruling released on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook no longer among Glassdoor's top 10 workplaces
Description: Facebook Inc  dropped to the 23rd spot in Glassdoor's list of "Best Places to Work" in 2020 from the seventh it secured last year, amid heightened regulatory scrutiny of the world's largest social network.

Headlines: Trump will have final say on U.S.-China trade deal: White House trade adviser
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will be the one to make the final decision on tariffs and the U.S.-China trade deal, White House trade adviser Peter Navarro said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Powell's 'half-full' U.S. glass sturdy but still at risk for spills as Fed meets
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has taken a glass-half-full view of the U.S. economy but the trouble may be that the glass has gotten smaller and has a few cracks.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. House Democrats back USMCA: What happens next?
Description: U.S. House Democrats on Tuesday backed a renegotiated version of the U.S.-Mexico-Canada (USMCA) trade agreement after a year of often acrimonious negotiations with the White House, and it was signed by the United States, Canada and Mexico.

Headlines: U.S. senators threaten Facebook, Apple with encryption regulation
Description: U.S. senators grilled Apple Inc and Facebook Inc executives over their encryption practices on Tuesday and threatened to regulate the technology unless the companies make encrypted user data accessible to law enforcement.

Headlines: Exxon Mobil scores win in New York climate change lawsuit
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp won a major victory in a closely-watched lawsuit on Tuesday when a judge ruled that the company did not defraud investors out of up to $1.6 billion by hiding the true cost of climate change regulation.

Headlines: Exxon wins climate change lawsuit, as cases over global warming proliferate
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp on Tuesday scored a win in a closely-watched case after a judge ruled that the company did not hide the true cost of climate change regulation from investors.

Headlines: Exclusive: Malaysia's Mahathir hopeful of 1MDB settlement with Goldman soon
Description: Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad is hopeful of reaching an out-of-court settlement with Goldman Sachs  over the 1MDB scandal soon, but he said compensation of "one point something billion" dollars offered by the bank was too small.

Headlines: Chevron expects $10 billion-$11 billion charge in fourth quarter; plans asset sales
Description: U.S. oil major Chevron Corp  on Tuesday said it expects to write down the value of its assets $10 billion to $11 billion this quarter and is considering selling some natural gas projects to prepare for long term low prices.

Headlines: Wall Street slips as tariff deadline closes in
Description: Wall Street's main stock indexes ended slightly lower on Tuesday, though not far from record highs, as investors awaited concrete news on whether a new round of U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods would take effect on Dec. 15, a potential turning point in a trade dispute between the world's two largest economies that has convulsed markets.

Headlines: Pelosi to speak on USMCA as officials close in on trade deal
Description: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi will hold a news conference on Tuesday to discuss the U.S. Mexico Canada (USMCA) trade deal as U.S. and Canadian officials prepared to fly to Mexico City to work on final changes to the agreement.

Headlines: Senate Democratic leader Schumer 'waiting to see the writing' on USMCA
Description: Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer said on Tuesday he would wait to see the written form of the U.S. Mexico Canada trade pact before making a determination on it.

Headlines: United Steelworkers union says supports approval of revised USMCA trade deal
Description: The United Steelworkers International (USW) union on Tuesday said it supported approval of a revised U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade agreement to replace the 1994 NAFTA trade agreement that it said had sent U.S. jobs to Mexico and depressed wages.

Headlines: U.S. attorney general says Big Tech probes to be completed next year
Description: U.S. Attorney General William Barr said on Tuesday that he hoped to have Justice Department investigations of the big tech platforms - Facebook Inc , Alphabet Inc's  Google, Amazon.com Inc  and Apple Inc  - completed next year.

Headlines: Drowning in uncertainty: Trade questions slow investment, squeeze profits across U.S.
Description: From a denim plant in rural Georgia to a St. Paul, Minneapolis loudspeaker maker, nagging uncertainty over when President Donald Trump's trade wars might end, if ever, is confounding many U.S. manufacturers.

Headlines: Oil rises but U.S.-China trade war weighs on demand outlook
Description: Oil prices inched up on Tuesday as OPEC's deal with associated producers last week to deepen output cuts in 2020 continued to provide a floor for prices, but U.S.-China trade tensions clouded the demand outlook.

Headlines: Global stocks, dollar slip as U.S.-China trade deadline looms
Description: The dollar eased and global stock markets slipped on Tuesday as uncertainty kept risk appetite in check days ahead of the Dec. 15 deadline for a new round of U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports.

Headlines: Lighthizer says U.S. is invested in Mexico's success as countries sign trade deal
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer stressed that the United States has a stake in Mexico's success as representatives from the United States, Mexico and Canada gathered in Mexico City on Tuesday to sign modifications to the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement, a new trade pact.

Headlines: McConnell says Senate will not take up USMCA next week
Description: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said on Tuesday the U.S. Senate would not take up the USMCA trade deal next week before congressional recess.

Headlines: U.S. Justice Department to review Google's deal for Fitbit: source
Description: The U.S. Justice Department will review plans by Alphabet Inc-owned  Google to buy fitness tracker maker Fitbit Inc  for possible antitrust issues, a source told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Deutsche Telekom CEO denies T-Mobile/Sprint deal will reduce competition
Description: T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp did not pursue a merger in order to reduce price competition in the U.S. wireless market, the chief executive of Deutsche Telekom, T-Mobile's majority shareholder, testified on Tuesday in federal court in Manhattan.

Headlines: Peloton tumbles over 6% after short seller warns of competition
Description: Shares of Peloton Interactive  tumbled over 6% on Tuesday after noted short seller Andrew Left valued the seller of stationary exercise bicycles at about one seventh of its recent stock price.

Headlines: Amazon issues fix after some Blink home cameras found vulnerable to hacking
Description: Amazon.com Inc  said on Tuesday it had issued a fix to rectify security flaws in certain of its Blink home camera systems after a cyber security firm found vulnerabilities that could let hackers hijack the device.

Headlines: Netflix could lose four million U.S. subscribers in 2020: brokerage
Description: Needham and Co was the fourth Wall Street brokerage in two months to cut its rating for Netflix Inc  on Tuesday, arguing competition from new streaming services could lead to the loss of 4 million premium U.S. subscribers next year.

Headlines: U.S. third-quarter labor cost growth cut; productivity soft
Description: Growth of U.S. labor costs was not as robust as initially thought in the third quarter, suggesting inflation could remain tame in the near term.

Headlines: Pelosi: revised USMCA pact much improved from initial Trump version
Description: The revised United States Mexico Canada trade agreement reached between House Democrats and the White House improves U.S. President Donald Trump's initial deal with new provisions targeting the environment and other areas, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Deutsche paints gloomy picture at investor gathering
Description: Deutsche Bank  pared back its revenue growth target on Tuesday, highlighting the tough task facing Germany's biggest lender to revive its fortunes against a gloomy economic backdrop.

Headlines: Boeing deliveries halved in first 11 months of 2019
Description: Boeing Co  delivered less than half as many planes in the first 11 months of 2019 as in the same period a year earlier, the planemaker said on Tuesday, as it continued to struggle with the grounding of its best-selling 737 MAX jets.

Headlines: Ryanair says European delays may mean no 737 MAX jets for next summer
Description: Ryanair  may not receive any 737 MAX aircraft from Boeing  in time for its summer season due to European delays in testing the grounded jets, Chief Executive Michael O'Leary said.

Headlines: Bain Capital nears deal for Italian IT services firm Engineering: sources
