Description: Bain Capital is close to finalizing a deal for a stake in IT services provider Engineering Ingegneria Informatica that would see the U.S. investor share ownership of one of Italy's biggest technology companies, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: House Democrats claim victory in revamping U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade pact
Description: U.S. House Democrats on Tuesday claimed victory in negotiating changes to a U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade agreement to ensure better protection for workers, the environment and remove key provisions that they said would have benefited big pharmaceutical companies.

Headlines: U.S. top trade official lauds USMCA as model for future trade deals
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer said an historic agreement on the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade agreement would benefit U.S. farmers, workers and ranchers for years to come.

Headlines: Schlumberger CFO Simon Ayat to be replaced by Stephane Biguet
Description: Schlumberger NV  Chief Financial Officer Simon Ayat is stepping down after nearly 12 years in the role and will be replaced by second-in-command Stephane Biguet, the top oilfield services provider said on Tuesday.

Headlines: McDonald's could sell over 250 million Beyond Meat burgers in U.S. annually: UBS
Description: McDonald's Corp is selling only 20-30 plant-based Beyond Meat burgers per day in Canadian restaurant testing, although sales are reaching 100 burgers a day in more densely populated areas in the country, industry checks by UBS showed.

Headlines: AFL-CIO labor union endorses USMCA trade deal
Description: The major AFL-CIO labor union on Tuesday said it was endorsing the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade agreement after working with lawmakers and members of President Donald Trump's administration to make changes to the proposal first introduced in 2017.

Headlines: Watches of Switzerland scopes out further acquisitions in U.S
Description: Watches of Switzerland  is considering buying more stores in the United States and predicted on Tuesday that luxury watch demand will hold up in the U.S. and Britain, where it has just bought four shops from Fraser Hart.

Headlines: Trump says U.S., Mexico, Canada trade pact 'looking good'
Description: Efforts to finalize the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) were "looking good," U.S. President Donald Trump said in a tweet on Tuesday shortly before U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi was scheduled to discuss the trade deal at a news conference.

Headlines: Britain's Lloyds criticized for mistreating victims of major fraud
Description: Lloyds Banking Group  has been heavily criticized for mishandling a compensation scheme for victims of one of Britain's biggest banking scandals in a report published on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. productivity weak in third quarter; labor costs revised lower
Description: U.S. worker productivity fell by the most in nearly four years in the third quarter, the government confirmed, while growth in unit labor costs was not as robust as initially thought.

Headlines: Dollar General to sell CBD cosmetics in select Tennessee and Kentucky stores
Description: Discount store chain Dollar General Corp  said on Tuesday it would sell cannabidiol (CBD) cosmetic products in more than 1,000 stores in Tennessee and Kentucky, as demand for the products grows.

Headlines: Choppy markets leave U.S. bank bonus decisions in limbo
Description: December is always a month of suspense on Wall Street, as dealmakers, traders and money managers at big U.S. banks wait to find out how much they will receive in bonuses.

Headlines: France fines Morgan Stanley $22 million for bond manipulation
Description: France's markets watchdog AMF said on Tuesday it had fined U.S bank Morgan Stanley  20 million euros ($22 million) for manipulation of sovereign bonds.

Headlines: 'Symmetric,' now a Fedspeak staple, may point to endgame for U.S. framework debate
Description: After 14 conferences, a couple dozen research papers and presentations and some very dense math, the Federal Reserve's hunt for a better way to reach its inflation target may boil down to a single word: symmetric.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco will exercise 15% greenshoe option in whole or part during first 30 days of trading: statement
Description: Saudi Aramco will exercise its 15% greenshoe option in whole or part during the first 30 days of its trading period, its lead managers said.

Headlines: Non-Saudi investors get 23% of Aramco IPO institutional tranche
Description: Non-Saudi investors in oil giant Saudi Aramco's initial public offering have been allocated 23.1% of the institutional tranche, one of the lead banks working on the transaction said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Domino's Pizza chairman Stephen Hemsley to step down
Description: Domino's Pizza Group  on Tuesday said its long-serving Chairman Stephen Hemsley will step down from the board, four months after the British pizza delivery chain announced the retirement of its chief executive officer.

Headlines: Cboe buys EuroCCP to bolster Dutch EU base after Brexit
Description: Cboe Global Markets  said on Tuesday it would take full control of EuroCCP, Europe's largest clearing house for stock trades, to bolster its post-Brexit base in Amsterdam and diversify into derivatives.

Headlines: Irish court lifts restriction on Ryanair profit target
Description: An Irish court on Tuesday withdrew a ban on reporting a reference to Ryanair's  profit after tax target for the airline's 2020 financial year contained in a 2018 share option scheme after the airline said the order was not needed.

Headlines: BlackRock Investment Institute 'modestly positive' on risk assets for 2020
Description: BlackRock Investment Institute said on Tuesday it was cautiously rotating into cyclical assets, Japanese equities and emerging markets.

Headlines: EU antitrust regulators mull tougher line against tech giants
Description: EU antitrust regulators are considering taking a tougher line against tech giants by forcing them to do more to ensure a level playing field, a senior European Commission official said on Tuesday, a move which could affect Facebook, Amazon, Apple and Google.

Headlines: Amazon secures top Champions League rights for Germany
Description: Amazon.com has secured the rights to broadcast top European soccer Champions League matches for the 2021/22 season in Germany, the U.S. company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Japan's markets watchdog recommends $22 million fine for Nissan over Ghosn pay
Description: Japan's markets watchdog said on Tuesday it has recommended that Nissan Motor Co Ltd  be fined about 2.4 billion yen ($22 million) over the underreporting of former chairman Carlos Ghosn's compensation.

Headlines: U.S. trade offensive takes out WTO as global arbiter
Description: U.S. disruption of the global economic order reaches a major milestone on Tuesday as the World Trade Organization (WTO) loses its ability to intervene in trade wars, threatening the future of the Geneva-based body.

Headlines: Explainer: Malaysia's mega 1MDB scandal that has scalded Goldman Sachs
Description: Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad has vowed to bring back billions of dollars allegedly stolen from state fund 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB), co-founded by his predecessor Najib Razak.

Headlines: Apple has 'deep concerns' that ex-employees accused of theft will flee to China
Description: Apple Inc on Monday told a federal court it has "deep concerns" that two Chinese-born former employees accused of stealing trade secrets from the company will try to flee before their trials if their locations are not monitored.

Headlines: Rolls-Royce says ValueAct executive leaves board, shares fall
Description: British engineering company Rolls-Royce  said Bradley Singer, a representative of its largest shareholder the activist investor ValueAct Capital, has resigned from its board, weakening the stock.

Headlines: U.S., Canadian officials converge on Mexico City to seal final changes to trade deal
Description: Senior U.S. and Canadian officials were set to fly to Mexico City on Tuesday to work on the final changes to a languishing North American trade pact that could clear the way for a vote in the U.S. Congress before the end of the year.

Headlines: Ford to nearly halve its 2018 before interest and taxes loss in China
Description: U.S. automaker Ford Motor Co.  said on Monday it expects its full year 2019 loss, before interest and taxes, from China to be nearly halved from the year ago.

Headlines: House Speaker Pelosi says 'not quite finished yet' in reaching USMCA deal
Description: A deal to clinch a North American trade pact with Canada and Mexico was close but "not quite finished yet," Nancy Pelosi, the speaker of the U.S. House of Representatives, said on Monday.

Headlines: White House adviser Kushner says 'making pretty good progress' on USMCA
Description: White House adviser Jared Kushner said on Monday there was progress on reaching a trade deal with Mexico and Canada, but he would not confirm reports he planned to travel to Mexico for talks.

Headlines: Honda's Hachigo seizes the wheel as quality crisis hits profits
Description: At a two-day gathering for Honda's suppliers in March, Chief Executive Takahiro Hachigo sounded the alarm.

Headlines: Australia cartel case against Citi, Deutsche delayed by late night witness statement
Description: An Australian criminal cartel lawsuit against Citigroup Inc  and Deutsche Bank AG  was postponed on Tuesday after defense lawyers complained the prosecution had given them a redacted statement for a key witness late on the previous day.

Headlines: Former Boeing employee who warned about 737 problems will testify at hearing
Description: A former Boeing Co  employee who warned of problems with 737 production will testify on Wednesday at a U.S. House hearing on the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) review of the grounded 737 MAX.

Headlines: Mexico asks Pelosi to act on trade deal, business groups wary
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Monday urged U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to decide on ratification of a North American trade pact, even as Mexican business groups fretted that proposed changes were weakening the deal.

Headlines: Canada's Freeland invited to Mexico talks as USMCA deal looms
Description: Mexico's government has invited Canadian Deputy Prime Minister Chrystia Freeland to talks in Mexico along with U.S. officials, a senior Mexican official said on Monday, as a final agreement on a new North American trade deal appeared to draw nearer.

Headlines: J&J CEO spurns U.S. congressional hearing on carcinogens in talc products
Description: Johnson & Johnson  Chief Executive Officer Alex Gorsky has declined to appear at a U.S. congressional hearing set for Tuesday on the safety of the company's Baby Powder and other talc-based cosmetics.

Headlines: GM loans $40 million to firm to acquire, retool shuttered Lordstown, Ohio, factory
Description: General Motors Co  confirmed on Monday it agreed to loan $40 million to an electric vehicle start-up to facilitate the acquisition of its shuttered Lordstown Assembly plant in Ohio.

Headlines: Top U.S. officials heading to Mexico in press to finalize USMCA - administration official
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and White House adviser Jared Kushner will head to Mexico on Tuesday to work on final details of the U.S.-Mexico-Canada (USMCA) trade pact, which has yet to be ratified by the U.S. Congress, an administration official said.

Headlines: Oil slips as weak China exports highlight trade war impact
Description: Oil prices fell on Monday after data showed Chinese exports declined for a fourth straight month, sending jitters through a market already concerned about damage to global demand by the trade war between Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: Wall St. falls as Apple, health shares drag, tariff deadline looms
Description: U.S. stocks pulled back on Monday from near-record levels, as Apple and healthcare shares fell and investors braced for a busy week of political and economic news, including a potential turning point in the U.S.-China trade dispute.

Headlines: Sprint tells of business struggles in first day of T-Mobile merger trial
Description: Executives from Sprint Corp testified on Monday that the U.S. wireless carrier has struggled to improve its network, hindering its growth and underscoring the need to merge with larger rival T-Mobile US Inc.

Headlines: Uber nears deal for self-driving car simulation startup: The Information
Description: Uber Technologies Inc  is in advanced negotiations to acquire Foresight, a startup that develops simulation software, The Information reported on Monday citing a source familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Global stocks, gold little changed as trade war spurs concerns
Description: Global equity markets traded flat on Monday on hopes officials would delay more U.S. tariffs set to take effect on Chinese goods this coming Sunday, while gold held firm as investors hedged against a possible escalation in the trade war.

Headlines: Australia's Westpac faces investor rage after exploitation payment scandal
Description: Australia's Westpac Banking Corp  faces a showdown with investors at its annual meeting this week, seeking to hold back an avalanche of outrage over a money laundering scandal that includes accusations of enabling child exploitation payments.

Headlines: Amazon lawsuit blames Trump for loss of Pentagon cloud contract
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Monday accused U.S. President Donald Trump of exerting "improper pressure" and bias that led the Department of Defense to award a lucrative $10 billion cloud contract to rival Microsoft Corp.

Headlines: Volkswagen charged with violating vehicle emission standards in Canada
Description: German automaker Volkswagen AG  on Monday was charged with importing nearly 128,000 vehicles into Canada contravening the country's environmental legislation, a Canadian government agency said.

Headlines: Nokia halts legal action against Daimler with mediation offer in patent row
Description: Finnish telecoms equipment maker Nokia has suspended legal action against German carmaker Daimler in the hope that mediation will resolve their dispute over technology licensing fees.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley cutting jobs due to uncertain global environment -source
Description: Morgan Stanley  is cutting about 2% of its workforce globally due to an uncertain global economic outlook, according to a source familiar with the matter.

Headlines: France's Sanofi to buy biotech firm Synthorx for $2.5 billion
Description: France's Sanofi  on Monday agreed to buy California-headquartered biotechnology firm Synthorx  in a cash deal worth about $2.5 billion as it steps up a push in the lucrative field of cancer drugs under its new chief executive.

Headlines: ViacomCBS plans sale of CBS headquarters in New York
Description: ViacomCBS  is planning to sell the CBS headquarters in New York, known as Black Rock, as it seeks to cut costs from the combined company, Chief Executive Officer Bob Bakish told reporters Monday.

Headlines: Brazil's weak currency, cheaper credit add to Amazon threats
Description: Brazil's record-low interest rates and exchange rate threaten to accelerate Amazon deforestation, which has already risen sharply under Brazil's farm-friendly President Jair Bolsonaro, economists tell Reuters.

Headlines: Tiger Global cuts Juul's valuation by half to $19 billion: WSJ
Description: Private equity firm Tiger Global Management has cut its valuation of e-cigaratte maker Juul Labs Inc by half to $19 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.

Headlines: Reinvesting Aramco IPO money will aid government revenues: minister
Description: Saudi Arabia's finance minister on Monday said that reinvesting money from the initial public offering (IPO) of oil group Saudi Aramco would help to create more revenue channels for the government.

Headlines: Just Eat takeover battle hots up with fresh $6.5 billion Prosus bid
Description: Prosus  raised its unsolicited cash offer for British food delivery service Just Eat  to $6.5 billion on Monday, ratcheting up the pressure on rival bidder Takeaway  in their bitter takeover battle.

Headlines: Canada to present fiscal update before Christmas: finance minister
Description: Canada's new minority Liberal government will present a fiscal update before the Christmas break, although no date has been set, Finance Minister Bill Morneau said on Monday.

Headlines: Walmart Chile pulls court requests for police protection, but warns looting continues
Description: Walmart in Chile on Monday pulled requests it filed earlier with Chilean courts demanding police protection for its supermarkets, but said looting of its stores continued and that the situation following weeks of unrest remained "complex."

Headlines: U.S. consumer inflation expectations rebound from five-year low: NY Fed
Description: U.S. consumers' inflation expectations rose slightly in November, bringing the outlook for near and medium-term inflation up from a five-year low in a New York Federal Reserve survey, potentially offering relief to policymakers worried about sagging inflation.

Headlines: Xerox expects revenue growth of up to $1.5 billion with HP takeover
Description: Xerox Holdings Corp  expects its proposed acquisition of personal computer company HP Inc  to result in sales growth of as much as $1.5 billion for the combined company, according to a presentation by the printer maker.

Headlines: Exclusive: Hyundai's $1.8 billion shipbuilding deal with Daewoo faces full EU probe - sources
Description: World No. 1 shipbuilding group Hyundai Heavy Industries Holdings Co Ltd's  $1.8 billion merger with rival shipbuilder Daewoo  will face a full-scale investigation in Europe due to serious EU antitrust concerns, two people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Intel creates chip to control quantum computers
Description: Quantum computers aim to carry out tasks in just a few minutes that would take today's best conventional computers thousands of years. But in nearly every photograph of the devices, there's a tangle of wires in the background connected to equipment that controls the quantum computer.

Headlines: Bankrupt PG&E to take $4.9 billion more charge on wildfire victim claims
Description: PG&E Corp said https://www.sec.gov/ix?doc=/Archives/edgar/data/75488/000095015719001393/form8-k.htm on Monday it would take a pretax charge of $4.9 billion in the current quarter related to the settlement of claims from victims of some of most devastating wildfires in California's modern history.

Headlines: Flying cars could lure investors away from ground-based services: survey
Description: Electric air taxis — known colloquially, if somewhat misleadingly, as "flying cars" — could draw millions of investor dollars away from ground-based transportation start-up firms in 2020, according to a study released on Monday.

Headlines: General Motors pulls out of Russian car assembly business with Avtovaz deal
Description: Russia's biggest automaker Avtovaz said on Monday it would buy out General Motors  from their joint venture producing vehicles in Russia under the Chevrolet brand, effectively ending GM's presence in car assembling in the country.

Headlines: Britain's Tesco considers Asia exit
Description: Britain's biggest retailer, Tesco , has signaled a further retreat from its once lofty global ambitions by starting a review of its remaining Asian businesses, which could result in a sale of those Thai and Malaysian operations.

Headlines: Tesco shares jump on possible sale of Asian business
Description: Shares in Tesco  rose more than 5% on Monday after Britain's biggest retailer said it might sell its Asian businesses, in Thailand and Malaysia, which analysts valued at up to $9 billion.

Headlines: Swedbank revamps management after money laundering probe
Description: Swedbank  said on Monday its chief risk officer was leaving as the Swedish bank's new CEO revamps its structure to regain customer trust after a money laundering scandal sent its shares down 40% in the past year.

Headlines: Swelling U.S. IPO backlog points to crowded 2020 field
Description: More and more companies are putting plans for U.S. initial public offerings (IPO) on ice this year because of investor pushback against their valuations, creating a backlog that could make stock market debuts more challenging in 2020.

Headlines: House Democrats, USTR nearing deal to pass modified USMCA agreement: WSJ
Description: House Democrats and U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer are nearing a deal to pass a revised version of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement, the Wall Street Journal reported late on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Jobs of the future are clustering in a handful of U.S. cities, study finds
Description: A new analysis of where "innovation" jobs are being created in the United States paints a stark portrait of a divided economy where the industries seen as key to future growth cluster in a narrowing set of places.

Headlines: Skechers' 'cool' value gives it room to run like Nike: Barron's
Description: Shoemaker Skechers USA Inc  is expected to post earnings growth on pace with Nike Inc  over the next three years, giving its relatively low valuation a chance of catching up, financial newspaper Barron's reported in its Dec. 7 edition.

Headlines: Mexico accepts U.S. steel demand in USMCA trade deal, but with conditions
Description: Mexico would accept a U.S. demand on steel in the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement if the rule took effect at least five years after the trade pact's ratification, Mexican Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard said on Sunday.

Headlines: Global financial watchdogs take aim at Big Tech's data dominance
Description: Google, Alibaba and other "Big Tech" companies could be forced to share data on financial services customers with banks and financial technology firms to prevent unfair competition.

Headlines: Capital One is a banking-peer bargain, even with recent gains: Barron's
Description: Shares of Capital One Financial Corp  could climb significantly if investors look beyond its well-known credit card arm to see the bank within it, according to Barron's Dec. 7 edition.

Headlines: As Fed reiterates rate pause, forecasts likely to be blown off course
Description: Friday's booming U.S. jobs report should give the Federal Reserve all it needs to stick to its plan not to cut interest rates further in the near future, so when U.S. central bankers meet this week, most of the focus will be on their outlook for next year and beyond.

Headlines: U.S. banks' reluctance to lend cash may have caused repo shock: BIS
Description: The unwillingness of the top four U.S. banks to lend cash combined with a burst of demand from hedge funds for secured funding could explain a recent spike in U.S. money market rates, the Bank for International Settlements said.

Headlines: Jeff Bezos says Amazon wants to work more with the Pentagon
Description: Amazon.com Inc founder Jeff Bezos said it would support the U.S. Department of Defense as technology companies vie for more defense contracts and the Pentagon seeks to modernize itself.

Headlines: VW's German plants need to shape up, says production chief
Description: Volkswagen's  German plants need to boost efficiency to match overseas operations, production chief Andreas Tostmann was quoted as saying, targeting 2 billion euros ($2.2 billion) in savings by 2023.

Headlines: Japan's markets watchdog likely to recommend $22 million fine against Nissan: NHK
Description: Japan's markets watchdog will likely recommend soon that the financial regulator fine Nissan Motor Co Ltd  about 2.4 billion yen ($22 million) over false reporting on its financial statement, public broadcaster NHK reported on Sunday.

Headlines: China November exports fall, but import growth hints of recovering demand
Description: China's exports in November shrank for the fourth consecutive month, underscoring persistent pressures on manufacturers from the Sino-U.S. war but growth in imports may be a sign that Beijing's stimulus steps are helping to stoke demand.

Headlines: China copper imports hit 13-month high in November on improved factory activity
Description: China's copper imports rose 12.1% in November from the previous month to their highest in more than a year, as an unexpected improvement in the manufacturing sector drove up demand.

Headlines: China November crude oil imports hit record high as refiners race to use up quotas
Description: China's crude oil imports hit a record high on a daily basis in November, as refiners operated at high run rates to use up annual import quotas.

Headlines: China November iron ore imports down for second month as top miners ship less
Description: China's iron ore imports fell for a second straight month in November, customs data showed on Sunday, as lower shipments from top miners in Australia and Brazil overshadowed firm demand for the steelmaking ingredient at mills.

Headlines: China's November coal imports slump 19% month-on-month on port curbs
Description: China's coal imports plunged 19% in November from the previous month as tighter import rules at ports curbed shipments towards the year's end.

Headlines: Mexico, U.S. draw closer to finalizing USMCA: source
Description: U.S. and Mexican negotiators are "very close" to finalizing the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement, a Washington-based source familiar with the talks said on Saturday, after a top Mexico official said the two sides had made progress on the trade deal.

Headlines: China's November trade surplus with U.S. at $24.60 billion vs $26.45 billion in October
Description: China's trade surplus with the United States for November stood at $24.60 billion, Reuters calculation based on Chinese customs data showed on Sunday, easing from the previous month's surplus of $26.45 billion.

Headlines: Proxy adviser ISS opposes plan by Hudson's Bay chairman to take firm private
Description: Institutional Shareholder Services said on Friday it recommends shareholders vote against a plan by the chairman of Hudson's Bay Co to take the Saks Fifth Avenue owner private after the bid was topped by an offer from Catalyst Capital Group Inc.

Headlines: Ericsson to pay over $1 billion to resolve U.S. corruption probes
Description: Swedish mobile telecoms company Ericsson  has agreed to pay over $1 billion to resolve probes into corruption, including the bribing of government officials, the U.S. Department of Justice said on Friday.

Headlines: Fiat appeals to Europe's top court against $33 million EU tax order
Description: Carmaker Fiat Chrysler  has lodged an appeal with Europe's top court against an EU order to pay 30 million euros ($33 million) in Luxembourg back-taxes, seeking to overturn a lower tribunal ruling backing EU antitrust regulators.

Headlines: Tesla boss Elon Musk wins defamation trial over his 'pedo guy' tweet
Description: Tesla Inc boss Elon Musk emerged victorious on Friday from a closely watched defamation trial as a federal court jury swiftly rejected the $190 million claim brought against him by a British cave explorer who Musk had branded a "pedo guy" on Twitter.

Headlines: Musk's defamation win may reset legal landscape for social media
Description: ((This December 6 story is refiled to fix typo in quote in paragraph nine))

Headlines: Mexico says 'good progress' on trade deal although work remains
Description: Negotiators working to close a new North American trade deal have made "good progress" but many elements are not yet resolved, Mexico's deputy foreign minister said on Friday.

Headlines: Mexico official lauds progress on trade deal but says work remains
Description: Mexico's deputy foreign minister for North America, Jesus Seade, said on Friday that negotiators made "good progress" to close the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) trade deal, but many elements remained to be resolved.

Headlines: Bankrupt PG&E reaches $13.5 billion settlement with California wildfire victims
Description: California's bankrupt power producer PG&E Corp  said on Friday it had reached a $13.5 billion settlement with victims of some of most devastating wildfires in the state's modern history.

Headlines: Trump calls for World Bank to stop loaning to China
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday called for the World Bank to stop loaning money to China, one day after the institution adopted a lending plan to Beijing over Washington's objections.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Tariff deadline keeps focus on trade as 2019 draws to close
Description: The stock market looks set to end 2019 the way it began the year -- highly sensitive to headlines from President Donald Trump's global trade war.

Headlines: JPMorgan banker testifying for cartel prosecutors says there was no agreement
Description: A prosecution witness in an Australian criminal cartel case against Citigroup Inc and Deutsche Bank AG said on Friday that the banks never colluded, but that he helped a regulator build its case to get immunity.

Headlines: Global stocks rally, dollar gains on robust U.S. jobs data
Description: The dollar rose and global equity markets jumped on Friday after data showed U.S. job growth increased by the most in 10 months in November, putting to rest recession fears and briefly taking the spotlight off contentious U.S.-China trade talks.

Headlines: Wall Street climbs on solid jobs data, trade hopes
Description: Wall Street ended solidly higher on Friday as a strong jobs report and optimism about U.S.-China trade negotiations ahead of an upcoming deadline helped stoke investor risk appetite.

Headlines: Tesla Inc boss Elon Musk wins defamation trial over 'pedo guy' tweet
Description: A U.S. District Court jury in Los Angeles on Friday found in favor of Tesla Inc  boss Elon Musk in the defamation lawsuit brought against him by a British cave explorer who Musk had branded a "pedo guy" on Twitter.

Headlines: Saudi delivers deeper cuts as OPEC+ oil producers back new pact
Description: By Shadia Nasralla, Olesya Astakhova and Bozorgmehr Sharafedin

Headlines: What deeper OPEC+ oil output cuts mean for the market
Description: Saudi Arabia and Russia led a deal on Friday in which OPEC and its allies committed to deeper oil output cuts in the first quarter of 2020 aiming to avert oversupply and support prices.

Headlines: U.S. lawmaker says Uber must take action after disclosing sexual assault reports
Description: The chairman of the House Transportation and Infrastructure Committee urged Uber Technologies Inc to take action after the company disclosed on Thursday it received over 3,000 reports of sexual assault related to its 1.3 billion rides in the United States last year.

Headlines: Trump will make final call on China tariffs, likes direction of talks: Kudlow
Description: Top White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Friday that a Dec. 15 deadline is still in place to impose a new round of U.S. tariffs on Chinese consumer goods, but President Donald Trump likes where trade talks with China are going.

Headlines: Amazon websites could be added to USTR's 'Notorious Markets' list: WSJ
Description: The Trump administration is considering putting some of Amazon.com Inc's  overseas websites on a list of global marketplaces known for counterfeit goods, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Strong U.S. job growth showcases economy's resilience
Description: U.S. job growth increased by the most in 10 months in November as the healthcare industry boosted hiring and production workers at General Motors  returned to work after a strike, the strongest sign yet the economy is in no danger of stalling.

Headlines: Strong U.S. job growth showcases economy's resilience
Description: U.S. job growth increased by the most in 10 months in November as the healthcare industry boosted hiring and production workers at General Motors  returned to work after a strike, the strongest sign yet the economy is in no danger of stalling.

Headlines: 3M exploring $1 billion sale of drug delivery systems unit: Bloomberg
Description: Industrial conglomerate 3M Co  is exploring a sale of its drug delivery systems unit, which could fetch around $1 billion, Bloomberg reported on Friday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: U.S. agencies looking into Goldman-1MDB settlement below $2 billion: Bloomberg
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  could end up paying less than $2 billion to resolve criminal and regulatory probes over its role in raising money for scandal-ridden Malaysian investment fund 1MDB, Bloomberg reported on Friday, citing three people familiar with the negotiations.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank staffers cleared but bank fined in money laundering case
Description: Frankfurt prosecutors have dropped an investigation into two Deutsche Bank  employees accused of aiding tax evasion through a former Virgin Islands unit, although they have fined the lender for compliance lapses.

Headlines: Uber says it received over 3,000 reports of sexual assault in U.S. in 2018
Description: Ride-hailing firm Uber Technologies Inc said it received over 3,000 reports of sexual assault related to its 1.3 billion rides in the United States last year, in a report aimed at ensuring drivers and the public it was serious about safety.

Headlines: Aston Martin not actively pursuing new investors as opens SUV plant
Description: Aston Martin , which was reported this week to be the target of Canadian billionaire Lawrence Stroll, said it was not actively pursuing new investors on Friday as it opened a new factory to build its first sport utility vehicle.

Headlines: Bayer reaches agreement to postpone more glyphosate lawsuits for settlement talks
Description: Germany's Bayer  has agreed with plaintiffs to postpone its next two U.S. lawsuits over the alleged cancer-causing effects of its glyphosate-based weed killers to allow more time for talks on a settlement.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. Nov payrolls up by most in 10 months
Description: U.S. job growth increased by the most in 10 months in November as former striking workers returned to General Motors'  payrolls and the healthcare industry stepped up hiring, confirming that the economy remained on a moderate expansion path despite a prolonged manufacturing slump.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's SenseTime expects $750 mln 2019 revenue despite U.S. ban - sources
Description: Chinese artificial intelligence (AI) start-up SenseTime, which Washington put on a trade blacklist in October, expects its 2019 revenue to increase by more than 200% year-on-year to around $750 million, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Trade war goes digital: countries eye tariffs on Internet economy
Description: A 20-year global moratorium on imposing tariffs on digital trade could end next week if India or South Africa makes good on threats, according to trade officials and documents, potentially forcing people to pay duties on software and movie downloads.

Headlines: Aston Martin CEO says shareholders in it for the long-term, not soliciting participation
Description: Aston Martin's two major shareholders are in it for the long term and the company is not actively soliciting participation, the firm's boss said on Friday after a media report said Lawrence Stroll, owner of Formula One team Racing Point, is preparing a bid for a major stake.

Headlines: Britain's Phoenix to buy Swiss Re's ReAssure business for $4.1 billion
Description: Phoenix Group Holdings  has agreed to buy the British ReAssure business of Swiss Re  for 3.2 billion pounds ($4.1 billion) in cash and shares, the UK insurer's biggest deal to date as it bulks up on policies closed to new customers.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco shares to start trading December 11: Tadawul exchange
Description: Saudi Aramco  shares will start trading on Dec. 11, the Saudi securities exchange Tadawul said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: Fed voters a less-hawkish bunch in 2020, lowering bar for U.S. rate cut
Description: The bar for cutting U.S. interest rates may get a little lower next year when a new crop of central bankers rotate into voting spots on the Federal Reserve's policy-setting panel as part of its annual membership reshuffle.

Headlines: H&M's brand COS to test clothing rentals in China with YCloset
Description: H&M , the world's second-biggest fashion group, said on Friday its brand COS had teamed up with Chinese subscription rental platform YCloset to try renting out clothes in the country as environmentally conscious consumers rein in purchases.

Headlines: OPEC+ agrees to 500,000 bpd additional cut, to meet in March: sources
Description: OPEC and allied oil producers, the so-called OPEC+, have agreed to deepen their output cuts by 500,000 barrels per day, sources said on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's Dongfeng plans partial sale of PSA stake - sources
Description: China's Dongfeng Motor will likely trim its stake in Peugeot owner PSA  after hiring banks to study options, people close to the matter said, in a move that could ease the French carmaker's planned merger with Fiat Chrysler (FCA) .

Headlines: As United Airlines seals CEO succession plan, eyes turn to American
Description: With United Airlines Holdings Inc  unveiling on Thursday plans for industry veteran Scott Kirby to take the helm as chief executive officer next year, investors are turning to succession plans at another carrier: American Airlines Group Inc .

Headlines: SoftBank's Son sticks with gut-led investing in chat with Alibaba's Ma
Description: Weeks after his billion-dollar bailout of WeWork, SoftBank Group Corp's founder and CEO Masayoshi Son reiterated his belief in an instinct-led investing style, in a discussion with Alibaba Group Holding Inc's co-founder Jack Ma.

Headlines: China-built Tesla cars secure new energy vehicle subsidies
Description: Tesla Inc  said on Friday its Chinese-built Model 3 cars would receive state subsidies, a move that will help the U.S. electric vehicle maker's push into the world's biggest auto market.

Headlines: Indonesia fines Garuda after CEO fired over smuggled Harley Davidson
Description: Indonesia will fine flag carrier PT Garuda Indonesia  for violating aviation rules after its chief executive was accused of smuggling a Harley Davidson motorcycle onboard a new plane, state news agency Antara cited the transport minister as saying.

Headlines: Italy's Atlantia interested in relaunch not rescue of Alitalia: paper
Description: Italy's Atlantia  is still interested in supporting the relaunch, and not the rescue, of ailing carrier Alitalia [CAITLA.UL], the chairman of the infrastructure group said in an interview on Friday.

Headlines: Returning General Motors workers seen boosting U.S. November payrolls
Description: U.S. job growth likely accelerated in November as former striking workers returned to General Motors'  payrolls, which would confirm that the economy remained on a moderate expansion path despite a prolonged manufacturing slump.

Headlines: Labor group accuses Google of illegally firing workers to stifle unionism
Description: The Communications Workers of America union filed a federal labor charge against Alphabet Inc's  Google on Thursday, accusing the company of unlawfully firing four employees to deter workers from engaging in union activities.

Headlines: Chinese defy Hong Kong's protest gloom in hunt for bargain stocks
Description: Chinese investors more than doubled their Hong Kong stocks purchases this year, braving market headwinds from violent street protests and the protracted Sino-U.S. trade war, which have battered the Asian financial hub's economy.

Headlines: No apology to Elon Musk from British diver at 'pedo guy' defamation trial
Description: The British cave explorer suing Elon Musk for calling him a "pedo guy" on Twitter testified on Thursday that his criticism of the Tesla Inc chief executive that led to the tweet was not a personal attack.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco prices shares at top of range in world's biggest IPO
Description: RIYADH/DUBAI Reuters - State-owned oil giant Saudi Aramco's initial public offering (IPO) will be the biggest in history, but will fall short of the towering $2 trillion valuation long sought by Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.

Headlines: GM, LG Chem to build $2.3 billion electric vehicle battery plant in Ohio
Description: General Motors Co  and South Korea's LG Chem  said on Thursday they will invest $2.3 billion to build an electric vehicle battery cell joint venture plant in Ohio, creating one of the world's largest battery facilities.

Headlines: Google co-founders step aside as Pichai takes helm of parent Alphabet
Description: Google co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin are stepping aside as leaders of the Internet behemoth they founded 21 years ago, ending an extraordinary run that saw them build one of the world's most valuable and influential companies.

Headlines: Factbox: Alphabet's 'Other bets' in focus as Google's Pichai takes helm
Description: Google Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai will replace Larry Page as CEO of parent Alphabet Inc, heralding a new chapter for the company that helped reshape the global tech industry under its co-founders Page and Sergey Brin.

Headlines: Boeing says 737 MAX approval delays could hit production
Description: Significant additional regulatory requirements or delays in returning Boeing Co's 737 MAX to commercial service could cause it to cut or temporarily halt production of the aircraft, it said in an Oct. 18 letter released on Thursday.

Headlines: United Auto Workers union names reformer Gamble president until 2022
Description: The United Auto Workers international executive board on Thursday named acting president Rory Gamble to head the union until June 2022 as he pledged a series of reforms following a criminal investigation into illegal payoffs that has rocked the union.

Headlines: Huawei mounts legal challenge against FCC over rural carrier customers
Description: China's Huawei mounted a legal challenge against the U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) on Thursday after the body designated the technology giant as a security threat and moved to bar it from a government subsidy program.

Headlines: Global stocks falter on trade uncertainty; sterling gains
Description: The dollar slid and global equity markets traded little changed on Thursday as enthusiasm over Apple shares was offset by doubts about the likelihood of a "phase one" trade deal before a new round of U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports begins in 10 days.

Headlines: Airbus faces delivery challenge, poised to win jet order race
Description: Airbus  must hand a record number of aircraft to customers in December to meet delivery goals, company data showed on Thursday, and is all but certain of winning an annual order race against Boeing.

Headlines: BlackRock global active equities chief to leave firm over relationship with colleague
Description: Mark Wiseman, global head of active equities at BlackRock Inc , is leaving the firm following a violation of the company's "relationships at work policy," the world's largest asset manager said in an internal memo on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump upbeat on U.S.-China talks as Beijing underscores tariff-cut demands
Description: U.S.-China trade talks are "moving right along," President Donald Trump said on Thursday, striking an upbeat tone even as Chinese officials held fast to their line that existing tariffs must come off as part of an interim deal to de-escalate the 17-month trade war between the two powers.

Headlines: UK bribery investigation adds to Glencore's legal headaches
Description: The UK's Serious Fraud Office (SFO) has launched a bribery  investigation into Glencore , adding to legal troubles that have hit the shares of one of the world's biggest miners and commodity traders.

Headlines: Timeline: Saudi Aramco's winding road to an IPO
Description: State-run oil giant Saudi Aramco has priced its initial public offering (IPO) at the top of its indicative range, making it the world's biggest flotation by raising more than Alibaba's  $25 billion listing in 2014.

Headlines: FACTBOX: Saudi Aramco: the oil colossus
Description: State-run oil giant Saudi Aramco has priced its initial public offering (IPO) at the top of its indicative range, making it the world's biggest flotation by raising more than Alibaba's  $25 billion listing in 2014.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco says IPO priced at top to make it world's biggest IPO
Description: State-owned oil giant Saudi Aramco has priced its initial public offering (IPO) at the top of its indicative range, the company said on Thursday, making it the world's biggest flotation, above  Alibaba's  $25 billion listing in 2014.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco shares priced at top of range in world's biggest IPO
Description: State-owned oil giant Saudi Aramco has priced its initial public offering (IPO) at the top of its indicative range, the company said on Thursday, making it the world's biggest flotation by raising more than Alibaba's  $25 billion listing in 2014.

Headlines: Trump says meetings, talks with China going well
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday the United States is having meetings and discussions with China right now that are going well.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade talks are 'on track': Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday that trade talks with China are on track, with deputy negotiators from both countries holding a call Thursday as they actively worked toward a deal, but he said the United States is not bound to a deadline.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit shrinks sharply; labor market tight
Description: The U.S. trade deficit dropped to its lowest level in nearly 1-1/2 years in October, suggesting trade could contribute to economic growth in the fourth quarter, though a broad decline in imports hinted at a slowdown in domestic demand.

Headlines: Nissan to close U.S. operations for two days next month
Description: Japan's No. 2 automaker Nissan Motor Co  said on Thursday its U.S. unit would halt operations for two days next month, as the company tries to reverse a slide in profitability in the country.

Headlines: Walmart favors 'reasonable controls' over collection and use of personal data
Description: (This December 5 story corrects eighth paragraph to say Walmart does not sell but shares individually identifiable data with third parties)

Headlines: Tiffany profit falls short on weak demand in Americas, Hong Kong
Description: Luxury jeweler Tiffany & Co , which is being bought by Louis Vuitton owner LVMH , missed market expectations for quarterly profit and sales on Thursday, hit by lower spending by foreign tourists in the United States and Hong Kong.

Headlines: United Airlines picks industry veteran Kirby for top job
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  insider Scott Kirby will succeed Oscar Munoz as chief executive officer next year as part of a transition the airline hopes will secure a growth path after some tumultuous years.

Headlines: CBS, Viacom complete merger in a win for Shari Redstone
Description: CBS Corp and Viacom Inc completed their merger on Wednesday, reuniting media mogul Sumner Redstone's U.S. entertainment empire.

Headlines: Billionaire Lawrence Stroll seeks big stake in Aston Martin: report
Description: Canadian billionaire Lawrence Stroll, owner of Formula One team Racing Point, is preparing a bid for a major stake in Aston Martin , Autocar magazine reported, sending the luxury sports car maker's battered shares up 17% on Thursday.

Headlines: Beyond Meat burgers to be sold at some Costco stores
Description: Beyond Meat Inc  said on Thursday that its burgers will be sold at some Costco Wholesale Corp  stores, in the plant-based meat maker's latest move in an increasingly competitive battle for retail shelf-space.

Headlines: BP increases stake in solar energy firm Lightsource BP
Description: BP  is increasing its stake in solar energy developer Lightsource BP to 50% from 43% and is aiming for rapid growth over the next few years, the two companies said on Thursday.

Headlines: Western, Chinese consumers divided on electric, self-driving cars -survey
Description: Automakers, ride-hailing and technology companies plowing money into the development of electric, self-driving and shared car services will find more enthusiastic consumers in China than in Europe and the United States, a survey on Thursday showed.

Headlines: FCA challenges Italy tax agency over value of U.S. business
Description: Fiat Chrysler  has challenged a claim by Italy's tax authorities over the valuing of its U.S. Chrysler business that could leave it with an unwanted tax bill just days ahead of an expected key merger agreement with Peugeot owner PSA .

Headlines: Gazing into the recession crystal ball
Description: The protracted trade war between China and the United States and a deteriorating global growth outlook have left investors nervous that the longest expansion in American history is at risk of ending.

Headlines: Japan launches $122 billion stimulus to fight trade risks, post-Olympic slump
Description: Japan's cabinet approved a $122 billion fiscal package on Thursday to support stalling growth in the world's third-largest economy amid offshore risks and as policymakers look to sustain activity beyond the 2020 Tokyo Olympics.

Headlines: Dollar General lifts profit forecast, tops third-quarter expectations on sales
Description: Discount store operator Dollar General Corp  raised its full-year profit forecast on Thursday after reporting its best quarterly same-store sales rise in nearly five years, benefiting from a wider selection of products and revamped stores.

Headlines: Wall Street's high-stake bets on calm less risky than they seem
Description: At a glance, a near-record accumulation of speculative bets on market tranquility looks like it couldn't have come at a worse time.

Headlines: UK's Javid: chances of ending Brexit transition without EU trade deal are remote
Description: Britain is unlikely to cut off ties to the European Union at the end of 2020 without having a free trade deal in place, finance minister Sajid Javid said on Thursday.

Headlines: Investors urge Big Oil to follow 'poster child' Repsol's climate pledge
Description: Investors cheered Spanish group Repsol's  pledge to slash net carbon emissions to zero by mid-century, saying they hope it will pile pressure on rival oil and gas companies to follow suit in the fight against climate change.

Headlines: Amazon faces U.S. antitrust scrutiny on cloud business: Bloomberg
Description: U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has broadened scrutiny of Amazon.com Inc beyond its retail operations to include cloud-computing business, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: British cave explorer felt 'branded a pedophile' by Elon Musk tweet
Description: The British cave explorer suing Elon Musk testified on Wednesday he felt "branded a pedophile" by the billionaire entrepreneur, despite Musk's assertion that his "pedo guy" tweet at the heart of the defamation case was not meant to be taken literally.

Headlines: Peloton's Christmas ad mocked as sexist
Description: Exercise bike maker Peloton Interactive Inc  said on Wednesday it was encouraged by support from some customers and social media users, despite its Christmas ad coming under criticism for being "sexist" and "dystopian".

Headlines: UAW union leaders recommend approval of Fiat Chrysler labor deal
Description: United Auto Workers leaders from Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV's U.S. plants on Wednesday recommended approval of a tentative labor agreement that would allow the Italian-American automaker to avoid a strike as it works to merge with France's Groupe PSA.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court skeptical of Intel in retirement fund dispute
Description: U.S. Supreme Court justices on Wednesday appeared skeptical of Intel Corp's bid to avoid a lawsuit accusing it of violating federal law in making employee retirement plan investments that cost beneficiaries hundreds of millions of dollars.

Headlines: BMW sues air conditioning suppliers over price fixing
Description: BMW is suing two of its suppliers over price fixing on air conditioning components, the German carmaker said on Wednesday.

Headlines: PG&E nearing $13.5 billion deal with wildfire victims -Bloomberg
Description: Bankrupt California power producer PG&E Corp  is close to finalizing terms for a $13.5 billion payout to victims of wildfires triggered by its power lines, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Stocks rally on renewed trade talk optimism, yields rise
Description: Government debt yields and a gauge of global equity markets rose on Wednesday as sentiment improved after U.S. President Donald Trump said trade talks with China were going "very well" and a news report suggested key differences were being ironed out.

Headlines: Exclusive: As Citgo profit rises, pressure to restore dividend grows - sources
Description: Citgo Petroleum Corp's directors are unlikely to bow to pressure this week to resume dividend payments, two sources close to the discussions said, as the refiner cannot yet help Venezuela's interim government ease creditors' claims against its parent PDVSA that also are threatening its assets.

Headlines: Warren calls for Larry Page testimony, despite change of guard at Alphabet
Description: United States Senator Elizabeth Warren said on Wednesday that she still expects Larry Page to testify in Congress, a day after he stepped down as chief executive of Alphabet Inc , Google's parent company.

Headlines: Under Pichai, Alphabet's moonshot projects may face more scrutiny
Description: Alphabet's  leadership change has some investors hoping that the owner of Google will take a hard look at the cash-burning ventures championed by its founders.

Headlines: Uber may offer courier services for retail business - CEO Khosrowshahi
Description: Uber Technologies Inc  Chief Executive Officer Dara Khosrowshahi said on Wednesday the ride hailing company could extend its food delivery service to offer courier services for other retail businesses.

Headlines: Oil jumps 3% on U.S. stockpiles drop; further OPEC output cuts seen
Description: Oil prices surged more than 3% on Wednesday on expectations that OPEC and allied producers would extend production curbs, and as U.S. government data showed a large drop in domestic crude stockpiles.

Headlines: Factbox: New Alphabet chief started at Google, made name with Android
Description: Google Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai will replace company co-founder Larry Page as CEO of parent Alphabet Inc, the company said in a blog post on Tuesday.

Headlines: Bombardier on track to meet 2019 Global 7500 business jet delivery targets: executive
Description: Canada's Bombardier  will hit its 2019 delivery targets for its Global 7500 business jet, as the company redirects manpower from other planes to its flagship corporate aircraft program, an executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Amazon designs more powerful data center chip
Description: (This December 3 story has been refiled to correct typo in paragraph 2)

Headlines: L'Oreal's Lancome beefs up stores as luxury cosmetics take off
Description: L'Oreal's  Lancome brand is planning to open a flagship store in China after launching its first major showcase in Paris this week, its chief executive said, as the company capitalizes on booming demand for high-end cosmetics.

Headlines: Exclusive: Saudi Aramco pursues war cover after attacks - sources
Description: Saudi Aramco is looking to buy insurance against war and terror attacks after a damaging drone and missile attack on some of its oil facilities in September, two sources told Reuters.

Headlines: OPEC gearing up for deeper oil cuts, Russia yet to agree
Description: OPEC is gearing up to deepen oil supply cuts later this week but still needs to strike an agreement with allies such as Russia on details of a deal to support prices and prevent a glut next year.

Headlines: U.S. services sector, private payrolls growth slow
Description: U.S. services sector activity slowed in November as lingering concerns about trade tensions and worker shortages pushed  production to its lowest level in a decade, which could heighten fears about the economy's health.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor eyes thrust on electric vehicles in $52 billion investment plan
Description: Hyundai Motor plans to invest about 61.1 trillion won ($51.81 billion) between 2020 and 2025, the company said on Wednesday, with a third of the expenditure focused on electric and autonomous vehicles, but analysts want to see it deliver.

Headlines: Ryanair cuts planned capacity and jobs, blames 737 MAX delays
Description: Low-cost airline Ryanair  trimmed its passenger traffic forecast on Wednesday, saying it would cut summer capacity and an unspecified number of jobs as a result of further delays in returning Boeing's  grounded 737 Max aircraft to service.

Headlines: Exclusive: WeWork China sets out bold 2020 sales targets at meeting - sources
Description: WeWork China has set out ambitious revenue goals for 2020 even though it faces staff cutbacks and weak occupancy numbers at its properties across China, sources familiar with the matter said, citing targets announced by the division's general manager at an internal meeting in Shanghai on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Alibaba-backed startup AutoX applies for driver-less test permit in California
Description: Chinese startup AutoX, backed by e-commerce giant Alibaba, has applied to test self-driving vehicles without an in-car backup driver in California, the first challenger to Alphabet Inc's autonomous driving venture Waymo to say it has done so.

Headlines: Airbnb to process EU payments via Luxembourg as Brexit looms
Description: Airbnb will process payments between hosts and guests for the European Union through Luxembourg as of 2020, as the home rental giant prepares for Britain's departure from the bloc, Luxembourg for Finance said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ryanair CEO denies accusation of bullying former operations chief
Description: Ryanair  chief executive Michael O'Leary on Wednesday dismissed accusations that he bullied and forced out his former operations chief Peter Bellew, telling a court he was a highly paid professional who had failed to deliver.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco's bookrunners recommend pricing IPO at top end: sources
Description: Saudi Aramco's bookrunners have recommended pricing its initial public offering at 32 riyals ($8.5) per share, the top of an indicative price range, three sources familiar with the deal said, potentially making it the world's biggest IPO.

Headlines: U.S. service sector slows more than expected in November
Description: U.S. services sector activity slowed more than expected in November amid lingering concerns about trade tensions and worker shortages, which could revive fears about the economy's health.

Headlines: Barry Callebaut cites progress in helping cocoa farmers tackle child labor
Description: Swiss cocoa products maker Barry Callebaut  said on Tuesday that 26% of the farmer groups from which it sourced products in 2018/2019 had programs to prevent child labor,

Headlines: Trump says trade talks with China going 'very well'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that trade talks with China were going "very well," sounding more positive than on Tuesday when he said a trade deal might have to wait until after the 2020 U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: Trump says Huawei is a security risk as NATO seeks secure 5G
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that Chinese telecommunication firm Huawei was a security risk after NATO said it needed secure next-generation 5G technology.

Headlines: Graphic: No Santa Rally? Trade fears threaten Wall Street's end of decade
Description: Wall Street's poor start to December has some investors bracing for a choppy end-of-year as fears about the U.S.-China trade war resurface.

Headlines: Could life insurance go up in smoke for some vapers?
Description: Global reinsurers are stepping up their warnings to life insurer clients about the potential risks of vaping, putting pressure on underwriters to charge certain vapers higher rates than smokers, or even exclude them altogether.

Headlines: Amazon Air provider hit with 'no confidence' vote as holiday shipping ramps up
Description: ABX Air pilots who fly for Amazon.com Inc and other clients cast a near-unanimous vote of "no confidence" against company management as the holiday shipping season, which depends on airplanes for fast delivery, takes off.

Headlines: Tesla Model X gets 5-star rating from European safety agency
Description: Tesla Inc said on Wednesday its Model X SUV has been awarded a five-star rating by the European New Car Assessment Programme (NCAP) in tests that are standards for Europe.

Headlines: Modest Orange dividend overshadows European mobile mast plans
Description: Orange  said it planned to carve out its mobile towers in most European countries to shore up the group's value, but the move was overshadowed by the French telecom firm's modest dividend outlook, sending its shares lower.

Headlines: Orange CEO says EU authorities are open to pan-European telecoms mergers
Description: The European Union's top antitrust policymaker, Margrethe Vestager, is open to the idea of pan-European mergers in the telecoms market, Orange's  boss Stéphane Richard said on Wednesday.

Headlines: South Africa's Grand Parade loses appetite for Burger King
Description: Grand Parade Investments (GPI) Ltd , which holds the Burger King franchise in South Africa, said on Wednesday it was in talks to sell a stake in the business, without giving a reason.

Headlines: Hadi Zablit promoted to general secretary of Renault, Nissan alliance
Description: Renault SA , Nissan Motor Co  and Mitsubishi Motors  on Wednesday said they had promoted Hadi Zablit to general secretary of their automaking alliance to accelerate business efficiencies across the companies.

Headlines: Elon Musk testifies his 'pedo guy' tweet not meant to be taken literally
Description: High-tech entrepreneur Elon Musk testified at his defamation trial on Tuesday that his "pedo guy" Twitter message at the center of the case was not meant to be taken literally and was sent in response to an "unprovoked" insult he received from the man now suing him.

Headlines: China's Postal Savings Bank says some retail investors opt out of Shanghai listing
Description: Postal Savings Bank of China  said investors had opted out of paying for 3% of shares on offer in its Shanghai listing - a rare development that underscores growing concerns over problems in China's banking system.

Headlines: China capex growth hits three-year low as weak economy, trade war drag
Description: Capital investment by Chinese firms has ground to its slowest pace in three years, as a weakening economy, tight credit and prolonged trade war with the United States dent sales growth and cash reserves, a Reuters analysis showed.

Headlines: OPEC, Russia debate deeper oil cuts as new glut looms
Description: OPEC and its allies led by Russia are gearing up to approve deeper oil production cuts this week to prevent a new glut and a collapse on oil prices with OPEC member Iraq saying the move was supported by key members.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco IPO institutional tranche 2.95 times oversubscribed
Description: The institutional tranche of Saudi Aramco's planned initial public offering (IPO) has been almost three times oversubscribed, receiving orders worth 189.04 billion riyals ($50.4 billion), financial advisers for the IPO said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Saudi auto services firm raises $50 million to invest in Aramco IPO
Description: Saudi Automotive Services Co said on Wednesday it is raising 190 million riyals ($50.67 million) in debt to invest in the initial public offering of state-owned oil giant Saudi Aramco.

Headlines: Qualcomm to appeal record South Korean anti-trust fine
Description: Qualcomm  said it would appeal a South Korean court decision on Wednesday to uphold a record $873 million fine against the U.S. chip giant for unfair business practices related to patent licensing and modem chip sales.

Headlines: No Santa Rally? Trade fears threaten Wall Street's end of decade
Description: Wall Street's poor start to December has some investors bracing for a choppy end-of-year as fears about the U.S.-China trade war resurface.

Headlines: Jared Kushner, Trump's son-in-law, takes bigger role in China trade talks
Description: President Donald Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner has added another role to his long list of White House duties - U.S.-China trade negotiator - as Washington and Beijing try to reach an initial agreement to avoid new U.S. tariffs on Dec. 15.

Headlines: Elon Musk's tweets bring controversy, nearly 30 million followers
Description: Trial began in U.S. District Court in Los Angeles on Tuesday in a defamation lawsuit brought against Elon Musk by British cave diver Vernon Unsworth over three July 15, 2018 tweets by the Tesla chief executive, one calling him "pedo guy."

Headlines: Alphabet's new CEO Pichai now sole target on Google regulatory battles
Description: Alphabet Inc's new chief executive, Sundar Pichai, will have the hot seat all to himself as regulators around the world investigate the company, U.S. politicians demand that it be broken up, and President Donald Trump accuses it of aiding his rivals.

Headlines: U.S. solar group says Trump tariffs killing jobs; White House says 'fake news'
Description: The U.S. solar industry warned on Tuesday that the Trump administration's tariffs on imported panels will cost the United States 62,000 jobs and $19 billion (£14.81 billion) in investment, an estimate the White House dismissed as "fake news".

Headlines: Trump says China trade deal may have to wait amid sticking points in talks
Description: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday a trade deal with China might have to wait until after the U.S. presidential election in November 2020, denting hopes that the two largest economies would soon reach an initial deal to ease their damaging trade war.

Headlines: Factbox: Trump has upended relationships with nine of 10 top U.S. trading partners
Description: During his election campaign in 2016, U.S. President Donald Trump promised to shake up global trade and bring down America's growing trade deficits.

Headlines: Johnson & Johnson says new tests show no asbestos in Johnson's Baby Powder
Description: Johnson & Johnson said on Tuesday that recent tests showed that Johnson's Baby Powder was free of asbestos, after U.S. Food and Drug Administration investigations reported trace amounts of the material in the product earlier this year.

Headlines: U.S. judge disqualifies Huawei lawyer from fraud, sanctions case
Description: A U.S. judge on Tuesday disqualified James Cole, a Washington lawyer for China's Huawei, from defending the telecommunications equipment maker against charges of bank fraud and sanctions violations.

Headlines: U.S. has not ruled out imposing tariffs on imported autos: Commerce chief
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Tuesday the Trump administration has not ruled out imposing tariffs on imported autos, after letting a review period end in November with no action.

Headlines: Proper U.S.-China trade deal more important than timing: U.S. Commerce chief
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross on Tuesday rejected any deadlines on a trade deal with China and launched a fresh attack on telecoms giant Huawei, further dimming hopes for an end to a 17-month trade war that has slowed global growth.

Headlines: Huawei urging suppliers to break the law by moving offshore: Ross
Description: China's telecoms giant Huawei has been encouraging its suppliers to violate U.S. law by telling them to move operations offshore in a bid to avoid U.S. sanctions, Commerce Department Secretary Wilbur Ross told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Former Bumble Bee tuna CEO found guilty of price fixing
Description: The former chief executive of Bumble Bee Foods LLC, Chris Lischewski, was found guilty of price-fixing on Tuesday, a court filing showed.

Headlines: Exclusive: White House considered kicking Huawei out of U.S. banking system - sources
Description: The Trump administration considered banning China's Huawei from the U.S. financial system earlier this year as part of a host of policy options to thwart the blacklisted telecoms equipment giant, according to three people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: WTO tussles over hard stop vs phase-out of appeals system
Description: The World Trade Organization (WTO) battled on Tuesday over whether to bring its Appellate Body to an abrupt halt or allow its adjudicators to settle a handful of pending cases, according to trade officials present at a meeting on the subject.

Headlines: United orders 50 new Airbus long-range jets to replace Boeing 757s
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  announced on Tuesday an order for 50 Airbus SE  A321XLR jets to fly between the U.S East Coast and Europe, becoming the latest U.S. airline to ink a deal for the European planemaker's new passenger jet.

Headlines: Elon Musk's jury to be queried on opinions of billionaires, visitors to Thailand
Description: Potential jurors in the defamation trial of high-tech entrepreneur Elon Musk may be excused from the case if they voice strong feelings about billionaires or people who visit Thailand.

Headlines: France fights back over U.S. tariff threat to champagne, cheese
Description: France and the European Union said on Tuesday they were ready to retaliate if U.S. President Donald Trump acted on a threat to impose duties of up to 100% on imports of champagne, handbags and other French products worth $2.4 billion.

Headlines: Brazilian investor group Abradin files complaint against Embraer-Boeing deal
Description: A Brazilian group representing minority investors filed a complaint on Tuesday with Brazil's antitrust watchdog CADE against the Embraer-Boeing deal.

Headlines: Stocks fall, bonds climb amid concern over longer trade war
Description: A comment by President Donald Trump that a deal to end the U.S.-China trade war might not come until after the November 2020 election weighed on global stock markets on Tuesday, sending investors to the safety of bonds.

Headlines: Wall Street falls as trade hopes wane
Description: U.S. stocks sold off for a third consecutive session on Tuesday after comments from President Donald Trump and Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross threw cold water on hopes of a possible near-term respite from the market-bruising U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: Oil steadies after slide on Trump's U.S-China trade comments
Description: Oil steadied on Tuesday, settling narrowly mixed as expectations of output cuts from OPEC and allied producers helped prices bounce after a slide following comments from U.S. President Donald Trump that a trade deal with China may be delayed.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp presents 'complex' turnaround plan for steel - workers
Description: Ailing conglomerate Thyssenkrupp  has worked out a new strategy for the group's steel business, a leading labor representative said on Tuesday, adding the roadmap included significant investments but also restructuring steps.

Headlines: Safran suspends electric jet taxiing project after Airbus ends talks
Description: France's Safran SA  has shelved plans to install an electric taxiing system on Airbus  A320 jets after the planemaker halted discussions on the project, it chief executive said.

Headlines: Workday third-quarter profit, revenue beat; shares rise
Description: Workday Inc beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit and revenue on Tuesday, and raised its full-year forecast for sales in its biggest business, as more companies signed up for its cloud-based financial and human resources management software.

Headlines: Xiaomi, Oppo to use Qualcomm's newest mobile phone chips
Description: Two fast-growing Chinese phone brands said on Tuesday that they will adopt Qualcomm Inc's  newest 5G chip in their flagship devices early next year.

Headlines: Amazon partners with Verizon on 5G in cloud computing expansion
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Tuesday said it was extending its cloud to 5G networks in partnership with Verizon Communications Inc, so developers can run latency-sensitive programs on mobile and connected devices.

Headlines: Safran CEO cautious on supply chain once Boeing grounding lifted
Description: The head of French jet engine maker Safran  has voiced caution over the ability of aerospace supply chains to ramp up quickly after the return to service of the Boeing 737 MAX, which has been grounded for months following two fatal accidents.

Headlines: France's Safran and Germany's MTU to work on new fighter engine
Description: France's Safran  and MTU Aero Engines  of Germany have agreed to develop together a jet engine for a Franco-German fighter, removing a key obstacle to one of Europe's flagship defence projects.

Headlines: McLaren looks to Asia and hybrid cars to stay on track
Description: British exotic sports car maker McLaren Automotive will bank on expanded sales in Asia and a new generation of hybrid cars as it steers toward a potential public offering, the company's chief executive said on Tuesday.

Headlines: French Champagne makers fear impact of potential new U.S. duties
Description: French champagne producers and exporters decried a U.S. government threat to slap tariffs of up to 100% on a range of French products including sparkling wines, saying they have nothing to do with the dispute and calling for government help.

Headlines: Glencore's Glasenberg says successor could be in place next year
Description: Glencore could announce a new chief executive next year once a new management team is in place, its current boss told an investor meeting on Tuesday as the commodities giant laid out its priorities for 2020.

Headlines: Fidelity Investments names new head of $3 trillion asset management division
Description: Fidelity Investments on Tuesday named Bart Grenier, who was at the center of a tickets scandal at the mutual fund company more than a decade ago, to lead its nearly $3 trillion asset management division.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs to launch new products and services on Amazon's cloud
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc will be launching new technology-based products and services for its institutional clients on Amazon's cloud next year, bank Chief Executive David Solomon said at a conference on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. shoppers, mostly online, spend 16% more over holiday weekend
Description: A record number of U.S. consumers spent more online and in stores over the holiday weekend for everything from clothing to toys, the National Retail Federation said on Tuesday.

Headlines: PG&E says its distribution lines caused no deadly fires in 2019
Description: California utility PG&E Corp  has determined there were  no lives or structures lost in 2019 wildfires that may have been caused by its distribution lines, according to a Friday court filing.

Headlines: Federal Reserve terminates 2015 forex enforcement action against Bank of America
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve announced Wednesday it had terminated a 2015 enforcement action against Bank of America  over its shortcomings in preventing traders from manipulating foreign exchange rates.

Headlines: Volkswagen headquarters raided again over diesel scandal
Description: German public prosecutors raided the Wolfsburg headquarters of Volkswagen  on Tuesday in the latest investigation into the carmaker's diesel emissions scandal.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce Secretary: Trump's objectives on U.S.-China trade deal haven't changed
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross on Tuesday told CNBC that President Donald Trump's objectives on a trade deal with China have not changed and that Trump is under no time pressure to complete a deal.

Headlines: Nokia names veteran Sari Baldauf as group boss to take on 5G challenge
Description: Telecoms equipment maker Nokia  announced on Tuesday that it plans to appoint its former networks chief Sari Baldauf as chairman, succeeding Risto Siilasmaa who will step down after eight years in the job.

Headlines: Unilever names Braams as new marketing head in expanded role
Description: Consumer goods giant Unilever Plc  on Tuesday appointed Conny Braams to the new post of chief digital and marketing officer, expanding the scope of a role previously held by advertising industry veteran Keith Weed.

Headlines: Glencore CEO says he may step aside next year
Description: Glencore CEO Ivan Glasenberg said on Tuesday he expected to be able to announce his successor next year, but said the timing was not yet certain.

Headlines: Ross says Trump has flexibility on tariffs toward France, Europe
Description: President Donald Trump has wide latitude in handling trade with France and other European allies, including imposing tariffs, U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross told CNBC in an interview in on Tuesday.

Headlines: France's Macron hopeful of settling digital tax dispute with U.S.
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Tuesday he was hopeful that trade and economic disagreements with the United States, including a dispute over France's new digital services tax, could be settled.

Headlines: We will work it out: Trump calls trade dispute with France "minor"
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he was sure "a minor dispute" with France on trade could be worked out after he threatened to impose duties of up to 100% on imports of champagne, handbags and other French products.

Headlines: EU says will seek immediate talks with U.S. over French digital tax
Description: The European Union will seek immediate talks with the United States on how to solve a dispute over France's new digital service tax, the EU delegation to the United States said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Explainer: Macron's quest for an international tax on digital services
Description: The United States has threatened punitive duties of up to 100% on $2.4 billion in imports from France of champagne, handbags, cheese and other products, after concluding that France's new digital services tax would harm U.S. technology companies.

Headlines: Factbox: France and others plan tax clampdown on digital giants
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration threatened to impose duties of up to 100% on French imports worth $2.4 billion after it concluded a tax on digital services imposed by Paris would be "unusually burdensome" for U.S. technology companies.

Headlines: Alibaba raises further $1.7 billion in over-allotted shares in HK listing
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba said on Tuesday it has raised an additional HK$13.17 billion ($1.68 billion) by exercising the over-allotment option in its Hong Kong secondary listing.

Headlines: World's largest pension fund halts stock lending to short sellers
