Headlines: U.S. charges former Outcome Health executives in $1 billion fraud
Description: U.S. prosecutors announced criminal charges accusing the founders of Outcome Health of overseeing a scheme to overbill clients and fraudulently obtain nearly $1 billion of funds, including from major investors.

Headlines: Oil climbs on U.S.-China trade talks optimism
Description: Oil prices edged higher on Monday as positive comments from the United States and China rekindled hopes in global markets that the world's two largest economies could soon sign an interim deal to end their trade war.

Headlines: Charles Schwab to buy TD Ameritrade in $26-billion blockbuster brokerage deal
Description: Charles Schwab Corp  agreed on Monday to buy TD Ameritrade Holding Corp  in an all-stock deal valued at $26 billion, creating a brokerage giant in a market that has been ravaged by price wars.

Headlines: EU on course to allow in more U.S. beef from 2020
Description: European Union plans to allow more U.S. beef imports cleared a key hurdle on Monday when EU lawmakers specializing in trade backed the move, which is likely to ease transatlantic tensions.

Headlines: Americans, not Chinese, pay Trump tariffs: NY Fed study
Description: When the Trump administration imposed tariffs on Chinese imports last year, officials insisted China would pay the cost - implying Chinese firms would have to cut their prices to absorb import "taxes" of up to 25% when the goods hit U.S. shores.

Headlines: LVMH aims to restore Tiffany's sparkle with $16.2 billion takeover
Description: Louis Vuitton owner LVMH has agreed to buy Tiffany for $16.2 billion in its biggest acquisition yet, as the French luxury goods maker bets it can restore the U.S. jeweller's lustre by investing in stores and new collections.

Headlines: EBay to sell ticketing unit StubHub for $4.05 billion
Description: EBay Inc  will sell ticketing unit StubHub to ticket reseller Viagogo Ltd for $4.05 billion in cash, the companies said on Monday, nearly a year after the ecommerce major came under pressure from activist investors to hive off some of its businesses.

Headlines: Tesla shares rise as Musk says Cybertruck orders hit 200,000
Description: Tesla Inc shares rose 4% on Monday after Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk tweeted over the weekend that the company had already received 200,000 orders for its futuristic Cybertruck pickup.

Headlines: Factbox: Uber's legal challenges around the world
Description: Uber  was stripped of its London operating license on Monday for the second time in just over two years as the city's regulator said the taxi app had put passenger safety at risk.

Headlines: Brazil minister says it's 'impossible' to put value on Eletrobras privatization
Description: Brazil's mines and energy minister said on Monday it is "impossible" to say how much the privatization of state-run power company Eletrobras SA  will raise, despite an earlier government estimate of 16.2 billion reais ($3.84 billion).

Headlines: China and U.S. moving closer to trade deal, but no agreement on tariff rollbacks: report
Description: China and the United States are "moving closer to agreeing" on a "phase one" trade deal, the Global Times, a tabloid run by the ruling Communist Party's official People's Daily, reported on Sunday.

Headlines: McDonald's to pay $26 million to settle California wage lawsuit
Description: McDonald's Corp agreed to pay $26 million to settle a nearly seven-year-old lawsuit accusing the fast food chain of underpaying U.S. staff at its corporate-owned restaurants in California.

Headlines: Eight electric pickup truck manufacturers to load up U.S. market by 2021
Description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk and his spacy Cybertruck have ignited a frenzy over electric pickups, and at least seven other U.S. automakers expect to build new battery-powered trucks by 2021.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco meets ADIA, Abu Dhabi funds in IPO pitch: sources
Description: Saudi Aramco's executives met officials of Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) on Monday to discuss a potential investment in the oil giant's share sale that could raise as much as $25.6 billion, three sources familiar with the talks said.

Headlines: Aramco IPO retail subscription at $5.8 billion, says lead manager
Description: Retail subscription for Saudi Aramco's initial public offering (IPO) reached 21.77 billion Saudi riyals ($5.8 billion) on Monday, lead manager Samba Capital said.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler has started 90% of planned investments in Italy: executive
Description: Fiat Chrysler  has already started 90% of the investments earmarked for Italy, the auto maker's Chief Operating Officer for the EMEA region Pietro Gorlier said on Monday.

Headlines: Factbox: M&As in vogue for luxury retailers seeking growth
Description: Louis Vuitton owner LVMH snapped up U.S. jeweler Tiffany & Co on Monday for $16.2 billion in its largest buyout ever, adding America's biggest luxury name to its stable of brands.

Headlines: GE brings in shipper Maersk's CFO as finance chief
Description: General Electric Co  on Monday named finance head at shipper AP Moller-Maersk  as its new chief financial officer in the latest top-level change aimed at turning around the U.S. industrial conglomerate.

Headlines: General Electric grabs finance chief from shipping group Maersk
Description: A.P. Moller-Maersk's  finance chief Carolina Dybeck Happe will leave the shipping group to take up a similar position at General Electric  early next year, the companies said on Monday.

Headlines: CBS and Viacom to close merger on Dec. 4
Description: The all-stock merger of CBS Corp  and Viacom Inc  is expected to close on Dec. 4, the companies said on Monday.

Headlines: MSCI arms all investors with ESG ratings of 2,800 top firms
Description: MSCI  published the environmental, social and governance (ESG) ratings of more than 2,800 companies on Monday, giving all asset managers more detail to make their investment decisions.

Headlines: Just Eat urges shareholders to shun Prosus and stick with Takeaway deal
Description: Britain's Just Eat  urged shareholders on Monday to shun a $6.3 billion cash offer from Prosus , saying a currently lower valued deal with Takeaway.com  was a better bet as it would create the largest food delivery firm outside China.

Headlines: No 'phase two' U.S.-China deal on the horizon, officials say
Description: An ambitious "phase two" trade deal between the United States and China is looking less likely as the two countries struggle to strike a preliminary "phase one" agreement, according to U.S. and Beijing officials, lawmakers and trade experts.

Headlines: Musk suggests Tesla has 200,000 orders for Cybertruck
Description: Tesla Inc  Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk indicated in a tweet on Sunday that the electric carmaker received  200,000 orders for its electric pickup truck within three days of its launch.

Headlines: Blackstone to invest $400 million in gene therapy venture with Ferring
Description: Blackstone Group Inc  said on Monday it will invest $400 million in a joint venture with Swiss drug company Ferring that is working on an experimental gene therapy for bladder cancer, the private equity giant's largest ever bet on drug development.

Headlines: Chinese importers scoop up Brazilian soybeans amid U.S. trade uncertainty
Description: Chinese buyers scooped up at least 20 cargoes of Brazilian soybeans last week due to uncertainty over a trade deal with the United States that sent them rushing to lock in supplies, traders said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump says administration to take 'good look' at Hong Kong rights bill
Description: (This November 22 story has been refiled to fix typo in first paragraph.)

Headlines: Uber to appeal London license loss decision
Description: Uber will appeal Monday's decision by London's transport regulator to strip the firm of its license in the city, saying it has taken steps to change its business model and sets the standard on safety.

Headlines: LVMH swoop on Tiffany will boost operating profits: Chairman
Description: Acquiring Tiffany will lift LVMH's operating profits by 500 million to 600 million euros ($661.32 million) in the first 12 months, the luxury goods group's Chairman and Chief Executive Bernard Arnault said on Monday.

Headlines: China's electric vehicle market to see sales rebound next year, executives say
Description: China's new energy vehicle (NEV) market is likely to see a sales rebound next year as automakers roll out more new products to lure buyers, but more supportive government policies are needed, auto executives said.

Headlines: SoftBank-backed Paytm raises $1 billion in fresh funding
Description: Indian digital payments company Paytm said on Monday it has raised fresh funds from a group of investors including existing backers SoftBank's  Vision Fund and China's Ant Financial Services in a deal valuing the firm at $16 billion.

Headlines: Novartis takes on Sanofi, Amgen with $9.7 billion takeover of heart drug maker
Description: Swiss drugmaker Novartis  is betting on heart drug prospect inclisiran in a $9.7 billion takeover of The Medicines Co  as it challenges cardiovascular medicines from Amgen Inc , Sanofi  and Regeneron Pharmaceuticals .

Headlines: China says it hopes U.S. will work on basis of equality in trade talks
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Monday it hopes the United States will work with Beijing on a basis of equality and mutual respect on the ongoing bilateral trade negotiations.

Headlines: Amazon opens pop-up store on China's Pinduoduo until year-end
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Monday said it will open a pop-up store on Chinese e-commerce platform Pinduoduo Inc that will run until the end of December and carry a selection of about 1,000 products from overseas.

Headlines: HP reiterates its rejection of Xerox's offer to buy the company
Description: HP Inc  reiterated on Sunday its rejection of Xerox  Corp's  $33.5 billion cash-and-stock offer for the company, adding that the proposal "significantly undervalues HP."

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Conditions may be set for Santa Claus rally
Description: (This November 22 story has been refiled to add dropped word in paragraph 12.)

Headlines: SoftBank to go ahead with WeWork stock tender offer this week
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  will this week launch a previously agreed tender offer for as much as $3 billion of WeWork shares, including up to $970 million owned by the office sharing company's cofounder Adam Neumann, two people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: France's 5G spectrum to be sold at floor price of 2.17 billion euros: minister
Description: Frances's 5G spectrum will be sold at a floor price of 2.17 billion euros ($2.4 billion), a minister said on Sunday, significantly more than the amount previously recommended by the country's telecoms regulator Arcep.

Headlines: Finnair cancels 276 flights as unions join solidarity strike
Description: Finland's national airline Finnair  said on Sunday it was forced to cancel 276 flights scheduled for Sunday and Monday after attempts to settle a labor dispute at the Finnish postal service failed, leading several Finnish labor unions to join a solidarity strike on Monday.

Headlines: France's LVMH close to buying Tiffany after sweetening offer: sources
Description: LVMH  is close to buying U.S. jewelry chain Tiffany & Co  for about $16.3 billion after sweetening its offer, sources said on Sunday, as the owner of Louis Vuitton and Bulgari aims to tap the fast-growing luxury jewelry market.

Headlines: Japanese hotel group Unizo gets six new buyout offers
Description: Japanese hotel operator Unizo Holdings  said on Sunday it had received six more buyout offers at a price competitive with an existing $1.6 billion bid proposed by Blackstone Group .

Headlines: Saudi Aramco markets IPO in Dubai after approaching Kuwait fund
Description: Saudi Aramco met investors in Dubai on Sunday to market its initial public offering (IPO), after trying to secure demand from Kuwait's sovereign wealth fund for the deal, worth up to $25.6 billion, which relies heavily on local and regional buyers.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco won't breach maximum weight for firms in Saudi index: Argaam
Description: Saudi Aramco's weighting in Saudi Arabia's main stock index once the oil giant has listed shares is not expected to breach the maximum limit set by the Gulf kingdom's Tadawul exchange, a senior executive said on Sunday.

Headlines: Saudi central bank says Aramco IPO not causing liquidity issues for banks
Description: Saudi Arabia's central bank is monitoring banking indicators on a daily basis and is not seeing any impact on liquidity from oil giant Aramco's initial public offering (IPO), its governor said on Sunday.

Headlines: Elon Musk: About 150,000 orders thus far for Tesla Cybertruck
Description: Tesla Inc  Chief Executive Elon Musk said on Saturday that there have been about 150,000 orders thus far for the electric carmaker's Cybertruck, which was unveiled late on Thursday.

Headlines: Still hope for U.S.-China deal this year: U.S. official
Description: United States national security adviser Robert O'Brien said on Saturday that an initial trade agreement with China is still possible by the end of the year, but warned Washington would not turn a blind eye to what happens in Hong Kong.

Headlines: Canada's use of Huawei 5G would hamper its access to U.S. intelligence: U.S. official
Description: The U.S. national security adviser urged Canada on Saturday not to use Huawei 5G technology, saying that doing so would put in jeopardy intelligence sharing with the United States and expose Canadians to being profiled by the Chinese government.

Headlines: Novartis nears deal to buy U.S. biotech firm Medicines Co for about $7 billion: WSJ
Description: Swiss drugmaker Novartis AG  is nearing an agreement to acquire U.S. biotechnology firm The Medicines Co  for about $7 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday.

Headlines: Trump vague about whether he will veto bills that back Hong Kong protesters
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump was vague on Friday about whether he would sign or veto legislation to back protesters in Hong Kong as he tries to strike a trade deal with China, and boasted that he alone had prevented Beijing from crushing the demonstrations with a million soldiers.

Headlines: Exclusive: UniCredit clinches deal to cut exposure to Turkish lender Yapi Kredi - sources
Description: UniCredit  has struck a deal to reduce its exposure to Turkey's Yapi Kredi , three sources told Reuters, a move seen as a first step toward the Italian bank's full exit from the recession-hit country.

Headlines: Italy could use ESM talks to push Italian candidate to head fund: Panetta
Description: Italy should use ongoing talks over the reform of the euro zone bailout fund, the ESM, to secure something for itself such as the appointment of an Italian to head the fund, Bank of Italy Deputy governor Fabio Panetta said on Saturday.

Headlines: UK's Labour vows action on 'tax and wage cheat' multinationals
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party held a rally outside an Amazon  depot on Saturday as it highlights its promise to target multinational firms it accuses of dodging taxes and cheating workers should it win next month's general election.

Headlines: China attacks U.S. at G20 as the world's biggest source of instability
Description: The United States is the world's biggest source of instability and its politicians are going around the world baselessly smearing China, the Chinese government's top diplomat said on Saturday in a stinging attack at a G20 meeting in Japan.

Headlines: German 5G bidders must guarantee no foreign state meddling: CDU
Description: Bidders for German 5G rollout contracts must guarantee the network will be free of foreign state influence, Chancellor Angela Merkel's Christian Democrats agreed on Saturday, stopping short of singling out China's Huawei.

Headlines: Amazon files lawsuit contesting Pentagon's $10 billion cloud contract to Microsoft
Description: Amazon.com Inc filed a lawsuit in a federal U.S. court on Friday contesting the U.S. Defense Department's decision last month to award a Pentagon cloud computing contract worth up to $10 billion to rival bidder Microsoft Corp.

Headlines: Aramco IPO: It's a thanks, but no thanks from Malaysia's Petronas
Description: With Saudi Aramco yet to name any major foreign investors in its upcoming share sale, Malaysia's state energy company Petronas [PETR.UL] decided to take a pass on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Chevron CEO plans major cost-cutting overhaul of production teams - sources
Description: Chevron Corp  Chief Executive Michael Wirth is preparing sweeping changes at the No. 2 U.S. oil and gas company that would cut costs and streamline operations in a drive to boost profitability, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Take Five: A spanner in the global economic works
Description: Can we have it both ways? For two decades, trade expansion has fueled rapid global economic growth. But with trade volumes contracting at a rate of more than 1% year-on-year and the Sino-U.S trade war nearing its two-year anniversary, world growth will plumb decade-lows next year, the Organisation for Economic Co-Operation and Development predicts.

Headlines: Wall Street rises with U.S.-China trade mood, upbeat economic data
Description: Wall Street advanced on Friday as both Washington and Beijing made positive comments on the potential for a trade deal between the world's two biggest economies and upbeat domestic economic data helped to ease investor worries.

Headlines: Canadian official's critique of 737 MAX software reflects 'working-level' view: regulator
Description: An email sent by a Transport Canada official urging Boeing  to remove an anti-stall system involved in two 737 MAX crashes reflects "working-level discussions" and were not reviewed by the Canadian regulator, the agency said on Friday.

Headlines: Mexico urges U.S. Congress not to let politics impede trade deal approval
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Friday urged U.S. lawmakers not to allow politics to hold up the approval of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) trade deal.

Headlines: Mexico's economy minister tries to dispel concerns over labor reform
Description: Mexico's Economy Minister Graciela Marquez said Friday that U.S. representatives should not be concerned that Mexico can implement its labor reform as the United States still has to approve a trade deal.

Headlines: WeWork names new executives, path to profitability by 2023: report
Description: WeWork named four men to executive roles on Friday and outlined a six-point path to profitability, though the money-losing flexible office space operator said it will not be cash flow positive until 2023, according to a media report.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs unveils internal campaign on use of gender identity pronouns
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  said on Friday it has launched an internal campaign to promote awareness about pronouns and how employees self-identify.

Headlines: Shattered glass: Futuristic design questioned after Tesla Cybertruck launch
Description: Tesla Inc's  launch of its futuristic Cybertruck pickup suffered a setback when its "armored glass" windows shattered, but it was the overall look of the electric vehicle that worried Wall Street on Friday, driving the automaker's shares down 6%.

Headlines: U.S. banks cram for Fed risk test, with ripple effects in repo
Description: New quarterly data from the biggest U.S. banks suggest that some will need to back away from short-term lending markets by year-end to avoid triggering requirements that they hold more capital.

Headlines: Dollar, global shares gain on Xi, Trump remarks
Description: The dollar gained and global equity markets rose on Friday on upbeat U.S. economic data while amicable messages from Chinese President Xi Jinping and U.S. President Donald Trump helped defuse tensions over the prolonged U.S.-Sino trade war.

Headlines: EU countries back tough line on 5G suppliers in potential blow to Huawei
Description: EU countries on Friday endorsed a tough line for selecting 5G suppliers, including vetting the domestic legal framework to which they are subjected, potentially dealing a blow to telecoms equipment market leader Huawei Technologies.

Headlines: Boeing's top communications official to retire as 737 MAX crisis drags on
Description: Boeing Co's  head of corporate communications, Anne Toulouse, elected to step down from her role and would retire next year, the world's largest planemaker said on Friday.

Headlines: More foreign firms halted U.S. deals amid Trump administration scrutiny: report
Description: More overseas companies investigated by U.S. authorities for national security concerns have abandoned investments in the United States since President Donald Trump took office, a report showed on Friday, signaling headwinds for key sources of funding for U.S. companies.

Headlines: Jet industry's grand masters fight to a draw in Dubai
Description: After insisting for 15 years that the superjumbo is the future, Emirates airline has been forced by the demise of the A380 to embrace smaller wide-body jets, resulting in a flurry of maneuvers between planemakers at this week's Dubai Airshow.

Headlines: Argentina creditors jockey for lead ahead of $100 billion debt talks
Description: By Karin Strohecker, Marc Jones, Rodrigo Campos and Cassandra Garrison

Headlines: Ray Dalio denies report hedge fund Bridgewater has bearish bet on market
Description: Bridgewater Associates' Ray Dalio said on Friday his hedge fund does not have a net bet that the stock market will fall, taking issue with a story published earlier in the Wall Street Journal.

Headlines: U.S. agency votes 5-0 to bar China's Huawei, ZTE from government subsidy program
Description: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) voted 5-0 Friday to designate China's Huawei and ZTE as national security risks, barring their U.S. rural carrier customers from tapping an $8.5 billion government fund to purchase equipment.

Headlines: British Airways, pilots' union agree preliminary pay deal to end dispute
Description: British Airways and its pilots' union BALPA have reached a preliminary agreement to end the pay dispute that resulted in the first walkout by pilots in the airline's history, the union said on Friday.

Headlines: Talks stall over thousands of job cuts at VW's Audi: sources
Description: Volkswagen's  premium unit Audi  wants to cut thousands of jobs to fund a costly transition to electric vehicles, but talks with powerful labor representatives have hit a logjam, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Airbnb business outside U.S., China had $46 million profit in 2018
Description: Airbnb's business excluding the United States and China turned a net profit of $46.47 million in 2018 compared with a loss of $97.22 million the previous year, according to an earnings statement the company filed in Dublin, Ireland, and made public on Friday.

Headlines: Judge leaves door open for Mediaset, Vivendi to reach agreement
Description: A Milan judge gave Italian broadcaster Mediaset  and its shareholder Vivendi another week to settle a dispute over plans for a Dutch-based holding to drive Mediaset's European growth, potentially opening the way to ending a three-year legal battle.

Headlines: Judge gives Mediaset, Vivendi until Nov. 29 to find accord: sources
Description: An Italian judge has pushed back to Nov. 29 a deadline to settle a dispute between Italian private broadcaster Mediaset  and its number 2 shareholder French media group Vivendi , two legal sources said on Friday.

Headlines: Bayer's Monsanto pleads guilty to illegal Hawaii pesticide spraying
Description: Monsanto pleaded guilty to spraying a banned pesticide on the Hawaiian island of Maui, and agreed to pay $10.2 million in criminal fines and other payments for the spraying and for illegally storing hazardous waste, U.S. prosecutors said.

Headlines: Federal pension fund says bill banning China investment is discriminatory
Description: The group overseeing a large U.S. federal pension fund said recent legislation aimed at preventing it from investing in China-based companies will deprive its participants of a significant opportunity for retirement returns if passed.

Headlines: Ban on flavored vapes could lead to loss of 150,000 jobs, $8.4 billion sales hit: report
Description: A potential U.S. ban on e-cigarette flavors could result in a loss of more than 150,000 jobs and a direct sales hit of $8.4 billion, according to a report released on Friday by a vaping industry trade group.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank sues Madoff feeder funds for reneging on $1.6 billion claims sale
Description: Deutsche Bank  has sued two offshore funds that funneled money to Bernard Madoff for 14 years, accusing them of reneging on their agreement to sell more than $1.6 billion of claims in the bankruptcy of the swindler's firm.

Headlines: Peugeot still aims to sign merger deal with Fiat this year: source
Description: French carmaker PSA  plans to sign a $50 billion merger deal with Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA)  this year, a source with direct knowledge of PSA's thinking said on Friday, brushing off concerns over a shock lawsuit filed this week.

Headlines: U.S. takes aim at judges pay in new attack on WTO system
Description: Judges at the World Trade Organization can earn more than 300,000 Swiss francs tax-free for what is a part-time job, the United States said on Friday, in a fresh onslaught on its beleaguered arbitration system.

Headlines: Trump, Xi send positive signals on initial deal to defuse U.S.-China trade war
Description: The leaders of the United States and China on Friday both underscored their desire to sign an initial trade deal and defuse a 16-month tariff war that has lowered global growth, providing a welcome boost to financial markets.

Headlines: Exclusive: Unilever, Henkel and buyout funds eye bids for Coty's $7 billion beauty brands – sources
Description: Consumer goods giants Unilever  and Henkel  and buyout funds including Advent and Cinven are exploring bids for some of Coty's  top beauty brands in a deal worth up to $7 billion, three sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Uber still in the dark on London taxi license renewal, three days before expiry
Description: Uber is waiting to find out whether its taxi license in London, one of its most important markets, will be renewed, just three days before it is due to expire in the latest stage of a long-running battle with the city's transport regulator.

Headlines: Trump says yet to decide whether to close trade deal with China
Description: President Donald Trump said on Friday a potential U.S.-China trade deal was coming along well, but he had yet to decide whether he wanted to finalize it.

Headlines: Airbnb's Belinda Johnson to step down as COO, join board
Description: Airbnb said on Friday Belinda Johnson will step down as chief operating officer in March and join the home rental company's board.

Headlines: Bitcoin plummets to a six-month low on China crackdown
Description: Bitcoin slumped to a six-month low on Friday after China's central bank launched a fresh crackdown on cryptocurrencies, warning of the risks entailed in issuing or trading them.

Headlines: Tesla's electric pickup breaks the mould with angular design and armored glass
Description: Tesla Inc  on Thursday unveiled its electric pickup, a truck with a futuristic angular body in gunmetal gray that resembled an armored vehicle and takes aim at the heart of Detroit automakers' profits.

Headlines: South African Airways inks deal to end eight-day strike
Description: South African Airways (SAA) signed a wage deal with trade unions on Friday to end an eight-day strike that brought the cash-strapped state airline to the brink of collapse.

Headlines: M&S poaches Tesco executive for top clothing job
Description: British retailer Marks & Spencer  has appointed the chief executive of rival Tesco's  F&F Clothing division to be the boss of its struggling clothing and home business, it said on Friday.

Headlines: Emirates' Clark says Rolls-Royce needs to sort itself out after engine delays
Description: The board of Rolls-Royce  must urgently address its engine performance problems, the head of Dubai's Emirates said, as the world's largest buyer of wide-body jets weighs up who will power its order of Boeing  787 jets.

Headlines: AstraZeneca shares rise on early U.S. approval for leukemia drug
Description: AstraZeneca  shares rose 2.7% on Friday after the British drugmaker won earlier-than-expected U.S. regulatory approval for a leukemia drug, in a challenge to rival AbbVie .

Headlines: U.S. factory and services activity quicken in November: Markit
Description: U.S. manufacturing output accelerated in November to its fastest pace in seven months and services activity also picked up more than expected, a survey of purchasing managers showed on Friday in a sign of the continued resilience of the U.S. economy in the face of the U.S.-China trade war and other headwinds.

Headlines: Aerospace suppliers prepare for prolonged grounding of 737 MAX
Description: Makers of aircraft parts are making contingency plans for a prolonged grounding of Boeing's 737 MAX, with several expecting the jet's return to service to take longer than the planemaker hopes.

Headlines: Explainer: From pig power to cleaner stoves, the world of carbon offsets
Description: (This Nov. 20 story corrects description of REDD+ projects to show they can also include forest replanting, in paragraph 9, and corrects paragraph 10 to show REDD+ projects gain approval from the UNFCCC)

Headlines: Prosus CEO remains confident in bid for Just Eat
Description: Technology company Prosus  remains confident about its bid for British meal delivery business Just Eat , Chief Executive Bob van Dijk said on Friday, despite an increase in the value of rival Takeaway.com's all-share bid.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sanofi's strategy boss to leave as CEO readies revamp
Description: Sanofi's  most senior strategy boss is set to leave by the end of the month, according to a memo seen by Reuters, in the first major management change under new chief executive Paul Hudson as he shakes up the firm's priorities.

Headlines: Factbox: Tesla, Detroit, Amazon-backed Rivian race to electrify pickup trucks
Description: Tesla Inc  debuted its electric pickup truck Cybertruck on Thursday, joining a list of automakers and start-ups that have been working on electrifying pickup trucks - the heart of the Detroit automakers' profits.

Headlines: Battling slowing sales, insurer AIA hires new CEO from rival Ping An
Description: Asia-focussed insurer AIA Group Ltd  on Friday named a senior executive at Chinese rival Ping An Insurance Group Co  as its chief executive officer to replace company veteran Ng Keng Hooi.

Headlines: KKR reaches halfway in $3 billion Asia infrastructure fundraising: source
Description: Global private equity group KKR & Co  has raised $1.5 billion for its first Asia-focused infrastructure fund, roughly half the total targeted, one person with direct knowledge said.    KKR began to target Asia's infrastructure sector with a series of hires beginning about a year ago and launched its fundraising in 2019.

Headlines: WeWork to lay off 2,400 employees in SoftBank revamp
Description: WeWork said on Thursday it is laying off around 2,400 employees, almost 20% of its workforce, as the office-sharing company seeks to drastically cut costs after it transformed from a Wall Street darling into a pariah in a matter of weeks.

Headlines: China's Xi: Should strengthen communication with U.S. to avoid misjudgment - Xinhua
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping said on Friday that Beijing and Washington should strengthen communication on strategic issues in order to avoid misjudgment and misunderstanding, China's official Xinhua News Agency reported.

Headlines: Ford's China JV with Changan to return to sales growth in 2020-president
Description: Auto sales at Ford Motor Co's  China venture with Chongqing-based carmaker Changan  are likely to turn positive next year, Changan’s president said on Friday.

Headlines: Board of Australia's Westpac 'unreservedly apologizes' over money-laundering
Description: The board of Australia's second largest bank on Friday apologized unreservedly for 23 million breaches of money laundering laws, but stood by management despite pressure from politicians to review its leadership.

Headlines: Facebook agrees to provide additional documents in California AG data privacy probe
Description: Facebook Inc has agreed to turn over additional documents after the California state attorney general's office went to court this month to compel the social media firm to comply with requests for information in its privacy investigation.

Headlines: Charles Schwab in advanced talks to buy TD Ameritrade: source
Description: Charles Schwab Corp  is in advanced talks to acquire TD Ameritrade Holding Corp , a person familiar with the matter said on Thursday, in a deal that could exceed $26 billion and combine the two largest U.S. discount brokerages.

Headlines: U.S. senators urge Trump administration to halt Huawei license approvals
Description: A bipartisan group of 15 U.S. senators urged the Commerce Department to suspend issuing licenses to U.S. firms that conduct business with China's Huawei Technologies Co, saying it could threaten U.S. security.

Headlines: SocGen's heads of Asia trade finance depart after bunker fuel losses
Description: Societe Generale's regional heads of trade and commodities finance for Asia Pacific have left the Paris-based bank, raising  concerns among Singapore-based shipping fuel traders that it may wind back financing services to the sector.

Headlines: Microsoft granted license to export 'mass-market' software to Huawei
Description: Microsoft Corp  said on Thursday it had been granted a license from the U.S. government to export software to Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.

Headlines: Australian fund cuts Westpac bond exposure on money laundering allegations
Description: An Australian bond fund has started to divest Westpac  bonds following allegations by the country's financial crime regulator of money laundering compliance breaches, some of which related to financing child exploitation.

Headlines: Panasonic has no plans for new Tesla battery plant in China: CEO
Description: Panasonic Corp  has no plans to build a new battery plant for Tesla Inc  in China, the Japanese company's chief executive said, as it struggles to make profits from its existing battery business with the electric vehicle maker.

Headlines: Xerox threatens hostile bid unless HP opens its books
Description: Xerox Corp  on Thursday threatened to take its $33.5 billion buyout bid for HP Inc  hostile, if the personal computer maker did not agree to a "friendly" discussion and open its books before Nov. 25.

Headlines: Gap's quarterly profit beats; says working on plan to split Old Navy
Description: Gap Inc  edged past lowered expectations for quarterly profit on Thursday and reiterated its plan to separate Old Navy from the namesake brand, days after the retailer cut its annual forecast and replaced longtime chief executive officer.

Headlines: Nordstrom bucks trend of grim retail forecasts; share jump 8%
Description: Nordstrom Inc  raised its 2019 forecast, unlike many competitors, and reported third-quarter profit above Wall Street expectations on Thursday as it sold more off-price clothing and kept inventories in check, sending the retailer's shares up about 8% in extended trading.

Headlines: Gap's Old Navy brand to exit China in early 2020
Description: Gap Inc  said on Thursday it would not sell its Old Navy apparels in China from early 2020 and instead would focus on its North America market to boost sales.

Headlines: Judge rejects U.S. move to disqualify states' lawyer in T-Mobile/Sprint lawsuit
Description: A federal judge on Thursday rejected a U.S. government effort to disqualify a lawyer arguing for 15 states and the District of Columbia in their effort to block T-Mobile US Inc's  planned $26.5 billion takeover of Sprint Corp .

Headlines: Wall Street dips as investors await U.S.-China trade progress
Description: U.S. stock indexes moved slightly lower on Thursday as investors moved to the sidelines with mixed messages and no concrete signs of progress on U.S.-China relations.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler brushes off GM lawsuit, sees Peugeot deal by year end
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV on Thursday brushed off a shock lawsuit from General Motors Co and said it was confident of reaching a binding merger deal with Peugeot owner PSA Group by the end of this year to create the world's fourth-largest carmaker.

Headlines: JPMorgan lowers account minimum, expands free trades for You Invest
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  said Thursday it is giving free online trades to more customers and lowering the amount of money needed to open one of its robo-adviser accounts, as firms across the industry bow to pressure to reduce fees and account minimums.

Headlines: Vivendi ready to sell part of Mediaset stake at a loss to end legal row: sources
Description: French media group Vivendi  is prepared to sell part of its stake in Mediaset  at a loss in an attempt to reach a deal to end years of bitter legal disputes with the Italian broadcaster, two sources close to the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Schwab-TD Ameritrade deal shows Trump rule-easing boon for financial M&A
Description: A possible purchase by brokerage giant Charles Schwab Corp.  of rival TD Ameritrade  reflects a more relaxed mood under Trump administration regulators, which has helped unleash other big-ticket takeovers in the financial sector, analysts said.

Headlines: Stocks slip, dollar rebounds on trade hopes stir sentiment
Description: The dollar rebounded and global equity markets edged lower on Thursday as efforts by China to smooth the path forward in U.S.-Sino trade talks helped sooth investor sentiment, though fears remained that a phase one deal might not occur until next year.

Headlines: Chinese antitrust regulator approves Boeing-Embraer deal
Description: A Chinese antitrust regulator has approved Boeing Co's  deal to buy a controlling stake in the commercial jet division of Brazilian planemaker Embraer , according to a statement on the regulator's website.

Headlines: GM's electric pickup to hit dealer showrooms in fall 2021: CEO
Description: General Motors Co's  first electric pickup truck model will go on sale in the fall of 2021, the company's top executive said, around the same time that electric carmaker Tesla Inc's  own model is expected to debut.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco order book reaches 73 billion riyals so far: Samba
Description: Saudi Aramco's initial public offering (IPO) has attracted approximately 73 billion riyals ($19.47 billion) in institutional and retail orders so far, Saudi Arabia's Samba Financial Group said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. fines former Deutsche Bank subprime chief over alleged mortgage fraud
Description: (This Nov 14 story amends charges in first and fifth paragraphs to civil claims.)

Headlines: Macy's cuts profit outlook as tourist numbers drop
Description: Macy's Inc  cut its annual profit forecast for the second time this year on Thursday, as the department store operator blamed weak international tourism, warm weather and sluggish mall traffic for the first drop in same-store sales in two years.

Headlines: Boeing settles more than half of Lion Air crash lawsuits: lawyer
Description: Boeing Co  has settled more than half of some 118 claims related to the fatal crash of a Lion Air flight on a 737 MAX aircraft in October 2018, attorney Dan Webb said at a court hearing on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. grants final approval for expanded Delta, Air France, Virgin, KLM JV
Description: U.S. Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao on Thursday granted final approval for an expanded trans-Atlantic joint venture for Delta Air Lines Inc , Air France KLM SA  and Virgin Atlantic.

Headlines: Apple, Intel file antitrust case vs SoftBank-owned firm over patent practices
Description: Apple Inc  and Intel Corp  on Wednesday filed an antitrust lawsuit against Fortress Investment Group, alleging the SoftBank Group Corp  unit stockpiled patents to hold up tech firms with lawsuits demanding as much as $5.1 billion.

Headlines: Cleveland Fed's Mester urges regulators to be more agile on cybersecurity risks
Description: Cleveland Federal Reserve President Loretta Mester said on Thursday that financial firms and regulators should be more agile and share information to better combat cybersecurity threats.

Headlines: Exclusive: Exxon aims to sell $25 billion of assets to focus on mega-projects - sources
Description: Exxon Mobil  plans to sell up to $25 billion of oil and gas fields in Europe, Asia and Africa in its biggest asset sales for decades, seeking to free up cash to focus on a handful of mega-projects, according to three banking sources.

Headlines: G20 has put up 'historically high levels' of trade barriers: WTO
Description: G20 economies slapped on 28 new barriers between mid-May and mid-October covering trade worth an estimated $460.4 billion, mainly via tariff increases and import bans, the World Trade Organization said on Thursday.

Headlines: United Auto Workers union to name new president as U.S. corruption probe widens
Description: The United Auto Workers union international executive board will  meet to name a new president, the union said on Thursday, a day after the previous president resigned following 17 months in office, but union officials said a date for the meeting had not been set.

Headlines: Explainer: How would a Schwab-TD Ameritrade deal affect retail investors?
Description: U.S. discount broker Charles Schwab Corp.  is in talks to buy rival TD Ameritrade  in a $26 billion deal that would create an online brokerage behemoth, according to media reports.

Headlines: Pot stocks soar as U.S. House committee clears bill on federal weed legalization
Description: Shares of marijuana companies rose on Thursday after a U.S. congressional committee passed a legislation to decriminalize cannabis, taking it a step closer to being approved by the Democratic-controlled House of Representatives.

Headlines: Europe voices guarded optimism it has dodged U.S. car tariffs
Description: EU trade chief Cecilia Malmstrom and ministers expressed cautious optimism on Thursday that the threat of U.S. tariffs on imported European cars had passed.

Headlines: U.S. labor market, manufacturing data point to slowing economy
Description: The number of Americans filing applications for unemployment benefits was unexpectedly unchanged at a five-month high last week, suggesting some softening in the labor market.

Headlines: Uber denies report it in talks with Germany's Wirecard
Description: Ride hailing company Uber denied a German magazine report on Thursday that it was considering hiring Wirecard as its main payments partner to replace Dutch platform Adyen.

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover chief wants alliances, not a merger
Description: Luxury automaker Jaguar Land Rover's chief executive told Reuters he is open to more alliances to lower the costs of developing technology, but is not looking for a full-blown corporate merger.

Headlines: OECD sees global growth at decade-low, blames governments' indecision
Description: The global economy is growing at the slowest pace since the financial crisis as governments leave it to central banks to revive investment, the OECD said on Thursday in an update of its forecasts.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler chairman sees Peugeot deal finalized by year-end
Description: Fiat Chrysler Chairman John Elkann said on Thursday he was confident the group would finalize its tie-up with Peugeot owner PSA this year and dismissed concerns about a lawsuit launched by rival General Motors.

Headlines: Fiat-Peugeot deal would boost Exor's coffers to 3.6 billion euros in 2022
Description: Fiat Chrysler's top shareholder Exor will have a total of 3.6 billion euros ($4 billion) in 2022 to invest once a deal to merge the carmaker with rival Peugeot goes through, Exor's boss John Elkann said.

Headlines: Trump wants Apple to be involved in 5G infrastructure building in U.S.
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he had asked Apple Inc Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook to look into helping develop telecommunications infrastructure for 5G wireless networks in the United States.

Headlines: China says it will strive to reach 'phase one' trade deal with U.S.
Description: China will strive to reach an initial trade agreement with the United States as both sides keep communication channels open, the Chinese commerce ministry said on Thursday, in an attempt to allay fears talks might be unraveling.

Headlines: McDonald's employees in Chicago sue over workplace violence
Description: McDonald's Corp  employees on Thursday sued the fast food giant and several of its franchisees in Chicago over a store redesign that staffers say has made it easier for angry customers to leap over the counter and attack them.

Headlines: Little cheer for Beaujolais Nouveau as U.S. tariffs guzzle profits
Description: Beaujolais Nouveau wine lovers made merry as this year's first bottles were uncorked, but producers faced the sobering truth of a dip in margins due to new tariffs imposed by the United States, their second biggest export market.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco IPO's institutional tranche oversubscribed: source
Description: The institutional tranche of Saudi Aramco's initial public offering (IPO) has been oversubscribed while the retail portion has received a little more than 10 billion riyals ($2.67 billion) in orders so far, a banking source told Reuters.

Headlines: Factbox: Exxon steps up assets sales with sweeping $25 billion plan
Description: Exxon Mobil  is accelerating its biggest asset sales in decades with plans to divest up to $25 billion of oil and gas fields in Europe, Asia and Africa as it sharpens its focus on a handful of mega projects at home and abroad.

Headlines: Exclusive: German exports to United States jump despite trade tensions
Description: Strong German exports to the United States helped Europe's largest economy to avoid a recession in the third quarter, data showed on Thursday, as companies benefited from a weaker euro and trade diversion linked to the U.S.-China tariff dispute.

Headlines: Daimler brings SUV to luxury Maybach brand's portfolio
Description: Daimler  plans to sell luxury Maybach brand's first sport-utility vehicle, its China chief executive, Hubertus Troska, said on Thursday, joining other luxury brands that offer SUV models to attract customers from China and the United States.

Headlines: Sanofi weighing options for consumer healthcare unit: sources
Description: Sanofi  is considering a joint venture or outright sale among options for its consumer healthcare unit, sources told Reuters, as the French drugmaker prepares to present a new strategic plan next month.

Headlines: Tesla picks a fight with Detroit by going after the pickup market
Description: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk has talked for years about building an electric pickup truck that would threaten the heart of the Detroit automakers' profits, and on Thursday he will finally take the wraps off the so-called cyberpunk truck.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump administration to miss 2019 target for Alaska refuge oil lease sale - official
Description: The Trump administration will miss its target of holding the first-ever oil drilling lease sale in Alaska’s Arctic National Wildlife Refuge this year due to delays in the environmental review process, Interior Secretary David Bernhardt told Reuters.

Headlines: OPEC+ likely to extend oil supply cuts until June: sources
Description: OPEC and its allies are likely to extend existing oil output cuts when they meet next month until mid-2020, with non-OPEC oil producer Russia supporting Saudi Arabia's push for stable oil prices amid the listing of state oil giant Saudi Aramco.

Headlines: Germany fines BMW, Daimler, Volkswagen for forming steel cartel
Description: Germany's cartel authority said on Thursday it was fining the country's three major carmakers - BMW , Volkswagen  and Daimler  - a total of 100 million euros for forming a cartel to buy steel.

Headlines: VW sees mild growth for China auto market over next three to four years
Description: Volkswagen AG , the top foreign automaker in China, said on Thursday it expects the world's biggest passenger car market to stabilize next year with low growth levels likely for three to four years.

Headlines: China invites U.S. trade negotiators for new round of talks: WSJ
Description: China has invited top U.S. trade negotiators for a new round of face-to-face talks in Beijing amid continued efforts to strike at least a limited deal, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday citing unnamed sources.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler to recall nearly 700,000 SUVs for electrical fault risk
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV  said on Thursday it will recall nearly 700,000 sport utility vehicles worldwide because a faulty electrical connection could prevent engine starts or contribute to a stall.

Headlines: De Beers Namibian diamond venture seeks tax breaks to extend operations
Description: Namdeb, a joint venture between the Namibian government and Anglo American's  diamond unit De Beers Group, said on Thursday it was in talks with the government about tax breaks to extend its land-based operations beyond 2023.

Headlines: BMW orders more than 10 billion euros' worth of battery cells
Description: German carmaker BMW  on Thursday said it had ordered more than 10 billion euros' ($11.07 billion) worth of battery cells from Chinese battery cell maker Contemporary Amperex Technology Co (CATL)  and Samsung SDI .

Headlines: Alibaba, Aramco share sale bonanza fails to produce fee windfall for banks
Description: A late-year rush of giant global share sales led by Alibaba's $13 billion Hong Kong listing and Aramco's $26 billion initial public offering is failing to deliver an equivalent payday for equities bankers.

Headlines: SoftBank sounds out Japan's top banks on $2.8 billion loan, sources say
Description: SoftBank Group Corp  is sounding out Japan's top three banks to borrow around 300 billion yen ($2.8 billion) to help fund its support of U.S. startup WeWork, three people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Pressure grows on Westpac CEO after massive Australian money laundering scandal
Description: Pressure mounted on the chief executive of Westpac Banking Corp  on Thursday over the handling of Australia's biggest money laundering scandal, with the prime minister saying the bank's board should reflect deeply on Brian Hartzer's position.

Headlines: Johnson & Johnson loses pelvic mesh class action in Australia
Description: More than 1,350 Australian women won a seven-year-old class action lawsuit on Thursday against Johnson & Johnson (J&J) for misleading patients and surgeons about the risks of the pharmaceutical giant's pelvic mesh implants.

Headlines: A U.S.-China 'phase one' trade deal may not be inked this year
Description: Completion of a "phase one" U.S.-China trade deal could slide into next year, trade experts and people close to the White House said, as Beijing presses for more extensive tariff rollbacks, and the Trump administration counters with heightened demands of its own.

Headlines: Trump says he doesn't think China is 'stepping up' in trade talks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he has not made a trade deal with China yet because Beijing is not "stepping up" in negotiations.

Headlines: GM sues Fiat Chrysler, alleging union bribes cost it billions
Description: General Motors Co on Wednesday filed a racketeering lawsuit against Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV, alleging that its rival bribed United Auto Workers (UAW) union officials over many years to corrupt the bargaining process and gain advantages, costing GM billions of dollars.

Headlines: Google bars elections ads from using political leanings, voter data
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google will stop giving advertisers the ability to target election ads using data such as public voter records and general political affiliations, the company said in a blog post on Wednesday.

Headlines: Factbox: How social media services handle political ads
Description: Online platforms including Facebook and Alphabet Inc's  Google face growing pressure to stop carrying political ads that contain false or misleading claims ahead of the U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: Some Huawei suppliers get U.S. approval to restart sales to blacklisted firm
Description: The Trump administration on Wednesday gave Huawei its second reprieve this week, allowing some suppliers to restart sales to the Chinese telecoms giant after it was placed on a trade black list over national security concerns six months ago.

Headlines: Charity to pay $4 million to resolve U.S. pharma kickback probe
Description: A Florida-based charity will pay $4 million to resolve claims that it acted as a conduit for companies including Biogen Inc and Novartis AG to pay kickbacks to Medicare patients using their high-priced multiple sclerosis drugs, the U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Scooter maker Superpedestrian raises $20 million, promises fewer breakdowns
Description: Electric scooter company Superpedestrian on Wednesday said it had raised $20 million for its diagnostic software that can spot impending hardware failure, a major problem for scooter operators.

Headlines: Union threatens strikes unless Lufthansa makes concessions in wage dispute
Description: A trade union representing Lufthansa's cabin-crew on Wednesday threatened strikes that could fall during the busy Christmas period if Germany's biggest airline does not make concessions in a wage dispute.

Headlines: Mexicans sue Walmart over Texas shooting that left victims on both sides of border
Description: Ten Mexican citizens have sued Walmart over the shooting at a store in the U.S. border town of El Paso, Texas, that killed eight Mexicans and left eight more injured, saying that Walmart did not do enough to protect its customers, Mexico said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: LVMH gets access to Tiffany's books after it raises offer - sources
Description: French luxury group LVMH  has persuaded U.S. jewelry chain Tiffany & Co  to provide it with confidential due diligence after it raised its bid to close to $16 billion, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump considering whether Apple should be exempt from China tariffs
Description: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday after touring a plant that assembles Apple Inc  computers that he was considering whether to exempt the U.S. company from tariffs on imports from China.

Headlines: Google to let sites block personalized ads under California privacy law
Description: Websites and apps using Google's advertising tools will be able to block personalized ads to internet users in California and elsewhere as part of the Alphabet Inc unit's effort to help them comply with the state's new privacy law, it told clients this week.

Headlines: Apple supplier Japan Display says executive embezzled $5.25 million
Description: Japan Display Inc said on Thursday it dismissed an accounting executive last year for embezzling about $5.3 million over four years since the Apple Inc supplier went public in 2014.

Headlines: Huawei asks Canadian court to stay extradition process for CFO to United States
Description: Lawyers for Huawei Technologies Co Ltd asked a Canadian court to immediately stay proceedings seeking to extradite the company's Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou to the United States, a company spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: UAW president resigns after union accuses him of false accounting
Description: United Auto Workers President Gary Jones resigned on Wednesday shortly after the union moved to remove him office amid a widening corruption probe from U.S. prosecutors, a union source told Reuters.

Headlines: Chinese airlines turn to Asia as long-haul losses pile up
Description: BENGALURU/BEIJING - Chinese airlines are adding seats on short- and mid-range Asian flights in a strategic shift away from prestigious but loss-making North American routes to a market that promises better returns and growth.

Headlines: Fed holds off on permanent lending tool as policymakers mull details
Description: The Federal Reserve will hold off deciding whether to introduce a permanent lending facility aimed at staving off the money market ructions seen earlier this fall even as a growing number of policymakers warm to the idea, several sources told Reuters.

Headlines: United Auto Workers president resigns amid corruption probe: source
Description: United Auto Workers (UAW) President Gary Jones resigned ON Wednesday after being linked to an ongoing corruption probe by U.S. federal officials, a union source confirmed to Reuters.

Headlines: Intel says chip supply for personal computers remains tight
Description: Intel Corp  said on Wednesday it was increasing its reliance on contract chip manufacturers to ramp up supply of chips used in personal computers as the company struggles with shipment delays amid higher demand.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers question Google about collection of health records
Description: U.S. Presidential candidate Elizabeth Warren along with fellow Senators Richard Blumenthal and Bill Cassidy wrote a letter to Alphabet's Google on Wednesday to raise questions about its access to the health records of tens of millions of Americans.

Headlines: Wall Street falls on concerns about U.S.-China trade deal progress
Description: Wall Street's main indexes ended Wednesday's session lower on concerns that a "phase one" trade deal between Washington and Beijing may not be completed this year, while minutes from the Federal Reserve's October policy meeting appeared to offer little help.

Headlines: OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma to pay states' lawyers, urged to help victims
Description: (Corrects name of lawyer to Scott Markowitz from Scott Bickford in 5th paragraph)

Headlines: Fed shows little appetite for bold policy change sought by Trump
Description: As U.S. Federal Reserve officials hone their monetary policy playbook in preparation for the next economic downturn, it appears they will eschew more controversial approaches tried by other global central banks, including one that President Donald Trump has called on the Fed to try.

Headlines: White House handling of U.S.-Japan trade deal angers Democrats
Description: House Democrats on Wednesday blasted the Trump administration for not consulting sufficiently with Congress while negotiating a mini trade deal with Japan, failing to provide details about it and refusing to testify at a congressional hearing.

Headlines: PayPal to buy rewards platform Honey Science for $4 billion
Description: Payment processor PayPal Holdings Inc  said on Wednesday it would buy privately held shopping and rewards platform Honey Science Corp for about $4 billion.

Headlines: Halkbank seeks to challenge U.S. jurisdiction before entering plea to charges
Description: Turkey's state-owned Halkbank , which U.S. prosecutors have criminally charged with helping Iran evade sanctions, said it should be able to challenge whether U.S. courts can hear the case at all before it entered a formal plea, according to a court filing made public on Wednesday.

Headlines: Shares slide on U.S.-China spat over Hong Kong, dollar gains
Description: Global stock markets stumbled and the dollar gained on Wednesday after China blasted a U.S. Senate bill aimed at protecting human rights in Hong Kong, the latest obstacle to easing tensions in a prolonged Sino-U.S. trade war that has dented growth worldwide.

Headlines: Ukraine widens probe against Burisma founder to embezzlement of state funds
Description: Ukraine has widened its investigation into the founder of energy company Burisma to include suspicion of embezzling state funds, Prosecutor General Ruslan Ryaboshapka said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Target sets upbeat holiday sales tone with raised forecast, shares surge
Description: Target Corp  signaled a strong start to the holiday season and raised its full-year earnings forecast on Wednesday, betting on its aggressive push into faster delivery and investments in store revamps, sending its shares up 14%.

Headlines: Fed minutes show rates on hold, little hurry to change course
Description: A divided Federal Reserve that decided to hit pause in its easing cycle following a rate cut in October signaled in minutes of last month's meeting it was in no hurry to reassess the path of interest rates.

Headlines: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries has skills to build Airbus wings: CEO
Description: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd  is confident that it has the technical and production know-how to build high-tech wings for Airbus SE  jetliners, the chief executive of the Japanese conglomerate said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Oil jumps over 2% after U.S. inventory data, Russia OPEC comments
Description: Oil prices surged more than 2% on Wednesday after a better-than-expected U.S. crude inventories report and as Russia said it would continue its cooperation with OPEC to keep the global oil market balanced.

Headlines: White House Deputy Press Secretary: progress being made on China phase-one deal text - Fox
Description: White House Deputy Press Secretary Judd Deere has said that talks with China are continuing and that there is progress on the text of a phase-one trade deal, Fox News reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries rethinking Spacejet delivery schedule: CEO
Description: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd  is rethinking the timetable for Japan's first new commercial aircraft in 50 years and cannot commit to its target of making initial deliveries by mid-2020, the company's chief executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. regulator proposes splitting auto safety spectrum to boost Wi-Fi
Description: A little-used block of spectrum set aside for auto safety should be split to accommodate the rapidly growing number of wireless devices, the chairman of the U.S. telecoms regulator said on Wednesday, a plan that sets up a clash between two major industries.

Headlines: Trade commission finds Chinese aluminum wire, cable export harms U.S. industry
Description: The U.S. International Trade Commission (ITC) on Wednesday said it had determined that U.S. industry was materially injured by below-cost imports of aluminum wire and cable from China, locking in U.S. antidumping and countervailing duties.

Headlines: Daimler's electric Mercedes-Benz SUV to make U.S. debut at $67,900
Description: Daimler will begin selling its electric Mercedes-Benz EQC in the United States early next year at a starting price of $67,900, the German carmaker said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. healthcare shares pick up steam as some political worries abate
Description: U.S. healthcare stocks, led by health insurers, have gained strength in recent weeks, buoyed by solid third-quarter earnings and investor comfort that political risks to the sector have eased. Wednesday's Democratic presidential debate could test their momentum.

Headlines: Treasury yields drop on reports trade deal may not come this year
Description: Treasury yields dropped on Wednesday on news a "phase one" U.S.-China trade deal may not be completed this year, according to Reuters sources.

Headlines: Big banks would get climate stress tests under proposed U.S. law
Description: U.S. Democratic Senator Brian Schatz of Hawaii on Wednesday introduced a bill that would direct the Federal Reserve to subject large banks to so-called "stress tests" measuring their resilience to climate-related financial risks.

Headlines: #MeToo drove rise in CEO firings in 2018: report
Description: The number of corporate leaders fired for #MeToo-related misconduct rose in 2018 while the number of S&P 500 companies led by females fell 20%, according to a report from U.S. think-tank the Conference Board.

Headlines: Tesla needs safeguards to prevent drivers from sleeping on 'Autopilot': U.S. senator
Description: Democratic U.S. Senator Ed Markey asked Tesla Inc  on Wednesday to disable its "Autopilot" driver-assistance system until it installs new safeguards to prevent drivers from evading system limits that could let them fall asleep.

Headlines: Apple starts construction of new $1 billion campus in Texas
Description: Apple Inc said on Wednesday it had started construction of a new campus in Austin, Texas, beside its existing facility where it makes the new MacBook Pro laptops.

Headlines: Continental to cut 5,040 jobs as combustion engine demand falls
Description: German auto supplier Continental  on Wednesday said it would pare back its engine manufacturing activities as more stringent emissions rules threaten demand for combustion engine components, resulting in around 5,040 job losses by 2028.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. is still talking to China on trade
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday the United States is continuing to talk to China but gave no other details, as both sides tried to hammer out a phase one trade deal ahead of looming U.S. tariffs due next month.

Headlines: Exclusive: ECB flags failings in dirty-money screening at Malta's top bank
Description: Malta's biggest bank failed for years to detect or address risks involving thousands of payments, the European Central Bank (ECB) said, detailing "severe shortcomings" that could have allowed money laundering or other criminal activities.

Headlines: Lowe's calms nerves with profit forecast raise after Home Depot sales warning
Description: Lowe's Cos Inc  raised its annual profit forecast on Wednesday, helping ease concerns over the health of the U.S. consumer after larger rival Home Depot Inc  cut its full-year sales estimates ahead of the all-important holiday season.

Headlines: Emirates jet swap opens door to Boeing 787 deal in Dubai
Description: Emirates agreed to buy its first Boeing  787 Dreamliners in a last-minute, $9 billion deal at the Dubai Airshow on Wednesday while reducing its order for the U.S. planemaker's delayed 777X model.

Headlines: Factbox: Global refiners raise cleaner shipping fuel output ahead of IMO 2020
Description: Global oil refiners have upgraded processing units and adjusted operations to raise output of low-sulphur residual fuels and marine gasoil (MGO) to prepare for stricter shipping fuel standards that kick in on Jan. 1, 2020.

Headlines: Peugeot's small car platforms should be favored in Fiat merger: executive
Description: Small car platforms developed by France's Peugeot should be favored if plans to merge PSA  and Fiat Chrysler  go ahead, PSA executive Gaetano Thorel told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Strike pushes South African Airways to brink of collapse
Description: South African Airways (SAA) has nearly no cash left and may miss salary payments this month, a board member said on Wednesday, as a crippling six-day strike has pushed the state-owned airline to the brink of financial collapse.

Headlines: Prosus, Takeaway trade barbs in battle for Britain's Just Eat
Description: The two companies vying to purchase British food delivery service Just Eat traded barbs on Wednesday, as technology company Prosus and Takeaway.com each sought to win over a critical mass of shareholders.

Headlines: Norwegian Air appoints industry outsider as new CEO to lead restructuring
Description: Loss-making Norwegian Air  has appointed Jacob Schram as chief executive to take charge of the budget carrier's restructuring as it struggles with a low-cost, long-haul model in an overcrowded industry.

Headlines: Emirates president says to restart airline expansion by early 2020s
Description: Emirates airline will restart its expansion by the early 2020s, company President Tim Clark said on Wednesday at the Dubai Airshow.

Headlines: U.S. aviation regulator pledges rigorous certification for Boeing 777X
Description: The U.S. aviation regulator will ensure certification of Boeing's  777X wide-body jet is conducted rigorously, the agency's head said on Wednesday while reaffirming that its review of the grounded 737 MAX will not be rushed.

Headlines: China's Great Wall aims to sell 300,000 WEY vehicles a year by 2025: chairman
Description: China's top sport-utility vehicle maker Great Wall Motor   aims to sell 300,000 of its premium brand WEY vehicles a year by 2025, its chairman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: BMW in talks with workers about efficiency measures
Description: BMW  is in talks with labor representatives and its top suppliers as it seeks to achieve cost savings of more than 12 billion euros ($13.26 bln) by 2022, Chief Financial Officer Nicolas Peter told analysts on Wednesday.

Headlines: If Lufthansa doesn't make concessions, we'll announce strikes: union
Description: Trade union UFO said on Wednesday that it would announce strikes that could fall during the Christmas period if Lufthansa  does not make concessions in a wage dispute.

Headlines: Lufthansa: We'll use the next seven days to try to solve wage dispute
Description: Lufthansa  said on Wednesday it would use the next seven days to try to reach a solution in a wage dispute with employees after trade union UFO said it would announce strikes if the airline does not make concessions.

Headlines: Alibaba raises up to $12.9 billion in landmark Hong Kong listing
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group  raised up to $12.9 billion in a landmark listing in Hong Kong, the largest share sale in the city in nine years and a world record for a cross-border secondary share sale.

Headlines: Aston Martin gets in touch with its feminine side for first SUV
Description: James Bond's carmaker of choice Aston Martin  took a first step into the lucrative SUV market on Wednesday with an eye on winning female customers, hoping it can dig itself out of a financial black hole.

Headlines: Junk loan market tensions signal end of buyout-led binge
Description: Many investors are shunning the riskiest corners of the junk-rated U.S. corporate loan market because of concerns about possible credit rating downgrades, putting the brakes on a run of leveraged buyouts and debt-funded dividends.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco to meet investors in Dubai and Abu Dhabi: sources
Description: Saudi Aramco plans meetings with investors in Dubai next week, sources said, in which it is seeking to raise up to $25.6 billion in the world's biggest share sale.

Headlines: Factbox: 'To Tim': Trump's tweets to Apple CEO Cook on factories, iPhones
Description: Apple Inc  Chief Executive Tim Cook will give U.S. President Donald Trump a personal tour of its Texas computer factory on Wednesday, the latest sign of a close relationship between two of America's most powerful men.

Headlines: Swedbank to investigate report of possible U.S. sanctions breach
Description: Swedbank's  chief executive Jens Henriksson vowed on Wednesday to "get to the bottom" of an alleged funds transfer from a Russian arms company, which Swedish public service broadcaster SVT said may have violated U.S sanctions.

Headlines: Shell UK gender pay gap widens slightly in 2019
Description: Royal Dutch Shell's gender pay gap in Britain edged higher in 2019 following the acquisition of a utility company, with women earning on average 18.7% less than men.

Headlines: Prosus urges Just Eat shareholders to accept its offer, reject Takeaway bid
Description: Dutch technology company Prosus NV  on Wednesday urged shareholders of Britain's Just Eat PLC  to accept its unsolicited 4.9 billion pound ($6.3 billion) cash bid for the company by Dec. 10, and spurn an alternative offer as too risky.

Headlines: Australia's Westpac slapped with 23 million money laundering breaches
Description: Regulators accused Australia's Westpac Banking Corp  of 23 million breaches of anti-money laundering laws, saying the banking giant ignored red flags and for years enabled payments from convicted child sex offenders and "high risk" countries.

Headlines: Strike certificate issued at South Africa's Comair: union
Description: A strike certificate has been issued at South African airline Comair  as part of a secondary strike against South African Airways, a spokeswoman for the National Union of Metalworkers South Africa said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Factbox: The Australian financial crime regulator's accusations against Westpac
Description: Australia's Westpac Banking Corp  has been accused of 23 million breaches of anti-money laundering law, with regulators saying the company enabled payments from convicted child sex offenders and "high risk" countries over half a decade.

Headlines: Beijing tariff demands may expand U.S.-China 'phase one' trade deal significantly
Description: A "phase one" trade deal between the United States and China was supposed to be a limited agreement that would allow leaders from both countries to claim an easy victory while soothing financial markets.

Headlines: After meeting AFL-CIO, Pelosi says USMCA must be enforceable for workers to win passage
Description: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Tuesday conditioned her support for a new U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade deal on better enforcement of its labor provisions, defying pressure by the Trump administration to get the deal done quickly.

Headlines: U.S. Fed approves merger between BB&T, SunTrust Banks
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve said on Tuesday it approved a merger between BB&T Corp and SunTrust Banks Inc, sealing the biggest tie-up of banks since the 2007-2009 global financial crisis.

Headlines: Uber, distracted backup driver cited by NTSB in fatal self-driving crash
Description: A U.S. safety agency on Tuesday faulted Uber for inadequate attention to safety and decisions in the company's autonomous vehicle development in an investigation into the first-ever death involving a self-driving vehicle, which also cited the vehicle's distracted back-up driver.

Headlines: Amazon uses aggregated seller data to help business, it tells lawmakers
Description: Amazon.com Inc uses "aggregated data" from sellers in its third-party marketplace to improve its overall business, the online retailer said in response to a congressional antitrust probe that could raise concerns with such sellers.

Headlines: GM not liable for punitive damages in ignition switch cases: U.S. appeals court
Description: A federal appeals court said General Motors Co is not liable for punitive damages over accidents that occurred after its 2009 bankruptcy and involved vehicles it produced earlier, including vehicles with faulty ignition switches.

Headlines: Microsoft Teams surpasses 20 million daily active users; rival Slack shares slip
Description: Microsoft Corp  said on Tuesday its workplace messaging app, Teams, has more than 20 million daily active users, up from 13 million in July.

Headlines: NZ cenbank 'looks closely' at Australian regulator allegations against Westpac
Description: New Zealand's central bank said on Wednesday that it would look closely at findings by Australia's financial crime watchdog calling Westpac Banking Corp's  anti-money laundering oversight "deficient".

Headlines: U.S. housing outlook improves but not breaking new ground: Reuters poll
Description: The rise in U.S. home prices will continue to outpace consumer inflation until at least 2022, albeit at a slower pace than forecast three months ago, despite a majority of analysts polled by Reuters predicting an improvement in activity in the coming year.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley pushes advisers to boost revenue in 2020 pay plan: sources
Description: Morgan Stanley  told financial advisers on Tuesday that they could be paid less if they do not generate more revenue or get customers to sign up for comprehensive financial plans next year, people familiar with the bank's 2020 compensation plan said.

Headlines: U.S. House Speaker Pelosi says enforcement is key to USMCA trade deal
Description: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Tuesday an agreement with the Trump administration on the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade deal can be reached if it is enforceable.

Headlines: Vodafone extends tech partnership with Ryanair
Description: Vodafone  has secured a seven-year technology partnership with Ryanair  to handle services including online booking, passenger boarding and in-flight transactions for the Irish airline in Europe.

Headlines: ConocoPhillips targets $50 billion free cash flow over next decade
Description: ConocoPhillips  unveiled a long-term plan on Tuesday to boost oil and gas production by about 3% per year, restrain annual spending to about $7 billion and return $50 billion to shareholders over the next decade.

Headlines: Retail sector weighs on Wall Street; Dow and S&P end lower
Description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average  and the S&P 500  fell from record levels on Tuesday as dour forecasts from retailers Home Depot and Kohl's fueled worries about consumer spending and the U.S.-China trade dispute dragged on.

Headlines: Kohl's, Home Depot forecasts quell pre-holiday cheer
Description: Retail heavyweights Kohl's Corp and Home Depot Inc sent a shiver through Wall Street on Tuesday, lodging weak results and annual forecasts that cast more doubt on the health of the U.S. consumer ahead of the crucial holiday shopping season.

Headlines: Trump can no longer impose 'Section 232' auto tariffs after missing deadline: experts
Description: The clock has run out on President Donald Trump's "Section 232" tariffs on imports of foreign-made cars and auto parts, after he failed to announce a decision by a self-imposed deadline, trade law experts say.

Headlines: Oversupply angst drags oil lower, stocks drift near highs
Description: Oil prices fell sharply on Tuesday on oversupply concerns, while a gauge of stocks across the globe rose for a seventh straight session after large overnight gains in Asia.

Headlines: Oil slumps on oversupply fears, trade talk concerns
Description: Oil fell more than $1 a barrel on Tuesday on concerns about excess global crude supply and limited progress toward resolving the U.S.-China trade dispute that has clouded the outlook for oil demand.

Headlines: Ghana joins airline competition fray with Dubai jet order
Description: Ghana became the latest African nation to support the development of an international airline to boost its economy and develop tourism as its government signed a provisional order for three Boeing long-haul 787 Dreamliner jets on Tuesday.

Headlines: Sales of grounded Boeing 737 MAX gather pace at Dubai Airshow
Description: Boeing Co  won fresh support for its grounded 737 MAX at the Dubai Airshow on Tuesday as airlines laid out plans to buy up to 50 of the jets worth $6 billion at list prices, a day after securing the first firm order since a safety ban in March.

Headlines: U.S. safety board wants Boeing to redesign 737 NG part after fatal Southwest accident
