Description: The U.S. National Transportation Safety Board on Tuesday called on Boeing Co  to redesign the fan cowl structure on 737 NG planes after a passenger was killed on a Southwest Airlines  plane in April 2018 after an engine failure.

Headlines: Without a China trade deal, the U.S. will hike tariffs: Trump
Description: The United States would raise tariffs on Chinese imports if no  deal is reached with Beijing to end a trade war, U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday, threatening an escalation of the spat that has damaged economic growth worldwide.

Headlines: Trade commission finds Chinese mattress imports hurt U.S. industry
Description: The U.S. International Trade Commission on Tuesday concluded that U.S. industry is materially injured by Chinese-made mattresses that are sold at less than fair value, paving the way for the U.S. Commerce Department to impose anti-dumping duties.

Headlines: Former Goldman Sachs CEO pushes back on Warren's criticism, wealth tax
Description: Former Goldman Sachs Group Inc  Chief Executive Lloyd Blankfein pushed back on Tuesday against Elizabeth Warren's criticism of him and other prominent billionaires, saying the singling out of individuals makes him fear for the "political process in the United States."

Headlines: Renault could pull out of markets, products in strategy review: interim CEO
Description: Renault has not ruled out withdrawing from some products or markets as part of a review of its mid-term goals, the carmaker's interim chief executive Clotilde Delbos said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Google enters gaming with cloud-based streaming service Stadia
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Tuesday launched Stadia, a cloud-based service that allows users to stream games including "Assassin's Creed Odyssey" and "NBA 2K20" on Chrome web browser.

Headlines: Saudi airline flynas signs order for 10 Airbus A321XLR jets
Description: Flynas has signed an order for 10 long-range Airbus A321XLR jets, the Saudi budget airline said at the Dubai Airshow on Tuesday.

Headlines: Sweden's Saab says UAE plans to buy two new surveillance aircraft
Description: The United Arab Emirates intends to buy two additional GlobalEye aircraft for surveillance from Saab , the Swedish defense firm said on Tuesday, lifting its shares by 3%.

Headlines: U.S. safety board wants Boeing to redesign part after fatal 737 NG accident
Description: The U.S. National Transportation Safety Board on Tuesday called on Boeing Co  to redesign the fan cowl structure on all 737 NG planes and retrofit existing planes after an April 2018 incident in which a woman was killed on Southwest Airlines  plane after an engine failure caused by a fan blade.

Headlines: European defense projects need single export license: Leonardo CEO
Description: European defense programs should be issued with a single weapons export license so policy changes of an individual state do not affect the supply chain, the CEO of Italian defense company Leonardo  said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Strike-hit South African Airways says only a deal with unions will end crisis
Description: South African Airways (SAA) resumed some regional flights on Tuesday but warned that only a deal with striking unions can resolve its current crisis, as the government said it has no more money for the cash-strapped state carrier.

Headlines: Home Depot cuts sales goal as online push not delivering as expected
Description: Home Depot Inc  said on Tuesday the marriage of its online and brick-and-mortar businesses was not yet generating as much revenue as it had expected, prompting the retailer to cut its 2019 sales forecast for the second time this year.

Headlines: Lower mortgage rates boost U.S. housing starts, building permits
Description: U.S. homebuilding rebounded in October and permits for future home construction jumped to a more than 12-year high, pointing to strength in the housing market amid lower mortgage rates.

Headlines: VW rejects anti-competitive allegation by parts maker Prevent
Description: Volkswagen  on Tuesday rejected claims it had engaged in anti-competitive behavior after parts supplier Prevent Group sued the German carmaker in the U.S. District Court in Detroit.

Headlines: Aramco IPO banks face pared payday of $90 million or less: sources
Description: By Saeed Azhar, Hadeel Al Sayegh, Rania El Gamal and Clara Denina

Headlines: Fed's Williams: Risks to U.S. economy still to the downside
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve has interest rates at the appropriate level for the U.S. economy but risks to the economic outlook are still tilted downwards, New York Federal Reserve President John Williams said on Tuesday.

Headlines: NY Fed's Williams: Financial regulations may have created inefficiencies
Description: Financial regulations put in place following the 2008 financial crisis may have contributed to recent ructions in short-term lending markets, New York Federal Reserve President John Williams said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Emirates wants new Boeing jet put through 'hell on Earth' in testing
Description: Emirates, the largest customer of Boeing's  upcoming 777x aircraft, wants the plane to be put through "hell on Earth" in testing to ensure it is safe to fly and meets performance expectations, the president of the Gulf airline said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China's Megvii seeks approval for Hong Kong IPO despite U.S. blacklist: sources
Description: Chinese artificial intelligence firm Megvii Technology Ltd  plans to seek listing approval on Thursday for a Hong Kong IPO of at least $500 million, people with knowledge of the matter said, despite being blacklisted by the U.S. government.

Headlines: Global economy dodges recession by narrowest of margins: Kemp
Description: The global economy may have narrowly avoided a recession, with most industrial and financial indicators pointing to a slight improvement in September-October after a sharp slowdown in the middle of the year.

Headlines: Return of short-selling bans: market protection or 'war against truth'?
Description: New moves to curb short-selling in some countries have set the stage for a renewed battle between free market advocates and authorities aiming to check investors they see as profiteers who destabilize major companies.

Headlines: PSA trade unions give the nod to merger with Fiat
Description: The majority of unions representing workers at Peugeot maker PSA  are in favour of a planned $50 billion merger with Fiat Chrysler , PSA executives and union representatives said.

Headlines: A year after arrest, Ghosn seeks trial date, access to evidence
Description: A year after his arrest, Nissan ex-Chairman Carlos Ghosn remains stuck in Tokyo under stringent bail conditions and without a trial date as he seeks access to a trove of Nissan emails and other evidence to fight charges of financial misconduct.

Headlines: Qantas challenges Airbus, Boeing to offer better deal on ultra-long haul jets
Description: Qantas  has asked Airbus  and Boeing  for a better deal on planes capable of non-stop Sydney-London flights before deciding whether to place an order.

Headlines: One week in, Netflix's stock is weathering Disney+
Description: Wall Street's reaction so far to Walt Disney Co's  long-awaited streaming service suggests investors believe the competition may not be as crushing as expected for entertainment rival Netflix Inc .

Headlines: Huawei plays down impact of new U.S. license extension
Description: Huawei Technologies has dismissed a new 90-day extension by the Trump administration allowing U.S. firms to continue doing business with the Chinese company as making little difference, repeating that it was being unfairly treated.

Headlines: What trade war? Chinese companies wow with third-quarter report card
Description: The top 200 Chinese companies spanning consumer, technology, industrial, property and financial industries reported September quarter earnings well ahead of market expectations, setting them up for a strong showing next year, analysts said.

Headlines: Popeyes signs first lease for China market as it seeks to take on KFC
Description: U.S. fried chicken chain Popeyes wants to become the top chicken brand in China, the chief executive of its parent company said on Tuesday, as it prepares to take on KFC, the no.1 player in the world's most populous market.

Headlines: Airbus and flynas agree on exercising purchasing options for A321XLR jets: industry sources
Description: Airbus  and Saudi budget airline flynas have reached a final agreement on exercising purchasing options to order long range A321XLR jets, industry sources told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Air Senegal signs MoU for eight Airbus A220 aircraft
Description: Air Senegal signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) for eight Airbus' A220 aircraft at the Dubai Airshow on Tuesday.

Headlines: Air Astana says signs letter of intent for 30 Boeing 737 MAX
Description: Kazakhstan flag carrier Air Astana said on Tuesday it had signed a letter of intent to order 30 Boeing 737 MAX for its recently launched low-cost carrier subsidiary Fly Arystana.

Headlines: Airbnb lobbies local Japan governments to ease curbs for Olympics
Description: Airbnb Inc said on Tuesday it is lobbying local governments in Japan to ease curbs on short-term home rentals during next year's Tokyo Olympics, seeking to counter a thicket of rules imposed last year.

Headlines: Toyota says labor officials found it responsible for worker suicide
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  on Tuesday said Japanese labor officials have found it responsible for the suicide of an employee, with the Mainichi Shimbun reporting that workplace bullying at the automaker had led to the employee's death.

Headlines: Japan lower house passes U.S. trade deal; auto tariffs still in question
Description: Japan's lower house of parliament approved on Tuesday a limited trade deal Prime Minister Shinzo Abe agreed with the United States, clearing the way for tariff cuts next year on items including U.S. farm goods and Japanese machine tools.

Headlines: Australia CBA insurance arm pleads guilty to cold-calling offences
Description: The life insurance arm of Commonwealth Bank of Australia  pleaded guilty to 87 counts of breaching a law banning sales staff from making unsolicited calls to sell financial products, the country's corporate regulator said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump, Powell met Monday at White House to discuss economy
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell met at the White House on Monday in their second meeting since Powell started the job in February 2017, and soon became the target of criticism from the president who appointed him.

Headlines: Trump says he told Fed's Powell U.S. interest rates are too high
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he complained to Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell about high U.S. interest rates in a meeting they held at the White House on Monday morning.

Headlines: Exclusive: KKR taps CK Infrastructure, buyout groups for Goodpack sale - sources
Description: KKR & Co.  has tapped Hong Kong's CK Infrastructure Holdings Ltd  and buyout groups including Blackstone  and Sweden's EQT AB  to gauge buying interest for Singapore-based Goodpack, an intermediate bulk container maker, multiple sources with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Exclusive: New York State Attorney General investigating WeWork - sources
Description: The New York State Attorney General (NYAG) is investigating WeWork, according to two people familiar with the matter, adding to a mounting series of problems that have turned the workspace provider from a Wall Street darling to a pariah in a matter of weeks.

Headlines: U.S. Congress seeks answers on patient privacy in Google, Ascension cloud deal
Description: Four Democratic leaders on the U.S. House of Representatives Energy and Commerce committee on Monday wrote Alphabet Inc's Google and Ascension Health demanding briefings by Dec. 6 on how patient data the hospital chain is storing on the cloud is used.

Headlines: U.S. watchdog backs Bezos' protest over key Pentagon launch program
Description: A U.S. watchdog on Monday backed a protest from Jeff Bezos' space company that challenged the Pentagon's military space launch procurement strategy, showing support for one of the Amazon billionaire's disputes with major agency procurement programs.

Headlines: Carl Icahn urges U.S. SEC to 'rethink' proposed rule change for proxy advisers
Description: Billionaire activist investor Carl Icahn on Monday urged the U.S. Securities Exchange Commission (SEC) to rethink a proposed rule change for proxy adviser firms, saying it would make activist investing "even more difficult and expensive to practice."

Headlines: T-Mobile CEO Legere to step down next year
Description: T-Mobile US Inc  Chief Executive Officer John Legere will step down next year, the company said on Monday, less than three weeks before it goes to trial to determine the fate of its planned $26.5 billion merger with smaller rival Sprint Corp .

Headlines: Beyond Meat vs Zhenmeat: The battle for China's meatless market
Description: U.S. plant-based "meat" makers targeting China like Impossible Foods and Beyond Meat Inc will need to battle homegrown rivals which are developing local favorites such as dumplings and mooncakes to nab a share of the lucrative market.

Headlines: Factbox: Who is doing what in China's plant-based meat business
Description: While China is no stranger to food using vegetarian ingredients to give a meat-like flavor, the buzz around Beyond Meat and Impossible Foods in the U.S. is driving a series of Chinese companies to roll out similar pea or soy-based meat products.

Headlines: Lawmakers urge U.S. government to tighten export controls to China on security fears
Description: Top Senate Democrat Chuck Schumer and Republican Senator Tom Cotton on Monday urged the U.S. government to swiftly issue rules to make it harder to export sophisticated technologies to China that Beijing can use to boost its military.

Headlines: FedEx CEO challenges NYT publisher to public debate after tax story
Description: FedEx Corp  Chief Executive Frederick Smith has challenged the publisher of the New York Times & Co  and the editor of the business section of the newspaper to a public debate in response to a story about the company's tax bill.

Headlines: Boeing to give Southwest board 737 MAX update this week
Description: Boeing Co  this week will present to the board of its largest 737 MAX customer, Southwest Airlines Co , an overview of its plans to return the grounded jet to service, a spokesman for the airline said on Monday.

Headlines: California to stop buying GM, Toyota and Fiat Chrysler vehicles over emissions fight
Description: California said on Monday it will halt all purchases of new vehicles for state government fleets from GM, Toyota, Fiat Chrysler and other automakers backing U.S. President Donald Trump in a battle to strip the state of authority to regulate tailpipe emissions.

Headlines: Wall Street nudges up as investors await U.S.-China trade clarity
Description: Wall Street's three main indexes on Monday barely extended the previous session's closing records as investors waited for concrete progress on U.S.-China trade relations after mixed headlines.

Headlines: Lawsuit against Boeing seeks to hold board liable for 737 MAX problems
Description: A shareholder lawsuit filed on Monday accused Boeing Co's board of doing nothing to investigate the safety of the 737 MAX until the fast-selling plane suffered a second deadly crash in five months.

Headlines: Justice Department asks court to scrap decades-old 'Paramount' antitrust decrees
Description: The U.S. Justice Department said on Monday it would ask a court to scrap decades-old 'Paramount' consent decrees enacted to protect movie theaters from powerful studios.

Headlines: Lawsuit claims Burger King's Impossible Whoppers are contaminated by meat
Description: Burger King was sued on Monday by a vegan customer who accused the fast-food chain of contaminating its meatless "Impossible" Whoppers by cooking them on the same grills as its traditional meat burgers.

Headlines: Stocks climb on Huawei extension, buoying U.S. Treasuries
Description: Global equity markets edged higher on Monday, lifting prices of U.S. government debt, as a 90-day extension allowing U.S. companies to do business with China's Huawei eased the latest spike in investor angst over U.S.-Sino trade tensions.

Headlines: With stores burned and looted, Walmart seeks police protection in riot-hit Chile
Description: Walmart has sought court orders for police protection in protest-wracked Chile after more than 120 of its supermarkets were looted or burned.

Headlines: Amazon offers ad-supported free music streaming service
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Monday it has introduced an ad-supported free version of its music streaming service Amazon Music, taking on rival Spotify Technology which has nearly 140 million users for its free version.

Headlines: Coty takes $600 million bet on reality star Kylie Jenner's beauty brands
Description: Coty Inc  said on Monday it would pay $600 million for a majority stake in Kylie Jenner's make-up and skincare businesses, as it looks to tap into the reality TV star's huge social media reach, sending its shares up as much as 5%.

Headlines: WeWork's 2025 junk bond falls to record low
Description: Shared-office operator WeWork's 2025 junk bond fell to a record low on Monday, with its last yielding bid at 16.06%.

Headlines: U.S. car safety agency head: NAFTA successor 'big win' for industry
Description: The acting top U.S. auto safety official said on Monday he was confident the U.S. Congress will ratify the trade treaty intended to replace NAFTA, boosting the auto industry and enabling automakers to build safer cars at lower prices.

Headlines: Airbus dominates second day of Dubai show as Boeing wins MAX order
Description: Gulf airlines Emirates and Air Arabia spent a combined $30 billion at list prices on Airbus  jetliners as the Dubai Airshow burst into life on Monday, while Boeing  won a symbolic first official order for the 737 MAX since its grounding in March.

Headlines: ByteDance CEO urges TikTok diversification as U.S. pressure mounts: internal note
Description: The founder and CEO of TikTok owner ByteDance will focus on adding users of the popular video app in countries outside of its strongest markets, according to an internal staff note seen by Reuters, as it faces political pressure in the United States.

Headlines: Fed's Mester: U.S. monetary policy 'in a good spot'
Description: The current level of interest rates is appropriate for the U.S. economy and the Federal Reserve should now pause as it monitors how the economy evolves, Cleveland Fed President Loretta Mester said on Monday.

Headlines: Boost founder says willing to pay up to $2 billion to buy brand from Sprint
Description: Boost Mobile founder Peter Adderton is willing to pay up to $2 billion to buy back the prepaid wireless brand from Sprint Corp , he told Reuters on Monday, a significant potential premium to what satellite TV provider Dish Network  agreed to pay for Sprint's entire prepaid wireless business.

Headlines: U.S. growth outlook in 2020 improves despite trade risk: Fannie Mae
Description: Fannie Mae  on Monday upgraded its forecast for 2020 U.S. economic growth to 1.9% from 1.7%, arguing that consumer spending and the housing market will buoy gross domestic product if a "phase one" trade deal between the United States and China is signed.

Headlines: Major FirstGroup shareholders call for U.S. asset sale
Description: Two major FirstGroup  shareholders on Monday called for the British bus and train operator to sell its U.S. assets as part of a portfolio overhaul which already includes the planned sale of North American intercity bus service Greyhound.

Headlines: Trump says 'cordial' talk with Fed's Powell covered negative interest rates, trade
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he met with U.S. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Monday and discussed a wide range of topics including negative interest rates, monetary policy easing, dollar strength and U.S. trade with China and the European Union.

Headlines: Emirates announces $16 billion order for 50 Airbus A350 planes
Description: Dubai state-owned airline Emirates said on Monday it had placed a firm order for 50 Airbus  A350 jets worth $16 billion at list prices.

Headlines: Airbnb teams up with the IOC to provide Games accommodation
Description: Short-term home rental company Airbnb Inc has joined the ranks of leading sponsors of the Olympic Games with a nine year deal to help provide accommodation for the world's biggest sporting event and cut the cost for host cities.

Headlines: Airbnb signs Olympics deal up to 2028
Description: Airbnb has struck a deal to support the Olympic Games up to 2028, the short-term home rental company announced on Monday.

Headlines: Former drug executive Shkreli's appeal denied by U.S. Supreme Court
Description: Former pharmaceutical executive Martin Shkreli will remain in prison after the U.S. Supreme Court on Monday rejected his effort to overturn his conviction and seven-year sentence for securities fraud and conspiracy.

Headlines: Alibaba to close books early in $13.4 billion Hong Kong listing after strong demand: sources
Description: Alibaba will stop taking orders from prospective institutional investors for its $13.4 billion secondary listing in Hong Kong earlier than expected after attracting strong demand, two people with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Volkswagen cuts profit, sales forecasts as autos downturn bites
Description: German carmaker Volkswagen  cut its forecasts for operating profit and sales growth on Monday due to a downturn in demand for passenger cars, while keeping profit margin targets.

Headlines: Global trade umpire: the next casualty of Trump's tariff war?
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has upended the global trade order with a slew of tariffs on economic rivals: now, Washington has redoubled its efforts to paralyze the very body designed to settle such disputes.

Headlines: Boeing, Airbus kept in suspense over big Dubai jet deals
Description: Airbus  and Boeing  fought to save billions of dollars of jet deals on Sunday as host airline Emirates kept the Dubai Airshow in suspense over dozens of tentative orders designed to fine-tune the world's largest international airline network.

Headlines: Kuwait's Jazeera unhappy with Airbus delays, no plans for aircraft order this week
Description: Kuwait's Jazeera Airways  is unhappy with delivery delays of Airbus  aircraft and has no plans to place an order at this week's Dubai Airshow, its chief executive said.

Headlines: Hong Kong's Best Mart 360 to keep stores open despite attacks
Description: Best Mart 360's chairman said on Monday he would keep every one of the popular Hong Kong snack food chain's stores open, despite them being repeatedly damaged during anti-government protests.

Headlines: HP down 5% after Xerox bid rejection, counter offer hints
Description: Shares of HP Inc  fell as much as 5% on Monday after the personal computer maker rejected a buyout offer from Xerox Holdings Corp , and indicated it might instead make its own offer to take over the U.S. printer maker.

Headlines: Parts with passports: how free trade drives GM's engines
Description: Long before the pistons for General Motors Co V-6 engines reach the U.S. No. 1 automaker's Romulus, Michigan plant, they are seasoned international travelers.

Headlines: Nissan recalls nearly 400,000 vehicles over braking system defect
Description: (This Nov. 16 story corrects headline to say nearly 400,000 vehicles were recalled, not 40,000)

Headlines: VW CEO says new ID.3 car 40% cheaper to build than electric Golf
Description: Volkswagen's  new ID.3 electric vehicle will be 40% cheaper to build than the electric version of its Golf model, Chief Executive Herbert Diess told investors on Monday.

Headlines: SoftBank to create $30 billion tech giant via Yahoo Japan, Line Corp deal
Description: SoftBank Corp plans to merge internet subsidiary Yahoo Japan with messaging app operator Line Corp to create a $30 billion tech group, as it strives to compete more effectively with local rival Rakuten and U.S. tech powerhouses.

Headlines: Banks and funds lower red flags on supercharged stocks
Description: A raft of major banks and fund managers have upgraded their view on global equities, with emerging-market stocks their top pick to benefit from signs of easing in the Sino-U.S. trade dispute.

Headlines: HP says open to exploring bid for Xerox
Description: HP Inc said on Sunday it was open to exploring a bid for U.S. printer maker Xerox Corp after rebuffing a $33.5 billion cash-and-stock acquisition offer from the latter as "significantly" undervaluing the personal computer maker.

Headlines: Ford bets on an electric Mustang to charge its turnaround
Description: The Mustang Mach E electric sport utility vehicle Ford Motor Co  unveiled in Los Angeles on Sunday is more than another car for the storied automaker.

Headlines: Emirates chairman warns of 'tough' second half
Description: Dubai state-owned airline Emirates chairman Sheikh Ahmed bin Saeed al-Maktoum said on Monday the airline will face a tough second half of the company's financial year.

Headlines: Amazon trims Fresh grocery delivery charges in Germany
Description: (This Nov. 4 corrects to clarify reduction applies to Amazon Fresh service only, in headline and paragraphs 1,3,5)

Headlines: Replacing Pratt engines in IndiGo fleet by end of January a challenge: CEO
Description: Replacing all Pratt & Whitney engines on IndiGo's fleet of almost 100 Airbus planes by Jan. 31, as ordered by India's aviation watchdog, will be challenging but the airline aims to complete the work, its chief executive officer said on Monday.

Headlines: Emirates close to finalizing part of wide-body jet order with Airbus: sources
Description: Dubai state-owned airline Emirates [EMIRA.UL] was close to a deal on Monday to finalize at least part of a provisional order for 70 wide-body aircraft from Europe's Airbus , industry sources said.

Headlines: Etihad Airways still has long way to go to become profitable: Group CEO
Description: Abu Dhabi-based Etihad Airways still has a long way to go to become profitable, Group CEO Tony Douglas said on Monday.

Headlines: UBS Chief Ermotti wants to stay until 2021: report
Description: UBS's  Sergio Ermotti wants to remain as chief executive of Switzerland's biggest bank until 2021, Swiss website Finews reported on Monday, citing unnamed sources.

Headlines: ArcelorMittal willing to re-commit to Ilva steel plant on three conditions: paper
Description: ArcelorMittal  is drafting a plan to re-commit to the 2018 deal, under which it bought the troubled Ilva steel plant in southern Italy, on three conditions, Il Messaggero daily reported on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. expected to grant Huawei 90-day license extension Monday: sources
Description: The Trump administration is set to issue a 90-day extension of a license on Monday allowing U.S. companies to continue doing business with China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL], two sources familiar with the deliberations said.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco in race for IPO record with $1.7 trillion top value
Description: Saudi Aramco is worth up to $1.7 trillion at the price range set by the oil giant on Sunday, below the $2 trillion sought by Saudi's crown prince but putting it in the running to become the world's biggest IPO.

Headlines: Factbox: Ford bets Mustang muscle can sell an electric SUV
Description: Ford Motor Co  has tried and failed to generate interest in utilitarian electric vehicles such as a battery-powered Focus compact car. Now, the company is using the high-performance image of its Mustang muscle cars to sell an electric SUV. Here are some details of the Mustang Mach E's design and performance.

Headlines: Made in China: Samsung farms out more phones to fend off rivals
Description: Samsung's plan to outsource a fifth of its smartphone production to China next year may help it compete with low-cost rivals such as Huawei and Xiaomi but it's a strategy fraught with risks, people with familiar with the move said.

Headlines: 'Crown jewel' Aramco stirs loyal Saudi demand for giant IPO
Description: From taxi drivers to clerics, Saudis clamoring to own part of state oil giant Aramco went online and to local banks on Sunday at the start of a long-delayed share sale for what could be the world's biggest initial public offering.

Headlines: Renault to have CEO shortlist soon but not in rush: Sueddeutsche Zeitung
Description: Renault  will have soon drawn up a shortlist of candidates for chief executive officer but there is no rush, the French carmaker's chairman told a German newspaper.

Headlines: Factbox: Saudi Aramco - the oil colossus
Description: Saudi Aramco set a price range for its blockbuster listing that implies the oil giant is worth between $1.6 trillion and $1.7 trillion, below the $2 trillion Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman previously targeted.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco will not market IPO in the United States: sources
Description: Saudi Aramco does not plan to market its domestic initial public offering (IPO) in the United States, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Ethiopian Airlines undecided whether to take more Boeing 737 MAX jets
Description: Ethiopian Airlines has not decided yet whether to take more deliveries of the 737 MAX, the jet grounded worldwide in the wake of crashes in Ethiopia and Indonesia, the airline's CEO said on Sunday, as Boeing  completes revisions to the aircraft's design.

Headlines: France's Le Maire favors car industry professional as next Renault CEO
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Sunday that the search for a new CEO for Renault  was still on and that he favored selecting a professional from the automobile sector.

Headlines: With inflation low, Fed can boost job market: Daly
Description: Sluggish inflation gives the Federal Reserve the leeway to keep borrowing costs low and help draw more workers into the labor market, San Francisco Federal Reserve Bank President Mary Daly said on Saturday.

Headlines: UK's Corbyn: Labour to exclude NHS, medicines from trade deals with U.S.
Description: UK opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn said the Labour Party will exclude Britain's National Health Service and medicines from trade deals with the United States, as he accused Prime Minister Boris Johnson of covering up "secret talks" on the NHS.

Headlines: U.S. to extend license for its companies to continue business with Huawei: sources
Description: The Trump administration is set to issue a two-week extension of a license allowing U.S. companies to continue doing business with China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, two sources familiar with the deliberations said.

Headlines: Boeing says timing of 737 MAX return in hands of regulators
Description: Boeing moved on Saturday to ease tensions with regulators over the return to service of its 737 MAX, saying it was up to the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration and its global counterparts to approve changes to the jet in the wake of two accidents.

Headlines: U.S. charges another ex-JPMorgan executive with alleged market manipulation
Description: The Department of Justice has charged another former JPMorgan Chase & Co executive with alleged racketeering and manipulating precious metals prices between 2008 and 2016, the latest in a string of similar prosecutions.

Headlines: Ford's UAW members vote to ratify new four-year contract
Description: The United Auto Workers union said on Friday that rank-and-file members at Ford Motor Co have voted in favor of a new four-year labor contract with the No. 2 U.S. automaker.

Headlines: Microsoft to probe work of Israeli facial recognition startup it funded
Description: Microsoft Corp  has hired former U.S. Attorney General Eric Holder to investigate whether the use of facial recognition technology developed by an Israeli startup it funded complies with its ethics principles, the company said on Friday.

Headlines: Take Five: Fighting fires
Description: How big a risk is a global economic recession? Recently, hopes of a fledgling growth turnaround were doused by data showing China's factory output growth slowing in October and Japan's economy grinding to a standstill in Q3. And Germany only narrowly avoided a recession in that period.

Headlines: Trade deal hopes, surging health stocks power Wall Street to highs
Description: Wall Street's main stock indexes closed at record levels on Friday, fueled by fresh optimism over a potential calming of U.S.-China trade tensions and by big gains in shares of healthcare companies.

Headlines: U.S. FAA regulator head tells team to 'take whatever time needed' on 737 MAX
Description: The head of the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration has told his team to "take whatever time is needed" in their review of Boeing Co's 737 MAX, according to a Nov. 14 memo and video message reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Twitter tightens bans on political ads and causes ahead of 2020 U.S. election
Description: Twitter Inc on Friday said its political advertising ban will include references to political candidates or legislation, and it will not allow ads that advocate for a certain outcome on social and political causes.

Headlines: Factbox: How social media sites handle political ads
Description: Online platforms including Facebook and Alphabet Inc's  Google face growing pressure to stop carrying political ads that contain false or misleading claims ahead of the U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: Bristol-Myers Squibb wins antitrust approval to buy Celgene, but must divest psoriasis drug
Description: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co and Celgene Corp have won U.S. antitrust approval for their merger on condition that they sell Celgene's psoriasis drug Otezla, the Federal Trade Commission said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: Oklahoma judge reduces Johnson & Johnson opioid payout to $465 million
Description: An Oklahoma judge on Friday said Johnson & Johnson must pay that state $465 million for fueling the opioid epidemic through the deceptive marketing of painkillers, down from his original award of $572 million.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. regulator rethinking changes to whistleblower program after backlash - sources
Description: The U.S. securities regulator is rethinking a proposal that could weaken a landmark whistleblower program after a pushback from whistleblower lawyers and advocates, people with knowledge of the deliberations told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court to hear Google bid to end Oracle copyright suit
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Friday agreed to hear Google's bid to escape Oracle Corp's multi-billion dollar lawsuit accusing Google of infringing software copyrights to build the Android operating system that runs most of the world's smartphones.

Headlines: Amazon challenges Pentagon's $10-billion cloud award to Microsoft
Description: Amazon.com Inc  on Thursday said it is contesting the Pentagon's award of an up to $10 billion cloud computing deal to Microsoft Corp , expressing concern that politics got in the way of a fair contracting process.

Headlines: U.S. defense chief rejects Amazon's accusations of bias in cloud contract
Description: U.S. Defense Secretary Mark Esper on Friday rejected any suggestion of bias in a Pentagon decision to award Microsoft Corp an up to $10 billion cloud computing contract, after Amazon.com Inc announced plans to challenge it.

Headlines: U.S. and China have significant differences ahead of trade talks Friday night
Description: Top U.S. and Chinese negotiators are seeking to narrow  differences on an initial trade agreement during a Friday evening phone call, but remain split on key issues.

Headlines: U.S. restaurants remove dining rooms to speed off-site food frenzy
Description: Restaurants are doing away with dining rooms as consumers increasingly order food deliveries through apps such as Uber Technologies Inc's Uber Eats and GrubHub Inc.

Headlines: Wall Street Weekahead: Sagging consumer discretionary shares look for a spark
Description: The strength of the U.S. consumer has been often cited as a pillar of the economy and one of the reasons the S&P 500 has recently scaled new heights, but consumer discretionary stocks  have skipped the party for several months.

Headlines: Stocks rally, oil gains on revived U.S.-China trade hopes
Description: Crude prices rose and global equities markets rallied on Friday, with the major U.S. indexes setting record highs, on renewed optimism the United States and China are nearing a deal to de-escalate a 16-month trade war that has crimped global growth.

Headlines: Trump, Apple CEO Tim Cook set to tour computer plant in Texas Wednesday: sources
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Apple CEO Tim Cook are set to visit facilities in Texas on Wednesday where Apple's high-end computers are assembled, sources briefed on the matter confirmed Friday.

Headlines: Fed says U.S. financial system resilient; flags low rates, 'stablecoin' as risks
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Friday flagged high levels of corporate debt, the impact of an extended period of low global interest rates, and emerging "stablecoin" cryptocurrency proposals as potential risks to the financial system.

Headlines: WeWork faces U.S. SEC inquiry over possible rule violations: Bloomberg
Description: WeWork is facing scrutiny from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission over whether it violated financial rules in the run-up to its abandoned initial public offering, Bloomberg reported on Friday, citing two people with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Oil prices gain 2% despite concerns about rising supplies
Description: Oil futures gained nearly 2% on Friday as comments from a top U.S. official raised optimism for a U.S.-China trade deal, but worries about increasing crude supplies capped prices.

Headlines: Renault's Delbos vies for CEO post as hunt narrows
Description: Renault's interim chief executive Clotilde Delbos has applied to take the job on a permanent basis, two sources familiar with the matter said, as the French carmaker edges toward a shortlist likely to also feature several external candidates.

Headlines: Cowboys owner Jerry Jones has a long-term game plan for Haynesville gas
Description: At a time when companies in a U.S. natural gas field have been losing money and exiting Louisiana's Haynesville shale basin, Dallas Cowboys' owner Jerry Jones' Comstock Resources  is picking up cheap assets, betting on the field's proximity to the growing U.S. Gulf Coast export hub.

Headlines: U.S. retail sales rise modestly; factory output tumbles
Description: U.S. retail sales rebounded moderately in October although consumers did cut back on purchases of big-ticket household items like furniture and discretionary spending, which could temper expectations for a strong holiday shopping season.

Headlines: U.S. companies say consumer still strong even as broader outlook dims
Description: Walmart became the latest company to point to a strong U.S. consumer, adding to a raft of firms in recent weeks citing healthy demand at a time when spending is seen as an increasingly key support for the economy.

Headlines: New 'Star Wars' title from EA set to be big draw this holiday season
Description: Electronic Arts Inc launched "Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order" on Friday, garnering strong reviews for its flagship action-adventure series that is crucial to its holiday sales, after the videogame publisher shelved "NBA Live" game.

Headlines: United joins U.S. peers in pulling 737 MAX until early March
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc said on Friday it is extending cancellations of Boeing 737 MAX flights until March 4, joining U.S. peers who are also scheduling without the aircraft until early March as the jet awaits approval to fly again.

Headlines: Citi names Manuel Romo CEO of Mexican unit
Description: Manuel Romo has been appointed chief executive officer of Citigroup's Mexican operations Citibanamex with immediate effect, the Mexican unit said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: BMW executive Markus Duesmann tasked with reviving Audi
Description: Volkswagen  on Friday installed former BMW  executive Markus Duesmann to reinvent Audi  after the German premium brand lost key engineering know-how and influence in the wake of the 2015 diesel-cheating scandal.

Headlines: Global debt to top record $255 trillion by year's end
Description: Global debt is on course to end 2019 at a record high of more than $255 trillion, the Institute of International Finance estimated on Friday -- nearly $32,500 for each of the 7.7 billion people on planet.

Headlines: Alibaba gets strong demand for $13.4 billion Hong Kong listing: sources
Description: Alibaba's  order books for its $13.4 billion Hong Kong share sale have already been covered "multiple times," sources with direct knowledge of the matter said on Friday, as the ecommerce group kicked off its campaign for the secondary listing in the city gripped by protests.

Headlines: Qantas completes 'double sunrise' test flight from London to Sydney, aircraft order could follow
Description: Qantas Airways Ltd  could place an order for planes capable of ultra long-haul flights early next year, the airline's chief executive said after he completed a 19 hour, 19 minute non-stop test flight from London to Sydney on Friday.

Headlines: On board Qantas' ultra-long haul test flight
Description: When I signed up to join a trial run of the world's longest commercial flight, I expected an exercise in endurance but not steak for breakfast and a physical work-out regime.

Headlines: J.C. Penney posts smaller loss under CEO Soltau, shares rise
Description: J.C. Penney Co Inc  on Friday reported a smaller-than-expected quarterly loss as it sold more diamond jewelry and denim clothing, results Chief Executive Jill Soltau said showed efforts to revive sales and profits at the department store are taking hold.

Headlines: South Africa's SAA workers start strike that could cripple airline
Description: South African Airways' future is hanging in the balance after its workers went on strike on Friday to demand higher wages and protest planned job cuts, forcing the struggling state-owned carrier to cancel all flights.

Headlines: Deere workers grapple with fallout from Trump's trade war
Description: Devin Spencer has been on edge ever since Deere & Co. laid off dozens of his colleagues at its Harvester Works plant in western Illinois due to dwindling demand for farm combines.

Headlines: Volkswagen says it has no plans to cooperate with Tesla
Description: Volkswagen  Chief Executive Herbert Diess on Friday said the German carmaker has no plans to cooperate with start-up electric carmaker Tesla .

Headlines: Timeline: Amazon challenges Pentagon awarding $10 billion cloud deal to Microsoft
Description: Amazon.com Inc  said on Thursday it is contesting the Pentagon's award of an up to $10 billion cloud computing deal to Microsoft Corp , expressing concern that politics got in the way of a fair contracting process.

Headlines: Mexican president welcomes Pelosi remarks on North American trade deal approval
Description: Mexico's president Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Friday welcomed remarks by U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi that U.S. legislators were making progress in the ratification of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) trade deal.

Headlines: Vivendi may cut Mediaset stake in deal to end legal tussles: sources
Description: Vivendi  could reduce its holding in Italian broadcaster Mediaset  in a potential deal to end a long-running legal row between the two companies, three sources close to the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: China's JD.com beats quarterly revenue estimates, shares rise
Description: China's JD.com Inc  beat analysts' estimates for quarterly revenue on Friday, boosted by stronger sales in its core e-commerce business, sending its shares up nearly 7% before the bell.

Headlines: U.S. and China 'getting close' to trade deal: White House economic adviser
Description: The United States and China are getting close to a trade agreement, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Thursday, citing what he called very constructive talks with Beijing about ending a 16-month trade war.

Headlines: Volkswagen to invest 60 billion euro in e-mobility, digital tech by 2024
Description: Volkswagen  will invest 60 billion euros ($66.12 billion) by 2024 to develop electric and hybrid cars as well as digital technologies, the multi-brand car and truckmaking group said on Friday.

Headlines: Siberian taxi firm bringing fare-haggling to Moscow plans expansion
Description: A Siberian ride-hailing firm that allows customers to haggle over their fares is investing to beef up its presence in Moscow, a market dominated by New York-listed internet giant Yandex  and Uber , its founder said.

Headlines: Alibaba's $13.4 billion bookbuild covered multiple times: sources
Description: Alibaba's $13.4 billion institutional bookbuild for its Hong Kong listing is already covered "multiple times," according to a message sent to investors and verified by sources with direct knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Hong Kong confirms economy fell into recession amid protests, trade war
Description: Hong Kong sank into recession for the first time in a decade in the third quarter, government data confirmed on Friday, weighed down by increasingly violent anti-government protests and the escalating U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: Highlights: Hong Kong paralyzed for fifth day, students guard campuses
Description: Anti-government protesters paralyzed parts of Hong Kong for a fifth day on Friday, forcing schools to close and blocking some main roads, as university students barricaded campuses and authorities struggled to calm the violence.

Headlines: A chip on its shoulder? EU files WTO complaint against Colombia
Description: The European Union filed a complaint at the World Trade Organization on Friday against Colombia over duties imposed on frozen potato fries from Belgium, Germany and the Netherlands.

Headlines: Apple could raise annual ad income to $11 billion by 2025: JPMorgan
Description: The launch of Apple TV+, coupled with Apple Inc's foray into digital services, could help the company increase its income from advertising by more than five fold to $11 billion annually within the next six years, analysts from JP Morgan said on Friday.

Headlines: Automakers around world await Trump tariff decision
Description: Automakers around the world are awaiting a decision from U.S. President Donald Trump on whether he will impose up to 25% tariffs on U.S. car and auto part imports after a 180-day review period elapsed this week.

Headlines: U.S. trade groups raise alarm over Canadian digital services tax
Description: More than a dozen U.S. trade groups and the U.S. Chamber of Commerce on Friday urged the Trump administration to block a French-style digital services tax proposed by Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau during October's election.

Headlines: AirAsia to sell tickets on other airlines as part of online push
Description: Malaysian budget carrier AirAsia Group Bhd said on Friday it would sell flights on more than 100 other global airlines as part of a push to boost revenues.

Headlines: Jet grounding and delays overshadow Dubai Airshow
Description: An eight-month crisis over the grounding of Boeing's 737 MAX jets and widespread industrial delays are setting an unpredictable backdrop to next week's Dubai Airshow, with some airlines reviewing fleet plans even as others look for bargains.

Headlines: AirAsia to sell tickets on other airlines as part of online push
Description: Malaysian budget carrier AirAsia Group Bhd said on Friday it would sell flights on more than 100 other global airlines as part of a push to boost revenues.

Headlines: Explainer: Why is Alibaba listing in Hong Kong?
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba is set to price its first share sale in Hong Kong next week, raising up to $13.4 billion in what will be the largest deal in the city since 2010 and the world's biggest ever cross-border secondary listing.

Headlines: Hong Kong's cash pool tightens as Alibaba primes for $13 billion listing
Description: Alibaba Group's $13.4 billion Hong Kong listing is shrinking cash levels in the protest-wracked financial hub, with short-term borrowing costs shooting back towards a decade-high marked in July.

Headlines: Boeing received 'unnecessary' contract boost for astronaut capsule, watchdog says
Description: Boeing's multibillion dollar contract to build U.S. astronaut capsules received an "unnecessary" extension from NASA, a watchdog report said on Thursday, the latest management blunders in the agency's program to restart domestic human spaceflight.

Headlines: Court tosses Carl Icahn's lawsuit seeking Occidental acquisition records
Description: Activist investor Carl Icahn will not have access to Occidental Petroleum Corp's Anadarko takeover records to support his proxy fight against the oil firm's board, a Delaware court judge ruled on Thursday.

Headlines: Montana lawmakers seek more time for Keystone XL public, tribal input
Description: Montana lawmakers representing Native American tribal members called on the state's congressional delegation and the U.S. State Department on Thursday to extend the public comment period for the environmental review of the Keystone XL pipeline, saying tribes were not properly consulted.

Headlines: Southwest pilots union says Boeing may be trying to hasten 737 MAX return
Description: The head of the Southwest Airlines Co pilot union Wednesday sharply criticized Boeing Co and questioned whether the manufacturer was trying to speed up the timeline for the 737 MAX's return to service.

Headlines: Tesla's difficult path to profit in six charts
Description: Tesla Inc's shares sky-rocketed on Thursday after the electric car maker surprised investors with a rare quarterly profit, and delivered a record number of cars while keeping a lid on costs.

Headlines: Oil edges lower on U.S. crude stockpiles, record production
Description: Oil prices eased on Thursday as U.S. crude futures were pressured by a build in domestic inventories and record production, but losses were limited by forecasts from the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries for a lower-than-expected oil surplus.

Headlines: Buffett's Berkshire invests in Restoration Hardware, whose shares rise
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  on Thursday disclosed a new investment in RH , boosting shares of the luxury furniture and home furnishings chain once known as Restoration Hardware.

Headlines: Asian shares rise, but gains capped by weak sentiment
Description: Asian equities rose on Friday after the S&P 500 index notched a new record closing high, but investor sentiment remained fragile following weak data from China and Germany, which reinforced concerns about the global economy.

Headlines: S&P 500 notches record, shakes off Cisco's gloomy outlook
Description: The benchmark S&P 500 stock index posted a slim gain to end with a record closing high on Thursday, as a dour forecast from tech stalwart Cisco Systems was offset by a strong report from big box retailer Walmart.

Headlines: Nvidia follows Intel to predict strong growth in data center business
Description: Nvidia Corp  on Thursday joined rival Intel Corp  to predict strong demand for chips used in data centers after its third-quarter revenue and profit beat market expectations.

Headlines: PayPal halts payment support to PornHub models
Description: PayPal Holdings Inc said on Thursday it had stopped payment support to PornHub's models after it found the adult entertainment website made certain payments without the permission of the payment processor.

Headlines: Icahn pushes for HP merger with Xerox: WSJ
Description: Activist investor Carl Icahn has taken a stake in HP Inc and is pushing for the personal computer maker's merger with printer maker Xerox Corp, arguing that a union could yield big profits for investors, according to the Wall Street Journal.

Headlines: WeWork bond drops, spread hits a record on report of delayed share tender
Description: WeWork's junk bond price dropped and its risk premium shot to a record high on Thursday following a report that its main backer still hasn't delivered on a plan to buy $3 billion of stock from existing shareholders.

Headlines: Google antitrust probe to expand into Android: CNBC
Description: The several dozen attorneys general investigating advertising practices at Alphabet Inc's  Google are planning to expand their antitrust probe into the unit's flagship Android business, CNBC reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Visa discloses FTC probe on debit transactions
Description: Visa Inc  on Thursday said the Federal Trade Commision (FTC) has initiated an inquiry into whether the payments processor's actions prohibited merchants from using other debit payment networks.

Headlines: Boeing brings back humans after automation problems on 777 assembly
Description: Boeing Co  has scaled back use of automation to make fuselage sections for its 777 jetliners amid reports of reliability issues and returned to having mechanics do some of the work, the planemaker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Stocks, yields slip as investor sentiment wavers
Description: World stocks edged lower and debt yields fell on Thursday as Chinese economic data slowed in October and Germany narrowly avoided a recession in the third quarter, adding to concerns about the U.S.-China trade war's impact on global growth.

Headlines: U.S. charges two former Herbalife executives in China over bribery scheme: source
Description: U.S. prosecutors criminally charged two former executives of Herbalife Nutrition Ltd's  Chinese unit with running a decade-long scheme to bribe Chinese government officials to win business and evade regulatory scrutiny, a person familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Huawei, ZTE 'cannot be trusted' and pose security threat: U.S. attorney general
Description: Huawei Technologies Co and ZTE Corp  "cannot be trusted," U.S. Attorney General William Barr said, labeling  the Chinese firms a security threat as he backed a proposal to bar U.S. rural wireless carriers from tapping an $8.5 billion government fund to purchase equipment or services from them.

Headlines: Ford uses Mustang name, hoping new electric SUV will zap Tesla
Description: Ford Motor Co  will tag its new electric sport utility vehicle (SUV) with the Mustang name, the automaker said on Thursday, seeking to entice customers into a new era by linking it to the model whose groundbreaking design in the 1960s combined sportiness and affordability.

Headlines: City and union officials to consult on Philadelphia refinery sale process: U.S. court
Description: A U.S. bankruptcy judge on Thursday approved a process for the sale of the Philadelphia Energy Solutions oil refinery, the largest and oldest on East Coast, under which city officials and a trade union will consult on the matter.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan says strong consumer will help the U.S. economy avoid recession in 2020
Description: Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Robert Kaplan said he does not expect the U.S. economy to enter a recession next year, and he was optimistic that the strong consumer can help the U.S. economy overcome potential headwinds.

Headlines: European pilot group demands action over Ryanair sick leave policy
Description: The European Cockpit Association (ECA) pilot group has urged regulators to take action over what it described as a "safety hazard" caused by Ryanair's  approach to flight crews' sick leave, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Fed's Bullard: 'More normal' yield curve bullish sign for 2020
Description: The way U.S. bond markets responded to recent Federal Reserve interest rate cuts could be "bullish" for the economy, St. Louis Federal Reserve President James Bullard said on Thursday, adding he was ready to keep rates on hold and see how it plays out.

Headlines: Exclusive: Eurazeo hires JPMorgan to exit car rental group Europcar - sources
Description: European investment firm Eurazeo  is exploring a partial or full sale of its near 30% stake in Europcar Mobility Group  as it seeks to cash out from the troubled French car rental company, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Walmart posts strong results ahead of holidays, earns praise from Trump
Description: Walmart Inc  raised its annual outlook on Thursday as a robust economy boosted purchases at its stores and website and the retailer picked up market share in food and other groceries, earning praise from U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Warren lashes out at Goldman over Apple Card bias claims: Bloomberg
Description: U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren questioned Goldman Sachs's response to allegations of bias in how the bank evaluates applicants for Apple Inc's credit card, suggesting it should pull down the algorithm if it cannot be explained, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fed not focused on daily ups, downs of trade deal: Williams
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve will not make policy based on day to day developments in U.S.-China trade policy or on Britain's exit from the European Union, a U.S. central banker said on Thursday, in part because businesses do not make their decisions that way either.

Headlines: ProSieben says merger with Mediaset wouldn't work
Description: German broadcaster ProSiebenSat.1  is more interested in collaborating in digital growth areas than in a full-blown merger, Chief Executive Max Conze said on Thursday after Italy's Mediaset  raised its shareholding.

Headlines: Tesla sedans regain recommended status in Consumer Reports survey
Description: Tesla Inc's  Model 3 and S sedans both regained "recommended" status in Consumer Reports magazine's annual reliability survey, allowing the electric carmaker's overall standing to rise slightly.

Headlines: Daimler seeks 1 billion euros in savings at Mercedes-Benz by cutting jobs
Description: Tougher emissions rules will hit Daimler's profits in 2020 and 2021, prompting the German carmaker to seek more than 1 billion euros ($1.1 billion) in savings from cutting staff costs at its Mercedes-Benz business by the end of 2022, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: SoftBank's Yahoo Japan in merger talks with Line, shares jump
Description: SoftBank's Yahoo Japan is in talks to merge with messaging app operator Line Corp  to create a $27 billion tech giant and help the Japanese conglomerate expand e-commerce and payments services.

Headlines: Strong healthcare costs help to lift U.S. producer inflation
Description: U.S. producer prices increased by the most in six months in October, lifted by gains in the costs of goods and services, further bolstering the Federal Reserve's stance that it will probably not cut interest rates again in the near term.

Headlines: Facebook signs lease for office space in Hudson Yards
Description: Facebook Inc signed a lease for over 1.5 million square feet of office space across 30 floors and three buildings in New York City's Hudson Yards, according to a statement by the luxury and commercial real estate development on Thursday.

Headlines: Wells Fargo former interim CEO Parker steps down as general counsel
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  said on Thursday general counsel Allen Parker, who briefly served as interim chief executive of the scandal-hit U.S bank, will step down next year.

Headlines: Spain's former BBVA chairman 'FG' placed under investigation: source
Description: Spain's High Court on Thursday placed the former chairman of BBVA , Francisco Gonzalez, under investigation as part of a probe into an alleged spying case, a source with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: New Roma model joins Ferrari's 'prancing horse' stable
Description: Ferrari  on Thursday rolled out the Roma, a record fifth new model announced this year, as the Italian luxury carmaker with the famous "prancing horse" logo looks to sustain profit and share price growth.

Headlines: Britain's Asda blames Brexit uncertainty for sales dip
Description: Asda, the British supermarket arm of the world's biggest retailer Walmart , blamed lower sales in its latest quarter on Brexit uncertainty, saying it had negatively affected consumers' spending patterns.

Headlines: IBM to launch faster weather forecast system to cover the globe
Description: Technology company IBM said on Thursday it will launch a new weather forecasting system which will be able to predict conditions up to 12 hours in advance and cover parts of the world which have not had access to such detailed data.

Headlines: How SoftBank is putting its stamp on LatAm's venture capital scene
Description: SoftBank, whose $5 billion Latin America fund has showered regional startups with cash, is also courting local venture capital funds, an unusual move for the Japanese investor that has jolted the region's tech scene.

Headlines: Burberry aims to woo more customers in China with Tencent tie-up
Description: British luxury brand Burberry  on Thursday said it has joined forces with China's Tencent  for a new digital marketing and sales push to tap the nation's increasingly social media savvy shoppers in a critical luxury market.

Headlines: Alibaba's Hong Kong listing offers valuable Beijing goodwill
Description: Alibaba's Hong Kong listing will not only land it $13.4 billion, it will also garner goodwill from Beijing to help the Chinese e-commerce giant weather the fallout of a damaging trade war.

Headlines: WPP says acquisitions back on agenda after Kantar sale
Description: Advertising group WPP  will consider making acquisitions to bolster its capabilities in faster growing segments such as technology and commerce after selling a majority stake in its research arm Kantar, Chief Executive Mark Read said on Thursday.

Headlines: Singapore fines UBS $8 million over deceptive bond trades
Description: Singapore said on Thursday it had fined UBS S$11.2 million ($8 million) after investigations showed the Swiss bank deceived wealthy clients over prices for bonds and structured products.

Headlines: Qatar Airways signs $4 billion CFM engine order
Description: Qatar Airways has placed a $4 billion jet engine order with CFM International to power its 50 Airbus  A321neos.

Headlines: Danish prosecutor charges Danske Bank for overcharging customers
Description: Danske Bank  said on Thursday it has been preliminary charged by the Danish prosecutor for overcharging customers for an investment product.

Headlines: Alibaba to pioneer paperless listing in break with Hong Kong norm
Description: Alibaba's planned $13.4 billion share sale will be Hong Kong's first paperless stock market listing, a source with knowledge of the matter said, breaking with a long-held tradition of investors placing stock orders in bank branches.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. manufacturing group hacked by China as trade talks intensified - sources
Description: As trade talks between Washington and Beijing intensified earlier this year, suspected Chinese hackers broke into an industry group for U.S. manufacturers that has helped shape President Donald Trump's trade policies, according to two people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: China says holding 'in-depth' talks with U.S. on interim trade deal
Description: China and the United States are holding "in-depth" discussions on a first phase trade agreement, and cancelling tariffs is an important condition to reaching a deal, the Chinese commerce ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: In swaps we trust? Disappearing dollars drive currency trading dependence
Description: As dollars dry up, global finance is growing increasingly dependent on opaque currency trading to keep cash flowing.

Headlines: Factbox: Dollar domination - why global markets depend on the U.S. currency
Description: From the dominant reserve currency for central banks to the main conduit for global trade and borrowing, U.S. dollars are the lifeblood for banks and markets around the world.

Headlines: Factbox: FX swaps step from market obscurity to global stage
Description: Foreign exchange swap volumes have risen in the past three years to account for nearly half of the entire FX market, Bank for International Settlements (BIS) data shows.

Headlines: Reuters poll: Trade truce unlikely in 2020 but U.S. recession fears recede - economists
Description: The U.S.-China trade war is unlikely to see a permanent truce over the coming year, and while concerns have eased over a U.S. recession, an economic rebound is also not expected any time soon, according to a Reuters poll of economists.

Headlines: Calm, considered, Henry to steer BHP through choppy times
Description: Calm and considered, incoming BHP Group Ltd  chief executive Mike Henry is seen as a safe pair of hands to steer the world's largest mining company through what he says are uncertain times.

Headlines: German automation talent powers Musk's battery move to Europe
Description: To unclog bottlenecks last year at his Tesla Inc  plant in California, Elon Musk flew in six planeloads of new robots and equipment from Germany to speed up battery production for its Model 3.

Headlines: One of China's richest men named in Hikvision securities probe
Description: China's securities regulator is investigating one of the country's richest men for alleged violation of disclosure rules as a director of U.S.-blacklisted surveillance camera giant Hikvision , the company said.

Headlines: Global miner BHP taps Australia head Henry as new CEO
Description: BHP Group Ltd   on Thursday named its Australian head Mike Henry to succeed Andrew Mackenzie as the miner's chief executive, shunning calls from some investors for fresh blood from outside the Anglo Australian giant.

Headlines: Factbox: New BHP CEO Henry to drive efficiencies, focus on social license
Description: Global miner BHP Group Ltd   on Thursday appointed 16-year company veteran Mike Henry as its new chief executive from Jan. 1 next year, replacing Andrew Mackenzie.

Headlines: Key antitrust lawmaker frustrated with Google's Fitbit deal
Description: Lawmakers pressed top U.S. antitrust enforcers on their probes of tech giants Alphabet's Google, Facebook, Amazon and Apple on Wednesday, with the chair of a House subcommittee expressing frustration over the companies' continued acquisitions.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers question why Centrus awarded federal uranium contract
Description: A bipartisan group of U.S. Representatives asked officials at the Energy Department on Wednesday how Centrus Energy Corp, a company whose chief recently served as deputy at the department, won a federal contract to demonstrate a production method for a new nuclear power plant fuel.

Headlines: Trump threat of more China tariffs could hit consumer goods before Christmas
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's threat to jack up U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods if the world's two largest economies fail to reach  a trade deal could raise the price of cellphones, laptops, and toys less than two weeks before Christmas.

Headlines: Biotech-for-hire PeptiDream charts new path and becomes short target
Description: The promise of PeptiDream Inc's drug-discovery technology and its lucrative research-for-hire contracts have made it a darling of the Tokyo stock market. Now, those gains have made it a target for short-seller Muddy Waters.

Headlines: Hyundai to make Santa Cruz pickups at Alabama plant in $410 million expansion
Description: South Korean automaker Hyundai Motor  will start making its Santa Cruz pickup trucks at its U.S. factory in 2021, with an investment of $410 million, as it seeks a foothold in the popular, but highly competitive, segment led by U.S. rivals.

Headlines: Disney lifts Dow, S&P 500 to records while trade tensions cast shadow
Description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average and the S&P 500 posted record closing highs on Wednesday helped by a big jump in Walt Disney shares, but the Nasdaq fell as stocks were kept in check by fresh uncertainty over U.S.-China trade relations.

Headlines: Uber launches new safety features in UK as it fights for new license
Description: Uber launched a set of new safety features in Britain on Thursday as it battles to retain its taxi operating license in the face of concerns about passenger safety.

Headlines: WeWork losses widen to $1.25 billion amid record office space expansion
Description: The We Company, owner of WeWork, said on Wednesday net losses in the third quarter more than doubled to $1.25 billion as the  money-losing shared-office operator added a record number of desks to its global network but was unable to control rising costs.

Headlines: Cisco forecast disappoints as global worries weigh on client spending
Description: Cisco Systems Inc  on Wednesday forecast second-quarter revenue and profit below expectations as increasing global economic uncertainties kept clients away from spending more on its routers and switches.

Headlines: Tesla CEO says will build Gigafactory 4 in 'Berlin area'
Description: Tesla  will build its first European factory and design center near Berlin, giving the U.S. electric car pioneer the coveted "Made in Germany" label just as local rivals Audi, BMW and Mercedes prepare to launch competing cars.

Headlines: Brexit drove Tesla to pick Berlin over Britain for new factory - report
Description: Britain missed its chance to host the first European factory of U.S. electric vehicle pioneer Tesla  because of Brexit, Chief Executive Elon Musk said in remarks reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: ProPetro confirms U.S. SEC probe, accounting weaknesses
Description: Oilfield services firm ProPetro Holding Corp  on Wednesday said a board investigation had uncovered material weaknesses in its financial controls and an undisclosed related-party transaction with its former chief accountant.

Headlines: Takeaway CEO says does not want to overpay in $5.5 billion Just Eat bid
Description: The chief executive of food ordering company Takeaway.com  on Wednesday said he did not want to overpay as his company pursues an agreed merger with Britain's Just Eat , despite a higher unsolicited offer from rival Prosus .

Headlines: Occidental Petroleum stepping up oil and gas asset sales: marketing document
Description: Occidental Petroleum Corp  is stepping up its oil and gas-producing property sales, adding land in Utah's Uinta Basin acquired as part of its $38 billion deal for Anadarko Petroleum, according to a marketing document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Chicago mayor rejects Uber's alternative tax proposal
Description: Chicago's mayor on Wednesday rejected an alternative proposal by Uber Technologies Inc  to tax ride-hailing services, accusing the company of trying to resist any type of regulation by stirring up racial tensions.

Headlines: Disney+ streaming exceeds expectations with 10 million sign-ups, shares surge
Description: Walt Disney Co  shares soared to a record high after the entertainment firm said its new streaming service, Disney+, had been met with "extraordinary consumer demand," reaching 10 million sign-ups in its first day.

Headlines: Peloton exploring apps for Amazon Fire TV, Apple Watch: Bloomberg
Description: Peloton Interactive Inc  is exploring apps for Amazon.com Inc's  Fire TV and Apple Inc's  Watch, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Shares, bond yields slip on sour trade deal sentiment
Description: Global equity markets and government bond yields fell on Wednesday on growing doubts that a U.S.-China trade deal can be reached soon and fears that unrest in Hong Kong may lead to a Chinese crackdown.

Headlines: J&J blockbuster loses ground to biosimilars despite Quebec court ruling
Description: Johnson & Johnson's Remicade, a blockbuster drug that treats autoimmune disorders, has steadily lost market share among patients enrolled in the Canadian province of Quebec's public drug program, even after a court ruling reinstated full coverage in January, a Reuters analysis of government data shows.

Headlines: United Auto Workers union unveils ethics reforms after U.S. corruption probe
Description: The United Auto Workers (UAW) on Wednesday announced a series of ethics reforms in answer to a spreading U.S. federal corruption probe that has resulted in charges or convictions for a number of former leaders of the union.

Headlines: MetLife sued for gender discrimination by ex-chief administrative officer
Description: MetLife Inc was sued for gender discrimination on Wednesday by a female former senior vice president who said she was underpaid, called a "bitch" and told she had to "choose between being pretty and being smart" while working at the insurance company.

Headlines: Google Pay to offer checking accounts through Citi, Stanford Federal
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google said on Wednesday it will offer personal checking accounts next year through its Google Pay app, initially in partnership with Citigroup Inc  and a small credit union at Stanford University.

Headlines: Fed's Powell takes old-school view on U.S. borrowing capacity
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell likes to avoid any hint of politics in his public statements, but in a seemingly non-controversial response to a question about U.S. government borrowing on Wednesday, he weighed in on one of the core issues in the political debate over how to manage the economy.

Headlines: Facebook removes 3.2 billion fake accounts, millions of child abuse posts
Description: Facebook Inc  removed 3.2 billion fake accounts between April and September this year, along with millions of posts depicting child abuse and suicide, according to its latest content moderation report released on Wednesday.

Headlines: Black student loan borrowers are defaulting at nearly twice the rate of whites: NY Fed
Description: Student loan borrowers from mostly black neighborhoods are almost twice as likely to default on their debt as borrowers from neighborhoods that are mostly white, according to research released Wednesday by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

Headlines: Trade talks between U.S. and China 'hit a snag' over farm purchases: WSJ
Description: U.S.-China trade negotiations have 'hit a snag' over farm purchases, with China not wanting a deal that looks one-sided in the favor of the United States, the Wall Street Journal reported https://on.wsj.com/2CEYDR7 on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Brazil antitrust regulator to reassess Disney-Fox deal
Description: Brazil's antitrust regulator said on Wednesday it will reassess Walt Disney Co's (DIS.N) $71 billion purchase of Twenty-First Century Fox (FOXA.O) because the divestiture requested by the regulator as a condition for the merger of U.S. media companies has not happened yet.

Headlines: Visa, Mastercard draw FTC inquiry over debit card transactions: Bloomberg Law
Description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has initiated a preliminary inquiry on Visa Inc  and Mastercard Inc  for possibly prohibiting merchants from using other debit networks, Bloomberg Law reported on Wednesday, citing sources.

Headlines: One day ahead of deadline, Trump says he'll decide on auto tariffs 'soon'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday said he would make a decision soon on whether to impose tariffs on cars and auto parts imported into the United States but gave no other details.

Headlines: Del Vecchio says aims to build stable Mediobanca shareholder base
Description: Billionaire investor Leonardo Del Vecchio, Mediobanca's biggest shareholder, said on Wednesday he aimed to create a stable ownership base for the Italian investment bank and Generali, the insurance giant it effectively controls through a 13% stake.

Headlines: U.S. inflation firms on rising healthcare, energy costs
Description: U.S. consumer prices jumped by the most in seven months in October, which together with abating fears of a recession, support the Federal Reserve's signal for no further interest rate cuts in the near term.

Headlines: Germany welcomes Tesla's Berlin move as boost to e-car shift
Description: The German government on Wednesday welcomed Tesla's decision to set up shop in Berlin, a move it believes will turbo-charge the country's shift into the electric car era even as costs of running a business in Europe's largest economy remain high.

Headlines: German military refuses to take delivery of two Airbus A400M planes
Description: Germany's air force said on Wednesday it had decided not to accept delivery of two Airbus  A400M planes, citing recurring technical problems with the military transporters.

Headlines: U.S. consumer prices increase more than expected in October
Description: U.S. consumer prices rebounded more than expected in October and underlying inflation picked up, which together with abating trade tensions and fears of a recession, support the Federal Reserve's signal for no further interest rate cuts in the near term.

Headlines: Alibaba launches $13.4 billion Hong Kong listing to fund expansion
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group launched the share sale for its Hong Kong listing on Wednesday, braving unrest in the global financial hub to try to raise up to $13.4 billion to fund its expansion plans.

Headlines: Oil is our gold and we aim to use all of it, ADNOC official says
Description: Abu Dhabi National Oil Co aims to exhaust its vast oil and gas reserves even as many consumers switch to cleaner sources of energy, a senior executive in the Gulf oil company said.

Headlines: London forex trader accuses Citigroup of unfair dismissal
Description: A former top Citigroup  trader, who was fired in 2014 but acquitted of foreign exchange-rigging charges after a trial in New York, told a London employment tribunal he was unfairly dismissed despite being in the "eye of the storm" at the time.

Headlines: Airbus says A400M technical issues not safety critical
Description: Airbus  said on Wednesday that technical issues in its A400M planes that had prompted Germany to refuse delivery of two of the aircraft were not safety critical.

Headlines: Mediation between Bayer, plaintiffs seeks to clarify all justified claims: U.S. mediator
Description: Mediation between Bayer and plaintiffs in the United States aims to clarify all justified claims related to Roundup herbicide both at the national and state level, mediator Ken Feinberg told a German magazine.

Headlines: German auto lobby to pick utility manager Hildegard Mueller as president: report
Description: The German carmakers lobby VDA is set to appoint conservative politician and former Innogy  board member Hildegard Mueller as president, Berlin daily newspaper Der Tagesspiegel reported on Wednesday, citing sources.

Headlines: Alibaba's Jack Ma says Singles' Day shopping results miss expectations
Description: Alibaba Group Holding Inc co-founder Jack Ma said on Wednesday results from the Singles' Day annual online shopping festival had missed the Chinese e-commerce giant's expectations.

Headlines: UBS boss Ermotti fears Europe's banks 'too small to survive'
