Description: Danske Bank  shares fell more than 4% on Friday after the troubled lender said its annual profit would come in at the low end of forecasts, and unveiled plans to get costs and compliance under control by 2023.

Headlines: Singapore's Ascendas REIT to buy business parks from CapitaLand for $1.2 billion
Description: Ascendas Real Estate Investment Trust  said on Friday it is buying 30 business parks in the United States and Singapore for about S$1.66 billion ($1.22 billion) from its controlling unit holder CapitaLand Ltd .

Headlines: China to use import fair to highlight trade credentials
Description: China will use a giant import fair in Shanghai next week to try to showcase its free trade credentials, temper criticism of its policies and deepen its global economic influence at a time of fresh uncertainty over the China-U.S. trade war.

Headlines: India asks WhatsApp to explain privacy breach
Description: India, WhatsApp's biggest market with 400 million users, has asked the Facebook-owned  company to explain the nature of a privacy breach on its messaging platform that has affected some users, Technology Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said.

Headlines: China, U.S. maintain close contact on trade issues: foreign ministry
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Friday China and the United States have maintained close contact on bilateral trade issues.

Headlines: Trump says U.S., China to announce new venue to ink trade deal soon
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday the United States and China would soon announce a new site where he and Chinese President Xi Jinping will sign a "Phase One" trade deal after Chile canceled a planned summit set for mid-November.

Headlines: China wind power firm plans $1 billion LNG terminal by end-2022
Description: China's Suntien Green Energy Co. Ltd , a wind power producer and piped gas distributor, plans to build a $1 billion liquefied natural gas (LNG) receiving terminal in north China by end-2022, after its investment plans won state approval, a company official said.

Headlines: Nokia eyes Malaysian ports for 5G business as Huawei takes early lead
Description: Nokia  is targeting Malaysian ports in a bid to get a share of the country's fifth-generation (5G) technology market,  as the Southeast Asian country prepares to launch the ultra-fast mobile internet service next year.

Headlines: Australia's Genex pumped hydro project funding falls through, shares tank
Description: Australia's Genex Power Ltd  on Friday said it won't be able to line up funding for its pumped hydro project until next year, after failing to sign a power sale agreement from the project.

Headlines: Several automakers back Trump in two other California vehicle emissions suits
Description: General Motors Co , Toyota Motor Corp , Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV  and other major automakers late Thursday sought to intervene on the side of the Trump administration in two additional legal challenges to its efforts to bar California from setting tailpipe emissions standards.

Headlines: WeWork, former CEO Adam Neumann accused of pregnancy discrimination
Description: The former chief of staff to ousted WeWork CEO Adam Neumann has accused him and the company of discrimination, saying she feared for the health of her unborn baby because of Neumann's penchant for smoking marijuana on chartered planes.

Headlines: U.S. prosecutors file new charges in UAW corruption case
Description: A United Auto Workers official was charged on Thursday with embezzling hundreds of thousands of dollars in an alleged scheme that a person familiar with the case said involved union President Gary Jones.

Headlines: Facebook sued for age, gender bias in financial services ads
Description: Facebook Inc was sued on Thursday in a proposed class action accusing it of discriminating against older and female users by withholding advertising for financial services such as bank accounts, insurance, investments and loans.

Headlines: Ford plans to close engine plant in Michigan as part of UAW deal
Description: Ford Motor Co plans to close an engine plant in Romeo, Michigan, as part of a tentative agreement with the United Auto Workers union for a new four-year contract, a source told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Canada denies sharing Huawei CFO Meng's devices details with FBI: court documents
Description: The Canadian attorney general has filed affidavits asserting that information identifying Huawei Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou's electronic devices was not shared with the United States Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) during her December 2018 arrest in Vancouver, court documents showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Google urges confidentiality protections in Texas-led antitrust probe
Description: Google on Thursday petitioned a Texas judge to ensure that the state-led probe into possible antitrust violations by the Internet search and advertising company will not compromise its confidential business information.

Headlines: Pinterest quarterly revenue, forecast disappoint; shares plunge
Description: Pinterest Inc  fell short of Wall Street estimates for quarterly revenue on lower-than-expected average revenue per user and its revised full-year sales forecast came marginally below expectations, sending its shares tumbling 19%.

Headlines: Wall Street retreats from record on trade cloudiness
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Thursday as conflicting tones surrounding a possible trade deal between the United States and China eclipsed strong earnings reports from Apple and Facebook.

Headlines: Even after Lyft beat, Wall Street pummels former unicorns
Description: Wall Street pummeled shares of companies including Pinterest , Lyft , Uber Technologies  and SmileDirectClub  on Thursday as investors grew more sour on money-losing former startups that went public this year.

Headlines: Hudson's Bay going private deal faces Catalyst hurdle
Description: Hudson's Bay Co  shareholder Catalyst Capital Group Inc has opposed an agreed deal by the struggling Canadian department store operator with a group led by executive chairman Richard Baker to be taken private.

Headlines: American Airlines flight attendants stand up to Boeing CEO on 737 MAX
Description: American Airlines' flight attendants union still has safety concerns about the Boeing 737 MAX and is demanding an active role in the relaunch of the grounded aircraft, its president told Boeing Co's  chief executive in a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: New Wells Fargo CEO says he wants to fix problems, isn’t a 'wallflower'
Description: Wells Fargo & Co’s  new chief executive, Charlie Scharf, told employees this week he is more hands-on in his early days than at his previous CEO roles in order to tackle the bank’s regulatory and operational problems as staff grilled him about everything from growth targets to his family dog.

Headlines: Shares of oilfield firm ProPetro fall 10% on short-seller's report
Description: Shares of oilfield services firm ProPetro Holding Corp fell as much as 10% on Thursday after investment researcher Culper Research released a report outlining business dealings among its executives and board members, and criticized an internal audit into disclosures and related-party transactions as a "farce."

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending slowing; inflation benign
Description: U.S. consumer spending increased marginally in September while wages were unchanged, which could cast doubts on consumers' ability to continue driving the economy amid a deepening slump in business investment.

Headlines: Global stocks fall from 20-month highs on trade talk doubts
Description: World stock markets slid from 20-month highs on Thursday as uncertainty about a U.S.-China trade deal offset strong results from Apple and Facebook, while the dollar weakened as investors mulled whether the Federal Reserve will cut rates further.

Headlines: Pelosi: U.S. House close to approving trade deal with Mexico, Canada
Description: The U.S. House of Representatives is making progress every day toward approving the trade agreement President Donald Trump worked out with Canada and Mexico, Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Thursday.

Headlines: Mexico says timetable slipped slightly for U.S. to ratify trade deal
Description: The timetable towards ratification of a new North American trade deal has slipped slightly but the pact could still pass the U.S. Congress by year end, a senior Mexican trade official said on Thursday.

Headlines: Mexican president talks with Canada's Trudeau, aims for progress on trade
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said he talked with recently reelected Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Thursday, congratulating him on his win and agreeing to keep working toward passage of a new North American trade deal.

Headlines: Business forum boosts Saudi image, but some say more rehab needed
Description: Saudi Arabia's crown prince showed up only briefly this week at the kingdom's flagship investment forum, which largely drew leaders and firms with strategic interest in the Gulf state and wrapped up with relatively meagre deals and an anticlimactic  finale.

Headlines: Italian, French unions say FCA-Peugeot merger plan only benefits shareholders
Description: A planned merger between Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot owner PSA  would only benefit shareholders, two of the biggest Italian and a French unions said on Thursday, criticising a decision not to include labour groups in the decision.

Headlines: Trump bets on Fed cuts to help the dollar. Don't count on it
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump says further Federal Reserve rate cuts would lower the value of the dollar and help the country's trade position.

Headlines: Encana to move to U.S., change name amid pipeline crunch in Canada
Description: Encana Corp  will shift base from Calgary to the United States and become Ovintiv Inc next year, the oil and gas producer said on Thursday, the latest company to move away from Canada as the nation battles with pipeline capacity shortages.

Headlines: Facebook in EU antitrust crosshairs, online marketplace now under scrutiny
Description: Facebook's online marketplace has attracted scrutiny from EU antitrust regulators who are seeking details about its role vis-a-vis rivals in online classified ads, a questionnaire seen by Reuters showed.

Headlines: In record deal, U.S. to recover $1 billion from Malaysian fugitive Jho Low
Description: The U.S. Justice Department has struck a deal to recoup $1 billion in funds allegedly looted from a Malaysian state investment fund by fugitive financier Jho Low, in a record capture for a U.S. anti-corruption probe.

Headlines: FTC probes Altria for role in Juul executive changes
Description: U.S. antitrust enforcers are probing Altria Group Inc  for potentially exerting influence over electronic-cigarette maker Juul Labs Inc before winning approval for a big share buy, Altria said in a government filing on Thursday.

Headlines: Twitter says tech tools remove one in two abusive tweets in first-half
Description: Twitter's technology tools removed one in two tweets containing abusive content posted in the first half of this year, it said on Thursday, amid calls to the U.S. social media company and its peers to do more to tackle the issue.

Headlines: Facebook shares jump 5% after strong results
Description: Shares of Facebook Inc rose nearly 5% on Thursday, a day after the social network reported its third straight rise in the pace of quarterly sales growth as well as an uptick in users in some of its most lucrative markets.

Headlines: Altria writes down Juul investment by $4.5 billion amid vaping backlash
Description: Altria Inc took a $4.5 billion hit from its investment in embattled electronic-cigarette maker Juul Labs Inc on Thursday, the latest setback for the startup as a regulatory crackdown on vaping threatens to upend the fast-growing industry.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp board member commits to steel ahead of unit review
Description: Thyssenkrupp  will remain committed to its Steel Europe division, which faces 2,000 layoffs, a board member said on Thursday, just weeks before the conglomerate presents a new strategy for the division.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz beats profit estimates, plans to boost marketing; shares surge
Description: Kraft Heinz Co  will spend more on marketing for key brands widely thought to have been neglected after reporting on Thursday that lower costs helped it beat third-quarter profit expectations, sending shares up 13% in midday trading.

Headlines: Corteva signals hit from delayed planting in Brazil, slowing China
Description: Corteva Inc  said on Thursday demand for grains and oilseeds could be hit by a delayed soybean planting in Brazil and cooling growth in China and emerging economies, sending its shares down 8%.

Headlines: Thomson Reuters operating profit tops Wall Street estimates
Description: Thomson Reuters Corp  , parent of Reuters News, reported higher-than-expected quarterly operating profit on Thursday and said it would raise its dividend payout ratio and buy back more shares.

Headlines: OPEC October oil output jumps on swift Saudi recovery: Reuters survey
Description: OPEC oil output has bounced in October from an eight-year low as a rapid recovery in Saudi Arabian production from attacks on oil plants more than offset losses in Ecuador and voluntary curbs under a supply pact, a Reuters survey found.

Headlines: Hong Kong unrest, stronger dollar weigh on Estee Lauder's FY forecast
Description: Estee Lauder Cos Inc  cut its full-year profit forecast on Thursday as it expects to take a hit from the ongoing unrest in Hong Kong and a stronger dollar, taking the sheen off its better-than-expected results and sending its shares down 5%.

Headlines: WTO panel rules India export subsidies illegal, upholds U.S. case
Description: A World Trade Organization (WTO) panel ruled on Thursday that Indian export subsidies are prohibited and should be removed, upholding a complaint brought by the United States.

Headlines: Cigna raises 2019 forecast as Express Scripts buyout pays off
Description: Cigna Corp  raised its full-year earnings target on Thursday, after reporting a better-than-expected quarterly profit, boosted by its acquisition of pharmacy benefits manager Express Scripts last year.

Headlines: ICE feels regulatory freeze on NYSE, overall profits rise
Description: Intercontinental Exchange Inc  does not expect market data sales from the New York Stock Exchange to contribute to near-term revenue growth due to regulatory and legal gridlock, the company said on Thursday after posting better-than-expected quarterly profits.

Headlines: Nintendo's second-quarter profit doubles as Switch Lite delivers boost
Description: Nintendo Co Ltd's  second-quarter operating profit more than doubled, blowing past analyst estimates, on strong demand for its Switch console.

Headlines: Bombardier shares rise on target commitment, asset sales
Description: Bombardier Inc  said on Thursday it would meet a key 2019 target and announced a deal worth more than $1 billion with Spirit Aerosystems , sending shares up nearly 7% despite reporting it burned more cash than expected.

Headlines: Dunkin' profit beats as costs dip, defends in competitive breakfast and coffee market
Description: Dunkin' Brands Group Inc  reported better-than-expected quarterly profit amid lower costs on Thursday and raised its forecast for 2019, betting on investments to improve delivery and new menu items to boost growth.

Headlines: Dunkin' profit beats as costs dip, defends in competitive breakfast and coffee market
Description: Dunkin' Brands Group Inc  reported better-than-expected quarterly profit amid lower costs on Thursday and raised its forecast for 2019, betting on investments to improve delivery and new menu items to boost growth.

Headlines: Scrapped Chile APEC summit throws up new hurdle for U.S.-China trade deal
Description: Leaders from the United States and China encountered a new obstacle in their struggle to end a damaging trade war on Wednesday, when the summit where they were supposed to meet was canceled because of violent protests.

Headlines: Lazard axes 200 jobs as profit falls amid dealmaking slowdown
Description: Lazard Ltd  said on Thursday it had axed about 200 employees after a review of its business, as the investment bank reported a 21% drop in third-quarter adjusted net income amid a slowdown in worldwide deal activity.

Headlines: Uber pulls $40 million Colombia investment, citing regulatory uncertainty
Description: Ride-hailing mobile application Uber said on Thursday it will not be basing a $40 million support and safety center in Colombia after all, because of a lack of regulatory stability in the Andean country.

Headlines: Massive mining waste dams could pose deadly risks, say investors
Description: A global inquiry into how mining companies store billions of tonnes of waste in huge dams, launched after a collapse in Brazil killed hundreds, shows about a tenth of the structures have had stability issues, investors said on Thursday.

Headlines: Bombardier to sell aerostructures business to Spirit AeroSystems
Description: Canada's Bombardier  said on Thursday it had agreed to sell its aerostructures business to Spirit AeroSystems  for more than $1 billion in cash and debt.

Headlines: Britain welcomes Spirit AeroSystems' purchase of Bombardier's Belfast site
Description: The purchase of Bombardier's  plant in Belfast by Spirit AeroSystems  is great news for workers and a welcome investment in the United Kingdom, Britain's junior business minister Nadhim Zahawi said on Thursday.

Headlines: GM recalls 638,000 U.S. SUVs, trucks for unintended braking
Description: General Motors Co  is recalling 638,000 U.S. sport utility vehicles and pickup trucks because a wheel-speed sensor could fail and cause unintended braking, it said Thursday.

Headlines: Ukraine decries Nord Stream 2 approval, says it weakens Europe
Description: Denmark's decision to approve the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline, designed by Moscow to bypass Ukraine, strengthens Russia and weakens Europe, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Thursday.

Headlines: Lazard axes 200 jobs after business review
Description: Investment bank Lazard  has axed about 200 employees after a review of its business, Chief Financial Officer Evan Russo said on Thursday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler third-quarter operating profit tops expectations on North America
Description: Fiat Chrysler   on Thursday posted higher than expected operating earnings for the third quarter, lifted by its North-American business, as the carmaker heads to a merger with French rival PSA .

Headlines: U.S. labor costs rise in third quarter
Description: U.S. labor costs increased in the third quarter as a tightening labor market lifted wages across the board.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending rises moderately, wages flat
Description: U.S. consumer spending rose marginally in September while wages were unchanged, which could cast doubts on consumers' ability to continue driving the economy amid a deepening slump in business investment.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims rise more than expected
Description: The number of Americans filing applications for unemployment benefits rose slightly more than expected last week, but the trend in claims remained consistent with strong labor market conditions.

Headlines: Conte says crucial to keep jobs, plants in Italy in FCA-PSA deal
Description: Italy's Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said that merger plan between Peugeot owner  PSA and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles   must keep jobs and factories in Italy, Italian media reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Greek airline Sky Express partners with Qatar Airways
Description: Greek airline Sky Express said on Thursday it had signed an agreement with Qatar Airways to cooperate on flights connecting Doha with the Greek islands, in a boost to the country's key tourism industry.

Headlines: Price cuts, iPhone 11 timing drive Apple's uncertain China rebound: analysts
Description: Apple Inc managed to largely stem a fall in China revenue in the September quarter thanks to the release-timing of the iPhone 11, a cheaper variant, and a bit of good luck, but analysts said the company's good fortunes might be shortlived.

Headlines: Volkswagen brings electric cars to Rwanda for ride-hailing service
Description: Volkswagen  is importing a batch of electric powered Golf models into Rwanda for a local ride-hailing service, establishing a bridgehead in the country that it hopes to expand to other nations as it seeks to increase market share globally.

Headlines: Bristol-Myers posts better-than-expected results, Opdivo growth slows
Description: U.S. drugmaker Bristol-Myers Squibb Co  reported higher-than-expected third-quarter profit on Thursday, helped by strong sales of blood thinner Eliquis, even as growth of its blockbuster cancer treatment Opdivo slowed.

Headlines: SNC-Lavalin names Ian Edwards as CEO
Description: SNC-Lavalin Group Inc  said on Thursday it named interim head Ian Edwards as its chief executive officer.

Headlines: French finance minister says Peugeot-Fiat deal 'good news' for France
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire gave his blessing to the merger between national champion PSA and Italo-American carmaker Fiat-Chrysler, saying the deal would be good news for France and Europe but that he would keep an eye on possible job cuts.

Headlines: Investors fear looming safety risks of mining waste dams
Description: A global inquiry into how mining companies store billions of tonnes of waste in huge dams, launched after a collapse in Brazil killed hundreds, shows about a tenth of the structures have had stability issues, investors said on Thursday.

Headlines: Carlyle's third-quarter earnings drop by a quarter as asset sales slow
Description: U.S. buyout firm Carlyle Group LP  reported a 25% year-on-year drop in its third-quarter earnings on Thursday, driven by lower proceeds from asset sales in its private equity portfolio.

Headlines: Factbox: Fiat Chrysler, Peugeot tie-up - how does it work?
Description: Fiat Chrysler   and Peugeot owner PSA  have agreed to join forces to create the world's fourth-largest automaker.

Headlines: Fiat's China partner GAC says respects merger plan
Description: Fiat Chrysler's  Chinese partner Guangzhou Automobile Group   said it respected the firm's decision to merge with Peugeot parent firm PSA  and would look to deepen its cooperation with the automaker.

Headlines: German union seeks to preserve Opel independence as Peugeot pursues FCA
Description: IG Metall, Germany's largest union by members, said on Thursday it would seek to preserve the autonomy of PSA's  German unit Opel after PSA and Fiat Chrysler  announced plans to create the world's fourth-largest automaker.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler, Peugeot deal good news but must not affect jobs in Italy: Italian minister
Description: A planned merger between Italy's Fiat Chrysler  (FCA) and French Peugeot owner PSA  is good news provided it does not affect jobs in Italy, the country's industry minister said on Thursday.

Headlines: Chinese officials say they have doubts if trade deal possible with Trump: Bloomberg
Description: Chinese officials have doubts about whether it is possible to reach a comprehensive long-term trade deal with Washington and U.S. President Donald Trump, Bloomberg reported on Thursday, citing unnamed sources.

Headlines: Qantas, Southwest step up checks of Boeing 737 NGs after more cracks found
Description: Qantas Airways Ltd  and Southwest Airlines Co  are stepping up checks for structural cracks on Boeing Co  737 NGs after discovering problems with planes that did not require urgent inspections, airline sources said.

Headlines: China's auto market could shrink about 8% this year: industry official
Description: Auto sales in China may skid to 26 million this year, a drop of around 8%, a senior industry executive warned, as the world's largest auto market braces for a second year of contraction amid slowing economic growth and tighter vehicle emissions standards.

Headlines: China officials optimistic for trade deal with U.S. despite APEC setback
Description: Chinese officials voiced optimism that Beijing and Washington can find a way to clinch the so-called Phase One trade deal next month, despite the abrupt cancellation of the summit where the heads of state were to meet to formally sign the deal.

Headlines: China, U.S. heads of state maintain contact on trade negotiations
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Thursday that the Chinese and U.S. heads of state have been maintaining contact through various means on trade negotiations.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler-PSA must keep French industrial footprint: France's Le Maire
Description: France welcomed a planned merger between Italy's Fiat Chrysler  and French Peugeot maker PSA , but would be vigilant about the firm's French industrial footprint and about maintaining its decision centers, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said in a statement on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Beijing could ax extra tariffs on U.S. farm products to boost imports - China trade association chief
Description: Beijing could remove extra tariffs imposed since last year on U.S. farm products to ease the way for importers to buy up to $50 billion worth, rather than direct them to buy specific amounts, the head of a government-backed trade association said.

Headlines: U.S. Fed cuts interest rates, signals it is on hold
Description: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday cut interest rates for the third time this year to help sustain U.S. growth despite a slowdown in other parts of the world, but signaled there would be no further reductions unless the economy takes a turn for the worse.

Headlines: HSBC, StanChart cut key Hong Kong rate as recession looms
Description: Two of Hong Kong's biggest banks on Thursday cut their key benchmark rates in the city, their largest market, which is bracing for its first recession since the global financial crisis following months of protests.

Headlines: China's factory activity shrinks at sharper pace, services weaken as risks grow
Description: Factory activity in China shrank for the sixth straight month in October and by more than expected, while service sector growth eased as firms grapple with the weakest economic growth in nearly 30 years.

Headlines: Samsung flags smartphone profit fall, upbeat on chips
Description: Samsung Electronics warned of a smaller mobile business profit on Thursday as its rival Apple gave a positive iPhone sales outlook, dampening hopes new models will help the world's largest smartphone vendor finally get back on a growth track.

Headlines: Boeing says up to 50 planes grounded globally over cracks: AFP
Description: Boeing  has grounded up to 50 planes globally over cracks, Agence France Presse https://bit.ly/3238KJC news agency reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Airbus A220 engines pass engine checks after recent failures
Description: Airlines have completed one round of checks triggered by engine failures on the Airbus  A220 and have found no faults, an executive at engine maker Pratt & Whitney said on Thursday.

Headlines: China says to proceed with trade negotiations with U.S. as planned
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Thursday that Beijing and Washington will proceed with the bilateral trade negotiations according to plan and that the talks are progressing well.

Headlines: Air Premia braces for long-haul battle with new Boeing 787s
Description: South Korean carrier Air Premia announced on Wednesday a provisional deal to buy five Boeing  787-9 Dreamliner jets worth $1.4 billion at list prices, becoming the latest new airline to enter the highly competitive low-cost, long-haul market.

Headlines: Malaysian financier Jho Low ready to address other issues after U.S. settlement
Description: Fugitive financier Jho Low is ready to address issues related to the 1MDB scandal in Malaysia or elsewhere, a spokesman from the Wells Haslem Mayhew Strategic Public Affairs agency who handles press matters on behalf of Low said on Thursday.

Headlines: Chile cancels APEC trade summit and major climate gathering after riots
Description: Chile withdrew on Wednesday as the host of an APEC summit next month at which the United States and China had been expected to sign a deal to ease a trade war that has hurt the global economy, as raging street protests gripped the South American country.

Headlines: U.N. seeks new host for climate talks after Chile withdraws
Description: The United Nations is seeking a new host for this year's round of climate talks in December after Chile withdrew as raging street protests grip the South American country.

Headlines: Costa Rica defers to Chile, U.N. on rescheduling climate change summit
Description: Costa Rica's government said on Wednesday it defers to Chile, the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change and member states on how to proceed with the United Nations global climate change summit, COP25.

Headlines: Exclusive: Alibaba to resume Hong Kong listing plans as soon as November - sources
Description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd  is eyeing a listing in Hong Kong as early as November to raise up to $15 billion, after political unrest put the move on ice earlier this year, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Toshiba sues former employee of U.S. unit, citing fraud
Description: Toshiba Corp said on Thursday it filed a lawsuit against a former employee of a U.S. unit for conspiring with a contractor and defrauding the Japanese industrial conglomerate.

Headlines: Ford reaches tentative labor deal with United Auto Workers union
Description: Ford Motor  and the United Auto Workers union on Wednesday announced a tentative agreement for a new labor deal, allowing the No. 2 U.S. automaker to avoid a strike like the one that cost its larger rival General Motors  about $3 billion.

Headlines: Facebook sales grow as users tick up; Zuckerberg defends political ads
Description: Facebook Inc  reported an uptick in users in lucrative markets and its third straight rise in quarterly sales growth on Wednesday, but the company's controversial political ads stole the limelight when CEO Mark Zuckerberg spoke to analysts.

Headlines: Western Digital announces CEO succession plan, signals lean second-quarter
Description: Hard-drive maker Western Digital Corp  said on Wednesday its second-quarter profit would come in sharply below analysts' expectations and that its chief executive officer would retire soon, sending its shares down 10%.

Headlines: U.S. SEC considers relaxing post-crisis structured mortgage product rules
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on Wednesday said it was seeking feedback on whether disclosure rules were discouraging firms from issuing SEC-registered residential mortgage-backed securities (RMBS) as the Trump administration seeks to overhaul the U.S. housing finance market.

Headlines: U.S. handling of tariffs raises appearance of 'improper influence': watchdog
Description: Lack of transparency in the Commerce Department's handling of steel and aluminum tariffs raised the appearance that certain companies may have had "improper influence" in the process, its internal watchdog said in a document made public on Wednesday.

Headlines: The Federal Reserve is waiting for a U.S.-China 'Phase One' trade deal too
Description: U.S. trade policy and its impact on business investment, manufacturing and exports were a key factor in the Federal Reserve's decision to cut rates, chair Jerome Powell said Wednesday.

Headlines: Lyft sees 'path to profitability' as riders, revenues increase
Description: Ride-hailing company Lyft Inc  on Wednesday said higher-than-expected third-quarter revenues and an improved outlook showed it was well on its way to profitability by the end of 2021.

Headlines: Starbucks earnings heat up on China expansion, digital and cold brews
Description: Starbucks Corp  beat Wall Street sales and revenue estimates on Wednesday, driven by new stores, digital ordering and delivery in China, and cold drinks in the United States.

Headlines: Consumers support U.S. economy as business spending slumps
Description: U.S. economic growth slowed less than expected in the third quarter as a further contraction in business investment was offset by resilient consumer spending, further allaying financial market fears of a recession.

Headlines: MetLife profit falls short on U.S., Latam weakness
Description: U.S. insurer MetLife Inc  fell short of Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit on Wednesday, hit by a fall in adjusted earnings in its U.S. and Latin American businesses.

Headlines: Apple tunes out trade war as new AirPods, services lift holiday outlook
Description: Apple Inc  on Wednesday forecast sales for the crucial holiday shopping quarter ahead of Wall Street expectations, with Chief Executive Tim Cook seeing strong sales of the wearables such as the noise-cancelling AirPods Pro and hoping for a U.S.-China trade deal by year-end.

Headlines: Diamond Eagle in talks to buy fantasy sports provider DraftKings: Bloomberg
Description: Diamond Eagle Acquisition Corp , a special purpose acquisition company, is in advanced talks to buy fantasy sports provider DraftKings Inc, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: GE still sees $1.4 billion cash cost from Boeing 737 MAX grounding in 2019
Description: General Electric Co  still expects the grounding of Boeing Co's  737 MAX jetliner to reduce its cash flow by $1.4 billion in 2019, provided the aircraft remains grounded all year, GE Chief Executive Larry Culp said during a conference call on quarterly earnings on Wednesday.

Headlines: Boeing CEO pummeled on compensation, 737 MAX flaws at U.S. hearing
Description: Boeing Co  Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg was repeatedly hammered by U.S. lawmakers at a hearing on Wednesday over his compensation and key mistakes in development of the 737 MAX that he newly acknowledged.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers question Boeing's $1 mln rebate clause for Southwest 737 MAX orders
Description: To convince Southwest Airlines Co  to buy the Boeing 737 MAX, the plane maker reassured the airline that pilots would not need expensive simulator training and backed up the promise with a $1 million per plane rebate if training was needed, U.S. lawmakers said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Stock investors see silver lining in Fed's rate-cut pause
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve may be done cutting interest rates but stock investors are not done buying.

Headlines: For Fed Chair Powell, blunt is the 'appropriate' approach
Description: Understanding central banks is often compared to reading tea leaves: picking up on subtle clues that point in one direction or another.

Headlines: Peugeot, FCA accelerate merger talks: sources
Description: The boards of French automaker Peugeot SA and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV   on Wednesday agreed to pursue a $50 billion merger, sources familiar with the matter said, a deal that could transform the global auto industry.

Headlines: Uber takes aim at 'patchwork' of ride share taxes in Illinois
Description: Uber Technologies Inc on Wednesday sued a Chicago suburb over a new ride share tax, while calling on Illinois lawmakers to address the state's "emerging patchwork" of taxation.

Headlines: Boeing 737 MAX grounding a drag on Canadian investment in machinery, equipment
Description: The global grounding of Boeing's  737 MAX jet is weighing on Canadian economic investment in machinery and equipment, with carriers unable to take deliveries of the planes, the Bank of Canada said on Wednesday in a report.

Headlines: Ford shutters oldest Brazil plant as revival bid faces doubts
Description: Ford Motor Co  on Wednesday said it was shutting down its oldest plant in Brazil later in the day as planned, with prospects for saving any of the jobs in doubt as talks with a potential buyer have fallen behind schedule.

Headlines: PSA could help Fiat Chrysler modernize its vehicle platforms
Description: A proposed merger between France's Groupe PSA  and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles  would give FCA access to Peugeot’s more modern and flexible vehicle architectures, potentially enabling the combined companies to achieve lower costs through higher production volumes, a global auto analyst said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Oil falls on hike in U.S. crude stockpiles, trade deal concerns
Description: Oil prices fell on Wednesday after a steep U.S. crude inventory build added to worries about a possible delay in resolving the U.S.-China trade war, which has hurt global oil demand.

Headlines: Boeing CEO Muilenburg resists multiple calls for resignation
Description: Boeing  Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg on Wednesday spurned repeated calls to step down by U.S. lawmakers and from the mother of a young woman who was a victim of one of two 737 MAX crashes that killed 346 people.

Headlines: Two plead guilty in conspiracy involving Uber, LinkedIn, others: U.S. Justice Dept
Description: Two hackers pleaded guilty in federal court on Wednesday for a conspiracy to extract bounties from Uber Technologies Inc , LinkedIn  and other corporations in exchange for promises to delete information stolen from Amazon Web Services , according to the Justice Department.

Headlines: Former Exxon CEO Tillerson denies misleading investors in climate case
Description: Former Exxon Mobil Corp Chief Executive Officer Rex Tillerson on Wednesday denied misleading investors about how the oil major measured potential costs of climate change, as he testified in a closely watched civil lawsuit brought by New York's attorney general.

Headlines: Wall St. gains, U.S. Treasury yields fall after remarks by Fed's Powell
Description: Wall Street gained ground and U.S. Treasury yields fell on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve signaled a pause in the current easing cycle following the expected announcement of a rate cut.

Headlines: Exclusive: J&J's own expert, working for FDA, found asbestos in Baby Powder
Description: Ever since Johnson & Johnson disclosed this month that a government test had turned up asbestos in its Baby Powder, the company has attacked the validity of the result.

Headlines: Facebook agrees to pay UK fine over Cambridge Analytica scandal
Description: Facebook has agreed to pay a 500,000 pound ($644,000) fine for breaches of data protection law related to the harvesting of data by consultancy Cambridge Analytica, Britain's information rights regulator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler board approves moving forward with Peugeot merger: sources
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV's   board of directors has approved moving forward with talks to merge with French automaker Peugeot SA , a person familiar with the situation said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Bayer says U.S. glyphosate plaintiffs more than double since July
Description: Germany's Bayer is now facing 42,700 U.S. plaintiffs blaming its glyphosate-based weedkillers for their cancer, more than twice the tally in July and potentially raising any future settlement.

Headlines: Bayer says U.S. farmers unfazed by glyphosate litigation
Description: Bayer, the world's largest maker of seeds and pesticides, said U.S. farmers were unperturbed by lawsuits seeking damages from Bayer for an alleged cancer-causing effect of glyphosate-based herbicides.

Headlines: S&P closes at record on Fed bump
Description: U.S. stocks advanced on Wednesday, with the S&P 500 closing at a record for the second time in three sessions, after a policy statement by the U.S. Federal Reserve that cut interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point.

Headlines: Instant View: Markets take Fed cut, pause signal in stride
Description: U.S. stocks firmed slightly and yields on Treasuries gyrated in narrow ranges on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve lowered interest rates for the third time this year, while signaling it might pause its easing cycle.

Headlines: Kuwait, Gulf central banks cut key rates following Fed
Description: Kuwait’s central bank cut its benchmark interest rate on Wednesday, joining the Federal Reserve-led monetary easing cycle with its Gulf peers for the first time since July.

Headlines: Factbox: What happens at the Fed's rate-setting meetings?
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve concluded its latest two-day policy meeting on Wednesday to set a key U.S. interest rate that impacts investors, consumers, and companies around the world.

Headlines: GM, Toyota, Fiat Chrysler back Trump on California emissions challenge
Description: Major automakers are siding with the Trump administration in its bid to bar California from setting its own fuel efficiency rules or zero-emission requirements for vehicles, the companies said in a filing with a U.S. appeals court late on Monday.

Headlines: PSA CEO Tavares gets board's green light to pursue FCA merger: source
Description: The supervisory board of Peugeot maker PSA  agreed on Wednesday to give Chief Executive Carlos Tavares the go-ahead to pursue a merger with Italy's Fiat Chrysler , a source familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Italy respects market nature of FCA-PSA deal but must be vigilant: minister
Description: Italy respects the market nature of a possible merger between Fiat Chrysler  and Peugeot-owner PSA  but is also aware that such a crucial sector warrants high vigilance on the government's part, the country's economy minister said.

Headlines: Boeing CEO accused of telling 'half-truths' in 737 MAX hearing
Description: Boeing Co  Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg faced intense grilling by U.S. lawmakers at a hearing on Tuesday over what the company knew about its MCAS stall-prevention system linked to two deadly crashes, and about delays in turning over internal 2016 messages that described erratic behavior of the software in a simulator.

Headlines: FCA to pay 5.5 billion euro dividend, PSA to spin off Faurecia stake in proposed tie-up plan-sources
Description: Fiat Chrysler  will pay its shareholders a 5.5 billion euro ($6.1 billion) special dividend under a proposed tie-up scheme with French rival Peugeot , two sources close to the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Traders keep bets on Fed pause after third rate cut
Description: U.S. short-term interest rate futures on Wednesday pared earlier gains after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates for a third time this year and signaled it would pause to assess any further need to ease policy.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury yield curve flattens after Fed cuts rates
Description: The U.S. Treasury yield curve flattened on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates for the third time this year, but signaled that monetary easing could be on hold going forward.

Headlines: Trump's attempt to force feed China U.S. farm products stymies trade talks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's demand that Beijing commit to big purchases of American farm products has become a major sticking point in talks to end the Sino-U.S. trade war, according to several people briefed on the negotiations.

Headlines: U.S. agricultural sales to China will 'take some time to scale up': Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Wednesday that it will take time for Chinese purchases of U.S. agricultural goods to "scale up" to the $40 billion to $50 billion annual level touted by President Donald Trump if the two sides can seal a "Phase 1" trade deal.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler considers 5 billion euro special dividend as part of potential deal with Peugeot: Bloomberg
Description: Italian automaker Fiat Chrysler  is considering a 5 billion euro  ($5.56 billion) special dividend, as part of a potential combination with Peugeot owner PSA , according to a verified tweet by a Bloomberg reporter on Wednesday.

Headlines: Apple CEO's handling of trade war has helped buoy shares, investors say
Description: When Apple Inc  reports results on Wednesday, Wall Street expects flat fiscal fourth-quarter sales and lower full-year revenue compared with the prior year, mostly because of declining iPhone sales. Yet Apple's stock price has hit all-time highs in recent weeks, and its price-to-forward-earnings valuation is higher than it has been since 2010.

Headlines: GM President Mark Reuss takes on additional leadership role
Description: General Motors Co  said on Wednesday President Mark Reuss would now oversee North America, South America, China and international regions.

Headlines: White House says it still aims to sign U.S.-China trade deal next month
Description: The Trump administration still expects to sign an initial trade agreement with China next month despite the cancellation of the APEC summit in Chile where officials had hoped to finalize the pact, the White House said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Potential FCA, Peugeot merger would be credit positive: S&P
Description: A potential merger between Fiat Chrysler  and Peugeot  would be credit-positive for both car makers, S&P Global Ratings said on Wednesday, after the companies confirmed they were in talks over a possible tie-up.

Headlines: Citi plans to withdraw from two-thirds of foreign exchange platforms: FT
Description: Citigroup Inc  plans to compete on fewer foreign exchange platforms to win business from clients, Financial Times reported earlier on Wednesday, citing sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: California utility PG&E's stock tumbles as wildfire spreads
Description: Shares of bankrupt California power utility PG&E Corp  extended losses on Monday as investors worried that its equipment might be responsible for wildfires spreading in northern California.

Headlines: GE raises cash forecast, beats on adjusted EPS, lifting shares
Description: General Electric Co  posted adjusted profits on Wednesday that beat analysts' estimates and wowed investors by promising to deliver $1 billion more cash this year than it had previously forecast, sending its shares sharply higher.

Headlines: VW lowers 2019 sales outlook as demand cools
Description: Volkswagen  lowered its full-year sales outlook on Wednesday, warning of slowing demand even as nine-month adjusted operating profit jumped 11.2% on increased demand for SUVs as well as Skoda and Porsche cars.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler calls board meeting on Peugeot tie-up: sources
Description: Italy's Fiat Chrysler  has called a board meeting for late Wednesday to discuss a possible tie-up with French rival Peugeot , two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Pizza Hut, GrubHub troubles dent Yum profits; shares fall
Description: Yum Brands Inc  missed earnings expectations, largely hit by a write down in the value of its investment in delivery company GrubHub  and warned of sagging sales at its Pizza Hut U.S. chain next year, sending shares down 10% on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler, Peugeot owner PSA in talks to combine: source
Description: Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot owner PSA are in talks to combine in a deal that could create a $50 billion automaker, a source familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: UK union seeks meeting with Peugeot over potential Fiat tie-up fears
Description: Britain's biggest trade union Unite wants a meeting with management at French carmaker Peugeot over its possible tie-up with Fiat Chrysler, saying merger talks and uncertainty over Brexit are "deeply unsettling" for workers at British plants.

Headlines: Explainer: What is driving Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot merger talks?
Description: Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot owner PSA are in talks to combine and create a $50 billion giant better placed to tackle a host of costly technological and regulatory challenges facing the auto industry.

Headlines: Fidelity Contrafund cuts value of WeWork stake by 35%
Description: Fidelity Investments cut the value of Contrafund's stake in WeWork Companies Inc by 35% in September amid turmoil surrounding the office-sharing startup's failed initial public offering (IPO).

Headlines: Magna International to build hybrid transmissions for BMW
Description: Canadian auto-parts maker Magna International   said on Wednesday it would build dual-clutch and hybrid transmissions for German carmaker BMW  under a multi-year contract.

Headlines: Ghosn denies report of improper use of Nissan money
Description: Former Nissan Motor Co Ltd  boss Carlos Ghosn denied any impropriety over payments he made during his time at the automaker, following a newspaper report that Japanese tax authorities determined he used company money for private use.

Headlines: Whirlpool drops plan to shut plant in southern Italy
Description: U.S.-listed white goods maker Whirlpool Corp  has dropped plans to shut down a production site in the southern Italian city of Naples after two weeks of workers' protests, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: BP says no decision yet on 2019 dividend hike
Description: BP has yet to decide whether to boost its dividend by the end of the year, it said on Wednesday, after its shares fell sharply on the previous day on fears it would defer a decision to 2020.

Headlines: U.S. private sector job growth picks up in October: ADP
Description: U.S. private employers added 125,000 jobs in October, slightly above economists' expectations, a report by a payrolls processor showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: Italian trade union fears FCA-Peugeot tie-up could hit Italian plants
Description: Italian trade union FIOM said on Wednesday it feared a possible tie-up between Fiat Chrysler  and Peugeot owner PSA  could hurt Italian factories.

Headlines: Timeline: Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot merger talks mark next round of consolidation
Description: FiatChrysler  and France's Peugeot  said they are in talks about a potential tie-up, the latest bout of auto industry consolidation as the costs of developing zero-emissions vehicles rises amid slowing global demand.

Headlines: With Disney, Apple about to enter, the streaming wars are just beginning
Description: Apple Inc's Apple TV+ and Walt Disney Co's Disney+ will launch competitors to streaming video pioneer Netflix Inc in November. Several others already have hit the market or will debut in the coming months.

Headlines: Carmakers and repair shops clash as automation upends aftermarket
Description: The rapid rise of crash-avoidance technology has set carmakers and repair shops on course for a collision that could determine who controls the $800 billion auto aftermarket in the digital age.

Headlines: California fire threatens PG&E's plan to raise $14 billion
Description: A wildfire raging in California threatens to destroy more than homes and businesses - it could also undermine bankrupt PG&E Corp's  plan to raise $14 billion to finance the crisis-stricken utility's turnaround plan.

Headlines: Fly Emerson Air: How a U.S. company deploys its seven corporate jets
Description: As Tiger Woods staged his dramatic comeback at Augusta National Golf Club earlier this year, most of Emerson Electric Co's  fleet of luxury corporate jets swooped in.

Headlines: Aramco IPO will come soon, Saudi crown prince to decide: energy minister
Description: The initial public offering (IPO) for state-owned oil company Saudi Aramco will come soon, and will be a decision taken by Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the kingdom's energy minister said on Wednesday.

Headlines: WhatsApp sues Israel's NSO for allegedly helping spies hack phones around the world
Description: WhatsApp sued Israeli surveillance firm NSO Group on Tuesday, accusing it of helping government spies break into the phones of roughly 1,400 users across four continents in a hacking spree whose targets included diplomats, political dissidents, journalists and senior government officials.

Headlines: Huawei tightens China market hold with 42% share at expense of iPhones: Canalys
Description: Huawei Technologies captured a record 42% of China's smartphone market in the third quarter as local consumers rallied behind it after U.S. sanctions, leaving Apple  to languish towards the bottom of the pile, market data showed.

Headlines: Italy government following tie-up talks between FCA and Peugeot: minister
Description: The Italian government is following talks between Fiat Chrysler  and Peugeot owner PSA  over a possible tie-up, Industry Minister Stefano Patuanelli said on Wednesday.

Headlines: FCA-PSA tie-up must be 'merger of equals' with no job cuts: UILM trade union
Description: A possible tie-up between Fiat Chrysler  and Peugeot owner PSA  must be a "merger of equals" that leads to no job losses in Italy, Italian trade union UILM leader Rocco Palombella said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Apple mobilizes suppliers to unveil first 5G iPhones: Nikkei
Description: Apple Inc is mobilizing suppliers to launch its first 5G iPhone range, the Nikkei Asian Review said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S.-China trade deal might not be ready for signing in Chile - U.S. official
Description: An interim trade agreement between the United States and China     might not be completed in time for signing in Chile next month as expected but that does not mean the accord is falling apart, a U.S. administration official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Airbus cuts delivery goal on Hamburg plant snags
Description: Airbus  cut its full-year delivery goal for commercial jets on Wednesday, as the planemaker struggles with production delays at a recently expanded German plant.

Headlines: Sony in record second quarter profit, image sensor demand offsets slide in gaming earnings
Description: Sony Corp on Wednesday said operating profit jumped 16% in its strongest-ever result for a second quarter, as robust sales of image sensors offset a tumble in earnings from its gaming division.

Headlines: Nintendo moves closer to China Switch launch after nod for first game sale
Description: China granted approval for Nintendo Co  to sell its first Switch console game in the country, a regulator announced, drawing closer the official launch of the hybrid home-portable device in the world's biggest game market.

Headlines: Lead China, U.S. trade negotiators will speak again soon: China foreign ministry
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Wednesday that lead China and U.S. trade negotiators will speak again soon after a U.S. administration official said an interim trade agreement between the United States and China might not be completed in time for signing in Chile next month as expected.

Headlines: French carmaker PSA confirms talks with Fiat
Description: French carmaker PSA  confirmed on Wednesday that talks were underway with Italian peer Fiat  to create a new world leader in the automotive industry.

Headlines: Amazon pumps in more than $600 million into India units
Description: Amazon.com Inc  has invested around 45 billion rupees ($634.20 million) into its Indian subsidiaries as the Seattle-based e-commerce giant ramps up operations in one of its fastest growing markets.

Headlines: Japan retail sales rise most since 2014, but outlook murky
Description: Japanese retail sales grew at the strongest pace in 5-1/2 years in September as consumers rushed to buy big-ticket items to beat a rise in the country's sales tax, raising concerns spending could pull back sharply in the coming months.

Headlines: Samsung Elec shows off new design for square-folding phone
Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd has unveiled a new design for a smartphone that folds into a square, racing ahead in folding devices after it launched its first model in September.

Headlines: China warns U.S. criticism at U.N. over Xinjiang not 'helpful' for trade talks
Description: China's U.N. Ambassador Zhang Jun warned on Tuesday that U.S. criticism at the world body of Beijing's policy in remote Xinjiang was not "helpful" for negotiations between the two countries on a trade deal.

Headlines: AT&T surprises with HBO Max price in battle against Disney and Netflix
Description: AT&T Inc  in May will launch its HBO Max streaming service with a new "Game of Thrones" series at the current HBO price of $15 a month in an aggressive move to battle Netflix, Disney and Apple for the future of TV.

Headlines: NCAA board votes to let student athletes endorse brands, accept sponsors
Description: U.S. college athletes can profit from brand sponsorships and endorsement deals under a new rule approved on Tuesday by the governing board of the NCAA, the organization that regulates U.S. collegiate sports.

Headlines: In South Korea's dangerous shipyards, subcontracted workers are most at risk
Description: Park Chol-hee was working the holiday shift at Samsung Heavy Industries' Geoje shipyard on Labour Day, 2017, when a giant crane collided with another and crashed to ground, killing six people, including Park's younger brother.

Headlines: Amgen posts higher biosimilar sales, ends neuroscience program
Description: Amgen Inc on Tuesday said competition for its older drugs sent third-quarter revenue down 3%, but biosimilar sales were strong and the quarterly results were ahead of Wall Street estimates.

Headlines: J&J says new tests find no asbestos in same baby powder bottle that sparked recall
Description: Johnson & Johnson said on Tuesday that 15 new tests found no asbestos in a bottle of baby powder that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration says tested positive for trace amounts of asbestos, a finding the agency stands by.

Headlines: Uber says will not share electric bike rider data with Los Angeles
Description: Uber Technologies Inc said it would not share real-time location data of its electric bike riders with the city of Los Angeles, saying it would violate their privacy.

Headlines: Wall St. dips after S&P notches record, Fed on deck
Description: The S&P 500 edged lower to snap a four-session win streak on Tuesday and it retreated from a record high as investors grappled with a flood of earnings and the latest update on a potential trade deal between the U.S. and China.

Headlines: U.S. telecoms supply chain rules, seen hitting Huawei, under review: official
Description: Rules to implement a White House executive order that is expected to pave the way for China's Huawei to be banned from the U.S. telecoms supply chain are "under consideration and review," a Commerce Department official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Murray Energy files for bankruptcy as U.S. coal decline continues
Description: Murray Energy Corp, one of the largest privately-held U.S. coal miners, whose founder is an outspoken supporter of President Donald Trump, became the latest in a string of coal companies to file for bankruptcy on Tuesday as generators shift to cleaner-burning natural gas and renewable energy.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. coal-fired power plants scheduled to shut
Description: U.S. power companies expect to retire or convert from coal to gas over 13,800 megawatts (MW) of coal-fired plants in 2019 after shutting over 13,300 MW in 2018, according to U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) and Thomson Reuters data.

Headlines: China to ease foreign investments curbs, won't force tech transfers -vice minister
Description: China will eliminate all restrictions on foreign investments not included in its self-styled "negative lists," a vice commerce minister said on Tuesday, and also will "neither explicitly nor implicitly" force foreign investors and companies to transfer technologies.

Headlines: Ex-FDA chief Gottlieb sees investment opportunity in 'unloved' antibiotics
Description: As a private investor, former U.S. Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Scott Gottlieb is focused on an area where few have found success in recent years: developing new antibiotics.

Headlines: SEC probes AIG unit that sells retirement plans to teachers: WSJ
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is probing sales and disclosure practices at Valic, a unit of U.S. insurer American International Group Inc , the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Apple Pay in EU antitrust spotlight as regulators seek details
Description: Apple Inc  faces more regulatory woes in Europe as EU antitrust regulators ask online sales companies whether they have been told to use its mobile payment service instead of rival services, an EU document seen by Reuters showed.

Headlines: Global stocks falter, dollar slips on potential U.S.-China trade delay
Description: Global stocks faltered on Tuesday as strong earnings from U.S. drugmakers Merck and Pfizer and expectations the Federal Reserve will cut rates was offset by a potential delay in a U.S.-China trade deal, which clouded sentiment and weakened the dollar.

Headlines: Barbie, K-pop's BTS power Mattel's surprise revenue rise; shares jump
Description: Mattel Inc  reported a surprise jump in quarterly revenue on Tuesday as newer models energized demand for its flagship Barbie brand, while the launch of dolls based on Korean pop-sensation BTS lifted international sales.

Headlines: Mercedes recalls some EQC electric cars due to potentially faulty bolt
Description: Daimler is recalling some new Mercedes-Benz EQC electric cars because of a potentially defective bolt in the differential, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: GM expects to spend more on EVs than gas-powered cars in next five years: CEO
Description: General Motors Co expects to spend more on developing and selling electric vehicles (EVs) than gasoline-powered cars over the next five years, Chief Executive Mary Barra said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco aims to begin planned IPO on November 3: sources
Description: Saudi Aramco aims to announce the start of its initial public offering (IPO) on Nov. 3, three people with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters, after delaying the deal earlier this month to give advisers time to secure cornerstone investors.

Headlines: Bank of America to give employees special bonuses for 2019 performance
Description: Bank of America Corp  will  reward employees for the bank's strong performance through special bonuses for the third straight year, according to an internal memo viewed by Reuters.

Headlines: New Juul CEO reshuffles top deck to fix image
Description: Juul Labs Inc said on Tuesday its finance and marketing heads will step down, as new chief executive officer revamps top management in a bid to rebuild the e-cigarette maker's public image amid intense scrutiny from regulators and lawmakers.

Headlines: Beyond Meat butchered as stock sale ban lifted
Description: Shares of Beyond Meat Inc  plunged more than 20% on Tuesday as investors rushed to cash in after a restriction on selling stock lifted and worries mounted about rising costs and increased competition at the hugely popular plant-based meat producer.

Headlines: Amazon drops grocery delivery fee as competitors close in
Description: Amazon.com Inc is eliminating its grocery delivery charge for Prime members in the United States and making shopping easier by combining AmazonFresh and Whole Foods Market ordering on a single site, as it battles rival grocery sellers like Walmart Inc and Kroger Co.

Headlines: Oil mixed on forecast of falling U.S. fuel stockpiles
Description: Oil prices were mixed on Tuesday, paring earlier steep losses as investors focused on signs that U.S.-China trade tensions could ease next month and expectations that U.S. refined product stockpiles declined last week.

Headlines: IAC must face Tinder co-founder's $2 billion lawsuit: NY appeals court
Description: A New York state appeals court on Tuesday rejected IAC/InterActiveCorp's  bid to dismiss a $2 billion lawsuit by a group of Tinder founders, executives and early employees who said it undervalued the dating app to avoid paying them billions of dollars.

Headlines: KKR earnings slide 23% as weaker deal activity hits revenue
Description: Private equity firm KKR & Co  reported a 23% year-on-year drop in its quarterly after-tax distributable profit on Tuesday, as fee revenue slid amid a broader slowdown in asset sales by buyout firms.

Headlines: Hudbay vows appeal after court affirms Arizona project ruling
Description: Hudbay Minerals on Tuesday vowed to appeal a court ruling that barred the Canadian miner from building a major copper mine in the United States after losing its bid to have a judge revisit the decision.

Headlines: U.S. shipping sanctions to dent demand for dirty shipping fuel: Refinitiv
Description: U.S. sanctions on a top Chinese shipping fleet is set to produce a totally unintended result -- less burning of the dirtiest marine fuels at sea at the start of next year, Refinitiv data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Airbus-owned Stelia Aerospace to build Portugal assembly plant
Description: Stelia Aerospace, owned by European planemaker Airbus , will open a 40 million euro ($44 million) assembly plant near Porto in Portugal, creating 240 jobs, company and government officials said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Shipping companies, retailers look to develop cleaner marine biofuel
Description: Top shipping, retail and transport companies are looking to develop an alternative marine fuel which aims to reduce carbon emissions from ships, in another step to push the sector to go green.

Headlines: Strong consumer spending drives Mastercard profit beat
Description: Mastercard Inc  on Tuesday beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit as customers shrugged off fears of an economic slowdown and spent more with their credit and debit cards, boosting fees for the world's second-largest payment processor.

Headlines: Tesla filing shows U.S. sales tumbled 39% in third quarter
Description: Tesla Inc's  third-quarter revenue tumbled 39% in the United States, its first drop in more than two years, but sales in China and other regions surged, the electric car maker's break down of sales by geography showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Canadian airlines plan for grounded Boeing jet to fly again, travelers still leery
Description: Canadian airlines are making preparations for the day when Boeing's  grounded 737 MAX jet can fly again, but one executive said work must be done to regain travelers' trust in the U.S.-made narrowbody involved in two deadly crashes.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence slips, housing stabilizing
Description: U.S. consumer confidence fell for a third straight month in October amid concerns about the short-term outlook for business conditions and job prospects, but remained at levels consistent with continued growth in consumer spending.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S.-China trade deal may not be ready for signing in Chile - U.S. official
Description: The United States and China are continuing to work on an interim trade agreement, but it may not be completed in time for the U.S. and Chinese leaders to sign it in Chile next month, a U.S. administration official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: ConocoPhillips profit beats estimates on higher production
Description: U.S. oil and gas company ConocoPhillips' quarterly profit exceeded analysts' estimates on Tuesday, as higher shale production and a gain from asset sales offset the impact from lower crude prices and higher exploration costs.

Headlines: Kellogg profit gets boost from snacks, frozen foods
Description: Kellogg Co's  quarterly revenue and profit beat Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, as demand for its Pringles and Cheez-It snacks, as well as frozen foods cushioned the impact of sluggish sales for its cereals in North America.

Headlines: Pfizer raises 2019 forecast as sales of cancer drug, heart medicine surge
Description: Pfizer Inc  reported a higher-than-expected third-quarter profit on Tuesday on increased sales of cancer drug Ibrance and a strong launch of new heart medicine Vyndaqel, prompting the largest U.S. drugmaker to lift its earnings forecast for the year.

Headlines: China woes persist as pressure point for U.S. corporate profits
Description: The U.S.-China trade war persists as an impediment to the growth of U.S. companies, even as the two countries appear close to clinching a limited agreement.

Headlines: Pentagon announces F-35 jet prices for next three years
Description: The Pentagon on Tuesday announced pricing details for its agreement with Lockheed Martin Co that lowers by 12.7% the cost of the F-35 jets it plans to purchase through 2022, which may encourage other nations to buy warplanes.

Headlines: GM expects to spend more on EVs than gas-powered cars in next five years: CEO
Description: General Motors Co  expects to spend more on developing and selling electric vehicles (EVs) than gasoline-powered cars over the next five years, Chief Executive Mary Barra said on Tuesday.

Headlines: India's IndiGo places historic order for 300 Airbus planes
Description: Indian budget carrier IndiGo has placed an order for 300 Airbus  A320neo-family jets worth at least $33 billion at recent catalog prices, handing the European planemaker what could be its biggest ever order from a single carrier.

Headlines: Factbox: When will the Boeing 737 MAX fly again?
Description: Boeing Co's  best-selling jet, the 737 MAX, was grounded globally in March, days after the crash of an Ethiopian Airlines flight that followed a similar Lion Air disaster in Indonesia in on Oct. 29, 2018. A total of 346 people died in the two crashes.

Headlines: Air Canada sees year-end capacity up despite 737 MAX grounding, shares jump
Description: Air Canada said on Tuesday it expects higher capacity and revenues during the last three months of 2019, after reporting lower-than-expected third-quarter profit in the wake of the grounding of Boeing Co's 737 MAX jets.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence slips in October
Description: U.S. consumer confidence unexpectedly fell in October amid household concerns about the short-term outlook for business conditions and job prospects.

Headlines: Russia's Sberbank to buy stake in Mail.ru to expand in digital economy
Description: Sberbank  has agreed to buy Gazprombank's  holding stake in internet company Mail.ru  as Russia's largest lender continues its transformation under Chief Executive German Gref into a banking-to-online services company.

Headlines: Merck sees ongoing Keytruda strength as its sales top $3 billion in quarter
Description: Merck & Co Inc  on Tuesday said it expected immunotherapy Keytruda to continue its market dominance as an initial treatment for advanced lung cancer as sales of the drug topped $3 billion in a quarter for the first time, beating lofty Wall Street estimates.

Headlines: Britain's Tesco takes on discounters with paid-for loyalty card
Description: Tesco  will next week become the first major British supermarket group to offer a subscription customer loyalty scheme, the latest weapon in its fight to stem the market share gains of German-owned discounters.

Headlines: Merck to ramp up Gardasil vaccine production, flags 'tempered' sales growth in 2020
Description: Merck & Co Inc  said on Tuesday it intends to ramp up  production of its top-selling vaccine Gardasil in 2023 and warned of a slowdown in revenue growth next year as demand for the therapy outpaces supply.

Headlines: Swedish, Estonian regulators advance Swedbank probe
Description: Swedish and Estonian financial regulators have taken their investigations into Swedbank  over anti-money laundering controls at its Baltic operations to the next level, they said on Tuesday, marking a formal step in the process that could lead to a financial penalty.

Headlines: After Boeing crashes, jet design rules to get tougher for all
Description: Planemakers worldwide face tougher scrutiny and changes in the way aircraft are certified in the aftermath of two fatal crashes of Boeing 737 MAX jets, leading regulators have told Reuters.

Headlines: Aramco signs slew of deals at Future Investment Initiative conference
Description: Saudi Aramco has signed several deals at the Future Investment Initiative conference in Riyadh, Saudi Arabian General Investment Authority (SAGIA) said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook, Google, Twitter urged to do more to combat fake news in EU
Description: Facebook , Google  and Twitter  must do more to tackle fake news or face regulatory action, the European Commission said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Saudi, Gulf consortium seeking to buy Barneys New York: Maaal
Description: A Saudi and Gulf consortium is seeking to buy luxury retailer Barneys New York Inc, Saudi financial news website Maaal reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco to start IPO subscription on Dec. 4: Arabiya
Description: Saudi Aramco will start subscription for investors in its initial public offering on Dec. 4, Saudi-owned news channel Al-Arabiya said in a news flash on Tuesday citing sources.

Headlines: Exclusive: Google owner Alphabet in bid to buy Fitbit
Description: Google owner Alphabet Inc  has made an offer to acquire U.S. wearable device maker Fitbit Inc , as it eyes a slice of the crowded market for fitness trackers and smartwatches, people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. regulator to bar China's Huawei and ZTE from government subsidy program
Description: The U.S. telecommunications regulator plans to vote in November to designate China's Huawei and ZTE as national security risks, barring their U.S. rural carrier customers from tapping an $8.5 billion government fund to purchase equipment or services.

Headlines: U.S.-China tensions spur progress on giant Asia trade pact
Description: Tensions between the United States and China have given new impetus to a China-backed trade pact and there is a chance of major progress, if not final agreement, when Southeast Asian leaders meet in Bangkok this week, analysts say.

Headlines: Blackrock CEO says the world will see higher equity markets in 2020
Description: U.S. fund manager BlackRock Inc  chief executive said on Tuesday the world will see higher equity markets in 2020.

Headlines: Iran's thirsty energy industry runs up against water shortage
Description: The plan to build a petrochemical plant near the Iranian city of Firouzabad had everything usually needed to get a project off the ground: approval from the nation's top authority, funding from the Revolutionary Guards and plentiful gas feedstock.

Headlines: Factbox: Downstream Iranian energy projects disrupted by water crisis
Description: Below is a list of Iranian downstream energy projects where construction has been delayed and existing facilities where operations have been disrupted due to water scarcity.  [L5N26W2I0]

Headlines: Three-peat? Fed copies 1990s playbook in bid to avert a downturn
Description: In the midst of what became a golden decade for the U.S. Federal Reserve, central bankers twice in the 1990s cut interest rates in short bursts that managed to help the U.S. economy continue growing despite slowing investment and weak growth overseas.

Headlines: Australian regulator files privacy suit against Google alleging location data misuse
Description: An Australian regulator has filed a lawsuit against Alphabet Inc's Google, accusing it of misleading smartphone users about how it collected and used personal location data, advancing a global crackdown on the world's biggest tech firms.

Headlines: VW ramps up China electric car factories, taking aim at Tesla
Description: Volkswagen AG  is ramping up production of electric cars to around 1 million vehicles by end of 2022, according to manufacturing plans seen by Reuters, enabling the German carmaker to leapfrog Tesla Inc and making China the key battleground.

Headlines: Amazon could challenge loss of $10 billion Pentagon cloud deal as early as next week
Description: If Amazon.com decides to fight the Pentagon's decision to award a highly contested $10 billion cloud computing contract to Microsoft, it could act as early as next week.

Headlines: California regulator to probe utilities' mass power outages aimed at preventing fires
Description: California regulators said on Monday they will open a formal probe of whether utilities violated any rules by cutting power to millions of residents for days as a precaution during recent periods of high winds and heightened wildfire risks.

Headlines: 'We know we made mistakes' on 737 MAX: Boeing CEO
Description: Boeing Co Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg will acknowledge on Tuesday that the aircraft manufacturer made mistakes, as he appears at a congressional hearing on two 737 MAX crashes that killed 346 people, according to written testimony made public on Monday.

Headlines: Japan tax agency finds Ghosn used Nissan money for private use: report
Description: Japan's tax authorities have determined former Nissan Motor Co Ltd  boss Carlos Ghosn used company money for private use, bolstering the automaker's case that he diverted corporate funds for personal gain, the Yomiuri reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: United, Avianca and Copa's South American deal delayed as they mull fourth partner
Description: A proposed joint venture between United Airlines, Colombia's Avianca Holdings and Panama's Copa Holdings has been delayed due to the potential inclusion of a fourth partner, as well as problems at Avianca, the CEOs of two of the companies said.

Headlines: Justice Department issues grand jury subpoenas in J&J opioid probe: filing
Description: Johnson & Johnson  received grand jury subpoenas in August from the U.S. attorney's office for the Eastern District of New York related to its opioid medication policies, the company said in a regulatory filing on Monday.

Headlines: Microsoft says Russia-linked hackers target sports organizations
Description: Microsoft Corp said it has tracked "significant" cyberattacks coming from a group it calls "Strontium" or "Fancy Bear", targeting anti-doping authorities and global sporting organizations.

Headlines: Trump administration eases risks for banks on false lending claims
Description: The Trump administration said on Monday it would try to entice banks to offer more mortgages to low-income borrowers by reducing reliance on a Civil War-era law the Obama administration used in the wake of the subprime mortgage crisis to build bad-lending cases against big banks.

Headlines: Google results to share stage with U.S. antitrust probe
Description: Beyond fresh insights into Alphabet Inc's quarterly earnings on Monday, financial analysts could press executives for details on the U.S. antitrust probe by 48 states.

Headlines: Google's search for sales in cloud, hardware clip Alphabet profit
Description: Google parent Alphabet Inc  reported quarterly results on Monday that show costs continue to rise faster than revenue as the web search leader seeks to broaden its business, dampening Wall Street's enthusiasm despite Google's continued dominance in advertising sales.

Headlines: Trade optimism, Fed rate-cut expectation sends S&P 500 to record
Description: The S&P 500 hit a record high on Monday, while the Nasdaq fell just short of its lifetime high touched in late July as a more civil tone between the United States and China lifted hopes for a possible trade deal and investors looked toward a Federal Reserve rate cut later this week.

Headlines: TSMC, GlobalFoundries settle patent disputes
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd (TSMC)  and smaller contract chipmaking rival GlobalFoundries Inc on Monday agreed to dismiss all patent litigations between themselves and those that involve their customers.

Headlines: Beyond Meat to offer more store discounts as competition heats up; shares fall
