Description: Beyond Meat Inc reported its first ever net profit and raised its full-year sales forecast, but shares tumbled 6.5% in extended trading as the vegan burger maker said it would need to offer more store discounts or promotions as competition heats up.

Headlines: T-Mobile beats quarterly phone subscriber estimates
Description: T-Mobile US Inc  on Monday beat analysts' third-quarter estimates for net new phone subscribers who pay a monthly bill, boosted by competitive wireless plans aimed at fending off its bigger rivals.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers will press Boeing CEO for answers on 737 MAX crashes
Description: The head of a U.S. Senate panel reviewing two catastrophic Boeing 737 MAX crashes told Reuters ahead of hearings this week that the plane would not return to U.S. skies until "99.9% of the American public" and policymakers are convinced it is safe.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin awarded $7 billion U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp  has been awarded a $7 billion modification to a contract providing for 114 F-35 aircraft for the U.S. Air Force, the U.S. Marine Corps, the U.S. Navy, and the governments of Norway, Australia and Italy, the Pentagon said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump: 'ahead of schedule' on China trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he expected to sign a significant part of the trade deal with China ahead of schedule but did not elaborate on the timing.

Headlines: U.S. may extend tariff suspensions on $34 billion in Chinese goods
Description: The United States Trade Representative is studying whether to extend tariff suspensions on $34 billion of Chinese goods set to expire on Dec. 28 this year, the agency said on Monday.

Headlines: Micron launches new storage drives to challenge Intel in data centers
Description: (The October 24 story corrects to reflect that Micron's new devices are solid-state drives rather than hard drives with spinning disks.)

Headlines: Richard Branson's Virgin Galactic soars before crashing to earth in NYSE debut
Description: Richard Branson-backed Virgin Galactic Holdings Inc  fetched a valuation of around $2.3 billion on its market debut on Monday, after shares in the first publicly traded space tourism company popped before fizzling out.

Headlines: Lebanon's central bank urges quick solution to avoid future collapse
Description: Lebanon's central bank governor said on Monday a solution must be found in days to a crisis unleashed by huge protests against the ruling elite, saying this would restore confidence and avoid any future economic collapse.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade hopes boost stocks; dollar weak
Description: An index of global stock markets rallied to a 21-month high on Monday, boosted by growing hopes for a U.S.-China trade deal and the view that the U.S. Federal Reserve this week will deliver its third interest rate cut for 2019.

Headlines: Oil falls on weak Chinese data, forecasts for U.S. crude stocks build
Description: Oil prices fell on Monday after four days of gains as expectations U.S. crude stockpiles will rise and worries about weak Chinese industrial data offset hopes oil demand will increase if talks progress on a Sino-American trade deal.

Headlines: Ford to cut 450 jobs at Canada plant on Flex, Lincoln MKT production halt
Description: Ford Motor Co will cut about 450 jobs at its Oakville assembly plant in Ontario, as the No. 2 U.S. carmaker discontinues production of the Ford Flex and Lincoln MKT, Canada's largest private-sector union Unifor said https://reut.rs/2pmAPhJ on Monday.

Headlines: De Beers banks on 'diamonds are for me'
Description: Anglo American  unit De Beers said its 2019 marketing budget will exceed last year's figure of $170 million and will focus on the biggest market the United States, where women lavishing diamonds on themselves has boosted sales.

Headlines: New tuberculosis treatment for developing countries to cost $1,040
Description: A newly approved three-drug treatment for tuberculosis will be available in 150 countries including India and South Africa, priced at $1,040 for a complete regimen, more than twice the cost proposed in the past by advocacy groups for other treatments.

Headlines: LVMH woos Tiffany to tap fast-growing jewellery market
Description: LVMH has offered to buy Tiffany & Co, known for its engagement rings and ties to Hollywood glamour, as the owner of Louis Vuitton and Bulgari seeks to expand in jewellery, one of the fastest-growing parts of the luxury goods market.

Headlines: Pentagon deal to boost Microsoft's position in cloud computing: analysts
Description: Amazon.com Inc's  firm grip on the cloud computing market could be threatened by Microsoft Corp's  multi-billion dollar contract with the Pentagon, Wall Street analysts said on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Lebanon needs solution to crisis in days - Central bank governor
Description: Lebanon needs a political solution to the country's crisis in days to regain confidence and avert a future economic collapse, Central Bank Governor Riad Salameh told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: AT&T to add directors, sell up to $10 billion in assets next year
Description: AT&T Inc on Monday unveiled a three-year strategic plan that included selling up to $10 billion worth of businesses next year, paying off all its debt from the purchase of Time Warner and adding two new board members, bowing to pressure from activist investor Elliott Management.

Headlines: Lebanese banks to secure salaries, remain closed Tuesday: statement
Description: Lebanese banks will stay shut on Tuesday amid ongoing unrest, but are working to ensure public and private sector workers receive their salary payments, the country's banking association said on Monday.

Headlines: Lebanon's eurobonds drop after cenbank chief says solution needed to avert collapse
Description: Lebanon's eurobonds sharpened their sell-off on Monday after Central Bank Governor Riad Salameh said a political solution was needed to the country's crisis in days to regain confidence and avoid a future economic collapse.

Headlines: Ken Fisher says no lay-offs despite withdrawals over his remarks
Description: Fisher Investments founder Ken Fisher said there will be no lay-offs at his Washington state investment firm despite some $3 billion in withdrawals by pension funds and others over allegedly sexist remarks he made at an investor conference.

Headlines: Spotify shares surge after surprise profit, rise in paid users
Description: Spotify Technology SA  posted a surprise profit and beat Wall Street expectations for third-quarter revenue as the music streaming company added more-than-expected subscribers to its premium service, sending its shares up 12%.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. will cooperate with 'like-minded' nations on 5G networks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said in a letter Monday the United States plans to cooperate with "like-minded nations" to promote security in next-generation 5G networks.

Headlines: Ebbing flows curb U.S. goods trade deficit; inventories mixed
Description: The U.S. goods trade deficit fell in September as trade tensions restricted the flow of goods, but that did not change views that economic growth decelerated further in the third quarter amid slowing consumer spending and declining business investment.

Headlines: U.S. air travel regulator calls for focus on safety as deadly crash anniversary nears
Description: The head of the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) on Monday made a broad appeal for the airline industry to focus on safety, one day before the first anniversary of a deadly crash involving Lion Air and a Boeing 737 MAX plane that cost hundreds of lives.

Headlines: Exclusive: Wells Fargo lays off more than 200 business bankers in U.S. - sources
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  has laid off more than 200 bankers in its U.S. lending divisions in recent months, as the bank reacted to business trends and restructured some units, sources familiar with the matter said this week.

Headlines: Factbox: LVMH's jewelry and watches business
Description: LVMH has offered to buy Tiffany & Co, the U.S. jewelry retailer known for its engagement rings and ties to Hollywood glamor.

Headlines: Small U.S. oil and gas companies get cold shoulder from large banks
Description: The largest banking lenders to the U.S. oil and gas sector are becoming more cautious, marking down their expectations for oil and gas prices that underpin loans in a move expected to put further financial stress on struggling producers, industry and banking sources said.

Headlines: Carlsberg forecasts 10% profit growth for 2019
Description: Danish brewer Carlsberg  revised upwards its annual profit growth outlook on Monday, saying it now expects organic operating profit to rise by around 10% versus a previous forecast for a "high single-digit" percentage increase.

Headlines: UniCredit unveils 2015 data breach involving 3 million Italian clients
Description: UniCredit  has uncovered a data breach involving the personal records of 3 million domestic clients, it said on Monday, the third security incident at Italy's top bank in recent years.

Headlines: KKR adds Deutsche Bank to defense supplier Hensoldt's IPO lineup: sources
Description: Private equity firm KKR  has added Deutsche Bank  and KKR Capital Markets as additional global coordinators for the planned stock market flotation of German defense supplier Hensoldt, people close to the matter said.

Headlines: U.S. rejects sanctions sought by China in tariffs case, going to arbitration: trade official
Description: The United States rejected China's request on Monday for $2.4 billion in compensatory sanctions for alleged U.S. failure to comply with a World Trade Organization (WTO) ruling, sending it to arbitration, Geneva trade official said.

Headlines: Bitcoin holds ground after China voices support for blockchain
Description: Bitcoin held ground on Monday near a one-month high scaled over the weekend after China's president Xi Jinping said the world's second biggest economy should accelerate the development of blockchain technology.

Headlines: AT&T adds more monthly bill-paying subscribers than expected
Description: AT&T Inc  added more mobile phone subscribers who pay a monthly bill than analysts' estimates for the third quarter as the wireless carrier attracted customers with media content bundled with phone plans.

Headlines: Microsoft beats Amazon for Pentagon's $10 billion cloud computing contract
Description: Microsoft Corp.  has won the Pentagon's $10 billion cloud computing contract, the Defense Department said on Friday, beating out favorite Amazon.com Inc .

Headlines: Key dates leading up to the U.S. Pentagon's cloud-computing award to Microsoft
Description: Microsoft Corp  has won the U.S. Pentagon's $10 billion cloud-computing contract, the Defense Department said on Friday, beating out favorite Amazon.com Inc .

Headlines: The Force is with Microsoft: Shares up on winning JEDI contract
Description: Microsoft  shares rise 3.4% to $145.50 premarket, after company wins the Pentagon's $10 billion cloud computing contract.

Headlines: Brazil rates to hit record low 5.00%, seen falling further: Reuters poll
Description: Brazil's benchmark interest rate will be cut to a record low of 5.00% on Wednesday, according to the unanimous view in a Reuters poll of economists, as the central bank battles to spur economic growth and prevent inflation from falling further below target.

Headlines: In a Nike factory in Argentina's hinterland, the ghost of Macri's fall
Description: Rumors of layoffs started spreading among workers at a factory here in northeastern Argentina making Nike Inc  shoes the night before Cristian Fredy Aquino's scheduled shift.

Headlines: Investors brace for poor U.S. shale earnings amid weak oil and gas prices
Description: Investors are bracing for weaker results from U.S. shale players in coming days as lower oil and natural gas prices and cost-cutting measures have weighed on third-quarter operations.

Headlines: Exclusive: Thai Siam Cement's packaging unit set for $1 billion IPO - sources
Description: Thailand's Siam Cement Pcl's (SCG)  packaging subsidiary is planning a local listing, in a float that is set to raise about $1 billion, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Lazard appoints Girodolle CEO of Lazard France
Description: Lazard  said on Sunday it had appointed Jean-Louis Girodolle as CEO of Lazard Investment Banking in France, just a week after its chairman and CEO Matthieu Pigasse resigned.

Headlines: Prologis to buy warehouse rival Liberty in $12.6 billion deal
Description: Warehouse giant Prologis Inc  said on Sunday it had agreed to acquire rival industrial real-estate business Liberty Property Trust  in a $12.6 billion deal to improve its U.S. presence amid the ecommerce boom.

Headlines: French luxury group LVMH offers to buy U.S. jeweler Tiffany: sources
Description: Louis Vuitton owner LVMH  has approached Tiffany & Co  with a $14.5 billion acquisition offer, people familiar with the matter said, at a time when the U.S. luxury jeweler grapples with the impact of tariffs on its exports to China.

Headlines: Exclusive: Brazil to lure airlines to fly domestic, taking meetings with three carriers
Description: Brazil is determined to lure airlines to operate domestic flights in Latin America's largest aviation market, and is taking meetings with at least three carriers, a senior government official told Reuters.

Headlines: Brazil working to bring Boeing 737 MAX plane back into service this year
Description: Brazil is working to bring the Boeing 737 MAX airplane back to service "by the end of the year," Civil Aviation Secretary Ronei Glanzmann said on Sunday.

Headlines: UBS wants new recruit Khan to drop criminal complaint over spying: paper
Description: UBS  wants Iqbal Khan, co-head of its wealth management business, to drop his criminal complaint over a spying scandal that emerged after he left cross-town rival Credit Suisse , the SonntagsZeitung newspaper reported on Sunday.

Headlines: China should ease regulations for foreign financial institutions: HSBC executive
Description: China should ease regulations so that foreign financial institutions can obtain licenses and raise deposits more easily in the country, a senior executive from HSBC   said on Sunday.

Headlines: China studying blockchain application for forex - regulator
Description: China is studying the application of blockchain and artificial intelligence in cross-border financing with a focus on risk management, and will further liberalize its capital markets, a senior foreign exchange regulator said on Sunday.

Headlines: Leading union demands concessions in Thyssenkrupp elevator sale
Description: Top representatives at IG Metall, Germany's biggest union, will not approve a sale of Thyssenkrupp's  prized elevator division unless potential buyers give far-reaching concessions to employees, they said.

Headlines: China's industrial profits fall 5.3% in Sept as trade war toll mounts
Description: Profits at China's industrial firms contracted for the second straight month in September as producer prices continued their slide, highlighting the toll a slowing economy and protracted U.S. trade war are having taken on corporate balance sheets.

Headlines: Microsoft: 'appreciate' winning JEDI contract - statement
Description: Microsoft Corp.  said in a statement on Saturday that the company appreciates being chosen by the U.S. Defense department (DoD) for the Pentagon's $10 billion Joint Enterprise Defense Infrastructure Cloud (JEDI) contract.

Headlines: JS Global pulls Hong Kong listing amid trade gloom: sources
Description: Household appliances maker JS Global Lifestyle Company Ltd  pulled its initial public offering of up to HK$3.62 billion ($464 million) on Saturday, the third float delayed in Hong Kong so far this year, two sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Tech consultations on parts of U.S. trade deal completed: China's Commerce Ministry
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He had a phone call with U.S. trade officials as both countries confirmed technical consultations on some parts of a trade agreement were basically completed, China's Ministry of Commerce said in a statement on Saturday.

Headlines: Lagarde will take ECB out of ivory tower: De Guindos in El Pais
Description: Christine Lagarde will ensure European Central Bank policymakers climb down from their "ivory tower" and face the political realities of the euro zone, the ECB's vice president, Luis de Guindos, said in an interview published on Saturday.

Headlines: U.S., China say they are 'close to finalizing' part of a Phase One trade deal
Description: U.S. and Chinese officials are "close to finalizing" some parts of a trade agreement after high-level telephone discussions on Friday, the U.S. Trade Representative's office and China's Commerce Ministry said, with talks to continue.

Headlines: S&P 500 nears record high on trade progress, upbeat Intel earnings
Description: U.S. stocks rose on Friday after Washington said it was close to finalizing parts of a trade pact with Beijing and strong quarterly results from Intel Corp  boosted investor sentiment, sending the S&P 500 briefly over the record high close it set three months ago.

Headlines: UAW turns to Ford after GM workers approve new contract
Description: The United Auto Workers union said on Friday it has chosen Ford Motor Co  as the next U.S. automaker the union will negotiate with after workers at General Motors Co  approved a new contract deal.

Headlines: General Motors to restart Mexican plants after labor deal ratified
Description: General Motors Co  will gradually restart operations at several idled plants in Mexico beginning this weekend, after unionized workers for the U.S. automaker ratified a new labor contract, the company's Mexican unit said on Friday.

Headlines: Johnson & Johnson CEO testified Baby Powder was safe 13 days before FDA bombshell
Description: Facing off against a plaintiff’s lawyer for the first time about Johnson & Johnson’s Baby Powder, the company’s Chief Executive Alex Gorsky earlier this month insisted that the company’s iconic brand was safe.

Headlines: Timeline: UAW members ratify new labor deal with GM to end strike
Description: The United Auto Workers union said on Friday its members ratified a new four-year labor contract with General Motors Co  , ending the strike with the No. 1 U.S. automaker after 40 days.

Headlines: Indonesia report on 737 MAX crash faults Boeing design, says Lion Air made mistakes
Description: Boeing, acting without adequate oversight from U.S. regulators, failed to grasp risks in the design of cockpit software on its 737 MAX airliner, sowing the seeds for a Lion Air crash that also involved errors by airline workers and crew, Indonesian investigators found.

Headlines: Boeing completes year of turmoil with promise to Indonesia on 737 MAX crash
Description: Boeing Co on Friday promised to act on safety recommendations for its 737 MAX aircraft made in a new report by Indonesian investigators on the deadly Lion Air crash a year ago.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Bond fund managers see risk Fed cuts rates to zero
Description: Speculation the Federal Reserve will continue cutting interest rates well past its policy meeting next week is pushing some bond fund managers into assets ranging from short-term Treasury bills to half-paid off 15-year home mortgages.

Headlines: Global stocks, dollar, yields climb on trade progress news
Description: Global stock indexes, the dollar and bond yields rose on Friday, with the S&P 500 nearing a record high as the United States said it was close to finalizing parts of a trade deal with China.

Headlines: Two charities to pay $6 million to resolve U.S. pharma kickback probe
Description: Two charities will pay $6 million to resolve claims they operated as pass-throughs for seven pharmaceutical companies to pay kickbacks to Medicare patients using their high-priced medications, the U.S. Justice Department said on Friday.

Headlines: UAW to bargain next with Ford on new contract deal: sources
Description: The United Auto Workers union is set to announce later on Friday it has chosen Ford Motor Co  as the next U.S. automaker the union will negotiate with, sources briefed on the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: What slowdown? China's riding to the rescue of luxury brands
Description: When Tiffany & Co said this month it was sending its priciest jewelry to mainland China to reach wealthy shoppers no longer jet-setting abroad, it reflected a trend helping global luxury brands weather a Chinese economic slowdown.

Headlines: Exxon Mobil seeks buyer for Montana refinery: sources
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp  is seeking a potential buyer for its roughly 60,000 barrel per day Billings, Montana refinery, according to three sources familiar with Exxon’s plans.

Headlines: General Motors strike to dent U.S. October job growth
Description: A strike by General Motors  workers should weigh on U.S. job growth in October, government data showed on Friday.

Headlines: Toyota's not alone in the slow lane to self-driving cars
Description: When Toyota Motor Corp  launches its all-battery Lexus next year, the luxury model will be able to drive autonomously on highways, a big step for the Japanese automaker, which has so far trailed rivals in bringing self-driving cars to market.

Headlines: U.S. denies China's claim of 'weaponizing' visa decisions for Washington space meeting
Description: The United States on Friday rejected Chinese accusations that political motives were behind a top Beijing space official not receiving a visa in time to attend the start of an international conference in Washington this week.

Headlines: U.S. government's annual budget deficit largest since 2012
Description: The U.S. government ended fiscal year 2019 with the largest budget deficit in seven years as gains in tax receipts were offset by higher spending and growing debt service payments, the Treasury department said on Friday.

Headlines: Brazilian beverage distributors file antitrust complaint against Ambev
Description: Beverage distributors working for Brazilian brewer Ambev SA  have filed a complaint against the company at the local antitrust regulator Cade, accusing it of anticompetitive practices.

Headlines: Oil prices clock strong weekly gains on trade hopes, crude supply
Description: Oil prices rose on Friday, registering the strongest weekly gains in more than a month as support from optimism over a U.S.-China trade deal, falling U.S. crude stocks and possible action from OPEC to extend output cuts outweighed broader economic concerns.

Headlines: White House adviser Navarro fighting 'Phase One’ of U.S.-China trade dealL CNBC
Description: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro is fighting "Phase One" of the China trade deal announced by U.S. President Donald Trump on Oct. 11, CNBC reported on Friday, citing sources.

Headlines: Tesla starts selling China-made Model 3 with autopilot function
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla  on Friday started selling its China-made Model 3 with an autopilot function priced from 355,800 yuan ($50,310), making it the company's cheapest model on sale in the country, the official website showed.

Headlines: United Airlines says in talks with Apple on San Francisco airport upgrade
Description: United Airlines is in early discussions with Apple Inc about upgrading the U.S. carrier's terminal at San Francisco International airport, United's Chief Digital Officer Linda Jojo told journalists on Friday without providing more details.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler recalls 108,000 diesel Ram 1500 pickup trucks for coolant leaks
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV  said on Friday it is recalling 108,000 Ram 1500 diesel-powered pickup trucks in the United States for coolant leaks tied to reports of some fires and four minor injuries.

Headlines: United wants Azul in Latin American venture with Copa, Avianca
Description: United Airlines  wants to include Brazil's Azul  in its planned tie-up with Copa Holdings  and Colombia's Avianca Holdings  to create a four-way partnership in Latin America, a senior executive said on Friday.

Headlines: Fisher loses another $584 million from high-profile clients
Description: A Texas retirement system and Goldman Sachs Group Inc pulled a combined $584 million from Fisher Investments on Friday, after allegations that firm founder Ken Fisher made sexist comments at a conference.

Headlines: Russia affirms close oil cooperation with Saudi Arabia, OPEC+
Description: Russia's energy ministry said on Friday it continues close cooperation with Saudi Arabia and OPEC and non-OPEC oil producers to enhance market stability and predictability.

Headlines: Mexico expects U.S. Congress to start formal trade deal approval soon
Description: Mexico expects U.S. lawmakers to soon begin the process of approving a new trade deal between the two countries and Canada now that President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador has promised wage increases and funding for labor reforms, a senior Mexican official said on Friday.

Headlines: MSCI CEO says limiting capital flows to China would be 'devastating'
Description: Restricting the flow of U.S. capital to China would have a "devastating" impact on global markets, the head of index provider MSCI Inc  told CNBC on Friday.

Headlines: United Airlines' plans to sunset 757s depends on 737 MAX timing: COO
Description: United Airlines  wants to sunset older Boeing Co  757s "as soon as possible" but the timing will depend on when the Boeing 737 MAX starts flying again, Chief Operating Officer Andrew Nocella told journalists on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Qatar pushes for Deutsche Bank chairman to go - sources
Description: Qatari investors in Deutsche Bank  want the lender's chairman to leave after he botched an attempt to appoint their envoy to the board, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Richemont teams up with designer Alber Elbaz for fashion venture
Description: Richemont  said on Friday that it was teaming up with former Lanvin designer Alber Elbaz for a new venture at a time when luxury goods groups are vying to make star hires.

Headlines: Exclusive: Qatar pushes for Deutsche Bank chairman to go - sources
Description: Qatari investors in Deutsche Bank  want the lender's chairman to leave after he botched an attempt to appoint their envoy to the board, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Big U.S. retailers pull 22-ounce J&J baby powder off shelves after recall
Description: Four major U.S. retailers, including Walmart and Target Corp, are removing all 22-ounce bottles of Johnson & Johnson's baby powder from their stores, following the healthcare conglomerate's recall last week of some bottles due to possible asbestos contamination.

Headlines: USTR says close to finalizing parts of trade deal with China
Description: The United States and China are close to finalizing some sections of a trade agreement after a phone call between top negotiators, the U.S. Trade Representative's office said on Friday.

Headlines: EasyJet adds Orly baggage connections with long-haul partners
Description: Low-cost airline easyJet  has added baggage services to its flight-connections partnership with two budget long-haul carriers flying from Paris, in a move that challenges Air France on transatlantic and Caribbean leisure routes.

Headlines: Verizon earnings beat estimates as cheaper plans attract customers
Description: Verizon Communications Inc  beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit and revenue on Friday, as the largest U.S. wireless carrier cut prices of its unlimited plans to pull in more subscribers who pay monthly bills.

Headlines: Boeing considered system redesign before accidents: NTSB report
Description: Boeing  engineers and test pilots considered before two fatal 737 MAX crashes whether an anti-stall system should be redesigned after discussing how flawed data from a single sensor could trigger it repeatedly, U.S. investigators have found.

Headlines: U.S. FAA revokes certification of Xtra Aerospace after Lion Air crash
Description: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) on Friday revoked the repair certification of Florida-based Xtra Aerospace LLC, which fixed a sensor suspected of contributing to the catastrophic crash of a Lion Air 737 MAX a year ago.

Headlines: Amazon sales forecast, slower cloud growth disappoint investors
Description: Shares of Amazon.com Inc were down 3% on Friday, as investors were let down by a lower-than-expected sales outlook and surprised by slower revenue growth at its lucrative AWS cloud business.

Headlines: Britain's ARM to continue supplying chip technology to Huawei
Description: Chip designer ARM will continue to supply Huawei Technologies after the British company's legal team ruled that its chip technology is of UK origin and would not breach U.S. restrictions on supplying the Chinese tech giant.

Headlines: Estonian minister blamed for slow reform after Danske scandal
Description: Estonia's far-right finance minister has been criticized by lawmakers for holding up financial reforms promised after the Baltic state became the focus of Europe's biggest money laundering scandal.

Headlines: Exclusive: India probe finds AB InBev, Carlsberg, United Breweries colluded on prices - sources
Description: The investigations unit of India's Competition Commission has concluded that Anheuser-Busch InBev , Carlsberg  and United Breweries  colluded to fix beer prices, two people with direct knowledge told Reuters.

Headlines: Brazil's Vale CEO says not yet time to resume dividends
Description: Vale SA's  chief executive officer said on Friday that a resumption in paying dividends or share buybacks would depend on progress in repairing the damage from its Brumadinho tailings dam collapse, which killed more than 250 people.

Headlines: Behind AT&T's plan to take on Netflix, Apple and Disney with HBO Max
Description: In the bestselling novel "Circe" -- optioned by WarnerMedia for its forthcoming HBO Max streaming service -- the daughter of the Greek god Helios tames wild beasts and menaces the gods.

Headlines: Take Five: Brextension, Brelection, Bremain
Description: Oct 31 was when Britain was to exit the European Union, with Prime Minister Boris Johnson saying he would rather be "dead in a ditch" than delay Brexit again. But with the UK parliament failing to play along, he's been forced to ask for an extension and the EU will decide on Monday or Tuesday long it will be.

Headlines: How SoftBank made WeWork an offer it had to accept
Description: By Mike Spector, Joshua Franklin, Greg Roumeliotis and Anirban Sen

Headlines: AB InBev loses $13 billion in value as beer drinking slows in Brazil and South Korea
Description: Anheuser-Busch InBev  saw more than $13 billion wiped off its market value on Friday, after a profit warning and weaker-than-expected third-quarter earnings growth sparked by reduced demand for its beer in Brazil and South Korea.

Headlines: Amazon's AWS unit gets OK to build $800 million data facility in Argentina
Description: Argentina has given the go-ahead to Amazon.com Inc's Web Services division AWS to build an $800-million data facility in Buenos Aires, which would mark a massive investment for the company in South America, according to a provincial bulletin dated Oct. 24.

Headlines: 'Rhetoric' masks lack of progress on gender diversity in finance: UK watchdog
Description: The number of women in senior roles at financial services firms in Britain has flatlined since 2005 despite diversity "rhetoric" from industry, according to research from the Financial Conduct Authority.

Headlines: Factbox: 'Fly up' co-pilot urges in final moments of fatal Lion Air crash
Description: A final Indonesian report on the fatal crash of Lion Air flight 610 published on Friday details stress and confusion in the cockpit as the Boeing 737 MAX's MCAS software, misled by faulty sensor readings, repeatedly lowered the plane's nose.

Headlines: EU readies stricter rules against money laundering: document
Description: The European Union is getting ready to tighten rules against money laundering, an EU draft document shows, a year after previous reforms now deemed inadequate to tackle a series of banking scandals.

Headlines: Heineken to invest $244 million in Brazil by 2020 to double capacity: paper
Description: Heineken , the world's second-largest brewer, will invest 985 million reais ($244 million) in Brazil to double its production capacity, CEO Mauricio Giamellaro told the Valor Econômico newspaper in an interview published on Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street firms record best first-half profit in a decade: report
Description: Wall Street firms recorded their best first half in a decade as profits rose 11%, but a slowdown in the global economy and ongoing trade tensions could hit earnings in the second half of 2019, according to a report from the New York State Comptroller.

Headlines: Airless tire makers hope for breakout moment with autonomous driving
Description: Makers of airless tires such as Japan's Bridgestone Corp. hope driverless cars will herald a breakthrough for their niche technology, which is more than a decade old but underperforms standard tires in every way except resistance to puncture.

Headlines: Future delivery: Japanese trucks designed with no cabin and interchangeable cargo holds
Description: In Japan, trucks are being designed for a driverless future with no cabin and interchangeable container areas that would allow vehicles to be highly customized for parcel delivery or even serve as mini-hotels or beauty salons.

Headlines: JLR parent posts smaller loss as China demand picks up
Description: Jaguar Land Rover owner Tata Motors  posted a smaller-than-expected loss in the second quarter on Friday as a pick up in sales of its luxury car in China helped it ride out weak vehicles sales in India, its home market.

Headlines: H&M opens new-look small boutique in Berlin, plans more
Description: H&M  opened a boutique-like store in a trendy neighbourhood in Berlin on Friday that offers yoga classes, a cafe with a garden and space for other brands as the Swedish budget chain seeks a new look to revive flagging sales.

Headlines: Renault looks for new partners, third-quarter revenue falls
Description: French carmaker Renault  is on the hunt for new partners to buy its cars and components as it reported a fall in quarterly revenue and pushed ahead on a strategic review with "nothing off the table".

Headlines: SoftBank to write down minimum $5 billion for WeWork, other losses: Bloomberg
Description: SoftBank has ample funds to endure the pain from its massive bailout of WeWork, analysts said, even as it is reportedly set to write down at least $5 billion due to a slump in the value of the U.S. office sharing startup and some other top holdings.

Headlines: BMW CEO says trade war could cost U.S. jobs
Description: BMW  has told United States trade representatives, including Robert Lighthizer, that intensifying a global trade war could threaten jobs in South Carolina, Chief Executive Oliver Zipse said on Friday.

Headlines: Factbox: Which HBO subscribers will get HBO Max at no extra charge?
Description: Next week, when WarnerMedia reveals details about its upcoming subscription streaming video service HBO Max, some current HBO subscribers in the United States will learn that they will have access to the new service at no additional charge.

Headlines: Judge asks Samsung heir to be humble at bribery trial
Description: A South Korean judge overseeing Samsung Group heir Jay Y. Lee's bribery trial told him on Friday to "humbly accept" whatever the outcome of the trial, which could result in a tougher sentence for the conglomerate's de-facto leader.

Headlines: Debenhams appoints chairman, investors lend support through Christmas
Description: British department store group Debenhams said Mark Gifford, a former chief financial officer at rival House of Fraser, had been appointed as the chairman of its parent group Celine Jersey Topco.

Headlines: Kering shares surge as Gucci shines despite Hong Kong protests
Description: Kering  led a luxury goods share rally on Friday after its star fashion label Gucci posted stronger-than-expected sales, demonstrating how some brands have so far managed to counter the hit from protests in Hong Kong.

Headlines: Deeper global slowdown still more likely despite round of rate cuts: Reuters poll
Description: A steeper decline in global economic growth still more likely than a synchronized recovery, even as multiple central banks dole out rounds of monetary easing, according to economists polled by Reuters in recent weeks.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's WeWork equivalent Ucommune files for U.S. IPO - sources
Description: China's biggest shared workspace provider Ucommune has filed a confidential prospectus with the U.S. securities regulator as it seeks an initial public offering (IPO) before the end of the year, two people with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: South Korea grounds nine Boeing 737 NG planes with cracks
Description: South Korea's transport ministry on Friday said nine Boeing Co  737 NG planes in the country had been grounded after checks found structural cracks requiring repairs.

Headlines: Citi names Fraser as president, putting her in line to be first female CEO
Description: Citigroup Inc  has promoted Jane Fraser to head of its global consumer bank and president, putting her in a position eventually to become the first female chief executive of the U.S. bank.

Headlines: Senate Democrat Schumer proposes plan to swap gas cars for electric vehicles
Description: Senator Chuck Schumer, the top Senate Democrat, late on Thursday proposed a $454 billion plan over 10 years to help shift the United States away from gasoline-powered vehicles by offering cash vouchers to help Americans buy cleaner vehicles.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia faces reality check as Wall Street heads to Riyadh
Description: Wall Street's heavy hitters are back in Saudi Arabia but the terms of engagement have changed.

Headlines: Twitter ad platform suffers tech glitches, hitting revenue; shares tumble
Description: Twitter Inc posted worse-than-expected quarterly revenue and profit on Thursday, plagued by technical issues that hurt its advertising, and unusually low demand over the summer, sending its shares down about 20%.

Headlines: UAW, Mack Trucks agree tentative deal, suspend two-week strike
Description: United Auto Workers (UAW) suspended a two-week-long strike after reaching a tentative deal with Volvo's  Mack Trucks  on Thursday, both parties said.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury temporarily blocks creditor seizure of refiner Citgo
Description: The United States on Thursday temporarily blocked a creditor seizure of Citgo, a win for political leaders in Venezuela struggling to retain control over the U.S. refiner owned by the chaotic South American nation.

Headlines: Watch Fox News? You likely think the U.S. economy is great. MSNBC viewers not so much
Description: The performance of the U.S. economy has been a solid clue to the outcome of past presidential elections.

Headlines: Amazon's gloomy holiday forecast misses estimates, shares fall 7%
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Thursday forecast revenue and profit for the holiday quarter below expectations, as it faces fierce competition and rising costs from its plan to speed up delivery times globally.

Headlines: Amazon's faster shipping dents profits, more pain to come
Description: Amazon.com Inc's chief financial officer on Thursday said costs for its one-day shipping program will spike to around $1.5 billion during the holiday season as the online retailer speeds up free delivery to woo shoppers and fend off rivals like Walmart Inc and Target Corp.

Headlines: HSBC, StanChart results to show Hong Kong protests are starting to gnaw
Description: HSBC Holdings Plc  and Standard Chartered Plc  are set to show early signs of strain from anti-government protests in Hong Kong, the single-biggest profit center for the two banks, when they report quarterly earnings next week.

Headlines: Massachusetts accuses Exxon in lawsuit of climate change deceit
Description: The state of Massachusetts sued Exxon Mobil Corp  on Thursday, accusing the oil giant of misleading investors and consumers for decades about the role fossil fuels play in climate change.

Headlines: Barneys close to sale to Authentic Brands after rival bid fails: sources
Description: Luxury retailer Barneys New York Inc is close to being sold to licensing firm Authentic Brands Group LLC after a competing bid from a trade show executive failed to qualify for a bankruptcy auction, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Brazil narrows field to China, Russia, France for Angra 3 nuclear partner
Description: (This October 23 story corrects paragraph 8; Westinghouse owned by Brookfield Business Partners, not Toshiba Corp as erroneously reported)

Headlines: Intel data center rebound eases U.S.-China trade war worries
Description: Intel Corp  on Thursday beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter revenue and profit and raised its full-year revenue forecast, powered by sales to data centers and easing concerns about slowing demand during the U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: Strong tech results propel S&P 500, Nasdaq
Description: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq rose on Thursday following strong quarterly reports from several technology companies, including Microsoft Corp , but dour results from 3M Co  stymied the Dow Jones Industrial Average.

Headlines: Albemarle cuts 2019 forecast on lithium price pressure
Description: Albemarle Corp , the world's largest lithium producer, on Thursday cut its sales and profit forecasts for the year, hit by a continued slump in prices for the white metal, sending its shares down nearly 7% in extended trading.

Headlines: FTC staff recommends approval of Roche deal for Spark: report
Description: The Federal Trade Commission staff reviewing Roche's  plan to buy U.S.-based gene therapy specialist Spark Therapeutics  for $4.3 billion recommended that the deal be approved without requiring any asset sales, the Capitol Forum reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Walmart pulls 22-ounce J&J baby powder from shelves - CNBC
Description: Walmart Inc has removed and blocked sales of Johnson & Johnson's 22-ounce baby powder bottles from its stores, CNBC reported on Thursday, making it the third large retailer to pull the product.

Headlines: Exclusive: Software under scrutiny in Airbus A220 engine failures
Description: A U.S.-led investigation into a series of engine failures on Airbus's smallest jet, the A220, is studying whether a software change allowed unexpected vibrations that tore parts and forced three emergency landings, several people familiar with the case said.

Headlines: Beyond Meat brings in Coca-Cola veteran to head marketing
Description: Beyond Meat Inc  will bring in Coca-Cola Co veteran Stuart Kronauge as its chief marketing officer, the vegan patty maker said on Thursday, as it looks to boost its presence in retail and restaurants.

Headlines: 'Never give up!' Draghi tells Lagarde as he leaves ECB
Description: European Central Bank President Mario Draghi told his successor on Thursday to "never give up" on propping up the euro zone economy in the face of a worsening outlook and little help from governments.

Headlines: Pound down vs dollar after PM calls for election; S&P 500 gains
Description: The British pound fell against the dollar on Thursday after British Prime Minister Boris Johnson's call for a national election, while global stock markets edged higher.

Headlines: Visa profit beats estimates on higher customer spending
Description: Visa Inc's  quarterly profit beat analysts' estimates on Thursday, helped by growth in overall customer spending, which boosted fees for the world's largest payment processor.

Headlines: American, Spirit eye more Mobile deliveries to avoid Airbus tariffs
Description: American Airlines Group  and Spirit Airlines  executives said on Thursday they were working with Airbus SE  to mitigate the impact of U.S. tariffs on European-made aircraft, including having more planes delivered from Mobile, Alabama.

Headlines: Oil extends gains despite weak demand outlook
Description: Oil prices extended their gains on Thursday, with Brent rising above $61 a barrel as a surprise drop in U.S. crude inventories and the prospect of further market-supporting action by OPEC and its allies offset some concern over the outlook for demand.

Headlines: Tesla overtakes GM as most valuable U.S. automaker, short sellers burned
Description: Tesla Inc  shares soared 17% on Thursday after the electric carmaker surprised Wall Street by delivering on Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk's promise of a profit in the third quarter, even as doubts remained about its long-term prospects.

Headlines: Ex-Deutsche Bank traders avoid prison time for Libor scheme
Description: Two former Deutsche Bank AG  traders will serve no prison time for conspiring to manipulate the Libor benchmark interest rate between 2005 and 2011, a federal judge ruled on Thursday, sharply criticizing U.S. prosecutors for treating the two men as "proxy wrongdoers" for a much larger scheme.

Headlines: American, Southwest overcome 737 MAX travails with quarterly profit growth
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  and Southwest Airlines Co  posted quarterly profit increases on Thursday thanks to strong U.S. travel demand even as the two carriers pointed to a rising cost impact from the continued grounding of the Boeing 737 MAX.

Headlines: Democratic senator asks whether Trump interfered with court case on Turkey's Halkbank
Description: A top Democratic senator on Thursday questioned whether President Donald Trump interfered with a criminal investigation of Turkey's Halkbank, which has been accused of conspiring to evade U.S. sanctions against Iran.

Headlines: New York Fed offers to inject more liquidity into the banking system
Description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York is boosting the size of the cash injections it can make into overnight borrowing markets.

Headlines: Rosneft switches contracts to euros from dollars due to U.S. sanctions
Description: Russia's largest oil company Rosneft  has fully switched the currency of its contracts to euros from U.S. dollars in a move to shield its transactions from U.S. sanctions, its Chief Executive Igor Sechin said on Thursday.

Headlines: White House aide: Phase one U.S.-China trade deal targets intellectual property
Description: An initial pact on U.S-China trade will include much of a scrapped May deal's agreement regarding intellectual property and will target enforcement mechanisms, White House trade adviser Peter Navarro said on Thursday, adding that he hopes the Chinese negotiate in "good faith."

Headlines: Vice President Pence says Trump hopes to tackle China IP theft after 'Phase 1' deal
Description: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence said on Tuesday that the Trump administration is aiming to complete a 'Phase 1' deal with China on agricultural purchases next month in Chile and move on to tackle intellectual property theft issues dividing the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: Fortum CEO says Uniper obstructed proposed purchase: Kommersant
Description: Uniper  deliberately obstructed Fortum's proposed purchase of a stake in the German utility by registering assets in Russia as strategic, Kommersant daily quoted Fortum  CEO Pekka Lundmark as saying on Thursday.

Headlines: Under pressure, Barclays restores UK post office cash withdrawals
Description: Barclays  on Thursday said it will maintain customers' ability to withdraw cash from Britain's Post Office branches, reversing a change announced earlier this month that angered the public and lawmakers amid cuts to the lender's branch network.

Headlines: U.S. senators ask FTC to probe Amazon over Capital One hack
Description: Two U.S. senators on Thursday asked the U.S. Federal Trade Commission to probe Amazon.com Inc  to determine if the company failed to secure its servers prior to the Capital One hack.

Headlines: Car parts maker Valeo says sales up but warns of GM strike impact
Description: French car parts supplier Valeo  cautioned on Thursday that the General Motors strike was currently costing it around 160 million euros ($178 million) in sales and around 50 million euros in operating margin terms.

Headlines: 3M cuts profit forecast after sales miss on slowing Asia demand
Description: 3M Co  on Thursday became the latest U.S manufacturer to signal American corporations are suffering from the trade war with China, after it reported quarterly revenue well short of Wall Street estimates and cut its full-year profit forecast.

Headlines: U.S. business investment still weak; jobless claims fall
Description: New orders for key U.S.-made capital goods fell more than expected in September and shipments also declined, a sign that business investment remains soft amid the fallout from the U.S.-China trade war but other data on Thursday showed the spat has yet to have much effect on the overall jobs market.

Headlines: FCA pays up to keep its Jeep brand on CR7 Juve jersey
Description: Italian-American carmaker Fiat Chrysler  more than doubled the value of a jersey sponsorship deal with Juventus  in a sign of increasing support from the Agnelli family for Italy's football champions.

Headlines: Raytheon profit beats estimates, raises 2019 forecast on higher weapons demand
Description: U.S. weapons maker Raytheon Company  reported better-than-expected third-quarter profit on Thursday and raised its full-year earnings and sales outlook, helped by higher demand for space programs, weapons and missile warning systems.

Headlines: Chemicals maker Dow cuts costs as global slowdown bites
Description: Dow Inc  beat Wall Street's tempered profit estimates in the third quarter as it cut costs to offset a sharp drop in demand for chemicals used in plastics and other manufacturing, sending its shares up more than 5%.

Headlines: U.S. new home sales dip in September; prices fall
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes fell in September as low inventories continue to weigh on sales even as prices saw the biggest monthly fall in five years.

Headlines: ECB's Draghi welcomes German nominee Schnabel
Description: European Central Bank President Mario Draghi on Thursday praised Germany's nominee for the executive board Isabel Schnabel as an excellent economist who would enhance discussions at the bank.

Headlines: Comcast tops profit forecast as it gains high-speed internet customers
Description: Comcast Corp  beat Wall Street profit and revenue estimates on Thursday, as the company added high-speed internet customers and lost more video subscribers than expected.

Headlines: Daimler third-quarter operating profit up 8%, boosted by Mercedes sales
Description: Daimler  reported a slight rise in third-quarter operating profit on Thursday, boosted by sales of Mercedes-Benz cars, sending its shares higher, but announced cost cuts and warned legal provisions tied to diesel litigation could rise.

Headlines: Challenged by electric cars, Brembo aims to put the brakes on noise
Description: Brembo's  distinctive colored brakes stop many of the world's fastest cars but when it comes to the electric vehicles of the future it faces a problem - traditional brakes are noisy.

Headlines: SoftBank clinches WeWork takeover deal, bailing out co-founder
Description: SoftBank Group agreed to spend more than $10 billion to take over WeWork on Tuesday, doubling down on an ill-fated investment and giving a near $1.7 billion payoff to the U.S. office-space sharing startup's co-founder Adam Neumann to relinquish control.

Headlines: WeWork's new chairman defends payouts to founder, says company will survive
Description: (This October 23 story corrects 16th paragraph to show that WeWork has sites in 123 cities, not countries.)

Headlines: Highlights: Draghi comments at ECB press conference
Description: The European Central Bank kept its ultra-easy monetary policy unchanged on Thursday, ending Mario Draghi's eight-year tenure at the bank in exactly the same place he started: trying to prop up a perpetually ailing currency bloc.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims unexpectedly fall
Description: The number of Americans filing applications for unemployment benefits unexpectedly fell last week, pointing to a still-tight jobs market even as hiring and economic growth has slowed.

Headlines: Southwest profit jumps 7.2% as demand, MAX cancellations push up fares
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  reported a 7.2% rise in third-quarter profit on Thursday, driven by strong travel demand and higher fares following flight cancellations due to the grounding of its Boeing 737 MAX jets.

Headlines: Hershey ups full-year sales forecast after third-quarter beat
Description: Hershey Co  raised its full-year revenue forecast after posting third-quarter results that beat Wall Street estimates on Thursday, driven by price increases and investments in snacking brands.

Headlines: Nissan explores sale of European plants amid falling sales: Bloomberg
Description: Nissan Motor Co Ltd  is considering selling two of its European plants as the Japanese carmaker faces falling sales in the region and an industry shift toward electric cars, Bloomberg reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Hyundai targets EV sales of over half a million by 2025, posts disappointing third-quarter
Description: South Korea's Hyundai Motor pledged to boost sales of electric vehicles (EV) to over half a million by 2025 as part of a bid to focus on new technologies and catch up with rivals, but some analysts saw the target as conservative and warned of the costs.

Headlines: Puma sees profit hit from U.S. tariffs on China
Description: German sportswear group Puma  cautioned on Thursday that it would take a hit from U.S. tariffs on China in the fourth quarter but still raised its sales forecast and narrowed its profit target after a strong third quarter in all regions.

Headlines: Tesla shares soar 21% as surprise profit answers skeptics
Description: Tesla Inc  on Wednesday surprised investors with a quarterly profit that sent its shares soaring, as Chief Executive Elon Musk promised a 2020 rollout of a cheaper SUV and more self-driving technology to stay ahead of larger rivals rushing into the premium electric vehicle market he created.

Headlines: Caterpillar cuts profit outlook as China construction sales slump
Description: Industrial bellwether Caterpillar Inc  reported a drop in sales in the United States and China in the third quarter, leading it to cut its outlook for the year and adding to evidence that the global economy is firmly on the decline.

Headlines: Ghosn's lawyers seek dismissal of charges, accuse prosecutors of misconduct
Description: Carlos Ghosn's lawyers have asked the Tokyo District Court to dismiss all charges against the former Nissan Motor Co Ltd  chairman, saying prosecutors colluded with government officials and Nissan executives to oust him from his post.

Headlines: Teva’s proposed opioid settlement could cost drugmaker pennies on the dollar
Description: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd's proposed $23 billion drug giveaway to settle thousands of U.S. opioid lawsuits will likely cost the company a fraction of that figure due to how it has valued those medicines, according to a Reuters review of pricing data and industry analysts.

Headlines: Snap says DOJ, SEC drop probe on IPO disclosures
Description: Snap Inc said on Wednesday that the U.S Department of Justice and the Securities and Exchange Commission were no longer investigating whether the company misled investors at the time of its March 2017 initial public offering.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg grilled in U.S. Congress on digital currency, privacy, elections
Description: Facebook Inc CEO Mark Zuckerberg conceded on Wednesday that the company's planned digital currency Libra was a "risky project," but sought to reassure skeptical U.S. lawmakers that it could lower the cost of electronic payments and open up the global financial system to more people.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade reprieve makes no dent on recession chances: Reuters poll
Description: The recent truce in the U.S.-China trade war is not an economic turning point and has done nothing to reduce a significant risk that the United States could slip into recession in the next two years, a Reuters poll of economists found.

Headlines: U.S. trade envoy meets lawmakers on U.S.-Mexico-Canada deal as time runs short
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer met this week with Democratic lawmakers to try to resolve their concerns about the U.S.-Mexico-Canada (USMCA) trade agreement as Republicans increased pressure to get the deal passed by the end of 2019.

Headlines: Microsoft forecasts cloud sales above expectations
Description: Microsoft Corp  on Wednesday forecast sales for its cloud computing services that topped analysts' estimates, even as quarterly growth slows for its Azure business.

Headlines: Amazon buys healthcare start-up Health Navigator
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Wednesday it bought healthcare start-up Health Navigator, its second purchase in the healthcare services industry.

Headlines: Israeli fashion mogul submits bid for Barneys, challenging Authentic Brands
Description: Israeli businessman Samuel Ben-Avraham said on Wednesday he has submitted an offer for Barneys New York Inc, challenging a $271 million bid for the bankrupt luxury department store from brand developer Authentic Brands Group LLC.

Headlines: J&J slashes third-quarter profit by $3 billion over proposed opioid deal
Description: Johnson & Johnson  on Wednesday lowered its previously reported third-quarter profit by $3 billion to account for a proposed opioid settlement payment.

Headlines: Ford cuts full-year profit outlook as third-quarter profit dips
Description: Ford Motor Co  on Wednesday cut its forecast for operating profit for the year after a disappointing third quarter that Chief Executive Jim Hackett blamed on higher warranty costs, bigger discounts and weaker than expected performance in China.

Headlines: Huawei exposure roils Xilinx's revenue forecast
Description: Xilinx Inc  on Wednesday forecast current-quarter and full-year revenue below Wall Street estimates, the second major chipmaker this week to flag the impact of a prolonged U.S.-China trade dispute on its business.

Headlines: EBay forecasts holiday-quarter revenue below estimates, shares fall 3%
Description: EBay Inc  forecast current-quarter revenue below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, as it faces fierce competition from bigger rivals Amazon.com  and Walmart Inc  in the run-up to the crucial holiday shopping season.

Headlines: PayPal tops Wall Street estimates on higher customer traffic, shares rally
Description: PayPal Holdings Inc  reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit on Wednesday as more people used its payment processing platform to make transactions and forecast full-year adjusted profit above Wall Street estimates.

Headlines: Forecast points to deepening Illinois budget deficit
Description: Illinois' budget deficit will top $3 billion and its pile of overdue bills will hit a new record high by fiscal 2025 if the state's "unsustainable" tax structure remains in place, according to a five-year forecast released on Wednesday by the governor's budget office.

Headlines: Wall Street ticks higher, but chip stocks tumble
Description: U.S. stocks edged higher on Wednesday as investors shrugged off lackluster quarterly reports from industrial bellwethers Boeing Co  and Caterpillar Inc , though a lower-than-expected revenue outlook from Texas Instruments Inc  sent chipmakers' shares lower.

Headlines: Spirit Airlines commits to 100 Airbus jets amid tariff dispute
Description: U.S. budget carrier Spirit Airlines  on Wednesday unveiled a provisional deal to order 100 Airbus A320neo-family jets to be delivered through 2027, becoming the first U.S. airline to pick European planes since Washington imposed tariffs on them.

Headlines: U.S. FAA must restore 'public confidence' in plane certification -inspector general
Description: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) must work to restore "public confidence" in aircraft certification efforts after two deadly Boeing 737 MAX crashes, the U.S. Transportation Department's inspector general said on Wednesday in a public report.

Headlines: WeWork's Claure warns layoffs are coming
Description: WeWork's new executive chairman Marcelo Claure wrote in a memo to employees on Wednesday that layoffs were in the works at the U.S. office-space sharing start-up following a $9.5 billion rescue financing deal with SoftBank Group Corp.

Headlines: WeWork plans to lay off 4,000 staff - FT
Description: Office-sharing startup WeWork is planning to cut as many as 4,000 jobs as a part of a turnaround plan put in place by top shareholder Japan's SoftBank Group after it took control of the company this week, Financial Times reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Google unveils quantum computer breakthrough; critics say wait a qubit
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Wednesday it had achieved a breakthrough in computing research by using a quantum computer to solve in minutes a complex problem that would take today's most powerful supercomputer thousands of years to crack.

Headlines: China factory production key as Tesla reports third-quarter results
Description: Tesla Inc  is conducting trial production runs at its new $2 billion China factory for the past several weeks and will sell some of the first cars from the plant to its employees, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Explainer: Google hails 'quantum supremacy', but don't chuck out your PC just yet
Description: Researchers at Google say they have achieved 'quantum supremacy', in which a computer harnessing the properties of sub-atomic particles did a far better job of solving a problem than the world's most powerful supercomputer.

Headlines: Global stocks rise despite lackluster results; sterling creeps up as EU delays Brexit decision
Description: World stock indexes climbed on Wednesday as investors brushed aside some earnings disappointments, while the British pound inched up as European Union leaders delayed a decision on whether to grant Britain a three-month Brexit extension.

Headlines: American drivers warming to self-driving cars - survey
Description: About 40% of adult Americans drivers are leaning more to buying self-driving cars in the future as they look to snack, chat on their phone or catch up on email while the car drives itself, a survey by Adobe Analytics showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: Brazil court approves contract draft for transfer of rights oil deal
Description: Brazil's federal audits court on Wednesday approved a draft contract for a massive transfer of rights oil deal between  state-run oil firm Petroleo Brasileiro SA , better known as Petrobras, and the government.

Headlines: Exxon, New York prosecutors face off in climate change fraud trial
Description: A lawyer for New York's attorney general on Tuesday told a state judge Exxon Mobil Corp  used two sets of books to hide the true cost of climate change regulations from investors, while an attorney for the oil major assailed the claims as false and politically motivated.

Headlines: Walmart offers holiday deals early to avoid shorter holiday season
Description: Walmart Inc  will offer online holiday deals a few days earlier this year in order to minimize the impact from a shorter selling period between Thanksgiving and Christmas, the retailer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Boeing sees 737 MAX U.S. approval before year-end, shares rise
Description: Boeing Co  said on Wednesday it still expects U.S. regulatory approval for its grounded 737 MAX in the fourth quarter, sending its shares higher despite a slump in quarterly profit.

Headlines: Nasdaq cancels trades in about 50 securities
Description: Nasdaq Inc  said it canceled trades that spanned a two-minute period before the opening bell on Wednesday which affected about 50 securities.

Headlines: Bitcoin plunges to five-month low vs dollar after Zuckerberg testimony
Description: Bitcoin's price dropped on Wednesday to its lowest level against the dollar since the middle of May after Facebook Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerbeg, in testimony before Congress, expressed doubts about whether the company's cryptocurrency project Libra was going to work.

Headlines: Snap drops as Wall Street puts focus on disappointing revenue outlook
Description: Shares of Snap Inc  fell 6% on Wednesday, as Wall Street focused more on a disappointing revenue outlook than regulators no longer investigating the company over whether it misled investors at the time of its 2017 initial public offering.

Headlines: Metro Bank reports third-quarter loss, deposit outflows as Chairman exits
Description: Britain's troubled Metro Bank  reported a loss for the third quarter, said its chairman Vernon Hill has stepped down two months early, and warned it may have to curb its growth plans as it battles to recover from an accounting scandal.

Headlines: Intel files antitrust case against SoftBank-backed firm over patent practices
Description: Chipmaker Intel Corp has filed an antitrust lawsuit against a SoftBank Group Corp-owned investment company alleging the firm stockpiled patents to hold up technology companies with numerous lawsuits.

Headlines: Health insurer Anthem signals better-than-feared 2020 earnings, shares rise
Description: Anthem Inc  on Wednesday signaled earnings for 2020 could be better than feared, allaying some concerns that rising medical costs are eating into profits and sending shares of the No. 2 health insurer up 4%.

Headlines: Nasdaq eyes upside from free e-trades as profit tops expectations
Description: Nasdaq Inc  may see its market share of retail stock executions increase as a result of online brokers moving to free trades, the transatlantic exchange operator said on Wednesday after releasing better-than-expected quarterly financial results.

Headlines: How will Amazon deliver in its second biggest market?
Description: Every half an hour, 50 vans sweep into Amazon's distribution center in Mannheim, Germany and sweep out again with up to 200 parcels and a precise delivery plan in each.

Headlines: Sales of Eli Lilly diabetes drug Trulicity fall short, shares drop
Description: Eli Lilly and Co  third-quarter sales missed Wall Street estimates on Wednesday as rebates limited revenue from its top-selling diabetes drug Trulicity, and its shares fell about 4%.

Headlines: Head of international 737 MAX review, NTSB chair to testify before Senate
Description: The chair of a panel of international regulators that harshly criticized the Federal Aviation Administration's certification of the now grounded Boeing 737 MAX will testify Tuesday before a Senate committee.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz sees potential in baby food, will keep Plasmon
Description: Global packaged food group Kraft Heinz Co  will keep baby food line Plasmon and plans to leverage its 'Made in Italy' credentials to expand the brand abroad, Kraft Heinz Co's general manager for Italy said.

Headlines: SoftBank adds to financial burden with $10 billion WeWork deal
Description: SoftBank Group Corp's financial strains escalated on Wednesday as it agreed to spend more than $10 billion to take over office-space sharing startup WeWork, knocking the Japanese tech conglomerate's already weakened shares.

Headlines: General Dynamics profit rises but headwinds for jets in fourth-quarter send shares lower
Description: Gulfstream jet deliveries helped General Dynamics Corp  report a 7.3% rise in quarterly profit on Wednesday, but shares fell as much as 4% after company officials said the fourth quarter would see more deliveries of less-profitable refurbished aircraft.

Headlines: Clean getaway: Meat waste joins biofuels at luxury jet show
Description: At the world's biggest industry show in Las Vegas luxury jets are luring buyers with their sleek silhouettes, plush cabins - and increasingly, their use of alternative fuels.

Headlines: Factbox: In Germany, competition heats up between two logistics giants
Description: Amazon  is not only a major customer of logistics companies like Deutsche Post DHL, FedEx and UPS. It is a growing rival.

Headlines: Boeing makes progress on 737 MAX, but FAA needs weeks to review
Description: Boeing Co  is making progress toward getting its 737 MAX aircraft in the air again, but the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) will need at least several more weeks for review, FAA Administrator Steve Dickson said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Boeing ousts airliner chief as 737 MAX crisis grows
Description: Boeing Co on Tuesday ousted the top executive of its commercial airplanes division, Kevin McAllister, marking the first high-level departure since two fatal crashes of its 737 MAX jets.

Headlines: Blackstone third-quarter earnings drop less than expected
Description: Blackstone Group Inc , the world's largest manager of alternative assets such as private equity and real estate, said on Wednesday its distributable earnings in the third quarter fell 8% year-on-year, but still beat analyst estimates.

Headlines: Some U.S. electronics factories start layoffs as trade tariffs hit
Description: U.S. electronics factories are investing less and slowing hiring or laying off workers in some cases due to the rising costs of trade tariffs, according to an industry survey set for release on Wednesday.

Headlines: Samsung updates software to fix fingerprint recognition problem
Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  has updated software to fix problems with fingerprint recognition features on its flagship Galaxy S10 and Note 10 smartphones, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Brewer Heineken tempers profit hopes as Americas slip
Description: Heineken , the world's second-largest brewer, forecast profit this year would be at the bottom end of its previous guidance after an unexpected dip in third-quarter sales in the Americas partly offset strong growth in Asia.

Headlines: Exclusive: Datsun brand set to go as Nissan rolls back Ghosn's expansionist strategy - sources
Description: Nissan Motor Co Ltd is likely to axe its Datsun brand, drop some unprofitable products and close a number of assembly lines worldwide as it seeks to boost profits by getting smaller, two company sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: China's premier says cooperation with the U.S. can create mutual benefit
Description: China's premier Li Keqiang says cooperation between China and the United States can create mutual benefit, as negotiations between the world's two largest economies over a trade war continue to drag on.

Headlines: Huawei launches foldable phone in China at prices starting from $2,400
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd started taking orders on Wednesday in China for its eagerly awaited foldable smartphone, as it ramps up marketing at home to make up for weak overseas sales amid U.S. trade sanctions.

Headlines: Toyota's luxury Lexus brand plans battery EV launch in 2020
Description: Toyota Motor's  Lexus will launch its first all-battery electric vehicle next year, as the luxury brand races to market a battery-operated car amid growing competition to develop zero-emissions vehicles, the head of the brand said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Biogen, Eisai revive plans for Alzheimer's drug, surprising market
Description: Biogen Inc  revived plans on Tuesday to seek U.S. approval for Alzheimer's treatment aducanumab, surprising investors and saying data from more patients in two discontinued studies showed the drug reduced the decline of patients.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley elbows out rivals for plum role in $1.5 billion IPO relaunch: sources
Description: Morgan Stanley  has usurped rivals including Deutsche Bank, Citigroup, Credit Suisse and Goldman Sachs to lead the relaunch of a $1.45 billion IPO - Hong Kong's second-largest this year - in an unusually brutal shuffling of banks' roles on a big deal.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. states plan Google antitrust meeting next month in Colorado - sources
Description: U.S. state attorneys general probing Alphabet's Google plan to meet next month in Colorado to discuss a probe into whether the search giant's business practices break antitrust law, according to three sources knowledgeable about the meeting.

Headlines: Former UAW official pleads guilty to federal charges
Description: A former top official of the United Auto Workers union pleaded guilty on Tuesday to federal charges of financial misconduct while about 48,000 UAW members voted on whether to end a nearly five-week walkout at GM.

Headlines: Aramco listing was delayed to rope in anchor investors: sources
Description: Oil giant Saudi Aramco's much-vaunted stock market listing was delayed after deal advisers said they need more time to lock in cornerstone investors, three sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. House votes to advance bill curbing anonymous shell companies
Description: The U.S. House voted on Tuesday to advance legislation that would require most companies to disclose who actually owns them, as well as handing banks a long-sought update to anti-money laundering rules.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump's G7 and trade adviser Kelly Ann Shaw to leave White House - officials
Description: President Donald Trump's G7 and trade adviser, Kelly Ann Shaw, is leaving his administration for a position in the private sector, White House officials said on Tuesday, marking the departure of one of the most senior women on the president's economic team.

Headlines: U.S. defense chief recuses himself from review of $10 billion cloud computing contract
Description: U.S. Defense Secretary Mark Esper has removed himself from reviewing a disputed $10 billion cloud computing deal because of a possible conflict of interest, a move that could further delay the contract-award process.

Headlines: Wall Street slips after rejection of Brexit timetable
Description: U.S. stocks ended lower on Tuesday, giving up early gains after British lawmakers rejected the government's proposed timetable for passing legislation to ratify its deal to exit the European Union.

Headlines: Nike's Parker hands over CEO role to former eBay chief
Description: Nike Inc's  long-time chief executive officer, Mark Parker, will step down next year and be replaced by board member and former eBay CEO John Donahoe, who will be tasked with strengthening the sportswear maker's online strategy.

Headlines: Gulfstream expects more queries during certification after Boeing MAX crashes
Description: Gulfstream Aerospace Corp President Mark Burns said on Tuesday he expected regulators to ask for more details on software when the company certifies its new G700 long-range corporate jet, following two crashes involving the Boeing 737 MAX.

Headlines: Exclusive: Blackstone, CVC seek to take Paysafe public - sources
Description: Private equity firms Blackstone Group Inc  and CVC Capital Partners Ltd are seeking to hire underwriters for an initial public offering (IPO) of Paysafe Group Ltd that could value the payments processing firm at more than $10 billion, including debt, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. charges six investment bankers over insider trading scheme
Description: U.S. prosecutors said on Tuesday they had charged six members of an insider trading ring who worked for firms including Goldman Sachs Group , Moelis and Centerview Partners and allegedly booked tens of millions of dollars in illicit profits.

Headlines: Oil prices rise as OPEC mulls deeper output cuts
Description: Oil prices rose on Tuesday after China signaled progress in trade talks with the United States and OPEC and its allies mulled deeper production cuts, but gains were capped by forecasts of a buildup in U.S. crude stockpiles.

Headlines: Pound, stocks slip as lawmakers reject Brexit law timetable
Description: The pound weakened and stocks on world markets declined on Tuesday after British lawmakers rejected the government's proposed timetable for passing legislation to ratify its deal to exit the European Union.

Headlines: U.S. business borrowing for equipment rises 18% in September: ELFA
Description: U.S. companies' borrowing to spend on capital investments rose 18% in September from a year earlier, the Equipment Leasing and Finance Association (ELFA) said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Gulfstream unveils new flagship G700 business jet in challenge to rival Bombardier
Description: U.S. planemaker Gulfstream on Monday unveiled its widely-expected G700 long-range jet, in a challenge to Bombardier Inc's  flagship Global 7500 aircraft.

Headlines: Air New Zealand to start non-stop Auckland to New York route in 2020
Description: Air New Zealand Ltd  said on Wednesday it will launch a non-stop flight service between Auckland and New York in October 2020, in a bid to take advantage of strong visitor growth from North America.

Headlines: Bank of Canada rate cut bets sink as investors eye post-election spending
Description: Investors are ditching bets that the Bank of Canada will cut interest rates over the coming months as the domestic economy shows resilience and the federal election result adds to prospects of growth-boosting fiscal spending next year.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler to build new car battery hub in Turin
Description: Fiat Chrysler  will build a new battery assembly complex in its Mirafiori plant in Turin, with an initial investment of 50 million euros ($56 million), the carmaker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Zuckerberg to tell Congress Facebook is 'not the ideal messenger' for Libra currency
Description: Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg plans to acknowledge before Congress that Facebook is not the "ideal messenger" for its Libra cryptocurrency project, given ongoing criticism of the company.

Headlines: Spanish court to probe Russian tycoon's bid for DIA supermarket chain: document
Description: Spain's High Court will investigate allegations that Russian tycoon Mikhail Fridman acted to depress the share price of DIA  when trying to take control of the supermarket chain, a court document seen by Reuters showed.

Headlines: Boeing texts reveal flawed simulator, not smoking gun: ex-colleagues
Description: Four days after leaked internal pilot messages set off a media firestorm for Boeing Co , former colleagues have defended a former pilot who voiced concerns about unreported 737 MAX software problems two years before fatal crashes.

Headlines: Five U.S. officials including Kushner, Mnuchin to attend Saudi financial conference: sources
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and presidential adviser Jared Kushner will lead Washington's delegation to an annual  financial conference in Saudi Arabia, government sources said on Tuesday.

Headlines: UTC says Boeing 737 MAX production could remain at current levels
Description: United Technologies  believes Boeing will still make 737 MAX planes at its current rate for the rest of 2019, Chief Financial Officer Akhil Johri said on Tuesday, allaying some fears of a complete halt in production.

Headlines: UPS COO's retirement eclipses e-commerce gains
