Description: United Parcel Service Inc's  e-commerce fueled quarterly profit beat on Tuesday was overshadowed by news that Jim Barber, widely viewed as the world's biggest parcel delivery firm's next leader, would retire at year-end.

Headlines: McDonald's misses profit target as competition delivers breakfast, plant burgers
Description: McDonald's Corp  missed Wall Street estimates for profit for the first time in two years on Tuesday as more investment to spruce up U.S. restaurants and speed up service weighed on the world's biggest fast food chain, sending its shares down 4%.

Headlines: U.S. crude stocks expected to rise for sixth consecutive week: Reuters poll
Description: U.S. crude stockpiles likely rose for the sixth straight week, while refined products stockpiles likely fell last week, an extended Reuters poll showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: S&P cuts Boeing outlook to 'negative' on fresh 737 MAX concerns
Description: S&P Global Ratings lowered its outlook for Boeing Co  to "negative" from "stable" on Tuesday, after reports that the planemaker may have misled the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration about problems with the anti-stall software on its grounded 737 MAX jet.

Headlines: How a major U.S. farm lender left a trail of defaults, lawsuits
Description: After completing a credit review in a half-hour phone call, a BMO Harris Bank underwriter cleared $12 million in loans for Ohio corn and soybean producer Greg Kruger in 2013.

Headlines: Investor revolt torpedoes Swiss Sunrise's $6.4 billion Liberty Global deal
Description: Sunrise Communications Group  bowed to investor pressure on Tuesday and scrapped its 6.3 billion Swiss franc ($6.39 billion) acquisition of Liberty Global's  Swiss cable business UPC.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin profit climbs, expects lower cash flow in 2020; shares dip
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp  raised its estimate for 2019 earnings on Tuesday as quarterly profit climbed 9.2% amid improved sales of its F-35 fighter jets, but it forecast a lower cash flow for next year and shares dipped in afternoon trading.

Headlines: Bank of America expands zero-commission stock trading
Description: Bank Of America said on Monday it would expand its zero-dollar online trading to all customers of its Preferred Rewards program and cut commissions for others, following similar moves by several online brokers.

Headlines: U.S. companies facing worker shortage race to automate
Description: U.S. companies are responding to the lowest unemployment rate in almost 50 years by increasing their focus on automation in order to maintain healthy margins as labor costs tick higher, a Reuters analysis of corporate earnings transcripts shows.

Headlines: Explainer: As Draghi era ends at ECB, cheap money concerns nag
Description: Mario Draghi hands over power at the European Central Bank to Christine Lagarde amid fierce debate over the ultra-loose money policies he spearheaded to aid a eurozone recovery from the financial crisis.

Headlines: Centene posts narrow profit beat, signals early close of WellCare deal
Description: Centene Corp  said on Tuesday its deal for WellCare Health Plans  could close sooner than previously expected and posted a profit that edged past Street estimates, reassuring investors of strength in its core Medicaid business.

Headlines: Hasbro shares plunge as toymaker battles tariff costs
Description: Hasbro Inc  fell well below Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit on Tuesday, as the toy maker wrestled with higher shipping and warehousing costs due to U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports, sending its shares down about 18%.

Headlines: U.S. existing home sales drop more than expected in September
Description: U.S. home sales fell more than expected in September as the market continues to struggle with a dearth of properties for sale, especially for cheaper homes.

Headlines: Harley-Davidson beats forecasts as international sales rebound
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc  beat expectations for profit on Tuesday and stuck to its full-year shipment forecast, allaying fears of another major hit from European import tariffs and a further slump in sales in its main U.S. market.

Headlines: Turkey's Halkbank could face fine for failing to appear in U.S. court: prosecutor
Description: A U.S. prosecutor on Tuesday called Turkey's Halkbank  a "fugitive" after it failed to make an initial court appearance in a criminal case accusing it of conspiring to violate U.S. sanctions against Iran.

Headlines: OPEC, allies to mull deeper oil cut amid worries over demand growth
Description: OPEC and its allies will consider whether to deepen cuts to crude supply when they next meet in December due to worries about weak demand growth in 2020, sources from the oil-producing club said.

Headlines: Infosys loses $6.6 billion in market cap after whistleblower complaints
Description: India's No.2 software services exporter, Infosys Ltd , is probing whistleblower complaints that its top two executives engaged in "unethical practices" to boost short-term revenue and profit, sending its shares down 16% on Tuesday.

Headlines: VW speeds up production of next generation Golf
Description: Volkswagen  will start deliveries of its new Golf hatchback in December after shaving an hour off the time needed to build its flagship model, the board member responsible for production at the VW brand said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fintech Revolut to launch in the U.S. by year-end with Mastercard deal
Description: Digital banking app Revolut is set to begin issuing its cards in the United States by the end of this year via a partnership with payments company Mastercard Inc MA.N, the two companies said on Tuesday.

Headlines: P&G raises full-year forecast after beauty, healthcare brands drive profit beat
Description: Procter & Gamble Co  on Tuesday raised its full-year sales and profit forecasts after a better-than-expected first quarter, as it sold more toothpaste and expensive face cream.

Headlines: Huawei to develop radars for self-driving cars, top executive says
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd will utilize its 5G technologies to develop radar for self-driving cars, its deputy chairman told a conference, as the Chinese manufacturer looks to play a bigger role in the auto industry.

Headlines: UBS tightens investment banking belt as earnings slide continues
Description: Swiss bank UBS  is axing high-paying investment banking staff after a disappointing performance at the division prompted a 16% slide in third-quarter net profit and put the group's 2019 profit goals further out of reach.

Headlines: Diaper rush: conquering a $9 billion market no one wants to talk about
Description: The time may not be far off when more adults need diapers than babies as the population grows older, potentially a huge opportunity for manufacturers of incontinence products - if they can lift the stigma that has long constrained sales.

Headlines: South Africa's Eskom takes Deloitte to court alleging improper contracts
Description: South Africa's Eskom is taking legal action to recover 207 million rand ($14 million) linked to contracts it alleges were improperly awarded to Deloitte Consulting in 2016, the cash-strapped state power firm said late on Monday.

Headlines: Trade tensions, jibes at U.S. overshadow Chinese cyber conference
Description: At one of the world's showpiece tech conferences in China, jibes at the United States for its 'bully behavior' lent a Cold War tone to proceedings as trade tension once again reared its ugly head in an event that drew a dearth of top U.S. executives.

Headlines: Chinese vice foreign minister says progress made in trade talks with U.S.
Description: China and the United States have achieved some progress in their trade talks, Vice Foreign Minister Le Yucheng said on Tuesday, and any problem could be resolved as long as both sides respected each other.

Headlines: Senior Chinese diplomat reiterates that U.S. forced trade war on China
Description: The United States has forced an unwanted trade war on China and Beijing must take the necessary countermeasures to protect its interests, senior Chinese diplomat Wang Yi said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China will keep door open to foreign investment, global industry despite trade tensions
Description: China will take steps to safeguard its interests, but won't close its door to foreign investment and the global industry despite trade frictions with the United States, a Chinese official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Renault chairman vows to get Nissan alliance back on track next year
Description: Renault Chairman Jean-Dominique Senard is determined to get the carmaker's alliance with Japan's Nissan  back on track next year, he said on Tuesday, adding other matters such as a potential tie-up with Fiat Chrysler were less of a priority.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs lowers forecast 2020 U.S. shale oil output growth
Description: Goldman Sachs wound back its forecast for growth in U.S. shale output in 2020, and slightly reduced its outlook for 2020 global oil demand growth.

Headlines: AMS posts third-quarter revenue jump, sees strong demand from Apple, others
Description: Apple  supplier AMS  beat expectations with a 41% jump in third-quarter revenue on Tuesday and forecast further strong demand for its optical sensors from smartphone makers as it takes aim at a takeover of German lighting maker Osram .

Headlines: Arla's CFO steps down to take up position at Ahold Delhaize
Description: Arla Foods, one of the world's largest dairy firms, said on Tuesday that Chief Financial Officer Natalie Knight will leave the company at the end of February because she is moving to Belgian food retailer Ahold Delhaize .

Headlines: UBS, authorities eye client overcharges in Singapore and Hong Kong
Description: UBS  is working with relevant authorities to address inappropriate spreads it may have charged wealthy clients whose money was booked in Hong Kong and Singapore in debt securities transactions, it said in its third-quarter report on Tuesday.

Headlines: Walmart chief seeks stable business environment from India's Modi: ET
Description: Walmart Inc's  chief executive has written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeking certainty and predictability in India's business environment, the Economic Times newspaper reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Bombardier unveils revamped small business jet to compete with Embraer
Description: Bombardier  on Monday unveiled its revamped Liberty Learjet 75 corporate plane, betting that extra legroom and a lower price tag would help the Canadian company beat back competition from Embraer SA's  market leading model.

Headlines: Oil prices fall 1% as global demand concerns grow
Description: Oil prices fell nearly 1% on Monday after comments from a U.S. official fed concerns surrounding the U.S.-China trade war, adding to worries that a slowing global economy would reduce demand for oil.

Headlines: Global stocks climb on hopes for progress in trade; Canadian dollar gains
Description: World stock indexes rose on Monday as signs of work to resolve the U.S.-China trade war bolstered investor hopes, while the Canadian dollar strengthened in the hours before results of the election for prime minister.

Headlines: SoftBank's WeWork takeover would lead to Adam Neumann's exit: sources
Description: SoftBank Group  offered nearly $10 billion on Monday to WeWork and its shareholders under a takeover plan that would keep the U.S. office-space sharing start-up afloat and lead to the exit of its Chairman Adam Neumann, sources said.

Headlines: U.S. allows Chevron to drill for oil in Venezuela for three more months
Description: The U.S. Treasury Department on Monday renewed a license allowing Chevron, the last U.S. operating energy company in Venezuela, to continue drilling in the country for another three months through Jan. 22.

Headlines: Drug firms avert landmark opioid trial as talks on $48-billion settlement set to resume
Description: Four large drug companies could resume talks on Tuesday to try to reach a $48 billion settlement of all opioid litigation against them, after agreeing with two Ohio counties to a $260 million deal to avert the first federal trial over their role in the U.S. opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Trade hopes move S&P 500 close to new record high
Description: The benchmark S&P 500 stock index rose within striking distance of a record high on Monday as further signs of progress toward resolution of the U.S.-China trade war boosted shares in sectors sensitive to trade and the global economy.

Headlines: Howard Hughes announces management reshuffle, to sell assets worth $2 billion
Description: Howard Hughes Corp , which counts activist investor William Ackman as chairman, said on Monday it would sell about $2 billion of non-core assets following a strategic review and announced a management reshuffle.

Headlines: October brings losses for short sellers in U.S. opioid-related shares
Description: October has been a rough month for short sellers betting against companies at the heart of the opioid crisis, although those traders still have paper profits of almost $600 million for the year, according to data from financial analytics firm S3 Partners.

Headlines: China asks WTO for $2.4 billion sanctions against U.S. in latest clash
Description: China is seeking $2.4 billion in retaliatory sanctions against the United States for failing to comply with a World Trade Organization ruling in a case that highlights White House complaints about the global trade body.

Headlines: San Jose to propose turning PG&E into giant customer-owned utility - WSJ
Description: San Jose, California's third-biggest city, is proposing to convert PG&E Corp  into the country's largest customer-owned utility, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday, citing the city's mayor.

Headlines: Facebook suspends Russian Instagram accounts targeting U.S. voters
Description: Facebook Inc said on Monday it has suspended a network of Instagram accounts operated from Russia that targeted Americans with divisive political messages ahead of next year's U.S. presidential election, with operators posing as people within the United States.

Headlines: Colorado abandons legal effort to stop Sprint, T-Mobile merger
Description: Colorado became on Monday the second state to drop out of an effort by state attorneys general led by New York and California to stop T-Mobile US Inc's $26 billion merger with Sprint Corp.

Headlines: Boeing may face billions more in losses as MAX crisis deepens - analysts
Description: Boeing Co may have to book billions of dollars in additional charges related to its parked 737 MAX jets, brokerages said on Monday, citing fresh uncertainty over the time frame for lifting a safety ban imposed after deadly crashes.

Headlines: Factbox: Billion-dollar lawsuits accuse drugmakers, distributors of fueling U.S. opioid crisis
Description: On Monday, two Ohio counties reached a last-minute settlement with four companies they accused of fueling the nationwide opioid epidemic. The counties were seeking billions of dollars to cover the cost of addiction treatment programs, healthcare and other services.

Headlines: Factbox: The U.S. opioid epidemic by the numbers
Description: Opioid deaths in the United States have soared over the last two decades, driving a wave of litigation against drugmakers and distributors.

Headlines: Santander to sell Puerto Rico unit to FirstBank in $1.1 billion deal
Description: Banco Santander  said on Monday it had agreed to sell Santander Bancorp, the Spanish lender's retail and commercial banking franchise in Puerto Rico, to FirstBank Puerto Rico in a deal valued at $1.1 billion.

Headlines: Former Chevron exec seeks $500 million for post-sanctions Venezuela
Description: The former chief of Chevron Corp's Latin American operations is moving to raise $500 million from big financial firms to invest in Venezuela once U.S. sanctions are eventually lifted, confident that political change will come and that foreign investment will be needed to boost sagging oil output.

Headlines: UBS, Simmons Energy pare bankers as shale M&A slows: sources
Description: UBS Group AG and the energy arm of Piper Jaffray Companies have cut staff in their oil and gas investment banking teams, three people familiar with the matter said on Monday, as U.S. dealmaking continues to dry up.

Headlines: Companies slow to disclose financial costs of climate change: report
Description: U.S. and European companies in polluting industries rarely disclose the financial risks they face related to climate change even though a global task force called on them to do so two years ago, Moody's Investors Service said in a report on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Europe regulator to clear Boeing 737 MAX in January at earliest
Description: European regulators expect to clear Boeing's grounded 737 MAX to return to service in January at the earliest, following flight trials by European test pilots scheduled for mid-December, Europe's top aviation safety official told Reuters.

Headlines: Trump praises U.S.-China trade talks as Beijing seeks billions in WTO case against U.S.
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday said efforts to end a U.S. trade war with China were going well as the world's two largest economies continued to battle over trade and politics across the world despite heralding a long-awaited truce this month.

Headlines: Trump's Vuitton visit stirs discord at the brand as designer hits out
Description: Louis Vuitton designer Nicolas Ghesquiere has hit out at Donald Trump after the U.S. president inaugurated one of the brand's factories last week, distancing himself from a visit that was attended by top executives from parent group LVMH.

Headlines: Embraer announces $1.4 billion order, launch customer for Praetors jets
Description: Embraer SA on Monday announced an order worth $1.4 billion from Flexjet, which becomes the new launch customer for the Brazilian company’s Praetor jets.

Headlines: Opioid talks with Teva, distributors could resume Tuesday: attorney
Description: Talks to reach a settlement of thousands of lawsuits stemming from the U.S. opioid addiction crisis could resume as soon as Tuesday, an attorney for local governments said on Monday.

Headlines: Fidelity drops Fisher's money management firm as withdrawals accelerate
Description: Fidelity Investments has dropped Fisher Investments as a money manager, a Fidelity spokesman said on Monday, the latest in an accelerating series of withdrawals from the firm over allegedly sexist comments by its leader, Kenneth Fisher.

Headlines: Peloton's stock takes a spill, even as IPO underwriters cheer it on
Description: Shares of Peloton Interactive  slumped 6% on Monday, even after a multitude of buy ratings from the stationary bike seller's IPO banks, underscoring Wall Street's growing exhaustion from money-losing startups.

Headlines: Apple starts selling locally assembled iPhone XR in India
Description: Apple Inc  has started selling its popular iPhone XR phones assembled in India, as it looks to expand its share in the world's second-largest smartphone market where it has struggled against cheaper products from rivals.

Headlines: Fallout from Trump's trade wars felt by economies around the world
Description: The collateral damage of the United States' trade wars is being felt from the fjords of Iceland to the auto factories of Japan.

Headlines: Italy's biggest bank wants to become less Italian
Description: The chief executive of UniCredit  has a plan to revive his company's ailing share price - make it less Italian.

Headlines: Coty looks to offload brands including Wella, Clairol; shares rise
Description: Coty Inc  is exploring the sale of its business unit that houses hair and nail care brands such as Wella, Clairol and OPI as part of its plan to whittle down its portfolio and cut debt, sending its shares up nearly 14% on Monday.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank plans job cuts of at least 10% in rates unit: Bloomberg
Description: Deutsche Bank AG  said it is considering substantial cuts to the unit that trades interest-rate securities, a division that survived a large-scale pullback as part of the lender's sweeping revamp in July, Bloomberg reported on Monday.

Headlines: Halliburton vows more cost cuts as shale demand dwindles, shares rise
Description: Halliburton Co on Monday promised more cost cuts after reporting a bigger-than-expected drop in quarterly revenue as the oilfield services looks to counter weak demand from North American shale producers, sending its shares up about 7%.

Headlines: India's Infosys U.S. listed shares plunge after whistleblower complaints
Description: U.S.-listed shares of Infosys Ltd   fell nearly 16% in premarket trading on Monday after the Indian software services exporter said it had received whistleblower complaints alleging "unethical practices" by the company's executives.

Headlines: Teva, three U.S. drug distributors reach opioid settlement - source
Description: Drug maker Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Inc  and the three biggest U.S. drug distributors reached a settlement on Monday to avoid a trial over their role in the opioid addiction crisis, a source said on Monday.

Headlines: Smith+Nephew CEO steps down over pay, ex-Roche Diagnostics chief to take over
Description: Smith+Nephew Plc  Chief Executive Namal Nawana is stepping down after just 17 months in the role after becoming dissatisfied with his salary at the medical device maker.

Headlines: Unizo keeps door open for Blackstone, Fortress talks
Description: Unizo Holdings  said Monday it would continue talks with Blackstone Group  and SoftBank-backed  Fortress Investment Group on a potential takeover, raising the possibility of a bid battle between the two global buyout firms.

Headlines: Gojek CEO quits to join Indonesian cabinet, replacements named
Description: Gojek CEO and co-founder Nadiem Makarim said on Monday he had resigned to join Indonesia's new cabinet, and the ride-hailing and payments company said two senior executives would jointly take over running operations of the $10 billion firm.

Headlines: Qantas, Virgin Australia get slots at Tokyo's Haneda airport
Description: Qantas Airways  and Virgin Australia Holdings Ltd  were awarded one slot each to operate flights at Tokyo's Haneda Airport, according to a draft decision by Australia's International Air Services Commission (IASC).

Headlines: Boeing expresses regret over ex-pilot's 737 MAX messages, faults simulator
Description: Boeing Co said on Sunday it understood the outcry over leaked messages from a former test pilot over erratic software behavior on its 737 MAX jet two years before recent crashes, and added it was still investigating what they meant.

Headlines: Japan's extended exports slump could push BOJ to ease next week
Description: Japan's exports contracted for a 10th straight month in September, adding to speculation the central bank could ease monetary policy as soon as next week to support an economy hit by a slowdown in global demand.

Headlines: China's central banker says yuan level 'appropriate', trade tensions risk to global economy
Description: China's top central banker said on Saturday that potential escalation of trade tensions and policy uncertainty were the major risk factors facing the world economy, and market forces were keeping China's yuan at an appropriate level.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Tech haves and have-nots face third-quarter tests
Description: Technology companies, which make up the largest swath of the U.S. stock market, are expected to post a nearly 8% drop in third-quarter profits as reports roll in from many of the sector's biggest corporations.

Headlines: Thomson Reuters says engaged in CEO succession planning
Description: Thomson Reuters Corp  is engaged in succession planning for Chief Executive Jim Smith as "a matter of good governance," the business information company said on Sunday.

Headlines: Long-haul, fuel efficient jets underpin demand at Las Vegas air show
Description: New large corporate planes that can fly farther and an industry push toward sustainable aviation fuels are seen as bright spots as the world's biggest business jet makers assemble in Las Vegas to showcase their offerings at the sector's largest gathering.

Headlines: U.S. business investment downturn could pressure slowing economy
Description: (This September 26 story corrects to clarify historicals in paragraphs 10 and 17)

Headlines: Facebook open to currency-pegged stablecoins for Libra project
Description: Facebook Inc , facing growing skepticism about its digital currency project Libra, on Sunday said the initiative could use cryptocurrencies based on national currencies such as the dollar, instead of the synthetic one it initially proposed.

Headlines: Qantas tests world's longest commercial flight from New York to Sydney
Description: Australia's flag carrier Qantas  completed on Sunday a nonstop test flight from New York to Sydney, researching how the world's longest potential commercial airplane journey of nearly 20 hours would impact pilots, crew and passengers.

Headlines: Boeing board to meet in Texas as scrutiny intensifies: sources
Description: Boeing Co's  board of directors and top executives from its airplanes division and supply chain were due to meet on Sunday in San Antonio, Texas, two days after the U.S. planemaker was plunged into a fresh crisis over its banned 737 MAX jet.

Headlines: China's Xiaomi says plans to launch more than 10 5G phones next year
Description: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi Corp plans to launch more than 10 5G phones in 2020, CEO Lei Jun said on Sunday, speaking at the World Internet conference in the eastern Chinese town of Wuzhen.

Headlines: Turkey says nothing will come of Halkbank case if law in U.S. works
Description: Nothing will come of a case against Turkey's state-owned lender Halkbank "if the law in the United States works", Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu said on Sunday, adding that the case was politically motivated.

Headlines: BMW open for new partners in mobility services venture: FAS
Description: BMW  is keen to find additional partners for the mobility services venture it runs with rival carmaker Daimler , BMW's new chief executive told a Sunday newspaper.
